column1: The Revelation of Jesus Christ, which God gave to Him to show to His servants things which must soon take place. He sent and signified it by His angel to His servant John|Di sitn dem we rait dong iina da buk ya, a di sitn dem we Gad shuo Jiizas Krais. Gad shuo im dem sitn ya, so im kuda tel im sorvant dem bout di sitn dem we suun apm. A dem sitn de Jiizas sen im ienjel go tel im sorvant Jan.

who bears record of the word of God, and of the testimony of Jesus Christ, and of all things that he saw.|An Jan rait dong evriting wa im did si an ier. Im rait dong aal a di mesij dem we Gad sen im, an evriting we Jiizas Krais shuo im.

Blessed is he who reads and those who hear the words of this prophecy and keep those things which are written in it, for the time is near.|Enibadi we riid di sitn dem we iina da buk ya out loud a-go api, an di wan dem we ier it an du wa it se, dem a-go api tu. Kaaz di taim suun kom wen aal a dem sitn de we Jiizas tel wi bout a-go apm.

John, To the seven churches which are in Asia: Grace to you and peace from Him who is and who was and who is to come and from the seven Spirits who are before His throne|Dis a Jan. Mi a rait da leta ya tu di sevn choch dem we de iina Iezha. Mi a prie se Gad, di wan we alaiv, di wan we de bout fram wie bak wen, an di wan we a-go kom baka ort, an im Uoli Spirit we de infronta im chuon, wi gud an kain tu unu an gi unu piis iina unu aat.

and from Jesus Christ, who is the faithful witness, the firstborn from the dead, and the ruler of the kings of the earth.To Him who loved us and washed us from our sins in His own blood|An mi prie se Jiizas Krais, di wan we aalwiez taak di chuut bout Gad, wi gud an kain tu unu an gi unu piis iina unu aat. Im a di fos wan fi ded an kom bak alaiv, an a im ruul uova aal a di king dem we de pan ort. Jiizas a di wan we lov wi an a im frii wi fram wi sin dem wid im blod wen im ded pan di kraas.

and has made us kings and priests to His God and Father, to Him be glory and dominion forever and ever. Amen.|Siek-a dat wi komiin laik wan fambili, wan gruup a priis fi sorv Gad im Faada. So wi fi ana an rispek Jiizas Krais fi eva an eva! Iemen!

Look! He is coming with clouds,and every eye will see Him,even those who pierced Him.And all the tribes of the earth will mourn because of Him.Even so, Amen.|Luk de! Im a kom iina di kloud, an evri yai a-go si im, iivn di wan dem we mek dem kil im wid di suod;an aal di piipl dem pan ort a-go baal siek-a im. A so it a-go go! Iemen.

“I am the Alpha and the Omega, the Beginning and the End,” says the Lord, “who is and who was and who is to come, the Almighty.”|Di Laad Gad se, “A mi staat evriting an evriting don wid mi. Mi a di wan we alaiv, di wan we de bout fram wie bak wen, an di wan we a-go kom baka ort. A mi a di wan we av aal a di powa.”

I, John, both your brother and companion in the tribulation and kingdom and patience of Jesus Christ, was on the isle that is called Patmos on account of the word of God and the testimony of Jesus Christ. |Mi a Jan, unu breda an fren we a go chuu di siem sofarieshan we unu a go chuu. Aal a wi a-go tek paat iina Gad kindom, an siem laik unu, mi naa gi op — mi wi gwaan sofa til Gad kom bak. Kaaz mi priich Gad wod an tel piipl aal a di sitn dem we Jiizas shuo mi, dem put mi pan wan ailan niem Patmos.

I was in the Spirit on the Lord’s Day, and I heard behind me a great voice like a trumpet|Pan di die wen piipl gyada fi worship di Laad, di Uoli Spirit tek kanchuol a mi. Den mi ier wan vais baka mi, an di vais loud an klier laik wan chompit.

saying, “I am the Alpha and the Omega, the First and the Last,” and “What you see, write in a book, and send it to the seven churches which are in Asia: to Ephesus, Smyrna, Pergamum, Thyatira, Sardis, Philadelphia, and Laodicea.”|Di vais se tu mi se, “Rait dong dem sitn ya we yu si iina wan buk an sen it go a di sevn choch dem: sen it go a Efisos, Simorna, Porgamom, Taiyataira, Saadis, Filidelfiya an Leyodiisiya.”

I turned to see the voice that spoke with me. And when I turned, I saw seven golden candlesticks|So mi ton roun fi si uu a taak tu mi. Wen mi ton roun mi si sevn a di sitn dem we wi yuuz fi uol kyanggl, an di uol a dem mek outa guol.

and in the midst of the seven candlesticks was one like a Son of Man, clothed with a garment down to the feet and with a golden sash wrapped around the chest. |An tan op iina di migl a dem, mi si sopm we luk laik wan man. Im did av aan wan lang lang jakit we kech im klier dong a im fut, an wan guol chrap kraas im ches.
The hair on His head was white like wool, as white as snow. His eyes were like a flame of fire.|Im ed an im ier did wait laik katn ar sunuo, an im yai dem shain brait laik wan faiya we a bliez.

His feet were like fine brass, as if refined in a furnace, and His voice as the sound of many waters. |Im fut dem shain brait laik branz aiyan we dem rob til it shain, an we dem did bon iina faiya fi get out aal wa no fi iina it. An wen im taak, im vais soun loud laik di naiz fram wan big big waatafaal.

He had in His right hand seven stars, and out of His mouth went a sharp two-edged sword. His appearance was like the sun shining brightly.|Im did av sevn staar iina im rait an, an wan suod wid di tuu said dem wel shaap kom outa im mout. An im fies shain brait laik di son a migl die.

When I saw Him, I fell at His feet as though I were dead. Then He laid His right hand on me, saying to me, “Do not be afraid. I am the First and the Last. |Wen mi si di man, mi fling dong miself a im fut an no muuv — laik se mi ded. Den im chrech out im rait an, an toch mi an se tu mi se, “No bada fried. Mi a di fos an mi a di laas — evriting staat wid mi, an evriting don wid mi.

I am He who lives, though I was dead. Look! I am alive forevermore. Amen. And I have the keys of Hades and of Death.|Mi alaiv! Mi did ded wan taim, bot luk, nou mi a liv fi eva! Mi av di kii an di powa fi uopm ar lak op di plies we di ded piipl dem de, an mi kyan mek dem kom bak alaiv.

“Write the things which you have seen, and the things which are, and the things which will take place after this.|So rait evriting iina di buk, dat a di sitn dem we yu si we a apm nou an we go apm lieta.

The mystery of the seven stars which you saw in My right hand, and the seven golden candlesticks: The seven stars are the angels of the seven churches, and the seven candlesticks which you saw are the seven churches.|Di sevn staar dem we yu si iina mi rait an, an di sevn guol sitn dem fi uol kyanggl, dis a wa dem miin: di sevn staar dem a di liida dem fi di sevn choch dem, an di sevn sitn fi uol kyanggl a di sevn choch dem.”

To the angel of the church of Ephesus write:“He who holds the seven stars in His right hand, who walks in the midst of the seven golden candlesticks, says these things: |An den di man we mi did si se tu mi se, “Rait dong da mesij ya sen go gi di liida fi di choch we iina Efisos. Tel im se:Dis a wa di wan we uol di sevn staar dem iina im rait an, an we waak mongks di guol sitn fi uol kyanggl av fi se:

I know your works, your labor and your patience, and that you cannot bear those who are evil. And you have tested those who say they are apostles, but are not, and have found them to be liars.|Mi nuo evriting bout unu. Mi nuo aal wa unu go chuu kaaz unu biliiv iina mi, an ou unu tan op chrang an no gi op wen chobl tek unu. Mi nuo se unu kyaahn tek di wikid piipl dem. Unu tes di wan dem we taak bout se dem a apasl wen dem a no no apasl, an fain out se dem a uol laiyad.

You have endured, and have been patient, and for My name’s sake have labored and have not grown weary.|Unu tan op chrang an no gi op wen chobl tek unu, an unu go chuu nof sofarieshan siek-a ou unu biliiv iina mi. An unu aalwiez fala mi, unu neva get taiyad an gi op.
But I have something against you, that you have abandoned the love you had at first.|Bot mi stil av sitn gens unu: unu no lov unu wan aneda di wie unu yuus tu wen unu did fos biliiv iina mi

Remember therefore from where you have fallen. Repent, and do the works you did at first, or else I will come to you quickly and remove your candlestick from its place, unless you repent.|So memba ou faar unu jrap bak fram di lov unu yuuz tu av fi wan aneda. Ton we fram unu sin an staat du di rait sitn dem we unu yuus tu du wen unu did jos get siev. Ef unu no du dat, mi a-go kom tek we unu guol sitn we unu yuuz fi uol kyanggl fram we it de.

But this you have: You hate the works of the Nicolaitans, which I also hate.|Bot unu av wan gud sitn bout unu: siem laik ou mi iet di sitn dem we di Nikolieshan piipl dem a du, a siem wie unu iet dem tu.

“He who has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches. To him who overcomes I will give permission to eat of the tree of life, which is in the midst of the Paradise of God.|Aal uu kyan ier beta lisn we di Uoli Spirit a se tu di choch dem. Enibadi we biit di devl an no gi iin tu di sitn dem we im waahn dem fi du, mi a-go gi dem di rait fi iit fram di chrii we gi laif, we iina Gad gyaadn we de a evn.

“To the angel of the church in Smyrna write:“The First and the Last, who was dead and came to life, says these things: |“Rait da leta ya go gi di liida fi di choch we iina Simorna an tel im se:Di Laad Gad se: Mi a di fos an mi a di laas — evriting staat wid mi, an evriting don wid mi. Mi a di wan we alaiv, di wan we de bout fram wie bak wen, an di wan we a-go kom baka ort.”

I know your works and tribulation and poverty (but you are rich). And I know the blasphemy of those who say they are Jews and are not, but are a synagogue of Satan. |Mi nuo bout aal a unu sofarieshan an ou unu puor — bot unu riili rich. An di piipl dem we se dem a Juu bot dem a no Juu, mi nuo ou dem a tel aal saat a lai an a chat bad bout unu. Dem a wan gruup a piipl we bilang tu Sietan.

Do not fear any of those things which you are about to suffer. Look, the devil is about to throw some of you into prison, that you may be tried, and you will have tribulation for ten days. Be faithful unto death, and I will give you the crown of life.|No fried a di sitn dem wa unu bout fi sofa. Mi a tel unu, di devl a-go fling som a unu iina prizn fi tes unu. An unu a-go sofa fi ten die. Bot unu fi tan op chrang an chos mi siem wie, iivn ef dem mek op dem main fi kil unu. Kaaz siem laik ou wan rona get wan medal wen im win wan ries, mi wi gu'unu laif fi fu'unu praiz.

“He who has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches. He who overcomes shall not be hurt by the second death.|Aal uu kyan ier beta lisn we di Uoli Spirit a se tu di choch dem. Enibadi we biit di devl an no gi iin tu di sitn dem wa im waahn dem fi du, wen Gad kom bak fi joj di worl im naa go sen dem fi ded.
“To the angel of the church in Pergamum write:“He who has the sharp two-edged sword says these things:
column2: “Rait da leta ya sen go gi di liida fi di choch we iina Porgamom an tel im se:Di wan we av di suod we di tuu said dem wel shaap se fi tel im se

column1: I know your works and where you live, where Satan’s throne is. Yet you hold firmly to My name, and did not deny My faith even in the days of Antipas, My faithful martyr, who was killed among you, where Satan dwells.|‘Mi nuo we unu liv. Unu liv we Sietan av im chuon bot unu stil biliiv iina mi. Unu neva ton we fram di chuut, iivn iina di taim wen dem kil mi sorvant, Antipas, iina di toun we Sietan ruul.

“But I have a few things against you: You have there those who hold the teaching of Balaam, who taught Balak to cast a stumbling block before the children of Israel, to eat things sacrificed to idols and to commit sexual immorality.|Bot mi stil av sopm gens unu. Unu av som piipl iina unu choch we a fala wa Bielam tiich. Bielam did tiich Bielak ou fi chrik di Izrelait dem fi mek dem sin. Im chrik dem mek dem nyam fuud we did bon pan alta gi faalz gad, an mek dem sliip wid ada piipl ozban an waif.
So you also have those who hold the teaching of the Nicolaitans.
column2: An unu av som piipl mongks unu we a fala wa di Nikolieshan dem tiich.

column1: Repent, or else I will come to you quickly and will war against them with the sword of My mouth.|Dem fi ton we fram dem sin, shuo se dem sari fi di rang we dem du an beg Gad paadn! Ef unu no du dat, mi a-go kom tu unu suun an waar gens dem wid di suod we kom outa mi mout.

“He who has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches. To him who overcomes I will give the hidden manna to eat. And I will give him a white stone, and on the stone a new name written, which no one knows except he who receives it.|Aal uu av iez fi ier beta lisn gud we di Uoli Spirit a se tu di choch dem. Enibadi we biit di devl an no gi'iin tu di sitn dem we im waahn dem fi du, mi a-go gi dem som a di fuud we niem mana we sumadi did aid. An mi a-go gi dem wan wait stuon tu wid wan nyuu niem rait pan it. Onggl di sumadi we get da stuon de a-go andastan wa rait pan it.’

“To the angel of the church in Thyatira write: “The Son of God, who has eyes like a flame of fire, and whose feet are like fine brass, says these things:|“Rait da leta ya sen go gi di liida fi di choch we iina Taiyataira. Tel im se: Faada Gad Bwai Pikni, di wan uufa yai dem shain brait laik wan faiya we a bliez, uufa fut dem shain brait laik branz we dem bon iina faiya fi get out aal wa no fi iina it an we dem rob til it shain shain, im se

I know your works, love, service, faith, and your patience, and that your last works are more than the first.|“Mi nuo ou unu liv: unu lov wan aneda, tan op chrang fi wa unu biliiv, sorv wan aneda, an tan op chrang an no gi op wen unu did a go chuu nof chobl an kraasiz. Matarafak, unu a du nof muo nou dan wa unu yuus tu du wen unu did jos get siev.

“But I have a few things against you: You permit that woman Jezebel, who calls herself a prophetess, to teach and seduce My servants to commit sexual immorality and eat food sacrificed to idols. |Bot mi stil av sitn gens unu. Unu put op wid da uman de, Jezibel, we kaal arself wan prafit. Shi yuuz di sitn dem we shi a tiich fi chrik mi sorvant dem fi tek paat iina seks sin an fi nyam fuud we dem tek bon sakrifais gi faalz gad.

I gave her time to repent of her sexual immorality, but she did not repent. |Mi gi ar taim fi chienj ar wiez an fi shuo se shi sari fi di rang we shi a du, bot shi aad-iez an no waahn gi op ar seks sin dem.

Look! I will throw her onto a sickbed, and those who commit adultery with her into great tribulation, unless they repent of their deeds. |So mi a-go lik ar wid torbl siknis an mek ar sofa. An aal uu sliip wid ar we a no ar ozban, ef dem no ton we fram ar wikidnis an shuo se dem sari fi wa dem du, mi a-go lik dem wid torbl sofarieshan tu.

I will put her children to death, and all the churches shall know that I am He who searches the hearts and minds. I will give to each one of you according to your deeds.|Mi a-go kil aaf ar falara dem. Den aal a di choch dem wi fain out se a mi a di wan we sorch out evribadi main an aat. An fi aal we unu a du, mi a-go pie unu bak wa unu fi get.

“Now to you I say, and to the rest in Thyatira, as many as do not have this teaching, who have not known what some call the ‘depths of Satan,’ I will put on you no other burden. |Nou dis a wa mi a tel di res a unu we de a Taiyataira, unu we naa fala di laiyad sitn dem we Jezibel a tiich an we no nuo notn bout wa dem kaal di siikrit sitn dem we Sietan shuo dem — mi naa put no muo presha pan unu.
But hold firmly what you have until I come.
column2: Mi onggl waahn unu fi eng aan pan wa unu av til mi kom.

column1: “To him who overcomes and keeps My works to the end, I will give authority over the nations—|Enibadi we biit di devl an no gi iin tu di sitn dem we im waahn dem fi du, an gwaan du we mi waahn dem fi du til di en a di worl, mi a-go gi dem powa fi ruul uova di piipl dem we liv iina di ada konchri dem.

He ‘shall rule them with a rod of iron;like the vessels of a potter they shall be broken in pieces’—even as I myself have received authority from My Father. |‘Di wie ou im a-go ruul dem aad, im naa go tek no piti pan dem.Im a-go brok op aal uu go gens im iina piis piis siem laik ou sumadi tek piis a aiyan paip an brok op wan klie pat.’
And I will give him the morning star.|An siem laik ou mi get di rait fi ruul fram mi Faada, mi a-go gi dem powa fi ruul. Mi a-go gi dem di staar we shain brait wen die a lait fi shuo se dem a wina.
He who has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches.|Aal uu kyan ier beta lisn gud we di Uoli Spirit a se tu di choch dem.”

“To the angel of the church in Sardis write:“He who has the seven Spirits of God and the seven stars says these things: I know your works, that you have a reputation of being alive, but you are dead.|An im se tu mi agen se, “Rait da leta ya go gi di liida fi di choch we iina Saadis an tel im se:Di wan we av Gad Uoli Spirit an we uol di sevn staar dem se, mi nuo evriting bout unu. Piipl tingk se unu a fala mi, bot unu riili naa fala mi at aal.

Be watchful, and strengthen the things which remain but are ready to die, for I have not found your works perfected before God.|So wiek op, an staat liv agen laik ou unu nuo Gad piipl fi liv, bifuo evriting mash op, kaaz mi fain se di wie unu a liv no mach op wid di wie fi mi Gad waahn unu fi liv.

Remember therefore how you have received and heard; hold fast and repent. Therefore if you will not watch, I will come upon you as a thief, and you will not know what hour I will come upon you.|So memba di mesij we unu did ier an biliiv; du we it se, ton we fram unu sin. Ef unu no wiek op, mi a-go kom tu unu laik wan tiif, an unu naa go nuo di taim wen mi a-go kom gens unu.

“You have a few names even in Sardis who have not soiled their garments. They shall walk with Me in white, for they are worthy. |Bot unu av som piipl mongks unu iina Saadis we kip dem kluoz kliin — dem naa liv iina sin. An dem piipl de a-go jres op iina wait kluoz an waak wid mi kaaz dem liv ou Gad waahn dem fi liv.

He who overcomes shall be clothed in white garments. I will not blot his name out of the Book of Life, but I will confess his name before My Father and before His angels. |Enibadi we no gi iin tu di sitn dem we di devl waahn dem fi du, dem a-go get jres op iina wait kluoz tu. Mi naa go kraas out dem niem outa di buk we Gad rait dong di niem a di piipl dem we a-go get fi liv fi eva, bot wen mi tan op infronta mi Faada an im ienjel dem, mi wi se dat dem a fi mi falara.
He who has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches.|Aal a uu kyan ier beta lisn gud we di Uoli Spirit a se tu di choch dem.”

“To the angel of the church in Philadelphia write:“He who is holy, He who is true, He who has the key of David, He who opens and no one shuts, and shuts and no one opens, says these things:|Im se tu mi agen se, “Rait da leta ya go gi di liida fi di choch we iina Filidelfiya an tel im se:Da mesij ya a kom fram di wan we uoli an we aalwiez du we Gad waahn im fi du. A im av King Dievid kii we shuo se im av di powa fi ruul. Wa im uopm nobadi kyaahn shot, an wa im shot nobadi kyaahn uopm.

I know your works. Look! I have set before you an open door, and no one can shut it. For you have a little strength, and have kept My word, and have not denied My name. |Mi nuo evriting bout unu. (Luk ya, mi uopm wan duor infronta unu we nobadi kyaahn shot). Mi nuo se unu no chrang, bot unu stil eng aan pan mi wod an unu neva ton unu bak pan mi an se unu no biliiv mi.

Listen! I will make them of the synagogue of Satan, who say they are Jews and are not, but lie. Listen! I will make them come and worship before your feet and to know that I have loved you.|Lisn! A gweehn mek di laiyad piipl dem we bilang tu Sietan choch, we se dem a Juu wen dem a no no Juu — a gweehn mek dem kom lidong a unu fut wid dem fies a grong an mek dem andastan se mi lov unu.

Because you have kept My word of patience, I also will keep you from the hour of temptation which shall come upon the entire world, to test those who dwell on the earth.|Kaaz mi tel unu fi tan op chrang an no gi op wen chobl tek unu, an unu dwi'it, mi a-go kip unu sief iina da taim de wen torbl kraasiz an sofarieshan a-go kom pan di uol worl fi tes aal uu liv pan di ort.
“Look, I am coming quickly. Hold firmly what you have, so that no one may take your crown. |Mi suun kom so eng aan pan we unu av so dat nobadi kyaahn tek we unu kroun.

He who overcomes will I make a pillar in the temple of My God, and he shall go out no more. I will write on him the name of My God and the name of the city of My God, the New Jerusalem, which comes down out of heaven from My God, and My own new name. |Evri wan a unu we biit di devl an no gi iin tu di sitn dem we im waahn unu fi du, mi a-go mek unu komiin laka wan impuotant kalom iina fi mi Gad ous, an unu naa go lef, unu a-go tan de fi eva an eva. An mi a-go rait fi mi Gad niem pan im, an mi a-go rait pan im Nyuu Jeruusilem, we a fi mi Gad siti niem. Da siti de kom fram Gad an a-go kom dong fram evn. An mi a-go rait dong fi mi nyuu niem pan im tu.
He who has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches.|Aal uu av iez beta lisn we di Uoli Spirit a se tu di choch dem.

“To the angel of the church of the Laodiceans write:“The Amen, the Faithful and True Witness, the Beginning of the creation of God, says these things: |An den im se, “Rait da leta ya go gi di liida fi di choch we iina Leyodiisiya an tel im se:Da mesij ya a kom fram di wan we niem di Iemen, di wan we aalwiez shuo wi di chuut bout Gad, an a im Gad yuuz fi mek evriting.
I know your works, that you are neither cold nor hot. I wish you were cold or hot. |Mi nuo evriting bout unu. Mi nuo se unu no kuol an unu no at. Mi wish unu did koul ar at.

So then, because you are lukewarm, and neither cold nor hot, I will spit you out of My mouth. |Bot unu si laik ou unu jos waam — an unu no kuol an unu no at — mi out fi pit unu outa mi mout rait ya nou.

For you say, ‘I am rich, and have stored up goods, and have need of nothing,’ yet do not realize that you are wretched, miserable, poor, blind, and naked.|Unu se, ‘Mi rich; mi av uol iip a moni an evriting mi waahn.’ Bot yu no si ou yu mash op an tan bad, an pap dong laik oul shuuz bak, an puor, an blain an na'av aan no kluoz?

I counsel you to buy from Me gold refined by fire, that you may be rich, and white garments, that you may be dressed, that the shame of your nakedness may not appear, and anoint your eyes with eye salve, that you may see.|Dis a wa mi tingk unu shuda du, bai guol fram mi, guol we bon iina faiya fi get out aal wa no fi iina it. Ef unu bai da guol de, unu wuda riili get rich. Bai wait kluoz fram mi so unu kyan kova op unuself. Da wie de unu na'afi shiem kaaz unu na'av aan no kluoz. An bai yai jrap fram mi tu fi jrap iina unu yai dem so unu kyan si.

“Those whom I love, I rebuke and discipline. Therefore be zealous and repent.|Di piipl we mi lov, mi taak tu dem aad an chrietn dem out an mek dem nuo se we dem a du rang. So get siiros an ton we fram unu sin dem an shuo se unu sari.

Listen! I stand at the door and knock. If anyone hears My voice and opens the door, I will come in and dine with him, and he with Me.|Lisn mi! Mi tan op rait a di duor an a nak. Ef enibadi ier mi a kaal an uopm di duor, mi wi kom iina im ous an mi an im wi nyam an jringk tugeda.

“To him who overcomes will I grant to sit with Me on My throne, as I also overcame and sat down with My Father on His throne.|Enibadi we biit di devl an no gi iin tu di sitn dem we im waahn dem fi du, mi a-go gi im di rait fi sidong saida mi, pan mi chuon, siem laik ou mi did biit di devl an no gi iin tu di sitn dem we im did waahn mi fi du, an sidong saida mi Faada pan fi'im chuon.
He who has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches.|Aal uu kyan ier beta lisn tu wa di Uoli Spirit a se tu di choch dem.

After this I looked. And there was an open door in heaven. The first voice I heard was like a trumpet speaking with me, saying, “Come up here, and I will show you things which must take place after this.” |Afta aal a dem sitn de apm, mi luk an si wan duor uopm iina evn. An di vais we did soun laik wan chompit we mi did ier a taak tu mi di fos taim, se tu mi se, “Kum op ya-so. Kum mek mi shuo yu we gweehn apm likl fram dis.”

Immediately I was in the Spirit. And there was a throne set in heaven with One sitting on the throne! |Siem taim di Uoli Spirit tek kanchuol a mi, an mi si wan chuon iina evn wid sumadi sidong pan it.

And He who sat there appeared like a jasper and a sardius stone. There was a rainbow around the throne, appearing like an emerald|An di sumadi pan di chuon luk laik di red an griin lait we kom fram som dier stuon we niem jaspa an kaanieliyan. An a bier brait lait laik rienbuo sorkl roun di chuon.

Twenty-four thrones were around the throne. And I saw twenty-four elders sitting on the thrones, clothed in white garments. They had crowns of gold on their heads.|Roun di fos chuon, mi si twenti-fuo ada chuon wid twenti-fuo elda sidong pan dem. Di twenti-fuo elda dem did av aan wait kluoz, an evri wan a dem av aan wan guol kroun pan dem ed.

Lightnings and thunderings and voices proceeded from the throne. Seven lamps of fire were burning before the throne, which are the seven Spirits of God.|Laitnin flash an mi ier som naiz an tonda klap an aal a dat did a kom fram di chuon. Mi si sevn taach a bliez infronta di chuon. Dem sevn taach de a Gad Uoli Spirit.

Before the throne was a sea of glass like crystal.In the midst of the throne, and around the throne, were four living creatures covered with eyes in front and in back.|Infronta di chuon mi si wan sii we luk laik glaas, we klier laik kristal. Iina di migl an roun di chuon, mi si fuo sopm. Dem av yai a front an yai a bak.

The first living creature was like a lion, the second living creature like a calf, the third living creature had a face like a man, and the fourth creature was like a flying eagle.|Di fos sitn luk laik wan laiyan, di sekan wan luk laik wan kou, di tord wan fies luk laik wan man fies, an di fuot wan av wing laik wan iigl.

The four living creatures had six wings each, and they were covered with eyes all around. All day and night, without ceasing, they were saying:“ ‘Holy, holy, holy,Lord God Almighty,’who was, and is, and is to come.”|Evri wan a di fuo sopm dem av siks wing an di uol a dem badi plos dem siks wing dem ful op a yai. Dem av yai aal anda dem wing. Die an nait dem neva tap se: “Uoli, uoli, uoli Laad Gad a yu av aal di powa. Yu did de bout fram wie bak wen, yu aalwiez a-go de bout, an a yu a-go kom baka ort.”

When the living creatures give glory and honor and thanks to Him who sits on the throne, who lives forever and ever,|Enitaim di sopm dem gi priez, ana an tangks tu di wan we sidong pan di chuon an we liv fi eva an eva

the twenty-four elders fall down before Him who sits on the throne, and worship Him, who lives forever and ever. Then they cast their crowns before the throne, saying,|di twenti-fuo elda dem fling dong demself a di fut a di wan we sidong pan di chuon, an gi priez tu di wan we liv fi eva an eva. Dem pudong dem kroun infronta di chuon an se:

“You are worthy, O Lord, to receive glory and honor and power; for You have created all things,and by Your will they exist and were created.”|“Ana an rispek tu yu, wi Laad an wi Gad, yu fi get priez an ana an powa, kaaz yu mek evriting. Yu mek dem kaaz yu did waahn fi mek dem. An dem de ya kaaz yu waahn dem fi de ya.”

Then I saw in the right hand of Him who sat on the throne a scroll written within and on the back, sealed with seven seals.|Wen mi luk agen, di wan we sidong pan di chuon av wan ruol op buk iina im rait an tai op tait wid sevn chring. Di tu saida di buk av sitn rait pan dem.

And I saw a strong angel proclaiming with a loud voice, “Who is worthy to open the scroll and to break its seals?”|An mi si wan powaful ienjel a shout out iina wan loud vais se, “Uu gud inof fi kot di chring dem an uopm di ruol op buk?”

But no one in heaven or on earth or under the earth was able to open the scroll or to look in it. |Bot nobadi iina evn, nobadi pan ort ar nobadi anda di ort kuda uopm di ruol op buk ar iivn luk iina it.

I began to weep loudly, because no one was found worthy to open and read the scroll, or to look in it.|So mi staat wan piis a baalin kaaz dem kudn fain nobadi we gud inof fi uopm di buk ar iivn luk iina it.

Then one of the elders said to me, “Do not weep. Look! The Lion of the tribe of Judah, the Root of David, has triumphed. He is able to open the scroll and to loose its seven seals.”|Den wan a di elda dem se tu mi se, “No bada baal! Luk, di wan we dem kaal di Laiyan we kom fram Juuda Chraib, di powaful wan we kom fram Dievid fambili, im biit di enimi an im no gi iin tu di sitn dem we di enimi waahn im fi du. Im av di powa fi uopm di ruol op buk an fi luus di sevn chring dem we tai it op.”

I saw a Lamb in the midst of the throne and of the four living creatures, and in the midst of the elders, standing as though it had been slain, having seven horns and seven eyes, which are the seven Spirits of God, sent out into all the earth.|Den mi luk an si wan Biebi Shiip we luk laik dem did kil im bot im kom bak alaiv. Mi si im tan op nier di chuon, an di fuo laiv sitn dem an di elda dem tan op roun im. Im av sevn aan an sevn yai we a Gad Uoli Spirit we im sen aal bout di ort.
He came and took the scroll out of the right hand of Him who sat on the throne.
column2: Di Biebi Shiip kom an tek di ruol op buk outa di rait an a di wan we did a sidong pan di chuon.

column1: When He had taken the scroll, the four living creatures and the twenty-four elders fell down before the Lamb, each one having a harp, and golden bowls full of incense, which are the prayers of saints.|Afta im tek it, di fuo laiv sitn dem an di twenti-fuo elda dem fling dong demself infronta di Biebi Shiip. Evri wan a dem did av wan aap an wan guol boul ful-a som spais we dem bon we sumel swiit. Da spais de a riili di prieya a Gad piipl dem.

And they sang a new song, saying:“You are worthy to take the scroll,and to open its seals;for You were slain,and have redeemed us to God by Your blood out of every tribe and tongue and people and nation,|An dem sing wan nyuu sang: “Yu gud inof fi tek di ruol op buk an fi bos aaf di chring dem,kaaz yu did get kil.An yu tek yu blod bai piipl fi Gad fram evri chraib an langwij an piipl an konchri.
and have made us kings and priests unto our God;and we shall reign on the earth|An yu ton dem iina wan kindom we ful-a priis fi sorv wi Gad, an dem a-go ruul pan di ort.”

Then I looked, and I heard around the throne and the living creatures and the elders the voices of many angels, numbering ten thousand times ten thousand, and thousands of thousands|Den mi luk an ier di vais a wan uol iip a ienjel. An ef yu fi ad dem op bout touzn an touzn an touzn — yu kyaahn kount dem. Dem gyada roun di chuon an roun di sitn dem an di elda dem.

saying with a loud voice: “Worthy is the Lamb who was slain,to receive power and riches and wisdom and strengthand honor and glory and blessing!”|An di uol a dem sing da sang ya iina wan loud vais: “Di Biebi Shiip gud inof fi get nof ana an rispek, kaaz dem did kil im. Im gud inof fi get priez kaaz im wel powaful an im wel rich an wel waiz an im wel chrang. An im gud inof fi get ana an rispek fram evriting we im mek!”

Then I heard every creature which is in heaven and on the earth and under the earth and in the sea, and all that are in them, saying: “To Him who sits on the throne and to the Lamb be blessing and honor and glory and power, forever and ever!”|Den mi ier evriting iina evn an evriting pan di ort an evriting we anda di ort an we iina di sii sing da sang ya:“Wi gi priez an ana an powa tu di wan we sidong pan di chuonan wi priez di Biebi Shiip tu. Wi priez dem fi eva an eva!”

The four living creatures said, “Amen.” And the twenty-four elders fell down and worshipped Him who lives forever and ever.|Di fuo sitn dem se, “Iemen,” an di elda dem fling dong demself a im fut an gi im ana an priez.

I saw when the Lamb opened one of the seals. Then I heard one of the four living creatures saying, with voice like thunder, “Come and see.”|Mi wach di Biebi Shiip brok di sevn chring dem wan wan. Wen im brok di fos chring, mi ier wan a di fuo sitn dem se iina wan vais we soun laik tonda, “Kum ya!”

And I looked, and there before me was a white horse. He who sat on it had a bow. And a crown was given to him, and he went forth conquering that he might overcome.|Wen mi luk mi si, wan wait aas tan op infronta mi! Di man we did a raid di wait aas did av wan buo an aro iina im an, an im did get wan kroun. An im raid outa evn go a ort laik wan suoja we fait an biit op im enimi dem aredi an a go biit dem op agen.
When He opened the second seal, I heard the second living creature say, “Come and see.”|Wen di Biebi Shiip brok di sekan chring, mi ier di sekan sitn se, “Kum!”

Then another horse that was red went forth. Power was given to him who sat on it to take peace from the earth, causing people to kill one another. Then a great sword was given to him.|Den mi si wan sekan aas kom out, red laik faiya. Di sumadi we did a raid im did get powa fi mek di piipl dem pan ort ton gens dem wan aneda an kil aaf dem wan aneda iina waar. Im did get wan big suod tu.

When He opened the third seal, I heard the third living creature say, “Come!” I looked, and there was a black horse, and he who sat on it had a pair of scales in his hand.|Wen di Biebi Shiip brok di tord chring, mi ier di tord sitn se, “Kum!” Wen mi luk mi si wan blak aas! Di wan we sidong pan it av wan skiel iina im an.

Then I heard a voice in the midst of the four living creatures saying, “A quart of wheat for a day’s wages, and three quarts of barley for a day’s wages, and do not harm the oil and the wine.”|Den mi ier sopm laik wan vais mongks di fuo sitn dem a se, “Wan poun a biekin flowa a-go kaas wan uol die pie, an siks poun a kounta flowa a-go kaas wan uol die pie, bot no faas wid di ail an di wain!”
When He opened the fourth seal, I heard the voice of the fourth living creature say, “Come!”|Wen di Biebi Shiip brok di fuot chring, mi ier di vais a di fuot sitn se, “Kum!”

So I looked, and there was a pale horse, and the name of him who sat on it was Death, and Hades followed him. Power over a fourth of the earth was given to them, to kill with sword, with hunger, with death, and by the beasts of the earth.|Wen mi luk, mi si wan aas we av wan yelo-griin kola! Di wan we did a raid di aas niem det, an di wan we niem, di Plies we Ded Piipl Go did a fala rait baka im. Di tuu a dem did get powa fi yuuz suod, staavieshan, siknis, an wail wail animal fi kil aaf kwaata a di piipl dem pan ort.

When He opened the fifth seal, I saw under the altar the souls of those who had been slain for the word of God and for the testimony they had held. |Wen im brok di fif chring, mi si anda di alta di suol a di piipl dem we did get kil kaaz dem biliiv Gad wod an kaaz dem tel piipl bout Gad.

They cried out with a loud voice, “How long, O Sovereign Lord, holy and true, until You judge and avenge our blood on those who dwell on the earth?” |Di suol dem anda di alta kaal out wid wan loud vais, “Ou lang, powaful Laad, yu we uoli an we aalwiez du we Gad waahn yu fi du, ou lang yu a-go wiet fi joj an ponish di piipl dem pan ort we kil wi aaf?

Then a white robe was given to each of them, and they were told to rest a little longer, until the number of their fellow servants and brothers should be completed, who would be killed as they were.|Den evri wan a dem get wan lang wait jakit we kech dem klier dong a dem fut, an sumadi tel dem se dem fi wiet likl langga til di res a Gad piipl dem we fi get kil laik dem, get kil.

I watched as He opened the sixth seal. And suddenly there was a great earthquake. The sun became black, like sackcloth made from goat hair, and the moon became like blood.|Den mi si wen di Biebi Shiip brok di siks chring an wan torbl ortkwiek apm. Di son tap shain an di uol plies ton blak blak laik wen nait wel daak, an di muun ton red laik blod

And the stars of heaven fell to the earth, as a fig tree drops its unripe figs when it is shaken by a strong wind.|an di staar dem we iina di skai jrap a grong laik wen griin fruut jrap aafa chrii wen chrang briiz a bluo.

Then the heavens receded like a scroll when it is rolled up, and every mountain and island was removed from its place.|Di skai ruol op laik wan ruol op buk an disapier. An evri mountn an konchri tombl dong outa dem plies.

Then the kings of the earth and the great men and the rich men and the commanding officers and the strong and everyone, slave and free, hid themselves in the caves and in the rocks of the mountains.|Den di king dem pan ort, di impuotant piipl dem, di aami liida dem, rich piipl, evribadi, weda dem a sliev ar dem frii, ron go aid iina kiev an baka di mountn rak dem.

They said to the mountains and rocks, “Fall on us, and hide us from the face of Him who sits on the throne, and from the wrath of the Lamb|Dem baal out an beg di mountn an di rak dem fi: “Jrap pan wi an aid wi fram di wan we sidong pan di chuon, an fram di Biebi Shiip so dat im kyaahn fain wi fi ponish wi.
for the great day of His wrath has come. Who is able to withstand it?”|Kaaz di torbl die kom wen Gad an di Biebi Shiip a-go ponish wikid piipl, an nobadi at aal kyaahn diil wid da jojment de.”

Then I saw four angels standing at the four corners of the earth, holding the four winds of the earth, that the wind would not blow on the earth or on the sea or on any tree. |Afta dat mi si fuo ienjel tan op a di fuo kaana a di ort. Dem did a tap di fuo briiz dem we bluo pan di ort fram bluo pan di lan ar pan di sii ar pan di chrii dem.

And I saw another angel ascending from the east, having the seal of the living God. He cried out with a loud voice to the four angels who had been given power to harm the earth and the sea|Den mi si wan neda ienjel kom fram di iis. Iina im an, im did av wan stamp we did bilang tu Gad we liv fi eva an eva. Im kaal out iina wan loud vais tu di fuo ienjel dem we get powa fi mash op di lan an di sii:

saying, “Do not harm the earth or the sea or the trees, until we have sealed the servants of our God on their foreheads.”|“No chobl di lan ar di sii ar di chrii dem til wi put wan maak iina di piipl dem farid we bilang tu fi wi Gad.”

Then I heard the number of those who were sealed, one hundred and forty-four thousand out of every tribe of the children of Israel:|Den mi ier umoch piipl a-go get di maak. A wan onjrid an faati-fuo touzn piipl fram di twelv chraib dem we mek op Izrel.

Twelve thousand from the tribe of Judah were sealed, twelve throusand from the tribe of Reuben were sealed, twelve thousand from the tribe of Gad were sealed,|Fram Juuda chraib, twelv touzn, fram Ruuben chraib twelv touzn, fram Gad chraib twelv touzn.

twelve thousand from the tribe of Asher were sealed, twelve thousand from the tribe of Naphtali were sealed, twelve thousand from the tribe of Manasseh were sealed|A twelv touzn fram Asha chraib, twelv touznfram Naftali chraib, twelv touzn, fram Manase chraib.

twelve thousand from the tribe of Simeon were sealed, twelve thousand from the tribe of Levi were sealed, twelve thousand from the tribe of Issachar were sealed,|Fram Simiyan chraib twelv touzn, fram Liivai chraib twelv touzn, fram Isakyar chraib twelv touzn.

twelve thousand from the tribe of Zebulun were sealed, twelve thousand from the tribe of Joseph were sealed, and twelve thousand from the tribe of Benjamin were sealed.|A twelv touzn fram Zebyulan chraib, twelv touzn fram Juozif chraib, an fram Benjamin chraib twelv touzn. Aal a dem piipl de get di maak.

Then I looked. And there was a great multitude which no one could count, from all nations and tribes and peoples and tongues, standing before the throne and before the Lamb, clothed with white robes, with palm branches in their hands.|Afta dat mi si wan big kroud a piipl tan op infronta mi, dem did so nof dat nobadi kudn kount dem. Dem kom fram evri konchri, chraib, an piipl we chat aal kain-a langwij. Dem kom tan op infronta di chuon an infronta di Biebi Shiip. Dem did av aan wait jakit we kech dem klier dong a dem fut, an dem did av paam liif iina dem an.

They cried out with a loud voice: “Salvation belongs to our God who sits on the throne, and to the Lamb!”|An dem baal out iina wan loud loud vais an se: “A fi wi Gadwe sidong pan im chuon an di Biebi Shiip siev wi.”

All the angels stood around the throne and the elders and the four living creatures and fell on their faces before the throne and worshipped God|Aal a di ienjel dem faam wan sorkl roun di chuon, di elda dem, an di fuo sitn dem. Dem fling dong demself infronta di chuon, put dem fies a grong an worship Gad

saying: “Amen! Blessing and glory and wisdom and thanksgiving and honor and power and might be to our God forever and ever! Amen.”|an se: “Iemen! Wi Gad, wi gi yu priez an ana an rispek. Yu waiz,an powaful an chrang an wi aalwiez gi yu tangks fi eva an eva. Iemen!”

Then one of the elders asked me, “Who are these clothed in white robes, and where did they come from?”|Den wan a di elda dem aks mi, “Dem piipl ya we av aan lang wait jakit — a uu dem bi, an we dem kom fram?”

I said to him, “Sir, you know.” He said to me, “These are those who came out of great tribulation and washed their robes and made them white in the blood of the Lamb. |Mi ansa im se, “Sa, yu nuo di ansa.” Den im se, “Yu si dem piipl ya, dem a di wan dem we go chuu di torbl torbl sofarieshan. Dem wash dem kluoz wait wait iina di Biebi Shiip blod.

Therefore, they are before the throne of God, and serve Him day and night in His temple. And He who sits on the throne will dwell among them.|Siek-a dat “dem tan op infronta Gad chuon nou an a sorv im die an nait iina im ous. An di wan we sidong pan di chuon a-go liv wid dem an protek dem.

‘They shall neither hunger any more, nor shall they thirst any more; the sun shall not strike them,’ nor any scorching heat;|Dem naa go get onggri no muoan dem chuot naa go jrai no muo. Di at son naa go bon dem,ar no iit naa go skaach dem op.
for the Lamb who is in the midst of the throne will shepherd them and ‘He will lead them to springs of living water.’ ‘And God will wipe away every tear from their eyes.’
column2: Kaaz di Biebi Shiip we de a di migl a di chuon a-go tek kier a dem jos laik ou wan shepad tek kier a im shiip dem. Im a-go liid dem go a wan plies we fresh kliin waata eva a ron. An Gad gweehn jrai op aal a dem yai-waata.”

column1: When He opened the seventh seal, there was silence in heaven for about half an hour.|Wen di Biebi Shiip brok chring nomba sevn, yu kudn ier a soun iina evn fi bout aaf owa siek-a ou di plies kwaiyat.
And I saw the seven angels who stand before God, and seven trumpets were given to them.|Wen mi luk mi si sevn ienjel we tan op infronta Gad an sumadi did gi dem sevn chompit.

Another angel, having a golden censer, came and stood at the altar. He was given much incense to offer with the prayers of allthe saints on the golden altar which was before the throne.|Den mi si wan neda ienjel wid wan guol pan iina im an we av wan anggl. Im kom tan op infronta di alta an sumadi gi im wan uol iip a swiit spais fi bon mek sakrifais. Im did fi put it wid Gad piipl dem prieya an bon it pan di guol alta we de infronta di chuon.

The smoke of the incense, with the prayers of the saints, ascended before God from the angel’s hand.|Di sumuok fram di spais we dem bon, miks op wid Gad piipl dem prieya, go op tu Gad fram di ienjel an.

Then the angel took the censer, filled it with fire from the altar, and threw it onto the earth. And there were noises, thundering, lightning, and an earthquake.|Den di ienjel tek di guol pan we uol di swiit spais we dem bon, ful it op wid faiya fram di alta, an fling it pan di ort. An som torbl tonda ruol, an laitnin flash, an di ort shiek op.
Then the seven angels who had the seven trumpets prepared themselves to sound them.|Afta dat, di sevn ienjel dem we av di sevn chompit dem get redi fi bluo dem.

The first angel sounded, and there followed hail and fire mixed with blood, and they were thrown upon the earth. A third of the trees and all the green grass were burned up.|Di fos ienjel bluo im chompit, an iel an faiya miks op wid blod get fling dong fram di skai pan di ort an wan outa di chrii paat a di ort get bon op. Wan outa evri chrii a di chrii dem we did a gruo an aal a di griin graas get bon op tu.

Then the second angel sounded, and something like a great mountain, burning with fire, was thrown into the sea. A third of the sea became blood|Wen di sekan ienjel bluo fi im chompit, sitn laik wan big mountn we kech a faiya get fling dong iina di sii. An ef yu plit op di sii iina chrii paat, wan outa di chrii paat dem did ton iina blod.

a third of the living creatures in the sea died, and a third of the ships were destroyed.|An wan outa evri chrii sitn we did liv iina di sii ded aaf, an wan outa evri chrii ship we did de pan di sii get mash op.

The third angel sounded, and a great star from heaven, burning like a torch, fell on a third of the rivers and on the springs of waters. |Wen di tord ienjel bluo fi im chompit, wan big staar we did a bon laik faiya jrap fram di skai. An ef yu plit op di riva waata dem an di spring waata dem iina chrii paat, di staar did jrap pan wan paat a dem.

The name of this star is Wormwood. A third of the waters became wormwood, and many men died from the waters, because they were made bitter.|Di staar did niem wormwud. So wan outa chrii paat a di waata did ton bita. So it did kil aaf uol iip a piipl we did jringk it.

The fourth angel sounded, and a third of the sun was struck, and a third of the moon, and a third of the stars, so that a third of them were darkened. A third of the day had no light, and likewise a third of the night.|Wen di fuot ienjel bluo fi im chompit, sitn lik di son, an di muun an di staar dem. An ef yu plit dem op iina chrii paat, wan paat a dem ton daak. An ef yu plit op di die an di nait dem iina chrii paat, wan paat a dem neehn av no lait.

Then I watched, and I heard an angel flying through the midst of heaven, saying with a loud voice, “Woe, woe, woe to the inhabitants of the earth, because of the other trumpet blasts of the three angels, who are yet to sound!”|Wail mi did a wach, mi ier wan iigl we did a flai ai iina di skai a kaal out iina wan loud vais se: “Chobl fu'unu! Chobl fu'unu! Chobl fi evribadi we liv pan di ort, siek-a wa gweehn apm wen di neks chrii ienjel dem bluo fi dem chompit, an dem a get redi fi bluo dem!”

The fifth angel sounded, and I saw a star fallen from heaven to the earth. The star was given the key to the bottomless pit. |Wen di fif ienjel bluo im chompit, mi si wan staar we did jrap pan di ort. Sumadi gi di staar di kii fi di tonel we liid tu di diip diip pit we no av no batam.

He opened the bottomless pit, and smoke ascended from the pit, like the smoke of a great furnace. The sun and the air were darkened by the smoke from the pit.|Wen im uopm di tonel we liid go dong a di pit, sumuok kom op fram di pit laik sumuok we kom fram wan big faiya-said. Di sumuok we kom outa di tonel did so blak an tik dat it blak out di son lait an daak op di skai.
And out of the smoke locusts came upon the earth. Power was given them as the scorpions of the earth have power.
column2: Den som sitn we luk laik graasapa kom outa di sumuok pan di ort. An dem get powa fi bait laik wen skaapiyan bait piipl.

column1: They were commanded not to harm the grass of the earth, or any green thing, or any tree, but only those men who did not have the seal of God on their foreheads. |Gad gi dem powa fi bait piipl an aada dem se dem onggl fi mek di wan dem we no av fi im maak iina dem farid sofa. Bot dem no fi chobl di graas, ar di griin plaant, ar non a di chrii dem pan di ort.

They were given authority, not to kill them, but to torment them for five months. Their torment was like the torment of a scorpion when it stings a man. |Dem neva get powa fi kil di piipl dem niida. Dem onggl did fi mek dem sofa fi faiv mont. An di pien we dem sofa komiin laik wen skaapiyan bait sumadi.

In those days men will seek death but will not find it. They will desire to die, but death will elude them.|Fi di faiv mont di piipl gweehn du evriting fi kil demself. Bot no mata we dem du dem naa go ded.

The shape of the locusts was like horses prepared for battle. On their heads were something like crowns of gold, and their faces were like faces of men. |Di graasapa dem luk laik aas we redi fi go a waar. Dem av aan sitn we luk laik guol kroun pan dem ed an dem fies luk laik man fies.
They had hair like the hair of women, and their teeth were likethe teeth of lions.|Dem ier luk laik uman ier, an dem tiit komiin laik laiyan tiit.

They had breastplates like breastplates of iron, and the sound of their wings was like the sound of chariots with many horses running to battle. |Di graasapa dem did av aan sitn we luk laik di aiyan jakit we suoja wier fi protek demself. An dem wing soun laik di naiz fram wan uol iip a aas an kyaat wid suoja a gyalop go a waar.

They had tails like scorpions and stings in their tails. Their power was to hurt men for five months. |Dem av tiel an dem av sting, laik we skaapiyan av. An dem av powa iina dem tiel fi mek piipl sofa fi faiv mont.

They had as king over them the angel of the bottomless pit, whose name in Hebrew is Abaddon, and in Greek his name is Apollyon.|Dem did av wan king. A im a di ienjel fi di pit. Iina di Iibruu langwij, im niem Abadan. An iina di Griik langwij im niem Apaliyan.
The first woe is past. Now, two more woes are yet to come.|Dat a di fos set a sofarieshan dem did afi go chuu. Dem av tuu muor fi kom.

The sixth angel sounded, and I heard a voice from the four horns of the golden altar which is before God|Wen ienjel nomba siks bluo fi im chompit, mi ier wan vais a kom fram di aan we de pan di guol alta we de infronta Gad.

saying to the sixth angel who had the trumpet, “Release the four angels who are bound at the great Euphrates River.”|Di vais se tu da ienjel de, “Luus di fuo ienjel dem we tai op a di big big riva Yuufrietiiz.”

And the four angels, who had been prepared for the hour and day and month and year, were released to kill a third of mankind.|So di ienjel luus di fuo ienjel dem we did de de redi fi da siem owa, da siem die, da siem mont an da siem ier ya. Fi dem jab a fi kil wan outa evri chrii sumadi we pan di ort.
The army of horsemen numbered two hundred million. I heard their number.
column2: An sumadi tel mi di nomba a suoja we did a raid waar aas. A did tuu onjrid miliyan a dem.

column1: Thus I saw the horses in the vision: Those who sat on them had breastplates of fiery red, hyacinth blue, and sulfur yellow. The heads of the horses were like the heads of lions, and out of their mouths came fire and smoke and brimstone. |Di aas an di raida dem we mi si iina mi vijan, a so dem luk: dem av aan sitn laik aiyan jakit we suoja wier fi protek demself. Dem kola red laik faiya, an daak bluu, an yelo laik solfa. Dem ed luk laik laiyan ed, an faiya, sumuok, an solfa did a kom outa dem mout.

A third of mankind was killed by these three plagues—by the fire and by the smoke and by the brimstone, which came out of their mouths.|Di faiya, sumuok, an solfa we kom outa di aas dem mout kil aaf wan outa evri chrii sumadi pan di ort.

The power of the horses is in their mouths and in their tails. For their tails are like serpents, with heads by which they inflict injury.|An di aas dem powa did iina dem mout an iina dem tiel. An dem tiel komiin laik siniek wid ed we dem yuuz fi bait piipl.

The rest of mankind, who were not killed by these plagues, did not repent of the works of their hands. They did not cease to worship demons, and idols of gold, silver, brass, stone, and wood, which cannot see nor hear nor walk.|Di res a di piipl dem we neva get kil fram di faiya, di sumuok, ar di solfa, stil neva ton we fram dem wikidnis. Dem neva tap worship diiman, an faalz gad we mek outa guol, silva, branz, stuon, an wud — faalz gad we kyaahn si ar ier ar waak.

Nor did they repent of their murders or their magical arts or their sexual immorality or their thefts.|An dem neva tap kil an wok uobiya, an tek paat iina aal saat a seks sin, an dem neva tap tiif niida.

Then I saw another mighty angel coming down from heaven, clothed with a cloud and a rainbow on his head. His face was like the sun, and his feet like pillars of fire.|Den mi si wan neda powaful ienjel a kom dong fram evn. An im did av wan kloud rap roun im laik kluoz, an wan rienbuo uova im ed. An im fies shain brait laik di son. An im fut dem komiin laik som kalom we mek outa faiya.
He had a little scroll open in his hand. He set his right foot on the sea and his left foot on the land
column2: Di ienjel did av wan likl ruol op buk uopm op iina im an. Im tan op wid im rait fut pan di sii an im lef fut pan di lan.

column1: and cried out with a loud voice, like a lion roaring. When he cried out, seven thunders sounded their voices.|Den im baal out wid wan loud vais laik wen wan laiyan ruor. Wen im baal out mi ier sevn tonda ruol.

And when the seven thunders sounded their voices, I was about to write, but I heard a voice from heaven saying to me, “Seal up those things which the seven thunders said, and do not write them.”|Wen di sevn tonda ruol, mi did out fi rait dong wa dem se. Bot sumadi iina evn se tu mi se, “No tel nobadi wa di sevn tonda dem se. No rait it dong.”
The angel whom I saw standing on the sea and on the earth lifted up his hand to heaven
column2: Den di ienjel we did tan op pan di sii an pan di lan lif op im rait an tu evn.

column1: and swore by Him who lives forever and ever, who created heaven and the things that are in them, and the earth and the things that are in it, and the sea and the things that are in it, that there should be no more delay.|An im mek da pramis ya pan di Laad — di Laad we liv fi eva an eva, di Laad we mek evn an evriting we op de, di Laad we mek di ort an evriting pan it, an di Laad we mek di sii an evriting wa iin de, im se, “Dis ya naa go wiet no langga!

But in the days when the seventh angel is about to sound, the mystery of God will be fulfilled, as He has declared to His servants the prophets.|Wen di taim kom fi ienjel nomba sevn bluo fi'im chompit, Gad siikrit plan a-go kom chuu. It a-go kom chuu siem laik ou Gad did tel im prafit dem se it a-go apm.

Then the voice which I heard from heaven spoke to me again and said, “Go, take the little scroll which is open in the hand of the angel who is standing on the sea and on the earth.”|Siem taim di vais we mi did ier fram evn taak tu mi agen. Im se, “Yu si di ienjel we tan op pan di sii an pan di lan wid di uopm ruol op buk iina im an, go tek it fram im.”

So I went to the angel and said to him, “Give me the little scroll.” He said to me, “Take it and eat it. ‘It will turn your stomach sour, but in your mouth it will be as sweet as honey.’|So mi go tu di ienjel an aks im fi gi mi di likl ruol op buk. Im se tu mi se, “Si'it ya. Tek it an nyam it. It a-go ties swiit laik oni iina yu mout, bot it a-go mek yu tumok sowa.”

I took the little scroll from the angel’s hand and ate it. It was as sweet as honey in my mouth, but when I had eaten it, my stomach turned sour.|So mi tek di likl ruol op buk fram di ienjel an nyam it. It did ties swiit laik oni iina mi mout, bot afta mi nyam it, it mek mi tumok ton sowa.

Then he said to me, “You must prophesy again about many peoples and nations and tongues and kings.”|Den dem tel mi se, “Yu afi go gi mesij agen bout wa Gad plan fi uol iip a piipl, fram uol iip a konchri, an we taak aal saat a langwij, an tu nof king tu.”

I was given a reed like a measuring rod. The angel stood, saying, “Rise and measure the temple of God and the altar, and those who worship in it.|Den dem gi mi wan lang piis a tik laik wan ruula an sumadi tel mi se, “Go meja mi ous an di alta, an kount umoch piipl de de a worship.

But exclude the court which is outside the temple, and do not measure it, for it has been given to the nations. They will trample on the Holy City for forty-two months.|Bot no meja out iina di yaad we mi ous de, kaaz mi gi da paat de tu di piipl dem we a no Juu. Dem a-go tek kanchuol a di uoli siti an ruul it fi faati-tuu mont.

And I will give power to my two witnesses, and they will prophesy for one thousand two hundred and sixty days, clothed in sackcloth.|An mi a-go gi mi tuu sorvant dem powa fi priich mi mesij fi wan touzn, tuu onjrid an siksti die. Dem a-go av aan som rof kluoz fi shuo se dem wel sad an dem aat a baal out fi di piipl dem.”
These are the two olive trees and the two candlesticks standing before the God of the earth.
column2: Dem tuu sorvant ya a di tuu aliv chrii an di tuu sitn dem fi uol kyanggl we de infronta di Laad we ruul di ort.

column1: If anyone desires to harm them, fire proceeds out of their mouth and devours their enemies. If anyone desires to harm them, he must be killed in this way.|Ef nobadi chrai fi du dem notn bad, faiya a-go kom outa dem mout an bon op dem enimi. A so enibadi we chrai fi chobl di tuu witnis dem a-go ded.

They have power to shut heaven, that it may not rain during the days of their prophecy. They have power over waters to turn them into blood and to strike the earth with every plague as often as they desire.|Gad gi dem tuu man de powa fi shot op di skai so no rien kyaahn faal di uol taim dem de de a priich im mesij bout wa a-go apm. An im gi dem powa tu fi ton waata iina blod an fi lik di ort wid aal kain-a sofarieshan enitaim dem waahn.

When they have finished their testimony, the beast that ascends from the bottomless pit will wage war against them and overcome them and kill them.|Wen dem don se aal wa Gad waahn dem fi se, di wail wail animal we kom op outa di diip diip pit we no av no batam gweehn atak dem, an biit dem an kil dem.

Their dead bodies will lie in the street of the great city, which spiritually is called Sodom and Egypt, where also our Lord was crucified.|Dem badi a-go get lef pan di ed ruod a di big big siti we evribadi nuo, di toun we dem kaal Sadam ar Iijip. It kaal Sadam ar Iijip kaaz a de dem did kil dem Laad pan di kraas.

Those from every people and tribe and tongue and nation will see their dead bodies for three and a half days, and will not allow their dead bodies to be put in graves. |Fi chrii an a aaf die piipl gweehn luk pan dem ded badi a lai dong iina di ruod. Piipl fram evri chraib, evri konchri an piipl we taak aal saat a langwij a-go luk pan dem, kaaz dem naa go mek nobadi beri dem.

Those who dwell on the earth will rejoice over them and make merry and send gifts to one another, because these two prophets tormented those who dwell on the earth.|Di piipl dem pan di ort a-go wel api se dem tuu prafit de ded. Dem a-go paati an sen prezent go gi wan aneda kaaz dem tuu prafit de yuus tu mek di piipl dem sofa wikid wikid.

After the three and a half days, the breath of life from God entered them, and they stood on their feet, and great fear fell on those who saw them.|Afta di chrii an a aaf die, Gad a-go mek dem kom bak alaiv an tan op. An aal a di piipl dem we a wach a-go kech dem fried — fried til dem no nuo wa fi du wid demself.

Then they heard a loud voice from heaven saying to them, “Come up here!” And they ascended to heaven in a cloud, while their enemies watched them.|Den di tuu prafit dem ier wan loud vais outa evn se tu dem, “Kum op ya.” An wan kloud tek dem op iina evn wail dem enimi a wach.

At that same hour there was a great earthquake, and a tenth of the city fell. Seven thousand men were killed in the earthquake, and the remnant were frightened and gave glory to the God of heaven.|Siem taim wan torbl ortkwiek apm an ef yu plit op di siti iina ten paat, wan paat mash op. Di ortkwiek kil aaf sevn touzn piipl. An di res a piipl dem kech dem fried an staat gi priez tu di Gad we de a evn.
The second woe is past. Listen, the third woe is coming quickly.|Dat a di sekan set a sofarieshan dem did afi go chuu. Dem av wan muor fi kom.

The seventh angel sounded, and there were loud voices in heaven, saying:“The kingdoms of the world have become the kingdoms of our Lord, and of His Christ, and He shall reign forever and ever.”|Wen ienjel nomba sevn bluo fi im chompit, mi ier som loud vais iina evn a se,
And the twenty-four elders, who sat before God on their thrones, fell on their faces and worshipped God|Den di twenti-fuo elda dem fling dong demself wid dem fies a grong an worship Gad.

saying: “We give You thanks, O Lord God Almighty, who is and was and who is to come, because You have taken Your great powerand begun to reign.|Dem se:“Laad Gad, yu we av aal di powa, wi gi yu tangks.Yu a di wan we alaiv,an di wan we de bout fram wie bak wen.Wi tangk yu se yu a shuo yu powaan ruul uova di uol worl.

The nations were angry, and Your wrath has come,and the time has come for the dead to be judged, and to reward Your servants the prophets and the saints and those who fear Your name,small and great, and to destroy those who destroy the earth.”|Di piipl dem we neva did a worship yu did wel beks wid yu;an di taim kom nou fi yu shuo dem se yu beks wid dem tu.An a taim nou fi yu joj di ded,an fi gi yu sorvant di prafit dem,an yu piipl an aal uu ana an rispek yu,weda dem big ar likl, wa dem dizorv.An a taim nou fi yu mash op di piipl dem we a mash op di ort.”

Then the temple of God was opened in heaven, and the ark of His covenant was seen in His temple. And there came lightning, noises, thundering, an earthquake, and great hail.|Den Gad ous iina evn uopm op. An mi si iina Gad ous di likl wud baks we kip di tuu stuon buk dem we Gad did gi Muoziz an we av di ten Laa dem rait pan it. Siem taim laitnin did a flash, tonda staat ruol, wan ortkwiek lik an wan torbl staam kom, an aal ais staat jrap fram di skai.

A great sign appeared in heaven: a woman clothed with the sun, with the moon under her feet, and on her head a crown of twelve stars.|Den mi si wan powaful sain iina evn: wan uman we luk laik shi av aan di son — rap roun ar laik ar kluoz, an di muun anda ar fut an wan kroun pan ar ed wid twelv staar.
She was with child and cried out in labor and in pain to give birth.
column2: Di uman did av biebi iina beli. An shi did a chogl fi push out ar Biebi. An shi baal out wen biebi pien laik ar.

column1: Then another sign appeared in heaven: There was a great red dragon with seven heads and ten horns, and seven diadems on his heads.|Den mi si wan neks powaful sain iina evn: wan big big red jragan we av sevn ed an ten aan, an sevn kroun pan im ed dem.

His tail drew a third of the stars of heaven, and threw them to the earth. The dragon stood before the woman who was ready to give birth, to devour her Child as soon as He was born. |Im yuuz im tiel an jrag dong wan outa evri chrii staar we iina di skai an fling dem dong a ort. Di jragan tan op infronta di uman we did bout fi av ar biebi, so dat im kuda nyam aaf ar pikni az im baan.

She gave birth to a male Child, “who was to rule all nations with an iron scepter.” And her Child was caught up to God and to His throne.|Shi av wan bwai biebi. Ar biebi a-go ruul aal a di piipl dem iina di worl. A im a-go ron tingz an im naa go tek piti pan non a im enimi dem. An bifuo yu kuda kwint, ar pikni get tek op iina evn an go sidong pan Gad chuon.

The woman fled into the wilderness where she has a place prepared by God, that they may nourish her there for one thousand two hundred and sixty days.|Di uman ron we go a wan plies we Gad set op fi ar, faar faar we nobadi no liv. A de-so shi a-go get luk aafa fi wan touzn, tuu onjrid an siksti die.

Then war broke out in heaven. Michael and his angels fought against the dragon, and the dragon and his angels fought|Den waar brok out iina evn. Maikal an di ienjel dem we im liid fait gens di jragan, an di jragan an fi im ienjel dem fait bak.
but they did not prevail, nor was there a place for them in heaven any longer.|Bot di jragan did tuu wiik, so im kudn win an im kudn tan a evn.

The great dragon was cast out, that ancient serpent called the Devil and Satan, who deceives the whole world. He was cast down to the earth, and his angels were cast down with him.|Di powaful jragan — di uol siniek we did de bout fram wie bak wen, we dem kaal di devl, ar sietan, we chrik di uol worl fi sin gens Gad, im an im ienjel dem get fling dong a ort.

Then I heard a loud voice in heaven, saying:“Now the salvation and the power and the kingdom of our Godand the authority of His Christ have come,for the accuser of our brothers,who accused them before our God day and night,has been cast down.|Den mi ier sumadi iina evn a baal out loud loud se:
They overcame himby the blood of the Lamband by the word of their testimony,and they loved not their livesunto the death.|Gad piipl biit di devl an no gi iin tu di sitn dem we im waahn dem fi du,

Therefore rejoice, O heavens,and you who dwell in them!Woe unto the inhabitants of the earth and the sea!For the devil has come down to you in great wrath,because he knows that his time is short.|So evribadi iina evn,unu fi api!Bot aal uu liv pan di ort an piipl we de a sii, chobl fu'unu,kaaz di devl gaan dong tu unu!Im beks bad — beks til im tempa a bwail uova,kaaz im nuo se im taim shaat.”

When the dragon saw that he was cast down to the earth, he persecuted the woman who gave birth to the male Child.|Wen di jragan si se im get fling dong a ort, im staat ron dong di uman we did av di bwai biebi.

The woman was given two wings of a great eagle, that she might fly into the wilderness to her place, where she is to be nourished for a time and times and half a time, from the presence of the serpent.|Sumadi gi di uman tuu wing laik wan powaful iigl, so shi kuda flai go a di plies we Gad set op fi ar — faar faar we nobadi no liv. A de-so shi a-go get luk aafa fi chrii an a aaf ier, we di jragan kyaahn du ar notn.

Then the serpent spewed water out of his mouth like a flood after the woman, that he might cause her to be carried away by the flood. |Den di jragan pit out wan uol iip a waata, laik wan riva, outa im mout fi chrai wash we di uman.
But the earth helped the woman. The earth opened its mouth and swallowed the flood which the dragon spewed out of his mouth.
column2: Bot di grong uopm op an tek iin di flod waata we di jragan pit outa im mout.

column1: Then the dragon was angry with the woman, and he went to wage war with the remnant of her offspring, who keep the commandments of God and have the testimony of Jesus Christ.|Den di jragan get beks wid di uman — beks til im tempa a bwail uova. So im go we fi go mek waar gens ar ada pikni dem — di wan dem we du we Gad se dem fi du, an we biliiv evriting bout Jiizas.

I stood on the sand of the sea. And I saw a beast rising out of the sea, having seven heads and ten horns, with ten crowns on his horns, and blasphemous names on his heads.|Wen mi luk mi si wan wail animal a kom outa di sii. It av ten aan an sevn ed, wid ten likl kroun pan im aan dem, an pan evri wan a im ed dem im av wan niem we se som torbl sitn bout Gad.

The beast which I saw was like a leopard. His feet were like those of a bear, and his mouth like the mouth of a lion. The dragon gave him his power and his throne and great authority.|Di wail animal we mi si luk laik wan taiga, bot im paa dem luk laik fi wan bier, an im mout luk big an powaful laik wan laiyan mout. Di jragan gi di wail animal di siem powa laik wa im av an mek im ruul pan im chuon wid nof nof powa.

I saw one of his heads as if it was mortally wounded, but his deadly wound was healed, and the whole world marveled and followed the beast.|Wan a di wail animal ed did av wan chap we luk laik it did kil im, bot im ed did get beta. Aal di piipl pan di ort shak wen dem si di wail animal

They worshipped the dragon who gave authority to the beast. And they worshipped the beast, saying, “Who is like the beast? Who is able to wage war with him?”|an aal a di piipl dem worship di jragan tu, kaaz im did gi di wail animal powa, an dem worship di wail animal a se, “Nobadi no powaful laik di wail animal? An nobadi kyan mek waar gens im?”
He was given a mouth speaking great things and blasphemies. And he was given authority to wage war for forty-two months.
column2: Sumadi gi di wail animal vais fi taak som wikid an torbl sitn gens Gad an fi shuo aaf im powa fi faati-tuu mont.

column1: He opened his mouth to speak blasphemies against God, to blaspheme His name and His tabernacle and those who dwell in heaven.|Di wail animal uopm im mout an staat kos out Gad an taak som torbl sitn bout Gad an Gad niem an evn an aal uu liv iina evn.

It was granted to him to wage war with the saints and to overcome them. And authority was given him over every tribe and tongue and nation. |An di wail animal get powa fi mek waar gens Gad piipl dem an fi win dem. An im get powa uova evri chraib, piipl, dem langwij an dem konchri.

All who dwell on the earth will worship him, all whose names have not been written in the Book of Life of the Lamb who was slain from the foundation of the world.|Evribadi we liv pan di ort a-go worship di wail animal. Di onggl piipl we naa go worship im a di wan dem we riili a liv. Fi dem niem rait dong bifuo di worl mek iina di buk we di Biebi Shiip av — di Biebi Shiip we did get kil.
If anyone has an ear, let him hear:|Enibadi we av iez, lisn gud.

“He who is to be taken captive,into captivity he shall go;he who kills with the sword,with the sword he must be killed.” Here is a call for the patience and the faith of the saints.|Ef nobadi fi get lak op iina prizn,a dat a-go apm tu dem.Ef nobadi fi get kil wid di suod,dem a-go get kil wid di suod.Dat miin se Gad piipl dem mos tan op chrang an no mek notn tap dem fram chos iina Gad no mata wa apm.

Then I saw another beast rising out of the earth. He had two horns like a lamb and he spoke like a dragon. |Den mi luk an si wan neda wail animal a kom op outa di ort. Im did av tuu aan laik we di Biebi Shiip av, bot im taak laik di jragan.

He exercises all the authority of the first beast in his presence and causes the earth and those who dwell on it to worship the first beast, whose deadly wound was healed. |Im yuuz di siem kain-a powa we di fos wail animal did av gens aal a di piipl dem pan di ort an fuos dem fi worship di fos wail animal we did av wan chap we luk laik it did kil im, bot we ed did get beta. An aal we im du, im du it infronta di fos wail animal.
He performs great signs, making fire come down from heaven on the earth in the sight of men.|An di sekan wail animal du som powaful sitn, im aal mek faiya kom dong fram evn infronta piipl.

He deceives those who dwell on the earth by the signs which he was granted to do in the presence of the beast, telling those who dwell on the earth to make an image to the beast who was wounded by a sword and lived. |Gad did lou di fos wail animal fi du som powaful sitn fi di sekan wail animal. Siek-a dem sitn de di piipl pan ort did get fuul op. Di sekan wail animal aada di piipl dem pan ort fi mek wan sitn we luk laik di wail animal we did get chap wid di suod bot we did stil liv.

He was allowed to give breath to the image of the beast, that the image of the beast should both speak and cause as many as would not worship the image of the beast to be killed.|Gad lou di sekan wail animal fi get powa fi gi laif tu di sitn we luk laik di fos wail animal so dat it kuda taak, an kil enibadi we no waahn worship it.

He causes all, both small and great, both rich and poor, both free and slave, to receive a mark on their right hand or on their forehead|Im aal fuos evribadi, likl an big, rich an puo, uu frii an uu a sliev, fi tek wan maak pan dem rait an ar pan dem farid.
so that no one may buy or sell, except he who has the mark or the name of the beast or the number of his name.|So nobadi kudn bai ar sel ef dem no av di maak — dat a di wail animal niem ar im nomba.

Here is a call for wisdom: Let him who has understanding calculate the number of the beast. It is the number of a man. His number is six hundred and sixty-six.|Unu afi waiz ef unu waahn andastan dis ya. Enibadi we waiz kyan ad op di wail animal nomba, kaaz a man nomba. Im nomba a 666.

Then I looked. The Lamb was standing on Mount Zion and with Him one hundred and forty-four thousand having His Father’s name written on their foreheads. |Den mi luk, an mi si di Biebi Shiip tan op pan mount Zaiyan, an im 144,000 sorvant dem we av im niem an im Faada niem rait dong pan dem farid did de de wid im.

And I heard a sound from heaven, like the sound of many waters and like the sound of a great thunder. I heard the sound of harpists playing their harps.|An mi ier wan vais fram evn we soun laik wen wan powaful riva kom dong, an laik wen loud tonda ruol. Di soun did komiin laik wa yu ier wen piipl a plie dem aap.

They sang a new song before the throne and before the four living creatures and the elders. No one could learn that song except the one hundred and forty-four thousand who were redeemed from the earth.|An dem sing wan nyuu sang infronta di chuon an infronta di fuo laiv wail animal an di elda dem. Nobadi kudn lorn di sang, onggl di 144,000 we Gad did siev.

These are those who were not defiled with women, for they are virgins. These are those who follow the Lamb wherever He goes. These were redeemed from among men, as first fruits to God and to the Lamb. |Dem man ya neva sliip wid no uman — dem neva av seks. Dem fala did Biebi Shiip evriwe im go. Dem did get siev fram mongks di piipl dem we de pan di ort, so dem bilang tu Gad an di Biebi Shiip. Dem komiin laik di fos paat a di sitn we sumadi gi Gad fram dem faam.
No lie was found in their mouths, for they are without fault before the throne of God.|Dem no tel no lai, an nobadi kyaahn paint no fingga pan dem.

Then I saw another angel flying in the midst of heaven, having the eternal gospel to preach to those who dwell on the earth, to every nation and tribe and tongue and people. |Afta dat, mi si wan neda ienjel a flai iina di skai. Im did av wan mesij fram Gad we a-go laas fi eva fi go tel di piipl dem we liv pan di ort. Di mesij a did fi evri konchri, chraib, piipl, an evri langwij.

He said with a loud voice, “Fear God and give Him glory, for the hour of His judgment has come. Worship Him who made heaven and earth, the sea and the springs of water.”|Di ienjel kaal out loud loud an se, “Unu beta gi Gad nof rispek an priez, kaaz a fi'im taim nou fi joj aal di piipl dem we de pan di ort. Unu fi worship di wan we mek evriting: di evn an di ort, di sii an di spring dem.”

Another angel followed, saying, “ ‘Fallen! Fallen is Babylon, that Great City,’ because she made all the nations drink of the wine of the wrath of her sexual immorality.”|Den mi si wan sekan ienjel iina di skai an mi ier im kaal out se, “Mash op! Babilan di powaful siti mash op! Shi mek aal a di konchri dem iina di worl jringk di wain we mek dem du aal kain-a seks sin laik ar.”

A third angel followed them, saying with a loud voice, “If anyone worships the beast and his image and receives his mark on his forehead or on his hand|Den ienjel nomba chrii kom afta di ada tuu ienjel dem an kaal out loud loud: “Ef nobadi worship di wail animal an di sitn we dem mek fi luk laik im an tek im maak pan dem farid ar pan dem rait an

he also shall drink of the wine of the wrath of God, which is poured out in full strength into the cup of His anger. He shall be tormented with fire and brimstone in the presence of the holy angels and in the presence of the Lamb.|Gad a-go beks bad an a-go ponish dem wikid. A laik se dem a jringk chrang wain we Gad chuo gi dem iina wan kop an it no waata dong. Gad gweehn ponish dem wid solfa we a-go bon dem op laik faiya infronta im uoli ienjel dem an di Biebi Shiip.

The smoke of their torment will ascend forever and ever. They have no rest day or night, who worship the beast and his image and whoever receives the mark of his name.”|An di sumuok fram di solfa we a bon dem, go op fi eva an eva. Di piipl dem we worship di wail animal an di sitn we dem mek fi luk laik im, an we tek im maak pan dem badi a-go sofa die an nait fi eva an eva an dem naa go get no iiz op.
Here is the patience of the saints; here are those who keep the commandments of God and the faith of Jesus.
column2: So Gad piipl we du we im se afi tan op chrang an gwaan chos Jiizas.

column1: Then I heard a voice from heaven saying to me, “Write: Blessed are the dead who die in the Lord from now on.”“Yes,” says the Spirit, “that they may rest from their labors, for their works follow them.”|Den mi ier wan vais fram evn se tu mi se, “Rait dong dis: fram nou aan, di piipl dem we ded an dem an di Laad a wan, a dem bles.”Di Spirit se, “Yes, dem aad wok don, an dem a res nou, an aal a di sitn dem wa dem did du wi taak fi dem.”

I looked. And there was a white cloud, and on the cloud sat One like a Son of Man, having on his head a golden crown, and in His hand a sharp sickle.|Wen mi luk, mi si wan wait kloud infronta mi, an sumadi laik di Man we Gad Pik did a sidong pan di kloud wid wan guol kroun pan im ed, an sitn laik wan shaap kotlis iina im an.

Then another angel came out of the temple, crying with a loud voice to Him who sat on the cloud, “Thrust in Your sickle and reap. The time has come for You to reap, for the harvest of the earth is ripe.”|Den wan neda ienjel kom outa Gad ous an kaal out luod loud tu di sumadi we sidong pan di kloud, im se, “Tek yu kotlis an staat chap dong di fiil, kaaz di fruut dem pan di ort wel raip an di taim kom nou fi staat gyada op wa de pan di ort.”
So He who sat on the cloud thrust His sickle on the earth, and the earth was harvested.|So di sumadi we did sidong pan di kloud, flash im kotlis uova di ort, an gyada op we fi gyada.
Another angel came out of the temple which is in heaven. He also had a sharp sickle.
column2: Wan neks ienjel kom outa Gad ous iina evn wid wan shaap kotlis tu.

column1: Yet another angel who had authority over fire came out from the altar. He cried with a loud voice to him who had the sharp sickle, saying, “Thrust in your sharp sickle and gather the clusters of the vine of the earth, for her grapes are fully ripe.”|An wan neks ienjel we inchaaj a faiya kom fram di alta an kaal out loud loud tu di wan we av di shaap kotlis. Im se, “Tek yu shaap kotlis an gyada di bonch a griep fram di griep vain dem pan di ort, kaaz di griep dem raip nou.”

The angel thrust his sickle into the earth and gathered the vintage of the earth, and threw it into the great winepress of the wrath of God.|Di ienjel flash im kotlis pan di ort an gyada op di griep dem. Im tek dem, an fling dem iina di big wain pit we dem kwiiz out di juus outa di griep. An wa apm iina di wain pit komiin laik ou Gad a-go diil wid dem kaaz im wel beks.

The winepress was trampled outside the city, and blood came out of the winepress, up to the horses’ bridles, for one hundred and eighty-six miles.|Dem get tep op tep op pan iina di wain pit we de outsaida di siti, an blod ron outa di wain pit laik wan riva, bout faiv fut diip an 184 mail lang.

I saw another great and marvelous sign in heaven: seven angels having the seven last plagues, for in them the wrath of God is complete.|Mi si wan neda big an impuotant sain iina evn: di sevn ienjel dem we av di laas sevn torbl sitn dem we kaaz wikid sofarieshan — afta aal dem sitn ya don, Gad naa go beks no muo kaaz im don joj di piipl dem.

And I saw what looked like a sea of glass mixed with fire, and those who have the victory over the beast, over his image and over his mark and over the number of his name, standing on the sea of glass, having harps of God. |Mi si sitn we luk laik wan glaas sii miks wid faiya.
