An mi si di piipl dem we neva gi iin tu di wail animal ar worship di sitn we dem mek fi luk laik im, an we neva tek di nomba fi im niem. Dem did tan op saida di glaas sii, an iina dem an dem did av di aap dem we Gad gi.

They sang the song of Moses, the servant of God, and the song of the Lamb, saying:“Great and marvelous are Your works,Lord God Almighty!Just and true are Your ways,O King of saints!|An dem did a sing di sang we Muoziz, Gad sorvant, sing an di sang wa di Biebi Shiip sing:

Who shall not fear You, O Lord,and glorify Your name?For You alone are holy.All nations shall comeand worship before You,for Your judgments have been revealed.”|Uo Laad, uu wudn fried a yu,an big yu opan gi yu nof rispek,kaaz nobadi els no uoli laik yu?Aal a di piipl dem iina di worl afi go kom niil dong infronta yuan worship yu,kaaz evribadi si se evriting we yu du rait.”

After this I looked. And now the temple of the tabernacle of the testimony in heaven was opened.|Afta dem don sing, mi luk an si Gad ous uopm op iina evn (dat a di tent wid di stuon buk wid di pramis we Gad did mek wid im piipl dem).

The seven angels came out of the temple with the seven plagues. They were clothed in pure, bright linen, having their chests wrapped with golden sashes.|An di sevn ienjel dem we av di sevn torbl sitn dem we a-go mek piipl sofa kom outa Gad ous. Dem did av aan linin kluoz we did kliin an shain. An aal a dem did av aan wan braad guol belt kraas dem ches.

Then one of the four living creatures gave to the seven angels seven golden bowls full of the wrath of God, who lives forever and ever.|Den wan a di fuo wail animal dem gi di sevn ienjel dem sevn guol boul ful-a di wain we shuo se Gad wel beks — Gad we liv fi eva an eva.
And the temple was filled with smoke from the glory of God and from His power. No one was able to enter the temple until the seven plagues of the seven angels were completed.
column2: Gad brait brait lait an im powa ful op im ous wid sumuok. Nobadi kudn go iina Gad ous til di sevn torbl sitn dem don — di torbl sitn wa di sevn ienjel dem did av fi mek piipl sofa.

column1: Then I heard a loud voice from the temple saying to the seven angels, “Go, pour out the bowls of the wrath of God on the earth.”|Den mi ier wan loud vais fram Gad ous se tu di sevn ienjel dem, “Unu go pich out wa iina unu boul pan di ort fi shuo se Gad wel beks.”

The first went and poured out his bowl on the earth, and foul and grievous sores came on the men who had the mark of the beast and those who worshipped his image.|Di fos ienjel pich out wa iina fi im boul pan di lan. Den som ogli suor we kaaz nof pien brok out pan di piipl dem we av di wail animal maak, an we worship di sitn we dem mek fi luk laik im.

The second angel poured out his bowl on the sea. It became like the blood of a dead man, and every living creature in the sea died.|Di sekan ienjel pich out wa iina fi im boul pan di sii, an it ton iina sitn we luk laik ded man blod, an evriting we liv iina di sii ded aaf.
The third angel poured out his bowl on the rivers and springs of water, and they became blood.|Di tord ienjel pich out wa iina fi im boul pan di riva an spring waata dem, an dem ton iina blod.
Then I heard the angel of the waters saying:“You are righteous, O Lord,who is and was and who is to be,because You have judged these things.|Den mi ier di ienjel we inchaaj a di waata se tu Gad se:
For they have shed the blood of saints and prophets,and You have given them blood to drink. It is what they deserve!”|kaaz dem kil yu piipl an yu prafit dem an mek fi dem blod ron,

And I heard another from the altar saying:“Yes, Lord God Almighty,true and righteous are Your judgments.”|Den mi ier wan vais fram di alta se:“Yes, Laad Gad, nobadi no powaful laik yu,yu joj piipl ou dem fi get jojan gi dem wa dem dizorv!”

The fourth angel poured out his bowl on the sun, and power was given to him to scorch men with fire.|Den ienjel nomba fuo pich out wa iina fi im boul pan di son, an Gad lou di iit fram di son fi skaach op di piipl dem laik faiya.

Men were scorched with great heat, and they blasphemed the name of God who has power over these plagues, and they did not repent and give Him glory.|Di son did so at it bon di piipl dem bad bad. An iivn duo dem a bon op, dem stil a kos Gad, Gad we av powa uova di sitn dem we mek piipl sofa. Dem kos im an stil wudn ton we fram dem sin an gi Gad priez.

The fifth angel poured out his bowl on the throne of the beast, and his kingdom was filled with darkness. They gnawed their tongues because of the anguish|Den ienjel nomba faiv pich out wa iina fi im boul pan di wail animal chuon, an kaaz daaknis fi kom dong pan di uol a im kindom. Di torbl pien we piipl sofa, mek dem chaa op chaa op dem tong.

and blasphemed the God of heaven because of their pains and their sores, and did not repent of their deeds.|Siek-a ou dem a sofa an di suor we dem av, dem kos aaf Gad we iina evn, bot dem stil wudn ton we fram di torbl sitn we dem did a du.

The sixth angel poured out his bowl on the great Euphrates River, and its water was dried up, to prepare the way for the kings from the East.|Ienjel nomba siks pich out wa iina fi im boul pan di big big riva Yuufrietiiz, an di waata jrai op an mek wie so dat di king dem fram di Iis konchri dem kyan kraas wid dem aami.

Then I saw three unclean spirits like frogs coming out of the mouth of the dragon, out of the mouth of the beast, and out of the mouth of the false prophet.|Den mi si chrii wikid spirit we luk laik bulfrag; wan kom outa di jragan mout, wan outa di wail animal mout an wan outa di laiyad prafit mout.

For they are spirits of demons, performing signs, who go out to the kings of the earth and of the whole world, to gather them to the battle of that great day of God Almighty.|Di spirit dem a diiman spirit we du som powaful sitn. Dem go out aal uova di worl go gyada op di king dem fi waar — di waar we a-go apm pan di big die wen Gad, we muo powaful dan evribadi, a-go joj piipl.

“Look, I am coming as a thief. Blessed is he who watches and keeps his garments on, lest he walk naked and his shame be exposed.”|“Luk, mi a-go kom laik wan tiif! Di wan dem we gwaan luk out an kip aan dem kluoz so dat dem na'afi go bout niekid an shiem se evribadi si dem niekid, a dem wel bles.”
They gathered them together to the place which in Hebrew is called Armageddon.
column2: Di wikid spirit dem gyada op di ruula dem an dem aami dem a wan plies we iina di Iibruu langwij dem kaal Aamagedan.

column1: The seventh angel poured out his bowl into the air, and a loud voice came out of the temple of heaven, from the throne, saying, “It is done!”|Ienjel nomba sevn pich out wa iina fi im boul iina di ier, an wan loud vais kom fram Gad chuon we iina Gad ous, it se, “It don.”

And there were noises and thundering and lightning and a great earthquake, such a mighty and great earthquake, as had never occurred since men were on the earth.|Den laitnin flash, an wan piis a tonda klap, an wan torbl torbl ortkwiek shiek. Fram Gad put piipl pan ort, no ortkwiek so torbl neva apm yet — it did wel torbl.

The great city was divided into three parts, and the cities of the nations fell. Babylon the Great was remembered before God, to give to her the cup of the wine of the fierceness of His wrath.|Di ortkwiek plit op di powaful siti iina chrii paat, an aal a di siti iina aal di konchri dem iina di worl mash op. Gad memba Babilan, di powaful siti. Im joj ar, an fuos ar fi jringk di wain we did iina di kop we shuo se Gad did wel beks.
Every island fled away, and the mountains were not found.|Wen di ortkwiek did shiek, nobadi kudn fain non a di ailan dem ar di mountn dem — dem did gaan.

Great hail, about the weight of a hundred pounds, fell from heaven upon man. Men blasphemed God because of the plague of the hail, because that plague was so severe.|Som big uol ielstuon jrap outa di skai pan piipl. Som a dem wie nieli onjrid poun. An di piipl dem kos Gad siek-a di torbl sofarieshan we dem fies siek-a di ielstuon dem we jrap pan dem.

One of the seven angels who had the seven bowls came and talked with me, saying to me, “Come, I will show you the judgment of the great prostitute who sits on many waters|Wan a di sevn ienjel dem we av di sevn boul dem kom an se tu mi se, “Kum ya! Mek a shuo yu ou Gad a-go joj an ponish di powaful an wikid uor — dat a di siti we bil op saida uol iip a waata

with whom the kings of the earth committed adultery, and the inhabitants of the earth were made drunk with the wine of her sexual immorality.”|we di king dem pan di ort du aal kain-a naasi seks sin wid, an di piipl dem we liv iina di worl get jongk fram di wain we shi gi dem an du aal kain-a seks sin laik ar.

Then he carried me away in the Spirit into the wilderness. I saw a woman sitting on a scarlet beast which was full of blasphemous names, having seven heads and ten horns.|Den di Spirit tek kanchuol a mi, an di ienjel kyari mi go iina wan plies we nobadi neva liv, an mi si wan uman sidong pan wan red red wail animal. Di wail animal did av wan uol iip a torbl niem rait op aal uova im we kos out Gad. An im av sevn ed an ten aan.

The woman was arrayed in purple and scarlet, and adorned with gold and precious stones and pearls, having in her hand a golden cup full of abominations and the filth of her sexual immorality.|Di uman did jres op iina porpl an red kluoz. Shi did a wier som guol an ada juwil laik porl an dier stuon. Iina ar an shi did av wan guol kop. Di kop did ful op a di wikid an torbl naasinis we shuo ar seks sin dem.

On her forehead a name was written:MYSTERY,BABYLON THE GREAT,THE MOTHER OF PROSTITUTESAND OF THE ABOMINATIONS OF THE EARTH.|Shi av wan niem rait pan ar farid we nobadi no nuo wa it miin. Di niem se:A MI A POWAFUL BABILAN.MI A DI MUMA FI AAL UORAN FI AAL KAIN-A SEKS SIN AN NAASINIS IINA DI WORL.

I saw the woman, drunk with the blood of the saints and with the blood of the martyrs of Jesus.When I saw her, I marveled greatly. |Mi si se di uman did jongk. Shi did jringk an get jongk wid Gad piipl dem blod — di wan dem we dem did kil. Dem kil dem kaaz dem did tan op chrang fi wa dem biliiv bout Jiizas.Wen mi si ar, mi fraitn so til.

Then the angel said to me, “Why do you marvel? I will tell you the mystery of the woman and of the beast that carries her, which has the seven heads and the ten horns.|Bot di ienjel se tu mi se: “Wa yu a fraitn bout? Mek mi tel yu di siikrit bout di uman niem an di wail animal we shi a raid we av di sevn ed wid di ten aan dem.

The beast, which you saw, was, and is not, and is to ascend out of the bottomless pit and go to destruction. Those who dwell on the earth whose names are not written in the Book of Life from the foundation of the world will marvel when they see the beast that was, and is not, and is to come.|Di wail animal we yu did si, did alaiv wan taim bot im ded nou. Im a-go kom op outa di diip diip singk uol we na'av no batam, an Gad a-go don im. Aal a di piipl dem pan ort uufa niem no rait dong iina di buk bifuo di worl mek, dem a-go shak wen dem si di wail animal, kaaz im did de ya bifuo, bot im did ded, an im a-go kom bak alaiv. Da buk de av iin di niem a di piipl dem we riili a liv.

“Here is the mind which has wisdom: The seven heads are seven mountains on which the woman sits.|“(Aal dem sitn ya we mi a se, dem kaal fi sumadi we tingk waiz). Di sevn ed dem tan fi di sevn mountn we paat di uman sidong. Di sevn ed dem tan fi sevn king tu.

They are also seven kings. Five have fallen, one is, the other has not yet come; and when he comes, he must remain a little while. |Faiv a dem ded, wan a liv, an di neks wan no kom yet, bot wen im du kom, im a-go tan fi wan likl wail.

Concerning the beast who was, and is not, he is the eighth, and is of the seven, and is going to destruction.|Di wail animal we did de ya aredi, an ded nou, a-go ton king nomba iet. Im a did wan a di sevn king dem, bot Gad a-go don im.

“The ten horns which you saw are ten kings who have received no kingdom yet, but they will receive authority as kings for one hour with the beast.|“Di ten aan dem we yu did si a ten king we neva get fi ruul yet, bot dem a-go get powa fi ruul wid di wail animal fi wan owa.
These are of one mind and will give their power and authority to the beast. |Aal a dem onggl a tingk fi du wan sitn, dat a fi gi di wail animal fi dem powa an mek im ruul.

These will wage war with the Lamb, but the Lamb will overcome them, for He is Lord of lords and King of kings. Those who are with Him are called and chosen and faithful.”|Dem a-go mek waar gens di Biebi Shiip, bot di Biebi Shiip a-go biit dem kaaz im a Laad uova aal laad an King uova evri king — im a-go av im speshal piipl dem wid im, we im kaal, pik, an we du we im se.”

Then he said to me, “The waters which you saw, where the prostitute sits, are peoples and multitudes and nations and tongues.|Den di ienjel tel mi se, “Di waata we yu si, (we di uor sidong), a piipl — kroud a piipl fram aal kain-a konchri we taak aal kain-a langwij.

These ten horns and the beast which you saw will hate the prostitute; they will make her desolate and naked, and devour her flesh, and burn her with fire.|Di wail animal an di ten aan dem we yu did si a-go iet di uor. Dem a-go mash ar op an lef ar niekid. Dem a-go nyam ar flesh an tek faiya bon ar op.

For God has put in their hearts to fulfill His will, and to be of one mind, and to give their kingdom to the beast, until the words of God are fulfilled.|Kaaz Gad put iina dem aat we im waahn dem fi du. Im mek dem mek op dem main fi gi di wail animal fi dem powa fi ruul so til im wod kom chuu.
The woman whom you saw is that great city, which reigns over the kings of the earth.”|Di uman we yu si a di powaful siti. Fi ar king ruul uova aal a di ada king dem iina di worl.”

After this I saw another angel coming down from heaven, having great authority, and the earth was illuminated with his glory.|Afta dis, mi si wan neks ienjel kom dong fram evn. Im av nof powa, an im brait lait lait op di ort.

He cried out mightily with a loud voice, saying:“ ‘Fallen! Fallen is Babylon the Great!’She has become a dwelling place of demons,a haunt for every unclean spirit,and a haunt for every unclean and hateful bird.|Im shout out wid wan powaful vais:“Mash op! Babilan di powaful siti mash op!Shi ton wan yaad fi diiman,wan aid out fi evri wikid spirit,wan ruus fi evri kain-a doti bod.

For all the nations have drunkof the wine of the wrath of her sexual immorality,the kings of the earth have committed adultery with her,and the merchants of the earth have become rich through theabundance of her luxury.”|Kaaz aal a di konchri dem iina di worl jringkdi wain we mek dem du aal kain-a seks sin laik ar.Di king dem pan di ort du aal kain-a naasi seks sin wid ar,an di bizniz piipl dem iina di worl get rich fram di uol iip a seks sin we shi du.”

Then I heard another voice from heaven saying:“ ‘Come out of her, my people,’lest you partake in her sins,and lest you receive her plagues.|Den mi ier wan neda vais fram evn se:“Kum outa ar, mi piipl,so unu no afi tek paat iina ar sin dem,so non a di jojment we a-go kech ar na'afi kech unu;
For her sins have reached up to heaven,and God has remembered her iniquities.|Kaaz ar nof sin dem pail op til dem kech a evn,an Gad memba ar wikidnis.

Render to her as she has rendered to you,and repay her double for her deeds;in the cup which she has mixed, mix a double portion for her.|Du ar bak di siem ting shi du ada piipl;di sitn dem we shi du ada piipl, pie ar bak tuu taim.An di kop a wain we shi miks gi ada piipl, gi ar bak tuu kop ful.

To the extent that she glorified herself and lived luxuriously,so give her torment and sorrow;for in her heart she says,‘I sit as a queen, and am no widow,and will see no sorrow.’|Shi big op arself an taak bout ou shi powaful an du aal kain-a seks sin.Ponish ar an mek ar sofa di siem wie,kaaz shi se tu arself,‘A mi ruul. Mi a di kwiin. Mi ozban no ded,so mi wi neva av notn fi baal bout.’

Therefore her plagues will come in one day—death and mourning and famine.And she will be utterly burned with fire,for strong is the Lord God who judges her.|Siek-a dat, iina wan die, torbl sofarieshan a-go tek ar:som a ar piipl a-go ded, piipl a-go ala an baal,nof staavieshan a-go de pan di lan.An faiya a-go bon ar op,kaaz di Laad Gad we joj ar, im powaful.

“The kings of the earth, who have committed adultery and lived luxuriously with her, will weep and mourn over her when they see the smoke of her burning. |“Wen di king dem pan ort we tek paat iina aal kain-a seks sin wid ar an we liv ou shi liv, si di sumuok we a kom fram di faiya we a bon ar op, dem a-go ala an baal fi ar.

Standing far off for the fear of her torment, they will say:‘Alas, alas for that great city,that mighty city, Babylon!In one hour your judgment has come.’|Dem wi stie faar fram ar kaaz dem fried se wa a apm tu ar mait-a riich dem tu. An dem a-go baal an se,“ ‘Woi! Woi! Luk pan dibig big siti! Luk wa apm tuBabilan di powaful siti!Iina wan owa Gad joj yu an di uol siti mash op!’
“The merchants of the earth will weep and mourn over her, for no one buys their merchandise any more:|“Di bizniz piipl dem iina di worl a-go ala an baal fi ar kaaz nobadi naa bai dem gudz no muo

the merchandise of gold, silver, precious stones and pearls, fine linen, purple, silk and scarlet, all kinds of scented wood, all artifacts of ivory, all merchandise of costly wood, bronze, iron, and marble;|gudz laik guol, silva, dier stuon an porl. Nobadi naa go bai dem linin, dem dier porpl klaat, dem silk klaat ar dem red klaat. Nobadi naa go bai di sitn dem we mek outa swiit wud, ar elifant tiit, dier wud, branz, aiyan an maabl.

and cinnamon and incense, myrrh and frankincense, wine, oil, fine flour and wheat, cattle and sheep, horses and chariots, and slaves and souls of men.|Nobadi naa go bai dem siniman, spais, insens, dier ail we dem kaal mor, ar dem swiit powda we dem kaal frangkinsens. Dem wain, aliv ail, speshal flowa an wiit, nobadi naa go bai dem. Dem kou, shiip, aas an bogi, an di piipl we dem tek ton sliev, nobadi naa go bai dem.

‘The fruit that your soul lusted afterhas departed from you,and all the things which graceful and exquisitehave departed from you,and you shall never find them.’|“Di bizniz piipl dem we de iina di worl a-go se, ‘Aal a di nais sitn dem we unu lov an we unu wel wel waahn gaan fram unu. Aal a unu rich fuud, unu gud laif an unu fansi sitn dem, unu luuz aal a dem an unu kyaahn get dem bak.’

“The merchants of these things, who gained wealth by her, will stand far off for fear of her torment, weeping and wailing|Di bizniz piipl dem we sel aal a dem sitn de, an we get rich aafa ar a-go tan op faar fram ar, kaaz dem fried se di sofarieshan we lik ar mait-a riich dem tu. Dem a-go ala an baal

and saying:‘Alas, alas, that great city,that was arrayed in fine linen, in purple and scarlet,and decked with gold and precious stones and pearls!|an se,“ ‘Chobl! Chobl fi di big big siti,we aalwiez jres op iina nais linin, porpl an red kluoz,an nais shaini guol, dier stuon, an porl juwil!

In one hour such great riches came to nothing!’“All sea captains and seafaring men, sailors and all who trade by sea, stood far off|Kaaz iina wan owa aal a di sitn dem we mek yu rich get mash op!’“An evri ship kyaptin an evribadi we wok pan di ship, di piipl dem we chravl iina buot, di siela dem an aal uu mek moni aafa di sii, tan faar fram ar.

and cried out when they saw the smoke of her burning, saying, ‘What city is like this great city?’ |Wen dem si di sumuok we a kom fram di faiya we a bon ar op, dem baal out, ‘No siti eva powaful laik da wan ya?’

They threw dust on their heads and cried out, weeping and wailing, and saying:‘Alas, alas, that great city,in which all who had ships in the seagrew rich from her wealth!In one hour she has been laid waste!’|Dem fling dot pan dem ed, an ala, an baal an se:“ ‘Woi! Woi luk pan di big bigsiti. Evribadi we did av ship outa sii get rich aafa ar.Iina wan owa di uol siti mash op!

“Rejoice over her, O heavenand saints and apostles and prophets,for God has avenged you against her.”|Evribadi iina evn, unu fi api siek-a wa apm tu ar!Aal a Gad piipl, im apasl an prafit, unu fi api!Kaaz Gad joj ar an ponish ar fi aal wa shi du unu.’ ”

Then a mighty angel took up a stone like a great millstone and threw it into the sea, saying:“With such violenceshall that great city Babylon be thrown down,and shall be found no more.|Den wan powaful ienjel pik op wan big big rakstuon we komiin laik di stuon we dem yuus fi grain grien. Im fling it iina di sii an se:“Siem laik ou da rakstuon ya get fling iina di sii aad aad,a siem so Babilan di powaful siti a-go get lik dong aad aad,an nobadi naa go kyan fain ar.

The sound of harpists and musicians, flute players and trumpeters,shall not be heard in you any more.No craftsman of any craftshall be found in you any more,and the sound of a millstoneshall not be heard in you any more.|No muo myuuzik naa go plie iina yu agen:no aap, no fluut an no chompit.Nobadi we du no kain-a chried wi eva wok iina yu agen.Nobadi wi eva ier no grien a grain agen iina yu siti.

The light of a lampshall shine in you no more,and the voice of bridegroom and of brideshall be heard in you no more.For your merchants were the great men of the earth,and all nations were deceived by your sorcery.|No muo lamp lait wi eva shain iina yu siti agen.No muo wedn wi eva apm iina yu siti agen.Yu did av di bes biznizman dem iina di worl.Yu yuuz yu uobiya fi chrik op aal a di piipl dem iina di worl.

In her was found the blood of prophets and of saintsand of all who were slain on the earth.|Gad ponish Babilan kaaz shi did kil im piipl an im prafit dem,an aal di piipl we get kil aal uova di worl, a Babilan kil dem.”

After these things I heard a great sound of many people in heaven, shouting:“Alleluia!Salvation and glory and honor and power belong to the Lord our God!|Afta di powaful ienjel don taak, mi ier sopm laik wan big big kroud a piipl iina evn. Dem did a shout an a se:“Aliluuya!Fi wi Gad we siev wi fi get priez kaaz im powaful.

For true and righteous are His judgments,because He has judged the great prostitutewho corrupted the earth with her sexual immorality;and He has avenged on her the blood of His servants.”|Priez im kaaz im joj piipl ou dem fi get joj.Im joj di powaful uor we mek aal di piipl pan di ort tek paat iina ar seks sin dem.Im ponish ar fi'im piipl dem we shi kil.”
Again they said:“Alleluia!Her smoke rises forever and ever.”|An di kroud a piipl dem shout out wan muor taim:“Aliluuya!Sumuok go op fram di faiya we a bon ar op, di faiya we a-go bon fi eva an eva.”

The twenty-four elders and the four living creatures fell down and worshipped God who sat on the throne, saying:“Amen! Alleluia!”|Di twenti-fuo elda dem an di fuo sitn dem (we luk laik animal) fling demself a grong an worship Gad, we did sidong pan im chuon, an dem baal out:“Iemen, Aliluuya!”

Then a voice came from the throne, saying:“Praise our God,all you His servantsand those who fear Him,both small and great!”|Den wan vais kom fram di chuon a se,“Priez fi wi Gad,aal a unu we a im piipl,an aal a unu we rispek im,weda unu likl ar big, priez im!”

Then I heard something like the sound like a great multitude, as the sound of many waters and as the sound of mighty thunderings, saying:“Alleluia!For the Lord God Omnipotent reigns!|Den mi ier sopm laik wan big big kroud a piipl a shout, dem vais soun loud laik di naiz fram wan big big waatafaal, an laik wen torbl tonda a ruol, dem shout out:“Aliluuya!Kaaz fi wi Laad, di powaful Gad, a im ron tingz.

Let us be glad and rejoiceand give Him glory,for the marriage of the Lamb has come,and His wife has made herself ready.|Mek di uol a wi jomp op an dong wid jai iina wi aat.Mek wi gi'im nof rispek an ana!Kaaz di taim kom nou fi di Biebi Shiip get marid,an di uman we im fi marid tu, redi an a wiet pan im.

It was granted her to be arrayed in fine linen,clean and white.”Fine linen is the righteous deeds of the saints.|Gad gi ar kluoz fi wier,we mek outa priti linin we brait an kliin.”(Di priti kliin linin a di rait sitn dem we Gad piipl dem du.)

Then he said to me, “Write: Blessed are those who are invited to the marriage supper of the Lamb.” And he said to me, “These are the true sayings of God.”|Den di ienjel se tu mi se, “Rait dis dong: ‘Di wan dem we get invait fi kom a di Biebi Shiip wedn sopa, a dem api.’ ” Den di ienjel se tu mi se, “Wa mi a tel yu, a Gad wod we chuu.”

I fell at his feet to worship him. But he said to me, “See that you not do that. I am your fellow servant, and of your brothers who hold the testimony of Jesus. Worship God! For the testimony of Jesus is the spirit of prophecy.”|Wen mi ier dis, mi jrap pan mi nii a im fut fi worship im. Bot im se tu mi se, “No, yu kyaahn du dat! Mi sorv Gad jos laik yu an yu breda an sista dem we biliiv evriting we Jiizas tiich. So a Gad yu fi worship, kaaz di chuu sitn dem we nobadi neva nuo an we Jiizas shuo wi, a dat lou piipl fi pred Gad mesij!”

I saw heaven opened. And there was a white horse. He who sat on it is called Faithful and True, and in righteousness He judges and wages war. |Wen mi luk, mi fraitn fi si evn uopm op an wan wait aas tan op im infronta mi. An di sumadi we did a raid di aas niem di Wan we Aalwiez Sorv Gad an we Evribadi Kyan Chos. Im du wa rait wen im joj piipl an waar gens im enimi dem.

His eyes are like a flame of fire, and on His head are many crowns. He has a name written, that no one knows but He Himself. |Im yai dem komiin laik wan faiya we a bliez, an im av wan uol iip a kroun pan im ed. Im av wan niem rait pan im we nobadi no nuo, onggl im wan.
He is clothed with a robe dipped in blood. His name is called The Word of God.|Im did av aan lang jakit we suok iina blod, an dem kaal im Gad wod.

The armies in heaven, clothed in fine linen, white and clean, followed Him on white horses. |Di aami dem we iina evn did a fala baka im. Dem did a raid pan wait aas tu an dem did jres op iina dier linin kluoz we wait an kliin.

Out of His mouth proceeds a sharp sword, with which He may strike the nations. “He shall rule them with an iron scepter.” He treads the winepress of the fury and wrath of God the Almighty. |Wan shaap suod kom outa im mout we im a-go yuuz fi waar gens di piipl dem iina di worl an ponish dem. “Im a-go ruul dem wid wan aiyan paip.” An im a-go tep op, tep op pan dem an mash dem out laik wen piipl a mash out griep wid dem fut. Im a-go du dem da wie de fi mek dem si se Gad we av aal di powa, wel mad wid dem.
On His robe and on His thigh He has a name written:KING OF KINGSAND LORD OF LORDS.
column2: Pan im lang jakit an pan di tap paat a im fut im av wan niem rait dong:KING UOVA AAL A DI KING DEM ANLAAD UOVA AAL A DI LAAD DEM.

column1: And I saw an angel standing in the sun, and he cried with a loud voice to all the birds flying in the midst of heaven, “Come and gather for the supper of the great God|An mi si wan ienjel tan op iina di son. Im shout out loud loud tu aal a di bod dem we a flai ai op iina di skai se, “Unu kom, kom gyada tugeda fi Gad big big sopa,

to eat the flesh of kings, the flesh of commanders, the flesh of strong men, the flesh of horses and their riders, and the flesh of all men, both free and slave, both small and great!”|so unu kyan nyam unu beli ful. Kom nyam aal kain-a badi: badi fi di king dem, di ed suoja dem, di powaful piipl dem, di aas dem an dem raida an di badi fi piipl we frii an piipl we a sliev, badi fi piipl we mata an piipl we no mata.”
Then I saw the beast and the kings of the earth with their armies gathered to wage war against Him who sat on the horse and against His army.
column2: Den mi si di wail animal an di king dem fram aal uova di worl an dem aami dem gyada op fi mek waar gens di raida pan di aas an fi im aami.

column1: But the beast was captured and with him the false prophet who worked signs in his presence, by which he deceived those who received the mark of the beast and those who worshipped his image. These two were thrown alive into the lake of fire that burns with brimstone.|Bot di wail animal an di faalz prafit we did du di mirikl dem fi di wail animal get kyapcha. Di faalz prafit did yuuz di mirikl dem fi fuul op di piipl dem we did tek di maak a di wail animal an we worship di sitn we luk laik im. Di tuu a dem get fling dong iina di liek a faiya we a bon wid solfa.
The remnant were slain with the sword which proceeded out of the mouth of Him who sat on the horse. And all the birds gorged themselves with their flesh.
column2: Di res a piipl dem get kil wid di suod we kom outa di man mout we did de pan di aas. An aal a di bod dem nyam di piipl dem badi til dem tumok ful.

column1: And I saw an angel coming down out of heaven, having the key to the bottomless pit and a great chain in his hand.|An mi did si wan ienjel kom dong outa evn, im av di kii fi di pit we no av no batam an im av wan big big chien iina im an.

He seized the dragon, that ancient serpent, who is the Devil and Satan, and bound him for a thousand years.|Im kyapcha di jragan — di siniek we de bout fram wie bak wen, dat a di devl an Sietan — an tai im op fi wan touzn ier.

He cast him into the bottomless pit, and shut him up, and set a seal on him, that he should deceive the nations no more, until the thousand years were ended. After that he must be set free for a little while.|Im fling di jragan iina di pit we no av no batam, an lak it op tait tait so im kyaahn kom out. Im du dat so di jragan kyaahn chrik di piipl dem iina di worl no muo til di touzn ier dem don. Wen da touzn ier de don, di jragan a-go get frii fi a likl wail.

I saw thrones, and they sat on them, and the authority to judge was given to them. And I saw the souls of those who had been beheaded for their witness of Jesus and for the word of God. They had not worshipped the beast or his image, and had not received his mark on their foreheads or on their hands. They came to life and reigned with Christ for a thousand years.|Den mi si som chuon an di wan dem we did get powa fi ruul did sidong pan dem. An mi si di spirit fi di piipl dem uufa ed did get chap aaf kaaz dem biliiv iina Jiizas an tan op chrang fi im an fi Gad wod. Dem neva worship di wail animal ar di sitn we dem mek fi luk laik im an dem neva tek im maak pan dem farid ar pan dem an niida. Dem kom bak alaiv an ruul wid Krais Jiizas fi wan touzn ier.
The rest of the dead did not come to life until the thousand years were ended. This is the first resurrection.
column2: (Di res a di ded piipl dem neva kom bak alaiv til di touzn ier dem don.) Dis a di fos taim piipl a kom bak alaiv.

column1: Blessed and holy is he who takes part in the first resurrection. Over these the second death has no power, but they shall be priests of God and of Christ and shall reign with Him a thousand years.|Di piipl dem we kom bak alaiv di fos taim riili api. Dem a Gad piipl. Di sekan det no av no powa uova dem. Dem a-go ton priis fi Gad an Krais Jiizas an dem a-go ruul wid im fi wan touzn ier.
When the thousand years are ended, Satan will be set free from his prison|Wen di touzn ier don, wan ienjel a-go luus Sietan fram im prizn

and will go out to deceive the nations which are in the four corners of the earth, Gog and Magog, to gather them for battle. Their number is like the sand of the sea.|an im a-go kom out an go fuul op di konchri dem aal uova di worl — dem kaal dem konchri ya Gag an Miegag. Im a go fi gyada dem op fi waar. Di wie dem so nof, dem komiin laik san a sii-said.
They traveled the breadth of the earth and surrounded the camp of the saints and the beloved city. But fire came down from God out of heaven and devoured them.
column2: Dem maach kraas di uol ort an sorkl di siti we Gad lov an wich paat im piipl did a liv. Bot faiya kom dong fram evn an bon dem op.

column1: The devil, who deceived them, was cast into the lake of fire and brimstone where the beast and the false prophet were. They will be tormented day and night forever and ever.|An di devl, we fuul dem op, get fling dong iina di siem liek a faiya we a bon wid solfa we di wail animal an di faalz prafit did get fling iina. Aal a dem a sofa wikid wikid die an nait fi eva an eva.

Then I saw a great white throne and Him who was seated on it. From His face the earth and the heavens fled away, and no place was found for them.|Den mi luk an si wan big, big, wait chuon an sumadi sidong pan it. Di ort an di skai did disapier fram infronta im an nobadi neva si dem agen.

And I saw the dead, small and great, standing before God. Books were opened. Then another book was opened, which is the Book of Life. The dead were judged according to their works as recorded in the books.|An mi si ded piipl, piipl we mata an piipl we no mata, tan op infronta di chuon, an som buk did uopm op. An wan neda buk did uopm op tu, di buk we Gad rait dong di niem a di piipl dem we a-go get fi liv fi eva. Di ded piipl dem get joj bies pan wa dem did du. An wa dem did du did rait dong iina di buk dem.

The sea gave up the dead who were in it, and Death and Hades delivered up the dead who were in them. And they were judged, each one by his works.|Aal a di ded piipl dem we did iina di sii go bifuo Gad fi go get joj. An aal uu did iina di plies we ded piipl de kom bak alaiv an go bifuo Gad fi go get joj fi aal we dem did du.
Then Death and Hades were cast into the lake of fire. This is the second death.
column2: Den det an di plies we ded piipl de get fling dong iina di liek a faiya. Dis a di laas taim piipl a-go ded. Di liek a faiya a di laas det.

column1: Anyone whose name was not found written in the Book of Life was cast into the lake of fire.|Enibadi uufa niem no rait dong iina di buk we Gad rait di niem a di piipl dem we a-go liv fi eva an eva, dem a-go get fling dong iina di liek a faiya tu.

Then I saw “a new heaven and a new earth.” For the first heaven and the first earth had passed away, and there was no more sea. |Den afta Gad don joj evribadi, mi si wan nyuu evn an wan nyuu ort, kaaz di fos evn an di fos ort did disapier, an di sii did disapier tu.

I, John, saw the Holy City, the New Jerusalem, coming down out of heaven from God, prepared as a bride adorned for her husband.|Mi si di uoli siti, di nyuu Jeruusilem, a kom dong fram Gad outa evn. It did luk laik wan uman we jres op nais nais fi go a ar wedn fi miit di man we shi a-go marid.

And I heard a loud voice from heaven, saying, “Look! The tabernacle of God is with men, and He will dwell with them. They shall be His people, and God Himself will be with them and be their God.|An mi did ier wan loud vais fram di chuon a se, “Fram nou aan Gad yaad a-go de mongks piipl. Im a-go liv wid dem an dem a-go bi fi'im piipl. Gad imself a-go de wid dem an im a-go bi fi dem Gad.

‘God shall wipe away all tears from their eyes. There shall be no more death.’ Neither shall there be any more sorrow nor crying nor pain, for the former things have passed away.”|Gad a-go waip dem fies an jrai op aal a dem yai-waata. Nobadi naa go ded agen, so nobadi naa go ala ar baal. An nobadi naa go fiil no pien, kaaz dem uol taim sitn de don we wid.”

He who was seated on the throne said, “Look! I am making all things new.” Then He said to me, “Write, for these words are faithful and true.”|Gad we did sidong pan di chuon se, “Mi a mek evriting nyuu!” Den im se, “Rait dis dong, kaaz wa mi a se a chuu an evribadi kyan biliiv it.”

He said to me, “It is done. I am the Alpha and the Omega, the Beginning and the End. I will give of the spring of the water of life to him who thirsts. |Im se tu mi se, “Evriting don nou. Mi a di fos an mi a di laas. Evriting staat wid mi an evriting don wid mi. Aal uufa chuot jrai, mi a-go gi dem waata fi jringk — waata fram di spring we gi laif, an mi a-go gi dem it frii.

He who overcomes shall inherit all things, and I will be his God and he shall be My son.|Enibadi we biit di devl an no gi iin tu di sitn dem we im waahn dem fi du, gweehn get aal dem nais sitn ya. An mi a-go bi fi dem Gad an dem a-go bi fi mi pikni.

But the cowardly, the unbelieving, the abominable, the murderers, the sexually immoral, the sorcerers, the idolaters, and all liars shall have their portion in the lake which burns with fire and brimstone. This is the second death.”|Bot di wan dem we a kowad, we no biliiv iina Gad, we mek demself doti wid aal a di naasi sitn we dem du, we kil piipl, we tek paat iina aal kain-a seks sin, we wok uobiya, we worship faalz gad an we tel lai — dem a-go get fling dong iina di liek a faiya we a bon wid solfa. A dis a di sekan det.”

One of the seven angels who had the seven bowls full of the seven last plagues came to me and said to me, “Come, I will show you the bride, the wife of the Lamb.”|Di sevn ienjel dem we did av di sevn boul ful-a di sevn laas sitn dem fi mek piipl sofa wikid wikid, wan a dem se tu mi se, “Kum, mek mi shuo yu di braid, di Biebi Shiip waif.”

And he carried me away in the Spirit to a great and high mountain, and showed me the Holy City, Jerusalem, descending out of heaven from God|Den di Spirit tek kanchuol a mi an di ienjel kyari mi we go op a di tap a wan ai ai mountn. Im shuo mi di uoli siti, Jeruusilem, we did a kom dong fram Gad, outa evn.

having the glory of God, her light like a most precious jewel, like a jasper, clear as crystal.|Di siti did ful-a Gad brait brait lait. Di wie it did so brait, it luk laik wan dier griin an bluu stuon we niem jaspa. Di stuon did so klier, yu kuda si rait chuu it, siem laik ou yu kyan si chuu kristal.

It had a great, high wall, with twelve gates, and at the gates twelve angels, and on the gates the names of the twelve tribes of the sons of Israel were written: |Di siti waal did wel ai an it did av twelv giet. Evri wan a di twelv giet dem did av wan ienjel a gyaad it, an di niem a wan a Izrel twelv chraib dem did rait dong pan it.

three gates on the east, three gates on the north, three gates on the south, and three gates on the west.|Di siti did shiep laik wan baks. Pan evri wan a di said dem, yu did av chrii giet: chrii pan di naat said, chrii pan di sout said, chrii pan di iis said, an chrii pan di wes said.

The wall of the city had twelve foundations, and on them were the names of the twelve apostles of the Lamb.|Di waal a di siti did bil op pan twelv big big stuon. An evri wan a di stuon dem did av di niem fi wan a di Biebi Shiip twelv apasl dem rait dong pan it.

He who talked with me had a golden rod to measure the city and its gates and wall.|Di ienjel we did a taak tu mi did av wan ruula iina im an we mek outa guol. Da ruula de a did fi meja di siti, di giet dem an di waal dem.

The city lies as a square, its length as long as its width. He measured the city with the rod: one thousand four hundred miles. Its length and breadth and height are equal.|Nou, di siti did shiep laik wan baks. Lang wie an kraas wie it meja di siem ting. Wen di ienjel meja it, it a did 1,400 mail lang, 1,400 mail waid, an 1,400 mail ai (aal a di said dem meja di siem ting).

He then measured its wall: two hundred feet by the measurement of a man, that is, of an angel.|Im meja di siti waal wid im ruula an it a did 216 fut ai (azkaadn tu ou piipl meja tingz, an a di siem wie fi meja di ienjel did a yuuz).

The wall was built of jasper and the city was pure gold, as clear as glass.|Di siti waal did mek outa som priti griin an bluu stuon we niem jaspa. An di siti did mek outa di bes kain-a guol. An di wie di guol did so gud, it komiin laik lait did a shain chuu it jos laik ou lait shain chuu glaas.

The foundations of the wall of the city were garnished with all kinds of precious jewels. The first foundation was jasper; the second, sapphire; the third, chalcedony; the fourth, emerald; |Di twelv big stuon we di siti waal did bil pan did mek outa aal kain-a priti dier stuon. Di fos stuon mek outa jaspa, stuon nomba tuu a did wan bluu stuon niem safaiya, nomba chrii a did kalsiduoni we did griin wid nof ada kola, stuon nomba fuo a did wan red an griin stuon niem emral

the fifth, sardonyx; the sixth, sardius; the seventh, chrysolite; the eighth, beryl; the ninth, topaz; the tenth, chrysoprase; the eleventh, jacinth; and the twelfth, amethyst.|nomba faiv a did wan saadaniks stuon we av red an som ada kola, stuon nomba siks a did wan red an griin stuon niem kaanieliyan, nomba sevn a did wan yelo guol stuon niem krisolait, nomba iet a did wan stuon niem beril wid bluu an griin an nof ada kola, stuon nomba nain a did tuopaz — it yelo, stuon nomba ten a did krisopries we luk laik griin apl, nomba ilevn a did jasint we miks wid red, arinj, bluu an griin, an stuon nomba twelv a wan porpl stuon niem amatis.

The twelve gates were twelve pearls, each of the gates made of a single pearl, and the street of the city was pure gold, transparent as glass.|Di twelv giet dem a twelv porl, so wan giet mek outa wan porl. An di mien ruod iina di siti di mek outa di bes kain-a guol. An di wie ou di guol did so gud, it komiin laik lait did a shain chuu it jos laik ou lait shain chuu glaas.
I saw no temple in the city, for the Lord God Almighty and the Lamb are its temple.|Mi neehn si Gad ous iina di siti, kaaz di Laad Gad we nobadi no powaful laik an di Biebi Shiip, a dem a Gad ous.

The city has no need of sun or moon to shine in it, for the glory of God is its light, and its lamp is the Lamb. |Di siti no niid di son ar di muun fi lait it op, kaaz Gad brait brait lait, lait it op, an di Biebi Shiip a di lamp fi di siti.

And the nations of those who are saved shall walk in its light, and the kings of the earth shall bring their glory and honor into it. |Di piipl dem fram aal a di konchri dem iina di worl a-go liv iina di lait we a shain fram di siti, an di king dem we ruul di worl a-go kyari aal a di sitn dem we mek dem rich go iina di siti.
Its gates shall never be shut by day, for there shall be no night there. |Di giet fi di siti neva lak a die taim (an dem no av no nait de).
They shall bring into it the glory and the honor of the nations.
column2: Aal di piipl dem iina di worl a-go kyari aal a di sitn dem we mek dem rich go iina di siti.

column1: No unclean thing shall ever enter it, nor shall anyone who commits abomination or falsehood, but only those whose names are written in the Lamb’s Book of Life.|Notn we no kliin, nobadi we du wikid an torbl naasinis, an nobadi we tel lai kyan go iina di siti. Onggl di piipl dem uufa niem rait dong iina di buk we di Biebi Shiip av kyan go iin de. A iina da buk de Gad rait dong di niem a di piipl dem we a-go liv fi eva an eva.

Then he showed me a pure river of the water of life, clear as crystal, flowing from the throne of God and of the Lamb|Den di ienjel shuo mi di riva wid di waata we gi laif. Di waata did a kom fram Gad an di Biebi Shiip chuon. Di waata did so klier it luk laik kristal.

in the middle of its street. On each side of the river was the tree of life, which bore twelve kinds of fruit, yielding its fruit each month. The leaves of the tree were for the healing of the nations.|Di waata did a ron dong di migl a di siti mien ruod. Pan di tuu saida di riva, di chrii we gi laif did a gruo. Di chrii bier fruut twelv taim fi di ier — wan taim fi evri mont a di ier. Di piipl iina di worl yuuz di liif dem fi mek dem beta wen dem sik.

There shall be no more curse. The throne of God and of the Lamb shall be in it, and His servants shall serve Him.|Notn ar nobadi we Gad no tek iin kyaahn go iina di siti. Gad an di Biebi Shiip chuon a-go iina di siti an Gad piipl a-go worship im.
They shall see His face, and His name shall be on their foreheads.|Dem a-go si Gad fies tu fies, an im niem a-go rait pan dem farid.

Night shall be no more. They need no lamp nor the light of the sun, for the Lord God will give them light. And they shall reign forever and ever.|No muo nait naa go kom iina di siti, so Gad piipl dem naa go niid no lamp lait ar no son lait, kaaz di Laad Gad brait brait lait a-go lait op di siti. An Gad piipl a-go ruul fi eva an eva.

The angel said to me, “These words are faithful and true. The Lord God of the holy prophets sent His angel to show to His servants the things which must soon take place.”|Di ienjel tel mi se, “Aal a dem sitn ya we mi a tel yu chuu an evribadi kyan biliiv dem. Di Laad, di Gad we gi'im Spirit tu im prafit dem fi priich im wod, sen im ienjel kom shuo im sorvant di sitn dem we suun apm.”

“Look, I am coming soon. Blessed is he who keeps the words of the prophecy of this book.”|Jiizas se, “Lisn, aal a unu, mi suun kom! Unu si enibadi we du aal we rait dong iina da buk ya bout wa a-go apm nou an wa a-go apm lieta, a dem wel api.”

I, John, am he who saw and heard these things. When I heard and saw them, I fell down to worship at the feet of the angel who showed me these things.|A mi, Jan, we ier an rait dong dem sitn ya. An wen mi did ier an si dem sitn de, mi fling dong miself a di ienjel fut we did a shuo mi di sitn dem. Mi did bout fi worship im

But he said to me, “See that you not do that. For I am your fellow servant, and of your brothers the prophets, and of those who keep the words of this book. Worship God!”|bot di ienjel se tu mi se, “Nuo, no du dat! Mi a wan sorvant jos laik yu an yu breda — di prafit dem, an aal uu du we rait dong iina da buk ya. A Gad yu fi worship!

Then he said to me, “Do not seal the words of the prophecy of this book, for the time is at hand. 11He who is unjust, let him be unjust still. He who is filthy, let him be filthy still. He who is righteous, let him be righteous still. He who is holy, let him be holy still.”|Di sitn dem we bout fi apm nou, an di sitn dem we a-go apm lieta we rait dong iina da buk ya, no aid dem fram piipl, kaaz di taim suun kom fi aal a dem apm.

He who is unjust, let him be unjust still. He who is filthy, let him be filthy still. He who is righteous, let him be righteous still. He who is holy, let him be holy still.”|So, di piipl dem we a du rang mos gwaan du rang. Di piipl dem we a du aal kain-a naasinis mos gwaan du dem naasinis. Di piipl dem we a liv rait mos gwaan liv rait, an di piipl dem we a kip demself kliin mos gwaan kip demself kliin.

“Look, I am coming soon! My reward is with Me to give to each one according to his work.|“Lisn, aal a unu, mi suun kom! An wen mi kom mi a-go ponish di piipl dem we du rang, an mi a-go gi di piipl dem we a liv rait wa mi did se mi wuda gi dem. Evribadi a-go get wa dem fi get bies pan wa dem du.
I am the Alpha and the Omega, the Beginning and the End, the First and the Last.”|Mi a di fos an mi a di laas — Evriting staat wid mi, an evriting don wid mi.

Blessed are those who do His commandments, that they may have the right to the tree of life, and may enter through the gates into the city.|“Di wan dem we wash dem lang jakit a dem api, kaaz a dem a-go get di rait fi go iina di siti an fi iit fruut fram di chrii we gi laif.

Outside are dogs and sorcerers and the sexually immoral and murderers and idolaters and everyone who loves and practices a lie.|Bot di piipl dem we mek demself doti wid aal kain-a naasinis kyaahn go iina di siti: piipl we wok uobiya, du aal kain-a seks sin, kil piipl, worship faalz gad, an piipl we lov fi tel lai, non a dem kyaahn go iina di siti.

“I, Jesus, have sent My angel to you with this testimony for the churches. I am the Root and the Offspring of David, the Bright and Morning Star.”|“A mi, Jiizas, sen mi ienjel kom tel yu dem sitn ya fi tel di choch dem. Mi a di wan we kom fram King Dievid fambili — Mi a di wan we komiin laik di brait staar we shain wen di son a kom op a maanin taim.

The Spirit and the bride say, “Come.” Let him who hears say, “Come.” Let him who is thirsty come. Let him who desires take the water of life freely.|Di Spirit an di braid se, “Kom Laad Jiizas!” An aal uu ier wa de iina da buk ya, se, “Kom Laad Jiizas!” Aal uufa chuot jrai an we waahn waata fi jringk, kom kom tek di frii waata we gi laif.

I testify to everyone who hears the words of the prophecy of this book: If anyone adds to these things, God shall add to him the plagues that are written in this book.|Mi a waan enibadi we ier di sitn dem we rait dong iina da buk ya bout wa a-go apm. Mi a waan unu, ef nobadi ad notn, Gad a-go mek dem go chuu di sevn torbl sitn dem we rait dong iina da buk ya.

And if anyone takes away from the words of the book of this prophecy, God shall take away his part out of the Book of Life and out of the Holy City and out of the things which are written in this book.|An ef enibadi tek we eni paat a di mesij we iina da buk ya bout we Gad se a-go apm, Gad a-go tek we fi dem rait fi iit non a di fruut fram di chrii we gi laif an im rait fi liv iina di uoli siti, we rait dong iina da buk ya.
He who testifies to these things says, “Surely I am coming soon.” Amen. Even so, come Lord Jesus!|Jiizas, di wan we tel wi dem sitn ya, im se, “Ye, mi suun kom.”Iemen! Kom Laad Jiizas!
The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.
column2: Mi prie se di Laad Jiizas wi shuo aal a im piipl lov iivn duo wi no dizorv it. Iemen!

column1: He was returning, sitting in his chariot and reading the book of Isaiah the prophet.|Tiyafilas sa, iina mi fos buk mi rait bout aal a di sitn dem we Jiizas du an we im tiich fram di staat

until the day when He was taken up, after He had given commandments through the Holy Spirit to the apostles whom He had chosen|til di die im get tek op iina evn. Dat a did afta Jiizas yuuz di Uoli Spirit fi tel im apasl dem we im did pik, wa im waahn dem fi du.

to whom He presented Himself alive after His passion by many infallible proofs, appearing to them for forty days, and speaking concerning the kingdom of God|Afta im did sofa an ded pan di kraas, im kom bak alaiv an shuo imself tu im apasl dem. Im pruuv tu dem iina nof difrant wie se im alaiv. Fi bout faati die im kip aan a shuo op mongks dem taim afta taim an taak tu dem bout Gad kindom.

Being assembled with them, He commanded them, “Do not depart from Jerusalem, but wait for the promise of the Father, of which you have heard from Me.|Wan a di taim wen im did a iit wid dem im tel dem se, “Tan a Jeruusilem an wiet fi wa mi Faada pramis fi gi unu, di siem sitn we mi did tel unu bout.
For John baptized with water, but you shall be baptized with the Holy Spirit not many days from now.”|Kaaz Jan baptaiz piipl wid waata, bot kopl die fram nou Gad a-go baptaiz unu wid di Uoli Spirit.

So when they had come together, they asked Him, “Lord, will You at this time restore the kingdom to Israel?”|So wen dem kom tugeda, dem aks im se, “Laad, a nou yu a-go kaaz di Izrelait dem fi ruul agen?”

He said to them, “It is not for you to know the times or the dates, which the Father has fixed by His own authority.|Im se tu dem se, “A onggl mi Faada wan av di powa fi disaid wen dat a-go apm. An im no lou unu fi nuo dat.

But you shall receive power when the Holy Spirit comes upon you. And you shall be My witnesses in Jerusalem, and in all Judea and Samaria, and to the ends of the earth.”|Bot di Uoli Spirit a-go kom pan unu an ful unu op wid powa an unu wi tel piipl iina Jeruusilem, Judiya, Samieriya an aal uova di worl bout mi.”

When He had spoken these things, while they looked, He was taken up. And a cloud received Him from their sight.|Az im don se dis tu dem, Gad tek im op iina evn rait infronta dem yai, an wen im did a go op, wan kloud aid im so dem kudn si im no muor.

While they looked intently toward heaven as He ascended, suddenly two men stood by them in white garments.|Dem did stil a luk iina di skai wen Jiizas did a go op, wen aal av a sodn tuu man we jres iina wait kluoz kom tan op saida dem

They said, “Men of Galilee, why stand looking toward heaven? This same Jesus, who was taken up from you to heaven, will come in like manner as you saw Him go into heaven.”|an se tu dem se, “Unu man we kom fram Gyalalii, wa mek unu tan op ya-so wid unu yai faasn pan di skai? Da siem Jiizas ya we unu si get tek op fram unu iina evn, im a-go kom bak di siem wie, jos laik ou unu si im go op iina evn.”

Then they returned to Jerusalem from the Mount of Olives, which is a Sabbath day’s walk from Jerusalem.|Di apasl dem lef di il niem Mount Aliv an go baka Jeruusilem, bout aaf mail waak fram di mountn.

When they had entered, they went up into the upper room, where they were staying: Peter, James, John, and Andrew; Philip and Thomas; Bartholomew and Matthew; James the son of Alphaeus and Simon the Zealot; and Judas the son of James.|Wen dem kech a Jeruusilem, dem go opstiez go a di ruum we dem did a stie. Piita, Jan, Jiemz an Anju; Filip an Tamas, Bartalimyuu an Matyu; Jiemz, Alfiyos bwai pikni, Saiman we niem Zelat, an Juudas, Jiemz bwai pikni, aal a dem did de de.

These all continued with one accord in prayer and supplication, with the women and Mary the mother of Jesus, and with His brothers.|Di uol a dem did eva a miit tugeda fi prie: dem, di uman dem, Mieri, Jiizas mada, an Jiizas breda dem.

In those days Peter stood up among the disciples (the number of people together was about a hundred and twenty), and said|Iina dem die de, wen di biliiva dem gyada op fi wan a dem miitn, (bout onjrid an twenti a dem did de de), Piita tan op

“Brothers, this Scripture had to be fulfilled, which the Holy Spirit previously spoke by the mouth of David concerning Judas, who became the guide to those who seized Jesus. |an se tu dem se, “Breda an sista, wa rait dong iina Gad wod did afi apm. Lang bifuo it apm, di Uoli Spirit did mek Dievid taak bout Juudas, di wan we sel out Jiizas an mek di piipl dem ares im.
For he was numbered with us and took part in this ministry.
column2: Jiizas did pik Juudas fi bi wan a im apasl an so im a did wan a wi.”

column1: (Now this man purchased a field with the reward of iniquity. And falling headlong, he burst asunder in the middle and all his organs spilled out.|(Im yuuz di moni we im did get fi sel out Jiizas an bai wan piis a lan. Pan da siem piis a lan de, im faal dong ed wie an im beli bos an im chraip an evriting iina im flai out.

It became known to all the residents of Jerusalem. So this field is called in their dialect Akeldama, that is, Field of Blood.)|Evribadi iina Jeruusilem ier bout wa apm tu im, so iina fi dem langwij dem kaal di piis a lan Akeldama, dat miin blod fiil.)

“For it is written in the Book of Psalms,‘Let his habitation become desolate,and let no one live in it,’and,‘Let another take his office.’|“Kaaz it rait dong iina di buk we niem Saamz se,“‘Mek im ous emti outan nobadi no liv de,’an,“‘Mek sumadi els tek fi'im plies an du di wok we im shuda du.’
Therefore, of these men who have accompanied us while the Lord Jesus went in and out among us|So wan a di man dem we did de de wid wi aal di taim wen di Laad Jiizas did a muuv mongks wi

beginning from the baptism of John until the very day that He was taken up from us, one of these men must become with us a witness of His resurrection.|fram wen Jan did staat baptaiz tu di taim wen Gad tek im op a evn, wi niid wan a dem man de fi jain op wid wi an tel piipl se Jiizas kom bak alaiv.

So they proposed two, Joseph, called Barsabbas, who was surnamed Justus, and Matthias.|So di biliiva dem kaal out tuu sumadi niem, wan a did Juozif we dem kaal Baasabas ar Jostos, an di ada wan niem Mataiyas.
Then they prayed, “You, Lord, who knows the hearts of all men, show which of these two You have chosen |Den dem prie, “Laad, yu nuo wa iina evribadi aat. So shuo wi wich wan a dem yu pik
to take the place in this ministry and apostleship, from which Judas by transgression fell, to go to his own place.|fi tek uova di apasl wok we Juudas did av. Kaaz Juudas get wa im dizorv.
Then they cast lots, and the lot fell on Matthias. So he was numbered with the eleven apostles.|Den dem jraa schraa an Mataiyas get pik, so im jain di gruup a ilevn apasl.
When the day of Pentecost had come, they were all together in one place.|Wen Pentikas die kom, aal a di piipl we biliiv iina Jiizas did gyada op iina di siem plies.

Suddenly a sound like a mighty rushing wind came from heaven, and it filled the whole house where they were sitting. |Aal av a sodn dem ier wan naiz a kom fram di skai. Di naiz soun laik wen wan chrang chrang briiz a bluo, an it ful op di uol ous we dem did sidong.
There appeared to them tongues as of fire, being distributed and resting on each of them|Den dem si som sitn we luk laik som likl faiya we shiep laik tong kom res pan evri wan a dem ed.

and they were all filled with the Holy Spirit and began to speak in other tongues, as the Spirit enabled them to speak.|Di Uoli Spirit tek kanchuol a aal a dem an gi dem powa fi taak iina som difrant difrant langwij.

Now dwelling in Jerusalem were Jews, devout men, from every nation under heaven.|Nou yu did av som Juu we aalwiez a worship Gad an we kom fram aal uova di worl. Di uol a dem did a stie iina Jeruusilem.

When this sound occurred, the crowd came together and were confounded, because each man heard them speaking in his own language.|Wen dem ier di big naiz, wan kroud a dem gyada op. Dem did wel shak kaaz evri wan a dem did ier iina fi dem uona langwij wa di biliiva dem did a se.

They were all amazed and marveled, saying to each other, “Are not all these who are speaking Galileans?|Dem did so shak dem kudn biliiv we dem did a ier, so dem aks, “Wiet, aal a dem piipl ya we a taak, no Gyalalii dem kom fram?
How is it that we hear, each in our own native language? |So ou kom evri wan a wi a ier dem a taak iina fi wi uona langwij, di langwij we wi taak fram wi a pikni?

Parthians, Medes and Elamites, residents of Mesopotamia, Judea and Cappadocia, Pontus and Asia|Evribadi ier dem uona Langwij, piipl we kom fram Paatiya, Miid, Iilom, piipl we kom fram Mesopotiemiya, Judiya, Kyapaduoshiya, Pontos, an Iezha

Phrygia and Pamphylia, Egypt and the regions of Libya near Cyrene, and visitors from Rome, both Jews and proselytes|piipl we kom fram Frijiya, Pamfiliya, Iijip an di paat a Libiya we nier Sairiin; piipl we kom fram Ruom an jos a tan de likl
Cretans and Arabs—we hear them speaking in our own languages the mighty works of God.
column2: (piipl we a Juu an piipl we ton Juu); piipl we kom fram Kriit an piipl we a Arab — wi ier di uol a dem a taak iina fi wi uona langwij bout di powaful sitn dem we Gad du!

column1: They were all amazed and perplexed, saying to each other, “What does this mean?”|Kaaz dem did so shak an kaaz wa dem di ier did kanfyuuz dem, dem aks dem wan aneda, “A wa aal a dis miin?”
Others mocking said, “These men are full of new wine.”|Bot som a dem laaf aafa di biliiva dem an se, “A jongk dem jongk man. Dem jringk tu moch wain we jos mek.”

But Peter, standing up with the eleven, lifted up his voice and said to them, “Men of Judea and all you who dwell in Jerusalem, let this be known to you, and listen to my words.|Den Piita tan op wid di ada ilevn apasl dem, riez im vais an taak tu di kroud a piipl dem se, “Aal a unu we a Juu, an aal a unu we liv iina Jeruusilem, mek a tel unu sopm an unu fi lisn gud wa mi a tel unu.
For these are not drunk, as you suppose, since it is the third hour of the day. |Dem piipl ya no jongk laik unu tingk. A jos nain aklak a maanin!
But this is what was spoken by the prophet Joel:|No man, a dem sitn ya di prafit Jowel did se wuda apm. Im se:

‘In the last days it shall be,’ says God,‘that I will pour out My Spirit on all flesh;your sons and your daughters shall prophesy,your young men shall see visions,and your old men shall dream dreams.|“Gad se, ‘Iina di laas die dem,mi a-go put mi Spirit iina piipl evriwe.Unu bwai pikni dem an unu gyal pikni dem a-go priich mi mesij.Unu yong man dem a-go get vijan fram Gad,an unu uol man dem a-go andastan Gad mesij chuu di jriim dem we dem get fram Gad.

Even on My menservants and maidservantsI will pour out My Spirit in those days;and they shall prophesy.|Iina dem die de mi a-go put mi Spirit iina aal uu du we mi se dem fi du, weda dem a man ar uman,an dem a-go priich mi mesij tu.

And I will show wonders in heaven aboveand signs on the earth below:blood, and fire, and vapor of smoke.|Mi a-go shuo som powaful sitn op iina di skai an shuo som sain pan da ort ya,blod an faiya an wan ton a sumuok.

The sun shall be turned into darkness,and the moon into blood,before that great and glorious day of the Lord comes.|Di son a-go ton blak laik naitan di muun a-go ton red laik blod bifuo di big an impuotant die kom fi di Laad du som powaful sitn.
And whoever callson the name of the Lord shall be saved.
column2: An evribadi we kaalpan di Laad niem gweehn get siev.’

column1: “Men of Israel, hear these words: Jesus of Nazareth was a man attested to you by God with powerful works and wonders and signs, which God did through Him in your midst, as you yourselves know. |“Unu Izrel piipl, ier we mi a se: Gad yuuz di mirikl, sain an powaful sitn dem we im did mek Jiizas du mongks unu, fi shuo unu klier klier se im did a wok wid Jiizas, di man fram Nazaret.

You have taken Him, who was handed over to you by the ordained counsel and foreknowledge of God, and by lawless hands have crucified and killed Him|Azkaadn tu im plan, Gad gi uova da man de tu unu kaaz a so im did set it op, an im did don nuo se a so tingz did a-go go. An unu mek di piipl we a no Juu kil im pan di kraas.
whom God raised up by loosening the pull of death, because it was not possible that He should be held by it.|Bot Gad mek im kom bak alaiv an frii im fram det powa kaaz det kudn kip im dong fi eva.

For David says concerning Him:‘I foresaw the Lord always before me,for He is at my right hand,that I may not be shaken.|Dis a wa Dievid did se bout im. Im se,“‘Mi si di Laad, im eva infronta mi.Im aalwiez de wid mi, rait saida mi.Notn kyaahn shiek mi.

Therefore my heart was glad, and my tongue rejoiced;moreover my flesh will dwell in hope.|Siek-a dat an kaaz mi aat api,mi gi yu priez wid mi uona mout.An mi shuor se evriting a-go aarait,iivn duo mi a wan man jos laik evribadi els,bot mi a luk fi get aal wa Gad pramis fi gi mi.

For You will not abandon my soul to Hades,nor will You allow Your Holy One to see corruption.|Kaaz yu naa go figet mi an lef mi suol mongks di ded,an yu naa go lef yu sorvant we aalwiez du wa yu se fi ratn iina di griev.
You have made known to me the ways of life;You will make me full of joy with Your presence.|Yu shuo mi wa mi fi du so dat mi kyan riili liv.An kaaz yu de ya wid mi, yu wi mek mi aat wel api.’

“Brothers, I may speak confidently to you concerning the patriarch David, that he both died and was buried, and his tomb is with us to this day. |“Breda an sista mi no afi fried fi taak tu unu bout wi faada Dievid. Wi nuo se im ded an dem beri im, an im tuum stil de ya op tu tide.

But being a prophet, and knowing that God had sworn with an oath to him, that of his seed according to the flesh, He would raise up the Christ to sit on his throne|Im a did wan prafit an im did nuo se Gad did pramis im se im a-go mek wan a im pikni sidong pan im chuon.

he foresaw this and spoke concerning the resurrection of the Christ, that His soul was not abandoned to Hades, nor did His flesh see corruption.|Chuu Gad did shuo Dievid wa im a-go du bifuo it apm, Dievid taak bout ou Gad wuda mek Krais Jiizas kom bak alaiv afta im ded. Im se Gad wudn lef im iina di griev ar mek im badi ratn.
God raised up this Jesus, of which we all are witnesses. |Gad did mek da siem Jiizas de kom bak alaiv, an di uol a wi did si wid wi uona yai.

Therefore being exalted to the right hand of God, and having received from the Father the promise of the Holy Spirit, He has poured out this which you now see and hear.|So Gad big op Jiizas an put im fi sidong a im rait an. An Faada Gad gi im Bwai Pikni di Uoli Spirit jos laik im did pramis. So aal wa unu a si an a ier ya nou, a Jiizas mek dem a apm.
For David has not ascended to the heavens, yet he says:‘The Lord said to my Lord,“Sit at My right hand,|Dievid neva get tek op iina evn, bot im se,“ ‘Di Laad tel fi mi Laad se:“Sidong a mi rait an
Until I make Your enemiesYour footstool.” ’
column2: til mi mek yu enimi demkom ton wan stuul fi yu put yu fut pan.” ’

column1: “Therefore, let all the house of Israel assuredly know that God has made this Jesus, whom you have crucified, both Lord and Christ.”|“So mi waahn aal a unu Izrel piipl fi nuo an andastan dis: Gad mek da siem Jiizas ya Laad an Krais.”

When they heard this, they were stung in the heart and said to Peter and to the rest of the apostles, “Brothers, what shall we do?”|Wen di piipl dem ier di sitn dem we Piita se, a laik sitn tab dem iina dem aat. So dem aks Piita an di ada apasl dem se, “Wi breda, wa wi fi du?”

Peter said to them, “Repent and be baptized, every one of you, in the name of Jesus Christ for the forgiveness of sins, and you shall receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.|Piita tel dem se “Aal a unu, ton we fram unu sin dem an shuo se unu sari fi wa unu du, get baptaiz iina Jiizas Krais niem an Gad wi paadn unu fi unu sin dem. Ef unu du dat, Gad wi gi unu im gif, dat a di Uoli Spirit.

For the promise is to you, and to your children, and to all who are far away, as many as the Lord our God will call.”|Wa Gad pramis a fi unu an unu pikni dem an fi aal uu liv faar faar fram ya-so — a fi evribadi we Gad a-go kaal fi bi im pikni.”

With many other words he testified and exhorted them, saying, “Be saved from this perverse generation.” |Piita yuuz nof ada wod fi waan dem an fi beg di piipl dem se, “Unu fi tek we unuself fram mongks di wikid piipl we a liv iina dem taim ya, so dat di ponishment we a-go kom pan dem no riich unu tu.”

Then those who gladly received his word were baptized, and that day about three thousand souls were added to them.|Di wan dem we biliiv Piita mesij get baptaiz, an da die de, di Laad mek bout chrii touzn muor piipl jain di choch.

They continued steadfastly in the apostles’ teaching and fellowship, in the breaking of bread and in the prayers.|Di piipl dem we biliiv Piita mesij spen di uol a dem taim a lorn fram di apasl dem, shier wa dem av wid wan aneda, iit tugeda an prie tu Gad tugeda.
Fear came to every soul. And many wonders and signs were done through the apostles.
column2: Aal a di piipl dem shuo nof rispek fi Gad kaaz im did mek di apasl dem du nof nof mirikl an som powaful sitn mongks dem.

column1: All who believed were together and had all things in common. |Evribadi we biliiv iina Jiizas did stie tugeda — dem a did wan gruup, an dem elp dem wan aneda wid wa dem niid.
They sold their property and goods and distributed them to all, according to their need. |Dem sel som a di sitn dem we dem did av an gi tu wan aneda fram taim tu taim azkaadn tu wa dem niid.

And continuing daily with one mind in the temple, and breaking bread from house to house, they ate their food with gladness and simplicity of heart|Evridie dem miit op iina di yaad we Gad ous de. Dem go a wan aneda ous an iit fuud tugeda an dem aat did wel api. Dem did api fi shier wid wan aneda.
praising God and having favor with all the people. And the Lord added to the church daily those who were being saved.
column2: Dem kip aan a priez Gad an aal di piipl iina Jeruusilem did api wid dem an taak gud bout dem. Evridie di Laad Jiizas siev muor an muor piipl an mek dem jain di choch.

column1: Now Peter and John went up together to the temple at the ninth hour, the hour of prayer. |Wan die Piita an Jan did a go op a Gad ous. A did chrii aklak iina di die, di taim wen piipl miit fi prie.

A man lame from birth was being carried, whom people placed daily at the gate of the temple called Beautiful to ask alms from those who entered the temple.|A di giet fi Gad ous, di giet we dem kaal Giet Byuutiful, yu did av wan man we did kripl fram im baan. Evridie dem wuda put im a di giet fi beg sopm fram di piipl dem we a go iina di yaad we Gad ous de.
Seeing Peter and John about to go into the temple, he asked for alms.|Wen di bega-man si Piita an Jan bout fi go iin, im beg dem som moni.
Peter, gazing at him with John, said, “Look at us.” |Piita an Jan luk chriet pan im an Piita se tu im, “Luk pan wi!”
So he paid attention to them, expecting to receive something from them.|So di kripl man faasn im yai dem pan dem kaaz im fiil shuor se dem did a go gi im som moni.

Then Peter said, “I have no silver and gold, but I give you what I have. In the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, rise up and walk.” |Den Piita se tu im, “Mi no av no moni at aal kyan gi yu. Bot wa mi av mi a-go gi yu. Iina Jiizas Krais niem, di wan we kom fram Nazaret, git op an waak.”
He took him by the right hand and raised him up. Immediately his feet and ankles were strengthened.
column2: Den Piita uol im rait an an elp im fi get op. Siem taim di man fut dem get chrang.

column1: Jumping up, he stood and walked and entered the temple with them, walking and jumping and praising God.|Im jomp rait op an staat waak. Den im go wid dem iina di yaad we Gad ous de, a waak, an a jomp op an dong an a priez Gad.
All the people saw him walking and praising God.|Wen di piipl dem si im a waak an a priez Gad,

They knew that it was he who sat for alms at the Beautiful Gate of the temple. And they were filled with wonder and amazement at what happened to him.|dem si se a di siem bega-man we yuus tu de a di giet fi Gad ous, di giet we niem Giet Byuutiful. Dem did so shak dem kudn biliiv we apm tu im.

As the lame man who was healed held on to Peter and John, all the people ran together to them in the entrance that is called Solomon’s Porch, greatly amazed. |Wen dem riich di plies we dem kaal Salaman Puoch, dat a wan waak wie we av wan ous tap uova it, di man did stil a uol aan pan Piita an Jan. Aal a di piipl dem did shak. Dem ron tugeda go we Piita an Jan an di man did de.

When Peter saw it, he answered the people: “Men of Israel, why do you marvel at this man? Or why do you stare at us, as if by our own power or piety we had made him walk? |Wen Piita si dem, im se tu dem se, “Aal a unu Izrel piipl, wa unu shak so fa? Wa unu tan op a luk pan wi so fa? Unu tingk a chuu wi powaful ar chuu wi gud iina Gad yai mek wi mek da man ya waak?

The God of Abraham and Isaac and Jacob, the God of our fathers, has glorified His Son ­Jesus, whom you handed over and denied in the presence of Pilate, when he had decided to release Him.|Di Gad fi Iebriyam, Aizak, an Jiekob, di Gad fi wi faada faada dem, im big op an gi nof rispek tu im sorvant Jiizas. A da siem Jiizas de unu gi op, an ton unu bak pan im infronta Pailat, iivn duo Pailat did mek op im main fi let im go.
You denied the Holy and Righteous One and asked for a murderer to be granted to you|Iivn duo Jiizas aalwiez sorv Gad an du we rait, unu ton unu bak pan im an aks fi dem le'go wan mordara insted-a im.

and you killed the Creator of Life, whom God has raised from the dead, of which we are witnesses. |Unu kil di wan we gi piipl riil laif, bot Gad mek im kom bak alaiv. An wi si aal a dat wid wi uona yai.

And His name, by faith in His name, has made this man strong, whom you see and know. And faith which comes through Him has given him perfect health in your presence.|A Jiizas powa mek da kripl man ya get beta. So wa unu si apm tide, onggl apm kaaz wi biliiv iina Jiizas. Unu kyan si fi unuself se a Jiizas powa mek im beta.
Now brothers, I know that you acted in ignorance, as did also your rulers. |“Nou mi breda an sista, mi nuo se unu an unu liida dem neva nuo wa unu did a du.

But what God foretold through all the prophets, that His Christ should suffer, He thus fulfilled.|Bot lang bifuo it apm, Gad tel im prafit dem se di wan we im wuda sen fi siev piipl wuda sofa, an a siem so im mek it apm.

Therefore repent and be converted, that your sins may be wiped away, that times of refreshing may come from the presence of the Lord|So ton we fram unu sin, beg Gad paadn an kom bak tu im, so dat im wi tek we unu sin dem.

and that He may send the One who previously was preached to you, Jesus Christ|Unu fi du dat so di Laad Gad wi sen wan taim fi unu spirit res an get chrang, an im wi sen Krais Jiizas kom tu unu, Jiizas we im pik fi siev piipl.
whom the heavens must receive until the time of restoring what God spoke through all His holy prophets since the world began.
column2: Jiizas afi tan a evn til di taim kom fi Gad mek evriting nyuu. A dat Gad mek im prafit dem tel piipl fram wie bak wen.

column1: For Moses indeed said to the fathers, ‘The Lord your God will raise up for you a prophet like me from your brothers. You shall hear whatever He may say to you.|Kaaz Muoziz did se, ‘Di Laad, fu'unu Gad, a-go riez op wan prafit laik mi. Da prafit de a-go bi fu'unu, an im a-go kom fram mongks unu uona piipl. Unu mos lisn an du evriting we im se.

And it shall be that every soul who will not hear that prophet shall be utterly eliminated from the people.|Gad a-go ton im bak pan enibadi we no lisn an we no du we da prafit de se, an dem naa go bi paat a im piipl no muor.’

Indeed, all the prophets since Samuel and those who follow, as many as have spoken, have likewise foretold these days.|“An aal a di prafit dem, fram Samwel kom dong, taak bout di sitn dem we a apm iina dem taim ya lang bifuo dem apm.

You are the sons of the prophets and of the covenant which God made with our fathers, saying to Abraham, ‘And in your seed shall all the families of the earth be blessed.’|Unu a di prafit dem pikni, an Gad did mek wan pramis tu unu faada faada dem an da pramis de a fi unu. Im tel Iebriyam se, ‘Mi a-go yuuz fi yu pikni dem fi bles aal a di piipl dem pan ort.’

God, having raised up His Son Jesus, sent Him to you first, to bless you in turning every one of you from your iniquities.”|So wen Gad riez op Jiizas im sorvant, im sen im kom a unu fos fi bles unu. Im bles unu wen im kaaz unu fi ton we fram unu wikidnis.”

As they spoke to the people, the priests, the captain of the temple, and the Sadducees came upon them|Piita an Jan did stil a taak tu di piipl wen di priis dem, di ed gyaad dem fi Gad ous, an di Sadyusii dem kom op tu dem.
being greatly troubled because they taught the people and preached through Jesus the resurrection from the dead.
column2: Dem did wel beks kaaz di apasl dem did a tiich di piipl se Jiizas did ded an kom bak alaiv. An dem yuuz dat fi shuo se ded piipl a-go kom bak alaiv tu.

column1: And they seized them and put them in custody until the next day, for it was already evening. |Dem grab Piita an Jan, an kaaz nait did suun kom, dem put dem iina jiel til di neks die.

But many of those who heard the word believed, and the number of the men grew to about five thousand.|Bot nof a di piipl dem we did ier di apasl dem mesij biliiv it. Di gruup a man dem we biliiv iina Jiizas nou a did bout faiv touzn.
On the next day their rulers and elders and scribes|Di neks die di ruula dem, di elda dem, an di Laa tiicha dem gyada op iina Jeruusilem.

were assembled at Jerusalem with Annas the high priest, and Caiaphas, and John and Alexander, and all who were of the family of the high priest. |Anos di liida fi di priis dem, Kaiyafas, Jan, Aligzanda, an di ada man dem fram di liida fi di priis fambili did de de tu.

When they had stood them in the midst, they asked, “By what power or by what name have you done this?”|Dem aada Piita an Jan fi kom tan op infronta dem an dem staat kwestiyan dem: “A uu gi unu di powa an di rait fi mek di kripl man get beta?”

Then Peter, filled with the Holy Spirit, said to them, “Rulers of the people and elders of Israel: |Di Uoli Spirit tek kanchuol a Piita, den Piita se tu dem: “Unu we a di ruula dem an di elda dem fi di piipl
If we today are being examined concerning a good deed done to a crippled man, how this man has been healed|sins unu a kwestiyan wi bout di gud we wi du fi di kripl man an ou im get beta,

be it known to you all, and to all the people of Israel, that by the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, whom you crucified, whom God raised from the dead, by Him this man stands before you whole.|lisn mi, mi waahn aal a unu an evribadi we iina Izrel fi nuo, a Jiizas Krais we kom fram Nazaret mek im beta. Jiizas we unu kil pan di kraas, an we Gad mek kom bak alaiv, a im mek da kripl man ya tan op chrang infronta unu tide.
He is‘the stone you builders rejected,which has become the cornerstone.’|Jiizas a “ ‘di rakstuon we unu, di bilda, did fling wean we nou a di wan we a uol op di bildin.’

There is no salvation in any other, for there is no other name under heaven given among men by which we must be saved.”|A onggl Jiizas wan kyan siev piipl, an a fi'im niem Gad gi piipl. Nobadi els iina di uol worl kyaahn siev yu.

When they saw the boldness of Peter and John and perceived that they were illiterate and uneducated men, they marveled. And they recognized that they had been with ­Jesus.|Wen dem si ou Piita an Jan tan op chrang fi wa dem biliiv an wen dem lorn se dem a did jos aadineri sumadi we neva go a no skuul go lorn, dem shak. Den dem si se di tuu a dem did nuo Jiizas an did waak wid im fi a gud wail.
But seeing the man who was healed standing with them, they had nothing to say against it. |An kaaz di kripl man we did get beta did tan op wid dem, dem kudn se notn.

So when they had commanded them to go outside of the Sanhedrin, they conferred among themselves|So di liida dem gi aada fi di gyaad dem tek Piita, Jan, an di man outa di ruum we dem did a miit so dat di liida dem kuda taak wid dem wan aneda.

saying, “What shall we do to these men? For, indeed, that an acknowledged miracle has been done through them is revealed to all who dwell in Jerusalem, and we cannot deny it.|Dem aks, “Wa wi a-go du wid dem man ya? Evribadi we liv iina Jeruusilem si an nuo se a wan big mirikl dem man ya du tide, so wi kyaahn fuul nobadi se it neva apm.

But lest it spread further among the people, let us threaten them that they no longer speak to anyone in this name.|Bot wi kyaahn mek ada piipl ier bout dem sitn ya. So wi afi go waan dem man ya mek dem nuo se dem kyaahn priich tu di piipl dem an yuuz Jiizas niem no muor.”
Then they called them and commanded them not to speak or teach at all in the name of Jesus.
column2: Den dem kaal iin Piita an Jan an waan dem se dem no fi priich ar tiich iina Jiizas niem tu di piipl at aal at aal.

column1: But Peter and John answered them, “Whether it is right in the sight of God to listen to you more than to God, you judge. |Bot Piita an Jan ansa dem se, “Unu joj fi unuself wa unu tingk it rait fi du iina Gad yai, fi du we unu se, ar fi du we Gad se?
For we cannot help but declare what we have seen and heard.
column2: Kaaz wi kyaahn tap taak bout di sitn dem we wi did si an ier.”

column1: When they had further threatened them, they let them go, finding no way to punish them, because of the people. For all glorified God for what was done, |Di liida dem chretn Piita an Jan agen, den dem let dem go. Dem kudn mek op dem main ou fi ponish Piita an Jan, kaaz aal a di piipl dem did a gi Gad priez fi wa did apm.
for the man on whom this miracle of healing was performed was over forty years old.
column2: Dem did a gi priez kaaz di kripl man we did get beta did uova faati ier uol.

column1: On being released, they went to their own people and reported what the chief priests and elders had said to them|Afta dem get let go Piita an Jan go bak tu di ada piipl we biliiv iina Jiizas an go tel dem evriting we di liida fi di priis dem an di elda dem se tu dem.

When they heard this, they lifted their voices in unity to God and prayed, “Lord, You are God, who has made the heaven and the earth and the sea and everything in them|Wen dem ier di nyuuz, aal a dem jain tugeda an staat prie tu Gad. Dem se, “Maasa Gad, a yu mek di evn an di ort an di sii an evriting we iina dem.
