and who by the mouth of Your servant David said:‘Why did the nations rage,and the people devise vain things?|Yu yuuz di Uoli Spirit fi mek yu sorvant Dievid, fi wi faada se:‘Wa mek di piipl we a no Juu a rail opan a plan aal saat a sitn gens Gad iivnduo dem kyaahn mek dem apm?

The kings of the earth came,and the rulers were assembled togetheragainst the Lordand against His Christ.|Di king dem pan ort get demself redi fi fait,an di ruula dem jain tugedafi fait gens Gad an gens fi'im Krais.’

Indeed, both Herod and Pontius Pilate, with the Gentiles and the people of Israel, were assembled together against Your holy Son Jesus whom You have anointed|Wi nuo fi shuor se a so it go, kaaz Erad, Ponchos Pailat, piipl we a no Juu, an di Izrel piipl miit op iina da siti ya an plan fi kil Jiizas, yu sorvant we uoli.
to do what Your hand and Your counsel had foreordained to be done.
column2: Dem kom tugeda fi du aal wa yu did don plan se wuda apm an it apm da wie de kaaz a yu powa an kaaz dat a wa yu did waahn fi apm.

column1: Now, Lord, look on their threats and grant that Your servants may speak Your word with great boldness|So Laad, luk pan ou dem a chretn wi! Elp yu sorvant dem fi pred yu mesij an no fried a notn.
by stretching out Your hand to heal and that signs and wonders may be performed in the name of Your holy Son Jesus.
column2: Yuuz yu powa an mek piipl beta. An mek wi yuuz di niem a yu sorvant Jiizas fi du som powaful mirikl an som sain.

column1: When they had prayed, the place where they were assembled together was shaken. And they were all filled with the Holy Spirit and spoke the word of God with boldness.|Afta dem don prie, di ous we dem did a miit get shiek op. Di Uoli Spirit tek kanchuol a dem an mek dem priich Gad wod an no fried a notn.

All the believers were of one heart and one soul, and no one said that what he possessed was his own. But to them all things were in common. |Aal a di piipl we biliiv iina Jiizas a did wan iina dem aat an main. Nobadi neva se, ‘Notn mi av a fi mi wan.’ Bot dem shier aal wa dem av mongks dem wan aneda.

With great power the apostles testified to the resurrection of the Lord Jesus, and great grace was on them all. |Di apasl dem kip aan tel piipl iina wan powaful wie bout ou Jiizas kom bak alaiv, an ou Gad shuo dem nof nof lov, iivn duo dem no dizorv it.

There was no one among them who lacked, for all those who were owners of land or houses sold them, and brought the income from what was sold|Non a di piipl we biliiv iina Jiizas neva shaat a notn, kaaz di wan dem we av lan an ous wuda sel dem an kyari di moni we dem get
and placed it at the apostles’ feet. And it was distributed to each according to his need.
column2: kom gi di apasl dem. Di apasl dem wuda shier it op gi evribadi bies pan wa dem niid.

column1: Joseph, whom the apostles called Barna­bas (which means, Son of Encouragement), a Levite from the land of Cyprus|So Juozif, wan man fram Saipros we elp tek kier a Gad ous, an we di apasl dem kaal Baanabas (Baanabas miin Bwai pikni we push piipl fi gwaan chos iina Gad)
sold a field he owned, and brought the money and placed it at the apostles’ feet.|sel piis a lan we im did av an kyari di moni kom gi di apasl dem fi shier op.
Now a man named Ananias, with his wife Sapphira, sold a piece of property. |Nou yu did av wan man an im waif niem Ananaiyas an Sofaira. Dem did sel piis a lan we dem did av.

He kept back part of the proceeds with his wife’s knowledge, and brought a part of it and placed it at the apostles’ feet.|Im mek op im main fi kip bak som a di moni we im get fi di lan, an im waif did nuo bout it tu. Im kyari di res a di moni go gi di apasl dem.

Then Peter said, “Ananias, why has Satan filled your heart to deceive the Holy Spirit and keep back part of the proceeds of the land?|Den Piita aks im se, “Ananaiyas, ou kom yu mek Sietan tek kanchuol a yu an mek yu lai tu di Uoli Spirit? Yu kip bak som a di moni fi yuself, an kom a gwaan laik se yu a gi evriting?

While it remained unsold, was it not your own? And when it was sold, was it not under your authority? Why have you conceived this deed in your heart? You did not lie to men, but to God.”|Tel mi sopm, di lan a no did fi yu bifuo yu sel it? An afta yu sel it, di moni a did fi yu an yu kuda du eniting we yu did waahn fi du wid it. So wa mek yu tingk yu did afi lai? A no piipl yu lai tu, a Gad yu lai tu.”

On hearing these words, Ananias fell down and died. And great fear came on all those who heard these things. |Wen Ananaiyas ier dem wod de im jrap dong ded siem taim. An evribadi we ier we apm kech dem fried.
The young men rose and wrapped him up and carried him out and buried him.
column2: So di yong man dem komiin kom rap op im badi an kyari im out go beri im.

column1: About three hours later his wife came in, not knowing what had happened. |Bout chrii owa lieta im waif kom iin tu, bot shi neva nuo wa did apm.

Peter said to her, “Tell me whether you sold the land for this amount?” She said, “Yes, for that much.|So Piita aks ar se, “Tel mi sopm, dis a aal a di moni yu an yu ozban sel di lan fa?” Shi se, “Yes! A aal a di moni dat we wi get fi'it.”

Peter said to her, “How is it that you have agreed together to test the Spirit of the Lord? Look! The feet of those who have buried your husband are at the door, and they will carry you out.”|Piita se tu ar se, “Mek di tuu a unu mek op unu main fi si ef unu kuda lai tu di Laad Spirit an no get ponish? Luk! Di man dem we beri yu ozban tan op a di duor, an dem a kom fi yu fi go beri yu tu.”

At once she fell down at his feet and died. Upon entering, the young men found her dead and carried her out and buried her beside her husband.|Siem taim shi jrap dong a im fut an ded. Den di yong man dem kom iin kom fain ar ded an dem kyari ar out go beri ar saida ar ozban.
Great fear came on the entire church and on all those who heard these things.
column2: Evribadi iina di choch an evribadi we ier bout dem sitn ya kech dem fried.

column1: Many signs and wonders were performed among the people by the hands of the apostles. And they were all together in Solomon’s Porch.
column2: Di apasl dem mek nof sain an mirikl apm mongks di piipl dem. An di uol a dem mek op dem main fi miit op tugeda pan Salaman Puoch.

column1: No one else dared join them, but the people respected them.|Nobadi we neva paat a dem gruup did mad inof fi go jain dem, iivn duo aal a di piipl iina Jeruusilem taak gud bout dem.
Believers were increasingly added to the Lord, crowds of both men and women|Bot muor an muor piipl biliiv iina di Laad an jain dem gruup, uol iip a man an uman.

so that they even brought the sick out into the streets and placed them on beds and mats, that at least the shadow of Peter passing by might touch some of them. |Siek-a aal wa did a apm, piipl kyari out dem sik kom pudong iina di ruod pan dem chrecha so dat iivn Piita sheda kuda faal pan dem.

Crowds also came out of the cities surrounding Jerusalem, bringing the sick and those who were afflicted by evil spirits, and they were all healed.|Kroud an kroud a piipl kom fram di toun dem roun Jeruusilem. Dem kyari dem sik piipl an piipl we diiman spirit did tek set pan kom a di apasl dem an aal a dem get beta.

Then the high priest and all those who were with him (that is, the sect of the Sadducees) rose up and were filled with jealousy.|Den di liida fi di priis dem an di Sadyusii dem we did a fala im did wel beks kaaz evribadi did api wid di apasl dem.
They seized the apostles and put them in the common prison.
column2: So dem ares di apasl dem an put dem iina di prizn we aal kain-a bad piipl de.

column1: But during the night an angel of the Lord opened the prison doors and led them out, and said|Bot iina di nait wan a di Laad ienjel dem uopm di prizn duor an let out di apasl dem. Di ienjel se
“Go, stand and speak in the temple to the people all the words of this life.”|“Go tan op iina di yaad we Gad ous de an tel di piipl dem evriting bout da nyuu wie ya fi liv.”

Having heard this, they entered the temple at dawn and taught. But the high priest and those who were with him came and called together the Sanhedrin and the senate of all the sons of Israel, and sent to the prison to have them brought out.|Wen die lait dem go iina di yaad we Gad ous de, siem laik ou di ienjel did tel dem fi du, an staat tiich di piipl dem. Wen di liida fi di priis dem an im falara dem riich, im kaal tugeda aal a di Juu liida dem fi wan miitn. Den im sen som suoja tu di prizn fi kyari di apasl dem kom infronta dem.
But when the officers came and did not find them in the prison, they returned and reported|Bot wen di afisa dem riich a di prizn, dem neva fain di apasl dem. So dem go bak go tel dem se

“We found the prison securely shut and the guards standing outside before the doors. But when we opened it, we found no one inside.” |“Wi fain di prizn lak op tait tait an di gyaad dem tan op a di duor, bot wen wi uopm di duor, wi no fain nobadi at aal.”

Now when the high priest, the captain of the temple, and the chief priests heard these things, they were in doubt of what might become of this.|Wen di ed gyaad fi Gad ous an di ed priis ier dem sitn de, dem shak, an staat wanda bout wa wuda kom out a aal a dis.

Then one came and told them, “Look, the men whom you put in prison are standing in the temple and teaching the people.”|Den sumadi kom tel dem se, “Lisn! Di man dem we unu did put iina prizn, mi si dem tan op iina di yaad we Gad ous de a tiich di piipl!”

Then the captain with his escorts went and brought them, without force lest they should be stoned, for they feared the people.|So di ed gyaad an di afisa dem go fi di apasl dem. Bot dem neva rof dem op ar notn, kaaz dem did fried se di piipl wuda stuon dem.

When they had brought them, they stood them before the Sanhedrin. And the high priest questioned them|Afta di ed gyaad fi Gad ous kyari iin di apasl dem, dem aada dem fi tan op infronta di liida dem, an di liida fi di priis dem kwestiyan dem.

saying, “Did we not strictly command you not to teach in this name? Yet now you have filled Jerusalem with your teaching, and you intend to bring on us this Man’s blood.”|Im se tu dem se, “Wi neva aada unu chrang chrang se unu no fi tiich nobadi bout di sitn dem we da man de niem Jiizas se unu fi tiich? Bot luk wa unu du. Unu ful op Jeruusilem wid di sitn dem we im tiich. An no onggl dat, unu chrai put fi'im blod pan wi an dem an se a wi kil im.”
Peter and the other apostles answered, “We must obey God rather than men. |Bot Piita an di ada apasl dem se tu dem se, “Wi afi du we Gad se wi fi du, bot wi no afi du wa piipl se wi fi du.
The God of our fathers raised Jesus, whom you killed by hanging on a tree.|Unu niel op Jiizas pan di kraas an kil im, bot di Gad fi fi wi faada faada dem, im mek im kom bak alaiv.

God exalted this Man to His right hand to be a Ruler and a Savior, to give repentance to Israel and forgiveness of sins.|Gad big op Jiizas an put im fi sidong a im rait an. Im mek Jiizas wan liida an di wan we a-go siev piipl so dat di Izrel piipl wuda get di chaans fi ton we fram dem sin, shuo se dem sari, an get dem sin paadn.

We are His witnesses to these words, as is the Holy Spirit whom God has given to those who obey Him.”|Wi a tel piipl bout dem sitn ya we wi nuo, an di Uoli Spirit we Gad gi tu aal uu du we im se, im a tel piipl bout dem sitn ya tu.”
When they heard this, they were cut to the heart and took counsel to kill them.|Wen di Juu liida dem ier dem sitn de, dem get beks til dem blod staat bwail an dem redi fi kil di apasl dem.

But a Pharisee in the Sanhedrin named Gamaliel, a teacher of the law honored by all the people, stood and ordered the apostles to be put outside for a little while.|Bot wan Farisii niem Gyamieliyel, wan a di Laa tiicha dem we evribadi rispek, tan op iina di miitn infronta aal a di liida dem an aada dem fi put di apasl dem outa duor likl bit.

Then he said to them, “Men of Israel, take heed to yourselves what you intend to do concerning these men.|Afta dat im se tu di ada liida dem, “Mi breda aal a wi a Izrelait. Nou ier wa mi a se, unu beta main wa unu bout fi du tu dem man ya.

For in previous days Theudas rose up, boasting to be somebody, to whom a number of about four hundred men joined themselves. He was killed, and all who obeyed him were dispersed and came to nothing.|Kopl ier bak wan man niem Tuodos shuo op an staat tel piipl bout ou im a wan powaful liida an bout fuo onjrid man did jain op wid im. Bot dem kil im, an aal a im falara dem skyata aal uova di plies an a so dat did don.

After Theudas, Judas the Galilean rose up in the days of the census and drew away many people after him. This man also perished, and all who obeyed him were scattered. |Afta dat wen di govament did a rait dong evribadi niem fi si umoch piipl did iina di konchri, Juudas we kom fram Gyalalii go gens di govament an get som piipl fi jain op wid im. Dem kil im an aal a im falara dem skyata tu.

Now I tell you, keep away from these men and leave them alone, because if this intention or this activity is of men, it will come to nothing.|So ier mi, wen it kom tu dem man ya lef dem, no du notn fi ort dem. Kaaz ef di sitn we dem plan an di wok we dem a du, ef a man kom op wid dem, it naa kom tu notn.

But if it is of God, you will not be able to overthrow them, lest perhaps you be found even fighting against God.”|Bot ef a Gad a gi dem powa fi du wa dem a du, unu kyaahn tap dem; unu wuda fain se unu onggl a fait gens Gad.” Im get dem fi lisn an du wa im se

They agreed with him. When they had called in the apostles, they beat them, and commanded them not to speak in the name of Jesus, and released them.|an dem kaal iin di apasl dem an mek di suoja dem biit dem. Den dem aada dem se, “No taak tu di piipl an yuuz Jiizas niem eva agen!” Afta dat dem let dem go.

Then they departed from the presence of the Sanhedrin, rejoicing that they were counted worthy to suffer shame for His name.|So di apasl dem lef di miitn wel api kaaz Gad did tingk dem gud inof fi mek dem sofa fi Jiizas Krais.

Daily, in the temple and from house to house, they did not cease to teach and preach Jesus Christ.|An evridie di apasl dem go a di yaad we Gad ous de an iina piipl ous go tiich an priich di Gud Nyuuz se Jiizas a di wan we Gad sen fi siev piipl.

Now in those days, as the disciples were multiplied, there was murmuring among the Hellenists against the Hebrews, because their widows were overlooked in the daily distribution.|Iina dem die de, di gruup a piipl we biliiv iina Jiizas did a gruo muo an muo. Di uman dem we a Juu an we taak di Griik langwij uufa ozban dem did ded, staat mombl anda di kwaiyat gens di uman dem we a Juu we onggl taak di Juu langwij an uufa ozban dem did ded tu. Dem did a mombl se dem neva did a get fi dem shier a di moni an fuud we dem did fi get a die taim.

So the twelve called the multitude of disciples together and said, “It is not reasonable for us to leave the word of God and serve tables.|So di twelv apasl dem kaal wan miitn wid aal a di piipl we biliiv iina Jiizas fi saat out di mata. Dem se tu dem se, “It wudn rait fi wi tap pred Gad mesij bout Jiizas fi go shier op moni an fuud fi di uman dem we ozban ded.

Brothers, look among yourselves for seven men who are known to be full of the Holy Spirit and of wisdom, whom we will appoint over this duty.|So breda an sista unu pik sevn man fram mongks unu. Evribadi mos si se dem mek di Uoli Spirit kanchuol dem laif an dem wel waiz. Wi wi put dem inchaaj a da wok ya
But we will give ourselves continually to prayer and to the ministry of the word.
column2: an fi wi wok wi bi fi prie an pred Gad mesij bout Jiizas.

column1: And what was said pleased the whole multitude, and they chose Stephen, who was a man full of faith and of the Holy Spirit, and Philip, and Procorus, and Nicanor, and Timon, and Parmenas, and Nicolas, a proselyte from Antioch|Aal a di piipl dem we did biliiv iina Jiizas did api fi du wa di apasl dem did se dem fi du. So dem pik Stiivn, wan man we biliiv iina Gad nof nof an we di Uoli Spirit kanchuol. An dem pik Filip, Prakoros, Nekenor, Timon, Paaminas, an Nikolas we did ton wan Juu an we did kom fram Antiyak.
whom they presented before the apostles. And when they had prayed, they placed their hands on them.|Dem put dem man ya fi tan op infronta di apasl dem an dem put dem an pan dem ed an prie fi dem.

So the word of God spread, and the number of the disciples grew rapidly in Jerusalem, and a great number of the priests were obedient to the faith.|Gad mesij bout Jiizas pred muo an muo, an muo an muo piipl biliiv iina Jiizas an wan uol iip a di priis dem biliiv di Gud Nyuuz tu.
Now Stephen, full of faith and power, did great wonders and miracles among the people. |Stiivn a did wan man we Gad did a yuuz fi du som powaful mirikl an sain mongks di piipl.

Then some men rose up from what is called the Synagogue of the Freedmen (Cyrenians, Alexandrians, and those from Cilicia and of Asia), disputing with Stephen.|Bot yu did av som man we kom fram di Choch fi di Piipl we get Frii (kaaz a so dem kaal demself). Som a dem kom fram Sairiin, Aligzanjriya, Silisiya an Iezha. Dem man ya staat fi aagyu wid Stiivn
But they were not able to withstand the wisdom and the Spirit by which he spoke.|bot dem fain se dem kudn manij im, kaaz di Spirit did mek im wel waiz an tel im aal wa im fi se.

Then they secretly instigated men who said, “We have heard him speak blasphemous words against Moses and God.”|So anda di kwaiyat dem get som man fi tel lai pan Stiivn se, “Wi ier da man ya se som torbl sitn bout Muoziz an bout Gad.”

So they stirred up the people and the elders and the scribes, and came upon him and seized him and led him to the Sanhedrin|So dem rail op di piipl, di elda dem an di Laa tiicha dem. Dem ron dong pan Stiivn, grab im an jrag im go a di plies we di liida dem miit an mek im tan op infronta dem.

and set up false witnesses who said, “This man does not cease to speak blasphemous words against this holy place and the law. |Dem kyari iin som man fi tel lai pan Stiivn. Dem se, “Da man ya no tap taak torbl sitn gens da plies ya we uoli, an gens di Laa we Gad gi Muoziz fi gi wi.

For we have heard him say that this Jesus of Nazareth will destroy this place, and will change the customs which Moses handed down to us.|Wi ier im se di wan Jiizas we kom fram Nazaret a-go mash dong da plies ya an mek wi liv difrant fram ou Muoziz tel wi faada faada dem fi liv.”

All who sat in the Sanhedrin, gazing at him, saw his face as the face of an angel.|Evribadi we did a sidong iina di plies we dem miit faasn dem yai pan Stiivn an si se im fies did a shain laik wan ienjel.
Then the high priest said, “Are these things so?”|Den di liida fi di priis dem aks Stiivn se, “Dem sitn ya we dem a se bout yu, dem a chuu?”

He said, “Brothers and fathers, listen! The God of glory appeared to our father Abraham, when he was in Mesopotamia, before he lived in Harran|Stiivn ansa an se, “Aal a unu we a mi breda an mi faada, lisn we mi a se! Di Gad we av im brait brait lait a shain roun im, shuo imself tu wi faada Iebriyam wen Iebriyam did stil a liv iina Mesopotiemiya. Dat a did bifuo im muuv go liv a Ieran.
and said to him, ‘Leave your country and your relatives, and come to the land which I will show you.’|Gad tel im se, ‘Lef yu konchri an yu fambili an go tu di konchri we mi a-go tel yu fi go.’

Then he departed from the land of the Chaldeans and lived in Harran. When his father died, He removed him from there to this land in which you now live.|“So im lef im konchri Kaldiya an go liv a Ieran. Afta im faada ded, Gad sen im kom a da konchri ya we unu a liv nou.

He gave him no inheritance in it, nor a foothold, and promised to give it to him as a possession and to his descendants after him while he had no child. |Gad neva gi im no lan iina di konchri, no iivn wan likl piis we im kuda kaal fi'im uon. Bot Gad did pramis fi gi di uol a it tu im an im pikni dem wan die. Wen Gad did mek da pramis de Iebriyam neva av no pikni.

God spoke in this way, ‘Your descendants shall be sojourners in a land belonging to others, who will enslave them and mistreat them four hundred years.|Gad se tu Iebriyam, ‘Yu pikni dem a-go liv laik chrienja iina wan konchri we a no fi dem. Di piipl we ruul da konchri de a-go tek dem ton sliev an dem a-go sofa fi fuo onjrid ier.

And I will judge the nation to whom they will be enslaved,’ said God. ‘After that they shall come out and worship Me in this place.’|Bot mi a-go ponish di piipl we tek dem ton sliev, an afta dat dem a-go lef da konchri de an kom worship mi rait ya-so.’

Then He gave him the covenant of circumcision. And Abraham became the father of Isaac and circumcised him on the eighth day. And Isaac became the father of Jacob, and Jacob of the twelve patriarchs.|Den Gad aada Iebriyam fi get sorkomsaiz an fi sorkomsaiz aal a di man dem iina im fambili fi shuo se dem bilang tu Gad. So iet die afta Aizak baan, Iebriyam sorkomsaiz im. Wen Aizak bwai pikni, Jiekob baan, Aizak sorkomsaiz im, an wen Jiekob twelv bwai pikni dem baan, im sorkomsaiz dem tu. A dem twelv de a wi faada faada dem.

The patriarchs, moved with envy, sold Joseph into Egypt. But God was with him|“Kaaz wi faada faada dem did bad main gens Juozif, dem sel im tu som man we tek im go ton sliev dong a Iijip. Bot Gad did de wid im

and delivered him out of all his afflictions, and gave him favor and wisdom before Pharaoh, king of Egypt, who appointed him governor over Egypt and all his house.|an siev im outa aal a im chobl. Im mek im waiz an mek Fiero, di King a Iijip spirit tek im. So Fiero pik im fi ruul uova Iijip, an di uol a im palis.

Then a famine came over all Egypt and Canaan with great affliction, and our fathers found no sustenance.|“Den staavieshan tek Iijip an Kienan, an kaaz uol iip a piipl fi sofa, an wi faada dem kudn get no fuud.
But when Jacob heard that there was grain in Egypt, he sent out our fathers the first time. |Wen Jiekob ier se fuud de a Iijip, im sen wi faada dem dong de fi di fos taim fi go bai fuud.

During the second time Joseph was made known to his brothers, and Joseph’s family became known to Pharaoh.|Wen dem go bak dong de di sekan taim, Juozif mek im breda dem nuo uu im bi, an Fiero get fi nuo bout Juozif fambili.
Then Joseph sent and called for his father Jacob and all his kindred, seventy-five souls.|Afta dat, Juozif sen fi'im faada Jiekob an im uol fambili, aal sevnti-faiv a dem.
Then Jacob went down into Egypt. And he and our fathers died|So Jiekob imself go dong a Iijip, an im an wi faada faada dem liv dong de til dem ded.

and were carried to Shechem and put in the tomb that Abraham had bought for a price of silver from the sons of Hamor, the father of Shechem.|Lieta dem muuv dem badi go beri dem iina di griev we Iebriyam did bai a Shekem. Iebriyam did bai da piis a lan de fram Iemuor bwai pikni dem.

When the time of the promise drew near, which God had sworn to Abraham, the people grew and multiplied in Egypt |“Wen di taim did nier fi Gad du wa im did pramis Iebriyam, di piipl iina Iijip did get nofa an nofa
until another king rose up who did not know Joseph.
column2: til di taim wen wan neks king we neehn nuo notn bout Juozif staat ruul uova Iijip.

column1: He dealt deceitfully with our people and mistreated our fathers, forcing them to put out their young children, that they might not live.|Im tek advaantij a wi faada faada dem an mek dem sofa. Im fuos dem fi fling out dem likl pikni dem outa dem ous so dem wuda ded.

At that time Moses was born, and was fair in the sight of God. And he was reared for three months in his father’s house.|“Roun dem taim de Muoziz did baan. Im a did wan priti-priti biebi. Im faada an mada did av im iina dem ous a tek kier a im fi chrii mont.
When he was put out, Pharaoh’s daughter took him up and reared him as her own son. |Wen dem did afi put im outa di ous, Fiero daata fain im an tek im fi ar uona pikni an gruo im op.
Moses was educated in all the wisdom of the Egyptians and was powerful in words and in deeds.
column2: Dem tiich Muoziz aal a di waiz sitn dem we di Iijip piipl dem nuo an im ton wan big impuotant man we se an du som big impuotant sitn.

column1: When he was forty years old, it came to his heart to visit his brothers, the sons of Israel. |“Wen Muoziz ton faati ier uol, im mek op im main fi go luk fi fi'im piipl, di Izrel piipl dem.

But seeing one being wronged, he defended him, and avenged him who was oppressed, and struck the Egyptian.|An wen im si wan a dem a get biit op fi no riizn im ron go elp im an kil di Iijip man we did a biit im op.

He supposed that his brothers would understand that God would deliver them by his hand, but they did not understand.|Muoziz tingk se fi'im uona piipl wuda andastan se Gad did a yuuz im fi tek dem outa dem sofarieshan, bot dem neva andastan.

On the next day he appeared to them as they fought and tried to reconcile them in peace, saying, ‘Men, you are brothers. Why do you wrong each other?’|Di neks die Muoziz si tuu Izrel man a fait. Im chrai fi paat dem an se tu dem se, ‘Luk man, di tuu a unu a breda, so wa unu a fait fa?’

“But the one wronging his neighbor pushed him away, saying, ‘Who appointed you a ruler and a judge over us?|“Bot di man we did a biit op di ada wan push we Muoziz an se, ‘Uu mek yu ruula an joj uova wi?
Will you kill me as you killed the Egyptian yesterday?’
column2: A kil yu waahn kom kil mi laik ou yu kil di Iijip man yeside?’

column1: Moses fled at this word and became a sojourner in the land of Midian,where he became the father of two sons.|Wen Muoziz ier wa di man se, im ron we go a Midiyan go liv an ton farina an get tuu bwai pikni de.

“When forty years had passed, an angel of the Lord appeared to him in the wilderness of Mount Sinai, in a flame of fire in a bush.|“Afta faati ier did paas, Muoziz did iina di dezot nier mount Sainai we wan ienjel kom tu im iina wan bush we did de pan faiya.

When Moses saw it, he marveled at the sight. As he drew near to look at it, the voice of the Lord came to him, saying|Wen Muoziz si'it im shak. So wen im go nier fi go si wa riili did a gwaan im ier di Laad vais.

‘I am the God of your fathers, the God of Abraham and the God of Isaac and the God of Jacob.’ Moses trembled and dared not look.|Di Laad se, ‘Mi a di Gad fi yu faada faada dem, di Gad fi Iebriyam, Aizak an Jiekob.’ Muoziz did so fried im staat fi chrimbl an im kudn luk pan di bush no muor.
“Then the Lord said to him, ‘Take off the shoes from your feet, for the place where you are standing is holy ground.|Den di Laad se tu im, ‘Tek aaf yu slipaz dem; yu a tan op pan uoli grong.

I have indeed seen the oppression of My people who are in Egypt. I have heard their groaning, and I have come down to deliver them. Now come, I will send you to Egypt.’|Mi luk an mi si ou mi piipl dem iina Iijip a sofa. Mi ier ou dem a gruon, so mi kom dong fi frii dem. So kom, mi a-go sen yu bak dong a Iijip.’

“This Moses, whom they rejected, saying, ‘Who appointed you a ruler and a judge?’ God sent as both ruler and redeemer by the hand of the angel who appeared to him in the bush.|“A da siem Muoziz ya dem did ton dem bak pan wen dem se, ‘A uu mek yu wan ruula an wan joj?’ A im siem wan Gad sen tu dem fi ruul dem an fi frii dem wid di elp a di ienjel we did taak tu im fram di bush.

He led them out after he had shown wonders and signs in the land of Egypt, and at the Red Sea, and for forty years in the wilderness.|Im liid dem outa Iijip. An im du som powaful mirikl an sain iina Iijip, a di Red Sii an iina di dezot fi faati ier.

“This is the Moses who said to the sons of Israel, ‘The Lord your God will raise up for you a prophet like me from your brothers. Him you shall hear.’|“Dis a di siem Muoziz we tel di Izrelait dem se, ‘Gad a-go sen unu wan prafit jos laik mi fram mongks unu uona piipl.’

This is he who was in the congregation in the wilderness with the angel who spoke to him on Mount Sinai, and with our fathers, who received living oracles to give to us|Da siem Muoziz ya did de de wid di Izrel piipl we did gyada op iina di dezot. Im did de de wid wi faada faada dem an wid di ienjel we did taak tu im pan Mount Sainai. An a im did get Gad wod, di Wod we laas fi eva, an a im kyari it kom gi wi.

whom our fathers would not obey, but thrust away. And in their hearts they turned back to Egypt|“Bot wi faada faada dem mek op dem main se dem naa du wa im se dem fi du. Insted-a dat, dem push im wan said an staat wish iina dem aat fi go baka Iijip.

saying to Aaron, ‘Make for us gods to go before us. For we do not know what has become of this Moses, who led us out of the land of Egypt.’|Dem se tu Ieran, ‘Bil op som gad fi wi we wi kyan kyari infronta wi, kaaz di wan Muoziz, di wan we liid wi outa Iijip, wi no nuo wa apm tu im!’

So they made a calf in those days, and offered a sacrifice to the idol, and rejoiced in the works of their hands. |A da taim de dem did mek di faalz gad we luk laik wan bulkou. Dem bon sakrifais gi it, an dem did wel api wid di sitn wa dem mek wid dem uona an.

But God turned and gave them up to worship the host of heaven, as it is written in the book of the Prophets:‘O House of Israel, have you offered to Me slain animals and sacrificesfor forty years in the wilderness?|Bot Gad ton we fram dem an lef dem fi worship di staar dem iina di skai. Dis a di siem ting wa rait dong iina di buk we di prafit dem rait:

Yes, you even raised the shrine of Moloch,and the star of your god Remphan,idols which you made to worship;therefore I will exile you beyond Babylon.’|Unu kyari di tent wich paat unu worship di faalz gad we niem Molakan unu kyari wid unu di staar fi fu'unu gad Riefan.An unu mek dem faalz gad de an unu worship dem.So mi a-go mek unu get kyari we go faar faar paas Babilan.’

“Our fathers had the tabernacle of witness in the wilderness, telling Moses to make it as He had commanded, according to the pattern that he had seen|Iina di dezot wi faada faada dem did av wid dem di tent we shuo se Gad did de mongks dem. Gad did tel Muoziz fi mek it an im mek it siem laik ou Gad did shuo im.

which our fathers, having received it, brought with Joshua into the land possessed by the Gentiles, whom God drove out in front of our fathers until the days of David|Lieta wi faada faada dem get di tent fram fi dem faada. Dem kyari it wid dem wen dem go wid Jashwa. Dem kyari it wid dem wen dem tek uova di konchri wich paat Gad did ron out di piipl dem bifuo di Izrelait dem riich. An di tent did de op tu di taim wen king Dievid did a ruul.

who found favor in the presence of God and asked to find a tabernacle for the God of Jacob.|Siek-a ou Dievid liv, Gad did api wid im. Dievid beg Gad fi lou im fi bil op wan ous fi'im, wich paat aal a Jiekob piipl kyan worship im.
But Solomon built Him a house.
column2: Bot a Salaman bil wan ous fi Gad.

column1: “However, the Most High does not dwell in houses made with hands. As the prophet says:|Bot wi nuo se di Muos Ai Gad no liv iina ous we man mek. Wan a im prafit se:

‘Heaven is My throne,and the earth is My footstool.What house will you build for Me? says the Lord,or what is the place of My rest?|“Di Laad se, ‘Evn a mi chuon we mi ruul framan di ort a mi fut stuul.So wa kain-a ous yu a-go bil fi mi?Ar wa kain-a plies unu kyan gi mi fi liv?
Has not My hand made all these things?’
column2: No mi mek aal a dem sitn ya?’”

column1: “You stiff-necked people, uncircumcised in heart and ears! You always resist the Holy Spirit. As your fathers did, so do you.|“Unu piipl, unu stoban, an aad-iez an no waahn lisn tu Gad mesij. Unu aat komiin jos laik di piipl dem we no biliiv iina Gad. Unu eva a-go gens wa di Uoli Spirit waahn, siem laik we unu faada faada dem did du!

Which of the prophets have your fathers not persecuted? They have even killed those who foretold the coming of the Righteous One, of whom you have now become the betrayers and murderers|Wich wan a Gad prafit dem fi unu faada faada dem neva mek sofa? Dem aal kil Gad mesinja dem we did tel dem fram wie bak wen se di wan we aalwiez du we rait did a kom. Bot unu sel im out an kil im.
who have received the law by the disposition of angels, but have not kept it.”|Iivn duo Gad sen im ienjel dem tu unu fi gi unu im Laa, unu naa du we im se.
When they heard these things, they were cut to the heart, and they gnashed their teeth at him.|Wen di Juu liida dem ier dis dem beks wid im so til dem staat grain dem tiit.

But being full of the Holy Spirit, he gazed into heaven and saw the glory of God, and Jesus standing at the right hand of God|Bot di Uoli Spirit tek kanchuol a Stiivn. Im faasn im yai op iina di skai an si Gad brait brait lait iina evn an Jiizas tan op a Gad rait-an-said.
and said, “Look! I see the heavens opened and the Son of Man standing at the right hand of God.”|Im se “Luk! Mi si evn uopm op an di Man we Gad pik tan op a Gad rait-an-said.”
Then they cried out with a loud voice, closed their ears, and rushed at him in unison.|Wen dem ier dat, dem baal out pan tap a dem vais, kova op dem iez, an di uol a dem ron dong pan im wan taim.
And they threw him out of the city and stoned him. The witnesses laid down their garments at the feet of a young man named Saul.
column2: Dem ron im outa di siti an staat stuon im. An di wan dem we did a stuon im pudong dem kluoz a di fut a wan yong man we niem Saal.

column1: They stoned Stephen as he was calling on God, praying, “Lord Jesus, receive my spirit.”|Wen dem did a stuon im, Stiivn prie an se, “Laad Jiizas, mi put mi spirit iina yu an.”

Then he knelt down and cried with a loud voice, “Lord, do not hold this sin against them.” Having said this, he fell asleep.|Den im jrap pan im nii an kaal out, “Laad, no uol da sin ya gens dem.” Afta im se dat im ded.

And Saul was consenting to his death. On that day a great persecution broke out against the church in Jerusalem. And they were all scattered throughout the regions of Judea and Samaria, except the apostles. |An Saal did de de an im did biliiv se dem did rait fi kil Stiivn. Da die de wan torbl sofarieshan tek di choch iina Jeruusilem. An aal a di biliiva dem did get skyata skyata aal uova Judiya an Samieriya. Onggl di apasl dem neva get skyata skyata.
Devout men carried Stephen to his burial and made great lamentation over him.
column2: Som man we worship Gad beri Stiivn an dem ala an baal fi im.

column1: But Saul ravaged the church, entering house by house and dragging out both men and women and committing them to prison.|Bot Saal staat wok aad aad fi mash op di choch. Im did a go fram ous tu ous an a jrag out man an uman an fling dem iina prizn.
Therefore those who were scattered went everywhere preaching the word.
column2: Di biliiva dem we did get skyata skyata priich di Gud Nyuuz bout Jiizas evriwe dem go.

column1: Philip went down to the city of Samaria and preached Christ to them.
column2: Filip go dong a wan siti iina Samieriya an priich tu dem bout Krais Jiizas.

column1: When the crowds heard Philip and saw the miracles which he did, they listened in unity to what he said.|Wen di kroud a piipl ier Filip an si di mirikl dem wa im did a du, aal a dem lisn gud tu wa im did a se.

For unclean spirits, crying with a loud voice, came out of many who were possessed. And many who were paralyzed or lame were healed.|Wikid spirit baal out an kom outa nof piipl an nof kripl piipl an piipl we kudn muuv at aal get beta.
So there was much joy in that city.
column2: So di uol a di piipl dem iina di siti did wel api.

column1: Now a man named Simon was previously in the city practicing sorcery and astonishing the nation of Samaria, saying he was someone great|Nou yu did av wan man iina di toun niem Saiman. Fi wan lang taim im did a wok uobiya an di piipl dem kudn biliiv som a di powaful sitn dem we im wuda du. An im yuus tu kliem se im a wan big impuotant sumadi.

to whom they all listened, from the least to the greatest, saying, “This man is the great power of God.”|Evri jak man iina Samieriya, fram di likl man tu di big impuotant wan dem lisn tu im. Dem se “Da man ya a di gad we niem di Griet Powa. A im kom dong kom ton Saiman.”
They listened to him, because for a long time he had astonished them by his sorceries.|Dem did lisn tu im aad aad kaaz fi wan lang lang taim dem kudn biliiv di sitn dem we dem si im du.

But when they believed Philip preaching about the kingdom of God and the name of Jesus Christ, both men and women were baptized. |Bot wen dem biliiv di gud nyuuz we Filip did a priich bout Gad kindom an Jiizas Krais, evribadi, man an uman go get baptaiz.

Even Simon himself believed. And when he was baptized, he continued with Philip and was amazed as he watched the miracles and signs which were done.|Aal Saiman biliiv an get baptaiz tu. Im fala Filip evriwe im go an im kudn biliiv di mirikl dem we Filip did a du.

Now when the apostles who were at Jerusalem heard that Samaria had received the word of God, they sent Peter and John to them.|Wen di apasl dem iina Jeruusilem ier se di piipl iina Samieriya biliiv an staat fala Gad wod, dem sen Piita an Jan tu dem.
When they came down, they prayed for them that they might receive the Holy Spirit|Wen dem riich dem prie fi dem dat di Uoli Spirit wuda kom tek kanchuol a dem.
for still He had come on none of them. They were only baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.
column2: (Kaaz di Uoli Spirit neva tek kanchuol a non a dem yet. Filip did onggl baptaiz dem kaaz dem did biliiv di Gud Nyuuz bout Jiizas.)

column1: Then they laid their hands on them, and they received the Holy Spirit.|So Piita an Jan put dem an pan dem an di Uoli Spirit kom liv iina dem.

When Simon saw that through the laying on of the apostles’ hands the Holy Spirit was given, he offered them money|Wen Saiman si se piipl get di Uoli Spirit wen di apasl dem put dem an pan dem, im chrai fi bai powa fram dem.
saying, “Give me also this power, that whomever I lay hands on may receive the Holy Spirit.”|Im se, “Gi mi da powa ya tu mek mi kyan put mi an pan piipl an mek dem get di Uoli Spirit.”

Peter said to him, “May your money perish with you, because you thought you could purchase the gift of God with money! |Piita se, “Mi uop se yu an yu moni go a el kaaz yu tingk se yu kuda bai di Uoli Spirit wa Gad gi piipl!
You have neither part nor share in this matter, for your heart is not right before God. |Yu no av no paat iina da wok ya, kaaz yu aat no rait iina Gad yai.

Therefore repent of your wickedness, and ask God if perhaps the intention of your heart may be forgiven you. |Ton we fram di wikid sitn dem we yu a tingk bout an prie an beg Gad fi paadn yu. Da wie de im mait-a paadn yu fi di wikid sitn dem we yu av iina yu aat
For I see that you are in the gall of bitterness and in the bond of iniquity.
column2: kaaz mi si se yu grojful an bad main an sin av yu laik wan prizna.”

column1: Then Simon answered, “Pray to the Lord for me that nothing you have spoken may come upon me.”|Den Saiman se tu dem, “Unu prie tu di Laad fi mi so dat non a di sitn dem we unu taak bout wi no apm tu mi.”

When they had testified and preached the word of the Lord, they returned to Jerusalem and preached the gospel in many villages of the Samaritans.|Afta Piita an Jan don tel di piipl wa dem nuo bout di Laad, an priich di Gud Nyuuz, dem go baka Jeruusilem. Pan di wie dem priich di Gud Nyuuz iina nof Samaritan dischrik.

Now an angel of the Lord said to Philip, “Rise up and go toward the south on the way that goes down from Jerusalem to Gaza.” This is desert. |Nou wan a di Laad ienjel go tu Filip an se tu im, “Git op an go tek di sout ruod, di ruod we go fram Jeruusilem tu Gaaza.” (Piipl no riili yuuz da ruod de agen).

So he rose up and went. And there was a man of Ethiopia, a eunuch of great authority under Candace, queen of the Ethiopians, who was in command of her entire treasury. He had come to Jerusalem to worship.|So Filip get op an lef. Wen im did a chravl pan di ruod, im bok op wan man we kom fram Iitiyuopiya. Im a did wan impuotant man. A im did inchaaj a aal a di moni fi Kyandiis, kwiin fi Iitiyuopiya. Im did go a Jeruusilem fi go worship Gad an wen im a go baka im yaad
He was returning, sitting in his chariot and reading the book of Isaiah the prophet.|im did sidong iina im aas an bogi kyaat a riid di buk we di prafit Aizaiya rait.
The Spirit said to Philip, “Go to this chariot and stay with it.”|Di Spirit tel Filip se, “Gwaan go jain da bogi de an stie kluos tu it.”

Then Philip ran to him, and heard him read the book of Isaiah the prophet, and said, “Do you understand what you are reading?”|Den Filip ron op tu di bogi an ier di man a riid sitn we di prafit Aizaiya rait. Filip aks im se, “Yu andastan wa yu a riid?”

He said, “How can I, unless someone guides me?” So he invited Philip to come up and sit with him.|Di man se, “Ou mi fi andastan ef nobadi no elp mi an tel mi we it miin?” So im aks Filip fi kom op kom sidong wid im.

The passage of Scripture which he was reading was this:“He was led as a sheep to slaughter;and as a lamb before its shearer is silent,so He opened not His mouth.|Di paat a Gad wod we di man did a riid, dis a wa it se:“Dem tek im an liid im we laik ou dem wuda liid wan shiip go a di plies fi kil im,an siem laik ou wan Biebi Shiip tan op an no mek wan soun wen dem a kot aaf im wul,a siem so im neva se a wod.
In His humiliation justice was denied Him;who will speak of His generation?For His life is taken from the earth.”
column2: Dem shiem im an tek im mek preke an im neva get no jostis.Nobadi kyan taak bout fi'im pikni pikni dem?Kaaz dem kil im.”

column1: The eunuch said to Philip, “I ask you, of whom does the prophet speak, of himself or of someone else?”|Di man aks Filip se, “Tel mi sopm, a uu di prafit did a taak bout, imself ar sumadi els?”
Then Philip spoke, beginning with the same Scripture, and preached Jesus to him.|So Filip staat a di siem paat we im did a riid an priich tu im di Gud Nyuuz bout Jiizas.

As they went on their way, they came to some water. And the eunuch said, “Look, here is water. What hinders me from being baptized?”|Dem did stil a gwaan pan di ruod wen dem kech a wan plies we waata de. Di man we inchaaj a di moni se tu Filip, “Luk! Si waata de! Wa fi tap mi fram get baptaiz rait nou?”

Philip said, “If you believe with all your heart, you may.” He answered, “I believe that Jesus Christ is the Son of God.”|So Filip se, "Ef unu bileev wid evriting ina unu aat, unu kyahn du it. Im ansa bak se, Mi bileev se Krais Jeezas a Gad Son.

And he commanded the chariot to halt. Then both Philip and the eunuch went down into the water, and he baptized him. |So di man aada im jraiva fi tap di bogi. Den im an Filip go dong iina di puul a waata an Filip baptaiz im.

When they came up out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord took Philip away. And the eunuch saw him no more, and he went his way rejoicing.|Afta dem kom op outa di waata, aal av a sodn Gad Spirit jos tek we Filip an di man we inchaaj a di moni neva si im agen. So im ed fi im yaad a gi Gad priez.

But Philip was found at Azotus. And passing through, he preached the gospel in all the cities until he came to Caesarea.|Den Filip si se Gad Spirit tek im go a Azuotos. Fram de-so im gwaan priich Gad wod tu aal di toun dem til im riich a Sesuriiya.

Saul, still breathing out threats and murder against the disciples of the Lord, went to the high priest|Roun dem siem taim de, Saal stil did a chretn fi kil aaf di biliiva dem. Im go tu di liida fi di priis dem

and requested letters from him to the synagogues of Damascus, so that if he found any there of the Way, either men or women, he might bring them bound to Jerusalem.|an aks im fi gi im leta fi kyari go gi di liida fi di Juu dem choch a Damaskos. So dat ef im fain nobadi we a fala wa Jiizas tiich, weda man ar uman, im wuda ares dem an kyari dem bak go a Jeruusilem.
As he went he drew near Damascus, and suddenly a light from heaven shone around him. |Wen dem did de pan dem wie an did nier Damaskos, aal av a sodn wan brait brait lait fram evn shain roun Saal.
He fell to the ground and heard a voice saying to him, “Saul, Saul, why do you persecute Me?”|Im jrap a grong an ier sumadi se tu im se, “Saal, Saal, wa mek yu a mek mi sofa?

He said, “Who are You, Lord?”The Lord said, “I am Jesus, whom you are persecuting. It is hard for you to kick against the goads.” |Saal aks, “A uu yu, Sa?” Jiizas ansa, “Mi a Jiizas, di wan we yu a mek sofa.

Trembling and astonished, he said, “Lord, what will You have me do?” The Lord said to him, “Rise up and go into the city, and you will be told what you must do.”|Git op an go iina di toun. Sumadi iin de wi tel yu wa yu mos du.”

The men traveling with him stood speechless, hearing the voice, but seeing no one. |Di man dem we did a chravl wid Saal tan op de bot dem did so shak, dem kudn se a wod. Dem ier di sumadi we did a taak tu Saal, bot dem neva si nobadi.

Saul rose up from the ground. And when his eyes were opened, he saw nothing. So they led him by the hand and brought him into Damascus.|Saal get op, bot wen im uopm im yai dem im kudn si a ting. So dem uol im an an liid im go a Damaskos.
For three days he was without sight, and neither ate nor drank.|Fi chrii die Saal kudn si notn an im neehn nyam ar jringk notn niida.

A disciple named Ananias was in Damascus. The Lord said to him in a vision, “Ananias.”He said, “Here I am, Lord.”|Nou yu did av wan man iina Damaskos niem Ananaiyas we did biliiv iina Jiizas. Iina wan vijan di Laad se tu im se, “Ananaiyas!”Im ansa, “Yes, Laad.”

The Lord said to him, “Rise and go to Straight Street, and inquire at Judas’ house for someone named Saul of Tarsus, for he is praying|Di Laad se tu im se, “Go uova Juudas ous pan chriet chriit an aks fi wan man fram Taasos niem Saal. Im de de a prie

and has seen in a vision a man named Ananias coming in and putting his hand on him, so that he may see again.”|an get wan vijan a wan man niem Ananaiyas we kom kom put im an pan im fi mek im kyan si agen.”

Ananias answered, “Lord, I have heard from many about this man, how many evil things he has done to Your saints at Jerusalem.|Ananaiyas se, “Bot Laad, nof piipl tel mi bout da man de an di uol iip a wikid sitn dem we im du tu yu piipl dem iina Jeruusilem.
And here he has authority from the chief priests to bind all who call on Your name.
column2: An im get di powa an di rait fram di ed priis fi kom dong ya kom ares enibadi we kaal pan yu niem.

column1: But the Lord said to him, “Go your way. For this man is a chosen vessel of Mine, to bear My name before the Gentiles and their kings, and before the sons of Israel.|Bot di Laad se tu Ananaiyas se, “Gwaan! Kaaz mi pik da man ya fi sorv mi. Mi pik im fi go tel piipl bout mi, piipl we a no Juu, di king dem an di Izrel piipl dem tu.
For I will show him how much he must suffer for My name’s sake.
column2: Mi a-go shuo im umoch im afi go sofa fi fi mi siek.

column1: Then Ananias went his way and entered the house. Putting his hands on him, he said, “Brother Saul, the Lord Jesus, who appeared to you on the way as you came, has sent me so that you may see again and be filled with the Holy Spirit.” |So Ananaiyas go a di ous we Saal did de. Im go iina di ous, put im an pan Saal an se, “Breda Saal, di Laad Jiizas, di wan we yu did si wen yu did de pan yu wie a kom ya, im sen mi tu yu. Im sen mi so yu wi kyan si agen an fi mek di Uoli Spirit kom liv iina yu.”

Immediately something like scales fell from his eyes, and he could see again. And he rose up and was baptized.|Siem taim im a taak, som sitn we komiin laik fish skiel jrap aafa Saal yai an im kuda si agen. Den im get op an get baptaiz.

When he had eaten, he was strengthened. For several days Saul was with the disciples in Damascus.|An afta Saal get sopm fi iit, im get bak chrang agen. Saal tan a Damaskos fi kopl die wid di piipl dem we biliiv iina Jiizas.
Immediately he preached in the synagogues that the Christ is the Son of God.
column2: Saal neva wies no taim. Im staat priich siem taim iina di Juu dem choch se Jiizas a Gad Bwai Pikni.

column1: All who heard him were amazed and said, “Is not this he who killed those who called on this name in Jerusalem, and came here with that intent, to bring them bound to the chief priests?” |An aal a di piipl we ier im shak. So dem staat fi aks dem wan aneda se, “A no da siem man ya did a chrai fi kil aaf di piipl dem iina Jeruusilem we worship Jiizas? A no im kom dong ya fi ares piipl an kyari dem go baka di ed priis?”

Yet Saul increased all the more with power and confounded the Jews living in Damascus, proving that this One is the Christ.|Bot Gad gi Saal muor an muor powa fi priich. Im did a pruuv fram Gad wod se Jiizas a di wan we Gad sen fi siev piipl. An di Juu dem we liv iina Damaskos did kanfyuuz kaaz dem kudn fain notn rang wid wa im did a tiich.
After many days had passed, the Jews arranged to kill him.|Afta wan lang taim paas dem siem Juu de gyada op an plan fi kil Saal.
But their scheme was known by Saul. They watched the gates day and night to kill him.
column2: Bot Saal did fain out bout it. Die an nait dem wach di siti giet fi si ef dem kuda kech im fi kil im.

column1: But the disciples took him by night, and lowered him in a basket through the wall.|So wan nait som a Saal falara dem tek im an let im dong iina wan baaskit chuu wan uol iina di siti waal.

When Saul had come to Jerusalem, he tried to join the disciples. But they all feared him, not believing he was a disciple.|Wen Saal kech a Jeruusilem, im chrai fi jain op wid di piipl dem we biliiv iina Jiizas, bot aal a dem did fried a im kaaz dem neva biliiv se im did riili get siev.

But Barnabas took him, and led him to the apostles, and declared to them how on the road he had seen the Lord, and that He had spoken to him, and how he had boldly preached in Damascus in the name of Jesus. |Bot Baanabas elp im. Im tek im tu di apasl dem. Im tel dem ou Saal si di Laad Jiizas wen im did a go a Damaskos, ou di Laad taak tu im, an ou im neva fried fi priich tu di piipl iina Damaskos bout Jiizas.
So he stayed with them while coming in and going out of Jerusalem.
column2: So Saal tan wid di apasl dem an muuv roun wid dem iina Jeruusilem. An im neva fried fi priich tu di piipl bout Jiizas.

column1: And he spoke boldly in the name of the Lord Jesus and disputed against the Hellenists. But they tried to kill him.
column2: Im taak bout Jiizas an riizn wid di Juu dem we taak Griik. Bot dem chrai fi kil im.

column1: When the brothers learned this, they brought him down to Caesarea, and sent him off to Tarsus.|Wen di piipl we biliiv iina Jiizas fain out se di Juu dem did a chrai fi kil Saal, dem tek im dong a Sesuriiya an sen im we go a Taasos.

Then the churches throughout all Judea and Galilee and Samaria had peace and were built up. And walking in the fear of the Lord and in the comfort of the Holy Spirit, they were multiplied.|Den di choch dem we did iina Judiya, Gyalalii, an Samieriya get a briek fram di sofarieshan we dem did a go chuu fi a wail. Di choch gruo muor an muor kaaz dem di a du we de Laad waahn dem fi du an di Uoli Spirit did a wok wid dem.
As Peter passed through every region, he came down also to the saints who lived in Lydda.|Wail Piita did a go fram plies tu plies im go a Lida go luk fi Gad piipl.
There he found a man named Aeneas, who had been bedridden for eight years and was paralyzed. |Im fain wan man dong de niem Ieniyas we did kripl fi iet ier an kudn get op outa im bed.

Peter said to him, “Aeneas, Jesus the Christ heals you. Rise up and make your bed.” And immediately he rose up.|Piita se tu im se, “Ieniyas, Jiizas Krais mek yu beta! Git op an ruol op yu bed!” Siem taim Ieniyas get op.
All those who lived in Lydda and Sharon saw him and turned to the Lord.
column2: Evribadi we liv iina Lida an Sheran ton tu di Laad wen dem si wa apm tu im.

column1: In Joppa there was a disciple named Tabitha, which is translated Dorcas. This woman was full of good works and almsgiving.|Nou yu did av wan uman we biliiv iina Jiizas we liv a Japa. Shi did niem Tabita, bot iina Griik shi niem Daakas. Shi did eva a du gud an a elp puo piipl.
In those days she became ill and died. And when they had washed her, they placed her in an upper room.|Wail Piita did de a Lida, shi tek sik an ded. Dem wash ar badi an put it iina wan opstiez ruum.

Since Lydda was near Joppa, the disciples, hearing that Peter was there, sent two men to him, pleading, “Do not delay to come to us.”|Lida neva faar fram Japa. So wen di piipl we biliiv iina Jiizas ier se Piita did de a Lida, dem sen tuu man tu im wid wan mesij se “Ori op kum ya kwik kwik!”

Peter rose up and went with them. When he arrived, they led him into the upper room. All the widows stood by him weeping, and showing the tunics and garments which Dorcas had made while she was with them.|So Piita get op siem taim an go wid dem. Wen im kech de, dem kyari im opstiez tu di ruum. Aal a di uman dem uufa ozban did ded tan op saida im a baal an a shuo im aal a di kluoz dem we Daakas yuus tu mek wen shi did alaiv.

Peter put them all outside and knelt down and prayed. And turning to the body he said, “Tabitha, arise.” She opened her eyes, and when she saw Peter she sat up. |Piita sen aal a dem outa di ruum. Den im go dong pan im nii an prie tu Gad. Den im ton tu di ded uman an se, “Tabita, git op!” Shi uopm op ar yai dem, an wen shi si Piita, shi sidong op.

He gave her his hand and lifted her up. And when he had called the saints and widows, he presented her alive. |Im uol ar an an elp ar tan op. Den im kaal aal a Gad piipl, an di uman dem uufa ozban dem did ded tu an shuo dem se Daakas kom bak alaiv.
It became known throughout all Joppa, and many believed in the Lord. |Piipl aal uova Japa ier bout wa apm an ton tu di Laad.
He remained in Joppa for many days with Simon, a tanner.|Piita tan a Japa fi wan gud likl wail wid Saiman, wan man we mek leda.

In Caesarea there was a man named Cornelius, the centurion of a band of soldiers called the Italian Detachment|Nou yu did av wan man dong a Sesuriiya niem Kaaniiliyos. Im a did paat a wan big gruup a suoja we kom fram Itali, an im a did ed fi onjrid a dem.

a devout man and one who feared God with all his household, who gave many alms to the people and continually prayed to God.|Im an im uol fambili aalwiez worship Gad. Nof taim im wuda elp puo piipl an im aalwiez a prie tu Gad.

About the ninth hour of the day he saw clearly in a vision an angel of God coming in and saying to him, “Cornelius.”|Wan die roun chrii aklak, Kaaniiliyos get wan vijan. Iina im vijan im si wan a Gad ienjel kom tu im. Di ienjel se tu im se, “Kaaniiliyos!”

When he looked at him he was afraid, and said, “What is it, Lord?”He said to him, “Your prayers and your alms have come up as a memorial before God. |Kaaniiliyos faasn im yai pan di ienjel an staat kech im fried. Im aks, “A wa Laad?”Di ienjel ansa im se, “Gad ier yu prieya dem, an im si di gud sitn dem we yu du fi puo piipl. Gad memba di sitn dem we yu du, an tu im dem komiin laik wan sakrifais.
Now send men to Joppa, and bring back Simon whose surname is Peter.|Nou sen som man go a Japa an tel dem fi bring bak wan man niem Saiman, an we dem kaal Piita tu.
He is lodging with Simon, a tanner, whose house is by the sea. He will tell you what you must do.”|Im a stie a Saiman ous, di wan we mek leda an we liv a di sii-said.

When the angel who spoke to him had departed, Cornelius called two of his household servants and a devout soldier from among those who continually waited on him.|Afta di ienjel we taak tu im lef, Kaaniiliyos kaal tuu a im speshal sorvant dem an wan a im suoja we sorv im an we aalwiez worship Gad.
When he had explained everything to them, he sent them to Joppa.|Im tel dem evriting we di ienjel tel im an sen dem go a Japa.

The next day as they went on their journey and drew near the city, Peter went up on the housetop to pray about the sixth hour. |Di neks die, roun twelv aklak, wen dem did riich nier di siti, Piita go op pan di ous tap fi prie.
He became very hungry and desired to eat. But while they prepared a meal, he fell into a trance|Piita did get onggri an waahn sopm fi iit, an wail im did a wiet fi di fuud im get wan vijan.

and saw heaven opened, and a vessel like a great sheet, tied at the four corners, descending to him, and let down to the earth.|Iina im vijan im si evn uopm op an sitn laik wan big big shiit a kom dong tu ort, laik se piipl did a uol di fuo kaana dem an a let it dong.

In it were all kinds of four-footed animals of the earth and wild beasts and reptiles and birds of the air. |Iina di shiit im si aal kain-a animal: animal we av fuo fut, animal we kraal pan dem beli an av kuol blod, an som wail bod.
Then a voice came to him, “Rise, Peter; kill and eat.”|Den im ier wan vais se tu im se, “Piita, git op, kil som a dem animal ya an nyam dem.”

Peter said, “Not at all, Lord. For I have never eaten anything that is common or unclean.”|Piita se, “Uu mi? Nuo Laad, ou mi fi du dat? Mi neva nyam non a dem sitn de we di Laa se no fi nyam kaaz dem no kliin.”
The voice spoke to him a second time: “What God has cleansed, do not call common.”|Den di vais se tu Piita di sekan taim se, “No tek notn we Gad mek kliin an se it doti an no gud fi iit.”
This happened three times. And again the vessel was taken up into heaven.|Im ier di vais se di siem ting chrii taim, an den di shiit get tek op bak iina evn.

Now while Peter wondered what this vision which he had seen might mean, the men who were sent by Cornelius had inquired for Simon’s house and stood at the gate|Siem taim Piita de de a chrai fi figa out wa di vijan miin, di man dem we Kaaniiliyos did sen, fain Saiman ous an did tan op a di giet.
and called and asked whether Simon, who was surnamed Peter, was lodging there.|Dem kaal out loud an aks ef Saiman Piita de de.
While Peter thought about the vision, the Spirit said to him, “Three men are looking for you.|Piita did stil a tingk bout di vijan wen di Uoli Spirit se tu im se, “Luk Piita, chrii man a luk fi yu.
So rise and go down, and go with them, doubting nothing. For I have sent them.|So git op an go dongstiez tu dem. No fried fi go wid dem, kaaz a mi mek dem kom fi yu.”

Then Peter went down to the men who were sent to him by Cornelius and said, “Here I am, the one you are seeking. Why have you come?”|So Piita go dongstiez tu dem an se tu dem se, “Si mi ya, a mi unu a luk fa. Wa unu a luk fi mi fa?”

They said, “Cornelius, a centurion, a man who is righteous and fears God and is of good report throughout the nation of the Jews, was directed by a holy angel to summon you to his house to hear your words.”|Di man dem ansa im se, “A Kaaniiliyos, wan ed man fi onjrid suoja sen wi. Aal a di Juu dem tingk im a gud sumadi an dem shuo im nof rispek. Wan a Gad ienjel tel im fi sen fi yu so im kyan ier wa yu av fi se.”

Then he invited them in and gave them lodging.The next day Peter went with them, and some brothers from Joppa accompanied him. |Den Piita tek dem iina a di ous an put dem op fi di nait. Di neks die Piita, di man dem we did kom fi im, an som a di breda dem fram Japa ed out fi Kaaniiliyos yaad.

And the next day they entered Caesarea. Cornelius was waiting for them and had called together his relatives and close friends.|Di die afta dat Piita riich a Sesuriiya. Kaaniiliyos did a wiet pan dem, so im gyada op aal a im fambili an fren dem iina im ous til dem kom.
As Peter entered the house, Cornelius met him and fell down at his feet and worshipped him.|Wen Piita go iina di ous, Kaaniiliyos miit im a di duor an jrap a im fut fi worship im.
But Peter lifted him up, saying, “Stand up. I myself am a man.”|Bot Piita elp im fi get op. Im se, “Tan op man, mi a jos wan man siem laik yu.”
As he talked with him, he went in and found many who had come together.|Piita did stil a taak tu Kaaniiliyos wen im go iina di ous an fain wan uol iip a piipl a wiet pan im.

He said to them, “You know how unlawful it is for a Jew to visit or approach a foreigner. But God has shown me not to call any man common or unclean. |So Piita se tu dem, “Aal a unu nuo se azkaadn tu di Juu dem Laa, it no rait fi wan Juu av notn fi du wid piipl we a no Juu, ar fi go a dem yaad. Bot Gad shuo mi se mi no fi luk pan nobadi an tingk se dem no kliin ar se it rang fi mi kip kompni wid dem.

So when I was sent for, I came without question. Therefore I ask why you have sent for me.|So wen yu sen kom kaal mi, mi neva aks no kwestiyan, mi jos kom. So nou dat mi de ya, tel mi wa mek yu sen fi mi?”

Cornelius said, “Four days ago I was fasting until this hour. At the ninth hour I prayed in my house, and suddenly a man stood before me in bright clothing|Kaaniiliyos se tu im se, “Fuo die ago, siem chrii aklak iina di die ya, mi did de iina mi ous a prie. Aal av a sodn mi si wan man iina som brait brait kluoz a tan op infronta mi.
and said, ‘Cornelius, your prayer has been heard, and your alms are remembered before God.|Im se tu mi se, ‘Kaaniiliyos, Gad ier yu prieya an im memba wa yu du fi puo piipl.

Therefore send to Joppa for Simon, whose surname is Peter. He is lodging in the house of Simon, a tanner, by the sea. When he comes, he will speak to you.’ |Nou sen som man go a Japa fi wan man niem Saiman, we dem kaal Piita. Im a stie a Saiman yaad, di wan we mek leda an we liv a di sii-said.’

So ­immediately I sent for you, and you have done well to come. Now therefore we are all here, present before God, to hear everything the Lord has commanded you.”|So mi sen fi yu siem taim, an mi riili api se yu nais inof fi kom. Gad de ya wid wi an aal a wi wel waahn fi ier evriting we Gad tel yu fi tel wi.”
Then Peter began to speak, saying, “Truthfully, I perceive that God is no respecter of persons. |Den Piita staat taak tu dem. Im se, “Nou mi riili andastan se Gad no paashal
But in every nation he who fears Him and works righteousness is accepted by Him.|bot enibadi, no mata wich konchri dem kom fram, ef dem worship im an aalwiez du we rait, im wi tek dem fi'im piipl.

The word which He sent to the children of Israel, preaching peace through Jesus Christ, who is Lord of all|Unu nuo di mesij we Gad sen kom tu di Izrel piipl. Di mesij we se dat Gad a-go yuuz Jiizas we a Laad fi evribadi fi mek tingz rait wid im an piipl.

the word, which you know, that was proclaimed throughout all Judea, beginning from Galilee after the baptism which John preached: |Unu nuo bout di big impuotant sitn dem we apm aal uova Judiya. It staat iina Gyalalii afta Jan priich tu di piipl an tel dem fi ton we fram dem sin an get baptaiz.

how God anointed Jesus of Nazareth with the Holy Spirit and with power, who went about doing good and healing all who were oppressed by the devil, for God was with Him.|Unu nuo ou Gad did gi Jiizas we kom fram Nazaret im Uoli Spirit an powa. Jiizas go aal bout a du gud sitn, an aal a di piipl we di devl did kanchuol, Jiizas frii dem kaaz Gad did de wid im.

We are witnesses of all that He did both in the land of the Jews and in Jerusalem, whom they killed by hanging on a tree.|“Wi did si evriting we im du iina Jeruusilem an di res a Juu konchri dem. Dem niel im pan di kraas an kil im.
But God raised Him on the third day and presented Him publicly
column2: Bot Gad mek im kom bak alaiv chrii die lieta an kaaz piipl fi si im.

column1: not to all the people, but to witnesses previously chosen by God, to us who ate and drank with Him after He rose from the dead.|A no evribadi did si im, onggl wi, di wan dem we Gad did pik fram wie bak wen — wi we iit an jringk wid im afta im kom bak alaiv.
He commanded us to preach to the people and to testify that it is He who was ordained by God to be the Judge of the living and the dead.
column2: Jiizas aada wi fi priich tu di piipl an fi mek dem nuo se a im a di wan we Gad pik fi joj piipl we a liv an piipl we ded.

column1: To Him all the prophets bear witness that whoever believes in Him will receive remission of sins through His name.
column2: Aal a di prafit dem taak bout im an se Gad wi paadn enibadi we biliiv iina Jiizas fi aal a dem sin kaaz dem chos iina Jiizas.

column1: While Peter was still speaking these words, the Holy Spirit fell on all those who heard the word.|Piita did stil a priich wen aal av a sodn di Uoli Spirit kom dong an tek kanchuol a aal a di piipl we did a lisn tu di mesij.

All the believers of the circumcision who had come with Peter were astonished, because the gift of the Holy Spirit had been poured out even on the Gentiles. |Di Juu dem we biliiv iina Jiizas an we did kom wid Piita did shak. Dem did shak fi si se Gad gi di Uoli Spirit iivn tu di piipl we a no Juu.
For they heard them speaking in other tongues and magnifying God.Then Peter continued
column2: Dem nuo se dem get di Uoli Spirit kaaz dem did ier di piipl we a no Juu a taak iina tongz an a priez Gad. Den Piita se

column1: “Can anyone forbid water for baptizing these, who have received the Holy Spirit as we have?”|“Gad gi di Uoli Spirit tu dem piipl ya siem laik wi, so enibadi kyan tap dem fram get baptaiz?”
So he commanded them to be baptized in the name of the Lord. Then they asked him to stay a few days.
column2: So Piita gi aada fi dem get baptaiz iina Jiizas Krais niem. Den di piipl a Kaaniiliyos ous aks im fi stie wid dem fi a likl wail.

column1: The apostles and the brothers through­out Judea heard that the Gentiles also had received the word of God.
column2: Di apasl dem an di ada breda an sista dem aal uova Judiya we biliiv iina Jiizas ier se di piipl we a no Juu biliiv Gad wod tu.

column1: So when Peter went up to Jerusalem, those who were circumcised disputed with him|So wen Piita go baka Jeruusilem, di biliiva dem we sorkomsaiz did tingk im rang an staat aagyu wid im.
saying, “You went in and ate with uncircumcised men!”|Dem se tu im se, “Yu go a di ous a piipl we a no Juu an iit wid dem?”
Peter began explaining it to them in order, saying|So Piita tel dem evri singgl ting we apm fram staat tu finish. Im se

“I was in the city of Joppa praying. And in a trance I saw a vision: A vessel like a great sheet was descending, let down from heaven by four corners, and it came to me. |Mi did de iina di siti dong a Japa a prie an get wan vijan. Iina mi vijan mi si sitn laik wan big big shiit get let dong fram di skai. It did komiin laik piipl did uol di fuo kaana dem an a let it dong tu we mi did de.

I considered what I had observed and saw four-footed creatures and wild beasts and reptiles and birds of the air.|Wen mi luk iina di shiit mi si aal kain-a animal: animal we av fuo fut, animal we kraal pan dem beli an av kuol blod, an som wail bod.
Then I heard a voice saying to me, ‘Rise, Peter; kill and eat.’|Den mi ier wan sumadi se tu mi, ‘Piita, git op. Kil som a dem animal ya an nyam dem.’

“I said, ‘Not at all, Lord. For nothing common or unclean has at any time entered my mouth.’|“An mi ansa im se, ‘Uu mi? Nuo Laad, ou mi fi du dat? Mi neva nyam non a dem de sitn de we di Laa se yu no fi nyam kaaz dem no kliin.’

“The voice answered from heaven a second time, ‘What God has cleansed, do not call common.’ |“Den di vais fram evn se tu mi di sekan taim se, ‘No tek notn we Gad mek kliin an se it doti an no gud fi iit.’ 10Chrii taim di siem ting apm, an den di shiit get tek op bak iina evn.
This happened three times. And again everything was taken up into heaven.|Chrii taim di siem ting apm, an den di shiit get tek op bak iina evn.
And immediately three men sent from Caesarea to me came to the house where I was.
column2: “Siem taim dat apm chrii man we kom fram Sesuriiya riich a di ous we wi did a stie.

column1: The Spirit told me to go with them without hesitation. Moreover these six brothers came with me, and we entered the man’s house. |Di Uoli Spirit tel mi fi go wid dem an no ich. Dem siks breda ya did go a Sesuriiya wid mi an aal a wi go iina Kaaniiliyos ous.

He told us how he had seen an angel in his house, who stood and said to him, ‘Send men to Joppa, and call for Simon whose surname is Peter. |Im tel wi ou im did si wan ienjel kom tu im iina im ous an tel im fi, ‘Sen som man go a Japa go kaal Saiman Piita.
He will speak words to you by which you and all your household will be saved.’
column2: Im wi priich wan mesij tu yu. Da mesij de wi tel yu an evribadi iina yu ous ou unu kyan get siev.

column1: As I began to speak, the Holy Spirit fell on them, as He fell on us at the beginning.|Den siem taim mi staat taak tu dem, di Uoli Spirit tek kanchuol a dem siem laik ou im did tek kanchuol a wi di fos taim.

Then I remembered the word of the Lord, how He said, ‘John indeed baptized with water, but you shall be baptized with the Holy Spirit.’|A da taim de mi memba ou di Laad did se: ‘Jan baptaiz piipl wid waata, bot Gad a-go baptaiz unu wid di Uoli Spirit.’

If then God gave them the same gift as He gave us when we believed in the Lord Jesus Christ, who was I to be able to hinder God?”|So ef Gad gi di Uoli Spirit tu di piipl we a no Juu siem laik ou im did gi wi di Uoli Spirit kaaz wi biliiv iina Jiizas, a uu mi fi go fait gens Gad?”

When they heard these things, they were silent. And they glorified God, saying, “Then God has granted to the Gentiles also repentance unto life.”|Wen dem ier aal we Piita se dem tap aagyu wid im. Insted-a dat dem staat priez Gad an se, “So den Gad gi di piipl we a no Juu di chaans fi ton we fram dem sin an get siev so dem kyan liv fi eva an eva.”

Now those who were scattered by the persecution that arose over Stephen traveled as far as Phoenicia and Cyprus and Antioch, preaching the word to no one except Jews.|Afta di Juu dem kil Stiivn, sofarieshan tek di piipl dem we biliiv iina Jiizas an kaaz som a dem fi get skyata skyata. Dem skyata go klier a Foniisiya, Saipros, an Antiyak, an evriwe dem go dem priich di gud nyuuz, bot a onggl di Juu dem wan dem did a priich tu.

Some of them were men of Cyprus and Cyrene, who, when they had come to Antioch, spoke to the Hellenists, preaching the Lord Jesus.|Bot yu did av som man we kom fram Saipros an Sairiin we did mongks dem piipl de we kom a Antiyak. Dem man de staat tu priich di gud nyuuz bout di Laad Jiizas tu di piipl we a no Juu tu.
The hand of the Lord was with them, and a great number believed and turned to the Lord.|Di Laad Gad did de wid dem an im gi dem powa fi priich an wan uol iip a piipl biliiv an ton tu di Laad.

News of these things came to the ears of the church which was in Jerusalem, and they sent Barnabas to Antioch. |Nyuuz bout wa did a apm iina Antiyak riich di piipl dem iina Jeruusilem we biliiv iina di Laad, so di liida dem sen Baanabas go a Antiyak.

When he arrived and saw the grace of God, he rejoiced and exhorted them all to remain with the Lord with a loyal heart. |Wen im riich an si ou Gad did gud tu dem iivn duo dem neva dizorv it, im did wel api an elp push aal a dem fi gwaan chos iina di Laad wid aal a dem aat.

For he was a good man, full of the Holy Spirit and of faith. And many people were added to the Lord.|Baanabas a did wan gud man. Di Uoli Spirit did tek kanchuol a im laif an im did biliiv nof nof. Siek-a im, uol iip muor piipl ton tu di Laad an get siev.
Then Barnabas went to Tarsus to look for Saul.
column2: Den Baanabas lef go a Taasos fi go luk fi Saal

column1: When he had found him, he brought him to Antioch. For a whole year they met with the church and taught a considerable crowd. And the disciples were first called Christians in Antioch.|an wen im fain im, im kyari im baka Antiyak wid im. So fi wan uol ier Baanabas an Saal miit op wid di choch piipl an tiich kroud an kroud a piipl. An dong a Antiyak a di fos plies we di biliiva dem get di niem Kristiyan.
In these days prophets came down from Jerusalem to Antioch.
column2: Roun dem siem taim de som prafit fram Jeruusilem kom dong a Antiyak.

column1: One of them, named Agabus, stood up and prophesied by the Spirit that there would be a great famine throughout all the world, which came to pass in the days of Claudius Caesar. |Wan a dem we niem Agabos tan op fi priich. Di Uoli Spirit tek kanchuol a im an mek im taak bout ou wan torbl staavieshan a-go tek di uol worl. (Wa Agabos se apm wen taim Klaadiyos did a ruul uova Ruom.)

Then every disciple, according to his ability, determined to send relief to the brothers who lived in Judea. |So di piipl dem we biliiv iina Jiizas mek op dem main fi elp Gad piipl we de iina Judiya. Evribadi gi wa dem kuda gi an dem gi bies pan wa dem av.
Indeed they did, and sent it to the elders by the hands of Barnabas and Saul.|Dem sen di moni wid Baanabas an Saal go gi di choch liida dem a Jeruusilem.

About that time King Herod extended his hands to harm certain ones from the church.|Roun dem taim de, King Erad gi aada fi ares som a di choch piipl dem. Im du dat kaaz im did plan fi mek dem sofa aad aad.
He killed James the brother of John with the sword. |Im mek dem kil Jiemz, Jan breda, wid wan suod.

Seeing that it pleased the Jews, he proceeded further to arrest Peter also. This happened during the Days of Unleavened Bread. |Wen im si se wa im did du tu Jiemz mek di Juu dem api, im gi aada fi ares Piita tu. Dis apm wen di Paasuova alidie did a gwaan.

When he had seized him, he put him in prison and handed him over to four squads of soldiers to guard him, intending to bring him before the people after the Passover.|Afta Erad mek im suoja dem ares Piita im put im iina prizn. Im put fuo gruup a suoja fi gyaad im an iich gruup did av fuo suoja. Erad did plan fi joj Piita infronta evribadi wen di Paasuova alidie don.
So Peter was kept in prison. But the church prayed to God without ceasing for him.|So dem kip Piita lak op iina prizn, bot di choch piipl dem did a prie tu Gad wid aal a dem aat fi im.

The very night when Herod would have brought him out, Peter was sleeping between two soldiers, bound with two chains. And the guards before the door were securing the prison.|Pan da siem nait de, di nait bifuo Erad did plan fi joj Piita infronta evribadi, Piita did a sliip bitwiin tuu suoja. Dem did tai im op wid tuu chien an dem did av tuu suoja infronta di duor a gyaad di prizn.

And suddenly an angel of the Lord approached him, and a light shone in the prison. He struck Peter on the side and woke him up, saying, “Rise up, quickly.” And the chains fell off his hands.|Aal av a sodn wan a di Laad ienjel dem tan op infronta Piita an wan brait brait lait shain iina di prizn. Im lik Piita iina im said an wiek im op. Im se, “Git op, kwik!” Siem taim di chien jrap aafa Piita an.

Then the angel said to him, “Dress yourself and put your sandals on.” And he did so. Then he said to him, “Wrap your cloak around you and follow me.”|Di ienjel se tu Piita se, “Bokl yu belt an put aan yu slipaz.” So Piita du dat. Den di ienjel se tu im se, “Put aan yu lang jakit an fala mi.”

He went out and followed him, and did not know that what was done by the angel was real, but thought he was seeing a vision. |Piita fala di ienjel outa di prizn, bot im neva tingk se wa di ienjel did a du did riili a apm. Im did tingk se a wan vijan.

When they had passed the first and the second guards, they came to the iron gate leading to the city, which opened to them by itself. And they went out and went forward one street. And immediately the angel left him.|Afta di tuu a dem paas di fos an di sekan gyaad, dem riich di aiyan giet we liid iina di siti. Di giet uopm itself fi dem an dem go chuu di giet an waak dong wan naro chriit. Aal av a sodn di ienjel disapier lef Piita.

When Peter had come to himself, he said, “Now I certainly know that the Lord has sent His angel and delivered me from the hand of Herod and from all that the Jewish people were expecting.”|A da taim de Piita kom tu imself an se, “Nou mi nuo fi riil se di Laad sen im ienjel an frii mi fram Erad an di sitn dem we di Juu dem did tingk Erad did a-go du tu mi.”

Realizing this, he came to the house of Mary, the mother of John, whose other name was Mark, where many were gathered together praying. |Wen Piita si wa riili apm, im go a Mieri ous, dat a Jan Maak mada. Nof piipl did gyada op an did a prie.
As Peter knocked at the door of the porch, a servant girl named Rhoda came to answer.|Wen im nak a di giet, wan sliev gyal niem Ruoda go tu im.

When she recognized Peter’s voice, from joy she did not open the door, but ran in and announced that Peter was standing at the door.|Wen shi ier di vais an fain out se a did Piita, di wie ou shi did so api shi ron bak iina di ous an no uopm di giet. Shi tel evribadi se a Piita outa duor.

They said to her, “You are insane.” But she insisted that it was really so. So they said, “It is his angel.”|Bot dem se tu ar se, “Yu ed a tek yu!” Bot shi kip aan a tel dem se a im out de fi riil, an dem kip aan a se tu ar se, “A mosi im ienjel!”
But Peter continued knocking. And when they opened the door and saw him, they were astonished. |Aal da taim de Piita did stil a di giet a nak. Wen dem uopm di duor an si im, dem did wel shak.

Motioning to them with his hand to be quiet, he described to them how the Lord had led him out of the prison. And he said, “Go, tell these things to James and to the brothers.” Then he departed and went to another place.|So Piita mek wan sain wid im an an se, “Shhh, tap unu naiz!” Den im tel dem ou di Laad Gad sen wan a im ienjel an frii im outa prizn. Im se, “Tel Jiemz an di ada breda dem bout wa apm.” Afta dat im lef an go a wan neda plies.
Now when day came, there was a great disturbance among the soldiers about what had become of Peter. |Wen die lait di suoja dem did fried an wel kanfyuuz, kaaz non a dem kudn tel wa apm tu Piita.

When Herod had searched for him and did not find him, he examined the guards and commanded that they should be put to death.Then he went down from Judea to Caesa­rea, and stayed there.|Afta Erad sorch fi Piita an kudn fain im, im kwestiyan di gyaad dem an gi aada fi tek dem an kil dem. Den Erad lef Judiya an go a Sesuriiya go stie.

Now Herod was very angry with the people of Tyre and Sidon. But they came to him in unity, and having made Blastus, the king’s personal servant, their friend, they asked for peace, because their country was fed by the king’s country.|Erad did riili riili beks wid di piipl dem fram Taiya an Saidan. So di piipl dem jain op tugeda iina wan gruup an go fi miit di King. Bot fos dem manij fi get Blastos, we di inchaaj a di king palis, fi elp dem. Den dem go beg di king paadn an mek piis wid im, kaaz dem get fi dem fuud fram di king konchri.

On an appointed day, Herod, dressed in royal apparel, sat on his throne and gave a public speech to them.|Wen di die kom we Erad did set fi miit wid dem, im put aan im speshal king kluoz, sidong pan im speshal siit fi joj an taak tu di piipl dem.
The mob shouted, “It is the voice of a god, and not of a man!” |Wen di piipl dem ier di king dem staat fi shout out an a se, “A no jos wan naamal man dis a taak, im soun laik im a wan gad.”

Immediately an angel of the Lord struck him, because he did not give God the glory. And he was eaten by worms and died.|Siem taim wan a di Laad ienjel chraik dong Erad kaaz im tek di priez fi imself insted-a mek di piipl dem priez Gad. Di siknis we im get mek worm staat nyam im til im ded.
But the word of God spread and increased.
column2: Bot muor an muor piipl ier Gad wod an staat biliiv iina Jiizas.

column1: When Barnabas and Saul had fulfilled their ministry, they returned from Jerusalem and took with them John, whose surname was Mark.|Afta Baanabas an Saal don wa dem did go a Jeruusilem fi du, dem lef an tek Jan Maak wid dem.
