In the church that was in Antioch there were prophets and teachers: Barnabas, Simeon who was called Niger, Lucius of Cyrene, Manaen who had been brought up with Herod the tetrarch, and Saul. |Nou yu did av som prafit an som tiicha mongks di biliiva dem we did de a Antiyak: man laik Baanabas, Simiyan we dem kaal Naiga, Luushos fram Sairiin, Manoyen (im an Erad di ruula a did gud gud fren fram dem a pikni) an Saal.

As they worshipped the Lord and fasted, the Holy Spirit said, “Set apart for Me Barnabas and Saul for the work to which I have called them.”|Dem did a sorv di Laad an a kip we fram fuud wen di Uoli Spirit se tu dem se, “Frii op Baanabas an Saal so dem kyan du di wok we mi did pik dem fi du.”

Then after fasting and praying, they laid their hands on them and sent them off.|So afta dem taim fi kip we fram fuud an prie did don, dem put dem an pan Baanabas an Saal ed, prie fi dem, an sen dem aaf.

So, being sent out by the Holy Spirit, they went down to Seleucia, and from there they sailed to Cyprus. |Di Uoli Spirit sen out di tuu a dem an dem lef go dong a Siluukiya an fram de-so dem siel go Saipros.

When they arrived at Sal­amis, they preached the word of God in the synagogues of the Jews. And they had John as an assistant.|Wen dem riich a Salamis, dem staat priich Gad wod iina di Juu dem choch. (Dem did av Jan wid dem fi elp dem wid di wok).

When they had gone through the whole island to Paphos, they found a certain sorcerer, a Jewish false prophet, whose name was Bar-Jesus|Afta dem chravl kraas di uol konchri til dem riich wie a Pafos, dem miit wan uobiya man, wan Juu we niem Bar-Jiizas we a did wan faalz prafit.

who was with the proconsul, Sergius Paulus, an intelligent man. This man called for Barnabas and Saul and sought to hear the word of God.|Bar-Jiizas an di govana fi di konchri, Sorjiyos Paalos, a did fren. Di govana a did wan man we brait an av nof sens. Im sen kaal Baanabas an Saal, kaaz im did waahn fi ier Gad wod.

But Elymas the sorcerer (which is his name by interpretation) opposed them, trying to divert the proconsul from the faith. |Bot Elimas di uobiya man (iina di Griik langwij a so dem kaal im) tan op chrang gens Baanabas an Saal, a chrai fi mek di govana ton gens di gud nyuuz.
Then Saul, who also is called Paul, filled with the Holy Spirit, stared at him and said|Bot di Uoli Spirit tek kanchuol a Saal (we dem kaal Paal), an im luk chriet pan Elimas

“You son of the devil, enemy of all righteousness, full of deceit and of all fraud, will you not cease perverting the right ways of the Lord?|an se tu im se, “Yu komiin laik Sietan pikni! Yu aalwiez a go gens evriting we rait! Yu ful op a lai an yu a wan uol jinal. Yu naa tap chrai fi mek di Laad chuut komiin laik se it a lai?

Now, look! The hand of the Lord is against you, and you shall be blind, not seeing the sun for a time. Immediately mist and darkness fell on him, and he went about seeking someone to lead him by the hand.|Rait nou Gad a-go chraik yu dong an blain yu an yu naa go kyan si di son lait fi nou.”Siem taim im yai dem get fag op an daak an im staat fiil im wie roun an a chrai fi fain sumadi fi uol im an an liid im we im waahn fi go.

When the proconsul saw what had happened, he believed and was astonished at the doctrine of the Lord.|Wen di govana si evriting wa apm, im biliiv, an wa Paal an Baanabas did a tiich bout di Laad Jiizas did riili kaaz im fi wanda aad aad.

Now when Paul and his companions set sail from Paphos, they came to Perga in Pamphylia. And John departed from them and returned to Jerusalem. |Paal an di man dem we did a chravl wid im siel fram Pafos go a Porga iina Pamfiliya, bot Jan lef dem an ton bak go a Jeruusilem.
But they departed from Perga and came to Antioch in Pisidia. And they went into the synagogue on the Sabbath day and sat down.
column2: Dem lef Porga an go a Pisidiyan Antiyak. Pan di Sabat dem go iina di Juu dem choch go sidong.

column1: After the reading from the Law and the Prophets, the rulers of the synagogue sent word to them, saying, “Brothers, if you have any word of exhortation for the people, say it.”|Afta sumadi riid fram di Laa buk an fram di Prafit dem, di liida dem fi di Juu dem choch sen wan mesij tu dem se, “Breda, ef unu av wan mesij we kyan elp bil op di piipl dem unu taak op.”

Then Paul stood up, and motioning with his hand said: “Men of Israel, and you who fear God, listen.|So Paal get op an mek wan sain wid im an tu di piipl an se, “Aal a unu Izrel piipl an piipl we a no Juu we worship Gad, ier wa mi a se!

The God of this people of Israel chose our fathers, and exalted the people when they lived as foreigners in the land of Egypt, and with great power He led them out of it. |Di Gad fi di Izrel piipl pik wi faada faada dem. Im mek im piipl gruo muo an muo an get nof an chrang wen dem did a liv iina Iijip. Den im yuuz im powa an frii dem outa da konchri de.
For about forty years He endured their conduct in the desert. |Fi bout faati ier, out iina di bush we nobadi neva liv, im tek kier a dem an put op wid dem bad brok wie.

When He had destroyed seven nations in the land of Canaan, He gave them their land as an inheritance by lot.|Im mek dem kil aaf an mash op di piipl dem fram sevn difrant konchri we did liv iina Kienan an tek fi dem konchri gi fi'im piipl.

“After about four hundred and fifty years, God gave them judges until Samuel the prophet.|Aal a dem sopm ya tek bout fuo onjrid an fifti ier fi apm. Afta dat Gad riez op liida mongks dem, wan afta di ada, til di taim wen im gi dem Samwel di prafit.

Then they requested a king. And God gave them Saul the son of Kish, a man of the tribe of Benjamin, for forty years. |Den di piipl aks Samwel fi pik wan king gi dem. So Gad pik Saal, Kish bwai pikni, we kom fram Benjamin chraib, an im ruul dem fi faati ier.

When He had removed him, He raised up David to be their king, of whom He testified, saying, ‘I have found David the son of Jesse, a man after My own heart, who will fulfill My entire will.’|Gad tek we di king pozishan fram Saal an gi Dievid. Gad taak gud bout Dievid, im se, ‘Mi si se Dievid, Jesi bwai pikni a wan man we wi tingk ou mi wuda tingk an we wi du evriting we mi waahn im fi du.’

From this man’s descendants God has raised a Savior for Israel, Jesus, according to His promise.|“Da siem man ya, Dievid, Gad pik wan a im pikni pikni dem, di wan niem Jiizas, an sen im fi kom siev di Izrel piipl, kaaz a dat im did pramis dem faada faada se im wuda du.
Before His coming John had preached a baptism of repentance to all the people of Israel.
column2: Bifuo Jiizas did kom Jan priich tu di Izrel Piipl dem se dem fi ton we fram dem sin an get baptaiz.

column1: As John was fulfilling his course, he said, ‘Who do you think I am? I am not He. But look! He is coming after me, the sandals of whose feet I am not worthy to untie.’|Wen Jan did suun don di wok we Gad gi im fi du im se tu di piipl dem se, ‘Unu tingk se mi a di wan we fi kom, bot mi a no im. Nuo! Bot di wan we fi kom suun kom, an mi no iivn gud inof fi tek aaf im slipaz aafa im fut.’

“Brothers, sons of the family of Abraham, and those of you who fear God, the word of this salvation has been sent to us.|“Breda an sista we a Iebriyam pikni, an aal a unu we a no Juu we rispek Gad, a wi di mesij kom tu bout ou Gad siev piipl.

Because those who live in Jerusalem, and their rulers, did not know Him, in condemning Him they have fulfilled the voices of the Prophets which are read every Sabbath.|Bot di piipl dem we liv iina Jeruusilem an dem ruula dem neva andastan se Jiizas a di wan we did kom fi siev dem. Di sitn dem we di prafit rait an we di piipl an dem liida dem riid bout iina dem choch evri Sabat, dem mek aal a dem sitn de kom chuu wen dem ton dem bak pan Jiizas an sen im fi go ded.
Though they found in Him no cause worthy of death, yet they asked Pilate to have Him killed. |Iivn duo dem neva fain notn fi chaaj im fa, dem beg Pailat fi kil im pan di kraas.

When they had fulfilled all that was written of Him, they took Him down from the tree and placed Him in a tomb. |Afta di Izrel piipl dem du aal we di prafit dem se dem wuda du tu Jiizas, dem tek im badi aafa di kraas an beri it iina wan griev.
But God raised Him from the dead
column2: Bot Gad mek im kom bak alaiv

column1: and for many days He appeared to those who came up with Him from Galilee to Jerusalem, who are now His witnesses to the people.|an difrant difrant taim fi kopl die wel Jiizas shuo imself tu di piipl dem we did kom wid im fram Gyalalii tu Jeruusilem. A dem siem piipl de a tel piipl bout im nou.
“We preach to you good news: The promise which was made to the fathers
column2: Gad did mek wan pramis tu wi faada faada dem. An wi de ya fi tel unu di gud nyuuz bout di pramis.

column1: God has fulfilled to us, their children, raising Jesus. As it is written in the second Psalm:‘You are My Son;today I have become Your Father.’|Im kip im pramis we im did mek tu wi faada faada dem wen im mek Jiizas kom bak alaiv. Kaaz it rait dong iina Saam tuu se,“ ‘Yu a fi mi bwai pikni;tide tide mi ton yu faada.’

That He raised Him from the dead, no more to return to corruption, He has spoken in this way:‘I will give You the holy and sure blessings of David.’|Gad mek Krais Jiizas ded an kom bak alaiv, an im kyaahn ded agen. An dis a wa Gad did se bout dat:“ ‘Mi a-go elp yu an gi yu di siem speshal pramis we mi did gi Dievid.’
So He says in another Psalm:‘You will not let Your Holy One see decay.’
column2: An it rait dong wan neks plies se:“ ‘Yu naa go mek yu sorvant we aalwiez du we yu waahn im fi du ded an ratn.’

column1: “For after David had served by the counsel of God in his own generation, he fell asleep, was buried with his fathers, and saw decay. |“Kaaz afta Dievid du we Gad did waahn im fi du mongks fi'im piipl we im gruo op wid, im ded an dem beri im mongks im faada faada dem griev an im badi ratn.
But He whom God raised up saw no decay.|Bot di wan we Gad mek ded an kom bak alaiv, fi'im badi neva ratn.

“Therefore, brothers, let it be known to you that through this Man forgiveness of sins is proclaimed to you|So mi breda an sista, mi waahn unu fi nuo dis, so wi a tel unu se, siek-a wa Jiizas du, Gad waahn unu fi nuo se unu kyan get paadn fu'unu sin dem.

and by Him everyone who believes is justified from everything from which you could not be justified by the Law of Moses. |Siek-a wa Jiizas du, evribadi we biliiv iina im, Gad mek dem no gilti no muor an frii dem fram dem sin wen Muoziz Laa kudn du dat.
Therefore beware, lest what is spoken of in the prophets come upon you:|Main wa di prafit dem se kech unu: dem se,

‘Look, you scoffers,marvel and perish!For I will perform a work in your dayswhich you will never believe,even if someone declares it to you.’|“ ‘Luk ya, aal a unu we a bad chat we Gad se,unu a-go get joj.Kaaz mi a-go du som sopm iina da taim yadat unu wuda neva biliiv,iivn ef sumadi tel unu.’ ”

When Paul and Barnabas went out of the synagogue, the Gentiles asked that these words might be preached to them the next Sabbath.|Wen Paal an Baanabas did a lef di Juu dem choch, di piipl dem beg dem fi kom taak tu dem agen bout dem sitn ya di neks Sabat.

When the congregation was dismissed, many of the Jews and devout proselytes followed Paul and Barnabas, who spoke to them and urged them to continue in the grace of God.|Afta di Juu dem choch uova, nof a di Juu dem an di piipl dem we did ton Juu fala Paal an Baanabas. Paal an Baanabas did a taak tu dem an a tel dem no fi tap chos Gad fi shuo dem lov iivn duo dem neva dizorv it.
On the next Sabbath almost the whole city assembled to hear the word of God.|Di neks Sabat, nieli di uol toun gyada op fi ier Gad wod.

But when the Jews saw the crowds, they were filled with jealousy, blaspheming and contradicting what Paul was saying.|Wen di Juu dem si di kroud, dem get red yai an staat bad main Paal, an staat chat bout se wa im a se bout Jiizas a lai, an chat bad sitn bout Paal tu.

Then Paul and Barnabas boldly said, “It was necessary that the word of God should be spoken to you first. But seeing you reject it, and judge yourselves unworthy of eternal life, we are turning to the Gentiles.|Bot Paal an Baanabas neva fried fi tel dem di chuut. Dem se, “Wi did afi priich Gad wod tu unu fos bifuo wi kuda priich tu di piipl we a no Juu, kaaz a dat Gad tel wi fi du. Bot unu ton unu bak pan Gad mesij an se a lai wi a tel. Da wie de unu ton unu bak pan Gad. An unu tingk se unu neva gud inof fi liv wid im fi eva an eva laik wa im did pramis. So fram nou aan, wi a lef unu an go priich Gad mesij tu di piipl dem we a no Juu.

For thus has the Lord commanded us:‘I have established you to be a light of the Gentiles,that you may bring salvation to the ends of the earth.’|Dis a wa di Laad Gad aada wi fi du, im se:“ ‘Mi pik yu laik wan lait fi mek di piipl we a no Juu nuo bout mi,fi tel piipl aal uova di worl bout di wan we kom fi siev dem.’ ”

When the Gentiles heard this, they were glad and glorified the word of the Lord. And all who were ordained to eternal life believed.|Wen di piipl we a no Juu ier dis, dem api so til. Dem gi tangks an priez fi Gad mesij. An aal a di wan dem we Gad did pik fi liv fi eva, biliiv di mesij an get siev.
The word of the Lord was spread throughout the entire region.
column2: So Gad wod did a pred aal uova di konchri.

column1: But the Jews stirred up the devout and honorable women and the chief men of the city, and raised up persecution against Paul and Barnabas, and drove them from their region. |Bot di Juu dem rail op di uman dem we rich an we worship Gad, an di big impuotant man dem iina di toun. Dem du som torbl sitn gens Paal an Baanabas an mek dem sofa an ron dem outa dem toun.
So they shook off the dust of their feet against them and went to Iconium.
column2: So Paal an Baanabas shiek aaf di dos aafa dem fut fi mek dem nuo se Gad no api wid dem an im a-go joj dem. Den dem go we go a Aikoniyom.

column1: And the disciples were filled with joy and with the Holy Spirit.
column2: An di choch piipl dem did wel api an di Uoli Spirit did tek kanchuol a dem.

column1: At Iconium they entered the synagogue of the Jews together and so spoke that a great crowd of both Jews and Greeks believed.
column2: Di siem ting we did apm tu Paal an Baanabas iina Antiyak apm iina Aikoniyom. Di tuu a dem go iina di Juu dem choch an taak tu piipl we a Juu an piipl we a no Juu. Wa dem se did so powaful dat nof nof piipl we a Juu an piipl we a no Juu biliiv iina Jiizas.

column1: But the unbelieving Jews stirred up the Gentiles and embittered their minds against the brothers. |Bot som a di Juu dem we mek op dem main se dem naa biliiv di gud nyuuz bout Jiizas, rail op di piipl dem we a no Juu, an paizn dem main gens di breda dem.

So they continued there a long time, speaking boldly for the Lord, who bore witness to His gracious word, granting signs and wonders to be done by their hands.|So Paal an Baanabas tan de fi wan lang taim. An dem neva fried fi priich fi di Laad. Di mesij we dem did a priich bout ou di Laad lov piipl iivn duo dem no dizorv it, di Laad pruuv se a chuu dem did a taak wen im gi dem powa fi du aal kain-a mirikl an sain.

But the people of the city were divided. Some sided with the Jews, and others with the apostles. |Di piipl we liv iina di toun ton gens dem wan aneda siek-a wa Paal an Baanabas did a priich. Som biliiv di Juu dem an som biliiv wa Paal an Baanabas se.

When an assault was planned by both Gentiles and Jews, with their leaders, to attack them and to stone them|Wen di piipl we a Juu, di piipl we a no Juu an dem ruula dem chrai fi mek Paal an Baanabas sofa an fi stuon dem

they learned of it and fled to Lystra and Derbe, cities of Lycaonia, and to the surrounding region. |Paal an Baanabas fain out wa dem did a plan fi du an ron we go a Lischra an Dorbi iina Likuoniya an di dischrik dem nier de.
And there they preached the gospel.
column2: Dong de-so dem gwaan priich di gud nyuuz.

column1: In Lystra there sat a man, crippled in his feet, who had never walked and was lame from birth.|Iina Lischra yu did av wan kripl man a sidong. Im did baan wid im tuu fut dem kripl so im neva waak fram im baan.

He heard Paul speaking, who looked intently at him and perceived that he had faith to be healed |Im did a lisn tu Paal a priich bout Jiizas. Paal luk chriet pan im an si se im did biliiv iina Gad inof se Gad kuda get im beta.
and said with a loud voice, “Stand upright on your feet.” And he jumped up and walked.|So Paal kaal out tu im an se, “Git op an tan op chriet!” Siem taim di man jomp op an staat waak.

When the crowds saw what Paul had done, they lifted up their voices, saying in Lycaonian, “The gods have come down to us in the likeness of men!” |Wen di kroud si wa Paal du, dem staat baal out iina di Likuoniyan langwij, dem se, “Di gad dem ton man an kom dong fram evn tu wi.”

Barnabas they called Zeus, and Paul they called Hermes, because he was the main speaker.|Dem se Baanabas a Zuus, di ed fi di gad dem, an dem kaal Paal Ormiiz, di mout piis fi di gad dem, kaaz a im did a taak di muos.

The priest of Zeus, who was in front of the city, brought bulls and garlands to the gates to offer sacrifices with the crowds.|Outsaida di siti nier di giet, dem did av wan ous fi di piipl we worship Zuus. Di ed priis fi Zuus kom wid som bulkou an som flowaz kaaz im an di piipl did waahn fi bon sakrifais gi Baanabas an Paal dem.

But when the apostles Barnabas and Paul heard this, they tore their clothes and rushed out into the crowd, crying out|Bot wen Baanabas an Paal ier bout wa dem did plan fi du, dem tier dem kluoz, an ron out tu di kroud an baal out tu dem se:

“Men, why are you doing this? We also are men, of like nature with you, preaching to you to turn from these vain things to the living God, who made the heaven and the earth and the sea, and everything that is in them|“Oi! Oi! Wa unu a du dem sitn de fa? No dwi'it! Wi a jos man siem laik unu! Wi onggl kom fi tel unu di Gud Nyuuz. Wi a tel unu fi ton we fram dem woklis sitn ya, an ton tu Gad, di Gad we liv fi eva an we mek evn an ort an di sii an evriting iina dem.
who in times past allowed all nations to walk in their own ways.
column2: Fos taim im yuus tu lef aal a di piipl iina di worl we a no Juu fi du we dem waahn fi du.

column1: Yet He did not leave Himself without witness, for He did good and gave us rain from heaven and fruitful seasons, satisfying our hearts with food and gladness.”|Bot Gad aalwiez mek piipl nuo ou im gud tu dem. Im du dis wen im mek im rien faal fram evn an mek dem fiil bier a ier taim, so unu av nof fuud fi iit an im mek unu aat api.”
With these words they scarcely restrained the crowds from sacrificing to them.|Iivn afta Paal se aal a dem sitn de, dem stil did av a aad taim bifuo dem kuda get di piipl fi no bon sakrifais tu dem.

Then some Jews from Antioch and Iconium came there and persuaded the crowds. They stoned Paul and dragged him out of the city, supposing he was dead.|Den som Juu kom fram Antiyak an Aikoniyom an win uova di kroud. Dem get dem fi stuon Paal an wen dem tingk se im ded, dem jrag im badi go fling it outa di siti.

But as the disciples gathered around him, he rose up and went into the city. The next day he departed with Barnabas for Derbe.|Bot wen di piipl dem we biliiv iina Jiizas gyada op roun im badi, Paal get op an go bak iina di siti. Di neks die im an Baanabas lef go a Dorbi.

When they had preached the gospel to that city and had made many disciples, they returned to Lystra and to Iconium and to Antioch|Dem priich di gud nyuuz iina Dorbi an uol iip a piipl biliiv iina Jiizas. Den dem go baka Lischra, Aikoniyom, an Antiyak

strengthening the minds of the disciples and exhorting them to continue in the faith, to go through many afflictions and thus enter the kingdom of God. |a elp di piipl dem we biliiv iina Jiizas fi get chrang iina wa dem biliiv. Dem tel dem fi eng aan pan di chuut we dem biliiv bout Jiizas. Dem tel dem se, “Wi afi go chuu nof sofarieshan fi get iina Gad kindom.”

When they had appointed elders for them in every church, with prayer and fasting, they commended them to the Lord in whom they believed.|Iina aal a di choch dem, Paal an Baanabas pik elda gi dem fi liid dem. An afta dem spen taim a prie an kip we fram fuud, Paal an Baanabas ton di liida dem an di choch piipl dem uova tu di Laad Jiizas we dem biliiv iina.
Then they passed throughout Pisidia and came to Pamphylia|Afta Paal an Baanabas paas chuu Pisidiya, dem go a Pamfiliya
and when they had preached the word in Perga, they went down into Attalia.|an afta dem priich Gad wod tu di Porga piipl dem, dem lef an go dong a Ataliya.

From there they sailed to Antioch, where they had been commended to the grace of God for the work which they had completed.|Di tuu a dem lef Ataliya an siel bak go a Antiyak. A Antiyak dem did lef fram afta di piipl dem we biliiv iina Jiizas did prie fi dem an sen dem fi go priich Gad wod tu ada piipl. Dem did aks Gad fi tek kier a dem an bles dem. Nou dat dem don di wok, dem kom bak tu di choch piipl we did sen dem out.

When they arrived and had assembled the church, they reported what God had done through them and how He had opened the door of faith to the Gentiles.|Wen dem riich a Antiyak, Paal an Baanabas gyada op di choch piipl an tel dem evriting we Gad did gi dem powa fi du, an ou Gad gi di piipl we a no Juu di chaans fi biliiv iina im.
And there they stayed a long time with the disciples.
column2: An dem tan wid di piipl a Antiyak we biliiv iina Jiizas fi wan lang taim.

column1: Some men came down from Judea and were teaching the brothers, “Unless you are circumcised in the tradition of Moses, you cannot be saved.”|Den som man kom fram Judiya kom a Antiyak. Dem staat fi tiich di piipl we biliiv iina Jiizas se, “Ef unu no get sorkomsaiz azkaadn tu we Muoziz Laa se, unu kyaahn get siev.”

Therefore when Paul and Barnabas had no small dissension and dispute with them, they determined that Paul and Barnabas, and certain others among them, should go up to Jerusalem to the apostles and elders about this question.|Paal an Baanabas aagyu chrang chrang gens wa dem man de did a tiich, an tan op tu dem an mek dem nuo se dem rang. So di choch pik Paal an Baanabas, an som ada biliiva fi go wid dem a Jeruusilem fi go taak tu di apasl an elda dem bout di mata.

So being sent on their way by the church, they passed through Phoenicia and Samaria, declaring the conversion of the Gentiles, and they brought great joy to all the brothers. |Di choch sen dem aaf, an wen dem did a go chuu Foniisiya an Samieriya dem tel di piipl dem we biliiv iina Jiizas ou nof a di piipl we a no Juu iina Antiyak biliiv di gud nyuuz. Dat mek di biliiva dem wel api.

When they arrived in Jerusalem, they were welcomed by the church and the apostles and the elders, and they declared what God had done through them.|Wen dem riich a Jeruusilem, di choch, di apasl dem, an di elda dem tek dem iin. Den Paal an Baanabas tel dem evriting we Gad mek dem du mongks di piipl we a no Juu.

Then some believers of the sect of the Pharisees rose up, saying, “It is necessary to circumcise them, and to command them to keep the Law of Moses.”|Den som a di choch piipl dem we a paat a di Farisii gruup tan op an se, “Di piipl we a no Juu afi get sorkomsaiz an wi afi aada dem fi kip Muoziz Laa tu.”
The apostles and elders assembled to consider this matter.
column2: Di apasl an di elda dem mek op dem main fi miit an diil wid di prablem.

column1: After much disputing, Peter rose up and said to them, “Brothers, you know that some time ago God decided among us, that by my mouth the Gentiles should hear the word of the gospel and believe.|Afta dem did a aagyu fi wan gud wail, Piita get op an taak tu dem. Im se, “Mi breda, unu nuo ou lang taim a-go Gad pik mi fram mongks unu an yuuz mi fi tel di piipl we a no Juu di Gud Nyuuz so dem wuda biliiv iina Jiizas.

God, who knows the heart, approved of them, giving them the Holy Spirit just as He did to us|Gad, di wan we nuo evribadi aat, gi dem im Uoli Spirit, an dat shuo se im tek dem fi im piipl siem laik ou im did du wid wi.
and made no distinction between them and us, and purified their hearts by faith.|Gad shuo se wi no difrant fram dem. Im paadn dem fi dem sin kaaz dem biliiv iina im.

Now then, why test God by putting a yoke upon the neck of the disciples, which neither our fathers nor we have been able to bear?|So tel mi nou, wa mek unu waahn flai iina Gad fies fi go presha im piipl fi du wa Gad neva aada dem fi du, sitn we no iivn wi ar fi wi faada faada dem kuda du?

But we believe that through the grace of the Lord Jesus Christ we shall be saved, even as they.”|Nuo man! Wi biliiv a chuu wi Laad Jiizas lov wi iivn duo wi no dizorv it wai im siev wi jos laik ou im siev dem.”
The entire assembly remained silent and listened to Barnabas and Paul declaring what signs and wonders God had done through them among the Gentiles.
column2: Evribadi iina di miitn kip kwaiyat an lisn tu Paal an Baanabas wail dem tel dem bout di mirikl an di powaful sitn dem wa Gad gi dem powa fi du mongks di piipl we a no Juu.

column1: After they had become silent, James answered, “Brothers, listen to me. |Wen dem don taak, Jiemz taak op an se, “Breda unu lisn tu mi.
Simon has declared how God first visited the Gentiles to take from among them a people for His name.
column2: Simiyan jos tel wi ou Gad shuo se im kier fi di piipl we a no Juu wen im tek som a dem fi bi im uona piipl.

column1: With this the words of the prophets agree. As it is written:|Wa di prafit dem se grii wid dis, kaaz it rait dong se:

‘After this I will return,and I will rebuild the tabernacle of David, which has fallen;I will rebuild its ruins,and I will set it up;|“‘Lieta aan mi a-go kom bakkom bil op bak Dievid kindom we did get mash dong.Mi a-go bil it bak op,an mek it chrang agen,

that the rest of men may seek the Lord,and all the Gentiles who are called by My name,says the Lord who does all these things.’|so dat aal di piipl we a no Juu we bilang tu mi,an di res a piipl iina di worl wi ton tu di Laad.A di Laad se dem sitn ya’
Known to God are all His works since the beginning of the world.
column2: an piipl nuo dem sitn de fram wie bak wen.”

column1: “Therefore my judgment is that we should not trouble those of the Gentiles who are turning to God|So Jiemz se tu dem se, “Ier mi nou, mi fiil se wi fi lef di piipl we a no Juu an no chrai fi mek it aad fi dem ton tu Gad.

but that we write to them to abstain from food offered to idols, from sexual immorality, from strangled animals, and from blood. |Insted-a dat, wa wi fi du a rait an tel dem se dem no fi nyam no fuud we piipl tek bon sakrifais gi faalz gad, ton we fram aal saat a seks sin, no nyam miit fram animal we eng ar we dem blod neva bliid out wen dem get kil, an no nyam ar jringk blod.

For Moses has had in every city since early generations those who preach him, being read in the synagogues every Sabbath.”|Kaaz fi wan lang lang taim, evri Sabat dem riid Muoziz Laa iina di Juu dem choch an dem priich evriting we rait dong iina da Laa de iina evri toun.”

Then it pleased the apostles and the elders, with the whole church, to send chosen men from among them to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas, namely, Judas called Bar­sabas, and Silas, leading men among the brothers.|Den di apasl dem, di elda dem an aal a di choch piipl dem mek op dem main fi sen som man fram di choch go a Antiyak. So dem pik tuu a dem liida, Juudas (we niem Baasabas) an Sailas an sen dem wid Paal an Baanabas.

They wrote this letter by their hand:The apostles and the elders and the brothers,To the brothers who are of the Gentiles in Antioch and Syria and Cilicia:Greetings.|Dis a di leta we dem gi dem fi gi di choch:Wi, di apasl an elda dem, we a unu breda, a rait an a sen oudi tu aal a unu we de a Antiyak, Siriya, an Silisiya we biliiv iina Jiizas.

Since we have heard that some of us, whom we did not commission, have gone out and have troubled you with words, unsettling your minds, saying, “You must be circumcised and keep the law,” |Wi ier se som man fram wi gruup kom a mek chobl fi unu an a chrai fi mes op unu ed wid di sitn dem we dem a tiich, bot wi neva sen dem, ar wi neva gi dem no rait fi du wa dem a du.

it seemed good to us, being assembled in unity, to send chosen men to you with our beloved Barnabas and Paul|So aal a wi mek op wi main fi pik som man an sen dem tu unu wid wi gud gud fren dem, Baanabas an Paal.
men who have risked their lives for the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.
column2: Dem tuu man ya nieli ded a du di wok we wi Laad Jiizas Krais gi dem fi du.

column1: Therefore we have sent Judas and Silas, who will also speak to you, saying the same things.|So wi a sen Juudas an Sailas wid dem fi tel unu wid dem uona mout di siem sitn wa wi rait iina da leta ya.

For it seemed good to the Holy Spirit and to us to put on you no greater burden than these necessary things:|Di Uoli Spirit tingk se it bes fi wi no put no muo presha pan unu dan wa wi bout fi tel unu nou, an wi tingk so tu.

Abstain from food offered to idols, from sexual immorality, from strangled animals, and from blood. If you keep yourselves from these, you will do well.Farewell.|Unu no fi nyam no fuud we piipl tek bon sakrifais gi faalz gad, no nyam ar jringk no blod, no nyam miit fram animal we eng ar we blod neva bliid out wen dem ded. Unu fi kip we fram aal saat a seks sin. Ef unu kip we fram aal a dem sitn de, unu a du di rait ting. Unu tek kier.

So when they were dismissed, they went down to Antioch. And when they had assembled the congregation, they delivered the letter.|So afta dem sen aaf di man dem, dem go a Antiyak, gyada op aal a di piipl we biliiv iina Jiizas, an gi dem di leta.
When they had read it, they rejoiced over the exhortation. |Wen dem riid out di leta loud, di piipl did api kaaz it elp bil dem op iina wa dem biliiv.

Judas and Silas, being prophets themselves, exhorted the brothers with many words and strengthened them.|Juudas an Sailas a did prafit tu so dem taak nof sopm we elp fi mek di piipl we biliiv iina Jiizas get chrang iina wa dem biliiv.

After they had remained there for a time, they were sent off in peace by the brothers to the apostles.|Afta Juudas an Sailas spen kopl wiik wid dem, di choch piipl dem prie fi Gad bles dem an mek im piis protek dem an sen dem bak tu di liida dem iina Jeruusilem we did sen dem kom Antiyak.
But it seemed good to Silas to remain there.
column2: Bot Sailas se it mek muo sens fi dem jos tan deso.

column1: And Paul and Barnabas remained in Antioch, teaching and preaching the word of the Lord, with many others also.|Bot Paal an Baanabas tan a Antiyak an tiich an priich Gad wod. An nof muor tiicha an priicha did iina di choch.

After some days Paul said to Barnabas, “Let us return and visit our brothers in every city where we preached the word of the Lord and see how they are doing.”|Som taim afta dat Paal se tu Baanabas se, “Mek wi go bak go luk fi di breda an sista dem iina aal a di toun dem we wi did priich Gad wod go si ou dem a du.”
Barnabas determined to take with them John, who was called Mark.|Baanabas did waahn kyari Jan, we dem kaal Maak, wid dem tu.

But Paul thought it was not good to take with them one who had withdrawn from them in Pamphylia and had not gone with them to the work.|Bot Paal neva tingk it rait fi tek im wid dem. Im tan op chrang gens it, kaaz di fos taim wen dem did a pred di Gud Nyuuz, wen dem riich a Pamfiliya, Jan Maak did ton bak bifuo dem don di wok.

Then there arose a sharp contention, so that they separated from each other. Barnabas took Mark and sailed to Cyprus|Paal an Baanabas kech op an tingz get so bad dat dem kudn sekl it. So Baanabas tek Maak wid im an siel go a Saipros
but Paul chose Silas and departed, being commended by the brothers to the grace of God.|bot Paal pik Sailas an lef out afta di biliiva dem prie an aks di Laad fi tek kier a dem.
And he went through Syria and Cilicia, strengthening the churches.|So dem paas chuu Siriya an Silisiya an elp di piipl dem we biliiv iina Jiizas fi tan op chrang iina wa dem biliiv.

Then he came to Derbe and then to Lystra. A disciple was there, named Timothy, the son of a Jewess who believed, but his father was a Greek. |Den Paal go a Dorbi an Lischra. Nou yu did av wan choch breda de niem Timoti. Im mada a did wan Juu we biliiv iina Jiizas, bot im faada a did Griik.
He was well spoken of by the brothers who were at Lystra and Iconium.
column2: Di choch piipl iina Lischra an Aikoniyom taak gud bout im.

column1: Paul wanted him to travel with him. So he took him and circumcised him because of the Jews who were in those places, for they all knew that his father was a Greek. |Paal did waahn Timoti fi go wid im, so im mek Timoti get sorkomsaiz. Im du dis kaaz di Juu dem we did liv iina di ieriya did nuo se Timoti faada a did Griik. Dat miin se Timoti neva did sorkomsaiz.

As they went through the cities, they delivered to them the decrees to observe, that were set forth by the apostles and elders at Jerusalem. |An iina evri toun we dem go, dem gi di piipl dem we biliiv iina Jiizas di ruul dem we di apasl an di elda dem iina Jeruusilem did se di piipl we a no Juu fi fala.
So the churches were strengthened in the faith, and increased in number daily.|So di choch piipl dem get chrangga an chrangga iina wa dem biliiv an evridie muor an muor piipl jain dem gruup.

They went through the region of Phryg­ia and Galatia and were forbidden by the Holy Spirit to speak the word in Asia. |Di Uoli Spirit wudn lou dem fi priich di gud nyuuz iina Iezha, so dem muuv chuu Frijiya an Gyaliesha.
When they came near Mysia, they tried to go into Bithynia, but the Spirit did not allow them.|Wen dem riich a Misiya, dem chrai fi go iina Bitiniya, bot di Uoli Spirit neva lou dem.
So they passed by Mysia and went down to Troas.
column2: So dem paas chuu Misiya an go dong a Chuowas.

column1: During the night a vision appeared to Paul: A man of Macedonia stood and pleaded with him, saying, “Come over to Macedonia and help us.”|Iina di nait Paal get wan vijan. Im si wan man fram Masiduoniya tan op an a beg im aad aad se, “Kom uova Masiduoniya kom elp wi!”

After he had seen the vision, immediately we sought to go into Macedonia, concluding that the Lord had called us to preach the gospel to them.|Afta Paal get di vijan, wi mek op wi main se Gad did waahn wi fi go priich di Gud Nyuuz tu dem, so wi chrai siem taim fi go a Masiduoniya.
From Troas we set sail on a straight course to Samothrace and the next day to Neapolis
column2: Den wi tek wan buot fram Chuowas an fala wan chriet lain go a Samachries. Di neks die wi siel go a Niyapolis.

column1: and from there to Philippi, which is the main city of that part of Macedonia, and a colony. We stayed in this city several days.|Fram de-so wi siel go a Filipai. Filipai a did wan big impuotant siti iina da ieriya a Masiduoniya de we a did wan Ruoman parish.

On the Sabbath we went out of the city to a riverside, where prayer was customarily offered. And we sat down and spoke to the women who had assembled.|Pan di Sabat die wi go chuu di siti giet go a di rivasaid. Wi go de kaaz wi did uop fi fain wan plies we piipl gyada op fi prie tu Gad. So wi sidong an staat fi taak tu di uman dem we did gyada op de.

A woman named Lydia, a seller of purple fabric of the city of Thyatira, who worshipped God, heard us. The Lord opened her heart to acknowledge what Paul said.|Yu did av wan uman mongks dem fram Taiyataira niem Lidiya we yuus tu sel som dier porpl klaat. Shi did lov Gad so moch dat shi aalwiez a du di sitn dem we shi nuo Gad waahn ar fi du. Di Laad toch ar aat mek shi andastan an biliiv wa Paal did a se.

When she and her household were baptized, she entreated us, saying, “If you have judged me to be faithful to the Lord, come to my house and remain there.” And she persuaded us.|Afta shi an di piipl we liv a ar ous get baptaiz, shi beg wi fi kom a ar yaad. Shi se, “Ef unu tek mi fi wan a di Laad piipl we riili biliiv iina im, kom tan a mi yaad.” Shi win wi uova, so wi go wid ar.

On one occasion, as we went to the place of prayer, a servant girl possessed with a spirit of divination met us, who brought her masters much profit by fortune-telling. |Wen wi did a go a di plies we piipl prie tu Gad, wan gyal we dem tek ton sliev miit wi. Shi did av wan diiman iina ar we mek shi kuda tel piipl we a-go apm iina di fyuucha. Shi yuus tu mek nof moni fi ar maasta dem we shi wok fa laik wan riida uman.

She followed Paul and us, shouting, “These men are servants of the Most High God, who proclaim to us the way of salvation.”|Shi kip aan a fala baka wi an Paal an a baal out, “Dem man ya a di Muos ai Gad sorvant dem. Dem a priich an a tel unu di wie ou unu fi get siev.”

She did this for many days. But becoming greatly troubled, Paul turned to the spirit and said, “I command you in the name of Jesus Christ to come out of her.” And it came out at that moment.|Die afta die shi kip aan a du di siem ting. Bot Paal get riili riili beks. So im ton roun an se tu di spirit we did iina di gyal se, “Iina Jiizas Krais niem. Kom outa ar!” An di spirit kom out siem taim.

When her masters saw that the hope of their profits was gone, they seized Paul and Silas, and dragged them into the marketplace to the rulers. |Bot wen ar maasta dem si se dem naa go kyaahn mek no muor moni aafa ar, dem grab Paal an Sailas an jrag dem go a di maakit plies infronta di joj dem.

And they brought them to the magistrates, saying, “These men, being Jews, greatly trouble our city|Wen dem put dem infronta di joj dem, dem se, “Yu si dem man ya, a bier chobl dem a kaaz iina wi toun. Dem a Juu
and teach customs which are not lawful for us, being Romans, to receive or observe.|an dem a tiich an a tel wi fi du som sitn we fi wi laa no lou wi fi du kaaz wi a Ruoman piipl.”
The crowd rose up together against them. And the magistrates tore the garments off them and gave orders to beat them.
column2: Di piipl iina di kroud jain iin an staat fi biit Paal an Sailas. So di joj dem tier aaf Paal an Sailas dem kluoz an gi aada fi biit dem wid tik.

column1: After they had laid many stripes on them, they threw them into prison, commanding the jailer to guard them securely.|Afta dem don biit dem bad bad, dem put dem iina prizn an gi aada fi di waadn lak dem dong tait tait fi mek shuor se dem kyaahn get we.

Having received such an order, he threw them into the inner prison and fastened their feet in the stocks.|Di waadn put dem iina wan lak op we de faar faar anda di grong iina di prizn. Den im faasn dem fut iina som evi wud.

At midnight Paul and Silas were praying and singing hymns to God, and the prisoners were listening to them.|Roun migl nait Paal an Sailas did a prie an a sing priez tu Gad, an di ada prizna dem did a lisn.

Suddenly there was a great earthquake, so that the foundations of the prison were shaken. And immediately all the doors were opened and everyone’s shackles were loosened. |Aal av a sodn wan powaful ortkwiek apm we shiek dong tu di prizn grong. Aal di prizn duor dem flai uopm, an di prizna dem chien bos aaf.

When the jailer awoke and saw the prison doors open, he drew his sword and would have killed himself, supposing that the prisoners had escaped.|Wen di waadn wiek op an si di prizn duor dem uopm op, im did bout fi tek im suod an kil imself, kaaz im did shuor se a brok di prizna dem did brok out.
But Paul shouted, “Do not harm yourself, for we are all here.|Bot Paal baal out tu im se, “No kil yuself kaaz aal a wi stil de ya!”

He called for lights and rushed in, trembling, and fell down before Paul and Silas.|So di waadn kaal tu sumadi fi gi im wan lamp. Im buolt iina di prizn, fling dong imself a Paal an Sailas fut a chrimbl.
He then led them out and asked, “Sirs, what must I do to be saved?”|Den im tek dem outa duor an aks dem se, “Sa, wa mi afi du fi get siev?”
They said, “Believe in the Lord Jesus Christ, and you and your household will be saved.” |Dem se tu im se, “Biliiv iina di Laad Jiizas an yu wi get siev, yu an aal uu liv iina yu ous.”
And they spoke the word of the Lord to him and to all who were in his household.
column2: Den Paal an Sailas priich Gad mesij tu im an tu aal uu liv iina im ous.

column1: In that hour of the night he took them and washed their wounds. And immediately he and his entire household were baptized. |An siem taim da nait de, di waadn tek dem an luk aafa dem kot. An rait afta dat im an evribadi iina im ous get baptaiz.
Then he brought them up to his house and set food before them. And he rejoiced with his entire household believing in God.
column2: Di waadn kyari dem go a im yaad an gi dem som fuud fi iit. An im an im uol fambili did wel api se dem ton tu Gad an biliiv iina im.

column1: When it was day, the magistrates sent the sergeants, saying, “Release those men.” |Di neks maanin di Ruoman ruula dem sen di poliis fi go tel di waadn fi let go di man dem.

The prison guard reported these words to Paul, saying, “The magistrates have sent to release you. Now therefore depart, and go in peace.”|Di waadn tel Paal se, “Di ruula dem sen aada fi mi let unu go. So unu frii fi go nou, so gwaan iina piis.”

But Paul said to them, “They have publicly beaten us, who are uncondemned Romans, and have thrown us into prison. And now do they secretly throw us out? Certainly not! Let them come themselves and bring us out.”|Bot Paal se tu di poliis man dem se, “Dem biit wi op iina di uopm infronta evribadi wen dem neva iivn chrai wi fi si ef wi did du notn rang — iivn duo a Ruom wi kom fram an dem lak wi op iina prizn. An nou dem waahn fi aid an sen wi we. Dem mosi mad! Dem afi kom liid wi out demself!”

The sergeants reported these words to the magistrates, and they were afraid when they heard that they were Romans. |Di poliis man dem go tel di ruula dem wa Paal an Sailas se. An wen dem fain out se a Ruom Paal an Sailas did kom fram, dem fraitn so til.

So they came and entreated them. And they brought them out, asking them to leave the city. |So di ruula dem kom beg dem paadn an tel dem ou dem sari fi wa dem du tu dem. Afta dem liid dem out, dem beg dem uova an uova fi lef di siti.

They went out of the prison and entered the house of Lydia. When they had seen the brothers, they exhorted them and departed.|Wen dem lef di prizn, dem go a Lidiya yaad. Dem taak tu di breda an sista dem an tel dem no fi tap biliiv iina Jiizas. Afta dat dem lef di siti.

When they had traveled through Amphipolis and Apollonia, they came to Thessalonica, where there was a synagogue of the Jews.|Afta dem paas chuu Amfipolis an Apoluoniya dem riich a Tesalonaika, we di Juu dem did av wan choch.

According to his custom, Paul went in, and on three Sabbaths he lectured to them from the Scriptures|An laik im aalwiez du, Paal go iina di Juu dem choch. Fi chrii Sabat im yuuz Gad wod fi aagyu wid dem.

explaining and proving that the Christ had to suffer and to rise from the dead, and saying, “This Jesus, whom I preach to you, is the Christ.|Im shuo dem an elp dem fi andastan wa it miin wen Gad wod se Krais Jiizas did afi sofa an kom bak alaiv. Im se, “Da siem Jiizas ya we mi a tel unu bout, a im a di wan we Gad sen kom fi siev piipl.”

Some of them were persuaded and joined with Paul and Silas, including a great crowd of devout Greeks and many leading women.|Som a di Juu dem biliiv wa Paal did a se a chuu, so dem jain Paal an Sailas, som uol iip a Griik piipl we worship Gad an nof uman uufa ozban dem a did tap-a-tap man.

But the Jews who did not believe became jealous and, taking some evil men from the marketplace, gathered a crowd, stirred up the city, and attacked the house of Jason, trying to bring them out to the mob.|Bot di Juu dem get beks se so moch piipl did jain op wid Paal an Sailas. So dem gyada op som woklis aigla fram di maakit, faam wan pasi, an staat fi kik op rompos, galang bad an ton di siti opsaid dong. Di Juu liida dem go stuon Jiesn yaad, a luk fi Paal an Sailas fi jrag dem infronta di ruula dem.

But when they did not find them, they dragged Jason and some brothers to the city officials, crying out, “These men who have turned the world upside down have come here also|Wen dem no fain dem, dem jrag Jiesn an som a di choch breda dem infronta di siti ruula dem a baal out, “Dem piipl ya we mek chobl evriwe, dem kom ya tu

and Jason has received them. They are all acting contrary to the decrees of Caesar, saying that there is another king, Jesus.”|an Jiesn tek dem iin an a kip dem iina im ous! Aal a dem a go gens Siiza laa, a chat bout ou wan neks king de bout niem Jiizas!”
They troubled the crowd and the city officials when they heard these things.
column2: An di kroud a piipl an di siti ruula dem did get kanfyuuz wen dem ier wa di Juu liida an dem pasi did a se.

column1: When they had taken a bail payment from Jason and the rest, they released them.|Afta di siti ruula dem kalek biel moni fi Jiesn an di ada breda dem, dem let dem go.

The brothers immediately sent Paul and Silas away by night to Berea. When they arrived, they went into the synagogue of the Jews. 1|Wen nait kom di breda an sista dem sen we Paal an Sailas siem taim go a Beriya. Wen dem riich de, dem go a di Juu dem choch.

These were more noble than those in Thessalonica, for they received the word with all eagerness, daily examining the Scriptures, to find out if these things were so. |Di Juu dem we de a Tesalonaika did lak op dem main gens Gad mesij. Bot di wan dem we de a Beriya, dem lisn gud kaaz dem did wel waahn ier di mesij. So evridie dem luk aad aad iina Gad wod fi si ef wa Paal did a se mach op wid wa rait dong iina Gad wod.
Therefore many of them believed, including honorable Greek women and many Greek men.|So nof a dem biliiv, aal nof a di Griik uman dem we kom fram rich fambili an di impuotant man dem tu.

But when the Jews of Thessalonica learned that the word of God was preached by Paul at Berea, they came there also, stirring up the crowds.|Bot wen di Juu dem fram Tesalonaika ier se Paal did a priich Gad wod iina Beriya, dem kom de-so tu fi kom rail op di kroud.
The brothers immediately sent Paul away to the sea. But Silas and Timothy remained there.|Den siem taim di breda an sista dem sen we Paal go a sii, bot Sailas an Timoti tan a Beriya.

Those who escorted Paul brought him to Athens and departed with instructions for Silas and Timothy to come to him quickly.|Di wan dem we go wid Paal siel wid im go klier a Atenz. Den afta Paal gi dem wan mesij fi tel Sailas an Timoti fi mikies kom tu im, dem lef im.

While Paul waited for them in Athens, his spirit was provoked within him as he saw that the city was full of idols. |Paal did a wiet fi Sailas an Timoti iina Atenz wen im spirit muuv iina im kaaz im did so mad wen im si ou di siti ful op a faalz gad.

Therefore he disputed in the synagogue with the Jews and the devout persons, and in the marketplace daily with those who happened to there.|So evridie im go a di Juu dem choch, an iina di maakit go taak tu di piipl dem we did de de; piipl we a Juu an piipl we a no Juu we worship Gad.

Then some of the Epicurean and Stoic philosophers encountered him. And some said, “What will this babbler say?” Others said, “He seems to be a proclaimer of foreign gods,” because he preached Jesus and the resurrection to them. |Som tiicha we did bilang tu wan gruup we niem Epikyuuriyan an som we bilang tu wan neda gruup we niem Stowik did a aagyu wid Paal. An som ada wan aks, “A wa da likl bod-brien, mout-a-masi man ya a chat bout?” An som ada piipl ansa se, “It soun laik im a chat bout som kain-a gad we wi no nuo bout.” Dem se dat kaaz Paal did a priich di Gud Nyuuz bout Jiizas an ou Gad mek ded piipl kom bak alaiv.

They took hold of him and led him to the Areopagus, saying, “May we know what this new doctrine is of which you speak?|So dem aks Paal fi kom wid dem go miit di Ieriyapagos liida dem. Dem se tu im se, “Wi wuda laik fi nuo bout di nyuu sitn dem we yu a tiich, so yu kyan tel wi bout it?
For you are bringing strange things to our ears. Therefore we want to know what these things mean.” |Kaaz di sitn dem we wi ier yu a tiich, wi neva ier dem bifuo, so wi waahn fi nuo wa dem miin.”

For all the Athenians and foreigners who lived there spent their time in nothing else, but either telling or hearing something new.|Aal a di Atenz piipl an di farina dem we liv de spen dem taim a du notn muor dan a tel dem wan aneda bout eniting nyuu we dem ier an a lisn tu eniting nyuu we enibadi av fi tel dem.

Then Paul stood in the middle of the Areopagus, and said: “Men of Athens, I ­perceive that in all things you are very religious.|So Paal tan op infronta di Ieriyapagos an se tu dem se, “Atenz piipl mi si se unu av nof nof gad we unu worship iina evri wie.

For as I passed by and looked up at your objects of worship, I found an altar with this inscription: Whom you therefore unknowingly worship, Him I proclaim to you.|Kaaz wen mi did a muuv roun an a tek a gud luk pan di plies dem we unu go worship, mi aal si wan alta wid dem wod ya rait dong pan it, ‘Tu di Gad we wi no nuo.’ Wel di wan we unu worship an no nuo bout, a im mi a tel unu bout.

“God who made the world and all things in it, being Lord of heaven and earth, does not live in temples made by hands.|“Di Gad we mek di worl, aal a di piipl dem, di animal dem, an di chrii dem we iina it, a im ruul uova evn an ort. Im no liv iina ous we man mek fi Gad wid dem uona an.

Nor is He served by men’s hands, as though He needed anything, since He gives all men life and breath and all things. |An im no niid nobadi fi du notn fi'im, laik se im niid notn fram dem, kaaz a im gi evribadi laif an aal di sitn dem we dem niid.

He has made from one blood every nation of men to live on the entire face of the earth, having appointed fixed times and the boundaries of their habitation|Gad mek wan man fos an aal di ada chraib a piipl iina di worl kom fram da wan man de. An iivn bifuo im mek dem, Gad mek op im main wen an wich paat a di ort dem a-go liv.

that they should seek the Lord so perhaps they might reach for Him and find Him, though He is not far from each one of us. |Gad du dat so piipl wuda si se dem niid im. Da wie de dem mait-a sorch fi'im an chrai fi fain im, iivn duo im no de faar fram non a wi.

‘For in Him we live and move and have our being.’ As some of your own poets have said, ‘We are His offspring.’|Kaaz a im mek wi, gi wi laif, an mek wi kyan muuv bout. An iivn wan a fu'unu uona piipl we rait paim se di siem ting, im se, ‘Aal a wi a Gad pikni tu.’

“Therefore since we are the offspring of God, we ought not to suppose that the Deity is like gold or silver or stone or an engraved work of art or an image of the reflection of man.|“So sins wi a Gad pikni, wi no fi tingk se Gad tan laik wan faalz gad we man tingk op an mek outa guol, ar silva, ar kot outa stuon.

God overlooked the times of ignorance, but now He commands all men everywhere to repent.|So fos taim wen piipl neva nuo Gad, im neva ponish dem. Bot nou im a aada evribadi evriwe fi ton we fram dem sin an beg Gad paadn

For He has appointed a day on which He will judge the world in righteousness by a Man whom He has appointed, having given assurance of this to all men by raising Him from the dead.”|kaaz im set wan die wen im a-go joj aal a di piipl iina di worl. An im av wan speshal man we a-go joj piipl fi'im, an da man de a-go joj evribadi di wie ou dem fi get joj — im no paashal. An Gad mek da man de kom bak alaiv afta im did ded fi mek evribadi si se a no no juok ting im a diil wid.”

When they heard of the resurrection of the dead, some scoffed. But others said, “We will hear you again concerning this matter.”|Wen dem ier se man ded an kom bak alaiv, som a dem laaf an aal tek im mek preke, bot som a dem se, “Wi wi ier som muor bout dis fram yu wan neks taim.”
So Paul departed from them.
column2: So Paal lef outa di miitn wid di Ieriyapagos liida dem.

column1: However, some men joined him and believed. Among them were Dionysius the Areopagite, and a woman named Damaris, and others with them.|Bot som piipl biliiv Paal an jain op wid im. Som a dem we biliiv a did Daiyoniisis, im a did wan memba fi di Ieriyapagos, an wan uman niem Damaris, an som muor piipl tu.
After this, Paul left Athens and went to Corinth.|Afta dat Paal lef Atenz an go a Korint.

He found a Jew named Aquila, a native of Pontus, who had recently come from Italy with his wife Priscilla, because Claudius had commanded all the Jews to leave Rome. And he went to them.|Iina Korint Paal miit wan Juu niem Akwila we did baan iina Pontos. Im an im waif Prisila did no tuu lang muuv fram Itali kaaz Klaadiyos did gi aada se aal a di Juu dem fi lef Ruom. Paal jain op wid dem

And because he was of the same trade, he remained with them and worked, for they were tentmakers by trade. |an kaaz im an dem du di siem kain-a wok, im tan wid dem an wok wid dem (fi dem wok a did fi mek tent).

And because he was of the same trade, he remained with them and worked, for they were tentmakers by trade. |Evri Sabat Paal go a di Juu dem choch an go aagyu wid di Juu dem an wid di Griik piipl dem fi chrai win dem uova.

When Silas and Timothy came from Macedonia, Paul was pressed by the Spirit and testified to the Jews that Jesus was the Christ. |Nou wen Sailas an Timoti kom fram Masiduoniya, Paal tap mek tent an yuuz aal a im taim fi priich di mesij an tel di Juu dem se Jiizas a di wan we Gad sen fi siev piipl.

But when they opposed him and blasphemed, he shook out his garments and said to them, “Your blood be upon your heads. I am innocent. From now on I will go to the Gentiles.”|Wen dem go gens im an kos im out, im tan op tu dem, shiek di dos aafa im kluoz fi mek dem nuo se Gad no api wid dem an im a-go joj dem. Den im tel dem se, “Fram nou aan, ef Gad joj an ponish unu a fu'unu faalt! Mi no rispans! Fram nou aan mi wi go tu di piipl we a no Juu.”

Then he departed from there and entered the house of a man named Justus, one who worshipped God, whose house was next door to the synagogue. |Den Paal lef di Juu dem choch an go a Taitos Jostos ous. Jostos a did wan man we a no Juu, bot im worship Gad an im ous did de rait saida di Juu dem choch.

Crispus, the ruler of the synagogue, believed in the Lord with his entire household. And many of the Corinthians, who heard, believed and were baptized.|Krispos uu a di liida fi di Juu dem choch an evribadi iina im ous biliiv iina di Laad. An nof a di Korintiyan piipl dem we ier biliiv tu an get baptaiz.
The Lord spoke to Paul in the night through a vision, “Do not be afraid, but speak and do not be silent.|An iina di nait di Laad se tu Paal iina wan vijan, “No fried, taak op an no kip kwaiyat
For I am with you, and no one shall attack you and hurt you, for I have many people in this city.” |kaaz mi de ya wid yu, an nobadi kyaahn du notn fi ort yu, kaaz mi av nof piipl iina da siti ya.”
So for a year and six months he sat among them, teaching the word of God.|So im tan de fi wan ier an siks mont an tiich dem bout Gad mesij.
When Gallio was proconsul of Achaia, the Jews in unity attacked Paul and brought him to court|Nou afta Gyaliyo did ton govana fi Akaiya di Juu dem gyada op an grab Paal an jrag im infronta di joj
saying, “This man is persuading men to worship God contrary to the law.”|dem se, “Da man ya a chrai fi get piipl fi worship Gad iina wan wie we go gens di Laa!”

When Paul was about to speak, Gallio said to the Jews, “O Jews, if it were a matter of a misdemeanor or serious crime, I would rightly bear with you. |Bot jos az Paal did bout fi se sopm, Gyaliyo se tu di Juu dem se, “Ef a did sopm bad ar sopm wikid im did du, it wuda rait fi mi lisn tu unu.

But if it is a question of words and names and your law, look into it yourselves. For I do not intend to be a judge of these matters.” |Bot sins unu a aagyu bout wod, an niem an fi unu Laa, unu diil wid dat unuself. Mi naa go joj dem sitn de.”
So he drove them out of court.
column2: So im aada som suoja fi ron dem outa di kuot ous.

column1: Then all the Greeks seized Sosthenes, the ruler of the synagogue, and beat him before the judgment seat. But none of these things mattered to Gallio.|So dem grab Sostoniiz, di ruula fi di Juu dem choch, an staat biit im infronta di kuot ous. Bot Gyaliyo neva pie dem no main.

Yet Paul remained many days. He had his hair cut in Cenchrea, for he had taken a vow. Then, bidding farewell to the brothers, he sailed to Syria, and Priscilla and Aquila were with him.|Afta Paal tan wid dem iina Korint fi wan lang taim, im tel di breda an sista dem ba-bai. Den im an Prisila an Akwila tek wan ship wa did a siel go a Siriya. Wen dem riich a Senkriya Paal get im ier kot aaf fi kip wan pramis we im did mek tu Gad.
He arrived at Ephesus and left them there. But he himself went into the synagogue and lectured the Jews.
column2: Wen dem riich a Efisos Paal lef Prisila an Akwila an im go iina di Juu dem choch go taak tu dem.

column1: When they asked him to remain for a while longer, he did not consent|So wen dem aks im fi tan likl langga, Paal se nuo.

but, bidding farewell, said, “I must by all means attend this upcoming feast in Jerusalem, but I will return to you if God wills.” And he set sail from Ephesus. |So im tel dem ba-bai an se, “Ef Gad waahn mi fi kom bak tu unu agen, mi wi kom bak.” Den im go pan wan ship an lef fram Efisos

When he had landed at Caesarea, he went up and greeted the church and then went down to Antioch.|an wen im riich a Sesuriiya, im go op a Jeruusilem go tel di choch piipl oudi. Den im lef go dong a Antiyak.

After spending some time there, he departed and passed through the entire region of Galatia and Phrygia in sequence, strengthening all the disciples.|Afta im tan de fi a likl wail, Paal lef an chravl chuu Gyaliesha an Frijiya a tel di choch dem fi tan op chrang fi wa dem biliiv.

Meanwhile a Jew named Apollos, born in Alexandria, who was an eloquent man and powerful in the Scriptures, came to Ephesus.|Roun dem siem taim de wan Juu niem Apalos, we did baan iina Aligzanjriya kom a Efisos. Im a did wan man we wel brait, kyan taak gud, an we nuo Gad wod gud.

This man was instructed in the way of the Lord, knowing only the baptism of John, but being fervent in spirit, he accurately spoke and taught the things concerning the Lord.|Im did lorn bout di Laad Jiizas, an taak op chrang an tiich di sitn dem we rait bout Jiizas. Bot im onggl di nuo bout ou Jan baptaiz piipl, im neva nuo bout ou Jiizas se piipl fi get baptaiz.

He began to speak boldly in the synagogue. When Aquila and Priscilla heard him, they took him and explained the way of God more accurately.|An im neva fried, so im staat fi taak chrang chrang iina di Juu dem choch, bot wen Prisila an Akwila ier im, dem tek im wan said an tiich im so im kuda andastan Gad wod beta.

When Apollos intended to pass into Achaia, the brothers wrote to encourage the disciples to welcome him. On arriving, he greatly helped those who had believed through grace.|Wen Apalos did waahn kraas uova go a Akaiya, di breda an sista dem push im fi gwaan. Dem rait wan leta tu di breda an sista dem uova de an tel dem fi tek im iin an chriit im gud. Di wan dem we did biliiv kaaz Gad did so gud tu dem, wen Apalos riich im du uol iip fi elp dem.

For he vehemently refuted the Jews publicly, proving from the Scriptures that Jesus was the Christ.|Im aagyu aad aad wid di Juu dem infronta evribadi, an shuo dem klier klier fram Gad wod se Jiizas a di wan we Gad sen fi siev piipl.

While Apollos was at Corinth, Paul passed through the upper regions and came to Ephesus. He found some disciples|Apalos did de a Korint wen Paal did a chravl chuu di ili paat a di konchri an riich a Efisos. Im si som a di piipl dem we biliiv iina Jiizas de

and said to them, “Have you received the Holy Spirit since you believed?”They said to him, “No, we have not even heard that there is a Holy Spirit.”|an se tu dem se, “Unu did get di Uoli Spirit wen unu biliiv iina Jiizas?” Dem se, “Nuo, wi neva iivn ier se Uoli Spirit de.”

He said to them, “Into what then were you baptized?”They said, “Into John’s baptism.”|So Paal aks dem agen se, “Wen unu did get baptaiz, wa dat did miin?” Dem se, “Wi get baptaiz kaaz wi biliiv wa Jan tiich.”

Paul said, “John indeed baptized with the baptism of repentance, telling the people that they should believe in the One coming after him, that is, in Christ Jesus.”|Paal se, “Jan baptaiz piipl we ton we fram dem sin an shuo se dem sari fi wa dem du. An im tel di Izrel piipl fi biliiv iina di wan we did fi kom afta im, dat a Jiizas.”
When they heard this, they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.|Wen dem ier wa Paal se, dem get baptaiz iina Jiizas niem.

When Paul had laid his hands on them, the Holy Spirit came on them, and they spoke in other tongues and prophesied. |An wen Paal put im an pan dem, di Uoli Spirit tek kanchuol a dem, an dem staat taak iina wan chrienj wie we nobadi no nuo ar andastan, an gi out mesij we kom fram Gad.
There were about twelve men in all.
column2: A did bout twelv man did de de.

column1: He went into the synagogue and spoke boldly for three months, lecturing and persuading concerning the kingdom of God.|So die afta die, fi bout chrii mont, Paal go iina di Juu dem choch an im neva fried fi aagyu wid dem an chrai fi get dem fi biliiv se wa im did a se bout Gad kindom a chuu.

But when some were hardened and did not believe, but spoke evil of the Way before the crowd, he withdrew from them and took the disciples, lecturing daily in the school of Tyrannus.|Bot wen som a dem we did aad-iez mek op dem main no fi biliiv di mesij, an infronta evribadi, chat som torbl sitn gens di Wie ou di Laad se piipl fi liv, Paal lef dem an tek di piipl dem we biliiv iina Jiizas wid im. An evridie Paal tiich dem iina di big ruum we Tairanos yuuz fi taak tu nof piipl.

This continued for two years, so that all who lived in Asia heard the word of the Lord Jesus, both Jews and Greeks.|Paal kip dis op fi tuu ier, so dat evribadi we liv iina Iezha ier di Laad wod, weda dem a Juu ar Griik.
God worked powerful miracles by the hands of Paul.
column2: Gad gi Paal powa fi du som powaful mirikl

column1: So handkerchiefs or aprons he had touched were brought to the sick, and the diseases left them, and the evil spirits went out of them.|so dat aal korchiv an iepran we im did yuuz fi waip im fies an jrai im an, piipl kyari go gi di sik piipl dem an dem get beta, an di piipl dem we did av diiman — di diiman kom outa dem.

Then some of the itinerant Jewish exorcists invoked the name of the Lord Jesus over those who had evil spirits, saying, “We command you to come out in the name of Jesus whom Paul preaches.” |An yu did av som Juu we did a go roun an a chrai fi aada diiman fi kom outa piipl. Dem did a yuuz di Laad Jiizas niem fi du it, so dem wuda se, “Iina di niem a Jiizas Krais we Paal priich, mi a aada yu fi kum outa da sumadi ya.”
There were seven sons of a Jewish high priest named Sceva doing this.|Wan man niem Siiva, we a did di liida fi di Juu priis dem did av sevn bwai pikni we did a du dem sitn de.
The evil spirit answered, “I know Jesus, and I know Paul, but who are you?”|Bot di diiman ansa dem bak an se, “Mi nuo Jiizas, an mi nuo bout Paal. Bot yu, a uu yu bi?”

Then the man in whom the evil spirit was jumped on them, overpowered them, and prevailed against them, so that they fled from that house naked and wounded.|Den di man we di diiman did kanchuol jomp pan dem an biit dem op bad bad. Im biit dem an tier aaf dem kluoz dat dem ron outa di ous niekid an kot op kot op.

This became known to all Jews and Greeks living in Ephesus. And fear fell on them all, and the name of the Lord Jesus was magnified. |Evribadi we liv iina Efisos ier bout dis, weda dem a Juu ar Griik an wen dem ier bout it, dem kech dem fried, an dem priez di Laad Jiizas.
Many who believed came confessing and telling their deeds.
column2: Uol iip a di wan dem we did biliiv tan op infronta evribadi an tel dem bout di rang sitn dem we dem did a du.

column1: Many who practiced magic brought their books together and burned them before everyone. They calculated their value, which equaled fifty thousand drachmas.|An uol iip a dem we yuus tu wok aal kain-a uobiya gyada op dem uobiya buk dem an bon dem op infronta evribadi. An wen dem kount op umoch di buk dem wot, dem fain out se dem did wot fifti touzn dala.
So the word of the Lord powerfully grew and spread.
column2: An siek-a aal wa did apm muor an muor piipl get fi ier bout di Laad mesij an biliiv it.

column1: After these things happened, Paul determined in his spirit to pass through Macedonia and Achaia and go to Jerusalem, saying, “After I have been there, I must also see Rome.” |Afta aal a dem sitn ya apm, Paal mek op im main fi go op a Jeruusilem, so im chravl chuu Masiduoniya an Akaiya. An im se, “Afta mi spen som taim op de, mi afi go a Ruom fi a likl wail.”

He sent two who ministered to him, Timothy and Erastus, into Macedonia, but he delayed in Asia for a time.|So afta im sen tuu a di piipl we wok wid im, Timoti an Irastos, go a Masiduoniya, im tan iina Iezha fi wan likl wail.
About that time great trouble arose about the Way. |Roun dem siem taim de, som siiros chobl staat op. Piipl did a se aal saat a sopm bout di Wie ou di Laad se piipl wi get fi liv fi eva.

For a silversmith named Demetrius, who made silver shrines for Artemis, brought much business to the craftsmen. |Nou yu did av wan man we niem Dimiichriyos we yuus tu mek tingz outa silva. Im yuus tu mek som likl likl ous we luk jos laik di big wan fi di faalz gad we niem Aatimis. An di woka dem yuus tu mek uol iip a moni aafa dem.

He gathered them together with the workmen of similar trades and said, “Men, you know that by this trade we have our wealth.|Dimiichriyos gyada op aal a di piipl we du di siem kain-a wok laik im an di piipl we du sitn kluos tu wa im du an se tu dem se, “Piipl, unu nuo se wi mek nof nof moni aafa da wok ya.

And you see and hear, not only at Ephesus, but almost throughout all Asia, that this Paul has persuaded and turned away many people, saying that these things made by hands are not gods.|An unu si an ier fi unuself ou di wan Paal a get piipl fi biliiv se di gad dem we man mek wid dem an a no gad at aal. An dat naa jos apm iina Efisos, it a apm aal uova Iezha.

Now not only is our trade in danger of coming into disrepute, but also the temple of the great goddess Artemis, whom all Asia and the world worship, may be discredited and her magnificence destroyed.”|Ef dis ting no tap, it a-go mash op wi bizniz. An no onggl dat, bot piipl a-go staat tingk se di ous fi di powaful gad Aatimis no wot notn no muor. An piipl aal uova Iezha an di uol worl we yuus tu worship ar, naa go worship ar no muor.”

When they heard this, they were full of anger and cried out, “Great is Artemis of the Ephesians!”|Wen dem ier wa Dimiichriyos se dem get mad an staat baal out pan tap a dem vais an a se, “Aatimis, gad fi di Efisos piipl dem, yu laaj!”

The city was filled with confusion. And in unison they seized Gaius and Aristarchus, Paul’s traveling companions from Macedonia, and rushed into the theater.|Di uol siti did rail op. So dem grab Gaiyos an Ieristaakos, di man fram Masiduoniya we did a chravl wid Paal, an staat jrag dem go a di plies iina di siti we piipl aalwiez gyada op wen sitn speshal a apm.
When Paul intended to go in among the crowd, the disciples would not let him.|Paal did waahn fi go iina da speshal plies de fi go taak tu di piipl dem, bot di biliiva dem wudn mek im go.

Even some of the rulers of Asia, who were his friends, sent to him begging him not to venture into the theater.|Aal som a Paal fren dem we di bilang tu di gruup a ruula dem we inchaaj a di siti sen wan mesij tu im an beg im no fi go de.

The assembly was confused. Therefore some cried out one thing and some another, and most of them did not know why they had come together.|Som a di piipl did a shout wan ting an som did a shout sitn els, kaaz dem did iina wan big miks op. Muos a dem neva iivn nuo wa dem did de de fa.

The Jews pushed Alexander to the front as the crowd prompted him. Alexander motioned with his hand, wishing to make his defense to the mob. |Som a di piipl iina di kroud tingk se Aligzanda a did di prablem, kaaz di Juu dem did push im op front. So im uol op im an fi di kroud kip kwaiyat so im kuda taak fi imself fi mek dem nuo se im an im fren dem neva du notn.

But when they learned that he was a Jew, for about two hours they all with one voice cried out, “Great is Artemis of the Ephesians!”|Bot wen di kroud lorn se im a wan Juu, aal a dem staat baal out, “Aatimis, gad fi di Efisos piipl dem, yu laaj!” An dem kip dis op fi bout tuu owa.

The city clerk quieted the crowd and said, “Men of Ephesus, what man is there who does not know that the city of the Ephesians is the guardian of the temple of the great Artemis and of the image which fell from heaven? |Di man we inchaaj fi tel di piipl iina di siti bout notn impuotant we di liida dem mek op dem main fi du ar se, im get di kroud fi sekl dong. Den im se tu dem se, “Efisos piipl, uu out de no nuo se a wi inchaaj fi tek kier a di ous fi di powaful Aatimis an ar stuon we jrap fram evn we wi worship?

Seeing then that these things are undeniable, you ought to be quiet and do nothing rash.|So sins nobadi kyaahn se dem sitn ya no go so, unu fi sekl unuself an tap dis fuulinish we a kaaz so moch chobl.

For you have brought these men here who are neither temple robbers nor blasphemers of your goddess.|Kaaz unu kyari dem tuu man ya komiin ya iivn duo dem no tiif notn outa di ous fi wi gad, ar se notn bad bout ar.

So if Demetrius and the craftsmen who are with him have a complaint against anyone, the courts are open and there are proconsuls. Let them press charges against one another. |So ef Dimiichriyos an di man dem we du di siem kain-a wok laik im av no prablem wid enibadi, di kuot uopm regila an joj de de. So mek dem kyari it go de-so.
If you seek anything further, it shall be settled in the legal assembly. |Bot ef unu waahn notn els, unu afi go diil wid dat wen di liida dem fi di siti kaal di piipl fi miit.

For we are in danger of being charged with rioting today, since there is no reason we may give to account for this uproar.”|Kaaz rait nou di Ruoman ruula kuda chaaj wi fi aal a wa apm ya tide laik ou nobadi kyaahn gi no gud riizn fi wa apm.”
When he had said this, he dismissed the assembly.|Afta im don taak, im aada dem fi lef di bildin an go a dem yaad.

After the uproar ceased, Paul summoned the disciples and embraced them and departed for Macedonia.|Afta di el an powda ous iina di siti sekl dong, Paal sen fi di biliiva dem. Im taak tu dem an elp dem fi tan op chrang iina wa dem biliiv an den im tel dem ba-bai an lef fi go a Masiduoniya.

When he had gone through that region and had greatly exhorted them, he arrived in Greece|Afta im paas chuu da ieriya de an taak tu di biliiva dem an elp dem tan op chrang iina wa dem biliiv, im riich a Griis

and stayed there three months. When the Jews plotted against him as he was about to sail to Syria, he decided to return through Macedonia.|we im spen chrii mont. Bot kaaz di Juu dem did set op deriks fi kil im wen im did a go siel go Siriya, im mek op im main fi go bak chuu Masiduoniya.

Accompanying him to Asia were Sopater of Berea, and Aristarchus and Secundus of Thessalonica, Gaius of Derbe, and Timothy, and Tychicus and Trophimus of Asia.|An Sowpata, Piros bwai pikni fram Beriya, Ieristaakos, Sikondos fram Tesalonaika, Gaiyos fram Dorbi, an Timoti, Taikikos an Chrofimos fram Iezha go wid Paal.
These men went forward and waited for us at Troas.
column2: Dem did go bifuo wi an did de a Chuowas a wiet fi wi.

column1: But we sailed away from Philippi after the Days of Unleavened Bread, and after five days we came to them at Troas, where we stayed for seven days.|So afta di Paasuova alidie, wi siel fram Filipai. An it tek wi faiv die fi riich a Chuowas an jain di wan dem we did a wiet fi wi, an wi tan de fi sevn die.

On the first day of the week, when the disciples came together to break bread, Paul, ready to leave the next day, preached to them and continued his message until midnight. |Pan di fos die a di wiik wen wi gyada op fi brok bred, Paal staat taak tu di piipl. An kaaz im did plan fi lef di neks die, Paal priich til migl nait.
There were many lamps in the upper room where they were assembled.
column2: Nou uol iip a lamp did iina di ruum opstiez we wi did av di miitn.

column1: A young man named Eutychus sat in the window, falling into a deep sleep as Paul spoke for a longer time. Being overcome by sleep, he fell down from the third floor and was taken up dead. |An wan yong man niem Yuutikos did a sidong pan wan winda. An wen Paal did a priich, im jrap iina wan diip diip sliip. Im did stil iina diip sliip wen im jrap chuu di winda fram di tord fluor an wen dem pik im op, im ded.

Paul went down and leaned over him, and embracing him said, “Do not be troubled, for he is alive.” |Bot Paal go dongstiez, an chrech out imself uova di yong man badi an og im op. Den im se tu di piipl we did de de se, “Unu no bada baal, im stil alaiv.”

When he had gone up and had broken bread and eaten, he conversed for a long while until dawn and departed.|Den Paal go bak opstiez, an afta im brok bred an iit, im taak wid dem fi wan lang taim so til die lait. Afta dat im lef.
They took the lad in alive and were greatly comforted.
column2: Som a di biliiva dem fala di yong man go a im yaad. Im did alaiv an dem did wel api.

column1: We went ahead to the ship and sailed to Assos, intending to take Paul on board there. For he had arranged this, intending to go on foot.|Wi tek wan ship an siel go a Asos we Paal wuda jain wi pan di ship. Paal did set tingz op da wie ya, kaaz im did mek op im main fi tek fut an no siel go a Asos.
When he met us at Assos, we took him on board and went to Mitylene.|Wen im miit op wid wi a Asos, im jain wi pan di ship an wi siel go a Mitaliine.

The day after sailing from there we arrived off Chios. And the next day we crossed over to Samos and stayed at Trogyllium, and the following day we came to Miletus.|Wi siel out fram de-so an di neks die wi riich a Kaiyas. Di neks die wi riich a Samos an di die afta dat wi riich a Miletos

Paul had decided to sail by Ephesus, to avoid spending time in Asia. For he was hurrying so he could be in Jerusalem, if possible, on the day of Pentecost.|Paal neva waahn spen no taim iina Iezha, so im did mek op im main fi siel paas Efisos, kaaz im did a ori fi si ef im kuda riich Jeruusilem bifuo Pentikas.
From Miletus he sent to Ephesus for the elders of the church. |Fram Miletos, im sen sumadi go a Efisos wid wan mesij fi tel di choch elda dem fi kom miit im.

When they came to him, he said to them, “You know how I always lived among you from the first day that I came to Asia|Wen dem riich, im se tu dem se, “Unu nuo ou mi liv di uol taim mi did de ya wid unu, fram di fos die mi riich iina Iezha til nou
serving the Lord with all humility and with many tears and trials which befell me through the plots of the Jews.
column2: ou mi ombl miself an sorv di Laad. An unu nuo ou mi baal siek-a aal di sofarieshan we mi did afi go chuu siek-a aal wa di Juu dem du tu mi.

column1: I did not keep from declaring what was beneficial to you, and teaching you publicly and from house to house|An unu nuo se wen mi did a priich tu unu, mi neva kip bak notn fram unu we kuda elp unu. An mi neva fried fi tiich unu infronta evribadi an fi go fram ous tu ous a tiich.

testifying to both Jews and Greeks of repentance toward God and of faith in our Lord Jesus Christ.|An mi neva fried fi tel piipl we a Juu an piipl we a Griik fi ton we fram dem sin, shuo se dem sari fi wa dem du, ton tu Gad, an biliiv iina Jiizas.

“Now, compelled by the Spirit, I am going to Jerusalem, not knowing what shall befall me there|“An nou di Uoli Spirit push mi fi go a Jeruusilem an mi a go, iivn duo mi no nuo wa a-go apm tu mi wen mi riich

except that the Holy Spirit testifies to me in every city that imprisonment and afflictions await me.|bot di Uoli Spirit waan mi se, iina evri toun we mi go, dem a-go lak mi op iina prizn an mek mi sofa.

But none of these things deter me. Nor do I count my life of value to myself, so that I may joyfully finish my course and the ministry which I have received from the Lord Jesus, to testify to the gospel of the grace of God.|Bot fi mi laif no wot notn tu mi kaaz di onggl ting we mi a liv fa a fi mek shuor se mi don mi wok an du aal we mi Laad Jiizas gi mi fi du, fi tel evribadi bout di Gud Nyuuz — ou Gad lov wi, iivn duo wi no dizorv it.

“Now I know that all you, among whom I went proclaiming the kingdom of God, will see my face no more.|“An aal a unu we mi did go roun an priich tu bout Gad kindom, mi nuo se unu naa go si mi fies agen.
Therefore I testify to you this day that I am innocent of the blood of all men.|So mi a tel aal a unu klier klier se ef eni a unu ded iina unu sin, a no fi mi faalt.
For I did not keep from declaring to you the whole counsel of God.
column2: Kaaz mi neva kip bak notn fram unu wen mi did a priich tu unu bout wa Gad waahn unu fi du.

column1: Therefore take heed to yourselves and to the entire flock, over which the Holy Spirit has made you overseers, to shepherd the church of God which He purchased with His own blood.|An siem laik ou wan shepad luk aafa im Shiip dem, a siem so unu fi tek kier a unuself an Gad choch we di Uoli Spirit put unu inchaaj a, an we im mek im uon wen im bwai pikni ded pan di kraas.

For I know that after my departure, dreadful wolves will enter among you, not sparing the flock.|Mi nuo se afta mi lef som man a-go kom mongks unu we komiin laik som torbl wail animal an dem a-go kom mash op di choch.

Even from among you men will arise speaking perverse things, to draw the disciples away after them.|An di taim a-go kom wen iivn som a unu uona piipl a-go tiich som torbl sitn we go gens di chuut fi get som a unu fi fala dem.

Therefore watch, remembering that for three years night and day I did not cease to warn everyone with tears.|So wach unuself an memba ou nait an die fi chrii ier, mi neva tap waan evri wan a unu, iivn duo mi did afi go chuu nof sofarieshan.

“Now, brothers, I commend you to God and to the word of His grace, which is able to build you up and give you an inheritance among all who are sanctified.|“So nou mi a put unu iina Gad an, an lef unu wid di mesij bout ou Gad lov unu iivn duo wi no dizorv it. Da mesij de wi tek kier a unu an elp unu tan op chrang an gi unu aal wa Gad pramis fi gi aal a im piipl.
I have not coveted anyone’s silver or gold or clothing.
column2: Mi neva red yai nobadi fi dem moni ar dem dier kluoz.

column1: Yes, you yourselves know that these hands have provided for my necessities and for those who were with me. |Unu wel nuo se wid mi uona tuu an dem mi tek kier a aal we mi did niid, an aal we di piipl we wok wid mi did niid tu.

In all things I have shown you how, working like this, you must help the weak, remembering the words of the Lord Jesus, how He said, ‘It is more blessed to give than to receive.’ ”|Iina evriting we mi du mi shuo unu se wi afi wok aad so wi kyan av inof fi shier wid di wan dem we no av notn. An unu fi memba wa wi Laad Jiizas se, im se, ‘Ef yu gi sumadi sopm, it mek yu muo api dan ef sumadi gi yu sopm.’ ”
Having said these things, he knelt down with all of them and prayed.|Afta im don taak tu di elda dem, Paal an aal a dem go dong pan dem nii an prie.
They all wept much and embraced Paul’s neck and kissed him
column2: An aal a dem staat fi baal loud loud an og op Paal an kis im.
