Therefore, in all things it was necessary for Him to be made like His brothers, so that He might be a merciful and faithful High Priest in the things pertaining to God, to make atonement for the sins of the people. |So siek-a aal a dem sitn de nou, im did afi ton laik im breda an sista dem we de pan ort. Im did afi ton laik dem iina evri wie. Da wie de, az Gad elpa, im kuda ton wan liida fi di priis dem we Gad kyan chos, an im wi gud an kain tu piipl kaaz im andastan we dem a go chuu. An im kuda kom tek we di piipl dem sin tu.

For since He Himself suffered while being tempted, He is able to help those who are being tempted.|An kaaz im fi wan did sofa wen di devl did chrai fi mek im du rang, im kyan elp di piipl dem we a fies notn we wi kaaz dem fi sin.

Therefore, holy brothers, partakers in a heavenly calling, consider the Apostle and High Priest of our profession, Jesus Christ|So mi breda an sista we bilang tu Gad, an we im kaal jos laik ou im kaal mi, unu fi kip unu main pan Jiizas. Im a di mesinja we Gad sen wi, an di liida fi di priis dem we go tu Gad fi wi, siek-a wa wi se wi biliiv iina.

who was faithful to Him who appointed Him, as Moses was faithful in all His house.|Gad kaal im an im aalwiez du we Gad se im fi du, jos laik ou Muoziz did du wa Gad tel im fi du wen im did a liid di piipl dem.

For the One was counted worthy of more glory than Moses, in that He who builds the house has more honor than the house itself. |Bot im kom get muo priez dan Muoziz, an Gad lif im op aiya dan Muoziz, jos laik ou di wan we bil wan ous get muo big op dan di ous wuda get.
For every house is built by someone, but the One who builds all things is God.|Kaaz evri ous we de bout, a sumadi bil it, bot a Gad bil evriting.

Moses was faithful in all God’s house as a servant, testifying about those things that were to be spoken later. |Az wan sorvant we elp an liid Gad piipl dem, Muoziz did aalwiez du wa Gad se im fi du. Im did taak bout di sitn dem we Jiizas wuda se lietaraan.

But Christ is faithful over God’s house as a Son, whose house we are if we hold fast the confidence and the rejoicing of our hope firm to the end.|Bot Krais Jiizas, im a Gad Bwai Pikni. Gad put im inchaaj an im tek kier a Gad piipl dem an du wa Gad tel im fi du, jos laka ou wan bwai pikni we aalwiez du we im mada an faada tel im fi du wuda luk aafa dem ous an fambili. An ef wi uol aan chrang an gwaan luk tu Gad laik we wi buos bout aal di wail, den wi a paat a Gad piipl.
Therefore, as the Holy Spirit says:“Today, if you hear His voice|So den, jos laik wa di Uoli Spirit se,“Ef unu ier im vais tide

do not harden your heartsas in the rebellion,on the day of temptation in the wilderness|du, no get aad-iez an no pie im no main.No galang siem laka wen unu faada faada dem did ton dem bak pan Gad an mek op dem main se dem naa lisn we im se.Dem mek op dem main fi tes im iina di dezot fi si we im a-go du.
where your fathers tested Me and triedMeand saw My works for forty years.| A de-so unu faada faada dem did tes mi fi si ou lang mi did a go kip op wid dem,an dem si wa mi du fi faati ier

Therefore I was angry with that generation,and said, ‘They always go astray in their heart,and they have not known My ways.’|A dat mek mi did beks so wid da jinarieshan de,an mi se, ‘Fi dem aat eva a chrie,dem no waahn liv ou mi se dem fi livan dem naa fala di wie we mi shuo dem.’
So I swore in My wrath,‘They shall not enter My rest.’ ”|So mi get beks bad an swier se,‘Dem wi neva eva kom get da piis de we mi gi; dem naa go eva get fi kom a da plies de we dem kyan jos res!’ ”

Be attentive, brothers, lest there be in any of you an evil, unbelieving heart, and you depart from the living God.|Mi breda an sista, mek shuor se non a unu no av aat we so wikid dat unu no biliiv iina di Gad we alaiv — di siem wan we mek piipl liv.

But exhort one another daily, while it is called “Today,” lest any of you be hardened through the deceitfulness of sin. |Insted-a dat, elp unu wan aneda evridie, so langks a ‘Tide’ it niem, so sin no ful op non a unu aat, an mek it tof op.

For we have become partakers of Christ if we hold the beginning of our confidence firmly to the end|Kaaz wi an Krais Jiizas, wi staat wok tugeda ef wi gwaan uol aan an chos iina im no mata wa, laik ou wi yuus tu du wen wi did fos staat biliiv iina im.

while it is said:“Today, if you will hear His voice,do not harden your heartsas in the rebellion.”|Laik mi jos se, dis a wa Gad wod se,“Ef unu ier im vais tide,Unu no fi get aad-iez an no pie im no mainNo galang siem laka wen unu faada faada dem did ton dem bak pan mi an mek op dem main se dem naa go lisn.”

For who were they who heard and rebelled? Was it not all of those who came out of Egypt, led by Moses?|Kaaz a uu dem piipl de we ier Gad an mek op dem main se dem naa lisn we im se? A neva di siem piipl dem we Muoziz did liid outa Iijip?

And with whom was He grieved for forty years? Was it not with those who had sinned, whose bodies fell in the wilderness?|An a uu Gad did beks wid fi faati ier? No di wan dem we did sin an jrap dong ded iina di dezot?

And to whom did He swear that they would not enter His rest, but to those who disobeyed? |An a uu Gad swier se naa go eva kom get di piis we im gi, an naa go eva get fi kom a di plies we dem kyan jos res, iihn? Ef a neva di wan dem we neehn lisn im an du wa im se dem fi du, den a uu?

So we see that they could not enter because of unbelief.|So wi si se dem neehn get di piis we Gad gi, an dem neehn get fi go a di plies we dem kyan res, jos kaaz dem neehn biliiv iina im laik ou dem fi biliiv.

Therefore, since the promise of entering His rest remains, let us fear lest any of you should seem to come short of it. |So wi fi mek shuor se Gad no pramis fi gi wi piis an res an wi en op no get it kaaz wi gilti a sopm.

For the gospel was preached to us as well as to them. But the word preached did not benefit them, because it was not mixed with faith in those who heard it. |Kaaz wi did ier di Gud Nyuuz priich jos laik ou di Izrel piipl dem did ier it tu. Bot di wod we priich neehn elp dem at aal at aal kaaz dem neehn biliiv laik di res a piipl dem we did ier it.

For we who have believed have entered this rest, as He has said,“As I have sworn in My wrath,‘They shall not enter My rest.’ ”However, His works have been finished since the creation of the world.|Nou wi we biliiv a-go get di kain-a piis iina wi aat we Gad gi an wi a-go get fi go iina di plies we wi kyan jos res. Jos laik wa im se,“Mi did get beks bad an mi pramis se,‘Dem naa go get di kain-a piis iina dem aat laik we mi a-go gi mi piipl dem an dem naa go get fi go iina di plies we dem kyan jos res!’ ”.Gad se dis iivn duo wa im did a plan fi du did don aredi — Gad wok don fram di taim im mek di worl.
For He spoke somewhere about the seventh day like this: “And God rested on the seventh day from all His works.”|Kaaz im did se dis somwe bout di sevn die, “an pan die sevn im res fram aal a im wok”
And again in the present passage He said, “They shall not enter My rest.”|An rait ya-so agen im se: “dem naa go get di piis we mi pramis fi gi mi piipl dem an fi res laik wa mi pramis tu.”

Since therefore it remains for some to enter it, and they to whom it was first preached did not enter due to unbelief|So, som piipl stil kyan get di piis iina dem aat we Gad pramis fi gi im piipl dem an fi res laik ou im pramis, bot di wan dem we did ier di Gud Nyuuz priich, dem neehn get dat, kaaz dem neva du wa dem did fi du.

again He establishes a certain day, “Today,” saying through David, after so long a time, as it has been said:“Today, if you will hear His voice,do not harden your hearts.”|So Gad set wan neks die agen, dat a “tide.” Wi nuo se dis a chuu, kaaz afta umoch umoch ier im mek Dievid rait dis we mi did tel unu aredi,“Ef unu ier im vais tide,du, no get aad-iez an no lisn im an no du wa im se.”
For if Joshua had given them rest, He would not have later spoken of another day.|Kaaz ef Jashwa did liid di piipl dem an mek dem get fi res, Gad wudn taak bout wan neda die afta dat.
Therefore a rest remains for the people of God.|So jos laik ou Gad did res pan die sevn, afta im did don mek di worl, a so wan Sabat res stil de de fi Gad piipl dem.

For whoever enters His rest will also cease from his own works, as God did from His.|Kaaz di wan we get fi res ou Gad mek piipl res, im did res tu an no du no wok, jos laik ou Gad did res wen im did don fi im wok.

Let us labor therefore to enter that rest, lest anyone fall by the same pattern of unbelief.|So wi fi chrai aad aad fi mek shuor se wi get da kaina res de we Gad gi, so nobadi no mis di chaans fi get it kaaz dem go du di sed sitn dem we dem faada faada did du — no lisn Gad an no du wa im se dem fi du.

For the word of God is alive, and active, and sharper than any two-edged sword, piercing even to the division of soul and spirit, of joints and marrow, and able to judge the thoughts and intents of the heart.|Kaaz wen Gad taak, a laik se di sitn dem we im se alaiv, av powa an kyan du tingz! Gad wod kot beta dan eni wan a di tuu-saidid kotlis dem, an aal buor chuu an plit op suol fram spirit, an kot we wich paat di buon dem jain op fram di blod an sitn dem we de insaida di buon dem. It kyan joj we wi tingk iina wi aat an di sitn dem we wi waahn.

There is no creature that is not revealed in His sight, for all things are bare and exposed to the eyes of Him to whom we must give account.|No iivn wan sitn kyan aid fram Gad! Bot evriting uopm op an im kyan si di uol a dem, an a im wi afi go ansa tu bout evriting we wi du.

Since then we have a great High Priest who has passed into the heavens, Jesus the Son of God, let us hold firmly to our confession. |Wi av wan liida fi di priis dem we a di bigis wan outa aal a di liida dem fi priis. Im go we Gad de — dat a Jiizas, Gad Bwai Pikni. So laik ou im a fi wi liida fi priis, di uol a wi we se wi biliiv iina im fi uol aan chrang chrang an gwaan biliiv siem wie.

For we do not have a High Priest who cannot sympathize with our weaknesses, but One who was in every sense tempted like we are, yet without sin.|Kaaz wi no av wan liida fi di priis dem we kyaahn andastan we wi a go chuu, an we no nuo se wi no so chrang wen wi fies notn we wi kaaz wi fi sin. Insted-a dat wi av wan we did get presha fi du aal kain-a rang sitn tu, siem laka wi — bot im neehn sin.

Let us then come with confidence to the throne of grace, that we may obtain mercy and find grace to help in time of need.|So mek wi go tu di wan we shuo wi lov iivn duo wi no dizorv it, an no bada if-an-bot an galang laik wi fried, so im we gud an kain, wi kain tu wi an shuo wi lov iivn duo wi no dizorv it an elp wi enitaim wi niid di elp.

For every high priest chosen from among men is appointed to represent men in things pertaining to God, that he may offer both gifts and sacrifices for sins.|A pik Gad pik evri wan a di liida fi di priis dem fram mongks dem uona piipl, so dem kuda kom tu Gad fi di piipl dem. An so, dem kyan kom gi Gad aafrin an bon sakrifais gi im fi di piipl dem sin.

He is able to have compassion on the ignorant and on those who are wayward, for he himself is also subject to weakness. |Kaaz di liida fi di priis dem a piipl tu, im wi nuo ou fi tek taim wid piipl we no nuo beta an a du rang, sins im wiik an wi du rang tu.
Because of this he must offer sacrifices for his own sins, just as he does for the people. |A dat mek im afi bon sakrifais gi Gad fi fi im sin an fi ada piipl uon.

No man takes this honor for himself, but he who is called by God receives it, just as Aaron did.|Fi ton di liida fi di priis dem a wan big ting dat, an nobadi kyaahn jos kom kom se dem waahn ton wan, an go ton wan. A no so it go. Gad afi kaal im fi ton di liida fi di priis dem, jos laik ou im did kaal Ieran.

So also Christ did not glorify Himself to be made a High Priest, but it was He who said to Him:“You are My Son;today I have become Your Father.”|A siem ting wid Krais Jiizas. Im neehn jos go tek op liida fi priis pozishan jos so, an big op imself — nuo, a Gad se tu im se,“Yu a fi mi Bwai Pikni;tide mi ton fi yu faada!”
As He also says in another place:“You are a priest foreverin the order of Melchizedek.”|An somwe els im se,“Yu a wan priis fi eva,wan priis laka Melkezidek.”

In the days of His flesh, Jesus offered up prayers and supplications with loud cries and tears to Him who was able to save Him from death. He was heard because of His godly fear.|Wen Jiizas did de ya pan ort a liv, im did prie tu Gad aad aad, di wan we kuda siev im an no mek im ded. Im krai out loud an baal yai-waata. An Gad did ier im kaaz Jiizas did ombl imself, chos iina Gad an did eva redi fi du wa Gad tel im fi du.
Though He was a Son, He learned obedience through the things that He suffered|Iivn duo Krais Jiizas a Gad uona pikni, wen im go chuu sofarieshan im did lorn fi lisn wa Gad se an du wa Gad se fi du.

and being made perfect, He became the source of eternal salvation for all those who obey Him|An nou dat im go chuu aal a dat, an kom ton aal a we im sopuoz fi bi, im en op ton di wan we siev piipl fi eva, so langks dem du wa im tel dem fi du.
being designated by God a High Priest according to the order of Melchizedek.
column2: Kaaz Gad pik im fi ton di liida fi di priis dem laik Melkezidek.

column1: Concerning this we have much to say that is hard to explain, since you have become hard of hearing.|A uol iip wi av fi se bout dem sitn ya we wi a taak bout. Bot it aad fi brok it dong tu unu kaaz unu jos naa andastan.

For though by now you should be teachers, you need someone to teach you again the first principles of the oracles of God and have come to need milk rather than solid food. |Kaaz wen unu shudaana tiich ya nou, unu niid sumadi fi tiich unu uova di fos sitn dem we Gad se. Unu ton piipl we niid milk; unu kyaahn nyam aad fuud!
Everyone who lives on milk is unskilled in the word of righteousness, for he is a baby. |Enibadi we liv pan milk, no riili nuo wa rait fram rang, kaaz dem a stil biebi.

But solid food belongs to those who are mature, for those who through practice have powers of discernment that are trained to distinguish good from evil.|Bot aad fuud a fi big piipl kaaz dem chrien demself fi nuo wa rait fram rang, so dem nuo ou fi luk pan tingz.

Therefore, leaving the elementary principles of the doctrine of Christ, let us go on to maturity, not laying again a foundation of repentance from dead works and of faith toward God|So, mek wi muuv op man, an muuv paas di sitn dem we wi don tiich unu bout Krais Jiizas. Mek wi gruo paas dem sitn de, so wi kyan tiich unu siem laka ou wi wuda tiich piipl we chrang iina wa dem biliiv iina. Wi shudn afi tiich unu agen se piipl fi beg Gad paadn, chienj dem wiez an tap du di sitn dem we naa riili elp dem at aal, an dat dem fi biliiv iina Gad. Wi tiich unu dem sitn de wen unu did jos staat fala Jiizas.

of instruction about washings, the laying on of hands, the resurrection of the dead, and eternal judgment. |Wi shudn afi a tiich nou bout ou wi fi baptaiz, ar ou fi put an pan piipl wen dem a baptaiz an prie fi Gad bles dem, ar se ded piipl a-go kom bak alaiv an dat Gad a-go joj piipl — an a wa im mek op im main pan a-go laas fi eva. Nuo sa! wi shudn afi a tiich dem sitn de agen.
This we will do if God permits.|An a dem sitn de wi plan fi muuv paas, ef a dat Gad waahn.

For it is impossible for those who were once enlightened, who have tasted the heavenly gift, who shared in the Holy Spirit|Notn kyaahn mek piipl we did a waak wid Gad an ton bak an tap biliiv iina im, we did nuo di chuut we kom fram Gad, we did nuo ou it fiil fi Gad gi dem sopm kaaz dem get tingz fram im, we get di Uoli Spirit tu laik ada piipl
and have tasted the good word of God and the powers of the age to come|we did ties an nuo fi demself se Gad wod gud, an we fiil an nuo di powa we kom wen Gad staat ruul iina evri wie

if they fall away, to be renewed once more to repentance, since they again crucify to themselves the Son of God and subject Him to public shame. |an den afta aal a dat ton dem bak pan Gad, notn kyaahn mek dem piipl de kom bak tu Gad agen. Kaaz a niel dem a niel Gad Bwai Pikni pan di kraas wan muo taim, an mek piipl a luk dong pan im an tek im fi fuul.

For land that drinks in the rain that often falls upon it and bears a crop useful to those for whom it is cultivated receives a blessing from God.|Kaaz di grong we suok op di rien we faal pan it nof nof, an we mek plaant gruo an bier fuud we di faama kyan nyam — Gad bles da grong de.

But land that bears thorns and thistles is rejected and near to being cursed. Its destiny is to be burned.|Bot di grong we onggl mek makabush an we eva wiid op wiid op, da grong de naa no yuus, an Gad suun mek it kyaahn bier notn; faiya a-go en op bon it dong.

But though we speak in this manner, we are persuaded of better things for you, things that accompany salvation|Bot fren, iivn duo wi taak so, wi shuor se fi unu kies difrant — wi shuor se beta sitn a-go apm tu unu, kaaz unu a liv laik piipl we Gad siev.

for God is not unjust so as to forget your work and labor of love that you have shown for His name, in that you have ministered to the saints and continue ministering. |Gad fier yu nuo. Im naa go figet wa unu du. Im naa figet ou unu shuo umoch unu lov im wen unu elp di breda an sista dem we biliiv iina Gad, an ou unu stil a elp dem.

We desire that every one of you show the same diligence for the full assurance of hope to the end|Muo dan notn els, wa wi waahn unu fi du, a gwaan du di sitn dem we unu a du wid aal a unu aat til unu ded. Da wie de, unu wi en op get di sitn dem we unu a luk faawod tu; di sitn dem we Gad av fi unu.

so that you may not be lazy, but imitators of those who through faith and patience inherit the promises.|Wi no waahn unu fi get liezi an no waahn du notn. Nuo! unu fi tan laik di piipl dem we biliiv iina Krais Jiizas. Dem no gi op, an so dem get wa Gad did pramis fi gi dem.

For when God made a promise to Abraham, because He could vow by no one greater, He vowed by Himself|Nou wen Gad did mek Iebriyam di pramis, sins nobadi no de we biga dan Gad an muo powaful dan im, im swier pan imself.

saying, “Surely I will bless you, and surely I will multiply you.”|Im se, “Mi pramis yu se mi a-go bles yu uol iip, an mi a-go gi yu pikni pan tap a pikni, an fi dem pikni gweehn av uol iip a pikni, an fi dem pikni pikni gu dong a-go av uol iip a pikni tu!”
So after Abraham had patiently endured, he obtained the promise.|An afta Iebriyam wiet ou lang an gwaan chos Gad, im get wa Gad pramis im.

For men indeed swear by a greater authority than themselves, and for them an oath of confirmation ends all dispute.|Piipl swier pan sumadi we biga dan demself an we muo powaful tu, an dis aalwiez shuo se wa dem se a riili so it go — aal aagiment don.

So God, wanting to show more abundantly the immutability of His counsel to the heirs of promise, confirmed it by an oath.|A siem so Gad did waahn shuo di piipl dem we im pramis klier klier se im riili a-go gi dem wa im pramis dem, an im naa go chienj im main, so im no jos pramis dem, bot im swier pan tap a dat.

So that by two immutable things, in which it was impossible for God to lie, we who have fled for refuge might have strong encouragement to hold fast to the hope set before us. |Gad du tuu sitn we kyaahn chienj, kaaz wi nuo se Gad kyaahn lai. Im du dem tuu sitn de, so wi we ron tu im fi kip sief, wi wi fiil laik wi kyan uol aan chrang kaaz wi nuo fi shuor se wi a-go get di sitn dem we im pramis fi gi wi.

We have this hope as a sure and steadfast anchor of the soul, which enters the Inner Place behind the veil. |Wen wi chos Gad, an wi nuo fi shuor se im a-go gi wi wa im pramis wi, dat mek wi suol chrangga, an notn we a gwaan kyaahn kom shiek wi op. Wi tan todi jos laik wen di angka fi di ship jrap a di batam a di sii so di ship tan wan plies. An wen wi chos iina Gad so, di sitn dem we wi set wi aat pan, dem sitn de go insaid baka di kortn, go wan speshal speshal plies we Gad tan an we di priis dem wan kyan go.

This is where Jesus has entered for us as a forerunner, since He has become the everlasting High Priest in the order of Melchizedek.|A de-so Jiizas go tu. Im go de bifuo wi, so im kyan elp wi. An im ton wan liida fi di priis dem fi eva, jos laka Melkezidek.

For this Melchizedek, king of Salem, priest of the Most High God, met Abraham returning from the slaughter of the kings and blessed him.|Da Melkezidek ya we wi a taak bout, im did a king fi Sielem, an did a di priis fi di Muos Ai Gad tu. A im did miit op Iebriyam an bles im wen Iebriyam did jos a kom baka im yaad afta im go biit aaf di king dem.

To him Abraham also gave a tenth part of everything. In the first place, his name is translated “king of righteousness,” and then also he is king of Salem, which means “king of peace.”|Iebriyam tek wan outa evri ten sitn we im did get iina di waar an a kyari go baka im yaad, an gi im. Nou di niem Melkezidek riili miin ‘king we du wa rait,’ bot den ‘king fi Sielem’ kyari wan difrant miinin, dat miin ‘king we mek piis.’

Without father, without mother, without descent, having neither beginning of days nor end of life, but made like the Son of God, he continually remains a priest.|Melkezidek naa no mada, im naa no faada, im naa no fambili chrii fi shuo a we im kom fram. Im neehn baan an im neehn ded, laik Gad Bwai Pikni im tan wan priis fi eva.

Now consider how great this man was, to whom even the patriarch Abraham gave a tenth of the spoils.|Jos tingk bout ou big im bi, wen aal wan man laka Iebriyam, we a di faada fi di uol Izrel, gi im wan outa evri ten sitn we im did tek we!

Surely the sons of Levi, who receive the office of the priesthood, have a command to take tithes of the people according to the law, that is, from their brothers, though they also come from the seed of Abraham.|Nou di laa se, aal a Liivai pikni pikni dem go dong, we ton priis, fi tek wan outa evri ten sitn fram Gad piipl dem. Dat miin se fi dem uona piipl a gi dem wan outa evri ten, iivn duo dem piipl de a Iebriyam pikni pikni dem go dong tu.

But this man, whose descent is not numbered among them, received tithes from Abraham and blessed him who had the promises.|Da man ya duo, Melkezidek, nobadi kudn shuo se im kom fram Liivai fambili bot im get wan outa evri ten fram Iebriyam. An a im did aal bles Iebriyam tu — wen a Iebriyam Gad did mek pramis tu.
Without question, the inferior is blessed by the superior. |An evribadi don nuo aredi se sumadi we a bles sumadi els, biga dan di wan we a get bles.

In the one case mortal men receive tithes, but in the other he of whom it is witnessed that he is alive receives them.|Nou, di priis dem we kom fram Liivai, we get wan outa evri ten, di uol a dem ded, bot Melkezidek we get wan outa evri ten, Gad wod tiich se im no ded.

One might say that Levi also, who receives tithes, paid tithes through Abraham|An wi kuda se Liivai imself, we get wan outa evri ten sitn, did pie Melkezidek wan outa evri ten tu di taim wen Iebriyam did gi im wan outa fi im ten.
for he was still in the loins of his father when Melchizedek met Abraham.|Kaaz wen Melkezidek did miit Iebriyam, Liivai neehn baan yet, an a Iebriyam fambili Liivai wudaana kom fram.

If perfection were attained through the Levitical priesthood (for through it the people received the law), what further need was there that another priest should rise in the order of Melchizedek, rather than established in the order of Aaron?|Gad did gi di Izrel piipl dem di laa. Di priis dem did fi kom fram Liivai fambili an dem did impuotant tu di laa. Nou ef di priis dem fram Liivai fambili kuda du aal we dem did fi du, wan difrant kain-a priis wudn afi kom? Wan we tan laka Melkezidek, an we no kom fram Ieran fambili, no chuu?
For a change in the priesthood necessitates a change in the law. |Wen Gad chienj di kain-a priis we kom, di laa mos chienj tu.

For the One concerning whom these things are spoken pertains to another tribe, from which no man served at the altar. |Im, Melkezidek, we wi a taak bout, im kom fram wan difrant chraib an nobadi fram da chraib de neva wok az priis a di alta yet.

For it is evident that our Lord descended from Judah, a tribe concerning which Moses said nothing about priests. |Kaaz evribadi mos nuo aredi se a Juuda wi Laad kom fram, an Muoziz neva se priis a-go kom fram da chraib de.
This is far more evident when another priest arises in the likeness of Melchizedek|An aal a wa wi se, dat klier klier ef sumadi laka Melkezidek kom ton priis;

who becomes a priest not by a law pertaining to ancestry, but by the power of an endless life.|an im no kom ton priis siek-a di fambili we im kom fram laik ou di laa se it fi go. Im ton priis kaaz im kyaahn ded — an dat powaful.
For He testifies:“You are a priest forever,in the order of Melchizedek.”|Kaaz Gad wod se,“Yu a-go ton wan priis fi eva,jos laka Melkezidek.”
For there is then an annulling of the previous commandment due to its weakness and uselessness.|So di fos laa did put wan said kaaz it neehn wot notn, an it kudn du wa it did fi du.

For the law made nothing perfect, but now a better hope is introduced, by which we draw near to God.|Kaaz di laa kudn mek notn ton aal we it fi ton. Bot nou Gad gi wi sitn beta fi luk faawod tu an dat bring wi kluos tu im.
And He was not made a priest without an oath.
column2: An Gad neehn mek im priis an no mek wan pramis tu. Im did mek wan pramis! Bot di ada priis dem did ton priis an im neehn mek no pramis.

column1: (Other priests were made without an oath, but this One with an oath by the One who said to Him:“The Lord has swornand will not relent,‘You are a priest forever, in the order of Melchizedek.’ ”)|Bot Jiizas did ton wan priis wen Gad pramis im se,“Mi, di Laad, pramis seyu a-go bi wan priis fi eva,an mi naa go chienj mi main!”
Through this oath Jesus became the guarantor of a better covenant.|An kaaz Gad aal mek pramis wid Jiizas, dis shuo se Jiizas mek di pramis we Gad gi wi beta dan di uol wan fi shuor shuor.
And the former priests were numerous because they were hindered from serving because of death.
column2: Nou a uol iip a priis yu did afi av. Kaaz priis wuda ded an so ada priis wuda afi kom tek uova.

column1: But He, because He lives forever, has an everlasting priesthood.|Bot Kaaz Jiizas naa no ded a ded, im a-go tan priis fi eva an nobadi naa tek uova fram im.

Therefore He is able to save to the uttermost those who come to God through Him, because He at all times lives to make intercession for them.|Piipl kyan kom tu Gad siek-a im an im kyan siev dem piipl de fi eva an eva. Im kyan siev dem fi eva kaaz im naa ded so im kyan aalwiez taak tu Gad fi dem.

For such a High Priest was fitting for us, for He is holy, innocent, undefiled, separate from sinners, and is higher than the heavens.|Liida fi priis we komiin laik Jiizas, a riili di kain-a liida fi priis we wi niid. Im mek Gad api iina evri kain-a wie. Im no du notn rang; im neva sin. Nobadi kyaahn bliem im fi notn. Gad mek im difrant, im no komiin laka sina piipl. An Gad riez im op ai ai, aiya dan aal evn.

Unlike those high priests, He does not need to offer daily sacrifices—first for His own sins and then for the people’s, for He did this once for all when He offered up Himself.|Im no tan laik di ada liida dem fi di priis dem we afi bon sakrifais fi fi dem uona sin an den fi di piipl dem sin die afta die afta die. Nuo sa! Im sakrifais imself gi Gad wan taim, fi evribadi, an a it dat.

For the law appoints men who are weak as high priests, but the word of the oath, which came after the law, appoints a Son who is made perfect forever.|Di Laa gi piipl we wiik, an we wi du rang, pozishan fi ton di liida fi priis. Bot di pramis we Gad mek, we kom afta di laa, da pramis de mek di Bwai Pikni liida fi di priis dem. An im ton di wan we kyan du evriting we im sopuoz fi du fi eva.

Now this is the main point of the things that we are saying: We have such a High Priest, who is seated at the right hand of the throne of the Majesty in the heavens|Nou dis a di mien sitn wi a se: Wi av wan liida fi priis we did sidong pan di rait-an-said a Gad chuon op iina evn.

a minister in the sanctuary and the true tabernacle, which the Lord, not man, set up.|An im wok az di liida fi di priis dem iina di muos uoli uoli plies, we Gad de. Da tent de a di riil tent, a di Laad put dat op — a no man!
For every high priest is appointed to offer gifts and sacrifices. Therefore it is necessary that this priest also have something to offer.
column2: Evri liida fi priis afi gi aafrin plos bon sakrifais gi Gad. So da wan ya did afi av sopm fi gi Gad tu.

column1: For if He were on earth, He would not be a priest, since there are priests that offer gifts according to the law.|Nou, ef im did de pan ort im wudn ton liida fi priis at aal, kaaz yu don av liida fi priis aredi we gi di aafrin we di laa se fi gi.

They serve in a sanctuary that is an example and shadow of the heavenly one, as Moses was instructed by God when he was about to make the tabernacle, “See that you make all things according to the pattern shown you on the mountain.”|Dem wok az liida fi di priis dem iina tent we luk laik wa de a evn, bot dem de tent kyaahn riili kom kluos tu di wan we de a evn, nuo sa! Dem de komiin laka sheda fi di riil ting. A so kom Gad did waan Muoziz wen im did bout fi mek di tent fi piipl kom worship im. Gad se, “Mek shuor se yu mek evriting jos laik wa mi shuo yu pan di moutn.”

But now He has obtained a more excellent ministry, because He is the Mediator of a better covenant, which was established on better promises.|Bot nou, di wok we Jiizas get fi du, dat uol iip biga dan di priis dem uon, laik ou im kom bitwiin Gad an wi an mek wan beta diil wid Gad fi wi, an da plan de pramis wi som beta sopm tu.
For if that first covenant had been faultless, then no occasion would have been sought for a second. |Kaaz ef notn neehn rang wid di fos plan, Gad wudn go mek wan neda wan.

For finding fault with them, God says:“Surely the days are coming, says the Lord,when I will make a new covenantwith the house of Israeland with the house of Judah|Bot Gad did si se di piipl dem did a du rang, dem neehn a fala di fos plan, so im se tu dem se,“Wach it, di taim a kom, di Laad se,wen mi a-go mek wan nyuu pramiswid di Izrel piipl dem,an mi a-go mek wan nyuu pramis wid di piipl dem a Juuda tu.

not according to the covenantthat I made with their fathersin the day when I took them by the handto lead them out of the land of Egypt;because they did not continue in My covenant,and I rejected them, says the Lord.|It naa go komiin laik di pramis we mi did mek wid dem faada faada demwen mi did tek dem an — an liid dem outa Iijip.Kaaz dem did brok di pramis an neehn lisn wa mi se,so mi ton we fram dem.A dat di Laad se.

This is the covenant that I will make with the house of Israelafter those days, says the Lord:I will put My laws into their mindsand write them on their hearts;and I will be their God,and they shall be My people.|Bot nou, afta dem die de,dis a di nyuu pramis we mi a mek wid di Izrel piipl dem, di Laad se.Mi a-go put mi laa dem iina dem edan mi a-go rait dem dong pan dem aat.Mi a-go bi fi dem Gad,an dem a-go bi fi mi piipl dem.

No longer shall every man teach his neighbor,and every man his brother, saying, ‘Know the Lord,’for all shall know Me,from the least of them to the greatest.|Nobadi naa go afi tiich dem nieba agen,ar dem breda ar sista dem se dem fi, ‘nuo di Laad.’Kaaz evribadi a-go nuo mi aredi,fram di liklis wan tu di tap-a-tap.

For I will be merciful toward their unrighteousness,and their sins and their lawless deeds Iwill remember no more.”|Kaaz mi a-go chriit dem gud an kain an paadn dem fi aal a di wikid sitn dem we dem du.Mi naa memba dem sin — mi a-go figet dem.”

In speaking of a new covenant He has made the first one old. Now that which is decaying and growing old is ready to vanish away.|Wen di Laad se di pramis we im mek a wan ‘nyuu’ wan, im miin se di fos wan naa yuuz agen. An ef sitn naa yuuz, an a get uol, den it suun gaan an don fa.

Then indeed, the first covenant had ordinances for divine services and an earthly sanctuary.|Nou di fos plan we Gad did mek did av ruul bout ou piipl fi worship im, an bout di tent we piipl fi worship — we piipl mek.

A tabernacle was made. In the first part of the tabernacle, called the Holy Place, were the candlestick, the table, and the showbread. |Dem put op wan tent fi worship Gad an afta yu go chuu di fos kortn yu did de iina di Uoli Plies. Iin de-so, yu did av wan lampstan an di tiebl wid dem speshal bred we di priis tek gi Gad.
Behind the second veil was the second part of the tabernacle called the Most Holy Place
column2: An baka di sekan kortn yu did av di tent we dem kaal di Uoliyis Plies.

column1: which contained the golden censer and the ark of the covenant overlaid with gold, containing the golden pot holding the manna, Aaron’s rod that budded, and the tablets of the covenant.|Iin de-so yu av di alta we mek outa guol. De-so dem bon wan spais we sumel swiit. Yu did av di baks tu, we tan fi di pramis we Gad mek, dat did kova aal uova iina guol. Da baks de av iin di jog we did uol mana, we Gad did gi dem fi nyam. Ieran waakn tik we liif did gruo pan did iin de tu. An di tuu stuon dem we Gad ruul did rait op pan did iin de wid di res a sitn dem.
Above the ark were the cherubim of glory overshadowing the mercy seat. Concerning these things we cannot now speak in detail.
column2: Uova di guol baks yu did av di sitn dem we dem kaal ‘cherobim’ we komiin laik pikni wid wing. Dem sitn de did shuo se Gad de de-so. An dem wing chrech uova di plies we Gad paadn sin. Bot wi kyaahn taak bout aal a di niti-griti ya-so.

column1: Now when these things were thus ordained, the priests would regularly go into the first part, conducting the services of God. |So, wen di ting set op so nou, di priis dem wuda kom iina di fos paat a di tent aal di wail kom du dem priis wok.

But only the high priest went into the second part once a year, not without blood, which he offered for himself and for the sins of the people, committed in ignorance.|Bot a onggl di liida fi di priis dem wan kyan go paas di sekan kortn we de insaida di tent, an a onggl wan taim fi di ier im wuda du dat. Im neva go an no tek animal blod wid im. Im wuda gi Gad dat fi fi im sin an fi di rang sitn dem we piipl du an no iivn si se dem du.

The Holy Spirit was signifying through this that the way into the Most Holy Place was not yet revealed, because the first part of the tabernacle was still standing. |Di Uoli Spirit did a shuo se di wie fi get iina di riil tent, di Uoliyis Plies neehn uopm op yet, so langks di uol tent — di wan pan ort, did stil a yuuz.

This is an illustration for the present time, showing that the gifts and sacrifices offered could not perfect the conscience of those who worshipped|Di tent pan ort a wan sain we shuo wa did a gwaan da taim de. It shuo se aal a di gif an sakrifais we piipl yuus tu kyari go gi Gad wen dem a worship im kudn set dem kanchens frii.

since they are concerned only with foods and drinks, ceremonial cleansings, and fleshly ordinances imposed until the time of reformation.|Dem sitn de did onggl a diil wid wa piipl fi nyam an jringk an di difrant difrant wie dem kyan kliin op demself. Aal a dem ruul de, we onggl a tel wi bout ou piipl fi du tingz, an we naa tel wi notn bout piipl aat, dem onggl a-go laas til di taim kom fi set tingz rait. Dat a wen di nyuu plan kom iin an chienj tingz roun.

But Christ, when He came as a High Priest of the good things to come, by a greater and more perfect tabernacle, not made with hands, that is to say, not of this creation|Bot Krais Jiizas kom aredi az di liida fi priis fi di gud sitn dem we a kom. An di tent we im go chuu, dat biga an beta dan di ada wan. It no niid notn els fi mek it no beta dan it bi. An a no piipl mek da wan de. Dat miin fi se a no da worl ya it kom fram.

neither by the blood of goats and calves, but by His own blood, He entered the Most Holy Place once for all, having obtained eternal redemption. |An a no guot blod ar kou kyaaf blod im tek du dis. Bot a fi im uona blod im tek go iina di Uoliyis Plies. Im go de onggl wan dege-dege taim an a it dat — im wan siev di uol a wi fram sin fi eva!

For if the blood of bulls and goats, and the ashes of a heifer, sprinkling the unclean, sanctifies so that the flesh is purified|So, ef guot an bulkou blod an di ashiz fi wan kou kyaaf kyan springkl pan piipl we no kliin iina Gad yai an mek dem kliin fi go worship Gad

how much more shall the blood of Christ, who through the eternal Spirit offered Himself without blemish to God, cleanse your conscience from dead works to serve the living God?|den tingk bout umoch muo Krais Jiizas blod a-go du fi wi! Siek-a di Spirit we liv fi eva, im kuda gi op imself, an im naa no sin at aal. So fi im blod frii wi kanchens fram di sitn dem we wi du uova an uova fi worship, bot we riili naa no yuus an we boun fi kil wi aaf. Im blod frii wi kanchens fram dem de an mek wi kyan riili sorv di Gad we liv fi eva!

For this reason He is the Mediator of a new covenant, since a death has occurred for the redemption of the sins that were committed under the first covenant, so that those who are called might receive the promise of eternal inheritance.|A so kom im mek wan nyuu plan bitwiin Gad an piipl. So di piipl dem we Gad kaal fi bi fi im uona piipl dem, im kyan bles dem fi eva laik we im pramis fi du. Dat kyan apm kaaz im ded, an kaaz im go ded di piipl dem we sin an brok di uol taim plan we Gad did mek wid dem, dem piipl de kyan get paadn.
For where there is a will, there must also of necessity be the death of the testator.|Kaaz wen sumadi rait wan wil, dem afi pruuv se di sumadi ded fos fi di wil av yuus.
For a will has force after men are dead, since it has no force at all while the testator lives. |Di wil no miin notn ef di sumadi we rait it no ded yet — a wen di sumadi ded, it av powa.
So not even the first covenant was inaugurated without blood.
column2: So di fos plan we Gad did mek neehn av no powa widout no blod.

column1: For when Moses had taught every precept to all the people according to the law, he took the blood of calves and goats, with water, scarlet wool, and hyssop, and sprinkled both the book and all the people|Kaaz wen Muoziz did tel aal di piipl dem evri wan a Gad ruul we did rait dong iina di Laa Buk, im tek wan kou kyaaf blod an guot blod, wid waata an wan likl piis a wan plaant niem isop, we im tai wid som daak-red shiip skin, an springkl di blod an waata pan di Laa Buk an pan aal a di piipl dem.
saying, “This is the blood of the covenant that God has commanded you to keep.”|An Muoziz se, ‘Dis a di blod fi di plan we Gad mek wid unu, an se unu afi kip.’
Likewise he sprinkled both the tabernacle and all the vessels of worship with blood.
column2: A siem so im tek di blod an springkl pan di tent an pan evriting we did iina di tent we dem did yuuz fi worship.

column1: And according to the law almost everything must be cleansed with blood; without the shedding of blood there is no forgiveness.|An bies pan wa di laa se, yu did afi springkl blod pan nieli evriting fi mek it kliin; an ef no blod no ron, no sin no get paadn.

It was therefore necessary that the replicas of heavenly things be cleansed with these sacrifices, but that the heavenly things themselves be cleansed with better sacrifices than these.|So, di sitn dem we onggl komiin laik di wan dem we de a evn, dem sakrifais de did afi bon fi mek dem sitn de get kliin. Bot di wan dem we de a evn — di riil wan dem, beta sakrifais did afi bon fi dem sitn de.

For Christ did not enter holy places made with hands, which are patterned after the true one, but into heaven itself, now to appear in the presence of God for us.|Kaaz Krais Jiizas neehn go iina wan tent we piipl mek, we did jos a ak laik di riil tent — nuo sa! Im go iina evn itself an de de wid Gad nou, fi elp wi.

Nor did He enter to offer Himself often, as the high priest enters the Most Holy Place every year with blood that is not his own. |An im neehn go iina evn go gi op imself uova an uova laik ou di liida fi di priis dem did afi go iina di Uoliyis Plies ier afta ier a kyari blod we a no fi dem uon.

For then He would have had to suffer repeatedly since the world was created, but now He has appeared once at the end of the ages to put away sin by sacrificing Himself.|Ef a so, den Krais Jiizas wuda afi sofa uol iip a taim sins di worl mek. Bot nier di taim wen di worl a-go don nou, im gi op imself laik wan sakrifais, onggl wan taim, an dat kova evriting. Da wie de im kuda get rid a sin.
As it is appointed for men to die once, but after this comes the judgment|An jos laik ou wi nuo fi shuor se a wan taim evribadi a-go ded an den Gad a-go joj dem,

so Christ was offered once to bear the sins of many, and He will appear a second time, not to bear sin but to save those who eagerly wait for Him.|wel a siem so, Krais Jiizas sakrifais imself onggl wan taim fi paadn uol iip a piipl sin. Bot wen im kom bak, a no kom im a kom fi tek we sin bot fi siev di piipl dem we a wiet fi im.

For the law is a shadow of the good things to come, and not the very image of those things. It could never by the same sacrifices, which they offer continually year after year, perfect those who draw near. |Di laa we di Juu piipl dem get a no di riil ting, it a no notn laik di gud gud sitn we a kom. Da laa de a jos laik di sheda fi di riil sitn dem. Kaaz ier afta ier, uova an uova di priis tek di siem sakrifais gi Gad fi mek di piipl dem we kom kom worship get kliin, an stil di sakrifais kyaahn mek di piipl dem kliin iina evri wie.

Otherwise, would they not have ceased to be offered, since the worshippers, once purified, would no longer be conscious of sins?|Ef dat kuda apm, dem no wuda tap gi dem sakrifais de, no so? Kaaz di piipl dem we kom fi worship, dem no wuda kliin wans an faraal? An ef a so, dem wudn fiil gilti bout no sin, no chuu?
But in those sacrifices there is an annual reminder of sins. |Bot dem sakrifais de we dem tek gi Gad, dem dis a memba piipl bout dem sin ier afta ier.
For it is not possible for the blood of bulls and goats to take away sins.
column2: Kaaz bulkou blod an guot blod kyaahn tek we nobadi sin.

column1: Therefore, when He came into the world, He said:“Sacrifices and offerings You did not desire,but a body You have prepared for Me.|So wen Krais Jiizas kom iina di worl im se,
In burnt offerings and sacrifices for sinYou have had no pleasure.|wen dem bon uol-a animal fi sakrifais, an gi yu aafrin fi tek we sin,dem sitn de no mek yu api.

Then I said, ‘See, I have come to do Your will, O God,’ as it is written of Mein the volume of the book.”|Den mi se, ‘Gad si mi ya, mi kom fi du wa yu waahn mi fi du,jos laik ou it rait dong bout mi iina di ruol op buk.’ ”

Previously when He said, “You did not desire sacrifices and offerings. You have had no pleasure in burnt offerings and sacrifices for sin,” which are offered in accordance with the law|Fos Jiizas se, “A neehn sakrifais an aafrin yu did waahn, yu neehn waahn dem fi tek no uol-a animal an bon mek sakrifais gi yu an yu neehn waahn no sin aafrin niida. Dem sitn de neehn mek yu api” — duo bies pan di laa a dem sitn de piipl did fi gi.

then He said, “See, I have come to do Your will, O God.”He takes away the first that He may establish the second.|Den im se, “Si mi ya. Mi kom fi du wa yu waahn mi fi du.” So di fos plan we se piipl did afi gi op sakrifais fi tek we dem sin, Gad mek it naa no muo powa so di sekan plan kuda set op; da plan de gi di sakrifais we Krais Jiizas mek aal a di powa.

By this will we have been sanctified through the offering of the body of Jesus Christ once for all.|An siek-a dat, di uol a wi ton kliin iina Gad yai. Im sakrifais im uona badi jos wan dege-dege taim an dat kova evriting.

But every priest stands daily ministering and repetitively offering the same sacrifices, which can never take away sins. |An aal a di priis dem tan de die afta die, a sorv an a gi op di siem sakrifais uova an uova — an dem de sakrifais kyaahn tek we sin.

But this Man, after He had offered one sacrifice for sins forever, sat down at the right hand of God.|Bot wen da priis ya gi onggl wan sakrifais, an da sakrifais ya kova evriting, im go sidong saida Gad, pan im rait-an-said.
Since that time He has been waiting for His enemies to be made His footstool.|An fram da taim de, im de de a wiet til di piipl dem we iet im ton wan stuul fi im put im fut pan
For by one offering He has forever perfected those who are sanctified.
column2: kaaz im tek jos wan aafrin an mek di uol a wi we a ton kliin iina Gad yai ton jos laik ou wi fi ton fi eva an eva.

column1: The Holy Spirit also witnesses to us about this. For after saying|An di Uoli Spirit shuo wi se dem sitn ya chuu fi riil, kaaz fos im se

“This is the covenant that I will make with themafter those days, says the Lord:I will put My laws into their hearts,and in their minds I will write them,”|“Di Laad se, ‘Likl muo fram nou,dis a di diil we mi a-go mek wid dem:Mi a-go put mi laa iina dem ed an rait it dong pan dem aat,so dem wi andastan it an lisn we mi se.’”
then He adds,“Their sins and lawless deedswill I remember no more.”|Den im se,“Mi naa go memba non at aal di piipl dem sinan ou dem did brok mi laa.”
Now where there is forgiveness of these, there is no longer an offering for sin.|So nou, wen Gad paadn sin, no muo sin aafrin no afi gi op.
Therefore, brothers, we have confidence to enter the Most Holy Place by the blood of Jesus|So mi breda an sista, laik ou wi frii fi go iina di Uoliyis Plies siek-a Jiizas blod

by a new and living way that He has opened for us through the veil, that is to say, His flesh|kaaz im go sakrifais im badi we komiin laka di kortn we put op iina Gad ous fi kova di plies we Gad de; an di sakrifais im go sakrifais im badi, dat uopm op wan nyuu wie fi wi, wan wie we gi laif — wan wie we liid tu Gad.
and since we have a High Priest over the house of God|Plos wi av wan priis we a wan a di bigis wan eva, an a im ruul uova Gad ous.

let us draw near with a true heart in full assurance of faith, having our hearts sprinkled to cleanse them from an evil conscience, and our bodies washed with pure water. |So siek-a aal a dem sitn de, kom mek wi jraa kluos tu Gad an no fried. Bot mek wi go tu im an riili chos im wid aal a wi aat. Kaaz Jiizas blod don kliin wi aat so wi kanchens frii, an wi badi don wash iina kliin waata tu.

Let us firmly hold the profession of our faith without wavering, for He who promised is faithful. |Mek wi uol aan chrang an gwaan biliiv se wi a-go get di sitn dem we Gad se im a-go gi wi — a dat wi tel di worl se wi biliiv. So mek wi uol aan pan dat an no staat tingk sitn els. A Gad pramis wi, an wat-eva im pramis fi du, im a-go du fi chuu.
And let us consider how to spur one another to love and to good works.
column2: An mek wi tingk bout ou wi kyan gwaan push wi wan aneda fi shuo lov an fi du di gud sitn dem.

column1: Let us not forsake the assembling of ourselves together, as is the manner of some, but let us exhort one another, especially as you see the Day approaching.|Mek wi gwaan miit tugeda an kip choch — no tap, laik we som piipl a du. Insted-a dat mek wi kom tugeda an taak so wi wan aneda aat kyan get chrangga; wos laka ou di Laad suun kom bak, mek wi du dem sitn de muo an muo nou.

For if we willfully continue to sin after we have received the knowledge of the truth, there no longer remains a sacrifice for sins|Kaaz ef wi mek op wi main se wi a-go gwaan sin galang afta wi don nuo wa chuu, no muo sakrifais no de fi tek we wi sin yu nuo.

but a fearful expectation of judgment and fiery indignation, which will devour the adversaries.|Bot notn no lef fi wi du dan fi wiet an fried a Gad jojment we a kom, plos di wikid wikid faiya we im a-go tek bon op di piipl dem we fait gens im.

Anyone who despised Moses’ law died without mercy in the presence of two or three witnesses.|Ef sumadi did brok di Laa we Gad did gi Muoziz, an tuu ar chrii sumadi se dem si im ar shi a brok di Laa, dem wuda kil da sumadi de an dem naa sari fi dem niida.

How much more severe a punishment do you suppose he deserves, who has trampled under foot the Son of God, and has regarded the blood of the covenant that sanctified him to be a common thing, and has insulted the Spirit of grace?|So a umoch wos Gad fi ponish sumadi we chrampl op pan im Bwai Pikni, an we chriit Jiizas blod laik se it chiip, wen a it yuuz fi set op di nyuu plan we Gad mek? An a it yuuz fi tek we da siem sumadi de sin. Umoch wos im ar shi fi get ponish wen dem taak gens di Uoli Spirit we shuo wi wan kain-a lov we wi no iivn dizorv — iihn, umoch wos?

For we know Him who said, “Vengeance is Mine,” says the Lord, “I will repay.” And again He says, “The Lord will judge His people.”|Kaaz wi nuo a uu se, “A mi a di wan we a-go ponish piipl fi di wikidnis we dem du, an mi a-go pie dem bak fi aal a di bad sitn dem we dem du.” An wan neks taim im se, “Di Laad wi joj im piipl dem.”
It is a fearful thing to fall into the hands of the living God.|A no wan nais sitn fi jrap iina di an fi di Gad we a liv, an im ponish yu yu nuo — enibadi we dat apm tu fi kech dem fried!

Remember the former days, after you were enlightened, in which you endured a great struggle of afflictions. |Bot unu fi memba iina di paas wen unu did jos andastan Gad wie, di sofarieshan we unu did afi go chuu, bot unu uol aan an kot chuu siem wie.

In part you were made a spectacle both by reproaches and afflictions. And in part you became companions of those who were so abused.|Som a di taim dem, dem did biit unu op an chriit unu bad infronta evribadi; wen a no dat gwaan, a jain unu jain op wid di piipl dem we dem chriit so, an tan saida dem iina fi dem chraiyal an chibilieshan.

For you had compassion on me in my chains and joyfully endured the confiscation of your property, knowing that you have in heaven a better and an enduring possession for yourselves.|Kaaz fi riil, unu aal sari fi di piipl dem we dem chuo iina prizn. An wen dem kom tek we unu sitn dem, unu mek dem galang wid dem, an aal a sumail sed wie, kaaz unu nuo se unu uon tingz we moch moch beta dan dem sitn de, an wa unu uon a-go laas fi eva.
Therefore do not throw away your confidence, which will be greatly rewarded.|So no bada gi op. Gwaan uol tait, kaaz siek-a dat unu a-go get som blesn de!

For you need patience, so that after you have done the will of God, you will receive the promise.|Unu afi uol aan an pres chuu fi du wa Gad waahn unu fi du, an so get di sitn dem we im pramis fi gi unu.
For,“In yet a little while,He who is to come will come, and will not wait.|Kaaz tuu tuuz,“Di wan we a kom a-go riich — im naa go lie-lie.

Now the just shall live by faith;but if anyone draws back,My soul shall have no pleasure in him.”|An mi piipl dem we du di rait sitn dem a-go liv kaaz dem biliiv iina mi.An ef dem go ton bakmi naa go api wid dem at aal at aal.”

But we are not of those who draw back to destruction, but of those who have faith to the saving of the soul.|Bot wi a no non a dem piipl de we ton bak an en op get laas, mash op an dem sitn de. Nuo sa! Wi a wan a dem piipl de we chos iina Gad an so im a siev wi suol.

Now faith is the substance of things hoped for, the evidence of things not seen. |Wen wi chos iina Gad it mek wi shuor bout di sitn dem we wi onggl uop se wi a-go get, an wi nuo se di sitn dem we wi kyaahn si, dem de de fi chuu.
For by it the men of old obtained a good report.
column2: A dis mek Gad did api wid wi faada faada dem.

column1: By faith we understand that the universe was framed by the word of God, so that things that are seen were not made out of things which are visible.|Kaaz wi chos iina Gad, wi andastan se im jos se di wod an di worl mek, so di sitn dem we wi kyan si, dem kom fram di sitn dem we wi kyaahn si.

By faith Abel offered to God a more excellent sacrifice than Cain offered. Through this he was approved as righteous, with God testifying concerning his gifts. He still speaks through his faith, though he is dead.|A kaaz Iebl chos iina Gad mek im bon wan beta sakrifais gi Gad dan Kien. A kaaz im chos iina Gad mek Gad se im api wid im, an se im a sumadi we du di rait sitn dem. An siek-a di chos we im chos iina Gad, im stil a chat iivn duo im ded, kaaz wa Iebl did du stil a sen wan mesij tu wi.

By faith Enoch was taken to heaven so that he would not see death. He was not found, because God took him away. For before he was taken, he had this commendation, that he pleased God. |Kaaz Iinok did chos iina Gad, Gad did tek im op wich paat im de wen im did stil alaiv, so im neehn ded at aal, an nobadi kudn fain im kaa Gad did tek im op. An Gad du dat kaa im did mek Gad api siek-a wa im du.

And without faith it is impossible to please God, for he who comes to God must believe that He exists and that He is a rewarder of those who diligently seek Him.|Nou ef sumadi no chos iina Gad, dem kyaahn mek im api non at aal. Kaaz enibadi we kom kom worship Gad afi biliiv fos se Gad de fi chuu, an dat im a-go du som uol iip a gud sitn fi di wan dem we luk fi im aad aad.

By faith Noah, being divinely warned about things not yet seen, moved with godly fear, prepared an ark to save his family, by which he condemned the world and became an heir of the righteousness that comes by faith.|Afta Gad waan Nowa bout di sitn dem we Nowa kudn si yet, a kaaz Nowa chos iina Gad an av nof nof rispek fi im mek im lisn we Gad se an go bil wan big buot fi siev im fambili. Kaaz Nowa did chos iina Gad so, im kot aaf imself fram di piipl dem iina di worl an shuo se dem rang kaa dem no chos iina Gad. Gad se, “Nowa a sumadi we du wa rait” kaaz Nowa chos iina im.

By faith Abraham obeyed when he was called to go out into a place which he would later receive as an inheritance. He went out not knowing where he was going.|Kaaz Iebriyam chos iina Gad, wen Gad kaal im, im lisn. An so im go a wan plies we im did bout fi get fram Gad, im go de iivn duo im neehn nuo a wich paat im did a go.

By faith he dwelt in the promised land, as in a foreign land, dwelling in tents with Isaac and Jacob, the heirs of the same promise|An kaa im chos iina Gad im muuv go a di lan we Gad pramis im an liv de laik farina. Im liv iina tent wid Aizak an Jiekob. Gad did mek di siem pramis tu dem tu.

for he was looking for a city which has foundations, whose builder and maker is God. |Iebriyam tan de kaaz im did a luk faawod fi wan siti we Gad did jraa op an bil. Da siti de tan op pan som chrang foundieshan.

By faith Sarah herself also received the ability to conceive seed, and she bore a child when she was past the age, because she judged Him faithful who had promised.|Aal wen Siera neehn av no pikni, an did paas di taim fi av biebi, an Iebriyam did tuu oul fi gi ar non, im chos se Gad wuda kip im pramis an so Gad mek Iebriyam kuda gi ar biebi.

Therefore from one man, who was as good as dead, sprang so many, a multitude as the stars of the sky and innumerable as the sand by the seashore.|Az a matarafak, fram da wan man ya, wan bag a pikni kom; pikni we nof laik di staar dem we de op iina di skai, an we plenti plenti laik san a sii, iivn duo im did so oul dat im de a griev mout.

These all died in faith not having received the promises, but having seen them from afar were assured of them, embraced them, and confessed that they were strangers and pilgrims on the earth.|Aal a dem piipl ya we ded did a chos iina Gad siem wie, aal wen dem neehn get iina dem an, di sitn we Gad did pramis. (Dem did si dem fram faar faar — lang bifuo dem apm an dem did wel api). An dem neehn fried fi se dem no kom fram ya-so — dat dem a farina pan ort.
Those who say such things declare plainly that they are looking for a homeland. |Piipl we se dem sitn ya, shuo se dem a luk fi wan konchri we a riili fi dem uon.

And certainly, if they had been thinking of the country out of which they came, they might have had the opportunity to return. |Az a matarafak ef dem did a tingk bout di plies we dem did lef dem wuda get di chaans fi go bak de.

But they desired a better country, that is, a heavenly one. Therefore God is not ashamed to be called their God, for He has prepared a city for them.|Insted-a dat dem did a luk fi wan beta plies — wan we de a evn. So Gad no shiem fi se im a fi dem Gad, kaaz im get wan siti redi fi dem.

By faith Abraham, when he was tested, offered up Isaac, and he who had received the promises offered up his only begotten son. |Kaaz Iebriyam did chos iina Gad wen Gad did tes im, im did redi fi sakrifais Aizak gi im. Im did get di pramis we Gad did mek wid im, an im did stil redi fi gi op im wan dege-dege bwai.
Of him God said, “Through Isaac shall your seed be named.”|Gad did se tu im se, “A Aizak a-go mek yu av pikni pikni gu dong.”

He reasoned that God was able to raise him up, even from the dead, from which he indeed received him in a figurative sense.|Iebriyam did don riizn out se, Gad kuda mek ded piipl kom bak alaiv, an iina wan wie a ded Aizak did ded an im get im bak.
By faith Isaac blessed Jacob and Esau concerning things to come.|Aizak chos iina Gad an so im bles Jiekob an Iisaa, an biliiv se fi dem blesn a-go kom iina di fyuucha.

By faith Jacob, when he was dying, blessed each of the sons of Joseph and worshipped while leaning on the top of his staff.|Kaaz Jiekob chos iina Gad, wen im did a ded, im bles evri wan a Juozif pikni dem an im liin op pan im waakn tik a worship Gad.

By faith Joseph, when he was dying, mentioned the exodus of the children of Israel and gave instructions concerning his bones.|Kaaz Juozif did chos iina Gad, wen im did bout fi ded im did taak bout di taim wen di Izrel piipl dem did a go kom outa Iijip, an im did tel dem bout wa dem fi du wid im badi wen im ded.

By faith Moses, when he was born, was hidden by his parents for three months, because they saw he was a beautiful child, and they were not afraid of the king’s command.|Wen Muoziz did baan, kaaz im mada an faada chos iina Gad, dem aid im fi chrii mont kaaz dem si se di pikni did priti, an dem neehn fried a di laa we di king did mek.
By faith Moses, when he became of age, refused to be called the son of Pharaoh’s daughter|Siek-a ou Muoziz chos iina Gad wen im did get big, im neehn waahn nobadi kaal im Fiero daata pikni.

choosing rather to suffer affliction with the people of God than to enjoy thepleasures of sin for a time. |Im did prefa fi sofa wid Gad piipl dem, dan fi go av fon fi wan likl wail an miks op iina sin.

He esteemed the reproach of Christ as greater riches thanthe treasures in Egypt, for he looked to the reward.|Im did fiil se di sofarieshan we di wan we Gad sen fi siev piipl go chuu, wot muo dan aal a di rich sitn dem we de a Iijip. Im did fiil so, kaaz im yai did de pan di blesn dem we im did a-go get.

By faith he forsook Egypt, not fearing the wrath of the king. He endured by looking to Him who is invisible.|Siek-a ou im chos iina Gad, im lef Iijip an neehn fried se di king mait-a beks. An im neehn ton bak. Im uol aan pan di Gad we nobadi kyaahn si, laik se im kuda si im.

By faith he kept the Passover and the sprinkling of blood, lest the one who destroys the firstborn touch them.|Kaaz im chos iina Gad im did kom bring iin di Paasuova alidie an did mek di blod springkl pan di duor dem, so di Ienjel we kom fi kil wudn kil di fos bwai pikni dem fi di izrel piipl dem.

By faith they passed through the Red Sea as on dry land, which the Egyptians attempted to do, but were drowned.|Kaaz di piipl dem did chos iina Gad, dem did paas chuu di Red Sii laik se a jrai lan dem a waak pan, bot wen di Iijip piipl dem did chrai fi du dat tu, di uol a dem joun aaf.
By faith the walls of Jericho fell down after they were encircled for seven days.|Kaaz di piipl dem did chos iina Gad, Jeriko waal did jrap dong afta di piipl dem did maach roun it fi sevn die.

By faith the prostitute Rahab, when she received the spies with peace, did not perish with those who did not believe.|Rieyab we did sliip wid man fi moni, shi neehn ded wen di piipl dem we neva lisn Gad did a ded aaf. Shi neehn ded kaaz shi did chos iina Gad, an wen di chrienja dem kom fi spai out di siti, shi did tek dem iina ar ous an aid dem.

And what more shall I say? For time would fail me to tell of Gideon, Barak, Samson, Jephthah, of David and Samuel and the prophets|An wa els mi fi se? Kaaz mi naa no taim fi tel unu bout Gidiyan, Barak, Samsn, Jefta, Dievid, Samwel an di prafit dem.

who through faith subdued kingdoms, administered justice, obtained promises, stopped the mouths of lions|Siek-a ou dem chos iina Gad, dem fait waar gens konchri an win; som did inchaaj a piipl an dem ruul iina wan wie we rait iina Gad yai; an Gad gi dem wa im pramis fi gi dem tu. An kaaz dem chos iina Gad, dem shot laiyan mout so di laiyan dem no nyam dem.

quenched the violence of fire, escaped the edge of the sword, out of weakness were made strong, became valiant in fighting, and turned the armies of foreign enemies to flight.|Kaaz dem chos iina Gad, dem put out faiya we a bon red; an dem get we fram dem enimi we out fi tek suod kil dem aaf. Iivn duo dem wiik, dem get chrang. An dem get big an bad iina waar an mek aami we no kom fram bout de afi ron we.

Women received their dead raised to life again. Others were tortured and did not accept deliverance, so that they might obtain a better resurrection. |Uman get bak dem ded fambili, kaaz dem kom bak alaiv. Bot som ada wan, dem enimi did mek dem sofa bad bad, bot dem mek op dem main se dem naa go go frii. Da wie de, dem kyan kom bak alaiv an liv wan beta laif.

Still others had trials of mocking and scourging, and even chains and imprisonment.|So a dat apm tu som a dem kaaz dem chos iina Gad, bot yu av som ada wan — dem laaf aafa dem an tek wip biit dem. Som aal get tai op wid chien an lak op iina prizn tu.

They were stoned, they were sawn in two, were tempted, were slain with the sword. They wandered around in sheepskins and goatskins, while destitute, afflicted, and tormented.|Dem stuon som a dem, an tek saa kot dem iina tuu an yuuz suod kil dem aaf tu. Dem piipl de we sofa so, dem waak bout iina shiip skin an guot skin, dem neehn av no moni — dem did wel puor. Piipl mek dem sofa an did taament dem.

The world was not worthy of them. They wandered in deserts and mountains, in dens and caves of the earth.|Dem did tuu gud fi da worl ya! Dem go bout an liv iina dezot an op iina mountn, iina kiev an uol we de iina grong.

These all have obtained a good report through faith, but they did not receive the promise.|Di uol a dem chos iina Gad an so im did api wid dem. Bot non a dem stil neehn get di sitn dem yet we im did pramis.

For God provided something better for us, so that with us they would be made perfect.|Kaaz Gad did plan fi du sitn we wie wie beta fi wi, so wi an dem kyan bi aal a wa Gad waahn wi fi bi di siem taim.

Therefore, since we are encompassed with such a great cloud of witnesses, let us also lay aside every weight and the sin that so easily entangles us, and let us run with endurance the race that is set before us.|So laik ou wan kroud a piipl de aal bout roun wi, an dem shuo wi aredi ou fi chos iina Gad, wi afi dash aaf evriting we a sluo wi dong iina da ries ya. Di sin we tai op wi fut iizi iizi, wi afi dash dem aaf man, an ron di ries we de infronta wi an no wier out pan di wie.

Let us look to Jesus, the author and finisher of our faith, who for the joy that was set before Him endured the cross, despising the shame, and is seated at the right hand of the throne of God. |Wi fi kip wi yai lak pan Jiizas. A im fos shuo wi wa it miin fi chos iina Gad, an mek wi kyan chos im iina evri wie. Im nuo se im did a-go en op wel api, so im go chuu di sofarieshan an go ded pan di kraas, an im neehn bizniz se im did a du sitn we evribadi els wuda shiem fi du. Afta dat im galang go sidong a Gad rait an.

For consider Him who endured such hostility from sinners against Himself, lest you become weary and your hearts give up.|Unu fi luk pan Jiizas, luk ou di wikid sina dem chriit im wel bad, bot im uol aan an pres chuu siem wie. Unu fi tingk bout dat so unu no get taiyad an waahn gi op.
You have not yet resisted to bloodshed while striving against sin.|Unu a fait gens sin, bot unu neva yet fait so til blod staat ron.

And you have forgotten the exhortation addressed to you as sons:“My son, do not despise the discipline from the Lord,nor grow weary when you are rebuked by Him;|A memba unu no memba wen Gad did taak tu unu kaaz unu a im pikni, an tel unu tingz we mek unu aat chrang? Iihn?“Mi pikni, wen mi ponish unu fi mek unu si se unu du sitn rang,unu no fi tek it laik se a no notn,an no bada gi op kaaz mi rof unu op an set unu chriet
for whom the Lord loves He disciplines,and scourges every son whom He receives.|Mi rof op uu mi lov,an mi ponish evribadi we mi tek fi mi pikni.

Endure discipline; God is dealing with you as with sons. For what son is there whom a father does not discipline?|So, go chuu unu aad taim an tek it laik se unu a get chrietn out, kaaz wen Gad du dat a chriit im a chriit unu laik fi im uona pikni. An wich pikni unu fain we di faada no rof op an chrietn out? iihn?

If you are without discipline, of which everyone has partaken, then you are illegitimate children and not sons.|Ef unu no get rof op an chrietn out laik evri naamal pikni, den unu a baastad pikni, an unu wudn riili bi fi Gad pikni den.

Furthermore, we have had human fathers, and they corrected us, and we gave them reverence. Shall we not much more be subject to the Father of spirits and live?|Pan tap a dat, di uol a wi faada we de pan ort, dem rof wi op wen wi du rang, an wi rispek dem fi dat. Den a umoch muo so wi fi gi iin tu di faada we de a evn so wi kyan riili liv.

For they indeed disciplined us for a short time according to their own judgment, but He does so for our profit, that we may partake of His holiness.|Wi faada we de pan ort, dem ponish wi fi wan likl wail, an dem ponish wi ou dem tingk bes fi ponish wi. Bot Gad ponish wi fi wi uona gud, an a kaaz im waahn wi gud an kliin laka ou im gud an kliin mek im du dat.

Now no discipline seems to be joyful at the time, but grievous. Yet afterward it yields the peaceful fruit of righteousness in those who have been trained by it.|Nobadi neva eva tingk se it nais wen dem a get ponish di taim wen dem a get ponish — nuo sa, it at dem taim de man. Bot lieta dong it elp wi. Kaaz siek-a dat, wi lorn fi waak chriet an du di sitn dem we rait, plos it mek wi liv iina piis wid piipl.
Therefore lift up your tired hands, and strengthen your weak knees. |So lif op unu an dem we a jrap dong an mek unu wiik nii dem tan op chrang.

Make straight paths for your feet, lest that which is lame go out of joint, but rather be healed.|Waak pan ruod we chriet so di piipl dem uufa fut wiik an kyaahn waak gud, dem fut naa go get no wos, bot wi get beta.

Pursue peace with all men, and the holiness without which no one will see the Lord|Chrai aad fi liv iina piis wid evribadi, an chrai fi no dabl-dabl iina sin bot tan gud an kliin kaaz nobadi naa get fi si Gad ef dem no gud an kliin.

watching diligently so that no one falls short of the grace of God, lest any root of bitterness spring up to cause trouble, and many become defiled by it|Gad lov wi iivn duo wi no dizorv it, so mek shuor se nobadi no ton dem bak pan wa im du fi dem. An mek shuor se nobadi no galang laik bita ruut we gruo kom ton bita chrii. Dem piipl de wi kom kom mek chobl an brok out wan bag a piipl. Mek shuor se dat no apm.

lest there be any sexually immoral or profane person, as Esau, who for one morsel of food sold his birthright. |An mek shuor tu, se nobadi no kom liv no luus laif an naa no rispek fi Gad an Gad sitn dem laik Iisaa. Evriting we Iisaa wuda get, kaaz im a im faada fos bwai pikni, im gi we aal a dat fi wan dege-dege pliet a fuud.

For you know that afterward, when he wanted to inherit the blessing, he was rejected. For he found no place for repentance, though he sought it diligently with tears.|Yu nuo se likl muo fram dat wen im did waahn get da blesn de nou, dem ton im bak. Im kudn tek bak wa im did du, aal wen im kom a baal.

You have not come to a mountain that can be touched and that burned with fire, and to blackness and darkness and storm|A no laik di Izrel piipl dem wen dem did kech a Mount Sainai, unu no kom a no mountn we unu kyan toch, wich paat faiya a bon at, an di plies daak roun unu; no lait neehn de de an staam a bluo.

and to the sound of a trumpet and to a voice speaking words, such that those who heard them begged that the word not be spoken to them anymore.|Unu no kom kom ier wan chompit a bluo loud loud an wan vais a chat som wod de, so aal uu did ier beg fi no ier no muo. 20Kaaz dem kudn tan di ruul we dem did a ier: “Aal ef a wan animal toch di moutn, stuon im.”

For they could not endure that which was commanded: “If so much as a beast touches the mountain, it must be stoned or thrust through with a spear.”|Kaaz dem kudn tan di ruul we dem did a ier: “Aal ef a wan animal toch di moutn, stuon im.”
So terrible was the sight that Moses said, “I am terrified and trembling.|Az a matarafak wa did a gwaan did fraitn di piipl dem so moch, Muoziz se, “Mi a shiek di wie mi fried.”

But you have come to Mount Zion and to the city of the living God, the heavenly Jerusalem, and to an innumerable company of angels; |Insted-a dat, unu kom a Mount Zaiyan, di Jeruusilem we de a evn, di siti fi di Gad we mek piipl liv. Unu kom tu wan iip a ienjel we gyada de an we api so til.

to the general assembly and church of the firstborn, who are enrolled in heaven; to God, the Judge of all; and to the spirits of the righteous ones made perfect; |Unu kom wich paat di fos set a pikni we a fala Krais Jiizas gyada op. Fi dem niem don rait dong iina evn aredi. Unu kom tu Gad tu, we joj evribadi. An unu kom tu dem piipl de we du rait iina Gad yai. Gad don mek dem rait iina evri wie.

and to Jesus, the Mediator of a new covenant; and to the sprinkled blood that speaks better than that of Abel.|Unu kom tu Jiizas, di wan we iina di migl we mek di nyuu plan bitwiin Gad an piipl. An unu kom tu im blod, we ron an wash we sin, an da blod de tan fi sitn wie beta dan Iebl blod.

See that you do not refuse Him who is speaking. For if they did not escape when they refused Him who spoke on earth, much less shall we escape if we turn away from Him who speaks from heaven.|Wach out an mek shuor se unu no ton unu bak pan di wan we a chat! Kaaz ef dem neehn get we wen dem did ton dem bak pan di wan pan ort we waan dem, unu tingk se wi a-go get we ef wi ton wi bak pan di wan fram evn we a waan wi?

At that time His voice shook the earth, but now He has given us a promise, saying, “Yet once more I will shake not only the earth but also heaven.”|Wen im did taak da taim de, im vais did shiek op di ort, bot nou im pramis se, “Mi a-go shiek op di ort wan muo taim, bot da taim ya a no ort wan mi a-go shiek op, mi a-go shiek op evn tu.”

And this statement, “Yet once more,” signifies the removal of those things that can be shaken, things that are created, so that only those things that cannot be shaken will remain.|Nou wen im se, ‘wan muo taim,’ dat shuo se di sitn dem we get shiek op im a-go tek dem we, an dem sitn de a di tingz we im did mek. Im a-go du dat so wa kyaahn shiek op, kyan tan.

Therefore, since we are receiving a kingdom that cannot be moved, let us be gracious, by which we may serve God acceptably with reverence and godly fear.|So laik ou Gad a gi wi di rait fi ruul wid im, an dat a sitn we kyaahn shiek op, mek wi gi Gad tangks an yuuz dis an worship im iina wan wie we wi mek im api. Mek wi rispek im big taim.
For our God is a consuming fire.|Kaaz fi riil, wi Gad a laik wan faiya we bon op tingz.
Let brotherly love continue.
column2: Unu mos gwaan lov di breda an sista dem we biliiv iina Gad jos laik unu.

column1: Do not forget to entertain strangers, for thereby some have entertained angels unknowingly.|An no tap elp chrienja an tek dem iina unu ous, kaaz a so som piipl tek iin ienjel an no iivn nuo.

Remember those who are in chains, as if imprisoned with them, and those who are ill treated, since you are also in the body.|Unu fi memba di piipl dem we iina prizn, laik se unu iin de wid dem. An memba di piipl dem we a sofa tu, laik se a unu a sofa an a fiil di pien we dem a fiil.

Marriage is to be honored among everyone, and the bed undefiled. But God will judge the sexually immoral and adulterers.|Evribadi fi rispek marid laif, ozban an waif mosn go sliip wid nobadi els — dem fi kip dem bed kliin. Kaaz di piipl dem we dabl iina seks sin, an we sliip wid piipl dem no marid tu, Gad a-go joj dem.

Let your lives be without love of money, and be content with the things you have. For He has said:“I will never leave you,nor forsake you.”|Unu no fi lov moni. Unu fi satisfai wid wat-eva unu av, kaaz Gad se,“Mi naa go lef unu non at aal.Nuo mi naa lef unu fi fen fi unuself.”

So we may boldly say:“The Lord is my helper; I will not fear.What can man do to me?”|Dat mek wi shuor shuor wen wi se,“Di Laad a di wan we elp mi an mi naa go fried a notn.Wa nobadi kyan kom du mi, iihn?”

Remember those who rule over you, who have proclaimed to you the word of God. Follow their faith, considering the results it has produced in their lives.|Memba unu liida dem we tel unu bout Gad wod. Tingk bout wa did apm siek-a ou dem liv dem laif, an chos iina Gad jos laik dem.
Jesus Christ is the same yesterday, and today, and forever.|Jiizas Krais no chienj — siem wie ou im tan yeside, a so im tan tide an a siem so im a-go tan fi eva an eva.

Do not be carried away with diverse and strange doctrines. It is a good thing that the heart be strengthened with grace, not with foods, which have not profited those who have been occupied with them.|No mek di chrienj sitn dem we piipl go bout an a tiich mek unu chrie we. Kaaz a no ruul bout wa unu fi nyam an no nyam, mek di aat chrang. Bot a ou Gad lov wi so moch iivn duo wi no dizorv it — an a wan gud sitn dat. Di ruul dem bout wa piipl fi nyam neehn elp di piipl dem we did a fala dem.

We have an altar from which those who serve in the tabernacle have no right to eat.|Wi av wan alta, an di piipl dem we wok we di Juu dem worship dem naa no rait fi nyam non a di sitn dem we wi tek bon sakrifais a da alta de.

For the bodies of those beasts, whose blood is brought into the sanctuary by the high priest on account of sin, are burned outside the camp.|Kaaz di liida fi di priis dem tek di animal blod kyari go iina di Uoliyis Plies go gi fi sin aafrin. Bot di animal badi get bon op outsaida di kyamp.

Therefore Jesus also, so that He might sanctify the people with His own blood, suffered outside the gate.|A siem ting riich Jiizas. Im did sofa outsaida di kyamp tu, jos fi mek di piipl dem kliin fram sin wen im yuuz fi im uona blod.
Therefore let us go forth to Him outside the camp, bearing the reproach that He bore.|Wi fi galang outsaida di kyamp tu im den. Mek wi sofa an tek biit op, an tek di shiem we im did sofa tu.
For here we have no continuing city, but we seek one to come.|Kaaz wi naa no siti we a-go laas fi eva ya-so, bot wi a luk fi di siti we a-go kom.

Through Him, then, let us continually offer to God the sacrifice of praise, which is the fruit of our lips, giving thanks to His name. |So siek-a we Jiizas du, mek wi priez Gad aal di wail. Wen wi priez Gad so, a sakrifais wi a sen op gi im. A wi aafrin dat wi a gi wid wi mout, an dat shuo se wi chos iina im, an wi a se im a fi wi Laad.
But do not forget to do good and to share. For with such sacrifices God is well pleased.|An no figet fi du wa gud, an fi shier we unu av, kaaz Gad lov dem kain-a sakrifais de.

Obey your leaders and submit to them, for they watch over your souls as those who must give an account. Let them do this with joy and not complaining, for that would not be profitable to you.|Lisn wa unu liida dem se, an du wa dem tel unu fi du. Kaaz dem a-go afi ansa tu Gad an tel im bout ou dem did tek kier a unu. So du fi unu paat, so dem wi api fi du di wok an dem fies no afi lang dong, kaaz ef dat apm, dat naa go elp unu at aal.
Pray for us. For we trust that we have a good conscience and in all things are willing to live honestly.
column2: Prie fi wi. Wi shuor se wi kanchens naa bada wi an wi waahn liv rait iina evri wie.

column1: But I implore you to pray, that I may be restored to you very soon.|Beg unu du, prie iivn muo se mi wi kom bak tu unu suun suun.

Now may the God of peace, who through the blood of the eternal covenant brought again from the dead our Lord Jesus, the Great Shepherd of the sheep|Gad gi wi piis iina wi aat. Im tek di blod we mek di nyuu plan bitwiin wi an im laas fi eva, an mek di ed shepad fi di shiip dem kom bak alaiv — dat a wi Laad Jiizas Krais. Mi prie se di Gad, we du aal a dem sitn ya

make you perfect in every good work to do His will, working in you that which is pleasing in His sight, through Jesus Christ, to whom be glory forever and ever. Amen.|wi gi unu aal a di gud sitn dem we impuotant fi go du wa im waahn unu fi du. Mi prie tu se im wi mek wi ton aal a wa im waahn wi fi ton. An dis wi apm kaaz im wi mek Krais Jiizas du dat. Di piipl dem fi priez Krais Jiizas fi eva an eva an lif im op. Iemen.

I implore you, brothers, to heed this word of exhortation, for I have written to you in few words.|Nou breda an sista, mi a beg unu, bier wid di likl mesij we mi rait fi mek unu aat chrang, an no bada get beks, kaaz a no notn lang mi rait.

Know that our brother Timothy has been set free, with whom I shall see you if he comes soon.|Mi waahn unu nuo se wi breda Timoti get let outa jiel. Ef im suun kom, mi wi bring im wid mi wen mi kom luk fi unu.
Greet all those who rule over you and all the saints. Those from Italy greet you.
column2: Sen oudi tu aal a unu liida dem an aal a Gad piipl dem. Di wan dem fram Itali sen oudi tu.

column1: Grace be with you all. Amen.|Mi prie se Gad lov, we non a wi no dizorv, wi tan wid unu.

James, a servant of God and of the Lord Jesus Christ,To the twelve tribes which are scattered abroad:Greetings.|Da leta ya a kom fram Jiemz wan sliev fi Gad an di Laad Jiizas Krais. Mi a rait da leta ya tu di twelv chraib a Gad piipl dem wa skyata skyata aal uova di worl. Oudi tu aal a unu.
My brothers, count it all joy when you fall into diverse temptations|Mi breda an sista, unu fi wel api wen chobl an kraasiz tek unu.

knowing that the trying of your faith develops patience. |Kaaz unu nuo se dem sitn de kom fi tes unu fi si ef unu a-go stil chos iina Gad. Wen dem chobl de tek unu, ef unu gwaan chos iina Gad siem wie, unu wi kyan tan op chrang no mata wa.

But let patience perfect its work, that you may be perfect and complete, lacking nothing.|Unu fi gwaan uol aan chrang no mata wa apm an chos iina Gad so unu kyan bi aal we Gad waahn unu fi bi, an so unu wi no shaat a notn.

If any of you lacks wisdom, let him ask of God, who gives to all men liberally and without criticism, and it will be given to him.|Ef sumadi no waiz, aal dem afi du a aks Gad an im wi mek dem waiz, kaaz Gad naa go uol bak notn fram dem. Im wi gi dem wa dem aks fa so dem wi nuo se im lov dem.

But let him ask in faith, without wavering. For he who wavers is like a wave of the sea, driven and tossed with the wind. |Bot wen yu aks yu mos biliiv se Gad a-go gi yu we yu aks fa. Enibadi we aks Gad fi sopm an stil a wanda ef Gad gweehn gi dem, tan jos laik wen briiz a bluo sii waata an it jos a-go op an dong so.
Let not that man think that he will receive anything from the Lord.
column2: Sumadi laik dat no fi bada tingk se di Laad a-go gi im notn at aal.

column1: A double-minded man is unstable in all his ways.
