column2: Kaaz da man ya kyaahn mek op im main bout notn we im a du — wan minit im se sitn — di neks minit im chienj im main.

column1: Let the brother of low degree rejoice in that he is exalted
column2: Gad piipl dem we puor mos buos bout ou Gad lif dem op an put dem pan tap.

column1: but the rich in that he is made low, because as the flower of the grass he will pass away.|Bot di rich piipl dem mos buos bout ou Gad ombl dem, kaaz rich piipl a-go get bluo we laik wail flowaz.

For the sun rises with a burning heat and it withers the grass, and its flowers fall, and its beauty perishes. So will the rich man wither away in his ways.|Wen di son kom op an jrai op di plaant dem, di flowaz jrap aaf so it no priti no muo. A di siem ting a-go apm tu rich piipl we bizi a luk bout dem bizniz.

Blessed is the man who endures temptation, for when he is tried, he will receive the crown of life, which the Lord has promised to those who love Him.|Ef unu uol aan chrang an no gi op wen unu a go chuu chraiyal an kraasiz we kom fi tes unu, unu a-go wel api. Kaaz wen unu tes don, Gad gweehn gi unu di kroun a laif we im pramis fi gi evribadi we lov im.

Let no man say when he is tempted, “I am tempted by God,” for God cannot be tempted with evil; neither does He tempt anyone.|Wen yu fiil fi du sopm wa yu nuo se rang, no bada se a Gad mek yu fiil fi du it. Kaaz nobadi kyaahn presha Gad fi du wa rang, an Gad no presha nobadi fi du wa rang niida.

But each man is tempted when he is drawn away by his own lust and enticed.|Bot wen sumadi fiil fi du wa rang, a siek-a di wikid sitn we iina dem aat. Di sitn dem iina dem aat presha dem fi du wa rang.

Then, when lust has conceived, it brings forth sin; and when sin is finished, it brings forth death.|Afta dem don plan, di wikid sitn dem tek kanchuol a dem an mek dem sin. An wen sin don wid dem, it kil dem.
Do not err, my beloved brothers. |Mi breda an sista, no fuul unuself.

Every good gift and every perfect gift is from above and comes down from the Father of lights, with whom is no change or shadow of turning.|Evri gud sitn — di sitn dem we no av notn bad bout dem — kom fram Faada Gad we mek aal a di lait dem we iina di skai. Bot im no tan laik di lait dem we im mek. Dem eva a chienj, bot im no chienj op chienj op.

Of His own will He brought us forth with the word of truth, that we should be a kind of first fruits of His creatures.|Gad mek op im main fi gi wi nyuu laif, so im sen wi di chuu mesij, so wi kuda komiin laik di fos set a fuud fram di fiil fi im.
Therefore, my beloved brothers, let every man be swift to hear, slow to speak, and slow to anger|Mi breda an sista, ier wa mi a se, unu mos kwik fi ier an sluo fi taak ar get beks.
for the anger of man does not work the righteousness of God. |Kaaz wen unu get beks, unu kyaahn du di gud sitn dem we Gad waahn unu fi du.

Therefore lay aside all filthiness and remaining wickedness and receive with meekness the engrafted word, which is able to save your souls.|So unu fi get rid a aal a di naasi an torbl sitn dem we so nof bout di plies. Ombl unuself an tek iin di mesij we Gad put iina unu aat we kyan siev unu laif.
Be doers of the word and not hearers only, deceiving yourselves.|Unu no fi onggl ier Gad mesij — unu fi du wa it se! Ef unu onggl a lisn an naa du wa Gad se, unu onggl a fuul unuself.

For if anyone is a hearer of the word and not a doer, he is like a man viewing his natural face in a mirror. |Ef nobadi ier di mesij an no du wa it se, dem komiin laik wan man we luk pan imself iina wan lukin glaas, si wa im luk laik
He views himself, and goes his way, and immediately forgets what kind of man he was. |an afta im don luk, im go we an no memba a ting we im luk laik.

But whoever looks into the perfect law of liberty, and continues in it, and is not a forgetful hearer but a doer of the work, this man will be blessed in his deeds.|Bot ef nobadi tek a gud luk iina di Laa we rait iina evri wie, an wa set piipl frii, ef im gwaan du wa it se an no figet it — a im a-go get bles.

If anyone among you seems to be religious and does not bridle his tongue, but deceives his own heart, this man’s religion is vain. |Ef nobadi tingk se im a sorv Gad di rait wie, bot im kyaahn kanchuol im tong, im jos a fuul imself, an we im se im a du fi Gad no wot notn.

Religion that is pure and undefiled before God, the Father, is this: to visit the fatherless and widows in their affliction and to keep oneself unstained by the world.|Di kain-a wok we gud an kliin iina Faada Gad yai a dis: elp di pikni dem uufa faada an mada dem ded an we a sofa, an di uman dem we ozban ded an we a sofa tu, an kip we fram di wikid sitn dem we iina di worl.

My brothers, have faith in our Lord Jesus Christ, the Lord of glory, without partiality.|Mi breda an sista, sins unu se unu chos iina wi powaful Laad Jiizas Krais, unu kyaahn chriit som piipl beta dan som.

For if a man with a gold ring, in fine clothing, comes into your assembly, and also a poor man in ragged clothing comes in|Ef sumadi iina buosi kluoz an wan guol ring kom a unu choch, an wan puo sumadi we av aan uol kluoz kom iin tu

and you have respect for him who wears the fine clothing and say to him, “Sit here in a good place,” and say to the poor, “Stand there,” or “Sit here under my footstool,”|an unu chriit di wan iina fansi kluoz speshal an tel im se, “Sidong a da nais siit ya,” bot tel di puo wan se, “yu tan op uova de-so,” ar “sidong ya-so pan di fluor a mi fut,”
have you not then become partial among yourselves and become judges with evil thoughts?|ef unu du dat, no paashal unu paashal? Dat shuo se unu tek said an a joj piipl rang.

Listen, my beloved brothers. Has God not chosen the poor of this world to be rich in faith and heirs of the kingdom which He has promised to those who love Him?|Mi breda an sista, ier wa mi a se. No Gad pik di puo piipl iina di worl fi bles dem kaaz dem biliiv iina im? Im pik dem fi tek paat iina im kindom wa im pramis fi gi aal uu lov im.

But you have despised the poor. Do not rich men oppress you and drag you before the judgment seats? |Bot unu shiem puo piipl. Tel mi sopm, no di siem rich piipl dem a presha unu an a jrag unu go a kuot ous?
Do they not blaspheme that worthy name by which you are called?
column2: No dem siem wan a chat aal saat a torbl sitn buot di Wan we wi bilang tu gud niem?

column1: If you fulfill the royal law according to the Scripture, “You shall love your neighbor as yourself,” you are doing well.|A gud sitn ef unu fala di Laa we aiya dan eni ada laa, an we rait dong iina Gad wod se, “Unu fi lov unu nieba siem laik ou unu lov unuself.”
But if you show partiality, you are committing sin and are convicted by the law as sinners|Bot ef unu chriit som piipl beta dan som, a sin dat, unu a brok di Laa.
For whoever shall keep the whole law and yet offend in one point is guilty of breaking the whole law. |Kaaz iivn ef unu kip aal a di Laa dem an onggl brok wan, unu brok di uol a dem siem wie.

For He who said, “Do not commit adultery,” also said, “Do not kill.” Now if you do not commit adultery, yet you kill, you have become a lawbreaker.|Kaaz di siem wan we tel wi se, “No sliip wid sumadi we a no yu waif ar yu ozban,” tel wi se, “No morda.” So iivn ef wi no sliip wid sumadi we a no wi waif, ar wi ozban, bot wi morda sumadi, wi brok di uol Laa siem wie.
So speak and so do as those who will be judged by the law of liberty.
column2: Wi mos taak an gwaan laik piipl we di Laa a-go joj. An a di sed Laa a-go set wi frii

column1: For he who has shown no mercy will have judgment without mercy, for mercy triumphs over judgment.|kaaz piipl we no paadn nobadi, naa go get no paadn pan jojment die. Ef unu paadn piipl unu wi get frii fram jojment.

What does it profit, my brothers, if a man says he has faith but has no works? Can faith save him?|Mi breda an sista, wa sens unu tingk it mek ef sumadi se dem biliiv sopm, bot no du di sitn dem we wi shuo se dem riili biliiv? Unu tingk dem kyan get siev da wie de?
If a brother or sister is naked and lacking daily food
column2: Ef unu si wan a unu breda ar sista niekid an onggri

column1: and one of you says to them, “Depart in peace, be warmed and filled,” and yet you give them nothing that the body needs, what does it profit?|no bada jos tel im se, “Gad bles yu yu ier. Mek shuor yu tan waam an kip yu beli ful.” Unu tingk dat kyan elp im ef unu no gi im notn at aal?
So faith by itself, if it has no works, is dead.|A siem so ef unu se unu biliiv sopm an no av no akshan fi bak it op, wa unu se unu biliiv no wot notn — it no mek no sens.

But a man may say, “You have faith and I have works.”Show me your faith without your works, and I will show you my faith by my works.|18Bot sumadi wi se, “Wan sumadi biliiv iina Jiizas, an wan neks sumadi du gud wok.” Bot mi wuda ansa im se, “Aarait den, shuo mi ou nobadi kyan biliiv iina Jiizas an no du gud wok, an mi wi shuo yu se mi biliiv iina Jiizas an a dat mek mi du di gud sitn dem we mi du.”
You believe that there is one God; you do well. The demons also believe and tremble.
column2: Yu biliiv se a onggl wan Gad de — gud! Aal di diiman dem biliiv dat an chrimbl.

column1: But do you want to be shown, O foolish man, that faith without works is dead? |Ou unu so fuul-fuul! Unu waahn mi shuo unu se, ef sumadi se dem biliiv sopm bot no av no wok fi bak op wa im se im biliiv, it no wot notn?

Was not Abraham our father justified by works when he offered his son Isaac on the altar? |Aarait, unu memba ou Gad did tes an pruuv se faada Iebriyam did riili biliiv iina im? Iebriyam did put im bwai pikni Aizak pan di alta fi kil im an bon sakrifais gi Gad.
Do you see how faith worked with his works, and by works faith was made perfect? |So unu si se wa Iebriyam du shuo se im riili biliiv Gad.

The Scripture was fulfilled which says, “Abraham believed God, and it was reckoned to him as righteousness,”and he was called the friend of God.|So it apm jos laik wa Gad wod did se, “Iebriyam biliiv iina Gad, an Gad se im eva du di rait sitn.” A so Iebriyam kom fi bi Gad fren.
You see then how by works a man is justified, and not by faith only.|So unu si se Gad wi se sumadi a liv rait, no jos chuu dem se dem biliiv iina im, bot kaaz dem du wa im se dem fi du.

Likewise, was not Rahab the prostitute justified by works when she received the messengers and sent them out another way?|A di siem wie Rieyab we did sliip wid piipl fi moni, did du we rait iina Gad yai wen shi tek iin di Izrel spai dem an sen dem we wan neda wie.

As the body without the spirit is dead, so faith without works is dead.|So siem laik ou di badi ded an no wot notn wen di spirit lef it, a siem so it no wot notn wen sumadi se dem biliiv iina Gad an no du di wok wa shuo se dem riili biliiv.

My brothers, not many of you should become teachers, knowing that we shall receive the greater judgment. |Mi breda an sista, nof a unu no fi ron go chrai ton tiicha, kaaz unu nuo se wi we a tiicha a-go get joj aada.

We all err in many ways. But if any man does not err in word, he is a perfect man and able also to control the whole body.|Aal a wi du rang sitn nof taim. Bot ef sumadi neva se notn rang yet dem no av no sin at aal. Kaaz ef nobadi kyan kanchuol dem tong dem kyan kanchuol dem uol badi tu.

See how we put bits in the mouths of horses that they may obey us, and we control their whole bodies.|Wen wi waahn kanchuol wan aas, wi put wan bit iina im mout. Da wie de wi kyan ton im eni wie wi waahn im fi go.

And observe ships. Though they are so great and are driven by fierce winds, yet they are directed with a very small rudder wherever the captain pleases.|Luk ou ship big, bot di kyaptin yuuz wan likl stierin ton it eniwe im waahn it fi go, iivn duo a chrang briiz a bluo it.

Even so, the tongue is a little part of the body and boasts great things. See how great a forest a little fire kindles. |A siem so piipl tong tan. Iivn duo di tong a wan likl likl paat a dem badi, it kyan chat big buosi chat, an kaaz nof chobl fi ada piipl. Tingk buot ou wan likl gyash a faiya kyan bon dong wan uol faris.

The tongue is a fire, a world of evil. The tongue is among the parts of the body, defiling the whole body, and setting the course of nature on fire, and it is set on fire by hell.|Iivn duo di tong a paat a wi badi, it komiin laik wan torbl faiya. It ful op a wikid powa we kyan mes op yu uol laif an put yu iina so moch chobl dat it komiin laik aal el brok luus pan yu, kaaz di tong komiin laik it set pan faiya we kom chriet fram el.

All kinds of beasts, and birds, and serpents, and things in the sea are tamed or have been tamed by mankind.|Piipl kyan chrien aal kain-a animal: wail animal, bod, animal we kraal pan di grong an animal we liv iina di sii — piipl chrien dem animal de aal di taim.

But no man can tame the tongue. It is an unruly evil, full of deadly poison.|Bot nobadi kyaahn kanchuol di tong. It bizi-badi, wikid an ful-a paizn fi kil aaf piipl. Nobadi kyaahn kanchuol it at aal at aal.

With it we bless the Lord and Father, and with it we curse men, who are made in the image of God.|Di siem tong we wi yuuz fi priez Faada Gad, a di siem tong wi a yuuz fi kos aaf piipl we Gad mek fi tan laik imself.

Out of the same mouth proceed blessing and cursing. My brothers, these things ought not to be so. |Di mout we wi a yuuz fi priez Gad a di siem mout wi a yuuz fi kos out piipl. Mi breda an sista, notn kyaahn go so.
Does a spring yield at the same opening sweet and bitter water?|Ou fresh waata an saalt waata fi kom outa di siem spring, iihn?

Can the fig tree, my brothers, bear olives, or a vine, figs? So no spring can yield both salt water and fresh water.|Breda an sista, fig chrii kyan bier aliv fruut? Griep vain kyan bier fig? Saalt spring kyaahn sen out fresh waata mi breda an sista!

Who is wise and understanding among you? Let him show his works by his good life in the meekness of wisdom.|Enibadi mongks unu waiz an av sens? Ef unu liv gud, ombl unuself an du wa rait, dat wi shuo se unu waiz.

But if you have bitter envying and strife in your hearts, do not boast and do not lie against the truth.|Bot ef unu aat bita, an unu bad main an onggl a fait fi av unu uona wie, no bada buos bout unuself an ton we fram di chuut, kaaz wen unu du dat unu a mek di chuut luk laik se a lai.

This wisdom descends not from above, but is earthly, unspiritual, and devilish. |Wa dem de piipl de kaal waiz no kom fram evn. Wa dem kaal waiz kom fram di worl, an no av notn fi du wid di Spirit — it kom fram di devl.
For where there is envying and strife, there is confusion and every evil work.|Eniwe yu fain piipl we onggl tingk bout demself an we bad main, yu fain chobl, kanfyuuzhan, an aal kain-a wikidnis tu.

But the wisdom that is from above is first pure, then peaceable, gentle, open to reason, full of mercy and good fruits, without partiality, and without hypocrisy.|Bot unu si di piipl dem we Gad mek waiz, fos ting bout dem, dem aat kliin, dem a no waar-buot, dem kier bout ada piipl, an dem no aad-iez. Dem kwik fi paadn piipl we du dem rang, an dem aalwiez du we rait. Dem no paashal an dem a no ipokrit niida.

And the fruit of righteousness is sown in peace by those who make peace.|Jos laik ou wen wan faama plaant gud siid im riip gud krap, a siem so di wan dem we du wa gud an liv iina piis wi mek ada piipl du wa gud an liv iina piis tu. An dat wi kaaz evribadi fi liv gud wid dem wan aneda tu.

Where do wars and fights among you come from? Do they not come from your lusts that war in your body?|Mi breda an sista, wa unu tingk a kaaz unu fi a waar an chries aaf unu wan aneda? No di sitn dem we iina unu aat we unu wel waahn an a fait aad aad fi get, iivn duo unu nuo se dem no rait?

You lust and do not have, so you kill. You desire to have and cannot obtain. You fight and war. Yet you do not have, because you do not ask.|Unu waahn sitn we unu no av bot unu kyaahn get it. Unu grojful an red yai an wi iivn kil fi get wa unu waahn! Bot unu stil kyaahn get we unu waahn kaaz unu no aks Gad fi it.

You ask, and do not receive, because you ask amiss, that you may spend it on your passions.|Iivn wen unu aks Gad, unu stil no get wa unu aks fa, kaaz unu a aks fi di rang riizn. Unu jos waahn dem sitn de fi big op unu ches an fi mek unu fiil impuotant.

You adulterers and adulteresses, do you not know that the friendship with the world is enmity with God? Whoever therefore will be a friend of the world is the enemy of God.|Unu komiin laik piipl we sliip wid ada piipl waif an ozban! Unu no nuo se piipl we lov di worl iet Gad? So enibadi we mek di worl dem fren mek Gad dem enimi.

Do you think that the Scripture says in vain, “He yearns jealously for the spirit that lives in us”?|Wen Gad wod se, “Di spirit we Gad put iina wi jelos bad an wel waahn wi fi kip tu Gad wan” — unu tingk se it se dat fi notn?

But He gives more grace. For this reason it says:“God resists the proud,but gives grace to the humble.”|Bot muo dan notn els, Gad gud an kain tu wi. A dat mek Gad wod se,“Gad kaaz buosi piipl plan fi mash opbot im gud an kain tu piipl we ombl demself.”
Therefore submit yourselves to God. Resist the devil, and he will flee from you.|So ton tu Gad an no du notn we di devl waahn unu fi du. Tan op chrang chrang gens im, an im wi ron we fram unu.

Draw near to God, and He will draw near to you. Cleanse your hands, you sinners, and purify your hearts, you double-minded.|Jraa nier Gad, an Gad wi jraa nier unu. Sina kliin op unu laif. An unu we kyaahn mek op unu main, kliin op fi unu aat tu.
Grieve and mourn and weep. Let your laughter be turned to mourning, and your joy to ­dejection.|Baal, muon, gruon, an ala. Tap kin unu tiit an staat baal. No bada fiil api, a sad unu fi sad.
Humble yourselves in the sight of the Lord, and He will lift you up.|So ombl unuself infronta Gad, an du evriting we im se unu fi du an im wi big unu op.

Do not speak evil of one another, brothers. He who speaks evil of his brother and judges his brother speaks evil of the law and judges the law. If you judge the law, you are not a doer of the law, but a judge. |Mi breda an sista, no taak bad sitn buot wan aneda! Ef unu du dat ar joj piipl an gwaan laik se Gad kyaahn paadn dem, unu a se Gad Laa no gud. An ef unu se di Laa no gud unu a gwaan laik se a unu a joj uova di Laa.

There is one Lawgiver who is able to save and to destroy. Who are you to judge another?|Bot a onggl wan sumadi gi di Laa, an a im a di onggl joj. A im kyan siev piipl an im kyan sen dem go ded tu. So uu unu tingk unu bi fi a joj nobadi?

Come now, you who say, “Today or tomorrow we will go into this city, spend a year there, buy and sell, and make a profit,”|Nou lisn tu mi, aal a unu we se, “Tide ar tumaro wi a-go wok fi wan ier iina da toun ya, ar iina da toun de an mek som moni.”

whereas you do not know what will happen tomorrow. What is your life? It is just a vapor that appears for a little while and then vanishes away.|Bot wa unu nuo buot tumaro? Unu no iivn nuo ou unu laif a-go go tumaro. Unu laif komiin jos laik fag. Di fag kom dong fi likl bit, an den az di son kom out so, di fag jos disapier.

Instead you ought to say, “If the Lord wills, we shall live and do this or that.”|So a no so unu fi taak. Unu fi se, “Ef di Laad waahn wi fi du dis, ar ef di Laad waahn wi fi du dat, den wi wi liv an du dis, ar du dat.”
But now you are rejoicing in your boastings. All such rejoicing is evil.|Bot unu a buos an a brag bout fi unu plan dem, an fi a buos dem wie de no gud — a wikidnis dat.
Therefore, to him who knows to do good and does not do it, it is sin.|So enibadi we nuo di rait sitn we dem fi du an no du it, a sin dem a sin.
Come now, you rich men, weep and howl for your miseries that shall come upon you.|Lisn tu mi, unu rich piipl, ala an baal kaaz som torbl sitn a-go apm tu unu!
Your riches are corrupted and your garments are moth-eaten. |Unu moni an aal a unu nais sitn dem ratn aaf, an insek a nyam op nyam op unu dier kluoz dem.

Your gold and silver are corroded, and their corrosion will be a witness against you and will eat your flesh like fire. You have stored up treasures for the last days.|Unu guol an unu silva dem get rosti, an dem a-go joj unu an shuo se unu gilti. Dem a-go nyam op unu flesh jos laik se a faiya a bon unu op. Unu pak op wan uol iip a moni an nais sitn iina dem taim ya wen di worl suun don.

Indeed the wages that you kept back by fraud from the laborers who harvested your fields are crying, and the cries of those who harvested have entered into the ears of the Lord of Hosts.|Lisn tu mi! Unu rab di piipl dem we wok pan unu faam an no pie dem we dem wok fa. Nou dem pie we unu tiif aaf a baal out gens unu tu di Laad we ruul uova evriting.

You have lived in pleasure on the earth and have been wayward. You have nourished your hearts as in a day of slaughter. |Unu a liv big laif pan ort. Unu get evriting unu waahn fi mek unu api. Bot rait ya nou, unu komiin laik dem big fat kou we dem a kyari go a bucha shap fi go kil.
You have condemned and killed the righteous man who does not resist you.|Unu mek joj rait aaf piipl we no du notn rang se dem gilti, an morda dem. An dem kudn iivn tan op fi demself gens unu.

Therefore be patient, brothers, until the coming of the Lord. Notice how the farmer waits for the precious fruit of the earth and is patient with it until he receives the early and late rain.|Mi breda an sista, no gi op, jos wiet til di Laad kom. Tingk bout ou wan faama afi wiet lang fi di soma an di spring rien fi mek im fiil gruo.
You also be patient. Establish your hearts, for the coming of the Lord is drawing near. |A siem so unu fi tan todi an no gi op, kaaz Gad suun kom.

Do not grumble against one another, brothers, lest you be condemned. Look, the Judge is standing at the door.|Mi breda an sista, no bada grombl grombl bout wan aneda, ar Gad wi joj unu. An luk, di joj tan op rait a di duor.

My brothers, take the prophets, who spoke in the name of the Lord, as an example of suffering and patience.|Mi breda an sista, ef unu waahn fi nuo ou fi riili wiet pan di Laad iivn wen unu a sofa, luk pan Gad prafit dem we gi out im mesij. Dem neva gi op, iivn wen dem did a go chuu nof chobl.

Indeed we count them happy who endure. You have heard of the patience of Job and have seen the purpose of the Lord, that the Lord is very gracious and merciful.|Lisn tu mi, wi se di wan dem we tan op chrang fi Gad, a dem bles. Unu memba ou Juob did tan op chrang fi Gad chuu aal a di torbl sitn dem we im sofa? Unu memba ou Gad elp im, an kyari im chuu. Di Laad du aal a dem sitn de kaaz a ou im jengkl an gud an kain.

But above all things, my brothers, do not swear, either by heaven or by the earth or by any other oath. But let your “Yes” be “Yes” and your “No” be “No,” that you do not fall into condemnation.|Bot mi breda an sista, ef unu no memba notn els, memba dis, no swier non at aal. No swier an kaal pan evn, ar no swier an kaal pan ort, ar no swier an kaal pan notn at aal. Jos mek shuor se wen unu se “yes,” unu miin yes, an wen unu se “no,” a no unu miin. Da wie de unu wi no kaal dong Gad jojment pan unuself.
Is anyone among you suffering? Let him pray. Is anyone merry? Let him sing psalms.|Ef non a unu a sofa an av prablem, unu fi prie. Ef non a unu api, unu fi sing an priez Gad.

Is anyone sick among you? Let him call for the elders of the church, and let them pray over him, anointing him with oil in the name of the Lord. |Non a unu sik? Aks di choch liida dem fi kom prie fi unu. Mek dem put aliv ail pan unu an kaal pan di Laad niem.

And the prayer of faith will save the sick, and the Lord will raise him up. And if he has committed any sins, he will be forgiven.|An wen di choch liida dem prie tu di Laad an biliiv se im ier dem, dem prieya a-go mek di sik sumadi get beta. Di Laad a-go mek dem get beta, an ef dem did sin, im a-go paadn dem.

Confess your faults to one another and pray for one another, that you may be healed. The effective, fervent prayer of a righteous man accomplishes much.|Ef unu sin, unu fi tel wan aneda wa unu du, an prie fi wan aneda so unu kyan get beta. Wen sumadi we liv rait prie, im prieya ful op a powa an wi mek gud sitn apm.

Elijah was a man subject to natural passions as we are, and he prayed earnestly that it might not rain, and it did not rain on the earth for three years and six months.|Ilaija a did jos wan man laik enibadi els. Im prie aad aad an aks Gad no fi mek no rien faal. An fi chrii an a aaf ier, no iivn wan jrap a rien neehn faal pan di lan.
And he prayed again, and the sky gave rain, and the earth brought forth its fruit.|Den im prie agen an aks Gad fi sen rien, an rien faal so dat di lan bier nof fuud.
Brothers, if any one of you strays from the truth and someone corrects him|Mi breda an sista, ef nobadi mongks unu chrie fram Gad chuu mesij an wan a unu elp im kom bak
let him know that he who converts the sinner from the error of his way will save a soul from death and will cover a multitude of sins.
column2: memba dis: di wan we elp im kom bak a-go siev im so im no ded an im wi get paadn fi di uol iip a rang we im du.

column1: Paul, a servant of God and an apostle of Jesus Christ, according to the faith of God’s elect and the knowledge of the truth which leads to godliness|Taitos, dis a Paal, wan sliev fi Gad an wan a Jiizas apasl. Gad sen mi fi tiich im piipl dem ou fi biliiv iina im muor an fi elp dem andastan Gad wod beta. Im waahn mi fi tiich dem di chuut so dat dem wi liv ou im waahn dem fi liv.

in hope of eternal life which God, who cannot lie, promised before the world began|An wen dem andastan Gad wod it wi gi dem sopm fi luk faawod tu. Dem wi luk fi si an nuo fi shuor se Gad wi mek dem liv fi eva. Kaaz lang bifuo di worl did mek Gad pramis fi mek wi liv fi eva, an Gad no lai.

and has in due time revealed His word through preaching, with which I was entrusted according to the command of God our Savior|Wen di taim did rait, di Gad we siev wi, mek mi nuo bout da pramis ya an im sen mi fi go tel evribadi bout it.

To Titus, my own son in the common faith:Grace, mercy, and peace, from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ our Savior.|Taitos, mi lef yu a Kriit so yu kuda saat out aal di sitn dem we did lef fi du, an fi pik elda put iina evri toun, laik mi did se.

For this reason I left you in Crete, that you should set in order the things that are lacking, and appoint elders in every city, as I commanded you:|Taitos, mi lef yu a Kriit so yu kuda saat out aal di sitn dem we did lef fi du, an fi pik elda put iina evri toun, laik mi did se.

any man who is blameless, the husband of one wife, having faithful children who are not accused of being wild or unruly.|Wan elda mos liv im laif so dat nobadi kyaahn se notn bad bout im. Im mos onggl av wan waif an im pikni dem fi biliiv iina Jiizas. Im pikni dem no fi wail ar go gens wa dem mada an faada se bot mos aalwiez shuo dem rispek.

For an overseer must be blameless, as a steward of God, not self-willed, not easily angered, not given to drunkenness, not violent, not greedy for dishonest gain|Sins di elda a-go inchaaj a Gad wok, im afi bi sumadi we di piipl dem kyan rispek an no av notn bad fi se bout. Im no fi ful-a imself, kwik fi get beks an im no fi lov waar niida. Im no fi lov jringk tu moch an im no fi lov ron dong moni.

but hospitable, a lover of what is good, self-controlled, just, holy, temperate|Insted-a dat, di elda mos uopm op im ous tu piipl, lov du gud sitn an im aat mos kliin. Im mos fier tu evribadi an im mos nuo ou fi kanchuol imself an du we im nuo iina im main rait an no fala wa im badi waahn fi du.

holding firmly the trustworthy word that is in accordance with the teaching, that he may be able both to exhort with sound doctrine and to convince those who oppose it.|Di elda mos uol aan chrang pan di riil mesij bout Jiizas, we wi tiich. Im afi du dis so im kyan tiich piipl di rait sitn an karek di wan dem we a tiich di rang sitn.

For there are many unruly men, empty talkers and deceivers, especially those of the circumcision|Kaaz nof piipl de bout we naa no rispek fi dem we iina powa. Dem de piipl de lov taak fuulinish an chrai fi mek piipl biliiv wa dem se, an a di Juu dem gwaan so di muos.

who must be silenced, who subvert whole houses by teaching for dishonest gain things they ought not teach. |Yu mos shot dem op; tap dem fram taak fuulinish. Kaaz dem a kaaz aal wan uol-a fambili fi ton we fram di chuut siek-a di sitn dem we dem a tiich. Dem a tiich tingz we dem no fi tiich an dem a du it so dem kyan mek moni.

One of them, a prophet of their own, said, “The Cretans are always liars, evil beasts, and idle gluttons!”|Iivn wan a dem uona prafit dem taak bad bout dem. Im se, “Di Kriitan dem eva a tel lai. Dem liezi an krabit laik. Dem gwaan laik se dem a som wikid wail animal.”

This witness is true. So rebuke them sharply that they may be sound in the faith|Im neva did a lai wen im se so. Dat miin se yu afi set dem chriet an karek dem aad aad, so dat dem wi biliiv iina di chuut
not paying attention to Jewish myths and commandments of men who reject the truth. |an no fala di mek op tuori we di Juu dem av, ar fala baka piipl we go gens Gad wod.

To the pure, all things are pure. But to those who are defiled and unbelieving, nothing is pure. Even their minds and consciences are defiled. |Evriting kliin fi di piipl we aat kliin an uufa main no ful-a sin. Bot notn no kliin fi di wan dem we mek sin ruul dem an we no biliiv. Fi dem aat an main doti.

They profess that they know God, but in their deeds they deny Him, being abominable, disobedient, and worthless for every good work.|Dem se dem nuo Gad, bot dem no gwaan laik se dem nuo im. Dem de kain-a piipl de sik Gad tumok. Dem no du wa im se an dem so woklis dat dem kyaahn du notn gud.
But as for you, teach what is fitting of sound doctrine: |Taitos, yu afi tiich wa rait; yu afi tiich di chuut.

Older men should be sober, serious, temperate, sound in faith, in love, in patience.|Tel di uolda man dem se dem no fi go uova buod wid notn. Dem fi kanchuol demself an liv so piipl kyan rispek dem. Di uolda man dem fi eva chrang iina wa dem biliiv, aalwiez shuo lov an neva gi op.

Likewise, older women should be reverent in behavior, and not be false accusers, not be enslaved to much wine, but teachers of good things|A siem so di uolda uman dem fi liv laik uman we se dem a fala Gad. Dem no fi tel lai ar taak bad bout ada piipl. Dem no fi lov wain so til dem kyaahn tap jringk it niida. Di uolda uman dem fi tiich wa gud.
that they may teach the young women to love their husbands, to love their children|Kaaz a so di yongga wan dem wi lorn fi lov dem ozban an dem pikni.

and to be self-controlled, pure, homemakers, good, obedient to their own husbands, that the word of God may not be dishonored.|Dem wi lorn ou fi ron dem ous. Di uolda uman dem wi elp di yongga wan dem lorn ou fi kanchuol demself, liv wan gud an kliin laif, an fi fala wa dem ozban se. So dat nobadi kyaahn se notn bad bout Gad wod.
Likewise, exhort young men to be self-controlled|Push di yongga man dem fi kanchuol demself tu.

in all things presenting yourself as an example of good works: in doctrine showing integrity, gravity, incorruptibility|Yu, Taitos, mek shuor se yu eva a du gud sitn an liv rait, so piipl wi si ou yu liv an fala wa yu du. Wen yu tiich mek shuor se yu taak di chuut an tek it siiros.

and sound speech that cannot be condemned, so that the one who opposes you may be ashamed, having nothing evil to say of you.|Mek shuor se wa yu a tiich a riili Gad wod we nobadi kyaahn taak gens. Da wie de di piipl dem we go gens yu wi shiem kaaz dem kyaahn se notn bad bout wi.

Exhort servants to be obedient to their own masters, to please them well in everything, not answering back|Tiich di sliev dem fi lisn an fala wa dem maasta se aal di taim. Dem fi du dem bes fi mek dem maasta api iina aal we dem du. Tel di sliev dem no fi bak ansa dem maasta niida

or stealing, but showing complete fidelity, so that they may exemplify the doctrine of God our Savior in all things.|ar tiif fram dem. Dem fi anis an shuo di piipl dem se dem kyan chos dem. Wen dem du dis, piipl wi luk pan dem an rispek wa wi tiich bout wi sievya Faada Gad.
For the grace of God that brings salvation has appeared to all men
column2: Gad shuo ou im lov wi iivn duo wi no dizorv it wen im mek wan wie fi piipl get siev.

column1: teaching us that, denying ungodliness and worldly desires, we should live soberly, righteously, and in godliness in this present world|Di gud we im du fi wi, tiich wi ou fi ton we fram wikidnis an fi no lov di sitn dem we di worliyan dem waahn.
as we await the blessed hope and the appearing of the glory of our great God and Savior Jesus Christ
column2: It a tiich wi wail wi wiet an luk faawod fi di die wen wi laad an sievya Jiizas Krais kom bak iina aal a im powa.

column1: who gave Himself for us, that He might redeem us from all lawlessness and purify for Himself a special people, zealous of good works.|Im a di wan we gi op im laif fi siev wi fram aal kain-a wikidnis an mek wi kliin so wi kuda bi im piipl; piipl we eva a chrai fi du gud.

Teach these things, exhort, and rebuke with all authority. Let no one despise you.|Mek shuor se yu tel evribadi dem sitn ya. Yuuz di powa we Gad gi yu fi push di piipl dem fi fala di chuut an fi karek dem. An no mek nobadi put yu dong ar se yu a wan bad tiicha an no pie yu no main.

Remind them to be subject to rulers and authorities, to obey them, to be ready for every good work|Mek shuor di piipl dem memba se dem fi rispek an fala di ruula dem fi di konchri an di piipl dem we iina powa; dem fi lisn, fala an eva redi fi du aal kain-a gud sitn.

to speak evil of no one, not to be contentious, but gentle, showing all humility toward everyone.|Dem no fi taak bad bout nobadi an dem no fi kwaril-kwaril. Insted-a dat, dem fi tek taim wid piipl an shuo rispek tu evribadi.

We also were once foolish, disobedient, deceived, serving various desires and pleasures, living in evil and envy, filled with hatred and hating each other.|Kaaz wan taim wi yuus tu fuul-fuul tu, wi neva waahn fala notn we nobadi se an wi a did sliev tu aal a di wikid sitn dem we wi waahn. Evridie wi beks wid wi wan aneda an wi eva waahn wa sumadi els av. Aal wi du a iet: wi iet evribadi an evribadi iet wi.
But when the kindness and the love of God our Savior toward mankind appeared
column2: Bot wen Gad wi sievya shuo wi ou im lov wi an ou im gud tu wi

column1: not by works of righteousness which we have done, but according to His mercy He saved us, through the washing of rebirth and the renewal of the Holy Spirit|im siev wi. A no kaaz a notn gud we wi du bot kaaz im lov wi an im andastan wa wi go chuu. Gad siev wi wid di powa a im Uoli Spirit we wash wi an gi wi nyuu laif.
whom He poured out on us abundantly through Jesus Christ our Savior|Gad sen Jiizas Krais wi sievya, an mek im gi wi di Uoli Spirit.

so that, being justified by His grace, we might become heirs according to the hope of eternal life.|Gad gi wi im Spirit, so nou dat tingz aarait wid wi an im, siek-a ou im lov wi iivn duo wi no dizorv it, wi kyan get wa wi Faada Gad pramis wi; kaaz wi nuo fi shuor se im a-go mek wi liv fi eva.

This is a faithful saying, and these things I want you constantly to affirm, so that those who have believed in God might be careful to maintain good works. These things are good and profitable to everyone.|Aal a wa mi jos tel yu, a chuu sopm. An a dat mi waahn yu fi tiich aad aad. Tiich it so dat aal a di piipl we biliiv iina Gad wi mek shuor se dem onggl du gud sitn; dem sitn ya gud an wi elp evribadi.

But avoid foolish debates, genealogies, contentions, and arguments about the law, for they are unprofitable and useless.|No fait wid nobadi uova no fuul-fuul taak ar mek op tuori. An no bada kos-kos wid nobadi uova uu a uufa jinarieshan ar bout di laa. Stie faar fram dem sitn de kaaz dem no wot notn an dem kyaahn elp nobadi.

Reject a divisive man after a first and second admonition|Ef sumadi iina di choch a kos-kos, gi chobl an a mek ada piipl kwaril an ton gens dem wan aneda, waan im fi tap. Ef im no lisn, waan im agen. Bot ef im no lisn da taim de, no av notn fi du wid im.
knowing that such a man is perverted and is sinning, being self-condemned.|Kaaz yu nuo se da man de ed mes op an im ful-a sin; a im bring dong jojment pan imself.

When I send Artemas or Tychicus to you, be diligent to come to me in Nicopolis, for I have decided to spend the winter there. |Wen mi sen Aatimas ar Taikikos tu yu, chrai yu bes fi kom miit mi a Nikapolis, kaaz mi a-go tan de til winta don.

Diligently send Zenas the lawyer and Apollos on their journey. See that they lack nothing.|Du aal we yu kyan du fi elp Ziinas di laaya an Apalos. Mek shuor se wen dem redi fi lef de, dem av aal we dem niid.

And let our people also learn to continue doing good works to meet urgent needs, that they may not be unproductive.|Di piipl we biliiv iina Jiizas an we iina Kriit mos lorn fi wok aad an du gud sitn, so dat dem wi aalwiez av inof, so dem kyan gi piipl we niid it.

All who are with me greet you. Greet those who love us in the faith.Grace be with you all. Amen.|Evribadi we de ya wid mi sen dem lov. Tel aal a Gad piipl we de dong de wid yu, oudi! Mi prie se Gad wi shuo unu lov iivn duo wi no dizorv it.

Paul, a prisoner of Christ Jesus, and Timothy our brother,1To Philemon, our beloved fellow laborer|Mi gud gud fren Failiiman we wok wid mi, dis a Paal we de iina prizn kaaz mi tiich bout Jiizas. Mi an wi breda Timoti a rait da leta ya tu: yu
and to beloved Apphia, and to Archippus our fellow soldier, and to the church in your house:|wi sista Afiya, Aakipos we a suoja laik wi an tu aal a di piipl dem we gyada iina yu yaad fi av choch.
Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
column2: Mi prie se wi faada Gad an wi Laad Jiizas Krais wi shuo unu lov iivn duo wi no dizorv it an gi unu piis iina unu aat.

column1: I thank my God, always mentioning you in my prayers|Evritaim mi prie tu Gad mi memba yu Failiiman. An mi gi Gad tangks fi yu
whenever I hear of your love and faith, which you have toward the Lord Jesus and for all the saints|kaaz mi ier bout ou yu chos iina di Laad Jiizas an ou yu lov aal a Gad piipl.

that the sharing of your faith may be most effective by the acknowledgment of every good thing which is in you from Christ Jesus.|Az yu andastan aal a di gud sitn dem we Gad gi wi kaaz wi an Krais Jiizas a wan, mi prie se di fiet we yu shier wid wi an aal a Gad piipl wi gruo.

For we have great joy and encouragement on account of your love, because the hearts of the saints are refreshed through you, brother.|Failiiman, mi breda, yu lov fi Gad piipl, du mi aat gud an gi mi chrent. Yu lov kaaz aal a Gad piipl fi api.
Therefore, though I might be very bold in Christ to command you to do that which is proper|Nou, chuu mi a wan a Gad apasl, mi kuda aada yu fi du wa yu sopuoz fi du.

yet for love’s sake I rather appeal to you—I, Paul, an old man, and now also a prisoner of Jesus Christ|Bot siek-a ou yu lov Gad piipl mi a beg yu insted. Mi, Paal, wan oul man an we nou iina prizn kaaz mi tiich bout Jiizas.

I appeal to you on behalf of my son Onesimus, whose father I have become in my imprisonment|Mi a beg fi mi pikni Oniisimos. Wen mi iina prizn, mi tek im fi mi pikni kaaz a mi elp im fi biliiv iina Jiizas.

who in the past was unprofitable to you, but now he is profitable to you and to me.|Wan taim im neehn av no yuus tu yu, bot nou im av nof yuus fi yu an fi mi. 12Oniisimos a mi aat, an mi a sen im bak tu yu.
I have sent him back. Therefore receive him as my own heart.|Oniisimos a mi aat, an mi a sen im bak tu yu.

I wanted to keep him with me, so that in your place he might serve me during my imprisonment for the gospel.|Mi iina prizn kaaz mi tiich bout Jiizas an wail mi de ya mi wuda lov fi kip im ya wid mi, so im kuda elp mi laik ou yu wuda elp mi ef yu did de ya.

But without your consent I would do nothing, so that your goodness would not be forced, but given willingly. |Bot mi no waahn du notn widout aks yu fos an mi no waahn fi fuos yu an. Mi waahn wen yu fi elp mi yu du it kaaz yu waahn fi elp mi.
Perhaps this was why he departed for a while, that you might receive him forever|Miebi im did gaan we fram yu likl, so dat wen im kom yu wuda tek im bak fi gud.

no longer as a slave but more than a slave, a beloved brother, especially to me but how much more to you, both in the flesh and in the Lord.|Nou im a no jos wan sliev, im a muor dan dat. Oniisimos a yu sliev bot nou im a yu breda tu. Im a yu gud gud breda chuu im biliiv iina Jiizas jos laik wi. Im miin uol iip tu mi an im a-go miin nof muor tu yu.

If then you consider me a partner, receive him as you would me. |So ef yu tingk se mi an yu a fren sins mi an yu wok tugeda fi di Laad, yu wi tek im bak iina yu ous an welkom im laik ou yu wuda welkom mi.
If he wronged you or owes you anything, charge this to my account.|Ef im did du notn rang tu yu ar im uo yu, mi wi tek kier a it.

I, Paul, have written this with my own hand. I will repay it—not to mention that you owe me even your own self.|Mi, Paal we a rait da leta ya miself, wi pie yu bak. An mi nuo se mi no afi memba yu se yu uo mi, kaaz a mi elp yu fi biliiv iina Krais.
Yes, brother, help me rejoice in the Lord, refresh my heart in the Lord.|Mi breda mi wish se yu wuda du mi da fieva ya an mek mi api, sins mi an yu biliiv iina di siem Gad.

Being convinced of your obedience, I write to you, knowing that you will also do more than I say.|Yu si chuu mi nuo se yu wuda fala aal we mi se, mi rait yu. Mi rait yu kaaz mi nuo se yu wuda aal du muor dan wa mi aks yu fi du.

But, in addition, prepare also lodging for me, for I hope that through your prayers I shall be graciously restored to you.|Wan neda ting, get wan ruum redi fi mi, kaaz mi a uop se Gad wi ansa unu prieya an sen mi bak tu unu.
Epaphras, my fellow prisoner in Christ Jesus, greets you|Epafras we iina prizn jos laka mi kaaz im tiich bout Jiizas, sen oudi fi yu.
as do Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, and Luke, my fellow laborers.|Maak, Ieristaakos, Diimas an Luuk, we wok wid mi, sen oudi fi yu tu.
The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.
column2: Mi prie se Jiizas Krais wi Laad wi shuo di uol a unu lov iivn duo wi no dizorv it.

column1: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the command of God our Savior, and of the Lord Jesus Christ, our hope|Timoti, dis a Paal, Jiizas Krais apasl. A di Gad we siev wi an Jiizas Krais di wan we mek wi kyan luk fi get aal kain-a gud sitn, aada mi fi bi wan apasl.

To Timothy, my true son in the faith:Grace, mercy, and peace, from God our Father and Jesus Christ our Lord.|Timoti, yu komiin laik se yu a riili fi mi pikni kaaz di tuu a wi biliiv an chos iina di siem Gad.

As I urged you when I went into Macedonia, continue to remain at Ephesus so that you might command some to teach no other doctrine|Wen mi did a go Masiduoniya, mi beg yu fi tan a Efisos so yu kyan waan di piipl dem we naa tiich Gad wod fi tap pred faalz wod.

nor pay attention to fables and endless genealogies, which cause debates rather than godly edifying, which is in faith. |Dem no fi wies dem taim niida pan mek op tuori we no mek no sens at aal, an dem no fi bada wid uu a uufa jinarieshan. Dem de sitn de onggl kaaz piipl fi kwaril-kwaril wid dem wan aneda insted-a chos iina Gad plan fi siev piipl.

Now the goal of this command is love from a pure heart, and from a good conscience, and from sincere faith.|Mi tel yu fi du dis so di piipl dem kyan lov dem wan aneda wid di kain-a lov we kom fram wan gud aat, we nuo rait fram rang. Wen dem lov dem wan aneda so, dem a ak laik piipl we riili bilang tu Gad.
From this, some have lost their way and turned aside to empty talk|Di faalz tiicha dem ton dem bak pan dem sitn ya. Dem ton tu di sitn dem we no mata an staat taak som sitn we no mek no sens.

desiring to be teachers of the law, and understanding neither what they say nor what they affirm.|Dem waahn fi tiich Gad Laa, bot dem no andastan we dem a se moch les di sitn dem we dem a taak bout, iivn duo dem tingk se dem nuo.
But we know that the law is good if someone uses it lawfully.|Nou wi nuo se di Laa a gud sopm, ef it yuuz laik ou it fi yuuz.

And we know that the law is not given for a righteous person, but for the lawless and disobedient, for the ungodly and for sinners, for the unholy and the profane, for those who kill their fathers and mothers, for murderers|Wi andastan se di Laa neva mek fi gud piipl bot fi piipl we a kriminal an di wan dem we wudn fiil no wie ef dem brok di Laa. It mek fi piipl we no worship di chuu Gad an di sina dem, fi di wan we no fala no kain-a gad an di wan dem we kos Gad. Di Laa mek fi di mordara dem — aal di wan dem we wuda kil dem uona mada an faada.

for the sexually immoral, for sodomites, for slave traders, for liars, for perjurers, and for anything else that is contrary to sound doctrine|It mek fi di man dem we av seks wid ada man, ar uman we av seks wid ada uman, an fi piipl we tek paat iina aal kain-a seks sin. Di Laa a fi di wan dem we kech an sel piipl fi ton sliev, an fi piipl we a laiyad an piipl we go a kuot go tel lai pan ada piipl. Matarafak it a fi enibadi we go gens di chuu mesij we wi tiich

according to the glorious gospel of the blessed God, which was committed to my trust.|an we lain op wid di Gud Nyuuz bout wa Gad du fi wi wen im sen im Bwai Pikni fi siev wi. A da siem powaful Gud Nyuuz ya, Gad, di wan we piipl fi priez, se mi fi tiich.

I thank Christ Jesus our Lord, who has enabled me, because He counted me faithful and appointed me to the ministry.|Mi afi tangk wi Laad Jiizas Krais di wan we gi mi chrent kaaz im chos mi fi bi im apasl.

I was previously a blasphemer, and a persecutor, and an insolent man. But I was shown mercy, because I did it ignorantly in unbelief. |Im pik mi iivn duo mi yuus tu kos im an taament im piipl dem. Duo mi did wikid, im di stil gud an kain tu mi kaaz im si se dem taim de mi neva biliiv iina im an mi neva riili nuo wa mi did a du.
The grace of our Lord overflowed with the faith and love which is in Christ Jesus.
column2: Jiizas Krais wi Laad did shuo mi lov iivn duo mi neva dizorv it at aal at aal. Im kaaz mi fi biliiv iina im an fi lov piipl.

column1: This is a faithful saying and worthy of all acceptance, that Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners, of whom I am the worst. |Nou lisn mi gud kaaz wa mi bout fi tel yu a no no lai bot a chuu sopm we di uol a wi fi tek an biliiv: Jiizas kom iina di worl fi siev sina. Luk pan mi, mi a did di wos kain-a sina an Gad siev mi.

But I received mercy for this reason, that in me, first, Jesus Christ might show all patience, as an example to those who were to believe in Him for eternal life.|Gad did gud tu mi so Jiizas Krais kuda shuo ou im tek taim wid piipl. Jiizas put op wid sumadi laka mi, so ada piipl we a-go biliiv iina im an get fi liv fi eva an eva, wi si se im riili riili tek taim wid piipl.

Now to the eternal, immortal, invisible King, the only wise God, be honor and glory forever. Amen.|So rispek an priez tu di King we a-go bi king fi eva, di onggl Gad, di wan we kyan neva ded an we wi kyaahn si wid wi yai dem, priez tu im fi eva an eva, Iemen!

This command I commit to you, my son Timothy, according to the prophecies that were previously given to you, that by them you might fight a good fight|Timoti, mi bwai pikni, mi a chos yu fi du wa mi tel yu fi du. Wa mi a tel yu a di sed sitn dem di prafit dem di se bout yu. So memba aal a wa dem se, so yu wi no gi op bot fait laik wan riil suoja

keeping faith and a good conscience, which some have rejected and suffered shipwreck in regard to their faith.|an gwaan biliiv iina Jiizas Krais no mata wa an du we yu nuo iina yu aat rait. Kaaz som piipl ton dem bak pan wa dem nuo iina dem aat rait, an mash op dem fiet iina Gad.

Among these are Hymenaeus and Alexander, whom I have delivered to Satan that they may learn not to blaspheme.|Tuu piipl we dis apm tu a Aimeniyos an Aligzanda. Mi ton dem uova tu Sietan so dat dem wi lorn no fi kos Gad.

Therefore I exhort first of all that you make supplications, prayers, intercessions, and thanksgivings for everyone|So fos ting fos, mi a beg yu an di piipl dem fi prie fi evribadi. Beg Gad fi kom chuu fi dem. Gi Gad tangks fi dem an aks im fi gi dem aal we dem niid.

for kings and for all who are in authority, that we may lead a quiet and peaceful life in all godliness and honesty|Prie fi enibadi we ron wan konchri an fi piipl we iina powa. Prie fi dem so wi kyan liv iina piis an kwaiyat, biyiev laik ou wi fi biyiev an worship Gad.
for this is good and acceptable in the sight of God our Savior
column2: A wan gud sopm dis an a so di Gad we siev wi waahn wi fi prie fi evribadi.

column1: who desires all men to be saved and to come to the knowledge of the truth.
column2: Im waahn evribadi fi get siev an fi nuo di chuut.

column1: There is one God and one mediator between God and men, the Man Christ Jesus|Kaaz a onggl wan Gad de bout, an Jiizas Krais a di migl man, di onggl wan we kyan bring Gad an piipl tugeda.

who gave Himself as a ransom for all. This was the testimony given at the proper time.|Jiizas gi op im laif so dat im kuda bai bak evribadi an frii dem fram sin. Wen Jiizas ded, im shuo se Gad did av wan plan fi siev piipl bot iina fi im uona taim.

For this I was appointed a preacher and an apostle (I speak the truth in Christ and do not lie), a teacher of the Gentiles in faith and truth.|A so mek Gad sen mi fi bi im apasl, so mi kuda priich di chuut. Im sen mi fi tiich aal a di piipl dem we a no Juu an tel dem se Gad wi siev dem ef dem biliiv iina Jiizas. Mi naa lai, mi a tel yu di chuut.

Therefore I desire that the men pray everywhere, lifting up holy hands, without wrath or contentiousness.|So mi aks dat wen unu kom tugeda fi worship Gad, dat aal a di man dem wi lif op dem an, an prie. Dem man ya laif mos kliin an wen dem a prie dem no fi av op nobadi iina dem aat ar a kwaril wid dem wan aneda.

In like manner also, that women clothe themselves in modest clothing, with decency and self-control, not with braided hair, gold, pearls, or expensive clothing|Mi waahn di uman dem fi jres prapa. Dem no fi jres op demself iina big fansi ier stail, guol, porl ar dier kluoz.
but with good works, which is proper for women professing godliness.|Wa dem fi du a jres op demself wid di gud sitn dem we dem du fi ada piipl. A dat uman we a fala Gad fi du.
Let a woman learn in silence with all obedience. |Wen di man dem a tiich, di uman dem fi tan todi, kwaiyat demself an lorn.
I do not permit a woman to teach or to usurp authority over a man, but to be silent. |Uman mos kwaiyat demself, mi no lou dem fi tiich iina choch ar fi ruul uova man.
For Adam was formed first, then Eve. |Kaaz Adam did mek bifuo Iiv.
And Adam was not deceived, but the woman, being deceived, fell into sin.|An a no Adam di siniek did chrik, a Iiv an a shi du wa Gad se dem neva fi du.

Yet she will be saved in childbearing if they continue in faith, love, and holiness, with self-control.|Bot Gad gweehn siev di uman chuu ar pikni. Im gweehn siev di uman dem ef dem gwaan biliiv iina im, shuo lov an liv ou im waahn dem fi liv.
This is a faithful saying: If a man desires the office of an overseer, he desires a good work.|Wen piipl se a gud sopm ef wan man waahn ton elda iina di choch, a chuu dem a taak.

An overseer then must be blameless, the husband of one wife, sober, self-controlled, respectable, hospitable, able to teach; |Di elda fi liv im laif so dat nobadi kyaahn se notn bad gens im. Im fi av onggl wan waif, im fi nuo ou fi kanchuol imself an no go uova buod wid notn. Piipl mos kyan rispek im an im fi kyan chriit piipl gud wen dem kom a im yaad. Di elda mos nuo ou fi tiich.

not given to drunkenness, not violent, not greedy for money, but patient, not argumentative, not covetous; |Im no fi lov jringk tu moch an im no fi lov fait, bot im fi nais an jengkl an liv iina piis wid evribadi. Pan tap a dat im no fi lov moni niida.
and one who manages his own house well, having his children in submission with all reverence.|Im fi nuo ou fi ron im ous an im pikni dem fi lisn wa im se an shuo rispek.
For if a man does not know how to manage his own house, how will he take care of the church of God?|Kaaz ef sumadi kyaahn ron dem uona ous ou dem a-go ron Gad choch?

He must not be newly converted, so that he does not become prideful and fall into the condemnation of the devil. |Di elda no fi bi sumadi we jos staat biliiv iina Jiizas Krais ar im wi get buosi. Kaaz ef im get buosi Gad wi ponish im laik ou im di ponish di devl.

Moreover he must have a good reputation among those who are outsiders, so that he does not fall into reproach and the snare of the devil.|A no jos piipl we biliiv iina Jiizas wan, bot aal piipl we no biliiv iina Jiizas mos taak gud bout im. Kaaz ef piipl rispek im nobadi kyaahn se notn wikid bout im an di devl naa go kyan chrap im.

Likewise deacons must be serious, not insincere, not given to much wine, not greedy|Siem laik di elda, di diikan dem fi bi sumadi we piipl rispek. Dem no fi tel wan sumadi sitn an go tel sumadi els sitn difrant, dem no fi lov jringk tu moch an dem no fi waahn waahn moni.
keeping the mystery of the faith in a pure conscience.
column2: Dem fi eng aan tait pan di chuu mesij we Gad shuo wi wid aal a dem aat an no fiek it.

column1: And let them first be tested; then, being found blameless, let them serve as deacons.|Piipl we waahn ton diikan kyaahn jos ton diikan so. Di choch afi tes dem fos, an ef nobadi no fain notn rang wid dem, den dem kyan ton diikan.

Likewise, their wives must be serious, not slanderers, sober, and faithful in all things.|A siem so di uman dem mos liv dem laif so piipl wi rispek dem. Dem no fi susu-susu, lai ar taak bad bout piipl. Insted-a dat dem fi kyan kanchuol demself, no go uova buod wid notn an piipl fi kyan chos dem.
Let the deacons be the husbands of one wife, managing their children and their own houses well.|Di diikan dem mos onggl av wan waif an mos kyan kanchuol dem pikni dem an ron dem uona ous.

For those who have served well in the office of deacon purchase for themselves good standing and great boldness in the faith, which is in Christ Jesus.|Piipl wi rispek di diikan dem we du wan gud jab, an kaaz piipl rispek dem, di diikan dem kyan taak bout dem chos iina Jiizas an no fried a notn.
I am writing these things to you, hoping to come to you shortly|Mi uop se mi kyan kom si yu suun bot mi a rait da leta ya siem wie.

but if I am delayed, you might know how you ought to conduct yourself in the house of God, which is the church of the living God, the pillar and foundation of the truth. |In kies sitn uol mi bak mi a rait fi mek yu nuo ou piipl we a paat a Gad fambili mos biyiev. Gad fambili a di choch an di choch a fi Gad we liv fi eva an eva. Di choch sopuot an uol op di chuut jos laik ou di foundieshan an di kaana puos uol op wan bildin.

Without question, great is the mystery of godliness:God was revealed in the flesh,justified in the Spirit,seen by angels,preached to the Gentiles,believed on in the world,taken up into glory.|Aal a wi nuo fi shuor se di uol a di sitn dem we Gad shuo wi, we jos big an powaful, a chuu. A chuu se:Jiizas baan a ort laik wan man.Di Uoli Spirit pruuv se Gad did tek im fi im Piknian di ienjel dem did si im.Piipl priich tu evribadi bout im,evribadi put dem chos iina iman Gad tek im op iina evn.

Now the Spirit clearly says that in the last times some will depart from the faith and pay attention to seducing spirits and doctrines of devils|Di Uoli Spirit tel wi plien plien se iina dem laas die ya, nof piipl a-go ton dem bak pan di chuut bout Jiizas an go biliiv iina wa di wikid laiyad spirit tel di faalz tiicha dem fi priich.
speaking lies in hypocrisy, having their consciences seared with a hot iron|Dem tiicha ya a ipokrit, dem no nuo rait fram rang kaaz dem naa no kanchens.

forbidding to marry, and commanding to abstain from foods, which God has created to be received with thanksgiving by those who believe and know the truth.|Dem tiich se piipl no fi get marid an dem no fi nyam sortn an sortn fuud. Bot di piipl we biliiv iina di chuu Gad nuo se Gad mek aal fuud fi nyam, aal yu afi du a gi tangks fos.
For everything created by God is good, and not to be refused if it is received with thanksgiving|Evriting we Gad mek gud, so ef yu gi tangks yu no afi fried fi nyam notn.
for it is sanctified by the word of God and prayer.
column2: Kaaz prieya an Gad wod mek di fuud kliin.

column1: If you remind the brothers of these things, you will be a good minister of Jesus Christ, nourished by the words of faith and of good doctrine, which you have followed closely.|Timoti, yu wi bi wan gud sorvant fi Jiizas Krais ef yu tiich di piipl di chuut bout dem sitn ya, gwaan kip di chuu mesij bout Krais Jiizas kluos tu yu aat an gwaan fala di chuu sitn dem we mi did tiich yu.

But refuse profane and foolish myths. Instead, exercise in the ways of godliness.|No av notn fi du wid di tuori dem we no chuu an we a jos fuulinish, bot wok aad fi fala we Gad se an liv ou yu nuo Gad waahn yu fi liv.

For bodily exercise profits a little, but godliness is profitable in all things, holding promise for the present life and also for the life to come.|Kaaz jos laik ou wi eksasaiz an chrien wi badi so it wi chrang, wi afi eksasaiz an chrien wi aat fi fala Gad. Kaaz wen wi chrien wi aat fi fala Gad wi no jos get chrang bot Gad kaaz wi fi liv nou an fi eva an eva.
This is a faithful saying and worthy of all acceptance.
column2: Dat a di chuut an evribadi fi fala it.

column1: For to this end we both labor and suffer reproach, because we trust in the living God, who is the Savior of all men, especially of those who believe.|Wi put wi chos iina di Gad we kyaahn ded an we siev evribadi, speshali di wan dem we biliiv iina im. Gad pramis fi mek wi liv fi eva ef wi chos iina im an a so mek wi afi chogl an wok aad.
Command and teach these things.
column2: Tiich dem sitn ya an tel evribadi fi mek shuor dem fala dem.

column1: Let no one despise your youth, but be an example to the believers in speech, in conduct, in love, in spirit, in faith, and in purity. |No mek nobadi put yu dong kaaz yu yong. Mek shuor yu liv rait so piipl kyan fala yu: lov piipl, chos iina Gad an liv wan kliin laif an no sin.
Until I come, give attention to reading, exhortation, and doctrine. |Gwaan tiich an riid Gad wod out loud mek evribadi ier, an gwaan elp di piipl fi andastan dem til mi kom.

Do not neglect the gift that is in you, which was given to you by prophecy, with the laying on of hands by the elders.|No figet bout di gif we di Uoli Spirit gi yu, mek shuor se yu yuuz it. A da gif de yu did get wen di prafit dem did taak uova yu an di elda dem did put dem an pan yu an prie.

Meditate on these things. Give yourself completely to them, that your progress may be known to everyone. |Memba dem sitn ya. Tingk bout dem aal di taim an put evriting iina di wok we mi gi yu, so piipl kyan si ou faar yu kom.

Take heed to yourself and to the doctrine. Continue in them, for in doing this you will save both yourself and those who hear you.|Wach ou yu liv an wach wa yu tiich. Gwaan tiich an du aal we mi tel yu fi du, kaaz ef yu du it, yu no onggl a siev yuself bot yu a siev di piipl dem we ier yu tu.

Do not rebuke an elder, but exhort him as a father, the younger men as brothers|No disrispek di uol man dem iina di choch an taak tu dem eni an eni wie. Taak tu dem laik ou yu wuda taak tu yu faada. Taak tu di yong bwai dem laik dem a yu breda.

the elder women as mothers, and the younger women as sisters, with complete purity.|Di uol uman dem, yu fi taak tu dem laik ou yu wuda taak tu yu mada an di yongga uman dem taak tu dem laik dem a yu sista. Du dis wid wan kliin aat.
Honor widows that are widows indeed.
column2: Rispek an tek kier a di uman dem we ozban ded an we riili niid elp.

column1: But if any widow has children or grandchildren, let them learn first to show piety at home and to repay their parents. For this is good and acceptable before God.|Bot ef wan uman we ozban ded av pikni ar granpikni, a dem sopuoz fi tek kier a ar. Dem fi tek kier a ar jos laik ou shi di tek kier a dem. Dem fi tek kier a ar kaaz a dat Gad waahn dem fi du.

Now she who is a widow indeed, and desolate, trusts in God, and continues in supplications and prayers night and day. |A di uman we ozban ded an we no av no fambili, a di wan di choch mos elp. Shi a di wan we chos iina Gad wid aal ar aat, prie nait an die, an aks Gad fi elp ar.
But she who lives in pleasure is dead while she lives.|Bot di uman we ozban ded an onggl kier bout wa shi waahn an no we Gad waahn, fi ar spirit ded iivn duo shi stil a liv.
And these things command, that they may be blameless.|Mek shuor di choch andastan dem sitn ya so nobadi kyaahn av notn bad fi se bout dem.

But if any do not care for their own, and especially for those of their own house, they have denied the faith and are worse than unbelievers.|Bot enibadi we no tek kier a dem uona fambili dem a ton dem bak pan Gad wod an wosa dan sumadi we neva biliiv iina Gad at aal.
Do not let a widow be counted unless she is over sixty years old, has been the wife of one man|No uman we ozban ded no fi de pan di lis bifuo shi ton siksti. Shi mos onggl did av wan ozban tu.

is well attested in good works, if she has brought up children, has lodged strangers, has washed the saints’ feet, has relieved the afflicted, and has diligently followed every good work.|Ef shi a-go go pan di lis, piipl mos nuo ar fi di gud sitn dem we shi du. Dem mos nuo ar kaaz shi bring op ar pikni dem gud, aalwiez uopm op ar yaad tu piipl an shi wash di fut a di biliiva dem. Dem mos nuo ar kaaz shi elp enibadi we niid elp an kaaz shi du aal kain-a gud sitn.

But refuse the younger widows, for when their sensual desires have drawn them away from Christ, they want to marry|No put no uman we anda siksti pan da lis ya. Kaaz dem niecha wi kaaz dem fi go marid agen an jraa dem fram Gad.

and bring judgment on themselves, because they have cast off their first pledge.|Dat miin se dem wuda brok dem pramis tu Gad. Kaaz di uman dem pan di lis pramis fi no marid agen bot liv di res a dem laif a du Gad wok.

Besides that, they learn to be idle, and not only idle, wandering around from house to house, but also gossips and busybodies, saying what they ought not.|Plos, ef dem go roun fram yaad tu yaad dem wi get liezi. Dem wi get liezi an staat susu-susu, kaaz chobl, an taak tingz we dem no fi a taak.

Therefore I desire that the younger women marry, bear children, manage the house, and give no occasion to the adversary to speak reproachfully. |So mi waahn di yongga uman dem we ozban ded fi go marid agen. Dem fi get marid, av pikni an tek kier a dem fambili so dat di piipl dem we no laik wi, kyaahn av notn bad fi se bout wi.
For some have already turned aside after Satan.
column2: Kaaz som a di yongga wan dem don ton we gaan fala Sietan.

column1: If any believing man or woman has widows, let those assist them. Do not let the church be charged, so that it may relieve those who are widows indeed.|Ef wan uman we biliiv iina Gad, av wan sumadi iina ar fambili we ozban ded, shi fi elp da uman de. Shi fi elp ar, so dat di choch kyan go elp di uman dem we riili niid elp.

Let the elders who rule well be counted worthy of double honor, especially those who labor in the word and doctrine.|Unu fi ana an rispek di elda dem we a gud liida, wos ef dem wok aad fi priich an tiich. Unu fi ana dem an pie dem gud tu.

For the Scripture says, “You shall not muzzle the ox that treads out the grain,” and, “The laborer is worthy of his reward.”|Kaaz Gad wod se, “Yu no fi tap di aks fram nyam wen im a mash out di grien” an “Di piipl dem we wok fi get di moni we dem wok fa.”

Do not receive an accusation against an elder, except before two or three witnesses. |No biliiv notn bad we nobadi tel yu bout di elda dem. Yu fi onggl biliiv wa dem se ef a tuu ar chrii piipl we did de de tel yu wa apm.

Rebuke in the presence of everyone those who sin, that the rest also may fear.|Gad, Jiizas Krais an di uol a di ienjel dem we Gad pik a mi witnis, du wa mi tel yu fi du. Du it an mek shuor se yu chriit evribadi di siem wie. No av no fievrit.

I command you before God and the Lord Jesus Christ and the elect angels that you observe these things without prejudice, doing nothing by partiality.|Gad, Jiizas Krais an di uol a di ienjel dem we Gad pik a mi witnis, du wa mi tel yu fi du. Du it an mek shuor se yu chriit evribadi di siem wie. No av no fievrit.

Do not lay hands suddenly on anyone, and do not partake of other men’s sins. Keep yourself pure.|No kwik fi put yu an pan nobadi an mek dem liida iina di choch. No shier iina dem sin bot kip yuself kliin.

No longer drink only water, but use a little wine for your stomach’s sake and your frequent illnesses.|(Tap jringk waata wan bot yu fi jringk likl wain tu fi elp yu tumok an fi mek yu no so siki-siki).

Some men’s sins are evident, pointing to judgment, but other men’s sins are revealed later.|Som piipl sin yu kyan si so plien dat nobadi no iivn afi se notn fi yu nuo se dem gilti. Bot ada piipl sin no so iizi fi si, it no shuo til lieta.
Likewise, the good works of some are evident, but those that are not cannot be hidden.|A di siem wid di gud sitn dem we piipl du. Som a dem iizi fi si an som no iizi fi si, bot non a dem kyaahn aid.

Let as many servants as are under the yoke of slavery count their own masters worthy of all honor, so that the name of God and His doctrine may not be slandered.|Aal uu a sliev, mos nuo se dem maasta fi get rispek so nobadi kyan taak bad bout Gad ar bout wa wi tiich.

Let those who have believing masters not despise them, because they are brothers. Instead, let them serve as slaves, because those who receive their service are faithful and beloved. Teach and command these things. |Ef enibadi av wan maasta we biliiv iina Jiizas tu, dem no fi rispek dem no les jos chuu di tuu a dem a breda. Bot sins dem an dem maasta ya a breda, dem fi rispek dem iivn muor an sorv dem beta. Kaaz it miin se dem a elp fi tek kier a Gad piipl we im lov. A dem sitn ya mi a beg yu fi tiich an fi push di piipl dem fi du.

Anyone who teaches otherwise and does not consent to wholesome words, to the words of our Lord Jesus Christ, and to godly doctrine |Ef enibadi tiich notn we no ad op wid we wi Laad Jiizas tiich wi an ou Gad se wi fi liv, ar wos, a tiich se Gad wod a no chuu

is conceited and knows nothing. He has a morbid disposition for controversy and verbal disputes, from which come envy, strife, blasphemies, evil speculations|im ful-a imself an no nuo ar andastan notn. Im lov fi kwaril an fait wid ada piipl uova wa som wod miin. Im kaaz piipl fi waar an kos wid dem wan aneda an fi red yai fi dem wan aneda sitn dem.

constant disputes by men of corrupt minds, being destitute of the truth, and supposing that financial gain is godliness. Withdraw yourself from such men.|Dem sitn ya onggl kaaz bier aagiment mongks piipl we main wikid an no nuo di chuut. Dem piipl de tingk se fi fala Gad, a wan wie fi mek moni.
But godliness with contentment is great gain.|Yu laif wi ful op a gud sitn wen yu staat liv ou Gad waahn yu fi liv, bot onggl ef yu api wid wa yu av.
For we brought nothing into this world, and it is certain that we can carry nothing out.|Kaaz wi no kyari notn kom iina di worl, so wi kyaahn lef wid notn.
If we have food and clothing, we shall be content with these things.|So den, ef wi av fuud fi iit an kluoz fi wier, wi fi api wid dat.

But those who desire to be rich fall into temptation and a snare and into many foolish and harmful lusts, which drown men in ruin and destruction. |Bot di piipl dem we waahn fi rich, di devl chrik dem an mek dem du aal kain-a wikid sitn. Im kech dem wid di fuul-fuul sitn dem we dem waahn an we no gud fi dem. Dem kyaahn si se di sitn dem we dem waahn a-go mash dem op an singk dem.

For the love of money is the root of all evil. While coveting after money, some have strayed from the faith and pierced themselves through with many sorrows.|Kaaz di lov fi moni a di ruut fi aal kain-a wikidnis. Som piipl waahn moni so bad dat dem ton dem bak pan Gad an bring dong nof kraasiz pan demself.

But you, O man of God, escape these things, and follow after righteousness, godliness, faith, love, patience, and gentleness. |Bot aal laik yu Timoti we a wan man a Gad, yu fi ron fram dem wikid sitn de. Yu fi chrai yu bes fi liv ou Gad waahn yu fi liv an fi liv di sitn dem we yu tiich. Yu mos gwaan tiich di Wod an chos se Gad wi gi yu chrent. No gi op, shuo lov an tek yu taim wid piipl tu.

Fight the good fight of faith. Lay hold on eternal life, to which you are called and have professed a good profession before many witnesses.|Yu chos iina Gad so yu a-go av nof tingz we yu a-go afi chogl chuu. Gwaan tan op chrang an priich Gad wod. Ef yu du dis yu kyan nuo fi shuor se yu a-go liv fi eva. Kaaz dat a di pramis we Gad gi yu wen yu did se dat yu biliiv iina im infronta evribadi.

I command you, in the sight of God, who gives life to all things, and in the sight of Christ Jesus, who testified a good confession before Pontius Pilate|Infronta Gad we gi evriting laif an Jiizas Krais we tan op tu Ponchos Pailat an se wa im biliiv, mi a tel yu

to keep this commandment without blemish, blameless until the appearing of our Lord Jesus Christ|fala aal a di sitn dem we mi tiich yu. Du dis so nobadi kyaahn se notn bad bout yu. Fala dem til di die wen wi Laad Jiizas kom bak.

which He, who is the blessed and only Ruler, the King of kings and Lord of lords, will reveal at the proper time. |Gad we di piipl priez an uu a di onggl chuu ruula, di Laad an King uova evribadi, wi sen bak Jiizas wen im redi.

He alone has immortality, living in unapproachable light, whom no one has seen, nor can see. To Him be honor and everlasting power. Amen.|A Gad wan kyan liv fi eva an no ded. Im liv iina wan brait brait lait, it so brait no man kyaahn luk pan im ar kom nier im. A dat mek nobadi neva si im ar kyan si im. Ana an powa tu Gad fi eva! Iemen!

Command those who are rich in this world that they not be conceited, nor trust in uncertain riches, but in the living God, who richly gives us all things to enjoy.|Waan di rich piipl dem se dem no fi gwaan laik dem beta dan enibadi els jos chuu dem av moni. Dem no fi put dem chos iina moni niida kaaz moni kom an moni go. Wa dem fi du a put dem chos iina Gad kaaz im wi gi wi aal we wi niid fi liv api.
Command that they do good, that they be rich in good works, generous, willing to share|Tel dem fi du nof gud sitn — a dat dem fi rich wid, an tel dem se dem mos gi tu ada piipl an shier wa dem av.

and laying up in store for themselves a good foundation for the coming age, so that they may take hold of eternal life.|Ef dem du dis, dem wi bil wan salid fyuucha fi demself an wi get di laif we Gad pramis.

O Timothy, guard that which is committed to your trust. Avoid profane babblings and opposing views from so-called knowledge.|So Timoti, gyaad di sitn dem we Gad gi yu fi tek kier a. Mek shuor yu kip dem sief. Stie faar fram taak we no av notn fi du wid Gad. No lisn tu di fuulinish wa som piipl taak chuu dem tingk dem waiz. Dem waahn fi kaal we dem a se nalij bot a no nalij dat.

By professing it, some have erred concerning the faith.Grace be with you. Amen.|A da siem nalij de we kaaz nof a dem fi tap biliiv iina wa Gad tiich.Mi prie se Gad wi shuo unu lov iivn duo wi no dizorv it.

Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, according to the promise of life which is in Christ Jesus|Timoti, dis a Paal, Jiizas Krais apasl. Gad pik mi fi bi Jiizas apasl an sen mi fi go tel evribadi bout di laif we Gad pramis fi gi wi ef wi biliiv iina Krais Jiizas.

To Timothy, my beloved son:Grace, mercy, and peace, from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord.|Timoti, yu komiin laik mi uona pikni we mi lov, mi prie se Faada Gad an wi Laad Jiizas Krais wi shuo yu lov iivn duo wi no dizorv it, mi prie tu se im wi gud an kain tu yu an gi yu piis iina yu aat.

I thank God, whom I serve with a pure conscience as my forefathers did, as I continually remember you in my prayers night and day|Evritaim mi prie tu Gad mi memba yu an gi Gad tangks fi yu. Mi prie tu Gad jos laik ou mi granfaada an fi im faada an fi im faada faada dem yuus tu prie, an mi kanchens no bada mi.
greatly desiring to see you, remembering your tears, that I may be filled with joy|Mi memba ou yu did baal an it mek mi waahn fi si yu. Kaaz mi nuo se ef mi si yu mi wuda api.
remembering the genuine faith that first lived in your grandmother Lois and your mother Eunice and that I am persuaded lives in you also.
column2: Mi memba ou yu chos iina Gad nof nof. Jos laik ou yu mada Yuunis an yu granmada Lai did biliiv iina Gad an did chos iina im nof nof tu. Mi shuor se jos laik dem yu biliiv an chos iina Gad nof nof tu.

column1: Therefore I remind you to stir up the gift of God, which is in you by the laying on of my hands.|Siek-a dat yu mos mek shuor se yu gwaan yuuz di gif we Gad gi yu wen mi did put mi an dem pan yu an prie.

For God has not given us the spirit of fear, but of power, and love, and self-control. |Kaaz di spirit we Gad gi wi, neva mek wi friedi-friedi. Gad Spirit gi wi powa, lov an mek wi kyan kanchuol wiself.

So do not be ashamed of the testimony of our Lord, nor of me, His prisoner. But share in the sufferings of the gospel by the power of God|So no shiem fi tel di piipl dem bout Gad. No shiem fi se yu nuo mi niida, jos chuu dem fling mi iina jiel kaaz mi sorv Gad. Yuuz di powa we Gad gi yu. Sofa wid mi an gwaan tel di piipl bout Gad.

who has saved us and called us with a holy calling, not by our works, but by His own purpose and grace, which was given us in Christ Jesus before the world began|Gad siev wi an pik wi fi bi im piipl. A no kaaz a notn we wi du mek im du dat. Gad pik wi kaaz im did plan fi gud an kain tu wi. Wie bifuo taim im di plan fi shuo wi lov iivn duo wi no dizorv it an sen Krais Jiizas fi siev wi.

but is now revealed by the appearing of our Savior, Jesus Christ, who has abolished death and has brought life and immortality to light through the gospel|Nou Jiizas Krais wi sievya shuo wi ou im kain wen im kom an mek it so dat wi kyaahn ded. Im tiich di Gud Nyuuz so dat wi kuda andastan wa it miin fi liv fi eva.
for which I was appointed a preacher, an apostle, and a teacher of the Gentiles.|A da siem Gud Nyuuz de Gad se mi fi tiich. Im mek mi wan a Jiizas apasl dem so mi kuda tel di piipl dem di Gud Nyuuz.

For these things I suffer, but I am not ashamed, for I know whom I have believed, and am persuaded that He is able to keep that which I have committed to Him until that Day.|A kaaz mi tiich di Gud Nyuuz mek mi a sofa nou. Bot iivn duo mi iina prizn mi no shiem, kaaz mi nuo uu mi biliiv iina. An mi nuo se im wi kip sief aal a di sitn dem we im chos mi wid til di die Gad kom fi joj wi.

Follow the pattern of sound teaching which you have heard from me in the faith and love that is in Christ Jesus. |Yu si di sitn dem we mi tiich, tek kier an fala dem, no tiich notn difrant. Yu fi du dis wid di sitn dem we wi biliiv an we Jiizas Krais gi wi an wid di lov we im gi wi tu.
Guard the treasure that was committed to you through the Holy Spirit who lives in us.
column2: Gyaad di sitn dem we Gad gi yu fi tiich. Gyaad dem wid di elp a di Uoli Spirit we liv iina yu.

column1: You know that all those who are in Asia have turned away from me, including Phygelus and Hermogenes.|Yu nuo se evribadi roun a Iezha said ton dem bak pan mi, aal di wan Fijilos an di wan Ormajinis.

May the Lord grant mercy to the house of Onesiphorus, for he often refreshed me and was not ashamed of my chains.|Mi prie se Gad wi gud an kain tu Onisiforos an im fambili. Kaaz im neva shiem fi kom luk fi mi iina jiel an fi mek mi aat api.
But when he arrived in Rome, he searched me out very diligently and found me.|Wen im riich a Ruom im luk fi mi aad aad an neva tap til im fain mi.
May the Lord grant that he may find mercy from the Lord on that Day. You know very well how many ways he ministered to me at Ephesus.
column2: Mi prie se pan di die Gad kom bak fi joj di worl dat im wi gud an kain tu Onisiforos. Yu nuo se im did elp mi nof nof wen mi did iina Efisos.

column1: So you, my son, be strong in the grace that is in Christ Jesus. |So yu, Timoti, we komiin laik mi pikni, mek di lov we Krais Jiizas gi iivn duo wi no dizorv it, kip yu chrang.

Share the things that you have heard from me in the presence of many witnesses with faithful men who will be able to teach others also.|Yu si di sitn dem wa yu ier mi tiich an priich bout Jiizas Krais infronta nof piipl, yu fi tiich it tu piipl we yu kyan chos an we kyan tiich tu. Tiich it tu dem so dat dem kyan go tiich ada piipl.
Endure hard times as a good soldier of Jesus Christ.|Sins yu a wan a Krais Jiizas gud suoja dem, yu afi go chuu nof sofarieshan laik di res a Jiizas suoja dem. Mek shuo se yu uol aan.

No soldier on active duty entangles himself with civilian affairs, that he may please the enlisting officer. |Riil suoja no bada imself wid evridie laif. Im onggl bizniz wid di aami wok, kaaz im waahn fi mek im komaanda api.
Anyone who competes as an athlete is not rewarded without competing legally. |Jos laik sumadi we du spuots, yu kyaahn win notn ef yu no fala di ruul dem.
The farmer who labors should be first to partake of the crops. |An di faama we wok aad, shuda di fos fi iit we gruo iina di fiil.
Consider what I am saying, and may the Lord grant you understanding in all things.|Tingk pan dem sitn ya an Gad wi elp yu andastan di uol a dem.

Remember Jesus Christ, raised from the dead, descended from David, according to my gospel|Memba uu Krais Jiizas bi. Jiizas a di wan we Gad bring bak fram di ded an we kom fram di siem fambili we Dievid kom fram. Dat a di mesij we mi tiich.

in which I suffer trouble like a criminal, even with chains. But the word of God is not bound.|A chuu mi a tiich da mesij ya mek mi a sofa so. An a kaaz mi tiich da mesij ya mek dem fling mi iina prizn an chriit mi laik se mi a kriminal. Bot dem kyaahn tap Gad mesij ar lak it op laik ou dem lak mi op iina prizn.

Therefore I endure all things for the sake of the elect, that they also may obtain the salvation which is in Christ Jesus with eternal glory.|An sins di mesij no iina prizn mi wi gwaan sofa fi di piipl dem we Gad pik. So dat Jiizas Krais wi siev dem an so dem kyan liv fi eva wid Gad.
This is a faithful saying:If we die with Him,we shall also live with Him.|Nou lisn mi gud kaaz wa mi bout fi tel yu a no no lai bot a chuu sopm:Ef wi did ded wid im,Wi a-go liv wid im tu.
If we endure,we shall also reign with Him.If we deny Him,He also will deny us.|Ef wi no gi op,Wi a-go ruul wid im tu. Ef wi gwaan laik wi no nuo im,im wi gwaan laik im no nuo wi.
If we are faithless,He remains faithful;He cannot deny Himself.|Ef wi ton wi bak pan im,im stil naa ton im bak pan wi.Kaaz Jiizas Krais kyaahn gwaan laik im no nuo uu im bi.

Remind them of these things, commanding them before the Lord that they not argue about words, which leads to nothing of value and to the destruction of those who hear them.|No mek nobadi figet dem sitn ya. Waan dem iina Gad niem fi tap fait uova wa som wod miin. Dem sitn de no elp nobadi. It onggl mash op di piipl dem we ier it.

Study to show yourself approved by God, a workman who need not be ashamed, rightly dividing the word of truth. |Chrai aad an du yu wok di wie Gad waahn yu fi du it. Mek shuor yu du yu wok gud an onggl tiich di chuut. Ef yu du dis, yu naa go av notn fi shiem bout an Gad wi api wid yu.
