So then those who are of faith are blessed with faithful Abraham.
column2: So enibadi we biliiv iina Gad laik ou Iebriyam did biliiv — Gad a-go bles dem jos laik ou im bles Iebriyam.

column1: For all who rely on the works of the law are under the curse. For it is written, “Cursed is everyone who does not continue in all things which are written in the Book of the Law, to do them.”|Gad a-go ponish di piipl dem we a fala di Laa an tingk se dat a-go siev dem. Kaaz nobadi kyaahn fala aal a di Laa dem an it rait dong iina Gad wod se, “Enibadi we no fala aal a di Laa dem, Gad a-go ponish dem.”

Now it is evident that no man is justified by the law in the sight of God, for “The just shall live by faith.”|So unu mos kyan si klier klier nou se nobadi kyaahn mek tingz rait wid Gad jos chuu dem a fala di Laa. It aal rait dong se, “Di piipl dem we mek tingz rait wid Gad an we get dem sin tek we — dem a-go liv fi eva kaaz dem chos iina Gad.”

But the law is not of faith, for “The man who does them shall live by them."|Bot yu no afi biliiv iina Gad fi fala di Laa, di Laa no av notn fi du wid dat. It rait dong iina Gad wod se, “Di wan dem we a fala di Laa an du evriting we di Laa se dem fi du — dem wi liv azkaadn tu ou di Laa se dem a-go liv.”

Christ has redeemed us from the curse of the law by being made a curse for us—as it is written, “Cursed is everyone who hangs on a tree”|Nou wi no aalwiez fala aal a di Laa dem an siek-a dat Gad wuda ponish wi. Bot Krais Jiizas siev wi fram get ponish wen im kom an sofa fi wi. Im get ponish so wi wudn get ponish. It aal rait dong iina Gad wod se, “Enibadi we dem eng op pan wan kraas — Gad a ponish dem.”

so that the blessing of Abraham might come on the Gentiles through Jesus Christ, that we might receive the promise of the Spirit through faith.|Jiizas ded fi wi so dat di piipl dem we a no Juu an we biliiv iina im kyan get bles siem laik ou Gad did bles Iebriyam. Im du it tu so dat wen wi chos iina im wi kyan get di Spirit we Gad pramis fi gi wi.

Brothers, I am speaking in human terms: Though it is only a man’s covenant, yet if it is ratified, no one annuls or adds to it. |Breda an sista, mi a-go yuuz sopm we wi du evridie fi chrai an mek unu andastan wa mi a taak bout. Se tuu piipl mek a diil an di tuu a dem pramis fi du fi dem paat. Nobadi kyan brok da diil de ar ad notn tu it.

Now the promises were made to Abraham and his Seed. He does not say, “and to seeds,” meaning many, but “and to your Seed,” meaning one, who is Christ.|Nou di pramis we Gad mek tu Iebriyam, a did fi Iebriyam an im pikni. Gad wod neva se a nof piipl — it neva se “an tu im pikni dem.” Wa rait dong iina Gad wod a “tu im pikni.” A wan sumadi it a taak bout, an da sumadi de a Krais Jiizas.

And this I say, that the law, which came four hundred and thirty years later, does not annul the covenant that was ratified by God in Christ, so as to nullify the promise.|Wa mi a chrai fi se a dat Gad did mek wan pramis tu Iebriyam, wan pramis we im naa go brok. Fuo onjrid an toti ier lieta, Gad gi wi di Laa. Da Laa de no miin se Gad naa go kip im pramis tu Iebriyam. Di Laa kyaahn chienj dat.

For if the inheritance comes from the law, it no longer comes from the promise. But God gave it to Abraham through a promise.|Nou ef Gad gi wi wa im gi wi kaaz wi fala di Laa — it miin se im wudn a kip im pramis. An siem laik ou Gad bles Iebriyam kaaz a dat im pramis fi du, a siem so im a-go bles wi kaaz a dat im did pramis. So, im naa bles wi kaaz wi fala di Laa, bot kaaz a dat im se im wuda du.

What purpose then does the law serve? It was added because of transgressions, until the Seed should come to whom the promise was made. And it was ordained through angels by the hand of a mediator. |Nou som piipl a-go se, “So wa wi get di Laa fa?” Gad mek wan pramis tu wi bot im gi wi di Laa kaaz wi did a sin an im waahn wi fi liv rait. Gad did waahn piipl fi fala da Laa de til wen Iebriyam pikni, we Gad se im wuda bles, kom. Nou wen Gad did a gi wi di Laa — im sen som ienjel fi tel Muoziz an den Muoziz kom tel wi. So Muoziz a did wi lingk tu Gad.
Now a mediator is not a mediator for only one party, but God is one.|Bot wen Gad did a mek im pramis tu Iebriyam, im neva sen nobadi — im kom taak tu im imself.

Is the law then contrary to the promises of God? God forbid! For if there had been a law given which could have given life, righteousness would indeed come through the law. |Wiet so dat miin se di Laa a go gens Gad Pramis? Nuo sa! Kaaz ef di Laa we Gad gi wi kuda mek wi liv fi eva, den wi wuda a mek tingz rait wid Gad wen wi fala di Laa.

But the Scripture has confined all things under sin, that the promise through faith in Jesus Christ might be given to those who believe.|Bot a no so it go. Iina Gad wod it rait dong se, sin av powa uova evribadi iina di worl, it komiin laik se wi iina prizn. An so Gad pramis fi siev wi an mek wi liv fi eva ef wi biliiv iina Jiizas Krais.

But before faith came, we were imprisoned under the law, kept for the faith which was later to be revealed. |Bifuo di taim kom wen wi kuda chos iina Jiizas an get siev, di Laa did av wi laik prizna. An it did av wi laik prizna til a did taim fi Gad shuo se wi kuda mek tingz rait wid im ef wi biliiv iina Jiizas.

So the law was our tutor to bring us to Christ, that we might be justified by faith.|So di Laa did a gyaad wi til Krais Jiizas kom. It did a elp wi fi liv rait so dat wen Jiizas kom wi kuda mek tingz rait wid Gad, ef wi biliiv iina im.
But now that faith has come, we are no longer under a tutor.|Bot nou a taim wen wi kyan chos iina Jiizas an get siev, so wi no afi fala di Laa no muor — di taim fi it ruul uova wi don.
You are all sons of God by faith in Christ Jesus.
column2: Nou aal a unu a Gad pikni kaaz unu biliiv an chos iina Jiizas Krais.

column1: For as many of you as have been baptized into Christ have put on Christ. |Aal a unu get baptaiz, an so nou unu an Jiizas a wan. An wen unu get baptaiz unu staat fi biyiev an gwaan laik im.

There is neither Jew nor Greek, there is neither slave nor free, and there is neither male nor female, for you are all one in Christ Jesus. |Unu no plit op no muor. Unu no av piipl we a Juu an piipl we a no Juu ar piipl we a sliev an piipl we frii. It no iivn mata ef unu a man ar uman, aal a unu a wan kaaz aal a unu biliiv iina Jiizas.

If you are Christ’s, then you are Abraham’s seed, and heirs according to the promise.|An ef unu bilang tu Krais Jiizas, den unu a Iebriyam pikni an aal a di sitn dem we Gad pramis fi gi Iebriyam, unu wi get tu.

Now I say that as long as the heir is a child, he does not differ from a servant though he is lord of all.|So wa mi a se a dat iivn duo wan pikni uon evriting we im faada av an wan die a-go ruul uova it — til im get big, im komiin jos laik wan sliev.
But he is under tutors and governors until the time appointed by the father.
column2: Im a laik wan sliev kaaz wen im likl im no uon notn ar inchaaj a notn. Ada piipl ruul uova im til di die wen im faada se im kyan ron tingz.

column1: So when we were children, we were in bondage to the elements of the world.|So yu si wi, wi a laik da pikni de. Wen wi did yong, di spirit dem we did av kanchuol uova di worl did av wi laik sliev.

But when the fullness of time came, God sent forth His Son, born from a woman, born under the law|Bot wen di taim we Gad set did kom, im sen im Bwai Pikni, Jiizas. Iivn duo im a did Gad pikni, Jiizas baan jos laik mi an yu. Im did av wan mada an im did afi fala di Laa tu.
to redeem those who were under the law, that we might receive the adoption as sons.|Gad sen im Bwai Pikni fi frii aal a wi we a did sliev tu di Laa so dat di uol a wi kuda ton Gad pikni.

And because you are sons, God has sent forth into our hearts the Spirit of His Son, crying, “Abba, Father!” |An kaaz di uol a wi a nou im pikni, Gad sen im Bwai Pikni Spirit fi kom liv iina wi aat. An a da Spirit de we kaaz wi fi baal out, “Faada, mi Faada.”

Therefore you are no longer a servant, but a son, and if a son, then an heir of God through Christ.|So unu a no sliev no muor; unu a Gad pikni. An kaaz unu a im pikni, unu a-go get aal we Gad pramis fi gi im pikni dem.

Previously, when you did not know God, you served those who by nature are not gods.|Iina di paas, wen unu an Gad neva kluos, unu a did sliev. Unu a did sliev tu di sitn dem we unu kaal gad bot we a no riili gad at aal.

But now, after you have known God, or rather are known by God, how do you turn again to the weak and beggarly elemental forces to which you desire again to be in bondage? |Bot nou unu an Gad kluos — mi riili shuda se nou Gad mek it so unu an im kyan kluos — ou unu kyan ton unu bak pan im an a go bak go fala di wiik spirit dem we a ruul di worl an we naa no powa? Unu waahn go bak go ton dem sliev agen?
You observe days and months and seasons and years. |Unu av speshal die, mont an taim iina di ier wen unu go selibriet an av festival.
I am afraid for you, lest I have worked for you in vain.|Mi fried fi unu. Yu miin se aal a di wok we mi du — aal di tiich mi did tiich unu — aal a dat a fi notn?

Brothers, I ask you, become as I am, for I also have become as you are. You have done me no wrong.|Mi a wan Juu an mi naa fala di Laa — mi komiin jos laik unu we a no Juu. So breda an sista mi a beg unu, du laik mi an no bada fala di Laa. Unu neva du mi notn rang bifuo.
You know that it was because of an infirmity of the flesh that I first preached the gospel to you.
column2: Unu nuo se a chuu mi did sik mek mi did kom priich di Gud Nyuuz tu unu di fos taim.

column1: Though my infirmity was a trial to you, you neither despised nor rejected me, but received me as an angel of God, even as Christ Jesus.|An iivn duo mi siknis did mek tingz aad fi unu, unu neva kin op unu nuoz pan mi ar ton unu bak pan mi. Insted-a dat unu welkom mi laik ou unu wuda welkom wan ienjel fram Gad ar laik ou unu wuda welkom Jiizas Krais.

So where is your blessing? For I bear witness of you that, if it had been possible, you would have plucked out your own eyes and given them to me.|Dem taim de unu did api, a wa apm fi chienj dat? Kaaz mi nuo fi shuor se dem taim de unu wuda du eniting fi mi. Ef unu kuda tek out unu uona yai dem gi mi, unu wuda du it.
Have I therefore become your enemy because I tell you the truth?|So wa, mi a unu enimi nou kaaz mi tel unu di chuut?

They would zealously influence you, but not favorably. Yes, they would exclusively control you, so that you might consult them. |Yu si dem piipl de we a chienj op di Gud Nyuuz, dem wel waahn fi win unu uova. Dem waahn unu fi jain dem bot dem no miin unu no gud. Wa dem a chrai fi du a ton unu gens mi, kaaz dem wel waahn unu fi fala dem wid aal a unu aat.

But it is good to be zealous in a good manner always and not only when I am present with you. |It gud fi fala sitn wid aal a yu aat yu nuo, bot onggl ef wa yu a fala a sopm gud an yu a du it fi di rait riizn. A dat unu fi du aal di taim, no jos wen mi de de wid unu.

My little children, of whom I labor in birth again until Christ is formed in you|Mi pikni we mi lov, jos laik ou mada go chuu nof pien wen dem a av biebi — a siem so mi a fiil pien fi unu. An mi naa go tap fiil pien til unu an Jiizas a wan, an unu staat fi biyiev laik im.

I desire to be present with you now and to change my tone, for I am displeased with you.|Mi wish wid aal a mi aat se mi kuda de de wid unu nou an taak tu unu likl saafa. Kaaz mi kyaahn andastan wa a gwaan wid unu an mi a wori bout unu.
Tell me, you who desire to be under the law, do you not hear the law?|Tel mi sopm, aal a unu we waahn fi fala di Laa an mek it kanchuol unu, unu no andastan wa di Laa a se?

For it is written that Abraham had two sons, the one by a slave woman, the other by a free woman.|Kaaz it rait dong se Iebriyam did av tuu bwai pikni. Wan a dem mada a did wan sliev bot di neks wan mada did frii.

But he who was of the slave woman was born according to the flesh, but he of the free woman through the promise.|Di bwai we mada a sliev baan jos laik ou eni ada biebi baan an im mada get im siem laik ou ada mada get biebi. Notn neva speshal bout im. Bot di bwai we mada did frii im did speshal. Im baan kaaz Gad did pramis Iebriyam se im an Siera wuda av wan pikni.

These things are an allegory, for these are the two covenants. The one is from Mount Sinai, which gives birth to bondage; she is Hagar. |Nou wi kyan tek wa apm wid Iebriyam tuu bwai an yuuz it fi shuo di tuu pramis dem we Gad mek. Di fos pramis afi du wid di Laa we Gad gi Muoziz op a Mount Sainai. Da pramis ya a laik Iegar. Jos laik ou fi ar pikni a sliev a siem so di piipl dem we a paat a da pramis ya, a sliev tu.

Now this Hagar is Mount Sinai in Arabia, and represents the present Jerusalem, and is in bondage with her children. |So nou Iegar tan fi Mount Sainai we de iina Ariebiya. Shi komiin laik Jeruusilem iina dem taim ya, kaaz, siem laik ou Iegar an ar pikni a did sliev, a siem so di piipl dem we liv a Jeruusilem a sliev tu di Laa.
But the Jerusalem which is above is free, which is our mother.|Bot di ada uman, shi tan fi di nyuu Jeruusilem we a-go de iina evn. Shi frii, an a shi a wi mada so wi frii tu.

For it is written:“Rejoice, barren womanwho does not bear;break forth and shout,you who have no labor pains!For the desolate has many more childrenthan she who has a husband.”|Kaaz it rait dong iina Gad wod se:“Uman we kyaahn av biebiwe naa no pikni — a unu fi a sing priez;Yu we neva fiil biebi pien yet —jomp op an sing an shout;kaaz di uman we naa nobadi —shi a-go av muor pikni dan di uman we av ozban.”
Now we, brothers, like Isaac, are the children of promise.|So Breda an sista, siem laik ou Aizak baan kaaz a dat Gad did pramis Iebriyam, a siem so wi a Gad pikni kaaz a dat Gad did pramis.

But as it was then, he who was born after the flesh persecuted him who was born after the Spirit, so it is now also. |Iebriyam bwai pikni Ishmiyel did baan laik ou eni ada pikni baan bot Aizak did baan siek-a Gad Spirit. An siem laik ou Ishmiyel did kaaz Aizak fi sofa a siem so wi we a Gad pikni a sofa nou.

Nevertheless what does the Scripture say? “Cast out the slave woman and her son, for the son of the slave woman shall not be heir with the son of the free woman.”|Bot wa Gad wod se? It se, “Ron di sliev uman an ar pikni, kaaz fi ar pikni kyan neva get wa di faada a-go lef fi di frii uman an fi ar pikni.”
So then, brothers, we are not children of the slave woman, but of the free woman.|So breda an sista, wi a no di sliev uman pikni bot di frii uman pikni.
For freedom Christ freed us. Stand fast therefore and do not be entangled again with the yoke of bondage.
column2: Gad frii wi so dat wi wudn afi fala di Laa. So tan op chrang an no mek notn ar nobadi tek unu ton unu bak iina sliev.

column1: Indeed I, Paul, say to you that if you become circumcised, Christ will profit you nothing.|Unu lisn mi gud! Mi, Paal, a tel unu se ef unu go mek dem sorkomsaiz unu, notn we Krais Jiizas du a-go wot notn tu unu at aal.
I testify again to every man who is circumcised that he is obligated to keep the whole law.
column2: An agen mi a tel evribadi we go get sorkomsaiz se dem afi fala di Laa. An no jos som a di Laa bot di uol a di Laa.

column1: You have been cut off from Christ, whoever of you are justified by law; you have fallen from grace. |Yu si di wan dem we gaan bak gaan fala di Laa an tingk se dat a-go mek tingz rait bitwiin dem an Gad — dem kot aaf demself fram Krais Jiizas. Unu a mek it so dat Gad naa go kyan gud an kain tu unu.

For we, through the Spirit, by faith, eagerly wait for the hope of righteousness. |Bot yu si wi, di wan dem we a chos iina Jiizas Krais, di Uoli Spirit mek wi nuo fi shuor se wi a-go get aal a wa Gad pramis fi gi wi. So wi kyan wiet an luk fi aal we Gad pramis fi gi wi kaaz Gad mek tingz rait bitwiin wi an im aredi.

For in Christ Jesus neither circumcision nor uncircumcision means anything, but faith which works through love.|Kaaz wen yu an Jiizas a wan it no mata ef yu sorkomsaiz ar yu no sorkomsaiz. Di onggl ting wa mata a dat yu chos iina im. An yu shuo se yu chos iina im wen yu shuo lov.
You were running well. Who hindered you from obeying the truth?
column2: Unu did a ron so aad an a gwaan so gud! A uu kaaz unu fi tap fala an biliiv iina di chuut?

column1: This persuasion does not come from Him who calls you. |A kyaahn Gad we kaal unu fi bi im pikni, a kaaz unu fi tap fala di chuut.
A little yeast leavens the whole batch. |Laik piipl aalwiez se, “Yu onggl niid wan likl bit a yiis fi mek di uol duo swel op.”

I have confidence in you through the Lord that you will not think otherwise. But he who is troubling you shall bear his judgment, whoever he is. |Mi biliiv iina Gad, an so mi shuor se unu naa go ton unu bak pan aal we mi tiich unu an go fala wa dem ada piipl de a se. Bot yu si di wan dem we a chrai fi kanfyuuz unu, uu eva dem waahn fi bi, Gad a-go ponish dem.

Brothers, if I am still preaching circumcision, why do I still suffer persecution? Then the offense of the cross has ceased.|Nou breda an sista, ef mi did a priich se piipl mos sorkomsaiz stil, unu tingk se di Juu dem wuda stil a mek mi sofa aal nou? Ef mi did a priich dat insted-a priich bout ou Jiizas ded pan di kraas fi wi, dem wudn beks no muor, kaaz mi wuda a du wa dem waahn.
I wish that those who are troubling you would castrate themselves!
column2: Mi wish se di wan dem we a chrai fi kanfyuuz an a tel unu fi go get sorkomsaiz wuda jos go chap aaf aal a fi dem uon.

column1: You, brothers, have been called to liberty. Only do not use liberty to give an opportunity to the flesh, but by love serve one another.|Breda an sista, Gad kaal unu so dat unu kuda frii fram di Juu dem Laa. Bot dat no miin se unu kyan go liv eni ou unu waahn fi liv. Wa unu fi du a sorv an lov wan aneda.

For the entire law is fulfilled in one word, even in this: “You shall love your neighbor as yourself.”|Wen yu luk pan it, aal di Laa riili a tel unu fi du a fi “Lov unu nieba laik ou unu lov unuself.”

But if you bite and devour one another, take heed that you are not consumed by one another.|Bot ef unu kip aan a bait an chaa op chaa op unu wan aneda laik unu a wail animal, unu beta wach out, kaaz unu a-go mash op unu wan aneda.

I say then, walk in the Spirit, and you shall not fulfill the lust of the flesh.|Mi a tel unu liv unu laif laik ou Gad Spirit se unu fi liv. Da wie de unu naa go gi iin tu sin an du di rang sitn dem we unu eva waahn fi du.

For the flesh lusts against the Spirit, and the Spirit against the flesh. These are in opposition to one another, so that you may not do the things that you please. |Kaaz di rang sitn dem we di badi waahn fi du, di Spirit no waahn dat. An di sitn dem we di Spirit waahn fi du, di badi no waahn dat. Di tuu a dem eva a fait wid dem wan aneda, a so mek unu kyaahn aalwiez du wa unu waahn fi du.
But if you are led by the Spirit, you are not under the law.|Bot ef Gad Spirit liid unu, di Laa naa no powa uova unu.

Now the works of the flesh are revealed, which are these: adultery, sexual immorality, impurity, lewdness,|Aal a wi nuo bout di sitn dem we piipl du wen dem mek dem badi kanchuol dem. Dem de piipl de sliip roun sliip roun wid evribadi an evriting. Dem main an aat doti. Dem naa no kanchuol uova demself.

idolatry, sorcery, hatred, strife, jealousy, rage, selfishness, dissensions, heresies|Di piipl we mek dem badi kanchuol dem worship aal kain-a faalz gad an wok uobiya. Dem chriit piipl aad an dem lov kos an fait. Dem bad main piipl fi we dem av an it no tek notn fi set dem aaf. Di piipl dem we mek dem badi kanchuol dem eva waahn piipl fi rispek dem bot dem no rispek nobadi. Dem onggl bizniz wid demself. Dem kaaz piipl fi plit op an dem onggl taak tu dem fren.

envy, murders, drunkenness, carousing, and the like. I warn you, as I previously warned you, that those who do such things shall not inherit the kingdom of God.|Aal dem waahn, a wa ada piipl av. Dem de piipl de eva a jringk tu moch, an a go aal kain-a wail paati. A dem de kain-a sitn de dem lov du. Mi a waan unu jos laik ou mi did waan unu bifuo: di wan dem we mek dem badi kanchuol dem an we du aal a di sitn dem we mi jos taak bout — dem naa go kyan tek paat iina Gad kindom.

But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, patience, gentleness, goodness, faith|Bot Gad Spirit kaaz fi im piipl fi lov evribadi an aalwiez api no mata wa. It kaaz dem fi liv gud wid piipl, no fi lov fait an fi aalwiez tek taim wid ada piipl. Di Spirit mek dem kain an mek dem eva a du gud fi piipl. It kaaz dem fi bi sumadi we piipl kyan chos.
meekness, and self-control; against such there is no law.|Di Spirit mek dem jengkl an mek dem nuo ou fi kanchuol demself. No Laa no de bout we wi tap yu fram liv so.

Those who are Christ’s have crucified the flesh with its passions and lusts.|Di piipl dem we bilang tu Jiizas Krais no mek dem badi ruul dem. Dem no du di wikid sitn dem we dem badi wel waahn du, dem tap dem sitn de. It komiin laik se dem niel dem op pan di kraas an kil dem.
If we live in the Spirit, let us also walk in the Spirit. |So sins Gad Spirit gi wi laif, mek wi liv ou di Spirit waahn wi fi liv.

Let us not be conceited, provoking one another and envying one another.|Mek wi no get ful-a wiself an tingk se wi beta dan ada piipl. Mek wi no provuok wan aneda an mek wi no red yai fi wan aneda sitn dem.

Brothers, if a man is caught in any transgression, you who are spiritual should restore such a one in the spirit of meekness, watching yourselves, lest you also be tempted.|Breda an sista, ef unu fain se sumadi we iina di choch a liv iina sin, unu we a liv ou Gad Spirit se unu fi liv, mos karek dem bot tek taim wid dem. Tek kier so unu no faal iina sin tu.
Bear one another’s burdens, and so fulfill the law of Christ. |Wen sumadi av prablem, unu fi elp dem. Unu fi elp unu wan aneda. Kaaz wen unu du dat unu a du we Krais Jiizas se unu mos du.
For if someone thinks himself to be something when he is nothing, he deceives himself.|Kaaz ef sumadi tingk se dem big an impuotant bot dem a nobadi, dem onggl a fuul demself.

But let each one examine his own work, and then he will have rejoicing in himself alone, and not in another.|Evribadi mos luk iina demself an si ef wa dem a du rait. Unu no fi luk pan nobadi fi si ef unu rait, unu mos onggl luk pan unuself. An den ef wa unu a du rait, unu kyan api wid unuself
For each one shall bear his own burden.
column2: Kaaz evribadi mos kyari dem uona luod.

column1: Let him who is taught in the word share all good things with him who teaches.
column2: Unu we a lorn Gad wod mos shier aal a di gud sitn dem we unu av wid unu tiicha.

column1: Be not deceived. God is not mocked. For whatever a man sows, that will he also reap. |No fuul unuself: Unu kyaahn tek Gad mek preke. Eniting we unu plaant a dat unu a-go riip.

For the one who sows to his own flesh will from the flesh reap corruption, but the one who sows to the Spirit will from the Spirit reap eternal life. |So ef yu plaant di sitn dem we yu badi waahn, a ded unu a-go ded — a dat unu a-go riip. Bot ef yu plaant di sitn dem we Gad Spirit waahn yu wi riip laif, wan laif we naa go don.
And let us not grow weary in doing good, for in due season we shall reap, if we do not give up. |So mek wi no get taiyad fi du gud, kaaz ef wi no gi op, wen Gad redi, im wi mek wi riip nof gud sitn.

Therefore, as we have opportunity, let us do good to all people, especially to those who are of the household of faith.|So wen-eva wi av di chaans fi du gud, mek wi du it. Mek wi du gud fi evribadi, wos ef dem a paat a Gad fambili an biliiv iina Jiizas laik wi.
You see what large letters I have written to you with my own hand.
column2: Unu si ou di leta dem big wen mi rait unu wid mi uona an!

column1: It is those who desire to make a good showing in the flesh that try to compel you to be circumcised, only that they may not be persecuted for the cross of Christ. |Di wan dem we a chrai fuos unu fi get sorkomsaiz, dem jos waahn fi brag an buos bout demself. Dem a push unu fi get sorkomsaiz so dat dem no sofa. Kaaz dem wuda a sofa ef dem did a tel piipl bout ou Jiizas ded pan di kraas fi siev dem.

For they themselves who are circumcised do not keep the law. But they desire to have you circumcised, so that they may boast in your flesh.|No iivn di wan dem we sorkomsaiz a fala di Laa, bot dem waahn yu fi go get sorkomsaiz so dat dem kyan go brag bout ou dem kaaz yu fi du it.

God forbid that I should boast, except in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ, by whom the world is crucified to me, and I to the world.|Mi uop se mi wi onggl buos bout ou Jiizas ded pan di kraas fi mi an ou siek-a im, mi no liv laik ou di res a piipl iina di worl liv — mi ded tu di worl an di worl ded tu mi. Mi uop se mi neva eva buos bout notn els bot dat.

For in Christ Jesus neither circumcision nor uncircumcision means anything, but a new creation.|A no notn ef yu sorkomsaiz ar yu no sorkomsaiz; di onggl ting we mata a se Gad tek yu an ton yu iina wan nyuu sumadi.
Peace and mercy be on all who walk according to this rule and upon the Israel of God.
column2: Fi evribadi we grii wid mi — mi prie se Gad wi gi dem piis an dat im wi gud an kain tu dem an aal a im piipl dem.

column1: From now on let no one trouble me, for I bear in my body the marks of the Lord Jesus.|Fram nou aan, nobadi fi gi mi no muor chobl kaaz mi av di maak dem pan mi badi we shuo se mi a Gad sliev.
Brothers, the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.|Breda an sista mi prie se wi Laad Jiizas Krais wi shuo di uol a unu lov iivn duo wi no dizorv it. Iemen!
The beginning of the gospel of Jesus Christ, the Son of God.|Dis a ou di Gud Nyuuz bout Jiizas Krais, Gad Bwai Pikni staat.

As it is written in the Prophets: “Look, I am sending My messenger before Your face, who will prepare Your way before You.”|It rait dong iina di buk we di prafit Aizaiya rait, se:“Luk, mi wi sen mi mesinja fi gwaan til yu kom, im a-go get piipl redi fi yu.”

“The voice of one crying in the wilderness:‘Prepare the way of the Lord, make His paths straight.’ ”|“Sumadi a shout iina di dezot, ‘Klier di wie fi di Laad kom chuu, mek di chrak we di Laad fi waak pan chriet.’ ”

John came baptizing in the wilderness and preaching a baptism of repentance for the remission of sins.|So Jan di Baptis staat fi priich iina di dezot an se piipl fi ton we fram dem sin, get baptaiz, an Gad wi paadn dem fi aal di rang we dem du.

The whole region of Judea and all the people of Jerusalem went out to him and were all baptized by him in the Jordan River, confessing their sins.|Piipl fram aal uova Judiya an evribadi we liv iina Jeruusilem did a go tu im. Wen dem si se dem a sina, an sari fi di rang we dem du, im baptaiz dem iina di Riva Jaadn.
John was clothed with camel’s hair and with a leather belt around his waist. And he ate locusts and wild honey.
column2: Jan kluoz did mek outa kyamil ier wid wan leda belt roun im wies. An fi im fuud im nyam graasapa an oni we im fain iina di dezot.

column1: He preached saying, “After me is coming One mightier than I, the straps of whose shoes I am not worthy to stoop down and untie.|Jan tel di piipl dem se, “Sumadi muo powaful dan mi a kom an mi no iivn gud inof fi pul di chrap pan im slipaz.
I indeed have baptized you with water, but He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit.|Mi baptaiz unu iina waata, bot im a-go baptaiz unu wid di Uoli Spirit.
In those days Jesus came from Nazareth in Galilee and was baptized by John in the Jordan.|Roun dem taim de, Jiizas did kom fram Nazaret iina Gyalalii an Jan did baptaiz im iina Riva Jaadn.

Coming up out of the water, He immediately saw the heavens opened and the Spirit descending on Him like a dove.|Siem taim Jiizas a kom op outa di waata, im si evn uopm op an di Spirit a kom dong pan im laik wan dov.
And a voice came from heaven, saying, “You are My beloved Son in whom I am well pleased.”|An wan vais fram evn se, “Yu a fi mi wan dege-dege Bwai Pikni, mi lov yu an yu mek mi aat glad.
The Spirit immediately drove Him into the wilderness.
column2: Siem taim di Uoli Spirit kaaz Jiizas fi go iina di dezot.

column1: And He was there in the wilderness for forty days, tempted by Satan, and was with the wild beasts. And the angels ministered to Him.|An im did iina di dezot fi faati die. An wen im did out de, Sietan chrai aad aad fi mek im du rang. Im did out de mongks di wail animal dem bot ienjel did a luk aafa im.

After John was put in prison, Jesus came to Galilee preaching the gospel of the kingdom of God, saying, “The time is fulfilled, and the kingdom of God is at hand. Repent and believe the gospel.”|Nou afta dem lak op Jan iina prizn, Jiizas go a Gyalalii go priich Gad gud nyuuz, Im se, “A taim nou! Gad suun ruul iina evri wie! Ton we fram unu sin an ton tu Gad an biliiv di gud nyuuz!”

As He walked by the Sea of Galilee, He saw Simon and Andrew, his brother, throwing a net into the sea, for they were fishermen. |Wen im did a waak saida Gyalalii sii, im si Saiman an im breda Anju. Dem did a fling out dem net iina di liek fi kech fish kaaz dem a did fishaman.
Jesus said to them, “Come, follow Me, and I will make you fishers of men.”|Jiizas se tu dem se, “Fala mi! An siem laik ou unu kech fish, mi wi tiich unu ou fi kech piipl an mek dem ton mi falara.”
Immediately they left their nets and followed Him.
column2: So dem lef dem buot siem taim an fala Jiizas.

column1: When He had gone a little farther from there, He saw James the son of Zebedee and John, his brother, who also were in the boat mending their nets. |Likl dong fram de-so, im si Jiemz an Jan, Zebidii tuu bwai pikni dem iina wan buot a fiks dem net.
Immediately He called them. And they left their father Zebedee in the boat with the hired servants and followed Him.
column2: Jiizas kaal dem an siem taim dem go fala im. Dem lef dem faada Zebidii iina di buot wid di man dem we did a wok fi im.

column1: They went to Capernaum, and immediately on the Sabbath He entered the synagogue and taught.|Lieta Jiizas an im falara dem lef go a Kyaporniyom. Pan di Sabat im go iina di Juu dem choch an staat fi tiich.

They were astonished at His teaching, for He taught them as one having authority, and not as the scribes. |Evribadi shak wen dem ier di sitn dem we im did a tiich, kaaz im tiich laik sumadi we av di rait an di powa fi du it. Im neehn tiich laik di Laa tiicha dem.
In their synagogue there was a man with an unclean spirit.
column2: Siem taim wan man we did iina di Juu dem choch we diiman did tek kanchuol a.

column1: And he cried out, “Leave us alone! What do You have to do with us, Jesus of Nazareth? Have You come to destroy us? I know who You are, the Holy One of God.”|An im baal out, Jiizas a Nazaret, wa yu waahn wid wi? A kom yu kom fi kil wi aaf? Mi nuo uu yu bi! Yu a di Uoli Wan we kom fram Gad!
Jesus rebuked him, saying, “Be silent and come out of him!” |“Kiba yu mout!” Jiizas se tu di diiman iina wan siiros vais. “Kom outa di man!”
When the unclean spirit had convulsed him and cried out with a loud voice, it came out of him.|Di diiman fling im dong an mek im de de a flata, it baal out loud loud an kom outa im.

They were all amazed, so that they questioned among themselves, “What is this? What new teaching is this? With authority He commands even the unclean spirits, and they obey Him.” |Di piipl dem did wel shak, so dem aks dem wan aneda, “A wa dis ya? A som powaful nyuu sitn im a tiich! Da man ya aal av di powa an di rait fi aada diiman fi kom outa piipl an dem du wa im se.”
Immediately His fame spread everywhere throughout the region surrounding Galilee.
column2: Nyuuz bout Jiizas pred faas faas aal uova di ieriya roun Gyalalii.

column1: When He came out of the synagogue with James and John, they went directly to the house of Simon and Andrew. |Afta Jiizas lef di Juu dem choch, dem go chriet a Saiman an Anju ous. Jiemz an Jan did go wid dem tu.
The mother of Simon’s wife lay sick with a fever, and immediately they told Him of her.|Saiman mada-in-laa did sik iina bed a ruos wid fiiva, Wen Jiizas riich a di ous, dem tel im bout ar.

So He came and took her by the hand and lifted her up, and immediately the fever left her. And she served them.|Jiizas go tu ar, uol ar an an tek taim riez ar op. Di fiiva brok an shi staat luk aafa dem.

In the evening, when the sun had set, they brought to Him all who were sick and those who were possessed with demons.|Afta di son go dong an iivnin kom, di piipl dem kyari aal a di sik piipl dem an aal a di piipl dem we diiman did a kanchuol go a Jiizas.

The whole city was gathered at the door, and He healed many who were sick with various diseases and cast out many demons. And He did not let the demons speak, because they knew Him.|Di uol toun gyada op a di ous duor. So im iil uol iip a dem we did sik wid aal kain-a difrant difrant siknis an ron out diiman outa nof a dem. Bot im neva mek di diiman dem se notn kaaz dem did nuo uu im bi.

In the morning, rising up a great while before sunrise, He went out and departed to a solitary place. And there He prayed.|Orli orli iina di maanin, wen it did stil daak daak, Jiizas get op an go fain wan plies we nobadi no de, so im kuda tan de an prie.

Simon and those who were with Him followed Him, 37and when they found Him, they said to Him, “Everyone is searching for You.”|So Saiman an im fren dem staat luk fi im, Wen dem fain im, dem se tu im se, “Evribadi a luk fi yu!”

He said to them, “Let us go into the nearby towns, that I may preach there also. For that is why I have come.”|So im ansa dem se, “Mek wi go a som ada plies iina di dischrik dem we de nier ya-so, so mi kyan priich tu dem tu, kaaz a dat mi kom out ya fi du.”
So He preached in their synagogues throughout Galilee and cast out demons.
column2: So im go aal bout Gyalalii go priich iina di Juu dem choch an ron out diiman outa piipl.

column1: A leper came to Him, pleading with Him and kneeling before Him, saying, “If You are willing, You can make me clean.”|Wan fasi-fasi skin man kom tu Jiizas. Im go dong pan im nii an beg Jiizas fi elp im. Im se, “Ef yu waahn fi kyuor mi an mek mi kliin, yu av di powa fi dwi'it.”

Then Jesus, moved with compassion, extended His hand and touched him, and said to him, “I will. Be clean.” |Jiizas fiil sari fi di man, so im chrech out im an an toch im an se, “Mi waahn yu fi get kliin. Gwaan, yu beta nou!”
As soon as He had spoken, the leprosy immediately departed from him, and he was cleansed.|Di man get beta siem taim an im skin get kliin kliin.

He sternly warned him, and sent him away at once, saying, “See that you say nothing to anyone. But go your way, show yourself to the priest, and offer for your cleansing what Moses commanded, as a testimony to them.” |Siem taim Jiizas waan im aaf chrang chrang an sen im we. Jiizas tel im se, “Mek shuor se yu no se notn tu nobadi bout dis. Nou dat yu get beta, jos gwaan go shuo yuself tu di priis an kyari di sakrifais we Muoziz Laa se yu fi gi wen yu skin get beta. Dat wi shuo evribadi se yu get kliin.”

Instead he went out and began to proclaim it widely and to spread the news around, so that Jesus could no more openly enter the city, but was out in remote places. And they came to Him from every quarter.|Bot di man lef an staat pred tu evribadi wa Jiizas du fi im. So fram dat Jiizas kudn go iina no toun mek nobadi si im. Im afi tan iina di konchri paat faar faar fram di toun. Bot piipl stil kip aan a kom tu im fram aal bout.
Again, He entered Capernaum after some days. And it was reported that He was in the house.|Afta kopl die Jiizas go baka Kyaporniyom an nyuuz pred aal bout se im kom uom.

Immediately many were gathered together, so that there was no room to receive them, not even at the door. And He preached the word to them. |So piipl staat fi gyada op a im ous an di plies did ram op so til yu kudn fain no we fi tan op, no iivn a di duor. An Jiizas priich Gad wod tu dem.
They came to Him bringing one sick with paralysis, who was carried by four men.|Som piipl kom de wid wan kripl man fi si Jiizas an fuo a di man dem did a kyari im.

When they could not come near Him due to the crowding, they uncovered the roof where He was. When they had broken it open, they let down the bed on which the paralytic lay.|Bot siek-a di kroud, dem kudn get di man iina di ous we Jiizas de. So di man dem tier aaf paat a di ous tap an let dong di kripl man pan im chrecha.

When Jesus saw their faith, He said to the paralytic, “Son, your sins are forgiven you.”|Wen Jiizas si ou di man dem biliiv iina im, im se tu di kripl man se, “Mi pikni, mi paadn yu fram aal a yu sin dem.”

But some of the scribes were sitting there, reasoning in their hearts, “Why does this Man speak such blasphemies? Who can forgive sins but God alone?”|Som a di Laa tiicha dem did sidong de an dem staat tingk aad aad tu demself se, “A wa rang wid da man ya duo iihn? Ou im fi se dem sitn de? Im a disrispek Gad! No onggl Gad wan kyan paadn sin?”

Immediately, when Jesus perceived in His spirit that they so reasoned within themselves, He said to them, “Why do you contemplate these things in your hearts?|Bot siem taim Jiizas pik op iina im spirit wa dem did a tingk. So im se tu dem se, “Wa mek unu a tingk dem sitn de iina unu aat?

Which is easier to say to the paralytic: ‘Your sins are forgiven you,’ or to say, ‘Rise, take up your bed and walk’?|Wich wan iiziya, fi tel di kripl man, ‘Mi paadn yu sin dem,’ ar fi tel im se, ‘Tan op, pik op yu chrecha, an waak’?

But that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins,” He said to the paralytic, “I say to you, rise, and take up your bed, and go your way to your house.”|Bot fi mek unu nuo, mi a-go shuo unu se di Man we Gad Pik av di rait an di powa fi paadn sin pan ort.” So im se tu di kripl man se, “Lisn tu mi, tan op, tek op yu chrecha, an go a yu yaad.”

Immediately he rose, picked up the bed, and went out in front of them all, so that they were all amazed and glorified God, saying, “We never saw anything like this!”|Di man get op siem taim, tek op im chrecha an ed fi im yaad wail evribadi did a wach im. Di piipl did shak an dem priez Gad an se, “Wi neva si notn laik dis bifuo!”
He went out again by the seaside, and the whole crowd came to Him, and He taught them. |Jiizas go bak pan di sii-said an uol iip a piipl gyada op roun im, an im tiich dem.

As He passed by, He saw Levi the son of Alphaeus sitting at the tax collector’s station, and He said to him, “Follow Me.” And he rose and followed Him.|Wen im did de pan im wie im si Liivai, Alfiyos bwai, sidong wich paat piipl kalek taks. Jiizas se tu im se, “Fala mi!” So im get op an fala Jiizas.

As Jesus was at supper in his house, many tax collectors and sinners also sat together with Jesus and His disciples. For there were many, and they followed Him.|Afta dat, Jiizas go nyam a Liivai yaad, an nof taks kalekta an piipl we du rang did kom kom sidong an nyam wid im an im speshal falara dem, kaaz a uol iip a piipl did a fala im.

When the scribes and Pharisees saw Him eating with tax collectors and sinners, they said to His disciples, “How is it that He eats and drinks with tax collectors and sinners?”|Wen di Laa tiicha dem an di Farisii dem si se Jiizas did a nyam wid taks kalekta an piipl we du rang, dem aks im falara dem se, “Wa mek im nyam wid di taks kalekta an rang-duwa?”

When Jesus heard it, He said to them, “Those who are well have no need of a physician, but those who are sick. I came not to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.”|Wen Jiizas ier wa dem se, im se tu dem se, “Piipl we no sik no niid dakta, a onggl sik piipl niid dakta. Mi neehn kom ya fi tel piipl we du rait fi ton fram dem rang, a piipl we du rang mi kom ya fa.”

Now the disciples of John and of the Pharisees were fasting. And people came and said to Him, “Why do the disciples of John and of the Pharisees fast, but Your disciples do not fast?”|Nou Jan di Baptis falara dem an di Farisii dem did a kip we fram fuud. Som piipl kom tu Jiizas an aks im se, “Wa mek Jan falara dem an di Farisii dem a kip we fram fuud an fi yu falara dem naa du dat?”

Jesus said to them, “Can the wedding guests fast while the bridegroom is with them? As long as they have the bridegroom with them, they cannot fast. |Jiizas ansa dem se, “Yu tingk se di piipl dem we di braidgruum invait a im wedn fi kip we fram fuud wen im mongks dem? Wen di braidgruum de mongks dem, dem kyaahn kip we fram fuud.

But the days will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them, and then they will fast in those days.|Bot di taim a-go kom wen di braidgruum a-go get tek we fram dem. Da taim de dem wi kip we fram fuud.

No one sews a piece of new cloth on an old garment, or else the new piece that covered it tears away from the old, and the tear is made worse.|“Nobadi no yuuz piis a nyuu klaat fi pach op uol kluoz. Ef dem du dat, wen dem wash di kluoz, di nyuu klaat a-go tier we fram di uol wan an lef wan biga uol dan wa did de de bifuo.

And no one pours new wine into old wineskins, or else the new wine bursts the wineskins, and the wine is spilled, and the wineskins will be marred. But new wine must be poured into new wineskins.”|Nobadi no chuo nyuu wain iina uol wain bakl. Ef dem du dat, di wain a-go bos op di bakl. Di bakl a-go mash op an di wain a-go wies. Wa piipl du a put nyuu wain iina nyuu wain bakl.

He went through the grain fields on the Sabbath. As they went, His disciples began to pluck the heads of grain.|Wan Sabat, Jiizas an im speshal falara dem did a go chuu wan wiit fiil. Im falara dem staat pik som a di wiit dem wen dem did a paas chuu.
The Pharisees said to Him, “Look, why are they doing on the Sabbath what is not lawful?”|So som Farisii aks Jiizas se, “Luk ya, wa mek dem a du wa di Laa se dem no fi du pan di Sabat?”

He said to them, “Have you never read what David did, when he and those who were with him were in need and hungry: how he went into the house of God, in the days Abiathar was the high priest, and ate the ritual bread, which is lawful only for the priests to eat, and also gave it to those who were with him?”|Jiizas ansa dem se, “Unu neva riid wa Dievid did du wen im an im fren dem did onggri? Ou im go iina Gad ous wen taim Abaiyataar a did liida fi di priis dem, nyam di uoli bred we di Laa se onggl di priis dem fi get, an aal gi im fren dem som?”
Then He said to them, “The Sabbath was made for man, and not man for the Sabbath.|Den Jiizas se tu dem se, “Di Sabat did mek fi piipl, piipl neva mek fi di Sabat.
So the Son of Man is Lord even of the Sabbath.|Kaaz a dat di Man we Gad Pik, a im ruul. An im ruul aal uova di Sabat.
Again, He entered the synagogue, and there was a man who had a withered hand. |Wan neda die Jiizas go baka di Juu dem choch an wan man wid wan kripl an did de de.

They watched Him to see whether He would heal him on the Sabbath, so that they might accuse Him.|Di Farisii dem wach Jiizas laik wan aak fi si ef im did a go mek di man beta pan di Sabat, so dem kuda av sopm fi se gens im.
He said to the man who had the withered hand, “Stand up.”|So Jiizas se tu di man wid di kripl an se, “Tan op infronta evribadi.”

Then He said to them, “Is it lawful to do good or to do evil on the Sabbath, to save life or to kill?” But they kept silent.|Den im aks di piipl, “Wich wan di Laa se wi kyan du pan di Sabat: fi du gud ar fi du bad, fi siev sumadi laif ar fi kaaz sumadi fi ded?” Bot nobadi neva se a wod.

When He had looked around at them with anger, being grieved for the hardness of their hearts, He said to the man, “Stretch your hand forward.” He stretched it out, and his hand was restored as whole as the other.|Jiizas luk roun pan dem an im did wel beks an it bon im fi si ou dem aad-iez. So im se tu di man se, “Chrech out yu an.” Di man chrech out im an, an im an get beta.
Then the Pharisees went out and immediately took counsel with the Herodians against Him, how to kill Him.|So siem taim di Farisii dem lef out an go staat plan wid Erad falara dem fi kil Jiizas.

Jesus withdrew with His disciples to the sea. And a great crowd followed Him from Galilee and Judea 8and Jerusalem, and Idumea, and from beyond the Jordan. And those from Tyre and Sidon, a great crowd, when they heard what great things He did, came to Him.|Den Jiizas an im falara dem lef out an go dong a di sii, an wan uol iip a piipl fram Gyalalii fala im. An fram Judiya, 8Jeruusilem, Iduomiya, uova di ada saida Riva Jaadn, an roun Taiya an Saidan uol iip muo piipl kom tu im wen dem ier bout di sitn dem we im did du.

He told the disciples to have a small boat ready for Him because of the crowd, lest they should crush Him.|Siek-a di kroud, Jiizas tel im falara dem fi get wan likl buot redi fi im, so dat di kroud wudn push aad gens im.
For He had healed many, so that all who had diseases pressed on Him to touch Him.|Kaaz chuu im did iil nof a dem, aal a di sik piipl dem did a push an a chrai fi get kluos so dem kuda toch im.

When unclean spirits saw Him, they fell down before Him, crying out, “You are the Son of God.” |An piipl we av diiman iina dem, enitaim di diiman dem si Jiizas, dem fling dong demself an baal out se, “Yu a Gad Bwai Pikni!”
But He sternly ordered them not to make Him known.
column2: Bot Jiizas wuda waan di diiman dem se dem mosn tel nobadi bout im.

column1: He went up into the mountain and called to Him those whom He desired, and they came to Him.|Nou Jiizas go op pan wan il an kaal aal uu im did waahn an dem kom tu im.

He ordained twelve to be with Him, and to be sent out to preach, 15and to have authority to heal sicknesses and to cast out demons: |Im pik out twelv man we im kaal im apasl, so dat dem kuda tan wid im an dat im kuda sen dem fi go priich, 15an dat im kuda gi dem di rait an di powa fi ron out diiman outa piipl.

Simon, whom He named Peter; 17James, the son of Zebedee, and John, the brother of James, whom he surnamed Boa­nerges (meaning Sons of Thunder);|Di twelv we im pik a did Saiman we im kaal Piita, 17Jiemz an im breda Jan, Zebidii tuu bwai dem, we im kaal Buowanojiiz (dat miin man we komiin laik tonda);

Andrew,and Philip, and Bartholomew, and Matthew, and Thomas; and James the son of Alphaeus; andThaddaeus, and Simon the Zealot; 19and Judas Iscariot, who betrayed Him.|Anju, Filip, Bartalimyuu, Matyu, Tamas, Jiemz Alfiyos bwai, Tadiyos, Saiman di Zelat, 19an Juudas Iskyariyat, di wan we sel out Jiizas.

Then they entered a house, and the crowd came together again, so that they could not even eat bread. |Nou Jiizas go baka di ous wich paat im did a stie an wan kroud a piipl did gyada op de, so im an im falara dem kudn get fi iit.
When His family heard of it, they went out to seize Him, for they said, “He is beside Himself.”|Wen im fambili ier dis, dem go fi im fi go tek chaaj a im, kaaz dem se, “Im a luuz im ed.”

And the scribes who came down from Jerusalem said, “He is possessed by Beelzebub, and by the ruler of the demons He casts out demons.”|Di Laa tiicha dem we did kom dong fram Jeruusilem se, “Im av Belzibul, di diiman ruula, iina im. A Belzibul gi im powa fi ron out diiman.”

So He called them to Him and said to them in parables, “How can Satan cast out Satan? |So Jiizas kaal di piipl dem an tel dem wan likl tuori fi tiich dem sitn. Im aks dem se, “Ou Sietan fi ron out imself, iihn?
If a kingdom is divided against itself, that kingdom cannot stand.|Ef di piipl a wan kindom a iet dem wan aneda an a fait gens dem wan aneda, da kindom de kyaahn laas lang.
If a house is divided against itself, that house cannot stand. |Ef di piipl iina wan fambili a iet dem wan aneda an a fait gens dem wan aneda, da fambili de kyaahn laas lang.

And if Satan rises up against himself and is divided, he cannot stand, but is coming to an end.|An ef Sietan iet imself an a fait imself, im no wuda luuz im powa, im kindom no wuda mash op an no don im wuda don fa?

No one can enter a strong man’s house and plunder his goods, unless he first binds the strong man. Then he will plunder his house.|An nobadi kyaahn brok iina wan chrang man ous an tiif out im sitn dem. Dem wuda afi tai im op fos. Wen dem tai im op, a da taim de dem kyan tek we evriting.

Truly I say to you, all sins will be forgiven the sons of men, and whatever blasphemies they speak.|Mi a tel unu di chuut, piipl wi get paadn fi aal kain-a sin, iivn fi aal a di torbl sitn dem we dem se gens Gad.

But he who blasphemes against the Holy Spirit never has forgiveness, but is in danger of eternal condemnation.”|Bot nobadi we se torbl sitn gens di Uoli Spirit kyaahn get paadn fi dat, kaaz dem wuda sin wan sin we nobadi kyaahn get paadn fa non at aal.”
For they said, “He has an unclean spirit.”|Jiizas se dat kaaz dem did se, “Im av wan diiman iina im.”
Then His mother and His brothers came, and standing outside, they sent to Him, calling Him.|Den Jiizas mada an im breda dem kom fi si im. Dem tan op outa duor an sen sumadi go kaal im.

The crowd sat around Him and said to Him, “Your mother and Your brothers are outside asking for You.”|Di kroud a piipl we did sidong roun im se tu im se, “Yu mada, yu breda, an sista dem outa duor fi si yu.”
He answered, “Who are My mother and My brothers?”|Im ansa dem se, “Uu a mi mada an uu a mi breda dem?”
Then He looked around at those who sat around Him and said, “Here are My mother and My brothers! |Den im luk roun pan di piipl dem we did a sidong roun im an se, “Si mi mada an mi breda dem ya!
For whoever does the will of God is My brother, and My sister, and My mother.|Enibadi we du wa Gad se dem fi du a mi breda, sista, an mada dat.”

Again He began to teach by the seaside. A large crowd was gathered before Him, so that He entered a boat and sat in it on the sea. And the whole crowd was by the sea on the land. |Wan neks taim Jiizas did a tiich saida di liek. Wan big big kroud a piipl gyada op roun im. Im did afi go iina wan buot pan di liek go sidong wail di iip a piipl dem tan op a di liek-said.

He taught them many things in parables and said to them in His teaching: 3“Listen! And take note: A sower went out to sow.|An im yuuz som likl tuori an tiich dem uol iip a sitn. Im se tu dem se, 3“Ier dis! Wan faama did go out fi plaant som siid.
As he sowed, some seed fell beside the path, and the birds of the air came and devoured it.|An wen im did a plaant, som a di siid dem jrap wich paat piipl waak, an di bod dem kom kom nyam dem op.

Some seed fell on rocky ground, where it did not have much soil, and soon it sprang up because it did not have deep soil.|Som jrap we bie rakstuon de. Dem neehn av moch dot fi gruo iina. Nou, kaaz no uol iip a dot neehn de de, di ruut kudn go dong diip diip so di plaant dem kom op faas faas.
But when the sun rose, it was scorched. And because it had no root, it withered away.|Wen di son kom op, it skaach op di plaant dem, an, chuu dem ruut neehn lang inof, dem jrai op an ded.
Other seed fell among thorns, and the thorns grew up and choked it, and it yielded no grain. |Som ada siid jrap mongks makabush, an wen dem pap op di makabush chuok dem. So dem neva bier notn.

And other seed fell on good ground, and it yielded grain that sprang up and increased by thirty, sixty, or a hundred times as much.”|Bot som a di siid dem jrap pan gud grong, an kom bier fuud. Som bier toti an siksti an iivn onjrid taim muo dan wa di faama did plaant.”
Then He said to them, “He who has ears to hear, let him hear.”|Den Jiizas se, “Enibadi we av iez fi ier — beta lisn gud!”
When He was alone, those who were around Him with the twelve asked Him about the parable.|Afta di kroud lef, di twelv apasl an di ada piipl dem we did de roun Jiizas aks im bout di tuori dem.

He said to them, “To you is given the secret of the kingdom of God, but to those who are outside, everything is said in parables|So im ansa dem se, “Unu get di chaans fi nuo di siikrit sitn dem bout Gad kindom. Bot di piipl dem we de outsaid, mi yuuz tuori tel dem evriting

So that‘seeing they may see, and not perceive,and hearing they may hear and not understand;lest they should turn, and their sins be forgiven them.’|So ‘Iivn duo dem mait-a a luk an a luk aad aad, dem naa go si notn,an iivn duo dem mait-a a lisn an a lisn gud gud dem naa go andastan wa dem ier, kaaz ef dem did andastan dem wuda ton we fram dem sin an get siev.’ ”
Then He said to them, “Do you not understand this parable? How then will you understand all the parables? |Den Jiizas aks dem se: “Unu no andastan da tuori de? Den ou unu a-go andastan no ada tuori?
The sower sows the word.
column2: Di faama plaant di mesij.

column1: These are those beside the path, where the word is sown. But when they hear, Satan comes immediately and takes away the word which is sown in their hearts. |Di siid we jrap wich paat piipl waak, dem a di piipl we ier di mesij, bot Sietan kom siem taim an tek we di mesij outa dem aat.

Others, likewise, are seed sown on rocky ground, who, when they hear the word, immediately receive it with gladness|Di siid dem we jrap wich paat bie rakstuon de a di piipl dem we wel glad fi Gad wod siem taim dem ier it.

but have no root in themselves, and so endure for a time. Afterward, when affliction or persecution rises for the word’s sake, immediately they fall away.|Bot siem laik di plaant uufa ruut no go dong diip iina di grong, dem no mek Gad wod go diip iina dem aat, so dem no laas no taim. Wen tof taim lik dem siek-a Gad wod, dem gi op an ton bak siem taim — siem laik ou di plaant jrai op an ded.
And others are seed sown among thorns, the ones who hear the word.|Stil som piipl komiin laka di siid dem we jrap iina makabush. Dem piipl de ier Gad wod

But the cares of this world, and the deceitfulness of riches, and the desires for other things entering in choke the word, and it proves unfruitful.|Bot chuu dem a fret bout laif, chuu aal dem kyaahn tingk bout a ou fi mek moni an get rich, an chuu dem waahn muo an muo tingz, dem sitn de blak Gad wod, so it no du notn difrant iina dem laif.

Still others are seed sown on good ground, those who hear the word, and receive it, and bear fruit: thirty, sixty, or a hundred times as much.”|Bot som ada siid jrap pan gud grong. Dem a di piipl we ier Gad wod an tek it iin an it bier uol iip a fruut: toti, siksti ar iivn wan onjrid taim muor dan wa di faama did plaant.”

He said to them, “Is a candle brought to be put under a basket or under a bed and not to be set on a candlestick?|Den Jiizas tel dem wan neda tuori, im se, “Piipl no lait lamp fi put it anda baaskit ar anda bed, duohn? Dem no put it we piipl kyan si di lait?

For there is nothing hidden except to be revealed; neither is anything kept secret except to be proclaimed. |Kaaz notn no aid we naa go kom out iina uopm, an eniting we aid a-go kom out we evribadi kyan si it.
If anyone has ears to hear, let him hear.”|Enibadi we av iez fi ier, beta lisn gud!”

He said to them, “Take heed what you hear. The measure you give will be measured for you, and to you who hear will more be given.|An im se tu dem se, “Tingk gud bout wa unu ier. Eniting we unu dish out gi piipl a dat unu a-go get bak, an get aal muo pan tap a it.

For to him who has will more be given. And from him who has not will be taken, even what he has.|Kaaz enibadi we av sopm Gad a-go gi im muor, bot di wan we no av notn, Gad a-go tek we fram dem iivn di likl bit we dem av.”
He said, “The kingdom of God is like a man who scatters seed on the ground.|Den Jiizas se tu dem agen se, “Mek mi tel unu ou Gad kindom tan. It komiin laik sumadi we plaant som siid iina im fiil.
He sleeps and rises night and day, and the seed sprouts and grows; he does not know how. |Di faama go sliip a nait an get op a maanin taim an di siid dem kech an gruo, bot im no nuo ou di siid gruo.

For the earth bears fruit by itself: first the blade, then the head, then the full seed in the head.|Pan it uon di grong mek di siid kech an gruo an bier fuud. Di staak kom fos, den di kaan tik, den di kaan pan di tik.
But when the grain is ripe, immediately he applies the sickle because the harvest has come.|An wen di fuud we di faama plaant redi, im pik dem.

He said, “To what shall we liken the kingdom of God, or with what parable shall we compare it? |Jiizas aks di piipl dem agen, “Wa wi kyan se Gad kindom tan laik? Ar wa kain-a tuori wi kyan yuuz fi elp piipl andastan it?
It is like a grain of mustard seed which, when it is sown in the ground, is the smallest seed on earth. |It komiin laik wan likl likl siid we sumadi plaant iina di grong. It likla dan aal ada siid

Yet when it is sown, it grows up and becomes greater than all shrubs, and shoots out great branches, so that the birds of the air may nest in its shade.|bot wen it plaant, it gruo an get big, biga dan aal a di plaant dem we iina di gyaadn. It sen out som big big lim an di wail bod dem bil dem nes iina it.”
With many such parables He spoke the word to them as they were able to hear it.
column2: So Jiizas yuuz nof likl tuori laik dem ya fi tiich dem aal wa dem kuda andastan.

column1: Without a parable He did not speak to them. But when they were alone, He expounded on all things to His disciples.|Evriting im tel dem im yuuz tuori fi tel dem. Bot wen im de mongks im speshal falara dem, im brok dong evriting tu dem fi mek dem andastan.
That same day, when the evening came, He said to them, “Let us go cross to the other side.”|Da siem die de, wen it kech iivnin, Jiizas se tu im falara dem, “Mek wi go uova di ada saida di liek.”

When they had sent the crowd away, they took Him in the boat just as He was. There were also other little boats with Him.|So dem lef di kroud, go iina di buot wid im, an go pan di ada saida di liek. Som ada buot we did de de go wid im tu.

A great wind storm arose, and the waves splashed into the boat, so that it was now filling the boat. |Aal av a sodn, som chrang chrang briiz staat bluo, an it bluo op di waata iina di buot til it nieli ful.

He was in the stern asleep on a pillow. They woke Him and said, “Teacher, do You not care that we are perishing?”|Aal dem taim de Jiizas did faas a sliip pan wan pila iina di baka di buot. So dem wiek im op an se tu im se, “Tiicha, yu no si se wi out fi ded, yu no kier?”

He rose and rebuked the wind, and said to the sea, “Peace, be still!” Then the wind ceased and there was a great calm.|So Jiizas get op an taak chrang tu di briiz, an tel di sii fi sekl dong. So di briiz tap an di wiev dem sekl dong.
He said to them, “Why are you so fearful? How is that you have no faith?”|Den Jiizas aks dem se, “Wa mek unu fried so? Unu stil no biliiv iina Gad?”

They feared greatly and said to one another, “What kind of Man is He, that even the wind and the sea obey Him?”|Dem fried so til dem ton fuul, so dem se tu wan aneda se, “A uu da man ya? Iivn di briiz an di sii dem du wa im tel dem!”
The Preaching of John the Baptist
column2: Wa Jan di Baptis priich

column2: Jiizas Get Baptaiz

column2: Wen dem did temp Jiizas

column2: Jiizas Kaal im Falara dem

column2: Jiizas Ron out wan Diiman

column2: Jiizas Mek Sik Piipl Get Beta

column1: The Cleansing of a Leper
column2: Jiizas Iil wan Fasi-fasi Skin Man

column1: The Healing of a Paralytic
column2: Jiizas Iil wan Kripl Man

column2: Jiizas Kaal Liivai

column2: Kip we fram Fuud

column1: The Question About the Sabbath
column2: Jiizas a Laad fi di Sabat

column1: The Man With a Withered Hand
column2: Di man oofa an a wida we

column1: The Crowd at the Seaside
column2: Piipl kroud op a seesyd

column1: The Choosing of the Twelve Apostles
column2: Jiizas Pik im Twelv Apasl dem

column1: Jesus and Beelzebub
column2: Dem Se Jiizas a Wok wid Belzibul

column1: The Mother and Brothers of Jesus
column2: Jeezas mada an breda

column1: The Parable of the Sower
column2: Di Tuori bout di Faama

column1: The Purpose of the Parables
column2: Wa di Likl Tuori dem Gud fa

column1: The Parable of the Sower Explained
column2: Jiizas Tel wa di Tuori bout di Siid Miin

column1: A Light Under a Basket
column2: Di Tuori bout we Piipl Put Lamp

column1: The Parable of the Growing Seed
column2: Di tuori bout di seed we staat gruo

column1: The Parable of the Mustard Seed
column2: Wan Tuori bout som Likl Siid

column1: The Use of Parables
column2: We dem yuuz parebl fa

column1: The Calming of a Storm
column2: Di Briiz an di Sii Lisn Jiizas

column1: A profile of god's kingdom
column2: Ou Gad Kindom Tan

column1: They went to the other side of the sea to the region of the Gadarenes.|Jiizas an im falara dem riich di neks saida Liek Gyalalii, iina di konchri we di Girasiinz piipl dem liv.

When He had come out of the boat, immediately a man with an unclean spirit came out of the tombs and met Him.|Siem taim Jiizas kom outa di buot, wan man we did av wan diiman, kom fram di beriyin grong an kom op tu im.
He lived among the tombs. And no one could constrain him, not even with chains|Di man did liv a di beriyin grong, an nobadi kudn tai im op no muor, no iivn wid chien.

because he had often been bound with shackles and chains. But he had pulled the chains apart and broken the shackles to pieces. And no one could subdue him.|Kaaz a nof taim piipl tai op im an an im fut dem wid chien an aiyan chrap, bot im aalwiez bos aaf di chien dem an brok op di aiyan chrap dem. Nobadi neva chrang inof fi kanchuol im.

Always, night and day, he was in the mountains and in the tombs, crying out and cutting himself with stones.|Nait an die im did de iina di griev yaad an op iina di mountn a baal out an kot kot op imself wid stuon.
But when he saw Jesus afar off, he ran up and kneeled before Him|Wen di man spat Jiizas fram faar, im ron go jrap dong pan im nii infronta im.

and cried out with a loud voice, “What have You to do with me, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? I adjure You by God, do not torment me.”|Den im baal out pan tap a im vais se, “Lef mi no Jiizas, di Muos Ai Gad Bwai Pikni! Mi a beg yu, fi Gad siek, no mek mi sofa!”
For Jesus said to him, “Come out of the man, you unclean spirit!”|Im se dat kaaz Jiizas did tel im se, “Kum outa da man ya, yu diiman yu!”
Then He asked him, “What is your name?” He answered, “My name is Legion. For we are many.” |So Jiizas aks im se, “Wa yu niem?” An im ansa bak, “Mi niem ‘Uol-iip’, kaaz a nof a wi de ya.”
And he begged Him repeatedly not to send them away out of the country.
column2: Den im beg an beg Jiizas nof fi sen dem outa di ieriya.

column1: Now there was a great herd of swine feeding near the mountains.|Pan di il-said, yu did av wan uol iip a ag a nyam.
All the demons pleaded with Him, asking, “Send us to the swine, so that we may enter them.” |So di diiman dem beg im se, “Sen wi go iina di ag dem. Mek wi go iina dem.”

At once, Jesus gave them leave. Then the unclean spirits came out and entered the swine. And the herd, numbering about two thousand, ran wildly down a steep hill into the sea and were drowned in the sea.|Jiizas mek dem gwaan. So di diiman dem kom outa di man, an go chriet iina di ag dem. Den di uol a di ag dem, bout tuu touzn a dem, tek aaf dong di stiip stiip il-said an joun iina di liek.

Those who fed the swine fled and reported it in the city and in the country. And people went out to see what it was that had happened. |Wen dat apm, di man dem we luk aafa di ag dem ron go pred di nyuuz iina di toun an di plies dem we de nier di toun. So di piipl dem kom out fi si wa apm.

They came to Jesus and saw him who had been possessed with the legion of demons sitting and clothed and in his right mind. And they were afraid. |An wen dem riich we Jiizas de, dem si di man we did av iin diiman. Im did a sidong de, av aan kluoz an iina im rait main. An di piipl dem kech dem fried.

Those who saw it told them how it befell him who had been possessed with the demons and also concerning the swine. |Di wan dem we did si wa apm tu di man we did av iin di diiman, tel evribadi wa did apm, an dem taak bout di ag dem tu.
Then they began to plead with Him to depart out of their region.
column2: Den di piipl dem beg Jiizas fi lef dem ieriya.

column1: When He entered the boat, he who had been possessed with the demons prayed Him that he might be with Him.|Wen Jiizas did a go iina di buot, di man we did av iin di diiman did a beg fi go wid im.

Jesus did not let him, but said to him, “Go home to your friends and tell them what great things the Lord has done for you and how He has had compassion on you.” |Bot Jiizas neva mek im go wid im. Insted-a dat, im se tu im se, “Go a yu yaad, go tu yu uona piipl dem an tel dem aal wa di Laad du fi yu. Tel dem ou im gud an kain tu yu.”

So he departed and began to proclaim in the Decapolis what great things Jesus had done for him. And everyone was amazed.|So di man lef an staat pred di nyuuz aal uova di ten siti dem we dem kaal Dikyapolis. Im tel dem aal wa Jiizas du fi im, an evribadi did shak wen dem ier.

When Jesus had crossed again by boat to the other side, many people gathered to Him. And He was beside the sea.|Afta dat Jiizas go bak kraas Liek Gyalalii iina wan buot. Wen im riich, wan big kroud gyada op roun im pan di sii-said.

One of the rulers of the synagogue, named Jairus, saw Jesus and came and fell at His feet |Den wan man niem Jairos we did inchaaj a wan a di Juu dem choch, kom wich paat Jiizas de. Wen im si im, im go dong pan im nii infronta im.

and earnestly asked Him, “My little daughter is lying at the point of death. I ask You, come and lay Your hands on her, so that she may be healed. And she will live.”|Im beg Jiizas, “Du, mi likl daata a-go ded! Du, mi a beg yu, kom put yu an pan ar an shi wi get beta an liv.”
So Jesus went with him. And many people followed Him and pressed in on Him.
column2: So Jiizas go wid im. Wan big kroud go wid im tu an dem did a pres aad gens Jiizas.

column1: And a certain woman had a hemorrhage for twelve years,|Wan uman we did a sofa did iina di kroud. Fi twelv ier shi kudn tap bliid.

and had suffered much under many physicians. She had spent all that she had, and was not better but rather grew worse. |Shi go wan uol iip a dakta, bot non a dem kudn elp ar. Shi spen aaf aal ar moni pan dakta bil, an insted-a shi get beta, shi onggl get wosa.
When she had heard of Jesus, she came in the crowd behind Him and touched His garment. |Di uman did ier wa piipl did a se bout Jiizas, so shi kom op baka im iina di kroud an toch im kluoz.
For she said, “If I may touch His garments, I shall be healed.”|Kaaz shi did a se tu arself se, “Ef mi kuda jos toch im kluoz, mi wuda get beta.”
And immediately her hemorrhage dried up, and she felt in her body that she was healed of the affliction.|Wen shi toch im, shi tap bliid siem taim, an shi fiil iina ar badi se shi get beta.

At once, Jesus knew within Himself that power had gone out of Him. He turned around in the crowd and said, “Who touched My garments?”|Siem taim Jiizas nuo se di powa we im av did mek sumadi beta. So im ton roun iina di kroud an did a aks, “A uu toch mi kluoz?”

His disciples said to Him, “You see the crowd pressing against You, and You say, ‘Who touched Me?’ ”|Im falara dem se tu im se, “Yu no si di kroud a piipl we a pres gens yu? So ou yu fi aks a uu toch yu?”
And He looked around to see her who had done it.
column2: Bot Jiizas ton roun an stil a luk fi si a uu did toch im.

column1: But the woman, fearing and trembling, knowing what had happened to her, came and fell down before Him and told Him the entire truth. |Di uman did fried an a chrimbl, kaaz shi nuo wa did apm tu ar. So shi jrap arself a im fut an tel im evriting.

He said to her, “Daughter, your faith has made you well. Go in peace, and be healed of your affliction.”|So Jiizas se tu ar se, “Daata, kaaz yu biliiv iina mi, yu aarait nou. Gwaan wid piis iina yu aat, kaaz yu beta nou.”

While He was still speaking, some came from the house of the synagogue ruler and said, “Your daughter is dead. Why trouble the Teacher any further?”|Jiizas did stil a taak wen som piipl fram Jairos yaad kom tu Jairos — di ed fi di Juu dem choch. Dem tel im se, “Yu gyal pikni ded! Wa mek yu stil a bada di tiicha?”

As soon as Jesus heard the word that was spoken, He said to the ruler of the synagogue, “Do not be afraid, only believe.”|Bot Jiizas neva pie dem no main. Im se tu di ed fi di Juu dem choch, “No bada fried, jos biliiv.”
He let no one follow Him, except Peter, and James, and John the brother of James. |Jiizas neva mek nobadi go wid im, onggl Piita, Jiemz an Jiemz breda, Jan.

He came to the house of the ruler of the synagogue, and saw the tumult, and those who wept and wailed loudly. |Wen dem riich Jairos yaad, im si di piipl dem a mek wan bag a naiz an a pudong wan piis a loud baalin.

When He came in, He said to them, “Why make this uproar and weep? The girl is not dead, but sleeping.”|Wen Jiizas go iin im se tu dem se, “Wa unu a baal an a gwaan so fa? Di pikni no ded; a sliip shi a sliip.”

They laughed at Him in ridicule. But when He had put them all out, He took the father and the mother of the girl and those who were with Him and entered where the girl was lying.|An dem staat laaf aafa im. Bot Jiizas sen evribadi outa di ous. Den im tek di likl gyal mada an faada an im chrii falara dem an go iina di ruum we di likl gyal did de.

He took the girl by the hand and said to her, “Talitha cumi,” which means, “Little girl, I say to you, arise.”|Den Jiizas tek taim uol di likl gyal an an se tu ar se, “Taliita kum!” Dat miin, “Likl gyal, git op!”

Immediately the girl arose and walked, for she was twelve years of age. And they were greatly astonished.|Di likl gyal get op siem taim an staat waak roun (shi a did bout twelv ier uol). Dem we si wa apm did shak so til.
He strictly ordered them to let no one know of it and directed them to give her something to eat.
column2: Bot Jiizas aada dem chrang chrang no fi tel nobadi wa apm. Den im tel dem fi gi ar sopm fi nyam.

column1: The Healing of the Gadarene Demoniac
column2: Jiizas Iil wan Man wid Uol iip a Diiman

column1: Jairus’ Daughter and the Woman Who Touched Jesus’ Garment
column2: Wan Ded Gyal Pikni an wan Sik Uman

column1: He went away from there and came into His own country. And His disciples followed Him.
column2: Den Jiizas lef da plies de an im an im falara dem go baka Nazaret we im kom fram.

column1: When the Sabbath came, He began to teach in the synagogue. And many hearing Him were astonished, saying, “Where did this Man get this? What is this wisdom that is given Him, that even miracles are done by His hands? |Pan di Sabat, im tiich iina di Juu dem choch. Uol iip a piipl we did ier im kudn biliiv dem iez. So dem aks, “A we da man ya get di sitn dem we im a tiich fram? Ou im so waiz? An di mirikl dem we im a wok, a we im get di powa fi du dem?

Is this not the carpenter, the Son of Mary and the brother of James and Joseph and Judas and Simon? Are not His sisters here with us?” And they took offense at Him.|A uu im, no di kyaapinta dis? No Mieri bwai? An wi no nuo im breda dem: Jiemz, Juozif, Juudas an Saiman? An im sista dem no liv ya wid wi?” An so dem did beks an neehn waahn diil wid Jiizas non at aal.

Jesus said to them, “A prophet is not without honor, except in his own country, and among his own relatives, and in his own house.”|Bot Jiizas se tu dem se, “Piipl eva rispek an big op prafit yu nuo, onggl di piipl dem we im baan an gruo mongks — im uona fambili an uu im liv wid no shuo im da rispek de.”
He could not do any miracles there, except that He laid His hands on a few sick people and healed them.|So Jiizas kudn wok no mirikl de, onggl fi toch kopl sik piipl an mek dem beta.

And He was amazed because of their unbelief. Then He went to the surrounding villages, teaching. |An im kudn biliiv ou di piipl dem neehn biliiv iina im. Den Jiizas go roun an tiich iina di dischrik dem.

He called to Him the twelve, and began to send them out two by two, and gave them authority over unclean spirits.|Im kaal im twelv apasl dem an sen dem out tuu tuu an gi dem di rait fi ron out wikid spirit.

He called to Him the twelve, and began to send them out two by two, and gave them authority over unclean spirits.|Im tel dem se, “Wen unu go wich paat mi sen unu, di onggl ting unu fi kyari a unu waakn tik — no bred, no bag, no moni
but to wear sandals, and not put on two tunics. |wier unu slipaz, bot no kyari no ada kluoz.”
He said to them, “Wherever you enter a house, remain there until you depart from that place. |An im tel dem se, “Enitaim unu go iina wan ous, tan de til unu lef di ieriya.

And whoever will not receive you or hear you, when you depart from there, shake the dust off your feet as a testimony against them. Truly I say to you, it will be more tolerable for Sodom and Gomorrah on the Day of Judgment than for that city.”|Ef unu go iina wan ieriya an di piipl dem no tek unu iin ar no waahn ier wa unu av fi se, shiek di dos aafa unu fut wen unu a lef fi waan dem an fi shuo dem se Gad no api wid dem an im a-go joj dem.”
So they went out and preached that men should repent.
column2: So dem lef an staat fi priich se evribadi fi ton we fram dem sin an ton tu Gad.

column1: And they cast out many demons and anointed with oil many who were sick and healed them.
column2: Dem ron out nof diiman an naint nof sik piipl wid ail an mek dem get beta.

column1: King Herod heard of Him, for His name was spread publicly. He said, “John the Baptist has been raised from the dead, and therefore these miracles are at work in him.”|King Erad did ier bout aal wa Jiizas did a du, kaaz evribadi did nuo bout Jiizas. Som a di piipl dem did a se, “Im a Jan di Baptis kom bak alaiv, so a dat mek im av powa iina im fi wok mirikl.”

But others said, “He is Elijah.”And yet others said, “He is the Prophet, or like one of the prophets.”|Som ada piipl did a se, “Im a Ilaija!” Stil som ada piipl did a se, “Im a wan prafit, laik wan a di prafit dem fram wie bak wen.”

But when Herod heard of it, he said, “It is John, whom I beheaded. He has been raised from the dead!”|Bot wen Erad ier aal wa di piipl dem did a se bout Jiizas, im se, “A Jan, uufa ed mi did mek dem chap aaf, a im kom bak alaiv!”

Herod had sent and seized John and bound him in prison for the sake of Herodias, his brother Philip’s wife, for he had married her.|Kaaz Erad did mek im suoja dem ares Jan an lak im op iina prizn. Im du dat siek-a Eruodiyas, im breda Filip waif, we im did tek we an marid.
For John said to Herod, “It is not lawful for you to have your brother’s wife.”|Kaaz Jan did tel im uova an uova se, “It no rait fi yu marid yu breda waif — yu a brok di Laa.”
So Herodias had a grudge against him and would have killed him, but she could not, |So Eruodiyas kyari bad beli fi Jan an did waahn kil im. Bot shi neva get di chaans

or Herod feared John, knowing that he was a righteous and holy man, and protected him. When he heard him, he was greatly perplexed, but heard him gladly.|kaaz Erad did wel rispek Jan an protek im, kaaz im nuo se Jan a did wan gud man we aalwiez du wa rait. Erad did lov fi lisn tu Jan, iivn duo evritaim im ier im, wa Jan se kanfyuuz im muor an muor.

But a convenient day came when Herod on his birthday prepared a ceremonial dinner for his lords and commanding officers and leading men of Galilee.|Bot Eruodiyas get ar chaans pan di die wen Erad did a kip op im bortdie paati. Aal a di tap man dem iina di govament, di tap aami piipl dem, an di liida dem fram Gyalalii did de a di paati.

When the daughter of Herodias came in and danced and pleased Herod and those who sat with him, the king said to the girl, “Ask of me whatever you desire, and I will give it to you.” |Eruodiyas daata daans fi Erad an im ges dem. Dem did wel api wid ou shi daans. So Erad se tu ar se, “Aks mi fi eniting we yu waahn an mi wi gi yu.”
And he swore to her, “Whatever you ask of me, I will give you, up to half of my kingdom.”|Im pramis ar se, “Eniting yu aks fa mi wi gi yu, op tu aaf a mi kindom.”
She went out and said to her mother, “What shall I ask?”She said, “The head of John the Baptist.”|So shi lef an go aks ar mada, “Mama, wa mi fi aks fa?” Ar mada tel ar se, “Aks fi Jan di Baptis ed.”

She came in immediately with haste to the king and asked, “I want you to give me the head of John the Baptist on a platter at once.”|So shi ron bak tu di king siem taim an tel im wa shi waahn. Shi se, “Mi waahn Jan di Baptis ed pan wan pliet rait nou!”

The king was extremely sorrowful. Yet for the sake of his oath and those who sat with him, he would not reject her. |Di king aat staat at im wen im ier wa shi aks fa, bot im kudn tek bak im wod, kaaz im did don pramis ar infronta aal a im ges dem aredi.

So the king immediately sent an executioner and commanded his head to be brought. He went and beheaded him in the prison, |So im aada im suoja dem siem taim fi go chap aaf Jan ed kyari it kom. So di suoja dem go a di prizn go chap aaf Jan ed.
and brought his head on a platter, and gave it to the girl. And the girl gave it to her mother.|Wan a dem put it pan wan pliet an kyari it go gi di likl gyal an di gyal kyari it go gi ar mada.
When his disciples heard of it, they came and took up his corpse and laid it in a tomb.|Wen Jan falara dem ier wa apm, dem go tek im badi an beri im.
The apostles met with Jesus and told him everything, both what they had done and what they had taught.|Den Jiizas apasl dem gyada op roun im an tel im bout aal a wa dem did du an wa dem did tiich.

hen He said to them, “Come away by yourselves to a remote place and rest a while,” for many were coming and going, and they had no leisure even to eat.|Jiizas an im apasl dem kudn iivn get taim fi nyam, kaaz a di uol iip a piipl we did a kom an go, so Jiizas tel im apasl dem se, “Kom mek wi go a wan plies we nobadi no de so wi kyan get we fram di kroud, get sopm fi nyam an res likl.”
So they went into a remote place privately by boat.
column2: Den dem lef iina wan buot fi go a wan plies we nobadi no de.

column1: But the people saw them departing, and many knew Him and ran there on foot out of every city. They arrived first and came together to Him.|Bot nof piipl si dem wen dem did a lef an figa out we dem did a go. So piipl fram evri toun ron go a di plies we dem did a go an riich de bifuo dem.

When Jesus came out and saw many people, He was moved with compassion on them, because they were like sheep without a shepherd. And He began to teach them many things.|Wen Jiizas kom outa di buot, im si di big big kroud a piipl pan di sii-said an im fiil sari fi dem, kaaz dem did komiin laik shiip we no av no shepad fi luk aafa dem. So im tiich dem nof sitn.

When the day was now getting late, His disciples came to Him and said, “This is a remote place, and now the time is passing.|Liet iina di iivnin im speshal falara dem go tu im an se tu im se, “Nobadi no liv out ya-so an it wel liet aredi.

Send them away into the surrounding country and villages to buy themselves bread, for they have nothing to eat.”|Sen we di piipl so dem kyan go a di dischrik an toun dem we nier ya-so, so dem kyan bai sitn fi nyam.”

But He answered, “You give them something to eat.” They said to Him, “Shall we go and buy two hundred denarii worth of bread and give it to them to eat?”|Jiizas ansa dem se, “Unu gi dem sitn fi nyam.” So dem se tu im se, "It wuda tek iet mont wot a pie fi bai fuud fi fiid da kroud a piipl ya! We wi fi get dat de kaina moni?"

He said to them, “How many loaves have you? Go and see.” When they found out, they said, “Five, and two fish.”|Den Jiizas aks dem se, “Umoch bred unu av? Gwaan go fain out.” So dem fain out an tel im se, “Wi av faiv bred an tuu fish.”
Then He commanded them to make everyone sit down by companies on the green grass.
column2: Den Jiizas aada aal di piipl fi sidong pan di griin graas.

column1: So they sat down in ranks, by hundreds and by fifties. |So dem sidong iina som gruup, som gruup did av onjrid, som gruup a fifti.
