When He had taken the five loaves and the two fish, He looked up to heaven, and blessed and broke the loaves, and gave them to His disciples to set before them. And He divided the two fish among them all.|Den Jiizas tek di faiv bred an tuu fish an luk op iina di skai, gi tangks an brok op di bred dem. Im gi im falara dem, an dem tek it gi di piipl dem. An im du di siem ting wid di fish dem.
They all ate and were filled.
column2: Evribadi nyam til dem beli ful

column1: And they took up twelve baskets full of the fragments and of the fish.
column2: an Jiizas falara dem pik op twelv baaskit ful-a fish an bred wa di piipl dem nyam an lef.

column1: Those who ate of the loaves were about five thousand men.
column2: An da die de a did bout faiv touzn man did nyam bred.

column1: Immediately He compelled His disciples to get into the boat and to go before Him to the other side, to Bethsaida, while He sent the crowd away. |iizas mek im speshal falara dem go iina di buot siem taim an go bak kraas Betsieda. Bot im tan wich paat im did de til im don sen we di piipl dem.
When He had sent them away, He departed to a mountain to pray.|Afta im tel di piipl ba-bai, im go op iina di mountn fi prie.
When evening came, the boat was in the midst of the sea. And He was alone on the land. |Wen iivnin kom Jiizas did stil de we im did de, im wan, an di buot did iina di migl a di sii.

He saw them straining at rowing, for the wind was against them. About the fourth watch of the night He came to them, walking on the sea and would have passed by them. |Im kuda si se dem did a chogl aad fi ruo di buot kaaz di briiz did a bluo gens dem. Wen die did suun lait, Jiizas waak pan tap a di waata go out wich paat dem de, kaaz im did waahn paas dem.

But when they saw Him walking on the sea, they supposed it was a ghost, and cried out. |Wen dem si im a waak pan tap a di waata, dem did tingk a wan dopi. So dem baal out, 50kaaz aal a dem did si im an dem did kech dem fried. Bot im taak tu dem siem taim an se, “Unu tek aat! A mi, man. No bada fried.”

For they all saw Him and were troubled. Immediately He spoke to them and said, “Be of good cheer, it is I. Do not be afraid.” |kaaz aal a dem did si im an dem did kech dem fried. Bot im taak tu dem siem taim an se, “Unu tek aat! A mi, man. No bada fried.”

Then He went up to them in the boat and the wind ceased. They were greatly astonished in themselves beyond measure, and wondered. |Den im go iina di buot wid dem, an di briiz tap. An dem did shak so til,

For they had not comprehended the miracle of the loaves, for their hearts were hardened.|kaaz iivn duo dem did si di mirikl we Jiizas did du wid di fish an di bred, dem stil neva andastan di powa we im av, kaaz dem ed did tof.
When they had crossed over, they came to the land of Gennesaret and anchored on the shore. |Afta Jiizas an im speshal falara dem kraas di liek, dem tap a wan plies niem Genesaret.
When they had come out of the boat, immediately the people recognized Him, |Wen dem kom outa di buot, siem taim piipl si se a Jiizas.

and ran throughout the surrounding region, and began to carry the sick on beds to wherever they heard He was. |So dem ron aal uova di ieriya go fi di sik piipl dem an kyari dem pan dem chrecha go evriwe dem did ier se Jiizas did de.

And wherever He entered, into villages, cities, or the country, they laid the sick in the marketplaces and pleaded with Him that they might touch even the fringe of His garment. And as many as touched Him were healed.|Evri dischrik ar konchrisaid, ar maakit plies we Jiizas go, di piipl dem kyari dem sik piipl tu im. Dem beg im fi jos mek dem toch di en a im kluoz, an evribadi we du dat get beta.
The Rejection of Jesus at Nazareth
column2: Di Nazaret Piipl dem Ton gens Jiizas

column1: The Mission of the Twelve
column2: Jiizas Sen out im Twelv Apasl dem

column1: The Death of John the Baptist
column2: King Erad Chap aaf Jan di Baptis Ed

column1: The Feeding of the Five Thousand
column2: Jiizas Fiid Faiv Touzn Piipl

column1: Walking on the Water
column2: Jiizas Waak pan Waata

column1: The Healing of the Sick in Gennesaret
column2: Sik piipl a get iil ina Jenasaret.

column1: The Pharisees and certain scribes who came from Jerusalem gathered around Him.
column2: Den som Farisii an som a di Laa tiicha dem we kom fram Jeruusilem gyada op roun Jiizas.

column1: When they saw some of His disciples eat bread with defiled, that is, ritually unwashed hands, they found fault.|An dem si se som a Jiizas falara dem nyam dem fuud an dem neva wash dem an.

For the Pharisees and all the Jews, unless they wash their hands ritually, do not eat, keeping the tradition of the elders. |Kaaz di Farisii dem, az a matarafak, aal a di Juu dem, no nyam til dem wash dem an kaaz dem did fala aad aad di wie ou dem faada faada dem yuus tu liv.

When they come from the market, unless they wash, they do not eat. And there are many other traditions which they have received and observe, such as the washing of cups and pitchers and bronze vessels and dining couches.|An wen dem komiin fram maakit dem no nyam notn til dem mek demself kliin azkaadn tu wa dem lorn fram dem faada faada dem. An dem kip nof ada uol taim sitn: dem wash kop, pat, kekl an dem siit we dem sidong pan wen dem a go nyam dem fuud.

So the Pharisees and scribes asked Him, “Why do Your disciples not live according to the tradition of the elders, but eat bread with unwashed hands?”|Di Farisii dem an di Laa tiicha dem aks Jiizas se, “Mek yu falara dem no du wa wi faada faada dem tiich wi fi du — a nyam an no wash dem an?”

He answered, “Well has Isaiah prophesied of you hypocrites, as it is written: ‘These people honor Me with their lips, but their hearts are far from Me.|Jiizas ansa dem se, “Aizaiya di prafit did a taak chuut wen im rait bout unu uol ipokrit. Im rait se, “ ‘Aal dem set a piipl ya du a tek dem mout big mi op, bot iina dem aat dem no waahn av notn fi du wid mi.

In vain do they worship Me, teaching as doctrines the precepts of men.’|An it no mek sens dem worship mi, wen dem a tiich man-mek ruul laik se dat a fi mi ruul,kaaz dem onggl a tiich di sitn dem wa man mek op laik se a Gad Laa.’

For laying aside the commandment of God, you hold the tradition of men—the washing of pitchers and cups, and many other such things you do.”|Unu eng aan tu unu uol taim sitn dem we kom fram unu faada faada dem, bot unu no pie no main tu wa Gad se unu fi du.”

And He said to them, “You full well reject the commandment of God so that you may keep your own tradition. |An im se, “Unu tingk unu so sumaat dat unu ton unu bak pan we Gad se unu fi du an se it no mata, so dat unu kyan fala wa unu faada faada dem se unu fi du.

For Moses said, ‘Honor your father and your mother,’ and, ‘Whoever curses father or mother, let him be put to death.’|Kaaz Muoziz se, ‘Rispek unu faada an unu mada,’ an, ‘Enibadi we kos out an disrispek dem faada an mada, kil dem.’

But you say, ‘If a man says to his father or mother, “It is Corban,” that is to say, “What you would have profited from me is a gift to God,” he shall be free.’|Bot unu se dat it aarait ef enibadi tel im faada ar mada se, ‘Di elp mi kuda gi unu mi don gi Gad aredi.’
Then you no longer let him do anything for his father or his mother, |Da wie de unu tap im fram du wa im shuda du fi'im faada an im mada.

making the word of God of no effect through your tradition, which you have delivered. And you do many similar things.”|So unu yuuz di sitn dem we unu faada faada dem se, fi mek Gad wod komiin laik se it no miin notn. An unu du nof muo sitn laik dat.”

When He had called all the people to Him, He said, “Listen to Me, every one of you, and understand: |Den Jiizas kaal di kroud wan muo taim fi kom wich paat im did de an se tu dem se, “Aal a unu lisn mi, an andastan dis:

There is nothing from outside a man that by entering him can defile him. But the things which come out of the man are what defile him. |Notn we de outsaida sumadi kyaahn mek dem get doti, a wa kom outa dem mout mek dem doti.”
If anyone has ears to hear, let him hear.”|Ef unu av iez fi ier, ier we mi a se.

When He had left the people and entered the house, His disciples asked Him concerning the parable. |Afta Jiizas lef di kroud an go iina di ous, im falara dem aks im wa di tuori miin. 18So im se tu dem se, “Unu miin se unu riili no get wa mi a se? Unu no nuo se notn wa nobadi iit kyaahn mek Gad rait dem aaf se dem doti?

He said to them, “Are you so without understanding also? Do you not know that anything from the outside that enters a man cannot defile him, |So im se tu dem se, “Unu miin se unu riili no get wa mi a se? Unu no nuo se notn wa nobadi iit kyaahn mek Gad rait dem aaf se dem doti?

because it does not enter his heart, but into his stomach, and goes out into the sewer, thus purifying all foods?”|Kaaz wa dem iit no go iina dem aat, it go iina dem tumok an den it go iina di tailit.” (Jiizas se dis fi shuo se aal fuud kliin.)
And He said, “What comes out of a man is what defiles a man. |So im se, “A di sitn dem wa kom outa sumadi mek dem doti an no kliin iina Gad yai.

For from within, out of the heart of men, proceed evil thoughts, adultery, fornication, murder, |Kaaz a insaida sumadi aat aal kain-a wikidnis we piipl tingk op kom fram. Piipl du aal kain-a seks sin, tiif, kil piipl

theft, covetousness, wickedness, deceit, licentiousness, an evil eye, blasphemy, pride and foolishness. |sliip wid ada piipl we dem no marid tu, waahnti-waahnti, wikid, tel lai, no bizniz wid no laa an brok evri wan a dem, red yai, tek dem mout tier dong ada piipl, shuo aaf, an ful op a aal kain-a fuulinish.
All these evil things come from within and defile a man.”
column2: Aal a dem sitn de kom outa sumadi aat an mek dem doti an no kliin iina Gad yai.

column1: From there He arose and went to the region of Tyre and Sidon. He entered a house and would have no one know it. Yet He could not be hidden.|Afta dat Jiizas lef an go a Taiya ieriya. Im go iina wan ous, an im neva waahn nobadi fi nuo se im de de, bot im kudn aid.

For a certain woman, whose young daughter had an unclean spirit, heard of Him, and came and fell at His feet. |Wan uman iina di ieriya did av wan likl gyal pikni we diiman did kanchuol. Siem taim shi ier bout Jiizas, shi go tu im an jrap arself a im fut.

The woman was a Greek, a Syrophoenician by race. And she begged Him to cast the demon out of her daughter.|Di uman did taak Griik, an shi did bilang tu di Sairofoniisiyan chraib. Shi beg Jiizas fi ron out di diiman outa ar daata.

Jesus said to her, “Let the children first be filled. For it is not fitting to take the children’s bread and throw it to the dogs.”|Bot Jiizas ansa ar se, “Mek di pikni dem iit dem beli ful fos. Kaaz it no rait fi tek di pikni dem fuud an gi daag.”

She answered, “Yes, Lord. Yet the dogs under the table eat the children’s crumbs.”|So shi ansa im se, “Laad dat a chuu, bot iivn di daag dem anda di tiebl nyam di kromz dem we jrap fram di pikni dem.”
Then He said to her, “For this answer, go your way. The demon has gone out of your daughter.”|Den Jiizas se tu ar se, “Yu si siek-a wa yu se, yu kyan gwaan uom, di diiman gaan outa yu pikni.”
When she had come to her house, she found the demon had gone out, and her daughter lying on the bed.|Wen shi riich uom shi si ar pikni lai dong pan ar bed an di diiman gaan outa ar.

Again, departing from the region of Tyre and Sidon, He came to the Sea of Galilee, through the region of the Decapolis.|Afta dat Jiizas lef di Taiya ieriya an go chuu Saidan go a Liek Gyalalii iina di ieriya niem Dikyapolis.
They brought to Him one who was deaf and had difficulty speaking. And they pleaded with Him to put His hand on him.
column2: Som piipl kyari wan man we did def an we kuda bieli taak tu Jiizas. Dem beg im fi jos toch im.

column1: He took him aside from the crowd, and put His fingers into his ears, and spat and touched his tongue. |Jiizas tek di man wan said, muuv im outa di kroud, put im fingga iina im iez, pit an den toch di man tong.
Looking up to heaven, He sighed, and said to him, “Ephphatha,” that is, “Be opened.” |Den im luk op iina di skai, gi out wan sai an se, “Ef - fata!” (Dat miin, “Uopm op!”).
Immediately his ears were opened, and the impediment of his tongue was loosened, and he spoke correctly.|Siem taim di man iez uopm op an im tong luus op an im staat taak gud gud.

He ordered them to tell no one. But the more He ordered them, the more they greatly proclaimed it. |Bot Jiizas aada di piipl dem no fi tel nobadi bout wa apm, bot dem kudn kip kwaiyat, dem pred it muo an muo.

They were astonished beyond measure, saying, “He has done all things well. He makes both the deaf to hear and the mute to speak.”|An aal uu ier did wel shak. Dem se, “Im du evriting gud! Im aal mek piipl we did def ier, an piipl we did dom taak.”
The Tradition of the Elders
column2: Wa di elda dem a du fram lang tym

column1: The Syrophoenician Woman’s Faith
column2: Jiizas Elp wan Uman we a no Juu

column1: The Deaf and Mute Man Healed
column2: Jiizas Mek wan Man Get Beta

column1: What it Means to Truly be Clean
column2: Wa Mek Piipl Riili Kliin

column1: In those days, the crowds being very great with nothing to eat, Jesus called His disciples to Him and said to them|Roun dem taim de wan neda big kroud did gyada op roun Jiizas. Dem neva av notn fi nyam, so Jiizas kaal im falara dem tugeda an se
“I have compassion on the crowd, because they have now been with Me three days and have nothing to eat. |Mi sari fi dem piipl ya. A uol a chrii die nou dem de ya wid mi, an dem naa notn fi nyam.

If I send them away fasting to their own houses, they will faint on the way, for some of them have come from afar.”|Som a dem liv faar faar fram ya-so. Ef mi sen dem we onggri dem mait-a jrap dong a ruod.”

His disciples answered, “Where can one get bread to feed these men here in the wilderness?”|Jiizas falara dem se, “We paat nobadi fi get inof fuud iina dis ya dezot plies ya fi ful aal a dem piipl ya beli?”
He asked them, “How many loaves do you have?” They said, “Seven.”|Jiizas aks dem se, “Umoch bred unu av?” “Sevn,” dem se.

He commanded the people to sit down on the ground. Taking the seven loaves and giving thanks, He broke them and gave them to His disciples to serve. And they served the crowd. |Jiizas tel di kroud a piipl fi sidong pan di grong. Afta dat im tek di sevn bred, gi tangks, an brok dem op gi im falara dem fi fiid di piipl dem.
And they had a few small fish. And blessing them, He commanded that these also be served them.|Dem did av kopl sumaal fish tu. Jiizas tek dem, gi Gad tangks an gi im falara dem fi fiid di piipl dem.
So they ate and were filled. And they collected seven baskets of the broken pieces that were left.|Evribadi nyam til dem beli ful, an wen dem pik op wa did lef bak, it ful sevn baaskit.
There were about four thousand who had eaten, and He sent them away. |A bout fuo touzn piipl did de de an afta dem don iit, Jiizas sen dem we.
He immediately entered a boat with His disciples and came to the region of Dalmanutha.|Rait afta im du dat, im an im falara dem go iina wan buot an kraas go Dalmanyuuta.

The Pharisees came up and began to debate with Him, seeking from Him a sign from heaven to test Him.|Di Farisii dem kom out an staat aagyu wid Jiizas. Dem did waahn fi tes im, so dem aks im fi wan sain fi pruuv se a Gad sen im.

He sighed deeply in His spirit and said, “Why does this generation look for a sign? Truly I say to you, no sign shall be given to this generation.”|So Jiizas gi out wan evi evi sai an se, “Wa mek di piipl iina da taim ya aalwiez a luk fi wan sain? Mi a tel unu di chuut, unu naa go get no sain.”
Then He left them and, entering the boat again, departed to the other side.|Den im lef dem, go bak iina di buot, an go uova di ada saida di liek.
Now the disciples had forgotten to take bread and did not have more than one loaf with them in the boat.
column2: Nou Jiizas falara dem did onggl av wan bred iina di buot kaaz dem neva memba fi kyari som wid dem.

column1: He warned them, “Take heed. Beware of the yeast of the Pharisees and the yeast of Herod.”|So Jiizas tel dem se, “Wach out! Gyaad unuself gens di Farisii dem an Erad yiis.”
They reasoned among themselves, saying, “It is because we have no bread.”|16So dem se tu wan aneda, “A chuu wi no av no bred mek im se dat.”

Being aware of it, Jesus said to them, “Why do you reason that you have no bread? Do you still not perceive or understand? Are your hearts still hardened?|Jiizas nuo wa dem did a taak bout, so im aks dem se, “Wa mek unu a taak bout ou a chuu unu naa no bred? Unu stil no si an andastan? A aad unu aad fi lorn so?
Having eyes, do you not see? Having ears, do you not hear? And do you not remember?|Unu av yai, so ou unu kyaahn si? Unu av iez, so ou unu kyaahn ier? A memba unu no memba?

When I broke the five loaves for the five thousand, how many baskets full of broken pieces did you collect?” They said to Him, “Twelve.”|Wen mi did brok di faiv bred dem an fiid di faiv touzn piipl dem, umoch baaskit a nyam-an-lef unu did pik op afta dat?” Dem se, “Twelv.”

“And the seven among the four thousand, how many baskets full of broken pieces did you collect?” They said, “Seven.”|“An wen mi did brok di sevn bred an fiid di fuo touzn piipl dem, umoch baaskit a nyam-an-lef unu did pik op?” Dem se, “Sevn.”
He said to them, “Do you still not understand?”|So Jiizas se tu dem se, “So a andastan unu stil no andastan?”
He came to Bethsaida. And they brought a blind man to Him and entreated Him to touch him.
column2: Jiizas an im falara dem riich a Betsieda. Som piipl kyari wan blain man tu Jiizas an beg im fi toch im.

column1: He took the blind man by the hand and led him out of the town. When He had spit on his eyes and put His hands on him, He asked him, “Do you see anything?”|So Jiizas uol di man an an kyari im go outa di toun. Den im pit pan di man yai dem, put im an pan dem an aks di man se, “Yu kyan si notn?”
He looked up and said, “I see men as trees, walking.”|Di man luk op an se, “Mi si piipl, bot dem luk laik chrii a waak roun.”

Then again He put His hands on his eyes and made him look up. And he was restored and saw everyone clearly. |So Jiizas put im an pan di man yai dem agen. Wen im uopm op im yai dem da taim de, im kuda si, an im si evriting gud gud.
He sent him home away to his house, saying, “Neither go into the town, nor tell it to anyone in the town.”|Jiizas tel im fi go a im yaad, im se, “No iivn go bak iina di toun.”

Jesus and His disciples went out into the towns of Caesarea Philippi. On the way He asked His disciples, “Who do men say that I am?”|Afta dat Jiizas an im falara dem go a wan toun niem Sesuriiya Filipai. Wen dem did de pan dem wie im aks dem se, “Uu piipl se mi bi?”
They answered, “John the Baptist, but some say, Elijah; and others, one of the prophets.”|Dem se, “Som se yu a Jan di Baptis, som se Ilaija, an som se yu a wan a di prafit dem.”
He said to them, “But who do you say that I am?” Peter answered Him, “You are the Christ.”|Den Jiizas aks dem se, “Bot wa bout unu, uu unu tingk mi bi?” Piita ansa im se, “Yu a di Krais.”
He warned them that they should tell no one about Him.
column2: Den Jiizas waan dem no fi tel nobadi bout im.

column1: He began to teach them that the Son of Man must suffer many things, and be rejected by the elders and the chief priests and the scribes, and be killed, and after three days rise again. |Den Jiizas staat tel im falara dem se, “Di Man we Gad Pik a-go afi go chuu nof nof sofarieshan, an di elda dem, di ed priis dem, an di Laa tiicha dem a-go ton dem bak pan im, an dem a-go kil im. Bot chrii die afta dat, im a-go kom bak alaiv.”
He said this openly. And Peter took Him and began to rebuke Him.
column2: Im mek dem andastan evriting we im did a tel dem. So Piita tek im wan said an staat ries im op fi se sitn laka dat.

column1: But when He had turned around and looked at His disciples, He rebuked Peter, saying, “Get behind Me, Satan! For you are not mindful of the things of God, but the things of men.”|Bot Jiizas ton roun an luk pan im ada falara dem, den im taak aad aad tu Piita an se, “Gu we fram mi Sietan! Yu naa tingk bout di sitn dem we Gad waahn, a onggl wa piipl waahn de pan fi yu main!”

When He had called the people to Him, with His disciples, He said to them, “If any man would come after Me, let him deny himself and take up his cross and follow Me.|Den Jiizas kaal di kroud a piipl an im falara dem an se tu dem se, “Ef sumadi waahn fi ton wan a mi falara dem, dem afi figet bout wa dem waahn, tek op dem kraas, an fala mi.

For whoever would save his life will lose it. But whoever would lose his life for My sake and the gospel’s will save it. |Sumadi we waahn siev dem laif a-go luuz it, bot enibadi we luuz dem laif siek-a mi an kaaz dem tan op chrang fi di Gud Nyuuz, dem a-go siev dem laif.
For what does it profit a man if he gains the whole world and loses his own soul?
column2: Kaaz wa gud it wuda du sumadi ef dem get evriting iina di worl bot dem luuz dem laif?

column1: Or what will a man give in exchange for his soul?
column2: An wa sumadi kyan gi fi get bak dem laif?

column1: Whoever therefore is ashamed of Me and of My words in this adulterous and sinful generation, of him will the Son of Man also be ashamed when He comes in the glory of His Father with the holy angels.”|Kaaz ef nobadi shiem a mi an fi mi mesij iina da worl ya we ful op a sin an piipl we ton dem main gens Gad, di Man we Gad Pik naa go av notn fi du wid dem wen im kom iina im Faada brait brait lait wid im uoli ienjel dem.”
The Feeding of the Four Thousand
column2: Jiizas Fiid Fuo Touzn

column1: The Demand for a Sign
column2: Di Piipl Aks fi wan Sain

column1: The Yeast of the Pharisees and of Herod
column2: Di Farisii an Erad Yiis

column1: The Healing of a Blind Man at Bethsaida
column2: Jiizas Mek wan Blain Man Get Beta

column1: Peter’s Declaration About Jesus
column2: Wa Piita Se bout Jiizas

column1: Jesus Foretells His Death and Resurrection
column2: Jiizas Se Piipl a-go Kil im

column1: And He said to them, “Truly I say to you, there are some standing here who will not taste death before they see the kingdom of God come with power.”|Den im se tu dem se, “Mi a tel unu dis, an a chuu mi a taak, som a unu we tan op ya-so naa go ded bifuo di taim kom wen unu si Gad a ruul iina wan powaful wie.”

After six days Jesus took with Him Peter and James and John and led them up a high mountain, alone by themselves. And He was transfigured before them.|Afta siks die Jiizas tek Piita, Jiemz an Jan wid im an di fuo a dem wan go pan wan ai mountn. Aal av a sodn Jiizas staat fi chienj rait infronta dem
His garments became shiny, extremely white as snow, such as no launderer on earth could whiten them. |im kluoz ton wait laka lait. It did wel wait. No bliich iina di worl kudn bliich dem wait so.
And there appeared to them Elijah with Moses. And they were talking with Jesus.
column2: Den dem si Ilaija an Muoziz kom tan op infronta im an a taak tu im.

column1: Peter said to Jesus, “Rabbi, it is good for us to be here. Let us make three sanctuaries: one for You, and one for Moses, and one for Elijah.” |So Piita se tu Jiizas se, “Tiicha, a gud ting se wi did de ya. Mek wi bil op chrii shed no — wan fi yu, wan fi Muoziz an wan fi Ilaija.”
For he did not know what to say, because they were very afraid.|(Kaaz dem did so fraitn, im neva nuo wa fi se).

Then a cloud overshadowed them, and a voice came out of the cloud, saying, “This is My beloved Son. Listen to Him.”|Den wan kloud kom dong kom kova dem op an dem ier sumadi vais iina di kloud se, “A fi mi Bwai Pikni dis. Unu fi lisn wa im se!”
Suddenly, when they looked around, they no longer saw anyone with them except ­Jesus only.|Dem ton roun fi luk siem taim, bot wen dem luk dem no si nobadi, onggl dem an Jiizas wan.

As they came down the mountain, He warned them to tell no one what they had seen, until the Son of Man had risen from the dead.|An wen Jiizas an im falara dem did a kom dong di mountn, im gi dem aada se dem no fi se notn tu nobadi bout wa dem did si til afta di Man we Gad Pik ded an kom bak alaiv.

They kept that statement to themselves, questioning each other what the rising from the dead meant.|So dem kip it tu demself an taak bout it mongks dem wan aneda an a wanda wa im miin wen im se, “Wen im ded an kom bak alaiv?”
And they asked Him, “Why do the scribes say that Elijah must first come?”|Den dem aks im se, “Wa mek di Laa tiicha dem se dat Ilaija mos kom bak fos, bifuo di wan we Gad sen fi siev piipl kom?”

He answered, “Elijah indeed comes first to restore all things. Yet how is it written of the Son of Man that He should suffer many things and be treated with contempt? |Jiizas ansa dem se, “Ilaija kom fi chuu fi get evriting pan chrak. Bot wa mek unu tingk it rait dong se di Man we Gad Pik gweehn afi go chuu nof sofarieshan an piipl a-go chriit im laik se im a no nobadi?

But I say to you that Elijah has indeed come, and they have done to him whatever they wished, as it is written of him.”|Bot mi a tel unu, Ilaija kom aredi, an som piipl du im aal wa dem did waahn fi du im, jos laik ou it rait dong se dem wuda du im.”

When He came to His other disciples, He saw a great crowd around them, and the scribes disputing with them. |Wen Jiizas an im chrii falara dem riich pan di flat, dem si wan big kroud a piipl gyada op roun di ada falara dem, an di Laa tiicha dem did a aagyu wid dem.
Immediately when all the people saw Him, they were greatly amazed, and running to Him, greeted Him.|Wen di piipl si Jiizas, dem did shak, so dem ron go miit im siem taim.
He asked the scribes, “What are you debating with them?”|So im aks dem se, “A wa unu an dem a aagyu bout?”
One in the crowd answered, “Teacher, I brought You my son, who has a mute spirit. |Wan man iina di kroud ansa se, “Tiicha, mi bring mi bwai pikni tu yu we av wan diiman iina im we mek im dom.

Wherever it takes hold on him, it dashes him to the ground. And he foams at the mouth and gnashes with his teeth and becomes rigid. And I told Your disciples so that they would cast it out, but they could not.”|Enitaim di diiman tek kanchuol a im, it mek im fling dong imself a grong, im mout fraat op fraat op, im grain im tiit an tifn op imself. Mi beg yu falara dem fi ron out di spirit, bot dem kudn dwi'it.”

He answered, “O faithless generation, how long shall I be with you? How long shall I bear with you? Bring him to Me.”|Jiizas se tu dem se, “Unu piipl iina da taim ya! Unu no biliiv! Umoch langga mi afi tan ya wid unu? Umoch langga mi afi put op wid unu? Kyari di bwai kom tu mi.”

So they brought the boy to Him. When he saw Him, immediately the spirit dashed him, and he fell on the ground and wallowed, foaming at the mouth.|So dem kyari di bwai tu im. Wen di diiman si Jiizas, im mek di bwai staat shiek aad aad siem taim. Im jrap a grong, staat ruol bout, an im mout staat fraat op fraat op.
He asked his father, “How long has it been since it came to him?” He said, “From childhood.|So Jiizas aks di bwai faada, “Ou lang sins im a sofa so?” Im se, “Fram im a likl pikni sa.

Often it has thrown him into the fire and into the water to kill him. But if You can do anything, have compassion on us and help us.”|Uol iip a taim di diiman fling im iina faiya an iina waata fi kil im. Bot ef yu kyan du notn fi'im, tek piti pan wi an elp wi, du.”
Jesus said, “If you can believe, all things are possible to him who believes.”|Jiizas ansa im se, “ ‘Ef yu kyan du notn fi'im?’ Ef yu biliiv eniting kyan apm.”
Immediately the father of the child cried out with tears, “Lord, I believe. Help my unbelief!”|Siem taim di bwai faada baal out, “Mi biliiv, elp mi fi biliiv muo!”

When Jesus saw that the people came running together, He rebuked the foul spirit, saying to it, “You mute and deaf spirit, I command you, come out of him, and enter him no more.”|Wen Jiizas si se wan kroud a piipl staat gyada op faas faas, im chat tu di diiman chrang chrang an tel im se, “Yu spirit we mek di bwai kyaahn taak ar ier, mi a tel yu, kom outa im an neva go iina im agen!”

The spirit cried out and convulsed him greatly. But it came out of him, and he was as dead, so that many said, “He is dead.”|Di spirit baal out an shiek di bwai aad aad an kom outa im. Afta im kom out di bwai luk laik wan ded man an nof a di piipl dem se, “Im ded!”
But Jesus took him by the hand and lifted him up, and he arose.|Bot Jiizas tek taim uol im an an elp im op, an im tan op.
When He had entered the house, His disciples asked Him privately, “Why could we not cast it out?”|Afta Jiizas go iina di ous, im falara dem aks im se, “Wa mek wi kudn ron out di diiman?”
He said to them, “This kind cannot come out except by prayer and fasting.”|Jiizas ansa dem se, “Ef unu no prie, unu kyaahn ron out dem de kain-a diiman de.”
They departed from there and passed through Galilee, and He did not want anyone to know it. |Jiizas an im falara dem lef an paas chuu Gyalalii. Im neva waahn nobadi fi nuo we dem de,

For He was teaching His disciples, saying, “The Son of Man will be delivered into the hands of men, and they will kill Him. After He is killed, He will rise the third day.” |kaaz im did a tiich im falara dem. Im tel dem se, “Sumadi a-go sel out Di Man we Gad Pik an gi im uova tu piipl we iet im. Dem a-go kil im, bot chrii die afta dat, im a-go kom bak alaiv.”
But they did not understand the teaching and were afraid to ask Him.|Bot dem neva andastan wa im did miin, an dem did fried fi aks im.

He came to Capernaum. And being in the house, He asked them, “What was it that you disputed among yourselves on the way?” |Afta Jiizas an im falara dem riich a Kyaporniyom an go iina di ous im aks dem se, “Wa unu did a taak bout wen unu did a waak?”

But they kept silent, for on the way they had disputed among themselves who was the greatest.|Bot dem no se notn, kaaz dem did a aagyu bout wich wan a dem a-go get di tap-a-tap pozishan iina di gruup.

He sat down and called the twelve. And He said to them, “If anyone desires to be first, he must be last of all and servant of all.”|Afta Jiizas sidong, im kaal im twelv falara dem an se, “Ef non a unu waahn di tap-a-tap pozishan, unu afi sekl fi laas plies an sorv evribadi.”
He took a child and set him in their midst. And when He had taken him in His arms, He said to them, |Den im tek wan likl pikni an mek im tan op mongks dem. Im og op di pikni an se tu dem se

“Whoever receives one of these children in My name receives Me. And whoever receives Me receives not Me, but Him who sent Me.”|“Enibadi we tek iin wan a dem likl pikni ya kaaz im biliiv iina mi tek mi iin tu an enibadi we tek mi iin, a no jos mi dem a tek iin, dem a tek iin di wan we sen mi tu.”

John answered Him, “Teacher, we saw one who does not follow us casting out demons in Your name, and we forbade him because he was not following us.”|Jan se tu Jiizas se, “Tiicha, wi si wan man a yuuz yu niem ron out diiman outa piipl an wi chrai fi tap im kaaz im no bilang tu wi gruup.”

But Jesus said, “Do not forbid him, for no one who does a miracle in My name can quickly speak evil of Me. |Bot Jiizas se tu dem se, “No tap im, kaaz nobadi we yuuz fi mi niem fi wok mirikl kyaahn jos ton roun di neks minit an chat bad bout mi.
For he who is not against us is for us.
column2: Kaaz enibadi we naa fait gens wi de pan fi wi said.

column1: Truly I say to you, whoever gives you a cup of water to drink in My name, because you belong to Christ, will not lose his reward.|Mi a tel unu dis, an mi naa lai, enibadi we gi unu wan kop a waata kaaz unu bilang tu mi, boun fi get wa dem fi get.

“Whoever causes one of these little ones who believe in Me to sin, it would be better for him if a millstone were hung around his neck and he were thrown into the sea. |“Ef nobadi mek wan a dem likl pikni ya we biliiv iina mi sin, it wuda beta fi dem ef sumadi tai wan big big rakstuon roun dem nek an fling dem iina di sii.

If your hand causes you to sin, cut it off. It is better for you to enter life maimed than with two hands to go into hell, into the fire that shall never be quenched, |So ef unu an mek unu sin, chap it aaf. Kaaz it wuda beta fi unu kripl an liv fi eva wid Gad dan fi av tuu an an get fling dong iina el faiya we kyaahn out!
where ‘their worm does not die, and the fire is not quenched.|we ‘Di worm dem we a nyam dem kyaahn dedan di faiya we a bon dem kyaahn out.’

And if your foot causes you to sin, cut it off. It is better for you to enter life lame than with two feet to be thrown into hell, into the fire that shall never be quenched,|Ef unu fut mek unu sin, chap it aaf. Kaaz it wuda beta fi unu ef unu kyaahn waak an liv fi eva wid Gad dan fi av tuu fut an get fling dong a el.

where ‘their worm does not die, and the fire is not quenched.’|Ef unu yai kaaz unu fi sin, juk it out. Kaaz unu wuda beta aaf ef unu go iina Gad kindom wid onggl wan yai dan fi av tuu yai an get fling dong a el

And if your eye causes you to sin, pluck it out. It is better for you to enter the kingdom of God with one eye than with two eyes to be thrown into the fire of hell|Ef unu yai kaaz unu fi sin, juk it out. Kaaz unu wuda beta aaf ef unu go iina Gad kindom wid onggl wan yai dan fi av tuu yai an get fling dong a el
where ‘their worm does not die, and the fire is not quenched.’|we ‘Di worm dem we a nyam dem kyaahn dedan di faiya we a bon dem kyaahn out.’
Everyone will be salted with fire, and every sacrifice will be salted with salt.|Bot faiya a-go bon an kliin op evribadi.

“Salt is good. But if the salt loses its saltiness, how will you season it? Have salt in yourselves, and have peace with one another.”|Saalt gud fi unu, bot ef di saalt no ties saalti agen, ou unu ago seezn it? Unu fi av saalt ina unu, an mek pees wid wana neda.
The Transfiguration
column2: Di chansfamieshan

column1: The Healing of a Boy With an Unclean Spirit
column2: Jiizas Ron out Diiman outa wan Bwai

column1: Jesus Again Foretells His Death and Resurrection
column2: Jiizas Se Piipl a-go Kil im

column1: Who Is the Greatest?
column2: Uu a-go Av di Tap-a-Tap Pozishan

column1: He Who Is Not Against Us Is for Us
column2: Uu Naa Fait gens yu De pan yu Said

column1: Temptations to Sin
column2: Tingz we Kaaz Piipl fi Sin

column1: He arose and went from there to the region of Judea to the other side of the Jordan, and the people came to Him again. And again, as was His custom, He taught them.|Afta Jiizas lef we im did de, im go paas Riva Jaadn an go iina di Judiya ieriya. Nof piipl kom tu im agen. An laik im aalwiez du, im tiich dem.

The Pharisees came to test Him, asking, “Is it lawful for a man to divorce his wife?”|Som Farisii did waahn fi tes im. So dem kom tu im an aks im se, “Di Laa gi no man di rait fi brok op wid im waif?”'
He answered them, “What did Moses command you?”|Jiizas aks dem se, “Wa Muoziz tel unu fi du?”
They said, “Moses permitted a man to write a certificate of divorce and to divorce her.”|Dem ansa se, “Muoziz lou di man dem fi rait wan piepa gi dem waif fi shuo se dem no marid no muor.”
Jesus answered them, “Due to the hardness of your heart he wrote you this precept.|Bot Jiizas se tu dem se, “Muoziz lou unu fi du dat kaaz unu no av no aat.
But from the beginning of the creation, God ‘made them male and female.’|Bot fram Gad mek di worl, im ‘mek man an uman.’
‘For this cause shall a man leave his father and mother, and cleave to his wife,|‘A dat mek wan man wi lef im faada an mada, jain op wid im waif,
and the two shall be one flesh.’  So then they are no longer two, but one flesh.|an di tuu a dem wi ton wan sumadi.’ So dem a no tuu agen, dem ton wan.
What therefore God has joined together, let not man put asunder.”|So ef Gad mek wan man an im waif wan, nobadi no fi plit dem op.”
In the house His disciples asked Him concerning this matter again.|Wen dem go bak iina di ous, Jiizas falara dem aks im bout wa im did se.

He said to them, “Whoever divorces his wife and marries another commits adultery against her.|So im tel dem se, “Ef nobadi brok op wid dem waif an go marid sumadi els, im du rang gens im waif. Im komiin jos laik sumadi we a gi im waif bon.
And if a woman divorces her husband and marries another, she commits adultery.”|An ef di waif brok op wid ar ozban an marid sumadi els, a bon shi a gi ar ozban.”

They brought young children to Him, that He might touch them. But the disciples rebuked those who brought them. |Som piipl did bring dem pikni tu Jiizas fi im toch dem. Bot Jiizas speshal falara dem staat tel aaf di piipl dem we bring di pikni dem kom an staat ron dem.

But when Jesus saw it, He was very displeased and said to them, “Allow the little children to come to Me, and do not forbid them, for of such is the kingdom of God. |Wen Jiizas si dis, im get beks an se, “Lou di pikni dem mek dem kom! No chrai tap dem, kaaz Gad kindom a fi piipl we komiin laik dem likl pikni ya.

Truly I say to you, whoever does not receive the kingdom of God as a little child shall not enter it.” |Mi a tel unu dis ya, an a chuu mi a taak, enibadi we no chos iina Gad an fala im laik wan likl pikni naa go kyan go iina Gad kindom.”
And He took them up in His arms, put His hands on them, and blessed them.|Den Jiizas tek di pikni dem, put im an pan dem an bles dem.

When He set out on His way, a man came running and knelt before Him, and asked Him, “Good Teacher, what must I do to inherit eternal life?”|Wen Jiizas did bout fi lef out wan man ron op tu im, go dong pan im nii an aks im se, “Gud tiicha, wa mi mos du ef mi waahn liv fi eva?”
He said to him, “Why do you call Me good? No one is good, except God alone.|Jiizas aks im se, “Wa mek yu kaal mi gud? Nobadi no gud, onggl Gad wan.

You know the commandments, Do not commit adultery, Do not murder, Do not steal, Do not bear false witness, Do not defraud, Honor your father and mother.|Yu nuo wa Muoziz Laa se, ‘No kil, no sliip wid nobadi we yu no marid tu, no tiif, no tel lai pan piipl, no chrik piipl fi tek we wa dem av, rispek yu faada an mada an du wa dem se.’ ”
He answered Him, “Teacher, all these have I observed from my youth.”|Di man ansa im se, “Tiicha, fram mi a likl bwai mi fala aal a dem de wid aal a mi aat.”

Then Jesus, looking upon him, loved him and said to him, “You lack one thing: Go your way, sell whatever you have and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven. And come, take up the cross and follow Me.”|Jiizas luk pan im an lov im, an se tu im se, “A onggl wan sitn yu shaat a. Go sel evriting we yu av an gi di moni tu di puo piipl dem, an yu wi rich iina evn. Wen yu du dat, kom fala mi.”
He was saddened by that word, and he went away grieving. For he had many possessions.|Wen di man ier wa Jiizas se, im aat jrap an im go we sad kaaz im did wel rich.

Jesus looked around and said to His disciples, “How hard it will be for those who have wealth to enter the kingdom of God!”|Den Jiizas luk roun an se tu im falara dem se, “A di aadis ting fi rich piipl go iina Gad kindom!”

The disciples were astonished at His words. But Jesus answered again, “Children, how hard it is for those who trust in riches to enter the kingdom of God! |Im falara dem shak wen dem ier dat. So Jiizas se tu dem agen, “Pikni, it riili aad fi go iina Gad kindom.
It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of God.”
column2: It iiziya fi wan kyamil go chuu wan niigl yai dan fi sumadi we rich go iina Gad kindom.”

column1: They were astonished beyond measure, saying among themselves, “Who then can be saved?”|Dis shak dem iivn muor, so dem se tu wan aneda se, “Den a uu kyan get siev?”

Jesus, looking at them, said, “With men it is impossible, but not with God. For with God all things are possible.”|Jiizas luk pan dem an se, “Wa piipl kyaahn du, Gad kyan du, kaaz notn no de we Gad kyaahn du.”
Peter began to say to Him, “Look, we have left everything and have followed You.”|Den Piita taak op an se, “Luk, wi lef evriting we wi av fi fala yu!”

Jesus answered, “Truly I say to you, there is no one who has left a house or brothers or sisters or father or mother or wife or children or fields, for My sake and for the gospel’s sake, |Jiizas se, “Mi a tel unu di chuut, nobadi no de bout we lef dem ous, breda, sista, mada, faada, pikni, ar ous an lan fi mi an di Gud Nyuuz

who shall not receive a hundred times as much now in this age, houses and brothers and sisters and mothers and children and fields, with persecution, and in the age to come, eternal life. |we naa go get bak iina dem taim ya ous an lan, breda, sista, mada an pikni. Dem a-go get bak onjrid taim muor, an dem a-go get sofarieshan wid dem tu. An iina di taim we a-go kom, dem wi get fi liv fi eva.
But many who are first will be last, and the last first.”|Bot nof a uu de a front nou a-go de a bak, an uu de a bak a-go de a front.

They were on the way, going up to Jerusalem, and Jesus went ahead of them. And they were amazed, and those who followed were afraid. Again, He took the twelve aside and began to tell them what would happen to Him,|Jiizas an im falara dem did a go op a Jeruusilem. Jiizas did infronta dem an dem did shak, bot di piipl we did a fala dem did fried. Jiizas tek di twelv wan said agen an staat tel dem wa a-go apm tu im.

saying, “Listen! We are going up to Jerusalem. The Son of Man will be handed over to the chief priests and the scribes, and they will condemn Him to death and hand Him over to the Gentiles. |Im se, “Luk ya no, wi a go op a Jeruusilem an dem a-go tek di Man we Gad Pik an ton im uova tu di ed priis an di Laa tiicha dem. Dem a-go joj im an se im gilti an fi ded, an dem a-go ton im uova tu di piipl we a no Juu.

They will mock Him, and scourge Him, and spit on Him, and kill Him. Then after three days He will rise.”|Dem a-go laaf aafa im an tek im ton preke, dem a-go pit pan im, biit im wikid wikid, an afta dat dem a-go kil im pan wan kraas. Bot chrii die afta dem kil im, im a-go kom bak alaiv.”

Then James and John, the sons of Zebedee, came to Him, saying, “Teacher, we want that whatever we may ask, You would do for us.”|Jiemz an Jan, Zebidii tuu bwai dem go tu Jiizas an se tu im se, “Tiicha, wi a-go aks yu sopm an wi uop se yu wi du wa wi aks yu.”
He said to them, “What do you want Me to do for you?”|So Jiizas aks dem se, “Wa unu waahn mi fi du fi unu?”

They said to Him, “Grant us to sit, one at Your right hand and the other at Your left hand, in Your glory.”|Dem se, “Wen yu kom iina yu brait brait lait fi ruul, mek wan a wi sidong a yu rait-an-said an di ada wan pan yu lef-an-said.”

But Jesus said to them, “You do not know what you are asking. Can you drink the cup that I drink and be baptized with the baptism with which I am baptized?”|Bot Jiizas tel dem se, “Unu no nuo wa unu riili a aks! Unu kyan jringk wa mi bout fi jringk ar get baptaiz laik ou mi a-go get baptaiz, a sofa mi a-go sofa yu nuo?”

They said to Him, “We can.” Jesus said to them, “You will indeed drink the cup that I drink and be baptized with the baptism with which I am baptized. |Dem se, “Ye, wi kyan du dat.” Den Jiizas se tu dem se, “Fi riil, unu a-go jringk fram di kop we mi jringk fram an baptaiz di siem wie mi get baptaiz

But to sit at My right hand or at My left hand is not Mine to grant. It is for those for whom it has been prepared.”|bot fi sidong pan mi rait-an-said ar mi lef-an-said, a no fi mi fi gi we, kaaz dem pozishan de don put op fi di wan dem uu fi get dem aredi.”
When the ten heard it, they began to be very displeased with James and John.|Nou wen di ada ten falara dem ier dis, dem get mad wid Jiemz an Jan.

But Jesus called them together, and said, “You know that those who are appointed to rule over the Gentiles lord it over them, and their great ones exercise authority over them. |Bot Jiizas kaal dem an se tu dem se, “Unu nuo se di ruula dem fi di piipl we a no Juu baas dem op an di wan dem we iina tap-a-tap pozishan eva a tel dem wa fi du.
But it shall not be so among you. Whoever would be great among you must be your servant, |Bot a no so it go mongks unu. Insted-a dat, ef nobadi waahn av tap pozishan mongks unu, dem afi sorv unu
and whoever among you would be greatest must be servant of all. |an ef non a unu waahn kom fos, unu mos ton evribadi sliev.

For even the Son of Man came not to be served, but to serve, and to give His life as a ransom for many.”|Jos laik ou di Di Man we Gad Pik neehn kom ya fi nobadi sorv im, a kom im kom ya fi sorv piipl an fi gi op im laif so piipl kyan get frii fram dem sin.”

Then they came to Jericho. And as He went out of Jericho with His disciples and a great number of people, blind Bartimaeus, the son of Timaeus, sat along the way begging.|Jiizas an im falara dem riich a Jeriko. Wen Jiizas an im falara dem an wan big kroud a piipl did a lef, wan blain man niem Baatimiyos, Timiyos bwai, did sidong a di ruod-said a beg.

When he heard that it was Jesus of Nazareth, he began to cry out, “Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!”|Wen im ier se a Jiizas fram Nazaret a paas, im staat fi baal out, “Jiizas, Dievid bwai pikni, tek piti pan mi!”

Many ordered him to keep silent. But he cried out even more, “Son of David, have mercy on me!”|Nof piipl tel im fi shot im mout an tap im naiz, bot im baal out louda an louda, “Dievid bwai pikni, tek piti pan mi!”

Jesus stood still and commanded him to be called. So they called the blind man, saying, “Be of good comfort. Rise, He is calling you.”|So Jiizas tap an se, “Kaal im.” So dem kaal di blain man an tel im se, “Tek aat! Git op! Im a kaal yu.”
Throwing aside his garment, he rose and came to Jesus.|Di man fling aaf im jakit, jomp op an go tu Jiizas.

Jesus answered him, “What do you want Me to do for you?” The blind man said to Him, “Rabbi, that I might receive my sight.”|Jiizas aks im se, “Wa yu waahn mi fi du fi yu?”Di blain man ansa im se, “Tiicha, mi waahn fi si.”

Jesus said to him, “Go your way. Your faith has made you well.” Immediately he received his sight and followed Jesus on the way.|Jiizas tel im se, “Gwaan, kaaz yu biliiv yu get beta nou.” Siem taim di man yai dem uopm op an im kuda si, an im fala Jiizas dong di ruod.
Teaching About Divorce
column2: Jiizas Se Man no fi Lef im Waif

column1: Little Children Blessed
column2: Jiizas Bles Likl Pikni

column1: The Rich Man
column2: Di Rich Man an Jiizas

column1: Jesus Foretells His Death and Resurrection a Third Time
column2: Jiizas a-go Ded an Kom Bak Alaiv

column1: The Request of James and John
column2: Jiemz an Jan Aks fi sopm Speshal

column1: The Healing of Blind Bartimaeus
column2: Jiizas Mek Baatimiyos Si

column1: When they drew near Jerusalem and came to Bethphage and Bethany at the Mount of Olives, He sent out two of His disciples|Jiizas an im falara dem did riich nier Jeruusilem. Wen dem kech a Betpiej an Betani a Mount Aliv, Jiizas sen tuu a im falara dem an

and said to them, “Go into the village opposite you. As soon as you enter it, you will find a colt tied, on which no one has ever sat. Untie it and bring it here.|se, “Go a di dischrik infronta unu. Az unu kech de-so, unu wi fain wan yong dangki we nobadi neva raid yet tai op de. Luus it an kyari it kom.

If anyone says to you, ‘Why are you doing this?’ say ‘The Lord has need of it,’ and immediately he will send it here.”|Ef nobadi aks unu ‘Wa mek unu a luus it?’ tel dem se, ‘Di Laad waahn it an im suun sen it bak.’ ”
They went their way and found the colt tied by the door outside on the street. And they untied it.|Di falara dem lef an fain di yong dangki tai op pan di ruod infronta di duor, so dem luus it.
Some of those who stood there said to them, “What are you doing untying the colt?”|Wen dem did a luus di yong dangki, som piipl we did tan op de aks dem se, “Mek unu a luus di yong dangki?”
They answered just as Jesus had commanded. And they let them go.|Dem ansa ou Jiizas did se dem fi ansa, an di piipl mek dem gwaan wid it.
They brought the colt to Jesus and threw their garments on it. And He sat upon it. |So dem kyari di dangki go gi Jiizas, put dem jakit pan im an Jiizas sidong pan im.

Many spread their garments on the street. And others cut down branches off the trees and scattered them on the street. |Nof piipl pred dem jakit pan di ruod, an som a dem chap bush an pred dem pan di ruod.
Those who went before and those who followed cried out, saying: “Hosanna! ‘Blessed is He who comes in the name of the Lord!’|Di wan dem we go infront an di wan dem we fala baka Jiizas did a kaal out,
Blessed is the kingdom of our father David that is coming in the name of the Lord! Hosanna in the highest!”
column2: “Gad bles di wan we a kom fi ruul iina wi Faada Dievid kindom!” “Priez Gad we de a evn!”

column1: Jesus entered Jerusalem and went into the temple. When He had looked around at everything, as the hour was now late, He went out to Bethany with the twelve.|Wen Jiizas riich a Jeruusilem, im go iina Gad ous. Afta im luk roun pan evriting, im an im twelv falara dem lef go a Betani kaaz it did liet aredi.
On the next day when they had returned from Bethany, He was hungry. |Wen Jiizas an im falara dem lef Betani di neks maanin, im did onggri.

Seeing from afar a fig tree with leaves, He went to see if perhaps He might find anything on it. When He came to it, He found nothing except leaves, for it was not the season for figs.|Jiizas si wan fig chrii likl out fram we dem did de. It did kova op wid liif, so im go fi si ef no fig de pan it. Bot im neva fain non kaaz a neva fig taim yet.

Jesus said to it, “May no one ever eat fruit from you again.” And His disciples heard it.|So im se tu di chrii, “Fram nou aan nobadi naa go eva nyam fig fram yu agen!” An im falara dem ier wen im se so.

And they came to Jerusalem. Jesus went into the temple and began to drive out those who sold and bought in the temple, and He overturned the tables of the moneychangers and the seats of those who sold doves.|Afta Jiizas an im falara dem riich Jeruusilem, im go iina Gad ous an staat fling out aal a di piipl dem we did iin de a bai an sel. Di piipl dem we did a chienj out moni, Jiizas pich uova fi dem tiebl an ton uova di chier fi aal uu did de de a sel dov.
And He would not allow anyone to carry any vessel through the temple.
column2: An im wudn mek nobadi kyari gudz go iina di yaad we Gad ous de.

column1: And He taught them, and said, “Is it not written, ‘My house shall be called a house of prayer for all nations’? But you have made it a ‘den of thieves.’ ”|Afta dis im staat tiich di piipl dem. Im se, “It no rait dong iina Gad wod se: “ ‘Fi mi ous a-go bi wan ous we piipl fram aal uova di worl kom fi prie’?Bot unu tek it ton ‘wan aid out fi tiif!’ ”

The scribes and chief priests heard it and looked for a way to kill Him. For they feared Him, because all the people were astonished at His teaching.|Di ed priis an di Laa tiicha dem ier wa Jiizas se, an dem staat luk fi wan wie fi kil im, kaaz dem did fried a im, kaaz im did a tiich so gud it did shak di uol kroud a piipl.
When evening came, He went out of the city.|Iina di iivnin Jiizas an im falara dem lef di siti.
In the morning, as they passed by, they saw the fig tree withered from the roots. |Di neks maanin wen Jiizas falara dem paas di fig chrii dem si se it jrai op fram di ruut.

Peter, calling to remembrance, said to Him, “Rabbi, look! The fig tree which You cursed has withered away.”|Piita memba wa Jiizas did se tu di chrii. Den im se, “Tiicha, luk! Di chrii we yu did se nobadi naa go eva nyam fram agen, it jrai op!”
Jesus answered them, “Have faith in God. |Jiizas tel dem se, “Biliiv iina Gad!

For truly I say to you, whoever says to this mountain, ‘Be removed and be thrown into the sea,’ and does not doubt in his heart, but believes that what he says will come to pass, he will have whatever he says.|Ier wa mi a se, an a chuu mi a taak, ef nobadi se tu da mountn ya, ‘Git op an go fling yuself iina di sii,’ ef im riili biliiv iina im aat an no staat wanda ef it riili a-go apm, it wi apm fi'im fi chuu.

Therefore I say to you, whatever things you ask when you pray, believe that you will receive them, and you will have them. |A dat mek mi a tel unu se eniting unu prie an aks Gad fa, biliiv se im gi unu, an unu wi get it.

And when you stand praying, forgive if you have anything against anyone, so that your Father who is in heaven may also forgive you your sins.|So enitaim unu tan op fi prie, ef unu av notn gens nobadi unu fi paadn dem. Da wie de unu faada we iina evn wi paadn unu fi aal a di rang unu du.”
But if you do not forgive, neither will your Father who is in heaven forgive your sins.|Bot ef unu kyaahn paadn peepl, Gad naago paadn fi unu sin dem niida.

They came again to Jerusalem, and as He was walking in the temple, the chief priests and the scribes and the elders came to Him|Jiizas an im falara dem go baka Jeruusilem. Wen Jiizas did a waak iina di yaad we Gad ous de, di ed priis, Laa tiicha an elda dem kom tu im
and said, “By what authority are You doing these things, and who gave You this authority to do them?”|an aks im se, “Wa rait yu av fi a du dem sitn ya? An uu gi yu di rait fi du dem?”

Jesus answered them, “I will also ask of you one question. Answer Me, and I will tell you by what authority I do these things.|Jiizas se tu dem se, “Mek mi aks unu wan kwestiyan. Ansa mi an mi wi tel unu a uu gi mi di rait fi du dem sitn ya.
Was the baptism of John from heaven or from men? Answer Me.”|Wen Jan did a baptaiz piipl, a uu did sen im fi dwi'it, Gad ar man?”

They debated among themselves, saying, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ He will say, ‘Why then did you not believe him?’|Dem staat wok it out mongks dem wan aneda. Ier dem no, “Ef wi se a Gad, im a-go aks wi se, ‘Den wa mek unu neva biliiv im.’

But if we say, ‘From men’ ”—they feared the people, for everyone held John to be a real prophet.|Bot ef wi se ‘A man’....” (Dem did fried a di piipl dem, kaaz di uol a dem did tingk se Jan a did wan prafit.)

So they answered Jesus, “We do not know.”Jesus answered them, “Neither will I tell you by what authority I do these things.”|So dem se tu Jiizas se, “Wi no nuo.” So Jiizas se tu dem se, “Den mi naa go tel unu uu gi mi di rait fi du dem sitn ya niida.”
The Triumphant Entry Into Jerusalem
column2: Jiizas Raid Go iina Jeruusilem

column1: The Cursing of the Fig Tree
column2: Jiizas Kos wan Fig Chrii

column1: The Cleansing of the Temple
column2: Jiizas Ron som Piipl outa Gad ous

column1: The Lesson From the Fig Tree
column2: Di Fig Chrii Jrai op

column1: The Question of Jesus’ Authority
column2: Wan Kwestiyan bout Jiizas Powa

column1: He began to speak to them in parables. “A man planted a vineyard, and set a hedge around it, and dug a pit for the winepress, and built a tower, and rented it to vinedressers, and went to a far country. |Den Jiizas taak tu dem an tel dem da tuori ya: “Yu did av wan man we did plaant wan griep faam. Im put op wan waal aal roun it, dig out wan uol iina di grong fi krosh out di griep fi mek wain, an bil op wan plies pan tap a di waal fi di gyaad wach uova di faam. Den im rent it out tu som faama an go farin.

At harvest time he sent a servant to the vinedressers to receive from them some of the fruit of the vineyard.|Wen a did taim fi gyada op di griep, im sen wan a im sorvant go a di tenant dem fi go get fi im shier.
But they seized him and beat him and sent him away empty-handed.|Di tenant dem grab di sorvant, biit im op an sen im we wid im tuu lang an.

Then he sent another servant to them. They threw stones at him, and wounded him in the head, and sent him away shamefully handled.|Di uona sen wan neks sorvant, bot di tenant dem biit im op iina im ed an dis im bad bad.

Still he sent another, and they killed him. And there were many others. Some they beat, and some they killed.|Di uona stil sen wan neda sorvant, bot dem kil im. Im sen nof muo sorvant, bot dem biit som an kil di res a dem.

“Having yet his one well-beloved son, he sent him last to them, saying, ‘They will revere my son.’|“Di uona did av onggl wan sumadi lef uu im kuda sen — im wan bwai pikni we im lov bad bad. So im sen im tu di tenant dem, kaaz im se, ‘Dem wi rispek mi bwai.’

“But those vinedressers said among themselves, ‘This is the heir. Come, let us kill him, and the inheritance will be ours.’|“Bot di tenant dem se tu dem wan aneda, ‘A da wan ya a-go get evriting wen im faada ded. Kom mek wi kil im! Da wie de wen im faada ded a wi a-go get evriting we im shuda get.’
So they took him and killed him and threw him out of the vineyard.|So dem grab im, kil im, an fling im badi aafa di faam.”

“What then will the owner of the vineyard do? He will come and kill the vinedressers and give the vineyard to others.|Jiizas aks, “So wa unu tingk di uona fi di faam a-go du? Im a-go kom an kil aaf di tenant dem an tek di faam gi ada piipl.

Have you not read this Scripture: ‘The stone which the builders rejected has become the cornerstone.|Unu neva riid wa rait dong iina Gad wod,“ ‘Di rakstuon di bilda fling we a it a uol op di bildin nou.
This was the Lord’s doing, and it is marvelous in our eyes’?”|A di Laad du dis, an wi yai uopm op waid wen wi si di sitn we im du.’?”

Then they tried to seize Him, but feared the people, for they knew that He had spoken the parable against them. So they left Him and went their way.|Di liida dem did waahn fi lak op Jiizas kaaz dem nuo se a riili dem im did a taak bout. Bot dem did fried a di kroud a piipl, so dem go we lef im.
They sent to Him some of the Pharisees and some of the Herodians to trap Him in His words.
column2: Di liida dem sen som man fram mongks di Farisii dem an Erad falara dem fi tek Jiizas uona wod chrap im.

column1: When they came to Him, they said, “Teacher, we know that You are true and swayed by no man. For You do not regard the person of men, but truthfully teach the way of God. Is it lawful to pay taxes to Caesar, or not?|Dem go tu im an se, “Tiicha, wi nuo se yu taak di chuut kaaz yu naa luk no fren fram nobadi. Yu no paashal. Yu tiich di rait sitn bout wa Gad waahn piipl fi du. Tel wi, it rait fi wi pie taks tu Siiza, di Ruoman ruula? Wi fi pie it ar wi no fi pie it?”

Should we pay, or should we not pay?”But He, knowing their hypocrisy, said to them, “Why test Me? Bring Me a denarius that I may see it.”|Bot im nuo se dem did op tu no gud, so im aks dem se, “Wa unu a tes mi fa? Gi mi wan silva kain mek mi si'it!”

They brought it, and He said to them, “Whose image and inscription is this?” They said to Him, “Caesar’s.”|So dem gi im wan silva kain, an im aks dem se, “Uufa picha an niem de pan it?” Dem ansa im se, “Siiza.”

Then Jesus answered them, “Render to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and to God the things that are God’s.” And they were amazed at Him.|Den Jiizas se tu dem se, “Gi Siiza wa a fi'im, an gi Gad wa a fi'im.” An dem did shak fi ier ou im ansa dem.
Then the Sadducees, who say there is no resurrection, came to Him, saying, |Som Sadyusii (dem kliem se piipl we ded kyaahn kom bak alaiv) kom tu Jiizas an aks im se

“Teacher, Moses wrote for us that if a man’s brother dies and leaves his wife behind, but leaves no children, that man must take the wife and raise up children for his brother.|Tiicha, Muoziz rait dis fi wi, ‘Ef wan man breda ded lef im waif wid no pikni, di breda mos marid di uman an av pikni wid ar fi'im ded breda.’
Now there were seven brothers. The first took a wife, and when he died, he left no children. |Wel, wan taim yu did av sevn breda. Di fos wan marid bot ded an neva av no pikni.
The second took her and died, leaving no children, and the third likewise.|Di sekan breda marid di ded breda waif, bot im ded tu an neva av no pikni. Di siem ting apm tu di tord breda.
The seven had her and left no children. Last of all, the woman died too.|Di sevn breda dem ded bot non a dem no gi ar no pikni. Den di uman ded tu.

In the resurrection, when they rise, whose wife will she be? For the seven had her as wife.”|Wen a taim fi dem kom bak alaiv wid aal di ada ded piipl dem, uufa waif shi a-go bi sins di sevn a dem did marid ar?”

Jesus answered them, “Do you not err, because you know neither the Scriptures nor the power of God?|Jiizas ansa dem se, “Unu nuo se unu wel rang? An unu nuo wai? Kaaz unu no nuo we Gad wod se, an unu no nuo Gad powa.

When they rise from the dead, they neither marry nor are given in marriage, but are like angels in heaven. |Kaaz wen ded piipl kom bak alaiv, man an uman naa go a get marid, dem a-go komiin laik di ienjel dem iina evn.

Now concerning the dead rising, have you not read in the book of Moses, in the account about the bush, how God spoke to him, saying, ‘I am the God of Abraham and the God of Isaac and the God of Jacob’?|Bot wen unu a taak bout ded piipl fi kom bak alaiv, unu neva riid wa Muoziz rait dong iina di paat bout di bush ou Gad se, ‘Mi a Iebriyam Gad, Aizak Gad, an Jiekob Gad’?
He is not the God of the dead, but the God of the living. You therefore do greatly err.”|Im a no Gad fi di ded, bot fi uu a liv. So unu wel rang.”

One of the scribes came and heard them reasoning together. Perceiving that Jesus had answered them well, he asked Him, “Which is the first commandment of all?”|Wan Laa tiicha kom an ier Jiizas an di Sadyusii dem a aagyu. Wen im si se Jiizas gi dem wan gud ansa, im aks Jiizas se, “Outa aal a di Laa dem we Gad se wi fi fala, wich wan a di muos impuotant wan?”

Jesus answered him, “The first of all the commandments is, ‘Hear, O Israel, the Lord our God is one Lord.|Jiizas ansa im se, “Di muos impuotant Laa a dis: ‘Piipl a Izrel, lisn, di Laad we a fi wi Gad, im a wan.

You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart, and with all your soul, and with all your mind, and with all your strength.’ This is the first commandment. |Yu fi lov di Laad we a yu Gad. Yu fi lov im wid aal a yu aat, yu fi lov im wid aal a yu suol, yu fi lov im wid aal a yu main, an yu fi lov im wid aal a yu chrent.’
The second is this: ‘You shall love your neighbor as yourself.’ There is no other commandment greater than these.”
column2: Di sekan muos impuotant Laa a dis: ‘Yu fi lov yu nieba siem laik ou yu lov yuself.’ No ada Laa no muo impuotant laik dem tuu ya.”

column1: The scribe said to Him, “Well said, Teacher. You have spoken the truth, that there is one God and there is no other but Him. |Di Laa tiicha se tu im se, “A chuu ting dat, tiicha. Yu rait fi se a onggl wan Gad de, an dat no ada gad no de bout, onggl im.

To love Him with all the heart, and with all the understanding, and with all the soul, and with all the strength, and to love one’s neighbor as oneself, is more than all burnt offerings and sacrifices.”|An yu rait fi se di muos impuotant Laa a fi lov im wid aal yu aat, wid aal a yu main an wid aal a yu chrent, an yu fi lov yu nieba siem laik ou yu lov yuself. Yu rait fi se dem tuu laa de muo impuotant dan wen sumadi bon sakrifais gi Gad ar gi op aafrin.”

When Jesus saw that he answered wisely, He said to him, “You are not far from the kingdom of God.” After that, no one dared to ask Him any question.|Wen Jiizas si se di man gi wan ansa we mek sens, im se tu im se, “Yu no de faar fram Gad kindom.” Afta dat nobadi els neva iivn tingk fi aks im no muo kwestiyan.

While Jesus taught in the temple, He said, “How can the scribes say that Christ is the Son of David?|Jiizas did a tiich iina di yaad we Gad ous de. Im se, “Ou kom di Laa tiicha dem se di Krais a Dievid pikni?

David himself, speaking by the Holy Spirit, declared: ‘The Lord said to my Lord, “Sit at My right hand, until I put Your enemiesunder Your feet.” ’ |Di Uoli Spirit taak chuu Dievid an se: “ ‘Di Laad se tu fi mi Laad se: “Sidong a mi rait-an-said til mi put yu enimi dem anda yu fut.” ’

David himself calls Him ‘Lord.’ How then is He his Son?” And the large crowd heard him gladly.|Ef Dievid kaal im ‘Laad’, ou di Man We Gad sen fi siev piipl fi bi Dievid bwai pikni?” An di big kroud a piipl did api a lisn wa im se.

He said to them in His teaching, “Beware of the scribes, who love to go about in long robes and love greetings in the marketplaces, |Wen Jiizas did a tiich dem im se, “Unu si dem Laa tiicha de, wach unuself an mek shuor se unu no komiin laik dem! Dem lov waak bout iina lang jakit an get speshal oudi wen dem go a maakit.
and the prominent seats in the synagogues, and the places of honor at banquets,|An wen dem go a di Juu dem choch an go a big dina, dem lov fi sidong iina di bes siit.

who devour widows’ houses and for a pretense make long prayers. They will receive greater condemnation.”|An dem chrik op di uman dem uufa ozban ded an tek we dem ous an lan, wen dem don dem prie lang prieya fi mek demself luk gud. Dem el a-go at.”
Jesus sat opposite the treasury and saw how the people put money into the treasury. Many who were rich put in much.
column2: Jiizas go sidong kraas fram we di aafrin baks did de an wach di kroud a piipl we did a jrap dem moni iina di baks. Nof a di rich piipl dem put iin uol iip a moni.

column1: But a certain poor widow came and put in two mites, which make a farthing.|Den im si wan puo uman uufa ozban ded put iin tuu likl red moni we aadli wot notn — bout tuu sent.

He called His disciples to Him and said to them, “Truly I say to you, this poor widow has put in more than all those who are contributing to the treasury.|Jiizas kaal im falara dem an se tu dem se, “Mi a tel unu di chuut, unu si da puo uman ya we ar ozban ded, shi jrap muo iina di aafrin baks dan aal a dem.

They all contributed out of their abundance. But she, out of her poverty, put in all that she had, her entire livelihood.”|Kaaz aal a dem gi outa di uol iip we dem av, kaaz dem rich. Bot shi, iivn duo shi so puor, shi gi evriting we shi av fi liv aafa.”
The Parable of the Vineyard and the Vinedressers
column2: Di Tuori bout som Faama

column1: The Question of Paying Taxes
column2: Di Kwestiyan bout Siiza Taks

column1: The Widow’s Offering
column2: Wan Uman uufa Ozban Ded Aafrin

column1: As He went out of the temple, one of His disciples said to Him, “Teacher, see what great stones and what great buildings are here.”|Jiizas did a lef di yaad we Gad ous de wen wan a im falara dem se tu im se, “Tiicha, luk! Yu si ou dem bildin ya big an priti! An luk ou dem stuon ya we dem tek bil dem big!”

Jesus answered him, “Do you see these great buildings? Not one stone shall be left upon another that shall not be thrown down.”|Jiizas ansa im se, “Yu si dem big priti bildin ya? Evri wan a dem a-go get tier dong. No iivn wan a dem stuon ya a-go lef pan tap a dem wan aneda. Di uol a dem a-go lik dong!”

As He sat on the Mount of Olives opposite the temple, Peter, James, John, and Andrew asked Him privately|So wen Jiizas did a sidong pan Mount Aliv kraas fram Gad ous, Piita, Jiemz, Jan an Anju kom tu im wan a wie an aks im se

“Tell us, when will these things happen, and what will be the sign when all these things will be fulfilled?”|“Tel wi, a wen aal dem sitn ya a-go apm? An wa sain wi kyan luk fa fi nuo se dem a-go apm?”
Jesus answered them, “Take heed lest anyone deceive you. |Jiizas se tu dem se, “Wach out, no mek nobadi fuul unu op.

Many will come in My name, saying, ‘I am He,’ and will deceive many.|Kaaz a uol iip a piipl a-go kom yuuz op yuuz op mi niem, an a se, ‘Mi a Krais, a mi Gad sen fi siev piipl,’ an dem a-go fuul op nof piipl.

When you hear of wars and rumors of wars, do not be troubled. For such things must happen, but the end is still to come. |Wen unu ier bout waar nier an faar, no bada mek dem sitn de fraitn unu. Dem sitn de boun fi apm, bot dat no miin se a don di worl a don.

For nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom. And there will be earthquakes in various places, and there will be famines and troubles. These are the beginning of sorrows.|Kaaz wan set a piipl a-go waar gens wan neks set a piipl, an wan kindom a-go fait gens wan neda kindom. Ortkwiek a-go apm iina nof nof plies. Fuud a-go shaat an nof nof piipl a-go staav. An di wie piipl a-go sofa, it a-go komiin laik di fos pien we lik wan uman we tek iin fi av Biebi.

“But take heed. For they will hand you over to councils, and in the synagogues you will be beaten. You will be brought before rulers and kings for My sake, as a testimony to them.|“Wach out. Chobl a-go riich unu. Dem a-go tek unu an ton unu uova tu di liida dem fi di Juu dem choch, an dem a-go biit unu iina dem choch. An kaaz unu fala mi, unu wi get fi tan op infronta ruula an king an tel dem bout mi.
And the gospel must first be preached to all nations.
column2: Bot di Gud Nyuuz afi priich tu di uol worl fos bifuo dem sitn de apm.

column1: But when they arrest you and hand you over, take no thought beforehand, or premeditate what you should speak. But speak whatever is given you in that time, for it is not you who speaks, but the Holy Spirit.|Wen dem ares unu an ton unu uova tu di joj, no bada fret bout wa unu a-go se ar ou unu a-go se it. Jos se we Gad tel unu fi se da taim de, kaaz a no unu a taak, a di Uoli Spirit a taak chuu unu.

“Now a brother will betray his brother to death, and the father the son; children will rise up against their parents, and will cause them to be put to death.|“Breda an sista a-go infaam pan dem uona breda an sista dem an mek di piipl dem we a ruul kil dem. A siem so, wan faada a-go an uova im uona pikni. Pikni a-go ton gens dem faada an mada an mek di ruula dem kil dem.

You will be hated by all men for My name’s sake. But he who endures to the end shall be saved.|An evribadi a-go iet unu kaaz unu fala mi. Bot enibadi we uol aan tait an tan op chrang til di sofarieshan don, Gad a-go siev dem piipl de.

“When you see the ‘abomination of desolation’ spoken of by Daniel the prophet standing where it should not be (let the reader understand), then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains. |“Bot wen unu si di wikid wikid sitn we go gens Gad tan op iina Gad ous — mek shuor se evribadi we riid dis ya andastan we it miin — den dem we liv iina Judiya fi ron we go iina di mountn dem.
Let him who is on the housetop not go down or enter the house to take anything out of his house. |Uu de pan ruuf tap, no fi kom dong ar go bak iina di ous fi notn.
Let him who is in the field not turn back to take his garment. |Nobadi we de a dem bush, no fi go bak fi get im jakit.
But woe to women who are pregnant and to those who nurse in those days!
column2: Wat a sitn iina dem taim de fi uman we av biebi iina beli an fi mada we av yong biebi!

column1: Pray that your escape may not be in winter.
column2: Prie se dem sopm de no apm wen staam a kom ar wen a rieni taim.

column1: For in those days there will be distress as has not been from the beginning of the creation which God created to this time, nor ever shall be.|Kaaz di wie piipl gweehn sofa iina dem taim de, nobadi neva sofa so fram di taim Gad mek di worl. An nobadi naa go eva sofa so agen.

“Except the Lord shortened the days, no flesh would be saved. But for the sake of the elect, whom He chose, He shortened the days.|An nobadi wuda neva get siev ef di Laad neva shaatn dem die de. Bot siek-a im speshal piipl dem we im pik, im shaatn di die dem.
Then if anyone says to you, ‘Look, here is the Christ!’ or ‘Look, there He is!’ do not believe it. |So ef sumadi se tu yu, ‘Luk, si Krais ya!’ ar ‘Luk, si im de!’ No biliiv im.

For false christs and false prophets will rise and show signs and wonders to deceive, if possible, even the elect. |Kaaz piipl a-go kom kom se dem a di wan we Gad sen fi siev piipl, wen notn no go so. An som faalz prafit a-go shuo op tu. Dem piipl de a-go wok aal kain-a mirikl an shuo aal kain-a sain fi chrik op piipl, dong tu aal di piipl dem we Gad pik dem wi chrik op ef dem get di chaans.
But take heed. I have told you all things beforehand.
column2: Bot wach unuself! Mi a tel unu aal dem sitn ya bifuo dem apm.

column1: “But in those days, after that distress,‘the sun will be darkened,and the moon will not give her light;|“Bot iina dem die de, rait afta di torbl sofarieshan,“ ‘Di son a-go daak op,an di muun a-go tap shain;
the stars of heaven will fall,and the powers that are in heaven will be shaken.’|Di staar dem a-go jrap outa di skai,an evriting iina di skai a-go get shiek outa dem plies.’
Then they will see the Son of Man coming in clouds with great power and glory.
column2: “Den evribadi wi si di Man we Gad Pik a kom iina di kloud dem an im a-go av powa an wan brait brait lait a shain roun im.

column1: Then He will send His angels and gather His elect from the four winds, from the farthest part of the earth to the farthest part of heaven.|Den im wi sen im ienjel dem fi gyada op di piipl we im pik fram naat, sout, iis an wes, fram evri kribis an kaana a di ort.

Now learn a parable of the fig tree: When her branch is yet tender and puts outs leaves, you know that summer is near.|“Nou lorn sopm fram di fig chrii. Wen taim unu si dem branch get wel saaf an griin an dem staat sen out nyuu liif, unu nuo se soma suun kom.

So also, when you see these things come to pass, know that it is near, even at the doors.|A siem so wen unu si aal dem sitn ya a apm, unu wi nuo se di Man we Gad sen fi siev piipl suun kom; a laik se im de rait outsaida unu duor.
Truly I say to you, this generation will not pass away until all these things happen.|Mi a tel unu dis an a chuu mi a taak, di piipl we a liv iina dem taim ya naa go ded til aal a dem sitn ya apm.
Heaven and earth will pass away, but My words will not pass away.|Evn an ort naa go de bout fi eva, bot fi mi wod a-go laas fi eva.

“But concerning that day or hour no one knows, not even the angels in heaven, nor the Son, but only the Father.|“Nobadi no nuo di die ar di taim wen aal a dem sitn de a-go apm, no iivn di ienjel dem iina evn ar di Faada Bwai Pikni nuo, a onggl Faada Gad wan nuo dat.
Take heed, watch and pray. For you do not know when the time will come.|So wach out! An kip gyaad kaaz unu no nuo wen di taim a kom.

For the Son of Man is like a man leaving on a far journey who left his house and gave authority to his servants and to every man his work, and commanded the porter to watch.|Da taim de komiin laik wan man we a go we pan wan chrip. Im lef im sorvant dem inchaaj a im ous an gi evri wan a dem di wok we dem fi du. An im tel di wan we a gyaad di duor fi kip wach.

“Watch therefore—for you do not know when the master of the house is coming, in the evening, or at midnight, or at the crowing of the rooster, or in the morning|“So kip wach den, kaaz unu no nuo wen di baas a kom bak — weda iina di iivnin, migl nait, wen di kak kruo, ar wen die a lait
lest he come suddenly and find you sleeping.
column2: kaaz im mait kom bak wen unu naa luk fi'im kom an im kom fain unu a sliip.

column1: What I say to you I say to all: Watch!”|Wa mi se tu unu, mi a se tu evribadi: ‘Kip wach!’ ”
The Destruction of the Temple Foretold
column2: Jiizas Se Gad Ous a-go Mash dong

column1: Troubles and Persecutions
column2: Chrayalz an chibilieshan

column1: The Great Tribulation
column2: Di bigis prablem

column1: The Coming of the Son of Man
column2: Wen man son n a kom

column1: The Lesson of the Fig Tree
column2: We di fig chrii lesn tiich wi se

column1: The Unknown Day and Hour
column2: Nobadi no Nuo wen Krais Jiizas a Kom Bak

column1: Now the feasts of the Passover and of Unleavened Bread were two days away. And the chief priests and the scribes looked for a way to seize Him secretly and kill Him.
column2: A did tuu die bifuo di Paasuova alidie an di Festival we piipl nyam bred widout yiis. Di ed priis an di Laa tiicha dem did a chrai fain wan wie fi chrik Jiizas so dem kuda ares im an kil im.

column1: But they said “Not on the feast day, lest there will be an uproar among the people.”|Dem se, “Wi kyaahn dwi'it wen di festival a gwaan, kaaz dat wi rail op di piipl dem.”

While He was in Bethany in the house of Simon the leper, as He sat at supper, a ­woman came with an alabaster jar of ointment, a very costly spikenard. She broke the jar and poured the ointment on His head.|Jiizas did de a Saiman yaad a Betani. Saiman did av wan siknis we mek im skin fasi-fasi. Jiizas did sidong a di tiebl wen wan uman kom de. Shi did av wan likl stuon jaar ful-a wan dier dier porfyuum wa mek outa wan spais niem naad. Shi brok di jaar an chuo out di porfyuum pan Jiizas ed.
There were some with indignation within themselves, saying, “Why was this ointment wasted?|Som a di ges dem get beks, an staat tu se tu dem wan aneda se, “Wa mek shi a wies da dier dier porfyuum de?
It might have been sold for more than three hundred denarii and given to the poor.” And they grumbled against her.
column2: It kuda did sel fi muo dan chrii onjrid silva kain an tek di moni gi puo piipl!” So dem staat ries ar op.

column1: Jesus said, “Leave her alone. Why do you trouble her? She has done a good work for Me.|Bot Jiizas se tu dem se: “Unu lef ar! Wa unu a chobl ar fa? A sitn gud shi du tu mi.

You always have the poor with you, and whenever you wish, you may do good to them. But you will not always have Me.|Kaaz unu wi aalwiez av puo piipl mongks unu an unu kyan elp dem enitaim unu waahn fi elp dem. Bot unu naa go av mi mongks unu fi eva.
She has done what she could. She has come beforehand to anoint My body for burial.
column2: Shi du wa shi kuda du. Shi naint mi badi bifuo taim fi get mi redi fi dem beri mi.

column1: Truly I say to you, wherever this gospel will be preached throughout the whole world, what she has done will also be spoken of as a memorial to her.”|Mi a tel unu dis, an mi naa lai, enitaim piipl priich di Gud Nyuuz roun di worl, dem a-go memba ar an taak bout wa shi du.”

Then Judas Iscariot, who was one of the twelve, went to the chief priests to betray Him to them. |Juudas Iskyariyat, wan a di twelv falara dem, go tu di ed priis fi sel out Jiizas an ton im uova tu dem.

When they heard it, they were glad and promised to give him silver. So he looked for how he might conveniently betray Him.|Wen dem ier dis dem glad-bag bos, so dem pramis fi pie im aaf. Fram da taim de, Juudas staat luk fi wan chaans fi ton Jiizas uova tu dem.

On the first day of Unleavened Bread, when they sacrificed the Passover lamb, His disciples said to Him, “Where do You want us to prepare for You to eat the Passover?”|Nou di Paasuova alidie wen piipl nyam bred widout yiis did kom. Pan di fos die a da alidie de wen dem kil di biebi shiip, Jiizas falara dem aks im se, “We yu waahn wi fi luk aafa di Paasuova fuud fi yu nyam?”

So He sent two of His disciples and said to them, “Go into the city, and a man carrying a pitcher of water will meet you there. Follow him. |So im sen tuu a im falara dem an tel dem se, “Go a Jeruusilem, an wan man we a kyari wan jog a waata wi miit unu. Fala im.

Wherever he enters, say to the owner of the house, ‘The Teacher says, Where is the guest room where I may eat the Passover with My disciples?’|Wen im go iina wan ous, tel di uona fi di ous se, ‘Di tiicha se fi aks yu se: We di ges ruum de we mi kyan nyam di Paasuova fuud wid mi speshal falara dem?’
He will show you a large upper room, furnished and ready. Make preparations for us there.”|Im wi shuo unu wan big ruum opstiez fiks op an redi. A de-so unu fi luk bout di fuud.”

His disciples went out, and came into the city, and found it as He had told them. And they prepared the Passover.|So di tuu a dem lef go a Jeruusilem an fain evriting jos laik ou Jiizas did tel dem. An dem luk bout di Paasuova fuud.
In the evening He came with the twelve.
column2: Wen iivnin kom Jiizas an im twelv falara dem kom a di ous.

column1: As they sat and ate, Jesus said, “Truly I say to you, one of you who is eating with Me will betray Me.”|Wen dem did sidong a di tiebl an did a iit, Jiizas se tu dem se, “Mi a tel unu dis, an a chuu mi a taak, wan a unu we de ya a nyam wid mi a-go sel mi out.”
