They began to be sorrowful and to say to Him one by one, “Is it I?” and another, “Is it I?”|Wen di falara dem ier wa Jiizas se, dem aat jrap siek-a ou dem sad. An wan afta di ada dem aks Jiizas se, “A kyaahn mi?”
He answered them, “It is one of the twelve, one who is dipping bread in the dish with Me. |Im se, “A wan outa di twelv a unu, wan a unu we a dip unu an iina di boul wid mi.

The Son of Man indeed goes as it is written concerning Him, but woe to that man by whom the Son of Man is betrayed! It would have been good for that man if he had never been born.”|Kaaz di Man we Gad Pik mos go siem ou Gad wod se im a-go go, bot yu si di man we sel im out — chobl fi'im a tel yu! Im wuda betaraaf ef im neehn baan.”

As they were eating, Jesus took bread, blessed and broke it, and gave it to them, saying, “Take and eat it. This is My body.”|Wail dem did a nyam, Jiizas tek di bred an afta im gi tangks, im brok it an gi dem an se tu dem se, “Tek dis. Dis a mi badi.”
Then He took the cup, and when He had given thanks, He gave it to them. And they all drank from it.|Den im tek di kop wid di wain an gi tangks. Im gi it tu dem, an aal a dem jringk fram di kop.
He said to them, “This is My blood of the new covenant, which is shed for many.|Den im se tu dem se, “Dis a mi blod we set op di nyuu plan we Gad mek wid unu, mi blod we bliid out fi nof piipl.

Truly I say to you, I will drink no more of the fruit of the vine until that day when I drink it new in the kingdom of God.”|Mi a tel unu di chuut, mi naa go jringk no muor wain til di die kom wen mi jringk it iina wan nyuu wie iina Gad kindom.”
When they had sung a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.|Afta dem sing wan im dem lef go a Mount Aliv.

Jesus said to them, “All of you will fall away on account of Me this night, for it is written:‘I will strike the shepherd,and the sheep will be scattered.’|Jiizas se tu im falara dem se, “Aal a unu gweehn ton unu bak pan mi, kaaz it rait dong iina Gad wod se, “ ‘Mi a-go lik dong di shepad, an di shiip dem a-go ron aal bout di plies.’
But after I have risen, I will go before you to Galilee.”|Bot afta mi kom bak alaiv, mi a-go go iina Gyalalii bifuo unu.”
Peter said to Him, “Even if all fall away, I will not.”|Piita se tu im se, “Iivn ef di uol a dem ron we, mi naa go no we!”

Jesus said to him, “Truly, I say to you that this day, during the night, before the rooster crows twice, you will deny Me three times.”|Jiizas se tu im se, “Mi a tel yu dis an a chuu mi a taak, bifuo di ruusta kruo tuu taim tide — da sed nait ya — yu a-go se yu no nuo mi chrii taim.”

But he said more vehemently, “If I must die with You, I will not deny You.” They all said the same thing.|Bot Piita uol aan pan wa im se an stil se, “Aal ef dem afi kil mi wid yu, mi wi neva se mi no nuo yu!” An aal a dem se di siem ting.
They came to a place which was named Gethsemane. And He said to His disciples, “Sit here while I pray.”|Den dem go a wan plies kaal Getsemini, an Jiizas tel dem se, “Sidong ya-so wail mi go prie.”
He took Peter and James and John with Him and began to be greatly distressed and very troubled.|So im tek Piita, Jiemz an Jan wid im an im did wel sad an im aat did evi.
And He said to them, “My soul is deeply sorrowful unto death. Remain here and keep watch.”|Im se tu dem se, “Mi aat evi so til mi fiil laik da presha ya a-go kil mi. Tan ya-so an kip wach.”

He went a little farther and fell on the ground and prayed that, if it were possible, the hour might pass from Him.|Den im go likl forda, jrap imself flat a grong an prie an beg Gad se, “Ef im no afi sofa dem torbl sitn ya, no mek mi sofa.”

He said, “Abba, Father, all things are possible for You. Remove this cup from Me; yet not what I will, but what You will.”|Im se, “Faada, mi faada, notn no de we yu kyaahn du. Siev mi fram dem torbl sofarieshan ya! Bot ef a so yu waahn it fi go, aarait den.”

Then He came and found them sleeping and said to Peter, “Simon, are you sleeping? Could you not keep watch one hour?|Wen im go bak we im speshal falara dem de im fain dem a sliip, so im se tu Saiman Piita se, “Yu a sliip? Yu kudn kip wach fi wan owa?

Watch and pray, lest you enter into temptation. The spirit indeed is willing, but the flesh is weak.”|No sliip! Kip wach an prie so unu no fies notn we wi kaaz unu fi sin. Kaaz iina unu aat unu waahn du wa rait bot unu a jos piipl an dat mek unu wiik.”
Again He went away and prayed the same words.
column2: Jiizas go bak an prie di siem ting agen.

column1: When He returned, He again found them sleeping, for their eyes were heavy. And they did not know what to answer Him.|Wen im kom bak agen, im fain dem faas a sliip; dem kudn kip dem yai uopm an dem neva nuo wa fi se tu im.

When He returned a third time, He said to them, “Are you still sleeping and taking your rest? It is enough! The hour has come. Look, the Son of Man is betrayed into the hands of sinners.|Wen Jiizas kom bak tu dem di tord taim, im aks dem se, “Unu stil a sliip an a res? Inof a dat! Di taim kom nou. Luk! Dem a-go sel out di Man we Gad pik an ton im uova tu di wikid piipl dem.
Rise up, let us go. Look! He who betrays Me is at hand.|Unu git op! Mek wi go nou. Luk! Si di wan we sel mi out a kom de.”

Immediately, while He was still speaking, Judas, one of the twelve, and with him a great crowd with swords and clubs, came from the chief priests and the scribes and the elders.|Jiizas did stil a taak wen Juudas, wan a im twelv speshal falara dem riich. Wan bag a piipl did a fala im wid suod an big tik. A di ed priis, di Laa tiicha, an di elda dem did sen dem kom.

Now he who betrayed Him had given them a sign, saying, “Whomever I kiss, He is the One. Seize Him and lead Him away safely.”|(Di wan we sel out Jiizas did gi dem wan sain se, “Di wan we mi kis a im a di man. Ares im, tek im we an gyaad im wen unu a tek im we.”)
So as soon as he came, he went to Him immediately and said, “Rabbi, Rabbi!” and kissed Him. |Wen Juudas riich im waak rait op tu Jiizas siem taim an se, “Tiicha!” an kis im.
They laid hands on Him and seized Him.
column2: Den dem uol aan pan Jiizas an ares im.

column1: Then one of those who stood by drew his sword and struck the servant of the high priest and cut off his ear.|Wan a di falara dem we did a tan op de, tek out im suod an chap wan a di sorvant a di liida fi di priis dem. Im chap aaf im iez.
Jesus said to them, “Have you come out with swords and clubs to arrest Me as you would a thief?|Jiizas se tu di kroud se, “A kom unu kom wid suod an big tik fi ares mi laik mi a oul tiif an mordara?

Every day I was with you in the temple teaching, and you did not seize Me. But the Scriptures must be fulfilled.” |Die iin die out mi de mongks unu a tiich iina di yaad we Gad ous de, an unu neva ares mi. Bot dem sopm ya afi apm so wa rait dong iina Gad wod kyan kom chuu.”
Then they all deserted Him and fled.
column2: Den aal a im speshal falara dem tek fut an ron we lef im.

column1: A young man followed Him, wearing a linen cloth around himself. And the young men laid hold of him|Wan yong man did a fala baka Jiizas. Im did a wier onggl wan linin klaat rap roun im. Dem chrai fi grab im
so he left the linen cloth, and fled from them unclothed.|bot im get we an ron we niekid lef di linin klaat iina dem an.

They led Jesus away to the high priest. And all the chief priests and the elders and the scribes were assembled with him.|Dem kyari Jiizas go we di liida fi di priis dem, di ed priis dem, di Laa tiicha dem, an di elda dem gyada op.
Peter followed Him at a distance into the courtyard of the high priest. He sat with the guards and warmed himself by the fire.
column2: An Piita did de likl forda aaf a fala Jiizas aal di wie tu di liida fi di priis dem yaad. So Piita go sidong wich paat di gyaad dem de an did a mek di faiya kip im waam.

column1: Now the chief priests and the entire Sanhedrin requested testimony against Jesus to put Him to death, but found none.|Di ed priis an aal a di Juu liida dem did a chrai fi fain piipl fi taak gens Jiizas, so dem kuda get fi kil im, bot dem kudn fain non.
Many bore false witness against Him, but their testimonies did not agree.|Nof piipl mek op tuori gens im, bot wa dem se neva mach op wid wa dem wan aneda se.
Then some rose up and bore false witness against Him, saying|Som a dem tan op a tel da lai ya pan im:

“We heard Him say, ‘I will destroy this temple that is made with hands, and within three days I will build another not made with hands.’ ” |“Wi ier im se, ‘Mi wi tier dong Gad ous we man mek an bil bak wan iina chrii die we man no mek.’
But still their testimony did not agree.|Bot aal wen dem a gi da tuori ya, wa dem se neva mach op.

Then the high priest stood up in the midst and asked Jesus, “Do You answer nothing? What is it which these men testify against You?|So di liida fi di priis dem tan op infronta evribadi an aks Jiizas se, “Yu naa notn fi se? Wa kain-a sitn dem ya dem a se bout yu?”

But He kept silent and answered nothing.Again the high priest asked Him, “Are You the Christ, the Son of the Blessed One?”|Bot Jiizas kip kwaiyat. Im neva se a wod. So di liida fi di priis dem aks im agen, “Yu a di Krais, di Muos Ai Gad we wi priez Bwai Pikni?”

Jesus said, “I am. And you will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of Power and coming with the clouds of heaven.”|“Ye!” Jiizas ansa, “An unu a-go si di Man we Gad Pik a sidong a di rait an a di wan we powaful, an a kom dong pan kloud we kom outa evn.”
The high priest tore his robes, saying, “What need do we have of any further witnesses?|Den di liida fi di priis dem tier im kluoz an se, “Wa wi waahn muo piipl fi pruuv notn fa?
You have heard the blasphemy. What do you think?” They all condemned Him as guilty unto death.
column2: Unu ier fi unuself ou im a disrispek Gad. Wa di kuot se?” Aal a dem rait im aaf se im gilti an im fi ded.

column1: Then some began to spit on Him, and to blindfold Him, and to strike Him, saying to Him, “Prophesy!” And the guards struck Him with the palms of their hands.|Den som a dem staat pit pan im, som tai piis a klaat uova im yai so im kudn si an staat tomp im op wid dem fis an a se tu im se, “Yu se yu a wan prafit, so tel wi uu lik yu.” An di suoja dem we did a gyaad im biit im op tu.
While Peter was below in the courtyard, one of the servant girls of the high priest came. |Piita did stil de iina di yaad wen wan sliev gyal fi di liida fi di priis dem kom wich paat im de.

When she saw Peter warming himself, she looked at him and said, “You also were with Jesus of Nazareth.”|Wen shi si im a waam imself a di faiya-said, shi luk pan im gud gud an se, “Yu did de mongks Jiizas we kom fram Nazaret.”

But he denied it, saying, “I neither know nor understand what you are saying.” Then he went out to the porch, and a rooster crowed.|Bot im se a lai. Im se, “Mi no iivn nuo ar andastan wa yu a taak bout!” So im get op an go outa di giet. Siem taim wan ruusta kruo.

The servant girl saw him again and began to say to those who stood by, “This man is one of them.”|Wen di sliev gyal si im, shi staat tel di piipl dem we did tan op de agen se, “Da man ya a wan a dem!”

But again, he denied it. A little while later, those who stood by said again to Peter, “Surely, you are one of them. For you are a Galilean, and your speech confirms it.”|Bot Piita stil se im no nuo im.Likl afta dat di piipl dem we did tan op de se tu Piita se, “Yu a mos wan a dem, kaaz yu kom fram Gyalalii tu.”

Peter began to invoke a curse on himself, and to swear, “I do not know this Man of whom you speak.”|Den Piita staat kos an kaal dong aal kain-a kraasiz pan imself an se, “Mi se mi no nuo da man ya wa unu a chat bout! Gad ponish mi ef a lai mi a tel! Mi no nuo im!”

And the rooster crowed a second time. And Peter called to mind the word that Jesus said to him, “Before the rooster crows twice, you will deny Me three times.” And when he thought on this, he wept.|Siem taim wan ruusta kruo, dat mek di sekan taim. Den Piita memba ou Jiizas did tel im se, “Bifuo di ruusta kruo tuu taim, yu a-go se yu no nuo mi chrii taim.” An Piita staat baal, an im baal an baal so til.
The Plot to Kill Jesus
column2: Wan Plan fi Kil Jiizas

column1: The Anointing at Bethany
column2: Dem get anaint opa Betani

column1: Judas’ Agreement to Betray Jesus
column2: Juudas disyd fi bichrie Jiizas

column1: The Passover With the Disciples
column2: Di Paasuova wid di Disaipl dem

column1: The Lord’s Supper
column2: Di Laad Sopa

column1: Peter’s Denial Foretold
column2: Piita a-go Se im no Nuo Jiizas

column1: The Prayer in Gethsemane
column2: Jiizas Prie iina Getsemini

column1: The Betrayal and Arrest of Jesus
column2: Dem Ares Jiizas

column1: The Young Man Who Fled
column2: Di yong man we ron we

column1: Jesus Before the Sanhedrin
column2: Di Liida dem Kwestiyan Jiizas

column1: Peter’s Denial of Jesus
column2: Piita Se im no Nuo Jiizas

column1: Early in the morning the chief priests held a consultation with the elders and scribes and the whole Sanhedrin. And they bound Jesus and took Him away and handed Him over to Pilate.|Orli iina di maanin afta di ed priis dem, di elda dem, Laa tiicha an di ada Juu liida dem mek dem plan, dem tai op Jiizas an liid im we go ton im uova tu Pailat.
Pilate asked Him, “Are You the King of the Jews?”He answered him, “You have said so.”|So Pailat aks im se, “Yu a di Juu dem king?” Jiizas ansa im se, “A yu se so.”
The chief priests accused Him of many things, but He answered nothing.|Den di liida fi di priis dem staat se aal saat a sitn gens im.

So Pilate asked Him again, “Do You answer nothing? See how many things they testify against You.”|So Pailat aks im agen se, “Yu ier umoch bad sitn dem se yu du? Lisn! Yu no ier aal di torbl sitn dem we dem a se gens yu!”
But Jesus still answered nothing, so that Pilate was astonished.|Bot Jiizas stil neva se a wod, an da wan de lik Pailat fi siks!
Now at the feast he always released to them one prisoner, whomever they requested.|Evri Paasuova Alidie Pailat wuda frii wan prizna — eni wan we di piipl dem aks fa.

There was one named Barabbas, who had committed murder in the insurrection and was bound with the rebels.|Nou wan man niem Barabas an som ada kriminal did iina prizn fi morda afta dem did rail op di piipl gens di govament.
The crowd began crying aloud, asking Pilate to do as he had always done for them.|Den di kroud a piipl kom tu Pailat an staat beg im fi frii wan prizna fi dem laik im aalwiez du.
He answered them, “Do you want me to release to you the King of the Jews?”|So im aks dem se, “Unu waahn mi le'go di Juu dem King gi unu?”
For he knew that the chief priests had handed Him over out of envy.
column2: (Kaaz im nuo se di liida fi di priis dem did ton im uova tu im siek-a bad main.)

column1: But the chief priests stirred the people, so that he should instead release Barabbas to them.|Bot di ed priis dem rail op di kroud fi aks Pailat fi let go Barabas.
Pilate answered them again, “What then would you have me do to Him whom you call the King of the Jews?”|So Pailat aks dem agen se, “Den wa unu waahn mi fi du wid di wan we unu kaal di Juu dem King?”
They again cried out, “Crucify Him!”|Dem baal out se, “Kil im pan di kraas!”

Pilate said to them, “Why, what evil has He done?”But they cried out even more, “Crucify Him!” But they cried out even more, “Crucify Him!”|Pailat aks dem se, “Wa mek? Wa im du rang?” Bot dem baal out louda, “Kil im pan di kraas!”

So Pilate, resolving to satisfy the people, released Barabbas to them. And when he had scourged Jesus, he handed Him over to be crucified.|Pailat did waahn fi mek di kroud a piipl api, so im let go Barabas. Den im mek di suoja dem biit Jiizas. Afta dat im ton im uova tu dem fi dem kil im pan di kraas.

The soldiers led Him away to Praetorium Hall, and they called together the entire battalion.|So di suoja dem liid im go iina di palis (dat a di govana yaad) an kaal op di ada suoja dem we iina dem gruup.
They clothed Him with a purple robe. And they wove a crown of thorns and put it on His head,|Dem put wa lang lang porpl jakit pan Jiizas, an wan kroun mek outa makabush pan im ed.
and began to salute Him, “Hail, King of the Jews!” |Dem staat big im op an a se “Manaz an rispek tu di Juu dem King.”

and began to salute Him, “Hail, King of the Jews!” They struck His head with a staff and spit on Him. And bowing their knees, they worshipped Him.|Den dem lik lik im op iina im ed wid wan piis a tik an pit pit op pan im. Den dem go dong pan dem nii an gwaan laik se dem a worship im.

When they had mocked Him, they took the purple robe off of Him and put His own garments on Him. Then they led Him out to crucify Him.|Wen dem don mak im an tek im mek preke, dem tek aaf im porpl ruob an put aan bak im uona kluoz. Den dem kyari im go we fi niel im pan di kraas.

They compelled a man named Simon from Cyrene, the father of Alexander and Rufus, as he was passing through from the country, to bear Jesus’ cross.|Wan man niem Saiman we kom fram Sairiin did a komiin fram konchri (im a did Aligzanda an Ruufos faada). Di suoja dem fuos im fi kyari Jiizas kraas.
They brought Him to the place called Golgotha, which means, “Place of a Skull.”|Dem kyari Jiizas go a wan plies we niem Golgota, (dat miin Di Skol Plies).
They gave Him wine mingled with myrrh to drink, but He did not take it.|Dem chrai fi gi im wain miks wid wan spais niem mor, bot Jiizas wudn jringk it.

When they had crucified Him, they divided His garments, casting lots for them, to decide what each man should take.|Den dem niel im pan di kraas. Di suoja dem chuo dais fi shier op im kluoz an fi fain out uu fi get wich paat.
Now it was the third hour, and they crucified Him.|A did nain aklak iina di maanin wen dem kil im pan di kraas.
The inscription of His accusation was written above:|Den dem rait pan wan piis a buod wa im du mek dem kil im. It riid se, “DI JUU DEM KING.”
With Him they crucified two thieves, one on His right and the other on His left.|An dem kil tuu tiif siem taim wid im, wan pan im rait-an-said an wan pan im lef-an-said.
And the Scripture was fulfilled, which says, “He was numbered with the lawless ones.”|And the Scripture was fulfilled, which says, “He was numbered with the lawless ones.”

Those who passed by blasphemed Him, shaking their heads and saying, “Ah, You who would destroy the temple and build it in three days|Di piipl dem we did a paas se som torbl sitn tu Jiizas. Dem shiek dem ed an se, “Aa! Yu, we kyan mash op Gad ous an bil it bak iina chrii die
save Yourself, and come down from the cross!”|kum aafa di kraas an siev yuself no!

Likewise the chief priests mocked Him among themselves with the scribes and said, “He saved others, but He cannot save Himself!|A no dem wan, aal di ed priis dem, plos di Laa tiicha dem an di Juu liida dem laaf aafa Jiizas. Dem se, “Im siev ada piipl, bot im kyaahn siev imself!

Let the Christ, the King of Israel, descend now from the cross, that we may see and believe.” Those who were crucified with Him also reviled Him.|Mek di Krais, di wan we se im a Izrel king, kom dong aafa di kraas nou mek wi si an wi wi biliiv im!” An di tuu we dem did niel pan di kraas wid im kos im out tu.
When the sixth hour had come, there was darkness over the whole land until the ninth hour.|Wen it riich migl die, di uol plies get daak til bout chrii aklak di iivnin.

And at the ninth hour Jesus cried out with a loud voice, saying, “Eloi, Eloi, lama sabachthani?” which means, “My God, My God, why have You forsaken Me?”|Wen it kech chrii aklak, Jiizas baal out loud loud, “Elowi, Elowi, lema sabaktanai?” Dat miin, “Mi Gad, mi Gad, wa mek yu lef mi an gaan?”
Some of those who stood by, when they heard it, said, “Listen, He is calling Elijah!”|Wen som a di piipl we did tan op de ier im, dem se, “Lisn, im a kaal fi Ilaija!”

One man ran and filled a sponge with vinegar, put it on a stick, and gave it to Him to drink, saying, “Leave Him alone. Let us see if Elijah will come to take Him down.”|Den sumadi ron go dip piis a sponj iina som sowa wain, put it pan wan tik an gi im fi jringk. Den im se, “Lef im! Mek wi si ef Ilaija a-go kom kom tek im dong fram di kraas!”
But Jesus cried with a loud voice and gave up the spirit.|Bot Jiizas baal out loud loud, bluo im bret wan laas taim an den ded.
And the curtain of the temple was torn in two from top to bottom.
column2: Siem taim di kortn we did eng op iina Gad ous plit iina tuu fram tap tu batam.

column1: When the centurion who stood facing Him saw that He cried out and gave up the spirit, he said, “Truly, this Man was the Son of God.”|Wen di ed fi onjrid suoja we did tan op infronta di kraas si ou Jiizas ded, im se, “Fi riil, da man ya a did riili Gad Bwai Pikni fi chuu!”

There were also women looking on from a distance, among whom were Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James the Less and of Joseph, and Salome.|Som uman did tan op forda out a wach wa a gwaan. Uman laik Mieri Magdaliin, Mieri we a Jiemz an Juozif mada (Jiemz did yongga dan Juozif), an Saluomi did de de tu.
They also had followed Him and had ministered to Him when He was in Galilee. And many other women who came up with Him to Jerusalem were there.
column2: Wen Jiizas did iina Gyalalii dem did mongks im falara dem an dem yuus tu elp luk aafa im. Nof muo uman we did kom op wid im kom a Jeruusilem did de de tu.

column1: When the evening had come, because it was the Day of Preparation, that is, the day before the Sabbath|Da siem iivnin de, a did taim fi luk bout tingz fi di Paasuova alidie (dat miin se a did di die bifuo di Sabat)

Joseph of Arimathea, an honorable member of the Council, who also waited for the kingdom of God, came and went in boldly to Pilate, and requested the body of Jesus.|Juozif we kom fram Arimatiya a did wan a di Juu dem liida we evribadi did wel rispek. Im did a luk fi Gad kindom. Im get briev an go tu Pailat go aks im fi gi im Jiizas badi.

Pilate wondered if He were already dead. And calling for the centurion, he asked him whether He had been dead for a while.|Pailat did shak fi ier se im ded aredi. Im kaal di ed fi onjrid suoja an aks im ef Jiizas ded aredi.
When he learned about it from the centurion, he granted the body to Joseph.|Afta im ier we di ed fi onjrid suoja se, Pailat gi Juozif Jiizas badi.

So he bought fine linen, and taking Him down, wrapped Him in the linen and laid Him in a tomb which had been hewn out of the rock. And he rolled a stone against the door of the tomb. |Juozif bai som linin klaat, tek dong Jiizas badi aafa di kraas, rap im op iina di klaat an put im iina wan tuum we did dig iina wan rak. Den im ruol wan big stuon infronta di tuum.
Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joseph saw where He was laid.|Mieri Magdaliin an di ada Mieri, Juozif mada, did si we Juozif did beri Jiizas badi.
Jesus Before Pilate
column2: Jiizas infronta Pailat

column1: Jesus Sentenced to Die
column2: Dem sentens Jiizas tu det

column1: The Soldiers Mock Jesus
column2: Di Suoja dem Laaf aafa Jiizas

column1: The Crucifixion
column2: Dem Kil Jiizas pan di Kraas

column1: THE KING OF THE JEWS.
column2: Di King fi di Juu dem

column1: The Death of Jesus
column2: Jiizas Ded

column1: The Burial of Jesus
column2: Dem Beri Jiizas

column1: When the Sabbath was past, Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James, and Salome, bought spices, so that they might go and anoint Him.|Afta di Sabat, Mieri Magdaliin, Mieri Jiemz mada, an Saluomi bai som swiit spais fi go naint Jiizas badi.
Very early in the morning, on the first day of the week, they came to the tomb at the rising of the sun.|An orli orli iina di maanin, pan di fos die a di wiik az di son kom op, dem ed fi di tuum.
They said among themselves, “Who will roll the stone away from the door of the tomb for us?”|Wen dem did a waak dem se tu wan aneda, “A uu a-go ruol we di stuon fram infronta di tuum fi wi?”
But when they looked, they saw that the stone had been rolled away. For it was very large.|Bot wen dem luk op dem si se di big uol stuon di ruol we aredi.

And entering the tomb, they saw a young man sitting on the right side, clothed in a long white robe. And they were frightened.|Wen dem go iina di tuum, dem shak fi si wan yong man we av aan wan wait jakit sidong pan di rait-an-said.

He said to them, “Do not be frightened. You are looking for Jesus of Nazareth, who was crucified. He is risen. He is not here. See the place where they laid Him.|Bot im se tu dem se, “No fried. Mi nuo se unu a luk fi Jiizas we kom fram Nazaret, we dem kil pan di kraas. Bot im kom bak alaiv. Im no de ya. Luk, a rait uova de-so dem did put im badi.

But go your way, tell His disciples and Peter that He is going before you to Galilee. There you will see Him, as He told you.”|So go tel im falara dem, an Piita tu, se im a go a Gyalalii bifuo dem kom. Unu wi si im de, jos laik wa im did tel unu.”

They went out quickly and fled from the tomb, for they trembled and were amazed. And they said nothing to anyone, for they were afraid.|Dem lef di tuum an tek fut, kaaz dem did so shak an kanfyuuz. Dem neva se a wod tu nobadi kaaz dem did so fried.

Now when Jesus rose early on the first day of the week, He appeared first to Mary Magdalene, out of whom He had cast seven demons. |Afta Jiizas kom bak alaiv pan di fos die a di wiik, di fos sumadi we im mek si im a Mieri Magdaliin, di uman we im did ron sevn diiman outa.
She went and told those who had been with Him as they mourned and wept.
column2: Shi go we go tel im falara dem we did a ala an a baal.

column1: When they heard that He was alive and had been seen by her, they did not believe it.|An wen Mieri tel dem se Jiizas kom bak alaiv an dat shi si im, dem neva biliiv ar.
After that He appeared in another form to two of them as they walked and went into the country.
column2: Afta dat Jiizas shuo imself iina wan difrant wie tu tuu a im falara dem wen dem did a waak iina di konchri.

column1: And they went and told it to the rest, but they did not believe them either.|Dem go bak go tel di ada wan dem, bot dem neva biliiv dem.

Afterward He appeared to the eleven as they sat at supper, and He reprimanded them for their unbelief and hardness of heart, because they did not believe those who had seen Him after He had risen.|Afta dat Jiizas shuo imself tu im ilevn falara dem wen dem did a nyam. Im taak tu dem aad aad bout ou dem aad-iez an dem aat tof kaaz dem neva biliiv di wan dem we did si im afta im kom bak alaiv.
He said to them, “Go into all the world, and preach the gospel to every creature.|Im tel dem se, “Go aal uova di worl an priich di Gud Nyuuz tu evribadi.
He who believes and is baptized will be saved. But he who does not believe will be condemned.|Ef nobadi biliiv an get baptaiz, a dem a-go get siev, bot di wan dem wa no biliiv, jojment fi dem!

These signs will accompany those who believe: In My name they will cast out demons; they will speak with new tongues;|Di wan dem we biliiv a-go get powa fi du dem sitn ya: dem wi yuuz fi mi niem an ron out diiman, dem wi taak som nyuu langwij

they will take up serpents; if they drink any deadly thing, it will not hurt them; they will lay hands on the sick, and they will recover.”|dem wi kyan yuuz dem an pik op siniek, an no paizn we dem jringk naa go du dem notn. Dem wi put dem an pan sik piipl an mek dem get beta.”
After the Lord had spoken to them, He was received up into heaven and sat at the right hand of God. |Afta di Laad Jiizas don taak tu dem, Gad tek im op iina evn an mek im sidong a im rait-an-said.

Then they went forth and preached everywhere, the Lord working with them and confirming the word through the accompanying signs. Amen.|Im falara dem go aal bout go priich, an di Laad did a wok wid dem, an di sain dem we im mek dem du shuo evribadi se dem mesij a chuu sitn.
The Resurrection of Jesus
column2: Jiizas Kom Bak Alaiv

column1: The Appearance to Mary Magdalene
column2: Im Mek Mieri Magdaliin si im

column1: The Appearance to Two Disciples
column2: Im mek too a im disaipl dem si im

column1: The Commissioning of the Disciples
column2: im tel di disaipl dem we fi du

column1: The Ascension
column2: Wen im go op ina di ier

column1: That which was from the beginning, which we have heard, which we have seen with our eyes, which we have looked upon, and our hands have touched, concerning the Word of life|Di wan we niem di Wod we did de bout fram wie bak wen kom dong a ort tu wi. Wi did ier di Wod wid wi uona iez, si it wid wi uona yai dem, an toch it wid wi uon tuu an dem. A da siem Wod ya wi a tel unu bout.

the life was revealed, and we have seen it and testify to it, and announce to you the eternal life, which was with the Father and was revealed to us|A da siem laif de shuo itself tu wi. Wi si it, an wi a tel unu wa wi si. Wi a tel unu bout di siem laif we did de iina evn wid di Faada an we kom shuo itself tu wi.

we declare to you that which we have seen and heard, that you also may have fellowship with us. And our fellowship is with the Father and with His Son Jesus Christ.|Wa wi did si an ier a dat wi a tel unu tu. Wi a tel unu so dat unu kyan muuv kluos wid wi, an wi a muuv kluos wid di Faada an wid im Bwai Pikni Jiizas Krais.
We are writing these things to you so that our joy may be complete.|Wi a rait fi tel unu dem sitn ya, kaaz it mek wi riili api fi tel unu.

This then is the message which we have heard from Him and declare to you: God is light, and in Him is no darkness at all.|Wi a tel unu di siem mesij we wi ier fram Jiizas Krais. Im tel wi se Gad eva du wa rait kaaz Gad a lait. Gad kyaahn du notn rang kaaz notn no iina im we kuda mek im du rang. Dat miin se no daaknis no iina im.

If we say that we have fellowship with Him, yet walk in darkness, we lie and do not practice the truth. |Ef wi se wi a muuv kluos wid Gad bot wi a liv iina di daak siem wie, a lai wi a tel, wi naa liv azkaadn tu di chuut.

But if we walk in the light as He is in the light, we have fellowship one with another, and the blood of Jesus Christ His Son cleanses us from all sin.|Bot ef wi liv iina di lait siem laik Gad, wi a liv iina piis wid wan aneda. Da wie de Gad wash we aal a wi sin dem wid im Bwai Pikni blod.
If we say that we have no sin, we deceive ourselves, and the truth is not in us.|Ef wi taak se wi neva sin wi onggl a fuul wiself an no chuut no iina wi.

If we confess our sins, He is faithful and just to forgive us our sins and cleanse us from all unrighteousness.|Bot ef wi si se wi sin an beg Gad paadn, wi kyan nuo fi shuor se Gad wi paadn wi an wash we aal a wi sin dem.
If we say that we have not sinned, we make Him a liar and His word is not in us.|Ef wi se wi no av no sin, wi a kaal Gad laiyad, an dat shuo se im Wod no iina wi aat at aal at aal.
The Word of Life
column2: Di word we gi lyf

column1: God is light
column2: Gad a lait

column1: My little children, I am writing these things to you, so that you do not sin. But if anyone does sin, we have an Advocate with the Father, Jesus Christ the Righteous One.|Mi pikni we mi lov, mi a rait dem sitn ya tu unu so unu wi no sin. Bot ef nobadi du sin, wi av sumadi we wi taak tu Faada Gad fi wi, Jiizas Krais we eva du wa rait.

He is the atoning sacrifice for our sins, and not for ours only, but also for the sins of the whole world.|Jiizas Krais a di wan we gi op im laif so wi kuda get paadn fi wi sin dem an dat evribadi iina di worl kuda get paadn tu.
By this we know that we know Him, if we keep His commandments.|Wen wi du we Gad se wi fi du, a so wi nuo se wi riili riili nuo Gad.

Whoever says, “I know Him,” and does not keep His commandments is a liar, and the truth is not in him.|Bot ef sumadi se dem nuo Gad an no du we im se dem fi du, dem a laiyad an di chuut no iina dem aat.

But whoever keeps His word truly has the love of God perfected in him. By this we know we are in Him.|Wen enibadi du we Gad se dem fi du, da sumadi de shuo se dem riili lov Gad di wie im waahn dem fi lov im. A so wi nuo se wi a fi im uon.
Whoever says he remains in Him ought to walk as He walked.|Ef sumadi se Gad liv iina dem, dem fi liv di wie Krais Jiizas liv.

Brothers, I am writing no new commandment to you, but an old commandment which you have had from the beginning. The old commandment is the word which you have heard from the beginning.|Mi gud gud fren, a no riili wan nyuu laa mi a rait gi unu yu no. Wa mi a rait a di siem mesij we unu did ier fram lang taim.

Yet a new commandment I am writing to you, which holds true in Him and in you, because the darkness is passing away, and the true light is already shining.|Bot wen unu tingk bout it, iina wan wie, a riili wan nyuu laa mi a rait gi unu. It nyuu siek-a wa Jiizas did du an kaaz unu a liv unu laif fi fala im. Rait ya nou di daaknis a go we, an di riil lait staat shain aredi.
Whoever says he is in the light but hates his brother is in darkness even until now.|Ef nobadi se dem a waak iina di lait, an iet dem breda an sista; dem stil a liv iina daaknis.
Whoever loves his brother lives in the light, and in him there is no cause for stumbling.|Bot enibadi we lov dem breda an sista a liv iina di lait an no av notn iina dem laif fi mek nobadi sin.

But whoever hates his brother is in darkness, and walks in darkness, and does not know where he is going, because the darkness has blinded his eyes.|Bot di wan we iet im breda an sista a liv an a waak iina daaknis; im kyaahn si we im a go, kaaz di daaknis blain im yai dem.
I am writing to you, little children,because your sins are forgiven for His name’s sake.|Mi pikni mi a rait tu unu, kaaz Gad paadn unu sin siek-a wa Jiizas du.

I am writing to you, fathers, because you have known Him who is from the beginning.I am writing to you, young men, because you have overcome the evil one. I am writing to you, little children, because you have known the Father.|Aal unu uolda piipl, mi a rait tu unu,kaaz unu nuo di wan we de bout fram wie bak wen. Yong piipl mi a rait tu unu, kaaz unu don biit di wikid wan aredi.

I have written to you, fathers, because you have known Him who is from the beginning.I have written to you, young men, because you are strong, and the word of God lives in you,and you have overcome the evil one.|Likl pikni, mi did rait unu, kaaz unu nuo di Faada. Mi did rait unu uolda piipl, kaaz unu nuo di wan we de bout fram wie bak wen. Yong piipl mi did rait unu, kaaz unu chrang.Gad mesij de iina unu aat, kaaz unu biit di Wikid wan aredi.

Do not love the world or the things in the world. If anyone loves the world, the love of the Father is not in him. |No lov di worl ar di sitn dem we iina di worl. Ef nobadi lov di worl, di Faada lov no iina im.

For all that is in the world—the lust of the flesh, the lust of the eyes, and the pride of life—is not of the Father, but is of the world. |Aal a di sitn dem iina di worl: di wie unu waahn fi du aal kain-a rang sitn, di sitn dem we unu red yai fa, an ou unu lov fi buos bout wa unu av — dem no kom fram di faada, dem sitn de kom fram di worl.

The world and its desires are passing away, but the one who does the will of God lives forever.|Di worl an aal a di wikid sitn dem iina it a go we bot aal a di piipl dem we du we Gad waahn dem fi du wi liv fi eva.

Little children, it is the last hour. As you have heard that the antichrist will come, even now there are many antichrists. By this we know that it is the last hour. |Breda an sista di worl suun don. Unu did ier se di wan we go gens Krais Jiizas a-go kom. Wel nof piipl we go gens Krais Jiizas de ya aredi. A so wi nuo se di worl suun don.

They went out from us, but they were not of us, for if they had been of us, they would no doubt have remained with us. But they went out, revealing that none of them were of us.|Dem piipl de lef fram mongks unu, bot dem a neva did riili paat a unu at aal. Ef dem a did paat a unu dem wuda tan wid unu. Bot wen dem lef, dat shuo se dem a neva paat a unu choch at aal at aal.
But you have an anointing from the Holy One, and you know all things.|Krais Jiizas naint unu wid im spirit, so aal a unu nuo di chuut.

I have written to you, not because you do not know the truth, but because you know it, and because no lie is of the truth. |Mi neva did rait tu unu kaaz unu neehn nuo di chuut, bot kaaz unu nuo it aredi, an no lai kyaahn kom fram di chuut.
Who is a liar but the one who denies that Jesus is the Christ? Whoever denies the Father and the Son is the antichrist.
column2: So uu a di laiyad? No di wan we se Jiizas a no di Krais. Da sumadi de a di wan we go gens Gad an im Bwai Pikni — im a ton im bak pan Faada Gad wen im se Jiizas a no Gad Bwai Pikni.

column1: No one who denies the Son has the Father; the one who confesses the Son has the Father.|Ef piipl ton dem bak pan di Bwai Pikni, dem no kluos tu di Faada. Bot ef piipl rispek an fala di Bwai Pikni, dem kluos wid di Faada tu.

Let that which you have heard from the beginning remain in you. If that which you have heard from the beginning remains in you, you also will remain in the Son and in the Father.|Eng aan pan di chuu mesij we unu get fram di staat. Ef unu du dat, unu wi stie kluos tu di Bwai Pikni an im Faada tu.
And this is the promise that He has promised us—eternal life.
column2: An wa di Bwai Pikni did pramis a dis: im se wi a-go liv fi eva.

column1: I have written these things to you concerning those who deceive you.
column2: Mi rait dem sitn ya fi waan unu bout di piipl dem we a chrai fi fuul unu op.

column1: But the anointing which you have received from Him remains in you, and you do not need anyone to teach you. For as the same anointing teaches you concerning all things, and is truth, and is no lie, and just as it has taught you, remain in Him.|Yu si unu nou, di spirit we Jiizas gi unu liv iina unu, so unu no niid no ada tiicha. A im a unu tiicha. A im tiich unu evriting, an we im tiich unu a chuu — a no lai, so tan wid im an fala we im tiich.

And now, little children, remain in Him, so that when He appears, we may have confidence and not be ashamed before Him when He comes.|Breda an sista, tan iina Krais Jiizas so dat wen im kom bak wi no afi fried an ron go aid iina shiem.
If you know that He is righteous, you know that everyone who does righteousness is born of Him.|Unu nuo se Krais Jiizas du we rait aal di taim, an dat evribadi we du rait a Gad pikni.
Christ Our Advocate
column2: Krys a wi difenda

column1: The New Commandment
column2: Di Nyuu Laa

column1: The Antichrist
column2: Di enimi dem

column1: Children of God
column2: Gad Pikni

column1: Consider how much love the Father has given to us, that we should be called children of God. Therefore the world does not know us, because it did not know Him.|Luk umoch di Faada lov wi. Im kaal wi im uona pikni, an wi a riili fi im pikni fi chuu. Di piipl dem iina di worl no nuo wi, jos laik ou dem neva nuo Gad niida.

Beloved, now are we children of God, and it has not yet been revealed what we shall be. But we know that when He appears, we shall be like Him, for we shall see Him as He is. |Mi fren, wi a Gad pikni nou an wi no nuo evriting bout ou wi laif gweehn tan lieta, bot wi nuo se wen Krais Jiizas kom bak, wi gweehn tan siem laik im, kaaz wi a-go si im jos laik ou im tan.
Everyone who has this hope in Him purifies himself, just as He is pure.|Evribadi we biliiv se Jiizas a-go mek dem jos laik imself, kip we fram sin, jos laik ou Jiizas kip we fram sin.
Whoever practices sin breaks the law, for sin is lawlessness. |Evribadi we sin brok Gad Laa, kaaz sin a di siem sitn laik wen sumadi brok Gad Laa.
You know that He was revealed to take away our sins, and in Him there is no sin.|Unu nuo se Jiizas kom fi tek we sin an im no av no sin at aal.
Whoever remains in Him does not sin. Whoever sins has not seen Him and does not know Him.
column2: Nobadi we chos iina Jiizas no liv iina sin. Enibadi we jos a sin a gwaan so neva si im an dem no nuo im niida.

column1: Little children, let no one deceive you. The one who does righteousness is righteous, just as Christ is righteous.|Mi pikni, no mek nobadi fuul unu op. Enibadi wa du wa rait a dem gud iina Gad yai, jos laik ou Jiizas gud iina Gad yai.

Whoever practices sin is of the devil, for the devil has been sinning from the beginning. For this purpose the Son of God was revealed, that He might destroy the works of the devil. |Enibadi we sin bilang tu di devl, kaaz fram di worl staat di devl a sin. A dat mek Gad Bwai Pikni kom iina di worl, fi mash op di devl wok.

Whoever has been born of God does not practice sin, for His seed remains in him. And he cannot keep on sinning, because he has been born of God.|Nobadi we a Gad pikni kyaahn jos a sin a galang so, kaaz Gad laif de iina dem. Dem kyaahn jos gwaan iina sin so, kaaz dem a Gad pikni.

In this the children of God and the children of the devil are revealed: Whoever does not live in righteousness is not of God, nor is the one who does not love his brother.|Wi kyan nuo uu a Gad pikni fram uu a di Devl pikni. Enibadi we no du wa rait iina Gad yai, an we no lov dem breda an sista, dem a no Gad pikni.
For this is the message that you heard from the beginning: We should love one another
column2: Dis a di mesij wi ier fram di staat: wi fi lov wan aneda.

column1: not like Cain, who was of the wicked one and murdered his brother. And why did he murder him? Because his own works were evil, and his brother’s works were righteous.|Wi no fi tan laik Kien we did mek di devl ruul im an mek im go kil aaf im breda. An wa mek yu tingk im kil im breda, iihn? Kaaz im breda du wa rait an Kien, im du wikidnis.
Do not marvel, my brothers, if the world hates you.|Mi breda no bada fraitn ef di worl iet unu.

We know that we have passed from death to life, because we love the brothers. Whoever does not love his brother remains in death. |Wi nuo se wi no ded no muor, a liv wi staat liv ya nou. Wi nuo dis kaaz wi lov ada piipl. Aal a uu no lov dem breda an sista, dem ded siem wie.

Whoever hates his brother is a murderer, and you know that no murderer has eternal life remaining in him.|Enibadi we iet dem breda ar sista a wan mordara, an wi nuo se no mordara kyaahn liv fi eva wid Gad.

By this we know the love of God: that He laid down His life for us, and we ought to lay down our lives for the brothers. |A so wi kom fi nuo riil lov, kaaz Jiizas ded fi wi an a siem wie wi fi mek op wi main fi ded fi wi breda an wi sista dem.

Whoever has the world’s goods and sees his brother in need, but closes his heart of compassion from him, how can the love of God remain in him?|Ef nobadi si im breda ar sista riili shaat a sopm an no elp dem iivn duo im kuda elp dem, ou da sumadi de a-go se Gad lov iina im aat?

My little children, let us love not in word and speech, but in action and truth.|Mi pikni, wi fi mek shuor se wen wi se wi lov, wi riili lov fi chuu, an dat it shuo iina we wi du an a no jos suo-so wod.

By this we know that we are of the truth, and shall reassure our hearts before Him. |Siek-a ou wi lov wi breda an sista, a so wi nuo fi shuor se wi av di riil mesij, so wi kyan tan op infronta Gad an wi kanchens no bada wi.

For if our heart condemns us, God is greater than our heart and knows everything.|Iivn ef wi aat mek wi fiil laik se Gad rait wi aaf an no waahn av notn fi du wid wi, wi nuo se Gad biga dan wi aat, an im nuo evriting.
Beloved, if our heart does not condemn us, then we have confidence before God.|So mi fren, ef wi fiil iina wi aat se Gad no rait wi aaf, den wi kyan tan op infronta Gad an wi kanchens naa go bada wi

And whatever we ask, we will receive from Him, because we keep His commandments and do the things that are pleasing in His sight.|an eniting wi aks Gad fa im gi wi, kaaz wi du we im se wi fi du an wi du di sitn dem we wi nuo mek im api.

And this is His commandment: that we should believe on the name of His Son ­Jesus Christ and love one another as He commanded us.|Dis a wa Gad se wi fi du, wi fi biliiv iina Jiizas Krais, im Bwai Pikni, an wi fi lov wi wan aneda tu.

Now the one who keeps His commandments remains in Him, and He in him. And by this we know that He remains in us, through the Spirit whom He has given us.|Aal uu du we Gad se dem fi du dem kluos wid Gad an Gad kluos wid dem. An a di Spirit we Gad gi wi mek wi nuo fi shuor se Gad kluos wid wi.
Love One Another
column2: Lov wan aneda

column1: Confidence Before God
column2: Av kanfidens infronta Gad

column1: Beloved, do not believe every spirit, but test the spirits to see whether they are from God, because many false prophets have gone out into the world.|Mi fren, no biliiv iina evri spirit we se dem kom fram Gad. Wa yu fi du a tes di spirit dem fi si ef dem kom fram Gad fi chuu, kaaz a nof nof faalz prafit gaan out aal uova di worl.

This is how you know the Spirit of God: Every spirit that confesses that Jesus Christ has come in the flesh is from God|Dis a ou unu fi fain out ef dem riili av Gad Spirit. No spirit we se Jiizas Krais did kom iina di worl laik wan man, kom fram Gad.

and every spirit that does not confess that Jesus Christ has come in the flesh is not from God. This is the spirit of the antichrist, which you have heard is coming and is already in the world.|An eni spirit we se a lai se Jiizas did kom laik wan man, no kom fram Gad at aal. Da spirit de a di spirit fi di Wan we go gens Gad. Memba se unu did ier se di Wan we go gens Gad wuda kom. Wel im de ya aredi.

You are of God, little children, and have overcome them, because He who is in you is greater than he who is in the world.|Mi pikni we mi lov — unu a Gad pikni, an unu si di wan dem we go gens Gad, unu win dem aredi, kaaz di wan we iina unu muo powaful dan di wan we iina di worl.
They are of the world, and therefore they speak from the world, and the world listens to them.|Dem a worliyan, an dem taak laik worliyan, an di worl lisn dem.

We are of God, and whoever knows God listens to us. Whoever is not of God does not listen to us. This is how we know the spirit of truth and the spirit of error.|Wi a Gad pikni. Enibadi we nuo Gad lisn tu wi, bot aal uu no nuo Gad no waahn ier wa wi av fi se. Dis a ou wi nuo di chuu Spirit fram di laiyad spirit.

Beloved, let us love one another, for love is of God, and everyone who loves is born of God and knows God.|Mi fren, mek wi lov wan aneda, kaaz lov kom fram Gad, an enibadi we shuo lov a Gad pikni an dem nuo Gad.
Anyone who does not love does not know God, for God is love.|Nobadi we no lov no nuo Gad kaaz Gad a lov.

In this way the love of God was revealed to us, that God sent His only begotten Son into the world, that we might live through Him. |Gad shuo wi umoch im lov wi wen im sen im wan dege-dege Bwai Pikni iina di worl kom ded fi wi so wi kyan get riil laif.

In this is love: not that we loved God, but that He loved us and sent His Son to be the atoning sacrifice for our sins.|Riil lov a no ou wi lov Gad, bot a ou Gad lov wi an ou im sen im wan dege-dege Bwai Pikni kom ded fi wi sin dem.
Beloved, if God so loved us, we must also love one another. |Mi fren, ef Gad lov wi so, den a siem wie wi fi lov wan aneda.

No one has seen God at any time. If we love one another, God dwells in us, and His love is perfected in us.|Nobadi neva si Gad yet, bot ef wi lov wi wan aneda dat shuo se Gad riili iina wi an wi a lov ou im waahn wi fi lov.
We know that we live in Him, and He in us, because He has given us His Spirit. |Gad gi wi im Spirit. Dis shuo se wi liv iina im an im liv iina wi.
And we have seen and testify that the Father sent the Son to be the Savior of the world.|Faada Gad sen im Bwai Pikni fi siev wi. Wi did si im, an wi a tel evribadi bout im.
Whoever confesses that Jesus is the Son of God, God lives in him, and he in God.|Ef nobadi se Jiizas a Gad pikni, Gad liv iina im an im liv iina Gad.

And we have come to know and to believe the love that God has for us. God is love. Whoever lives in love lives in God, and God in him.|Gad a lov. Wi nuo an wi biliiv se Gad lov wi. Enibadi we aalwiez kip kluos tu Gad an shuo lov tu ada piipl, Gad kluos wid dem, an im elp dem fi lov piipl di wie ou im waahn dem fi lov dem.

In this way God’s love is perfected in us, so that we may have boldness on the Day of Judgment, because as He is, so are we in this world. |Wen jojment die kom wi wi kyan tan op infronta Gad an no fried, kaaz im lov iina wi aat, an wi a liv iina di worl jos laik ou Jiizas did liv.

There is no fear in love, but perfect love casts out fear, because fear has to do with punishment. Whoever fears is not perfect in love.|Riil lov no fried a notn. Piipl we fried se Gad a-go ponish dem no av Gad lov iina dem aat, a dat mek dem fried kaaz dem no riili nuo Gad.
We love Him because He first loved us.
column2: Wi lov wan aneda kaaz Gad lov wi fos.

column1: If anyone says, “I love God,” and hates his brother, he is a liar. For whoever does not love his brother whom he has seen, how can he love God whom he has not seen?|Ef sumadi se dem lov Gad, an iet dem breda an sista dem, dem a laiyad, kaaz sumadi kyaahn lov Gad we dem kyaahn si, an no lov dem breda an sista we dem kyan si.
We have this commandment from Him: Whoever loves God must also love his brother.
column2: Gad tel wi se enibadi we lov im mos lov dem breda an sista tu.

column1: Test the Spirits
column2: Tes di spirit dem

column1: God Is Love
column2: Gad a Lov

column1: Whoever believes that Jesus is the Christ is born of God, and everyone who loves the Father loves the one born of the Father.|Enibadi we biliiv se Jiizas a riili di Krais, dem a Gad pikni. An evribadi we lov di Faada lov im pikni tu.
By this we know that we love the children of God: when we love God and keep His commandments.|Dis a ou wi a-go nuo se wi lov Gad pikni dem, wen wi lov Gad an du wa im tel wi fi du.
For this is the love of God, that we keep His commandments. And His commandments are not burdensome|Wen wi du wa Gad tel wi fi du, wi shuo se wi riili lov im, an wa Gad tel wi fi du no aad.

for whoever is born of God overcomes the world, and the victory that overcomes the world is our faith.|Kaaz wen wi chos iina Jiizas, Gad gi evri wan a wi we a im pikni di powa fi no gi iin tu di wikid sitn dem we iina di worl.

Who is it that overcomes the world, but the one who believes that Jesus is the Son of God?|So a uu av di powa fi no gi iin tu di wikid sitn dem iina di worl? No onggl di wan dem we biliiv se Jiizas a Gad Bwai Pikni?

This is He who came by water and blood—Jesus Christ. He did not come by water only, but by water and blood. It is the Spirit who bears witness, because the Spirit is the truth.|Jiizas Krais a di wan we did kom iina di worl fram evn. Wen im kom im did get baptaiz an den im ded pan di kraas. Im neva onggl get baptaiz, bot im ded pan di kraas tu. Di Spirit taak bout im, an di Spirit onggl taak di chuut.
There are three who testify in heaven: the Father, the Word, and the Holy Spirit, and the three are one.|So wi av chrii wie fi nuo se Jiizas riili riil:
There are three that testify on earth: the Spirit, the water, and the blood, and the three are toward the one.|di Spirit, di waata, an di blod, an di chrii a dem se di siem ting.

If we receive the testimony of men, the testimony of God is greater; for this is the testimony of God which He has given concerning His Son. |Wi biliiv we piipl se, bot wa Gad se wot muo dan wa piipl se, kaaz dis a wa Gad se wen im taak bout im pikni.

Whoever believes in the Son of God has this witness in himself. Whoever does not believe God has made Him out to be a liar, because he does not believe the testimony that God gave about His Son. |Enibadi we biliiv iina Gad pikni nuo iina dem aat se wa Gad se a chuu. Bot enibadi we no biliiv Gad, tek im fi wan laiyad, kaaz dem no biliiv we Gad se bout im pikni.
And this is the testimony: that God has given us eternal life, and this life is in His Son. |An dis a wa Gad se: im gi wi laif we wi mek wi liv fi eva, an wi get da laif ya wen wi an im pikni kluos.
Whoever has the Son has life, and whoever does not have the Son of God does not have life.|Enibadi we kluos wid Gad pikni av laif. Bot enibadi we no kluos wid Gad pikni no av laif.

I have written these things to you who believe in the name of the Son of God, that you may know that you have eternal life, and that you may continue to believe in the name of the Son of God. |Mi rait unu we biliiv iina Gad Bwai Pikni so dat unu wi nuo se unu a-go liv fi eva an eva.
This is the confidence that we have in Him, that if we ask anything according to His will, He hears us.|Wi shuor se Gad wi ier wi prieya wen wi aks im fi di sitn dem we im waahn wi fi aks fa.
So if we know that He hears whatever we ask, we know that we have whatever we asked of Him.|Sins wi nuo se Gad ier wi prieya, wi shuor se wi prieya dem don ansa aredi.

If anyone sees his brother commit a sin which does not lead to death, he shall ask, and He shall give him life. This is for those whose sin does not lead to death. There is a sin that leads to death. I do not say that he should pray for it.|Ef nobadi si im breda ar sista sin iina wan wie we naa go mek im ded, unu fi prie fi dem se Gad wi paadn dem, an da sumadi we sin da sin de we naa go mek im ded, Gad wi mek im liv. Som sin kaaz piipl fi ded. Mi naa tel unu fi prie fi sumadi we du dem sin de.
All wrongdoing is sin, but there is a sin that does not lead to death.|Evriting wa rang a sin, bot a no evri sin sen piipl go ded.

We know that whoever is born of God does not keep on sinning. But whoever has been born of God guards himself, and the wicked one cannot touch him.|Wi nuo se nobadi we baan Gad pikni no jos kip aan a sin so. Gad Bwai Pikni kip dem sief, so di devl kyaahn toch dem.
We know that we are of God, and the whole world lies in wickedness.|Wi nuo se wi bilang tu Gad an dat di devl kanchuol di uol worl.

And we know that the Son of God has come and has given us understanding, so that we may know Him who is true, and we are in Him who is true—His Son Jesus Christ. He is the true God and eternal life.|Wi nuo se Jiizas Krais, Gad Bwai Pikni kom an shuo wi di riil Gad. Siek-a Jiizas, wi bilang tu Gad nou — di riil Gad we mek piipl liv fi eva an eva.
Little children, keep yourselves from idols. Amen.|Mi pikni, kip unuself fram faalz gad.
Overcoming the World
column2: Biliiv iina Gad Bwai Pikni

column1: The Witness Concerning the Son
column2: We wi nuo bowt di son

column1: Purpose of Writing
column2: Di riizn wa mek mi a ryt

column1: The elder, to the elect lady and her children, whom I love in the truth, and not I only, but also all those who know the truth,|Fram di elda tu di uman we Gad pik an ar pikni dem, mi riili riili lov unu. Evribadi we nuo di chuut lov unu tu
for the sake of the truth, which remains in us, and will be with us forever:|kaaz wi av di chuut iina wi an it a-go tan iina wi fi eva.

Grace, mercy, and peace will be with you from God the Father and from the Lord Jesus Christ, the Son of the Father, in truth and love.|Mi prie se Faada Gad an Jiizas Krais, im Bwai Pikni, wi shuo wi lov iivn duo wi no dizorv it. Mi prie tu se im wi gud an kain tu wi, an gi wi piis iina wi aat. Dem sitn ya wi tan wid wi we lov wi wan aneda, an we nuo di Gud Nyuuz we chuu.
I greatly rejoiced that I found some of your children walking in truth as we were commanded by the Father.
column2: Mi wel api kaaz mi fain out se som a yu pikni dem a liv azkaadn tu di chuut jos laik ou Faada Gad se wi fi liv.

column1: And now I ask you, lady, not as though I wrote a new commandment to you, but that which we have had from the beginning, that we love one another.|Mi a beg yu mam, mek aal a wi lov wi wan aneda. Wa mi a rait yu a no wan nyuu laa, a di siem laa wa wi did get fram di staat.

And this is love: that we walk according to His commandments. This is the commandment, that as you have heard from the beginning, you should walk in it.|Wen wi du wa Gad tel wi fi du, dat a lov, an fram lang lang taim im did tel wi fi lov wan aneda.

For many deceivers, who do not confess that Jesus Christ has come in the flesh, have gone out into the world. Each one is a deceiver and an antichrist.|Nof laiyad tiicha de iina di worl ya nou. Dem laiyad tiicha ya a taak buot se Jiizas Krais neva kom a ort wid wan badi laik wan man. Dem piipl de a laiyad. Dem a go gens Krais Jiizas.

Watch yourselves, so that we do not lose those things for which we have worked, but that we receive a full reward. |Wach unuself an mek shuor se unu no luuz wa wi wok so aad fa, so wi kyan get wi ful pie.

Whoever transgresses and does not remain in the teaching of Christ does not have God. Whoever remains in the teaching of Christ has both the Father and the Son.|Ef nobadi ton we fram di sitn dem wa Krais Jiizas tiich, im no av Gad iina im. Bot di sumadi we uol aan tait tu di sitn dem bout Krais Jiizas, da sumadi de av Faada Gad an im Bwai Pikni a liv iina im.

If anyone comes to you and does not bring this teaching, do not receive him into your house, nor greet him. |Ef enibadi kom tu unu we no biliiv iina wa wi tiich bout Krais Jiizas, no aaba im a unu ous, an no mek im tingk se unu api fi av im roun unu.
For whoever greets him takes part in his evil deeds.|Ef unu mek dem tingk se unu api fi av dem roun unu, unu an dem gilti a di siem wikidnis.

I have many things to write to you, but I prefer not to write with paper and ink. Instead, I hope to come to you and speak face to face that our joy may be complete.|A nof sitn mi av fi tel unu, bot mi no waahn rait dem wid pen an piepa. Mi suun kom luk fi unu so wi kyan taak fies tu fies, dat wi mek wi riili api.
The children of your elect sister greet you. Amen.
column2: Yu speshal speshal sista an ar pikni dem sen oudi fi unu.

column1: Final Greetings
column2: Laas Wod

column1: The elder, To the beloved Gaius, whom I love in the truth:|Da leta ya a kom fram mi, di Elda — tu mi speshal fren, Gaiyos. Mi fren, mi riili riili lov yu.
Beloved, I pray that all may go well with you and that you may be in good health, even as your soul is well. |Mi prie se evriting aarait wid yu, an dat yu badi aati jos laik ou yu suol aati.

For I greatly rejoiced when brothers came and testified of the truth that is in you, just as you walk in the truth. |Mi did riili api wen som a di breda an sista dem kom luk fi mi an tel mi ou yu tan op chrang fi di chuut.
I have no greater joy than to hear that my children walk in truth.
column2: Notn no mek mi api so laik wen mi ier se mi pikni dem a liv ou di Laad se dem fi liv — azkaadn tu di chuut.

column1: Beloved, you are faithful in all you do for the brothers and for strangers|Mi fren, wen yu tek kier a Jiizas sorvant dem, aal di wan dem we yu neva nuo, dat shuo se Gad kyan dipen pan yu.

who have testified of your love before the church. You will do well to send them along on their journey in a manner worthy of God.|Dem tel di choch ou yu lov dem. So mi a beg yu, sen dem pan dem wie jos laik ou yu nuo Gad wuda waahn yu fi du.
For His name’s sake they went out, receiving no help from the Gentiles.|Wen dem lef fi go luk bout Krais Jiizas bizniz, dem neehn tek notn fram di worliyan dem.
Therefore we ought to receive such men, that we might be fellow workers for the truth.|So wi afi kain tu dem breda an sista ya, tek dem iin, luk aafa dem, an wok wid dem fi pred di Gud Nyuuz.

I wrote to the church, but Diotrephes, who loves to put himself first among them, did not accept us.|Mi rait wan leta tu di choch, bot Daiyachrofiiz uu lov fi big op imself, no waahn av notn fi du wid mi.

Because of this, if I come, I will bring up what kinds of works he does: ranting against us with malicious words. Not content with that, he does not accept the brothers, and stops those who want to, and throws them out of the church.|So wen mi kom, mi a-go mek evribadi nuo bout di wikid lai dem wa im a tel pan mi. Bot a no onggl dat im du, im ton we di breda an sista dem we kom a di choch an chriit dem riil bad. An di ada breda an sista dem iina di choch we kain tu di wan dem we a priich Gad mesij, Daiyachrofiiz chriit dem riil torbl tu, an ron dem outa di choch.

Beloved, do not imitate that which is evil, but that which is good. Whoever does good is from God, but whoever does evil has not seen God. |Mi breda, no fala bad kompni. Enibadi we du wa rait kom fram Gad. Enibadi we lov du we rang no nuo Gad.

Demetrius receives good reports from everyone and from the truth itself. Yes, and we also testify, and you know that our testimony is true.|Evribadi av gud sitn fi se bout Dimiichriyos, dem kyan si se im riili a liv ou di Laad se im piipl fi liv. Wi taak gud bout im tu, an yu nuo se wi no tel lai.
I had many things to write, but I would rather not write to you with pen and ink. |Mi av nof muo sitn fi rait tu yu bout, bot mi no waahn rait it wid pen an piepa.

Instead, I hope to see you soon, and we shall speak face to face. Peace be to you. The friends greet you. Greet the friends by name.|Mi a prie se Gad bles yu an gi yu piis iina yu aat. Aal a yu fren dem we de ya sen oudi. Tel wi breda an sista dem — kaal evri wan a dem niem, an tel dem oudi fi mi.

Peter, an apostle of Jesus Christ,To the refugees scattered throughout Pontus, Galatia, Cappadocia, Asia, and Bithynia|Mi a Piita, wan a Jiizas Krais apasl dem — wan a di twelv man dem we did a waak wid im.Mi a rait tu unu, Gad piipl we skyata-skyata aal bout an a liv iina Pontos, Gyaliesha, Kyapaduoshiya, Iezha an Bitiniya.

elect according to the foreknowledge of God the Father, through sanctification by the Spirit, for obedience and sprinkling with the blood of Jesus Christ:Grace to you and peace be multiplied.|Faada Gad pik unu fi wan riizn, jos laik im did a plan fi du lang bifuo unu baan. An im Spirit kliin op unu aat so unu kyan fala wa Jiizas Krais se. An Jiizas blod mek unu kliin tu. Mi prie se Gad wi aalwiez shuo unu im lov iivn duo wi no dizorv it an gi unu piis iina unu aat.

Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who according to His abundant mercy has given us a new birth into a living hope through the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead|Tangks an priez tu di Gad an Faada a wi Laad Jiizas Krais. Im so gud an kain tu wi, im gi wi nyuu laif wen im mek Jiizas Krais ded an kom bak alaiv. Da wie de, wi nuo fi shuor se wi kyan get wa im pramis wi.

to an incorruptible and undefiled inheritance that does not fade away, kept in heaven for you|Siek-a dat, wi kyan luk fi get aal a wa Gad a kip sief iina evn fi im piipl dem. Dem sitn de kyaahn ded. Dem naa go pwail ar doti op. An dem kyaahn jrai op an disapier niida.

who are protected by the power of God through faith for a salvation ready to be revealed in the last time.|Di siem wie Gad tek kier a dem, a siem so im powa a-go kip unu sief tu, kaaz unu chos iina im. Im a-go kip unu sief an siev unu iina evri wie, an a pan di laas die unu a-go si aal a dat.

In this you greatly rejoice, even though now, if for a little while, you have had to suffer various trials|So unu mos api bout aal a dem sitn ya, iivn duo rait ya nou unu mait-a sad fi wan likl wail siek-a aal a di chraiyal dem we unu a fies, an di sitn dem we mek unu waahn du rang.

in order that the genuineness of your faith, which is more precious than gold that perishes, though it is tried by fire, may be found to result in praise, glory, and honor at the revelation of Jesus Christ|Dem ya chraiyal ya, a fi tes umoch unu chos iina Gad, fi mek shuor se unu riili chos iina im, jos laik ou dem tes guol iina faiya fi mek shuor se di guol riil fi chuu. An di chos we unu chos iina Gad — dat wot muo dan guol, kaa guol kyan mash op. So iivn duo unu a go chuu faiya kaa unu chos iina Gad, unu wi gwaan chos iina im siem wie an paas di tes, so Gad wi priez unu an ana unu wen Jiizas Krais kom bak.

whom, having not seen, you love; and in whom, though you do not see Him now, you believe and you rejoice with joy unspeakable and full of glory|Unu neva si Jiizas yet, bot unu lov im siem wie; an iivn duo unu kyaahn si im nou wid unu yai dem, unu stil biliiv an chos iina im. An no wod no de we kyan mek piipl riili nuo ou glad an api unu bi!
receiving as the result of your faith the salvation of your souls.
column2: Unu wel api kaaz Gad a siev unu suol kaaz unu chos iina im.

column1: Concerning this salvation, the prophets who prophesied of the grace that should come to you have inquired and searched diligently|Di prafit dem did sorch out aad aad fi chrai an andastan di wie ou Gad siev di piipl dem we chos iina im. An a di sorch we dem did sorch mek dem kuda taak bout ou Gad a-go siev unu.

seeking the events and time the Spirit of Christ, who was within them, signified when He foretold the sufferings of Christ and the glories to follow.|Dem did chrai fi fain out a uu ar a wa taim Krais Jiizas Spirit, we iina dem, did aalwiez a taak bout. Di Spirit tel dem wie bifuo da taim ya se Krais Jiizas did a go sofa. An di Spirit tel dem bout aal a di gud gud sitn dem we a-go apm afta dat tu.

It was revealed to them that they were not serving themselves but you, concerning the things which are now reported to you by those who have preached the gospel to you through the Holy Spirit, who was sent from heaven—things into which the angels desire to look.|Gad mek dem si se wa dem did a taak bout a neva did fi dem, bot dem did fi apm fi unu. Di sed sitn we di prafit dem did se, a di siem Gud Nyuuz di priicha dem kom gi unu. A di Uoli Spirit, we did sen dong fram evn, did gi dem di powa fi kom kom tel unu — aal ienjel did waahn andastan dem sitn ya!

Therefore guard your minds, be sober, and hope to the end for the grace that is to be brought to you at the revelation of Jesus Christ.|So siek-a aal we Gad du, mek shuor se unu get unu main redi fi akshan. Kanchuol unuself an staat liv siiros. Kip unu main onggl pan di blesn dem we Gad a-go gi unu wen Krais Jiizas kom bak.

As obedient children do not conduct yourselves according to the former lusts in your ignorance. |Laik som nais likl pikni we a fala Gad, no bada gi iin tu di bad sitn dem we unu yuus fi lang fa wen unu neehn nuo no beta, an go bak go du dem.

But as He who has called you is holy, so be holy in all your conduct|Bot wa unu fi du a liv kliin an no dabl-dabl iina sin. Du wa rait iina evriting we unu du, jos laik ou Gad, di wan we kaal unu fi kom ton fi im pikni dem, onggl du di sitn dem we rait an gud an kliin.
because it is written, “Be holy, for I am holy.”|Kaaz it rait dong se, “Unu fi tan kliin an no dabl-dabl iina sin, kaa mi kliin an mi na'av notn fi du wid sin.”

And if you address as Father the One who impartially judges according to each one’s work, conduct yourselves in fear during the time of your sojourning.|Gad no paashal, an im a-go joj evribadi bies pan ou dem liv dem laif an wa dem du. Ef unu kaal im Faada, unu fi liv rait an shuo im rispek fi di taim we unu de ya mongks chrienja.

For you know that you were not redeemed from your vain way of life inherited from your fathers with perishable things, like silver or gold|Kaaz unu nuo se a no notn laik silva an guol we kyaahn laas fi eva, Gad tek siev unu fram di kain-a laif we unu did a liv. Da laif de neva wot notn. An a da laif de unu get fram unu mada an faada piipl dem we did de ya bifuo unu.

but with the precious blood of Christ, as of a lamb without blemish and without spot.|Bot Gad siev unu wid Krais Jiizas preshos blod, preshos laik wan biebi shiip we neva du notn rang at aal at aal; wan biebi shiip we naa no maak ar no kot ar notn laka dat.

He was foreordained before the creation of the world, but was revealed in these last times for you.|Gad did pik im fi du dis fram bifuo dis ya worl did mek an im shuo op iina di laas die dem fi unu uona gud.

Through Him you believe in God who raised Him up from the dead and gave Him glory, so that your faith and hope might be in God.|An a im mek unu biliiv iina Gad — Gad we did mek im kom bak alaiv an ana im. So da wie de unu wi chos iina Gad an unu wi kyan nuo fi shuor se im a-go kip im wod an du som gud sitn fi unu.

Since your souls have been purified by obedience to the truth through the Spirit unto a genuine brotherly love, love one another deeply with a pure heart|Nou dat unu kliin op unu suol kaaz unu fala di riil mesij we dem tiich bout Krais Jiizas, unu kyan riili lov unu wan aneda. Unu mos aalwiez riili lov unu wan aneda wid aal a unu aat.

for you have been born again, not from perishable seed, but imperishable, through the word of God which lives and abides forever.|Unu fi du dis, kaaz nou, unu no jos baan fram unu mada an faada we kyan ded, bot da taim ya unu baan fram Gad — an da siid ya kyaahn ded. Unu baan fram Gad siek-a im wod we alaiv fi chuu, an we a-go liv fi eva an eva.

For “All flesh is as grass,and all the glory of man as the flower of grass.The grass withers, and its flower falls away|Gad wod se, “Evri man an uman a laik graas, an aal dem gud luks, an di big op we dem get tan laik wail flowaz. Di graas jrai op an di flowaz jrap a grong.
but the word of the Lord endures forever.”This is the word that was preached to you.
column2: bot di Laad wod liv fi eva an eva. An da wod ya a di Gud Nyuuz we dem did priich tu unu.

column1: Therefore put away all wickedness, deceit, hypocrisy, envy, and all evil speaking.|So tap dabl iina aal kain-a sin an wikidnis. No beks wid piipl an no chat tu dem, no bada tel no lai an no bi no ipokrit niida. Unu no fi bad main piipl fi we dem av. An mek shuor se unu no tek unu mout an tier dong nobadi.

As newborn babies, desire the pure milk of the word, that by it you may grow|An jos laik ou yong biebi no waahn notn bot dem mada milk, a siem so unu fi wel waahn Gad wod — dat a fi unu milk. Da wie de, unu naa go jos get siev an a it dat, bot unu wi gruo
if it is true that you have experienced that the Lord is good.
column2: nou dat unu “ties an si se di Laad gud.”

column1: Coming to Him as to a living stone who is rejected by men, but chosen by God and precious|Wen unu a kom tu di Laad, a wan stuon we a liv unu a kom tu. Im a laik wan stuon we a liv we piipl did ton dem bak pan an se naa no yuus, bot wan we Gad pik an we wot uol iip tu Gad.

you also, as living stones, are being built up into a spiritual house as a holy priesthood to offer up spiritual sacrifices that are acceptable to God through Jesus Christ.|So unu fi kom tu di Laad laik stuon we a liv tu. An mek Gad Spirit yuuz unu fi bil op Gad ous. Iina da ous de unu a-go bi wan gruup a priis fi Gad — an fi Gad wan. An unu a-go bon sakrifais we Gad Spirit se unu fi bon, an im wi tek da sakrifais de siek-a wa Jiizas Krais du.

For also it is contained in the Scripture,“Look! I lay in Ziona chief cornerstone, elect, precious,and he who believes in Himshall never be put to shame.”|Kaaz unu kyan riid iina Gad wod se, “Mi a pudong wan stuon iina Zaiyan, wan speshal stuon we jain op di tuu waal dem iina di kaana — dat a di muos impuotant stuon iina di bildin. Da stuon de a wan we mi pik. An enibadi we chos iina im, naa go en op fiil shiem.”

Therefore, to you who believe, He is precious. But to those who are disobedient,“The stone that the builders rejectedhas become the cornerstone,|Nou, fi aal a unu we biliiv iina di Laad, da stuon ya wot nof nof. Bot fi di wan dem we no biliiv,“Di stuon we di bilda dash wan said— a it ton di mien stuon,”

and, “A stone of stumbling, and a rock of offense.” They stumble because they are disobedient to the word, to which also they were appointed.|an wan neks paat iina Gad wod se, “Dis a wan stuon we kaaz man fi tombl dong— wan rak we wi chrip dem.” Dem tombl dong a grong kaa dem neva fala wa Gad se. An dat a wa Gad did plan fi dem.

But you are a chosen race, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, a people for God’s own possession, so that you may declare the goodness of Him who has called you out of darkness into His marvelous light. |Bot unu a wan set a piipl we Gad pik. Unu a di king priis — an Gad a di king. Unu a wan speshal piipl we Gad tek fi kom ton fi im uona piipl dem. Im pik unu so unu kyan tel ada piipl ou big im bi an ou gud im bi. Kaaz a im sed wan tek unu outa daaknis an kom put unu iina im brait brait lait.

In times past, you were not a people, but now you are the people of God. You had not received mercy, but now you have received mercy.|Wan taim unu a neva Gad piipl bot nou unu a fi im uon. Im neehn yuus tu av piti pan unu bot nou im gud an kain tu unu.

Dearly beloved, I implore you as aliens and refugees, abstain from fleshly lusts, which wage war against the soul.|Mi fren, mi a beg unu du, laik ou unu a farina pan ort, we a-go de ya fi nou mongks chrienja, no bada du wa di badi waahn — di badi a waar wid di suol.

Live your lives honorably among the Gentiles, so that though they speak against you as evildoers, they shall see your good works and thereby glorify God in the day of visitation.|Unu mos liv gud an liv rait mongks di piipl dem we no biliiv iina Jiizas, so iivn duo rait ya nou dem a se aal kain-a bad sitn bout unu, an a se a bier wikidnis unu du, dem wi si se a gud sitn unu a du an priez Gad wen im kom baka ort kom big op uu fi get big op an ponish uu fi get ponish.

Submit yourselves to every human authority for the Lord’s sake, whether it be to the king, as supreme|Siek-a wa di Laad du, mek shuor se unu lisn di piipl dem we ruul uova unu an du wa dem se unu fi du, weda di king we a di ed

or to governors, as sent by him for the punishment of evildoers and to praise those who do right.|ar di govana we di king sen out fi ponish di piipl dem we du rang, ar big op di wan dem we du wa rait.

For it is the will of God that by doing right you may put to silence the ignorance of foolish men.|Wa Gad waahn a fi unu du wa rait, an da wie de aal a uu no nuo beta an a chat fuulinish wi tap dem naiz.

As free people, do not use your liberty as a covering for evil, but live as servants of God.|Liv laik piipl we frii, piipl we a no no nobadi sliev. Bot dat no miin se unu fi yuuz dat an du we rang, ar tingk se unu kyan sin an aid it fram nobadi ar get we wid it. Wa unu fi du, a liv laik ou Gad sorvant dem fi liv.
Honor all people. Love the brotherhood. Fear God. Honor the king.
column2: Rispek evribadi. Unu fi lov di ada piipl dem we biliiv iina Gad tu. Unu fi andastan ou big Gad bi an gi im di muos rispek. An unu fi rispek di king tu.

column1: Servants, be submissive to your masters with all fear, not only to the good and gentle, but also to the harsh.|Sorvant, unu fi lisn an rispek unu maasta, no onggl di wan dem we nais an jengkl, bot aal di wikid wan dem tu

For this is commendable, if because of conscience toward God a person endures grief, suffering unjustly. |kaaz Gad api wid di piipl dem we du dat. An im a-go bles enibadi we put op wid di sofarieshan, iivn duo dem no dizorv it bot put op wid it siem wie kaaz dem nuo se a dat Gad waahn dem fi du.

For what credit is it if when you are being beaten for your sins you patiently endure? But if when doing good and suffering for it, you patiently endure, this is favorable before God.|So unu get wan biitn an unu bier it kaaz unu du sitn rang. Wa big iina dat? Bot ef unu sofa siek-a sopm gud wa unu du, an unu bier di sofarieshan, nou a dat Gad a-go bles.

For to this you were called, because Christ suffered for us, leaving us an example, that you should follow His steps:|A dis Gad kaal unu fi du yu no. Krais Jiizas imself sofa fi unu, an shuo unu ou fi bier di sofarieshan. Unu fi du laik im; fala iina im fut step dem.
“He committed no sin,nor was deceit found in His mouth.”|Jiizas, “im neva sin,an im neva se notn fi chrai an chrik nobadi.”

When He was reviled, He did not revile back; when He suffered, He did not threaten, but He entrusted Himself to Him who judges righteously.|Wen piipl tel im at-wod im neva tel dem bak non. An wen dem mek im sofa, im neva chretn fi du dem bak notn. Aal im du a gwaan put im chos iina Gad we joj evribadi bies pan wa dem du.

He Himself bore our sins in His own body on the tree, that we, being dead to sins, should live unto righteousness. “By His wounds you were healed.”|Jiizas — im did fiil uol iip a pien iina im badi fi wi wen im did de pan di kraas siek-a fi wi sin. Im du dat so sin wi no av no muo powa uova wi, an wi kyan liv an du wa rait. An siek-a di sofarieshan we im go chuu: di biit op biit op an di kot op kot op we bata bruuz im, chuu dat yu did get iil.

For you were as sheep going astray, but now have been returned to the Shepherd and Guardian of your souls.|Kaaz unu did a chrie laik laas shiip, bot nou Gad bring unu bak fi tek kier a unu, jos laik ou di shepad tek kier a im shiip dem. An im bring unu bak fi wach uova unu an fi mek shuor se unu aarait.

Likewise you wives, be submissive to your own husbands, so that if any do not obey the word, they may be won without a word by the conduct of their wives|A siem so aal a unu waif mos lisn unu ozban an du wa dem se unu fi du. Da wie de ef dem no biliiv iina Gad wod dem wi staat biliiv jos siek-a ou unu a gwaan. Unu wudn iivn afi se a ting tu dem.
as they see the purity and reverence of your lives.
column2: Kaaz dem wi si ou unu rispek dem an si se unu riili a liv fi Gad.

column1: Do not let your adorning be the outward adorning of braiding the hair, wearing gold, or putting on fine clothing.|Unu no fi dipen pan di fansi-fansi ier stail dem, ar guol chien, banggl an aal saat a fandanggl fi mek unuself luk gud. An unu no fi dipen pan di fansi-fansi jres dem niida.

But let it be the hidden nature of the heart, that which is not corruptible, even the ornament of a gentle and quiet spirit, which is very precious in the sight of God.|Insted-a dem sitn de, unu fi wach unu aat. A ou unu aat tan — a dat wi riili mek unu luk gud. Wen sumadi jengkl an kwaiyat — a dat luk gud kyaahn don, an a dat a-go laas fi eva, an a dat riili mata tu Gad tu.

For in this manner, in the old times, the holy women, who trusted in God, adorned themselves, being submissive to their own husbands|Di uman dem iina di paas, we did a liv fi Gad an we did chos im fi du aal we im se im a-go du — a so dem yuus tu mek demself luk gud. Dem lisn dem ozban an du wa dem ozban tel dem fi du.

even as Sarah obeyed Abraham, calling him lord. You are her children as long as you do right and are not afraid with any terror.|Luk pan Siera. Shi du wa Iebriyam tel ar fi du, an shi kaal im ar maasta. An unu a fi ar daata ef unu du wa rait an no fried a notn.

Likewise, you husbands, live considerately with your wives, giving honor to the woman as the weaker vessel, since they too are also heirs of the grace of life, so that your prayers will not be hindered.|A siem so di ozban dem fi liv gud wid dem waif an tingk bout dem siem laik ou Gad si dem. Unu nuo aredi se dem no chrang laka unu an dem kyaahn go du aal a wa unu kyan du. So andastan dat an rispek dem, kaaz di siem speshal laif we Gad so gud an kain fi gi unu, im gi dem tu. So mek shuor se unu chriit dem rait so unu kyan prie ou unu sopuoz fi prie.

Finally, be all of one mind, be loving toward one another, be gracious, and be kind.|Dis a di laas ting mi a se ya-so. Di uol a unu fi kom tugeda laik se unu a wan sumadi an chrai fi andastan wa unu wan aneda a go chuu. Unu fi lov unu wan aneda laik ou breda an sista lov dem wan aneda. Unu mos kip unu wan aneda neks tu unu aat an shuo umoch unu kier fi dem. An unu mos ombl unuself mongks unu wan aneda tu.

Do not repay evil for evil, or curse for curse, but on the contrary, bless, knowing that to this you are called, so that you may receive a blessing. |Wen sumadi du unu sopm, unu no fi du dem bak notn. An wen dem kos unu out, no bada kos dem aaf; insted-a dat unu fi aks Gad fi bles dem kaaz Gad kaal unu fi bles unu.

For“He who would love lifeand see good days,let him keep his tongue from evil,and his lips from speaking deceit.|Laik we rait dong iina Gad wod, “Enibadi we waahn fi liv fi langan liv api tu, dem mosn se notn bad bout nobadi, an dem fi tap tel lai.
Let him turn away from evil and do good;let him seek peace and pursue it.
