column2: Dem fi ton we fram wikidnis an du di gud sitn dem. An dem fi chrai aad fi liv iina piis wid dem wan aneda.

column1: For the eyes of the Lord are on the righteous,and His ears are open to their prayers; but the face of the Lord is against those who do evil.”|Kaaz di Laad a wach uova aal a di piipl dem we a liv rait an im a lisn tu dem wen dem prie, bot im no iina notn wid di piipl dem we a du wikidnis.”
Who is he who will harm you if you follow that which is good?
column2: Uu a-go du unu notn ef unu wel waahn du wa gud? Iihn?

column1: But even if you suffer for the sake of righteousness, you are blessed. “Do not be afraid of their terror, do not be troubled.”|Bot aal ef dem mek unu sofa kaaz unu a du wa rait — a bles unu bles! No fried a notn, an no wori unuself.

But sanctify the Lord God in your hearts. Always be ready to give an answer to every man who asks you for a reason for the hope that is in you, with gentleness and fear.|Unu fi andastan se Krais Jiizas a di onggl Laad, an worship im wan. An unu fi aalwiez redi fi ansa enibadi we aks unu a wa mek unu chos iina Krais Jiizas so.

Have a good conscience so that evildoers who speak evil of you and falsely accuse your good conduct in Christ may be ashamed.|An wen unu a ansa dem no bada disrispek dem ar fuos dem fi biliiv wa unu a se. An unu fi diil wid dem gud tu, so unu no en op fiil gilti. Da wie de, aal a uu se aal kain-a rang sitn bout unu gud bievya kaaz unu a Krais Jiizas falara, dem wi en op fiil shiem bout wa dem did se.

For it is better, if it is the will of God, that you suffer for doing good than for doing evil.|Ef unu du sitn gud an sofa — ef a so Gad se it fi go — unu betaraaf dan ef unu du sitn we rang an go sofa.

For Christ also has once suffered for sins, the just for the unjust, so that He might bring us to God, being put to death in the flesh, but made alive by the Spirit,|Kaaz Krais Jiizas sofa an ded fi di uol a wi sin wans an faraal. Wan man we du onggl wa rait, ded fi aal a uu a sina, fi bring wi tu Gad. Dem kil di badi, bot Gad mek im liv agen iina di Spirit.
by whom He also went and preached to the spirits in prison
column2: Di Spirit gi Jiizas Krais powa an im go priich tu di spirit dem we did de iina prizn.

column1: who in times past were disobedient, when God waited patiently in the days of Noah while the ark was being prepared, in which a few, that is, eight souls, were saved through water. |Dem de spirit de, a di spirit fi di piipl dem we neva fala Gad iina Nowa taim, wen Nowa did a bil di big buot. Gad did a wiet pan dem piipl de ou lang. A onggl iet a dem en op go iina di buot an kom chuu di flod sief sief.

Figuratively this is like baptism, which also saves us now. It is not washing off the dirt from the body, but a response to God from a good conscience through the resurrection of Jesus Christ|Dem flod waata de komiin laik baptizam we siev wi ya nou. Baptizam a no fi wash aaf wi badi. Wen wi baptaiz, it miin se wi kanchens klier klier an wi mek wan pramis tu Gad. An dat siev wi kaaz Gad mek Jiizas Krais ded an kom bak alaiv.

who has gone into heaven and is at the right hand of God, with angels and authorities and powers being made subject to Him.|Jiizas Krais de iina evn nou an im de saida Gad rait an. Im av kanchuol uova aal a di ienjel dem, an di spirit dem we ruul an av powa.

Therefore, since Christ has suffered for us in the flesh, arm yourselves likewise with the same mind, for he who has suffered in the flesh has ceased from sin|Sins Krais Jiizas sofa wen im did a waak pan da ort ya, a siem wie unu fi get unu main redi fi sofa tu. Kaaz enibadi we staat sofa so, a ton dem ton dem bak pan sin.

so that he no longer should live the rest of his time in the flesh serving human desires, but the will of God. |Fram nou aan den, da sumadi de no fi spen di res a dem laif pan da ort ya a du aal kain-a sitn we no av notn fi du wid Gad laka wan taim, kaaz a dat dem mait-a waahn fi du. Nuo, dem fi liv ou Gad waahn dem fi liv.

For in earlier times of our lives it may have sufficed us to do what the Gentiles like to do, when we walked in immorality: lusts, drunkenness, carousing, debauchery, and abominable idolatries. |Unu spen inof taim a du wa di worliyan dem laik fi du. Iina di paas aal wa unu mosn du — a dat unu did lang fi du an galang go du. An unu yuus fi jringk uol iip aal di taim. Unu jringk chrang jringk we jongk unu aaf. Den som a di taim dem, unu an unu fren dem wuda av unu wail paati an jringk an galang wid aal kain-a naasinis. An ef dat neva bad, unu put ada gad uova Gad we av aal powa — wat a wikid wikid sitn!

They are surprised that you do not join them in the same excess of wild living, and so they speak evil of you.|An nou, dem piipl de we a gwaan wid di siem kain-a naasinis an wikidnis, dem no tap chat unu, an a se aal kain-a sitn bout unu, kaaz dem kyaahn andastan wa riili a gwaan. Ou kom unu naa ron galang wid dem, an a du di sed sitn dem laik wan taim?
They will give account to Him who is ready to judge the living and the dead.
column2: Bot dem wi afi ansa tu Gad. Im redi fi joj evribadi — ded ar alaiv.

column1: For this reason the gospel was preached also to those who are dead, so that even though they might be judged according to men in the flesh, they might live according to God in the spirit.|A dat mek di Gud Nyuuz did priich tu aal di piipl dem we ded nou, kaaz iivn duo dem get joj laik ada piipl, di Spirit wi mek dem kyan go liv wid Gad.

The end of all things is near. Therefore be solemn and sober so you can pray. |Bot, di taim wen aal a dis a-go don suun kom. So klier unu ed an staat tingk chriet, get unu main redi fi akshan, kanchuol unuself an staat liv siiros. Du aal a dat so dat unu kyan prie.

Above all things, have unfailing love for one another, because love covers a multitude of sins.|An muo dan notn els unu fi riili lov unu wan aneda aal di taim an wid aal a unu aat. Kaa lov kova op sin, no mata ou it mait-a uol iip.
Show hospitality to one another without complaining.
column2: Unu fi shier wid unu wan aneda — a dat unu fi du. Shier unu ous an no bada lang op unu mout an grombl grombl wen unu a du it.

column1: As everyone has received a gift, even so serve one another with it, as good stewards of the manifold grace of God. |Gad gi unu difrant difrant gif. Evri wan a unu fi yuuz wat-eva gif Gad gi unu, an yuuz it gud. Yuuz it elp ada piipl.

If anyone speaks, let him speak as the oracles of God. If anyone serves, let him serve with the strength that God supplies, so that God in all things may be glorified through ­Jesus Christ, to whom be praise and dominion forever and ever. Amen.|So ef Gad mek non a unu fi priich — unu fi priich laik se a Gad wod itself unu a taak. Aal a uu fi sorv, fi sorv wid di chrent an powa we Gad gi unu. Da wie de Gad wi get di priez iina evriting wi du siek-a Jiizas Krais. Aal a di ana, priez an powa a fi Gad, tide, tumaro an fi eva! Iemen.

Beloved, do not be surprised at the fiery ordeal that is taking place among you to test you, as though some strange thing happened to you.|Aal a unu we mi lov, no bada fraitn an gwaan laik se a sitn chrienj a apm tu unu siek-a di faiya we a riich unu iina dem ya chraiyal ya.

But rejoice insofar as you share in Christ’s sufferings, so that you may rejoice and be glad also in the revelation of His glory. |Bot unu fi api se unu a sofa laik ou Krais Jiizas did sofa, so unu kyan daans an praans iivn muo wen im kom bak wid aal a di powa, an piipl si ou big, ou laaj an ou powaful im riili bi!

If you are reproached because of the name of Christ, you are blessed, because the Spirit of glory and of God rests upon you. On their part He is blasphemed, but on your part He is glorified.|Ef piipl shiem unu, an se aal kain-a bad sitn tu unu kaa unu a fala Krais Jiizas — a bles unu bles. Kaaz a di powaful Spirit — Gad Spirit, kom tan wich paat unu de.

Let none of you suffer as a murderer, or a thief, or an evildoer, or even as a busybody. |No mek non a unu sofa siek-a unu a mordara, ar tiif, ar no kain-a kriminal, ar kaaz unu a sumadi we megl-megl iina piipl bizniz.

Yet if anyone suffers as a Christian, let him not be ashamed, but let him glorify God because of it. |Nuo, a no so it fi go. Bot ef unu sofa chuu unu a piipl we biliiv iina Jiizas — a no notn dat fi shiem bout. Insted-a dat, unu fi priez Gad kaaz a big ting dat wen piipl a kaal unu Krais Jiizas falara.

For the time has come for judgment to begin at the house of God, and if it begins first with us, what shall the end be for those who do not obey the gospel of God?|Kaaz jojment taim kom ya nou; an wi we a Gad piipl, a wi it a staat wid fos. So, a wa a-go apm tu aal a di piipl dem we no biliiv Gad Gud Nyuuz?

And “If the righteous one is scarcely saved, where shall the ungodly and the sinner appear?”|An jos laik unu si iina Gad wod, “Ef Gad piipl we im a-go siev afi go chuu so moch chraiyal an chibilieshan, den a wa a-go apm tu di wikid piipl dem we no bizniz bout Gad an di sina dem?”

So then, let those who suffer according to the will of God entrust their souls to a faithful Creator, while continuing to do good.|So wa mi riili a chrai se a dis: aal uu a sofa kaaz a dat Gad waahn fi dem, dem fi jos gwaan du wa rait. Da wie de, dem a gi Gad aal a dem laif an suol. Yes, a dat dem a gi Gad — di wan we mek dem. Di wan we naa go ton im bak pan dem. An di wan we kip wat-eva pramis im mek tu dem.

I exhort the elders who are among you, as one who is also an elder and a witness of the sufferings of Christ as well as a partaker of the glory that shall be revealed: |Mi a taak tu di elda dem ya nou. Mi a elda laik unu, mi a wan we si fi miself ou Krais Jiizas did sofa tu, an mi tel piipl bout dis, an mi a-go daans an praans wid im wen im kom bak wid aal a di powa we evribadi a-go si. So mi a beg unu du

Shepherd the flock of God that is among you, take care of them, not by constraint, but willingly, not for dishonest gain, but eagerly. |tek kier a di shiip dem we Gad gi unu, an no du it kaaz nobadi a fuos unu fi du it bot kaaz unu waahn fi du it. A so Gad waahn it fi go. No du it kaaz unu waahn moni niida bot du it kaaz unu riili waahn fi elp dem.
Do not lord over those in your charge, but be examples to the flock.|No aada-aada roun di piipl dem we Gad gi unu fi tek kier a. Bot unu fi biyiev gud so dem wi waahn fala unu.
And when the chief Shepherd appears, you will receive a crown of glory that will not fade away.|An wen di Ed Shepad kom bak, unu wi get wan shaini kroun we naa go fied out.

Likewise you younger ones, submit yourselves to the elders. Yes, all of you be submissive one to another and clothe yourselves with humility, because “God resists the proud, but gives grace to the humble.”|Nou fi di wan dem we yongga dan di elda dem, a siem so unu fi lisn di elda dem an du wa dem se unu fi du. Evribadi we de iina di choch, unu fi ombl unuself an elp unu wan aneda, kaaz unu si iina Gad wod se, “Gad fait gens enibadi we buosi, bot im bles di wan dem we ombl demself.”
Humble yourselves under the mighty hand of God, that He may exalt you in due time.|So unu fi ombl unuself anda Gad powaful an, so wen im redi im kyan bles unu.
Cast all your care upon Him, because He cares for you.|Evriting we unu a wori an fret bout, gi it tu im, kaaz im kier bout unu.

Be sober and watchful, because your adversary the devil walks around as a roaring lion, seeking whom he may devour. |Wach out! Wiek op. Unu fi get unu main redi fi akshan. Klier unu ed an staat tingk chriet. Unu enimi — di devl, im a siniik roun laik wan wikid onggri-beli laiyan, a luk sumadi fi nyam.

Resist him firmly in the faith, knowing that the same afflictions are experienced by your brotherhood throughout the world.|Fait im aaf. No du wa im tel unu fi du, an tan op chrang an chos Jiizas, kaaz unu nuo se a no unu wan a go chuu dis, unu breda an sista dem we de aal uova di worl a go chuu di siem kain-a sofarieshan.

But after you have suffered a little while, the God of all grace, who has called us to His eternal glory through Christ Jesus, will restore, support, strengthen, and establish you.|Bot afta unu sofa likl, di Gad we lov unu so til, we no uol bak non a im lov fram unu, im sed wan we kaal unu fi enjai im powa we kyaahn don, kaaz unu a fala Krais Jiizas — im a-go fiks bak evriting fi unu agen, an di chos unu chos iina im, im a-go mek dat chrang chrang. Im a-go mek unu aat chrang tu, so unu kyan anggl di sofarieshan. An im a-go mek shuor se unu tan op chrang iina im no mata ou rof it mait-a get.
To Him be glory and dominion forever and ever. Amen.|A Gad fi get aal a di powa, tide, tumaro an fi eva! Iemen.

With the help of Silas, whom I consider to be a faithful brother to you, I have written briefly, exhorting you and testifying that this is the true grace of God in which you stand.|Silvanos, uu a laik mi breda, we riili chos iina Jiizas, a im elp fi rait da leta ya, so widoutn mek it tuu lang, mi rait fi jos elp unu fi gwaan uol aan pan Gad, an fi tel unu chrang chrang se wa Gad du fi unu riili a shuo se im lov unu bad bad. Tan op chrang iina da lov de.

The church that is at Babylon, elect together with you, greets you, and so does Mark, my son.|Unu sista choch we de iina Babilan, we Gad pik tu, se fi iel unu op, an Maak, uu a laik mi bwai pikni, se fi iel unu op tu.

Greet one another with a kiss of love. Peace be with all you who are in Christ Jesus. Amen.|Kis unu wan aneda fi mi, iina lov, an tel evribadi oudi. Piis an lov fi aal a unu we a fala Krais Jiizas. Iemen.

Simon Peter, a servant and apostle of Jesus Christ,To those who have received a faith as precious as ours through the righteousness of our God and Savior Jesus Christ.|Mi a Saiman Piita, wan a Jiizas Krais sorvant an apasl dem. Mi a wan a di twelv man dem we did a waak wid im.Mi a rait aal a unu we wi Gad, an Jiizas Krais di wan we siev wi, mek biliiv iina im. Im siev wi so unu kuda get fi biliiv iina im jos laik ou wi biliiv iina im. An im du dat kaaz im no paashal at aal at aal, bot kaaz im gud an kain.
Grace and peace be multiplied to you through the knowledge of God and of Jesus our Lord.
column2: Mi prie se Gad wi aalwiez shuo unu im lov an mek unu api aal di taim wen unu a lorn muo an muo bout im an bout wi Laad Jiizas.

column1: His divine power has given to us all things that pertain to life and godliness through the knowledge of Him who has called us by His own glory and excellence
column2: Im tek fi im uona powa an gi wi evriting we wi niid fi liv di kain-a laif we im waahn wi fi liv. An dis apm onggl kaaz wi lorn muo an muo bout im. Im a di wan we kaal wi fi shier iina uu im bi — wid aal a im powa an di priez an ana we piipl gi im.

column1: by which He has given to us exceedingly great and precious promises, so that through these things you might become partakers of the divine nature and escape the corruption that is in the world through lust.|Siek-a dem sitn ya im gi wi di big an preshos preshos gif we im did pramis wi. So, wi kyan komiin muo an muo laik Gad, an aal shier iina uu im bi. An da wie de wi kyan ron we fram di wikidnis we iina da worl ya, we set fi kil aaf piipl. Di wikidnis we kom bout siek-a ou dem wel waahn fi sin.

For this reason make every effort to add virtue to your faith; and to your virtue, knowledge;|A dis mek unu fi chrai aad nou fi no jos chos iina Gad, bot du gud fi ada piipl tu. An no jos du dat wan, bot unu fi mek shuor se unu riili nuo bout Gad tu.

and to your knowledge, self-control; and to your self-control, patient endurance; and to your patient endurance, godliness;|An no jos nuo bout Gad niida, bot unu fi nuo ou fi kanchuol unuself tu. No jos nuo ou fi onggl kanchuol unuself, bot unu fi chrai aad tu fi chos iina Gad an pres aan no mata wa. Unu fi gi Gad evri paat a unu laif an du wat-eva im waahn unu fi du.

and to your godliness, brotherly kindness; and to your brotherly kindness, love.|An no jos dat, bot unu fi lov an kier bout unu wan aneda tu. An pan tap a aal a dat unu fi lov evribadi fram di batam a unu aat.

For if these things reside in you and abound, they ensure that you will neither be useless nor unfruitful in the knowledge of our Lord Jesus Christ.|Ef unu av dem kain-a wiez ya, an unu riili nuo di Laad Jiizas Krais, dem sitn ya wi gruo muo an muo iina unu aat. An gud sitn wi apm iina unu laif.

But the one who lacks these things is blind and shortsighted because he has forgotten that he was cleansed from his former sins.|Bot ef sumadi no av dem, dat de sumadi kyaahn si forda dan dem nuoz an dem blain tu, an dem figet se Gad did paadn dem fram di sin dem we dem did du iina di paas.

Therefore, brothers, diligently make your calling and election sure. For if you do these things, you will never stumble.|So mi breda an sista, Gad kaal unu fi fala im. An im pik unu fi bi fi im piipl dem. So ef unu waahn dis fi laas unu fi chrai iivn aada fi mek shuor se dat apm. Kaaz ef unu du dis, notn kyaahn kot unu aaf fram Gad.

For in this way the entrance into the eternal kingdom of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ will be abundantly provided for you.|Da wie ya, Gad wi uopm op waid waid tu unu di duor fi di kindom a wi Laad an Sieviya Jiizas Krais — di kindom we a-go laas fi eva an eva. An im a-go gi unu aal rait fi go iin de.

Therefore I will not be negligent to always remind you of these things, though you know them and are established in the truth that is present with you.|A dat mek mi afi memba unu aal di wail bout dem sitn ya; iivn duo unu nuo dem aredi an don a uol aan chrang pan di chuu mesij we unu get aredi.

I consider it right, as long as I live in this body, to stir you up by reminding you|Yu nuo se az lang az mi liv iina da badi ya mi no tingk mi a-go eva tap push unu fi memba dem sitn ya. A dat mi fi du.
knowing that soon I will take off this body, even as our Lord Jesus Christ has shown me.|Wos, mi nuo se mi badi suun gaan. Jiizas Krais shuo mi dat plien plien.
And I will also be diligent to make sure that after my death you will always remember these things.
column2: An mi a-go chrai aad aad fi mek shuor se afta mi ded an gaan unu wi memba dem sitn ya siem wie.

column1: For we have not followed cleverly devised myths when we made known to you the power and coming of our Lord Jesus Christ, but we were eyewitnesses of His majesty.|Wen wi tel unu bout di powa a wi Laad Jiizas Krais an ou im a-go kom bak, a neva no mek op tuori wi did a tel unu bout. Bot a tingz we wi si fi wiself. Wid wi uona yai dem wi did si di brait brait lait.

For He received honor and glory from God the Father when a voice came to Him from the majestic glory, saying, “This is My beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.”|Wi did de de wen Faada Gad imself ana Jiizas big taim, wen im ier di vais fram di riil big Wan — di wan we big an powaful. Di vais se, “Dis a fi mi pikni we mi lov an im mek mi wel api.”

And we ourselves heard this voice, which came from heaven, when we were with Him on the holy mountain.|A no im wan ier it — wi did ier it tu. Wi did ier di vais a kom fram evn wen wi did de pan di uoli moutn wid im.

And we have a more reliable word of prophecy, which you would do well to follow, as to a light that shines in a dark place, until the day dawns and the morning star arises in your hearts.|So wi iivn shuora nou bout wa di prafit dem did se, an it wi du unu gud fi lisn it tu. Kaaz it komiin laik wan lamp we a shain iina wan daak plies til die lait kom an di maanin staar raiz op iina unu aat.

But know this first of all, that no prophecy of the Scripture is a matter of one’s own interpretation.|Muo dan notn els, unu fi andastan se di mesij we di prafit dem get fram Gad, we de iina Gad wod, a neehn mek dem mek it op.

For no prophecy at any time was produced by the will of man, but holy men moved by the Holy Spirit spoke from God.|Kaaz no mesij fram Gad neva kom bout bies pan we no man ar uman waahn, bot a di Uoli Spirit did tek kanchuol a piipl an mek dem gi mesij we kom fram Gad.

But there were also false prophets among the people, just as there will be false teachers among you, who will secretly bring in destructive heresies, even denying the Lord who bought them, bringing swift destruction upon themselves. |Yu did av faalz prafit we yuus tu kom tu di piipl dem iina di paas, a siem so nou faalz tiicha wi kom tu unu. Widout unu iivn si wa a gwaan, dem wi siniik iin di faalz sitn we dem tiich fi mek unu chrie. An dem aal a se Jiizas Krais, di Laad an Maasta, a no fi dem Laad, wen a im siem wan did pie fi mek dem go frii, so dat sin no av no powa uova dem. Bot bifuo dem kyan iivn bat dem yai, a el an powda ous dem a bring dong pan demself.

And many will follow their destructive ways, because of whom the way of truth will be blasphemed.|A uol iip a piipl a-go fala dem an du aal kain-a naasinis. An siek-a wa dem du, ada piipl a-go waahn se aal kain-a bad sitn bout di wie we riili liid tu Gad — an aal gi da wie de bad niem.

And in their greed they will exploit you with deceptive words. Their judgment, made long ago, does not linger, and their destruction does not slumber.|Siek-a ou dem faalz tiicha ya griidi, dem a-go mek op tuori fi chrai mek moni aafa unu. Bot a lang taim nou dem jojment redi. An Gad naa sliip, im a-go mash dem dong!

For if God did not spare the angels that sinned, but cast them down to hell and delivered them into chains of darkness to be kept for judgment;|Kaaz ef Gad neehn iivn spier di ienjel dem we did sin, bot did chuo dem chriet dong a el we dem chien op iina daaknis a wiet til jojment kom

and if He did not spare the ancient world, but saved Noah, a preacher of righteousness, with seven others, when He brought a flood upon the world of the ungodly; |an ef im neva spier di uol taim worl wen im sen flod pan di piipl dem we no bizniz wid im an no lisn we im se, an onggl siev Nowa — wan priicha we priich bout di rait wie — plos sevn ada piipl

and if He condemned the cities of Sodom and Gomorrah to destruction by reducing them to ashes, making them an example to those afterward who would live ungodly lives; |an ef im fling jojment pan tuu siti, Sadam an Gomaro an bon dem dong a grong, an yuuz dem fi waan piipl an mek dem si a wa a-go riich piipl we no bizniz wid im an we no lisn im

and if He delivered righteous Lot, who was distressed by the filthy conduct of the wicked |an ef im siev Lat, wan man we du wa rait iina Gad yai, an uu did taamentid iina im suol siek-a di doti laif we di wikid piipl dem roun im did a liv

(for that righteous man lived among them, and what he saw and heard of their lawless deeds tormented his righteous soul day after day);|kaaz da man de we did gud iina Gad yai an du wa rait, im did liv mongks wikid piipl die afta die an im suol did jos taamentid siek-a aal a di rang sitn dem we im si an ier.

then the Lord knows how to rescue the godly from trial, and to keep the unrighteous under punishment for the Day of Judgment|So ef a so it go den, dat miin se di Laad nuo ou fi siev piipl we gud iina im yai fram di chraiyal an kraasiz dem we dem fies. An a siem so im nuo fi kip di wikid piipl dem we no bizniz wid im til jojment die kom an gwaan ponish dem.

especially those who walk after the flesh in pursuit of unclean desires, and despise authority.They are presumptuous and arrogant, and are not afraid to slander the angelic beings.|An aal di wan dem we eva gi iin tu wa dem badi waahn an iet nobadi we ruul uova dem, a dem im a-go ponish wikid wikid.Dem faalz tiicha ya, so brait an out-a-aada an tingk se dem nuo muo dan evribadi els, so dem mosn lisn wa nobadi se. An dem no fried fi bad mout di spirit dem we av powa fi ruul uova piipl.

Whereas angels, who are greater in power and might, do not bring slanderous accusations against them before the Lord.|Bot aal di ienjel dem, iivn duo dem chrangga an muo powaful dan dem de, dem no se notn bad bout dem infronta Gad.

But these people are like irrational animals, born to be captured and destroyed. They speak evil of the things that they do not understand, and in their corruption they will be destroyed.|Bot dem ya faalz tiicha ya, dem redi fi chat gens, an a kos out tingz we dem no andastan. Dem no iivn tap an tingk — dem dis a gwaan laik wail animal we baan fi piipl kech an kil. An a siem so Gad a-go kot dem dong!

They shall receive the wages of unrighteousness. They count it a pleasure to carouse in the daytime. They are blots and blemishes who revel in their own deception while they carouse together with you. |An fi aal a di bad sitn dem we dem du, som bad sitn a-go riich dem. Wa dem kaal fon, a fi du eniting we dem badi waahn, an dem a du dem sitn de iina braad die lait tu! Dem a piis a shiem an disgries, an a shiem an disgries dem a-go bring dong pan unu wen dem kom fi iit fuud wid unu an a galang dem siem kain-a wie de.

They have eyes full of adultery that cannot cease from sin. They entice unstable souls. Their hearts are trained in greed. They are cursed children! |Evritaim dem luk pan wan man, ar dem luk pan wan uman aal dem kyan tingk bout a fi go bed wid im ar fi go bed wid ar. Dem eva a luk fi di chaans fi sliip wid sumadi. Dem eva a sin a galang so, laik se dem kyaahn satisfai. An dem pul iin di wiik wan dem iina dem chrap. Dem set iina dem aat fi bi griidi. Bot fi aal a dem sitn ya we dem du — Gad gweehn ponish dem!

They have forsaken the right way and have gone astray. They follow the way of Balaam the son of Beor, who loved the wages of wickedness,|Dem ton aafa di rait ruod an gaan gaan fala di ruod we Bielam tek. Bielam did a Biyuor pikni, an im did lov di moni we im get a du wikidnis.

but who was rebuked for his iniquity. The mute donkey speaking with a man’s voice constrained the madness of the prophet.|Bot di dangki did set im chriet. Im dangki taak tu im iina man vais, an mek di prafit tap di madnis we im did a du.

These men are wells without water and clouds that are carried by a storm, for whom the gloom of darkness has been reserved forever.|Dem piipl ya komiin laik wan foutn widout no waata, dem a laik kloud we staam bluo we; di daakis paat a el a wiet fi dem.

For when they speak arrogant words of vanity, they entice by the lusts of the flesh and by depravity those who barely escaped from those who live in error. |Dem mek big chat we no wot notn an chrai fi jraa we di piipl dem we jos bieli ton we fram di piipl dem we naa liv rait. Kaaz dem piipl ya bieli muuv we fram dem sitn de, an wi stil wel waahn av seks iivn duo dem no marid an dabl-dabl iina aal kain-a sin, di faalz tiicha dem yuuz dis an jraa dem we.

Although they promise them freedom, they themselves are slaves of corruption, for by that which a man is overcome, to this he is enslaved. |Dem pramis se dem a-go frii di piipl dem, bot dem siem wan a sliev — an wikidnis a dem maasta, kaaz di uol a wi a sliev fi eniting we a ruul uova wi.

For if after they have escaped the defilements of the world through the knowledge of the Lord and Savior Jesus Christ, and they are again entangled in them and are overcome, the latter end is worse for them than the beginning.|Ef nobadi manij fi get we fram di wikidnis a da worl ya, kaa dem kom fi nuo wi Laad, Jiizas Krais, di wan we siev wi, an den dem siem wan go tai op bak demself iina wikidnis an mek it kangka dem, dem wosaraaf nou dan bifuo dem did fos biliiv an staat fala Jiizas.

For it would have been better for them not to have known the way of righteousness than to have known it and then turn back from the holy commandment that was delivered to them.|Dem wuda betaraaf ef dem neva nuo di rait wie iina di fos plies, dan fi dem nuo it an den go ton dem bak pan wa Gad se wi fi du — di sed mesij we dem did get.

But it has happened to them according to the true proverb, “The dog returns to his own vomit,” and “the sow that was washed to her wallowing in the mud.”|Dem pruuv se di pravorb dem rait fi chuu. Di pravorb dem se, “Wan daag ton bak tu wa it vamit op” an “Wan pig we wash aaf aredi gaan bak gaan wala-wala iina di mod.”

This is now, beloved, the second epistle I am writing to you, in which I am stirring up your sincere minds by way of reminder|Fren, dis a mi sekan leta tu unu nou. Mi rait di tuu leta dem fi memba unu bout dem sitn ya, so unu kyan tingk bout wa gud an kliin.

that you should remember the words that were spoken previously by the holy prophets and the commandment of our Lord and Savior spoken through us, the apostles.|Mi waahn unu fi memba we Gad prafit dem did se iina di paas. An mi waahn unu memba di sitn dem we Gad se wi fi du tu, we Jiizas Krais gi im apasl dem we de iina fi unu ieriya fi gi unu.

Know this first, that there shall come scoffers in the last days who walk after their own lusts,|Fos ting fos, unu fi andastan se iina di laas die dem, piipl we mak piipl we biliiv iina Jiizas, a-go kom laaf aafa unu tu. Dem waahn fi du di rang sitn dem an a dat dem galang go du!

and say, “Where is the promise of His coming? For since the fathers fell asleep, all things have continued as they were since the beginning of the creation.”|Dem a-go se, “Im did pramis fi kom, duohn? So we im de? Wi faada faada an wi mada mada an aal a di fambili bifuo dem, dem ded an gaan, bot notn no chienj, evriting tan siem wie fram di taim di worl mek!”

For they willingly ignore that, by the word of God the heavens existed long ago, and the earth was formed standing out of the water and in the water,|Bot dem mek op dem main fi figet se, lang bifuo dem did iivn baan Gad jos se it an di evn an di ort did mek jos so — outa waata an fram waata.
by which the world that then existed was flooded with water and perished.
column2: An a siem waata did flod out an mash op di worl we did de bout wan taim.

column1: But by the same word, the heavens and the earth that now exist are being reserved for fire, kept for the Day of Judgment and destruction of the ungodly.|An a Gad siem wod a kip di evn an di ort ya nou til jojment die wen im a-go bon dem op iina faiya an ponish di piipl dem we no bizniz wid wa im se.

But, beloved, do not be ignorant of this one thing, that with the Lord one day is as a thousand years, and a thousand years as one day.|Bot fren, unu no figet dis: Wen wi a taak bout Gad — wan dege-dege die komiin laik aal wan touzn ier tu im; an wan touzn ier komiin laik wan suo-so die.

The Lord is not slow concerning His promise, as some count slowness. But He is patient with us, because He does not want any to perish, but all to come to repentance.|Gad no lingga wid notn we im pramis fi du laik wa som piipl mait-a tingk. Im jos a gwaan tek im taim wid unu kaaz im no waahn nobadi fi sofa. Wa im waahn a fi evribadi ton we fram sin an kom tu im.

But the day of the Lord will come like a thief in the night, in which the heavens will pass away with a loud noise, and the elements will be destroyed with intense heat. The earth also and the works that are in it will be burned up.|Bot jojment die a-go kom wen wi naa ekspek it — jos laik ou tiif kom. Pan da die de, evn a-go disapier — braps — wid wan loud loud naiz. An evriting we mek op di yuunivors, di son, di muun, di staar an aal a dem sitn de a-go bon op, an di ort an evriting we piipl du pan it a-go bon op tu.

Seeing then that all these things are to be destroyed, what sort of people ought you to be in holy conduct and godliness,|Sins evriting a-go mash op so, a wa kain-a piipl unu fi bi, iihn? Unu fi liv unu laif fi Gad. Unu fi liv kliin kliin laif

while you are waiting for and desiring the coming of the day of God, in which the heavens will be destroyed by fire and the elements will be consumed by intense heat?|wail unu a luk faawod fi jojment die kom an a du unu bes fi mek it kom kwik. A da die de evn a-go bon op, an di yuunivors wid aal di son, muun, staar an aal a dem sitn de a-go bon op tu an melt op.

But, according to His promise, we are waiting for new heavens and a new earth, in which righteousness dwells.|Bot wi a luk faawod fi di nyuu evn dem an di nyuu ort we im pramis wi. A de-so evribadi a-go liv ou Gad waahn dem fi liv.

Therefore, beloved, since you are waiting for these things, be diligent that you may be found by Him in peace, spotless and blameless.|So fren, wail unu a wiet pan dis, unu fi mek shuor se unu liv rait, an no mek Gad fain no faalt wid unu.

Keep in mind that the patience of our Lord means salvation, even as our beloved brother Paul has also written to you according to the wisdom given to him. |Memba se Gad a tek im taim so dat unu kyan get siev, jos laik wa wi gud fren, breda Paal rait an tel unu. A Gad mek im waiz so, so im kuda rait dem sitn de we im rait an tel unu.

As in all his letters, he writes about these things, in which some things are hard to understand, which the unlearned and unstable distort, as they also do the other Scriptures, to their own destruction.|A di siem sitn im se iina aal a im leta dem, wen im rait bout dem sopm ya. Yu av som sitn iina im leta dem we aad fi andastan, an piipl we neva lorn bout dem an ada piipl we no diip diip iina Gad, dem tek dem sopm de an twis dem roun, siem laik ou dem twis roun ada paat a Gad wod. Bot a chobl dem a kaal dong pan demself wen dem du dem sitn de.

You therefore, beloved, since you know these things beforehand, beware lest you also fall from your own firm footing, being led away by the deception of the wicked.|So fren, laik ou unu nuo dis aredi, wach out an no bada mek di rang we di wikid piipl dem we no bizniz wid Gad a du, kaaz unu fi chrie. Unu biliiv iina Gad chrang chrang nou, so no bada jrap aafa faam.

But grow in the grace and knowledge of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ. To Him be glory, both now and forever. Amen.|Gwaan mek wi Laad Jiizas Krais we siev wi, lov unu an chriit unu gud, an unu fi gwaan lorn muo an muo bout im tu. Mi prie se im wi get di priez, tide, tumaro an fi eva! Iemen.

Jude, a servant of Jesus Christ and a brother of James, To those who are sanctified and called by God the Father and preserved in Jesus Christ:|Da leta ya a kom fram mi, Juud. Mi a wan a Jiizas Krais sliev an Jiemz breda.Mi a rait aal a unu we Faada Gad pik fi bi fi im uon, we im lov, an we Jiizas Krais kip sief.
May mercy, peace, and love be multiplied to you.|Mi prie se Gad wi gud an kain tu unu, sekl unu aat, an gi unu nof nof lov.

Beloved, while I diligently tried to write to you of the salvation we have in common, I found it necessary to write and appeal to you to contend for the faith which was once delivered to the saints.|Mi breda an sista, mi did a du evriting fi rait unu bout di nyuu laif we Gad gi aal a wi kaaz wi an Jiizas Krais a wan. Bot mi afi rait an tel unu fi tan op chrang an fait fi di sitn dem we Gad piipl get, an we wi biliiv iina. Wi get dem wan taim fi aal a Gad piipl an dem kyaahn chienj.

For there are some men who secretly crept in, who were marked long ago for this condemnation. They are ungodly men, who pervert the grace of our God into immorality and deny the only Lord God and our Lord Jesus Christ.|Kaaz som man slip iina unu choch anda di kwaiyat. Dem man de maak fi get mash dong fram wie bak wen, an a dat mi a-go tel unu bout. Dem man de no av notn fi du wid Gad. Kaaz Gad lov piipl iivn duo dem no dizorv it, dem yuuz dat fi du aal kain-a wikidnis an ton gens Jiizas Krais, wi onggl maasta an Laad.

Now I want to remind you, though you already know, that the Lord saved the people out of the land of Egypt and afterward destroyed those who did not believe. |Mi nuo se unu nuo dem sitn ya aredi, bot mi stil a memba unu bout wa did apm tu di piipl dem wa di Laad did frii outa Iijip. Som a dem neva biliiv iina Gad, so Gad kil dem aaf iina di dezot.

Likewise, the angels who did not keep to their first domain, but forsook their own dwelling, He has kept in everlasting chains under darkness for the judgment of the great day.|Unu nuo tu bout di ienjel dem wa neehn tan we Gad put dem fi ruul. Dem jos lef dem plies so. Siek-a dat Gad tai dem op wid chien fi eva an eva. Gad a kip dem tai op iina wan daak daak pit til di big big jojment die.

Just as Sodom and Gomorrah, and the surrounding cities in like manner, gave themselves to immorality and went after different flesh, they serve as an example by suffering the punishment of eternal fire.|A siem so Sadam an Gomaro an di piipl dem we liv nier dem tek paat iina aal kain-a seks sin an ron aafa aal kain-a naasinis. Gad bon dem op wid faiya we a-go bon fi eva an eva mek evribadi si wa wi apm ef dem fala dem wikid piipl de.

Likewise, these ungodly dreamers defile the flesh, reject authority, and slander celestial beings. |A siem so dem piipl de kliem se dem get vijan an so dem du aal kain-a naasinis we mash op dem badi. Chuu dem kliem se dem get vijan dem go gens Gad, fait gens enibadi we a ruul uova dem, an bad mout Gad ienjel dem.

Yet Michael the archangel, when contending with the devil in a dispute about the body of Moses, did not dare to pronounce upon him a railing judgment. But he said, “The Lord rebuke you!”|Bot no iivn Maikal, Gad ed ienjel, wen im an di devl did a aagyu bout Muoziz badi, im neva brait inof fi kos out di devl an kaal dong jojment pan im. Im jos tel im se, “Gad a-go put yu iina yu plies.”

But these men slander those things that they do not understand. But they destroy themselves in those things that, like unreasoning animals, they know by instinct.|Bot dem ya piipl ya se som torbl torbl sitn bout we dem no andastan. Dem a gwaan laik wail animal wa kyaahn tingk out notn. An di sitn dem we dem du andastan widout afi tingk bout dem, a dem sitn de mash dem op.

Woe to them! For they have gone in the way of Cain, have run greedily after the error of Balaam for a reward, and perished in the rebellion of Korah.|Tingz gweehn torbl fi dem man ya! Dem tan jos laik Kien we morda im breda. Dem komiin laik Bielam — dem wi du eniting fi get moni. Dem go gens Gad jos laik ou Kuora did go gens Muoziz. Gad gweehn mash dem dong siem laik ou im did mash dong Kuora.

These are the ones who are stains on your love feasts as they feast with you irreverently and care only for themselves. They are clouds without water, carried along by winds; autumn trees without fruit, twice dead, uprooted;|Dem man ya wi mash op unu miitn wen dem kom nyam an jringk wid unu. Unu fi kip we fram dem, siem laik ou ship kyaptin chrai fi kip we fram san bangk iina shalo waata. Wen dem a nyam an jringk wid unu dem no bizniz wid nobadi onggl demself. Dem komiin laik kloud we no av no rien we briiz bluo aal bout. Dem a laik chrii we no bier no fruut wen a taim fi bier fruut. Dem jrai op, ded an get ruut op.

raging waves of the sea, which are foaming up their own shame; wandering stars for whom the gloom of darkness has been kept forever.|Di wikid sitn we dem du a-go shuo op laik fraat pan sii waata. Dem piipl ya komiin laik staar we no tan we Gad put dem fi tan, so Gad a-go lak dem op iina wan daak daak plies fi eva an eva.

Enoch, the seventh generation from Adam, also prophesied of these men, saying, “Look! The Lord is coming with ten thousand of His holy ones|Iinok did iina di sevn set a pikni we kom dong fram Adam lain a piipl dem. Im did priich bout di wikid piipl dem. Im se, “Di Laad a-go kom wid touzn tap a touzn a im uoli wan dem.

to execute judgment on everyone, and to convict all who are godless of all their wicked deeds that they have committed, and of all the terrible words that godless sinners have spoken against Him.”|Im a kom fi joj evribadi. Im gweehn ponish aal di wikid piipl dem fi aal di rang sitn dem we dem du gens Gad an fi aal di taim we dem kos im out.”

These men are grumblers, complainers, who walk after their own lusts. Their mouths speak arrogant words, and they flatter others to gain profit.|Dem piipl de no du notn bot grombl an paint fingga pan ada piipl; eniting we dem wikid aat tel dem fi du — a dat dem du. Dem buos bout demself an swiit-taak piipl so dem kyan yuuz dem fi di rang riizn.
But, beloved, remember the words that were previously spoken by the apostles of our Lord Jesus Christ. |Mi fren, unu fi memba wa wi Laad Jiizas Krais apasl dem did tel unu.

They said to you, “In the last days there will be scoffers who will walk after their own ungodly desires.”|Dem did tel unu se iina di laas die dem, di taim wen di worl bout fi don, unu gweehn av som piipl we gweehn mek fon a Gad an im mesij an im piipl. Dem a-go liv onggl fi di wikid sitn dem we dem waahn.

These are the men who cause divisions, sensual, devoid of the Spirit.|Dem piipl ya onggl kaaz choch piipl fi aagyu wid wan aneda an plit op di choch. Dem mek di wikid sitn we dem waahn kanchuol dem, an Gad Spirit no iina dem.

But you, beloved, build yourselves up in your most holy faith. Pray in the Holy Spirit.|Bot unu piipl we mi lov, gwaan mek unuself chrang iina wa unu biliiv, an mek di Uoli Spirit liid unu wen unu prie.

Keep yourselves in the love of God while you are waiting for the mercy of our Lord Jesus Christ, which leads to eternal life.|Tan iina Gad lov an gwaan wiet fi Jiizas kom an mek wi liv fi eva, kaaz a dat im a-go du, kaaz im so gud an kain tu wi.
On some have compassion, using discernment.|Tek taim wid di wan dem we naa chos iina Gad wid aal a dem aat.

And others save with fear while pulling them out of the fire, hating even the garment stained by the flesh.|Di wan dem we iina di faiya, grab dem out an siev dem; an yu av som ada piipl we unu fi tek piti pan, bot wach unuself wid dem, an av rispek fi Gad siem wie, an iet dong tu di kluoz we dem sin mes op.

Now to Him who is able to keep you from falling and to present you blameless before the presence of His glory with rejoicing|Di onggl Gad, di wan we siev unu, av powa fi kip unu fram tombl dong iina di devl chrap. Im wi mek unu tan op infronta im iina im brait brait lait wen im kom bak iina aal a im powa, an mek unu wel api an no fain no faalt wid unu.

to the only wise God our Savior, be glory and majesty, dominion and power, both now and forever. Amen.|Im a di onggl Gad. Im siev wi wen im sen Jiizas Krais wi Laad fi ded fi wi. Big im op an worship im. A im av aal powa an di rait fi ruul iina evri wie an uova evribadi, bifuo taim did staat, rait ya nou, an fi eva an eva. Iemen!

Bot kaaz unu aad-iez an mek op unu main se unu naa ton we fram unu sin — unu a mek tingz aad fi unuself. Pan di die wen Gad kom bak fi joj di worl, im a-go ponish unu. Im a-go shuo se im beks wid di piipl dem we a sin, an im a-go ponish dem. An im a-go ponish unu aada dan di res a piipl dem. |Da leta ya a kom fram mi, Paal, wan sliev fi Krais Jiizas. Gad pik mi fi bi wan a Jiizas Krais apasl an a im gi mi di wok fi priich im Gud Nyuuz.

which He promised beforehand through His prophets in the Holy Scriptures|Lang bifuo Jiizas baan, Gad did pramis fi sen da Gud Nyuuz de tu wi. Im mek im prafit dem rait it dong iina Gad wod se im a-go sen it.
concerning His Son, Jesus Christ our Lord, who was born of the seed of David according to the flesh|Da Gud Nyuuz ya a bout im Bwai Pikni we kom fram Dievid fambili.

and declared to be the Son of God with power, according to the Spirit of holiness, by the resurrection from the dead.|Jiizas Krais wi Laad a Gad Uoli Bwai Pikni. An iivn duo im kom fram Dievid fambili, Gad shuo klier klier se im a im Bwai Pikni an gi im im powa wen im mek Jiizas kom bak alaiv.

Through Him we have received grace and apostleship for the obedience of faith among all nations for His name|Gad kaaz Jiizas fi gud an kain tu mi an fi mek mi wan a im apasl dem, iivn duo mi neva dizorv it. Im mek mi wan apasl so dat mi kuda sorv Jiizas Krais an elp di piipl dem we a no Juu fi biliiv iina im an fala aal a wa im se.
among whom you also are called by Jesus Christ:|An yu si unu we a liv iina Ruom, unu a paat a dem piipl de we Gad kaal fi bilang tu Jiizas Krais.

To all who are in Rome, beloved of God, called to be saints:Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.|So mi a rait da leta ya tu aal a unu iina Ruom we Gad lov an uu im kaal fi bi im piipl. Mi prie se wi Faada Gad an di Laad Jiizas Krais wi shuo unu lov iivn duo wi no dizorv it an gi unu piis iina unu aat.

First, I thank my God through Jesus Christ for you all, because your faith is spoken of throughout the whole world.|Di fos ting mi waahn fi se a dat mi tangk Gad fi aal a unu. Mi kyan tangk im siek-a wa Jiizas Krais du fi di uol a unu. An mi tangk im fi unu kaaz unu biliiv an chos iina Jiizas Krais so moch dat piipl aal uova di worl a taak bout unu.

For God is my witness, whom I serve with my spirit in the gospel of His Son, that without ceasing, I mention you always in my prayers|Mi sorv Gad wid aal a mi aat. A sorv mi a sorv im wen mi priich di Gud Nyuuz bout im Bwai Pikni, an im nuo se wa mi bout fi se a chuu: Mi aalwiez a tingk bout unu.
making request if, by any means, now at last I might find a way in the will of God to come to you.|An wen mi a prie, mi aalwiez aks Gad fi mek mi kyan kom si unu, az lang az a dat im waahn.

For I long to see you, that I may impart to you some spiritual gift, so that you may be strengthened.|Kaaz mi lang fi si unu so dat mi kyan shier wid unu som a di sitn dem we Gad Spirit shuo mi. Mi waahn fi shier dem wid unu so dat mi kyan elp unu fi gruo chrang an biliiv iina Gad muor an muor.

This is so that I may be encouraged together with you by each other’s faith, both yours and mine. |Wa mi a se a dat mi wel waahn kom si unu so dat wi kyan elp fi bil op wi wan aneda. Unu wi get chrang wen unu si umoch mi chos iina Gad, an unu wi elp mi fi get chrang wen mi si umoch unu chos iina Gad.

Now I would not have you unaware, brothers, that I often intended to come to you (but was prevented until now), that I might have a harvest among you also, even as among the other Gentiles.|Breda an sista mi waahn unu fi nuo se a nof taim mi mek fi kom si unu bot sopm aalwiez tap mi fram kom. Mi wel waahn fi kom si unu, so dat mi kyan elp di piipl mongks unu fi biliiv an fala Jiizas Krais siem laik ou mi elp di res a piipl dem we a no Juu fi biliiv an fala Jiizas.

I am a debtor both to the Greeks and to the barbarians, both to the wise and to the unwise.|It komiin laik se mi a evribadi sorvant. Gad sen mi fi priich di Gud Nyuuz tu di Griik piipl dem an tu di piipl dem we a no Griik. Im sen mi fi priich tu piipl we waiz an nuo nof, an tu piipl we no nuo notn.
So, as much as is in me, I am ready to preach the gospel to you also who are in Rome.|So mi wel waahn fi kom priich di Gud Nyuuz tu aal a unu we de a Ruom tu.

For I am not ashamed of the gospel of Christ. For it is the power of God for salvation to everyone who believes, to the Jew first, and also to the Greek. |Mi no shiem fi priich di Gud Nyuuz kaaz it powaful. A di Gud Nyuuz Gad yuuz fi siev aal a di piipl we chos iina Jiizas. Im yuuz it fi siev di Juu dem fos an den im yuuz it fi siev di piipl dem we a no Juu.

For in it the righteousness of God is revealed from faith to faith. As it is written, “The just shall live by faith.”|Di Gud Nyuuz shuo ou Gad tek we piipl sin an mek tingz rait bitwiin im an dem, an dat im du aal a dat kaaz dem biliiv iina Jiizas Krais. It aal rait dong iina Gad wod se, “Di piipl uufa sin Gad tek we kaaz dem biliiv iina im, a dem a-go riili liv.”

The wrath of God is revealed from heaven against all ungodliness and unrighteousness of men, who suppress the truth through unrighteousness.|Fram evn, wich paat im ruul, Gad shuo se im beks an a-go joj aal a di piipl dem we a liv iina sin an we a du aal kain-a wikid sitn. Dem de piipl de tap ada piipl fram nuo di chuut bout Gad wid di wikid sitn dem we dem du.
For what may be known about God is clear to them since God has shown it to them. |Gad a-go ponish dem kaaz evriting we de de fi nuo bout Gad infronta dem plien plien, kaaz a Gad imself shuo dem.

The invisible things about Him—His eternal power and deity—have been clearly seen since the creation of the world and are understood by the things that are made, so that they are without excuse.|Nobadi kyan si Gad bot dem kyan nuo bout im. Fram Gad mek di worl, im a shuo piipl a uu im bi. Wen yu luk pan di sitn dem we im mek, yu kyan nuo se a im a riili Gad an dat a im a-go av aal di powa fi eva an eva. So nobadi kyaahn se dem neva nuo bout im.

Because, although they knew God, they did not glorify Him or give thanks to Him as God, but became futile in their imaginations, and their foolish hearts were darkened.|An iivn duo dem nuo se im a Gad, dem no chriit im laik se im a Gad. Dem no priez im an dem no gi im tangks fi aal we im du fi dem. Siek-a dat dem staat tingk bier fuulinish, notn we dem tingk no rait an dem kyaahn andastan notn bout Gad.
Claiming to be wise, they became fools. |Dem kliem se dem waiz bot a fuul dem ton fuul.

They changed the glory of the incorruptible God into an image made like corruptible man, birds, four-footed beasts, and creeping things.|Gad kyaahn ded, im a-go liv fi eva an eva, an insted-a dem worship im an se dat im a Gad, dem ton roun an a worship faalz gad. Dem staat worship faalz gad we luk laik wan man ar we komiin laik bod, faalz gad we luk laik animal we waak an animal we kraal.

Therefore God gave them up to uncleanness through the lusts of their hearts, to dishonor their own bodies among themselves.|An kaaz piipl so fuul-fuul, Gad lef dem fi du wa dem waahn fi du. Im lef dem fi du aal a di naasinis we dem wel waahn fi du, an fi tek paat iina aal kain-a seks sin we jos a mash op dem badi an we jos a bring dong shiem pan dem wan aneda.

They turned the truth of God into a lie and worshipped and served the creature rather than the Creator, who is blessed forever. Amen.|Dem ton dem bak pan di chuut bout Gad an go biliiv wan lai. Dem worship an sorv di sitn dem we Gad mek insted-a worship Gad we mek evriting. A Gad fi get di priez fi eva an eva. Iemen!

For this reason God gave them up to dishonorable passions. Their women exchanged the natural function for what is against nature.|An kaaz dem a du dem sitn de, Gad lef dem fi bring don shiem pan demself. Im lef dem fi tek paat iina aal kain-a seks sin. An so di uman dem tap du we naamal — dem tap sliip wid man an go staat sliip wid uman.

Likewise the men, leaving the natural function of the woman, burned in their lust toward one another, men with men doing that which is shameful, and receiving in themselves the due penalty of their error.|A siem so di man dem tap du wa naamal tu — dem tap sliip wid uman an go staat sliip wid man. Man a sliip wid man, dat a shiem, an kaaz wa dem a du rang, Gad a-go gi dem jos wa dem fi get — Gad a-go ponish dem.

And since they did not see fit to acknowledge God, God gave them over to a debased mind, to do those things which are not proper.|Dem nuo di chuut bout Gad bot dem mek op dem main se dem naa biliiv it. So Gad lef dem fi du aal a di sitn dem we dem doti main tel dem fi du im lef dem fi du di sitn dem we dem no fi du.

They were filled with all unrighteousness, sexual immorality, wickedness, covetousness, maliciousness; full of envy, murder, strife, deceit. They are gossips|Dem de piipl de wikid, dem ful op a wikidnis. Dem eva waahn wa ada piipl av an dem eva a du bad sitn tu ada piipl. Dem de piipl de ful op a bad main. Dem lov fi kos an fait, dem eva a chrai fi chrik dem wan aneda an dem eva waahn fi kil aaf dem wan aneda tu. Dem de piipl de lov fi susu-susu.

slanderers, God-haters, insolent, proud, boastful, inventors of evil things, and disobedient toward parents|Dem lai an dem lov fi big op demself — dem ful-a demself so til. Nobadi kyaahn taak tu dem an dem no shuo nobadi no rispek. Dem no fala notn we dem mada an faada se. Dem no lov Gad an dem eva a plan op plan op aal kain-a wikid sitn.

without understanding, covenant breakers, without natural affection, calloused, and unmerciful|Dem de piipl de naa no sens, dem naa no aat, dem no du notn we dem se dem a-go du an dem no tek piti pan nobadi.

who know the righteous requirement of God, that those who commit such things are worthy of death. They not only do them, but also give hearty approval to those who practice them.|Iivn duo dem nuo se Gad se enibadi we a tek paat iina dem sitn de, dizorv fi ded, dem gwaan liv dem laif siem wie. Wos dem aal a tel ada piipl se a gud sitn dem a du wen dem tek paat iina dem sitn de tu.

Therefore you are without excuse, Oman, whoever you are who judges, for when you judge another, you condemn yourself, for you who judge do the same things.|Unu si aal a unu we a joj ada piipl, no mata uu unu bi, unu naa go kyan se notn wen Gad kom fi joj di worl. Kaaz wen unu a joj ada piipl, it komiin laik unu a joj unuself, kaaz di rang sitn dem we dem a du, a di siem sitn unu a du tu.
But we know that the judgment of God is ­according to truth against those who commit such things.
column2: An aal a wi nuo se Gad rait fi joj evribadi we a du dem sitn de.

column1: Do you think, O man, who judges those who do such things, and who does the same thing, that you will escape the judgment of God?|Bot aal a unu we a joj ada piipl, di sitn dem we unu a joj ada piipl fa an we unu a du, unu no tingk se Gad a-go joj unu fi dem tu? Unu riili tingk im a-go jos mek unu get we so?

Do you despise the riches of His goodness, tolerance, and patience, not knowing that the goodness of God leads you to repentance?|Gad tek im taim wid unu, im put op wid unu an im no ponish unu siem taim wen unu du rang. Unu no si se Gad gud tu unu? Ar a kier unu no kier bout dem sitn de? Unu no si se Gad kain tu unu, kaaz im chrai fi get unu fi ton we fram sin an sari fi di rang we unu du?

But because of your hardness and impenitent heart, you are storing up treasures of wrath against yourself on the day of wrath when the righteous judgment of God will be revealed,|Bot kaaz unu aad-iez an mek op unu main se unu naa ton we fram unu sin — unu a mek tingz aad fi unuself. Pan di die wen Gad kom bak fi joj di worl, im a-go ponish unu. Im a-go shuo se im beks wid di piipl dem we a sin, an im a-go ponish dem. An im a-go ponish unu aada dan di res a piipl dem.
and He “will render to every man according to his deeds.”
column2: Gad “wi gi evribadi wa dem fi get — im wi pie dem bies pan wa dem du.”

column1: To those who by patiently doing good seek for glory and honor and immortality will be eternal life.
column2: Yu av som piipl we a liv rait an we aalwiez a du gud fi ada piipl. Dem piipl de waahn Gad fi taak gud bout dem. Dem waahn im fi big dem op an mek dem liv fi eva. An a dem de piipl de Gad a-go mek liv fi eva an eva.

column1: But to those who are contentious and do not obey the truth, but obey unrighteousness, indignation, and wrath|Bot yu av som ada piipl we onggl bizniz bout demself — dem no du notn fi elp ada piipl. Dem mek op dem main se dem naa du wa rait — dem onggl a-go du we Gad se rang. Dem piipl de Gad a-go shuo dem se im beks wid dem, im a-go ponish dem aad aad.

will be tribulation and anguish, upon every soul of man who does evil, to the Jew first, and then to the Gentile. |Di piipl dem we a du aal kain-a wikidnis, Gad a-go mek dem fiil nof pien — im a-go mek dem sofa. Im a-go du dat tu piipl we a Juu an tu piipl we a no Juu.

But glory, honor, and peace will be to every man who does good work—to the Jew first, and then to the Gentile,|Bot di piipl dem we eva a du gud an we a liv rait, Gad a-go big dem op an taak gud bout dem. Im a-go gi dem piis iina dem aat. Gad a-go du dat fi piipl we a Juu an fi piipl we a no Juu tu.
for there is no partiality with God.|Kaaz Gad no paashal, im chriit evribadi di siem.

As many as have sinned without the law will also perish without the law, and as many as have sinned under the law will be judged by the law|Di piipl we no nuo Gad Laa stil a-go get ponish fi dem sin. Gad a-go joj dem bies pan wa dem du. Di piipl we nuo Gad Laa an stil a sin, a-go get ponish tu. Gad a-go yuuz di Laa fi joj dem.

for the hearers of the law are not justified before God, but the doers of the law will be justified.|Kaaz Gad mek tingz rait bitwiin im an di piipl we ier di Laa an fala aal we it se, no wid di piipl dem we jos ier it bot naa fala it.

For when Gentiles, who do not have the law, do by nature the things contained in the law, these, not having the law, are a law unto themselves|Di piipl we a no Juu, dem neva get Gad Laa, so dem no nuo wa di Laa se. So wen dem du di sitn dem we di Laa se piipl fi du, dat shuo se dem nuo wa rait fram wa rang.

who show the work of the law written in their hearts, their conscience also bearing witness, while their conflicting thoughts accuse or even excuse them,|Wa dem du shuo se di sitn dem we di Laa tiich rait dong iina dem aat. An di sitn dem we dem tingk, shuo se a chuu tu. Kaaz dem uona kanchens wi tel dem ef wa dem a du rait ar ef it rang.

in the day when, according to my gospel, God will judge the secrets of men through Jesus Christ.|Di siem ting we mi priich a di siem ting we a-go apm pan di die wen Jiizas kom bak fi joj di worl. Im a-go joj piipl bies pan wa dem tingk an wa dem du, iivn di sitn dem we dem du iina siikrit.
Indeed you are called a Jew, and rest in the law, and make your boast in God. |So nou, wa bout unu? Unu se unu a Juu, unu put unu chos iina di Laa an buos bout ou unu bilang tu Gad.

You know His will and approve the things that are more excellent, because you are instructed in the law.|Unu nuo wa Gad waahn unu fi du an kaaz unu nuo di Laa, unu nuo wa rait an unu nuo se a dat unu fi du.
You are confident that you are a guide to the blind, a light to those who are in darkness|Unu biliiv se a unu a liida fi di piipl we blain an dat unu a wan lait fi di piipl we de iina daaknis.

an instructor of the foolish, and a teacher of babes, who have the full content of knowledge and truth in the law: |Kaaz unu nuo di Laa unu fiil se unu nuo an andastan evriting an dat evriting we unu se a chuu sopm. An siek-a dat unu fiil se unu kyan karek di piipl dem we no nuo rait fram rang an unu kyan tiich di piipl dem we no nuo di chuut.

You, therefore, who teach another, do you not teach yourself? You who preach not to steal, do you steal?|Unu a tiich ada piipl, so ou kom unu naa lorn? Ou kom unu naa fala wa unu tiich? Ou kom unu a priich se piipl no fi tiif bot unu a tiif?

You who say not to commit adultery, do you commit adultery? You who abhor idols, do you rob temples?|Unu tel piipl se dem no fi sliip wid piipl we dem no marid tu, so wa mek unu a sliip wid piipl we unu no marid tu? Unu taak gens di faalz gad dem, unu se unu iet dem, bot unu a tiif tingz outa di ous wich paat piipl worship dem.

You who boast in the law, do you dishonor God through breaking the law?|Unu brag an unu buos bout ou unu nuo Gad Laa bot unu naa fala it. Unu no si se wen unu du dat unu a kaaz piipl fi no av no rispek fi Gad?

As it is written, “The name of God is blasphemed among the Gentiles because of you.”|It aal rait dong iina Gad wod se, “Unu we se unu a Juu, unu a kaaz di piipl we a no Juu fi se aal saat a wikid sitn bout Gad.”

Circumcision indeed has merit, if you keep the law, but if you are a breaker of the law, your circumcision becomes uncircumcision.|Ef unu a fala di Laa, den di fak se unu sorkomsaiz miin sopm. Bot ef unu naa fala di Laa, unu kuda sorkomsaiz likl muor, it no miin a ting — a laik se unu neva sorkomsaiz iina di fos plies.

Therefore, if an uncircumcised man keeps the righteousness of the law, will not his uncircumcision be counted as circumcision? |So nou, di piipl dem we a no Juu an we no sorkomsaiz, ef dem a du aal a wa di Laa se dem fi du, unu no tingk se Gad a-go chriit dem siem laik ou im chriit di piipl we sorkomsaiz? Unu no tingk se im a-go tek dem fi fi im piipl?

Will the uncircumcised one who is righteous by nature, if he fulfills the law, not judge you who, by the letter of the law and circumcision, violate the law?|An unu we sorkomsaiz an nuo di Laa bot a brok it, unu no tingk se di piipl dem we no sorkomsaiz bot a fala di Laa naa go joj unu?
He is not a Jew who is one outwardly, nor is circumcision that which is external in the flesh. |No chuu sumadi sorkomsaiz an a liv laik wan Juu miin se dem a riili wan Juu.

But he is a Jew who is one inwardly. And circumcision is of the heart, by the Spirit, and not by the letter. His praise is not from men, but from God.|Di piipl dem we a riili Juu a di wan dem we Gad tek fi bi im piipl kaaz dem lou di Uoli Spirit fi chienj dem aat, no kaaz dem sorkomsaiz ar nuo di Laa. Dem de piipl de, Gad a-go big op, iivn ef ada piipl naa big dem op.

What advantage then does the Jew have? Or what profit is there in circumcision?|So den, piipl mait-a aks, wa gud it du wi, fi bi wan Juu? Wa wi get we di piipl dem we a no Juu no get? Wa gud it du wi fi get sorkomsaiz?

Much in every way! Chiefly because the oracles of God were entrusted to them.|An mi wuda tel dem se it gud fi bi wan Juu, a nof difrant sitn wi get, we elp wi iina nof difrant wie. Fos, a wi Gad did gi im Wod tu — a wi im chos wid im mesij.

What if some did not believe? Would their unbelief nullify the faithfulness of God?|Nou som a di Juu dem brok dem pramis an neva fala wa Gad wod se. So wa unu tingk? Unu tingk se kaaz dem de piipl de brok dem pramis, Gad naa go du wa im se im wuda du?

God forbid! Let God be true, and every man a liar. As it is written:“That You may be justified in Your words,and may prevail in Your judging.”|Notn kyaahn go so! Gad wi aalwiez du wa im se im a-go du, iivn wen piipl lai an se dem du wa dem did pramis fi du. It aal rait dong iina Gad wod se:“Evritaim Gad taak, piipl wi si se wa im a se a chuu sopm.No mata wa piipl se gens Gad, a Gad a-go win.”

But if our unrighteousness demonstrates the righteousness of God, what shall we say? Is God unrighteous in taking vengeance? (I am speaking in human terms.)|So wa ef wen wi du rang, piipl si klier klier se Gad aalwiez a du we rait? Wa wi kyan se bout dat? Unu tingk wi kyan se Gad a du rang wen im ponish wi? (Mi jos a taak ou som piipl taak)
God forbid! For then how could God judge the world?|Nuo sa! Kaaz ef Gad no joj wi, ou im fi go joj di res a di worl?

If through my lie the truth of God has abounded more to His glory, why am I still being judged as a sinner?|Nou som piipl mait-a se, “ef wen wi du rang an no fala we Gad se, wi a elp ada piipl fi si klier klier se Gad a di chuut an im aalwiez du we im se im wi du, an siek-a dat dem staat priez im, ou kom Gad stil a joj wi laik se wi a sina?”

Why not rather say, “Let us do evil that good may come,” as we are slanderously accused and as some claim that we say? Their condemnation is just.|Ef unu a go se dat, mek unu no jos se, “Kom mek wi go du aal kain-a wikid sitn, so dat wi wi kaaz nof gud sitn fi apm” — no dat som piipl we lov tel lai pan wi, a kliem se wi se. Dem piipl de, Gad a-go ponish dem — dem a-go get jos wa dem fi get.

What then? Are we better than they? No, not at all. For we have already charged that both Jews and Gentiles are all under sin. |So wa? Unu tingk se wi we a Juu beta aaf dan di piipl dem we a no Juu? Nuo sa! Kaaz mi don shuo unu aredi se evribadi, weda dem a Juu ar dem a no Juu, sin kanchuol dem laif — evribadi a sina.
As it is written:“There is none righteous, no, not one;|A siem so it se iina Gad wod. It rait dong se:“Nobadi, no iivn wan sumadi, du we rait iina Gad yai.
there is no one who understands;there is no one who seeks after God.|Nobadi no riili nuo we rait,Nobadi no riili waahn fi nuo Gad.

They have all turned aside;together they have become worthless;there is no one who does good,no, not one.”|Evribadi ton dem bak pan Gad, dem ton bad — dem naa no yuus tu Gad.Nobadi no du gud.Nobadi at aal!”

“Their throats are an open grave;with their tongues they have used deceit”;“the poison of vipers is under their lips”;|“Fi dem mout komiin laik wan uopm griev,wid dem tong a bier lai dem tel an chrik piipl.Di wod dem we kom outa dem mout kil piipl,a laik dem lip ful op a di siem paizn we siniek av.
“their mouths are full of cursing and bitterness.”|Dem eva a kos an a wish bad tingz pan piipl,an evriting wa dem se shuo se dem bita.”
“Their feet are swift to shed blood;|“Dem kwik fi kil piipl,
destruction and misery are in their paths;
column2: an evriwe dem go dem kaaz piipl fi sofa an dem mash op evriting.

column1: and they do not know the way of peace.”
column2: Dem no du notn we wuda kaaz piipl fi liv iina piis.”

column1: “There is no fear of God before their eyes.”
column2: Dem no fried a Gad — dem no rispek im fi uu im bi.”

column1: Now we know that whatever the law says, it says to those who are under the law, so that every mouth may be silenced, and all the world may become accountable to God. |Nou wi nuo se evriting we rait dong iina di Laa a fi di piipl we a fala di Laa. Gad gi dem di Laa so dat nobadi kyan se notn wen im kom fi ponish dem — nobadi kyan se dem neva nuo rait fram rang. So Gad a-go ponish evribadi we de iina di worl, weda dem a Juu ar dem a no Juu.

Therefore by the works of the law no flesh will be justified in His sight, for through the law comes the knowledge of sin.|Evribadi a-go get ponish, kaaz Gad naa go mek tingz rait bitwiin yu an im jos chuu yu a fala di Laa. Di Laa kyaahn du dat, wa di Laa du a mek wi nuo se wi a sina.

But now, apart from the law, the righteousness of God is revealed, being witnessed by the Law and the Prophets.|Bot nou Gad shuo wi ou im plan fi mek tingz rait bitwiin im an piipl. Da plan de no av notn fi du wid di Laa, (iivn duo di Laa an di prafit dem did taak bout da plan de). It no av notn fi du wid di Laa, so no chuu yu a fala di Laa dat miin se Gad a-go mek tingz rait bitwiin yu an im.

This righteousness of God comes through faith in ­Jesus Christ to all and upon all who believe, for there is no distinction. |Gad onggl mek tingz rait bitwiin im an piipl wen dem biliiv iina Jiizas Krais. A so it go fi evribadi weda yu a Juu ar yu a no Juu.
For all have sinned and come short of the glory of God
column2: Kaaz evribadi du rang — evribadi a sina. Gad did mek wi laik im an wi did fi tan laik im bot siek-a sin dat neehn apm.

column1: being justified freely by His grace through the redemption that is in Christ Jesus|Bot iivn duo wi no dizorv it, Gad shuo wi lov. So moch so dat im mek tingz rait bitwiin wi an im, an wi neva iivn afi du notn. Im sen Jiizas Krais fi ded fi wi an tek we wi sin dem.

whom God has set forth to be a propitiation through faith, in His blood, for a demonstration of His righteousness, because in His forbearance God had passed over the sins previously committed|Gad sen Jiizas fi gi op im laif an siev wi. Wen Jiizas ded pan di kraas, fi im blod pie fi wi sin dem an so wi no afi get ponish. Aal wi afi du fi get wi sin dem paadn, a biliiv iina Jiizas. Wen Gad sen Jiizas im shuo se im no paashal — im chriit evribadi siem wie, kaaz bifuo Jiizas did kom, im neva ponish nobadi fi dem sin, im tek taim wid dem.

to prove His righteousness at this present time so that He might be just and be the justifier of him who has faith in Jesus.|Bot iina dem ya taim ya Gad naa go tek taim wid piipl, im a-go ponish dem fi di rang we dem du. Wen im sen Jiizas im shuo wi se im aalwiez du we rait an dat im wi mek tingz rait bitwiin im an piipl, aal dem afi du fi get dem sin dem paadn, a fi biliiv iina Jiizas.

Where is boasting then? It is excluded. By what law? Of works? No, but by the law of faith.|So den, wa wi av fi brag an buos bout? Notn at aal! Wa? Unu tingk se wi kyan go buos bout se wi a fala di Laa? Afta Gad no mek tingz rait bitwiin im an piipl kaaz dem a fala di Laa, Gad onggl mek tingz rait bitwiin im an piipl kaaz dem biliiv iina Jiizas.

Therefore we conclude that a man is justified by faith without the works of the law. |So wi kyaahn se dat nobadi a-go get Gad fi mek tingz rait bitwiin im an dem, jos chuu dem a fala di Laa. Dem wi onggl get Gad fi du dat wen dem biliiv.

Is He the God of the Jews only? Is He not also the God of the Gentiles? Yes, of the Gentiles also|Anles wa unu a se a dat Gad a onggl Gad fi di Juu dem. Gad a no Gad fi di piipl dem we a no Juu tu? Afkuors im a fi dem Gad tu!

seeing it is one God, who shall justify the circumcised by faith, and the uncircumcised through faith.|A onggl wan Gad de, an a im a Gad fi di Juu dem an di piipl dem we a no Juu. Gad a-go mek tingz rait bitwiin im an di Juu dem wen dem biliiv siem laik ou im wi mek tingz rait bitwiin im an di piipl dem we a no Juu wen dem biliiv.

Do we then make the law void through faith? God forbid! Instead, we establish the law.|So wa dat miin fi di Laa? Ef Gad onggl mek tingz rait bitwiin im an piipl wen dem biliiv, dat miin se di Laa no wot notn? Nuo notn no go so! Wen wi biliiv iina Gad wi a shuo se di Laa riili wot sopm, a da taim de wi riili a fala di Laa.
What then shall we say that Abraham, our father according to the flesh, has found?|So aal a wi we a Juu, wa wi kyan se den bout wi faada Iebriyam? A wa did apm wid im?

If Abraham was justified by works, he has something to boast about, but not before God. |Ef Gad did mek tingz rait bitwiin im an Iebriyam, kaaz a di sitn dem we Iebriyam did du, den Iebriyam wuda av nof fi buos bout, bot im kudn buos infronta Gad.

What does the Scripture say? “Abraham believed God, and it was credited to him as righteousness.”|Bot a wa Gad wod se? It se “Iebriyam did biliiv iina Gad an so Gad mek tingz rait bitwiin im an Iebriyam.”

Now to him who works, wages are not given as a gift, but as a debt.|Nou ef sumadi go du wan wok, di moni we dem get wen dem don, dem naa go luk pan it an se a wan prezent. Nuo, dem a-go se a dat dem wok fa.

But to him who does not work, but believes in Him who justifies the ungodly, his faith is credited as righteousness.|Bot ef sumadi no afi du notn fi Gad mek tingz rait bitwiin im an dem, ef aal dem afi du a chos iina Gad, Gad we tek we piipl sin an se dat dem kliin, no wan gif im a gi wi? A no sopm wi did afi wok fa.

Even David describes the blessedness of the man to whom God credits righteousness without works:|Dat a wa Dievid did miin wen im did a taak bout ou piipl wel api wen Gad mek tingz rait bitwiin im an dem. Dem wel api kaaz aal dem did afi du a chos iina Gad, dem neva afi du notn els. Dievid rait iina Saamz se:
“Blessed are thosewhose iniquities are forgiven,and whose sins are covered;|“Di piipl uufa sin Gad paadn,a dem riili api.Gad paadn dem fi aal a di rang we dem du.
blessed is the manto whom the Lord shall not impute sin.”|Di piipl we Gad luk panan se im naa uol dem sin gens dem,a dem riili api.”

Does this blessedness then come upon the circumcised only, or upon the uncircumcised also? We are saying that faith was credited to Abraham as righteousness. |A onggl di piipl dem we sorkomsaiz Dievid did a taak bout? A dem wan Gad a-go paadn an mek api? Nuo, im did a taak bout di piipl we no sorkomsaiz tu. Wi se dat Iebriyam did biliiv iina Gad an so Gad mek tingz rait bitwiin im an Iebriyam.

How then was it credited? When he was in circumcision? Or in uncircumcision? Not in circumcision, but in uncircumcision. |A wen unu tingk Gad did du dat? Unu tingk im du it bifuo ar afta Iebriyam get sorkomsaiz? Gad did mek tingz rait bitwiin im an Iebriyam bifuo Iebriyam did sorkomsaiz.

And he received the sign of circumcision, a seal of the righteousness of the faith that he had while being uncircumcised, so that he might be the father of all those who believe, though they are uncircumcised, that righteousness might be credited to them also|An a lang afta dat apm Iebriyam go get sorkomsaiz. Im go get sorkomsaiz fi shuo se Gad did mek tingz rait bitwiin di tuu a dem iivn duo im neva sorkomsaiz, an Gad did du it kaaz Iebriyam did biliiv iina im. So Iebriyam komiin laik di faada fi aal a di piipl dem we neva get sorkomsaiz bot uu Gad mek tingz rait bitwiin im an dem kaaz dem biliiv iina im.

and the father of circumcision to those who are not of the circumcision only, but who also walk in the steps of the faith of our father Abraham, which he had while still being uncircumcised.|An a no jos dem piipl de im a faada fa, Iebriyam a faada tu fi di piipl dem we sorkomsaiz an we biliiv iina Gad laik ou Iebriyam did biliiv iina Gad bifuo im get sorkomsaiz.

It was not through the law that Abraham and his descendants received the promise that he would be the heir of the world, but through the righteousness of faith. |Gad did pramis Iebriyam se di worl wuda bilang tu im an im pikni dem. Gad neva mek im da pramis de kaaz im did a fala di Laa, bot kaaz Iebriyam did biliiv iina Gad an Gad did mek tingz rait bitwiin di tuu a dem.

For if those who are of the law become heirs, faith would be made void and the promise nullified|Ef a onggl di piipl we a fala di Laa a-go get di sitn dem wa Gad pramis, den it no mek no sens fi wi chos iina Gad an aal a di pramis dem we Gad mek no miin notn.

because the law produces wrath, for where there is no law, there is no sin.|Kaaz Gad beks wen piipl brok im Laa, an kaaz a di Laa im a-go joj dem piipl de. Bot ef no laa no de de, nobadi kyan brok it, kaaz notn wudn de de fi brok.

Therefore the promise comes through faith, so that it might be by grace, that the promise would be certain to all the descendants, not only to those who are of the law, but also to those who are of the faith of Abraham, who is the father of us all|A dat mek Gad neva mek im pramis bies pan weda piipl fala ar no fala di Laa, bot bies pan weda dem chos ar no chos iina im. Gad mek it da wie de so dat piipl wuda nuo se di sitn dem we im pramis a fi im frii gif tu aal a Iebriyam pikni dem. No jos di pikni dem we a fala di Laa bot tu di wan dem we biliiv laik Iebriyam tu. Iebriyam a di faada fi evribadi.

(as it is written, “I have made you a father of many nations”) before God whom he believed, and who raises the dead, and calls those things that do not exist as though they did.|It aal rait dong iina Gad wod dat Gad tel Iebriyam se, “Mi a-go mek yu di faada fi nof difrant piipl fram aal uova di worl.” Da pramis ya, gud, siek-a uu Gad bi. Dis a di Gad we Iebriyam did biliiv iina, di Gad we mek ded piipl kom bak alaiv an we kaaz evriting fi de bout, aal di sitn dem we neva de bout bifuo.

Against all hope, he believed in hope, that he might become the father of many nations according to what was spoken, “So shall your descendants be.”|Iivn duo im neva av no riizn fi biliiv se im wuda get we Gad pramis im, Iebriyam did biliiv siem wie. Im biliiv se Gad wuda mek im di faada fi nof difrant piipl fram aal uova di worl an dat it wuda apm siem laik ou it se iina Gad wod. It se, “Yu a-go av so moch pikni dat nobadi a-go kyan kount dem jos laik ou dem kyaahn kount di staar dem we iina di skai.”

And not being weak in faith, he did not consider his own body to be dead (when he was about a hundred years old), nor yet the deadness of Sarah’s womb.|Iebriyam a did aalmuos wan onjrid ier uol, im did nuo se im suun ded an dat im waif kudn av no pikni, bot iivn wid aal a dat Iebriyam stil biliiv. No taim at aal im did biliiv se Gad naa go du we im pramis fi du.

He did not waver at the promise of God through unbelief, but was strong in faith, giving glory to God|Iebriyam neva tap biliiv an im neva kwestiyan Gad. Im gi Gad priez an kaaz im chos iina Gad, im get chrang.
and being fully persuaded that what God had promised, He was able to perform.|Iebriyam biliiv wid aal a im aat, im did shuor se Gad kuda du evriting we im pramis fi du.
Therefore “it was credited to him as righteousness.”
column2: An a dat mek Gad did mek tingz rait bitwiin im an Iebriyam. Im du it kaaz Iebriyam did chos iina im.

column1: Now the words, “it was credited to him,” were not written for his sake only|Bot di paat iina Gad wod we it se, “Gad mek tingz rait bitwiin dem,” dat neva rait dong fi Iebriyam wan

but also for us, to whom it shall be credited if we believe in Him who raised Jesus our Lord from the dead|it rait fi wi tu. It rait dong fi aal a wi we Gad a-go mek tingz rait wid kaaz wi biliiv iina im. Wi biliiv iina di Gad we mek wi Laad Jiizas kom bak alaiv.
who was delivered for our transgressions, and was raised for our justification.|Gad sen Jiizas fi ded siek-a fi wi sin dem an Gad mek im kom bak alaiv so dat tingz kyan rait bitwiin wi an Gad.

Therefore, since we have been justified by faith, we have peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ|Gad put tingz rait bitwiin wi an im, kaaz wi biliiv iina im. An siek-a wa wi Laad Jiizas Krais did du, wi an Gad a liv iina piis.

through whom we also have access by faith into this grace in which we stand, and so we rejoice in hope of the glory of God. |Aal a di gud sitn dem we wi a get fram Gad an we wi no dizorv, wi a get dem siek-a wa Jiizas Krais did du an kaaz wi biliiv. An wi wel api kaaz wi nuo fi shuor se Gad a mek wi muor an muor laik im.

Not only so, but we also boast in tribulation, knowing that tribulation produces patience|Bot wi no jos api bout dat, wi api bout aal a di sitn dem we wi afi sofa chuu tu. Kaaz wi nuo se wen wi sofa chuu dem, wi wi get chrangga, an kaaz wi get chrangga wi kyan go chuu nof muor sopm an no gi op.

patience produces character, and character produces hope.|An wen wi sofa chuu nof sitn an no gi op, Gad wi proud a wi kaaz a tes im did a tes wi an a paas wi paas di tes. An wen wi si se Gad proud a wi, wi wi nuo se im wi gi wi aal wa im pramis wi.

And hope does not disappoint, because the love of God is shed abroad in our hearts by the Holy Spirit who has been given to us.|An kaaz wi nuo se Gad a-go gi wi we im pramis, wi no afi wori. Wi no afi wori kaaz wi nuo se Gad lov wi. Im shuo wi umoch im lov wi wen im gi wi di Uoli Spirit.

While we were yet weak, in due time Christ died for the ungodly.|Wen wi did wiik an neva av di powa fi elp wiself, Gad sen Jiizas fi ded fi wi — fi ded fi aal wikid piipl. Gad sen im wen im did fiil se di taim did rait.

Rarely for a righteous man will one die. Yet perhaps for a good man some would even dare to die. |(Tingk bout it! Iivn ef sumadi did a du evriting we di Laa se, it wuda aad fi fain sumadi we wuda ded fi dem, bot yu mait-a fain sumadi we briev inof fi ded fi sumadi we aalwiez du gud fi ada piipl.)
But God demonstrates His own love toward us, in that while we were yet sinners, Christ died for us.|Bot Gad shuo wi umoch im lov wi wen im sen Jiizas Krais fi ded fi wi, iivn duo wi a did sina.

How much more then, being now justified by His blood, shall we be saved from wrath through Him.|Jiizas ded fi wi sin dem, an so Gad put tingz rait bitwiin wi an im. An sins wi nuo se Jiizas did du dat wi nuo tu se im wi siev wi wen Gad kom fi joj di worl.

For if while we were enemies, we were reconciled to God by the death of His Son, how much more, being reconciled, shall we be saved by His life.|Wi a did Gad enimi, an iivn duo wi a did im enimi, Gad sen Jiizas fi ded fi wi sin dem an im mek tingz rait bitwiin wi an im. So nou dat tingz rait bitwiin wi an Gad, wi kyan nuo fi shuor se Jiizas wi siev wi wen Gad kom fi joj di worl. Wi nuo se im wi siev wi kaaz im kom bak alaiv.

Furthermore, we also rejoice in God through our Lord Jesus Christ, through whom we have now received reconciliation.|Pan tap a aal a dat, wi wel api. Wi api siek-a wa Gad yuuz wi Laad Jiizas Krais fi du. Gad yuuz Jiizas fi mek tingz rait bitwiin wi an im.

Therefore as sin came into the world through one man and death through sin, so death has spread to all men, because all have sinned.|A wan man kaaz sin fi kom iina di worl, an a da man de sin kaaz im fi ded. An siem ou it go wid im a siem so it go wid evribadi — evribadi sin so evribadi a-go ded.

For until the law, sin was in the world. But sin is not counted when there is no law. |Bifuo Gad did gi wi di Laa, piipl iina di worl did a sin. Bot di piipl dem we did a sin bifuo di Laa, Gad neva uol dem sin gens dem.

Nevertheless death reigned from Adam to Moses, even over those who had not sinned in the likeness of Adam’s sin, who was a type of Him who was to come.|Aal a di piipl dem we did a liv iina Adam taim kom chriet baka Muoziz taim, di uol a dem did afi ded.
