Dem did afi ded iivn duo dem neva sin laik ou Adam did sin. Nou Jiizas Krais, di wan we did fi kom, Adam did komiin likl bit laik im

But the free gift is not like the trespass. For if through the trespass of one man many died, then how much more has the grace of God and the free gift by the grace of the one Man, Jesus Christ, abounded to many. |bot di tuu a dem did stil difrant. Adam sin an aal we apm siek-a da sin de difrant fram di gif we Gad did gi wi. Wa Adam did du kaaz sin fi kom iina di worl, an sin kaaz nof piipl fi ded. Di gif we Gad gi, moch moch biga dan dat an it riich nof muor piipl. Iivn duo wi neva dizorv it, Gad sen Jiizas fi ded fi wi sin dem so dat im kuda put tingz rait bitwiin wi an im.

The gift is not like the result that came through the one who sinned. For the judgment from one sin led to condemnation, but the free gift, which came after many trespasses, leads to justification. |Mi wi se it agen, di gif we Gad gi wi fi frii difrant fram wa Adam sin did kaaz. Afta Adam did sin an kaaz sin fi kom iina di worl, Gad joj evribadi an se dem fi get ponish fi di rang we dem du. Bot nou afta nof nof piipl sin Gad shuo ou im gud an kain tu piipl wen im gi dem im gif. Iivn duo dem neva du notn fi dizorv it Gad tek we dem sin dem so dat dem no afi get ponish.

For if by one man’s trespass death reigned through him, then how much more will those who receive abundance of grace and the gift of righteousness reign in life through the One, Jesus Christ.|A chuu se siek-a wan man sin, evribadi did afi ded, bot yu si wa apm siek-a wa Jiizas Krais did du, dat moch moch muor powaful dan we Adam did kaaz. Siek-a wa Jiizas du, Gad shuo wi lov iivn duo wi neva dizorv it. Gad put tingz rait bitwiin im an piipl siek-a wa Jiizas did du an evribadi we Gad mek tingz rait wid a-go ruul wid Jiizas wen dem riich a evn.

Therefore just as through the trespass of one man came condemnation for all men, so through the righteous act of One came justification of life for all men.|So a wan man sin mek Gad joj piipl an se dat dem fi get ponish fi dem sin dem. A siem so a wan man — wan man we aalwiez du we rait, a im mek Gad put tingz rait wid piipl an mek dem liv fi eva an eva.

For just as through one man’s disobedience the many were made sinners, so by the obedience of One the many will be made righteous.|So, kaaz wan man neva du we Gad se im fi du, sin kom iina di worl an siek-a dat evribadi a sina. A siem so, Gad mek tingz rait bitwiin im an piipl kaaz wan man did du we im tel im fi du.

But the law entered, so that sin might increase, but where sin increased, grace abounded much more,|Nou Gad sen di Laa so dat piipl wuda nuo se wa dem a du a sin. Bot wen piipl staat fi sin muor an muor, iivn duo wi neva dizorv it, Gad shuo dem lov muor an muor.

so that just as sin reigned in death, grace might reign through righteousness unto eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord.|Im du dat, so dat, jos laik ou evribadi evriwe did a ded siek-a dem sin, a siem so Gad lov, iivn duo wi neva dizorv it, wuda kaaz piipl fi liv fi eva. Siek-a Gad lov an siek-a wa wi Laad Jiizas Krais du, Gad put tingz rait bitwiin im an piipl an mek dem liv fi eva an eva.
What shall we say then? Shall we continue in sin that grace may increase?|So den wa unu tingk? Unu tingk se wi fi gwaan sin so dat Gad wi shuo wi muor an muor lov, iivn duo wi no dizorv it?

God forbid! How shall we who died to sin live any longer in it?|Nuo sa, notn kyaahn go so! Wen it kom tu sin, a laik a ded wi ded, sin naa no powa uova wi. So ou wi, wi we sin naa no powa uova, ou wi fi a stil liv iina sin?

Do you not know that we who were baptized into Jesus Christ were baptized into His death?|Unu no nuo se wen wi did get baptaiz, wi an Jiizas ton wan? An wen wi did get baptaiz a laik wi did ded siem laik ou im did ded.

Therefore we were buried with Him by baptism into death, that just as Christ was raised up from the dead by the glory of the Father, even so we also should walk in newness of life.|Wen wi did get baptaiz, a laik wi did ded an beri wid Jiizas Krais. Wi did ded an beri wid im so dat siem laik ou di Faada yuuz fi im griet powa an mek Krais Jiizas kom bak alaiv, a siem so im wuda mek wi kom bak alaiv an gi wi wan nyuu laif.

For if we have been united with Him in the likeness of His death, so shall we also be united with Him in the likeness of His resurrection|Kaaz ef wi ded laik ou Jiizas did ded, sins wi an im a wan, wi no wi kom bak alaiv siem laik ou im did kom bak alaiv?

knowing this, that our old man has been crucified with Him, so that the body of sin might be destroyed, and we should no longer be slaves to sin.|Wi nuo se di wie wi yuus tu liv, dat don wid — it ded wid Jiizas pan di kraas. It ded wid im so dat sin wudn av no powa uova wi. It ded wid im so dat sin kudn tek wi fi sliev no muor.
For the one who has died is freed from sin.|Kaaz wen sumadi ded, dem frii; sin kyaahn kanchuol dem no muor.
Now if we died with Christ, we believe that we shall also live with Him|Nou ef wi did ded wid Krais Jiizas, wi biliiv se wi wi liv wid im tu.

knowing that Christ, being raised from the dead, will never die again; death has no further dominion over Him.|Wi nuo dat sins Gad mek Krais Jiizas kom bak alaiv im naa go kyan ded agen — det naa no powa uova im.
For the death He died, He died to sin once for all, but the life He lives, He lives to God.|Wen Jiizas ded, sin luuz aal a it powa fi eva, an di laif we im a liv nou, im a liv fi Gad.

Likewise, you also consider yourselves to be dead to sin, but alive to God through Jesus Christ our Lord.|A siem so unu mos luk pan unuself, wen it kom tu sin, a laik unu ded, sin naa no powa uova unu. An kaaz unu an Krais Jiizas a wan, di laif unu a liv nou, unu a liv fi sorv Gad.

Therefore do not let sin reign in your mortal body, that you should obey it in its lusts. |So unu mosn mek sin ruul uova unu badi no muor. No mek it ruul uova unu, so dat unu wudn du di sitn dem wa unu badi waahn unu fi du.

Do not yield your members to sin as instruments of unrighteousness, but yield yourselves to God, as those who are alive from the dead, and your bodies to God as instruments of righteousness. |No lou no paat a unu fi miks op iina sin. No lou sin fi yuuz unu badi fi du aal kain-a wikidnis. Insted-a dat, gi unu laif tu Gad. A laik unu did ded an Gad mek unu kom bak alaiv an a liv nou. So unu mos gi unuself tu Gad. Gi im evri paat a unu so dat im wi yuuz unu fi du wa rait.

For sin shall not have dominion over you, for you are not under the law, but under grace.|No mek sin kanchuol unu, kaaz unu no afi fala di Laa no muor. Di Laa kyaahn siev unu. Unu get siev kaaz Gad shuo unu lov iivn duo unu neva dizorv it.

What then? Shall we sin because we are not under the law but under grace? God forbid! |Di Laa kyaahn siev wi, so wi no afi fala it. Wi get siev kaaz Gad shuo wi lov iivn duo wi neva dizorv it. So den wa unu tingk dat miin? Unu tingk it miin se wi kyan gwaan liv iina sin? Nuo sa! Notn kyaahn go so!

Do you not know that to whom you yield yourselves as slaves to obey, you are slaves of the one whom you obey, whether of sin leading to death, or of obedience leading to righteousness? |Unu mos nuo se, wen unu tek unuself ton sumadi sliev an se unu a-go fala unu maasta, unu afi du evriting we unu maasta se. Nou unu kyan chuuz fi mek sin unu maasta an ded ar unu kyan mek Gad unu maasta an mek im put tingz rait bitwiin unu an im.

But thanks be to God, for you were slaves of sin, but you have obeyed from the heart that form of teaching to which you were entrusted, |Bot tangk Gad, iivn duo unu a did sin sliev, unu fala wid aal a unu aat, aal a di chuu sitn dem we mi did tiich unu.
and having been freed from sin, you became the slaves of righteousness.|An sins Gad set unu frii fram di powa we sin did av uova unu, unu ton Gad sliev — unu aalwiez du wa rait.

I speak in human terms because of the weakness of your flesh, for just as you have yielded your members as slaves to impurity and iniquity leading to more iniquity, even so now yield your members as slaves to righteousness unto holiness. |(Mi a yuuz sopm outa unu laif, dis uol ting bout sliev an maasta, fi elp unu andastan wa mi a se. Mi no tingk unu wi andastan ef mi no du dat.) Wan taim unu did tek unuself ton sliev tu aal kain-a naasinis an wikidnis — unu gi op evri paat a unu badi fi tek paat iina aal kain-a sin. A siem so nou unu fi tek unuself ton Gad sliev — unu mos gi op evri paat a unu fi du wa rait. Da wie de unu wi riili bi Gad piipl.
For when you were the slaves of sin, you were free from righteousness.|Wen unu a did sin sliev, unu neva bizniz wid wa Gad did waahn unu fi du — unu neva fiil laik se unu did afi du we rait.

What fruit did you have then from the things of which you are now ashamed? The result of those things is death. |An wa unu did get fram ou unu did a liv? Di sitn dem we unu did du an we unu shiem bout nou, wa unu did get fram dem? Di onggl ting dem sitn de du, a kaaz piipl fi ded.

But now, having been freed from sin and having become slaves of God, you have fruit unto holiness, and the end is eternal life. |Bot nou, unu frii. Sin no kanchuol unu no muor. Unu a Gad sliev, unu bilang tu im iina evri wie an im kaaz unu fi liv rait. An kaaz unu a liv rait Gad wi mek unu liv fi eva an eva. Dat a we yu get wen yu mek Gad ruul uova yu.

For the wages of sin is death, but the gift of God is eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord.|So aal sin du a kaaz piipl fi ded. So ef sin a yu maasta dat a aal yu a-go get. Bot wa Gad gi wi, im gi wi fi frii — a wan gif. Wen wi biliiv iina wi Laad Jiizas Krais, wen wi an im ton wan, Gad mek wi liv fi eva an eva.

Do you not know, brothers (for I speak to those who know the law), that the law has dominion over a man as long as he lives? |Breda an sista, mi nuo se unu wi andastan wa mi bout fi se, kaaz aal a unu nuo di Laa. Unu nuo se di Laa av powa uova piipl fi dem uol laif — az lang az dem alaiv, dem afi fala di Laa.

For the woman who has a husband is bound by the law to her husband so long as he lives. But if her husband dies, she is released from the law regarding her husband. |Mek mi shuo unu wa mi miin. Di Laa se ef wan uman marid, az lang az ar ozban stil alaiv shi afi tan wid im. Bot ef ar ozban ded, di Laa se shi frii.

So then, she will be called an adulteress if she marries another man while her husband lives. But if her husband dies, she is free from that law, so that she would not be an adulteress if she marries another man.|So den, ef wan uman go marid wan neda man wen ar ozban stil alaiv, shi a liv iina sin kaaz shi a brok di Laa. Bot ef ar ozban ded, shi frii fi go marid agen. Shi wudn a brok no Laa.

So, my brothers, you also have died to the law through the body of Christ, so that you may be married to another, to Him who has been raised from the dead, so that we may bear fruit for God.|Breda an sista a siem so it go wid unu wen it kom tu di Laa. Wen Jiizas did ded a laik unu did ded wid im, so di Laa naa no powa uova unu. Gad mek Jiizas kom bak alaiv an nou wi bilang tu im. Wi bilang tu Jiizas an siek-a dat wi a sorv Gad wen wi liv rait.

When we were in the flesh, the passions of sin, through the law, worked in our members to bear fruit leading to death.|Wan taim wi did a liv ou wi waahn fi liv — wi did a mek wi badi kanchuol wi. Di sitn dem we wi badi did wel waahn fi du, did a kaaz wi fi sin. An chuu wi did nuo Gad Laa, wi staat fi sin muor an muor. Wid aal a di rang sitn dem we wi did a du a onggl ded wi did a go ded.

But now we are delivered from the law, having died to things in which we were bound, so that we may serve in newness of the Spirit, and not in the oldness of the letter of the law.|Bot nou Gad frii wi fram di Laa. Di Laa did av wi laik prizna bot kaaz wi did ded, wi a no prizna no muor. Nou wi sorv Gad, no wen wi fala di Laa, dat a di uol wie, nou wi sorv im wan nyuu wie. Wi sorv im wen wi liv ou Gad Spirit se wi fi liv.

What shall we say then? Is the law sin? God forbid! But I did not know sin, except through the law. I would not have known coveting if the law had not said, “You shall not covet.”|So den wa wi kyan se? Unu tingk wi kyan se di Laa a sin? Unu tingk wi kyan se it rang? Nuo! Notn kyaahn go so! Ef a neva fi di Laa mi wudn iivn nuo wa sin bi! Mi wudn nuo wa it miin fi red yai ef di Laa neva se, “Unu no fi red yai.”

But sin, taking opportunity through the commandment, produced in me all kinds of coveting. For apart from the law sin is dead. |Siek-a di Laa, sin get a chaans fi stor op aal kain-a sitn iina mi. It mek mi waahn fi du aal a di sitn dem mi no fi du. Ef no Laa neva de, sin wudn av no powa.

I was alive without the law once, but when the commandment came, sin revived, and I died.|Wen mi neva nuo bout di Laa, mi did alaiv. Bot wen mi kom fi nuo wa di Laa se, sin riez op iina mi an mek mi wel waahn fi du di sitn dem mi no fi du
And the commandment, which was intended for life, proved to be death in me. |an a dat mek mi ded. So mi did fain se di siem Laa we Gad sen we did fi kaaz mi fi liv, a it kaaz mi fi ded.
For sin, taking opportunity through the commandment, deceived me and killed me through it.|Siek-a di Laa, sin get a chaans fi chrik mi an it yuuz di Laa fi kil mi.

So then, the law is holy and the commandment is holy and just and good.|So den di Laa kom fram Gad. Evri wan a di ruul dem kom fram Gad. An aal a di ruul dem gud kaaz dem elp piipl an dem tiich piipl wa rait.

Therefore has that which is good become death unto me? God forbid! Rather, sin, that it might be shown to be sin, was working death in me through that which is good, so that sin through the commandment might become exceedingly sinful.|So wa unu tingk mi a se? Unu tingk mi a se di Laa we gud, se a it kaaz mi fi ded? Nuo sa! Notn kyaahn go so! A sin kil mi. An sin shuo wi uu im riili bi wen im tek di Laa, sopm we gud, an yuuz it fi kil mi. So di Laa, it elp wi fi riili si ou torbl sin bi.

We know that the law is spiritual, but I am carnal, sold under sin. |Nou wi nuo di Laa kom fram Gad an dat it afi du wid wi spirit. Bot mi, mi a jos wan man. Mi komiin laik wan sliev. Mi a wan sliev an sin a mi maasta — mi afi du wa it se.

For what I am doing, I do not understand, for I do not practice what I will to do, but I do the very thing I hate.|Mi no andastan di sitn dem we mi a du, kaaz mi naa du di sitn dem we mi waahn fi du. Insted-a dat mi a du di sitn dem we mi iet.
But if I practice what I do not will to do, I agree with the law that it is good. |An ef mi a du di sitn dem we mi no waahn fi du, dat a shuo se mi a se, “Yes, di Laa rait”.
So now it is no longer I that do it, but sin that dwells in me. |So a no riili mi a du dem sopm ya bot a di sin we a liv iina mi a du it.

For I know that in me (that is, in my flesh) dwells no good thing, for the will to do what is right is present with me, but how to perform what is good I do not find.|Mi nuo se notn gud no de iina a mi, mi badi naa go mek mi du we rait. Kaaz mi waahn fi du we gud bot mi kyaahn du it.
For the good I desire to do, I do not do, but the evil I do not want is what I do.|Di gud sitn dem wa mi waahn fi du, mi no du dem. Bot di wikid sitn dem we mi no waahn fi du, a dat mi du.
Now if I do what I do not want, it is no longer I who does it, but sin that lives in me.|So ef mi a du di sitn dem we mi no waahn fi du, a no mi riili a du dem. A di sin we a liv iina mi a du it.
I find then a law that when I desire to do good, evil is present with me. |So mi fain se dis a wa a apm iina mi laif. Wen mi waahn fi du we rait, mi kyan onggl chuuz fi du wa wikid.
For I delight in the law of God according to the inner man|Iina mi aat, mi api bout di Laa we kom fram Gad.

but I see another law in my members, warring against the law of my mind and bringing me into captivity to the law of sin which is in my members. |Bot fi mi badi a fala wan difrant laa, an da laa de a go gens di Laa we iina mi ed. Fi mi badi a fala sin laa, an it av mi laik prizna — mi badi du evriting we it se.
O wretched man that I am! Who will deliver me from the body of this death?|Mi sari iihn, mi a wan sari kies fi chuu! Uu a-go siev mi fram da badi ya we a kil mi?

I thank God through Jesus Christ our Lord.So then, with my mind, I serve the law of God, but with my flesh, the law of sin.|Mi tangk Gad kaaz im wi siev mi an im yuuz wi Laad Jiizas Krais fi du it.So dis a ou tingz stie wid mi: iina mi ed, mi a wan sliev an Gad Laa a mi maasta. Mi waahn fi fala evriting we it se, bot mi badi, a laik sin a fi it maasta an it a fala evriting we sin se it fi du.

There is therefore now no condemnation for those who are in Christ Jesus, who walk not according to the flesh, but according to the Spirit.|So nou, di piipl we biliiv iina Krais Jiizas an we ton wan wid im, Gad naa go luk pan dem an se dem gilti an mos get ponish.

For the law of the Spirit of life in Christ Jesus has set me free from the law of sin and death. |Kaaz di Spirit we riili gi laif an we kaaz wi fi ton wan wid Krais Jiizas, da Spirit de set wi frii. Im set wi frii fram di laa we kaaz piipl fi sin an ded.

For what the law could not do, in that it was weak through the flesh, God did by sending His own Son in the likeness of sinful flesh, and concerning sin, He condemned sin in the flesh|Wi aat so ful op a sin wi kudn fala aal we di Laa se an so di Laa kudn siev wi. Bot Gad du we di Laa kudn du. Gad tek im Bwai Pikni ton im iina wan man, gi im wan badi siem laik fi wi uon we wuda waahn fi sin, an sen im kom a ort fi ded fi wi sin dem.

in order that the righteous requirement of the law might be fulfilled in us, who walk not according to the flesh but according to the Spirit.|Gad du dat, so dat aal a wi we a liv ou im Spirit se wi fi liv an uu naa du di sitn dem we wi badi waahn fi du, aal a wi wuda a du di sitn dem we di Laa se it rait fi wi du.

For those who live according to the flesh set their minds on the things of the flesh, but those who live according to the Spirit, the things of the Spirit. |Di piipl dem we a liv ou dem badi waahn dem fi liv, dem a mek dem badi kanchuol dem. Dem kyan onggl tingk wa dem badi waahn dem fi tingk. Bot di piipl dem we liv ou di Spirit se dem fi liv, dem a mek Gad Spirit kanchuol dem. Dem tingk ou Gad Spirit se dem fi tingk.

To be carnally minded is death, but to be spiritually minded is life and peace|Nou, ef yu onggl a tingk bout di sitn dem we yu badi waahn fi du, yu a-go ded. Bot ef aal yu a tingk bout a di sitn dem we Gad Spirit waahn yu fi du, Gad wi mek yu riili liv an gi yu piis iina yu aat.

for the carnal mind is hostile toward God, for it is not subject to the law of God, nor indeed can it be|So ef sumadi onggl a tingk bout di sitn dem we dem badi waahn, dem ton Gad enimi. Dem ton im enimi kaaz dem naa fala im Laa, an dem naa go kyan fala it niida.
and those who are in the flesh cannot please God.|Di piipl dem we a liv ou dem badi waahn dem fi liv, dem kyaahn mek Gad api.

You, however, are not in the flesh but in the Spirit, if indeed the Spirit of God lives in you. Now if any man does not have the Spirit of Christ, he does not belong to Him.|Bot yu si unu, unu naa liv ou unu badi waahn unu fi liv. Unu a liv ou di Spirit se unu fi liv, dat a ef Gad Spirit riili de iina unu. Nou di piipl we no av Krais Jiizas Spirit a liv iina dem, dem no bilang tu Gad.

And if Christ is in you, though the body is dead because of sin, the Spirit is alive because of righteousness. |Bot ef Krais Jiizas a liv iina unu, di Spirit wi kaaz unu fi liv. Unu badi a-go ded kaaz a unu sin bot unu spirit a-go liv. Krais Jiizas mek unu liv kaaz Gad put tingz rait bitwiin unu an im.

But if the Spirit of Him who raised Jesus from the dead lives in you, He who raised Christ from the dead will also give life to your mortal bodies through His Spirit that lives in you.|A Gad Spirit mek Jiizas kom bak alaiv. So den, ef Gad Spirit a liv iina unu, siem laik ou it mek Jiizas kom bak alaiv a siem so Gad wi yuuz im Spirit fi mek fi wi badi kom bak alaiv afta wi ded.

Therefore, brothers, we are debtors not to the flesh, to live according to the flesh.|So den breda an sista, wi afi liv ou Gad Spirit waahn wi fi liv. Wi no fi fala wi badi, an liv ou it waahn wi fi liv.

For if you live according to the flesh, you will die, but if through the Spirit you put to death the deeds of the body, you will live.|(Ef yu liv ou yu badi wuda waahn yu fi liv, yu mos ded.) Bot ef yu mek di Spirit elp yu, yu kyan tap du di sitn dem we yu badi waahn yu fi du, an den yu wi liv.
For as many as are led by the Spirit of God, these are the sons of God. |Kaaz a onggl di piipl dem we mek Gad Spirit liid dem, a Gad pikni.

For you have not received the spirit of slavery again to fear. But you have received the Spirit of adoption, by whom we cry, “Abba, Father.” |Kaaz Gad neva gi unu wan Spirit we ton unu iina sliev an kaaz unu fi fried. Di Spirit we Gad gi wi, mek wi im pikni an a da Spirit de mek wi kyan taak tu Gad an kaal im “Faada, fi mi Faada.”
The Spirit Himself bears witness with our spirits that we are the children of God
column2: Gad Spirit an fi wi Spirit jain op tugeda an se dat wi a Gad pikni.

column1: and if children, then heirs: heirs of God and joint-heirs with Christ, if indeed we suffer with Him, that we may also be glorified with Him.|So sins wi a Gad pikni, wi a-go get aal a di sitn dem we Gad pudong fi bles im piipl wid. An no jos dat, aal a we Gad pudong fi Krais Jiizas, im a-go shier it wid wi. Kaaz ef wi sofa laik ou Krais Jiizas did sofa, wi no wi get big op laik im an get aal a di nais sitn dem we im a-go get tu.

For I consider that the sufferings of this present time are not worthy to be compared with the glory which shall be revealed to us. |Aal di sofa wi a sofa nou, mi shuor se notn wi go chuu kyan mach op tu aal a wa Gad a-go gi wi lieta.
The eager expectation of the creation waits for the appearance of the sons of God. |Az a matarafak, evriting we Gad mek, a did fi Gad shuo dem a uu im pikni dem bi.

For the creation was subjected to futility, not willingly, but by the will of Him who subjected it, in hope |Gad mek it so dat non a di sitn dem we im mek kuda du wa im mek dem fi du. A no dat di sitn dem we im mek did waahn, bot a dat Gad mek op im main fi du. Gad did du dat so dat di sitn dem we im mek wuda luk
that the creation itself also will be set free from its slavery to corruption into the glorious freedom of the children of God.
column2: fi im kom frii dem an mek it so dat dem wudn ded an ratn. Gad wuda frii dem an gi dem aal a wa im av pudong fi im pikni dem.

column1: We know that the whole creation groans and travails in pain together until now.|Kaaz wi nuo se aal nou, evriting we Gad mek, a muon an a gruon tugeda. Evriting we Gad mek a fiil pien laik ou uman fiil pien wen shi a av biebi.

Not only that, but we also, who have the first fruits of the Spirit, groan within ourselves while eagerly waiting for adoption, the redemption of our bodies.|An a no jos dem a muon an a gruon, wi we av Gad Spirit a liv iina a wi, di Spirit we a di fos gif Gad gi wi, wi a muon an a gruon tu. Bot wi naa gruon out loud, wi a gruon insaida wiself. Wi a gruon kaaz wi a ded fi Gad frii wi fram da badi ya an gi wi wan nyuu wan an riili mek wi im pikni iina evri wie.

For we are saved through hope, but hope that is seen is not hope, for why does a man still hope for what he sees?|Wi did get siev kaaz a wa wi biliiv — wi biliiv an wi a luk fi Gad gi wi aal we im pramis wi. Bot ef wi did get aal we im pramis aredi wi wudn niid fi biliiv. Kaaz wich wan a wi wuda sidong a wiet an a luk fi get sopm we wi get aredi?
But if we hope for what we do not see, we wait for it with patience.|Bot ef wi no get aal we wi a luk fi get yet, wi wi sidong an wiet an no muuv til wi get it.

Likewise, the Spirit helps us in our weaknesses, for we do not know what to pray for as we ought, but the Spirit Himself intercedes for us with groanings too deep for words. |An siem taim dat a gwaan, Gad Spirit a elp wi kaaz wi wiik. Wen wi no nuo ou wi fi prie, di Spirit prie tu Gad fi wi. Di Spirit muon an gruon an se tingz we wi no nuo ou fi se.

He who searches the hearts knows what the mind of the Spirit is, because He intercedes for the saints according to the will of God.|An Gad we kyan luk iina wi aat an nuo wa wi riili waahn, im andastan we di Spirit a se. Kaaz di Spirit prie fi Gad piipl an wen im prie im prie jos laik ou Gad waahn im fi prie.

We know that all things work together for good to those who love God, to those who are called according to His purpose.|Wi nuo se aal di piipl we lov Gad an we Gad kaal fi tek paat iina im plan, wi nuo se Gad wok wid dem fi mek shuor se no mata wa apm, evriting wok out fi fi dem gud.

For those whom He foreknew, He predestined to be conformed to the image of His Son, so that He might be the firstborn among many brothers. |Kaaz di piipl we Gad pik iivn bifuo im mek di worl, im maak dem. Im maak dem fi ton laik im Bwai Pikni, so dat im Bwai Pikni wuda bi di fos outa aal a im pikni dem.

And those whom He predestined, He also called; and those whom He called, He also justified; and those whom He justified, He also glorified.|An di piipl we Gad maak, im kaal fi bi im piipl. An di piipl we im kaal, Gad put tingz rait bitwiin im an dem. An di piipl we Gad put tingz rait wid, Gad wi mek dem muor an muor laik im.
What then shall we say to these things? If God is for us, who can be against us? |So den wa wi kyan se bout aal a dis? Ef Gad de wid wi, uu kyan kom gens wi?

He who did not spare His own Son, but delivered Him up for us all, how shall He not with Him also freely give us all things?|Gad neva tap im uona Bwai Pikni fram sofa. Im gi im op an sen im fi ded fi wi. Nou ef Gad gi op im Bwai Pikni fi wi, unu no tingk im wi muor dan gi wi evriting els?
Who shall bring a charge against God’s elect? It is God who justifies.
column2: Uu kyan joj di piipl we Gad pik an se dat dem gilti? A Gad wan kyan joj piipl! A Gad wan kyan put tingz rait bitwiin im an piipl.

column1: Who is he who condemns? It is Christ who died, yes, who is risen, who is also at the right hand of God, who also intercedes for us.|So den uu kyan joj di piipl we Gad pik an se dat dem gilti? Nobadi! Nobadi kyaahn du dat! Jiizas Krais we did ded an kom bak alaiv an uu sidong a Gad rait an, a taak tu Gad an a beg fi wi.

Who shall separate us from the love of Christ? Shall tribulation, or distress, or persecution, or famine, or nakedness, or peril, or sword?|So den wa kyan mek Krais Jiizas tap lov wi? Ef chobl tek wi an pien lik wi, ef wi naa no fuud, no kluoz, notn, ef wi sofa siek-a wa wi biliiv, ef piipl chretn wi ar iivn ef dem kil wi, unu tingk se dat miin Krais Jiizas tap lov wi?

As it is written:“For Your sake we are killed all day long;we are counted as sheep for the slaughter.”|It rait dong iina Gad wod se:“Kaaz wi bilang tu yu, piipl chrai fi kil wi aal di taim;dem chriit wi laik shiip we dem plan fi kil.”
No, in all these things we are more than conquerors through Him who loved us.|Bot no mata we apm ar wa wi go chuu, Krais Jiizas, di wan we lov wi wi kaaz wi fi muor dan win.

For I am persuaded that neither death nor life, neither angels nor principalities nor powers, neither things present nor things to come|Kaaz mi nuo fi shuor se notn at aal kyan mek Krais Jiizas tap lov wi. It no mata ef wi ded ar wi alaiv, im naa tap lov wi. No ienjel, ruula ar powa iina evn kyan tap im fram lov wi. Notn we a apm nou an notn we a-go apm, wi mek im tap lov wi.

neither height nor depth, nor any other created thing, shall be able to separate us from the love of God, which is in Christ Jesus our Lord.|Mi nuo fi shuor se, notn we de wie op iina di skai ar we de anda di ort kyan mek im tap lov wi. Az a matarafak, notn we Gad mek, notn at aal kyan tek we di lov we kom fram Gad an we Krais Jiizas shuo wi.

I am speaking the truth in Christ, I am not lying; my conscience testifies with me in the Holy Spirit|Mi a taak di chuut; mi bilang tu Krais Jiizas an mi naa lai. Di Uoli Spirit kanchuol fi mi kanchens an mi kanchens naa bada mi. So mi nuo fi shuor se mi a taak di chuut wen mi se
that I have great sorrow and continual anguish in my heart.
column2: mi sad so til mi waahn baal. Mi aat no tap pien mi

column1: For I could wish that I myself were accursed from Christ for my brothers, my kinsmen by race|wen mi tingk bout fi mi piipl, di piipl we kom fram fi mi konchri, Izrel. Fi fi dem siek mi wish se a did mi. Mi wish se a did mi Gad joj an se fi ded an we no bilang tu Krais Jiizas no muor. Di piipl we kom fram fi mi konchri,

who are Israelites, to whom belong the adoption, the glory, the covenants, the giving of the law, the service of God, and the promises|di Izrel piipl, a dem Gad did pik fi bi im pikni. Gad shuo dem ou big, brait an powaful im bi an a dem Gad mek nof diil wid — im pramis fi gi dem nof sitn ef dem du wa im se. Gad mek nof pramis tu dem, an im gi dem di Laa. Gad aal shuo dem ou fi riili worship im.

to whom belong the patriarchs, and from whom, according to the flesh, is Christ, who is over all, God forever blessed. Amen.|Di Izrel piipl, dem a di pikni fi di uol taim liida dem — di liida dem we Gad did pik an we a did di ed fi di difrant difrant chraib dem. A fi dem fambili Krais Jiizas kom fram. Mek evribadi priez Gad, Gad we ruul uova evriting, fi eva an eva. Iemen!

It is not as though the word of God has failed. For they are not all Israel who are descended from Israel|Mi naa se Gad brok im pramis dem — Gad du evriting we im pramis fi du, bot a no evribadi we baan iina Izrel a riili Gad piipl.

nor are they all children because they are descendants of Abraham, but “In Isaac shall your descendants be called.”|Siem laik ou a no evribadi we kom fram Iebriyam fambili a riili Gad piipl. Gad did tel Iebriyam se, “Mi onggl a kount Aizak pikni dem an fi dem pikni pikni go dong, a dem a-go bi fi mi piipl.”

So those who are the children of the flesh are not the children of God, but the children of the promise are counted as descendants.|Dat miin se a no evribadi we baan iina Iebriyam fambili Gad tek fi im pikni. Gad did pramis Iebriyam se im wuda av wan pikni. Da pikni de a Aizak, so a onggl di piipl we kom fram Aizak fambili Gad tek fi fi im piipl.

For this is the word of promise, “At this time I will come, and Sarah shall have a son.”|Kaaz wen Gad did mek di pramis tu Iebriyam im did se, “Bout da taim ya neks ier, mi wi kom bak an Siera wi av wan bwai pikni.”

Not only that, but Rebekah also had conceived by one man, our father Isaac. |An a no jos dat, memba wa apm tu Ribeka tuu bwai pikni dem. Di tuu a dem a did Aizak pikni — Aizak fi wi faada faada go bak.

For before the children had been born, having done neither evil nor good, so that the purpose of God according to election might stand, not of works, but through Him who calls|Bifuo Aizak bwai pikni dem did baan, bifuo eni a dem kuda du notn gud ar bad, Gad pik wan fi ruul uova di ada wan. Gad pik im bifuo im baan fi shuo se a no notn we im did du mek Gad pik im — Gad pik uu im waahn fi pik fi du we im waahn im fi du.
it was said to her, “The elder shall serve the younger.”|So bifuo di bwai pikni dem did baan, Gad se tu Ribeka se “Di bwai pikni we uolda, im a-go sorv di yongga wan.”
As it is written, “Jacob I have loved, but Esau I have hated.”|It aal rait dong iina Gad wod se Gad se, “Mi did pik Jiekob, mi neva pik Iisaa.”
What shall we say then? Is there unrighteousness with God? God forbid!
column2: So den wa unu tingk bout dat? Unu tingk wi kyan se dat Gad no fier? Nuo Sa! Notn kyaahn go so! ”

column1: For He says to Moses,“I will have mercy on whom I have mercy,and I will have compassion on whom I have compassion.”|Gad tel Muoziz se,“Mi wi gud an kain tu uu mi waahn fi gud an kain tu,an mi wi tek piti pan uu mi waahn fi tek piti pan.

So then it is not of him who wills, nor of him who runs, but of God who shows mercy. |So den Gad no pik piipl bies pan wa dem waahn ar pan we dem du; Gad pik piipl bies pan uu im waahn fi gud an kain tu.

For the Scripture says to Pharaoh, “For this very purpose I have raised you up, that I may show My power in you, and that My name may be proclaimed in all the earth.”|Iina Gad wod it rait dong se Gad se tu Fiero se, “Dis a wai mi mek yu ton king: mi mek yu ton king so dat mi kuda yuuz yu fi shuo piipl ou powaful mi bi an so dat piipl aal uova di worl wuda nuo bout mi.”

Therefore He has mercy on whom He wills, and He hardens whom He wills.|So den Gad gud an kain tu uu im waahn fi gud an kain tu an ef im waahn fi mek sumadi ton dem aat gens im, im wi mek dem ton dem aat gens im.

You will then say to me, “Why does He yet find fault? For who can resist His will?” |So wan a unu a-go aks mi se, “Ef a so Gad du tingz, ou im fi bliem wi wen wi du rang? Uu kyan du notn bot wa Gad waahn dem fi du?”

Rather, O man, who are you to answer back to God? Shall the thing formed say to him who formed it, “Why have you made me like this?”|So wiet, a uu unu tingk unu bi? Unu we a jos man, wa mek unu tingk se unu kyan chat bak tu Gad? “Di klie pat kyan ton roun an aks di sumadi we mek it, ‘Wa mek yu mek mi so?’ ”

Does the potter not have power over the clay to make from the same lump one vessel for honor and another for dishonor?|Di sumadi we a mek di pat, im no av di rait fi tek piis a klie an mek wan speshal pat we im yuuz sortn an sortn taim, an den tek wan neda piis a klie an mek wan pat fi yuuz evridie?

What if God, willing to show His wrath and to make His power known, endured with much patience the vessels of wrath prepared for destruction|Gad did waahn fi shuo piipl se im beks, im did waahn dem fi nuo umoch powa im av. Bot im tek taim wid dem an put op wid di siem piipl we did a beks im; di piipl we im did redi fi waip out.

in order to make known the riches of His glory on the vessels of mercy, which He previously prepared for glory,|Gad tek taim wid dem kaaz im did waahn fi shuo dem ou big, brait an powaful im bi. Im did waahn dem, di piipl we im gud an kain tu, fi si se dem a-go ton laik im. Im did waahn dem, di piipl we im pik an get redi fram lang taim, fi si se im a-go mek dem ton laik im.
even us, whom He has called, not from the Jews only, but also from the Gentiles?|Wi a dem piipl de. Gad kaal wi, an a no jos piipl we a Juu im kaal, im kaal piipl we a no Juu tu.

As indeed He says in Hosea:“I will call those who were not My people, ‘My people,’and her who was not beloved, ‘Beloved,’ ”|Iina di buk we Ozeya rait, it rait dong se Gad se:“Di piipl we neva bilang tu mi,mi a-go kaal dem ‘Fi mi piipl.’An di piipl we kom fram difrant difrant konchri an we mi neva lov,mi a-go kaal dem ‘Mi lov.’

and,“In the place where it was said to them,‘You are not My people,’there they shall be called ‘sons of the living God.’ ”|An siem plies wich paat Gad se tu dem se, ‘Unu a no fi mi pikni’a da siem plies de Gad, Gad we alaiv, a-go kaal dem im pikni.”

Isaiah also cries out concerning Israel:“Though the number of the children of Israel be like the sand of the sea,a remnant shall be saved.|An dis a wa Aizaiya did se bout Izrel:“Iivn duo di Izrel piipl nof laik di san we de a sii-said,a onggl likl bit a dem a-go get siev.
For He will finish the work, and cut it short in righteousness,because the Lord will make a quick work upon the earth.”|Kaaz suun Gad a-go joj di uol worl;im a-go joj dem aad an it a-go apm faas.”

And as Isaiah previously said:“Unless the Lord of Hostshad left us a seed,we would have become like Sodom,and been made like Gomorrah.”|A jos laik wa Aizaiya did se wie bak wen. Im se:“Ef di Laad we av aal a di powa,neva lou som a wi faada faada dem go bak, fi liv,wi wuda don fa. Wi wuda komiin laik Sadam an Gomara.”

What shall we say then? The Gentiles, who did not pursue righteousness, have attained righteousness, even the righteousness which is by faith|So den wa wi kyan se bout aal a dat? Wi kyan se dat di piipl we a no Juu, dem neva did a luk fi Gad put tingz rait wid dem, bot Gad mek tingz rait bitwiin im an dem kaaz dem chos iina im.

but Israel, pursuing the law of righteousness, did not attain the law of righteousness. |Bot Izrel, di piipl we Gad pik, dem di a luk fi wan laa we wuda put dem rait wid Gad. Bot dem neva fain it so dem neva get put rait wid im.

Why not? Because they did not seek it by faith, but by the works of the law. For they stumbled over the stumbling stone. |Ou kom? Ou kom dem neva fain it? Dem neva fain it kaaz dem di uop se di sitn dem we dem did a du wuda mek Gad put tingz rait wid dem. Dem did a du dat insted-a chos Gad fi siev dem. Dem chrip an faal dong. Dem chrip uova di stuon we de de fi kaaz piipl fi faal dong.

As it is written:“Look! I lay in Zion a stumbling stoneand rock of offense,and whoever believes in Him will not be ashamed.”|A dat Gad wod did a taak bout. It rait dong se Gad se:“Lisn Gud! Mi a put wan stuon iina Zaiyan we a-go chrip piipl —wan stuon we a-go kaaz piipl fi faal dong.Bot di piipl we biliiv iina mi, mi naa go mek dem shiem.”
Brothers, my heart’s desire and prayer to God for Israel is that they may be saved.|Breda an sista, wid aal a mi aat mi a uop an a prie tu Gad se fi mi piipl, di piipl a Izrel, wi get siev.

For I testify about them that they have a zeal for God, but not according to knowledge.|Kaaz mi kyan tel unu fi shuor se dem wel waahn fi sorv Gad. Bot dem no andastan se wa dem a du no lain op wid di chuut.

For, being ignorant of God’s righteousness and seeking to establish their own righteousness, they did not submit to the righteousness of God. |Dem neva waahn fi andastan di wie Gad mek tingz rait bitwiin im an piipl, so dem go chrai fain dem uona wie fi mek tingz rait wid Gad; dem neva tek Gad wie fi mek tingz rait bitwiin im an dem.
Christ is the end of the law unto righteousness for every one who believes.
column2: Bot Krais Jiizas mek it so dat wi no afi fala di Laa no muor; Gad wi mek tingz rait bitwiin im an enibadi we biliiv iina Krais Jiizas.

column1: For Moses writes about the righteousness which is based on the law: “The man who does those things shall live by them.”|Di piipl dem we fala di Laa so dat Gad wuda put tingz rait bitwiin im an dem, dis a wa Muoziz did rait bout dem: “Ef sumadi du evriting we di Laa se, di Laa wi mek dem liv.”

But the righteousness which is based on faith says, “Do not say in your heart, ‘Who will ascend into heaven?’ ” (that is, to bring Christ down)|Bot dis a wa Gad wod se bout di piipl we get put rait wid Gad kaaz dem biliiv, it se: “No bada tingk tu unuself, ‘A uu a-go go op iina evn?’” (an wen unu a tingk dat, wa unu miin se, a uu a-go go op iina evn an aks Krais Jiizas fi kom dong kom siev wi.)

or, ‘Who will descend into the deep?’ ”  (that is, to bring Christ up from the dead).|"No aks niida, ‘A uu a-go go dong wich paat di ded piipl dem spirit de?’” (An wen unu a aks dat, wa unu riili a aks a uu a-go go dong de go tek Krais Jiizas fram mongks di ded piipl an bring im bak op ya.)

But what does it say? “The word is near you, in your mouth and in your heart.” This is the word of faith that we preach:|Wa els Gad wod se? It se: “Gad mesij de kluos tu unu, it de iina unu mout an iina unu aat.” A da siem mesij de wi a priich; di mesij we se yu afi chos Gad.

that if you confess with your mouth Jesus is Lord, and believe in your heart that God has raised Him from the dead, you will be saved|Kaaz ef yu se wid yu uona mout infronta piipl dat “Jiizas a Laad” an ef yu biliiv iina yu aat se Gad mek im kom bak alaiv, yu wi get siev.

for with the heart one believes unto righteousness, and with the mouth confession is made unto salvation.|Kaaz yu biliiv wid yu aat an wen yu biliiv, Gad wi mek tingz rait bitwiin yu an im; an wen yu se infronta piipl se yu biliiv iina Krais Jiizas, yu wi get siev.
For the Scripture says, “Whoever believes in Him will not be ashamed.”|Jos laik Gad wod se, “Nobadi we put dem chos iina im a-go shiem,”

For there is no distinction between Jew and Greek, for the same Lord over all is generous toward all who call upon Him.|an dat go fi di Juu dem an di piipl we a no Juu tu. Di siem sitn go fi di tuu a dem kaaz di tuu a dem av di siem Laad, an di Laad bles nof nof enibadi we kaal pan im.
For, “Everyone who calls on the name of the Lord shall be saved.”|Kaaz “Enibadi we kaal pan di Laad niem wi get siev.”

How then shall they call on Him in whom they have not believed? And how shall they believe in Him of whom they have not heard? And how shall they hear without a preacher? |Bot ef dem no biliiv iina im, ou dem fi kaal pan im? An ou dem fi biliiv iina im ef dem neva ier di mesij bout im? Ou dem fi ier ef sumadi no go priich tu dem?

And how shall they preach unless they are sent? As it is written: “How beautiful are the feet of those who preach the gospel of peace, who bring good news of good things!”|An ef nobadi no sen dem, ou dem fi go priich tu nobadi? Jos laik it se iina Gad wod, “A wan gud gud sopm wen Gad mesinja dem kom priich di Gud Nyuuz.”

But they have not all obeyed the gospel. For Isaiah says, “Lord, who has believed our report?”|Bot a no evribadi did biliiv an fala wa di Gud Nyuuz se. Laik Aizaiya did se “Laad, mi priich yu mesij, bot uu biliiv it?”
So then faith comes by hearing, and hearing by the word of God. |So den, piipl kyan onggl kom fi biliiv wen dem ier di mesij, an dem kyan onggl ier, ef sumadi go priich tu dem bout Krais Jiizas.

But I say, have they not heard? Yes, indeed:“Their voice went into all the earth,and their words to the ends of the world.”|So mek mi aks unu sopm, di Juu dem, dem neva ier? Dem no mos did ier! It rait iina Gad wod se,“Fi dem vais riich evri paat a di ort,an piipl aal uova di worl ier di wod we dem priich.”

But I say, did Israel not know? First, Moses says:“I will make you jealous by those who are not a nation,and by a foolish nation I will anger you.”|So den mek mi aks unu sopm els: Di Izrel piipl dem, a andastan dem neva andastan? Dem did andastan, yes, bot dem neva waahn fi fala wa dem ier. Fos, Muoziz did tel dem we Gad did se. Gad se,“Mi a-go du tingz fi di piipl dem we a no Juu, we a-go kaaz unu fi bad main dem;an unu a-go beks kaaz a wa mi du fi di piipl we unu tingk fuul-fuul.”

And Isaiah is very bold and says:“I was found by those who did not seekMe;I revealed myself to those who did not ask for Me.”|Den Aizaiya tel dem plien plien we Gad did se, im tel dem se Gad se,“Di piipl we neva did a luk fi mi, a dem fain mi;di piipl we neva did a aks fi mi, a dem mi mek nuo mi.”

But to Israel He says:“All day long I have stretched out My handsto a disobedient and contrary people.”|Dat a wa im se bout di piipl we a no Juu, bot dis a wa im se bout di Izrel piipl dem,“Uol die lang, mi av mi an dem uopm,redi fi welkom dem piipl ya we naa fala wa mi se an we eva a go gens mi.”

I say then, has God rejected His people? God forbid! For I also am an Israelite, a descendant of Abraham, of the tribe of Benjamin. |So den mek mi aks unu sopm, unu tingk se a waahn Gad no waahn im piipl no muor? No sa! Notn no go so! Kaaz mi a wan Izrelait tu, mi a wan a Iebriyam fambili an mi kom fram Benjamin chraib.

God has not rejected His people whom He foreknew. Do you not know what the Scripture says of Elijah? How he pleads with God against Israel, saying|Gad no ton im bak pan im piipl — di piipl we im pik fram bifuo im mek di worl! Unu no memba wa Gad wod se did apm wen Ilaija go komplien tu Gad bout aal we di Izrel piipl did a du? Ilaija se

“Lord, they have killed Your prophets and destroyed Your altars. I alone am left, and they seek my life”?|“Laad, dem kil aaf yu prafit dem, dem mash op yu alta dem; a mi wan lef an dem a luk fi kil mi!”

But what is the divine reply to him? “I have kept for Myself seven thousand men, who have not bowed the knee to Baal.”|Bot wa Gad did tel im? Gad tel im se, “Mi kip fi miself, sevn touzn piipl we neva go dong pan dem nii an worship Bieyal.”

So then at this present time there is a remnant according to the election of grace.|A siem so nou, iina dem taim ya, yu av wan sumaal gruup a piipl we Gad pik kaaz im mek op im main fi shuo dem lov iivn wen dem no dizorv it.

And if by grace, then it is no longer by works; otherwise grace would no longer be grace. But if it is by works, then is it no longer by grace; otherwise work would no longer be work.|A no notn we dem du mek im pik dem, im pik dem kaaz im mek op im main fi shuo dem lov iivn wen dem no dizorv it. Ef a neva so it go, ef Gad did a pik piipl bies pan wa dem du, den a no gud an kain im wuda a gud an kain tu piipl.

What then? Israel has not obtained what it was seeking. But the elect obtained it, and the rest were hardened.|So den, wa wi kyan jraa fram aal a dat? Di sitn dem we di Izrel piipl did a luk fa aad aad, dem neva fain it, bot di piipl we Gad pik, dem did fain it. Di res a dem, Gad mek dem ton dem aat gens im.

As it is written:“God has given them a spirit of slumber,eyes that would not seeand ears that would not hear,to this very day.”|A siem so it rait iina Gad wod se,“Gad mek it so dat dem kyaahn fiil ar andastan notn;dem av yai we kyaahn sian iez we kyaahn ier,an tu da die ya, a so dem tan.”

And David says:“Let their table become a snare and a trap,a stumbling block and a retribution to them.|An Dievid did se,“Mi prie se Gad wi set wan chrap fi dem an kech dem wen dem a av dem big big iit op.Gad, mek dem faal dong an ponish dem fi di rang we dem du;
Let their eyes be darkened, so that they may not see,and always bow down their backs.”|mek dem yai daak so dat dem kyaahn si an fiks dembak mek dem ben uova fi eva.”

I say then, have they stumbled that they should fall? God forbid! But through their transgression salvation has come to the Gentiles, to make them jealous.|So mek mi aks unu dis: wen di Juu dem did faal dong, unu tingk se dem did jrap so faar dat dem kudn kom bak? Nuo sa, notn no go so! Bot kaaz dem did sin, Gad mek it so dat di piipl dem we a no Juu kuda get siev, an im du dat fi mek di Izrel piipl dem jelos.

Now if their transgression means riches for the world, and their failure means riches for the Gentiles, how much more will their fullness mean?|So, wen di Juu dem did a sin, Gad bles di worl wid nof nof gud sitn. Wen dem neva fala wa im se dem fi du an luuz out pan aal we im did av fi dem, Gad bles di piipl dem we a no Juu nof nof. So ef Gad du aal a dat wen di Juu dem did ton dem bak pan im, unu no tingk se im a-go bles piipl nof nof muor wen di Juu dem kom bak kom biliiv iina im?

For I am speaking to you Gentiles. Inasmuch as I am the apostle to the Gentiles, I magnify my ministry|Aal di piipl we a no Juu, mi a taak tu unu nou: mi a di apasl we Gad sen fi priich tu di piipl we a no Juu, an mi tingk da wok de wel impuotant, so mi tek it siiros.

if somehow I may make my kinsmen jealous and may save some of them.|Mi tek it siiros kaaz mi uop se wa mi a du wi mek som a fi mi piipl, di Juu dem, jelos an waahn wa unu av, da wie de som a dem wi get siev.

For if their rejection means the reconciliation of the world, what will their acceptance mean but life from the dead?|Kaaz ef wen Gad did ton we fram dem, im mek it so dat di piipl iina di worl kuda ton im pikni, wa unu tingk a-go apm wen im tek dem bak? Wen Gad tek bak di Juu dem fi bi im piipl, it a-go komiin laik se dem did ded an im mek dem kom bak alaiv.

If the first portion of the dough is holy, the batch is also holy. And if the root is holy, so are the branches.|Nou ef yu gi di fos paat a di bred tu Gad, a riili gi yu a gi im di uol a di bred; an ef yu gi op di ruut paat a wan chrii tu Gad, yu a gi im di branch dem tu.

But if some of the branches were broken off, and you, being a wild olive shoot, were grafted in among them and became a partaker with them of the root and richness of the olive tree,|Bot ef som a di branch dem brok aaf, an dem tek unu, unu we a wan wail piis a aliv shuut, an bod di aliv chrii so dat unu kyan liv aafa di gud sitn dem we kom fram di ruut

do not boast against the branches. If you boast, remember you do not sustain the root, but the root sustains you.|unu kyaahn a gwaan laik se unu beta dan di branch dem. Bot ef eni a unu waahn fi brag an buos, jos memba se a no unu a sopuot di ruut bot a di ruut a sopuot unu.
You will say then, “The branches were broken off, so that I might be grafted in.”|Wen unu memba dat unu wi se, “Di branch dem did afi brok aaf, fi mek ruum fi mi.”

This is correct. They were broken off because of unbelief, but you stand by faith. Do not be arrogant, but fear.|Nou dat a di chuut. Dem did get brok aaf kaaz dem neva biliiv bot kaaz unu biliiv unu a go tan wich paat unu de. Bot no mek dat get tu unu ed, insted-a dat unu beta wach unuself!
For if God did not spare the natural branches, neither will He spare you.|Kaaz ef Gad did chap aaf di branch dem we did a gruo pan di chrii, im wi chap unu aaf tu.

Therefore consider the goodness and severity of God—severity toward those who fell, but goodness toward you, if you continue in His goodness. Otherwise, you also will be cut off. |Unu fi tek nuot a dis! Gad kain bot im aad tu. Di piipl we sin an tap biliiv iina im, im chriit dem aad, bot im kain tu unu, an im wi gwaan kain tu unu ef unu gwaan chos iina im. Bot ef unu tap chos iina im, im wi kot unu aaf tu.

And these also, if they do not remain in unbelief, will be grafted in, for God is able to graft them in again. |An iivn dem we Gad did kot aaf, ef dem chienj dem wiez an staat biliiv, im wi tek dem an bod dem bak iin, kaaz Gad av di powa fi put dem bak pan di chrii.

For if you were cut out of the olive tree which is wild by nature, and were grafted contrary to nature into a cultivated olive tree, how much more will these, who are the natural branches, be grafted into their own olive tree?|Unu kom fram wan wail aliv chrii an Gad tek unu an bod unu pan wan aliv chrii we im did plaant. Nou it no naamal fi tek di branch aafa wan kain-a chrii an put it pan wan neda kain-a chrii bot a dat Gad did du. Nou ef Gad kyan du dat, im no kyan muor dan tek di branch dem we im did brok aaf an bod dem bak pan di chrii we dem did kom fram?

For I do not want you to be ignorant of this mystery, brothers, lest you be wise in your own estimation, for a partial hardening has come upon Israel until the fullness of the Gentiles has come in. |Breda an sista mi waahn unu fi andastan da siikrit ya we piipl neva nuo bout bifuo. Mi waahn unu fi andastan it so dat unu no get ful-a unuself an tingk se unu waiz: Di Izrel piipl dem mek op dem main se dem naa biliiv iina Jiizas, bot dat naa go gwaan fi eva. It a-go tap wen aal a di piipl dem we a no Juu an we Gad did pik kom fi biliiv iina im.

And so all Israel will be saved, as it is written:“The Deliverer will come out of Zion,and He will remove ungodliness from Jacob”;|An so aal a di Izrel piipl a-go get siev, a siem so it rait dong iina Gad wod se:“Di wan we siev piipl a-go kom outa Zaiyan;An Jiekob fambili, di Izrel piipl, im a-go tek aal a di wikidnis outa dem aat.
“for this is My covenant with them,when I shall take away their sins.”|An dis a wa mi pramis dem wen mi tek we dem sin.”

As concerning the gospel, they are enemies for your sake, but as regarding the election, they are beloved for the sake of the patriarchs. |Kaaz di Juu dem did ton dem bak pan di Gud Nyuuz, dem a Gad enimi, an dat wok out gud fi unu we a no Juu. Bot dem a di piipl we Gad did pik an so im stil lov dem kaaz a dat im did pramis fi dem faada faada go bak se im wuda du.
For the gifts and calling of God are irrevocable.
column2: Gad naa go chienj im main bout di piipl we im did pik an im naa go tek bak di gif dem we im gi dem.

column1: For just as you once were disobedient to God, but have now received mercy through their disobedience|A siem so unu we a no Juu, unu neva yuus tu fala wa Gad se, bot Gad mek op im main fi gud an kain tu unu kaaz di Juu dem neva did a fala wa im se.

so these also have now been disobedient, that they also may receive mercy by the mercy shown to you. |So wan taim unu neva did a fala wa Gad se, a siem so nou di Juu dem naa fala wa im se, an siem laik ou Gad did gud an kain tu unu a siem so im a-go gud an kain tu di Juu dem.

For God has imprisoned them all in disobedience, so that He might be merciful to all.|Piipl neva waahn fi du wa Gad se dem fi du. So Gad lef dem fi du di sitn dem we dem waahn. Gad lef dem an mek di sitn dem we dem waahn fi du av dem laik prizna, so dat lieta im kuda gud an kain tu di uol a dem.
O the depth of the riches and wisdom and knowledge of God!How unsearchable are His judgmentsand unfathomable are His ways!
column2: Gad gud an kain tu aal piipl nof nof! Nobadi no waiz laik im an nobadi no nuo aal we im nuo.Uu kyan se wai im mek op im main fi du di sitn dem we im du? Uu kyan andastan di wie im du tingz?

column1: “For who has known the mind of the Lord?Or who has become His counselor?”
column2: Kaaz “Uu nuo wa di Laad a tingk? Uu kyan tel im wa im fi du ar wa im no fi du?

column1: “Or who has first given to Him,and it shall be repaid to him?”|Uu gi Gad notn we mek im afi pie dem bak?”
For from Him and through Him and to Him are all things.To Him be glory forever! Amen.
column2: Kaaz a Gad mek evriting! A im kaaz evriting fi liv an evriting mek fi sorv im.Gad fi get priez fi eva an eva! Iemen!

column1: I urge you therefore, brothers, by the mercies of God, that you present your bodies as a living sacrifice, holy, and acceptable to God, which is your reasonable service of worship.|So den breda an sista, sins Gad gud an kain tu unu nof nof, mi a beg unu du, gi op unu laif tu Gad laik wan sakrifais — wan sakrifais we alaiv, we de de fi sorv Gad an we Gad kyan api wid. Dat a ou unu fi worship Gad.

Do not be conformed to this world, but be transformed by the renewing of your mind, that you may prove what is the good and acceptable and perfect will of God.|No mek di piipl we de iina di worl tel unu ou fi liv. Insted-a dat mek Gad chienj di wie ou unu tingk so dat im kyan chienj di wie ou unu a liv. Da wie de unu wi nuo aal a wa Gad waahn unu fi du — unu wi nuo we rait, unu wi nuo wa mek Gad api an unu wi nuo ou im waahn unu fi liv.

For I say, through the grace given to me, to everyone among you, not to think of himself more highly than he ought to think, but to think with sound judgment, according to the measure of faith God has distributed to every man. |Kaaz a di gif we Gad gi mi, mi a tel unu: No bada tingk se unu muor dan wa unu riili bi. Insted-a dat unu fi ombl unuself an joj unuself bies pan di fiet we Gad gi unu.
For just as we have many parts in one body, and not all parts have the same function,|Siem laik ou wan badi mek op a nof difrant paat, an di difrant difrant paat dem de de fi du difrant sitn

so we, being many, are one body in Christ, and all are parts of one another. |a siem so, a nof a wi, bot di uol a wi mek op wan badi kaaz wi an Krais Jiizas a wan. Di uol a wi difrant bot wi jain op tugeda an wi bilang tu wi wan aneda.

We have diverse gifts according to the grace that is given to us: if prophecy, according to the proportion of faith;|Gad gi wi difrant difrant gif — im mek wi kyan du difrant sopm. Ef Gad gi sumadi di powa fi priich im mesij, den dem fi priich bies pan di fiet we dem av.
if service, in serving; he who teaches, in teaching; |Ef Gad gi dem di powa fi sorv, den dem fi sorv. Ef im gi dem di powa fi tiich den dem fi tiich.

he who exhorts, in exhortation; he who gives, with generosity; he who rules, with diligence; he who shows mercy, with cheerfulness.|Ef Gad mek yu kyan taak tu piipl an mek dem fiil laik se dem kyan du wa dem niid fi du, den a dat yu fi du. Ef im gi yu wan aat fi piipl we mek yu shier aal we yu av, den yu fi gi wid aal a yu aat. Ef Gad mek yu wan liida, den yu fi wok aad. Ef Gad mek yu kyan gud an kain tu piipl, den a dat yu fi du an yu fi api fi du it tu.
Let love be without hypocrisy. Hate what is evil. Cleave to what is good.
column2: Unu mos lov piipl wid aal a unu aat — unu lov mos riil; iet evriting we wikid an eng aan tait tu eniting wa gud.

column1: Be devoted to one another with brotherly love; prefer one another in honor
column2: Lov unu wan aneda laik breda an sista an unu fi aalwiez put unu breda an sista bifuo unuself.

column1: do not be lazy in diligence, be fervent in spirit, serve the Lord|Unu fi wok aad an no liezi! Unu mos eva waahn fi sorv di Laad wid aal a unu aat.

rejoice in hope, be patient in suffering, persevere in prayer|Wail unu wiet fi di sitn dem we Gad pramis fi gi unu, unu mos api kaaz unu nuo se unu a-go get it. Wen chobl tek unu, unu no fi gi op bot unu mos gwaan uol chrang an unu fi prie aal di taim, neva tap.

contribute to the needs of the saints, practice hospitality.|Ef unu choch breda an sista no av wa dem niid, unu fi shier wa unu av wid dem an unu mos eva redi fi tek iin piipl we a chravl an naa no we fi stie.
Bless those who persecute you; bless, and do not curse.|Di piipl we a kaaz unu fi sofa, unu mos prie an aks Gad fi bles dem; aalwiez aks Gad fi bles piipl, no prie an aks im fi du notn bad tu dem.
Rejoice with those who rejoice, and weep with those who weep. |Ef piipl api unu fi api wid dem, ef dem a baal unu fi baal wid dem tu.

Be of the same mind toward one another. Do not be haughty, but associate with the lowly. Do not pretend to be wiser than you are.|Liv gud wid unu wan aneda. No get ful-a unuself an fiil laik se unu kyaahn du sortn wok ar taak tu sortn an sortn piipl. Insted-a dat ombl unuself.
Repay no one evil for evil. Commend what is honest in the sight of all men.|Ef sumadi du yu sopm rang, no bada du dem bak notn rang; aalwiez chrai fi du wa evribadi tingk rait.
If it is possible, as much as it depends on you, live peaceably with all men.|Ef it kyan apm, du evriting we unu kyan du fi mek shuor se unu liv iina piis wid evribadi.

Beloved, do not avenge yourselves, but rather give place to God’s wrath, for it is written: “Vengeance is Mine. I will repay,” says the Lord.|Breda an sista ef sumadi du unu rang, no bada tek it pan unuself fi go mek dem pie fi wa dem did du unu, lef dem tu Gad mek im joj dem. A siem so it rait dong iina Gad wod dat di Laad se, “A fi mi jab fi mek piipl pie fi di rang we dem du, mi wi ponish dem.”

Therefore“If your enemy is hungry, feed him;if he is thirsty, give him a drink;for in doing so you will heap coals of fire on his head.”|Bot,“Ef yu enimi onggri, gi im sopm fi iit;ef im waahn sopm fi jringk, gi im sopm fi jringk.Wen yu du dat, a laik yu a pail op at kuol pan im ed.”
Do not be overcome by evil, but overcome evil with good.|No mek wikidnis biit yu bot biit wikidnis wid gud.

Let every person be subject to the governing authorities, for there is no authority except from God, and those that exist are appointed by God.|Evribadi mos du wa di govament se kaaz nobadi kyaahn ruul ef Gad neva gi dem di powa fi ruul. So di piipl dem we a ruul uova unu, a Gad put dem de.

Therefore ­whoever resists the authority resists what God has appointed, and those who resist will incur judgment. |So den di piipl we no du wa di govament se dem fi du, a go dem riili a go gens di piipl we Gad pik fi ruul, an di piipl dem we du dat, a jos bring dem a bring dong jojment pan demself.

Rulers are not a terror to good works, but to evil works. Do you wish to have no fear of the authority? Do what is good, and you will have praise from him|Di piipl we du wa rait, dem no afi fried a di piipl we a ruul uova dem. A jos di piipl dem we a du we rang fi fried. So, ef unu no waahn fi fried a di piipl we a ruul uova unu, jos du wa rait an wen unu du dat dem wi big unu op.

for he is the servant of God for your good. But if you do what is evil, be afraid, for he does not bear the sword in vain, for he is the servant of God, an avenger to execute wrath upon him who practices evil. |Kaaz di piipl we iina powa, dem a Gad sorvant an dem de de fi fi unu gud. Bot yu si ef unu a du rang, unu fi fried, kaaz Gad neva gi dem powa fi notn. Di piipl we iina powa a Gad sorvant an im yuuz dem fi joj an ponish di piipl we a du rang.

So it is necessary to be in subjection, not only because of wrath, but also for the sake of conscience.|So den unu fi du wa di piipl we ruul uova unu se unu fi du. Unu fi du dem no jos kaaz Gad wi ponish unu ef unu no du it bot kaaz diip dong iina unu aat unu nuo se a dat unu fi du.

For this reason you also pay taxes, for they are God’s servants, devoting themselves to this very thing.|A dat mek unu a pie taks tu, kaaz di piipl we a ruul uova unu, wen dem du we dem sopuoz fi du, a wok dem a wok fi Gad.

Render to all what is due them: taxes to whom taxes are due, respect to whom respect is due, fear to whom fear is due, and honor to whom honor is due.|Unu mos pie piipl wa unu uo dem: Ef unu av taks fi pie, pie di uol a dem; ef piipl fi get rispek, rispek dem an ef a big dem fi get big op, den big dem op.

Owe no one anything, except to love one another, for he who loves another has fulfilled the law.|No uo nobadi notn — pie piipl wa unu uo dem. Di onggl ting unu fi uo piipl a lov kaaz enibadi we lov dem nieba laik ou dem lov demself, dem a du evriting we di Laa se.

For the commandments, “You shall not commit adultery, You shall not murder, You shall not steal, You shall not give false testimony, You shall not covet,” and if there are any other commandments, are summed up in this saying, “You shall love your neighbor as yourself.”|Di Laa dem: “No sliip wid nobadi we yu no marid tu, no kil, no tiif, no red yai aafa piipl tingz,” aal a dem de an di res a Laa dem, yu kuda put dem tugeda an mek wan Laa we se: “Lov yu nieba laik ou yu lov yuself.”
Love works no evil to a neighbor. Therefore love is the fulfillment of the law.|Ef yu lov sumadi yu naa go du notn bad tu dem. So den, wen yu lov piipl, yu riili a du aal we di Laa se.

Furthermore, knowing the time, now is the moment to awake from sleep. For now our salvation is nearer than when we believed. |Dat a wa unu mos du kaaz unu nuo di taim wi a liv iina. Unu nuo se a taim nou fi wiek op an tap sliip, kaaz wi kluosa nou tu di die wen Gad a-go siev wi dan wen wi did fos staat biliiv iina Krais Jiizas.

The night is far spent, the day is at hand. Therefore let us take off the works of darkness and put on the armor of light.|Wi taim pan da ort ya suun don, it komiin laik wen nait a don an die a lait. So mek wi tap du di wikid sitn dem we piipl du iina di daak an insted-a dat tek op di wepan dem wa wi yuuz fi fait iina di die taim.

Let us behave properly, as in the day, not in carousing and drunkenness, not in immorality and wickedness, not in strife and envy. |So mek wi liv ou wi nuo wi fi liv, mek wi liv laik piipl we iina di lait, no laik piipl we iina di daak. Wi no fi tek paat iina no wail seks paati an wi no fi jringk til wi jongk. Wi no fi a sliip roun sliip roun ar a tek paat iina no kain-a seks sin. Unu no fi lov fait an unu no fi red yai fi ada piipl tingz.

But put on the Lord Jesus Christ, and make no provision for the flesh to fulfill its lusts.|Insted-a aal a dat, unu fi mek Jiizas Krais ruul uova unu an tap tingk bout di wikid sitn dem we unu badi waahn fi du an ou unu kyan get dem sitn de.

Welcome him who is weak in faith, but not for the purpose of arguing over opinions. |Di breda an sista dem we no chrang iina wa dem biliiv, unu mos tek dem iin an mek dem fiil welkom. No aagyu wid dem bout wa dem fiil rait fi du ar rang fi du.

For one has faith to eat all things, but he who is weak eats only vegetables. |Som piipl biliiv se dem kyan iit evriting, bot di piipl we no chrang iina wa dem biliiv, dem wi onggl iit vejitebl — dem naa iit no miit.

Do not let him who eats despise him who does not eat, and do not let him who does not eat judge him who eats, for God has welcomed him.|Di piipl we iit evriting dem no fi luk dong pan di piipl dem we no iit miit an di piipl we no iit miit, dem no fi joj di piipl we iit miit kaaz Gad don tek dem fi fi im pikni dem.

Who are you to judge another man’s servant? To his own master he stands or falls. And he will stand, for God is able to make him stand.|Uu unu tingk unu bi, fi a joj sumadi els sorvant? A onggl di sorvant maasta kyan tel im ef im a du we im fi du ar ef im naa du we im fi du — onggl dem maasta kyan se ef dem a tan op ar dem a faal dong. An dem wi tan op kaaz di Laad kyan mek dem tan op.

One man judges one day above another; another judges every day alike. Let each one be fully persuaded in his own mind.|Som piipl biliiv se wan die muor impuotant dan di res a die dem iina di wiik, bot ada piipl tingk se di uol a dem a di siem ting. Evribadi afi mek op dem uona main bout wa dem biliiv an nuo wai dem biliiv it tu.

He who observes the day observes it for the Lord, and he who does not observe the day, to the Lord he does not observe it. He who eats, eats in honor of the Lord, for he gives thanks to God; and the one who does not eat, in honor of the Lord he does not eat, and gives thanks to God.|Di piipl we se wan die muor impuotant dan di res, dem a yuuz da die de fi ana Gad. Di piipl we iit evriting, dem a du it fi ana Gad, kaaz dem gi Gad tangks fi di fuud we dem a iit. An di piipl dem we no iit miit, dem du dat fi ana Gad tu, kaaz dem gi Gad tangks fi di fuud we dem iit tu.
For none of us lives for himself, and no one dies for himself. |Non a wi a liv fi wiself wan an non a wi naa ded fi wiself wan.

For if we live, we live for the Lord. And if we die, we die for the Lord. So, whether we live or die, we are the Lord’s.|Kaaz ef wi liv, wi a liv fi di Laad; an ef wi ded, wi ded fi di Laad. So den, weda wi liv ar wi ded, wi bilang tu di Laad.

For to this end Christ died and rose and lived again, so that He might be Lord of both the dead and living.|A dat mek Krais Jiizas did ded an den kom bak alaiv; im du dat so dat im wuda bi Laad uova evribadi — Laad fi di piipl we ded an Laad fi di piipl we alaiv.
So why do you judge your brother? Or why do you despise your brother? For we shall all stand before the judgment seat of Christ.
column2: So den unu we no iit miit — wa mek unu a joj unu breda an sista? An unu we iit evriting — wa mek unu a luk dong pan unu breda an sista? Aal a wi afi go tan op infronta Gad fi im joj wi.

column1: For it is written:“As I live, says the Lord,every knee shall bow to Me,and every tongue shall confess to God.”|It rait iina Gad wod se:“Di Laad se, ‘Az shuor az mi alaiv,evribadi a-go ben dong pan dem nii infronta mi anaal a dem a-go se out loud dat mi a Gad.’ ”
So then each of us shall give an account of himself to God.
column2: So den evribadi afi go ansa tu Gad fi demself.

column1: Therefore let us no longer pass judgment on one another, but rather determine not to put a stumbling block or an obstacle in a brother’s way. |So mek wi tap joj wi wan aneda. Insted-a dat mek wi chrai wi bes fi no du notn we wi kaaz wi breda an sista fi sin.

I know and am persuaded by the Lord Jesus that nothing is unclean in itself, but to him who considers anything to be unclean, to him it is unclean. |Mi an Jiizas a wan an so mi nuo fi shuor se no fuud no de we rang fi mi iit. Bot ef sumadi riili biliiv se it rang fi dem iit sopm, den it wuda rang fi dem iit it.

If your brother is grieved because of your food, you are no longer walking in love. Do not destroy with your food one for whom Christ died.|Ef yu nuo se wen yu iit sortn an sortn fuud yu a-go ton aaf yu breda an sista, an yu du it siem wie, yu naa chriit dem wid lov. No mek di sitn dem we unu a iit mash op unu breda an sista we Krais Jiizas ded fa.
So do not let what is good to you be spoken of as evil.|So di sitn dem we unu tingk gud fi du, no du notn we wi mek piipl se dat dem wikid.

For the kingdom of God does not mean eating and drinking, but righteousness and peace and joy in the Holy Spirit. |Kaaz Gad Kindom no av notn fi du wid wa piipl iit an jringk ar we dem no iit an jringk. Gad kindom a bout ou piipl liv; ef dem a liv rait, ef dem av piis iina dem aat, an ef dem aat api — an aal a dem sitn de kom fram di Uoli Spirit.
For he who serves Christ in these things is acceptable to God and approved by men.|Enibadi we liv an sorv Krais Jiizas da wie de, wi kaaz Gad fi api wid dem an piipl wi rispek dem fi wa dem du.
Therefore let us pursue the things which produce peace and the things that build up one another.
column2: So den mek wi aalwiez chrai fi du di sitn dem we kaaz piipl fi liv iina piis an we wi elp fi bil op wi wan aneda.

column1: Do not destroy the work of God for the sake of food. All things indeed are clean, but it is evil for the man who causes someone to fall by what he eats. |No mash op di wok we Gad du uova fuud. So iivn duo evriting kliin an gud fi iit, it wuda rang fi yu iit it ef it a-go kaaz sumadi fi sin.

It is good neither to eat meat nor drink wine, nor do anything whereby your brother stumbles or is offended or is made weak.|It gud fi no iit miit ar jringk wain ar fi du notn we wuda kaaz yu breda ar sista fi sin.

The faith that you have, have as your own conviction before God. Happy is he who does not condemn himself in what he approves.|So den wen it kom tu dem sitn ya, kip wa yu biliiv bitwiin yu an Gad. Di piipl we kyan du wa dem biliiv rait an no wanda at aal ef wa dem a du rang ar fiil gilti bout we dem a du, a dem riili api.

But he who doubts is condemned if he eats, because it is not from faith, for whatever is not from faith is sin.|Bot ef sumadi iit sopm, an a wanda ef it rang ar it rait fi dem iit it, Gad a-go joj dem an se dat wa dem a du rang, kaaz dem naa liv azkaadn tu wa dem biliiv. An eniting we no lain op wid wa yu biliiv rait, a sin.

We who are strong ought to bear the weaknesses of the weak and not please ourselves. |Nou wi we chrang iina wa wi biliiv, wi fi tek taim wid an elp di wan dem we wiik. Wi no fi jos du di sitn dem we wi waahn an wa wi mek wi api.

Let each of us please his neighbor for his good, leading to edification.|Insted-a dat mek evri wan a wi du di sitn dem we wi mek wi breda an sista api, mek wi du di sitn dem we gud fi dem an wa wi elp fi bil dem op.

For even Christ did not please Himself. But as it is written, “The insults of those who insulted You fell on Me.”|Iivn Krais Jiizas neva du di sitn dem we im du fi mek imself api. It rait iina Gad wod dat Jiizas se tu Gad se, “Wen piipl chat bad bout yu an shiem yu, aal we dem se bout yu, dem riili a se bout mi tu.”

For whatever was previously written was written for our instruction, so that through perseverance and encouragement of the Scriptures we might have hope.|Evriting we rait dong iina Gad wod, rait dong fi tiich wi an fi elp push wi fi tan op chrang an no gi op so dat wi kyan gwaan luk fi get di sitn dem we Gad pramis wi.

Now may the God of perseverance and encouragement grant you to live in harmony with one another in accordance with Christ Jesus|Mi prie se Gad, Gad uu kyan mek piipl chrang an kaaz dem fi eng aan an no gi op, mi prie se im wi kaaz unu fi liv iina piis wid unu wan aneda wail unu a fala Krais Jiizas.
so that together you may with one voice glorify the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ.
column2: So dat aal a unu kyan kom tugeda wid wan aat an wan vais an priez di Gad an Faada fi wi Laad Jiizas Krais.

column1: Therefore welcome one another, just as Christ also welcomed us, for the glory of God.|So den tek unu wan aneda siem laik ou Krais Jiizas did tek unu, so dat piipl wi priez Gad.

Now I say that Jesus Christ has become a servant to the circumcised on behalf of the truth of God, to confirm the promises made to the patriarchs|Kaaz mi a tel unu, Krais Jiizas did kom fi elp di Juu dem. Im did kom fi shuo dem se Gad wi aalwiez du wa im se im a-go du — im did kom fi shuo dem se Gad wuda du aal we im did pramis di Juu dem faada faada go bak se im wuda du.

and that the Gentiles might glorify God for His mercy, as it is written:“For this reason I will acknowledge You among the Gentiles,and I will sing praises to Your name.”|Krais Jiizas did kom tu, so dat di piipl we a no Juu kuda priez Gad kaaz im did gud an kain tu dem. A siem so it rait iina Gad wod se:“So mi wi gi yu tangks wen mi de mongks di piipl we a no Juu,an mi wi sing priez tu yu.”
He also says:“Rejoice, O Gentiles, with His people!”|Wan neks paat se:“Aal di piipl we a no Juu get api an priez Gad wid im piipl di Juu dem.”
And again:“Praise the Lord, all you Gentiles;let all the peoples praise Him.”|An wan neda paat se:“Priez di Laad aal a unu we a no Juu, an mek evribadi evriwe priez im.”

And again Isaiah says:“There shall be a root of Jesse;He who shall rise to reign over the Gentiles,in Him shall the Gentiles hope.”|An iina wan neda paat a Gad wod, Aizaiya se:“Sumadi fram Jesi fambili a-go kom,an im a-go ruul uova di piipl we a no Juu,an dem a-go luk fi im gi dem aal we im pramis fi gi dem.”

Now may the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace in believing, so that you may abound in hope, through the power of the Holy Spirit.|Mi prie se Gad, Gad we kaaz piipl fi luk fa an nuo fi shuor se dem wi get wa im pramis, mi prie se im wi gi unu piis iina unu aat an mek unu aat api, api kyaahn don kaaz unu biliiv iina im. Mi prie se im du dat, so dat di Uoli Spirit wi kaaz unu muor an muor fi luk fi get di sitn dem we Gad pramis an nuo fi shuor se yu wi get dem.

Now I myself am persuaded concerning you, my brothers, that you also are full of goodness, filled with all knowledge, and also able to instruct one another. |Mi breda an sista, mi muor dan shuor bout unu, mi nuo se unu a gud piipl, unu nuo evriting we unu sopuoz fi du an unu kyan tiich unu wan aneda.

Nevertheless, brothers, I have written even more boldly to you on some points, to remind you, because of the grace that is given to me from God|Bot iina da leta ya mi diil wid unu aad, mi no uol notn bak wen it kom tu sortn an sortn tingz kaaz mi waahn unu fi memba dem. Mi no uol notn bak kaaz Gad gud an kain tu mi

that I might be a minister of Jesus Christ to the Gentiles, in the priestly service of the gospel of God, so that the offering of the Gentiles might be acceptable, being sanctified by the Holy Spirit.|im mek mi wan a Krais Jiizas sorvant dem an sen mi fi wok mongks di piipl dem we a no Juu. Mi a laik wan priis, fi mi jab a fi priich di Gud Nyuuz we Gad gi mi tu di piipl we a no Juu, so dat di Uoli Spirit kyan mek dem kliin an gi dem op tu Gad laik wan sakrifais, wan sakrifais we Gad kyan api wid.
In Christ Jesus therefore I have reason to boast in my service to God. |So kaaz mi an Krais Jiizas a wan, mi kyan proud a di wok we mi a du fi Gad.

For I will not dare to speak of anything except what Christ has accomplished through me, to make the Gentiles obedient, by word and deed|Mi wudn mad fi taak bout notn bot di wok we Krais Jiizas yuuz mi fi du — di wok we kaaz di piipl we a no Juu fi staat du aal a wa Gad se dem fi du. Dem staat fala Gad siek-a di sitn dem we mi se an du

by the power of signs and wonders, by the power of the Spirit of God, so that from Jerusalem and as far around as Illyricum, I have fully preached the gospel of Christ.|an siek-a di sain dem an di mirikl dem we Gad Spirit gi mi di powa fi du. So fram Jeruusilem go klier a Ilirikom, mi priich di Gud Nyuuz bout Krais Jiizas aal bout.

So I have strived to preach the gospel, not where Christ was named, so that I should not build on another man’s foundation. |Wa mi did aalwiez waahn fi du a fi go priich di Gud Nyuuz bout Krais Jiizas wich paat nobadi neva go priich yet. Da wie de mi wudn a bil pan di wok we sumadi els di staat fi du

But as it is written:“To whom He was not announced, they shall see;and those who have not heard shall understand.”|bot insted-a dat, siem laik ou it rait dong iina Gad wod:“Di piipl we nobadi neva tel bout Jiizas, dem wi sian di wan dem we neva ier bout im, dem wi andastan.”
For this reason also I was often hindered from coming to you. |A siek-a di wok we mi did a du, mek nof taim mi no get fi kom luk fi unu.

But now, no longer having a place in these regions, and having a great desire for many years to come to you|Bot nou mi naa notn a kip mi wich paat mi de, mi wok don an a nof ier nou mi waahn kom si unu.

whenever I go to Spain, I shall come to you, for I hope to see you when I pass through and to be helped on my way there by you, when I have first enjoyed your company for a little while.|Wen mi a go a Spien, mi uop se mi kyan paas chuu an si unu an dat afta mi spen likl taim wid unu, unu wi elp mi fi go we mi a go.
But now I am going to Jerusalem to minister to the saints.
column2: Bot rait ya nou mi a go a Jeruusilem fi elp Gad piipl.

column1: For Macedonia and Achaia were pleased to make some contribution for the poor among the saints who are in Jerusalem.
column2: Kaaz di choch dem iina Masiduoniya an Akaiya did muor dan api fi gi moni tu Gad piipl iina Jeruusilem we puor.

column1: It has pleased them indeed, and they are their debtors. For if the Gentiles have been partakers of their spiritual things, they also ought to minister to them in material things. |A dem mek op dem main fi du it, nobadi neva afi se notn tu dem, bot di chuut a dat dem sopuoz fi elp Gad piipl we puor. Kaaz ef di Juu dem did shier aal a di nais sitn dem we Gad Spirit gi dem wid di piipl we a no Juu, dem no fi shier dem moni an tingz wid dem tu.

Therefore, when I have completed this and have given this blessing to them, I shall come by way of you to Spain|So den afta mi don aal a dis an mek shuor di moni riich dem sief, mi wi ed out fi Spien bot mi a-go kom fi unu wie
and I know that when I come to you, I shall come in the fullness of the blessing of the gospel of Christ.|an mi nuo se wen mi kom de, Krais Jiizas a-go bles unu nof nof.

Now I ask you, brothers, through the Lord Jesus Christ and through the love of the Spirit, to strive together with me in your prayers to God on my behalf|Kaaz aal a wi biliiv iina Jiizas Krais, an siek-a di lov we di Uoli Spirit gi wi, mi a beg unu breda an sista fi prie tu Gad fi mi. Kom prie wid mi an prie aad aad.

that I may be delivered from the unbelievers in Judea, and that my ministry for Jerusalem may be acceptable to the saints|Prie se di piipl iina Judiya we no biliiv iina Jiizas Krais, prie se dem no ort mi. An prie tu se Gad piipl iina Jeruusilem wi api wid wa mi did du fi dem an tek wa mi bring fi dem.

so that I may come to you with joy by the will of God, and may be refreshed together with you.|So prie bout dem sitn de so dat mi kyan kom luk fi unu, ef dat a wa Gad waahn, an dat wen mi kom mi aat wi api an mi kyan get som res wail mi dong de wid unu.
Now the God of peace be with you all. Amen.
column2: Nou mi prie se Gad we gi piipl piis iina dem aat wi tan wid di uol a unu. Iemen!

column1: I commend to you our sister Phoebe, who is a servant of the church at Cenchrea|Nou mi waahn unu fi nuo se wi sista Fiibi a wan gud sumadi — shi sorv di choch iina Senkriya.

that you welcome her in the Lord in a manner worthy of the saints, and that you assist her in whatever matter she may have need of you, for she has been a helper of many and of myself as well.|Tek ar iin an chriit ar laik ou unu nuo unu fi chriit Gad piipl, kaaz shi bilang tu Gad, an Gad piipl sopuoz fi chriit dem wan aneda gud. Eniting shi niid fram unu, gi it tu ar, kaaz a nof piipl shi elp — shi aal elp mi.
Greet Priscilla and Aquila, my fellow workers in Christ Jesus,|Tel Priska an Akwila oudi fi mi. Dem wok wid mi fi Jiizas Krais

who risked their own necks for my life, to whom not only I, but also all the churches of the Gentiles, give thanks.|an dem put demself iina siiros chobl fi mi — dem did redi fi ded fi mi. Mi kyaahn tangk dem inof, an a no jos mi a tel dem tangks bot aal a di piipl we go a di choch dem fi piipl we a no Juu, a tangk dem tu.
