Likewise greet the church that is in their house.Greet my beloved Epaenetus, who is the first convert of Achaia for Christ.|Di uol a di piipl dem we gyada fi choch a Priska an Akwila ous, tel dem oudi fi mi tu.Mi gud gud fren Epiniitos tel im oudi fi mi. Im a did di fos wan iina Iezha fi biliiv iina Jiizas Krais.
Greet Mary, who labored much for us.|Mieri we wok aad aad fi unu, tel ar oudi.

Greet Andronicus and Junia, my kinsmen and fellow prisoners, who are noteworthy among the apostles, who also came to Christ before me.|Anjranikos an Juuniyas, mi kombolo uu did iina prizn wid mi, oudi tu unu. Aal a di apasl dem nuo dem gud gud an rispek dem an dem did biliiv iina Krais Jiizas bifuo mi.
Greet Ampliatus, my beloved in the Lord.|Tel Ampliyaatos oudi fi mi. Im a mi gud gud fren an im an Jiizas a wan.
Greet Urbanus, our fellow worker in Christ, and my beloved Stachys.|Orbanos we wok wid wi fi Jiizas Krais an mi gud gud fren Stiekis, tel di tuu a dem oudi fi mi.

Greet Apelles, who is approved in Christ.Greet those who are of the household of Aristobulus.|Tel Apelez we go chuu nof chraiyal an kraasiz an pruuv se im a Gad sorvant oudi fi mi. An tel aal a di piipl we liv a Aristobyuulos ous oudi fi mi tu.

Greet Herodion, my kinsman.Greet those who are of the household of Narcissus, who are in the Lord.|Tel mi kombolo Eruodiyan oudi an se oudi tu aal di piipl we liv a Narsisos yaad an we biliiv iina Jiizas Krais.

Greet Tryphena and Tryphosa, who labor in the Lord.Greet the beloved Persis, who also labored much in the Lord.|Tel Chraifiina an Chraifuosa we a wok fi di Laad oudi fi mi an mi waahn fi sen oudi fi mi gud gud fren Porsis tu. Porsis wok aad aad fi di Laad.
Greet Rufus, chosen in the Lord, and his mother, who is like a mother to me.|Tel Ruufos oudi fi mi. Im a wan a di Laad gud gud sorvant dem an tel im mada oudi fi mi tu — a laik shi a fi mi mada tu.

Greet Asyncritus, Phlegon, Hermes, Patrobas, Hermas, and the brothers who are with them.|Asingkritos, Flegan, Ormiiz, Pachrobas, Ormas an di uol a di breda an sista dem we de wid dem, tel dem oudi fi mi.

Greet Philologus, Julia, Nereus and his sister, and Olympas, and all the saints who are with them.|Tel Filalogos an Juuliya, Neriyos an im sista, Olimpas an aal a Gad piipl we de de wid dem oudi fi mi.
Greet one another with a holy kiss.The churches of Christ greet you.
column2: Unu fi tel unu wan aneda oudi an du it wid lov.Aal a Krais Jiizas choch dem we out ya sen oudi fi unu.

column1: Now I urge you, brothers, to closely watch those who cause divisions and offenses, contrary to the teaching which you have learned, and avoid them.|Nou breda an sista, mi a beg unu wach out fi di piipl we kaaz di piipl iina di choch fi plit op an fait wid dem wan aneda, we kaaz piipl fi ton we fram wa dem biliiv an we taak gens an tiich tingz we no lain op wid wa unu did lorn. No av notn fi du wid dem!

For such people do not serve our Lord Jesus Christ, but their own appetites, and through smooth talk and flattery they deceive the hearts of the unsuspecting.|Kaaz dem piipl de, dem naa sorv wi Laad Jiizas Krais, dem onggl a sorv demself. Dem a swiit-mout, dem yuuz aal kain-a fansi wod fi chrik an miks op di piipl dem we no nuo beta.

Your obedience has become known to all men. Therefore I am glad on your behalf. Yet I want you to be wise to that which is good, and innocent to that which is evil.|Evribadi ier bout ou unu biliiv an a fala di Gud Nyuuz bout Krais Jiizas wid aal a unu aat an unu mek fi mi aat wel api wid aal we unu a du. Bot mi waahn unu fi waiz — mi waahn unu fi aalwiez nuo wa rait fi unu du an no av notn fi du wid no kain-a wikidnis.

The God of peace will soon crush Satan under your feet.The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.|Suun, Gad we gi piipl piis iina dem aat, wi put Sietan anda yu fut an mash im op. Mi prie se di Laad Jiizas Krais wi shuo unu lov iivn duo wi no dizorv it.
Timothy, my fellow worker, and Lucius, Jason, and Sosipater, my kinsmen, greet you.|Timoti, we wok wid mi sen oudi fi unu. Mi kombolo dem: Luushos, Jiesn an Sosipieta sen oudi fi unu tu.
I, Tertius, who wrote this epistle, greet you in the Lord.|An mi, Torshiiyos we bilang tu Gad an we a rait dong da leta ya fi breda Paal, a sen oudi fi unu tu.

Gaius, who is host to me and to the whole church, greets you.Erastus, who is the city treasurer, and our brother Quartus greet you.|Gaiyos uu mi a stie wid an iina uufa yaad dem kip choch, sen oudi fi unu. Irastos we kip di moni fi di siti an wi breda Kwaatos sen oudi fi unu tu.
The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.
column2: Mi waahn di gries a di laad Jiizas Krais kom dong pan di wola unu. Iemen.

column1: Now to Him who has power to establish you according to my gospel and the preaching of Jesus Christ, according to the revelation of the mystery, which was kept secret for long ages past|Mek wi priez Gad — Gad we kyan mek unu tan op chrang iina wa unu biliiv azkaadn tu di Gud Nyuuz we mi priich bout Krais Jiizas, an azkaadn tu di chuu sitn dem we a did siikrit fram lang lang taim a bak

but now is revealed by the prophetic Scriptures according to the commandment of the everlasting God, made known to all the Gentiles for the obedience of faith|bot we Gad mek wi nuo bout nou. Gad we liv fi eva an eva, tel di prafit dem fi rait dong dem sitn ya iina Gad wod, an sen out piipl fi priich bout it so dat evribadi wuda nuo di chuut an staat fi biliiv an fala Gad.

to the only wise God, through Jesus Christ, to whom be glory forever. Amen.|Gad a di onggl riil Gad, notn an nobadi no waiz laik im. So siek-a wa Jiizas Krais du fi wi, mek wi priez Gad fi eva an eva. Iemen!

Paul, called to be an apostle of Jesus Christ through the will of God, and Sosthenes, our brother,|Da leta ya a kom fram Paal, di wan we Gad pik fi bi wan a Jiizas Krais apasl, an it a kom fram wi breda Sostoniiz tu.

To the church of God which is at Corinth, to those who are sanctified in Christ Jesus, called to be saints, with all who in every place call on the name of Jesus Christ our Lord, both their Lord and ours:|Da leta ya a fi aal a Gad piipl we de iina Korint. Gad kaal unu fi bi im piipl an di uol a unu bilang tu im, kaaz a im mek unu an Jiizas ton wan. A no jos unu wi a rait tu — wi a rait tu evribadi we se Jiizas a dem Laad laik wi.
Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
column2: Mi prie se wi Faada Gad an wi Laad Jiizas Krais wi shuo unu lov iivn duo wi no dizorv it an gi unu piis iina unu aat.

column1: I thank my God always on your behalf for the grace of God which has been given to you through Jesus Christ.|Mi eva gi Gad tangks fi aal we im du fi unu. Kaaz unu an Jiizas Krais a wan, im shuo unu lov iivn duo unu no dizorv it.

By Him you are enriched in everything, in all speech and in all knowledge,|An kaaz unu an Jiizas kluos, Gad bles unu wid nof gud sitn. Im mek unu kyan priich im wod an im mek unu kyan andastan evriting we de de fi nuo bout im Spirit.
even as the testimony of Christ was confirmed in you|An sins unu kyan du dem sitn de, dat shuo se di mesij we wi did bring kom gi unu bout Krais Jiizas — a chuu sopm.
so that you are not lacking in any gift while waiting for the revelation of our Lord Jesus Christ.
column2: So wail unu a wiet fi wi Laad Jiizas Krais fi kom bak notn no de we unu kuda waahn ar niid. Gad Spirit don gi unu evriting.

column1: He will strengthen you to the end, so that you may be blameless on the day of our Lord Jesus Christ.|Jiizas wi elp unu fi gwaan tan op chrang iina wa unu biliiv til di die im kom bak fi joj di worl. So pan da die de wen unu tan op infronta im, nobadi naa go kyan se unu did a liv rang.

God is faithful, and by Him you were called to the fellowship of His Son, Jesus Christ our Lord.|Gad, di wan we kaal unu fi bi wan wid im Bwai Pikni, wi Laad Jiizas Krais, aalwiez du wa im se im a-go du. So unu kyan chos se im wi de de fi unu.

Now I ask you, brothers, by the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that you all speak in agreement and that there be no divisions among you. But be perfectly joined together in the same mind and in the same judgment.|Nou iina wi Laad Jiizas Krais niem, mi a beg unu breda an sista fi tap aagyu wid unu wan aneda an plit op plit op di choch iina gruup. Unu niid fi kom tugeda an mek shuor se aal a unu tingk di siem wie an aal a unu mek op unu main fi du di siem sitn.

For it has been declared to me concerning you, my brothers, by those who are of the house of Chloe, that there are contentions among you. |Mi nuo se unu a aagyu wid unu wan aneda kaaz som piipl we liv iina Klowi ous tel mi bout it.

Now this is what I mean: Every one of you is saying, “I am of Paul,” or “I am of Apollos,” or “I am of Cephas,” or “I am of Christ.”|Unu nuo wa mi a taak bout. Som a unu a se, “Mi a fala Paal.” Wan neda gruup a se, “Mi a fala Apalos.” Wan neks gruup a se, “Mi a fala Siifas” an wan neda gruup a se, “Mi a fala Krais.”

Is Christ divided? Was Paul crucified for you? Or were you baptized in the name of Paul?|Krais Jiizas, fi im badi kot op kot op iina piis? A uu ded pan di kraas fi unu? Paal? A uufa niem dem baptaiz unu iina? Paal?
I thank God that I baptized none of you except Crispus and Gaius
column2: Mi tangk Gad se di onggl wan dem we mi baptaiz a Krispos an Gaiyos. Mi glad se a no mi baptaiz di res a unu.

column1: lest any should say that I had baptized in my own name.
column2: So non a unu kyaahn se a fi mi niem unu get baptaiz iina.

column1: I also baptized the household of Stephanas. Besides them, I do not know whether I baptized any other.|(An mi baptaiz di piipl dem we liv iina Stefanos ous, mi no memba ef mi baptaiz nobadi els.)

For Christ did not send me to baptize, but to preach the gospel, not with eloquent words, lest the cross of Christ should be made of no effect.|Kaaz a riili priich Krais Jiizas sen mi fi priich, no fi baptaiz piipl. An wen mi priich di Gud Nyuuz bout Jiizas mi neva yuuz no fansi wod fi chrai get unu fi biliiv, kaaz mi wudn waahn aal a wa Krais Jiizas du fi wi pan di kraas fi luuz powa.

For to those who are perishing, the preaching of the cross is foolishness, but to us who are being saved it is the power of God. |Kaaz di mesij bout ou Jiizas ded pan di kraas fi wi, komiin laik fuulinish tu di wan dem we no biliiv an we a-go go a el. Bot tu wi, di wan dem we siev, it shuo ou Gad powaful.

For it is written:“I will destroy the wisdom of the wise,and will bring to nothing the understanding of the prudent.”|Kaaz it rait dong se:“Mi a-go shuo di piipl dem we tingk se dem waizse aal a di sitn dem we dem tingk op, a fuulinish.An aal a di sitn dem we dem tingk sumaat,mi a-go mash dem op.”

Where is the wise? Where is the scribe? Where is the debater of this age? Has God not made the wisdom of this world foolish? |So den, wa unu tingk a-go apm tu di piipl dem we tingk se dem waiz? Wa unu tingk dat miin fi di Laa tiicha dem? Wa unu tingk dat a se bout di piipl dem we lov aagyu bout evriting? Gad no don shuo se aal a di sitn dem we dem piipl de tingk se dem nuo a fuulinish?

For since, in the wisdom of God, the world through its wisdom did not know God, it pleased God through the foolishness of preaching to save those who believe.|Kaaz piipl tingk se dem waiz, lef tu demself, dem wudn nuo Gad. Bot sins Gad riili waiz, im mek it so dat piipl kuda get siev ef dem biliiv di siem mesij we dem se a fuulinish.

For the Jews require a sign, and the Greeks seek after wisdom. |Di Juu dem a luk fi mirikl wok bifuo dem biliiv an di piipl dem we a no Juu, dem naa go biliiv ef di mesij we a priich no soun waiz tu dem.

But we preach Christ crucified, a stumbling block to the Jews and foolishness to the Greeks. |Bot yu si wi, wi priich bout ou Krais Jiizas ded pan di kraas fi siev wi. Di Juu dem beks enitaim dem ier da mesij ya an di piipl dem we a no Juu tingk se a fuulinish wi a taak.

But to those who are called, both Jews and Greeks, we preach Christ as the power of God and the wisdom of God. |Bot yu si di piipl dem we Gad kaal fi bi im pikni, weda dem a Juu ar dem a no Juu, da mesij de shuo ou Gad powaful an ou im waiz.

For the foolishness of God is wiser than men, and the weakness of God is stronger than men.|Kaaz di sitn dem we Gad du we di piipl dem we no biliiv tek fi fuulinish, mek muor sens dan eniting we enibadi kuda tingk bout. An we dem luk pan an se a wiik Gad wiik, it chrangga dan di chrangis ting enibadi kuda du.

For observe your calling, brothers. Among you, not many wise men according to the flesh, not many mighty men, and not many noble men were called. |Breda an sista, tingk bout ou unu did stie wen Gad kaal unu. Muos a unu, nobadi neva tingk se unu waiz. Muos a unu, nobadi neva tingk se unu kuda taak an mek piipl du wa unu se. An a onggl likl bit a unu kom fram big impuotant fambili.

But God has chosen the foolish things of the world to confound the wise. God has chosen the weak things ofthe world to confound the things which are mighty.|Bot Gad pik di sitn dem we piipl tingk a fuulinish, so dat im kyan shiem di wan dem we tingk se dem waiz. Gad pik di sitn dem we piipl tingk wiik, so dat im kuda shiem di piipl we tingk se dem chrang.

And God has chosen the base things of the world and things which are despised. Yes, and He chose things which did not exist to bring to nothing things that do|Gad pik di wan dem we nobadi no tingk impuotant an we piipl luk dong pan. Im pik di wan dem we piipl tingk no wot notn so dat im kuda shuo di wan dem we tingk dem a sumadi se dem a riili nobadi.
so that no flesh should boast in His presence.|Im du dat, so nobadi kyan kom tu im a buos bout ou dem waiz an ou dem impuotant.

But because of Him you are in Christ Jesus, whom God made unto us wisdom, righteousness, sanctification, and redemption. |A Gad kaaz unu fi kluos wid Jiizas Krais. An a Jiizas mek wi kyan nuo Gad an kyan andastan sortn tingz — Gad mek wi waiz wen wi kluos wid Jiizas. An chuu wi kluos wid Jiizas, Gad tek we aal a wi sin an mek tingz rait bitwiin wi an im. An so wi a im pikni nou.
Therefore, as it is written, “Let him who boasts, boast in the Lord.”|So, mek wi fala wa rait dong iina Gad wod, “Ef nobadi a-go buos bout notn, mek dem buos bout wa di Laad du fi dem.”

Brothers, when I came to you, I did not come with superiority of speech or wisdom, declaring to you the testimony of God.|Breda an sista, wen mi did kom priich Gad chuu mesij tu unu, we nobadi neva ier bifuo, mi neva yuuz no big wod ar chrai fi soun waiz.

For I determined not to know anything among you except Jesus Christ and Him crucified.|Kaaz mi did mek op mi main se wail mi did de de wid unu, mi wuda onggl priich bout Jiizas Krais an ou dem kil im pan di kraas.
I was with you in weakness and in fear and in much trembling.|Wen mi did kom tu unu, mi did wiik, an mi did fried so til mi did a chrimbl.

My speech and my preaching was not with enticing words of man’s wisdom, but in demonstration of the Spirit and of power|An wen mi did a tiich an a priich mi neva yuuz no fansi taak laik we di piipl dem we tingk dem waiz yuuz. Mi neva afi du dat fi mek unu biliiv kaaz Gad Spirit yuuz im powa fi shuo unu se aal a wa mi did a se a chuu sopm.

so that your faith should not stand in the wisdom of men, but in the power of God.|Mi priich da wie de so dat unu wudn biliiv jos kaaz piipl tingk se wa mi se waiz, bot kaaz unu si Gad powa fi unuself.

Yet we speak wisdom among those who are mature, although not the wisdom of this age, nor of the rulers of this age, who are coming to nothing.|Nou iivn duo mi no yuuz no big fansi wod, di piipl dem we biliiv iina Gad nof nof, dem tingk se di mesij we mi priich waiz. It no waiz kaaz a sopm we som sumaat piipl tingk op. An it no waiz kaaz di ruula dem we de bout nou an we a-go luuz dem powa an ded, tingk se it waiz.

But we speak the wisdom of God in a mystery, the hidden wisdom, which God ordained before the ages for our glory. |Nuo! mi no tiich we dem tingk waiz. Insted-a dat mi taak bout ou Gad, di onggl wan we riili waiz, did plan fi siev wi fram lang taim. Nobadi neva nuo bout da plan de bifuo kaaz im kip it fram wi. Bot lang bifuo im iivn mek di worl, Gad mek a plan fi siev wi — a so im waiz.

None of the rulers of this age knew it. For had they known it, they would not have crucified the Lord of glory.|Non a di piipl dem we a ruul iina dem taim ya did andastan da plan de. Kaaz ef dem did andastan it dem wuda neva tek wi big an powaful Laad, an niel im op pan wan kraas kil im.

But as it is written,“Eye has not seen,nor ear heard,nor has it entered into the heart of manthe things which God has prepared for those who love Him.”|Bot it rait dong se:“No yai no si,no iez no ier,aal a di sitn dem we Gad pudongfi di piipl we lov im.Nobadi kudn iivn tingk dem op.”

But God has revealed them to us by His Spirit.For the Spirit searches all things, yes, the deep things of God.|Bot Gad yuuz im Spirit fi shuo wi aal a dem sitn de.Gad Spirit sorch an fain out evriting, it aal nuo di sitn dem we Gad a tingk we nobadi els no nuo bout.

For what man knows the things of a man, except the spirit of man which is in him? Likewise, no one knows the things of God, except the Spirit of God. |Wich wan a unu kyan tel we sumadi els a tingk? Jos laik ou a onggl fi wi spirit nuo we wi a tingk bout, a siem so a onggl Gad Spirit nuo we im a tingk bout.

Now we have received not the spirit of the world, but the Spirit which is of God, so that we might know the things that are freely given to us by God. |Di spirit we wi av neva kom fram di worl. Di spirit we wi av kom fram Gad, an a chuu wi av im Spirit mek wi kyan andastan an nuo aal a di sitn dem we Gad kwik fi du fi wi.

These things also we proclaim, not in the words which man’s wisdom teaches, but which the Holy Spirit teaches, comparing spiritual things with spiritual. |Dat a wa wi eva a priich tel unu. An wen wi a priich wi no yuuz no wod we di piipl we waiz se wi fi yuuz. Nuo, wen wi priich wi se di sitn dem we di Spirit tel wi fi se, so dat wi kyan mek unu we av di Spirit andastan aal a wa di Spirit shuo wi.

But the natural man does not receive the things of the Spirit of God, for they are foolishness to him; nor can he know them, because they are spiritually discerned. |Di piipl we no av Gad Spirit, naa go biliiv notn we di Spirit se kaaz it a-go komiin laik fuulinish tu dem. Dem naa go kyan andastan it, kaaz a onggl wen yu av di Spirit yu kyan andastan dem sitn de.

But he who is spiritual judges all things. Yet he himself is not judged by anyone.|Di piipl we av Gad Spirit a liv iina dem, dem kyan andastan evriting bot piipl we no av di Spirit naa go kyan andastan dem.

For“who has known the mind of the Lordthat he may instruct Him?”But we have the mind of Christ.|KKaaz it rait dong iina Gad wod se,“Uu kyan nuo we di Laad a tingk?Uu kyan tel im wa fi du?”Bot kaaz wi av di Uoli Spirit wi tingk laik ou Krais Jiizas tingk.aaz it rait dong iina Gad wod se,

Brothers, I could not speak to you as to spiritual men, but as to worldly, even as to babes in Christ.|Breda an sista, bifuo mi kudn taak tu unu laik ou mi wuda taak tu piipl we av Gad Spirit a kanchuol dem. Mi did afi taak tu unu laik piipl we mek dem badi kanchuol dem — mi did afi taak tu unu laik se unu a biebi we no andastan di sitn dem bout Gad.

I have fed you with milk and not with solid food. For to this day you were not able to endure it. Nor are you able now|Mi did afi fiid unu milk, mi kudn gi unu no aad fuud kaaz unu neva redi fi it. An unu stil no redi fi it.

for you are still worldly. Since there is envy, strife, and divisions among you, are you not worldly and behaving as mere men?|Unu stil a mek di sitn dem we unu badi waahn kanchuol unu. Ef unu eva a kos unu wan aneda, an ef unu eva red yai an waahn waahn unu wan aneda sitn dem, unu no tingk se unu a mek unu badi kanchuol unu? Unu no tingk se unu a gwaan laik di piipl dem we no nuo Gad?

For while one says, “I am of Paul,” and another, “I am of Apollos,” are you not worldly?|Kaaz wen wan sumadi se, “Mi a fala Paal” an wan neda wan se, “Mi a fala Apalos,” unu no tingk se unu a gwaan laik piipl we no nuo Gad?

Who then is Paul, and who is Apollos, but ministers by whom you believed, even as the Lord gave to each one?|Afta aal, uu a Apalos? An uu a Paal? A wi kom priich tu unu an mek unu biliiv bot di tuu a wi did onggl a du wa Gad se wi fi du. Wi a onggl Gad sorvant.
I have planted, Apollos watered, but God gave the increase.|Luk pan it da wie ya, ef unu a did wan plaant, a mi wuda did plaant di siid. Apalos a di wan we did waata unu bot a Gad mek unu gruo.

So then neither is he who plants nor he who waters anything, but God who gives the increase. |So di wan we plaant an di wan we waata, dem no impuotant. Di onggl wan we riili impuotant a di wan we kaaz unu fi gruo.

Now he who plants and he who waters are one, and each one will receive his own reward according to his own labor. |Nou di wan we plaant an di wan we waata, di tuu a dem a wok tugeda kaaz dem waahn di siem sitn fi apm. An di tuu a dem a-go get pie bies pan we dem du.

For we are laborers together with God: You are God’s vineyard; you are God’s building.|Mi an Apalos, wi a jos Gad sorvant an di tuu a wi a wok tugeda fi Gad. Bot unu, unu a Gad fiil we wi a plaant op, unu a Gad bildin.

According to the grace of God which has been given to me, as a wise master builder, I have laid the foundation, but another builds on it. Now let each one take heed how he builds on it.|Mek mi put it wan neda wie. Gad gud an kain tu mi, so im mek mi wan a im ed bilda dem. A mi go iin go bil di foundieshan we sumadi els a-go bil pan. Nou aal a wi afi wach ou wi a bil.

For no one can lay another foundation than that which was laid, which is Jesus Christ.|Kaaz nobadi kyan go bil wan neda foundieshan pan tap a di wan we de de aredi. An di foundieshan we de de aredi a Jiizas Krais. Im a di wan an onggl foundieshan.

Now if anyone builds on this foundation with gold, silver, precious stones, wood, hay, or stubble,|Nou som piipl a-go yuuz guol, silva ar ada stuon we kaas nof moni wen dem a bil pan da foundieshan de. An som ada piipl a-go yuuz wud, jrai graas ar chraa wen dem a bil.

each one’s work will be revealed. For the Day will declare it, because it will be revealed by fire, and the fire will test what sort of work each has done.|Pan di die wen Krais Jiizas kom bak evribadi a-go nuo wa evribadi bil wid an evribadi a-go nuo ef wa evribadi bil gud kaaz Gad a-go tes it wid faiya.
If anyone’s work which he has built on the foundation endures, he will receive a reward. |Ef di faiya no bon op wa dem bil pan di foundieshan, Gad a-go pie dem fi di wok we dem du.

If anyone’s work is burned, he will suffer loss. But he himself will be saved, still going through the fire.|Bot ef di faiya bon op wa dem bil, Gad naa go pie dem. Dem naa go ded bot evriting els we dem av a-go bon op iina di faiya.
Do you not know that you are the temple of God, and that the Spirit of God dwells in you? |Unu no nuo se unu badi a Gad ous an dat im Spirit a liv iina unu?
If anyone defiles the temple of God, God will destroy him. For the temple of God is holy. And you are His temple.|Enibadi we mash op Gad ous, Gad a-go mash dem op. Kaaz Gad ous uoli an unu a Gad ous.

Let no one deceive himself. If anyone among you seems to be wise in this world, let him become a fool that he may be wise.|No bada fuul unuself. Ef unu tingk unu waiz jos chuu di piipl we no biliiv iina Gad se so, mi a tel unu a beta unu ton fuul so dat unu kyan riili get waiz.

For the wisdom of this world is foolishness with God. For it is written, “He catches the wise in their own craftiness,”|Kaaz wa dem piipl de se waiz, Gad tek fi fuulinish. It aal rait dong iina Gad wod se, “Di piipl dem we tingk se dem waiz, Gad tek di siem sitn dem we dem tingk waiz an yuuz it ton dem iina fuul.”
and again, “The Lord knows the thoughts of the wise, that they are vain.”|An it se agen se, “Di piipl dem we tingk dem waiz Gad nuo aal we dem a tingk. An im nuo se aal we dem a plan no wot notn.”
Therefore let no one boast in men. For all things are yours:|So tap buos bout uu unu a fala, kaaz evriting a fi unu uon.

whether Paul or Apollos or Cephas or the world or life or death or things present or things to come, all are yours|Gad sen aal a wi: Paal, Apalos an Siifas fi elp unu. Evriting we de iina di worl, Gad mek fi unu. Wa apm wen unu a liv an wa apm wen unu ded, Gad mek it so evriting wok out gud fi unu. Aal di sitn dem we apm nou an aal a di sitn dem we a-go apm — apm fi elp unu. Evriting bilang tu unu.
and you are Christ’s, and Christ is God’s.|An unu bilang tu Krais Jiizas, an Krais Jiizas bilang tu Gad.
Let a man so regard us as the ministers of Christ and stewards of the mysteries of God.
column2: Dis a ou unu fi tingk bout wi we a tiich unu: unu fi luk pan wi an si se wi a jos Krais Jiizas sorvant dem an di wan dem we de ya fi tel unu bout aal a di sitn dem we unu no nuo bout Gad.

column1: Moreover it is required in stewards that a man be found faithful.|Nou ef yu a wan sorvant, di onggl sitn yu maasta waahn, a fi yu du wa im gi yu fi du, an fi yu du it gud tu.

But with me it is a very small thing that I should be judged by you or by man’s judgment. I do not even judge myself. |So yu si mi, mi no bizniz wid wa piipl av fi se bout mi. It no mata tu mi ef unu ar di piipl we de a kuot waahn joj di wok we mi du. Mi no iivn joj miself.

For I know nothing against myself. Yet I am not justified by this. But He who judges me is the Lord. |Az faar az mi nuo, mi no du notn rang, bot dat no pruuv se wa mi a du rait. Bot a no unu a-go joj mi, a di Laad a-go joj mi.

Therefore judge nothing before the appointed time until the Lord comes. He will bring to light the hidden things of darkness and will reveal the purposes of the hearts. Then everyone will have commendation from God.|So no bada joj nobadi til di taim rait. Wiet til di Laad kom. Aal a di rang sitn dem we piipl du an chrai fi aid, im wi mek evribadi nuo bout dem an im wi shuo wa riili de iina piipl aat. An den Gad wi big op di wan dem we du di wok we im gi dem an we du it gud.

Brothers, I have figuratively applied these things to myself and to Apollos for your sakes, so that you may learn from us not to think of men above that which is written, and that not one of you would be arrogant for one against another.|Breda an sista, unu mait-a tingk se aal a di sitn dem we mi se onggl a taak bout mi an Apalos bot it a taak bout unu tu. Mi did a yuuz mi an Apalos laif fi shuo unu an mek unu andastan se unu no fi du eniting els bot we rait dong iina Gad wod. Kaaz ef unu fala wa rait dong, unu wi no buos bout wan tiicha an iet di ada wan.

For who makes you differ from another? And what do you have that you did not receive? Now if you received it, why do you boast as if you had not received it?|Kaaz a uu mek unu beta dan enibadi els? Wa unu av we a no get unu get it? An ef a get unu get it, mek unu a buos laik se a no get unu did get it?

Now you are full, now you are rich; you have begun reigning as kings without us, and I wish to God you reigned, so that we also might reign with you.|Uo! So unu av aal we unu kuda waahn aredi! An unu don rich! Wos unu ton king lef wi. Mi wish se unu did riili ton king fi chuu, so dat wi kuda ton king wid unu tu.

For I think that God has exhibited us, the apostles, last, as if we were sentenced to death. For we have been made a spectacle to the world, to angels and to men.|Kaaz it komiin laik se Gad put wi, im apasl dem, iina di luowis pozishan, laik se wi a som man we get sen fi go ded. Kaaz di worl, di ienjel dem — evribadi tek wi fi papi shuo.

We are fools for Christ’s sake, but you are wise in Christ. We are weak, but you are strong. You are honorable, but we are despised.|Nof piipl tingk wi a fuul kaaz wi biliiv iina Krais Jiizas. Bot unu, unu tingk se unu waiz kaaz unu bilang tu Krais. Nof piipl tingk se wi naa no powa fi du notn bot unu, unu tingk se unu av nof powa. Piipl shuo unu rispek bot dem no rispek wi.

Even to this present hour we both hunger and thirst, and are poorly clothed and beaten and homeless. |Aal nou wi onggri an wi chuot jrai. Fi wi kluoz komiin laik piis a uol tier op klaat, piipl chriit wi bad bad an wi no av no we fi liv.

We labor, working with our own hands. Being reviled, we bless. Being persecuted, we endure.|Wi tek wi uona an dem an wok aad aad. Wen piipl kos wi an se aal kain-a sopm bout wi, aal wi du a bles dem. Wen piipl mek wi a sofa, wi no gi op wi jos gwaan uol chrang.

Being slandered, we encourage. We are made as the filth of the world, and are the refuse of all things to this day.|Wen piipl tel lai pan wi, wi stil taak tu dem nais. Aal nou di worl gwaan laik se wi a jos gyaabij, wi komiin laik jregs we lef bak.
I do not write these things to shame you, but as my beloved sons I warn you.|Mi naa rait dem sitn ya fi shiem unu. Mi a rait dem fi tiich unu kaaz unu a laik mi pikni dem an mi lov unu.

For if you were to have ten thousand instructors in Christ, yet you do not have many fathers. In Christ Jesus I have become a father to you through the gospel. |Kaaz iivn duo unu mait-a av ten touzn tiicha fi elp unu liv ou Gad waahn unu fi liv, a no aal a dem a-go komiin laik wan faada tu unu. Bot mi a unu faada kaaz a mi fos bring di Gud Nyuuz kom gi unu an elp unu fi biliiv.
So I implore you, be followers of me.|So mi a beg unu, liv unu laif laik ou unu si mi a liv fi mi uon.

Therefore I have sent Timothy to you. He is my beloved son and is faithful in the Lord. He will remind you of my ways which are in Christ, as I teach everywhere in every church.|A so mek mi a sen Timoti tu unu, Timoti we mi lov an we komiin laik mi pikni kaaz di tuu a wi biliiv iina di siem Gad. Mi a sen im fi elp unu memba aal a di sitn dem we mi did tiich unu bout Krais Jiizas. A di siem sitn mi a tiich aal bout iina aal a di choch dem.
Now some are arrogant, as though I were not coming to you.|Nou som a unu staat get buosi kaaz unu tingk se mi naa go kom si unu.

But I will come to you shortly if the Lord wills. And I will know not only what those who are arrogant are saying, but also their power.|Bot mi a-go kom de suun, ef dat a wa di Laad waahn mi fi du. Mi a-go kom de an mi wi fain out fi miself no jos wa dem buosi piipl a se, bot mi a-go fain out a wa kain-a powa dem av.
For the kingdom of God is not in word, but in power.|Kaaz Gad kindom no bies pan wa piipl se, Gad kindom bies pan powa.

What do you desire? Shall I come to you with a rod, or in love and in the spirit of meekness?|Wich wan unu wuda waahn mi fi du? Unu wuda waahn mi fi kom tu unu wid wan tik fi biit unu ar unu wuda waahn mi kom wid wan spirit we kain an jengkl an shuo unu lov?

It is actually reported that there is sexual immorality among you, and such immorality as is not even named among the Gentiles, that a man has his father’s wife. |Nou piipl kom tel mi se unu av som piipl mongks unu we a du aal kain-a seks sin. Di sitn dem we dem a du so bad dat no iivn di piipl dem we no nuo Gad wuda du dem. Mi a ier bout ou wan man aal a sliip wid im stepmada.

But you are arrogant. Instead you should have mourned, so that he who has done this deed might be removed from among you.|An unu a buos bout unuself! Unu no tingk se unu shuda a eng dong unu ed iina shiem an a baal? Unu no tingk se unu shuda kik out di wan dem we a du dem sitn de?

For indeed, though absent in body but present in spirit, I have already, as if I were present, judged him who has done this deed,|Iivn duo mi no de de, mi spirit de de wid unu. An mi don joj di wan dem we a tek paat iina aal kain-a seks sin. Mi joj dem an mi tel unu aredi wa unu fi du wid dem, laik se mi did de de wid unu.

in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ. When you are assembled, along with my spirit, in the power of our Lord Jesus Christ,|Wen unu gyada tugeda an mi spirit de de wid unu, wid di rait an di powa we di Laad Jiizas Krais gi wi

deliver him to Satan for the destruction of the flesh, so that the spirit may be saved on the day of the Lord Jesus.|unu fi an uova di wan dem we a du aal kain-a seks sin tu Sietan. An dem uova so dat Sietan kyan mash dem op. Dat a di onggl wie dem wi chienj dem wiez an ton we fram sin. An wen dem ton we fram sin an get siev, Gad naa go ponish dem wen im kom bak fi joj di worl.
Your boasting is not good. Do you not know that a little yeast leavens the whole batch?
column2: Unu no fi buosi-buosi. A no gud sopm dat! Unu no nuo se a onggl wan likl bit a yiis yu niid fi mek di uol a di duo swel op?

column1: Therefore purge out the old yeast, that you may be a new batch, since you are unleavened. For even Christ, our Passover, has been sacrificed for us.|Unu mos get rid a aal a di sin we de iina unu laif, jos laik ou wi dash we uol yiis. Unu mos get rid a it so dat unu kyan komiin laik fresh duo we naa no yiis iina it. Kaaz dat a wa unu riili fi bi sins Gad mek unu nyuu wen unu biliiv iina Jiizas. Kaaz Jiizas ded fi set wi frii, im komiin jos laik di biebi shiip we dem did kil a Paasuova taim.

Therefore let us keep the feast, not with old yeast, nor with the yeast of malice and wickedness, but with the unleavened bread of sincerity and truth.|So no mek wi selibriet di Paasuova festival wid uol yiis — yiis we ful op a bad main an wikidnis. Mek wi selibriet it wid bred we naa no yiis — di bred we gud an kliin.

I wrote to you in my letter not to keep company with sexually immoral people.|Iina di leta we mi did rait tu unu, mi did tel unu se unu no fi av notn fi du wid piipl we a tek paat iina no kain-a seks sin.

Yet I did not mean the sexually immoral people of this world, or the covetous and extortioners, or the idolaters, since you would then need to go out of the world.|Wen mi se so mi neva did a taak bout di piipl dem we no biliiv iina Gad. A chuu se som a dem piipl de tek paat iina seks sin an som a dem griidi. Som a di piipl we no biliiv iina Gad, tiif ada piipl sitn dem an som a dem worship aal kain-a faalz gad. Bot ef a did dem mi did a taak unu kudn liv no we — unu wuda afi lef da worl ya.

But I have written to you not to keep company with any man who is called a brother, who is sexually immoral, or covetous, or an idolater, or a reviler, or a drunkard, or an extortioner. Do not even eat with such a person.|Wen mi did rait unu mi did a taak bout piipl we se dem biliiv iina Gad. No av notn fi du wid nobadi we se dem a Gad pikni bot a tek paat iina aal kain-a seks sin. No av notn fi du wid dem ef dem waahnti-waahnti, tiif ada piipl sitn dem, worship faalz gad, tel lai ar jringk tu moch. No iivn iit wid dem piipl de.
For what have I to do with judging those also who are outside? Do you not judge those who are inside?
column2: Kaaz wa bizniz mi av a joj piipl we no biliiv iina Gad? A no di piipl we biliiv iina Gad wi fi joj?

column1: But God judges those who are outside. Therefore “put away from among yourselves that wicked person.”
column2: Gad wi joj di piipl we no biliiv iina im. “Ron di wikid piipl dem fram mongks unu.”

column1: Dare any of you, having a matter against another, go to the law before the unrighteous, and not before the saints?|Ef non a unu a kwaril an a fait wid wan a unu choch breda ar sista, unu kuda riili mad inof fi kyari dem go kuot insted-a mek Gad piipl saat it out?

Do you not know that the saints will judge the world? If the world will be judged by you, are you unworthy to judge the smallest matters?|Unu no nuo se a Gad piipl a-go joj di worl? An ef a unu a-go joj di worl, unu no tingk se unu kyan manij fi saat out di likl aagiment dem we unu av mongks unu wan aneda?
Do you not know that we shall judge angels? How much more the things that pertain to this life?
column2: Unu no nuo se a wi a-go joj di ienjel dem? So den wi no mos kyan diil wid dem likl sitn ya we apm pan ort?

column1: If then you have judgments dealing with matters of this life, do you appoint as judges those who are least esteemed in the church?|So wen unu av prablem iina di choch an piipl a kwaril wid dem wan aneda, unu a-go pik piipl we no av notn fi du wid di choch fi saat out di mata?
I speak to your shame. Is it true that there is not even one wise man among you who shall be able to judge between his brothers?
column2: Mi a se dis fi shiem unu. Unu miin fi se dat nobadi no de mongks unu we waiz inof fi diil wid dem sitn ya?

column1: But brother goes to the law against brother, and before unbelievers, at that.|Bot sumadi we biliiv iina Gad kyari wan neda sumadi we biliiv go kuot — wos kyari dem go infronta wan joj we no biliiv iina Gad.
Now therefore it is already an utter failure for you that you go to law against one another. Why not rather be wronged? Why not rather be defrauded?
column2: Di fak se unu afi kyari unu wan aneda go kuot fi saat out unu prablem dem shuo se unu naa liv laik ou Gad waahn unu fi liv. Unu no tingk it beta fi sumadi du unu rang? Unu no tingk it beta fi sumadi tiif fram unu?

column1: But you yourselves do wrong and defraud, and do this to your brothers. |Nuo, insted-a dat, a unu a tiif an a unu a du rang — wos unu a du it tu unu uona breda an sista.

Do you not know that the unrighteous will not inherit the kingdom of God? Do not be deceived. Neither the sexually immoral, nor idolaters, nor adulterers, nor male prostitutes, nor homosexuals|Unu no nuo se di wikid naa go av no paat iina Gad kindom? No bada fuul unuself! Di piipl dem we tek paat iina aal kain-a seks sin an we worship faalz gad naa go tek paat iina Gad kindom. Piipl we sliip wid piipl dem no marid tu, piipl we sel dem badi fi moni, man we sliip wid man an uman we sliip wid uman, dem naa go si Gad kindom at aal.

nor thieves, nor covetous, nor drunkards, nor revilers, nor extortioners will inherit the kingdom of God. |Bot a no dem wan, piipl we tiif, piipl we waahnti-waahnti, piipl we eva a get jongk, piipl we tek dem mout tier dong ada piipl an piipl we chrik piipl fi get dem moni, no iivn wan a dem a-go tek paat iina Gad Kindom niida.

Such were some of you. But you were washed, you were sanctified, and you were justified in the name of the Lord Jesus by the Spirit of our God.|An a dem de kain-a piipl som a unu yuus tu bi. Bot Gad did wash unu an mek unu kliin. Im sen im Uoli Spirit fi taak tu unu aat so dat unu an wi Laad Jiizas Krais kuda ton wan. An wen unu ton wan, im tek we unu sin.

All things are lawful to me,” but not all things are helpful. “All things are lawful for me,” but I will not be brought under the power of anything. |Piipl wi se, “Mi kyan du eniting mi waahn fi du, no laa no de de fi tap mi,” — bot a no evriting we wi kyan du, gud fi wi. Piipl wi se tu, “Mi kyan du eniting mi waahn fi du, no laa no de de fi tap mi,” — bot mi naa go mek notn we mi kyan du ruul uova mi.

“Food is for the belly, and the belly is for food,” but God will destroy both of them. Now the body is not for sexual immorality, but for the Lord, and the Lord is for the body.|Ada piipl wi se tu, “Fuud a fi yu beli an yu beli a fi fuud,” — bot Gad a-go mash op di tuu a dem. Yu badi neva mek fi yu tek it go tek paat iina aal kain-a seks sin. Yu badi a fi di Laad an di Laad a fi yu badi.
God has raised up the Lord and will also raise us up by His own power.|Gad yuuz im powa an mek di Laad kom bak alaiv, an im a-go mek wi liv agen tu.

Do you not know that your bodies are the parts of Christ? Shall I then take the parts of Christ and make them the parts of a harlot? God forbid! |Unu no nuo se fi unu badi a paat a Krais Jiizas badi. So den, mi fi tek di piipl dem we mek op im badi an mek dem go sliip wid uman we sel ar badi fi moni — an mek dem ton paat a fi ar badi? Nuo sa!

What? Do you not know that he who is joined to a harlot is one body with her? For “the two,” He says, “shall become one flesh.”|Unu no nuo se enibadi we sliip wid wan uman we sel ar badi fi moni, ton paat a ar badi tu? Kaaz it rait dong iina Gad wod se, “Wen man an uman av seks, it komiin laik se dem badi ton wan.”
But he who is joined to the Lord becomes one spirit with Him.|Bot enibadi we a luk fi mek dem an di Laad wan, dem a-go bi wan wid im Spirit tu.
Escape from sexual immorality. Every sin that a man commits is outside the body. But he who commits sexual immorality sins against his own body.
column2: Unu fi ron we fram aal kain-a seks sin. Di res a sin dem we piipl du apm outsaida di badi — it naa du dem badi notn. Bot di piipl we tek paat iina aal kain-a seks sin a mash op dem badi.

column1: What? Do you not know that your body is the temple of the Holy Spirit, who is in you, whom you have received from God, and that you are not your own?|Unu no nuo se unu badi a di ous fi di Uoli Spirit we Gad gi unu? Unu no de pan unu uon.

You were bought with a price. Therefore glorify God in your body and in your spirit, which are God’s.|Gad pie nof fi unu wen im sen im Bwai Pikni fi ded fi unu. So tek kier a unu badi an liv rait so dat piipl wi nuo se unu bilang tu Gad.
Now concerning the things about which you wrote to me: “It is good for a man not to touch a woman.”
column2: Nou mek mi diil wid di sitn dem we unu rait mi bout: notn no rang ef wan man no go a bed wid wan uman.

column1: Nevertheless, because of sexual immorality, let every man have his own wife, and let every woman have her own husband.|Bot sins nof piipl a sliip wid piipl an dem no marid, evri man fi av im uona waif, an evri uman fi av ar uona ozban.

Let the husband render to the wife due affection, and likewise the wife to the husband.|Ozban mos sliip wid dem waif, dat a fi dem dyuuti. A siem wie so di waif dem mos sliip wid dem ozban kaaz dat a fi dem dyuuti tu.

The wife does not have authority over her own body, but the husband does. Likewise, the husband does not have authority over his own body, but the wife does.|Di waif badi a no fi ar uon, ar badi bilang tu ar ozban. A siem so di ozban badi a no fi im uon, im badi bilang tu im waif.

Do not deprive one another except with consent for a time, that you may give yourselves to fasting and prayer. Then come together again, so that Satan does not tempt you for lack of self-control. |Wen unu marid unu onggl fi tap sliip wid unu wan aneda ef di tuu a unu mek op unu main fi tap so unu kyan spen som taim a prie. An unu onggl fi du dat fi a shaat taim. Wen di taim paas unu fi go bak go sliip wid unu wan aneda so dat Sietan kyaahn kaaz unu fi du notn rang kaaz unu kyaahn kanchuol unu badi.
I speak this as a concession and not as a command.
column2: Mi naa tel di marid piipl fi tap av seks mi jos a se dat dem kyan tap fi a taim ef dem waahn du dat.

column1: For I would that all men were even as I myself. But every man has his proper gift from God, one after this manner and another after that.|Mi wish se evribadi wuda stie laik mi — mi no marid. Bot Gad mek evribadi difrant, im mek som piipl tan da wie ya an im mek som piipl tan da wie de.

I say to the unmarried and widows that it is good for them if they live even as I am. |Nou di piipl we no marid an di piipl dem we ozban ar waif ded lef dem, a dis mi afi se tu unu: it gud fi unu tan ou unu bi an no marid jos laik mi.

But if they cannot restrain themselves, let them marry. For it is better to marry than to burn with passion.|Bot ef dem kyaahn kanchuol demself, dem fi get marid. Kaaz a beta dem marid dan dem no marid an mek dem niecha kil dem.
Now to the married I command, not I, but the Lord, do not let the wife depart from her husband.|Nou di piipl dem we marid dis a wa di Laad a se unu mos du, a no mi se so: No waif mos lef ar ozban.

But if she departs, let her remain unmarried or be reconciled to her husband. And do not let the husband divorce his wife.|Bot ef shi lef im, shi no fi marid agen, shi kyan aalwiez mek op bak wid ar ozban duo. A siem wie no ozban mos lef im waif.

To the rest I speak, not the Lord: If any brother has an unbelieving wife who consents to live with him, he should not divorce her. |Tu di res a unu, dis a wa mi a se tu unu, no di Laad: Ef wan a yu choch breda dem av wan waif we no biliiv iina Gad, an shi api fi gwaan liv wid im, im no fi lef ar.

And if the woman has an unbelieving husband who consents to live with her, she should not divorce him. |An ef wan uman av wan ozban we no biliiv iina Gad, an im api fi gwaan liv wid ar, shi no fi lef im niida.

For the unbelieving husband is sanctified by the wife, and the unbelieving wife is sanctified by the husband. Otherwise, your children would be unclean. But now they are holy.|Gad tek di ozban we no biliiv iina im fi bi im pikni kaaz im waif a wan a im pikni. A siem so di waif we no biliiv, Gad tek ar fi bi im pikni kaaz ar ozban a fi im pikni. Ef Gad neva tek di ozban ar di waif we no biliiv iina im fi bi im pikni tu, fi dem pikni wudn bilang tu Gad. Bot chuu Gad tek dem az im pikni, fi dem pikni bilang tu im tu.

But if the unbeliever departs, let that one depart. A brother or a sister is not bound in such cases. God has called us to peace.|Bot ef di wan we no biliiv iina Gad waahn fi lef, mek dem gwaan. Ef dem waahn lef, di breda ar sista we biliiv no afi stie marid tu dem no muor. Kaaz Gad waahn wi fi liv iina piis.

For how do you know, O wife, whether you will save your husband? Or how do you know, O husband, whether you will save your wife?|Aal a unu we a waif an av ozban we no biliiv, ou unu nuo se unu naa go siev unu ozban? An aal a unu we a ozban an we av wan waif we no biliiv, ou unu nuo se unu naa go siev unu waif?

But as God has given to every man and as the Lord has called every man, so let him walk. This I command in all churches.|Gad mek it so dat evribadi liv difrant an iivn duo unu biliiv iina im nou, unu fi gwaan tan iina di siem pozishan we Gad put unu bifuo im kaal unu fi ton wan a im piipl. Iina evri wan a di choch dem dis a wa mi se unu fi du.

Is any man called while circumcised? Let him not become uncircumcised. Is any man called while uncircumcised? Let him not be circumcised. |Ef wan man did sorkomsaiz wen Gad kaal im fi bi wan a im piipl, im no fi chrai chienj notn ar aid notn, im fi tan ou im bi. Ef wan man neva sorkomsaiz wen Gad kaal im fi ton wan a im piipl, im no fi go get sorkomsaiz, im fi tan ou im tan.

Circumcision is nothing, and uncircumcision is nothing, but the keeping of the commandments of God is everything.|A no notn ef yu sorkomsaiz jos laik ou a no notn ef yu no sorkomsaiz. Di onggl ting we mata a dat unu du wa Gad se unu fi du.
Let each man remain in the same condition in which he was called.|Wen Gad kaal unu fi bi paat a im piipl, aal a unu fi tan ou Gad did put unu.

Were you called while a servant? Do not worry about it. But if you may become free, do so.|Ef yu a did wan sliev wen yu staat biliiv iina Gad, no mek dat bada yu. Bot ef yu av wan wie we yu kyan get frii, den du it.

For he who is called in the Lord while a servant is the Lord’s freeman. Likewise, he who is called while free is Christ’s servant. |Kaaz ef sumadi a did wan sliev wen dem staat biliiv iina Gad, wi Laad Jiizas Krais frii dem. A siem so ef dem did frii wen Gad kaal dem fi bi paat a im piipl, dem a-go ton wan sliev fi Krais.
You were bought at a price. Do not be the servants of men.|Gad pie fi unu, no mek nobadi tek unu ton unu iina sliev.

Brothers, let every man, in whatever condition he is called, remain there with God.|Breda an sista unu biliiv nou, so unu an Gad kluos. Bot unu mos tan iina di siem pozishan wich paat Gad did put unu bifuo unu staat biliiv.

Now concerning virgins, I have no command from the Lord. Yet I will give my judgment as one who has obtained mercy from the Lord to be faithful.|Nou fi di piipl dem we neva av seks wid nobadi yet, Gad neva gi mi no ruul fi unu. Bot Gad gud an kain tu mi an im elp mi so moch dat unu kyan chos wa mi bout fi tel unu.

I suppose therefore that this is good because of the present distress, that it is good for a man to remain as he is. |Yu si chuu di wan dem we biliiv iina Gad a-go go chuu nof aad taimz, mi tingk it beta fi unu tan ou unu bi.
Are you committed to a wife? Do not seek to be uncommitted. Are you free from a wife? Do not seek a wife. |Ef yu av wan waif, yu no fi lef ar bot ef yu naa no waif, yu no fi go luk non niida.

But if you marry, you have not sinned. And if a virgin marries, she has not sinned. Nevertheless they will have trouble in this life, but I would spare you that.|Bot ef di wan dem we neva av seks yet go get marid a no sin dem a sin. Bot dem we get marid, dem a-go av nof chobl iina da laif ya an mi no waahn unu fi afi go chuu dat.

But this I say, brothers, the time is short. It remains that those who have wives should be as though they had none;|Wa mi a chrai fi se breda an sista, a dat taim shaat — Krais Jiizas suun kom bak. So fram nou aan, aal a unu we av waif fi sorv Gad so til it komiin laik se unu no av no waif.

those who weep, as though they did not weep; those who rejoice, as though they did not rejoice; those who buy, as though they possessed nothing;|A siem so dem we a baal, fi sorv Gad so til it komiin laik se dem neva did a baal. Dem we api, fi sorv Gad jos laik dem wuda sorv im ef dem neva api. Mek di piipl dem we av moni fi bai aal we dem niid, sorv Gad so til it komiin laik se dem neva av notn.

and those who use this world, as though they did not make full use of it. For the form of this world is passing away.|Di piipl dem we a wok aad so dem kyan liv gud, unu no fi spen aal a unu taim a wori bout di sitn dem we de iina da worl ya. Kaaz da worl ya naa go tan so fi eva — it suun ded an gaan.

But I prefer that you have no concern. He who is unmarried cares for the things of the Lord, how he may please the Lord. |Mi no waahn unu fi afi wori bout notn. Di man we no marid onggl bizniz wid Gad wok an wa im waahn im fi du. Im onggl waahn Gad fi api wid im.

But he who is married cares for the things of the world, how he may please his wife.|Bot di man we marid im afi wori bout di sitn dem we im fambili niid fi liv. Im afi wori bout ou fi tek kier a im waif.

There is a difference between a wife and a virgin. The unmarried woman cares for the things of the Lord, that she may be holy in body and in spirit. But she who is married cares for the things of the world, how she may please her husband.|Di man we marid afi tingk bout tuu sitn wan taim. Di uman dem we no marid an di wan dem we neva sliip wid no man yet, dem eva a tingk bout di Laad an onggl bizniz wid ou dem kyan sorv im. Dem waahn aal we dem du wid dem badi an aal we dem tingk fi shuo se dem bilang tu Gad. Bot di uman dem we marid, dem afi wori bout fuud an ous an fambili — dem afi wori bout ou fi kip dem ozban api.

I say this for your own benefit, not to put any restraint upon you, but for what is proper, and that you may serve the Lord without distraction.|Mi naa chrai fi aada unu fi du dem sitn ya. Mi a se dem fi chrai elp unu, kaaz mi waahn unu fi kyan sorv Gad an no av notn a tap unu fram sorv im.

If any man thinks that he is behaving improperly toward his virgin, and if she is past the flower of her youth, and passions so require, let him do what he will. He does not sin. Let them marry. |Ef wan man fi marid wan uman we neva sliip wid no man yet an im tingk se im naa chriit ar rait, an shi a get uol an im fiil se im fi marid ar — mek im marid ar. Im naa sin ef im du dat. Dem fi get marid.

Nevertheless he who stands steadfast in his heart without necessity, and has power over his own will, and has so decreed in his heart that he will keep his virgin, does well. |Bot ef wan man fi marid wan uman we neva sliip wid no man yet, an im mek op im main se im naa get marid, an im kyan kanchuol imself — da man ya naa du notn rang niida.

So then he who gives her in marriage does well, but he who gives her not in marriage does better.|So di wan we marid di uman we neva sliip wid no man yet, du di rait sitn, bot di wan we no get marid — im du sitn iivn beta.

The wife is bound by the law as long as her husband lives. But if her husband dies, she is at liberty to be married to whom she will, but only in the Lord.|Wan uman mos stie marid tu ar ozban az lang az im a liv. Bot ef im ded shi kyan go marid sumadi els bot da man de afi bi wan a Gad pikni.

But in my judgment she is happier if she so remains as she is. And I think that I have the Spirit of God.|Az faar az mi kyan si an Gad Spirit liid mi jos laik ou im liid unu — a beta shi tan ou shi bi, shi wi muor api da wie de.

Now as concerning food offered to idols: We know that “we all have knowledge.” Knowledge produces arrogance, but love edifies.|Nou bout di fuud we unu sakrifais an gi faalz gad: wi nuo se aal a wi nuo bout da kain-a sakrifais de. Wen yu nuo sopm it kaaz yu fi get buosi bot lov, lov bil op piipl — it elp dem get chrang.
So if anyone thinks that he knows anything, he knows nothing yet as he ought to know. |Di piipl dem we tingk se dem nuo sopm no riili nuo it yet laik ou dem fi nuo it.
But if anyone loves God, this one is known by Him.|Bot ef sumadi lov Gad, Gad nuo dem.

So concerning the eating of foods that are offered in sacrifice to idols, we know that an idol is nothing in the world, and that there is no other God but one. |So den dis ting bout weda wi shuda iit ar no iit di fuud we piipl sakrifais gi faalz gad: di uol a wi nuo se dem faalz gad de no riili alaiv. An wi nuo se a onggl wan riil Gad de bout.

For there are those who are called gods, whether in heaven or in earth, as there are many gods and many lords. |Som piipl se dat yu av nof difrant gad, som we liv pan ort an som we liv iina evn (an wi nuo se a nof tingz piipl kaal gad an laad).

But for us there is but one God, the Father, from whom are all things and for whom we exist. And there is one Lord Jesus Christ, through whom are all things and through whom we exist.|Bot wi nuo se a onggl wan Gad de bout. Im a di Faada we mek evriting an im a uu wi a liv fa. An wi nuo se a onggl wan Laad de bout an dat a Jiizas Krais, a im mek evriting an a im mek wi kyan liv.

However, not everyone has this knowledge. Some, being accustomed to the idol until now, eat the food as a thing offered to an idol. So their weak conscience is defiled.|Bot a no evribadi nuo dis. Som piipl get so yuus tu worship faalz gad dat wen dem iit di fuud dem stil tingk se a wan sakrifais tu di faalz gad dem. An chuu dem stil yong iina wa dem biliiv, dem tingk se dem a sin wen dem nyam da fuud de.

But food does not commend us to God. Neither if we eat are we the better, nor if we do not eat are we the worse.|Bot fuud naa go mek wi an Gad kluosa, so a notn ef wi iit di fuud ar wi no iit di fuud. It naa du wi notn bad.

But take heed, lest by any means this liberty of yours becomes a stumbling block to those who are weak.|Wach unuself duo! Unu frii fi iit di fuud bot mek shuor se wen unu a iit it, unu naa kaaz di wan dem we yong iina wa dem biliiv fi sin.

For if anyone sees you, who have knowledge, eating in the idol’s temple, shall the conscience of him who is weak not be emboldened to eat those things which are offered to idols,|Kaaz ef wan a dem piipl de si wan a unu we chrang a iit di fuud we dem gi op tu di faalz gad dem, unu no tingk se dem a-go nyam it tu iivn duo dem tingk a sin?

and by your knowledge shall the weak brother perish, for whom Christ died?|An iivn duo unu nuo se it aarait, da breda ar sista ya we no chrang laik unu an we Jiizas ded fa, mait-a tap biliiv siek-a wa unu du.

When you thus sin against the brothers, wounding their weak conscience, you sin against Christ.|Wen yu kaaz sumadi fi go gens wa dem biliiv, an sin dem wie de, yu a sin tu. A laik unu a se Krais ded fi notn.

Therefore, if food causes my brother to stumble, I will never eat meat, lest I cause my brother to stumble.|So ef wa mi nyam a-go kaaz mi breda fi sin, mi wi tap nyam it. Da wie de mi wudn kaaz im fi sin.
Am I not an apostle? Am I not free? Have I not seen Jesus Christ our Lord? Are you not my work in the Lord?
column2: Mi a no wan a di apasl dem? Mi neva si wi Laad Jiizas Krais? Unu a no Gad piipl siek-a di wok we Gad sen mi fi du?

column1: If I am not an apostle to others, yet indeed I am to you. For you are the seal of my apostleship in the Lord.|Iivn ef ada piipl no tingk se mi a wan apasl, unu fi nuo se mi a wan! Kaaz di fak se unu an di Laad a wan shuo se mi a riili wan a Gad apasl.
This is my answer to those who examine me.
column2: Dis a wa mi av fi se tu aal a di piipl we a joj mi an a kwestiyan evriting we mi du.

column1: Do we have no right to eat and to drink?
column2: Unu no tingk se wi av di rait fi get fuud an jringks fi di wok we wi du?

column1: Do we not have the right to take along a believing wife as do other apostles, the brothers of the Lord, and Cephas?|Wi no av di rait fi tek uman we biliiv iina Gad an mek dem wi waif, an kyari dem roun wid wi, jos laik di ada apasl dem, di Laad breda an Siifas?
Or is it only Barnabas and I who have no right to refrain from working?
column2: Ar a mi an Baanabas a di onggl apasl dem we afi wok so dem kyan av moni fi liv?

column1: Who goes to war at any time at his own expense? Who plants a vineyard, but does not eat of its fruit? Or who feeds a flock, but does not drink of the flock’s milk? |Wich suoja unu nuo pie imself fi wok? Uu a-go plaant op nof griep an no nyam non wen di vain a bier? Uu unu nuo a-go tek kier a shiip an no jringk di milk we dem get fram dem?
Do I say these things as a man? Or does the law not say the same thing also?
column2: Unu tingk mi jos a se dem sitn ya kaaz dem mek sens? Di Laa no se dem siem sitn ya tu?

column1: For it is written in the Law of Moses, “You shall not muzzle the mouth of the ox while it treads out the grain.” Is God concerned about oxen? |Kaaz it rait dong iina Muoziz laa se, “Yu no fi tap di aks fram nyam wen im a mash out di grien.” Wen unu ier dat, unu riili tingk se Gad a wori bout di aks?

Or does He say it completely for our sake? For our sake, no doubt, this is written so that he who plows should plow in hope, and that he who threshes in hope should partake of his hope.|A no mos wi im a taak bout wen im se dat? Yes, it rait dong fi wi, so dat wen di wan we a dig op di grong an di wan we a mash out di grien go du dem wok dem kyan luk faawod tu di grien we dem a-go riip op.

If we have sown for you spiritual things, is it a great thing if we shall reap your material things?|Ef a wi plaant di gud sitn dem fram Gad Spirit iina unu aat, unu no tingk se wi shuda a get fram unu di sitn dem we wi niid fi liv?

If others partake of this right over you, should not we instead?Nevertheless, we have not used this right, but suffer all things, lest we might hinder the gospel of Christ.|Ef unu av ada piipl we unu afi sopuot, unu no tingk se unu shuda waahn sopuot wi muor dan dem?Bot iivn duo wi kuda tel unu fi sopuot wi, wi no aks unu fi notn. Wi go chuu evri an eniting so dat wi no tap nobadi fram biliiv di Gud Nyuuz bout Jiizas Krais.
Do you not know that those who minister unto holy things live from the things of the temple? And do you not know that those who wait at the altar partake of the altar?
column2: Unu no nuo se di wan dem we wok iina Gad ous get fi dem fuud siem plies de a Gad ous? An unu no nuo se di wan dem we elp fi fiks op di fuud fi bon sakrifais — dem get som a da siem fuud de?

column1: In the same way, the Lord has ordained that those who preach the gospel should live from the gospel.|A siem so di Laad se dat di wan dem we go roun an tiich di Gud Nyuuz fi get wa dem niid fi liv fram di piipl dem we dem a tiich.

But I have used none of these rights, nor have I written these things that it should be so done to me. For it would be better for me to die than allow anyone to make my boasting void. |Bot iivn duo mi av di rait fi aks unu fi sopuot mi, mi neva du it. An mi naa rait unu nou so dat unu wi staat du it niida. Mi wuda raada ded dan mek unu sopuot mi. Kaaz mi no waahn notn fi tap mi fram buos bout ou mi priich di Gud Nyuuz tu unu an neva get no elp fram unu.

Though I preach the gospel, I have nothing to boast of, for the requirement is laid upon me. Yes, woe unto me if I do not preach the gospel! |Mi kyaahn buos bout di fak se mi a priich di Gud Nyuuz kaaz a Gad aada mi fi du dat. An ef mi no priich di Gud Nyuuz, Gad wuda ponish mi.

So if I do this willingly, I have a reward, but if against my will, I have been entrusted with a commission.|Kaaz ef mi miself, chuuz fi priich di Gud Nyuuz, Gad wi pie mi. Bot ef a no chuuz mi chuuz fi du it, den aal mi a du, a du di wok we Gad gi mi an chos mi fi du.

What is my reward then? Truly that when I preach the gospel, I may present the gospel of Christ without charge, so that I may not abuse my authority in the gospel.|So den a wa mi a-go get pie? Fi mi pie a dat mi kyan priich di Gud Nyuuz bout Jiizas an no chaaj nobadi. Da wie de mi kyan priich an no aks unu fi sopuot mi iivn duo mi av di rait fi aks unu.

For though I am free from all men, I have made myself servant to all, that I might win even more. |Iivn duo mi frii an nobadi no uon mi, mi tek miself ton evribadi sliev, so dat mi kyan kaaz az moch piipl fi biliiv iina Gad az mi kyan.

To the Jews, I became as a Jew, that I might win the Jews; to those who are under the law, as under the law, that I might win those who are under the law;|Wen mi de wid piipl we a Juu, mi du di sitn dem we di Juu dem du so dat mi kuda win dem uova. An wen mi de mongks piipl we afi fala Muoziz laa, mi liv azkaadn tu di laa tu, iivn duo mi no afi fala it. Mi du dat so dat mi kyan win dem uova an elp dem fi biliiv iina Jiizas Krais.

to those who are outside the law, as outside the law (being not without God’s law, but under Christ’s law) that I might win those who are outside the law.|Wen mi de mongks piipl we no fala di laa, mi du wa dem du — mi no miin se mi brok Gad laa yu no, nuo, mi fala Krais Jiizas laa. Bot mi liv laik dem so dat mi kyan win dem uova an elp dem fi biliiv iina Jiizas tu.

To the weak, I became as weak, that I might win the weak. I have become all things to all men, that I might by all means save some.|Tu di piipl dem we wiik mi ton wiik tu, so dat mi kuda elp dem fi biliiv iina Jiizas Krais. So bies pan ou piipl liv, mi chienj ou mi liv so dat mi wuda du aal we mi kuda du fi elp siev som a dem.
This I do for the gospel’s sake, that I might partake of it with you.|Mi du aal a dat fi elp pred di Gud Nyuuz bout Jiizas, an so dat mi wi get di gud sitn dem we Gad pramis fi gi im piipl.

Do you not know that all those who run in a race run, but one receives the prize? So run, that you may obtain it.|Unu no nuo se aal di rona dem we go a stiediyom ron gens dem wan aneda, bot a onggl wan a dem kyan win? So unu mos ron laik se unu waahn fi win.

Everyone who strives for the prize exercises self-control in all things. Now they do it to obtain a corruptible crown, but we an incorruptible one.|Enibadi we a rona ar uu plie eni kain-a spuot afi eksasaiz an wok aad evridie. Dem afi nuo ou fi kanchuol demself iina evriting we dem du. Dem du dat so dat dem kyan win wan medal. Di medal we dem win kyan mash op bot yu si wa wi a-go get, dat kyaahn mash op — it a-go laas fi eva an eva.

So, therefore, I run, not with uncertainty. So I fight, not as one who beats the air. |So mi naa ron laik wan man we naa no we a ron go — mi ron chriet a di finish lain. Mi naa fait laik se mi a baks briiz.

But I bring and keep my body under subjection, lest when preaching to others I myself should be disqualified.|Nuo mi no mek mi badi kanchuol mi, mi kanchuol mi badi an mek it du wa mi waahn it fi du. Da wie de afta mi don priich di Gud Nyuuz Gad kyaahn se mi no dizorv fi mi praiz.

I would not want you to be unaware that all our fathers were under the cloud, and all passed through the sea,|Breda an sista mi waahn unu fi memba se fi wi faada an fi dem faada faada go bak, di kloud did protek di uol a dem wen dem did a kraas di red sii.
and all were baptized into Moses in the cloud and in the sea;|Wen dem waak anda da kloud de an kraas di sii, it komiin laik se dem did baptaiz an ton wan wid Muoziz, siek-a aal a wa dem go chuu.
all ate the same spiritual food;
column2: Di uol a dem did nyam di siem fuud we Gad iina im powa gi dem fi nyam.

column1: and all drank the same spiritual drink, for they drank of that spiritual Rock that followed them, and that Rock was Christ. |An di uol a dem did jringk di siem jringks we Gad iina im powa did gi dem fi jringk. Gad wok wan mirikl an mek waata kom outa rak, an a dat dem jringk. An di rak we di waata kom fram a did Krais Jiizas.

But with many of them God was not well pleased, and they were overthrown in the wilderness.|Bot iivn afta aal a dat, Gad neva api wid muos a dem. An so im kaaz dem fi ded an dem badi fi skyata skyata aal uova di dezot.
Now these things were our examples to the intent that we should not lust after evil things as they lusted.
column2: Nou aal dem sitn de apm so dat wi kuda si dem an lorn fram dem. Dem a waan wi fi no tan laik dem piipl de an waahn fi du bier wikid sitn.

column1: Neither be idolaters as were some of them. As it is written, “The people sat down to eat and drink and rose up to revel.”|Wi no fi du laik dem an worship no faalz gad. It rait dong iina Gad wod se, “Di piipl dem sidong fi nyam an jringk an den dem git op an staat daans.”

Neither let us commit sexual immorality as some of them committed, when twenty-three thousand fell in one day. |Wi no fi tek paat iina no kain-a seks sin laik dem. Kaaz a so mek twenti chrii touzn a dem ded aaf iina wan die.
Neither let us tempt Christ, as some of them also tempted and were destroyed by serpents.|Wi no fi stie laik dem an tes Krais Jiizas. Som a dem did tes Gad an siniek bait dem an kil dem.

Neither murmur, as some of them also murmured and were destroyed by the destroyer.|Wi no fi komplien an grombl grombl laik som a dem. Kaaz di wan dem we yuus tu grombl grombl, di ienjel we kom fi kil, kil dem aaf.

Now all these things happened to them for examples. They are written as an admonition to us, upon whom the end of the ages has come.|Aal a dem sitn de we apm tu dem a fi waan wi no fi liv laik dem. An it rait dong iina Gad wod fi waan aal a wi we a liv iina da taim ya wen di worl suun don.
Therefore let him who thinks he stands take heed, lest he fall.|So ef yu tingk se yu a tan op chrang, yu beta wach yuself so dat yu no jrap dong.

No temptation has taken you except what is common to man. God is faithful, and He will not permit you to be tempted above what you can endure, but will with the temptation also make a way to escape, that you may be able to bear it.|Di siem sin dem we unu a chogl wid, evribadi els a chogl wid dem tu. Bot Gad gud, im naa go mek yu fies no sin an no gi yu wan wie fi diil wid it — im naa go gi yu muor dan yu kyan manij.
So, my beloved, flee from idolatry. |So mi gud gud fren, no worship no faalz Gad — ron we fram dem sitn de.
I speak as to wise men. Judge for yourselves what I say. |Mi a taak tu unu laik piipl we av sens, so joj wa mi a se fi yuself.

The cup of blessing which we bless, is it not the communion of the blood of Christ? The bread which we break, is it not the communion of the body of Christ?|Di kop we wi yuuz wen wi av Laad sopa an we wi gi Gad tangks fa: wen wi jringk fram it wi naa tek paat iina wa Jiizas Krais did du fi wi wen im blod bliid out pan di kraas? An wen wi brok di bred a no tek wi a tek paat iina im badi tu?
For we, being many, are one bread and one body, for we are all partakers of that one bread.|So a onggl wan bred de bout an aal a wi ton wan badi wen di uol a wi iit da bred de.

Consider Israel after the flesh: Are not those who eat of the sacrifices partakers of the altar?|Luk pan di Juu dem: wen dem a bon sakrifais gi Gad, di wan dem we a gi op di sakrifais dem nyam som a di fuud tu. An wen dem nyam it, a no shuo dem a shuo se dem an Gad a wan?

What am I saying then, that the idol is anything or that which is offered in sacrifice to idols is anything?|Wa unu tingk mi a chrai fi se? Unu tingk se mi a se dat di fuud we dem bon gi sakrifais tu di faalz gad dem wot notn? Ar se di faalz gad dem we dem a gi di sakrifais tu a riil sopm?

But I say that the things which the Gentiles sacrifice, they sacrifice to demons, and not to God. I do not want you to have fellowship with demons. |Nuo! Wa mi a se a dat di piipl dem we no biliiv iina Gad bon sakrifais gi diiman, dem naa bon it gi Gad. An ef yu go nyam da fuud de, a laik yu a se dat yu an di diiman dem a wan, an mi no waahn unu fi av notn fi du wid no diiman.
You cannot drink the cup of the Lord and the cup of demons. You cannot be partakers of the Lord’s table and of the table of demons.
column2: Yu kyaahn a jringk fram di Laad kop an a jringk fram diiman kop tu. An yu kyaahn a nyam a di Laad tiebl an den go nyam a di diiman tiebl.

column1: Do we provoke the Lord to jealousy? Are we stronger than He?
column2: A mad unu a chrai fi mek Gad mad? Unu tingk se unu chrangga dan im?

column1: “All things are lawful for me,” but not all things are helpful. “All things are lawful for me,” but not all things edify.|Som piipl se, “Mi kyan du eniting wa mi waahn fi du,” bot a no evriting gud fi yu. Dem se, “Mi kyan du eniting wa mi waahn fi du,” bot a no evriting a-go elp yu fi gruo.
Let no one seek his own, but each one the other’s well-being.|Nobadi fi a luk out fi demself wan, dem fi a luk out fi dem nieba dem tu.
Eat whatever is sold in the meat market, asking no question for the sake of conscience|Yu kyan nyam di miit we dem sel iina di maakit an no afi wori ef it rait ar rang
for “The earth is the Lord’s, and everything in it.”|kaaz “Di uol worl an evriting we de iina it bilang tu Gad.”

If any of those who do not believe invite you to a feast, and you desire to go, eat whatever is set before you, asking no question for the sake of conscience.|Ef sumadi we no biliiv iina Gad invait yu a dem yaad fi iit dina, an yu waahn go, gwaan an nyam di fuud we dem gi yu. No bada wori bout ef da fuud de rait ar rang fi yu iit.

But if anyone says to you, “This was offered in sacrifice to idols,” do not eat it for the sake of him that mentioned it and for the sake of conscience, for “The earth is the Lord’s, and everything in it.”|Bot ef sumadi se tu yu se, “Kom iit som a di fuud we wi yuuz fi bon sakrifais gi di faalz Gad dem,” no nyam dat. No iit it kaaz di man we tel yu bout di fuud an piipl we no biliiv iina Gad wi si yu a iit it an tingk se yu a du sopm rang.

Conscience, I say, not your own, but that of the other. For why is my liberty judged by another man’s conscience? |So wail fi yu kanchens naa bada yu, no nyam it kaaz it wi kaaz ada piipl fi av prablem. Nou yu mait-a aks wai mi no fi iit wa mi waahn jos chuu ada piipl a-go av prablem wid it?

If I partake with thankfulness, why am I slandered concerning that for which I give thanks?|Ef mi prie an gi Gad tangks fi di fuud, it no aarait den fi mi iit it? Dem shudn av no prablem wid it ef mi du dat.

Therefore, whether you eat, or drink, or whatever you do, do it all to the glory of God.|Wel, di chuut a weda yu a iit fuud ar jringk jringks — evriting we yu du, yu fi du it iina wan wie we wi kaaz piipl fi priez Gad.
Give no offense, neither to the Jews, nor to the Gentiles, nor to the church of God|No du notn we a-go kaaz di Juu dem, di piipl we a no Juu ar Gad choch fi sin.

just as I try to please all men in all things, not seeking my own profit, but the profit of many, that they may be saved.|Unu fi du laik mi. Mi chrai fi du tingz we wi kaaz evribadi fi api. Mi no du tingz fi elp miself wan bot mi du tingz we wi elp evribadi. Mi du dat so dat evribadi kyan get siev.
Follow me as I follow Christ.|Unu mos fala mi, an du wa mi du. Jos laik ou mi fala Krais Jiizas, an du we im du.

I praise you, brothers, that you remember me in all things and keep the traditions as I delivered them to you. |Mi afi big unu op kaaz unu a du gud. Unu eva memba di sitn dem we mi did tiich unu an unu aalwiez a fala dem. Unu fala dem jos laik ou mi did se.

But I would have you know that the head of the woman is the man, the head of every man is Christ, and the head of Christ is God.|Bot mi waahn unu fi andastan se Krais, im a di ed fi evri man, evri ozban a di ed fi im waif, an Gad a di ed fi Krais.

Every man praying or prophesying having his head covered dishonors his head|Dat miin se ef wan man a prie ar a pred Gad mesij tu di piipl wid im ed kova op, a disrispek im a disrispek di wan we a di ed.

but every woman who prays or prophesies with her head uncovered dishonors her head, for that is the same as if she were shaved.|Bot eni uman we prie an pred Gad mesij tu piipl an no kova op ar ed, a shiem shi a bring dong shiem pan ar ozban. Siem laik ou a shiem wan uman wuda a shiem arself ef shi kot aaf aal a ar ier.

For if the woman is not covered, let her also cut off her hair. But if it is a shame for a woman to have her hair cut off or shaved, let her be covered.|So ef wan uman se shi naa go kova op ar ed, shi shuda jos go kot aaf ar ier. Bot sins a shiem fi wan uman kot ar ier shaat ar kot aaf aal a it, shi fi kova op ar ed.

For a man indeed ought not to cover his head, because he is the image and glory of God. But the woman is the glory of the man. |Man no niid fi kova im ed kaaz Gad mek man fi bi laik im an man shuo ou Gad griet. Bot uman, uman shuo ou man griet.
The man is not from the woman, but the woman from the man.|Kaaz wen Gad did a mek man im neva tek notn fram di uman fi mek im. Bot im tek paat a di man fi mek uman.
The man was not created for the woman, but the woman for the man. |Man neva mek fi uman niida, bot uman did mek fi man.

For this reason the woman ought to have a veil of authority over her head, because of the angels. |A siek-a dat an siek-a di ienjel dem dat uman mos av ar ed kova op. Shi fi av ar ed kova op fi shuo se ar ozban av ruul uova ar.

Nevertheless, neither is the man without the woman, nor the woman without the man in the Lord.|Dat no miin se man kyan du widout uman ar uman widout man, kaaz Gad neva mek dem fi du widout dem wan aneda.

For just as the woman came from the man, so the man comes through the woman, but all things come from God.|Memba se wen Gad did a mek uman im yuuz paat a di man fi du it, an nou fi man baan im niid wan uman. So evriting kom fram Gad.
Judge for yourselves. Is it proper for a woman to pray to God uncovered?
column2: Tingk bout dis an ansa da kwestiyan ya fi unuself: It rait fi wan uman prie tu Gad an no kova op ar ed?

column1: Does even nature itself not teach you that if a man has long hair it is a shame to him?
column2: It naamal fi wan man gruo im ier lang? A no shiem im a shiem imself?

column1: But if a woman has long hair, it is a glory to her, for her hair is given her for a covering. |Bot ef wan uman av taal ier, a no api shi fi wel api se shi av it? Kaaz a Gad gi ar da ier de fi ak laik wan kova fi ar ed.

But if anyone seems to be contentious, we have no such custom, nor have the churches of God.|Bot ef enibadi tingk se mi rang wen mi se dem tingz ya, a wan ting mi av fi se tu unu — mi an di res a Gad choch no tingk se eniting els rait.

Now in what I have to say to you, I do not praise you. You have come together not for the better, but for the worse.|Nou wen it kom tu di ruul dem we mi bout fi gi unu, mi kyaahn se unu a du gud, kaaz wen unu gyada fi choch unu du muor bad dan gud.

First of all, when you come together as the church, I hear that there are divisions among you, and in part I believe it. |Fos ting fos, mi ier se wen unu gyada tugeda fi av choch unu plit op iina gruup an aagyu wid unu wan aneda. A dat piipl a tel mi an mi biliiv se som a wa dem a se a chuu sopm.
For there must also be factions among you so that those who are genuine may become evident among you.
column2: Mi no fraitn fi ier se unu plit op iina gruup kaaz a so wi a-go nuo uu Gad riili api wid.

column1: Therefore when you come together into one place, it is not to eat the Lord’s Supper.|Wen unu gyada tugeda, a no riili di Laad sopa unu a iit.

For in eating, each one eats his own supper ahead of others. One goes hungry, and another becomes drunk. |Kaaz wen a taim fi iit, evribadi iit wen dem fiil laik, dem no wiet pan nobadi. Som piipl no get no fuud so dem onggri, wail ada piipl jringk til dem jongk.
What? Do you not have houses to eat and to drink in? Or do you despise the church of God and shame those who have nothing? What shall I say to you? Shall I praise you in this? I do not praise you.
column2: Wa apm? Unu no av yaad wich paat unu kyan nyam an jringk? Ar a shuo unu a chrai shuo se unu iet Gad choch wen unu shiem di piipl dem we no av notn? Wa mi fi se tu unu? Unu waahn mi tel unu ou unu gud? Mi kyaahn tel unu se unu a du gud wen unu du dem tingz ya.

column1: I have received of the Lord that which I delivered to you: that the Lord Jesus, on the night in which He was betrayed, took bread. |Di siem ting we di Laad did tiich mi a di siem ting we mi tiich unu: pan di nait Juudas sel out Jiizas, Jiizas tek di bred

When He had given thanks, He broke it and said, “Take and eat. This is My body which is broken for you. Do this in remembrance of Me.”|an wen im gi tangks fi it, im brok it an se, “Dis a mi badi we mi gi op fi unu. Iit da breda ya an memba mi.”

In the same manner He took the cup after He had supper, saying, “This cup is the new covenant in My blood. Do this, as often as you drink it, in remembrance of Me.”|Jos laik ou im tek di bred, wen dem don iit im tek op di kop an se, “Dis a mi blod an it a di nyuu pramis we Gad mek tu unu. Evritaim unu jringk wain fram da kop ya, unu fi memba mi.”

As often as you eat this bread and drink this cup, you proclaim the Lord’s death until He comes.|Kaaz til di Laad kom bak, evritaim unu iit di bred an jringk fram di kop, unu a tel di piipl dem se Jiizas did ded.

Therefore whoever eats this bread and drinks this cup of the Lord unworthily will be guilty of the body and blood of the Lord.|So enibadi we iit di bred ar jringk fram di kop iina wan wie we disrispek di Laad, da sumadi de, dem a sin gens di Laad badi an im blod.
Let a man examine himself, and so eat of the bread and drink of the cup. |Bifuo dem nyam di bred ar jringk fram di kop, evribadi mos luk pan demself an mek shuor se dem a tek paat fi di rait riizn.

For he who eats and drinks unworthily, eats and drinks damnation to himself, not discerning the Lord’s body. 30For this reason many are weak and unhealthy among you, and many die. |Kaaz ef sumadi iit di bred an jringk fram di kop an no rispek di fak se a di Laad badi, a jojment dem a bring dong pan demself.
For this reason many are weak and unhealthy among you, and many die.|A so mek nof a unu wiik an sik an a so mek som piipl ded.
If we would judge ourselves, we would not be judged.|Ef wi did a luk pan wiself an riili a tingk bout wa wi a du wen wi nyam di Laad sopa, Gad wudn ponish wi so.

But when we are judged, we are disciplined by the Lord, so that we would not be condemned with the world.|Bot wen Gad ponish wi a tiich im a chrai fi tiich wi. Im waahn wi lorn wa rait so dat wen im kom bak fi joj di worl, wi naa go ded laik di piipl we no biliiv iina im.
So, my brothers, when you come together to eat, wait for one another.|So mi breda an sista wen unu gyada tugeda fi tek Laad sopa, unu fi wiet pan unu wan aneda.

If anyone hungers, let him eat at home, so that you may not come together into condemnation.I will set the rest in order when I come.|Ef sumadi onggri mek dem nyam a dem yaad, so dat wen unu gyada tugeda unu no bring dong jojment pan unuself. Wen mi kom, mi wi gi unu som muor ruul bout som ada tingz we mi waahn unu fi fala.
Now concerning spiritual gifts, brothers, I do not want you to be ignorant. |Nou breda an sista, mi waahn unu fi andastan evriting bout di gif dem we di Uoli Spirit gi.
