You know that you were Gentiles, carried away to these dumb idols, however you were led. |Unu nuo se bifuo unu di staat biliiv iina Gad, sopm did jraa unu we an mek unu a fala aal kain-a faalz gad we kudn iivn taak.

Therefore I make known to you that no one speaking by the Spirit of God says, “Jesus be cursed!” And no one can say, “Jesus is the Lord,” except by the Holy Spirit.|So mi waahn unu fi andastan se nobadi we av Gad Spirit a liid dem kyan se dat, “Gad joj Jiizas an se im fi ded.” An sumadi kyan onggl se, “Jiizas a Laad” ef dem av di Uoli Spirit a liv iina dem.
There are various gifts, but the same Spirit. |A nof difrant sitn di Uoli Spirit mek wi kyan du bot wi fi memba se a di siem Spirit mek wi kyan du aal a dem.
There are differences of administrations, but the same Lord.|An wi av nof difrant wie fi sorv di Laad bot a di siem Laad di uol a wi a sorv.
There are various operations, but it is the same God who operates all of them in all people.|Wen wi a sorv Gad, evri wan a wi av di powa fi du sopm bot a di siem Gad gi di uol a wi di powa fi du it.
But the manifestation of the Spirit is given to everyone for the common good.
column2: Gad gi evribadi sopm fi shuo se di Uoli Spirit riil an im du dat fi wi uon gud an fi di gud a evribadi.

column1: To one is given by the Spirit the word of wisdom, to another the word of knowledge by the same Spirit|Gad Spirit mek som piipl kyan taak tingz we waiz, an ada piipl, Gad Spirit mek dem se tingz we ful op a wa Gad waahn piipl fi nuo.

to another faith by the same Spirit, to another gifts of healings by the same Spirit|Gad Spirit mek som piipl kyan biliiv iina Gad nof nof, an ada piipl, di Spirit gi dem di powa fi mek sik piipl get beta.

to another the working of miracles, to another prophecy, to another discerning of spirits, to another various kinds of tongues, and to another the interpretation of tongues. |Som piipl, Gad Spirit mek dem kyan wok mirikl. Wan neda set a piipl, di Spirit mek dem kyan priich Gad mesij. Ada piipl di Spirit gi dem di powa fi nuo ef a Gad Spirit a mek som piipl kyan du sortn tingz ar ef a som ada spirit a mek dem du it. Di Spirit aal mek som piipl kyan taak iina tongz an a di siem Spirit kaaz ada piipl fi andastan dem.

But that one and very same Spirit works all these, dividing to each one individually as He will.|Di powa fi du aal a dem sitn de kom fram di siem Spirit an im gi da powa de tu enibadi im waahn gi it tu.

For as the body is one and has many parts, and all the many parts of that one body are one body, so also is Christ. |Jos laik ou di badi av nof difrant paat, an yu niid aal a dem paat de fi mek op di badi, a siem so Krais Jiizas tan.

For by one Spirit we are all baptized into one body, whether we are Jews or Gentiles, whether we are slaves or free, and we have all been made to drink of one Spirit.|Wen wi did get baptaiz, Gad gi aal a wi im Spirit an so di uol a wi a wan. It no mata ef yu a Juu ar yu a no Juu, ef yu a sliev ar yu frii, Gad gi aal a wi di siem Spirit.
The body is not one part, but many.|Nou wi badi, it no mek op a jos wan paat. A nof difrant paat mek op di badi.

If the foot says, “Because I am not the hand, I am not of the body,” is it therefore not of the body?|So ef di fut paat get op an se, “Mi a no di an so mi a no paat a di badi,” notn kyaahn go so, im a stil paat a di badi.

And if the ear says, “Because I am not the eye, I am not of the body,” is it therefore not of the body?|An ef di iez se, “Mi a no paat a di badi kaaz mi a no di yai,” it rang, it a stil paat a di badi.

If the whole body were an eye, where would the hearing be? If the whole body were hearing, where would the sense of smell be?|Ef a did yai wan mek op di badi, a wa wi wuda yuuz fi ier? Ef di badi did mek op a iez wan, a wa wi wuda yuuz fi sumel?

But now God has established the parts, every one of them, in the body as it has pleased Him. |Aal a di paat dem iina di badi, evri wan a dem, Gad put dem de. Im put dem wich paat im waahn dem an im put dem de fi du wa im waahn dem fi du.
If they were all one part, where would the body be?|A no wan badi ef a onggl wan paat de de. Ou yu fi av wan badi ef a onggl wan paat yu av?
So there are many parts, yet one body.|So iivn duo yu av nof difrant paat iina di badi, aal a dem kom tugeda fi mek wan badi.

The eye cannot say to the hand, “I have no need of you,” nor the head to the feet, “I have no need of you.” |So den di yai kyaahn go tel di an se, “Mi no niid yu,” siem laik ou di ed kyaahn go tel di fut se, “Mi no niid yu.”
No, those parts of the body which seem to be weaker are necessary.|Az a mata a fak, di paat dem we unu tingk se unu kuda du widout kaaz unu fiil se dem wiik, a dem de paat de unu kyaahn du widout.

And those parts of the body which we think are less honorable, upon these we bestow more abundant honor. And our less respectable parts are treated with much more respect|An a di paat dem we wi no tingk wot nof, dem a di wan we wi mek shuor wi tek kier a. An di paat dem we wi no tingk luk gud, wi mek shuor se wi kova dem op gud gud.

whereas our more respectable parts have no need of this. But God has composed the body, having given more abundant honor to that part which lacks it,|Wi no niid fi du dat fi di paat dem we wi fiil luk gud. Bot Gad put aal a di paat dem tugeda iina di badi an im mek it iina wan wie we mek wi tek gud gud kier a di paat dem we wi no tingk riili impuotant.

so that there should be no division in the body, but that the parts should have the same care for one another.|Im mek it da wie de so dat di difrant difrant paat dem iina di badi wi wok tugeda an fi mek shuor se dem tek kier a dem wan aneda.

If one part suffers, all the parts suffer with it, and if one part is honored, all the parts rejoice with it.|Ef wan paat a di badi a sofa, di uol badi a sofa tu. Ef wan paat a di badi fiil gud den di uol badi fiil gud.
Now you are the body of Christ and members individually.|Nou unu mek op Jiizas Krais badi, evri wan a unu a paat a im badi.

God has put these in the church: first apostles, second prophets, third teachers, after that miracles, then gifts of healings, helps, governments, and various tongues.|Evribadi av wan plies iina Gad choch. A di tap tap pozishan yu av di apasl dem. Afta dat yu av di prafit dem, den di tiicha dem, di piipl dem we wok mirikl an piipl we mek sik piipl get beta. Afta dem de piipl de, yu av di piipl dem we lov fi elp ada piipl, den di wan dem we elp fi kip di choch iina aada an afta dem yu av di piipl we taak iina tongz.
Are all apostles? Are all prophets? Are all teachers? Are all workers of miracles?
column2: A evribadi a apasl? An a evribadi a prafit? Evribadi a tiicha? An a evribadi kyan wok mirikl?

column1: Do all have the gifts of healings? Do all speak with tongues? Do all interpret?
column2: An a evribadi kyan mek piipl beta? A evribadi kyan taak iina tongz? An a evribadi kyan andastan di piipl dem wen dem taak iina tongz?

column1: But earnestly covet the greater gifts. Yet I show you a more excellent way.
column2: So unu fi set unu aat pan di muor impuotant gif dem. An nou mi a go shuo unu wan wie we beta.

column1: If I speak with the tongues of men and of angels, and have not love, I have become as sounding brass or a clanging cymbal.|Ef mi kuda taak aal a di langwij dem iina di worl, aal taak di langwij wa di ienjel dem yuuz bot no av lov iina mi aat, mi komiin laik wan bel ar wan metal pan we jos a mek naiz.

If I have the gift of prophecy, and understand all mysteries and all knowledge, and if I have all faith, so that I could remove mountains, and have not love, I am nothing.|Ef mi kuda kyari mesij chriet fram Gad, an nuo bout aal a di tingz we Gad kip fram mi an nuo bout evriting we de fi nuo bout, an mi so chrang iina wa mi biliiv dat mi kyan muuv mountn bot mi no av lov iina mi aat, mi a no notn.

If I give all my goods to feed the poor, and if I give my body to be burned, and have not love, it profits me nothing.|An ef mi gi we evriting we mi av, an aal gi op mi badi so dat dem kyan bon it op, ef mi du aal a dat bot no av lov iina mi aat, it naa du mi no gud.

Love suffers long and is kind; love envies not; love flaunts not itself and is not puffed up|Wen sumadi av lov iina dem aat, dem kain tu piipl an dem tek taim wid dem. Dem no red yai ar gwaan buosi-buosi. Piipl we av lov iina dem aat no lov fi shuo aaf.

does not behave itself improperly, seeks not its own, is not easily provoked, thinks no evil;|Dem no disrispek ada piipl an dem no du tingz fi elp demself wan. Piipl we av lov iina dem aat no iizi fi get beks an dem no av op piipl iina dem aat.
rejoices not in iniquity, but rejoices in the truth;|Dem no api wen dem si wikidnis a gwaan, bot dem wi api wen dem ier di chuut.

bears all things, believes all things, hopes all things, and endures all things.|Piipl we av lov iina dem aat neva eva gi op no mata wa apm tu dem an dem neva tap biliiv iina Gad. Piipl we av lov iina dem aat chos Gad fi tek kier a dem an dem wi go chuu eniting we riich dem an no fos ar komplien.

Love never fails. But if there are prophecies, they shall fail; if there are tongues, they shall cease; and if there is knowledge, it shall vanish.|Chuu lov neva eva tap — it kyaahn ded. Bot wan die di piipl dem we kyari mesij chriet fram Gad, a-go tap kyari mesij. An di piipl dem we taak iina tongz, wan die dem a-go tap taak iina tongz. An di piipl we kyan andastan di tingz dem we Gad shuo wi, wan die dem a-go tap tu.
For we know in part, and we prophesy in part.|Kaaz Gad no shuo wi evriting an wi no nuo evriting we im nuo. So di gif dem we di Uoli Spirit gi wi a jos fi wan taim
But when that which is perfect comes, then that which is imperfect shall pass away. |wen Jiizas Krais kom bak an evriting don wid, wi naa go niid dem gif de agen.

When I was a child, I spoke as a child, I understood as a child, and I thought as a child. But when I became a man, I put away childish things.|Wen mi a did pikni, mi taak laik mi a pikni an mi tingk an gwaan laik ou pikni fi gwaan. Bot wen mi ton man mi tap gwaan laik pikni.

For now we see as through a glass, dimly, but then, face to face. Now I know in part, but then I shall know, even as I also am known.|Kaaz jos laik ou wen wi luk pan wiself iina wan shain piis a metal, wi kyaahn mek out evriting, a siem so wi tan nou. Wi nuo som tingz bot wi no nuo evriting. Bot wan die wi a-go si Gad fies tu fies an den wi wi nuo an andastan evriting we de de fi nuo bout Gad. Jos laik ou Gad nuo evriting bout wi.

So now abide faith, hope, and love, these three. But the greatest of these is love.|So nou a chrii tingz lef we wi fi gwaan du: chos iina Gad, gwaan biliiv se im a-go gi wi wa im se im a-go gi wi an fi lov wi wan aneda. Outa aal a dem di muos impuotant wan a lov.

Follow after love and desire spiritual gifts, but especially that you may prophesy.|So muo dan eniting els, unu fi waahn fi lov ada piipl, bot unu fi wel waahn di gif dem we di Uoli Spirit gi tu. An di gif we unu fi waahn di muos a di wan we lou unu fi kyari mesij chriet fram Gad.

For he who speaks in an unknown tongue does not speak to men, but to God. For no one understands him, although in the spirit, he speaks mysteries. |Kaaz di wan dem we taak iina tongz, dem naa taak tu piipl dem a taak tu Gad; nobadi kyan andastan dem. Di Uoli Spirit gi dem di powa fi taak bout tingz we nobadi no nuo ar andastan.

But he who prophesies speaks to men for their edification and exhortation and comfort. |Bot di wan dem we di Spirit lou fi kyari mesij fram Gad, dem a taak fi piipl andastan. Di mesij we dem kyari elp piipl fi get chrang iina wa dem biliiv, push dem fi gwaan biliiv an elp dem wen dem sad.

He who speaks in an unknown tongue edifies himself, but he who prophesies edifies the church.|Di piipl we taak iina tongz onggl a bil op demself bot di piipl we kyari mesij fram Gad a elp fi bil op di choch.

I desire that you all speak in tongues, but even more that you prophesy. For greater is he who prophesies than he who speaks in tongues, unless he interprets, so that the church may receive edification.|Nou mi waahn aal a unu fi kyan taak iina tongz bot muo dan dat mi waahn unu fi kyan kyari mesij fram Gad kom tel di piipl dem. Kaaz di wan dem we kyari mesij fram Gad muo impuotant dan di wan dem we taak iina tongz, ef wen dem taak iina tongz dem kyaahn tel wi wa it miin.

Now, brothers, if I come to you speaking in tongues, what shall I profit you, unless I speak to you by revelation or knowledge or prophesying or doctrine?|Nou breda an sista, ef mi kom tu unu an a taak iina tongz ou mi fi elp unu ef unu kyaahn andastan wa mi a se? Ou mi fi elp unu ef mi naa kom tel unu bout sopm we Gad shuo mi ar mek mi andastan wen mi a riid im Wod? Ou mi fi elp unu ef a no wan mesij fram Gad mi a kom tel unu ar a no tiich mi a tiich unu sopm fram Gad wod?

Even when things without life give sound, whether flute or harp, how will it be known what is played unless they give a distinction in the sounds?|Ef sumadi a plie wan fluut ar wan aap an a onggl wan soun it kyan mek, ou di piipl dem we a lisn fi nuo wich sang im a plie?

If the trumpet makes an uncertain sound, who will prepare himself for the battle?|An di aan we dem yuuz a waar taim, ef wen sumadi bluo it, it no soun klier, wich wan a di suoja dem a-go redi fi fait?

So also you, unless with the tongue you speak words easy to understand, how will it be known what is spoken? For you shall speak into the air.|A di siem ting apm wen unu taak iina tongz! Ef unu no taak so dat piipl kyan andastan unu, ou dem fi nuo wa yu a chrai se?

There are, it may be, so many kinds of languages in the world, and none of them is without significance.|A nof difrant langwij de iina di worl an iina evri wan a dem, di wod dem miin sopm, so piipl kyan andastan dem.

Therefore, if I do not know the meaning of the speech, I shall be a barbarian to him who speaks, and he who speaks will be a barbarian to me. |Ef sumadi a taak wan langwij we mi no andastan mi a-go tingk se dem kom fram wan neda konchri. An dem a-go tingk se mi kom fram wan difrant konchri tu.

So, seeing that you are zealous of spiritual gifts, seek that you may excel to the edifying of the church.|So sins unu a chrai aad fi get di gif dem we di Uoli Spirit gi, muo dan eniting els unu fi chrai fi get di wan dem we wi elp fi bil op di choch.
Let him who speaks in an unknown tongue pray that he may interpret.
column2: So di piipl dem we a taak iina tongz shuda prie an aks Gad fi mek dem andastan wa dem a se.

column1: For if I pray in an unknown tongue, my spirit prays, but my understanding is unfruitful.|Kaaz ef mi a prie iina tongz, a mi spirit a prie. Mi main naa tek paat, it no andastan notn we di Spirit a se.

What is it then? I will pray with the spirit, and I will pray with the understanding. I will sing with the spirit, and I will sing with the understanding.|So wa mi fi du den? Wa mi fi du a mek mi spirit prie bot prie wid mi ed tu an tingk bout wa mi a se. An wen mi a sing priez tu Gad, mi wi sing wid mi spirit an sing wid mi main tu an tingk bout wa mi a sing se.

Otherwise, when you bless with the spirit, how will he who occupies the place of the unlearned say “Amen” at your giving of thanks, seeing he does not understand what you say? |Kaaz ef yu spirit a prie an sumadi we no taak iina tongz a lisn, ou dem fi se ‘Iemen’ wen dem no nuo we yu a se?
For you indeed give thanks well, but the other is not edified.|Yu kuda a tangk Gad iina wan nais nais wie bot chuu dem kyaahn andastan, yu wudn a elp dem.
I thank my God that I speak in tongues more than you all.
column2: Mi tangk Gad se mi taak iina tongz muo dan unu.

column1: Yet in the church I had rather speak five words with my understanding, that by my voice I might teach others also, than ten thousand words in an unknown tongue.|Bot wen choch a kip mi wuda prefa fi se faiv wod we piipl kyan andastan an lorn fram dan fi go se ten touzn wod iina tongz.

Brothers, do not be children in your thinking; rather be infants in evil, but in your thinking be mature.|Breda an sista no tingk laik se unu a pikni, unu fi tingk laik se unu a big piipl. Onggl gwaan laik pikni wen it kom tu wikidnis kaaz pikni no du no iip a wikid sitn.

In the law it is written:“With men of other tonguesand other lipsI will speak to this people;but even then they will not hear Me,”says the Lord.|It rait dong iina Gad wod dat di Laad se:“Mi a-go sen piipl we taak aal kain-a chrienj langwijan we kom fram nof difrant konchri fi taak tu dem piipl ya,an dem stil naa go lisn tu mi iivn afta mi du aal a dat.”

So tongues are for a sign, not to believers, but to unbelievers. But prophesying does not serve unbelievers, but believers.|So den di piipl we taak iina tongz, dem a wan sain fi di piipl dem we no biliiv iina Gad, dem a no fi piipl we biliiv. Bot di piipl dem we kyari mesij fram Gad, dem a fi di piipl we biliiv iina Gad, no fi di wan dem we no biliiv.

Therefore if the whole church assembles in one place and all speak with tongues, and those who are unlearned or unbelievers come in, will they not say that you are out of your mind? |Nou se di uol a unu gyada fi choch an evribadi iina di choch a taak iina tongz, wa apm wen sumadi we no biliiv iina Gad ar sumadi we no nuo bout Gad kom iina di choch an ier unu? Dem naa go se di uol a unu mad?

But if all prophesy and there comes in one who does not believe or one unlearned, he is convinced by all and judged by all.|Bot ef sumadi we no biliiv ar sumadi we no nuo Gad kom iina di choch an evribadi iina di choch a kyari mesij fram Gad, wen dem ier wa unu a se dem a-go nuo di chuut an si se dem a sina. Dem wi si se dem a sin an waahn fi chienj dem wiez.

Thus the secrets of his heart are revealed. And so falling down on his face, he will worship God and report that God is truly among you.|Gad mesij a-go kaaz aal a di sitn dem we dem did aid op iina dem aat fi kom out iina di uopm, an dem a-go go dong pan dem nii, put dem fies a grong an staat worship Gad. Dem a-go se, “Gad riili de mongks unu.”

How is it then, brothers? When you come together, every one of you has a psalm, a teaching, a tongue, a revelation, and an interpretation. Let all things be done for edification. |So mi breda an sista, a wa unu fi du den? Mi a-go tel unu! Wen unu gyada tugeda fi av choch, evriting we unu du, unu fi du it so dat unu wi elp evribadi. A so it fi tan wen sumadi a sing wan sang ar a tiich, ar a kyari mesij fram Gad. A so it go wen sumadi a taak iina tongz ar wen sumadi a tel unu we di piipl we a taak iina tongz a se.

If anyone speaks in an unknown tongue, let it be by two, or at the most by three, and each in turn, and let one interpret.|Ef unu a-go av piipl we a taak iina tongz, a tuu unu fi av ar di muos chrii, no muo dan dat. Di uol a dem no fi taak wan taim niida, dem fi go wan wan. An ef dem a-go taak iina tongz sumadi afi de de we a-go tel di piipl dem wa dem a se.

But if there is no interpreter, let him remain silent in the church, and let him speak to himself and to God.|Bot ef nobadi no de de fi tel di piipl dem wa dem miin, unu fi tap di piipl dem we a taak iina tongz fram taak out loud, mek dem taak tu Gad wan.

Let two or three prophets speak, and let the others judge.|Wen unu a kip choch, unu fi mek tuu ar chrii a di piipl dem we kyari mesij fram Gad taak. An di res a piipl iina di choch fi lisn an tingk bout we dem se, an joj fi demself ef wa dem a ier a chuu sopm.

If anything is revealed to another that sits by, let the first keep silent.|Ef sumadi a taak tu di choch, an Gad shuo sumadi els we sidong iina choch sopm nyuu, we nobadi neva nuo bout bifuo, di wan we a taak fi tap an mek di ada wan tel di piipl wa Gad shuo im.

For you may all prophesy one by one, that all may learn and all may be encouraged.|Kaaz aal a unu kyan kyari mesij fram Gad, bot aal a unu kyaahn a taak wan taim, unu afi go wan wan. Da wie de evribadi wi lorn an unu wi elp evribadi fi tan op chrang iina wa dem biliiv.
The spirits of the prophets are subject to the prophets.
column2: Di wan dem we kyari mesij chriet fram Gad kyan kanchuol di gif we di Uoli Spirit gi dem.

column1: For God is not the author of confusion, but of peace, as in all churches of the saints.|Kaaz Gad no diil wid kanfyuuzhan, im waahn im choch fi ron sortn an sortn wie. An im waahn aal a di choch dem fi ron so.

Let your women remain silent in the churches. For they are not permitted to speak. They are commanded to be under obedience, as the law also says.|Di uman dem no fi taak wen choch a kip, an dem no fi inchaaj niida, a so di Laa se.

If they will learn anything, let them ask their husbands at home, for it is a shame for women to speak in the church.|Ef dem av sopm we dem waahn aks bout, mek dem aks dem ozban wen dem go a dem yaad. Kaaz ef wan uman taak wail choch a kip a shiem shi a shiem arself.
What? Did the word of God come from you? Or did it come to you only?
column2: Wa! Unu tingk se Gad wod staat wid unu ar se a unu wan it kom fa?

column1: If anyone thinks himself to be a prophet or spiritual, let him acknowledge that what I am writing you is a command of the Lord.|Ef enibadi se dem a wan a di piipl we kyari mesij chriet fram Gad ar dat dem av wan a di gif dem we di Uoli Spirit gi, dem fi si se wa mi a rait iina da leta ya, a di siem ting we Gad se wi fi du.
But if anyone is ignorant, let him be ignorant.|Bot ef dem no si se wa mi a rait a we Gad se wi fi du, no pie dem no main.

Therefore, brothers, eagerly desire to prophesy, and do not forbid speaking in tongues.|So mi breda an sista, unu fi wel waahn di Uoli Spirit gi unu di gif we wi mek unu kyan kyari mesij chriet fram Gad. An unu no fi tel nobadi se dem no fi taak iina tongz
Let all things be done decently and in order.
column2: bot mek shuor se unu du evriting iina di prapa wie jos laik ou Gad se it fi go.

column1: Now, brothers, I declare to you the gospel which I preached to you, which you have received, and in which you stand. |Nou mi breda an sista mi waahn fi elp unu memba di mesij bout Jiizas Krais we mi did priich tu unu. A da sed mesij de we unu a kip iina unu aat an we evriting we unu biliiv bies pan.

Through it you are saved, if you keep in memory what I preached to you, unless you have believed in vain.|A da mesij ya we wi siev unu ef unu uol aan pan it chrang an kip it iina unu aat. Bot ef unu tap biliiv, di biliiv we unu yuus tu biliiv iina Krais a did fi notn.

For I delivered to you first of all that which I also received: how Christ died for our sins according to the Scriptures,|Kaaz mi tel unu di muos impuotant paat a di mesij siem laik ou Gad tel mi. Mi tel unu se Jiizas Krais kom an ded fi wi an siev wi fram wi sin dem jos laik ou Gad wod did se im wuda du it
was buried, rose again the third day according to the Scriptures|Mi tel unu se dem beri im an wen chrii die paas im kom bak alaiv, jos laik ou Gad wod se im wuda kom bak.
and was seen by Cephas, and then by the twelve.|An wen im kom bak alaiv im go an mek Siifas si im an den im twelv falara dem si im.

Then He was seen by over five hundred brothers at once, of whom the greater part remain to this present time, though some have passed away. |Afta dat uol a faiv onjrid a wi breda an sista dem si im wan taim tu. Som a dem breda an sista de ded bot muos a dem stil alaiv.
Then He was seen by James and then by all the apostles.|Afta dem piipl de si im, im go shuo imself tu Jiemz an afta Jiemz im mek di uol a im apasl dem si im.
Last of all, He was seen by me also, as by one born at the wrong time.|Mi a di laas sumadi fi si im an im mek mi si im iivn duo mi komiin laik sumadi we baan di rang taim.

For I am the least of the apostles and am not fit to be called an apostle, because I persecuted the church of God.|Kaaz di res a apasl dem beta dan mi. Mi no gud inof fi dem iivn kaal mi wan apasl kaaz mi yuus tu mek Gad piipl sofa bad bad an mi aal did kil aaf som a dem.

But by the grace of God I am what I am. And His grace toward me was not in vain. I labored more abundantly than all of them, yet not I, but the grace of God which was with me. |Bot a chuu Gad gud an kain tu mi mek mi kyan du wa mi a du nou, an aal we im du fi mi, a no fi notn. Mi wok aada dan aal a di ada apasl dem. Bot mi neva du it pan mi uon, Gad elp mi fi du it, kaaz im gud an kain tu mi.
Therefore, whether it was I or they, so we preach and so you believed.|So it no mata ef a mi ar a dem did priich. Aal a wi priich di siem sitn an aal a unu biliiv di siem sitn.

Now if Christ is preached that He rose from the dead, how can some of you say that there is no resurrection of the dead?|Nou ef wi a priich se Krais Jiizas kom bak alaiv, ou som a unu kyan a se dat nobadi kyaahn kom bak alaiv?
If there is no resurrection of the dead, then Christ has not risen.|Bot ef nobadi kyaahn kom bak alaiv, den Krais Jiizas kudn kom bak alaiv niida.
If Christ has not risen, then our preaching is vain, and your faith is also vain.|An ef Jiizas Krais neva kom bak alaiv, den wi a priich fi notn an wa unu biliiv no mek no sens an no wot notn niida.

Yes, and we would then be found false witnesses of God, because we have testified that God raised up Christ, whom He did not raise up, if in fact the dead do not rise.|An ef a chuu se nobadi kyaahn kom bak alaiv afta dem ded den wi a tel lai pan Gad tu wen wi tel piipl se im mek Jiizas Krais kom bak alaiv.
For if the dead do not rise, then Christ has not been raised. |Kaaz ef nobadi kyaahn kom bak alaiv, den Gad neva mek Jiizas kom bak alaiv niida.

If Christ is not raised, your faith is vain; you are still in your sins.|Ef Krais Jiizas neva kom bak alaiv den wa unu biliiv naa no yuus, an unu neva get siev niida. Gad stil a-go ponish unu fi unu sin.
Then they also who have fallen asleep in Christ have perished. |Wos di piipl dem we biliiv iina Jiizas Krais an we ded aredi, dem gaan fi gud — Gad a ponish dem fi dem sin.

If in this life only we have hope in Christ, we are of all men most miserable.|So ef wi kyan onggl chos Krais Jiizas fi siev wi iina da laif ya an no di neks wan, den muo dan enibadi els, a wi piipl shuda a sari fa.
But now is Christ risen from the dead and become the first fruits of those who have fallen asleep.
column2: Bot di chuut a dat Jiizas Krais did kom bak alaiv. An im mek wi nuo fi shuor se Gad a-go mek ada piipl we ded an we biliiv iina im kom bak alaiv tu.

column1: For since death came by man, by man came also the resurrection of the dead.|Kaaz jos laik ou piipl ded siek-a wa wan man did du a siem so piipl a-go kom bak alaiv siek-a wa wan neda man did du.
For as in Adam all die, even so in Christ shall all be made alive.|Piipl afi ded siek-a wa Adam did du, bot piipl we biliiv iina Gad a-go kom bak alaiv siek-a wa Jiizas Krais did du.

But every man in his own order: Christ the first fruits; afterward, those who are Christ’s at His coming. |Bot evribadi naa go kom bak alaiv siem taim, evribadi av dem uona taim. Gad mek Jiizas Krais kom bak alaiv fos, an wen Jiizas Krais kom bak agen, di piipl we biliiv iina im an we ded, dem a-go kom bak alaiv tu.

Then comes the end when He will deliver up the kingdom to God the Father, when He puts an end to all rule and all authority and power.|An di worl a-go don wen Jiizas gi Faada Gad im kindom. Bot Jiizas naa go gi Gad di kindom til im tek kanchuol uova aal a di wikid spirit dem an tek we dem powa so dat dem kyaahn du notn agen.
For He will reign until He has put all enemies under His feet.|Kaaz Jiizas afi ruul uova di kindom, til im put di uol a im enimi dem anda im fut.
The last enemy that will be destroyed is death. |An di laas enimi we im a-go get rid a, a det.

For He “has put all things under His feet.” But when He says, “all things are put under Him,” it is revealed that He, who has put all things under Him, is the exception. |Kaaz iina Gad wod it se, “Im put evriting anda im fut — im ruul uova evriting.” Bot wen dem se “evriting,” dem naa taak bout Gad tu. A Gad mek Jiizas ruul uova evriting an put im enimi dem anda im fut.

When all things are subjected to Him, then the Son Himself will also be subject to Him who put all things under Him, that God may be all in all.|An wen Gad mek im Bwai Pikni ruul uova evriting, im a-go ruul uova im Bwai Pikni, da wie de Gad wi ruul uova evriting.

Otherwise, what will they do who are baptized for the dead, if the dead do not rise at all? Why are they then baptized for the dead? |Nou, wa bout di piipl dem we go get baptaiz fi di piipl dem we ded an neva get fi baptaiz bifuo dem ded? Ef nobadi kyaahn kom bak alaiv wa dem a get baptaiz fa?
And why do we stand in danger every hour?|An ef wi kyaahn kom bak alaiv wen wi ded, wa mek wi a tiich Gad wod an a put wi laif iina siiros chobl evridie?

I affirm, by the boasting in you which I have in Christ Jesus our Lord, I die daily. |Mi breda an sista, evridie mi put miself iina siiros chobl — mi kyan ded enitaim. Mi kyan se dem sopm ya jos laik ou mi kyan buos an se gud sitn bout unu kaaz unu biliiv iina Gad nof nof an unu an Jiizas kluos kluos.

If, in the manner of men, I have fought with beasts at Ephesus, what advantage is it to me if the dead do not rise?“Let us eat and drink,for tomorrow we die.”|Ef nobadi kyaahn kom bak alaiv, wa gud it du mi ef mi fait wid di piipl dem rait ya-so iina Efisos, we a fait mi laik se dem a wail animal? Ef nobadi kyaahn kom bak alaiv,“Mek wi nyam an jringk,kaaz tumaro wi mait-a ded.”
Do not be deceived: “Bad company corrupts good morals.”|No mek dem fuul unu, “Ef yu kip fren wid wikid piipl, dem wi kaaz yu fi ton we fram we yu nuo rait, an mek yu du wikid sitn tu.”

Awake to righteousness and do not sin, for some do not have the knowledge of God. I say this to your shame.|Unu fi wiek op, tek kanchuol a unuself an tap sin. Unu shuda shiem, kaaz som a unu no nuo Gad at aal.
But someone will say, “How are the dead raised up? With what body do they come?”|Bot som a unu a-go aks, “Ou ded piipl a-go kom bak alaiv? Wa kain-a badi dem a-go av?”
You fool! What you sow is not made alive unless it dies.|Unu a fuul! Wen yu a plaant siid, it no afi ded an jrai out fos bifuo yu kyan plaant it.

When you sow, you do not sow the body that shall be, but a bare kernel, perhaps of wheat or of some other grain.|An wa yu plaant, a no so it a-go luk wen it gruo. Yu plaant suo-so siid, miebi wan wiit grien ar som ada kain-a siid, bot wen it gruo it no luk siem wie.

Then God gives it a body as He pleases, and to each seed its own body. |Bot Gad mek evriting luk di wie im waahn it fi luk. Im mek aal di difrant difrant siid dem luk an shiep difrant fram dem wan aneda.

All flesh is not the same flesh. There is one kind of flesh of men, another flesh of beasts, another of fish, and another of birds.|Kaaz evriting kyaahn luk an shiep siem wie — animal badi difrant fram man badi, bod badi difrant fram fish badi.

There are also celestial bodies and terrestrial bodies. The glory of the celestial is one, and the glory of the terrestrial is another. |Di sitn dem we de a evn av wan kain-a badi an di sitn dem we de pan ort av wan neda kain-a badi. Dem badi difrant bot di tuu a dem priti iina dem uon wie.

There is one glory of the sun, and another glory of the moon, and another glory of the stars. One star differs from another star in glory.|Di son brait, di muun brait an iivn di staar dem brait, bot di chrii a dem no brait siem wie. Iivn wen yu luk pan di staar dem wan, aal a di staar dem no brait siem wie.

So also is the resurrection of the dead. The body is sown in corruption; it is raised in incorruption.|A so it a-go go wen Gad mek im piipl we ded kom bak alaiv. Di badi wa wi av nou, it kyan ded. An wen wi ded an dem beri wi, it a-go ratn. Bot wen Gad mek wi kom bak alaiv, di badi we wi a-go get, naa go kyan ded — it naa go ratn.

It is sown in dishonor, it is raised in glory. It is sown in weakness, it is raised in power. |Wen yu badi ded an beri, it ogli bad bad an it wiik bot wen Gad mek it kom bak alaiv it a-go wel priti an chrang chrang.

It is sown a natural body, it is raised a spiritual body.There is a natural body, and there is a spiritual body.|Wen yu badi beri, it mek op a buon an blod, bot wen Gad mek it kom bak alaiv, it a-go bi wan spirit. Siem laik ou yu av wan badi we mek op a buon an blod, a siem so yu av wan badi we a spirit.

So it is written, “The first man Adam was made a living soul.” The last Adam was made a life-giving spirit.|It aal rait dong iina Gad wod se, “Di fos man, Adam, Gad did afi mek im — Gad did afi gi im laif.” Bot di laas Adam, im a-go bi wan spirit we kyan gi piipl laif.
However, that which is spiritual is not first, but the natural, and then the spiritual. |kom fos. Afta da badi de, den di spirit badi kom.
The first man was of the earth, made of dust; the second man was the Lord from heaven.|Di fos man, Gad tek dot mek fi im badi, bot di sekan man, fi im badi kom fram evn.

As was the man of dust, so are those who are of dust; and as is the man of heaven, so are those who are of heaven. |Di piipl we liv pan ort, dem a laik di man we badi mek fram dot. An dem we liv iina evn, dem a-go bi laik di man we kom fram evn.

As we have borne the image of the man of dust, we shall also bear the image of the man of heaven.|An jos laik ou wi did av wan badi laik di man we mek outa dot, a siem so wan die wi a-go av wan badi laik di man we kom fram evn.

Now this I say, brothers, that flesh and blood cannot inherit the kingdom of God, nor does corruption inherit incorruption.|Mi breda an sista, dis a wa mi a chrai fi se tu unu, notn we mek op a buon an blod kyan tek paat iina Gad kindom. An sitn we ded kyaahn liv fi eva a di siem taim, a dat mek di badi we wi av nou, a no di badi wi a-go av wen Gad mek wi kom bak alaiv.

Listen, I tell you a mystery: We shall not all sleep, but we shall all be changed.|Lisn an lisn gud kaaz mi a-go tel unu sitn we nobadi no nuo bout — a no aal a wi a-go ded bot Gad a-go chienj di uol a wi.

In a moment, in the twinkling of an eye, at the last trumpet, for the trumpet will sound, the dead will be raised incorruptible, and we shall be changed.|An wi a-go chienj faas tu, bifuo yu kyan kwint yu yai it apm. Wen dem bluo di laas aan, Gad wi mek di ded piipl dem kom bak alaiv an di badi we im a-go gi dem naa go kyan ded agen. An im a-go chienj di uol a wi.

For this corruptible will put on incorruption, and this mortal will put on immortality.|Kaaz di badi dem we wi av nou wi ded an ratn an so wi afi chienj dem an get wan badi we kyaahn ded. Di sitn dem we kyan ded afi go chienj an ton iina sitn we kyaahn ded.

When this corruptible will have put on incorruption, and this mortal will have put on immortality, then the saying that is written shall come to pass: “Death is swallowed up in victory.”|An wen dat apm, a dem taim de di sitn dem we rait dong iina Gad wod a-go apm tu. Mi a taak bout di paat we se, “Det luuz, it naa no powa uova wi.”
“O death, where is your sting?O grave, where is your victory?”|“Ou yu fi se yu win iihn det?A wich paat yu powa de?”
The sting of death is sin, and the strength of sin is the law.|Sin a wa gi det di powa fi ort piipl an sin get fi it powa fram di laa.
But thanks be to God, who gives us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ!|Bot tangk Gad kaaz a im sen wi Laad Jiizas Krais so dat wi kuda win an dat det kuda luuz.

Therefore, my beloved brothers, be steadfast, unmovable, always abounding in the work of the Lord, knowing that your labor in the Lord is not in vain.|Mi breda an sista tan op chrang an no mek notn mek yu tap biliiv. Mek shuor se unu eva a du di Laad wok sins unu nuo se aal we unu du fi Gad — unu naa du fi notn.

Now concerning the collection for the saints, as I have given instruction to the churches of Galatia, so even you must do.|Nou bout di moni we unu niid fi kalek op fi elp Gad piipl dem — di siem ting we mi tel di piipl dem a di choch iina Gyaliesha fi du, a di siem ting mi waahn unu fi du.

On the first day of the week let every one of you lay in store, as God has prospered him, so that no collections be made when I come.|Pan di fos die a evri wiik, unu mos pudong paat a di moni we unu mek. Unu fi pudong moni bies pan ou Gad bles unu. Da wie de unu wi av di moni pudong an wi no afi go kalek op notn wen mi riich de.

And when I come, I will send whomever you approve with your letters to take your generous gifts to Jerusalem.|An wen mi riich de, mi wi sen uu eva unu pik fi kyari di moni we unu kalek, go a Jeruusilem. Mi wi sen dem wid leta so di piipl dem iina Jeruusilem wi nuo a uu dem bi.
If it is fitting that I go also, they will go with me.|An ef it mek sens fi mi go, dem kyan go wid mi.
Now I will come to you after I pass through Macedonia. For I will pass through Macedonia.|Mi a-go go chuu Masiduoniya, so afta mi go chuu de-so, mi wi kom luk fi unu.

It may be that I will remain, of course, and spend the winter with you, that you may send me on my journey wherever I go.|An mi mait-a stie wid unu fi a taim, laik di uol a winta. Mi wi tan wid unu, so wen a taim fi go wan neda plies — unu kyan elp mi fi go we eva mi afi go.

For I do not wish to see you now in passing. Instead, I trust to remain a while with you, if the Lord permits. |Kaaz mi no jos waahn paas chuu, mi waahn fi stie wid unu likl. So ef Gad wi lou mi, a dat mi wi du.
But I will remain at Ephesus until Pentecost.
column2: Bot mi wi tan a Efisos til di die a Pentikas

column1: For a great and effective door has opened to me, and there are many adversaries.|kaaz mi av a gud chaans fi du som wok dong de we wi elp fi siev piipl, iivn duo nof piipl we fait gens mi dong de.

Now if Timothy comes, see that he may remain with you without fear, for he does the work of the Lord, as I also do. |Nou ef Timoti kom tu unu, mek shuor se unu no du notn we wi kaaz im fi fried a unu. Tek im iin an chriit im gud, kaaz jos laik mi, im a du Gad wok.

Therefore let no one despise him. But send him on his way in peace, that he may come to me. I am expecting him with the brothers.|No mek nobadi luk dong pan im ar chriit im laik se im a notn. Unu mos elp im fi gwaan go wich paat im a-go iina piis, kaaz mi a luk fi im an di res a breda dem we a du Gad wok, fi kom bak tu mi.

As for our brother Apollos, I greatly wanted him to come to you with the brothers. But he was not willing at all to come at this time. However, he will come when he has a convenient time.|Nou bout wi breda Apalos, a nof taim mi push im an tel im fi kom si unu, bot im no fiil laik se a nou im fi kom. Bot wen im get di chaans, im wi kom.
Watch, stand fast in the faith, be bold like men, and be strong. |Kip unu yai dem uopm, tan op chrang fi wa unu biliiv, no fried a notn an gwaan kip chrang.
Let all that you do be done with love.|Mek shuor se evriting we unu du, a siek-a di lov we de iina unu aat.

You know the house of Stephanas, that it is the first fruits of Achaia, and that they have devoted themselves to the ministry of the saints. So I ask you, brothers|Nou breda an sista, unu nuo bout Stefanos an im fambili. Dem a did di fos set a piipl iina Akaiya fi biliiv iina Gad an get siev. An dem du aal we dem kyan du fi elp Gad piipl dem. So mi a beg unu
that you submit yourselves to such people, and to everyone who helps and labors with us.|breda an sista fi fala wa dem piipl de se, an no jos we dem se bot wa enibadi we wok wid dem se tu.

I am happy about the arrival of Stephanas, Fortunatus, and Achaicus, for they supplied what was lacking on your part. |Mi did api fi si Stefanos, Faachyunietos an Akaikos dem kom, kaaz wen dem de ya wid mi it komiin laik se a unu de ya.
They have refreshed my spirit and yours. Therefore acknowledge these men.
column2: An dem mek mi aat api siem laik ou dem mek fi unu aat api. So lisn gud tu wa piipl laik dem av fi se.

column1: The churches of Asia greet you. Aquila and Priscilla greet you heartily in the Lord, with the church that is in their house. |Di choch dem we iina Iezha sen oudi fi unu. Akwila, Priska an di uol a di piipl dem we gyada a dem yaad fi kip choch a sen oudi fi unu iina di Laad niem.
All the brothers greet you. Greet one another with a holy kiss.
column2: Aal a di breda an sista dem sen oudi fi unu. Unu fi tel unu wan aneda oudi an du it wid lov iina unu aat.

column1: I, Paul, write this greeting with my own hand.|Mi Paal a rait dong dem oudi ya wid mi uona an.
If anyone does not love the Lord Jesus Christ, let him be accursed. Come, O Lord!|Ef sumadi no lov di Laad, mi uop se Gad wi joj im an sen im fi ded. Kom wi Laad Kom!
The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.
column2: Mi prie se di Laad Jiizas wi shuo unu lov iivn duo wi dizorv it an bles unu.

column1: My love be with you all in Christ Jesus. Amen.|Mi lov di uol a unu, an siek-a Jiizas Krais di uol a wi a wan.

Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, and Timothy our brother,To the church of God which is at Corinth, with all the saints who are in all Achaia:|Da leta ya a kom fram mi, Paal, wan a Jiizas Krais apasl dem. Mi a wan apasl kaaz a dat Gad did waahn mi fi bi. Wi breda Timoti, im grii wid evriting we iina da leta ya. So, a di tuu a wi a sen it an wi a sen it tu aal a Gad piipl we kip choch iina Korint an tu aal a di piipl dem we iina Akaiya we biliiv iina Gad.
Grace to you and peace from God our Father and from the Lord Jesus Christ.
column2: Mi prie se wi Faada Gad an wi Laad Jiizas Krais wi shuo unu lov iivn duo wi no dizorv it an gi unu piis iina unu aat.

column1: Blessed be God, the Father of our Lord ­Jesus Christ, the Father of mercies, and the God of all comfort|Priez di Gad an Faada fi wi Laad Jiizas Krais. Im a di Faada we gud an kain tu evribadi. Im a di Gad we elp piipl wen dem niid it an we osh dem wen dem sad.

who comforts us in all our tribulation, that we may be able to comfort those who are in any trouble by the comfort with which we ourselves are comforted by God.|Wen wi a go chuu aal kain-a kraasiz an sofarieshan, a im kom elp wi an push wi fi gwaan tan chrang. Im du dat so wi kyan ton roun an elp ada piipl we a go chuu sofarieshan, no mata wa kain-a chobl dem av, an elp dem siem laik ou im elp wi.

As the sufferings of Christ abound in us, so our consolation also abounds through Christ.|Wi an Jiizas a wan, so wi afi go sofa uol iip siem laik im. Bot jos laik ou wi did afi sofa, a siem so im a-go elp wi an tek kier a wi nof nof kaaz wi an im a wan.

If we are afflicted, it is for your consolation and salvation, which is effective in enduring the same sufferings which we also suffer. Or if we are comforted, it is for your consolation and salvation.|So ef wi sofa, wi a sofa kaaz wi waahn fi elp unu an wi waahn unu fi kip chrang. An ef wi get elp, unu wuda a get elp tu. Kaaz unu wi nuo se wen unu a sofa laik wi, fi unu elp wi kom. An dat wi mek unu gwaan kip chrang wen chobl tek unu.

Our hope for you is steadfast, knowing that as you partake in the sufferings, so also you will partake of the consolation.|Wi biliiv iina unu an wi nuo se unu wi gwaan biliiv no mata wa unu fies kaaz jos laik ou unu sofa wid wi, Gad wi elp unu siem laik ou im elp wi.

For we would not, brothers, have you ignorant of our troubles which came to us in Asia. We were pressured beyond measure, above strength, so that we despaired even of life.|Breda an sista wi waahn unu fi nuo di chuut bout aal a di sitn dem we wi did afi sofa chuu wen wi did de a Iezha. Di sofarieshan a did muor dan wi kuda manij. It did so bad wi did shuor se a ded wi did a go ded.

We had the sentence of death in ourselves, so that we would not trust in ourselves, but in God who raises the dead.|It did komiin laik se a sen sumadi sen wi fi ded. Bot Gad mek wi go chuu dem sitn de fi tiich wi se wi mos chos iina im, di Gad we mek piipl kom bak alaiv, an no chrai fi yuuz wi uona chrent fi du notn.
He delivered us from so great a death and does deliver us. In Him we trust that He will still deliver us
column2: Wi did a go ded wan wikid wikid wie an a Gad mek wi neva ded. A im siev wi an im wi aalwiez kom siev wi wen wi iina chobl. Wi nuo se im wi gwaan kip wi sief.

column1: as you help together by praying for us, so that thanks may be given by many on our behalf for the gift bestowed upon us by means of many persons.|Unu mos prie se Gad wi elp wi tu. Kaaz wen Gad ansa unu prieya an bles wi, nof ada piipl wi staat fi gi Gad tangks fi aal we im du fi wi.

For our rejoicing is this: The testimony of our conscience is that we conducted ourselves in the world, and more abundantly toward you, in simplicity and godly sincerity, not with fleshly wisdom, but by the grace of God. |Nou dis a wa wi av we wi kyan buos bout: fi wi kanchens naa bada wi kaaz wi nuo se wi liv gud wid evribadi. Aal unu, muor dan di res a piipl dem, wi chriit gud. Wi neva aid notn fram unu an wi aalwiez liv laik ou piipl we se dem bilang tu Gad fi liv. An wi naa liv so kaaz wi sumaat ar wi av sens, bot kaaz Gad gud tu wi an a im mek wi kyan liv so.
For we write nothing else to you than what you read or understand. And I trust you will understand even to the end
column2: An unu nuo se wi naa chrai chrik unu kaaz wi no rait notn gi unu we unu kyaahn riid ar andastan. Rait ya nou unu no andastan evriting bout wi bot mi uop se

column1: as you have understood us in part, that we are yours, boasting even as you are ours on the day of the Lord Jesus.|wan die unu wi andastan evriting. Mi uop se unu wi andastan so dat pan di die wen Jiizas kom bak, unu wi kyan buos bout ou unu nuo wi siem laik ou wi kyan buos bout ou wi nuo unu.

In this confidence I planned to come to you before, that you might have a second benefit: |An kaaz mi did shuor se unu wuda andastan an welkom mi, mi did plan fi kom si unu fos, so dat unu kuda get bles tuu taim

to visit you while going to Macedonia, and to come again to you from Macedonia, and then be sent by you on my way to Judea.|an so unu kuda elp wi fi go a Masiduoniya. An den wen wi lef Masiduoniya wi did plan fi kom bak kom luk fi unu so dat unu kuda elp wi fi go a Judiya.

Therefore, when I was planning this, did I do this lightly? Or the things that I plan, do I plan according to the flesh, so that I would tell you “Yes, yes” and “No, no”?|So wen mi plan dem chienj op an mi neva get fi kom bak kom si unu, a siiros unu tingk mi neva siiros bout di plan dem wa mi mek? Unu tingk se mi komiin laik di piipl dem we liv iina di worl we onggl du tingz fi elp demself an we se “Yes mi a kom” an siem taim se “Nuo mi naa kom”?
But as God is true, we did not tell you “Yes” and “No.”|Wi kyan chos Gad, im no lai, an im a wi witnis kaaz wi neva tel unu “yes” an den likl afta dat tel unu “nuo.”

For the Son of God, Jesus Christ, who was preached among you by us, even by Silas, Timothy, and me, was not “Yes” and “No.” In Him it was “Yes.” |Kaaz Gad Bwai Pikni, Jiizas Krais, we mi, Silvanos an Timoti did priich tu unu bout, a no sumadi we se “Yes” wan minit an “Nuo” di neks. Jiizas aalwiez se wa im miin, im aalwiez se “Yes.”

For all the promises of God in Him are “Yes,” and in Him “Amen,” to the glory of God through us.|No mata umoch pramis Gad mek, a Jiizas Krais mek wi kyan get di uol a dem. A so mek wen taim wi waahn fi big op Gad wi se “Iemen” iina Jiizas niem.
Now He who establishes us with you in Christ and has anointed us is God
column2: Nou a Gad mek aal a wi kyan tan chrang an gwaan biliiv iina Jiizas Krais. A im pik wi fi bi im piipl.

column1: who also has sealed us and established the guarantee with the Spirit in our hearts.
column2: Im maak wi fi shuo se wi bilang tu im an gi wi di Spirit iina wi aat so wi wuda nuo se im a-go gi wi aal we im pramis fi gi wi.

column1: Moreover I call God as a witness upon my soul, that it is to spare you that I have not yet gone to Corinth. |Nou ef wa mi bout fi tel unu a lai, mek Gad ponish mi: a fi fi unu uona gud mek mi neva kom baka Korint. Mi neva kom bak kaaz mi neva waahn unu fi sofa.

Not that we have dominion over your faith, but we are fellow workers for your joy, for by faith you stand.|Wi a no som baas we a chrai fi ruul uova unu an tel unu wa fi biliiv. Wi a wok wid unu fi mek unu api kaaz unu chrang iina wa unu biliiv.
But I determined this for myself, that I would not come again to you in sorrow.|So mi mek op mi main se mi naa kom si unu ef wa mi av fi tel unu a-go kaaz unu pien.

For if I make you sorrowful, who then will there be to make me rejoice, but the one whom I have made sorrowful? |Kaaz ef mi mek unu sad, uu a-go de de fi mek mi api? No onggl di siem piipl we mi mek sad?

I wrote concerning this matter to you, so that when I came, I would not be grieved by those in whom I ought to rejoice, having confidence in you all, that my joy is your joy. |A so mek mi rait da leta de — mi neva waahn di sed piipl we fi mek mi api, fi mek mi sad. So mi rait unu so unu kuda chienj we niid fi chienj, an da wie de wen mi kom luk fi unu, mi wuda api. Kaaz mi nuo fi shuor se ef mi api unu api tu.

For out of much affliction and anguish of heart I wrote to you with many tears, not that you should be grieved, but that you might know the love which I have more abundantly for you.|Wen mi did rait da leta de mi did sad bad bad. Mi aat did so evi mi aal baal wen mi a rait it. Mi neva rait it fi mek unu sad, bot mi rait it fi mek unu nuo umoch mi lov unu bad bad.

But if anyone has caused grief, he has not grieved me, but to some extent all of you, not to put it too severely.|Nou sumadi mongks unu did du sitn we kaaz unu fi fiil pien iina unu aat. Mi nuo se it ort unu muor dan it ort mi kaaz wa dem did du did ort aal a unu wan wie ar aneda (mi no waahn fi mek tingz soun wosa dan dem bi).
This punishment which was inflicted by many on such a man is sufficient. |Muos a unu did ponish da sumadi de an di ponish we unu ponish im, it inof.

So on the contrary, you ought to forgive him and comfort him, lest perhaps he might be swallowed up with excessive sorrow.|Iiz im op nou, no ponish im no langga. Insted-a dat unu fi paadn im an kain tu im. Unu fi du dat so dat im no get so sad dat im gi op.
Therefore I ask you to confirm your love toward him.|An kaaz mi no waahn im fi gi op, mi a beg unu fi shuo im se unu stil lov im.

For to this end I also wrote, so that I might know that you are proving yourselves by whether you are being obedient in all things.|Mi did sen unu wan leta we se unu fi sen im fram mongks unu. A tes mi did a tes unu mek mi rait dat. Mi did waahn fi si ef unu wuda du aal we mi se unu fi du.

Whomever you forgive anything, I also forgive. For if I forgave someone anything, for your sakes I forgave it in Christ|Enibadi we unu paadn, mi paadn dem tu (dat a ef mi av notn fi paadn). Jiizas Krais si an nuo se mi riili paadn dem an mi du it fi elp unu.
lest Satan should take advantage of us. For we are not ignorant of his devices.
column2: Wi fi paadn im so dat Sietan no win kaaz wi nuo se im eva a luk fi wan wie fi kaaz chobl an mek piipl ton we fram Gad.

column1: Furthermore, when I came to Troas to preach Christ’s gospel, and a door was opened to me by the Lord|Nou wen mi go a Chuowas fi priich di Gud Nyuuz bout Jiizas, mi fain se di Laad did don mek wan wie fi mi taak tu di piipl dem.

I had no rest in my spirit, because I did not find Titus my brother. So taking my leave of them, I went from there into Macedonia.|Bot iivn duo di piipl dem did api fi ier wa mi av fi se, mi main kudn res, kaaz mi neva si mi breda Taitos. Bot sins mi neva fain im, mi tel di piipl dem iina Chuowas ba-bai an lef go a Masiduoniya.

Now thanks be to God who always causes us to triumph in Christ and through us reveals the fragrance of His knowledge in every place.|Wi tangk Gad we mek wi eva a win gens di wikid sitn dem we wi fies, chuu wi an Jiizas a wan. Gad yuuz wi fi pred di Gud Nyuuz bout Jiizas aal bout, an da Gud Nyuuz de komiin laik wan swiit swiit sumel.
For we are to God a sweet fragrance of Christ among those who are saved and among those who perish.
column2: Kaaz wi komiin laik di swiit sumel we insens gi aaf — di insens dem we Jiizas gi Gad. An da sumel de pred out mongks di piipl we a get siev an mongks di piipl dem we naa go get siev.

column1: To the one we are the fragrance of death, which brings death, and to the other the fragrance of life, which brings life. Who is sufficient for these things?|Tu di wan dem we no biliiv, it tingk laik ded sitn bot tu di wan dem we biliiv, it sumel gud laik sopm we wuda gi yu laif. So uu den av wa it tek fi du da wok ya?

For we are not as many are who peddle the word of God. Instead, being sent by God, we sincerely speak in Christ in the sight of God.|Wi no komiin laik nof ada piipl we chriit Gad wod laik a sopm chiip we dem kyan sel an mek moni. Nuo! Gad sen wi fi tiich im Wod an chuu wi a Jiizas sorvant dem wi aalwiez tiich di chuut laik se Gad did tan op rait infronta wi.

Do we begin again to commend ourselves? Or do we need, as some others, letters of commendation to you, or letters of commendation from you? |A shuo aaf unu tingk wi a shuo aaf agen? Ar laik som piipl unu tingk se wi niid unu fi sen wan leta ar sumadi fi sen wan leta gi unu wa se wi a du wan gud jab?

You are our letter written in our hearts, known and read by all men. |Wi no niid no leta, wi no niid nobadi fi rait an tel piipl se wi a du gud, kaaz wa dem leta de wuda du unu a du aredi. Piipl wi luk pan ou unu a liv an nuo se wi a du gud wok.

For you are prominently declared to be the letter of Christ, prepared by us, written not with ink but with the Spirit of the living God, not on tablets of stone but on human tablets of the heart.|Unu shuo se unu a laik wan leta we Krais Jiizas rait, an we kom bout kaaz a di wok we wi du. Da leta ya no rait wid ingk, it rait wid Gad Spirit we kyaahn ded. An it no rait dong pan rakstuon laik wen Gad did gi Muoziz di Laa bot it rait dong iina di aat a evribadi we biliiv iina Jiizas.
We have such trust through Christ toward God
column2: Wi kyan se dem sitn ya an shuor bout dem kaaz wi chos iina Jiizas. An a im mek wi a du di wok we wi a du an kyan tan op infronta Gad an no shiem.

column1: not that we are sufficient in ourselves to take credit for anything of ourselves, but our sufficiency is from God|Wi kyaahn du notn pan wi uon. Wi no av notn iina wi we wuda mek wi kyan du da wok ya. A Gad wan mek wi kyan du it.

who has made us able ministers of the new covenant, not of the letter but of the Spirit. For the letter kills, but the Spirit gives life.|A Gad mek wi kyan sorv im an go roun go tel piipl bout di Nyuu Diil we Gad mek wid wi. Da Nyuu Diil ya no av notn fi du wid di Laa we did rait dong. Iina da Nyuu Diil ya Gad sen im Spirit gi wi; kaaz di Laa kil bot di Spirit gi laif.

If the ministry that brought death, written and engraved on stones, was glorious, so that the children of Israel could not look intently at the face of Moses because of the glory of his countenance, the glory which was to fade away, |Di Laa did rait dong pan stuon, an wen Gad sen it, im sen it wid im brait brait lait. Da lait de did so brait dat it mek Muoziz fies staat shain. An iivn duo di brait lait did a fied, it mek im shain so moch dat di Izrel piipl dem kudn iivn luk pan im fi lang. Nou ef da Laa de, we kyaahn siev piipl bot sen piipl fi ded, did kom wid so moch powa
how will the ministry of the Spirit not be more glorious?
column2: unu no tingk se di Nyuu Diil we di Spirit bring an we kyan siev piipl a-go kom wid nof muor powa dan dat?

column1: For if the ministry of condemnation is glorious, the ministry of righteousness much more exceeds it in glory. |So ef di Laa we sen piipl fi ded did kom wid da powaful lait de, di Nyuu Diil we kyan siev piipl no mos kom wid wan muo powaful lait.

Even that which was made glorious had no glory in comparison to the glory that excels. |Az a mata a fak, di Nyuu Diil so big an powaful dat di Laa no iivn luk brait agen — it no impuotant nou laik fos taim.

For if that which fades was glorious, that which remains is much more glorious.|Nou ef di Laa we neva laas no taim did kom wid da brait brait lait de, di Nyuu Diil we a-go laas fi eva no mos kom wid wan muor powaful lait dan dat.
Seeing then that we have such hope, we speak with great boldness|So sins wi kyan luk fi Gad gi wi wa im pramis an nuo fi shuor se wi a get dem, wi no afi aid an taak bout Gad.

not as Moses, who put a veil over his face, so that the children of Israel could not look intently at the end of what was fading away. |An wi no afi du laik Muoziz an kova op wi fies wid piis a klaat so dat di Izrel piipl wudn si se di brait brait lait we did a shain roun im did a go we.

Instead, their minds were blinded. For until this day the same veil remains unlifted in the reading of the old covenant, the veil which was done away with in Christ.|Bot di Izrel piipl dem, dem komiin laik piipl we naa no sens. Kaaz aal tide die, wen dem ier di uol Laa a riid out, a laik sopm a tap dem fram andastan se di taim fi di Laa don. A laik se di piis a klaat stil a kova op di chuut an a tap dem fram si. An dem naa go kyan muuv da piis a klaat de kaaz a onggl Krais Jiizas wan kyan muuv it.
But even to this day, when Moses is read, the veil is in their hearts. |Yes, aal nou wen Muoziz Laa riid out loud, a laik di klaat stil a kova dem, an dem main blak aaf.
Nevertheless when anyone turns to the Lord, the veil is removed.|Bot wen yu biliiv iina di Laad, im tek we da piis a klaat de.

Now the Lord is the Spirit. And where the Spirit of the Lord is, there is liberty.|So wen wi chos iina Jiizas Krais an biliiv di Nyuu Mesij, Gad di Faada sen im Uoli Spirit gi wi, an di Uoli Spirit frii wi.

But we all, seeing the glory of the Lord with unveiled faces, as in a mirror, are being transformed into the same image from glory to glory by the Spirit of the Lord.|An so aal a wi we bilang tu Jiizas, fi wi fies no kova op an wi kyan luk pan di Laad brait brait lait. An di Uoli Spirit we a di Laad kaaz wi fi shain brait brait tu. An muor an muor im a mek wi laik imself, til wan die wi a-go luk jos laik im.
Therefore, since we have this ministry through the mercy we have received, we do not lose heart.|Gad, chuu im gud an kain, gi wi da wok ya fi du, an so wi naa gi op.

But we have renounced the secret things of shame, not walking in craftiness nor handling the word of God deceitfully, but by expressing the truth and commending ourselves to every man’s conscience in the sight of God.|Wi no av notn fi du wid di bad sitn dem we piipl aid an du, an we bring dong shiem pan dem. Wi no chrai fi chrik nobadi an wi no ad ar chienj op notn we de iina Gad wod. Gad a wi witnis se wi onggl tiich di chuut an so piipl nuo se dem kyan chos wi.
But if our gospel is hidden, it is hidden to those who are lost.|An iivn ef som piipl kyaahn andastan di Gud Nyuuz we wi priich, a onggl di piipl we no biliiv an we a-go ded, kyaahn andastan it.

The god of this world has blinded the minds of those who do not believe, lest the light of the glorious gospel of Christ, who is the image of God, should shine on them.|Dem no biliiv kaaz di devl we ruul da worl ya, blain dem so dat dem kyaahn si di lait. Im blain dem so dat dem kyaahn andastan di Gud Nyuuz bout Krais Jiizas. Im mek it so dat dem kyaahn andastan se Jiizas a jos laik Gad.

For we do not preach ourselves, but Christ Jesus the Lord, and ourselves your servants for Jesus’ sake.|A dat mek wi no priich bout wiself bot wi priich an tel unu se Jiizas Krais a Laad. Wi, wi a onggl unu sorvant, kaaz a dat im sen wi fi du.

For God, who commanded the light to shine out of darkness, has shone in our hearts to give the light of the knowledge of the glory of God in the face of Jesus Christ.|Di Gad we se, “Mek di lait shain iina di daak,” a im siem wan mek im lait shain iina wi aat so dat wi kyan andastan umoch im lov wi an ou powaful im bi. An wi onggl get fi andastan dem sitn de wen wi biliiv iina Krais Jiizas.

But we have this treasure in earthen vessels, the excellency of the power being from God and not from ourselves.|Iivn duo wi a laik som pat we mek outa klie an we iizi fi mash op, Gad mek wi andastan di Gud Nyuuz bout Jiizas an gi wi di powa fi tiich piipl, dat a laik wan chrezha. Im du it da wie de so dat evribadi wuda nuo se a no wi av di powa, bot a im riili av aal a di powa.

We are troubled on every side, yet not distressed; we are perplexed, but not in despair;|Evri wich wie wi ton chobl lik wi bot no mata wa wi fies, it naa go kyan tap wi. Iivn wen wi no nuo wa fi du, wi naa gi op.
persecuted, but not forsaken; cast down, but not destroyed;|Nof taim piipl mek wi sofa bot Gad neva lef wi, im eva de wid wi. Nof taim wi get lik dong, bot wi no ded.

and always carrying around in the body the death of the Lord Jesus, that also the life of Jesus might be expressed in our bodies. |Evriwe mi go dem mek mi sofa an dem chrai fi kil mi siem laik ou dem di kil Jiizas. Bot mi wi gwaan sofa an priich di Gud Nyuuz so dat piipl wi luk pan mi an nuo se Jiizas alaiv an dat a im a kip wi alaiv.

For we who live are always delivered to death for Jesus’ sake, that also the life of Jesus might be manifested in our mortal flesh.|So iivn duo wi alaiv nou, wi nuo se enitaim, enidie wi kyan ded kaaz wi a priich bout Jiizas. Bot wi wi gwaan priich an sofa til dem kil wi so dat piipl wi luk pan wi badi an nuo se Jiizas alaiv an dat a im a kip wi alaiv.
So then, death works in us, but life in you.|Wi nuo se wan die dem a-go kil wi kaaz wi priich bout Jiizas, bot wi wi gwaan tiich kaaz unu wi get a chaans fi nuo Jiizas an liv fi eva.

We have the same spirit of faith. As it is written, “I believed, and therefore I have spoken.” So we also believe and therefore speak|Iina Gad wod sumadi rait se, “Mi chos iina Gad so mi priich im mesij.” An siem laik ou im chos iina Gad, wi chos iina Gad tu, so wi wi gwaan priich tu.

knowing that He who raised the Lord Jesus will also raise us through Jesus and will present us with you. |Kaaz wi nuo se siem laik ou Gad mek wi Laad Jiizas kom bak alaiv, im wi mek wi kom bak alaiv tu kaaz wi biliiv iina Jiizas. An Gad wi tek wi op wid unu an bring wi wich paat im de.

All these things are for your sakes, so that the abundant grace through the thanksgiving of many might overflow to the glory of God.|Aal di sofa wi a sofa, a fi unu. Wi a du it fi elp unu so dat muor an muor piipl wi biliiv iina Jiizas an get siev. An dat wi kaaz nof muor piipl fi staat prie an gi Gad tangks an big im op fi aal we im du.

For this reason we do not lose heart: Even though our outward man is perishing, yet our inward man is being renewed day by day.|So iivn duo wi a get uol an wi badi bata-bata fram aal we wi a go chuu, wi no gi op. Evridie Gad mek wi spirit chrangga an chrangga an gi wi di chrent fi gwaan du im wok.

Our light affliction, which lasts but for a moment, works for us a far more exceeding and eternal weight of glory|Di likl chobl an di sofarieshan we wi a go chuu nou, naa go laas fi eva an dem a no notn wen yu tingk bout di nais nais sitn dem we Gad a-go gi wi, wen wi riich a evn.

while we do not look at the things which are seen, but at the things which are not seen. For the things which are seen are temporal, but the things which are not seen are eternal.|So wi naa wach di sitn dem we wi kyan si, kaaz dem sitn de naa go laas fi eva. Insted-a dat wi wach di sitn dem we wi kyaahn si kaaz dem de sitn de laas fi eva.

We know that if our earthly house, this tent, were to be destroyed, we have an eternal building of God in the heavens, a house not made with hands.|Wi nuo se wi badi a laik di ous dem we wi liv iina, dem naa go laas fi eva. An wi nuo se wen da badi ya mash op, Gad wi gi wi wan nyuu wan we im bil imself. Da badi de wi wi get wen wi riich a evn an it a-go laas fi eva.
In this one we groan, earnestly desiring to be sheltered with our house which is from heaven.|Wail wi dong ya pan ort, a wiet wi jos a wiet, kaaz wi wel waahn fi put aan wi nyuu badi.
Thus being sheltered, we shall not be found unsheltered. |An wen wi put aan da nyuu badi de, wi naa go jos bi spirit wan bot wi spirit wi av badi.

For we who are in this tent groan, being burdened, not because we wish to be unclothed, but to be further clothed, so that what is mortal might be swallowed up by life. |Nou wen mi se a jos wiet wi a wiet fi put aan di nyuu badi, mi no miin se a ded wi jos waahn fi ded so dat wi kyan dash we da badi ya. Wa mi a se a dat wi wel waahn fi put aan di nyuu badi kaaz da badi de a-go laas fi eva. It no komiin laik da badi ya we kyan mash op an ded.

Now He who has created us for this very thing is God, who also has given to us the guarantee of the Spirit.|Gad a di wan we mek wi redi fi da nyuu badi de an im sen im Spirit gi wi so dat wi wuda nuo fi shuor se wi a-go get dem.

Therefore we are always confident, knowing that while we are at home in the body, we are absent from the Lord. |An sins wi av Gad Spirit a liv iina wi, wi no fried an wi no gi op. Wi nuo se az lang az wi a liv pan ort iina da badi ya, wi de faar fram di uom we di Laad mek fi wi.
For we walk by faith, not by sight.|(An iivn duo wi kyaahn si it wi nuo wi a-go get it kaaz wi no liv wi laif bies pan wa wi kyan si wid wi yai dem bot pan wa wi biliiv.)

Instead, I say that we are confident and willing to be absent from the body and to be present with the Lord.|So laik mi did a se, wi no fried an wi no gi op, an wi waahn fi get wi nyuu badi an go liv wid di Laad muor dan wi waahn fi kip da badi ya.
So whether present or absent, we labor that we may be accepted by Him. |An so, wi mek shuor se evriting wi du a fi mek Gad api weda wi a liv pan ort ar wi de iina evn wid im.

For we must all appear before the judgment seat of Christ, that each one may receive his recompense in the body, according to what he has done, whether it was good or bad.|Kaaz aal a wi a-go afi tan op infronta Krais Jiizas, an im a-go joj wi. An weda gud ar bad, im a-go pie bak evri wan a wi fi di sitn dem we wi du wen wi did de pan ort.

Therefore, knowing the fear of the Lord, we persuade men. But we are revealed to God, and I trust we are also revealed in your consciences.|So kaaz wi av nof rispek fi di Laad an chuu wi nuo se im a-go joj evribadi, wi du aal we wi kyan du fi win piipl uova fi Gad. Gad nuo se wi onggl priich wa im waahn wi fi priich an mi uop se, iina unu aat, unu nuo se a dat wi a du.

For we are not commending ourselves again to you. Instead, we give you occasion to boast on our behalf, that you may have something to answer those who boast in appearance and not in heart. |Wi naa tel unu dem sopm ya fi mek wiself luk gud, wi a tel unu so dat unu wi fiil gud bout wi an kyan buos bout wi tu di wan dem we no bizniz bout wa iina piipl aat, bot onggl bizniz wid wa dem kyan si.

If we are beside ourselves, it is for God; if we are in our right mind, it is for you.|Som piipl tingk se mi mad, an ef a mad mi mad, dat a fi mi an Gad saat out. Bot ef a no mad mi mad, an a sens mi a taak, a fi elp unu.

For the love of Christ constrains us, because we thus judge: that if one died for all, then all have died. |Krais Jiizas lov wi, an a fi im lov mek wi a du wa wi a du. Kaaz wi nuo an biliiv se im did ded fi di uol a wi. An sins im ded fi evribadi, aal a wi did ded wid im tu.

And He died for all, that those who live should not from now on live for themselves, but for Him who died for them and rose again.|Jiizas ded fi aal a wi so dat di wan dem we did jos a liv fi mek demself api wuda chienj dem laif an staat liv dem laif fi mek im api — di wan we did ded an kom bak alaiv.

So from now on we do not regard anyone according to the flesh. Yes, though we have known Christ according to the flesh, yet we do not regard Him as such from now on.|So den, wi no luk pan piipl an joj dem bies pan ou big ar sumaal dem bi, wi no joj dem laik ou di piipl we no biliiv joj dem. Bifuo wi did biliiv, a siem so wi did luk pan Jiizas Krais an joj im, bot nou wi no du dat no muor.

Therefore, if any man is in Christ, he is a new creature. Old things have passed away. Look, all things have become new. |Wen sumadi biliiv iina Krais Jiizas, dem ton wan nyuu sumadi. Dem tap liv di wie dem yuus tu liv bifuo dem biliiv an staat liv difrant.

All this is from God, who has reconciled us to Himself through Jesus Christ and has given to us the ministry of reconciliation|Aal a dem sitn ya, a Gad du dem. A im sen Jiizas fi ded fi wi an mek tingz rait bitwiin wi an im. An a Gad sen wi fi tel piipl se im mek wan wie fi dem mek tingz rait wid im.

that is, that God was in Christ reconciling the world to Himself, not counting their sins against them, and has entrusted to us the message of reconciliation.|Wa mi a se a dat Gad yuuz Jiizas fi mek tingz rait bitwiin im an di uol worl. Gad naa uol dem sin gens dem an im sen wi fi tel piipl bout ou im mek tingz rait bitwiin dem an im.

So we are ambassadors for Christ, as though God were pleading through us. We implore you in Christ’s stead: Be reconciled to God.|So wi a taak fi Krais Jiizas, an a laik se Gad a yuuz wi fi beg unu fi lisn tu wa wi a se. An sins wi a taak fi Krais Jiizas, wi a beg unu fi mek Gad put tingz rait bitwiin unu an im.

God made Him who knew no sin to be sin for us, that we might become the righteousness of God in Him.|Jiizas neva sin yet bot Gad put fi wi sin pan im, so dat wi kuda get kliin. Da wie de wen wi biliiv iina Jiizas, tingz wuda rait bitwiin wi an Gad.
As workers together with God, we ask you not to receive the grace of God in vain.|So sins wi wok wid Gad, wi a beg unu, im so gud an kain tu unu, no mek it kom tu notn, no bada wies it.

For He says:“In an acceptable time I have listened to you,and in the day of salvation I have helped you.”Look, now is the accepted time; look, now is the day of salvation.|Kaaz Gad se,“Wen a did taim fi mi shuo yu gud fies,mi lisn tu yu prieya dem an ansa dem.Wen di die kom fi mi siev yu,mi elp yu.”Unu lisn mi! Nou a di taim fi Gad shuo unu gud fies. Tide a di die fi unu get siev.

We give no offense in anything, that our service may not be blamed. |Wi mek shuor se wi no du notn we wuda kaaz piipl fi no biliiv iina di mesij we wi a tiich. Wi no waahn nobadi fi av notn bad fi se bout di wok we wi a du.

But in all things we commend ourselves as servants of God: in much patience, in afflictions, in necessities, in distress,|So insted-a kaaz piipl fi ton we, wa wi du a shuo dem se wi a Gad sorvant iina evriting we wi du. Wi shuo dem se wi a Gad sorvant wen wi no gi op wen nof chobl an chraiyal an kraasiz tek wi.

in stripes, in imprisonments, in tumults, in labors, in sleeplessness, and in hunger;|Piipl biit wi, dem fling wi iina prizn, kroud an kroud a piipl chrai kil wi aaf bot wi stil a wok. Wi a wok aal wen wi no av di chrent fi wok no muor. Nof nait wi no get no sliip an wi naa no fuud fi iit, bot wi stil a wok.

by purity, by knowledge, by patience, by kindness, by the Holy Spirit, by genuine love|Wi shuo se wi a Gad sorvant wen wi kip wiself kliin. Gad mek wi andastan im mesij an mek wi nuo ou im waahn wi fi liv. Wi shuo se wi a Gad sorvant wen wi kain tu piipl, an tek taim wid dem an no kwik fi get beks ar grombl grombl. Wi mek di Uoli Spirit elp wi fi du wi wok, wi no du it pan wi uon. Wi shuo se wi a Gad sorvant wen wi shuo piipl lov, no mata uu dem bi ar we dem du, wi aalwiez shuo dem lov.

by the word of truth, by the power of God, by the armor of righteousness on the right hand and on the left|Wi onggl tiich di chuut an Gad powa a wok iina wi. An siem laik ou suoja yuuz di wepan iina dem lef an fi protek demself an di wan iina dem rait an fi fait di piipl dem we a kom gens dem a siem so di gud we wi du wi fait an protek wi fram evriting we wuda kom gens wi.

by honor and dishonor, by evil report and good report; as deceivers, and yet true;|Som piipl big wi op ada piipl chrai fi put wi dong. Som piipl rispek wi ada piipl chrai fi shiem wi. Som piipl se wi a laiyad bot wi aalwiez tel di chuut.

as unknown, and yet well known; as dying, and look, we live; as punished, but not killed; |Som piipl no nuo wi bot som piipl nuo wi. Som piipl tingk wi a ded bot luk wi stil a liv. Dem ponish wi an mek wi sofa bot wi no ded.

as sorrowful, yet always rejoicing; as poor, yet making many rich; and as having nothing, and yet possessing all things.|Wi aalwiez api iivn wen wi a sofa. An iivn duo wi puor wi a mek nof piipl rich. Mi no miin se wi elp dem mek moni, dem rich kaaz dem biliiv iina Gad an siek-a wa im a go gi dem wen dem biliiv. A siem so wid wi, it komiin laik se wi naa notn bot wi riili av evriting kaaz wi biliiv iina Gad.

O Corinthians, we have spoken frankly to you; our heart is opened wide.|Unu we iina Korint wi aalwiez chriet wid unu; wi aalwiez tel unu di chuut wi no aid notn fram unu. An wi lov unu wid evriting we de iina wi aat.
You are not restrained by us, but you are restrained in your own affections.|Wi naa uol bak wi lov fi unu bot unu a uol bak fi unu lov fi wi.

In return (I speak as to my children) you also be open.|So fi bi fier, mi a aks unu, sins wi stil lov unu, lov wi bak. Mi a taak tu unu laik se unu a mi uona pikni dem, lov wi wid evriting we de iina unu aat.
Do not be unequally yoked together with unbelievers. For what fellowship has righteousness with unrighteousness? What communion has light with darkness?
column2: No jain op jain op wid piipl we no biliiv iina Jiizas. Kaaz wa sumadi we a liv rait av fi du wid sumadi we a diil wid bier wikidnis? Ar ou lait an daak fi shier spies?

column1: What agreement has Christ with Belial? Or what part has he who believes with an unbeliever?
column2: Krais Jiizas an Belaiyar kyan grii bout notn? Sumadi we biliiv iina Krais Jiizas an sumadi we no biliiv iina im kyan grii bout notn?

column1: What agreement has the temple of God with idols? For you are the temple of the living God. As God has said:“I will live in themand walk in them.I will be their God,and they shall be My people.”|Faalz gad kyan de iina Gad choch? Unu badi a di ous fi di Gad we kyaahn ded. Gad imself se: “Mi wi liv iina dem aat an mi wi waak wid dem. Mi wi bi dem Gad an dem a-go bi mi piipl.”

Therefore,“Come out from among themand be separate,says the Lord.Do not touch what is unclean,and I will receive you.”|Di Laad se tu,“Kom fram mongks di piipl dem we no biliiv iina mi,mek shuor se piipl kyan si se unu an dem difrant.No av notn fi du wid no kain-a sin,an mi wi uopm mi an dem tu unu.

“I will be a Father to you,and you shall be My sons and daughters,says the Lord Almighty.”|Mi wi bi unu faada,an unu wi bi mi bwai an gyal pikni dem.”Dat a wa di Laad we muor powaful dan evri an eniting se.

Since we have these promises, beloved, let us cleanse ourselves from all filthiness of the flesh and spirit, perfecting holiness in the fear of God.|Mi gud gud fren, sins Gad mek dem pramis ya tu wi, mek wi stie faar fram sin an kip wi badi an wi spirit kliin. Mek wi rispek Gad an gi im evri paat a wi. Mek wi chrai fi bi muor laik im.

Accept us. We have wronged no one, we have corrupted no one, and we have defrauded no one.|Mek ruum iina yu aat fi wi. Wi no du notn rang tu nobadi, wi no mash op nobadi laif an wi no tek advaantij a nobadi.

I do not say this to condemn you, for I have said before that you are in our hearts, so that we would die or live with you.|Mi naa se dem sitn ya kaaz unu du notn rang bot laik mi tel unu aredi, a kaaz wi lov unu. Wi lov unu so moch dat notn kyan kip wi fram unu. Wi tugeda no mata ef wi ded ar wi alaiv.

Great is my boldness of speech toward you; great is my boasting of you. I am filled with comfort, and I am exceedingly joyful in all our tribulation.|Mi chos unu so mi nuo se mi kyan taak tu unu chriet an unu naa go tek it no wie. Mi proud a unu so til. Wen mi tingk bout unu, it push mi fi gwaan du di wok we mi a du. Iivn wen nof chobl a lik mi, unu mek mi api. Unu mek mi api so til mi glad-bag bos.

For when we came to Macedonia, our bodies had no rest, and we were troubled on every side. On the outside were conflicts; on the inside were fears.|Wen wi did jos riich a Masiduoniya, wi did taiyad, wi neva get no taim fi res. Evriwe wi ton chobl lik wi. Di piipl dem we neva biliiv iina Gad did a chrai fi fait wi out an iina wi aat wi did fried.
Nevertheless God, who comforts the downcast, comforted us through the coming of Titus|Bot Gad we mek piipl api wen dem sad an a wori, mek wi api an push wi fi gwaan wok wen im sen Taitos tu wi.

and not only by his coming, but also by the comfort with which he was comforted in you, when he told us about your sincere desire, your mourning, and your zeal toward me, so that I rejoiced even more.|An wi neva api jos chuu im kom, bot kaaz im tel wi ou unu did tek kier a im an elp im fi du di wok we im did av fi du. Im tel wi bout ou unu did wel waahn si mi so dat unu kuda mek mi nuo se unu lov mi, an dat unu did wel sari bout wa apm tu mi. Im tel mi bout ou unu eva av mi bak. An wen mi ier dem sitn de, it mek mi iivn muor api.

Though I caused you sorrow by my letter, I do not regret it, though I did regret it. For I perceive that this same letter has caused you sorrow, though only for a while. |Iivn duo di leta we mi sen unu did mek unu sad, mi no sari se mi did sen it. (Mi did fiil bad fos kaaz mi si se di leta did mek unu sad fi wan likl bit).

Now I rejoice, not that you were made sorrowful, but that your sorrow led to repentance. For you were made sorrowful in a godly way, that you might not suffer loss in any way through us. |Bot nou mi wel api. Mi no api kaaz it did mek unu sad. Mi api kaaz unu did so sad dat unu go tel Gad di rang we unu du an beg im fi paadn unu. A dat Gad did waahn. Im did waahn unu fi sari fi di rang we unu du an chienj unu wiez. So, wi neva du notn fi ort unu.

Godly sorrow produces repentance that leads to salvation and brings no regret, but the sorrow of the world produces death.|Kaaz ef sumadi a sin, an dem sari fi wa dem du laik ou Gad waahn dem fi sari, dem wi ton we fram dem sin an beg Gad fi paadn dem. An wen dem du dat Gad wi siev dem. Nobadi naa go se dem sari se dat apm. Bot ef sumadi a sin an no sari ou Gad waahn dem fi sari, dem a-go gwaan sin an dem naa go get siev. Dem a-go ded.

For observe this very thing, which you sorrowed in a godly way: What carefulness it produced in you, what vindication of yourselves, what indignation, what fear, what intense desire, what zeal, what avenging of wrong! In all things you have proven yourselves to be innocent in this matter. |So unu si umoch gud it du unu wen Gad mek unu sari. It mek unu staat tek tingz siiros an wel waahn fi shuo se unu a du di rait ting. It beks unu. It mek unu fried. It mek unu wel waahn fi si mi. It mek unu staat tek kier wid wa unu du an chrai aad fi mek shuor se unu a du di rait ting.

So though I wrote to you, I did it not because of him who had done the wrong, nor because of him who suffered wrong, but that our care for you in the sight of God might be evident to you. |So iivn duo mi rait unu da leta de, mi neva rait it kaaz unu du sopm rang ar kaaz sumadi du unu sopm rang. Mi rait it, so dat wen unu riid it Gad wuda elp unu fi si umoch unu rispek an lov wi.

Therefore we were comforted in your comfort.Yes, and we were exceedingly the more joyful for the sake of Titus, because his spirit was refreshed by you all.|An dat mek wi fiil gud iina wi aat.So wi did api wen Taitos tel wi bout unu, bot wi did get iivn muor api wen wi si ou unu mek Taitos api kaaz unu did fala aal a wa im tel unu.

So I am not ashamed if I have boasted of anything to him regarding you. But as we spoke all things to you in truth, even our boasting in the presence of Titus is found to be true.|Mi buos bout unu tu im an unu neva kaaz mi fi shiem. Kaaz jos laik ou evriting wi tiich unu a chuu, a siem so im kom fi si se evriting we mi did se bout unu a chuu tu.
