Now his affection abounds all the more toward you, as he remembers the obedience of you all, how with fear and trembling you received him. |So wen Taitos tingk bout unu an im memba ou unu did eva redi fi fala wa im tel unu, an ou unu tek im iin an rispek im nof nof, im aat jos ful op a lov fi unu.
Therefore I rejoice that I have confidence in you in everything.
column2: Mi aat ful. Mi api kyaahn don. Mi chos unu an mi nuo se mi no afi wori bout unu.

column1: Moreover, brothers, we want you to experience the grace of God bestowed on the churches of Macedonia|Breda an Sista mi waahn fi tel unu ou Gad shuo di choch dem iina Masiduoniya lov iivn duo dem no dizorv it.

how in a great trial of affliction, the abundance of their joy and their deep poverty overflowed toward the riches of their generous giving. |Iivn duo aad taim tek dem an dem did puor so til, dem did eva api fi shier wa dem av wid ada piipl. Dem gi we nof nof sitn.

For I bear record that according to their means, and beyond their means, they freely gave|Mi a tel unu, dem gi aal dem kuda gi an muor, an nobadi did afi aks dem fi du it, dem du it kaaz dem waahn fi du it.
begging us with much urgency that we would receive the gift and the fellowship of ministering to the saints.
column2: Dem beg wi an beg wi fi tek wa dem av gi it tu Gad piipl we de iina Judiya kaaz dem did wel waahn fi elp.

column1: This they did, not as we expected. First, they gave themselves to the Lord, and then to us by the will of God. |Dem gi muor dan wi kuda aks dem fi gi, muor dan wi did tingk dem kuda gi. Di fos ting dem du a fi gi dem laif tu Jiizas Krais an fala aal a di sitn dem we wi tiich. Dem du evriting jos laik ou Gad did waahn dem fi du it.

So we urged Titus, that as he had begun, so he would also complete this gracious deed for you.|So sins Taitos a di wan we did elp unu fi staat gyada op di sitn dem fi gi we, wi a push im fi go bak go finish di gud wok we im did staat.

But as you abound in everything—in faith, in utterance, in knowledge, in all diligence, and in your love to us—see that you abound in this grace also.|Nou, unu a du beta dan nof ada piipl. Unu biliiv iina Gad chrang chrang, unu nuo ou fi taak an priich gud, unu waiz an unu neva gi op. Unu lov wi nof nof tu. So sins unu a du so gud, mi waahn unu fi mek shuor se unu du gud wen unu a gi tu. Mek shuor se jos laik ou unu get muor dan ada piipl, unu gi muor dan ada piipl.

I say this not as a command, but to prove through the authenticity of others, the sincerity also of your love.|A no wan ruul mi a gi unu, mi naa se unu afi du it. Wa mi a du a tes unu. Mi a shuo unu di gud we ada piipl du, fi si ef di lov we unu se unu av iina unu aat, ef it riili riil.

For you know the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, that though He was rich, yet for your sakes He became poor, that through His poverty you might be rich.|Kaaz unu nuo ou wi Laad Jiizas Krais shuo wi lov iivn duo wi no dizorv it. Im did rich bot im gi op evriting an mek imself puor so dat unu we puor kuda get rich.

And in this matter I give my advice. It is appropriate for you, who began last year not only to give, but also to willingly give.|Nou mek mi tel unu wa mi tingk bout di sitn dem we unu a gyada op an a gi we: A unu it a-go elp, laik ou laas ier unu a did di fos wan dem fi gyada op wa unu kyan an gi tu ada piipl, an unu gi kaaz a dat unu did waahn fi du, nobadi neva afi aks unu fi du it.

Now therefore complete the task, so that, as there was a willingness to do so, there may be a performance of it according to your means.|So nou, unu niid fi don di wok we unu did staat laas ier. Gi aal we unu kyan gi, da wie de piipl wi si se unu wel waahn fi si di wok don, siem laik ou unu di wel waahn it fi staat.

For if there is a willing mind first, the gift is accepted according to what a man possesses and not according to what he does not possess.|Umoch yu av no mata, Gad no bizniz wid umoch yu av ar no av. Wa mata a umoch yu waahn fi gi outa we yu av.

I do not mean that other men have relief, and you be burdened|Mi naa se unu fi gi so moch dat unu naa notn lef fi unuself. Mi naa chrai fi mek fi dem luod lait an fi unu uon evi, bot mi waahn evribadi fi av, mi no waahn som fi av, an som no av notn.

but for equality, that your abundance now at this time may supply their need, and their abundance may supply your need—that there may be equality. |Rait ya nou unu av muor dan unu niid an dem no av notn, so unu fi shier wa unu av wid dem. An den wen dem av muor dan dem niid an unu no av notn, dem wi shier wa dem av wid unu. Da wie de evribadi wi av wen dem niid it.

As it is written, “He who gathered much had no excess. And he who gathered little had no lack.”|Jos laik it rait dong iina Gad wod se, “Di wan dem we did gyada op nof, neva av tu moch an di wan dem we did gyada op likl, neva av tuu likl.”
But thanks be to God, who placed the same sincere care in the heart of Titus for you.|Wi tangk Gad kaaz im mek Taitos lov an kier fi unu siem laik wi lov an kier fi unu.

For indeed he accepted the exhortation. But being more zealous, he went to you of his own accord. |Wen wi did beg im fi go luk fi unu, im kwik taim se yes. Im lov unu so moch dat im did wel waahn fi du it — wi neva riili afi aks im fi du it.

And we have sent with him the brother whose praise is in the gospel throughout all the churches.|A no jos Taitos a kom, wi a sen wan a wi breda dem wid im. Da breda de, im priich Gad wod, an aal a di choch piipl dem rispek im siek-a di gud wok we im a du.

And not only that, but he was also chosen by the churches to travel with us with this gift, which we administer to the glory of the same Lord, and to declare your willing mind|Dem no jos rispek im, bot di choch dem pik im fi go wid wi wen wi go a Judiya fi gi out aal a di sitn dem we dem kalek op an sen. Wi a kyari dem sitn ya go a Judiya, so dat Gad wi get di priez an fi shuo di piipl dem se wi wel waahn fi elp dem.
to prevent any man from blaming us in administering this abundant gift|Wi a sen da breda de wid Taitos kaaz unu si di sitn dem wa unu sen, wi no waahn nobadi fi se wi naa anggl dem rait.

providing for honest things, not only in the sight of the Lord but also in the sight of men.|Wi a du evriting fi mek shuor se wi diil wid dem rait, kaaz wi no jos waahn fi mek Gad api, bot wi waahn evribadi fi api wid di wok we wi a du.

Furthermore, we have sent with them our brother whom we have frequently proved diligent in many things, but now is much more diligent, due to the great confidence which he has in you.|Wi no jos sen Taitos an da breda de wan, wi sen wan neda wan a wi breda wid dem tu. Wi tes da breda ya an wi fain se im eva redi fi elp, an nou im waahn fi elp unu iivn muor dan bifuo kaaz im chos unu nof nof.

If anyone inquires about Titus, he is my partner and fellow helper concerning you. Or if our brothers are inquired about, they are the messengers of the churches, and the glory of Christ.|Nou yu si Taitos, im a mi fren we wok wid mi fi elp unu. An di tuu breda dem, a di choch dem pik an sen dem, an di wok we dem du wi kaaz piipl fi priez Krais Jiizas.

Therefore show to them, and before the churches, the proof of your love and of our boasting on your behalf.|So shuo dem lov an chriit dem gud so dat aal a di choch dem wi si se aal a di sitn dem we wi se bout unu, a chuu.

It is redundant for me to write to you concerning the ministry to the saints.|So nou, mi nuo se mi neva afi rait unu bout di sitn dem we unu a gyada op fi sen go Judiya fi di Juu dem we staat biliiv iina Krais Jiizas.

I know your willingness, for which I boast of you to those in Macedonia, that Achaia was ready a year ago, and your zeal has stirred up most of them.|Mi no afi rait unu kaaz mi nuo se unu wel waahn fi elp. Mi aal buos bout unu tu Gad piipl we de iina Masiduoniya. Mi tel dem ou fram laas ier di uol a unu iina Akaiya redi fi elp an kaaz unu redi fi elp, it mek dem wel waahn fi elp tu.

Yet I have sent the brothers, lest our boasting of you might be in vain in this case, that, as I said, you may be ready; |So mi a sen Taitos an di tuu breda dem tu unu kaaz mi waahn fi mek shuor se unu redi, jos laik mi se. Da wie de piipl wi nuo se aal a di sitn dem we mi se bout unu a chuu, an a no jos chat mi a chat.

and lest if any Macedonians come with me and find you unprepared, we (not to mention you) should be ashamed of this confident boasting.|Mi waahn fi mek shuor se unu redi kaaz ef som piipl fram Masiduoniya kom wid mi, an wen wi riich de unu no redi, a shiem mi wuda shiem. (Unu wuda muor dan shiem.) Wi wuda shiem kaaz wi did a buos bout ou unu redi.

Therefore I thought it necessary to exhort the brothers to go ahead to you and arrange beforehand your bountiful gift you previously promised, that it might be prepared as a gift, not as a matter of greed.|A dat mek mi did tingk it impuotant fi wi breda dem kom si unu bifuo mi kom dong de. Mi push dem fi go orli so dat dem kuda mek shuor se aal a di sitn dem we unu did pramis fi gi, gyada op an pudong. Kaaz ef evriting gyada op an redi wen mi riich de, it wi shuo se a gi unu riili waahn fi gi; it wi shuo se nobadi naa fuos unu fi du notn.

But this I say: He who sows sparingly will also reap sparingly, and he who sows bountifully will also reap bountifully.|So dis a wa mi waahn unu fi memba: Di wan we plaant likl bit a siid a-go riip likl bit a sitn, an di wan we plaant uol iip a siid a-go riip uol iip a sitn.

Let every man give according to the purposes in his heart, not grudgingly or out of necessity, for God loves a cheerful giver.|Evribadi mos gi wa dem disaid iina dem aat se dem fi gi. Yu no fi gi an den sari se yu gi. Nobadi shuda afi fuos yu fi du it niida kaaz Gad lov piipl we api fi gi.

God is able to make all grace abound toward you, so that you, always having enough of everything, may abound to every good work.|Gad av di powa fi gi unu aal we unu kuda niid an im wi aalwiez gi yu muor dan inof so dat unu kyan gi tu piipl we niid it.

As it is written:“He has dispersed abroad, He has given to the poor;His righteousness remains forever.”|It rait dong iina Gad wod se:“Gad aalwiez gi di puor we dem niid, im no uol bak notn fram dem;Im gud an kain fi eva an eva.”

Now He who supplies seed to the sower and supplies bread for your food will also multiply your seed sown and increase the fruits of your righteousness.|Nou, Gad, we gi di faama siid fi plaant an we gi piipl bred fi iit, im wi gi unu aal di siid we unu wuda niid fi plaant an im wi mek dem gruo tu. Im wi mek shuor se unu aalwiez av muor dan unu niid, so dat unu kyan aalwiez gi tu ada piipl.

So you will be enriched in everything to all bountifulness, which makes us give thanks to God.|Im wi gi unu evriting we unu niid so dat unu kyan aalwiez gi tu ada piipl. An wen unu shier wa unu av wid ada piipl, unu wi kaaz dem fi gi Gad tangks tu.

For the administration of this service not only supplies the need of the saints, but is abundant also through many thanksgivings to God. |So wen unu shier wa unu av wid di Juu dem iina Judiya we biliiv iina Krais Jiizas, unu no onggl a gi dem wa dem niid, bot unu a kaaz dem fi gi Gad tangks nof nof.

Meanwhile, through the performance of this ministry, they glorify God for the profession of your faith in the gospel of Christ and for your liberal sharing with them and with all others. |Siek-a wa unu a du, dem wi priez Gad kaaz unu biliiv an fala di Gud Nyuuz bout Krais Jiizas an kaaz unu shier wa unu av wid dem an ada piipl tu.

And in their prayer for you, they long for you because of the surpassing grace of God in you.|Dem lov unu an wel waahn fi si unu. An wen dem a prie dem memba unu, kaaz dem si ou Gad bles unu an yuuz unu fi elp dem nof nof.
Thanks be to God for His indescribable gift.
column2: Tangk Gad fi di gif we im gi wi. Da gif de so big an so gud mi no iivn nuo ou fi taak bout it.

column1: Now I, Paul, who am lowly in presence among you but bold toward you while absent, appeal to you by the meekness and gentleness of Christ. |Som piipl se mi saaf wen mi de de mongks unu bot gwaan laik mi rof wen mi de faar. Bot mi, Paal, mi a beg unu, iina Jiizas niem, Jiizas we kain an jengkl

I beg you that when I am present, I might not have to be bold with that confidence by which I intend to be bold against some, who think of us as if we walked according to the flesh. |no push mi fi rof wid unu wen mi kom de fi si unu, laik ou mi shuor se mi afi go rof wid di wan dem we tingk se wi a liv laik di piipl dem we de iina di worl an no nuo Gad.
For though we walk in the flesh, we do not war according to the flesh. |Kaaz iivn duo wi liv iina di worl wi no fait laik ou di worliyan dem fait.

For the weapons of our warfare are not carnal, but mighty through God to the pulling down of strongholds|Kaaz di sitn dem we wi fait wid, a no di siem kain-a sitn we di worliyan dem fait wid. No man neva mek di sitn dem we wi yuuz; di sitn dem we wi yuuz fi fait, a Gad mek dem an im gi dem di powa fi mash dong eniting we di enimi chrai fi bil op gens wi. Wi mash op dem aagiment

casting down imaginations and every high thing that exalts itself against the knowledge of God, bringing every thought into captivity to the obedience of Christ|an di sitn dem we dem se chuu dem ful-a demself, an we komiin laik wan waal a tap piipl fram nuo Gad. Wi a-go tier it dong. Di sitn dem we dem tingk an se, komiin laik wi enimi an siem laik ou suoja kech dem enimi an fling dem iina prizn, a siem so wi a-go kech evriting we dem tingk an fuos dem fi fala wa Krais Jiizas se.
and being ready to punish all disobedience when your obedience is complete.|An wen wi si se unu a fala Krais Jiizas iina evri wie, wi wi redi fi ponish enibadi we naa fala wa im se.

Do you look at things from the outward appearance? If any man trusts that he is Christ’s, let him consider again that, as he is Christ’s, even so are we Christ’s.|Unu onggl luk pan wa de pan di outsaid. Ef enibadi fiil shuor se dem bilang tu Krais Jiizas, mek dem tingk bout dis, siem laik ou unu bilang tu Jiizas, a siem so wi bilang tu im tu.

For even if I should boast somewhat more of our authority, which the Lord has given us for edification and not for your destruction, I shall not be ashamed,|Kaaz iivn ef mi buos likl tu moch bout di powa an di rait we di Laad gi mi, mi no shiem. Im gi mi da powa de no fi mash unu dong bot fi elp unu get chrang.
lest I appear to frighten you by my letters.
column2: An mi no waahn it luk laik se mi a chrai fi fraitn unu wid mi leta dem.

column1: “For his letters,” they say, “are weighty and powerful, but his bodily presence is weak, and his speech contemptible.” |Kaaz som piipl se, “Im rof wen im a rait wi. Iina im leta dem im taak tu wi aad bot wen im de mongks wi im saaf an wa im tel wi no wot notn.”

Let such a person consider this: that as we are in word by letters when we are absent, we will also be in deed when we are present.|Mek enibadi we se dat andastan dis, wa wi se iina di leta dem we wi rait unu wen wi no de de, a di siem ting wi a-go du wen wi de de wid unu.
For we dare not count or compare ourselves with those who commend themselves. They who measure themselves by one another and compare themselves with one another are not wise.
column2: Mi wudn mad fi chrai mach op miself wid di wan dem we eva a sing dem uona priez. Dem mek op dem main fi demself wa rait an den joj demself bies pan wa dem fiil rait. Wen dem du dat it shuo se dem no andastan notn.

column1: But we will not boast beyond measure, but within the boundaries which God has appointed us, which reach even you.|Bot wi, wi no komiin laik dem. Wi naa go brag an buos bout sopm we wi no av no bizniz a brag an buos bout. Wi onggl buos bout di wok we Gad gi wi fi du, an unu a paat a da wok de.

For we are not overextending ourselves as though we did not reach you, since we have come to you, preaching the gospel of Christ.|So wi neva did a paas wi plies wen wi buos bout unu kaaz wi a di fos wan fi kom tu unu an priich di Gud Nyuuz bout Krais Jiizas. Ef a neva wi kom priich tu unu, wi kudn a brag an buos bout unu.

We are not boasting of things beyond our measure in other men’s labors. But we have hope that when your faith is increased, our region shall be greatly enlarged by you|So wi no brag bout ada piipl wok laik se a wi did du it. Aal wi du a uop se unu wi get chrangga an chrangga iina wa unu biliiv, so dat wi wok mongks unu wi gruo tu.

to preach the gospel in the regions beyond you and not to boast in another man’s accomplishments. |Den, wi kyan go paas unu an go priich di Gud Nyuuz bout Krais Jiizas tu piipl we liv iina di ada konchri dem an we nobadi neva priich tu yet. Da wie de wen wi redi fi taak bout di wok we wi a du, wi nuo se wi naa brag an buos bout wok we sumadi els did du.
But, “Let him who boasts, boast in the Lord.”|Bot it rait dong iina Gad wod se, “Ef enibadi waahn fi buos mek im buos bout we di Laad du.”
For it is not he who commends himself who is approved, but he whom the Lord commends.|Kaaz it no mata ef yu tingk se yu a du gud, it onggl mata ef Gad tingk se yu gud.
I would to God you could bear with me a little in my folly. Indeed, bear with me|Mi uop se unu wi tek taim wid mi iivn ef unu tingk se wa mi bout fi se a fuulinish. Mi se fi tek taim wid mi!

For I am jealous over you with godly jealousy. For I have espoused you to one husband, that I may present you as a chaste virgin to Christ.|Mi wori bout unu siem laik ou Gad wori bout unu. Siem laik ou wan faada wi tek im gyal pikni we neva sliip wid nobadi yet an pramis fi marid ar tu wan man, a siem so mi did tek unu an pramis fi marid unu tu Krais Jiizas.

But I fear that somehow, as the serpent deceived Eve through his trickery, so your minds might be led astray from the simplicity that is in Christ.|Bot mi fried se, jos laik ou di siniek di chrik op Iiv, sumadi a-go chrik unu an kaaz unu fi ton we fram Krais Jiizas an tap fala im wid aal a unu aat.

For if he who comes preaches another Jesus, whom we have not preached, or if you receive another spirit, which you have not received, or another gospel, which you have not accepted, you might submit to it readily enough.|Kaaz wi tel unu bout Jiizas an unu tek di Uoli Spirit we Gad gi unu an unu biliiv di mesij we wi priich. Bot mek sumadi nyuu kom an tel unu bout wan difrant Jiizas an unu redi fi lisn an tek di spirit we dem a gi an biliiv di mesij we dem a priich.
For I think I am not in any way inferior to the most eminent of the apostles.
column2: Mi no tingk se fi unu “big apasl” dem beta dan mi.

column1: Even though I am unpolished in speech, yet I am not in knowledge. All things about us have been thoroughly revealed to you. |Kaaz iivn ef mi no taak gud laik dem wen mi infronta unu, mi nuo muor dan dem. An wi shuo evribadi plien plien se wi nuo muor dan dem iina evriting we wi du.

Did I commit a sin in abasing myself that you might be exalted, because I preached to you the gospel of God free of charge?|Wen mi priich Gad Gud Nyuuz bout Jiizas tu unu, mi did du it fi frii, mi neva chaaj unu notn. Mi put miself dong luo so dat mi kuda lif unu op. A sin mi did a sin wen mi du dem sopm de?
I robbed other churches by accepting wages from them to serve you. |A laik se mi did a tiif di ada choch dem, kaaz mi did tek moni fram dem so dat mi kuda kom elp unu.

Furthermore, when I was present with you and was lacking, I was a burden to no one. For the brothers who came from Macedonia supplied what I lacked. In all things I have kept myself from being burdensome to you, and so will I keep myself.|Wen mi did de mongks unu an wel niid som tingz mi neva aks unu fi notn, kaaz wi breda an sista dem we did kom fram Masiduoniya did bring evriting we mi niid. Mi neva presha non a unu fi notn an mi naa go presha non a unu fi notn niida.

As the truth of Christ is in me, no one shall stop me from this boasting in the regions of Achaia. |An nobadi iina Akaiya kyan tap mi fram buos bout dat. Siem laik ou unu nuo fi shuor se wa mi tiich bout Gad a chuu, a siem so unu kyan shuor bout dat.
Why? Because I do not love you? God knows.
column2: Wa mek mi naa presha unu fi gi mi notn? Unu tingk se a kaaz mi no lov unu? Gad nuo se mi lov unu.

column1: And I will continue doing what I am doing, that I may cut off the opportunity from those who desire an opportunity to be found equal to us in what they boast about.|Mi neva presha unu fi notn an mi naa go presha unu fi notn. Mi naa du it so dat di piipl dem we wuda waahn fi buos se dem a wok siem laik mi, naa go av no chaans fi se so.

For such are false apostles and deceitful workers, disguising themselves as apostles of Christ. |Kaaz dem piipl de, dem se dem a apasl, bot dem a no no apasl. Dem gwaan laik se a Gad sen dem an chrai fi chrik piipl an mek dem biliiv se dem a wan a Jiizas apasl dem, bot dem a no no apasl.
And no wonder! For even Satan disguises himself as an angel of light.
column2: An mi no sopraiz se dem chrai fi du dat kaaz iivn sietan imself chrai fi chrik piipl an jres op imself laik wan a Gad ienjel wid wan brait lait roun im.

column1: Therefore it is no great thing if his ministers also disguise themselves as ministers of righteousness, whose end will be according to their works.|So den it no fi sopraiz nobadi se fi im sorvant dem a chrai fi chrik piipl tu an gwaan laik se di wok we dem a du a gud sopm. Bot di die gweehn kom wen dem a-go get aal we dem a wok fa.

I say again, let no one think that I am a fool. Otherwise, at least receive me as a fool, so that I also may boast a little. |Mi wi se it agen, mi no waahn non a unu fi tingk se mi a fuul. Bot ef unu tingk se mi a wan fuul, chriit mi laik ou yu wuda chriit di ada fuul dem an lou mi fi brag an buos likl.

What I speak, I speak not according to the Lord, but as it were foolishly, in this confidence of boasting. |Nou wen mi taak dem wie ya, mi naa taak ou di Laad waahn mi fi taak. Mi a taak laik se mi a fuul.
Seeing that many boast according to the flesh, I also will boast. |Sins nof piipl a brag an buos laik ou di piipl dem iina di worl a buos, mi a-go brag an buos tu.
For you tolerate fools gladly, seeing you yourselves are wise.|Unu so waiz, unu eva redi fi tek iin an lisn tu di fuul dem.

For you permit it if a man brings you into bondage, if a man devours you, if a man takes from you, if a man exalts himself, or if a man strikes you on the face.|Unu put op wid piipl wen dem kom an chrai tek unu an ton unu iina sliev. Unu put op wid dem wen dem yuuz unu, unu put op wid dem wen dem tek advaantij a unu. Wen dem put unu dong an gwaan laik dem beta dan unu, wen dem baks unu iina unu fies, unu put op wid dem.

I say to my reproach that we were too weak for that.But whenever anyone is bold (I speak foolishly), I am bold also.|(Mi ges mi shuda shiem fi se dat wi did tuu wiik fi du dem sitn de tu unu.) Bot wat-eva dem tingk dem bad inof fi buos bout, mi a-go buos bout di siem sitn dem tu. (Mi a taak laik wan fuul ya nou).
Are they Hebrews? So am I. Are they Israelites? So am I. Are they the seed of Abraham? So am I.
column2: Dem a Iibruu? Mi a Iibruu tu. Dem a Izrelait? Mi a Izrelait tu. Dem a Iebriyam fambili? Mi a Iebriyam fambili tu.

column1: Are they servants of Christ? I speak as a fool. I am more: in labors more abundant, in stripes above measure, in prisons more frequently, in deaths often.|Dem a Krais Jiizas sorvant? (Mi a taak laik wan riil madman nou.) Mi a muor Krais sorvant dan dem. Mi wok aada dan dem. Mi get lak op iina prizn nof muor taim dan dem. Mi get nof muor biitn dan dem an a nof taim mi aalmuos ded.
Five times I received from the Jews forty lashes minus one.
column2: A faiv taim di Juu dem yuuz wan wip an lik mi toti-nain taim — dat a wan shaat a faati.

column1: Three times I was beaten with rods; once I was stoned; three times I suffered shipwreck; a night and a day I have been in the deep;
column2: A chrii taim di Ruoman dem yuuz kien biit mi. Wan taim som piipl aal stuon mi. A chrii taim mi outa sii an di ship we mi de pan mash op. Wan a dem taim de a wan uol nait an wan uol die mi iina di waata a fluot.

column1: in journeys often, in perils of waters, in perils of robbers, in perils by my own countrymen, in perils by the Gentiles, in perils in the city, in perils in the wilderness, in perils in the sea, in perils among false brothers;|Nof taim wen mi a chravl, mi aalmuos ded. Riva nieli tek mi laif. Tiif chrai kil mi. Mi uona piipl di Juu dem an aal piipl we a no Juu chrai fi kil mi tu. Mi no sief iina di siti. Mi no sief iina di dezot. Mi de a sii, mi aalmuos ded. Mi aal av piipl we gwaan laik dem a mi breda, bot a kil dem waahn fi kil mi.

in weariness and painfulness, in sleeplessness often, in hunger and thirst, in fastings often, and in cold and nakedness.|Mi chogl an wok aad aad, nof nait mi no get no sliip. Mi did onggri an waahn sopm fi jringk an nof taim neva av no fuud fi iit. Yu did av taim wen mi kuol an no av inof kluoz fi kip mi waam.

Beside the external things, the care of all the churches pressures me daily.|A nof sitn mi naa tel unu bout, bot pan tap a aal a dat, evridie mi wori bout aal a di choch dem. Mi wori so til mi aat evi.
Who is weak, and I am not weak? Who is led into sin, and I am not distressed?|Wen sumadi wiik, mi no fiil wiik tu? Wen sumadi get chrik an go sin, mi no beks til mi blod bwail?
If I must boast, I will boast of the things which concern my weakness.|Sins mi afi brag an buos, mi wi brag an buos bout di sitn dem we shuo se mi wiik.
The God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who is blessed forevermore, knows that I am not lying.|Di Gad an Faada fi di Laad Jiizas Krais, nuo se mi naa lai. Mek piipl priez im niem fi eva!

In Damascus the governor under King Aretas secured the city of the Damascenes with a garrison, desiring to arrest me. |Iina Damaskos, wan a King Aretas govana dem sen suoja fi gyaad di siti giet so dat dem kuda ares mi.
But I was let down by the wall through a window in a basket and escaped his hands.|Bot dem neva kech mi, kaaz som piipl let mi dong chuu wan winda iina di siti waal.
In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.|Wen taim did staat, di Wod did de bout, an di Wod did de de wid Gad. Matarafak, di Wod a did Gad.
He was in the beginning with God.
column2: Di Wod did de bout wid Gad fram bifuo di worl kom bout.

column1: All things were created through Him, and without Him nothing was created that was created. |Gad kaaz di wan we a di Wod fi mek evriting. Notn no de we im neehn mek.
In Him was life, and the life was the light of mankind. |Im a di wan we mek evriting liv, an a im kyari lait kom gi piipl so dem kyan si.
The light shines in darkness, but the darkness has not overcome it.|Im shain an lait op di daak an di daak kudn tap di lait fram shain!
There was a man sent from God whose name was John. |Nou, yu did av wan man we Gad did sen kom. Im niem Jan.
This man came as a witness in order to testify concerning the Light, that all men through Him might believe.|Gad did sen Jan fi tel piipl bout di wan we a di lait, so dem kuda biliiv we Jan se.
He was not this Light, but was sent in order to testify concerning the Light.|Jan a neehn di lait. Im did onggl kom fi tel piipl bout di lait.
The true Light, which enlightens everyone, was coming into the world.|Da lait de a di riil lait an im kom iina di worl an mek evribadi nuo im.
He was in the world, and the world was created through Him, yet the world did not know Him.|A im mek di worl an im kom liv iina it, bot di piipl dem iina di worl neehn nuo a uu im.
He came to His own, and His own people did not receive Him. |Im kom tu im uona konchri an im uona piipl dem ton dem bak pan im.

Yet to all who received Him, He gave the power to become sons of God, to those who believed in His name|Bot az fi aal a dem we welkom im — dat fi se, dem we chos iina im an im niem, im gi dem di rait fi ton Gad pikni.

who were born not of blood, nor of the will of the flesh, nor of the will of man, but of God.|Bot dem no baan iina Gad fambili laka ou naamal pikni baan wid mada an faada, ar kaaz sumadi did fiil fi av seks, ar kaaz wan ozban mek op im main se im waahn pikni. Nuo! A Gad imself mek dem baan.

The Word became flesh and dwelt among us, and we saw His glory, the glory as the only Son of the Father, full of grace and truth.|Nou, di wan we a di Wod ton man, im kom kom liv mongks wi, an wi si ou im big an powaful. Im a Faada Gad wan an onggl dege-dege Bwai Pikni. Faada Gad sen im kom an a di Faada mek im so big an powaful. Di Bwai Pikni shuo wi nof nof lov iivn duo wi no dizorv it, an a bier chuu sitn im shuo wi bout Gad.

John bore witness of Him and cried out, “This was He of whom I said, ‘He who comes after me is preferred before me, for He was before me.’ ” |Jan kom an im tel piipl bout im. Im baal out an tel dem se, “Da wan ya, a im mi did a taak bout wen mi tel unu se, ‘Di sumadi we de kom afta mi, im wie wie biga an beta dan mi, kaaz im did de bout fram lang bifuo mi baan.’ ”
We have all received from His fullness grace upon grace. |Siek-a ou im lov wi so moch an tel wi bier chuu sitn bout Gad, wi get muo lov fram im pan tap a di lov we wi did a get aredi.

For the law was given through Moses; grace and truth came through Jesus Christ. |Kaaz, yu si, Gad gi Muoziz di Laa fi gi wi, bot im yuuz Jiizas fi mek wi nuo wa chuu, an siek-a Jiizas, im shuo wi lov we wi no dizorv.

No one has seen God at any time. The only Son, who is at the Father’s side, has made Him known.|Nobadi neva eva si Gad yet. Di onggl sumadi we eva si im a di wan dege-dege Bwai Pikni, we a Gad imself. Im wel kluos tu di Faada, an a im mek wi nuo wa di Faada komiin laik.

Now this is the testimony of John, when the Jews sent priests and Levites from Jerusalem to ask him, “Who are you?”|Wan taim, di Juu liida dem sen som priis an som a dem we elp tek kier a Gad ous fram outa Jeruusilem fi kwestiyan Jan. Dem sen dem fi aks im se, “A uu yu?” Wen Jan a ansa dem kwestiyan, im tek di chaans fi tel dem bout Gad Bwai Pikni.
He confessed, and did not deny, but confessed, “I am not the Christ.”|Im no uol bak di chuut, bot tel dem plien an chriet se, “Mi a no di Krais.”

They asked him, “Who then? Are you Elijah?”He said, “I am not.”“Are you the Prophet?”He answered, “No.”|So dem aks im se, “Den a uu yu den? Ilaija?”Jan se, “Nuo, mi a no Ilaija!”“So, yu a di prafit?”Bot Jan tel dem se, “Nuo!”

They said to him then, “Who are you? Tell us so that we may give an answer to those who sent us. What do you say concerning yourself?”|“So a uu yu den?” dem aks. “Jos tel wi so wi kyan get fi tel di piipl dem we sen wi fi kom fain out. A uu yu se yu bi?”

John said, “I am the voice of one crying out in the wilderness, ‘Make straight the way of the Lord,’ just as the prophet Isaiah said.”|So Jan yuuz sopm we prafit Aizaiya se, fi tel dem a uu im bi. Im se, “Mi a di sumadi we a shout iina di dezot, ‘Mek di chrak we im fi waak pan chriet.’ ”
Now those who were sent were from the Pharisees. |Nou, di Farisii dem did sen som a fi dem uona piipl fi kwestiyan Jan tu.

They asked him, “Why do you baptize then, if you are not the Christ, nor Elijah, nor the Prophet?”|Ier wa dem se tu im, “So, ef yu a no di Krais, an ef yu a no Ilaija ar di Prafit, a wa mek yu a baptaiz piipl den?”
John answered them, “I baptize with water, but One stands among you, whom you do not know. |So, Jan ansa dem se, “Mi baptaiz unu iina waata, bot sumadi de mongks unu we unu no nuo bout.

This is He who comes after me, who is preferred before me, the strap of whose sandal I am not worthy to untie.”|Mi no iivn gud inof fi pul di chrap dem pan im slipaz. Im a-go pik op afta mi lef an gaan.”

These things took place in Bethany beyond the Jordan, where John was baptizing.|Nou, aal a dem sitn ya apm wich paat Jan did a baptaiz piipl. Di plies did niem Betani, an it did de pan di iis said a Riva Jaadn.

The next day John saw Jesus coming toward him and said, “Look, the Lamb of God, who takes away the sin of the world.|Di neks die, Jan si Jiizas a waak kom wich paat im de. Im si im an se, “Unu luk! Si Gad Biebi Shiip de! A im a di wan we a-go mash op an tek we sin fram outa di worl!

This is He of whom I said, ‘After me comes a Man who is preferred before me, for He was before me.’ |A im sed wan mi did a taak bout wen unu did ier mi se, ‘Wan man a kom afta mi, im wie biga an beta dan mi, kaa im did de bout fram wie bifuo mi baan.’

I did not know Him, but for this reason I came baptizing with water: so that He might be revealed to Israel.”|Mi neehn nuo a uu da sumadi de wuda bi. Mi onggl kom ya a baptaiz piipl, so dat dem we iina Izrel kuda get fi si an nuo a uu im.”

Then John bore witness, saying, “I saw the Spirit descending from heaven like a dove, and it remained on Him.|Den Jan staat taak an tel di piipl dem se, “Mi si di Spirit kom dong outa evn jos laka wan dov, an it lan pan im.

I did not know Him, but He who sent me to baptize with water said to me, ‘The One on whom you see the Spirit descending and remaining, this is He who baptizes with the Holy Spirit.’|Az mi did se, mi neehn nuo uu di sumadi wuda did bi. Bot, yu si di wan we sen mi fi baptaiz piipl, im did tel mi se, ‘Di sumadi we yu baptaiz an we yu si di Spirit kom dong an lan pan, a im a di wan we gweehn baptaiz piipl iina di Uoli Spirit.’
I have seen and have borne witness that He is the Son of God.”|Mi si dis ya apm wid mi uona tuu yai dem, an mi a tel unu se da man ya, a im a Gad Bwai Pikni.”
Again, the next day John was standing with two of his disciples. |Di neks die, Jan did de a di sed plies wid tuu a im falara dem.
Looking upon ­Jesus as He walked, he said, “Look, the Lamb of God!”|Nou, Jiizas did a waak paas, an Jan si im an shout out, “Unu luk! Si Gad Biebi Shiip de!”
The two disciples heard him speak, and they followed Jesus.|Az Jan se so, im tuu falara dem staat fala baka Jiizas.

Then Jesus turned, saw them following, and said to them, “What do you seek?”And they said to Him, “Rabbi” (which means Teacher), “where are You staying?”|Wen Jiizas ton roun an si dem, im aks dem se, “A wa unu waahn?”So dem ansa im an se, “Rabai, we yu liv?” (Rabai iina fi dem langwij miin Tiicha.)

Jesus said to them, “Come and see.”So they came and saw where He stayed and remained with Him that day, for it was about the tenth hour.|“Kom,” Jiizas se, “unu kom, an unu wi si wich paat mi stie” (a did bout fuo aklak iina di iivnin).So dem go an si wich paat im did a liv an dem tan a im yaad fi di res a di die.

One of the two who heard John speak, and followed Him, was Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother. |Saiman Piita did av wan breda niem Anju. Nou, Anju a did wan a Jan tuu falara dem we did fala Jiizas afta dem ier wa Jan did se bout im.

He first found his own brother Simon, and said to him, “We have found the Messiah” (which means the Christ). |Di fos ting Anju du afta im miit Jiizas a fain im breda, Saiman, an tel im se, “Wi fain di Mesaiya” (Iina fi dem langwij dat miin Krais).

Then he brought him to Jesus.When Jesus saw him, He said, “You are Simon the son of John. You shall be called Cephas” (which means Peter).|An im kyari Saiman go wich paat Jiizas did de.Wen Jiizas si Saiman, im luk pan im an se, “Yu a Saiman, Jan bwai pikni. Fram nou aan, yu niem Siifas” (iina fi dem langwij, dat de a di niem fi Piita).

The next day Jesus wanted to go to Galilee, and He found Philip, and said to him, “Follow Me.”|Di neks die, Jiizas mek op im main fi lef go a Gyalalii. Im fain wan man we niem Filip an se tu im se, “Fala baka mi.”
Now Philip was from Bethsaida, the city of Andrew and Peter. |Filip did kom fram wan toun niem Betsieda, di sed plies Anju an Piita kom fram.

Philip found Nathanael and said to him, “We have found Him of whom Moses in the law, as well as the prophets, wrote, Jesus of Nazareth, the son of Joseph.”|Afta Jiizas fain im, Filip fain Nataniyel an tel im se, “Wi fain di sumadi we Muoziz rait bout iina di Laa, di sed wan di prafit dem rait bout tu. Im niem Jiizas an im kom fram Nazaret. Im a Juozif bwai pikni.”

Nathanael said to him, “Can any good thing come out of Nazareth?”Philip said to him, “Come and see.”|Bot Nataniyel se tu Filip se, “Nazaret? Notn gud kyan kom outa dat de plies de?”So Filip se tu im se, “Kom kom si fi yuself.”

Jesus saw Nathanael coming to Him and said concerning him, “Here is an Israelite indeed, in whom is no guile.”|Wen taim Jiizas si Nataniyel a kom wich paat im de, dis a wa im se bout im, “Ku ya! Da man ya a wan Izrelait fi chuu! Da man ya no tel no lai.”

Nathanael said to Him, “How do You know me?”Jesus answered him, “Before Philip called you, when you were under the fig tree, I saw you.”|Nataniyel se tu im se, “Ou kom yu nuo mi?”Jiizas ansa im an se, “Mi si yu fram wen yu did anda di fig chrii, bifuo Filip kaal yu.”

Nathanael answered Him, “Rabbi, You are the Son of God! You are the King of Israel!”|Wen Nataniyel ier Jiizas se dat de, im se, “Rabai! Tiicha! Yu a Gad Bwai Pikni fi chuu! Yu a di King we ruul uova Izrel!”

Jesus answered him, “Because I said to you, ‘I saw you under the fig tree,’ do you believe? You will see greater things than these.”|So Jiizas se tu im se, “Yu biliiv iina mi kaa mi tel yu se mi did si yu anda di fig chrii? Yu gweehn si biga sitn dan dat.”

And He said to him, “Truly, truly I say to you, hereafter you shall see heaven opened and the angels of God ascending and descending upon the Son of Man.”|Den im se, “Mi a tel unu fi chuu chuu se unu gweehn si di skai uopm op, an unu a-go si Gad ienjel dem a go op iina evn an a kom dong pan di ort tu di Man we Gad Pik.”

On the third day there was a wedding in Cana of Galilee. The mother of Jesus was there.|Tuu die afta dat apm, yu did av wan wedn a wan toun niem Kiena. Kiena did de iina Gyalalii. Jiizas mada did de a di wedn
Both Jesus and His disciples were invited to the wedding. |an Jiizas an im falara dem did de de, kaa dem did get invait tu.
When the wine ran out, the mother of Jesus said to Him, “They have no wine.”|Di piipl dem a di wedn jringk aaf di wain, an wen it don, Jiizas mada se tu im se, “Dem na'av no muor wain lef.”
Jesus said to her, “Woman, what does this have to do with Me? My hour has not yet come.”|Jiizas se tu ar se, “Mama, wa mek yu de tel mi dat? Fi mi taim no kom yet.”
His mother said to the servants, “Whatever He says to you, do it.”|So im mada tel di sorvant dem we did de de se, “Eniting im tel unu fi du, dwi'it.”

Six water pots made of stone were sitting there, used for ceremonial cleansing by the Jews, containing twenty to thirty gallons each.|Nou siks waata jaar we mek outa stuon did de de. Di Juu piipl dem kip waata iina dem fi wash an mek demself kliin, kaaz a dat fi dem Laa did se dem fi du. Wan a di jaar dem kuda uol bout twenti tu toti gyalan a waata.
Jesus said to them, “Fill the water pots with water.” And they filled them up to the brim.|Jiizas se tu di sorvant dem se, “Ful op di jaar dem wid waata.” So dem ful dem op tu di brim.

Then He said to them, “Now draw some out, and take it to the master of the feast.”And they took it.|Den im se tu dem se, “Nou, chuo out som a wa iina dem an kyari it go gi di fuud manija.” An dem du wa im tel dem fi du.

When the master of the feast tasted the water that had been turned into wine, and did not know where it came from (though the servants who drew the water knew), the master of the feast called the bridegroom|Wen taim di manija ties di waata we Jiizas ton iina wain, im kaal fi di man we did a get marid. Nou, di manija neehn nuo we di wain did kom fram. (Bot di sorvant dem we chuo it out kom gi im did nuo duo.)

and he said to him, “Every man serves the good wine first, and after men have drunk freely, then the poor wine is served. But you have kept the good wine until now.”|Di manija kaal di man an se tu im se, “Wen ada piipl a get marid, dem shier out di bes wain fos. An afta di piipl dem jringk an jongk aaf, a dat de taim de dem shier out di chiip wain. Bot yu nou, yu shier out di bes wain laas!”

This, the first of His signs, Jesus did in Cana of Galilee, and He revealed His glory, and His disciples believed in Him.|Nou, Jiizas wok uol iip a mirikl an da wan ya a did di fos wan outa aal a dem. Im did du it iina Kiena we de a Gyalalii. Da wie de, im shuo ou im big an powaful. An im falara dem biliiv iina im.

After this He, and His mother, and His brothers, and His disciples went down to Capernaum. They remained there a few days.|Afta di wedn, im, im mada, im breda dem an im falara dem go a Kyaporniyom, an dem tan de fi kopl die.
The Passover of the Jews was at hand, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.|Nou, a did nieli taim fi di Paasuova alidie, so Jiizas go op a Jeruusilem.

In the temple He found those who were selling oxen and sheep and doves, and the moneychangers sitting there. |Wen im riich de, im si piipl a sel kou an shiip an dov iina di yaad wich paat Gad ous de. An im si di piipl dem we chienj out moni tu a sidong a dem tiebl.

When He had made a whip of cords, He drove them all out of the temple, with the sheep and oxen. He poured out the changers’ money and overturned the tables. |So im get som ruop an tek dem mek wan wip. Den im yuuz di wip an ron out di uol a di sela dem outa di yaad: dem an dem kou an dem shiip an dem dov. Im lik uova di piipl dem we a chienj out moni kain dem, an im ton uova aal a dem tiebl dem.

He said to those who sold doves, “Take these things away! Do not make My Father’s house a house of merchandise!” |Im se tu dem we did a sel di dov dem se, “Tek we dem sitn ya outa ya! No tek mi Faada ous ton maakit!”
His disciples remembered that it was written, “Zeal for Your house will consume Me.”|Sed taim dis ya apm, im falara dem memba ou Gad wod se, “Di wie mi lov yu ous, it de go kaaz mi fi ded.”

Then the Jews said to Him, “What sign do You show us, seeing that You do these things?”|So di Juu liida dem aks im se, “Wa kain-a mirikl yu kyan wok fi wi? Wa kain-a sain yu kyan gi fi shuo wi se yu av di rait fi du aal a dem sitn ya?”
Jesus answered them, “Destroy this temple, and in three days I will raise it up.”|So Jiizas se tu dem se, “Tier dong an mash op da ous ya, an mi wi bil it op bak iina chrii die.”

Then the Jews said, “It has taken forty-six years to build this temple, and will You raise it up in three days?”|Dem ansa im bak an se, “A faati-siks ier it tek fi mek da ous ya, an yu gweehn bil it op bak iina onggl chrii die?”
But He was speaking concerning the temple of His body.
column2: Bot a no Gad ous Jiizas did a taak bout. A im badi im did a taak bout.

column1: Therefore, when He was raised from the dead, His disciples remembered that He had said this to them. And they believed the Scripture and the word which Jesus had spoken.|Nou a afta Jiizas ded an kom bak alaiv im falara dem memba se im did se dem sitn de. An dem biliiv wa rait dong iina Gad wod an wa Jiizas did se.

Now when He was in Jerusalem at the Passover Feast, many believed in His name when they saw the signs which He did.|Nou, wen Jiizas did stil de a Jeruusilem pan di Paasuova alidie, nof piipl put dem chos iina im, kaa dem si di mirikl dem we im wok.
But Jesus did not entrust Himself to them, because He knew all men|Bot Jiizas neva chos dem non at aal, kaaz im did don nuo ou piipl tan.
and did not need anyone to bear witness of man, for He knew what was in man.|Nobadi neehn afi tel im bout ou piipl tan, kaa im did nuo aredi we iina piipl aat.
There was a man of the Pharisees named Nicodemus, a ruler of the Jews.|Yu did av wan Farisii man niem Nikodiimos, wan a di Juu liida dem.

He came to Jesus by night and said to Him, “Rabbi, we know that You are a teacher who has come from God. For no one can do these signs that You do unless God is with him.”|Im go luk fi Jiizas wan nait an se tu im se, “Tiicha, wi nuo se a Gad sen yu fi kom tiich, kaa nobadi kyaahn wok di mirikl dem we yu wok, ef a no Gad a kaaz dem fi dwi'it.”

Jesus answered him, “Truly, truly I say to you, unless a man is born again,  he cannot see the kingdom of God.”|So, Jiizas se tu im se, “Fi chuu chuu, mi a tel yu se nobadi kyaahn tek paat iina Gad kindom ef dem no baan agen.”

Nicodemus said to Him, “How can a man be born when he is old? Can he enter a second time into his mother’s womb and be born?”|So Nikodiimos aks im se, “Den a ou sumadi we oul fi baan agen? Sumadi kyan go bak iina im mada beli an baan wan neda taim?”

Jesus answered, “Truly, truly I say to you, unless a man is born of water and the Spirit, he cannot enter the kingdom of God.|Jiizas ansa im an se, “Fi chuu chuu, mi a tel yu se nobadi kyaahn tek paat iina Gad kindom ef dem no baan uova da taim ya iina waata an iina di Spirit.
That which is born of the flesh is flesh, and that which is born of the Spirit is spirit.|Wen biebi baan, a piipl a av piipl, bot Gad, im mek piipl baan iina di Spirit.
Do not marvel that I said to you, ‘You must be born again.’ |So no fraitn wen yu ier mi tel yu se, ‘Yu afi baan wan neks taim.’

The wind blows where it wishes, and you hear its sound, but you do not know where it comes from or where it goes. So it is with everyone who is born of the Spirit.”|Briiz bluo go wich paat it waahn fi go. Yu onggl ier di soun we it mek, bot yu kyaahn si a we it de kom fram an yu kyaahn si wich paat it de go. Nou, a siem so it go wid evribadi we di Spirit mek baan.”
Nicodemus said to Him, “How can this be?”|“Ou dat?”, Nikodiimos aks.
Jesus answered him, “Are you the teacher of Israel, but you do not know these things?|Bot, Jiizas se tu im se, “A yu a tap tiicha iina Izrel, an yu no andastan dem sitn ya we mi a taak bout?

Truly, truly I say to you, We speak of what We know and bear witness of what We have seen, but you do not receive Our testimony.|Fi chuu chuu, mi a tel yu: wi taak bout di sitn dem we wi nuo bout, an wi taak bout di sitn dem we wi si fi wiself, bot unu piipl no tek wa wi se.

If I have told you earthly things and you do not believe, how will you believe if I tell you heavenly things? |Ef mi taak tu unu bout di sitn dem we tek plies pan di ort an unu no biliiv, ou unu a-go biliiv mi ef mi taak tu unu bout wa gwaan iina evn?
No one has ascended to heaven except He who descended from heaven, even the Son of Man who is in heaven.|Nobadi neva go a evn yet — onggl di wan we kom dong fram out de. An dat a di Man we Gad Pik.
Just as Moses lifted up the serpent in the wilderness, even so must the Son of Man be lifted up|Jos laka ou Muoziz did lif op di siniek iina di dezot, a sed wie so di Man we Gad Pik mos get lif op
that whoever believes in Him should not perish, but may have eternal life.|so aal a dem we chos iina im kyan liv fi eva.

“For God so loved the world that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him should not perish, but have eternal life. |“Kaa, yu si, Gad lov di worl so moch dat im gi op im wan dege-dege Bwai Pikni, so enibadi we chos iina im naa go ded bot a-go liv fi eva.

For God did not send His Son into the world to condemn the world, but that the world through Him might be saved. |Kaa yu si, Gad neehn sen im Bwai Pikni iina di worl fi rait aaf di piipl iina di worl. Nuo! Gad sen im fi siev dem.

He who believes in Him is not condemned. But he who does not believe is condemned already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God.|Enibadi we chos iina Gad Bwai Pikni no get rait aaf, bot di piipl dem we no chos iina im, dem don rait aaf aredi, kaa dem no chos iina Gad wan dege-dege Bwai Pikni; dem no chos iina im niem.

This is the verdict, that light has come into the world, and men loved darkness rather than light, because their deeds were evil. |“Nou, a dis ya mek piipl get rait aaf: di wan we a di lait kom iina di worl, bot di piipl dem we liv iina di worl lov daaknis insted-a lait. Dem lov di daak, kaa a bier wikidnis dem du.

For everyone who does evil hates the light and does not come to the light, lest his deeds should be exposed. |Kaa evribadi we du rang iet lait an dem no waahn fi waak out iina di lait, kaa dem fried se di lait gweehn shuo op di bad sitn dem we dem a du.

But he who does the truth comes to the light, that it may be revealed that his deeds have been done in God.”|Bot di sumadi we a du wa Gad se a di rait ting fi du, waak out iina di lait, so dat evribadi kyan si se a riili Gad mek im du we im a du.”

After these things Jesus and His disciples came into the land of Judea. He remained with them there and baptized.|Afta dat, Jiizas an im falara dem lef an go out iina di konchri paat a Judiya. Im spen som taim de wid dem an im did a baptaiz piipl.

John also was baptizing in Aenon toward Salim, because much water was there. And people came and were baptized. |Jan did a baptaiz piipl tu a wan plies no tuu faar fram Sielem we dem kaal Ienan. Im did a baptaiz de, kaa nof waata did de de, an piipl did a go de fi get baptaiz.
For John had not yet been put in prison.
column2: (Dis a bifuo dem did lak op Jan iina prizn.)

column1: Then a dispute arose between some of John’s disciples and the Jews about ceremonial cleansing.|Nou, Jan falara dem an wan neda Juu get iina wan piis a aagiment bout wa dem rilijan se bout ou piipl fi wash an mek demself kliin.

They came to John and said to him, “Rabbi, He who was with you beyond the Jordan, to whom you bore witness, look, He is baptizing, and everyone is going to Him.”|Dem go uova tu Jan an se tu im se, “Tiicha, di man we did de de wid yu pan di ada said a Riva Jaadn — di wan we yu did a taak bout — luk, si'im de a baptaiz tu, an evribadi a go tu im.”
John answered, “A man can receive nothing unless it has been given to him from heaven.|Bot Jan se tu dem se, “Sumadi kyan onggl av wa Gad gi dem.

You yourselves bear witness of me, that I said, ‘I am not the Christ,’ but ‘I have been sent before Him.’ |Unu nuo fi unuself an kyan tel enibadi se mi did se, ‘Mi a no di Krais. Gad onggl sen mi kom bifuo im.’

He who has the bride is the bridegroom. But the friend of the bridegroom, who stands and hears him, rejoices greatly at the bridegroom’s voice. Therefore this joy of mine is fulfilled. 30He must increase, but I must decrease.”|Yu si, di braid a fi di braidgruum. Di braidgruum brejrin we saat out di sitn dem fi'im wedn an we tan op an lisn out fi'im, im glad-bag bos wen taim im ier di braidgruum vais. Rait ya nou, a siem wie so mi fiil wel wel api bout wa a gwaan.
He must increase, but I must decrease.”|Da man de we a baptaiz piipl, im afi get biga an biga. Mi, mi afi get sumaala an sumaala.

He who comes from above is above all. He who is of the earth is earthly and speaks of the earth. He who comes from heaven is above all. |“Di sumadi we kom fram op a tap, biga an beta dan evribadi. Di sumadi we kom fram ort bilang tu di ort, an im taak bout wa gwaan pan di ort. Di sumadi we kom fram op a tap, biga an beta dan evribadi.
He bears witness of what He has seen and heard, yet no one receives His testimony.|Im taak bout we im si an ier, bot nobadi no biliiv wa im se.
He who has received His testimony has certified that God is true.
column2: Di sumadi we tek iin an fala wa im se shuo klier klier se wa Gad se a chuu sitn.

column1: For He whom God has sent speaks the words of God, for God gives the Spirit without measure to Him.|Kaa, di wan we Gad sen kom se aal a wa Gad tel im fi se, kaa yu si, Gad gi'im evri singgl bit a im Spirit.
The Father loves the Son, and has placed all things into His hand.|Di Faada lov im Bwai Pikni, an im gi im powa uova evriting.

He who believes in the Son has eternal life. He who does not believe the Son shall not see life, but the wrath of God remains on him.|Di sumadi we chos iina im Bwai Pikni a-go liv fi eva, bot di wan we no waahn fi av notn fi du wid im naa go liv, an Gad eva a-go ponish im.”
Now when the Lord learned that the Pharisees had heard that Jesus was making and baptizing more disciples than John|Nou, di Farisii dem did ier se Jiizas did a get an baptaiz muo falara dan Jan
(though Jesus Himself did not baptize, but His disciples)|(bot Jiizas neehn a baptaiz a suol, a im falara dem did a du it.)
He left Judea and departed again to Galilee.|Wen di Laad fain out se di Farisii dem ier bout wa did a gwaan, im lef fram Judiya an go baka Gyalalii.
Now it was necessary that He go through Samaria.
column2: Bot im did afi paas chuu Samieriya fos.

column1: So He came to a city of Samaria which is called Sychar, near the plot of ground that Jacob gave to his son Joseph. |Nou, wen im did a go chuu Samieriya, im en op iina wan toun we dem kaal Saikaar. Saikaar neehn faar fram di lan we Jiekob did gi im bwai, Juozif

Jacob’s well was there. Jesus, therefore, being exhausted from His journey, sat down by the well. It was about the sixth hour.|an Jiekob did dig wan wel de. Wen Jiizas riich di wel, im did so taiyad im sit dong saida it. Dat did bout migl die.
A woman of Samaria came there to draw water. Jesus said to her, “Give Me a drink.” |Nou, wan Samaritan uman kom fi jraa waata fram outa di wel. So Jiizas aks ar se, “Beg yu fi som waata fi jringk?”
For His disciples had gone away into the city to buy food.|(Da taim de, im falara dem did gaan gaan bai fuud iina di toun.)

Then the woman of Samaria said to Him, “How is it that You, being a Jew, ask a drink from me, a woman of Samaria?” For Jews have no dealings with Samaritans.|So nou, di Samaritan uman se tu Jiizas se, “Yu a wan Juu an mi a wan Samaritan uman. Ou yu fi de aks mi fi gi yu waata fi jringk?” (Shi se so, kaa di Juu dem neehn miks an minggl wid Samaritan piipl.)

Jesus answered her, “If you knew the gift of God, and who it is who is saying to you, ‘Give Me a drink,’ you would have asked Him, and He would have given you living water.”|Jiizas ansa ar an se, “Ef yu did nuo bout di speshal sitn we Gad gi — Ef yu did nuo a uu de aks yu fi waata, yu wuda aks im fi waata, an im wuda gi yu it an mek yu liv wan nyuu saat a laif.”

The woman said to Him, “Sir, You have nothing to draw with, and the well is deep. Where then do You get that living water? |So shi se tu im se, “Bot, sar, yu no av no bokit fi tek jraa waata, plos di wel diip. So, a wich paat yu gweehn get da kain-a waata de we yu a taak bout?

Are You greater than our father Jacob, who gave us the well and drank from it himself, along with his sons and his livestock?”|Yu biga dan wi faada Jiekob we gi wi da wel ya, an we aal jringk waata fram outa it — im, im Bwai Pikni dem an im animal dem?”
Jesus said to her, “Everyone who drinks of this water will thirst again|So, Jiizas tel ar se, “Evribadi we jringk waata fram outa da wel ya gweehn get torsti agen

but whoever drinks of the water that I shall give him will never thirst. Indeed, the water that I shall give him will become in him a well of water springing up into eternal life.”|bot enibadi we jringk di waata we mi gi'im naa go torsti agen. Yu si, di kain-a waata we mi a-go gi'im gweehn ton wan spring iina im, wan we no tap ron, an we kaaz im fi liv fi eva.”

The woman said to Him, “Sir, give me this water, so that I will not thirst, nor come here to draw.”|“Sar,” di uman se agen, “beg yu gi mi som a da waata de, so dat mi kyaahn get torsti agen, an so dat mi no afi kom baka da wel ya fi jraa no muo waata!”
Jesus said to her, “Go, call your husband, and come here.”|So Jiizas tel ar se, “Gwaan go kaal yu ozban an kom bak.”

The woman answered, “I have no husband.”Jesus said to her, “You are right in saying, ‘I have no husband,’|“Mi no av no ozban,” shi se tu im. So Jiizas se tu ar, “A chuu yu de taak wen yu se yu na'av no ozban.

for you have had five husbands, and he whom you now have is not your husband. So you have spoken truthfully.”|Kaa a uol a faiv a dem yu av aredi, an di man yu de wid nou a no fi yu ozban. Wa yu se a chuu.”
The woman said to Him, “Sir, I perceive that You are a prophet.|“Sar,” shi se tu Jiizas, “mi kyan si se yu a wan prafit.

Our fathers worshipped on this mountain, but you all say that in Jerusalem is the place where men ought to worship.”|Wi faada faada dem worship Gad pan da mountn ya, bot unu, unu Juu piipl taak bout ou a Jeruusilem piipl fi worship Gad.”

Jesus said to her, “Woman, believe Me, the hour is coming when neither on this mountain nor in Jerusalem will you worship the Father.|So, Jiizas se tu ar se, “Liedi, chos mi pan da wan ya: di taim a-go kom wen piipl naa go worship di Faada pan da mountn ya ar iina Jeruusilem.

You worship what you do not know; we know what we worship, for salvation is of the Jews.|Unu Samaritan piipl worship wa unu no nuo bout. Wi worship wa wi nuo bout, kaa a di Juu piipl dem Gad a-go yuuz fi siev di piipl dem iina di worl.

Yet the hour is coming, and is now here, when the true worshippers will worship the Father in spirit and truth. For the Father seeks such to worship Him.|Bot di die an taim de kom — an it de ya nou — wen di piipl dem we riili worship di Faada gweehn worship im ou di Spirit waahn dem fi worship an fram wie dong iina dem aat. Kaaz a dem de saat a piipl de di Faada a luk fa fi worship im.

God is Spirit, and those who worship Him must worship Him in spirit and truth.”|Kaa, yu si, Gad a spirit an dem we worship im mos worship im ou di Spirit waahn dem fi worship an dem mos dwi'it fram wie dong iina dem aat.”

The woman said to Him, “I know that Messiah is coming” (who is called Christ). “When He comes, He will tell us all things.”|Den di uman se tu im se, “Mi nuo se di Mesaiya, di wan we dem kaal di Krais, a kom. Wen im kom, im a-go tel wi ou evriting go.”
Jesus said to her, “I who speak to you am He.”|Jiizas se tu ar se, “A mi im — mi we de ya a taak tu yu.”

Then His disciples came. They marveled that He talked with a woman. Yet no one said, “What do You seek?” or, “Why are You talking with her?”|Siem taim nou, Jiizas falara dem kom bak an dem shak fi fain im a taak tu wan uman. Bot nobadi neva se tu ar, “A wa yu waahn?” an non a dem neva aks im se, “A wa mek yu a taak tu ar?”

The woman then left her water pot, went her way into the city, and said to the men|So di uman nou, shi lef di waata pan we shi kyari fi put waata iina, an shi ron go bak iina di toun. Wen shi riich de shi se tu di piipl dem,
“Come, see a Man who told me all things that I ever did. Could this be the Christ?” |“Unu kom, kom kom luk pan wan man we tel mi bout aal a di sitn dem mi eva du. Unu tingk se im kuda a di Krais?”
They went out of the city and came to Him.
column2: Den di piipl dem lef outa di toun an mek fi wich paat Jiizas did de.

column1: Meanwhile His disciples urged Him, saying, “Rabbi, eat.”|Sed taim dat did a gwaan, Jiizas falara dem did a beg im fi nyam sitn. Dem se tu im se, “Tiicha, nyam sitn no!”
But He said to them, “I have food to eat of which you do not know.”|Bot Jiizas tel dem se, “Mi av fuud fi nyam we unu no nuo notn bout.”
Therefore the disciples said one to another, “Has anyone brought Him anything to eat?”|So dem staat se tu dem wan aneda, “Nobadi neehn kyari notn kom gi'im fi nyam, no chuu?”

Jesus said to them, “My food is to do the will of Him who sent Me, and to finish His work.|“Fi mi fuud,” Jiizas se tu dem, “a fi du we di wan we sen mi kom ya waahn mi fi du, an fi finish op di wok im gi mi.

Do you not say, ‘There are yet four months, and then comes the harvest’? Listen! I say to you, lift up your eyes and look at the fields, for they are already white for harvest.|No unu se, ‘Plaant tide, gyada fuo mont afta’? Bot a de tel unu, uopm op unu yai an luk pan di faam lan dem! Di fuud dem fit an redi fi riip op!

He who reaps receives wages, and gathers fruit that leads to eternal life, that both he who sows and he who reaps may rejoice together.|Di sumadi we gyada op di fuud a get fi'im pie, an di fuud we im de gyada a piipl we gweehn liv fi eva. So nou, im we plaant an im we gyada, di tuu a dem gweehn glad tugeda.
For in this is the saying true, ‘One sows, and another reaps.’ |So a chuu sitn piipl a taak bout wen unu ier dem se, ‘Wan sumadi plaant siid, bot sumadi els gyada di fuud.’

I sent you to reap a crop for which you did not labor. And you have benefited from their labor.”|Mi sen unu out fi gyada op wa unu no wok aad fi plaant. Ada piipl du di aad wok, an unu onggl a go iin an a gyada op wa dem wok aad fi plaant.”

Many of the Samaritans of that city believed in Him because of the word of the woman who testified, “He told me all that I ever did.”|Nou, nof a di Samaritan piipl dem we did lef outa di toun did biliiv iina Jiizas. Dem biliiv iina im siek-a wa di uman did tel dem se. Shi se, “Im tel mi bout evriting we mi eva du.”

So when the Samaritans came to Him, they asked Him to remain with them. And He stayed there two days.|So, wen dem fain Jiizas, dem beg an beg im fi no lef bot fi tan de wid dem. So im tan de wid dem tuu muo die
And many more believed because of His word.|an uol iip muo a dem chos iina im, siek-a wa im se.

They said to the woman, “Now we believe, not because of what you said, for we have heard for ourselves and know that this Man is indeed the Christ, the Savior of the world.”|Dem se tu di uman se, “A no jos chuu yu tel wi bout im mek wi biliiv iina im. A kaa wi si an ier im fi wiself, an siek-a dat wi nuo se a riili da man ya a-go siev di worl, fi chuu.”
After the two days He departed from there and went to Galilee. |Afta di tuu die dem kom an gaan, Jiizas lef go a Gyalalii.
For Jesus Himself testified that a prophet has no honor in his own country.|(Nou, a Jiizas siem wan did se dat no prafit no get no rispek iina im uona konchri.)

Then, when He came to Galilee, the Galileans welcomed Him, having seen all the things He did at Jerusalem at the feast. For they had also gone to the feast.|So nou, wen im riich Gyalalii di piipl dem we liv de did tek im iin, kaa dem did go a Jeruusilem fi di Paasuova alidie an dem did si aal a wa im did du de.

So Jesus came again to Cana of Galilee where He had made the water wine. And there was a certain nobleman whose son was sick in Capernaum.|Iina Gyalalii, im go a di plies we dem kaal Kiena — di sed plies wich paat im did tek waata an ton it iina wain. Nou, yu did av wan man fram Kyaporniyom we du big wok fi di king, we did av wan bwai pikni we did sik bad.

When he heard that Jesus had come out of Judea into Galilee, he went to Him, pleading that He would come down and heal his son, for he was at the point of death.|Wen im ier se Jiizas kom bak fram Judiya an dat im did de a Gyalalii, im go luk fi im an beg im fi kom wid im a Kyaporniyom fi mek im bwai pikni, we did bout fi ded, beta.
Then Jesus said to him, “Unless you see signs and wonders, you will not believe.”|Bot Jiizas se tu im se, “Ef unu piipl no si som sain an aal saat a powaful mirikl, unu wuda neva biliiv iina mi.”
The nobleman said to Him, “Sir, come down before my child dies.”|Bot di man se tu im se, “Sar, beg yu kom wid mi go dong a Kyaporniyom bifuo mi bwai ded.”

Jesus said to him, “Go your way. Your son lives.”And the man believed the word that Jesus spoke to him, and he went his way.|Den Jiizas se tu im, “Yu kyan gwaan. Yu bwai pikni a-go liv.”Den di man biliiv we Jiizas tel im se, an set out fi go baka im yaad.
While he was going down, his servants met him and told him, “Your son lives!” |Pan im wie bak, im sorvant dem kom miit im an tel im se im bwai pikni did a-go liv.

When he inquired of them the hour when he began to heal, they answered, “Yesterday at the seventh hour the fever left him.”|So im aks dem wa taim im bwai did staat get beta. Dem se, “Di fiiva brok yeside, bout iina di wan aklak belz.”

Then the father knew that it was at the same hour in which Jesus said to him, “Your son lives.” So he and his whole household believed.|Wen dem se dat an di man chek it out, it kom tu im se a did di siem taim Jiizas did tel im se, “Yu bwai pikni a-go liv.” So di man an aal a di piipl dem we liv iina im ous staat fi biliiv iina Jiizas.
This was the second sign that Jesus did when He had come from Judea to Galilee.
column2: Da mirikl ya a did di sekan wan Jiizas wok afta im lef Judiya an go baka Gyalalii.

column1: After this there was a feast of the Jews, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem. |Som taim afta dat, Jiizas go baka Jeruusilem fi wan neda Juu alidie.

Now in Jerusalem by the Sheep Gate there is a pool, which in Hebrew is called Bethesda, having five porches. |Nou, iina Jeruusilem, yu did av wan puul saida di giet we di shiip dem we go iina di siti waak chuu. Dem kaal di puul Betzata iina di Iibruu langwij, an it did av faiv kova uova waak wie bil neks tu it.

In these lay a great crowd of invalids, blind, lame, and paralyzed, waiting for the moving of the water. |Uol iip a sik piipl did a lai dong iina di waak wie dem — blain piipl, piipl we kudn waak an piipl we kudn muuv at aal.

For an angel went down at a certain time into the pool and stirred up the water. After the stirring of the water, whoever stepped in first was healed of whatever disease he had. |Afta a wail wahn ienjel go dong ina di pool an storop di waata. Afta dem storop di waata, enibadi we go een fos get eel, nomata wa kyna dizeez dem did av.
A certain man was there who had an illness for thirty-eight years. |Nou, yu did av wan sik man we did de de fi toti iet ier.

When Jesus saw him lying there, and knew that he had been in that condition now a long time, He said to him, “Do you want to be healed?”|Wen Jiizas si im a lai dong de, an si se im did de de sik fi ou lang, im aks im se, “Yu waahn get beta?”

The sick man answered Him, “Sir, I have no one to put me into the pool when the water is stirred. But while I am coming, another steps down before me.”|“Sar,” di man se tu im, “mi no av a suol fi elp put mi iina di puul wen taim di waata staat fi muuv op an dong. Evritaim mi chrai go iin de, sumadi fos mi.”
Jesus said to him, “Rise, take up your bed and walk.” |Jiizas se tu im se, “Git op! Tek op yu mat an waak!”
Immediately the man was healed, took up his bed, and walked. That day was the Sabbath.|Siem taim Jiizas se so, di man get beta, an tek op im mat an staat waak. Nou, dis ya apm pan di Sabat.

The Jews therefore said to him who was cured, “It is the Sabbath day. It is not lawful for you to carry your bed.”|So di Juu liida dem se tu di man we Jiizas mek get beta, “Tide a di Sabat, yu nuo, an di Laa no lou yu fi kyari yu mat pan da die ya.”
He answered them, “He who healed me said to me, ‘Take up your bed and walk.’ ”|Bot di man se tu dem se, “Di man we mek mi get beta tel mi se, ‘Tek op yu mat an waak.’ ”
So they asked him, “Who is the Man who said to you, ‘Take up your bed and walk’?”|So dem aks im se, “A wich man tel yu fi, tek op mat an waak?”

Now the man who was healed did not know who it was, for Jesus had withdrawn, as there was a crowd in that place.|Bot di man neehn nuo a uu did mek im get beta kaaz Jiizas did slip we iina di kroud a piipl we did de a di plies.

Afterward Jesus found him in the temple, and said to him, “See, you have become whole. Sin no more lest something worse happens to you.” |Afta di liida dem kwestiyan di man, Jiizas fain im iina Gad ous an se tu im, “Si'it de, yu beta nou! Tap sin ar sitn wosa mait-a go apm tu yu.”
The man departed and told the Jews that it was Jesus who had healed him.|Wel, di man lef go we go tel di Juu liida dem se a Jiizas did mek im get beta.

So the Jews persecuted Jesus and sought to kill Him, because He had done these things on the Sabbath day. 17Jesus answered them, “My Father is working still, and I am working.” |An di Juu liida dem did staat fi mek laif aad fi Jiizas, kaaz im did a du dem sitn ya pan di Sabat.
Jesus answered them, “My Father is working still, and I am working.”|Bot Jiizas se tu dem se, “Fi mi Faada eva a wok, an mi a wok tu.”

So the Jews sought even more to kill Him, because He not only had broken the Sabbath, but also said that God was His Father, making Himself equal with God.|Chuu im go se so, dem chrai aada fi kil im, kaaz a neehn se im did onggl a brok di Sabat, bot pan tap a dat, im did a se Gad a im Faada, an da wie de, im did a put im an Gad pan di siem levl.

Then Jesus said to them, “Truly, truly I say to you, the Son can do nothing of Himself, but what He sees the Father do. For whatever He does, likewise the Son does. |So Jiizas tel dem se, “Mi de tel unu di chuut, di Bwai Pikni kyaahn du a ting pan im uon. Im onggl du wa im si'im Faada a du. Wat-eva di Faada du, di Bwai Pikni dwi'it tu.
For the Father loves the Son and shows Him all things that He Himself does. And He will show Him greater works than these so that you may marvel.
column2: Kaa di Faada lov di Bwai Pikni an di Faada shuo im evriting we im du. Im a-go shuo im iivn biga sitn dan dem ya — tingz we gweehn shak unu.

column1: For as the Father raises the dead and gives them life, even so the Son gives life to whom He will.|Kaa, siem wie laka ou di Faada mek ded piipl kom bak alaiv, a siem wie so di Bwai Pikni gi laif tu enibadi im waahn gi'it tu.
The Father judges no one, but has committed all judgment to the Son|Plos, di Faada no rait aaf nobadi. Nuo! Im gi uova aal a dat de tu im Bwai Pikni

that all men should honor the Son, just as they honor the Father. He who does not honor the Son does not honor the Father who sent Him.|so dat evribadi kyan rispek di Bwai Pikni iina di sed wie dem rispek di Faada. Enibadi we no rispek di Bwai Pikni no rispek di Faada we sen im.

“Truly, truly I say to you, whoever hears My word and believes in Him who sent Me has eternal life and shall not come into condemnation, but has passed from death into life.|“Mi de tel unu fi chuu chuu, enibadi we ier we mi se an chos iina di wan we sen mi, a-go liv fi eva. Dem naa go get sen fi ded. Nuo! Dem get muuv uova fram we paat dem wuda ded, an gaan uova tu we paat dem gweehn liv.

Truly, truly I say to you, the hour is coming, and is now here, when the dead will hear the voice of the Son of God, and those who hear will live. |“Mi a tel unu fi chuu chuu, di die an taim a kom — matarafak, it de ya aredi — wen ded piipl gweehn ier Gad Bwai Pikni vais an di wan dem we ier an du wa im se gweehn liv fi eva.
For as the Father has life in Himself, so He has given to the Son to have life in Himself|Kaa di Faada av di powa fi mek piipl liv, an im gi di Bwai Pikni di powa so dat im kyan mek piipl liv tu.
and has given Him authority to execute judgment also, because He is the Son of Man.|An pan tap a dat, di Faada gi di Bwai Pikni di powa fi joj piipl, kaaz a im a di Man we Gad Pik.
“Do not marvel at this. For the hour is coming in which all who are in the graves will hear His voice
column2: “No bada get fraitn bout wa mi de se. Kaa di taim a-go kom wen evribadi we ded an iina dem griev gweehn ier Gad Bwai Pikni vais

column1: and come out—those who have done good to the resurrection of life, and those who have done evil to the resurrection of judgment.|an kom bak alaiv — dem we du gud a-go kom bak fi liv fi eva, an dem we du wikidnis a-go get sen fi ded.

I can do nothing of Myself. As I hear, I judge. My judgment is just, because I seek not My own will, but the will of the Father who sent Me.|Mi kyaahn du a ting pan mi uon. Mi onggl joj piipl di wie mi Faada tel mi fi dwi'it, an mi dwi'it rait, kaa mi naa dwi'it fi mek miself api. Nuo! Mi dwi'it fi mek di wan we sen mi kom ya api.
“If I bear witness of Myself, My testimony is not true.|“Ef a onggl mi wan a tel piipl bout miself, den wa mi se no wot notn.

There is another who bears witness of Me, and I know that the testimony which He bears of Me is true.|Bot yu av sumadi els we a se tingz bout mi, an mi nuo se aal a wa im a taak se wot sopm — wa im se a chuu.
“You sent to John, and he bore witness of the truth.|Unu sen go aks Jan bout mi an im taak chuut.
I do not receive testimony from man, but I say these things that you may be saved.|A no se mi waahn piipl fi taak bout mi. Mi onggl a tel unu bout dis, so Gad kyan siev unu.
He was a burning and a shining lamp, and you were willing for a season to rejoice in his light.|Jan did komiin laka wan lamp we a bon an gi out lait, an unu did glad fi di lait fi likl bit.

“I have greater testimony than that of John. The works which the Father has given Me to finish, the very works that I do, bear witness of Me, that the Father has sent Me.|“Bot sitn els de de we shuo uu mi bi an it wot muo dan we Jan se bout mi. A di sopm dem we mi Faada gi mi fi du — di siem wan dem we mi a du nou — a dem shuo se a di Faada sen mi kom.

The Father Himself, who has sent Me, has borne witness of Me. You have neither heard His voice at any time, nor seen His form.|An di Faada se tingz bout mi tu. Unu neva ier im vais yet, an unu neva si'im fi nuo ou im luk non at aal.
You do not have His word abiding in you, for you do not believe the One He has sent. |An unu no tek iin wa im se bout mi iina unu aat, kaaz unu no chos iina di wan we im sen kom.

You search the Scriptures, because you think in them you have eternal life. These are they who bear witness of Me. |Unu stodi an stodi Gad wod aad, kaa unu tingk se a dat a-go mek unu nuo ou unu kyan liv fi eva. Bot di sed wod we unu a stodi, taak bout mi
Yet you are not willing to come to Me that you may have life.
column2: an unu stil naa kom tu mi so unu kyan get fi av riil laif.

column1: “I do not receive honor from men.
column2: “Mi naa luk fi get big op fram piipl.

column1: But I know you, that you do not have the love of God in you. |Bot mi nuo unu an ou unu tan. Unu na'av no lov fi Gad iina unu aat.

I have come in My Father’s name, but you do not receive Me. If another comes in his own name, you will receive him. |Mi kom kaa mi faada sen mi kom, an unu ton unu bak pan mi. Bot ef sumadi els we nobadi no sen eva kom tu unu, unu tek dem iin.

How can you believe, who receive glory from one another and do not seek the glory that comes from the only God?|Ou unu fi biliiv iina mi, wen unu lov fi get big op fram unu wan aneda? Ou unu fi biliiv iina mi, wen unu naa chrai fi mek di wan an onggl Gad big unu op?

“Do not think that I shall accuse you to the Father. There is one who accuses you—Moses, in whom you trust.|“Bot no tingk se mi gweehn paint fingga pan unu an se unu gilti wen taim unu tan op infronta mi Faada. Nuo! A Muoziz gweehn dwi'it. Di siem wan we unu tingk se wuda elp unu.
For if you believed Moses, you would believe Me, for he wrote of Me. |Ef unu did biliiv iina Muoziz, unu wuda biliiv iina mi, kaaz a mi im did rait bout.
But if you do not believe his writings, how will you believe My words?”|Bot sins unu no biliiv wa im rait se, den a ou unu gweehn biliiv wa mi de tel unu?”
After these things Jesus went across the Sea of Galilee, which is the Sea of Tiberias.|Afta dis, Jiizas lef go uova tu di ada saida Gyalalii Sii wid im falara dem. (Dem kaal it Taibiiriyos Sii tu.)
And a great crowd followed Him, because they saw His signs which He did for the sick. |Wan big kroud a piipl fala baka im, kaa dem si di powaful mirikl dem im did a wok an mek sik piipl get beta.
Then Jesus went up on a mountain, and He sat there with His disciples.|So, Jiizas go op pan wan il-said an sidong op de wid im falara dem.
Now the Passover, the feast of the Jews, was near.|(Nou, a did nieli taim fi di Juu dem Paasuova alidie.)

When Jesus looked up and saw a great crowd coming to Him, He said to Philip, “Where shall we buy bread that these may eat?”|Wen Jiizas luk roun an si di big kroud a piipl we did a kom tu im, im se tu Filip, “Wich paat wi kyan bai fuud fi gi dem piipl ya?”
He said this to test him, for He Himself knew what He would do.|(Jiizas did nuo we im did a-go du aredi, bot im se dat tu Filip kaa im did waahn fi fain out wa im wuda se.)

Philip answered Him, “Two hundred denarii worth of bread is not sufficient for each of them to receive but a little.”|Filip ansa im an se, “No iivn iet mont wot a pie wuda inof fi bai fuud fi mek non a dem piipl ya get iivn wan likl tups a fuud.”
One of His disciples, Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother, said to Him|Den wan a im ada falara dem, Anju, Saiman Piita breda, se tu im se

“There is a boy here who has five barley loaves and two small fish. But what are they among so many?”|“Si wan lili bwai ya wid faiv likl wiit bred an tuu likl fish, bot a ou dem a-go sorv fi so moch piipl?”

Jesus said, “Make the people sit down.” Now there was much grass in the place. So the men sat down, numbering about five thousand. |Jiizas se, “Mek di piipl dem sidong.” (Nou nof graas did de bout di plies.) Di piipl dem sidong an di nomba a di man dem ad op tu bout faiv touzn.

Jesus then took the loaves, and when He had given thanks, He distributed them to the disciples, and the disciples to those who were sitting down; and likewise, they distributed the fish, as much as they wanted.|So Jiizas tek di fuud, gi Gad tangks fi it an shier gi aal a di piipl dem. Dem get az moch az dem waahn. Afta dat, im tek di fish dem an du di siem ting.

When they were filled, He told His disciples, “Collect the fragments that remain, that nothing may be lost.”|Afta evribadi beli ful op, Jiizas se tu im falara dem se, “Tek op aal a wa lef uova, so dat notn no wies.”
So they collected them and filled twelve baskets with the fragments of the five barley loaves which were left over by those who had eaten.
column2: So dem tek op di lef-uova fuud an ful op twelv baaskit wid wa dem fain.

column1: When those men saw the sign which He had done, they then said, “This is truly the Prophet who is to come into the world.”|Wen di piipl dem si di powaful sitn we Jiizas du, dem staat se tu dem wan aneda, “A di Prafit we did fi kom iina di worl dis fi chuu!”

Therefore, knowing that they would come and take Him by force to make Him king, Jesus departed again to a mountain by Himself alone.|Nou, chuu Jiizas did nuo se dem did waahn fi fuos im fi ton dem king, im lef de-so an go bak op iina di il.
Now when evening came, His disciples went down to the sea.|Wen iivnin kom, Jiizas speshal falara dem go dong a di liek,

They got into a boat and went across the sea toward Capernaum. It was now dark, and Jesus had not come to them.|an dem go iina wan buot fi go a Kyaporniyom. (Bai da taim de, it did daak, an Jiizas neehn de wich paat dem did de yet.)
The sea was stirred up because a strong wind was blowing.|Wen dem did a kraas di liek, wan chrang chrang piis a briiz staat bluo an di waata staat get wel rof.

So when they had rowed about three or four miles, they saw Jesus walking on the sea and coming near the boat. And they were afraid. |Afta dem ruo an ruo fi bout chrii ar fuo mail, dem si Jiizas a waak pan di waata a kom a di buot. An dem kech dem fried!
But He said to them, “It is I. Do not be afraid.”|Bot im se tu dem, “A mi, man! No bada fried!”

Then they gladly received Him into the boat, and immediately the boat was at the land to which they were going.|Dem did glad fi tek im iina di buot an siem taim di buot riich di plies we paat dem did mek fi go.

The following day the people who stood on the other side of the sea saw that there was no other boat there, except the one which His disciples had entered, and that Jesus had not entered the boat with His disciples, but that His disciples had gone away alone. |Di neda die, di kroud a piipl we did uova di ada said a di liek si se a did onggl wan buot uova de an dat Jiizas neehn go iina it wid im falara dem, bot dem did go we lef im.

However, other boats came from Tiberias near the place where they ate bread when the Lord had given thanks. |Den nou, som buot komiin fram Taibiiriyos an sekl saida wich paat di piipl dem nyam di fuud afta di Laad did gi tangks fi it.

When the people therefore saw that neither Jesus nor His disciples were there, they also got into boats and came to Capernaum, looking for Jesus.|So, wen di piipl dem si se Jiizas an im falara dem neehn de de, dem go iina di buot dem an go a Kyaporniyom fi luk fi Jiizas.
When they found Him on the other side of the sea, they said to Him, “Rabbi, when did You come here?”|Wen dem fain im pan di ada said a di liek, dem se tu im se, “Tiicha, a wen yu riich uova ya-so?”
