Jesus answered them, “Truly, truly I say to you, you seek Me not because you saw signs, but because you ate of the loaves and were filled.|So, Jiizas ansa dem an se, “Mi a-go tel unu sitn we chuu chuu: unu naa luk fi mi chuu unu si di big an powaful mirikl dem we unu si mi du. Nuo! Unu de luk fi mi kaa unu get fuud fi nyam unu beli ful.

Do not work for the food which perishes, but for that food which endures to eternal life, which the Son of Man will give you. For God the Father has set His seal on Him.”|No wok fi fuud we kyan pwail an we naa go laas no taim. Wok fi di kain-a fuud we a-go mek unu liv fi eva, a dat de fuud di Man we Gad Pik gweehn gi unu. Faada Gad put im speshal maak pan im fi shuo se im av di rait fi du we im du.”
Then they asked Him, “What shall we do that we may work the works of God?”|So, dem aks im se, “Wa wi mos du, so wi kyan du wa Gad waahn wi fi du?”
Jesus answered them, “This is the work of God, that you believe in Him whom He has sent.”|Jiizas ansa dem an se, “A dis Gad waahn unu fi du: im waahn unu fi chos iina di wan we im sen kom.”

Therefore they said to Him, “What sign do You show then, that we may see and believe You? What work will You perform?|So, dem aks im se, “Wa kain-a powaful mirikl yu gweehn du fi wi so wi kyan si'it an biliiv iina yu? Wa yu a-go du?

Our fathers ate manna in the desert. As it is written, ‘He gave them bread from heaven to eat.’”|Wi faada faada dem did nyam mana iina di dezot. It rait dong iina Gad wod se, ‘Im gi dem fuud fram outa evn fi nyam.’”

Then Jesus said, “Truly, truly I say to you, Moses did not give you the bread from heaven, but My Father gives you the true bread from heaven. |So Jiizas se tu dem se, “Mi a tel unu fi chuu chuu: a no bred we kom fram outa evn Muoziz gi unu. Mi Faada a di wan we de gi unu di riil fuud fram outa evn.

For the bread of God is He who comes down from heaven and gives life to the world.”|Kaa, di sumadi we kom dong fram outa evn an we gi laif tu di piipl dem we de iina di worl a im a di fuud we Gad gi.”
Then they said to Him, “Lord, give us this bread always.”|“So, sar,” dem se tu im, “gi wi da fuud de an no tap gi wi it.”

Jesus said to them, “I am the bread of life. Whoever comes to Me shall never hunger, and whoever believes in Me shall never thirst. |Den Jiizas se tu dem se, “A mi a di bred we gi laif. Di sumadi we kom tu mi naa go onggri agen. Di sumadi we chos iina mi naa go torsti agen.
But I told you that you have seen Me, and yet do not believe.|Bot, laik mi tel unu aredi, unu si mi an stil unu no chos iina mi.
All whom the Father gives Me will come to Me, and he who comes to Me I will never cast out. |Evribadi we di Faada gi mi a-go kom tu mi, an mi naa go ron dem.
For I came down from heaven, not to do My own will, but the will of Him who sent Me. |Kaa mi kom dong fram outa evn fi du wa Gad waahn mi fi du, no fi du mi uona ting.

This is the will of the Father who has sent Me, that of all whom He has given Me, I should lose nothing, but should raise it up at the last day.|An a dis di wan we sen mi waahn: im waahn mi fi no mek non a di piipl dem we im gi mi laas; im waahn mi fi mek dem kom bak alaiv pan di laas die.

This is the will of Him who sent Me, that everyone who sees the Son and believes in Him may have eternal life, and I will raise him up on the last day.”|Kaa mi Faada waahn evribadi we si di Bwai Pikni fi uu im riili bi an we chos iina im fi liv fi eva, an a mi a-go mek dem kom bak alaiv pan di laas die.”
The Jews then murmured about Him, because He said, “I am the bread which came down from heaven.”|Di Juu piipl dem nou staat grombl chuu im se, “Mi a di fuud we kom fram outa evn.”

They said, “Is this not Jesus, the son of Joseph, whose father and mother we know? How is it then that He says, ‘I have come down from heaven’? ”|Dem se tu dem wan aneda se, “A no Jiizas, Juozif bwai pikni, dis ya? A no fi'im mada an faada wi nuo? So ou den im a taak bout se, ‘Mi kom dong fram outa evn’?”
Jesus therefore answered them, “Do not murmur among yourselves. |“Unu tap grombl grombl mongks unu wan aneda,” Jiizas ansa dem.

No one can come to Me unless the Father who has sent Me draws him. And I will raise him up on the last day. |Sumadi kyan onggl kom tu mi ef a di Faada jraa dem kom, an mi a mek dem kom bak alaiv pan di laas die.

It is written in the Prophets, ‘They shall all be taught by God.’Therefore everyone who has heard and has learned of the Father comes to Me.|Wan a di prafit dem rait iina Gad wod se, ‘Gad a-go tiich aal a dem.’ Evribadi we lisn tu di Faada an tek iin wa im se kom tu mi.

Not that anyone has seen the Father, except He who is from God. He has seen the Father. |A no se nobadi eva si di Faada yet. Nuo! Di onggl sumadi we eva si'im a di wan we Gad sen kom. A onggl im wan eva si di Faada.
Truly, truly I say to you, whoever believes in Me has eternal life. |Mi a tel unu fi chuu chuu: enibadi we chos iina mi gweehn liv fi eva.
I am the bread of life.
column2: Mi a di fuud we kaaz piipl fi liv.

column1: Your fathers ate manna in the wilderness, and they died.|Unu faada faada nyam mana iina di dezot, an dem stil ded.
This is the bread which comes down from heaven, that one may eat of it and not die. |Bot si di fuud ya we kom fram outa evn! Enibadi we nyam it naa go ded.

I am the living bread which came down from heaven. If anyone eats of this bread, he will live forever. The bread which I shall give for the life of the world is My flesh.”|Mi a di fuud we gi laif, an we kom dong fram outa evn. Ef enibadi nyam dis ya fuud ya, dem a-go liv fi eva. Mi uona badi a di fuud we mi gweehn gi so di piipl dem iina di worl kyan liv.”

The Jews therefore quarreled among themselves, saying, “How can this Man give us His flesh to eat?”|Den di Juu dem staat kos an galang mongks dem wan aneda siek-a wa im se. Ier dem, “A ou da man ya kyan a gi wi im badi fi nyam?”

Jesus said to them, “Truly, truly I say to you, unless you eat the flesh of the Son of Man and drink His blood, you have no life in you.|So Jiizas se tu dem se, “Mi a tel unu fi chuu chuu: ef unu no nyam di Man we Gad Pik badi an ef unu no jringk fi'im blod, unu naa go liv fi eva.

Whoever eats My flesh and drinks My blood has eternal life. And I will raise him up on the last day.|Enibadi we nyam fi mi badi an we jringk fi mi blod a-go liv fi eva, an mi a-go mek dem kom bak alaiv pan di laas die.
For My flesh is food indeed, and My blood is drink indeed. |Kaa fi mi badi a di riil fuud an fi mi blod a di riil jringks.
Whoever eats My flesh and drinks My blood remains in Me, and I in him.|Enibadi we nyam mi badi an we jringk mi blod kluos tu mi, an mi kluos tu dem.

As the living Father sent Me, and I live because of the Father, so whoever feeds on Me also will live because of Me. |Jos laik ou di Faada we gi laif sen mi an mek mi liv, a siem so mi a-go mek di sumadi we nyam mi liv.

This is the bread which came down from heaven, not as your fathers ate manna and died. He who eats this bread will live forever.” |A dis a di fuud we kom dong fram outa evn. It no komiin laka di fuud we unu faada faada dem did nyam an stil ded. Di sumadi we nyam da fuud ya a-go liv fi eva.”
He said these things in the synagogue, as He taught in Capernaum.|Nou, Jiizas se dem sitn ya wen im did a tiich a di Juu dem miitn ous iina Kyaporniyom.

When they heard this, many of His disciples said, “This is a hard saying. Who can listen to it?”|Afta nof a Jiizas falara dem ier aal a we im did av fi se, dem se, “It no iizi fi tek iin wa im a tiich se. A wan aad sitn im a tiich. Uu kyan andastan wa im a se?”

Knowing in Himself that His disciples murmured about it, Jesus said to them, “Does this offend you?|Bot chuu Jiizas did nuo se im falara dem did a se dem sitn de, im se tu dem se, “Wa apm, wa mi se a bada unu?
Then what if you see the Son of Man ascend to where He was before?
column2: Den a wa gweehn apm ef unu si di Man we Gad Pik go bak we im did de bifuo!

column1: It is the Spirit who gives life. The flesh profits nothing. The words that I speak to you are spirit and are life.|Di Spirit a wa gi piipl riil laif. Piipl no wot notn; dem kyaahn dwi'it. A di Spirit mek mi se wa mi de se tu unu, an we di Spirit se kaaz piipl fi av laif.

But there are some of you who do not believe.” For Jesus knew from the beginning who they were who did not believe, and who it was who would betray Him.|Bot, som a unu no biliiv.” (Jiizas se dem sitn ya, kaa fram di staat, im did nuo di wan dem we neehn chos iina im, plos di wan we did a-go ton im uova tu im enimi dem.)

Then He said, “For this reason I have said to you that no one can come to Me unless it were given him by My Father.”|So pan tap a dat im se, “A dat mek mi tel unu se nobadi kyaahn kom tu mi ef mi Faada no gi'im di chaans.”
From that time many of His disciples went back and walked no more with Him.|Fram da taim de, nof a im falara dem ton bak an tap fala im.So im se tu im twelv falara dem se,
So Jesus said to the twelve, “Do you also want to go away?”|“Unu no waahn lef tu?”
Simon Peter answered Him, “Lord, to whom shall we go? You have the words of eternal life.|Saiman Piita ansa im an se, “Laad, a uu els wi mos go tu? A yu av di mesij we kaaz piipl fi liv fi eva.
We have believed and have come to know that You are the Christ, the Son of the living God.”|Wi biliiv an nuo se yu a di Uoli Wan we Gad sen kom.”
Jesus answered them, “Have I not chosen you, the twelve, and yet one of you is a devil?”|Den Jiizas ansa bak an se, “No twelv a unu mi pik? An stil wan a unu a di devl uona self.”

He spoke of Judas Iscariot, the son of Simon. For it was he who would betray Him, being one of the twelve.|(Nou, im did a taak bout Juudas, Saiman Iskyariyat bwai pikni, uu im nuo se did a-go ton im uova tu im enimi dem.)

After these things Jesus walked in Galilee. He would not walk in Judea, because the Jews were seeking to kill Him.|Afta dat, Jiizas go aal bout iina Gyalalii. Im tan we fram Judiya, kaa di Juu liida dem did a luk wan wie fi kil im.
Now the Jews’ Feast of Tabernacles was at hand. |Nou, a did nieli taim fi di Juu piipl dem Ot Alidie.

His brothers therefore said to Him, “Depart from here and go into Judea, that Your disciples also may see the works that You do.|Jiizas breda dem se tu im, “Muuv out fram ya-so no, an go a Judiya so yu falara dem kyan si di big an powaful sitn dem we yu kyan du.

For no one does anything in secret, while he himself seeks to be known openly. If You do these things, reveal Yourself to the world.”|Kaa, sumadi we waahn piipl fi nuo bout dem no du we dem a du anda di kwaiyat. So sins yu a du dem sitn ya, shuo aaf yuself tu di worl, mek evribadi si yu an nuo we yu a du.”
For even His brothers did not believe in Him.
column2: (Kaa no iivn im uona breda dem did biliiv iina im.)

column1: Therefore Jesus told them, “My time has not yet come, but your time is always fitting. |Bot Jiizas se tu dem se, “Fi unu, enitaim a di rait taim, bot fi mi taim no kom yet.

The world cannot hate you. But it hates Me, because I testify concerning it, that its works are evil.|Di piipl dem iina di worl kyaahn iet unu, bot dem iet mi kaa mi tel dem se wa dem du wikid an bad.
You go up to this feast. I am not going up to this feast yet, because My time has not yet fully come.”|Unu gwaan op de go tek paat iina di Ot Alidie. Mi naa go, kaa di rait taim fi mi go no kom yet.”
Having said these things to them, He remained in Galilee.|So, afta im tel dem dat, im tan wich paat im did de iina Gyalalii.

However, after His brothers had gone up to the feast, then He also went up, not publicly, but secretly. |Afta im breda dem lef fi go tek paat iina di Ot Alidie a Judiya, Jiizas go op de tu, bot im go anda di kwaiyat, so nobadi kuda si im.
Then the Jews looked for Him at the feast, and said, “Where is He?”|Nou, di Juu liida dem we did de de did a luk out fi im an did a aks, “A wich paat im de?”

There was much complaining among the people concerning Him. For some said, “He is a good Man.”Others said, “No, He deceives the people.” |Wan uol iip a piipl did a wispa wispa wa dem tingk bout Jiizas mongks demself. Som did a se, “Im a wan gud man.” An yu did av som we se, “Nuo, sa! A fuul im a fuul op di piipl dem.”

Yet no one spoke openly of Him for fear of the Jews.|Bot iina aal we did a gwaan evribadi kiba dem mout, no iivn a suol wuda se notn fi mek tu moch piipl ier wa dem tingk, kaa dem did fried a wa di Juu liida dem wuda du dem.
Now about the middle of the feast Jesus went up into the temple and began teaching.
column2: A no til aaf wie chuu di Ot Alidie dat Jiizas go op we paat Gad ous de an staat tiich.

column1: The Jews marveled, saying, “How has this Man become educated, having never been taught?|Di Juu liida dem shak wen dem si ou im tiich, so dem aks, “A ou da man ya nuo so moch an im neehn go a skuul?”
Jesus answered them, “My teaching is not Mine, but His who sent Me.|So Jiizas ansa dem an se, “A no mi mek op we mi tiich. A di wan we sen mi kom gi mi it fi tiich.

If any man desires to do His will, he shall know whether the teaching is from God or whether I speak on My own authority.|Ef sumadi mek op dem main fi du wa Gad waahn dem fi du, dem a-go fain out ef a riili Gad gi mi wa fi tiich ar ef a mi jos a taak fi miself.

He who speaks on his own authority seeks his own glory. But He who seeks the glory of Him who sent Him is true, and no unrighteousness is in Him.|Sumadi we taak fi imself a luk big op fram piipl, bot sumadi we wok so dat di wan we sen im get big op, a gud sumadi an wa im taak a chuu sitn. Dem no lai.
Did Moses not give you the law, and yet none of you keeps the law? Why do you seek to kill Me?”|No chuu se a Muoziz gi unu di Laa? Bot non a unu no kip it. So wa mek unu a chrai fi kil mi?”
The people answered and said, “You have a demon. Who is seeking to kill You?”|Di kroud a piipl dem den se tu im se, “Yu av diiman iina yu! A uu a chrai kil yu?”
Jesus answered them, “I did one work, and you all marvel.|So Jiizas se tu dem se, “Mi du onggl wan mirikl an di uol a unu shak.

Yet, because Moses gave you circumcision, you circumcise a man on the Sabbath day (although it did not come from Moses, but from the Patriarchs). |Bot, unu sorkomsaiz unu bwai pikni dem pan di Sabat kaa Muoziz se unu fi dwi'it — duo a no Muoziz staat it op, a unu faada faada dem.

If a man receives circumcision on the Sabbath day, so that the Law of Moses should not be broken, are you angry at Me because I completely healed a man on the Sabbath day? |So ef wan pikni kyan get sorkomsaiz pan di Sabat fi mek shuor se Muoziz Laa no get brok, wa mek unu beks wid mi, kaa mi mek sumadi get beta pan di Sabat.
Do not judge according to appearance, but practice righteous judgment.”|Tap joj sitn siek-a ou it luk pan di outsaid, an staat joj dem fi ou dem riili tan.”
Then some of them from Jerusalem said, “Is this not He whom they seek to kill?|Nou da taim de som a di piipl we liv a Jeruusilem staat aks, “A no di man dis we dem a chrai fi kil?

Look! He speaks publicly, and they say nothing to Him. Do the rulers indeed know that this is really the Christ?|Bot ku ya! Si'im ya a taak so evribadi kyan ier im, an evribadi a kiba dem mout, dem naa se notn tu im. Yu tingk se di ruula dem riili biliiv se im a di Krais fi chuu?
But we know where this Man is from. When the Christ comes, no one will know where He is from.”|Bot wi nuo wich paat im kom fram. Wen di Krais kom, nobadi naa go nuo wich paat im kom fram.”

Then Jesus, still teaching in the temple, cried out, “You know Me and you likewise know where I am from. I have not come on My own authority, but He who sent Me is true, whom you do not know.|Da taim de, Jiizas did stil a tiich iina di yaad we Gad ous de. Im ier we di piipl dem did a se, so im baal out loud loud pan tap a im vais an se, “Unu nuo mi an unu nuo we paat mi kom fram! Mi no sen miself kom ya, bot unu kyan chos di wan we sen mi kom. Unu no nuo im
But I know Him, for I am from Him, and He sent Me.”|bot mi nuo im, kaa mi kom fram im an a im sen mi kom ya.”
So they tried to seize Him, but no one laid hands on Him, because His hour had not yet come.|Wen dem ier dis ya dem chrai fi grab im, bot nobadi no toch im, kaaz a neehn fi im taim fi dem kil im yet.

Still, many of the people believed in Him and said, “When the Christ comes, will He do more signs than these which this Man has done?”|Stil, nof piipl iina di kroud biliiv iina im. Ier wa dem se, “Wen di Krais kom, yu tingk im a-go wok nof muo mirikl dan wa da man ya a du?”
The Pharisees heard the people murmuring these things concerning Him. So the Pharisees and the chief priests sent officers to arrest Him.
column2: Di Farisii dem ier di kroud a piipl a wispa dem sitn ya bout Jiizas. So di ed priis dem an di Farisii dem sen dem we gyaad Gad ous fi lak im op.

column1: Then Jesus said to them, “I shall be with you a little while longer, and then I go to Him who sent Me.|So Jiizas se, “A onggl likl bit muo taim mi gweehn de ya wid unu, an afta dat mi a-go bak tu di wan we sen mi kom ya.
You will look for Me and you will not find Me. And where I am, you cannot come.”|Unu gweehn luk fi mi, bot unu naa go fain mi. An unu kyaahn go kom wich paat mi a-go de.”

The Jews said among themselves, “Where does He intend to go that we shall not find Him? Does He intend to go to the Dispersion among the Greeks and teach the Greeks? |Di Juu liida dem den se tu dem wan aneda se, “A we da man ya plan fi go so, dat wi naa go kyan fain im? A go im a-go go tu di Juu piipl dem we skyata skyata mongks di Griik piipl dem, so dat im kyan tiich di Griik piipl dem?

What kind of saying is this which He said, ‘You will look for Me and you will not find Me. And where I am, you cannot come’? ”|A wa im miin wen im se, ‘Unu gweehn luk fi mi, bot unu naa go kyan fain mi. An unu kyaahn go kom wich paat mi a-go de’?”

On the last and greatest day of the feast, Jesus stood and cried out, “If anyone is thirsty, let him come to Me and drink.|Pan di laas an bigis die a di Ot Alidie, Jiizas get op an baal out pan tap a im vais, “Ef nobadi torsti, mek dem kom tu mi fi sitn fi jringk.

He who believes in Me, as the Scripture has said, out of his heart shall flow rivers of living water.” |Wa Gad wod se gweehn apm tu di piipl we biliiv iina mi. It se, ‘Som riva wid waata we gi laif a-go ron outa dem.’ ”

By this He spoke of the Spirit, whom those who believe in Him would receive. For the Holy Spirit was not yet given, because Jesus was not yet glorified.|(Nou, wen im se dat de, im did a taak bout di Spirit we di piipl dem we chos iina im wuda get lietaraan. Kaa op tu da taim de, nobadi neva get di Spirit, kaa Jiizas neehn get big op yet.)
Therefore when they heard these words, many of the people said, “Truly, this is the Prophet.”|Wen som a di piipl dem iina di kroud ier we Jiizas se, dem se, “Fi riil, da man ya a di Prafit.”

Others said, “This is the Christ.”But some said, “Will the Christ come out of Galilee? |Som ada wan se, “A di Krais dis ya.”Bot yu did stil av som we did a aks, “Nuo sa, kaa di Krais no kom fram Gyalalii, no chuu?

Has the Scripture not said that the Christ comes from the seed of David, out of the town of Bethlehem where David was?”|Gad wod no se dat di Krais gweehn kom fram Dievid fambili an fram outa Betliyem, di toun we Dievid did liv?”
So there was a division among the people because of Him.
column2: So di piipl dem did plit op uova wa dem tingk bout Jiizas.

column1: Some of them wanted to arrest Him, but no one laid hands on Him.|Som a dem did waahn fi uol im fi lak im op, bot nobadi neehn put dem an pan im.

Then the officers came to the chief priests and Pharisees, who said to them, “Why did you not bring Him?”|Wen dem we gyaad Gad ous go bak tu di ed priis dem an di Farisii dem, di ed priis dem an di Farisii dem aks dem se, “Wa mek unu no kyari im kom?”
The officers answered, “No man has ever spoken like this Man.”|Di gyaad dem se, “Nobadi neva eva taak laik ou da man ya taak.”
Then the Pharisees answered them, “Are you also deceived?|So, di Farisii dem se, “Yu miin se a chrik im chrik unu tu?
Have any of the rulers or the Pharisees believed in Him?|Non a di Juu ruula ar Farisii dem biliiv iina im, iihn?
Not at all. This crowd who does not know the law is accursed.”
column2: Nuo! Bot da fu-fuul kroud a piipl ya we no nuo notn bout di Laa — bad blesn de pan dem.”

column1: Nicodemus, being one of them who came to Jesus by night, said to them|Den Nikodiimos, di wan we did go a Jiizas bifuo da taim ya an we did iina dem gruup aks dem se
“Does our law judge a man before it hears him and knows what he is doing?”
column2: “Wi Laa lou wi fi joj nobadi an se dat dem gilti bifuo wi ier fram dem fos fi fain out wa dem a du?”

column1: They answered him, “Are you also from Galilee? Search and see that no prophet arises out of Galilee.”|Bot dem se tu im se, “Yu no kom fram Gyalalii tu? Go chuu Gad wod an si fi yuself — no prafit neva eva kom outa Gyalalii yet!”
Then everyone went to his own house.|Afta dat, aal a dem go a dem yaad.

After these things Jesus walked in Galilee. He would not walk in Judea, because the Jews were seeking to kill Him. |Afta dat, Jiizas go aal bout iina Gyalalii. Im tan we fram Judiya, kaa di Juu liida dem did a luk wan wie fi kil im.
Now the Jews’ Feast of Tabernacles was at hand.|Nou, a did nieli taim fi di Juu piipl dem Ot Alidie.

His brothers therefore said to Him, “Depart from here and go into Judea, that Your disciples also may see the works that You do. |Jiizas breda dem se tu im, “Muuv out fram ya-so no, an go a Judiya so yu falara dem kyan si di big an powaful sitn dem we yu kyan du.

For no one does anything in secret, while he himself seeks to be known openly. If You do these things, reveal Yourself to the world.”|Kaa, sumadi we waahn piipl fi nuo bout dem no du we dem a du anda di kwaiyat. So sins yu a du dem sitn ya, shuo aaf yuself tu di worl, mek evribadi si yu an nuo we yu a du.”
For even His brothers did not believe in Him.
column2: (Kaa no iivn im uona breda dem did biliiv iina im.)

column1: Therefore Jesus told them, “My time has not yet come, but your time is always fitting.|Bot Jiizas se tu dem se, “Fi unu, enitaim a di rait taim, bot fi mi taim no kom yet.

The world cannot hate you. But it hates Me, because I testify concerning it, that its works are evil. |Di piipl dem iina di worl kyaahn iet unu, bot dem iet mi kaa mi tel dem se wa dem du wikid an bad.

You go up to this feast. I am not going up to this feast yet, because My time has not yet fully come.” |Unu gwaan op de go tek paat iina di Ot Alidie. Mi naa go, kaa di rait taim fi mi go no kom yet.”
Having said these things to them, He remained in Galilee.|So, afta im tel dem dat, im tan wich paat im did de iina Gyalalii.

However, after His brothers had gone up to the feast, then He also went up, not publicly, but secretly.|Afta im breda dem lef fi go tek paat iina di Ot Alidie a Judiya, Jiizas go op de tu, bot im go anda di kwaiyat, so nobadi kuda si im.
Then the Jews looked for Him at the feast, and said, “Where is He?”|Nou, di Juu liida dem we did de de did a luk out fi im an did a aks, “A wich paat im de?”

There was much complaining among the people concerning Him. For some said, “He is a good Man.”Others said, “No, He deceives the people.” |Wan uol iip a piipl did a wispa wispa wa dem tingk bout Jiizas mongks demself. Som did a se, “Im a wan gud man.” An yu did av som we se, “Nuo, sa! A fuul im a fuul op di piipl dem.”

Yet no one spoke openly of Him for fear of the Jews.|Bot iina aal we did a gwaan evribadi kiba dem mout, no iivn a suol wuda se notn fi mek tu moch piipl ier wa dem tingk, kaa dem did fried a wa di Juu liida dem wuda du dem.
Now about the middle of the feast Jesus went up into the temple and began teaching.
column2: A no til aaf wie chuu di Ot Alidie dat Jiizas go op we paat Gad ous de an staat tiich.

column1: The Jews marveled, saying, “How has this Man become educated, having never been taught?”|Di Juu liida dem shak wen dem si ou im tiich, so dem aks, “A ou da man ya nuo so moch an im neehn go a skuul?”
Jesus answered them, “My teaching is not Mine, but His who sent Me.|So Jiizas ansa dem an se, “A no mi mek op we mi tiich. A di wan we sen mi kom gi mi it fi tiich.

If any man desires to do His will, he shall know whether the teaching is from God or whether I speak on My own authority. |Ef sumadi mek op dem main fi du wa Gad waahn dem fi du, dem a-go fain out ef a riili Gad gi mi wa fi tiich ar ef a mi jos a taak fi miself.

He who speaks on his own authority seeks his own glory. But He who seeks the glory of Him who sent Him is true, and no unrighteousness is in Him.|Sumadi we taak fi imself a luk big op fram piipl, bot sumadi we wok so dat di wan we sen im get big op, a gud sumadi an wa im taak a chuu sitn. Dem no lai.
Did Moses not give you the law, and yet none of you keeps the law? Why do you seek to kill Me?”|No chuu se a Muoziz gi unu di Laa? Bot non a unu no kip it. So wa mek unu a chrai fi kil mi?”
The people answered and said, “You have a demon. Who is seeking to kill You?”|Di kroud a piipl dem den se tu im se, “Yu av diiman iina yu! A uu a chrai kil yu?”
Jesus answered them, “I did one work, and you all marvel. |So Jiizas se tu dem se, “Mi du onggl wan mirikl an di uol a unu shak.

Yet, because Moses gave you circumcision, you circumcise a man on the Sabbath day (although it did not come from Moses, but from the Patriarchs).|Bot, unu sorkomsaiz unu bwai pikni dem pan di Sabat kaa Muoziz se unu fi dwi'it — duo a no Muoziz staat it op, a unu faada faada dem.

If a man receives circumcision on the Sabbath day, so that the Law of Moses should not be broken, are you angry at Me because I completely healed a man on the Sabbath day? |So ef wan pikni kyan get sorkomsaiz pan di Sabat fi mek shuor se Muoziz Laa no get brok, wa mek unu beks wid mi, kaa mi mek sumadi get beta pan di Sabat.
Do not judge according to appearance, but practice righteous judgment.”|Tap joj sitn siek-a ou it luk pan di outsaid, an staat joj dem fi ou dem riili tan.”
Then some of them from Jerusalem said, “Is this not He whom they seek to kill?|Nou da taim de som a di piipl we liv a Jeruusilem staat aks, “A no di man dis we dem a chrai fi kil?

Look! He speaks publicly, and they say nothing to Him. Do the rulers indeed know that this is really the Christ? |Bot ku ya! Si'im ya a taak so evribadi kyan ier im, an evribadi a kiba dem mout, dem naa se notn tu im. Yu tingk se di ruula dem riili biliiv se im a di Krais fi chuu?
But we know where this Man is from. When the Christ comes, no one will know where He is from.”|Bot wi nuo wich paat im kom fram. Wen di Krais kom, nobadi naa go nuo wich paat im kom fram.”

Then Jesus, still teaching in the temple, cried out, “You know Me and you likewise know where I am from. I have not come on My own authority, but He who sent Me is true, whom you do not know.|Da taim de, Jiizas did stil a tiich iina di yaad we Gad ous de. Im ier we di piipl dem did a se, so im baal out loud loud pan tap a im vais an se, “Unu nuo mi an unu nuo we paat mi kom fram! Mi no sen miself kom ya, bot unu kyan chos di wan we sen mi kom. Unu no nuo im
But I know Him, for I am from Him, and He sent Me.”|bot mi nuo im, kaa mi kom fram im an a im sen mi kom ya.”

So they tried to seize Him, but no one laid hands on Him, because His hour had not yet come. |Wen dem ier dis ya dem chrai fi grab im, bot nobadi no toch im, kaaz a neehn fi im taim fi dem kil im yet.

Still, many of the people believed in Him and said, “When the Christ comes, will He do more signs than these which this Man has done?”|Stil, nof piipl iina di kroud biliiv iina im. Ier wa dem se, “Wen di Krais kom, yu tingk im a-go wok nof muo mirikl dan wa da man ya a du?”
The Pharisees heard the people murmuring these things concerning Him. So the Pharisees and the chief priests sent officers to arrest Him.

column1: Then Jesus said to them, “I shall be with you a little while longer, and then I go to Him who sent Me.|So Jiizas se, “A onggl likl bit muo taim mi gweehn de ya wid unu, an afta dat mi a-go bak tu di wan we sen mi kom ya.
You will look for Me and you will not find Me. And where I am, you cannot come.”|Unu gweehn luk fi mi, bot unu naa go fain mi. An unu kyaahn go kom wich paat mi a-go de.”

The Jews said among themselves, “Where does He intend to go that we shall not find Him? Does He intend to go to the Dispersion among the Greeks and teach the Greeks? |Di Juu liida dem den se tu dem wan aneda se, “A we da man ya plan fi go so, dat wi naa go kyan fain im? A go im a-go go tu di Juu piipl dem we skyata skyata mongks di Griik piipl dem, so dat im kyan tiich di Griik piipl dem?

What kind of saying is this which He said, ‘You will look for Me and you will not find Me. And where I am, you cannot come’? ”|A wa im miin wen im se, ‘Unu gweehn luk fi mi, bot unu naa go kyan fain mi. An unu kyaahn go kom wich paat mi a-go de’?”

On the last and greatest day of the feast, Jesus stood and cried out, “If anyone is thirsty, let him come to Me and drink.|Pan di laas an bigis die a di Ot Alidie, Jiizas get op an baal out pan tap a im vais, “Ef nobadi torsti, mek dem kom tu mi fi sitn fi jringk.

He who believes in Me, as the Scripture has said, out of his heart shall flow rivers of living water.” |Wa Gad wod se gweehn apm tu di piipl we biliiv iina mi. It se, ‘Som riva wid waata we gi laif a-go ron outa dem.’ ”

By this He spoke of the Spirit, whom those who believe in Him would receive. For the Holy Spirit was not yet given, because Jesus was not yet glorified.|(Nou, wen im se dat de, im did a taak bout di Spirit we di piipl dem we chos iina im wuda get lietaraan. Kaa op tu da taim de, nobadi neva get di Spirit, kaa Jiizas neehn get big op yet.)
Therefore when they heard these words, many of the people said, “Truly, this is the Prophet.”|Wen som a di piipl dem iina di kroud ier we Jiizas se, dem se, “Fi riil, da man ya a di Prafit.”

Others said, “This is the Christ.”But some said, “Will the Christ come out of Galilee? |Som ada wan se, “A di Krais dis ya.”Bot yu did stil av som we did a aks, “Nuo sa, kaa di Krais no kom fram Gyalalii, no chuu?

Has the Scripture not said that the Christ comes from the seed of David, out of the town of Bethlehem where David was?” |Gad wod no se dat di Krais gweehn kom fram Dievid fambili an fram outa Betliyem, di toun we Dievid did liv?”
So there was a division among the people because of Him.
column2: So di piipl dem did plit op uova wa dem tingk bout Jiizas.

column1: Some of them wanted to arrest Him, but no one laid hands on Him.|Som a dem did waahn fi uol im fi lak im op, bot nobadi neehn put dem an pan im.

Then the officers came to the chief priests and Pharisees, who said to them, “Why did you not bring Him?”|Wen dem we gyaad Gad ous go bak tu di ed priis dem an di Farisii dem, di ed priis dem an di Farisii dem aks dem se, “Wa mek unu no kyari im kom?”
The officers answered, “No man has ever spoken like this Man.”|Di gyaad dem se, “Nobadi neva eva taak laik ou da man ya taak.”
Then the Pharisees answered them, “Are you also deceived? |So, di Farisii dem se, “Yu miin se a chrik im chrik unu tu?
Have any of the rulers or the Pharisees believed in Him?|Non a di Juu ruula ar Farisii dem biliiv iina im, iihn?
Not at all. This crowd who does not know the law is accursed.”
column2: Nuo! Bot da fu-fuul kroud a piipl ya we no nuo notn bout di Laa — bad blesn de pan dem.”

column1: Nicodemus, being one of them who came to Jesus by night, said to them|Den Nikodiimos, di wan we did go a Jiizas bifuo da taim ya an we did iina dem gruup aks dem se
“Does our law judge a man before it hears him and knows what he is doing?”
column2: “Wi Laa lou wi fi joj nobadi an se dat dem gilti bifuo wi ier fram dem fos fi fain out wa dem a du?”

column1: They answered him, “Are you also from Galilee? Search and see that no prophet arises out of Galilee.”|Bot dem se tu im se, “Yu no kom fram Gyalalii tu? Go chuu Gad wod an si fi yuself — no prafit neva eva kom outa Gyalalii yet!”
Then everyone went to his own house.|Afta dat, aal a dem go a dem yaad.
But Jesus went to the Mount of Olives.
column2: Bot Jiizas neehn go a fi im yaad. Im go op a Mount Aliv.

column1: Early in the morning He returned to the temple. All the people came to Him, and He sat down and taught them.|Orli di neda maanin, im go baka di yaad we Gad ous de. Wen im riich de, uol iip a piipl bongl roun im, an im sidong an staat tiich dem.
The scribes and Pharisees brought a woman caught in adultery. When they had put her in the middle
column2: Nou di Laa tiicha dem an di Farisii dem kyari iin wan uman we dem kech a sliip wid wan man we a no ar ozban. An dem mek ar tan op infronta di kroud a piipl.

column1: they said to Him, “Teacher, this woman was caught in the very act of adultery. |Ier dem tu Jiizas, “Tiicha, da uman ya get kech a sliip wid man we a no ar ozban.
Now Moses in the law commanded us to stone such, but what do You say?”|Iina di Laa, Muoziz tel wi se wi fi stuon uman laka dis ya. So, we yu se nou?”

They said this, testing Him, that they might have something of which to accuse Him.But Jesus stooped down and wrote on the ground with His finger, as though He did not hear them.|(Dem aks im dat de kaa dem did waahn fi chrik im, so dat dem kuda av sitn fi lak im op fa.)Jiizas ben dong an staat rait iina di grong wid im fingga.

So when they continued asking Him, He stood up and said to them, “Let him who is without sin among you be the first to throw a stone at her.”|Bot wen dem kip aan a push an a push im fi ansa dem, im tan op chriet an se tu dem se, “Eni wan a unu we neva sin yet, fling di fos stuon aafa ar!”
Again He stooped down and wrote on the ground.
column2: Den im ben dong wan neks taim an staat rait iina di grong.

column1: Being convicted by their conscience, those who heard it went out one by one, beginning with the eldest even to the last. Jesus was left alone, and the woman standing in the midst. |Wen dem ier we Jiizas se, dem lef go we wan afta di ada. Di uolis wan dem go we fos, an dem gwaan lef til a Jiizas wan did tan op de wid di uman.

When Jesus had stood up and saw no one but the woman, He said to her, “Woman, where are your accusers? Did no one condemn you?”|Jiizas get op an se tu ar se, “Liedi, we dem de? Nobadi neva se yu fi ded siek-a wa yu du?”

She said, “No one, Lord.”Jesus said to her, “Neither do I condemn you. Go and sin no more.”|“No iivn a suol, sar,” shi se.“Den mi naa go se yu fi ded siek-a we yu du niida,” Jiizas se tu ar. “Gwaan nou, an no sin no muor.”

Again, Jesus spoke to them, saying, “I am the light of the world. Whoever follows Me shall not walk in the darkness, but shall have the light of life.”|Jiizas staat taak tu di piipl dem agen an se, “Mi a di wan we lait op di worl. Enibadi we fala mi naa go waak iina di daak, bot dem a-go av di lait we gi piipl laif.”

The Pharisees therefore said to Him, “You bear witness of Yourself. Your testimony is not true.”|Di Farisii dem se tu im se, “Si, yu a taak bout yuself an nobadi no de bout fi bak wa yu a se. So we yu a se kyan neva chuu.”

Jesus answered them, “Though I bear witness of Myself, My testimony is true. For I know where I came from and where I am going. But you do not know where I came from or where I am going.|So Jiizas se tu dem se, “Aal ef mi did a taak bout miself, we mi a se chuu, kaa mi nuo we mi kom fram an mi nuo we paat mi a go. Bot unu no nuo we mi kom fram, an unu no nuo we paat mi a go.
You judge according to the flesh. I judge no one.
column2: Unu joj bies pan we unu kyan si. Mi no dwi'it di wie unu dwi'it.

column1: Yet if I do judge, My judgment is true. For I am not alone, but I am with the Father who sent Me. |Bot ef mi did fi joj nobadi, ou mi joj dem wuda rait, kaaz a no mi wan a dwi'it. Mi dwi'it wid mi Faada, di wan we sen mi kom ya.
Even in your law it is written that the testimony of two men is true. |It rait dong iina fu'unu uona Laa se dat ef tuu sumadi se di siem ting bout sitn, den we dem se a chuu.
I am One who bears witness of Myself, and the Father that sent Me bears witness of Me.”|Mi a di wan we taak bout miself, an mi faada we sen mi taak bout mi tu.”

Then they said to Him, “Where is Your Father?”Jesus answered, “You know neither Me nor My Father. If you knew Me, you would know My Father also.” |“So den, we paat yu Faada de?” di Farisii dem aks im.“Unu no nuo mi ar mi Faada,” Jiizas se tu dem. “Ef unu did nuo mi, unu wuda nuo mi Faada tu.”

Jesus spoke these words in the treasury, as He taught in the temple. No one arrested Him, for His hour had not yet come.|(Jiizas se dem sitn ya wen im did a tiich iina di yaad we Gad ous de, nier wich paat piipl jrap dem aafrin. An nobadi neehn uol im fi lak im op, kaa im taim neehn kom yet.)

Again, Jesus said to them, “I am going away, and you will seek Me, and you will die in your sins. Where I am going, you cannot come.”|Den Jiizas se tu dem agen se, “Mi a go we, an unu gweehn luk fi mi, bot unu gweehn ded iina unu sin. Unu kyaahn kom we paat mi a go.”

So the Jews said, “Will He kill Himself? For He said, ‘Where I am going, you cannot come.’ ”|Wa im se mek di Juu liida dem staat aks, “A kil im gweehn kil imself, mek im a se ‘We paat mi a go unu kyaahn kom’?”

He said to them, “You are from below; I am from above. You are of this world; I am not of this world.|Bot Jiizas gwaan taak an im se tu dem se, “Unu kom fram dong a batam ya; mi kom fram evn op a tap. Unu kom fram da worl ya; mi no kom fram ya.

Therefore I said to you that you will die in your sins. For unless you believe that I am He, you will die in your sins.”|A dat mek mi se tu unu se unu gweehn ded iina unu sin dem. Kaa ef unu no biliiv uu mi se mi bi, unu a-go ded iina unu sin dem.”
They said to Him, “Who are You?”Jesus said to them, “Just who I have been telling you from the beginning.|So dem aks, “A uu yu?”“Di siem sumadi mi a tel unu fram di staat,” Jiizas se tu dem.

I have many things to say and to judge concerning you, but He who sent Me is true. So I tell the world what I heard from Him.”|“Mi av nof ada sitn fi se an fi joj unu fa, bot di Faada we sen mi taak di chuut, an a wa mi ier im se mi tel di piipl dem iina di worl.”
They did not understand that He spoke to them of the Father.
column2: (Bot dem neehn andastan wa im did a tel dem se bout im Faada.)

column1: So Jesus said to them, “When you lift up the Son of Man, then you will know that I am He, and I do nothing of Myself. But I speak these things as My Father taught Me. |So Jiizas se, “Wen unu lif op di Man we Gad Pik pan di kraas, a dem taim de unu gweehn nuo se mi a uu mi se mi bi, an dat mi no du notn pan mi uon bot dat mi taak onggl wa mi Faada tiich mi.

He who sent Me is with Me. The Father has not left Me alone, for I always do those things that please Him.”|Di wan we sen mi tan wid mi. Im neehn mek mi tan pan mi uon, kaa mi eva a du wa mek im api.”
As He spoke these words, many believed in Him.|Siem taim im a taak bout dem sitn ya, nof piipl staat biliiv iina im.

Then Jesus said to those Jews who believed Him, “If you remain in My word, then you are truly My disciples. |Jiizas se tu di Juu dem we kom fram Jeruusilem an we chos iina im se, “Ef unu gwaan du di sitn dem we mi tiich, unu a mi falara dem fi chuu.
You shall know the truth, and the truth shall set you free.”|Unu gweehn nuo di chuut, an di chuut gweehn frii unu.”

They answered Him, “We are Abraham’s seed and have never been in bondage to anyone. Why do You say, ‘You shall be set free’? ”|Dem ansa im an se, “Wi a Iebriyam pikni an wi neehn a nobadi sliev bifuo. So, ou kom yu fi a se, ‘Di chuut gweehn frii unu’?”
Jesus answered them, “Truly, truly I say to you, whoever commits sin is a slave of sin. |Jiizas ansa dem an se, “Mi a tel unu fi chuu chuu, evribadi we sin, a sin sliev.
Now a slave does not remain in the house forever, but a son remains forever. |Wan sliev no tan iina wan fambili fi eva, bot wan bwai pikni a aalwiez paat a im fambili.
Therefore if the Son sets you free, you shall be free indeed.|So ef di Bwai Pikni frii unu, unu frii fi chuu.

I know that you are Abraham’s seed. But you seek to kill Me, because My word has no place in you.|Mi nuo se unu a Iebriyam pikni. Bot iivn duo unu a Iebriyam pikni, unu stil waahn fi kil mi, kaa wa mi a tiich unu se no toch unu aat.
I am telling what I have seen with My Father, and you are doing what you have seen with your father.”|Mi a tel unu we mi si wen mi de roun di Faada; bot unu, du wa unu ier di Faada se!”

They answered Him, “Abraham is our father.”Jesus said to them, “If you were Abraham’s children, you would do the works of Abraham. |“Iebriyam a fi wi faada,” dem se tu Jiizas.“Ef unu did a Iebriyam pikni,” Jiizas se, “den unu wuda du wa Iebriyam du.

But now you seek to kill Me, a Man who has told you the truth which I heard from God. Abraham did not do this. |Bot nou, unu a chrai fi kil mi, sumadi we taak di chuu sitn dem we im ier Gad taak bout. Iebriyam neehn du notn laka dat de.

You are doing the works of your father.”Then they said to Him, “We were not born of sexual immorality. We have one Father: God.”|Unu a du di sitn dem we unu uona faada du.”“Wi a no baastad pikni,” di piipl dem shout bak an se tu im. “A Gad imself a di onggl faada wi av.”

Jesus said to them, “If God were your Father, you would love Me, for I came from God and proceeded into the world. I did not come of My own authority, but He sent Me.|Bot Jiizas se tu dem se, “Ef Gad did a unu Faada fi chuu, unu wuda lov mi, kaa mi kom fram Gad an nou mi de ya. Mi no kom ya pan mi uon; a im sen mi ya.
Why do you not understand My speaking? Because you cannot bear to hear My word.
column2: Wa mek unu no andastan wa mi a se? A chuu unu kyaahn riili si chuu wa mi a tel unu se.

column1: You are of your father the devil, and you want to do the desires of your father. He was a murderer from the beginning, and does not stand in the truth, because there is no truth in him. When he lies, he speaks from his own nature, for he is a liar and the father of lies.|Unu bilang tu unu faada, di devl, an unu waahn fi du di sitn dem we unu faada waahn unu fi du. Im did a mordara fram di staat, an na'av notn fi du wid di chuut, kaa im no se ar av notn fi du wid di chuut. Wen im tel lai, im jos a taak ou im tan, kaa im a laiyad an im a di faada fi aal lai.
Yet because I tell the truth, you do not believe Me. |Bot chuu mi tel unu di chuut, unu no biliiv iina mi.
Which of you convicts Me of sin? If I speak the truth, why do you not believe Me?|Wich wan outa aal a unu kyan shuo se mi gilti a no sin? Ef mi de tel unu di chuut, wa mek unu no biliiv mi?
He who is of God hears God’s words. Therefore, you do not hear them, because you are not of God.”|Dem we bilang tu Gad ier wa Gad se. Unu kyaahn si chuu we mi a se, kaa unu no bilang tu Gad.”

The Jews answered Him, “Do we not rightly say that You are a Samaritan and have a demon?”|Di Juu piipl dem fram Jeruusilem ansa im se, “No chuut wi a taak wen wi se yu a wan Samaritan an yu av diiman iina yu?”
Jesus answered, “I do not have a demon. But I honor My Father, and you dishonor Me. |“Mi no av no diiman iina mi,” Jiizas se. “Mi rispek mi Faada, bot unu no shuo mi no rispek.
I do not seek glory for Myself. There is One who seeks it and judges.|Mi naa chrai fi mek piipl big big mi op. Bot yu av sumadi we waahn piipl fi big mi op, an im a di joj.
Truly, truly I say to you, if anyone keeps My word, he shall never see death.”|Mi a tel unu fi chuu chuu, enibadi we du wa mi tiich naa go ded.”

Then the Jews said to Him, “Now we know that You have a demon. Abraham and the prophets died, and You say, ‘If a man keeps My word, he shall never taste death.’ |Wen di Juu piipl dem fram Jeruusilem ier dis ya, ier dem, “A nou wi nuo se yu av diiman iina yu! Iebriyam an di prafit dem ded, an yu a se, ‘Enibadi we du wa mi tiich naa go ded’!
“Are You greater than our father Abraham, who died? The prophets are dead! Who do You make Yourself out to be?”|Yu no biga dan wi faada Iebriyam we ded? Di prafit dem ded tu. A uu yu se yu bi?”

Jesus answered, “If I glorify Myself, My glory is nothing. It is My Father who glorifies Me, of whom you say that He is your God. |Jiizas ansa dem se, “Ef mi big op miself, dat de big op de no wot wan ting. Fi mi Faada, di wan we unu se a fu'unu Gad, a im a di wan we big mi op.

Yet you have not known Him, but I know Him. If I say, ‘I do not know Him,’ I shall be a liar like you. But I know Him and keep His word.|Unu no nuo im, bot mi nuo im. Ef mi did fi se mi no nuo im, mi wuda lai laik unu. Bot mi nuo im, an mi du wa im se.
Your father Abraham rejoiced to see My day. He saw it and was glad.”
column2: Unu faada Iebriyam did glad wen im si fi mi die an iej. Im si'it an did glad bout wa im si.”

column1: Then the Jews said to Him, “You are not yet fifty years old. Have You seen Abraham?”|“Yu no iivn riich fifti yet,” di Juu dem se tu im, “an yu a taak bout yu si Iebriyam!”
Jesus said to them, “Truly, truly I say to you, before Abraham was born, I AM.”|So Jiizas se tu dem se, “Mi de tel unu fi chuu chuu se bifuo Iebriyam did baan, mi de bout!”

Then they took up stones to throw at Him. But ­Jesus hid Himself and went out of the temple. Going through their midst, He passed by.|Wen dem ier dis, dem pik op rakstuon fi fling aafa im, bot im aid we an go we fram we Gad ous did de.
As Jesus passed by, He saw a man blind from birth. |Nou, wen Jiizas did a waak, im si wan man we did blain fram di die im baan.
His disciples asked Him, “Rabbi, who sinned, this man or his parents, that he was born blind?”|So im falara dem aks im se, “Tiicha, a uu sin mek da man ya baan blain, im ar im mada an faada?”

Jesus answered, “Neither this man nor his parents sinned. But it happened so that the works of God might be displayed in him. |“Da man ya neehn sin,” Jiizas se tu dem, “Im mada an faada neehn sin niida. Im baan blain so piipl kyan si Gad du som powaful sitn iina im laif.

I must do the works of Him who sent Me while it is day. Night is coming when no one can work.|Fi az lang az di son a shain, wi mos du di powaful sitn dem we di wan we sen mi waahn wi fi du. Nait a kom wen nobadi kyaahn go du notn.
While I am in the world, I am the light of the world.”|Fi az lang az mi iina di worl, mi a di wan we lait op di worl.”

When He had said this, He spat on the ground and made clay with the saliva. He anointed the eyes of the blind man with the clay,|Afta im se dis, im pit pan di grong, miks op di pit iina di dot mek mod an put it pan di man yai dem.

and said to him, “Go, wash in the pool of Siloam” (which means “Sent”). So he went away and washed, and returned seeing.|Den im tel di man se, “Gwaan go wash yu fies iina di Sailuom Puul” (Sailuom miin Sen.) So di man go we go wash im fies an go baka im yaad a si!

The neighbors and those who had previously seen that he was blind said, “Is this not he who sat and begged?” |So nou, im nieba dem an dem we yuus fi si im a beg staat aks, “No di man dis ya we yuus tu sidong a beg?”

Some said, “This is he.”Others said, “He is like him.”But he said, “I am he.”|Som se, “A im siem wan.” Ada piipl se, “No sa, im onggl fieva im.” Bot di man kip aan se, “A mi, man. Mi a di man we yuus tu beg.”
So they said to him, “How were your eyes opened?”|“Den a ou kom yu get fi kyan si?” dem aks im.

He answered, “A Man called Jesus made clay, anointed my eyes, and said to me, ‘Go to the pool of Siloam and wash.’ So I went away and washed, and I received my sight.”|So im se tu dem se, “Di man we dem kaal Jiizas mek som mod an put it pan mi yai dem an tel mi fi go wash mi fies a Sailuom Puul. So mi go wash mi fies, an den mi kuda si.”
They said to him, “Where is He?”He said, “I do not know.”|“Wich paat da man ya de?” dem aks im.“Mi no nuo,” im se.
They brought the man who had been blind to the Pharisees.
column2: So dem tek di man we did blain kyari go a di Farisii dem.

column1: Now it was a Sabbath day when Jesus made the clay and opened his eyes.
column2: (Nou a pan di Sabat Jiizas did tek mod an mek di man get fi si.)

column1: Therefore the Pharisees also asked him how he received his sight. He said to them, “He put clay on my eyes, and I washed, and I see.”|So di Farisii dem aks di man ou kom im get fi kyan si.Di man tel dem se, “Im put mod pan mi yai dem, an mi go wash aaf mi fies an nou mi kyan si.”

Some of the Pharisees said, “This Man is not from God, because He does not keep the Sabbath day.”Others said, “How can a man who is a sinner do such signs?” So there was division among them.|Den som a di Farisii dem se, “Di man we du da sitn ya no kom fram Gad, kaa im no kip di Sabat.”Bot som ada piipl aks, “Bot a ou sina man fi du dem powaful mirikl ya?” So aal a dem neehn grii wid dem wan aneda.

Then they said to the blind man again, “What do you say about Him, since He opened your eyes?”He said, “He is a prophet.”|Dem ton tu di man we did blain wan neks taim an aks im se, “A fi yu yai dem im mek get beta. Wa yu afi se bout im?”So di man se tu dem se, “Im a wan prafit.”

But the Jews did not believe concerning him, that he had been blind and received his sight, until they called the parents of the one who had received his sight. |Di Juu liida dem stil neehn biliiv se di man did blain fi chuu an kuda si nou, so dem sen fi im mada an faada.

They asked them, “Is this your son, whom you say was born blind? How then does he now see?”|“A fu'unu bwai pikni dis ya, we unu se baan blain?” dem aks im mada an faada. “Den tel wi ou kom im get fi kyan si nou?”
His parents answered them, “We know that this is our son and that he was born blind. |“Wi nuo se im a fi wi pikni,” di man mada an faada se, “an wi nuo se im did baan blain.

But how he now sees, we do not know, or who opened his eyes, we do not know. He is of age. Ask him. He will speak for himself.” |Bot wi no nuo ou kom im get fi kyan si nou, an wi no nuo a uu mek im beta. Unu aks im. Im a big man. Im wi taak fi imself.”

His parents said this, because they feared the Jews. For the Jews had already agreed that if anyone confessed that He was the Christ, he would be put out of the synagogue. |(Di man mada an faada se so chuu dem did fried a di Juu liida dem, kaa di liida dem did don mek op dem main se enibadi we biliiv an se dat Jiizas a di Krais wuda get put outa di Juu dem choch.
Therefore his parents said, “He is of age. Ask him.”|A dat mek im mada an faada se, “Im a big man. Unu aks im.”)

So again they called the man who was blind and said to him, “Give glory to God. We know that this Man is a sinner.”|So di Juu liida dem kaal di man we did blain wan muo taim. “Taak di chuut an shiem di devl,” dem se. “Wi nuo se di man we mek yu get beta a sina man.”

He said, “I do not know if He is a sinner. I know one thing: I was blind, but now I see.”|Bot im se tu dem se, “Sina ar no sina, mi no nuo im a wich wan a dem. Wan ting mi nuo se a dat mi did blain, an nou mi kyan si!”
Then they said to him again, “What did He do to you? How did He open your eyes?”|Den dem aks im se, “A wa im du tu yu? A ou im mek yu get fi kyan si?”

He answered them, “I told you already, and you did not listen. Why do you want to hear it again? Do you also want to become His disciples?”|Bot di man ansa dem an se, “Mi tel unu aredi an unu neehn lisn. Wa mek unu waahn ier wan neda taim? A ton unu waahn ton im falara dem tu?”
Then they insulted him and said, “You are His disciple, but we are Moses’ disciples.|Den dem staat kos im aaf an se, “A yu a fi'im falara! A Muoziz wi fala!
We know that God has spoken to Moses. As for this fellow, we do not know where He is from.”|Wi nuo se Gad taak tu Muoziz, bot di man yu a taak bout, wi no iivn nuo wich paat im kom fram.”

The man answered, “Well, here is an amazing thing! You do not know where He is from, and yet He opened my eyes. |So, ier di man tu dem, “Bot wat a piis a sopm, iihn! Im mek mi kyan si, bot siem taim unu no nuo wich paat im kom fram!

We know that God does not listen to sinners. But if anyone is a worshipper of God and does His will, He hears him. |Wi nuo se Gad no lisn tu piipl we a sina. Im lisn tu dem we rispek im, an du we im se.
Since the world began, it has never been heard that anyone opened the eyes of someone born blind. |Fram di taim di worl mek nobadi neehn ier bout sumadi we baan blain an we get fi kyan si afta dat.
If this Man were not from God, He could do nothing.”|Ef da man ya neehn kom fram Gad, im kudn du wan ting.”

They answered him, “You were completely born in sin. Are you teaching us?” And they threw him out.|Wen dem ier dat, dem se tu im se, “Yu ful op a sin fram yu baan. A uu yu tingk yu bi fi a chrai a tiich wi notn?” An dem kik im outa di Juu choch.

Jesus heard that they had thrown him out, and when He found him, He said, “Do you believe in the Son of God?”|Jiizas ier se di Juu liida dem kik di man we did blain outa dem choch. Wen Jiizas fain im, im aks im se, “Yu biliiv iina di Man we Gad Pik?”
He answered, “Who is He, Lord, that I may believe in Him?”|“A uu im, sar?” di man aks Jiizas. “Tel mi so mi kyan biliiv iina im.”
Jesus said to him, “You have seen Him, and it is He who speaks with you.”|Jiizas se tu im se, “Yu a si im nou. A im a taak tu yu.”
Then he said, “Lord, I believe.” And he worshipped Him.|So di man se, “Laad, mi biliiv,” an im worship Jiizas.

Jesus said, “I came into this world for judgment, that those who do not see may see, and that those who see may become blind.”|Jiizas se, “Mi kom iina di worl fi joj piipl, so blain piipl kyan si an di wan dem we tingk se dem kyan si get blain.”
Some Pharisees who were with Him heard these words, and said to Him, “Are we also blind?”|Som a di Farisii dem we did de roun im ier wen im se dis an aks, “A blain yu a se wi blain tu?”

Jesus said, “If you were blind, you would have no sin. But now you say, ‘We see.’ Therefore your sin remains.|So Jiizas tel dem se, “Ef unu did blain, unu wudn gilti a no sin, bot chuu unu se unu kyan si, unu gilti.”

“Truly, truly I say to you, he who does not enter by the door into the sheepfold, but climbs up some other way, is a thief and a robber. |Jiizas se, “Mi a tel unu fi chuu chuu se di sumadi we no kom iina di shiip pen chuu di giet, bot we klaim go iin de wan neks wie, da sumadi de a tiif an raba.
But he who enters by the door is the shepherd of the sheep.|Di wan we go iina di pen chuu di giet, a im a di shiip dem shepad.

To him the doorkeeper opens, and the sheep hear his voice. He calls his own sheep by name, and he leads them out.|Di wan we wach uova di shiip giet uopm di giet fi di shepad, an di shiip dem ier di shepad vais. Di shepad kaal fi'im uona shiip dem bai dem niem an im liid dem out.

When he brings out his own sheep, he goes before them. And the sheep follow him, for they know his voice. |Wen im tek out aal a fi'im shiip, im go infronta dem, an di shiip dem fala im kaa dem pik op im vais.
Yet they will never follow a stranger, but will run away from him. For they do not know the voice of strangers.”|Dem naa go fala baka chrienja. Dem ron we fram im kaa dem no pik op chrienja vais.”
Jesus told them this parable, but they did not understand what He was telling them.|Jiizas did a tel dem wan tuori bot dem neehn andastan wa im did a se tu dem.
Then Jesus said to them again, “Truly, truly I say to you, I am the door of the sheep.|So im se tu dem agen se, “Mi a tel unu fi chuu chuu se dat mi a di giet we di shiip dem go chuu.
All who came before Me are thieves and robbers, but the sheep did not listen to them. |Enibadi els we kom bifuo mi a tiif an raba, bot di shiip dem neva lisn tu dem.

I am the door. If anyone enters through Me, he will be saved and will go in and out and find pasture. |Mi a di giet. Ef enibadi kom iin chuu mi, dem a-go siev. Dem a-go waak iin an waak out, an dem a-go fain plies wid nais griin graas fi nyam.

The thief does not come, except to steal and kill and destroy. I came that they may have life, and that they may have it more abundantly.|Di tiif kom onggl fi tiif, fi kil an fi mash op. Mi kom so dat dem kyan liv laif an no waahn notn at aal.
“I am the good shepherd. The good shepherd lays down His life for the sheep.
column2: “Mi a di gud shepad. Di gud shepad wi gi op im laif fi di shiip dem.

column1: But he who is a hired hand, and not a shepherd, who does not own the sheep, sees the wolf coming, and leaves the sheep, and runs away. So the wolf catches the sheep and scatters them. |Di sumadi we a get pie fi luk aafa dem a no di shepad. Dem no uon di shiip dem. So wen taim da sumadi de si wulf a kom, im ron go we lef di shiip dem. Den di wulf kom op pan di shiip dem an mek dem skyata.
he hired hand runs away because he is a hired hand and does not care about the sheep.
column2: Di sumadi we get pie fi luk aafa di shiip dem ron we kaaz im onggl bizniz bout di moni. Im no kieta bout di shiip dem.

column1: “I am the good shepherd. I know My sheep and am known by My own.
column2: Mi a di gud shepad. Mi nuo mi uona shiip dem an mi shiip dem nuo mi

column1: Even as the Father knows Me, so I know the Father. And I lay down My life for the sheep. |siem laka ou di Faada nuo mi an mi nuo di Faada. An mi gi op mi laif fi mi shiip dem.

I have other sheep who are not of this fold. I must also bring them, and they will hear My voice. There will be one flock and one shepherd.|Mi av ada shiip we no iina da shiip pen ya. Mi afi kyari dem iina di pen tu. Dem a-go lisn tu mi vais tu, so den, yu a-go av onggl wan gruup a shiip an onggl wan shepad.
Therefore My Father loves Me, because I lay down My life that I may take it up again.|Mi Faada lov mi kaa mi gi op mi laif, so dat mi kyan kom bak alaiv.

No one takes it from Me, but I lay it down Myself. I have power to lay it down, and I have power to take it up again. I received this command from My Father.”|Nobadi no tek we mi laif fram mi. A mi gi it op miself. Mi av di powa fi gi it we an mi av di powa fi tek it bak. A dis ya mi Faada tel mi fi du.”
Therefore there was a division again among the Jews because of these sayings. |Wen di Juu liida dem ier wa Jiizas se, dem staat aagyu wid dem wan aneda agen.
Many of them said, “He has a demon and is insane. Why do you listen to Him?”|Nof a dem se, “Im av wan diiman iina im an im tif stuon mad. Wa unu a lisn tu im fa?”

Others said, “These are not the words of one who has a demon. Can a demon open the eyes of the blind?”|Bot som ada wan se, “Dis ya kain-a tiichin ya no kom fram sumadi we av diiman iina dem. Diiman kyaahn mek blain piipl si?”
The Feast of the Dedication was at Jerusalem, and it was winter.|Di alidie wen di Juu piipl dem memba di taim wen Gad ous did dedikiet bak tu im did kom a Jeruusilem. A did di kuol siizn
Jesus walked in the temple in Solomon’s Porch.
column2: an Jiizas did a waak roun Gad ous ieriya pan Salaman Puoch.

column1: Then the Jews surrounded Him, saying, “How long will You keep us in suspense? If You are the Christ, tell us plainly.”|Di Juu liida dem bongl roun im an se, “Ou lang yu plan fi kip tingz fram wi an av wi a wanda? Ef yu a di Krais, jos se it plien an chriet.”

Jesus answered them, “I told you, and you did not believe. The works that I do in My Father’s name bear witness of Me. |So Jiizas se tu dem se, “Mi tel unu aredi, bot unu no biliiv. Di sopm dem we mi du kaa mi Faada tel mi fi du dem, dem shuo unu uu mi bi.
But you do not believe, because you are not of My sheep, as I said to you. |Bot unu mek op unu main fi no biliiv kaa unu a no fi mi shiip.
My sheep hear My voice, and I know them, and they follow Me. |Fi mi shiip dem lisn tu we mi se. Mi nuo dem, an dem fala baka mi.
I give them eternal life. They shall never perish, nor shall anyone snatch them from My hand. |Mi mek dem kyan liv fi eva, an dem naa go ded. Nobadi naa go grab an tek dem outa mi an.

My Father, who has given them to Me, is greater than all. No one is able to snatch them from My Father’s hand.|Mi Faada we gi mi aal a dem, im biga dan evribadi. Nobadi kyaahn grab an tek dem outa mi Faada an.
My Father and I are one.”
column2: Mi an di Faada a wan an di siem.”

column1: Again the Jews took up stones to stone Him.
column2: So di Juu liida dem pik op rakstuon fi stuon im wan neda taim

column1: Jesus answered them, “I have shown you many good works from My Father. For which of those works do you stone Me?”|bot Jiizas se tu dem se, “Mi du nof powaful sitn we mi Faada tel mi fi du infronta unu yai. A wich wan a dem unu a stuon mi fa?”

The Jews answered Him, “We are not stoning You for a good work, but for blasphemy, and because You, being a Man, claim to be God.”|“Wi naa stuon yu fi non a dem sitn de,” dem se tu im. “Wi gweehn stuon yu kaaz a ou yu a disrispek Gad. Yu a onggl wan man, an yu a taak bout se yu a Gad.”
Jesus answered them, “Is it not written in your law, ‘I said, “You are gods”’? |So Jiizas ansa dem an se, “A no iina fu'unu Laa buk it rait dong se Gad se, ‘Mi tel unu se unu a gad’?

If He called them ‘gods,’ to whom the word of God came, and the Scripture cannot be broken|Nou, wi nuo se wa rait dong iina Gad wod aalwiez chuu. So nou, ef Gad did se di piipl dem we im did a taak tu dem taim de a ‘gad,’

do you say of Him, whom the Father has sanctified and sent into the world, ‘You blaspheme,’ because I said, ‘I am the Son of God’? |wa mek unu se, ‘Yu a disrispek Gad’ tu di wan we Gad pik an sen iina di worl? Wa mek unu a se mi disrispek Gad kaa mi se, ‘Mi a Gad Bwai Pikni’?
If I am not doing the works of My Father, do not believe Me.|Ef mi naa du we mi Faada waahn mi fi du, den no biliiv mi.

But if I do them, though you do not believe Me, believe the works, that you may know and believe that the Father is in Me, and I in Him.”|Bot ef mi du wa im tel mi fi du, duo unu no biliiv mi siek-a wa mi tel unu, at liis biliiv mi siek-a di mirikl dem we mi du, so dat unu kyan nuo an andastan se di Faada iina mi, an mi iina di Faada.”
Again they tried to seize Him, but He escaped from their hands.|Den, dem chrai fi uol im an lak im op wan muo taim, bot im get we fram dem.

Then He went away again beyond the Jordan into the place where John was baptizing at first, and He remained there.|Im go bak kraas Jaadn Riva fi go a di plies we Jan did a baptaiz piipl iina di orliya die dem. Im tan de an no go no we afta im riich de.

Many came to Him and said, “John did no sign. But everything that John said about this Man was true.” |Uol iip a piipl kom tu im, an dem se, “Duo Jan neehn du no iivn wan mirikl, aal a we im did se bout da man ya a did chuu.”
And many believed in Him there.
column2: An uol iip a piipl we did de kraas Jaadn Riva biliiv iina im.

column1: Now a man was sick, Lazarus from Bethany, the village of Mary and her sister Martha.|Nou, yu did av wan sik man niem Lazaros. Lazaros did liv a Betani, di sed plies Mieri an ar sista, Maata, did liv.

This was Mary who anointed the Lord with ointment and wiped His feet with her hair, whose brother Lazarus was sick.|(A da Mieri ya did chuo porfyuum ail pan di Laad an waip aaf im fut dem wid ar ier. A fi ar breda Lazaros did sik.)
So the sisters sent word to Him, saying, “Lord, he whom You love is sick.”|So di sista dem sen mesij tu Jiizas se, “Laad, di sumadi we yu lov sik.”

When Jesus heard this, He said, “This sickness is not unto death, but for the glory of God, that the Son of God may be glorified by it.”|Wen Jiizas ier bout it, im se, “Nobadi naa go ded siek-a da siknis ya. It gweehn kaaz piipl fi big op Gad. An dem a-go big op di Man we Gad Pik siek-a it tu.”
Now Jesus loved Martha, and her sister, and Lazarus.|(Nou Jiizas did lov Maata, ar sista an Lazaros.)
So when He heard that he was sick, He remained where He was two more days.|Bot wen im ier se Lazaros did sik, im tan wich paat im did de fi tuu muo die.
Then after this He said to the disciples, “Let us go into Judea again.”|Afta dat, im se tu im falara dem se, “Kom mek wi go baka Judiya.”

His disciples said to Him, “Rabbi, the Jews were just trying to stone You. Are You going there again?”|“Bot Tiicha,” dem se, “no jos di ada die di Juu dem did a chrai fi stuon yu kil yu, an yu a go bak de?”

Jesus answered, “Are there not twelve hours in the day? If anyone walks during the day, he does not stumble, because he sees the light of this world.|Jiizas ansa dem se, “No twelv owa iina wan die? Sumadi we waak a die no faal dong, kaa im av di son fi mek im si.
But if anyone walks during the night, he stumbles, because the light is not in him.”|Bot ef sumadi waak a nait, im bok op an chrip uova, kaa im no av no lait iina im fi mek im si.”

After He said this, He said to them, “Our friend Lazarus has fallen asleep. But I am going that I may awaken him from sleep.”|Afta im se so, im tel dem se, “Wi fren Lazaros jrap asliip; bot mi a-go wiek im op.”
Then His disciples said, “Lord, if he is sleeping, he will be well.”|So im falara dem se tu im se, “Laad, ef im jrap asliip, im wi get beta.”

Jesus had spoken of his death. But they thought that He was speaking of getting rest through sleep.|(Nou, Jiizas did a taak bout ou Lazaros did ded, bot im falara dem did tingk se im miin Lazaros did jos a sliip.)
So then Jesus plainly told them, “Lazarus is dead.  |So im tel dem we im miin plien an chriet, im se, “Lazaros ded

And I am glad for your sakes that I was not there, so that you may believe. Nevertheless let us go to him.”|an fi fu'unu siek, mi glad mi neehn de de, so unu kyan get fi biliiv iina mi nou. Kom mek wi go wich paat im de.”

Then Thomas, who is called Didymus, said to his fellow disciples, “Let us go also, that we may die with Him.”|Den Tamas — uufa pet niem a did “Twin” — se tu di res a Jiizas falara dem se, “Kom mek di uol a wi go wid im, so wi kyan ded wid im tu.”
When Jesus arrived, He found that he had been in the tomb four days already. |Wen Jiizas riich, im fain se Lazaros did don iina di griev fi fuo die.
Now Bethany was near Jerusalem, less than two miles away.|(Betani did de les dan tuu mail fram Jeruusilem,

Many of the Jews had come to Martha and Mary, to comfort them concerning their brother.|an nof a di Juu dem we kom fram Jeruusilem said did kom fi osh Maata an Mieri an mek dem fiil beta kaa dem breda did ded.)
When Martha heard that Jesus was coming, she went and met Him, but Mary remained in the house.|Nou, wen Maata ier se Jiizas did a kom, shi go fi miit im, bot Mieri tan baka di yaad.
Martha said to Jesus, “Lord, if You had been here, my brother would not have died. |“Laad,” Maata se tu Jiizas, “ef yu did de ya, mi breda wudn ded.
But even now I know that whatever You may ask of God, God will give You.”|Bot mi nuo se iivn nou Gad wi gi yu eniting yu aks im fa.”
Jesus said to her, “Your brother will rise again.”|Jiizas se tu ar se, “Yu breda a-go kom bak alaiv.”
Martha said to Him, “I know that he will rise again in the resurrection on the last day.”|So Maata ansa im an se, “Mi nuo im gweehn kom bak alaiv pan di die wen di worl en an piipl kom bak alaiv.”

Jesus said to her, “I am the resurrection and the life. He who believes in Me, though he may die, yet shall he live.|Den Jiizas se tu ar se, “Mi a di wan we mek piipl kom bak alaiv; a mi mek piipl liv. Enibadi we biliiv iina mi a-go liv, aal ef dem ded.
And whoever lives and believes in Me shall never die. Do you believe this?”|An dem we alaiv an biliiv iina mi, dem naa go ded. Yu biliiv dis ya?”

She said to Him, “Yes, Lord, I believe that You are the Christ, the Son of God, who is to come into the world.”|“Yes, Laad,” shi se, “mi biliiv se a yu a di Krais, yu a Gad Bwai Pikni we kom iina di worl.”

When she had said this, she went her way and secretly called her sister Mary, saying, “The Teacher has come and is calling for you.”|Afta Maata se dis ya, shi go we go kaal Mieri ar sista wan said an tel ar se, “Di Tiicha de ya, an im a aks fi yu.”
When she heard this, she rose quickly and went to Him.|Wen Mieri ier dis ya, shi get op faas faas an go wich paat Jiizas did de.
Now Jesus had not yet entered the village, but was in the place where Martha met Him.|(Nou Jiizas neehn riich iina di toun yet; im did de a di siem plies wich paat Maata did miit im.)

When the Jews who were with Mary in the house, comforting her, saw that she quickly rose up and went out, they followed her, saying, “She is going to the tomb to weep there.”|Wen di Juu dem fram Jeruusilem we did iina di ous a osh Mieri si ou shi get op faas an go we, dem fala baka ar, kaa dem did fiil se shi did a go a di griev go baal fi ar breda.

When Mary came to where Jesus was, and saw Him, she fell down at His feet, saying to Him, “Lord, if You had been here, my brother would not have died.”|Wen Mieri kech we paat Jiizas did de, shi jrap arself a im fut an se, “Laad, ef yu did onggl de ya, mi breda wudn ded.”

When Jesus saw her weeping, and the Jews who came with her weeping, He groaned in the spirit and was troubled. |Wen Jiizas si ar a ala an a baal, an si di Juu dem we did kom wid ar a baal tu, im aat muuv.
He said, “Where have you laid him?”They said to Him, “Lord, come and see.”|“Wich paat unu put im?” Jiizas aks dem.“Kom, Laad, kom an si,” dem se tu im.
Jesus wept.
column2: Jiizas baal.

column1: Then the Jews said, “See how He loved him.”|Den di Juu dem se, “Ku de, unu si umoch im did lov im!”

But some of them said, “Could not this Man, who opened the eyes of the blind man, have also kept this man from dying?”|Bot som a dem se, “Da man ya mek di blain man kyan si. So, im kudn du sopm fi mek Lazaros no ded?”

Then Jesus, again groaning within Himself, came to the tomb. It was a cave, and a stone was lying against it.|Wa Jiizas si toch im aat wan muo taim, an im go wich paat di griev did de. (Nou, di griev a did wan kiev wid wan stuon infronta it.)

Jesus said, “Take away the stone.”Martha, the sister of him who was dead, said to Him, “Lord, by this time there is a stench, for he has been dead four days.”|“Tek we di stuon,” Jiizas se.“Bot Laad,” di ded man sista, Maata, se, “bai nou di plies mos sumel bad bad, kaaz a fuo die im iin de fa.”
Jesus said to her, “Did I not tell you that if you believed, you would see the glory of God?”|Den Jiizas se, “Duohn mi tel yu se ef yu biliiv, yu wuda si ou Gad big an powaful?”

So they took away the stone from the place where the dead man was lying. Jesus lifted up His eyes and said, “Father, I thank You that You have heard Me.|So dem muuv we di stuon. Den Jiizas luk op iina di skai an se, “Faada, mi tangk yu fi lisn mi.

I know that You always hear Me. But because of the people standing around, I said this, that they may believe that You sent Me.”|Mi nuo se yu eva lisn tu mi, bot mi a se dem sitn ya fi di siek-a di kroud a piipl we de ya-so, so dat dem kyan biliiv se a yu sen mi kom.”
When He had said this, He cried out with a loud voice, “Lazarus, come out!”|Afta Jiizas don se dat, im baal out loud loud se, “Lazaros, kum out!”

He who was dead came out, his hands and feet wrapped with grave clothes, and his face wrapped with a cloth.Jesus said to them, “Unbind him, and let him go.”|Di ded man kom out wid im an an fut dem tai op wid piis piis a klaat. Piis a klaat did rap roun im fies. Den Jiizas se tu dem se, “Tek di griev kluoz aafa im an mek im gwaan.”
Therefore many of the Jews who came to Mary, and saw what Jesus had done, believed in Him.|So nou, nof a di Juu dem we did kom luk fi Mieri biliiv iina Jiizas wen dem si we im du.
But some of them went away to the Pharisees and told them what Jesus had done.
column2: Bot som a dem go tu di Farisii dem an tel dem we Jiizas du.

column1: Then the chief priests and the Pharisees assembled the Sanhedrin and said, “What shall we do? This Man is performing many signs.|Den di ed priis dem an di Farisii dem kaal wan miitn fi di liida dem. “Wa wi a du?” dem aks. “Kaa da man ya a wok som powaful mirikl.

If we leave Him alone like this, everyone will believe in Him, and the Romans will come and take away both our temple and our nation.”|Ef wi mek im gwaan siem wie, evribadi a-go biliiv iina im, an di Ruoman ruula dem a-go kom an tek we Gad ous fram wi an ron wi piipl dem fram outa wi konchri.”

Then one of them named Caiaphas, who was the high priest that year, said to them, “You know nothing at all|Den wan a di liida dem we niem Kaiyafas, an we did a di liida fi di priis dem da ier de, taak op an se, “Unu no nuo a ting!

nor do you consider that it is expedient for us that one man should die for the people, that the whole nation should not perish.”|Unu no si se it beta fi wan man ded fi di piipl dem dan fi mek di uol konchri ded aaf?”

He did not say this on his own authority. But being the high priest that year, he prophesied that Jesus would die for the nation|(Nou, Kaiyafas neehn se dat pan im uon so, bot chuu im did a di liida fi di priis dem da ier de, im se Jiizas wuda ded fi di Juu piipl dem bifuo it iivn apm.

and not for the nation only, but that He might also gather together in unity the children of God who were scattered abroad.|Bot no fi dem wan, bot fi mek aal a Gad pikni dem we skyata skyata aal uova di plies kom tugeda iina wan.)
So from that day forward they planned to put Him to death.|So fram da die de, dem mek plan wid dem wan aneda fi kil Jiizas.

Therefore Jesus no longer walked openly among the Jews, but went away from there to the country near the wilderness, into a city called Ephraim, and remained there with His disciples.|Siek-a dat nou, Jiizas kip we fram di Juu piipl dem we kom fram Judiya. Im lef go a wan plies nier di dezot, wan toun niem Iifriem. An im tan de wid im falara dem.

Now the Passover of the Jews was at hand. Many went up to Jerusalem from the country before the Passover to purify themselves.|Wen a did nieli taim fi di Juu piipl dem Paasuova Alidie, uol iip a dem lef konchri an go op a Jeruusilem so dem kuda get demself kliin an redi fi di alidie.

Then they searched for Jesus and said among themselves as they stood in the temple, “What do you think, that He will not come to the feast?” |Dem did a luk aad fi Jiizas, an did a se tu dem wan aneda wen dem did a tan op iina Gad ous se, “Wa yu tingk? Yu tingk se im naa kom a Paasuova?”

Now both the chief priests and the Pharisees had given orders that if anyone knew where He was, he should report it, that they might seize Him.|(Nou, di ed priis dem an di Farisii dem did gi out aada se ef nobadi fain out we Jiizas de, dem fi tel dem so dem kyan get fi lak im op.)

Six days before the Passover Jesus came to Bethany, where Lazarus was, who had been dead, whom He had raised from the dead.|Siks die bifuo di Paasuova Alidie, Jiizas go a Betani, di plies we Lazaros, di wan we im did mek kom bak alaiv, did liv.

They prepared a supper for Him there. Martha served, but Lazarus was one of those who sat at the table with Him.|So dem chuo big nyaminz fi im de. Maata did a sorv, an Lazaros did de de wid di wan dem we did a sidong wid Jiizas roun di tiebl.

Then Mary took a pint of very costly ointment made from pure nard, and anointed the feet of Jesus, and wiped His feet with her hair. The house was filled with the fragrance of the ointment.|Mieri den nou tek wan bakl wid twelv paint a dier porfyuum ail we mek outa riil naad. Shi tek taim chuo it out pan Jiizas fut dem an den shi waip dem aaf wid ar ier. (An di porfyuum did sumel op iina di ous chrang chrang.)
But one of His disciples, Judas Iscariot, Simon’s son, who would betray Him, said|Bot wan a Jiizas falara dem, Juudas Iskyariyat, di wan we a-go sel im out se
“Why was this ointment not sold for three hundred denarii and given to the poor?”
column2: “Wa mek sumadi neehn sel da porfyuum ya fi chrii onjrid silva kain an gi di moni tu puo piipl?”

column1: He said this, not because he cared for the poor, but because he was a thief. And having the money box, he used to steal what was put in it.|(Nou, im neehn a se so kaaz im did kieta bout puo piipl; a chuu im a did tiif. A im did a luk aafa di chred bag, an im yuus tu tiif out wa dem put iin de.)

But Jesus said, “Leave her alone. She has kept this for the day of My burial.|“Lef ar,” Jiizas se, “shi kip it fi di die wen mi a-go beri. 8Unu eva a-go av puo piipl roun unu, bot unu naa go av mi roun ya wid unu fi eva.”
For you always have the poor with you, but you do not always have Me.”|Unu eva a-go av puo piipl roun unu, bot unu naa go av mi roun ya wid unu fi eva.”

When many of the Jews learned that He was there, they came, not for Jesus’ sake only, but that they might also see Lazarus, whom He had raised from the dead.|Nou wan big kroud a Juu piipl fram Judiya ier se Jiizas did de de-so, so dem go de. Dem go, no onggl kaaz im did de de, bot so dat dem kuda si Lazaros, di wan we im did mek kom bak alaiv.
So the chief priests planned to put Lazarus to death also
column2: So di ed priis dem mek plan fi kil Lazaros tu

column1: because on account of him many of the Jews went away and believed in Jesus.
column2: kaa siek-a Jiizas mek im kom bak alaiv nof a di Judiya Juu piipl dem did a-go tu Jiizas an staat chos iina im.

column1: On the next day a great crowd that had come to the feast heard that Jesus was coming to Jerusalem.
column2: Di neks die di big kroud we did kom fi di Paasuova Alidie ier se Jiizas did de pan im wie a go a Jeruusilem.

column1: They took branches of palm trees, and went out to meet Him, and cried out:“Hosanna!‘Blessed is He who comes in the name of the Lord!’The King of Israel!”|So dem tek som paam chrii branch an go fi miit im, an dem shout out loud loud se,“Priez Gad!”“Gad bles di wan we im sen kom!im sen im wid fi'im powa!”“Gad bles di wan we a king iina Izrel!”
Then Jesus, having found a young donkey, sat on it. As it is written:|Jiizas fain wan yong dangki an sidong pan it. Nou wa apm, apm siem laka ou it rait dong iina Gad wod. It se,
“Fear not, daughter of Zion;see, your King is coming,sitting on a donkey’s colt.”|“No fried, piipl we liv a Zaiyan;ku de, yu King a kom,im sidong pan wan yong dangki.”

His disciples did not understand these things at first. But when Jesus was glorified, they remembered that these things were written about Him and that they had done these things to Him.|(Nou Jiizas falara dem neehn andastan dem sopm ya fos aaf. A onggl afta Jiizas ded an kom bak alaiv an Gad shuo ou im big an powaful dem memba se dem sitn ya did rait dong bout im an dat dem did apm tu im.)

Now the crowd that was with Him when He called Lazarus out of the tomb and raised him from the dead bore witness.|So nou, di kroud a piipl we did de roun Jiizas wen im did kaal Lazaros outa di griev an mek im kom bak alaiv did a tel ada piipl bout wa did apm tu Lazaros.
The crowd went and met Him for this reason: They heard that He had performed this sign. |So di kroud a piipl go out fi miit Jiizas, kaa dem ier bout di big mirikl we im did du.

So the Pharisees said among themselves, “See, you are gaining nothing! Look, the world has followed Him!”|So di Farisii dem se tu dem wan aneda se, “Unu si se unu kyaahn du wan ting. Ku de, di uol worl a ron aafa im!”
Now there were some Greeks among those who went up to worship at the feast.
column2: Nou yu did av som Griik piipl we di de mongks dem we did a go a Jeruusilem fi di Paasuova Alidie fi priez Gad.

column1: They came to Philip, who was from Bethsaida of Galilee, and asked him, “Sir, we want to see Jesus.”|Dem go tu Filip, we did kom fram Betsieda iina Gyalalii, an dem se tu im se, “Wi wuda laik ef wi kuda si Jiizas, sar.”
Philip came and told Andrew, and in turn Andrew and Philip told Jesus.|Filip den go tel Anju, an di tuu a dem go tel Jiizas.
Jesus answered them, “The hour has come for the Son of Man to be glorified.|Jiizas se tu dem se, “Di taim kom fi Gad shuo ou di Man we Gad pik big an powaful.

Truly, truly I say to you, unless a grain of wheat falls into the ground and dies, it remains alone. But if it dies, it bears much fruit. |Mi a tel unu fi chuu chuu, ef wan wiit siid no jrap a grong an ded an ratn, it eva a-go tan wan wiit siid.
