Bot ef it get fi ded an ratn, it gruo an bier nof ada siid.

He who loves his life will lose it. And he who hates his life in this world will keep it for eternal life. |“Di sumadi we lov im laif tu moch a-go luuz it, bot di wan we no eng aan pan dem laif iina da worl ya a-go get fi kip it fi eva.

If anyone serves Me, he must follow Me. Where I am, there will My servant be also. If anyone serves Me, the Father will honor him.|Enibadi we waahn sorv mi afi fala mi. Eniwe mi de, dem a-go de de tu, an mi Faada a-go big dem op.

“Now My soul is troubled. What shall I say? ‘Father, save Me from this hour’? ­Instead, for this reason I came to this hour. |“Mi aat evi, rait ya nou. An wa mi fi se? ‘Faada, no mek mi go chuu da sofarieshan ya?’ Nuo! A fi da sed riizn ya mi kom iina di worl — fi go chuu di sofarieshan we a kom.

Father, glorify Your name.”Then a voice came from heaven, saying, “I have glorified it, and will glorify it again.” |Faada, big op yuself an yu niem!”Den wan vais fram outa di skai se, “Mi big it op aredi, an mi gweehn big it op wan neda taim.”

The crowd that stood by and heard it said that it had thundered. Others said, “An angel has spoken to Him.”|Di kroud a piipl we did de de an ier di vais se a ruol tonda did ruol. Ada piipl se a ienjel did a taak tu im.
Jesus answered, “This voice came not for My sake, but for your sakes.|Jiizas se, “A no fi mi, bot a fi fu'unu uona gud mek unu get fi ier di vais.
Now judgment is upon this world. Now the ruler of this world will be cast out.
column2: A di taim nou wen Gad gweehn joj di piipl dem we iina di worl; a nou di ruula fi da worl ya gweehn get fling out.

column1: And if I be lifted up from the earth, I will draw all men to Myself.”|An mi, wen mi get lif op aafa di ort, mi gweehn mek evribadi kom tu mi.”
He said this to signify by what kind of death He would die.
column2: (Im se dis ya fi mek dem nuo ou im did a-go ded.)

column1: The crowd answered Him, “We have heard from the law that the Christ remains forever. Why do You say, ‘The Son of Man must be lifted up’? Who is this Son of Man?”|So di kroud se tu im se, “Di Laa tel wi se di Krais gweehn stie fi eva, so ou yu a taak bout, ‘Di Man we Gad Pik a-go get lif op’? A uu a dis ya ‘Man we Gad Pik’?”

Then Jesus said to them, “Yet a little while the light is with you. Walk while you have the light, lest darkness overtake you. He who walks in darkness does not know where he is going.|Den Jiizas se tu dem se, “Unu a-go av di lait wid unu fi onggl likl bit langga. Waak wen unu av di lait, bifuo daaknis tek unu uova. Sumadi we a waak iina daaknis no nuo wich paat im a go.

While you have light, believe in the light that you may become sons of light.” Jesus said these things, and departed and hid Himself from them.|Chos iina di wan we gi lait wail unu av im wid unu, chos iina im so unu kyan bi piipl we bilang tu di lait.”Afta Jiizas don taak, im lef go we go aid imself fram di kroud.
Though He had done so many signs before them, yet they did not believe in Him.|Aal afta wen Jiizas du di uol a dem powaful sitn de infronta di piipl dem, dem stil mek op dem main fi no chos iina im.

This fulfilled the word spoken by Isaiah the prophet:“Lord, who has believed our report,and to whom has the arm of the Lord been revealed?”|Dis ya apm fi mek we Aizaiya di prafit did se kom chuu. Im se,“Laad, uu biliiv wa wi tel dem se?A uu di Laad shuo im powa tu?”
Therefore they could not believe. For Isaiah said again:|An dem kudn chos iina im kaaz jos laik wa Aizaiya se a wan neks plies,

“He has blinded their eyesand hardened their hearts,lest they should see with their eyesand perceive with their hearts and turn,and I would heal them.”|“Gad blain deman im mek dem aat tof,so dem kyan niida si wid dem yai,ar andastan iina dem main,ar ton tu mi, Gad, an chienj dem wiez so mi go mek dem get beta.”
Isaiah said this when he saw His glory and spoke of Him.|Aizaiya se dem sitn ya, kaaz im did si ou Krais big an powaful. Im did si an taak bout im.

Yet many of the rulers also believed in Him. But because of the Pharisees they did not confess Him, lest they be put out of the synagogue.|A di sed taim stil, uol iip a piipl, aal som a di Juu liida dem, chos iina im. Bot dem wudn se dem biliiv se Jiizas a di Krais, kaa dem did fried a di Farisii dem we wuda chuo dem outa di Juu choch.
For they loved the praise of men more than the praise of God.|Yu si, dem did rada big op fram piipl muo dan fram Gad.

Jesus cried out, “He who believes in Me believes not only in Me, but in Him who sent Me.|Den Jiizas shout out pan tap a im vais an se, “Di sumadi we chos iina mi no chos iina mi wan, im chos iina di wan we sen mi kom ya tu.
He who sees Me sees Him who sent Me. |Dem we si mi, si di wan we sen mi kom ya tu.
I have come as a light into the world, that whoever believes in Me should not remain in darkness.|Mi kom iina di worl laka wan lait, so dat dem we chos iina mi no gweehn tan iina daaknis.

“If anyone hears My words and does not believe, I do not judge him. For I did not come to judge the world, but to save the world. |“Ef enibadi ier wa mi se bot no du wa mi tel dem fi du, mi naa go rait dem aaf, kaa mi neehn kom ya fi rait aaf di piipl dem iina di worl; mi kom ya fi siev dem.

He who rejects Me, and does not receive My words, has that which judges him. The word I have spoken will judge him on the last day. |Yu av wan joj fi di piipl dem we ton dem bak pan mi, an no lisn tu wa mi se. Di sopm dem we mi se gweehn joj dem pan di laas die.

For I have not spoken on My own authority, but the Father who sent Me gave Me a command, what I should say and what I should speak.|Kaa di sopm dem we mi se, mi no se pan mi uon, a di faada we sen mi kom ya, a im tel mi we mi fi se an ou fi se it.
I know that His command is eternal life. Therefore what I say, I say as the Father tells me.”|An mi nuo se we im tel mi fi du gweehn mek piipl liv fi eva. So wa mi se a jos wa di Faada tel mi fi se.”

Now before the Passover Feast, ­Jesus knew that His hour had come to depart from this world to the Father. Having loved His own who were in the world, He loved them to the end.|Nou a did jos bifuo di Paasuova Alidie, an Jiizas did nuo se di taim wen im wuda lef di worl an go we tu im Faada did kom. Im did lov dem we did a fi im iina di worl, an da taim ya im shuo dem ou im did riili riili lov dem.

Now supper being concluded, the devil had put into the heart of Judas Iscariot, Simon’s son, to betray Him. |Sopa did a sorv, an di devl did don put it iina Juudas, Saiman bwai pikni, aat fi sel out Jiizas.

Jesus, knowing that the Father had given all things into His hands and that He came from God and was going to God|Nou, Jiizas did nuo se di Faada did gi im powa uova evriting, dat a Gad im kom fram, an dat a Gad im a go bak tu
rose from supper, laid aside His garments, and took a towel and wrapped Himself.|so im get op fram roun di tiebl, tek aaf im ruob an rap wan towil roun im wies.

After that, He poured water into a basin and began to wash the disciples’ feet and to wipe them with the towel with which He was wrapped.|Afta im du dat de, im chuo waata iina wan biesn an staat fi wash im falara dem fut. Im den jrai dem aaf wid di towil we im did rap roun im wies.
Then He came to Simon Peter, and Peter said to Him, “Lord, are You washing my feet?”|Wen im kech a Saiman Piita, Saiman Piita tel im se, “Laad, yu a go wash fi mi fut dem?”
Jesus answered him, “You do not understand what I am doing now. But later you will understand.”|So Jiizas se tu im se, “Yu no get wa mi a du rait ya nou, bot yu wi andastan afta dem sitn ya apm.”

Peter said to Him, “You shall never wash my feet!”Jesus answered him, “If I do not wash you, you have no part with Me.”|Piita se, “Nuo sa! Yu no gweehn wash mi fut dem!”Bot Jiizas ansa im se, “Ef mi no wash yu, yu na'av no lat an paat wid mi.”
Simon Peter said to Him, “Lord, not my feet only, but also my hands and my head!”|So Saiman Piita se, “Laad, no onggl wash mi fut dem! Wash mi ed an mi an dem tu!”

Jesus said to him, “He who is bathed needs only to wash his feet, but is completely clean. You are clean, but not all of you.”|Jiizas ansa an se, “Sumadi we bied aredi onggl afi wash im fut, kaa im uol badi wuda kliin aredi. Unu kliin, bot a no aal a unu kliin.”
For He knew who would betray Him. Therefore He said, “Not all of you are clean.”|(Im se so, kaa im did don nuo di wan we did a go sel im out. A dat mek im se, “A no aal a unu kliin”.)

So when He had washed their feet, and put on His garments, and sat down again, He said to them, “Do you know what I have done to you?|Wen Jiizas don wash im falara dem fut, im put aan bak im ruob an go bak go sidong roun di tiebl. Im den aks dem se, “Unu get we mi dis du tu unu?
You call Me Teacher and Lord. You speak accurately, for so I am.|Unu kaal mi ‘Tiicha’ an unu kaal mi ‘Laad,’ an unu rait, kaa mi a dat fi chuu.
If I then, your Lord and Teacher, have washed your feet, you also ought to wash one another’s feet. |Nou, ef mi, we a unu Laad an unu Tiicha, wash unu fut, unu mos wash unu wan aneda fut tu.
For I have given you an example, that you should do as I have done to you. |Mi a set egzampl fi unu fala. Wa mi du fu'unu, unu fi du fu'unu wan aneda.

Truly, truly I say to you, a servant is not greater than his master, nor is he who is sent greater than he who sent him. |Mi a tel unu fi chuu chuu, no sorvant no biga dan im maasta, an no mesinja no biga dan di sumadi we sen im.
If you know these things, blessed are you if you do them.|Ef unu andastan an du dem sopm ya wa mi a se, Gad a-go bles unu.

“I do not speak concerning all of you. I know whom I have chosen, but that the Scripture may be fulfilled, ‘He who eats bread with Me has lifted up his heel against Me.’|“Wa mi a se a no bout aal a unu. Mi don nuo wich wan a unu mi pik aredi. Bot wa Gad wod se afi kom chuu. It se dat, ‘Di sumadi we nyam fi mi uona bred ton gens mi.’
“Now I tell you before it happens, that when it does happen, you may believe that I am He.|Mi a tel unu dem sitn ya nou bifuo dem apm, so dat wen dem du apm, unu wi biliiv se mi a uu mi se mi bi.

Truly, truly I say to you, he who receives whomever I send receives Me. And he who receives Me receives Him who sent Me.”|Fi chuu chuu mi a tel unu se, enibadi we tek iin di sumadi mi sen tek mi iin tu, an enibadi we tek mi iin tek iin di wan we sen mi kom.”

When Jesus had said this, He was troubled in spirit, and testified, “Truly, truly I say to you that one of you will betray Me.”|Wen Jiizas don se dis ya, im aat get evi an im se, “Fi chuu chuu mi a tel unu se, wan a unu gweehn sel mi out.”
The disciples looked at one another, uncertain of whom He spoke. |So im falara dem staat luk pan dem wan aneda kaa wa Jiizas se tu dem did a bada dem ed.
Now there was leaning against Jesus’ bosom one of His disciples whom Jesus loved. |Wan a dem, di wan we Jiizas did wel lov, did de a di tiebl a sidong saida im.
Therefore Simon Peter motioned to him to ask who it was of whom He spoke.
column2: So Saiman Piita mek sain tu di falara we Jiizas lov an tel im fi aks Jiizas a wich wan a dem im a taak bout.

column1: Leaning back against Jesus’ bosom, he said to Him, “Lord, who is it?”|Di falara liin bak pan Jiizas ches, an aks im se, “Laad, a uu?”

Jesus answered, “It is he to whom I shall give a piece of bread when I have dipped it.” When He had dipped the bread, He gave it to Judas Iscariot, the son of Simon. |So Jiizas ansa an se, “A di wan we mi gweehn gi da piis a bred ya afta mi dip it iina di boul.” Den, wen im dip di bred iina di boul im gi it tu Juudas Iskyariyat, Saiman bwai pikni.

After receiving the piece of bread, Satan entered him.Then Jesus said to him, “What you are going to do, do quickly.”|An siem taim Juudas tek di bred so, Sietan tek uova im aat.“Mikies an du we yu bout fi du,” Jiizas se tu im.
But no one at the table knew why He said this to him.
column2: Bot non a dem we did sidong a di tiebl did nuo wa mek Jiizas did tel Juudas dat de.

column1: Since Judas had the moneybox, some thought that Jesus said to him, “Buy what we need for the feast,” or that he should give something to the poor. |Bot chuu Juudas did inchaaj a di chred bag, som a dem did tingk se Jiizas did a tel im fi go bai aal a wa dem did fi get fi di Bred Widout Yiis Alidie, ar fi go gi sitn outa it tu puo piipl.
Having received the piece of bread, he then left immediately. And it was night.|Juudas tek di bred an im go we sed taim. (Nou, a did nait.)

When he had gone out, Jesus then said, “Now is the Son of Man glorified, and in Him God is glorified.|Afta wen Juudas lef go we, Jiizas se, “Gad gweehn shuo ou di Man we im Pik big an powaful, an Gad gweehn yuuz im fi shuo ou im Gad big an powaful.

If God is glorified in Him, God will also glorify Him in Himself and will immediately glorify Him.|Ef di Man we Gad Pik shuo piipl ou Gad big an powaful, den suun suun Gad imself gweehn shuo dem ou di Man we im Pik big an powaful.

“Little children, yet a little while I am with you. You will seek Me. And as I said to the Jews, so now I tell you, ‘Where I am going, you cannot come.’|“Mi pikni, mi a-go de ya wid unu fi onggl likl bit langga. Unu gweehn luk fi mi, bot jos laik wa mi did se tu di Juu liida dem mi a tel unu di sed ting, ‘Wich paat mi de go, unu kyaahn kom de.’

“A new commandment I give to you, that you love one another, even as I have loved you, that you also love one another.|“Mi a tel unu fi du sopm nyuu — lov unu wan aneda. Sed wie mi lov unu, a so unu fi lov unu wan aneda.
By this all men will know that you are My disciples, if you have love for one another.”|Wen unu lov unu wan aneda, a so piipl gweehn nuo se unu a fi mi falara.”

Simon Peter said to Him, “Lord, where are You going?”Jesus answered him, “Where I am going, you cannot follow Me now. But you shall follow Me afterward.”|Saiman Piita aks im se, “Laad, a we yu a go?”Jiizas ansa im se, “Yu kyaahn fala mi go wich paat mi a go rait ya nou, bot yu wi kom likl muo.”
Peter said to Him, “Lord, why can I not follow You now? I will lay down my life for Your sake.”|So Piita aks im se, “Laad, wa mek mi kyaahn fala yu nou? Mi wuda ded fi yu.”

Jesus answered Him, “Will you lay down your life for My sake? Truly, truly I say to you, the rooster shall not crow until you have denied Me three times.”|Bot Jiizas se tu im se, “Yu wuda ded fi mi fi chuu? Mi naa lai yu, bot bifuo di ruusta kruo, yu gweehn se yu no nuo mi chrii taim!”
Let not your heart be troubled. You believe in God. Believe also in Me.|“No wori unuself. Chos iina Gad, an chos iina mi tu.

In My Father’s house are many dwelling places. If it were not so, I would have told you. I am going to prepare a place for you.|A nof ruum iina mi Faada ous. Ef a neehn so it go mi wudn se notn tu unu. Mi a go we fi fiks op wan plies fi unu.

And if I go and prepare a place for you, I will come again and receive you to Myself, that where I am, you may be also. |An afta mi go we go fiks it op, mi gweehn kom bak kom tek unu kyari go we wid mi, so dat unu kyan de wid mi eniwe mi de.
You know where I am going, and you know the way.”|Unu nuo di wie fi go wich paat mi a go.”

Thomas said to Him, “Lord, we do not know where You are going. How can we know the way?”|Tamas den se tu im se, “Laad, wi no nuo di wie fi go wich paat yu de go. Ou wi kyan get fi nuo di wie fi go de?”

Jesus said to him, “I am the way, the truth, and the life. No one comes to the Father except through Me. |Jiizas ansa im an se, “Mi a di wie, mi a di chuut, mi a di wan we mek piipl kyan liv. Nobadi kyaahn go tu di Faada ef dem no go chuu mi.

If you had known Me, you would have known My Father also. From now on you do know Him and have seen Him.”|Nou ef unu nuo mi fi chuu, den unu wuda nuo mi Faada tu. Fram nou aan, unu nuo im an unu si'im.”
Philip said to Him, “Lord, show us the Father, and that is sufficient for us.”|Filip se, “Laad, mek wi si di Faada an wi wi satisfai wid dat.”

Jesus said to him, “Have I been with you such a long time, and yet you have not known Me, Philip? He who has seen Me has seen the Father. So how can you say, ‘Show us the Father’? |So Jiizas se tu im se: “Yu no nuo mi, Filip, afta mi de mongks unu fi so lang? Enibadi we si mi si di Faada tu. Ou yu fi a aks mi se, ‘Shuo wi di Faada’?

Do you not believe that I am in the Father and the Father is in Me? The words that I say to you I do not speak on My own authority. But the Father who lives in Me does the works.|Yu no biliiv se mi liv iina di Faada, an di Faada liv iina mi? Di sitn dem we mi se mi no jos se dem aafa mi uon. A di Faada we liv iina mi a du im wok.

Believe Me that I am in the Father, and the Father is in Me. Or else believe Me on account of the works themselves. |Chos mi wen mi se mi liv iina di Faada an dat di Faada liv iina mi. An ef unu kyaahn biliiv mi siek-a wa mi se, den biliiv mi siek-a di mirikl dem we unu si.

Truly, truly I say to you, he who believes in Me will do the works that I do also. And he will do greater works than these, because I am going to My Father.|Fi chuu chuu mi a tel unu se enibadi we biliiv iina mi a-go wok di powaful mirikl dem we mi a du. Dem aal a-go wok muo powaful mirikl dan wa mi du nou, kaa mi a go baka di Faada.

I will do whatever you ask in My name, that the Father may be glorified in the Son. |An mi wi du eniting unu aks fa kaa unu a mi falara. Mi gweehn dwi'it so dat di Bwai Pikni kyan get fi shuo ou di Faada big an powaful.
If you ask anything in My name, I will do it.|Unu kyan aks mi fi eniting kaa unu a mi falara, an mi wi gi'it tu unu.
“If you love Me, keep My commandments. |“Ef unu lov mi fi chuu, unu gweehn du aal a wa mi tel unu fi du.
I will pray the Father, and He will give you another Counselor, that He may be with you forever:|An mi a-go aks mi Faada fi sen wan neda sumadi fi elp unu an de wid unu aal di taim.

the Spirit of truth, whom the world cannot receive, for it does not see Him, neither does it know Him. But you know Him, for He lives with you, and will be in you. |Da sumadi de a di Spirit we shuo piipl di chuu sitn dem bout Gad. Di worliyan dem kyaahn tek im iin an mek im kanchuol dem laif, kaa dem no si im an dem no nuo im. Bot unu nuo im, kaaz im liv wid unu an a-go de insaida unu.
I will not leave you fatherless. I will come to you.
column2: “Mi naa go lef unu laik se unu a pikni widout no mada ar faada. Mi a kom bak tu unu.

column1: Yet a little while and the world will see Me no more. But you will see Me. Because I live, you will live also. |Likl muo fram nou, di worliyan dem naa go si mi agen, bot unu gweehn si mi. Kaa mi a liv, unu gweehn liv tu.
On that day you will know that I am in My Father, and you are in Me, and I am in you. |Wen da die de kom, unu a-go si se mi liv iina mi Faada, dat unu liv iina mi an dat mi liv iina unu.

He who has My commandments and keeps them is the one who loves Me. And he who loves Me will be loved by My Father. And I will love him and will reveal Myself to him.”|Di sumadi we nuo an du wa mi se, a dem lov mi. Mi Faada a-go lov di sumadi we lov mi. Mi a-go lov dem tu, an mi gweehn shuo dem a uu mi bi.”

Then Judas (not Iscariot) said to Him, “Lord, how is it that You will reveal Yourself to us, but not to the world?”|Den Juudas — no Juudas Iskyariyat nou, wan neks man we niem Juudas tu — aks im se, “Bot, Laad, wa mek wi a-go kyan si yu, bot yu naa go mek di worliyan dem si yu?”

Jesus answered him, “If a man loves Me, he will keep My word. My Father will love him, and We will come to him, and make Our home with him.|Jiizas se tu im se, “Ef sumadi lov mi den da sumadi de a-go du wa mi se dem fi du. Mi Faada a-go lov dem, an di tuu a wi a-go liv wid dem.

He who does not love Me does not keep My words. The word which you hear is not Mine, but the Father’s who sent Me.|Sumadi we no lov mi, no du wa mi se. Di sitn dem unu ier mi se, a no mi kom op wid dem; a mi Faada, di wan we sen mi kom ya.
“I have spoken these things to you while I am still with you.
column2: “Mi a se dem sitn ya tu unu wail mi de mongks unu.

column1: But the Counselor, the Holy Spirit, whom the Father will send in My name, will teach you everything and remind you of all that I told you. |Bot di elpa, di Uoli Spirit, we di Faada gweehn sen kaa unu a mi falara, im a-go tiich unu evriting an im a-go memba unu bout evriting mi tel unu.

Peace I leave with you. My peace I give to you. Not as the world gives do I give to you. Let not your heart be troubled, neither let it be afraid.|“Mi a lef go we, bot mi a-go mek unu av piis iina unu aat — di kain-a piis we mi av iina fi mi aat. A no di sed kain-a piis yu get fram di worl. No mek unu aat bada unu, an no kech unu fried.

“You have heard Me say to you, ‘I am going away and am returning to you.’ If you loved Me, you would rejoice because I said, ‘I am going to the Father,’ for My Father is greater than I. |Unu ier mi tel unu se, ‘Mi a go we an mi a kom bak tu unu.’ Ef unu lov mi, unu wuda glad se mi a go a mi Faada, kaa mi Faada biga dan mi.
Now I have told you before it happens so that, when it happens, you may believe.|Mi a tel unu bifuo it apm, so dat wen it du apm unu kyan biliiv se a chuu mi did de taak.

After this I will not speak much with you, for the ruler of this world is coming. He has no power over Me|Mi naa go taak tu unu fi moch langga, kaa di ruula fi da worl ya de pan im wie a kom. Im no av no powa uova mi.

But I do as the Father has commanded Me so that the world may know that I love the Father.“Rise, let us go from here.|Mi onggl a du wa mi Faada tel mi fi du, so dat di piipl dem iina di worl kyan nuo se mi lov mi Faada.“Kom! Mek wi lef go we fram da plies ya.”
“I am the true vine, and My Father is the vinedresser. |“Mi a wan chrii, di riil chrii we gud fruut gruo pan, an mi Faada a di gyaadna we luk aafa di chrii.

Every branch in Me that bears no fruit, He takes away. And every branch that bears fruit, He prunes, that it may bear more fruit.|Im brok aaf aafa mi aal a di lim dem we no bier fruut. An im chrim op di lim dem we bier fruut so dat dem kyan bier muo.
You are already clean through the word which I have spoken to you.|Unu get chrim op aredi, an a di sitn dem we mi tel unu mek dat apm.

Remain in Me, as I also remain in you. As the branch cannot bear fruit by itself, unless it remains in the vine, neither can you, unless you remain in Me.|Tan wid mi, an mi wi tan wid unu. Wan branch kyaahn bier fruut pan it uon; it afi tan pan di chrii. A siem wie unu naa go kyan bier fruut ef unu no tan wid mi.

“I am the vine, you are the branches. He who remains in Me, and I in him, bears much fruit. For without Me you can do nothing.|“Mi a di chrii; unu a di lim dem. Evri lim we a paat a mi — an we mi a paat a — dem bier nof fruut. Unu kyaahn du wan ting widout mi.

If a man does not remain in Me, he is thrown out as a branch and withers. And they gather them and throw them into the fire, and they are burned. |Ef sumadi no tan pan mi, dem komiin laka di lim dem we get fling we an den jrai op. Piipl pik op dem lim de, fling dem iina faiya an bon dem op.

If you remain in Me, and My words remain in you, you will ask whatever you desire, and it shall be done for you.|Ef unu tan pan mi an ef wa mi se tan iina unu, aks fi eniting unu waahn, an unu wi get it.
My Father is glorified by this, that you bear much fruit; so you will be My disciples.|Wen unu bier nof fruut an shuo se unu a fi mi falara, da wie de mi Faada get nof rispek.
“As the Father loved Me, I also loved you. Remain in My love. |Mi lov unu jos laka ou mi Faada lov mi. No ton we fram di lov we mi av fi unu.

If you keep My commandments, you will remain in My love, even as I have kept My Father’s commandments and remain in His love.|Ef unu du wa mi tel unu fi du den unu naa go ton we fram di lov mi av fi unu, siem laka ou mi du wa mi Faada tel mi fi du an no ton we fram di lov we im av fi mi.
I have spoken these things to you, that My joy may remain in you, and that your joy may be full. |Mi a tel unu aal a dem sitn ya, so unu wi glad iina unu aat siem laka ou mi glad iina fi mi.
This is My commandment: that you love one another, as I have loved you. |“Dis ya a wa mi waahn unu fi du: lov unu wan aneda siem laka ou mi lov unu.
Greater love has no man than this: that a man lay down his life for his friends.
column2: Di bes wie sumadi kyan shuo se dem lov dem fren a fi gi op dem laif fi dem.

column1: You are My friends if you do whatever I command you.
column2: Ef unu du wa mi tel unu fi du den mi an unu a fren.

column1: I no longer call you servants, for a servant does not know what his master does. But I have called you friends, for everything that I have heard from My Father have I made known to you. |Mi naa kaal unu sorvant no muo, kaa sorvant no nuo dem maasta bizniz. Mi a kaal unu mi fren, kaa mi mek unu nuo bout evriting mi Faada tiich mi.

You did not choose Me, but I chose you, and appointed you, that you should go and bear fruit, and that your fruit should remain, that the Father may give you whatever you ask Him in My name. |“A no unu pik mi, a mi pik unu an put unu wan said fi bier nof fruut — di kain-a fruut we a-go laas fi eva. Wen dat apm, mi Faada gweehn gu'unu eniting unu aks im fa kaa unu a mi falara.
This I command you: that you love one another.
column2: A da sopm ya mi a tel unu fi du: lov unu wan aneda.

column1: “If the world hates you, you know that it hated Me before it hated you.|“Ef di piipl dem iina di worl iet unu, memba se dem did iet mi fos.

If you were of the world, the world would love you as its own. But because you are not of the world, since I chose you out of the world, the world therefore hates you.|Ef unu did komiin laka di piipl dem iina di worl, dem wuda lov unu laka ou dem lov dem uona piipl. Bot unu no komiin laka di piipl iina di worl, kaa mi pik unu out fram mongks dem. A it mek dem iet unu.

Remember the word that I said to you: ‘A servant is not greater than his master.’ If they persecuted Me, they will also persecute you. If they kept My words, they will keep yours also.|Memba we mi did tel unu se, ‘No sorvant no biga dan im maasta.’ Ef dem mek mi sofa den dem mos a-go mek unu sofa tu. Ef dem du wa mi tiich dem fi du, dem a-go du wa unu tiich dem fi du tu.

But all these things they will do to you for My name’s sake, because they do not know Him who sent Me. |Bot dem a-go du aal a dem sitn ya tu unu chuu unu a fi mi, an kaa dem no nuo di wan we sen mi kom ya.

If I had not come and spoken to them, they would not have had sin. But now they have no excuse for their sin.|Ef mi neehn kom an taak tu dem, dem wudn gilti a notn rang. Bot rait ya nou, dem na'av notn fi yuuz an se dem no gilti.
He who hates Me hates My Father also. |Enibadi we iet mi, iet mi Faada tu.

If I had not performed among them the works which no one else did, they would have no sin. But now have they seen and hated both My Father and Me. |Dem wudn gilti ef mi neehn du di powaful sitn dem we dem neva si nobadi els du. Bot nou dem si dem powaful sitn ya, an dem iet mi an mi Faada siem wie.
But that the word which is written in their law might be fulfilled, ‘They hated Me without a cause.’|Bot dis ya apm so dat wa rait dong iina Gad wod wuda kom chuu. It se, ‘Dem iet mi fi notn at aal.’

“But when the Counselor comes, whom I shall send to you from the Father, the Spirit of truth who proceeds from the Father, He will bear witness of Me.|“Mi a-go sen di Elpa fram di Faada tu unu. Im a di Spirit we shuo piipl di chuu sitn dem bout Gad, an im a di wan we kom fram di Faada. Wen im kom, im gweehn tel piipl bout mi.
And you also will bear witness, because you have been with Me from the beginning.|An unu fi tel piipl bout mi tu, kaa unu did de wid mi fram di staat.
“I have spoken these things to you so that you will not fall away.
column2: “Mi a tel unu dem sitn ya so dat unu no tap biliiv iina mi.

column1: They will put you out of the synagogues. Yes, the time is coming that whoever kills you will think that he is offering a service to God. |Dem a-go ron unu outa di Juu dem Choch. Di taim aal a kom wen sumadi a-go kil unu an tingk se dem a du sitn gud fi Gad.
They will do these things to you, because they have not known the Father nor Me.|Dem a-go du aal a dem sitn ya, kaa dem no nuo mi ar mi Faada.

I have told you these things, so that when the time comes, you may remember that I told you about them. “I did not tell you these things at the beginning, because I was with you.|Mi a tel unu dem sitn ya, so dat wen di taim kom, unu wi memba se mi did waan unu. “Mi neehn tel unu bout aal a dem sitn ya fram di staat, kaa mi did stil de mongks unu.
But now I am going to Him who sent Me, and none of you asks Me, ‘Where are You going?’ |Bot rait ya nou, mi a go tu di wan we sen mi kom ya, an non a unu no aks mi se, ‘A we paat yu a go?’
Rather, sorrow has filled your heart because I have told you these things. |Bot unu aat evi dong, kaa mi tel unu dem sitn ya.

Nevertheless I tell you the truth: It is expedient for you that I go away. For if I do not go away, the Counselor will not come to you. But if I go, I will send Him to you. |Bot mi a tel unu fi chuu chuu se dat a fi fu'unu uona gud dat mi a go we. Kaa ef mi no go we, di Elpa naa go kom tu unu. Bot ef mi go we mi a-go sen im kom tu unu.

When He comes, He will convict the world of sin and of righteousness and of judgment: |Wen im kom, im gweehn mek di piipl dem iina di worl nuo se dem rang bout sin, dat dem rang bout ou sumadi kyan get rait iina Gad yai an rang bout ou Gad joj piipl.
of sin, because they do not believe in Me;|Dem rang bout sin, kaa dem no chos iina mi.

of righteousness, because I am going to My Father, and you will see Me no more;|Dem rang bout Gad an bout uu an wa rait iina Gad yai, kaa, luk ya no, mi a go a mi Faada duo piipl tingk se mi a sina. Mi a go baka mi Faada an unu naa go si mi no muo.
and of judgment, because the ruler of this world stands condemned.|An dem rang bout ou Gad joj piipl, kaa di wan we ron tingz iina di worl, Gad rait im aaf aredi.
“I have yet many things to tell you, but you cannot bear them now. |“Mi av nof muo sitn fi se tu unu, muo dan unu kyan tek iin rait ya nou.

But when the Spirit of truth comes, He will guide you into all truth. For He will not speak on His own authority. But He will speak whatever He hears, and He will tell you things that are to come.|Bot wen di Spirit we shuo di chuu sitn dem bout Gad kom, im gweehn mek unu nuo aal a di sitn dem we chuu. Im naa go taak aafa im uon. Im onggl a-go taak wa im ier mi Faada se, an im a-go tel unu wa a-go apm.
He will glorify Me, for He will receive from Me and will declare it to you.|Im a-go shuo ou mi big an powaful, kaaz im a-go ier wa mi se an tel unu it bak.

All that the Father has is Mine. Therefore I said that He will take what is Mine and will declare it to you.|Evriting we mi Faada uon, a fi mi tu. A dat mek mi se di Spirit a-go tek wa mi se an mek unu nuo it fi unuself.

“In a little while you will not see Me. And then after a little while you will see Me, because I am going to the Father.”|“Likl bit fram nou unu naa go si mi no muo, den likl bit afta dat unu gweehn si mi.”

Then some of His disciples said among themselves, “What is this He is telling us: ‘In a little while you will not see Me; and then after a little while you will see Me,’ and, ‘because I am going to the Father’? ”|Wen Jiizas don se dat, som a im falara dem se tu dem wan aneda se, “A wa im miin wen im se, ‘Likl bit fram nou unu naa go si mi no muo, den likl bit afta dat unu gweehn si mi’? An wa im miin wen im se, ‘Kaa mi a go a mi Faada’?”
Then they said, “What is this He is telling us: ‘In a little while’? We do not know what He is saying.”|Dem kip aan a aks aks, “A wa im miin wen im se, ‘Likl bit fram nou’? Wi no get we im a se.”

Then Jesus knew that they wanted to ask Him. So He said to them, “Do you inquire among yourselves concerning what I said: ‘In a little while you will not see Me; and then after a little while you will see Me’? |Jiizas si se dem did waahn aks im bout it, so im se tu dem se, “A wa mi dis se unu a aks unu wan aneda bout, ‘Likl bit fram nou unu naa go si mi no muo, den likl bit afta dat unu gweehn si mi’?

Truly, truly I say to you that you will weep and lament, but the world will rejoice. You will be sorrowful, but your sorrow will be turned into joy.|Mi a tel unu fi chuu chuu se unu gweehn ala an baal, bot di piipl dem iina di worl a-go wel api. Unu a-go sad, bot dat a-go chienj an unu a-go wel glad.

When a woman is giving birth, she has pain, because her hour has come. But as soon as she delivers the child, she no longer remembers the anguish for joy that a child is born into the world. |Wen wan uman a av pikni shi iina uol iip a pien, kaa di taim fi shi av pikni kom. Bot wen shi av ar pikni, shi no memba di pien agen siek-a ou shi glad se sumadi baan kom iina di worl.

Therefore you now have sorrow. But I will see you again, and your heart will rejoice, and no one will take your joy from you.|A sed wie so it go wid unu: Unu iina pien nou, bot mi gweehn si unu agen, an unu a-go glad iina unu aat, an nobadi kyaahn go mek unu no api agen.

On that day you will ask Me nothing. Truly, truly I say to you, whatever you ask the Father in My name, He will give it to you. |Da taim de, unu naa go aks mi notn agen. Mi a tel unu fi chuu chuu se mi Faada gweehn gi unu eniting unu aks fa kaa unu a mi falara.

Until now you have asked nothing in My name. Ask, and you will receive, that your joy may be full.|Aal nou unu no aks fi notn kaa unu a mi falara. Aks an unu wi get we unu aks fa, so dat unu kyan riili riili api.

“I have told you these things in proverbs. But the time is coming when I will no longer speak to you in proverbs, for I will speak to you plainly about the Father. |“Mi a yuuz picha langwij tel unu dem sitn ya. Taim a kom wen mi naa go taak da wie ya agen. Mi a-go taak tu unu plien an chriet bout mi Faada.

On that day you will ask in My name. I am not saying to you that I shall ask the Father on your behalf. |Da die de, unu gweehn aks fi tingz kaa unu a mi falara. Mi naa se mi gweehn aks mi Faada fi notn fi unu.
For the Father Himself loves you, because you have loved Me, and have believed that I came from God.|Nuo, kaa mi Faada lov unu, kaaz unu lov mi an unu biliiv se a Gad mi kom fram.

I came from the Father and have come into the world. As I said, I am leaving the world and am going to the Father.”|Mi lef fram wich paat mi Faada de an kom iina di worl. Rait ya nou, mi a lef di worl fi go baka mi Faada.”
His disciples said to Him, “Yes! Now You are speaking plainly and with no figure of speech.|Den im falara dem se tu im se, “Si'it de, a nou yu a taak plien an chriet an naa taak iina picha langwij!

Now we know that You know everything and do not need anyone to question You. By this we believe that You came from God.”|A nou wi nuo se yu nuo evriting, an yu no niid nobadi fi aks yu notn. Siek-a dat, wi biliiv se a Gad sen yu kom iina di worl.”
Jesus answered them, “Do you now believe?|“Unu biliiv mi nou?” Jiizas se tu dem.

Listen, the hour is coming. Yes, it has now come that you will be scattered, each to his own home, and will leave Me alone. Yet I am not alone, for the Father is with Me.|“Unu luk! Di taim a kom — an it de ya aredi — wen aal a unu a-go skyata an go a unu yaad. Unu a-go lef mi wan. Bot mi no de pan mi uon, kaa mi Faada de ya wid mi.

“I have told you these things so that in Me you may have peace. In the world you will have tribulation. But be of good cheer. I have overcome the world.”|“Mi tel unu dem sitn ya so dat unu kyan av piis iina unu aat kaa mi an unu a wan. Iina da worl ya, unu gweehn av chobl an sofarieshan. Bot no fret! Mi don win di fait wid di worl.”

When Jesus spoke these words, He lifted His eyes toward heaven and said:“Father, the hour has come. Glorify Your Son, that Your Son may also glorify You. |Afta Jiizas don se dem sitn ya, im luk op iina di skai an prie tu Gad se:“Faada, di taim kom nou. Shuo evribadi ou yu Bwai Pikni big an powaful, so im kyan shuo dem ou yu big an powaful.

As You have given Him authority over all flesh, He will give eternal life to all whom You have given Him.|Kaa yu gi yu Bwai Pikni powa uova evribadi, so dat im kyan mek di piipl dem we yu gi tu im liv fi eva.

This is eternal life: that they may know You, the only true God, and Jesus Christ, whom You have sent.|Fi liv fi eva miin se dem nuo yu, di onggl wan we a riili Gad, an dat dem nuo Jiizas Krais, di wan yu sen kom.
I have glorified You on the earth. I have finished the work You have given Me to do.|Mi shuo piipl pan ort ou yu big an powaful, wen mi du di wok we yu did gi mi fi du.

And now, O Father, glorify Me in Your own presence with the glory which I had with You before the world existed.|So, Faada, rait we yu de nou, mek mi get nof rispek, di sed kain-a rispek mi did av wen mi did de de wid yu fram bifuo di worl did mek.

“I have revealed Your name to the men whom You have given Me out of the world. They were Yours, and You gave them to Me, and they have kept Your word. |“Di piipl dem fram outa di worl we yu gi mi, mi shuo dem a uu yu bi. Dem did a fi yu bot yu gi mi dem, an dem fala we yu tel dem fi du.
Now they know that all things You have given Me are from You.|Nou dem nuo se evriting we mi av kom fram yu,

For I have given them the words which You gave Me. They have received them and certainly know that I came from You, and they have believed that You sent Me.|kaa mi tel dem bak evriting we yu tel mi an dem biliiv it. Dem nuo fi shuor se a yu mi kom fram an dem biliiv se a yu sen mi kom.

I pray for them. I do not pray for the world, but for those whom You have given Me. For they are Yours.|Mi a prie fi dem. Mi naa prie fi di worliyan dem. Mi a prie fi dem we yu gi mi, kaa dem a fi yu.
All that are Mine are Yours, and all that are Yours are Mine. And I am glorified in them. |Aal a we mi av a fi yu, an aal a we yu av a fi mi. An dem shuo ou mi big an powaful.

I am to be no longer in the world, though these are in the world, for I am coming to You. Holy Father, through Your name keep those whom You have given Me, that they may be one as We are one. |“Mi naa go de iina di worl no langga. Mi a kom tu yu, bot dem stil a-go de iina di worl. Faada we uoli, yuuz yu powa an gyaad dem — di powa we yu gi mi — yuuz it an gyaad dem, so dem kyan ton wan, siem laka ou mi an yu a wan.

While I was with them in the world, I kept them in Your name. I have kept those whom You have given Me. And none of them is lost except the son of perdition, that the Scripture might be fulfilled.|Wen mi did de mongks dem, mi yuuz yu powa fi gyaad an kip dem sief — di powa we yu did gi mi. Non a dem neehn laas, onggl di wan we did baan fi ded an go a el. An dis ya apm so dat wa Gad wod se wuda kom chuu.

“But now I am coming to You, and I say these things in the world, that they may have My joy fulfilled in themselves.|“Mi a kom a yu nou, bot mi a se aal a dem sitn ya wail mi stil iina di worl, so dat dem kyan api kyaahn don jos laka ou mi api.

I have given them Your word. And the world has hated them because they are not of the world, just as I am not of the world. |Mi tel dem we yu tel mi fi tel dem, an di worliyan dem iet dem, kaa, jos laka mi, dem no worliyan.
I do not pray that You should take them out of the world, but that You should keep them from the evil one.|Mi naa prie an aks yu fi tek dem outa di worl, bot dat yu fi gyaad dem fram di wikid wan.
They are not of the world even as I am not of the world.
column2: Dem no worliyan siem laka ou mi no worliyan.

column1: Sanctify them by Your truth. Your word is truth.
column2: Yuuz di chuut mek dem liv fi yu. Fi yu mesij a di chuut.

column1: As You sent Me into the world, so I sent them into the world. |Siem laka ou yu sen mi kom iina di worl, a siem wie so mi sen dem iina di worl.
For their sakes I sanctify Myself, that they also may be sanctified by the truth.|A siek-a dem mek mi gi op miself fi sorv yu. Mi dwi'it so dem mait-a riili riili gi op demself fi sorv yu tu.

“I do not pray for these alone, but also for those who will believe in Me through their word|“Mi naa prie fi dem falara ya wan. Mi a prie fi dem we a-go biliiv iina mi wen dem ier wa dem falara ya se.

that they may all be one, as You, Father, are in Me, and I in You. May they also be one in Us, that the world may believe that You have sent Me.|Faada, mi prie se aal a dem kom tugeda iina wan, siem laka ou yu liv iina mi an mi liv iina yu. An mi prie tu se dem wi liv iina mi an yu, so dat di worliyan dem kyan biliiv se a yu sen mi kom.
I have given them the glory which You gave Me, that they may be one even as We are one:|Mi gi dem di uol iip a rispek yu did gi mi so dat dem kyan kom wan jos laka ou mi an yu a wan:

I in them and You in Me, that they may be perfect in unity, and that the world may know that You have sent Me, and have loved them as You have loved Me.|mi iina dem an yu iina mi — so dem kyan komiin laka wan, an so di piipl dem iina di worl mait-a nuo se a yu sen mi kom, an dat yu lov mi falara dem siem laka ou yu lov mi.

“Father, I desire that they also, whom You have given Me, be with Me where I am, that they may see My glory which You have given Me. For You loved Me before the creation of the world.|“Faada, mi waahn di piipl dem we yu gi mi fi de eniwe mi de, so dat dem kyan si di uol iip a rispek we yu gi mi, kaa yu lov mi fram bifuo di worl did mek.

“O righteous Father, the world has not known You, but I have known You, and these have known that You sent Me. |“Faada, we eva du rait, iivn duo di piipl dem iina di worl no nuo yu, mi nuo yu, an dem piipl ya nuo se a yu sen mi kom ya.

I have declared Your name to them, and will declare it, that the love with which You loved Me may be in them, and I in them.”|Mi mek dem nuo yu, an mi a-go gwaan mek dem nuo yu, so dat dem mait-a kyan lov dem wan aneda siem laka ou yu did lov mi, an so mi kyan liv iina dem.”

When Jesus had spoken these words, He went out with His disciples across the Kidron Valley. There was a garden which He and His disciples entered.|Afta Jiizas don prie, im an im falara dem kraas uova wan riva we dem kaal Kijran. Wan gyaadn did de de, an im an im falara dem go iin de.

Now Judas, who betrayed Him, also knew the place, for Jesus often met there with His disciples.|(Nou Juudas, di wan we sel out Jiizas, did nuo we di plies de, kaa a nof taim Jiizas yuus tu miit op wid im falara dem de.)

So Judas, having taken a detachment of soldiers and officers from the chief priests and Pharisees, came there with lanterns and torches and weapons.|So Juudas kom a di plies wid wan gruup a suoja. Di ed priis dem an di Farisii dem sen som a di man dem we gyaad Gad ous de tu. Di uol a dem go iina di gyaadn wid lamp, taach an aal saat a sitn fi fait wid.

Jesus therefore, knowing everything that would happen to Him, went forward and said to them, “Whom do you seek?”|So Jiizas nou, chuu im did don nuo wa did a go apm tu im, waak op tu dem an aks dem se, “A uu unu a luk fa?”

They answered Him, “Jesus of Nazareth.”Jesus said to them, “I am He.” And Judas, who betrayed Him, was standing with them.|“Jiizas we kom fram Nazaret,” dem se.“A mi dat,” Jiizas se tu dem. (Nou Juudas, di wan we sel im out did a tan op de wid dem.)
When He said, “I am He,” they drew back and fell to the ground.|So nou, wen Jiizas se, “A mi dat,” di suoja an di gyaad dem jraa bak an jrap a grong.
Again Jesus asked them, “Whom do you seek?”They said, “Jesus of Nazareth.”|Den Jiizas aks dem wan neda taim se, “A uu unu a luk fa?”An dem se agen se, “Wi a luk fi Jiizas we kom fram Nazaret.”

Jesus answered, “I told you that I am He. So then let these go their way if you are looking for Me.”|“Mi jos don tel unu se a mi im,” Jiizas se tu dem. “Ef a mi unu a luk fa, den mek dem man ya we de ya wid mi gwaan.”

This was to fulfill the word which He had spoken, “I have lost none of those whom You have given Me.”|Im se dis ya fi mek wa rait dong iina Gad wod kom chuu. It se, “No iivn wan a dem we yu gi mi, mi no laas.”

Then Simon Peter, having a sword, drew it and struck the high priest’s servant, and cut off his right ear. The servant’s name was Malchus.|Saiman Piita did av wan suod, an im jraa it out an chap aaf di rait iez a di sorvant fi di liida fi di priis dem. (Di sorvant did niem Malkos.)

Then Jesus said to Peter, “Put your sword into the sheath. Shall I not drink the cup which My Father has given Me?”|Bot Jiizas se tu Piita se, “Put bak yu suod iina it kies! Mi no fi jringk outa di kop we mi Faada gi mi fi jringk outa? Mi no fi sofa?”

Then the detachment of soldiers and the commander and the officers of the Jews arrested Jesus and bound Him. |Afta dat de apm, di suoja dem an dem liida plos di gyaad dem uol aan tu Jiizas an tai op im an dem.

First they led Him to Annas, for he was the father-in-law to Caiaphas, who was the high priest that year. |Dem tek im kyari go a Anas fos. Anas did a Kaiyafas faada-in-laa, an Kaiyafas did a di liida fi di priis dem fi da ier de.
Now it was Caiaphas who advised the Jews that it was expedient that one man should die for the people.
column2: (Nou Kaiyafas did a di wan we did tel di Juu liida dem se it wuda beta fi wan man ded fi di uol a di Juu piipl dem.)

column1: Simon Peter followed Jesus, and so did another disciple. That disciple was known to the high priest and went with Jesus into the courtyard of the high priest. |Saiman Piita an wan neks wan a Jiizas falara dem waak baka di suoja an gyaad dem, wen dem did a kyari Jiizas go a Anas. (Nou, da ada falara ya did nuo di liida fi di priis dem, an siek-a dat, im fala dem wen dem kyari Jiizas go a di liida fi di priis dem yaad.)

But Peter stood at the door outside. Then the other disciple, who was known to the high priest, went out and spoke to the doorkeeper and brought Peter in.|Bot Piita neehn go iin. Im tan outa duor a di giet. Di ada falara we did nuo di liida fi di priis dem kom bak out an taak tu di uman we did a wok a di giet an kyari Piita go insaid.

Then the servant girl, being the doorkeeper, said to Peter, “Are you not also one of this Man’s disciples?”He said, “I am not.”|“Yu a no wan a fi'im falara dem tu?” wan sliev gyal we did a wok a di giet aks Piita.“Nuo, mi no wan a dem,” im se tu ar.

Now the servants and officers stood there and warmed themselves, having made a fire of coals, for it was cold. Peter also stood with them and warmed himself.|(Nou it did wel kuol, an so di sorvant dem an di ed priis gyaad dem did a tan op roun wan faiya we dem did mek fi kip dem waam. Piita did tan op de wid dem tu, a waam op imself.)
The high priest then asked Jesus about His disciples and His teaching.|Siem taim dis ya did a gwaan, di liida fi di priis dem did a aks Jiizas kwestiyan bout im falara dem an bout wa im tiich.

Jesus answered him, “I spoke openly to the world. I always taught in the synagogue and in the temple, where the Jews always meet, and I said nothing in secret.|“Mi taak fi evribadi ier mi,” Jiizas se tu im. “Mi tiich iina di Juu dem choch an iina di yaad we Gad ous de — we paat di Juu piipl dem miit op tugeda. Mi no aid an se notn.
Why do you ask Me? Ask those who heard Me and what I have said to them. Certainly they know what I said.”
column2: Wa yu a aks mi dem sitn ya fa? Aks di piipl dem we ier wa mi se. Dem nuo wa mi se.”

column1: When He had said this, one of the officers who stood by struck Jesus with the palm of his hand, saying, “Is that how You answer the high priest?”|Wen Jiizas se dis ya, wan a di gyaad dem shat im a baks iina im fies. “A so yu taak tu di liida fi di priis dem?” im aks Jiizas.

Jesus answered him, “If I have spoken evil, bear witness of the evil, but if well, why do you strike me?” |So Jiizas se tu im se, “Ef mi se sitn rang, den tel evribadi ya-so wa mi se we rang. Bot ef mi onggl taak wa chuu, wa mek yu baks mi?”
Then Annas sent Him bound to Caiaphas the high priest.|Den Anas sen Jiizas go a Kaiyafas, di liida fi di priis dem. Im did stil av Jiizas tai op.

Meanwhile Simon Peter was standing and warming himself. So they said to him, “Are you not also one of His disciples?”He denied it and said, “I am not!”|Nou Saiman Piita did stil tan op a waam op imself, so di piipl dem roun di faiya aks im se, “Yu a no wan a im falara dem tu?”Bot im tel dem nuo. “Mi a no wan a dem,” im se.

One of the servants of the high priest, being a relative of the man whose ear Peter cut off, said, “Did I not see you in the garden with Him?”|Di sumadi uufa iez Piita did chap aaf, did a fambili wid wan a di liida fi di priis dem sorvant dem. Ier im tu Piita, “No yu mi si wid im iina di gyaadn?”
Peter then denied it again, and immediately a rooster crowed.|Piita se notn no go so, an siem taim im se so wan ruusta kruo.

Then they led Jesus from Caiaphas to the Praetorium. It was early. Yet they themselves did not enter the Praetorium, so that they might not be defiled, but might eat the Passover. |Orli di neda maanin, di Juu liida dem tek Jiizas fram Kaiyafas ous an kyari im go a di palis we bilang tu Pailat, di man di Ruoman dem put inchaaj a Judiya. Di Juu dem neehn go insaid im yaad, kaa dem did waahn fi kip demself kliin iina Gad yai so dat dem kuda get fi nyam di Paasuova fuud.
Pilate then went out to them and said, “What accusation do you bring against this Man?”|So Pailat kom out tu dem an aks dem se, “Wa unu se da man ya du rang?”
They answered him, “If He were not an evildoer, we would not have handed Him over to you.”|Dem se tu im se, “Ef im a no kriminal, wi wudn kyari im kom tu yu.”

Then Pilate said, “Take Him and judge Him according to your law.”The Jews said to him, “It is not lawful for us to put anyone to death,” |Den Pailat se tu dem se, “Tek im an diil wid im bies pan fu'unu uona laa.”Bot di Juu liida dem se, “Di laa no lou wi fi kil nobadi.”
that the saying of Jesus might be fulfilled which He spoke, signifying what death He would die.|(Nou dis ya apm fi mek we Jiizas did taak bout ou im did a-go ded kom chuu.)
Again Pilate entered the Praetorium, called Jesus, and said to Him, “Are You the King of the Jews?”|Pailat den go bak iina di palis, im sen fi Jiizas an aks im se, “Yu a di Juu dem king?”
Jesus answered him, “Are you speaking of your own accord, or did others tell you about Me?”|“Yu a se dis ya pan yu uon,” Jiizas aks im bak, “ar ada piipl taak tu yu bout mi?”

Pilate answered, “Am I a Jew? Your own nation and the chief priests handed You over to me. What have You done?”|“It komiin laka se mi a Juu tu yu?” Pailat aks im. “A fi yu uona piipl dem an yu ed priis dem kya yu kom a mi. A we yu du?”

Jesus answered, “My kingdom is not of this world. If My kingdom were of this world, then My servants would fight, that I would not be handed over to the Jews. But now My kingdom is not from here.”|So Jiizas se tu im se, “Mi no ruul laka di king dem we de iina di worl. Ef mi did ron tingz laka dem, mi sorvant dem wuda tek op fi mi an fait fi mek dem no ares mi an gi mi uova tu di Juu liida dem. Bot mi no ruul laka di king dem iina di worl.”

Therefore Pilate said to Him, “Then are You a king?”Jesus answered, “You say correctly that I am a king. For this reason I was born, and for this reason I came into the world, to bear witness to the truth. Everyone who is of the truth hears My voice.”|“So yu a king, den?!”, Pailat aks im.Jiizas ansa im an se, “ ‘King,’ a di wod yu yuuz. A dis mi did baan fa; a dis ya mek mi kom iina di worl: fi taak tu piipl bout di sitn dem we riili chuu. Evribadi we lov di chuut lisn we mi se.”

Pilate said to Him, “What is truth?” When he had said this, he went out again to the Jews and said to them, “I find no guilt in Him at all.|“Di chuut, a wa dat?” Pailat aks im. Afta Pailat aks Jiizas dis ya, im go out fi taak tu di Juu dem wan neks taim. Im se tu dem, “Mi no si notn we mi fi chaaj im fa.

“But you have a custom, that I should release someone to you at the Passover. Do you therefore want me to release to you the King of the Jews?”|Bot a di naamal ting fi mi frii wan prizna gi unu wen a Paasuova taim. Unu waahn mi le'go di Juu dem King gi unu?”
They all shouted again, “Not this Man, but Barabbas!” Now Barabbas was a robber.|Dem shout bak se, “A no dis ya man ya wi waahn. Gi wi Barabas. (Nou, Barabas did fait gens di Ruoman dem.)
Then Pilate took Jesus and flogged Him.
column2: Den Pailat tek Jiizas an mek im suoja dem biit im.

column1: The soldiers twisted a crown of thorns and put it on His head, and they put a purple robe on Him.|Dem tek makabush mek kroun put it pan im ed. Den, dem jres im op iina porpl ruob.

They said, “Hail, King of the Jews!” And they hit Him with their hands.|Dem go op tu im, uova an uova agen an se tu im se, “Manaz an rispek tu di Juu dem King!” An dem baks im iina im fies uova an uova agen.

Again Pilate went out and said to them, “Look, I am bringing Him out to you, that you may know that I find no guilt in Him.”|So wan neda taim, Pailat kom out tu di Juu dem an se, “Unu luk, si mi a tek im out tu unu ya, so unu kyan si se mi no fain se im du notn rang!”

Then Jesus came out, wearing the crown of thorns and the purple robe. Pilate said to them, “Here is the Man!”|Den Jiizas kom out a wier di maka kroun an di porpl ruob. An Pailat se tu tu dem se, “Unu luk, si di man ya!”

When the chief priests and officers saw Him, they cried out, “Crucify Him! Crucify Him!”Pilate said to them, “Take Him yourselves and crucify Him, for I find no guilt in Him.”|Wen di ed priis dem an dem we gyaad Gad ous si im dem shout out, “Niel im op pan di kraas mek im ded! Niel im op!”So Pailat se tu dem se, “Unu tek im niel im op unuself! Mi no si im du notn rang.”

The Jews answered him, “We have a law, and by our law He ought to die, because He made Himself the Son of God!”|Bot di Juu liida dem stil baal out, “Wi av wan laa we se im fi ded, kaa im a taak bout ou im a Gad Bwai Pikni.”
When Pilate heard these words, he was more afraid|Wen Pailat ier dem se dat de, im kech im fried muo dan ou im did fried aredi.
and entered the Praetorium again, and said to Jesus, “Where are You from?” But Jesus gave him no answer. |So im go bak iina im palis an aks Jiizas se, “Wich paat yu kom fram?” Bot Jiizas no ansa im.

Pilate said to Him, “Are You not speaking to me? Do You not know that I have power to release You, and power to crucify You?”|“Yu naa taak tu mi?” Pailat se tu im. “Yu no si se mi av di powa fi let yu go ar fi mek yu ded pan di kraas?”

Jesus answered, “You would have no power at all over Me, unless it were given to you from above. Therefore he who handed Me over to you has the greater sin.”|Jiizas ansa im an se, “Yu wudn av no powa uova mi ef Gad neehn gi yu it. So den di sumadi we kyari mi kom gi yu du wan wosa sin dan yu.”

From then on, Pilate tried to release Him. But the Jews cried out, “If you release this Man, you are not Caesar’s friend. Whoever makes himself a king speaks against Caesar!”|Fram da taim de, Pailat chrai an chrai fi let im go. Bot di Juu liida dem did kip aan a shout an se, “Ef yu mek da man ya get we, yu an Siiza a no fren! Enibadi we se dem a king a fait gens Siiza.”

When Pilate heard these words, he brought Jesus out and sat down on the judgment seat at a place called The Pavement (which in Hebrew is Gabbatha). |Wen Pailat ier dem se dat de, im tek Jiizas go outa duor an den im go sidong iina di joj siit we de a di plies we dem kaal “Stuon Fluor.” (Iina di Iibruu langwij it niem Gabata).

It was the Day of Preparation of the Passover and about the sixth hour.He said to the Jews, “Here is your King!”|A did di aaftanuun pan di die bifuo Paasuova staat wen Pailat se tu di Juu liida dem se, “Unu si unu king ya!”

But they shouted, “Away with Him! Away with Him! Crucify Him!”Pilate said to them, “Shall I crucify your King?”The chief priests answered, “We have no king but Caesar!”|Bot dem shout out se, “Tek im we! Tek im we! Niel im pan di kraas mek im ded!”“Mi fi niel op unu king pan di kraas mek im ded?” Pailat aks dem.“Siiza a di onggl king wi av,” di ed priis dem se tu im.
Then he handed Him over to them to be crucified. So they took Jesus and led Him away.
column2: So den Pailat gi Jiizas uova tu di Juu liida dem fi dem kil im pan di kraas. An dem tek im an kyari im we.

column1: He went out, carrying His own cross, to a place called The Place of a Skull, which in Hebrew is called Golgotha. |Jiizas kyari im uona kraas go a wan plies dem kaal di Skol Plies (iina di Iibruu langwij, dem kaal it Golgota).
There they crucified Him, and two others with Him, one on either side, and Jesus in the middle.|A de-so dem niel im op fi ded wid tuu ada man — wan pan im rait-an-said, di ada pan im lef-an-said.
Pilate wrote a title and put it on the cross. The writing was:|Pailat mek dem rait wan sain put uova im ed we riid se: “JIIZAS WE KOM FRAM NAZARET, DI JUU DEM KING.”

Many of the Jews read this title, for the place where Jesus was crucified was near the city. And it was written in Hebrew, in Greek, and in Latin. |So nof a di Juu dem we liv a Jeruusilem riid di sain, kaa di plies wich paat Jiizas did get niel op did nier di siti. Di sain did rait iina Iibruu, Latn an Griik.

The chief priests of the Jews said to Pilate, “Do not write, ‘The King of the Jews,’ but ‘He said, I am King of the Jews.’ ”|So di ed priis dem fi di Juu piipl dem se tu Pailat se, “Chienj ‘Di Juu dem king,’ an rait ‘Da man ya se im a di Juu dem king.’ ”
Pilate answered, “What I have written, I have written.”|Bot Pailat ansa dem se, “Wa mi rait, a dat mi rait!”

When the soldiers had crucified Jesus, they took His garments and divided them into four parts, a part for each soldier; and also His tunic. Now the tunic was seamless, woven from top to bottom.|Wen di suoja dem did don niel op Jiizas pan di kraas fi ded, dem tek im kluoz dem, an shier dem op iina fuo, wan set fi iich a dem. Bot dem neehn toch im anda kluoz. (Nou im anda kluoz did mek outa wan piis a klaat.)

So they said to one another, “Let us not tear it, but cast lots for it to decide whose it shall be.”This happened to fulfill the Scripture which says:“They divided My garments among them,and for My clothing they cast lots.”Therefore the soldiers did these things.|Di suoja dem se tu dem wan aneda se, “Mek wi no tier tier it op. Mek wi chuo dais an si uu fi get it.” Nou dis ya apm so dat wa Gad wod se wuda kom chuu. It se,“Dem shier op mi kluoz mongks dem wan anedaan dem tek dais gyambl fi mi kluoz.”So a sed ting di suoja dem du.

But standing by the cross of Jesus were His mother, and His mother’s sister, Mary the wife of Clopas, and Mary Magdalene.|Jiizas mada did a tan op saida im kraas. Ar sista did de de tu, plos yu did av Mieri, Kluopas waif, an Mieri Magdaliin.

When Jesus saw His mother and the disciple whom He loved standing nearby, He said to His mother, “Woman, here is your son.” |Wen Jiizas si im mada, an di falara we im did lov a tan op saida ar, im se tu ar se, “Uman, tek im az yu uona bwai pikni.”

Then He said to the disciple, “Here is your mother.”From that time, this disciple took her to his own home.|Den im se tu di falara se, “Luk, si yu mada de.” An fram da taim de, di sed falara tek iin Jiizas mada a im yaad.

After this, Jesus, knowing that everything was now accomplished, that the Scripture might be fulfilled, said, “I thirst.”|Afta dis, wen Jiizas si se evriting we did fi apm did apm, im se, “Mi torsti.” Im did se dat so dat wa Gad wod se wuda kom chuu.

A bowl full of sour wine was placed there. So they put a sponge full of sour wine on hyssop and held it to His mouth. |Wan jaar a sowa wain did de de, so dem tek wan sponj an suok it iina di jaar a sowa wain. Afta dat dem put it pan wan isop tik an put it op tu Jiizas lip.

When Jesus had received the sour wine, He said, “It is finished.” And He bowed His head and gave up His spirit.|Wen im get di wain, im se, “It don nou.” Den im ben dong im ed an put im spirit iina Gad an an ded.

Since it was the Day of Preparation, to prevent bodies from remaining on the cross on the Sabbath day (for that Sabbath day was a high day), the Jews asked Pilate that their legs might be broken, and that they might be taken away.|Nou, kaaz a did di die bifuo di Sabat an di Juu liida dem neehn waahn di ded dem fi tan pan di kraas pan di Sabat dem aks Pailat fi brok dem fut an den tek dem dong aafa di kraas. (Di Sabat we did a kom a did wan speshal Sabat.)

Therefore the soldiers came and broke the legs of the first and of the other who was crucified with Him. |So di suoja dem go brok di fut dem a di fos man we did get niel op wid Jiizas, den dem brok di neda wan fut dem.
But when they came to Jesus and saw that He was dead already, they did not break His legs.|Bot wen dem si se Jiizas did ded aredi, dem no bada brok fi im fut dem

However, one of the soldiers pierced His side with a spear, and immediately blood and water came out.|So insted-a brok Jiizas fut dem, wan a di suoja dem tek wan spier shub iina im said, an blod an waata ron out sed taim.

He who saw it has testified, and his testimony is true. He knows that he is telling the truth, that you may believe. |Di sumadi we si dem sitn ya apm taak bout dem, so unu kyan biliiv iina Jiizas. (Wa im taak bout a chuu. A no lai. An im nuo se a chuu im a taak.)

For these things happened so that the Scripture should be fulfilled, “Not one of His bones shall be broken,”|Aal a dem sitn ya apm so wa Gad wod se wuda kom chuu. It se, “No iivn wan a im buon dem a-go get brok.”
and again another Scripture says, “They shall look on Him whom they have pierced.”|An iina wan neks paat it se, “Dem a-go luk pan di wan we dem buor.”

After this, Joseph of Arimathea, being a disciple of Jesus, but secretly for fear of the Jews, asked Pilate that he might take away the body of Jesus. Pilate gave him permission. So he came and took away His body.|Afta dem sitn ya apm, Juozif we kom fram Arimatiya, aks Pailat fi gi im Jiizas badi. Juozif a did wan a Jiizas falara dem, bot im neehn mek nobadi nuo kaaz im did fried a di Juu liida dem. So wen Pailat tel im se im kuda did get Jiizas badi, im tek it kyari go we.

Nicodemus, who at first came to Jesus by night, also came, bringing a mixture of myrrh and aloes, weighing about seventy-five pounds.|Nikodiimos, di man we did go luk fi Jiizas a nait, fala Juozif. Im kyari bout sevnti-faiv poun a baam fi Jiizas badi. Di baam did mek outa mor an alo miks op tugeda iina wan.

Then they took the body of Jesus and wrapped it in linen cloths with the spices, as is the burial custom of the Jews. |Dem tek Jiizas badi an rap it op iina linin klaat wid swiit baam ail, an dem luk bout im di wie Juu piipl luk bout dem ded bifuo dem fi beri dem.

Now in the place where He was crucified there was a garden, and in the garden was a new tomb in which no one had ever been buried. |Wan gyaadn did de wich paat Jiizas get niel op. Iina di gyaadn, yu did av wan nyuu tuum, wan we nobadi neehn beri iina yet.
So because of the Jewish Day of Preparation, and since the tomb was nearby, they buried Jesus there.|Nou chuu a did di die bifuo di Sabat an di tuum did de nier, dem put Jiizas badi iina it.

Early on the first day of the week, Mary Magdalene went to the tomb while it was still dark and saw that the stone had been taken away from the tomb.|Orli Sonde maanin, di fos die a di wiik, wen it did stil daak, Mieri Magdaliin go a di tuum an si se di stuon we did a kova di fronta di tuum did ruol we.

So she came running to Simon Peter and to the other disciple whom Jesus loved, and said to them, “They have taken the Lord out of the tomb, and we do not know where they have put Him.”|So shi ron go a Saiman Piita an di ada falara we Jiizas did lov, an se tu dem se, “Dem tek di Laad outa di tuum, an wi no nuo we paat dem put im!”
So Peter came out with the other disciple and they went toward the tomb.
column2: So Piita an di ada falara lef go a di tuum.

column1: They both ran together, and the other disciple outran Peter and came to the tomb first.|Di tuu a dem did a ron, bot di wan we Jiizas did lov ron lef Piita an riich a di tuum fos.
Stooping down and looking in, he saw the linen cloths lying. Yet he did not enter.|Im ben dong an luk iina di tuum an si di linin klaat dem we did rap roun Jiizas badi, bot im neehn go iin de.
Then Simon Peter came, following him, and went inside the tomb. He saw the linen cloths lying there|Den Saiman Piita we did a kom baka im, riich an go chriet iina di tuum. Im si di linin klaat dem

and the cloth that was around His head, not lying with the linen cloths, but wrapped in a place by itself. |plos di beriyin klaat we did rap roun Jiizas ed pudong iin de. Di ed klaat did fuol op an put wan said. It neva de we di linin klaat dem did de.
Then the other disciple, who came first to the tomb, went in also. He saw and believed.|Afta dat, di ada falara, we riich di tuum fos go iin tu. Im si an im biliiv se Jiizas did riili kom bak alaiv.
For as yet they did not know the Scripture, that He must rise from the dead.|(Yu si, aal nou dem neehn get we Gad wod se bout ou Jiizas did afi kom bak alaiv.)
Then the disciples went away again to their own homes.
column2: Afta dat di tuu falara dem go baka dem yaad.

column1: But Mary stood outside at the tomb weeping. As she wept, she stooped down and looked into the tomb|Bot Mieri did tan op outa duor siem wie a baal, an ben dong a luk iina di tuum.

and she saw two angels in white sitting where the body of Jesus had lain, one at the head and one at the feet.|Shi si tuu ienjel iina wait kluoz sidong wich paat Jiizas badi did de — wan we im ed did de an di ada wan we im fut did de.

They said to her, “Woman, why are you weeping?”She said to them, “Because they have taken away my Lord, and I do not know where they have put Him.”|Dem aks ar se, “Uman, wa mek yu a baal?”“Dem tek we mi Laad,” shi se tu dem, “an mi no nuo we paat dem put im.”

When she had said this, she turned around and saw Jesus standing, but she did not know that it was Jesus.|Wen shi se dat de, shi ton roun an si sumadi tan op neks tu ar — a did Jiizas — bot shi neehn si se a im.

Jesus said to her, “Woman, why are you weeping? Whom are you seeking?”Supposing Him to be the gardener, she said to Him, “Sir, if You have carried Him away, tell me where You have put Him, and I will take Him away.”|“Uman,” im se tu ar, “wa mek yu a baal? A uu yu a luk fa?”Chuu Mieri did tingk se a wan gyaadna a taak tu ar, shi se tu im se, “Sar, ef a yu tek im we, tel mi wich paat im de, so mi kyan go fi'im.”

Jesus said to her, “Mary.”She turned and said to Him, “Rabboni!” (which means Teacher).|Den Jiizas se tu ar se, “Mieri!”Shi ton fi fies im an baal out iina di Iibruu langwij, “Rabonai!” (dat miin “Tiicha”).

Jesus said to her, “Stop holding on to Me, for I have not yet ascended to My Father. But go to My brothers and tell them, ‘I am ascending to My Father and your Father, to My God and your God.’ ”|Jiizas se, “No uol aan pan mi, kaa mi no gaan baka mi Faada yet. Go tel yu breda dem se mi se, ‘Mi a go baka mi Faada an fi unu Faada, mi a go baka mi Gad an fi unu Gad.’”

Mary Magdalene came and told the disciples that she had seen the Lord and that He had said these things to her.|Mieri Magdaliin fain Jiizas falara dem an tel dem se, “Mi si di Laad!” An shi tel dem aal a wa Jiizas tel ar.

On the evening of that first day of the week, the doors being locked where the disciples were assembled, for fear of the Jews, Jesus came and stood in their midst, and said to them, “Peace be with you.” |Da sed Sonde de, Jiizas falara dem miit op tugeda iina di iivnin. Dem lak di duor dem kaa dem did fried a di Juu liida dem. Jiizas kom iina di ruum an tan op wid dem an se, “Piis!”

When He had said this, He showed them His hands and His side. The disciples were then glad when they saw the Lord.|Wen taim im se dat de, im shuo dem im an dem an im said. An dem did glad kyaahn don wen dem si di Laad.

So Jesus said to them again, “Peace be with you. As My Father has sent Me, even so I send you.”|So Jiizas se tu dem wan neks taim se, “Piis! Siem laka ou di Faada sen mi iina di worl, a siem wie so mi a sen unu iin de.”
When He had said this, He breathed on them and said to them, “Receive the Holy Spirit. |Afta im se dat im bluo pan dem an se, “Mek di Uoli Spirit kom iina unu laif.

If you forgive the sins of anyone, they are forgiven them. If you retain the sins of anyone, they are retained.”|Ef unu paadn sumadi fi di rang we dem du, Gad a-go paadn dem; ef unu no paadn dem, Gad naa go paadn dem niida.”

But Thomas, one of the twelve, called The Twin, was not with them when Jesus came.|Nou, Tamas (we dem kaal Didimos), wan a Jiizas twelv falara dem neehn iina di ruum wid di ada falara dem wen taim Jiizas did kom iin de.

So the other disciples told him, “We have seen the Lord!”But he said to them, “Unless I see the nail prints in His hands, and put my finger in the nail prints, and put my hand in His side, I will not believe.”|So di ada falara dem se tu im se, “Wi si di Laad!”Bot im se tu dem se, “Ef mi no si di niel uol dem iina im an dem an get fi put mi fingga iina dem, an ef mi no get fi put fi mi an iina im said, den mi naa go biliiv se a chuu unu a taak.”

After eight days His disciples were again inside with the doors shut, and Thomas was with them. Jesus came and stood among them, and said, “Peace be with you.” |Iet die afta dat, Jiizas falara dem did iina di sed ous, an Tamas did de de wid dem da taim ya. Iivn duo di duor dem did lak, Jiizas kom iin kom tan op mongks dem sed wie an se, “Piis!”

Then He said to Thomas, “Put your finger here, and look at My hands. Put your hand here and place it in My side. Do not be faithless, but believing.”|Den im se tu Tamas se, “Put yu fingga ya-so an luk pan mi an dem. Chrech out yu an an put it iina mi said. Tap if-an-bot, an biliiv wa yu si.”
Thomas answered Him, “My Lord and my God!”|Den Tamas se tu im se, “Yu a mi Laad an mi Gad!”

Jesus said to him, “Thomas, because you have seen Me, you have believed. Blessed are those who have not seen, and have yet believed.”|So Jiizas se tu im se, “A chuu yu si mi mek yu biliiv se a mi? Gad bles di piipl dem we no si mi bot biliiv iina mi siem wie.”
Jesus performed many other signs in the presence of His disciples, which are not written in this book.|Jiizas du nof muo powaful sitn infronta im falara dem, we no rait dong iina da buk ya.

But these are written that you might believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God, and that believing you may have life in His name.|Bot dem ya rait dong so unu mait-a biliiv se Jiizas a di Krais, Gad Bwai Pikni, an dat wen unu biliiv iina im, unu kyan av laif we laas fi eva.

After this, Jesus revealed Himself again to the disciples at the Sea of Tiberias. He revealed Himself this way: |Afta dis ya Jiizas shuo imself tu im falara dem wan muo taim. Da taim ya, im du it a di Taibiiriyos Sii. Dis a wa apm:

Simon Peter; Thomas, called The Twin; Nathanael of Cana in Galilee; the sons of Zebedee; and two more of His disciples were together.|Saiman Piita, Tamas (we dem kaal Didimos), Nataniyel (we kom fram Kiena iina Gyalalii), Zebidii bwai pikni dem, an tuu a Jiizas ada falara dem did de tugeda.

Simon Peter said to them, “I am going fishing.” Then they said to him, “We will go with you.” They went out and immediately entered the boat. But that night they caught nothing.|“Mi a go kech fish,” Saiman Piita se tu dem.So dem ansa im se, “Wi a kom wid yu.”Dem go iina di buot, bot da nait de, dem no kech a ting.
When the morning came, Jesus stood on the shore. But the disciples did not know that it was Jesus.|Orli iina di maanin, Jiizas did a tan op a di sii-said, bot im falara dem neehn si se a im.
Jesus said to them, “Children, do you have any fish?”They answered Him, “No.”|Im kaal out tu dem an se, “Brejrin, unu na'av no fish?”“Nuo,” dem ansa.

TheyHe said to them, “Throw the net on the right side of the boat, and you will find some.” So they threw it, and now they were not able to draw it in because of the abundance of fish. answered Him, “No.”|So im tel dem se, “Fling uova unu net pan di rait-an-said a di buot an unu wi fain som.” So dem du dat, an dem kudn pul op bak di net, siek-a di uol iip a fish we dem kech wid it.

Then the disciple whom Jesus loved said to Peter, “It is the Lord!” When Simon Peter heard that it was the Lord, he put on his outer garment, for he had taken it off, and jumped into the sea.|Den di falara we Jiizas did lov tel Piita se, “A di Laad!” Sed taim Saiman Piita ier dat de, im rap di likl kluoz we im did av aan roun im (kaa im neehn av aan notn anda it) an im jomp iina di waata.

The other disciples came in the little boat, dragging the net full of fish. For they were not far from land, but about three hundred feet away.|Di ada falara dem fala baka Piita. Dem did a aal iin di net ful-a fish kaa dem neehn de faar fram shuor — onggl bout onjrid yaad.
When they came to land, they saw a charcoal fire there with fish lying on it, and bread.|Wen dem riich iin, dem si kuol faiya wid fish an bred pan it.
Jesus said to them, “Bring some of the fish which you have just caught.”|Jiizas se tu dem se, “Kyari som a di fish we unu kech kom.”

Simon Peter went up and dragged the net, full of one hundred and fifty-three large fish, to land. Although there were so many, the net was not torn. |Saiman Piita klaim iina di buot an aal iin di net. It did ful-a big fish, wan onjrid an fifti chrii a dem, bot wid aal dem mount a fish de, di net neehn bos op.

Jesus said to them, “Come and eat breakfast.” None of the disciples dared ask, “Who are You?” They knew it was the Lord. |“Kom nyam brekfas,” Jiizas se tu dem. Bot non a dem neehn bier fies inof fi aks im se, “A uu yu?” kaa dem did nuo se a did di Laad.
Jesus came and took the bread and gave it to them, and likewise the fish. |So Jiizas kom, tek di bred an gi dem, an im du di sed ting wid di fish.
This was now the third time that Jesus was revealed to His disciples after He was raised from the dead.
column2: Nou dat mek chrii taim Jiizas shuo imself tu im falara dem afta im kom bak alaiv.

column1: So when they had eaten breakfast, Jesus said to Simon Peter, “Simon, son of John, do you love Me more than these?”He said to Him, “Yes, Lord. You know that I love You.”He said to him, “Feed My lambs.”|Afta dem don nyam, Jiizas aks Saiman Piita se, “Saiman, Jan bwai pikni, yu lov mi muo dan ou yu lov dem ya?”“Yes, Laad,” Saiman se, “Yu nuo se mi lov yu.”So Jiizas se, “Fiid mi biebi shiip dem.”

He said to him again a second time, “Simon, son of John, do you love Me?”He said to Him, “Yes, Lord. You know that I love You.”He said to him, “Tend My sheep.”|Jiizas aks im agen se, “Saiman, Jan bwai pikni, yu lov mi fi chuu?”Im ansa, “Yes, Laad, yu nuo se mi lov yu.”Jiizas se tu im se, “Tek kier a mi shiip dem.”

He said to him the third time, “Simon, son of John, do you love Me?”Peter was grieved because He asked him the third time, “Do you love Me?” He said to Him, “Lord, You know everything. You know that I love You.”Jesus said to him, “Feed My sheep. |Fi di tord taim Jiizas aks im se, “Saiman, Jan bwai pikni, yu lov mi?”Piita did fiil a wie, kaaz a chrii taim nou Jiizas aks se, “Yu lov mi?” So im se, “Laad, yu nuo evriting. Yu nuo se mi lov yu.”Den Jiizas se tu im se, “Fiid mi shiip dem.

Truly, truly I say to you, when you were young, you dressed yourself and walked where you desired. But when you are old, you will stretch out your hands, and another will dress you and carry you where you do not want to go.”|Mi a tel yu fi chuu chuu, wen yu did sumaala yu put aan yu uona kluoz an yu go eniwe yu waahn fi go, bot wen yu get uol yu gweehn chrech out yu an dem, an ada piipl gweehn put aan yu kluoz an tek yu go wich paat yu no waahn go.”

He said this, signifying by what kind of death he would glorify God. When He had said this, He said to him, “Follow Me.”|(Nou Jiizas did a taak bout di wie ou Piita did a-go ded, an ou im did a-go mek Gad get big op kaaz a di wie im ded.) Den Jiizas se tu im se, “Fala mi!”

Peter turned and saw following them the disciple whom Jesus loved, who also leaned against His bosom at the supper and had said, “Lord, who is it that is going to betray You?” |Piita ton roun an si di falara we Jiizas did lov. (Di sed wan we did sidong saida Jiizas wen taim dem did a nyam di laas sopa. A im siem wan did aks Jiizas se, “Laad, a uu a-go sel yu out?”)
When Peter saw him, he said to ­Jesus, “Lord, what about this man?”|Wen Piita si im, im se tu Jiizas se, “Laad, wa gweehn apm tu im?”
Jesus said to him, “If it is My will that he remain until I come, what is that to you? Follow Me!”|Jiizas se tu im se, “Ef mi waahn im fi liv til mi kom bak, wa mek dat a bada yu? Yu jos fala mi.”

The saying went out among the brothers that this disciple would not die. Yet Jesus did not say to him that he would not die, but, “If it is My will that he remain until I come, what is that to you?”|So siek-a Jiizas se so, it did a go roun mongks di breda an sista dem se da falara ya neehn a-go ded. Bot a no dat Jiizas did se, im se, “Ef mi waahn im fi liv til mi kom bak, wa mek dat a bada yu?”

This is the disciple who testifies about these things, and wrote these things. We know that his testimony is true.|A dis a di falara we si di uol a dem sitn ya fi imself an tel piipl bout dem. A im rait dem dong an aal a wi nuo se a chuu im a taak.

There are also many other things which Jesus did. Were every one of them to be written, I suppose that not even the world itself could contain the books that would be written. Amen.|Jiizas du uol iip a ada sitn. Ef evriting did fi rait dong iina buk, spies wudn de iina di worl fi uol aal a di buk dem we piipl wuda rait.
Whereas many have undertaken to write a narrative of those things which are most surely believed among us
column2: Uol iip a piipl chrai fi rait dong di sitn dem wa apm mongks wi.

column1: just as they were handed down to us by those who from the beginning were eyewitnesses and ministers of the word|Dem rait it dong siem wie ou dem ier it fram di piipl dem we did de de fram di staat, si di sitn dem wa apm an we priich di wod.

it seemed good to me also, having accurately investigated all things from the very beginning, to write to you an orderly account, most excellent Theophilus|Anarebl Tiyafilas, mi stodi evriting fram di staat an mek op mi main fi rait an tel yu wa apm
that you might know the certainty of the things which you have been told.
column2: so yu wi nuo se wa yu ier a chuu sitn.

column1: There was in the days of Herod, the king of Judea, a certain priest named Zechariah, of the division of Abijah. And his wife was of the daughters of Aaron, and her name was Elizabeth.|Wen taim Erad a did King iina Judiya, wan priis did de de niem Zakaraiya. Im did bilang tu di Abija gruup a priis dem, an im waif Ilizibet a did wan a Ieran fambili.

They were both righteous before God, walking in all the commandments and ordinances of the Lord blamelessly. |Gad si se di tuu a dem a did gud sumadi. Kaaz dem liv ou im waahn dem fi liv, dem du aal a wa im tel dem fi du an nobadi kudn paint no fingga pan dem.
But they had no child, because Elizabeth was barren, and they both were now well advanced in years.|Bot dem neva av no pikni, kaaz Ilizibet kudn av non. Plos di tuu a dem did wel uol.
Now while he served as priest before God, when his division was on duty|Wan die, Zakaraiya did a du priis wok iina Gad ous, kaaz fi im gruup a priis did de pan dyuuti.

according to the custom of the priest’s office, his lot was to burn incense when he went into the temple of the Lord. |Iina dem die de di priis dem yuus tu kom tugeda an jraa niem fi si wich wan a dem fi go bon insens iina Gad ous. Dis ya taim ya a Zakaraiya niem get pik.
And the whole crowd of people were praying outside at the hour of incense.|Wen a did taim an Zakaraiya go iina Gad ous, di piipl dem we did gyada outa duor did a prie.
