Then an angel of the Lord appeared to him, standing on the right side of the altar of incense. |Wan a di Laad ienjel dem kom tu Zakaraiya an tan op pan di rait-an-said a di insens alta.
When Zechariah saw him, he was troubled, and fear fell upon him.|Wen Zakaraiya si im, im fraitn so til.

But the angel said to him, “Do not fear, Zechariah, for your prayer has been heard, and your wife Elizabeth will bear you a son, and you shall call his name John.|Di ienjel tel im se, “No fried! Gad ier yu prieya. Ilizibet a-go av wan pikni fi yu, an yu fi kaal im Jan.
You will have joy and gladness, and many will rejoice at his birth.|Im a-go mek yu wel api, an nof piipl a-go glad wen im baan.

For he will be great in the sight of the Lord, and shall drink neither wine nor strong drink, and he will be filled with the Holy Spirit, even from his mother’s womb.|Yu bwai pikni a-go speshal iina Gad yai. Im no fi jringk no wain ar no ada chrang jringk. Di Uoli Spirit a-go kanchuol im fram im iina im mada beli.
He will turn many of the sons of Israel to the Lord their God.|Im a-go bring bak uol iip a Izrel piipl tu di Laad, we a dem Gad.

And he will go before Him in the spirit and power of Elijah, to turn the hearts of the fathers to the children and the disobedient to the wisdom of the just, to make ready a people prepared for the Lord.”|Im a-go go bifuo Gad, wid di siem Spirit an powa laik wa Ilaija did av. Im aal a-go mek faada kom bak kom lov dem pikni. An di piipl dem we neva did a ier Gad, a-go staat tingk laik gud sumadi an du wa rait. An da wie de im a-go mek piipl redi fi di Laad.”

Zechariah said to the angel, “How shall I know this? For I am an old man and my wife well advanced in years.”|Zakaraiya go aks di ienjel, “Ou mi a-go nuo se a chuu sitn yu a taak? Mi a wan uol man, an mi waif no yong niida.”

The angel answered him, “I am Gabriel, who stands in the presence of God. And I was sent to speak to you and to bring you this good news. |Di ienjel tel im se, “Mi a Giebrel. Mi tan op bifuo Gad an im sen mi fi taak tu yu an fi tel yu di gud nyuuz.

And now you will be silent and unable to speak until the day that these things happen, because you did not believe my words, which will be fulfilled in their season.”|Bot chuu yu no biliiv mi, yu naa go kyan taak til wa mi tel yu bout apm.”
The people waited for Zechariah, and wondered why he waited so long in the temple.|Siem taim dis a gwaan, di piipl outa duor did a wanda wa mek im a tek so lang fi kom outa Gad ous.

When he came out, he could not speak to them. They perceived that he had seen a vision in the temple, for he made signs to them and remained speechless.|Zakaraiya kom out bot im kudn tel dem notn. Dem nuo se im si wan vijan iina Gad ous, kaaz dem si se im kudn taak an onggl a mek sain tu dem.
As soon as the days of his service were fulfilled, he departed to his own home. |Wen Zakaraiya don du im priis wok iina Gad ous, im go baka im yaad.
After those days his wife Elizabeth conceived, and for five months she hid herself, saying|Afta dat im waif get biebi, so shi tan a ar yaad fi faiv mont.

“Thus the Lord has dealt with me in the days when He looked on me, to take away my reproach among men.”|Shi se, “Di Laad du dis fi mi. Dem die ya, Gad shuo mi gud fies, so mi na'afi shiem wen mi de mongks ada piipl agen.”

In the sixth month the angel Gabriel was sent from God to a city of Galilee named Nazareth|Wen Ilizibet did av biebi iina beli fi siks mont, Gad sen ienjel Giebrel go a wan toun iina Gyalalii niem Nazaret,

to a virgin betrothed to a man whose name was Joseph, of the house of David. And the virgin’s name was Mary.|fi kyari wan mesij go gi wan yong uman niem Mieri we neva sliip wid no man yet. Mieri did ingiej fi marid Juozif, we kom fram di siem fambili we King Dievid did bilang tu.

The angel came to her and said, “Greetings, you who are highly favored. The Lord is with you. Blessed are you among women.”|Di ienjel go tu Mieri an se tu ar se, “Mieri, mi av nyuuz we a-go mek yu wel api. Gad riili riili bles yu an im a waak wid yu aal di taim.”
When she saw him, she was troubled by his words, and considered in her mind what kind of greeting this might be. |Wa Giebrel se kanfyuuz Mieri an shi staat fi wanda wa im miin.
But the angel said to her, “Do not be afraid, Mary, for you have found favor with God. |So di ienjel se tu ar se, “No fried Mieri, kaaz Gad riili riili bles yu.
Listen, you will conceive in your womb and bear a Son and shall call His name JESUS. |Yu a-go get biebi, wan bwai pikni, an yu fi kaal im Jiizas.

He will be great, and will be called the Son of the Highest. And the Lord God will give Him the throne of His father David|Im a-go ton wan griet man an dem a-go se im a di pikni fi di Muos Ai Gad. Di Laad Gad gweehn gi im di chuon wa im faada Dievid did av.
and He will reign over the house of Jacob forever. And of His kingdom there will be no end.”|An im aalwiez a-go ruul uova Jiekob piipl, Izrel; an im a-go ruul fi eva an eva.”
Then Mary said to the angel, “How can this be, since I do not know a man?”|Mieri aks di ienjel se, “Ou mi fi av biebi wen mi neva eva go a bed wid no man?”

The angel answered her, “The Holy Spirit will come upon you, and the power of the Highest will overshadow you. Therefore the Holy One who will be born will be called theSon of God.|Di ienjel ansa ar se, “Di Uoli Spirit a-go kom tu yu an di powa a di Muos Ai a-go toch yu. Im a-go bi Gad uoli pikni.

Listen, your cousin Elizabeth has also conceived a son in her old age. And this is the sixth month with her who was declared barren. |Yu si yu fambili Ilizibet? Piipl tingk se shi kudn av pikni bot shi a-go av pikni iina ar uol iej. A siks mont nou shi av biebi iina beli.
For with God nothing will be impossible.”
column2: Notn no de wa Gad kyaahn du.”

column1: Mary said, “I am the servant of the Lord. May it be unto me according to your word.” Then the angel departed from her.|Mieri se, “Mi de ya fi sorv di Laad. So mek it apm ou yu se it a-go go.” Den di ienjel go we lef Mieri.
In those days Mary arose and quickly went into the hill country, to a city of Judah|Mieri get redi an mikies go a wan toun iina di ili paat a Juuda.
and entered the house of Zechariah and greeted Elizabeth. |Wen shi riich, shi go a Zakaraiya ous an go iin go tel Ilizibet oudi.

When Elizabeth heard the greeting of Mary, the baby leaped in her womb. And Elizabeth was filled with the Holy Spirit. |Az Ilizibet ier Mieri se oudi so, di biebi iina ar beli jomp. An di Uoli Spirit tek kanchuol a Ilizibet
She spoke out with a loud voice, “Blessed are you among women, and blessed is the fruit of your womb!|an shi baal out loud loud, “Yu bles muo dan aal ada uman an di pikni iina yu beli bles tu.
But why is this granted to me, that the mother of my Lord should come to me? |Ou mi bles so, dat di mada a mi Laad kom luk fi mi?
Indeed, as soon as the sound of your greeting came to my ears, the baby in my womb leaped for joy. |Az yu taak so, braps! mi biebi jomp iina mi beli kaaz im api.
Blessed is she who believed, for there will be a completion to those things which were told her by the Lord.”|Yu bles kaaz yu biliiv wa di Laad se a-go apm.”
And Mary said:“My soul magnifies the Lord,|Mieri se:“Mi priez di Laad wid aal mi aat,
and my spirit rejoices in God my Savior.
column2: mi suol priez Gad we siev mi;

column1: For He has regardedthe low estate of His servant;surely, from now on all generations will call me blessed.|kaaz im si an memba miim puo sorvant.Fram nou aan, evri jinarieshan a-go se mi a Gad-bles uman,
For He who is mighty has done great things for me,and holy is His name.|kaaz di Muos Powaful Gad du da mirikl ya fi mi —im uoli!
His mercy is on those who fear Himfrom generation to generation.|Gad gud kyaahn don,an kain tu evribadiiina evri jinarieshan we rispek an priez im.
He has shown strength with His arm;He has scattered the proud in the imagination of their hearts.
column2: Im tek im an du som powaful sitn;im skyata skyata buosi piipl.

column1: He has pulled down the mighty from their thronesand exalted those of low degree.
column2: Gad aal dong ruula aafa dem ai chuonan lif op piipl we nobadi neva tingk se mata.

column1: He has filled the hungry with good things,and the rich He has sent away empty.|Im gi onggri piipl uol iip a gud sitn,bot rich piipl im sen we wid dem tuu lang an.
He has helped His servant Israel,in remembrance of His mercy,|Gad elp im sorvant dem, Izrel.Im memba fi bi gud an kain tu dem
as He spoke to our fathers,to Abraham and to his descendants forever.”|jos laik ou im did pramis Iebriyam an im pikni dem,fi bi gud an kain tu dem fi eva.”
Mary remained with her about three months and returned to her own house.
column2: Mieri tan wid Ilizibet bout chrii mont an den go baka ar yaad.

column1: Now Elizabeth’s time had come to give birth, and she gave birth to a son. |Wen a taim fi Ilizibet av ar biebi, shi did av wan bwai.
Her neighbors and cousins heard how the Lord had shown her great mercy, and they rejoiced with her.|Ilizibet nieba an fambili dem ier ou di Laad did gud tu ar an dem glad fi ar.

On the eighth day they came to circumcise the child. And they were calling him Zechariah, after the name of his father. |Wen Jan kech iet die uol, dem kyari im go a Gad ous fi sorkomsaiz im. Dem nieba an fambili did waahn niem im afta im faada, Zakaraiya, bot
But his mother answered, “Not so! He shall be called John.”|im mada se, “Nuo! A Jan im fi niem.”
They said to her, “There is no one among your relatives who is called by this name.”|Dem se, “Afta non a yu fambili dem no niem so?”
They made signs to his father, asking what he would have him called. |Den dem mek sain tu im faada fi fain out wa niem im waahn gi im pikni.
He asked for a writing tablet and wrote, “His name is John.” And they all were amazed. |So Zakaraiya aks fi wan sliet fi rait pan. Dem shak wen im rait se, “A Jan im niem.”
Immediately his mouth was opened and his tongue was loosed, and he spoke and praised God.|Siem taim Zakaraiya mout uopm op an im tong luus op, an im staat fi priez Gad.

Fear came on all who lived around them. And all these facts were talked about throughout all the hill country of Judea. |Di nieba dem kudn biliiv we did a gwaan, an di nyuuz bout wa apm pred aal uova di ili paat a Judiya.

All those who heard them laid them up in their hearts, saying, “What kind of child will he be?” For the hand of the Lord was with him.|Dem did si se di Laad powa de pan im so evribadi we ier bout it wanda an aks, “A wa da pikni ya a-go ton out tu?”
His father Zechariah was filled with the Holy Spirit and prophesied, saying,|Di Uoli Spirit tek kanchuol a Jan faada so im staat fi se:
“Blessed be the Lord God of Israel,for He has visited and redeemed His people,|“Priez di Laad, Izrel Gad,kaaz im kom an frii im piipl.
and has raised up a horn of salvation for usin the house of His servant David,|Im sen wan powaful sumadi fi siev wi.Da powaful sumadi ya kom fram di fambili a Gad sorvant Dievid.
as He spoke by the mouth of His holy prophets of long ago,|Jos laik ou im did taak chuu im uoli prafit demwie bak wen an se:
that we should be saved from our enemiesand from the hand of all who hate us,|im a-go siev wi fram wi enimi deman fram di wan dem we iet wi an av powa fi ort wi.
to perform the mercy promised to our fathersand to remember His holy covenant,|Im se im wuda gud tu wi faada faada deman im memba im uoli pramis;
the oath which He swore to our father Abraham,|Di pramis im mek tu wi faada Iebriyam,
to grant us that we, being delivered out of the hand of our enemies,might serve Him without fear,|fi siev wi fram dem we iet wi.So wi kyan du we im waahn wi fi du an no fried;
in holiness and righteousness before Him all the days of our lives.
column2: So wi kyan liv wan gud an kliin laif til wi ded.

column1: “And you, child, will be called the prophet of the Highest;for you will go before the face of the Lord to prepare His ways,|Mi pikni Jan, piipl a-go kaal yu wan prafit fi di Muos Ai,kaaz yu a-go gwaan bifuo im til im kom an get im piipl redi fi'im;
to give knowledge of salvation to His peopleby the remission of their sins,|Yu a-go mek Gad piipl nuo sedi Laad a kom fi siev dem;Im a-go paadn dem so dem kyan get siev.
through the tender mercy of our God,whereby the sunrise from on high has visited us;|Siek-a ou Gad gud an kain tu wi,di maanin son a-go shain dong pan wi.

to give light to those who sit in darknessand in the shadow of death,to guide our feet into the way of peace.”|It a-go shain pan di wan dem we a liv iina di daakan we fried fi ded.An im a-go shuo wi oufi liv iina piis.”

And the child grew and became strong in spirit, and he remained in the wilderness until the day of his appearance to Israel.|Di pikni gruo op an get chrang iina spirit, an im did liv iina di dezot til di die im shuo imself tu Izrel.

In those days a decree went out from Caesar Augustus that the entire inhabited earth should be taxed. |Iina dem die de, di Ruoman ruula, Siiza Agostos, gi aada fi rait dong di niem a evribadi iina im kindom.
This taxation was first made when Quirinius was governor of Syria.
column2: (Dis a di fos taim niem a rait dong sins di taim wen Kiriniyos did a ruul uova Siriya.)

column1: And everyone went to his own city to be taxed.|Aal im piipl dem did afi go a di toun we dem baan fi get dem niem rait dong, so di govament kyan taks dem.

So Joseph also departed from the city of Nazareth in Galilee to the City of David which is called Bethlehem, in Judea, because he was of the house and lineage of David|So kaaz Juozif did kom fram Dievid fambili an Dievid did baan iina Judiya, im did afi lef fram Nazaret iina Gyalalii an go a Betliyem iina Judiya.
to be taxed with Mary, his betrothed wife, who was with child. |Juozif go de wid Mieri fi get dem niem rait dong. Di tuu a dem did ingiej fi marid dem wan aneda an shi did av biebi iina beli.
So while they were there, the day came for her to give birth. |Wen dem de de, Mieri tek iin fi av biebi,

And she gave birth to her firstborn Son, and wrapped Him in strips of cloth, and laid Him in a manger, because there was no room for them in the inn.|an shi av ar fos pikni, wan bwai. Shi rap im op iina biebi blangkit an put im iina di baks we di animal dem nyam outa, kaaz no spies neva iina di ges ous fi dem.
And in the same area there were shepherds living in the fields, keeping watch over their flock by night.|Da nait de, som shepad did a luk aafa dem shiip iina wan fiil, nier we Mieri dem did de.

And then an angel of the Lord appeared to them, and the glory of the Lord shone around them, and they were very afraid.|Wan a di Laad ienjel dem kom tu di shepad dem. Wan brait brait lait fram Gad kova dem an it mek dem fraitn so til.

But the angel said to them, “Listen! Do not fear. For I bring you good news of great joy, which will be to all people.|So di ienjel tel dem se, “No fried! Mi av gud nyuuz fi unu. Nyuuz we a-go mek evribadi api.
For unto you is born this day in the City of David a Savior, who is Christ the Lord.|Di wan we a-go siev unu baan tide iina di toun we Dievid kom fram. Im a Krais, di Laad.

And this will be a sign to you: You will find the Baby wrapped in strips of cloth, lying in a manger.”|Mi a-go tel unu wa unu a-go si, so wen unu si dat unu a-go nuo se a im. Unu a-go si wan biebi rap op iina wan biebi blangkit an a lidong iina di baks we di animal dem nyam outa.”
Suddenly there was with the angel a company of the heavenly host praising God and saying,|Aal av a sodn uol iip a ienjel fram evn, jain im. Dem did a priez di Laad an se,
“Glory to God in the highest,and on earth peace, and good will toward men.”|“Priez Gad we de a evn,an piis fi evribadi we Gad api wid.”

When the angels went away from them into heaven, the shepherds said to each other, “Let us now go to Bethlehem and see what has happened, which the Lord has made known to us.”|Afta di ienjel dem lef an go baka evn, di shepad dem se tu dem wan aneda, “Mek wi go a Betliyem go si aal a wa di Laad tel wi bout.”
So they came hurrying and found Mary and Joseph, and the Baby lying in a manger.|Dem ori an go fain Mieri, Juozif an biebi Jiizas, we did a lai dong iina di bed we mek outa jrai graas.
When they had seen Him, they made widely known the word which was told them concerning this Child. |Wen dem si dem, dem tel evribadi aal a wa di ienjel did se bout di biebi.
And all those who heard it marveled at what the shepherds told them.|An evribadi we ier wa di shepad dem se, shak.
But Mary kept all these things and pondered them in her heart.|Bot Mieri, shi kip wa dem se iina ar aat an tingk bout dem aal di taim.

The shepherds returned, glorifying and praising God for all the things they had heard and seen, as it had been told them.|Di shepad dem go bak tu dem shiip a priez Gad fi aal we dem ier an si, kaaz evriting dem did si an ier a jos laik ou di ienjel did tel dem.

When eight days had passed and the Child was circumcised, He was named ­JESUS, the name given by the angel before He was conceived in the womb.|Iet die afta di biebi baan a did taim fi sorkomsaiz an niem im. Dem kaal im Jiizas. Jos laik ou di ienjel se dem fi kaal im, lang bifuo im baan.

When the days of her purification according to the Law of Moses were completed, they brought Him to Jerusalem to present Him to the Lord|Di die kom fi dem gi op sakrifais fi get bak kliin iina Gad yai, laik we Muoziz Laa se dem fi du. So Juozif an Mieri go a Jeruusilem an dem kyari Jiizas wid dem fi gi im tu di Laad,
(as it is written in the law of the Lord, “Every firstborn male shall be called holy to the Lord”) |(kaaz it rait iina Gad Laa se, “Evri bwai biebi we a im mada fos pikni bilang tu di Laad.”)

and to offer a sacrifice according to what is said in the law of the Lord, “a pair of turtledoves, or two young pigeons.”|So Mieri an Juozif kyari di sakrifais we Gad Laa se dem fi gi, “tuu dov ar tuu yong pijin.”

Now there was a man in Jerusalem whose name was Simeon, and this man was righteous and devout, waiting for the consolation of Israel, and the Holy Spirit was upon him.|Nou yu did av wan man iina Jeruusilem niem Simiyan. Simiyan a did wan gud sumadi we riili did a liv fi Gad. Im did a wiet fi Gad frii Izrel fram sofarieshan an di Uoli Spirit did de wid im.
It was revealed to him by the Holy Spirit that he would not die before he had seen the Lord’s Christ.
column2: Di Uoli Spirit did tel im se im naa go ded bifuo im si di Krais we di Laad pramis fi sen kom.

column1: Led by the Spirit, he came into the temple. And when the parents brought in the Child Jesus, to do for Him according to the custom of the law,|Di Spirit liid Simiyan go iina di yaad we Gad ous de an wen Mieri an Juozif kyari iin Jiizas fi du wa di Laa tel dem fi du,
he received Him in his arms and blessed God and said:|Simiyan tek di biebi an priez Gad a se,
“Lord, now let Your servant depart in peace,according to Your word;|“Laad, we yu pramis mi kom chuu,so nou mi kyan ded iina piis.
for my eyes have seen Your salvation|Kaaz wid mi uon tuu yai dem,mi si di sumadi we yu sen fi siev piipl.
which You have prepared in the sight of all people,|An yu a-go mek evribadi si ou im dwi'it
a light for revelation to the Gentiles,and the glory of Your people Israel.”|im a di lait we a-go mek piipl we a no Juunuo yu wiez an bring nof rispek tu yu piipl Izrel.”
Joseph and His mother were amazed at those things which were spoken about Him.
column2: Juozif an Mieri kudn biliiv we Simiyan se bout dem pikni.

column1: Then Simeon blessed them and said to Mary His mother, “Listen, this Child is destined to cause the fall and rising of many in Israel and to be a sign which will be spoken against|Simiyan bles dem an tel Mieri se, “Dis ya pikni ya baan fi bring dong jojment an fi bles uol iip a piipl iina Izrel tu. Im a-go bi wan sain fram Gad bot piipl a-go fait gens im.

so that the thoughts of many hearts may be revealed. And a sword will pierce through your own soul also.”|Siek-a dat, wa dem tingk iina dem aat a-go kom out iina di uopm. Mieri it a-go komiin laik wan suod a go chuu yu aat.”

And there was Anna a prophetess, a daughter of Phanuel, of the tribe of Asher. She was of a great age and had lived with her husband seven years from her virginity.|Wan uol uman niem Ana we a did wan prafit did de de tu. Shi a did Fanyuuwel daata, wan man we kom fram Asha chraib. Shi did marid, bot a onggl sevn ier shi an ar ozban did marid fa bifuo im ded.

And she was a widow of about eighty-four years of age who did not depart from the temple, but served God with fasting and prayer night and day.|An shi neva av no ada ozban aal wen shi ieti fuo. Maanin, nuun an nait, shi spen taim iina Gad ous, a faas an a prie.

Coming at that moment she gave thanks to the Lord and spoke of Him to all those who looked for the redemption of Jerusalem.|Siem taim Simiyan a taak tu Mieri bout Jiizas, Ana kom tu dem an staat fi priez Gad. Shi tel evribadi we did a luk fi Gad fi frii Jeruusilem, bout di pikni.

When they had performed everything according to the law of the Lord, they returned to Galilee, to their own city of Nazareth.|Afta Juozif an Mieri du wa Gad Laa se dem fi du, dem go baka dem yaad iina Nazaret we de a Gyalalii.
And the Child grew and became strong in spirit, filled with wisdom. And the grace of God was upon Him.|Jiizas gruo op an get chrang. Im did av sens an im did brait. An Gad did a bles im.

Now His parents went to Jerusalem every year at the Feast of the Passover. |Evri ier, Jiizas mada an faada go a Jeruusilem fi di Paasuova alidie — wan alidie fi memba ou Gad did tek di Izrel piipl dem outa Iijip.
When He was twelve years old, they went up to Jerusalem according to the custom of the feast.|Wen Jiizas riich twelv, dem kyari im go wid dem.

When the days of the feast were complete, as they returned, the Child Jesus remained behind in Jerusalem. And Joseph and His mother did not know of it. |Wen di alidie don, im mada an faada lef fi go baka dem yaad, bot dem neva nuo se Jiizas did stil de a Jeruusilem.

But supposing Him to be in their company, they went a day’s journey. Then they searched for Him among their relatives and acquaintances. |Dem tek it se im did iina di gruup a fambili an fren we dem did a chravl wid; so dem chravl fi wan uol die bifuo dem staat luk fi im mongks di gruup.
When they did not find Him, they returned to Jerusalem, searching for Him.|Wen dem no fain Jiizas, dem go baka Jeruusilem fi go luk fi im.

After three days they found Him in the temple, sitting in the midst of the teachers, listening to them and asking them questions. |Chrii die paas bifuo dem fain Jiizas iina Gad ous, sidong wid di tiicha dem, a lisn tu dem, an a aks dem kwestiyan.
All who heard Him were astonished at His understanding and His answers.
column2: Evribadi we ier Jiizas taak kudn biliiv di wie ou im ansa kwestiyan an di sitn dem we im andastan.

column1: When they saw Him, they were amazed. And His mother said to Him, “Son, why have You dealt with us like this? Look, Your father and I have anxiously searched for You.”|Wen Jiizas mada an faada si im, dem shak. Im mada se tu im se, “Si ya! Bwai, mek yu du wi so? Mi an yu faada did a luk fi yu ou lang!”
He said to them, “How is it that you searched for Me? Did you not know that I must be about My Father’s business?”|Jiizas se, “Wa mek unu a luk fi mi? Unu neva nuo se mi wuda iina mi faada ous?”
But they did not understand the word which He spoke to them.
column2: Dem neehn andastan wa im a se tu dem.

column1: Then He went down with them and came to Nazareth and was obedient to them. But His mother kept all these words in her heart.
column2: Afta dat Jiizas go bak uom a Nazaret wid dem an im du evriting dem tel im fi du. An im mada kip aal a dem sitn de iina ar aat.

column1: And Jesus increased in wisdom and in stature and in favor with God and men.
column2: Jiizas gruo op big. Im did brait an av nof sens. Gad did api wid wa im a du an di piipl dem did api tu.

column1: In the fifteenth year of the reign of Caesar Tiberius, Pontius Pilate was governor of Judea, Herod was tetrarch of Galilee, his brother Philip was tetrarch of Iturea and the region of Traconitis, and Lysanias was the tetrarch of Abilene.|A fiftiin ier nou Taibiiriyos did a Ed Ruula iina Ruom, im did av Ponchos Pailat a ron Judiya, Erad Antipas a ron Gyalalii, im breda Filip a ron Aituuriya an Chrakonaitis an Lizaniya did a ron Abiliin.

Annas and Caiaphas being the high priests, the word of God came to John the son of Zechariah in the wilderness.|Anas an Kaiyafas a did liida fi di priis dem. Iina da siem taim de Jan, Zakaraiya bwai pikni, did de iina di dezot an get wan mesij fram Gad.

He came into the region surrounding the Jordan, preaching the baptism of repentance for the remission of sins.|Im go aal roun Jaadn a priich se di piipl dem fi ton we fram dem sin an get baptaiz, an Gad wi paadn dem fi aal di rang we dem du.

As it is written in the book of the words of Isaiah the prophet, saying:“The voice of one crying in the wilderness:‘Prepare the way of the Lord;make His paths straight.|A im Aizaiya, di prafit, did a rait bout wen im se:“Sumadi a shout iina di dezot,‘Klier di wie fi di Laad kom chuu,mek di chrak we im fi waak pan chriet.

Every valley shall be filledand every mountain and hill shall be brought low;and the crooked shall be made straightand the rough ways shall be made smooth;|Evri goli a-go riez op,An evri moutn an il a-go mash dong.Evri ruod we twis an ton a-go chrietn out,an evri chrak a-go sumuud out.
and all flesh shall see the salvation of God.’ ”
column2: An evribadi a-go si ou Gad siev piipl.’ ”

column1: Then he said to the crowds that came out to be baptized by him, “You children of vipers! Who warned you to flee from the wrath to come? |Wan iip a piipl did kom fi Jan baptaiz dem, im se tu dem se, “Unu siniek pikni unu! A uu waan unu fi ron we fram di jojment we a kom?

Therefore bear fruit worthy of repentance, and do not begin to say to yourselves, ‘We have Abraham as our father.’ For I say to you that God is able from these stones to raise up children for Abraham.|Du di sitn dem we shuo se unu riili tap sin. An no bada staat tingk tu unuself se unu sief, an se, ‘A Iebriyam a wi faada.’ Mek mi tel unu sopm, Gad kyan mek pikni fi Iebriyam outa dem rakstuon ya ef im waahn!
Even now the axe is put to the root of the trees. Every tree therefore which does not bear good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire.”
column2: Rait ya nou di aks de a di chrii ruut. An evri wan a di chrii dem we naa bier gud fruut a-go chap dong an bon op iina faiya.”

column1: The people asked him, “What then must we do?”|Di kroud aks Jan, “So wa wi fi du den?”

John answered, “He who has two tunics, let him give to him who has none. And he who has food, let him do likewise.”|Im se tu dem se, “Ef yu av tuu shot yu fi gi sumadi wan an ef yu av fuud yu fi du di siem ting.”
Then tax collectors also came to be baptized and said to him, “Teacher, what must we do?”|Taks kalekta kom fi get baptaiz tu. “Tiicha,” dem aks Jan, “wa wi fi du?”
He said to them, “Collect no more than what is appointed you.”|Jan tel dem, “No kalek no muo dan we yu fi kalek.”

Then the soldiers likewise demanded of him, “And what must we do?” He said to them, “Do no violence to anyone nor accuse any falsely, and be content with your wages.”|Den som suoja aks Jan, “So wa bout wi, wa wi fi du?”Jan ansa, “No bad op piipl an tek we dem moni ar tel lai pan dem fi get it niida. Unu fi satisfai wid di pie we unu get.”

As the people were in expectation, and everyone reflected in their hearts upon John, whether he might be the Christ or not,|Dem taim de piipl did a riili luk fi di wan we Gad a sen fi siev dem, an a wanda iina dem main ef Jan a di Krais.

John answered them all, “I indeed baptize you with water. But One mightier than I is coming, the strings of whose shoes I am not worthy to untie. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and with fire. |So im se tu dem, “Mi baptaiz unu iina waata. Bot sumadi we muo impuotant dan mi a kom an mi no iivn gud inof fi pul di chrap pan im slipaz. Im wi baptaiz unu iina di Uoli Spirit an faiya.

His fan is in His hand, and He will thoroughly cleanse His threshing floor, and will gather the wheat into His granary. But He will burn the chaff with unquenchable fire.” |Im av im faak iina im an, redi fi riek op di fluor wich paat di grien chrash out. Im a-go gyada op di grien an put it iina im bochri, bot im a-go bon di chrash iina wan faiya we kyaahn out.”
Then he preached many other things in his exhortation to the people.
column2: An Jan yuuz uol iip a ada wod fi gi gud nyuuz tu di piipl dem.

column1: But Herod the tetrarch, being rebuked by him because of Herodias, his brother Philip’s wife, and for all the evils which Herod had done|Bot afta Jan tan op tu Erad Antipas, di ruula, an tel im ou im rang fi marid im breda waif, Eruodiyas, an bout aal di ada wikidnis dem we im du,
added also this above them all: He locked John up in prison.|Erad du wan wosa sitn, im lak op Jan iina prizn.

Now when all the people were baptized, and when Jesus also had been baptized and was praying, the heavens were opened, |Wen aal a di piipl dem did a get baptaiz, Jiizas kom fi get baptaiz tu. Wen im did a get baptaiz an a prie evn uopm op

and the Holy Spirit descended in a bodily form like a dove on Him, and a voice came from heaven which said, “You are My beloved Son. In You I am well pleased.”|an di Uoli Spirit kom dong pan Jiizas iina di shiep a wan dov. An wan vais fram evn se, “Yu a fi mi wan dege-dege bwai, mi lov yu an yu mek mi aat glad.”

Now Jesus Himself began His ministry at about thirty years of age, being, as was supposed, the son of Joseph,who was the son of Heli,|Nou, Jiizas did bout toti wen im staat priich. Piipl did tingk se Jiizas a fi Juozif bwai.Juozif a did Eli pikni,

who was the son of Matthat,who was the son of Levi, who was the son of Melchi,who was the son of Jannai, who was the son of Joseph,|Eli faada a did Matat,Matat a did Liivai pikni, Liivai faada a did Melki,Melki a did Janai pikni, Janai faada a did Juozif,

who was the son of Mattathias, who was the son of Amos,who was the son of Nahum, who was the son of Esli,who was the son of Naggai,|Juozif a did Matataiyas pikni, Matataiyas faada a did Iemos,Iemos faada a did Nieyom, Nieyom a did Eslai pikni,Eslai faada a did Nagai,

who was the son of Maath,who was the son of Mattathias, who was the son of Semein,who was the son of Josech, who was the son of Joda,|Nagai a did Maat pikni,Maat faada a did Matataiyas, Matataiyas a did Semiyen pikni,Semiyen faada a did Jozek, Jozek a did Juoda pikni

who was the son of Joanan, who was the son of Rhesa,who was the son of Zerubbabel, who was the son of Shealtiel,who was the son of Neri, |Juoda faada a did Juonan, Juonan a did Resa pikni,Resa faada a did Zeruubabel, Zeruubabel a did Shiyaltiyel pikni,Shiyaltiyel faada a did Neri,

who was the son of Melchi,who was the son of Addi, who was the son of Cosam,who was the son of Elmadam, who was the son of Er,|Neri a did Melki pikni,Melki faada a Adi, Adi a did Kosam pikni,Kosam faada a did Elmadam, Elmadam a did Or pikni,

who was the son of Joshua, who was the son of Eliezer,who was the son of Jorim, who was the son of Matthat,who was the son of Levi, |Or faada a did Jashwa, Jashwa a did Eliyiiza pikni,Eliyiiza faada a did Jorim, Jorim a did Matat pikni,Mata faada a did Liivai

who was the son of Simeon,who was the son of Judah, who was the son of Joseph,who was the son of Jonan, who was the son of Eliakim,|Liivai a did Simiyan pikni,Simiyan faada a did Juuda, Juuda a did Juozif pikni,Juozif faada a did Juonam, Juonam a did Elaiyakim pikni,

who was the son of Melea, who was the son of Menna,who was the son of Mattatha, who was the son of Nathan,who was the son of David,|Elaiyakim faada a did Miliya, Miliya a did Mena pikni,Mena faada a did Matata, Matata a did Nietan pikni,Nietan faada a did Dievid,

who was the son of Jesse,who was the son of Obed, who was the son of Boaz,who was the son of Salmon, who was the son of Nahshon,|Dievid a did Jesi pikni,Jesi faada a did Obed, Obed a did Buowaz pikni,Buowaz faada a did Siela pikni, Siela a did Nieshan pikni,

who was the son of Amminadab, who was the son of Ram,who was the son of Hezron, who was the son of Perez,who was the son of Judah, |Nieshan faada a did Aminadab, Aminadab a did Ram pikni,Ram faada a did Ezran, Ezran a did Perez pikni,Perez faada a did Juuda,
who was the son of Hezron, who was the son of Perez,|Juuda a did Jiekob pikni,Jiekob faada a did Aizak, Aizak a did Iebriyam pikni,Iebriyam faada a did Tera, Tera a did Nieyar pikni,

who was the son of Serug, who was the son of Reu,who was the son of Peleg, who was the son of Eber,who was the son of Shelah,|Nieyar faada a did Serog, Serog a did Ruu pikni,Ruu faada a did Peleg, Peleg a did Eba pikni,Eba faada a did Shiila,

who was the son of Cainan,who was the son of Arphaxad, who was the son of Shem,who was the son of Noah, who was the son of Lamech,|Shiila faada a did Kienan,Kienan a did Arfaksad pikni, Arfaksad faada a did Shem,Shem a did Nowa pikni, Nowa faada a did Lamek,

who was the son of Methuselah, who was the son of Enoch,who was the son of Jared, who was the son of Mahalalel,who was the son of Cainan, |Lamek a did Metyuuzila pikni, Metyuuzila faada a did Iinok,Iinok a did Jared pikni, Jared faada a did Mayalalel,Mayalalel a did Kienan pikni,
who was the son of Enosh,who was the son of Seth, who was the son of Adam,who was the son of God.|Kienan faada a did Iinos,Iinos a did Set pikni, Set faada a did Adam.Adam a did Gad pikni.
Jesus, being filled with the Holy Spirit, returned from the Jordan and was led by the Spirit into the wilderness,|Afta Jiizas get baptaiz, di Uoli Spirit tek kanchuol a im an mek im go iina di dezot.

being tempted by the devil for forty days. During those days He ate nothing. And when they were ended, He was hungry.|Im did de de fi faati die an fi di uol taim, di devl chrai aad aad fi mek im du rang. Nou, Jiizas did onggri bad kaaz fi di faati die im neehn nyam notn.
The devil said to Him, “If You are the Son of God, command this stone to become bread.”|Di devl se tu Jiizas, “Ef yu a Gad Bwai Pikni, tel da rakstuon ya fi ton bred.”
Jesus answered him, “It is written, ‘Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word of God.’”|Jiizas ansa, “It rait dong iina Gad wod se, ‘Man no liv pan bred wan.’”

The devil, taking Him up onto a high mountain, showed Him all the kingdoms of the world in a moment of time. |Di devl kyari Jiizas op a wan taal taal plies an bifuo im kuda kwint so, im shuo im aal di konchri dem iina di worl.

And the devil said to Him, “I will give You all this power and their glory, for it has been delivered to me. And I give it to whomever I will.|Im tel Jiizas se, “Mi wi gi yu powa uova aal a dem konchri ya an aal a di nais sitn we kom wid dem, kaaz mi get dem an mi kyan gi enibadi mi waahn.
If You, then, will worship me, all will be Yours.”|Ef yu worship mi, aal a it a fi yu.”

And Jesus answered him, “Get behind Me, Satan! For it is written, ‘You shall worship the Lord your God, and Him only shall you serve.’”|An Jiizas ansa im, “It rait dong se, ‘Yu fi worship di Laad we a yu Gad, an a im wan yu fi sorv.’ ”

He brought Him to Jerusalem, set Him on the pinnacle of the temple, and said to Him, “If You are the Son of God, throw Yourself down from here. |Den di devl kyari Jiizas go a Jeruusilem an mek im tan op pan di taalis paat a Gad ous. “Ef yu a Gad Bwai Pikni,” di devl se, “jomp aafa ya-so.
For it is written:‘He shall give His angels charge concerning you,to preserve you,’|Kaaz it rait dong se,‘Gad wi tel im ienjel demfi tek gud kier a yu,’ an dat
and‘In their hands they shall hold you up,lest you strike your foot against a stone.’”|‘dem wi kech yu, so yu no lik op yu fut pan rakstuon.’”
Jesus answered him, “It is said, ‘You shall not tempt the Lord your God.’”|Jiizas ansa im se, “It rait dong se, ‘No tes di Laad we a yu Gad.’”
When the devil had ended all the temptations, he departed from Him until another time.|Afta di devl don chrai aad aad fi mek Jiizas du rang, im lef im til im get wan neks chaans.

Jesus returned in the power of the Spirit to Galilee. And His fame went throughout the surrounding region.|Jiizas go baka Gyalalii anda di Spirit powa, an nyuuz bout im staat fi pred so til piipl we liv nier Gyalalii ier bout im.
He taught in their synagogues, being glorified by everyone.|Im tiich iina di Juu dem choch, an evribadi taak gud bout im.

He came to Nazareth, where He had been brought up. And as His custom was, He went to the synagogue on the Sabbath day. And He stood up to read. |Wen Jiizas riich a Nazaret, di plies we paat im gruo op, im go iina di Juu dem choch pan di Sabat, laik im aalwiez du. Im tan op fi riid

The scroll of the prophet Isaiah was handed to Him. When He had unrolled the scroll, He found the place where it was written:|an dem gi im di ruol op buk we di prafit Aizaiya rait. Im ruol it out an fain di paat we se:

“The Spirit of the Lord is upon Me,because He has anointed Meto preach the gospel to the poor;He has sent Me to heal the broken-hearted,to preach deliverance to the captivesand recovery of sight to the blind,to set at liberty those who are oppressed;|“Di Spirit a di Laad de pan mi,kaaz im pik mi outfi kyari gud nyuuz go gi puo piipl.Im sen mi fi mek di prizna dem nuo se dem a-go frii,fi mek blain piipl nuo se dem a-go si agen,fi mek piipl we a sofa nuo se dem naa go sofa fi eva.
to preach the acceptable year of the Lord.”
column2: An im pik mi out fi mek piipl nuo se dis a di taim wen di Laad a-go siev im piipl dem.”

column1: Then He rolled up the scroll, and He gave it back to the attendant, and sat down. The eyes of all those who were in the synagogue were fixed on Him. |Wen Jiizas don, im ruol op bak di buk gi dem an sidong. Evribadi we iina di Juu dem choch yai did faasn pan im
And He began to say to them, “Today this Scripture is fulfilled in your hearing.”|an Jiizas staat fi tel dem se, “Tide tide, aal a we unu jos ier, kom chuu.”

All bore witness to Him, and wondered at the gracious words which came from His mouth. Then they said, “Is this not Joseph’s son?”|Evribadi taak gud bout im an dem fraitn fi ier di nais sitn dem we im se. “Wiet! No Juozif bwai dis?” dem se.

He said to them, “You will surely say to Me this proverb, ‘Physician, heal Yourself. Whatever we have heard done in Capernaum, do also here in Your country.’ ”|Jiizas se tu dem, “Uol taim piipl yuus tu se, ‘Dakta, kyuor yuself.’ Mi nuo se no tuu lang fram nou unu a-go tel mi di siem sitn. Unu a-go tel mi se, ‘Di siem sitn dem we wi ier se yu du iina Kyaporniyom du dem rait ya-so wich paat yu kom fram.’ ”
He also said, “Truly, I say to you, no prophet is accepted in his own country. |“Mek mi tel unu dis.” Jiizas se, “Non a di prafit dem neva get rispek fram di piipl dem we dem baan an gruo mongks.

But I tell you truthfully, many widows were in Israel in the days of Elijah, when the heavens were closed for three years and six months, when great famine was throughout all the land.|A chuu ting se, nof uman we ozban ded did de a Izrel iina Ilaija taim. Dem taim de no rien neehn faal fi chrii an a aaf ier an bad bad staavieshan did de aal uova di konchri.

Yet to none of them was Elijah sent except to Zarephath, a city of Sidon, to a woman who was a widow. |Bot Gad neva sen Ilaija go a non a dem. Gad onggl sen im go wan plies niem Zarifat iina Saidan tu wan uman we ozban ded.

And many lepers were in Israel in the time of Elisha the prophet. But none of them was cleansed except Naaman the Syrian.”|Siem ting did apm a Izrel iina di taim a Ilaisha, di prafit. Uol iip a piipl did av wan siknis we mek dem skin fasi-fasi, bot a onggl di Siriyan we niem Nieman get iil.”
All those in the synagogue, when they heard these things, were filled with wrath.|Aal di piipl dem iina di Juu dem choch beks wen dem ier dis.

They rose up and thrust Him out of the city and led Him to the brow of the hill on which their city was built, that they might throw Him down headlong.|Dem get op, ron Jiizas outa di toun, an kyari im go a di ej a di il wich paat di toun de fi fling im uova it.
But passing through the midst of them, He went His way.|Bot Jiizas jos slip chuu di kroud an go bout im bizniz.
Then He went down to Capernaum, a city of Galilee, and was teaching them on the Sabbaths.|Den Jiizas go dong a Kyaporniyom, wan toun iina Gyalalii, an staat fi tiich di piipl pan di Sabat.
They were astonished at His teaching, for His word was with authority.|Di wie ou im tiich shak dem, kaaz im mesij shuo se im nuo we im a taak bout.

In the synagogue there was a man who had the spirit of an unclean demon. And he cried out with a loud voice, |Wan man wid wan diiman iina im, did de iina di Juu dem choch. Im baal out pan di tap a im vais.

“Leave us alone! What have You to do with us, Jesus of Nazareth? Have You come to destroy us? I know who You are—the Holy One of God!”|“Cho! Jiizas a Nazaret we yu waahn wid wi? A kom yu kom fi kil wi aaf? Mi nuo uu yu bi. Yu a di Uoli Wan we kom fram Gad!”

Jesus rebuked him, saying, “Be silent, and come out of him!” When the demon had thrown him down in their midst, he came out of him and did not hurt him.|“Kiba yu mout!” Jiizas se iina wan siiros vais. “Kom outa di man!” Di diiman fling dong di man fronta evribadi an kom out bot neva ort di man.

They were all amazed and said among themselves, “What a word this is! For with authority and power He commands the unclean spirits, and they come out.” |Aal a di piipl dem shak an se tu dem wan aneda, “Bot a wa dis ya? Im av di rait an di powa fi aada diiman fi kom outa piipl an dem kom out!
And His fame went out to every place in the surrounding countryside.
column2: An di nyuuz bout Jiizas pred aal bout di plies.

column1: He went out of the synagogue and entered Simon’s house. Now Simon’s mother-in-law was taken ill with a high fever, and they asked Him about her. |Wen Jiizas lef di Juu dem choch an go a Saiman yaad, Saiman mada-in-laa did av ai fiiva, so dem aks Jiizas fi elp ar.

So He stood over her and rebuked the fever, and it left her. And immediately she rose and served them.|So Jiizas tan op an tel di fiiva fi tap, an di fiiva brok. Shi get op siem taim an staat luk aafa dem.

Now when the sun was setting, all those who had anyone sick with various diseases brought them to Him. And He laid His hands on every one of them and healed them. |Wen di son did a go dong, di piipl dem we av sumadi we sik, kyari dem kom a Jiizas. Im put im an pan evri wan a dem an mek dem beta, no mata wa dem did sik wid.

And demons came out of many, crying out, “You are the Christ, the Son of God!” But He rebuked them and did not permit them to speak, because they knew that He was the Christ.|Diiman kom outa nof piipl an a shout, “Yu a Gad pikni!” Dem did nuo se im a di Krais, so Jiizas mek dem kyaahn se notn.

When it was day He departed and went into a remote place. And searching for Him, the people came to Him and tried to prevent Him from leaving them. |Di neks maanin Jiizas go wan plies wich paat nobadi neehn de. Aal dem taim de, di piipl did a luk fi im aad aad an wen dem du fain im, dem chrai fi mek im no go we.

But He said to them, “I must preach the kingdom of God to other cities also, for this is why I was sent.”|Bot Jiizas tel dem se, “Mi afi go gi di gud nyuuz bout Gad kindom tu di ada toun dem, kaaz a dat Gad sen mi fi du.”
And He was preaching in the synagogues of Galilee.
column2: An so Jiizas gwaan priich iina di Juu dem choch dem we de iina Judiya.

column1: As the people pressed upon Him to hear the word of God, He stood by the Lake of Gennesaret|Wan die, Jiizas did tan op a liek Genesaret an piipl did a kroud roun im fi lisn we Gad wod se.
and saw two boats beside the lake. But the fishermen had gone out of them and were washing their nets.
column2: Wen im luk im si tuu buot pan di liek-said. Di fishaman dem did lef dem de an did a wash dem net.

column1: He entered one of the boats, which was Simon’s, and asked him to thrust it out a little from the land. Then He sat down and taught the people from the boat.|So Jiizas go iina Saiman buot, an aks im fi kyari di buot go out likl muo iina di waata. Den Jiizas sidong an tiich di piipl dem.

When He had finished speaking, He said to Simon, “Launch out into the deep and let down your nets for a catch.”|Afta Jiizas don taak, im se tu Saiman, “Go out iina diip waata, an chuo out di net fi kech fish.”

Simon answered Him, “Master, we have worked all night and have caught nothing. But at Your word I will let down the net.”|Saiman ansa, “Tiicha, wi wok aad uol nait an wi no kech notn. Bot sins yu se so, mi wi du wa yu se.”
When they had done this, they caught a great number of fish, and their net was tearing. |Wen di fishaman dem we did a wok wid Saiman du we Jiizas se, dem kech so moch fish dem net staat bos op.

So they signaled to their partners in the other boat to come and help them. And they came and filled both boats, so that they began to sink.|So di fishaman dem kaal dem brejrin dem iina di ada buot fi kom elp dem, an di tuu buot dem ful so til dem staat singk.

When Simon Peter saw it, he fell down at Jesus’ knees, saying, “Depart from me, for I am a sinful man, O Lord.” |Wen taim Saiman Piita si aal a dis, im jrap dong a Jiizas fut an se, “Kip we fram mi Laad kaaz mi a wan man we du nof rang!”
For he and all who were with him were astonished at the catch of fish which they had taken, |Saiman an aal a di man dem we did de de wid im shak wen dem si di iip a fish we dem kech.

and so were James and John, the sons of Zebedee, who were partners with Simon. Then Jesus said to Simon, “Do not fear. From now on you will catch men.” |Tuu a Saiman brejrin dem we did fraitn tu, a Jiemz an Jan, Zebidii bwai dem.Den Jiizas se tu Saiman, “No fried, fram nou aan, yu naa go kech fish, yu a-go kech piipl.”
So when they had brought their boats to land, they left everything and followed Him.|So dem pul dem buot pan di liek-said, lef evriting an fala Jiizas.

When He was in a certain city, a man full of leprosy, upon seeing Jesus, fell on his face and begged Him, “Lord, if You will, You can make me clean.”|Wan taim wen Jiizas did iina wan toun, wan man kom tu im we av wan siknis we mek im skin fasi-fasi. Wen im si Jiizas, im go dong pan im nii, put im fies a grong an beg im se, “Laad, ef yu waahn fi kyuor mi an mek mi kliin, yu av di powa fi dwi'it.”

He reached out His hand and touched him, saying, “I will. Be clean.” And immediately the leprosy left him.|Jiizas put out im an toch di man an se, “Mi waahn yu fi get kliin. Gwaan yu beta nou!” An siem taim di man skin get beta.

Then He commanded him to tell no one, “But go and show yourself to the priest and make an offering for your cleansing, as Moses commanded, as a testimony to them.”|Jiizas tel im no fi tel nobadi, im se, “Jos gwaan go shuo yuself tu di priis an kyari di sakrifais we Muoziz Laa se yu fi gi wen yu skin get beta. Dat wi shuo evribadi se yu get kliin.”

Yet even more so His fame went everywhere. And great crowds came together to hear and to be healed by Him of their infirmities. |Bot nyuuz bout Jiizas pred muo, an kroud an kroud a piipl kom fi ier im an fi get kyuor fram dem siknis.
But He withdrew to the wilderness and prayed.
column2: Bot uol iip a taim Jiizas go we a wan plies we im kuda tan bai imself an prie.

column1: On a certain day, as He was teaching, Pharisees and teachers of the law were sitting nearby, who had come from every town of Galilee and Judea and from Jerusalem. And the power of the Lord was present to heal the sick.|Wan die wen Jiizas did a tiich, som Farisii an som a di Laa tiicha dem did sidong a lisn tu im. Dem kom fram evri dischrik iina Gyalalii, Judiya an Jeruusilem. Pan da die de Gad gi Jiizas di powa fi mek di sik piipl dem beta.

Now some men brought in a bed a man who was paralyzed. They searched for ways to bring him in and lay him before Him.|Jiizas did a tiich wen som man kom de wid dem kripl fren pan wan chrecha. Dem chrai fi kyari im iina di ous, fi put im infronta Jiizas.

When they could not find a way to bring him in, because of the crowd, they went up on the roof and let him down through the tiles with his bed into their midst before Jesus.|Siek-a di kroud, dem kudn du it, so dem klaim op pan di ous tap an let im dong chuu di ruuf. Dem put im rait iina di migl a di kroud, infronta Jiizas.
When He saw their faith, He said to him, “Man, your sins are forgiven you.”|Wen Jiizas si ou dem biliiv iina im, im tel di kripl man se, “Fren, mi paadn yu fram aal a yu sin dem.”

The scribes and the Pharisees began to question, “Who is He who speaks blasphemies? Who can forgive sins but God alone?”|Di Farisii an di Laa tiicha dem staat se tu demself se, “A uu im tingk im bi, kom a disrispek Gad! No Gad wan kyan paadn sin?”
When Jesus perceived their thoughts, He answered them, “Why question in your hearts? |Jiizas did nuo wa dem did a tingk an so im aks dem se, “Wa mek unu tingk dem sitn de iina unu aat?
Which is easier, to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven you,’ or to say, ‘Rise up and walk’?|Wich wan iiziya fi se, ‘Mi paadn yu sin dem,’ ar, ‘Get op an waak?’

But that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins,”He said to the paralyzed man, “I say to you, rise, take up your bed, and go to your house.”|Bot fi mek unu nuo, mi a-go shuo unu se di Man we Gad Pik av di rait an di powa fi paadn sin pan ort,” so Jiizas se tu di kripl man se, “Git op, tek op yu chrecha an go a yu yaad.”

Immediately he rose before them, and took up that on which he lay, and departed to his own house, glorifying God.|Siem taim, di kripl man tan op infronta dem, pik op im chrecha, an ed fi im yaad a gi Gad di priez.

They were all amazed, and they glorified God and were filled with fear, saying, “We have seen wonderful things today.”|Evribadi fraitn bout wa dem si an staat fi priez Gad. Dem se, “Wi si som big mirikl tide.”

After these things He went out and saw a tax collector, named Levi, sitting at the tax collector’s station. He said to him, “Follow Me.” |Afta Jiizas mek di man beta, im lef di toun an im si wan taks kalekta niem Liivai, a sidong a di staal we im kalek taks. Jiizas se tu im, “Fala mi.”
And he left everything, rose up, and followed Him.|An Liivai get op, lef evriting an fala Jiizas.

Then Levi made Him a great feast in his house. And there was a group of many tax collectors and others who sat down with them. |Den Liivai chuo wan big dina fi Jiizas iina im ous, an wan big kroud a taks kalekta an ada piipl did a nyam wid dem roun di tiebl.

But their scribes and Pharisees murmured against His disciples, saying, “Why do you eat and drink with tax collectors and sinners?”|Bot di Farisii an di Laa tiicha dem, komplien tu Jiizas speshal falara dem se, “Wa mek unu a nyam an jringk wid di taks kalekta an rang-duwa dem?”
Jesus answered them, “Those who are well do not need a physician, but those who are sick.|Jiizas ansa dem an se, “Piipl we no sik no niid no dakta, a onggl sik piipl niid dakta.
I have not come to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.”|Mi no kom ya fi tel piipl we du rait fi ton fram dem sin, a piipl we du rang mi kom ya fa.”

They said to Him, “Why do the disciples of John fast often and offer prayers, and likewise the disciples of the Pharisees, but Yours eat and drink?”|Dem tel Jiizas se, “Uol iip a taim, Jan falara dem kip we fram fuud an prie. Di Farisii dem dwi'it tu. Bot fi yu dem a nyam an jringk.”

He said to them, “Can you make the attendants of the bridegroom fast while the bridegroom is with them?|Jiizas ansa dem bak se, “Yu tingk se di piipl dem we di braidgruum invait a im wedn fi kip we fram fuud wen im mongks dem?

But the days will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them. Then in those days they will fast.”|Di taim a-go kom wen di braidgruum a-go gaan fram dem. A da taim de, dem wi kip we fram fuud.”

He told them a parable also: “No one sews a piece of a new material on an old one. Otherwise the new would tear, for the new piece does not match the old.|Den Jiizas tel dem se, “Nobadi no tier nyuu kluoz fi pach op uol kluoz, kaaz di pach fram di nyuu wan naa go mach di uol wan.

And no one puts new wine into old wineskins. Otherwise the new wine will burst the wineskins, and it will be spilled, and the wineskins will be destroyed. |Nobadi no put nyuu wain iina uol wain bakl. Kaaz di nyuu wain wi bos op di bakl, an di wain a-go dash we.
But new wine must be put into new wineskins, and both are preserved.|Nyuu wain mos put iina nyuu bakl.
And no one, having drunk old wine, immediately desires new. For he says, ‘The old is better.’ ”|An nobadi, afta dem jringk uol wain, no waahn nyuu wain, kaaz dem se, ‘Di uol wan beta.’ ”

On the second Sabbath after the first, He went through the grain fields, and His disciples plucked and ate the heads of grain, rubbing them in their hands.|Wan Sabat, Jiizas did a waak chuu wan wiit fiil, an im speshal falara dem staat pik som a di wiit, rob aaf di chrash iina dem an an nyam di grien.
Some of the Pharisees said to them, “Why are you doing what is not lawful to do on the Sabbath?”|Som Farisii si dem an aks, “Wa mek unu a du wa di Laa se wi no fi du pan di Sabat?”
Jesus answered them, “Have you not read what David did when he and those who were with him were hungry? |Jiizas ansa dem se, “Unu neva riid wa Dievid did du wen im an im fren dem did onggri?

He went into the house of God, and took and ate the ritual bread, and also gave it to those who were with him. This was not lawful, but for the priests only to eat.”|Ou im go iina Gad ous, tek di uoli bred an nyam wa di Laa se onggl di priis dem fi get, an aal gi im fren dem som?”
Then He said to them, “The Son of Man is Lord even of the Sabbath.”|Jiizas se tu dem se, “Di Man we Gad Pik, a im ruul uova di Sabat.”

On another Sabbath, when He entered the synagogue and taught, there was a man whose right hand had withered.|Wan neks Sabat, Jiizas go iina di Juu dem choch an did a tiich di piipl dem. Wan man uufa rait an did kripl, did de de.

The scribes and the Pharisees watched Him to see whether He would heal on the Sabbath, so that they might find an accusation against Him. |Nou di Farisii an di Laa tiicha dem did a luk fi wan riizn fi se sitn bad bout Jiizas. So, dem wach im laik aak fi si ef im a-go mek nobadi beta pan di Sabat.

But He knew their thoughts, and He said to the man who had the withered hand, “Rise and stand in front.” So he rose and stood in front.|Jiizas nuo wa dem a tingk, so im se tu di man we did av di kripl an se, “Git op an tan op infronta dem.” So im get op an tan op infronta evribadi.

Then Jesus said to them, “I will ask you one thing: Is it lawful on the Sabbath to do good or to do evil, to save life or to destroy it?”|Den Jiizas tel dem se, “Mek mi aks unu wan kwestiyan, wich wan di Laa se wi kyan du pan di Sabat: fi du gud ar fi du bad, fi siev sumadi laif ar fi kaaz sumadi fi ded?”

Then looking around at them all, He said to the man, “Stretch out your hand.” He did so, and his hand was restored as whole as the other.|Jiizas luk roun pan aal a dem, an den se tu di man, “Chrech out yu an.” Di man chrech out im an, an it get beta.
But they were filled with madness and discussed with each other what they might do to Jesus.
column2: Bot di Farisii an di Laa tiicha dem did beks beks an staat fi taak mongks dem wan aneda bout wa dem fi du wid Jiizas.

column1: In these days He went out to the mountain to pray and continued all night in prayer to God.|Wan die roun dem taim de, Jiizas go op pan wan il, an im spen di uol nait op de a prie tu Gad.
When it was day, He called for His disciples, and of them He chose twelve, whom He named apostles:|Wen die lait, Jiizas kaal im falara dem an pik out twelv a dem. Im kaal dem twelv de im apasl.
Simon, whom He named Peter, and Andrew his brother, and James and John, and Philip and Bartholomew,|Im di pik: Saiman (we Jiizas kaal Piita), im breda Anju, Jiemz an Jan, Filip, Bartalimyuu,
and Matthew and Thomas, and James the son of Alphaeus, and Simon called the Zealot, |Matyu, Tamas, Jiemz (dat a Alfiyos bwai pikni), Saiman we dem kaal Zelat
and Judas the son of James, and Judas Iscariot, who became a traitor.|Juudas (Jiemz bwai pikni), an Juudas Iskyariyat, di wan we sel out Jiizas.

He came down with them and stood on a level place with a crowd of His disciplesand a great crowd of people from all Judea and Jerusalem, and from the seacoast of Tyre and Sidon, who came to hear Him and be healed of their diseases,|Jiizas an im apasl dem kom dong aafa di il an go dong pan di flat. Wan big big kroud a Jiizas falara dem did de de an uol iip a piipl fram aal uova Judiya, Jeruusilem, an nier di sii-said a Taiya an Saidan.
including those who were vexed by unclean spirits. And they were healed.
column2: Dem kom fi ier Jiizas priich an fi mek im kyuor dem fram dem siknis. An Jiizas ron out diiman outa piipl.

column1: The whole crowd tried to touch Him, for power went out from Him and healed them all.|Evribadi did a chrai fi toch Jiizas, kaaz di powa fi kyuor dem did a kom fram im.

He lifted up His eyes on His disciples, and said:“Blessed are you poor,for yours is the kingdom of God.|Jiizas luk pan im falara dem an tel dem se,“Aal a unu we puor,Gad bles unu kaaz di kindom a fu'unu uon.

Blessed are you who hunger now,for you shall be filled.Blessed are you who weep now,for you shall laugh.|Aal a unu we onggri nou,Gad bles unu kaaz unu beli a-go ful.Aal a unu we a baal nou,Gad bles unu kaaz di taim a-go kom, wen unu a-go laaf.

Blessed are you when men hate you,and when they separate you from their company and insult you,and cast out your name as evil,on account of the Son of Man.|Gad bles aal a unu we piipl iet,we dem lef out,disrispek an kaal aal saat a niem an se unu wikid,kaaz unu fala di Man we Gad Pik.

“Rejoice in that day, and leap for joy, for indeed, your reward is great in heaven. For in like manner their fathers treated the prophets.|“Mek unuself api wen dem sitn de apm tu unu, an jomp op an dong wid jai iina unu aat, kaaz nof gud sitn pudong iina evn fi unu. Di piipl dem we a chriit unu bad, a siem so fi dem piipl yuus tu chriit Gad prafit dem.
“But woe to you who are rich,for you have received your consolation.|“Bot aal a unu we rich — chobl fi unu,kaaz unu get unu iizi laif aredi.

Woe to you who are filled,for you shall hunger.Woe to you who laugh now,for you shall mourn and weep.|Chobl fi aal a unu we beli ful nou,kaaz unu a-go onggri.Aal a unu we a laaf nou — chobl fi unu,kaaz unu a-go ala an baal.

Woe to you, when all men speak well of you,for so their fathers spoke of the false prophets.|Chobl fi aal a unu we piipl chat gud bout,a siem so fi dem piipl yuus tu chat gud bout di faalz prafit dem.
“But I say to you who hear, love your enemies, do good to those who hate you,|“Aal a unu we a lisn mi, unu fi lov unu enimi dem an chriit di piipl dem we iet unu gud.
bless those who curse you, and pray for those who spitefully use you. |Enibadi we kos unu, bles dem, an prie fi di wan dem we no diil wid unu gud.

To him who strikes you on the one cheek, offer also the other. And from him who takes away your cloak, do not withhold your tunic as well.|Ef sumadi baks unu pan wan saida unu fies, ton di neks said gi dem. Ef sumadi tek unu jakit, no tap im fram tek unu shot tu.

Give to everyone who asks of you. And of him who takes away your goods, do not ask for them back.|Ef enibadi we beg unu fi sitn we unu av, gi dem. An ef nobadi tek we fi yu sitn dem, no aks dem bak fi it.
Do unto others as you would have others do unto you.
column2: Diil wid piipl di wie unu waahn dem diil wid unu.

column1: “For if you love those who love you, what thanks do you receive? For even sinners love those who love them. |“Ef unu lov onggl di piipl dem we lov unu, wa big iina dat? Iivn di rang-duwa dem lov piipl we lov dem.

And if you do good to those who do good to you, what thanks do you receive? For even sinners do the same. |An iivn ef unu du gud fi di piipl dem we gud tu unu, wa big iina dat? Aal di rang-duwa dem du dat tu!

And if you lend to those from whom you hope to receive, what thanks do you receive? Even sinners lend to sinners, to receive as much in return.|Ef unu len tu piipl we unu tingk kyan pie unu bak, wa big iina dat? Aal rang-duwa len tu dem wan aneda an ekspek fi get bak aal a wa dem len.

But love your enemies, and do good, and lend, hoping for nothing in return. Then your reward will be great, and you will be the sons of the Highest. For He is kind to the unthankful and the evil.|Unu fi lov di piipl dem we iet unu. Du gud tu piipl, len an no ekspek fi get bak notn. Kaaz Gad a-go pie unu bak big taim. Gad kain tu di piipl dem we wikid an we no gi tangks. So wen unu du dis, dat shuo se unu a riili di Muos Ai Gad pikni.
Be therefore merciful, even as your Father is merciful.|Unu fi gud tu piipl aal ef dem no dizorv it, jos laik ou yu faada gud tu piipl.

“Judge not, and you shall not be judged. Condemn not, and you will not be condemned. Forgive, and you shall be forgiven.|“No joj piipl laik se Gad kyaahn paadn dem. Ef unu du dat di siem ting a-go riich unu. An no bada se nobadi gilti an rait dem aaf, kaaz dat wi riich unu tu. Paadn piipl, an unu wi get paadn tu.

Give, and it will be given to you: Good measure, pressed down, shaken together, and running over will men give unto you. For with the measure you use, it will be measured unto you.”|Gi an unu wi get uol iip wid aal braata. Unu kop a-go ful — ful so til it aal a ron uova. Di wie unu diil wid ada piipl, siem wie dem a-go diil wid unu.”
He spoke a parable to them: “Can the blind lead the blind? Will they not both fall into the ditch?
column2: An Jiizas se dis fi tiich dem sitn: “Blain man kyan liid blain man? Di tuu a dem no wi jrap iina wan uol?

column1: The disciple is not above his teacher, but everyone who is trained will be like his teacher.|Nobadi we a lorn no aiya dan dem tiicha. Bot wen dem don lorn, dem a-go komiin laik dem tiicha.

“Why do you see the speck that is in your brother’s eye, but do not see the beam that is in your own eye?|“Wa mek unu a luk pan di saados iina unu breda yai an unu naa wach di big piis a plangk iina fu'unu uon?

How can you say to your brother, ‘Brother, let me remove the speck that is in your eye,’ when you yourself do not see the beam that is in your own eye? You hypocrite! First remove the beam from your own eye, and then you will see clearly to remove the speck that is in your brother’s eye.|Ou unu fi se, ‘Mi breda, mek mi tek di saados outa yu yai,’ Wen siem taim unu no si di big piis a plangk iina fu'unu uon? Ipokrit! Tek di plangk outa fu'unu yai fos, den unu wi si beta fi tek di saados outa unu breda yai.
“A good tree does not bear corrupt fruit, nor does a corrupt tree bear good fruit. |“Gud chrii no bier bad fruut, an bad chrii no bier gud fruut.

Each tree is known by its own fruit. Men do not gather figs from thorns, nor do they gather grapes from a wild bush.|Unu kyan nuo wan chrii siek-a di kain-a fruut we it bier. Piipl no pik prangganat aafa maka chrii an griep aafa makabush.

A good man out of the good treasure of his heart bears what is good, and an evil man out of the evil treasure of his heart bears what is evil. For of the abundance of the heart his mouth speaks.|Di gud man du gud sitn siek-a di gud we stuor op iina im. An di wikid man du wikid sitn siek-a di wikidnis we stuor op iina im. Kaaz wa kom outa im mout a wa de iina im aat.
“Why do you call Me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ and not do what I say?|“Wa mek unu a kaal mi, ‘Laad, Laad,’ an naa du wa mi se?
Whoever comes to Me and hears My words and does them, I will show whom he is like:|Di wan we kom tu mi, ier we mi se an du wa mi se, mek mi tel yu sitn bout im.

He is like a man who built a house, and dug deep, and laid the foundation on rock. When the flood arose, the stream beat vehemently against that house, but could not shake it, for it was founded on rock. |Im komiin laik wan man we bil op wan ous — im dig dong diip iina di grong so im kuda bil di ous pan rakstuon. Di plies flod out an di riva kom dong an biit gens di ous, bot kudn mash it dong, kaaz di ous did bil op chrang chrang.

But he who hears and does not obey is like a man who built a house on the ground without a foundation, against which the stream beat vehemently. Immediately it fell, and the ruin of that house was great.”|Bot di wan we ier mi wod an no du wa mi se, im komiin laik sumadi we bil wan ous we naa no foundieshan. Di plies flod out an di riva kom dong an biit gens di ous an it jrap dong an mash op.”
When He had completed all His words in the hearing of the people, He entered Capernaum. |Afta Jiizas don se aal a dis tu di piipl dem, im go Kyaporniyom.

Now a centurion’s servant, who was dear to him, was sick and ready to die.|Wan ed fi onjrid suoja iina Kyaporniyom did av wan sorvant we did sik an bout fi ded. Di ed suoja did riet da sorvant ya nof,
When he heard of Jesus, he sent the elders of the Jews to Him, asking Him to come and heal his servant. |so az im ier bout Jiizas, im sen som Juu liida fi aks im fi kom get im sorvant beta.
When they came to Jesus, they asked Him earnestly, saying, “You should do this for him for he is worthy|Di liida dem go tu Jiizas an beg im se, “Du elp da man ya, ef nobadi fi get yu elp, a im.
for he loves our nation, and he has built us a synagogue.”|Kaaz im lov wi piipl an a im bil wan choch fi wi.”

So Jesus went with them.When He was not far from the house, the centurion sent friends to Him, saying, “Lord, do not trouble Yourself, for I am not worthy to have You come under my roof. |So Jiizas go wid dem. Wen Jiizas kech nier di ous, di ed suoja sen som a im fren dem fi tel im se, “Laad, no bada yuself, mi no gud inof fi yu kom anda fi mi ruuf.
Likewise, I did not think myself worthy to come to You. But say the word, and my servant will be healed.|A dat mek mi neva tingk mi kuda kom taak tu yu. Bot jos se di wod an mek mi sorvant get beta.

For I myself am a man placed under authority, having soldiers under me. I say to one, ‘Go,’ and he goes, and to another, ‘Come,’ and he comes, and to my servant, ‘Do this,’ and he does it.”|Kaaz mi tek aada fram dem we uova mi tu, an mi av suoja we mi kanchuol. Mi tel da wan ya, ‘Go de-so,’ an im go, an wan neks wan ‘Kum ya,’ an im kom. An mi tel mi sorvant, ‘Du dis,’ an im dwi'it.”

When Jesus heard these words, He marveled at him, and turned and said to the people who followed Him, “I tell you, I have not found such great faith even in Israel.” |Jiizas yai uopm op wen im ier di sitn dem we di ed suoja se. Im ton tu di kroud we did a fala im an se, “Mek mi tel unu sitn, aal nou mi no fain nobadi iina Izrel we chos iina mi so moch!”
Then those who were sent, returning to the house, found the servant well who had been sick.|Di ed suoja fren dem go baka di ous an fain se di sorvant did get beta.

The following day He went into a city called Nain, and many of His disciples and a large crowd went with Him.|Likl afta dat, Jiizas an im speshal falara dem lef fi go a di toun we dem kaal Nien, an wan big big kroud fala dem.

When He came near the gate of the city, a man who had died was being carried out, the only son of his mother, and she was a widow. And a large crowd from the city was with her. |Wen Jiizas did nier fi riich di toun giet, som piipl did a kyari out wan ded badi fi go beri. Im a did di onggl bwai pikni fi wan uman we ozban ded. Uol iip a piipl fram di toun did a waak wid ar.
When the Lord saw her, He had compassion on her and said to her, “Do not weep.”|Wen di Laad si ar, im sari fi ar an tel ar se, “Osh! No bada baal!”

Then He came and touched the coffin, and those who carried it stood still. He said, “Young man, I say to you, arise.” |Den Jiizas go op go toch di kafn, an di man dem we did a kyari it tap. Jiizas se, “Yuut man, git op!”
He who was dead sat up and began to speak. And He gave him to his mother.
column2: Di man get op an staat taak an Jiizas gi im bak tu im mada.

column1: Fear came on everyone. And they glorified God, saying, “A great prophet has risen up among us!” and “God has visited His people!” |Evribadi fraitn, an dem staat priez Gad. Dem se, “Wan a di prafit dem de ya mongks wi, wan powaful wan! Gad kom fi elp im piipl dem.”
This rumor of Him went throughout all Judea and the surrounding region.
column2: Da nyuuz ya bout Jiizas pred aal uova Judiya an di dischrik dem we de nier it.

column1: The disciples of John told him of all these things. |Jan falara dem tel im bout aal di sitn dem we Jiizas did a du, so im kaal tuu a dem

John, calling for two of his disciples, sent them to Jesus, saying, “Are You the One who is coming, or shall we look for another?”|an sen dem fi go aks Jiizas, “A yu wi fi a luk fa, ar a sumadi els a-go kom?”

When the men had come to Him, they said, “John the Baptist has sent us to You, saying, ‘Are You the One who is coming, or shall we look for another?’ ”|Di man dem go tu Jiizas an se, “Jan di Baptis sen wi fi aks ef a yu wi fi a luk fa, ar ef a sumadi els a-go kom.”

In that same hour He cured many of their infirmities and afflictions and evil spirits. And to many who were blind He gave sight. |Siem taim Jiizas mek uol iip a piipl we did sik iina aal kain-a wie get beta, im ron diiman outa piipl, an mek nof blain piipl si agen.

So Jesus answered them, “Go and tell John what you have seen and heard: that the blind see, the lame walk, the lepers are cleansed, the deaf hear, the dead are raised, and the gospel is preached to the poor.|Den Jiizas tel Jan falara dem se, “Go tel Jan wa unu si an ier. Blain piipl kyan si an kripl kyan waak. Piipl we av siknis we mek dem skin fasi-fasi get beta an def piipl a ier. Ded piipl kom bak alaiv an di gud nyuuz a priich tu puo piipl.
Blessed is he who does not fall away on account of Me.”
column2: Gad bles di piipl dem we no tap chos iina mi jos kaaz mi no gwaan ou dem tingk di wan we dem a wiet pan fi gwaan.”

column1: When the messengers of John had departed, He began to speak to the crowd concerning John: “What did you go out into the wilderness to see? A reed shaken by the wind? |Afta Jan mesinja dem gaan, Jiizas staat taak tu di kroud bout Jan, “Wa kain-a sumadi unu did go out iina di dezot fi si? Sumadi we kyaahn mek op im main laik taal graas we di briiz a bluo dis ya wie an dat de wie?

If not, what did you go out to see? A man dressed in fine clothes? Now those who are splendidly clothed and live luxuriously are in royal palaces. |Ef a no dat, den a wa unu go out de fi si? Wan man jres op iina a dier kluoz? Nuo man! Piipl we jres op iina dier kluoz an liv big laif, liv iina palis.
What then did you go out to see? A prophet? Yes, I say to you, and much more than a prophet.|So a wa unu go out de fi si? Wan prafit? Yes, an mi a tel unu, an im a muor dan jos wan prafit.

This is he of whom it is written:‘Look, I am sending My messenger before Your face,who shall prepare Your way before You.’|A Jan it a taak bout wen it rait dong se:“ ‘Luk, mi wi sen mi mesinja fi gwaan til yu kom,im a-go get piipl redi fi yu.’

I say to you, among those who are born of women there is no greater prophet than John the Baptist. Yet he who is least in the kingdom of God is greater than he.”|Mek mi tel unu dis, Jan biga dan enibadi we eva baan. Bot iivn di luowis sumadi iina Gad kindom, biga dan im.”

All the people who heard Him, including the tax collectors, justified God, having been baptized with the baptism of John.|(Evribadi we ier we Jiizas se, iivn di taks kalekta dem, tek it se Gad wie rait, kaaz dem did mek Jan baptaiz dem.

But the Pharisees and lawyers rejected the counsel of God for themselves, not having been baptized by John.|Bot di Farisii an di Laa tiicha dem ton dem bak pan wa Gad did waahn dem fi du, kaaz dem neva mek Jan Baptaiz dem.)
Then the Lord said, “To what then shall I compare the men of this generation, and what are they like? |“Di piipl we liv iina dem taim ya, a we dem komiin laik? Wa kain-a piipl dem bi?

They are like children sitting in the marketplace, calling to each other, saying:‘We played the flute for you,and you did not dance;we mourned to you,and you did not weep.’|Dem komiin laik pikni we a sidong iina di maakit an a ala tu dem wan aneda:“ ‘Wi plie di fluut fu'unu,an unu no daans:wi sing wan finaral sang,an unu no baal.’
For John the Baptist came neither eating bread nor drinking wine. But you say, ‘He has a demon.’ |Kaaz Jan di Baptis neva kom a nyam no bred an a jringk no wain, bot unu se, ‘Diiman iina im.’

The Son of Man has come eating and drinking. But you say, ‘Look, a glutton and a drunkard, a friend of tax collectors and sinners!’|Di Man we Gad Pik kom a nyam an a jringk, an unu se, ‘Luk ya, da man ya krievn an im a wan jongkad. Fi'im fren dem a taks kalekta an sina.’
But wisdom is justified by all her children.”
column2: Di piipl we fala di rait wie pruuv se Gad waiz an im wie rait.”

column1: One of the Pharisees asked Him to eat with him. So He went to the Pharisee’s house and sat down for supper.|Wan Farisii invait Jiizas fi kom kom nyam dina wid im, so Jiizas go a im yaad an sidong fi nyam.

There, a woman of the city who was a sinner, when she learned that Jesus was sitting for supper in the Pharisee’s house, brought an alabaster jar of ointment, |Wan sina uman iina di toun ier se Jiizas de a di Farisii yaad, so shi go de wid wan likl stuon jaar a dier porfyuum.

and stood behind Him at His feet, weeping, and began to wash His feet with tears, and wiped them with the hair of her head, and kissed His feet, and anointed them with the ointment.|Shi go baka im, tan wich paat im chrech out im fut an staat baal. Shi mek ar yai-waata wet op im fut an waip dem aaf wid ar ier, den shi kis dem an chuo out di porfyuum pan dem.

Now when the Pharisee who had invited Him saw it, he said to himself, “If this Man were a prophet, He would have known who and what kind of woman she is who is touching Him, for she is a sinner.”|Wen di Farisii we invait Jiizas si dis, im se tu imself, “Ef da man ya did a wan prafit, im wuda nuo wa kain-a uman a toch im!”
Jesus answered him, “Simon, I have something to say to you.”He said, “Teacher, say it.”|So Jiizas se tu im se, “Saiman, mi av sopm fi tel yu.”“Wa dat, tiicha?” Saiman se.
“A creditor had two debtors. The one owed five hundred denarii,  and the other fifty. |Jiizas tel im se, “Tuu man did uo wan monilenda. Wan uo im faiv onjrid silva kain, an di ada wan did uo fifti.

When they had no money to pay, he freely forgave them both. Tell Me, therefore, which of them will love him more?”|Non a dem neva av no moni fi pie im, so im se dem na'afi bada pie im bak notn. Tel mi Saiman, wich a dem a-go lov im muo?”
Simon answered, “I suppose he whom he forgave more.”He said to him, “You have judged rightly.”|Saiman ansa Jiizas se, “Mosi di wan we did uo im di muos.”“Yu rait,” Jiizas ansa im.

Then He turned to the woman and said to Simon, “Do you see this woman? I entered your house. You gave Me no water for My feet, but she has washed My feet with her tears and wiped them with the hair of her head. |Im ton tu di uman an se tu Saiman, “Yu si da uman ya? Mi kom a yu yaad an yu no gi mi no waata fi wash mi fut. Bot da uman ya wash mi fut wid ar yai-waata an waip dem wid ar ier.
You gave Me no kiss, but this woman, since the time I came in, has not ceased to kiss My feet.|Yu no welkom mi wid no kis, bot fram mi kom iin, dis uman no tap kis op mi fut.
You did not anoint My head with oil, but this woman has anointed My feet with ointment.|Yu no chuo ail pan mi ed, bot shi put porfyuum pan mi fut.

Therefore I say to you, her sins, which are many, are forgiven, for she loved much. But he who is forgiven little loves little.”|So mi a tel yu, shi get paadn fi ar uol iip a sin dem, kaaz shi lov mi nof nof. Piipl we get paadn fi likl bit a sin, onggl av likl bit a lov fi mi.”
Then He said to her, “Your sins are forgiven.”|Jiizas se tu di uman se, “Mi paadn aal a yu sin dem.”
Those who sat at supper with Him began to say to themselves, “Who is He who even forgives sins?”|Di ada ges dem staat se tu dem wan aneda, “A uu dis ya we aal a paadn sin?”
He said to the woman, “Your faith has saved you. Go in peace.”|Jiizas tel di uman se, “Kaaz yu chos iina mi, Gad siev yu. Go a yu yaad wid piis iina yu aat.”

Afterward, He went throughout every city and village, preaching and bringing the good news of the kingdom of God. With Him were the twelve|Afta dat, Jiizas chravl fram toun tu toun an dischrik tu dischrik, a priich di gud nyuuz bout Gad kindom. Aal dem taim de, di twelv did a go roun wid im.

and some women who had been healed of evil spirits and infirmities: Mary, called Magdalene, from whom seven demons had come out,|Som uman we Jiizas did ron diiman outa an we did sik an im mek beta, did a go roun wid im tu, dem a: Mieri di wan we dem kaal Magdaliin (Jiizas did ron sevn diiman outa ar),

and Joanna, the wife of Chuza, Herod’s steward, and Susanna, and many others, who supported Him with their possessions.|Jowana, Kuuza waif, (Kuuza did inchaaj a aal a di sitn dem we bilang tu Erad), Suuzana, plos nof ada uman. Aal dem uman ya did a yuuz wat-eva dem av fi elp sopuot Jiizas an im speshal falara dem.

When a large crowd had gathered together and people were coming to Him from every city, He told this parable:|Wan big big kroud a piipl we kom fram difrant difrant toun, gyada op fi ier Jiizas. Im tel dem da tuori ya:

“A sower went out to sow his seed. As he sowed, some fell along the path and was trampled down, and the birds of the air devoured it.|“Wan faama did go out fi plaant im siid dem. Wen im a skyata di siid, som jrap wich paat piipl waak an dem tep tep op pan dem, an bod kom kom nyam dem.
Some fell on a rock. And as soon as it sprang up, it withered away, because it lacked moisture. |Som jrap pan rakstuon, an wen dem staat gruo, dem kudn get no waata so dem jrai op an ded.
Yet some fell among thorns. And the thorns sprang up with it and choked it. |Ada siid jrap mongks makabush, an wen dem pap op, di makabush chuok dem.

And other seed fell on good ground and sprang up and yielded a hundred times the amount sown.”When He had said these things, He cried out, “He who has ears to hear, let him hear.”|Som a di siid dem jrap pan gud grong. Dem gruo op an bier wan onjrid taim muo dan wa di faama did plaant.”Afta dat Jiizas shout out an se, “Enibadi we av iez fi ier — beta lisn gud!”
His disciples asked Him, “What might this parable mean?”|Jiizas speshal falara dem aks im wa di tuori miin.

He said, “To you it has been given to know the secrets of the kingdom of God, but to others they are in parables, so that‘seeing they may not see,and hearing they may not understand.’|Jiizas se tu dem se, “Unu get fi andastan di siikrit sopm dem bout Gad kindom, bot fi ada piipl, mi mek wa mi se soun laik rigl. So dat,“ ‘Iivn duo dem kyan si, dem naa si;an iivn duo dem kyan ier, dem naa andastan.’
“Now the parable means this: The seed is the word of God. |“Di tuori wa mi jos tel unu, dis a wa it miin: Gad wod a di siid.

Those along the path are those who hear. Then comes the devil, who takes away the word from their hearts, lest they should believe and be saved.|Di wan dem we jrap wich paat piipl waak, a piipl we ier di wod, an den di devl kom tek di wod outa dem aat, so dem wi no biliiv an get siev.

Those on the rock are the ones who, when they hear the word, receive it with joy.
