But these have no root, for they believe for a while, then in the time of temptation fall away.|Di siid dem we jrap pan di grong we bier rakstuon de, a piipl we glad fi Gad wod, biliiv Gad wod fi likl bit, bot siem laik di plaant dem uufa ruut no go dong diip iina di grong, dem no mek Gad wod go diip iina dem aat. Dem biliiv fi likl bit, bot wen taim kom fi dem get tes, dem ton bak — siem laik ou di plaant jrai op an ded.

That which fell among thorns are those who, when they have heard, go out and are choked with the cares and riches and pleasures of this life, and bring no fruit to maturity. |Di wan dem we jrap iina makabush, a di piipl we ier Gad wod, bot dem staat fret bout laif an aal dem kyan tingk bout a ou fi mek moni an ou fi enjai demself. Dem mek dem sitn de chuok dem so dem no bier no raip fruut.

But the seed on the good ground are those who, having heard the word, keep it in an honest and good heart and bear fruit with patience.|Di wan dem we jrap pan gud grong, a di piipl dem uufa aat riili gud. Dem ier di wod an uol aan pan it. Aal wen aad taim kom, dem stil bier fruut.

“No one, when he lights a candle, covers it with a vessel or puts it under a bed, but sets it on a candlestick, that those who enter may see the light.|“Nobadi no lait lamp an kova it wid wan bokit ar put it anda wan bed. Lamp pudong we piipl kyan si di lait wen dem kom iina di ous.
For nothing is secret that will not be revealed, nor anything hidden that will not be known and revealed.|Notn no aid, we nobadi naa go nuo. No siikrit no de we naa go kom out iina di uopm.

Take heed therefore how you hear. For whoever has, to him will be given. And whoever has not, from him will be taken even what he thinks he has.”|Lisn gud! Enibadi we andastan wa mi tiich a-go andastan muor; bot di wan dem we no andastan, iivn di sitn dem we dem tingk dem andastan, dem naa go andastan no muor.”
Then His mother and His brothers came to Him, but could not reach Him because of the crowd. |Jiizas mada an breda dem kom fi si im, bot siek-a di kroud dem kudn get nier im.
Someone told Him, “Your mother and Your brothers are standing outside, desiring to see You.”|So sumadi tel Jiizas se, “Yu mada an breda dem tan op outa duor a wiet fi si yu.”
He answered them, “My mother and My brothers are these who hear the word of God and do it.”|Jiizas se tu di kroud se, “Fi mi mada an breda, a enibadi we ier Gad wod an du we im se dem fi du.”

One day He went into a boat with His disciples, and He said to them, “Let us go over to the other side of the lake.” So they launched out.|Wan die, Jiizas an im speshal falara dem did go iina wan buot an im se tu dem, “Mek wi go uova di ada said a di liek.” So dem go.

As they sailed, He fell asleep. Then a wind storm came down on the lake, and they were filling with water, and were in danger.|Wen dem a siel kraas, Jiizas jrap a sliip. Nou wan chrang chrang briiz kom dong pan di liek, an di buot staat ful op a waata so til evribadi did out fi joun.

They came to Him and awoke Him, saying, “Master, Master, we are perishing!”Then He arose and rebuked the wind and the raging of the water. And they ceased, and there was a calm.|Jiizas speshal falara dem wiek im op an se, “Laad! Laad! Wi a-go joun!” Jiizas get op an aada di briiz an di wiev dem fi sekl dong; an evriting get kaam.

He said to them, “Where is your faith?”Being afraid, they marveled, saying to each other, “Who then is this Man? He commands even the winds and water, and they obey Him.”|“We unu chos iina mi de?” Jiizas aks dem.Dem so fraitn wen dem si wa Jiizas du, dem aks dem wan aneda, “Tap! a wa kain-a man dis? Im taak tu aal briiz an wiev an dem du wa im tel dem fi du?”
They sailed to the country of the Gad­arenes, which is across from Galilee. |Dem siel go a di konchri we di Girasiinz piipl dem liv, we de kraas fram Gyalalii.

When He stepped out on land, a man from the city who had demons for a long timemet Him. He wore no clothes, nor did he live in a house but in the tombs.|Siem taim Jiizas kom outa di buot, wan man fram di toun kom op tu im. Di man did av iin diiman. Fi wan lang taim, im did a waak niekid an neva did liv iina no ous; a beriyin grong im did liv.

When he saw Jesus, he cried out and fell down before Him, and with a loud voice said, “What have You to do with me, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? I plead with You, do not torment me.”|Wen di man spat Jiizas, im baal out an jrap imself infronta Jiizas. Im shout out pan tap a im vais, “Lef wi no Jiizas, di Muos Ai Gad Pikni! Du mi a beg yu, no mek mi sofa!”

For He had commanded the unclean spirit to come out of the man. It often had seized him, and he was kept under guard, bound with chains and shackles. But he broke the shackles and was driven by the demon into the wilderness.|Im se dat kaaz Jiizas did staat fi tel di diiman fi kom outa im. (Uol iip a taim di diiman did tek im uova. So piipl yuus tu chien op im an an fut dem, an gyaad im. Bot im wuda brok outa di chien dem an di diiman wuda kyari im go wich paat nobadi no de.)

Jesus asked him, “What is your name?”He said, “Legion,” because many demons had entered him.|So Jiizas aks im se, “Wa yu niem?” Im ansa bak, “ ‘Uol-iip’ — a so wi niem.” Im se a so im niem kaaz a nof nof diiman did go iina im.
And they begged Him not to command them to go out into the abyss.
column2: Di diiman dem did a beg Jiizas no fi tel dem fi go dong a di diiman prizn — di pit we naa no batam.

column1: There was a large herd of swine feeding on the mountain. They begged Him to permit them to enter them, and He permitted them.|Nou wan uol iip a ag did a nyam pan di il-said. Di diiman dem beg Jiizas fi mek dem go iina di ag dem. Jiizas mek dem gwaan.

Then the demons went out of the man and entered the swine, and the herd ran violently down the steep bank into the lake and was drowned.|So di diiman dem kom outa di man, an go iina di ag dem, an di uol a di ag dem tek aaf dong di stiip stiip il-said go chriet iina di liek an joun.

When those who fed them saw what had happened, they fled and reported it in the city and in the country. |Wen di man dem we luk aafa di ag dem si wa apm, dem ron go pred di nyuuz iina di toun an di plies dem we de nier di toun tu.

Then they went out to see what had happened, and came to Jesus, and found the man from whom the demons had departed sitting at the feet of Jesus, clothed, and in his right mind. And they were afraid.|So di piipl dem go fi si a wa did apm. Wen dem riich wich paat Jiizas did de, dem si di man we Jiizas ron di diiman dem outa. Im did a sidong a Jiizas fut, im did av aan kluoz an iina im rait main. An di piipl dem kech dem fried.
Those who had seen it told them how he who had been possessed by demons was healed.|Di wan dem we did si wa apm, tel di ada piipl dem ou Jiizas mek di man we did av iin diiman get beta.

Then the whole crowd from the surrounding country of the Gadarenes asked Him to depart from them, for they were seized with great fear. So He went into the boat and returned.|Den aal a di Girasiinz piipl dem an evribadi we liv nier dem did wel fried so dem aks Jiizas fi lef dem ieriya. Jiizas go iina di buot an go we.

Now the man from whom the demons had departed asked Him if he could stay with Him. But Jesus sent him away, saying|Wen Jiizas did a lef, di man we im ron di diiman dem outa did a beg fi go wid im, bot Jiizas sen im we, an se,

“Return to your own house, and tell what great things God has done for you.” So he went his way and proclaimed throughout the whole city what great things Jesus had done for him.|“Go a yu yaad go tel evribadi aal wa Gad du fi yu.” Di man lef go pred di nyuuz aal uova di toun an tel dem aal wa Jiizas du fi im.
When Jesus returned, the crowd gladly received Him, for they were all waiting for Him.|Wen Jiizas go baka Gyalalii, wan kroud a piipl di a wiet fi im, so dem did glad fi si im kom.

Then a man named Jairus, who was a ruler of the synagogue, came and fell down at Jesus’ feet, and begged Him to come to his house|Siem taim wan man niem Jairos, we inchaaj a di Juu dem choch, kom niil dong infronta Jiizas, an beg im fi kom a im yaad.

for he had an only daughter, about twelve years of age, and she was dying.As He went, the people crowded Him. |Im did a beg Jiizas kaaz im wan an onggl gyal pikni did a ded. Shi did bout twelv.Wen Jiizas did a chrai fi go a Jairos yaad, di piipl dem did a pres gens im.

And a woman having a hemorrhage for twelve years, who had spent all her living on physicians, but could not be healed by anyone|Wan uman did de de, we a bliid fi twelv ier. Shi spen evriting shi av pan dakta bot non a dem kudn get ar beta.
came behind Him, and touched the fringe of His garment. And immediately her hemorrhage dried up.|Shi kom op baka Jiizas an toch di tiel a im kluoz. Siem taim shi tap bliid!

Jesus said, “Who touched Me?”When everyone denied it, Peter and those who were with Him said, “Master, the crowds are pressing against You, and You say, ‘Who touched Me?’ ”|“A uu toch mi?” Jiizas aks. Evribadi se a no dem bot Piita se, “Bot Tiicha, wan kroud a piipl roun yu a pres gens yu.”
But Jesus said, “Someone touched Me, for I perceive that power has gone out from Me.”|Bot Jiizas se, “Sumadi toch mi man. Mi nuo, kaaz mi fiil powa gaan outa mi.”

When the woman saw that she was not hidden, she came trembling. And falling down before Him, she declared to Him before all the people why she had touched Him and how she was healed immediately.|Di uman si se shi kudn aid, so shi jrap arself a Jiizas fut a chrimbl. Shi tel Jiizas wa mek shi toch im an ou shi get beta siem taim. Shi tel Jiizas dis infronta evribadi.
Then He said to her, “Daughter, be of good cheer. Your faith has made you well. Go in peace.”|Jiizas tel di uman se, “Daata, kaaz yu biliiv iina mi, yu aarait nou. Gwaan wid piis iina yu aat.”

While He was still speaking, someone from the synagogue ruler’s house came, saying to Jairus, “Your daughter is dead. Do not trouble the Teacher.”|Jiizas did stil a taak wen sumadi kom fram Jairos yaad an tel Jairos se, “Yu gyal pikni ded, no bada di tiicha agen.”
But when Jesus heard it, He answered him, “Do not fear. Only believe, and she will be made well.”|Wen Jiizas ier wa apm, im se tu Jairos, “No bada fried, jos biliiv, an shi wi get beta.”

When He came into the house, He permitted no one to go in except Peter, John and James, and the father and mother of the girl. |Jiizas neva mek nobadi go iina di ous wid im, onggl Piita, Jan, Jiemz, an di pikni faada an mada wan.
All wept and mourned for her. But He said, “Do not weep. She is not dead but sleeping.”|Evribadi did a ala an a baal kaaz di pikni did ded. Jiizas se, “Unu no baal! Shi no ded; a sliip shi a sliip.”
They laughed at Him, knowing that she was dead.|An di piipl dem staat laaf aafa im, kaaz dem did nuo se shi ded.
But He put them all outside and took her by the hand and called, saying, “Little girl, arise.” |Jiizas tek di pikni an an se, “Git op, mi pikni!”
Her spirit returned, and she arose immediately. And He told them to give her food. |Ar spirit kom bak iina ar badi, an shi tan op siem taim. An Jiizas tel dem fi gi ar sitn fi nyam.
Her parents were astonished, but He commanded them to tell no one what had happened.|Di pikni mada an faada did shak so til, bot Jiizas aada dem no fi tel nobadi wa apm.
Then He called His twelve disciples together and gave them power and authority over all demons and to cure diseases.
column2: Jiizas kaal im twelv apasl dem tugeda an gi dem powa an di rait fi ron out diiman an fi kyuor sik piipl.

column1: And He sent them to preach the kingdom of God and to heal the sick.
column2: Im sen dem out fi tel piipl bout Gad kindom an fi kyuor di sik.

column1: He said to them, “Take nothing for your journey: no staff, no bag, no bread, no money. And do not take two tunics apiece.|Jiizas tel dem se: “No tek notn wid unu wen unu a go; no kyari no waakn tik, no bag, no bred, no moni ar no kluoz fi chienj.
Whatever house you enter, stay there, and from there depart.|Di fos sumadi we tek unu iina dem ous, tan wid dem til unu redi fi lef di toun.

Whoever will not receive you, when you go out of that city, shake off the very dust from your feet as a testimony against them.|Ef piipl no waahn unu iina dem toun, shiek aaf di dos aafa unu fut wen unu a lef. Unu fi du dis mek dem nuo se Gad no api wid dem an im a-go joj dem.”
So they departed and went through the towns, preaching the gospel and healing everywhere.|So Jiizas apasl dem chravl fram dischrik tu dischrik, a priich di Gud Nyuuz an a kyuor piipl.

Now Herod the tetrarch heard of all that was done by Him. And he was perplexed, because it was said by some that John had risen from the dead|Wen Erad we ruul uova Gyalalii, ier bout di sitn dem we Jiizas did du, im staat fret, kaaz som piipl a se Jan di Baptis kom bak alaiv.
and by some that Elijah had appeared, and by others that one of the old prophets had risen. |Ada piipl se a Ilaija kom bak. Som se a wan a di prafit dem fram wie bak wen, kom bak alaiv.

But Herod said, “I have beheaded John. But who is this of whom I hear such things?” And he tried to see Him.|Bot Erad se, “A mi mek dem chap aaf Jan ed, so a uu da man ya mi a ier dem sitn ya bout?” An Erad chrai fi miit op wid Jiizas.

When the apostles returned, they told Jesus all that they had done. Then He took them and went aside privately into a deserted place belonging to the city called Bethsaida. |Di apasl dem kom bak an tel Jiizas aal a wa dem du. Den Jiizas tek dem an slip we go a wan toun niem Betsieda.

But when the crowds knew it, they followed Him. And He welcomed them and spoke to them about the kingdom of God, and healed those who had need of healing.|Bot di piipl dem fain out wich paat im a go an fala im. Jiizas neehn ton dem bak, im mek dem kom, im tiich dem bout Gad kindom, an im kyuor di wan dem we sik.

When the day began to end, the twelve came and said to Him, “Send the crowds away, so they can go into the towns and surrounding countryside and lodge and get food. For we are in a deserted place here.”|Wen iivnin a kom, Jiizas twelv apasl dem kom tu im an se, “Sen di piipl dem mek dem go iina di toun an dischrik we de nier ya-so, fi go luk fuud an som we fi tan. Kaaz notn no de out ya-so fi dem.”

He said to them, “You give them something to eat.”They said, “We have no more than five loaves and two fish, unless we go and buy food for all these people.”|Jiizas ansa dem se, “Unu gi dem sitn fi nyam.”Dem ansa Jiizas an se, “Wi av onggl faiv bred an tuu fish. Ef wi fi fiid da kroud a piipl ya, wi afi go bai fuud.”

There were about five thousand men.But He said to His disciples, “Make them sit down in groups of fifty.”|(Bout faiv touzn man did de de.)Bot Jiizas se tu im speshal falara dem, “Mek di piipl dem gruup op an sidong. Bout fifti sumadi fi de iina wan gruup.”
They did so, and made them all sit down.|Jiizas speshal falara dem du wa im tel dem, an evribadi sidong.

Then He took the five loaves and the two fish, and looking up to heaven, He blessed them, and broke them, and gave them to the disciples to set before the crowd. |Jiizas tek di faiv bred an tuu fish an im luk op iina di skai, gi tangks an brok op di bred dem. Im gi dem tu im falara dem, fi dem gi di piipl dem.
They all ate and were filled, and twelve baskets of broken pieces that remained were collected.|Evribadi nyam til dem beli ful, an Jiizas falara dem ful twelv baaskit wid lef-uova fuud.

As He was alone praying, His disciples were with Him. And He asked them, “Who do the people say that I am?”|Wan taim Jiizas did de wan said a prie. Im speshal falara dem di nier im an im aks dem se, “A uu di piipl se mi bi?”

They answered, “John the Baptist. But some say Elijah. And others say that one of the old prophets has risen.”|Dem ansa Jiizas se, “Som se yu a Jan di Baptis, ada piipl se Ilaija, bot yu av di wan dem we se yu a wan a di prafit dem fram wie bak wen, we ded an kom bak.”
He said to them, “But who do you say that I am?”Peter answered, “The Christ of God.”|“Bot wa bout unu?” Jiizas aks dem. “Uu unu tingk mi bi?” Piita ansa, “Di Krais.”
Jesus strictly commanded them to tell no one of this
column2: Jiizas waan dem se dem no fi tel nobadi.

column1: saying, “The Son of Man must suffer many things, and be rejected by the elders and chief priests and scribes, and be killed, and be raised the third day.”|Im se, “Di Man we Gad Pik a-go a fi go chuu nof nof sofarieshan, an di elda, ed priis, an Laa tiicha dem a-go ton dem bak pan im, an dem a-go kil im. Bot afta chrii die paas, im a-go kom bak alaiv.”

Then He said to them all, “If anyone will come after Me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross daily, and follow Me.|Den Jiizas se tu aal a dem se: “Ef sumadi waahn fi ton wan a fi mi falara dem, dem afi figet bout wa dem waahn, tek op dem kraas evridie an fala mi.

For whoever will save his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life for My sake will save it.|Sumadi we waahn siev dem laif a-go luuz it, bot enibadi we luuz dem laif siek-a mi, dem a-go get fi siev dem laif.
For what does it profit a man if he gains the whole world, yet loses or forfeits himself?|Wa gud it a-go du sumadi, ef dem get di uol worl bot dem luuz dem laif.

For whoever is ashamed of Me and My words, of him will the Son of Man be ashamed when He comes in His own glory and in the glory of His Father and of the holy angels.|Ef enibadi shiem a mi an wa mi tiich, wen di man we Gad Pik kom, im a-go shiem a dem tu. Wen im kom im lait a-go shain roun im. An di lait we shain roun di Faada an di uoli ienjel dem, a-go shain roun im tu.

“But I tell you truly, there are some standing here who shall not taste death before they see the kingdom of God.”|Mi a tel unu dis, an a chuu mi a taak, som a unu we tan op ya-so naa go ded bifuo di taim kom wen unu si Gad a ruul.”
About eight days after these sayings, He took Peter and John and James and went up onto a mountain to pray.|Bout iet die afta Jiizas se dis, im tek Piita, Jan an Jiemz go op iina wan moutn fi prie.

As He prayed, the appearance of His countenance was altered, and His clothing was white and glistening. |Siem taim Jiizas a prie, im fies staat luk difrant, an im kluoz staat shain brait laik wen laitnin flash.
And suddenly two men were talking with Him, who were Moses and Elijah|Aal av a sodn tuu man, Muoziz an Ilaija, shuo op an a chat wid im.
who appeared in glory and spoke of His departure which He was to accomplish in Jerusalem.
column2: Wan brait brait lait did a shain roun dem an dem did a taak bout ou Jiizas a-go ded iina Jeruusilem.

column1: Peter and those who were with him were heavy with sleep. But waking thoroughly, they saw His glory and the two men who stood with Him.|Aal dem taim ya, Piita an Jiizas ada tuu falara dem did faas asliip. Wen dem wiek op, dem si di tuu man dem a tan op wid Jiizas an wan lait a shain roun im.

As they departed from Him, Peter said to Jesus, “Master, it is good for us to be here. Let us make three sanctuaries: one for You, and one for Moses, and one for Elijah,” not knowing what he said.|Wen di man dem mek fi lef, Piita se tu Jiizas, “Tiicha, a gud ting se wi did de ya! Mek wi bil op chrii shed, wan fi yu, wan fi Muoziz an di neks wan fi Ilaija.” (Piita neehn riili nuo wa im a taak bout.)
While he was speaking, a cloud came and overshadowed them. And they were afraid as they entered the cloud. |Siem taim Piita a chat, wan kloud kom dong kom kova dem op, an dem kech dem fried.
A voice came from out of the cloud, saying, “This is My beloved Son. Listen to Him.” |Den dem ier wan vais iina di kloud se, “Dis a mi bwai pikni, a im mi pik, unu fi lisn we im se.”

When the voice had spoken, Jesus was found alone. They kept silent and told no one in those days anything they had seen.|Az di vais don taak, dem si se a Jiizas wan did de de. Jiizas speshal falara dem no tel nobadi wa dem si an ier da taim de, dem jos kip it mongks demself.
The next day, when they came down from the mountain, a great crowd met Him. |Di neks die, wen dem kom dong fram di mountn, wan big kroud kom miit dem.

Suddenly a man cried out from the crowd, saying, “Teacher, I beg You, look upon my son, for he is my only child. |Wan man iina di kroud baal out, “Tiicha, beg yu luk pan mi bwai. Im a mi wan an onggl pikni.

A spirit seizes him, and he suddenly cries out. It convulses him until he foams at the mouth, and bruises him, and scarcely leaves him.|Somtaim wan spirit wi tek im uova an im wi staat fi baal out; it mek im flata flata til im mout fraat op. Di spirit aadli lef im. It a mash im op.
I begged Your disciples to cast it out, but they could not.”|Mi beg yu speshal falara dem fi ron out di spirit bot dem kudn dwi'it.”

Jesus said, “O faithless and perverse generation, how long shall I be with you and bear with you? Bring your son here.”|Jiizas se, “Unu piipl we liv iina da taim ya! Unu no biliiv an unu no du we unu fi du. Umoch langga mi fi tan ya wid unu, an put op wid unu? Kyari yu bwai kom,” im se tu di man.

While he was coming, the demon threw him down and convulsed him. But Jesus rebuked the unclean spirit, and healed the child, and returned him to his father. |Wen di bwai did a kom tu Jiizas, di diiman fling im a grong an di bwai staat flata. Bot Jiizas aada di diiman fi kom out an im kyuor di bwai an gi im bak tu im faada.

And they were all amazed at the mighty power of God. But while everyone marveled at all the things Jesus did, He said to His disciples|Evribadi jaa jrap wen dem si di powa we Gad av. Wen dem a luk an a wanda bout wa dem si, Jiizas se tu im speshal falara dem

“Let these words sink down into your ears, for the Son of Man is about to be betrayed into the hands of men.”|“Ier wa mi a se an unu lisn mi gud! Dem a-go tek di Man we Gad Pik an gi im uova tu piipl we iet im.”

But they did not understand this statement, and it was hidden from them, so that they did not perceive it. And they were afraid to ask Him about this statement.|Bot Jiizas falara dem neva get we im se an dem di fried fi aks im wa im riili a taak bout. Gad did aid wa it miin so dem kudn andastan it.
A dispute arose among them as to which of them was the greatest.
column2: Jiizas speshal falara dem did a aagyu bout wich wan a dem mait-a av di tap pozishan iina di gruup.

column1: Jesus, perceiving the thought of their heart, took a child and put him by Him|Jiizas did nuo wa dem did a tingk, so im mek wan pikni tan op saida im.

and said to them, “Whoever receives this child in My name receives Me, and whoever receives Me receives Him who sent Me. For he who is least among you all will be great.”|Jiizas se tu dem se, “Enibadi we welkom da likl pikni ya, kaa im chos iina mi, welkom mi tu. An enibadi we tek mi iin, tek iin di wan we sen mi tu. Di wan mongks unu we de a di batam, a im av di tap a tap pozishan.”

John answered, “Master, we saw a man casting out demons in Your name and we forbade him, because he does not follow with us.”|“Laad,” Jan se, “Wi si wan man a yuuz yu niem ron out diiman outa piipl an wi chrai fi tap im, kaaz im a no wan a wi.”
Jesus said, “Do not forbid him, for he who is not against you is for you.”|Jiizas se tu im se, “No tap im, kaaz uu naa fait gens yu de pan yu said.”
When the time came for Him to be received up, He was steadfastly set to go to Jerusalem|Wen a did nier taim fi Jiizas go op iina evn, im set iina im main se im a go a Jeruusilem.
and sent messengers ahead of Him. They went and entered a village of the Samaritans to make things ready for Him
column2: Jiizas sen som mesinja fi gwaan bifuo im an get tingz redi. Wen dem riich a wan Samaritan dischrik

column1: but they did not receive Him, because He was set to go to Jerusalem.|di piipl we liv de neva waahn Jiizas kom de kaaz a Jeruusilem im did mek op im main fi go.

When His disciples James and John saw this, they said, “Lord, do You want us to command fire to come down from heaven and consume them, even as Elijah did?” |Wen Jiemz an Jan, tuu a Jiizas falara dem, si wa a gwaan, dem aks im se, “Laad, Yu no waahn wi kaal dong faiya fram evn fi bon dem op?”
But He turned and rebuked them and said, “You do not know what kind of spirit you are of.|Bot Jiizas ton roun an taak tu dem chrang chrang mek dem nuo se dat no rait
For the Son of Man did not come to destroy men’s lives but to save them.” And they went to another village.
column2: an so dem go a wan neda dischrik.

column1: As they went along the way, a man said to Him, “Lord, I will follow You wherever You go.”|Wen dem a waak pan di ruod, wan man se tu Jiizas, “Mi wi ton wan a yu falara dem an go wid yu eniwe yu go.”

Jesus said to him, “Foxes have holes and birds of the air have nests. But the Son of Man has no place to lay His head.”|Jiizas se tu im se, “Faks av uol an di bod dem av nes, bot di Man we Gad Pik no av no we fi pudong im ed.”
He said to another man, “Follow Me.”But he said, “Lord, let me first go and bury my father.”|Jiizas se tu wan neda man, “Fala mi.” Bot di man se, “Laad, mek mi go beri mi faada fos.”

Jesus said to him, “Leave the dead to bury their own dead. But you go and preach the kingdom of God.”|Bot Jiizas tel im se, “Mek di ded galang go beri uu ded fi dem, bot yu, yu fi go tel piipl bout Gad kindom.”
Yet another said, “Lord, I will follow You, but let me first go bid farewell to those at my house.”|Den sumadi els se tu Jiizas, “Mi wi fala yu Laad, bot mek mi go tel mi fambili ba-bai fos.”
Jesus said to him, “No one who puts his hand to the plow and looks back at things is fit for the kingdom of God.”|Jiizas ansa an se, “Enibadi we staat plou an luk bak no fit fi Gad kindom.”

After this the Lord appointed seventy others, and sent them two by two ahead of Him into every city and place where He Himself was about to come.|Afta dis, di Laad pik sevnti-tuu a im ada falara dem an sen dem out tuu tuu, fi go evriwe im plan fi go.

He said to them, “The harvest truly is plentiful, but the laborers are few. Pray therefore the Lord of the harvest to send out laborers into His harvest.|Im se tu dem se, “Nof fuud de out de iina di fiil fi pik, bot nof piipl no de de fi gyada dem. Aks di Laad we uon di fuud fi sen out piipl fi pik dem.
Go your ways. Listen, I am sending you out as lambs among wolves.|Mi a sen unu go out bot unu a-go komiin laik biebi shiip we de mongks wulf. Gwaan!
Carry no purse, no bag, no shoes, and greet no one on the road.|No kyari no moni, no pak no bag, no waak wid no ada slipaz an wen unu de pan unu wie no tel nobadi oudi.
“When you enter a house, first say, ‘Peace be to this house.’|“Wen taim unu go a nobadi yaad, di fos ting unu fi du a se, ‘Gad, mek yu piis kom dong pan da yaad ya.’

If a son of peace is there, your peace will rest upon him; but if not, it will return upon you. |Ef di ed a di ous lov piis, di piis we unu kaal dong wi tan wid im, bot ef im no lov piis, di piis we unu kaal dong naa go tan wid im.

Remain in the same house, eating and drinking what they give, for the laborer is worthy of his hire. Do not go from house to house.|Di man we lov piis an tek unu iin, a fi'im yaad unu fi tan. Nyam an jringk wa dem gi unu, kaaz ef sumadi wok dem fi get pie. Unu fi tan a wan yaad an no muuv fram yaad tu yaad.
“When you enter a city and they receive you, eat what is set before you.|“Enitaim unu go iina wan toun an di piipl dem tek unu iin, nyam we dem gi unu.
Heal the sick who are there and say to them, ‘The kingdom of God has come near to you.’ |Kyuor di wan dem we sik an se tu dem, ‘Gad kindom kom wich paat unu de.’
But when you enter a city and they do not receive you, go your way out into their streets and say|Bot ef unu go iina wan toun an dem no waahn tek unu iin, go iina di ruod an tel dem dis,

‘Even the dust of your city which clings to us, we wipe off against you. Yet be sure of this, that the kingdom of God has come near to you.’|‘Wi a waip aaf di dos aafa wi fut fi shuo unu se Gad no api wid unu — im a-go joj unu. Bot memba se Gad kindom kom wich paat unu de.’
But I say to you, it will be more tolerable on that Day for Sodom than for that city.|Mi a tel unu dis, wen jojment die kom, it a-go iiziya fi Sadam dan fi di piipl dem iina dat de toun.

“Woe to you, Chorazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! For if the mighty works had been done in Tyre and Sidon which have been done for you, they would have repented long ago, sitting in sackcloth and ashes.|“Chobl fi yu, Korazin! Chobl fi yu Betsieda! Ef di piipl we liv iina Taiya an Saidan did si di mirikl dem we unu si mi du mongks unu, dem wuda sari fi dem rang an chienj dem wiez lang taim. Dem wuda sidong iina ashiz an wier krokos bag fi shuo se dem miin it.
But it will be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon at the judgment than for you.
column2: It a-go iiziya fi Taiya an Saidan pan jojment die dan fi unu.

column1: And you, Capernaum, will you be exalted to heaven? You will be thrust down to hell.|Aal laka yu Kyaporniyom, yu tingk se Gad a-go lif yu op go a evn an ana yu? Nuo, im a-go fling yu dong a el.”

“He who listens to you listens to Me, he who rejects you rejects Me, and he who rejects Me rejects Him who sent Me.”|Fi don we im a se, Jiizas se tu im sevnti-tuu falara dem, “Enibadi we lisn tu unu lisn tu mi. Enibadi we ton dem bak pan unu, ton dem bak pan mi. Dem we ton dem bak pan mi ton dem bak pan di wan we sen mi.”

The seventy returned with joy, saying, “Lord, even the demons are subject to us through Your name.”|Di sevnti-tuu falara dem kom bak glad an dem se, “Laad, wen wi yuuz yu niem, aal di diiman dem du wa wi tel dem fi du.”
He said to them, “I saw Satan as lightning fall from heaven. |Jiizas tel dem se, “Mi did si Sietan jrap outa evn laik ou laitnin flash iina di skai.

Look, I give you authority to trample on serpents and scorpions, and over all the power of the enemy. And nothing shall by any means hurt you. |Mi gi unu di powa fi waak pan siniek an skaapiyan. Mi gi unu powa, muor powa dan we di enimi av. Notn bad kyaahn du unu.

Nevertheless do not rejoice that the spirits are subject to you, but rather rejoice that your names are written in heaven.”|No bada glad se diiman du we unu tel dem fi du. Wa unu fi glad bout a se unu niem rait dong iina evn.”

At that time Jesus rejoiced in the Holy Spirit and said, “I thank You, O Father, Lord of heaven and earth, because You have hidden these things from the wise and intelligent and revealed them to infants. Yes, Father, for it was Your good pleasure.|Dat de taim, di Uoli Spirit kaaz Jiizas fi get api an im se, “Faada, yu ron evriting iina evn an pan ort, mi priez yu. Mi priez yu kaaz yu a shuo dem sitn ya tu likl pikni bot yu aid dem fram piipl we tingk se dem brait an av nof sens. Yes Faada, a dat yu did waahn fi apm.

“All things have been handed over to Me by My Father. And no one knows who the Son is but the Father, and who the Father is but the Son and he to whom the Son desires to reveal Him.”|“Mi Faada gi mi evriting. A onggl di Faada wan riili nuo di Bwai Pikni. An nobadi no riili nuo di Faada, onggl di Bwai Pikni wan an enibadi els we di pikni waahn fi mek nuo di Faada.”
Then He turned to His disciples and said privately, “Blessed are the eyes which see what you see.|Jiizas kyari im speshal falara dem wan said an se tu dem se, “Gad bles di piipl dem we si we unu si.

For I tell you, many prophets and kings have desired to see what you see, and have not seen it, and to hear what you hear, and have not heard it.”|Kaaz mi a tel unu se a nof a Gad prafit dem an uol iip a king did waahn fi si wa unu si, an ier wa unu ier, bot dem neehn si ar ier it.”
Now, a lawyer stood up and tested Him, saying, “Teacher, what must I do to inherit eternal life?”|Wan Laa tiicha tan op fi tes Jiizas. “Tiicha,” im aks, “Wa mi fi du fi liv fi eva?”
He said to him, “What is written in the law? How do you read?”|Jiizas aks im, “Wa di Laa se? Wa yu get fram it?”

He answered, “ ‘You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart, and with all your soul, and with all your strength, and with all your mind’ and ‘your neighbor as yourself.’”|Di man se, “‘Yu fi lov di Laad we a fi yu Gad. Yu fi lov im wid aal a yu aat, lov im wid di uol a yu suol, lov im wid aal a yu chrent an wid di uol a yu main,’ an, ‘yu fi lov yu nieba siem laik ou yu lov yuself.’”
He said to him, “You have answered correctly. Do this, and you will live.”|Jiizas se tu im se, “Yu ansa rait. Du dat an yu wi liv.”
But he, desiring to justify himself, said to Jesus, “And who is my neighbor?”|Fi mek imself fiil gud di man aks Jiizas wan neks kwestiyan, “So, a uu a mi nieba?”

Jesus answered, “A man went down from Jerusalem to Jericho and fell among thieves, who stripped him of his clothing and wounded him and departed, leaving him half dead.|Jiizas ansa im se, “Wan man lef Jeruusilem an did a go a Jeriko. Pan di wie som tiif uol im op. Dem tek we aal we im av, biit im nieli kil im an lef im de fi ded.
By chance a priest came down that way. And when he saw him, he passed by on the other side.|Wan priis did a go dong di siem ruod an wen im bok op pan di man, im kraas an go waak pan di neks said.

So likewise a Levite, when he came to that place, looked at him and passed by on the other side.|Wan man we elp tek kier a Gad ous kom a di siem plies an si di man, bot im kraas go waak pan di neks said tu.

But a Samaritan, as he journeyed, came where he was. And when he saw him, he had compassion on him|Bot wan man we kom fram Samieriya did a chravl pan di siem ruod. Wen im riich wich paat di man de an si im, im fiil sari fi im.

and went to him and bound up his wounds, pouring in oil and wine. Then he set him on his own donkey and brought him to an inn, and took care of him.|So, im gu uova tu di man, chuo aliv ail an wain pan im kot dem an ban dem op. Den im put di man pan im uona dangki, kyari im go a wan ges ous an tek kier a im.

The next day when he departed, he took out two denariiand gave them to the innkeeper and said to him, ‘Take care of him. I will repay you whatever else you spend when I return.’|Di neks maanin im gi di uona fi di ges ous tuu silva kain, an se, ‘Tek kier a im, an wen mi kom bak, mi wi gi yu bak eni moni we yu spen fi luk aafa im.’ ”

“Now which of these three do you think was a neighbor to him who fell among the thieves?”|Den Jiizas aks di Laa tiicha se, “Yu si di man we di tiif dem biit op, wich wan a di chrii piipl dem yu tingk a did im nieba?”
He said, “The one who showed mercy on him.”Then Jesus said to him, “Go and do likewise.”|Im se, “Di wan we did elp im.”So Jiizas se, “Gwaan go du di siem ting.”

As they went, He entered a village. And a woman named Martha welcomed Him into her house. |Wen Jiizas an im speshal falara dem did a chravl go a Jeruusilem, dem waak chuu wan dischrik we wan uman niem Maata did liv. Wen Maata si dem, shi tek dem iina ar ous.

She had a sister called Mary, who also sat at Jesus’ feet and listened to His teaching. |Nou, Maata did av wan sista niem Mieri. Fram Jiizas riich a di ous, Mieri go sidong a im fut an no muuv. Shi sidong a lisn aal we im av fi se.

But Martha was distracted with much serving, and she came to Him and said, “Lord, do You not care that my sister has left me to serve alone? Then tell her to help me.”|Bot Maata, shi did a ron roun a du aal we shi niid fi du fi mek ar ges dem aarait. Shi go tu Jiizas an aks im se, “Laad, yu no si ou mi sista lef mi wan fi du aal a di wok? Yu no kier? Tel ar fi kom elp mi no!”
Jesus answered her, “Martha, Martha, you are anxious and troubled about many things. |Di Laad ansa ar se, “Maata, Maata, yu a bada bada yuself bout uol iip a sitn

But one thing is needed. And Mary has chosen the good part, which shall not be taken from her.”|bot a onggl wan sitn yu fi bada yuself bout. Mieri mek op ar main fi pik da wan de an nobadi naa go tap ar.”

He was praying in a certain place, and when He ceased, one of His disciples said to Him, “Lord, teach us to pray, as John also taught his disciples.”|Wan die Jiizas did de somwe a prie. Afta im don, wan a im speshal falara dem se tu im se, “Laad, shuo wi ou fi prie, laik ou Jan shuo fi im falara dem ou fi prie.”

He said to them, “When you pray, say:Our Father, who is in heaven,hallowed be Your name.Your kingdom come;Your will be doneon earth, as it is in heaven.|Jiizas tel dem se, “Wen unu prie, unu fi se:“ ‘Faada, mek piipl av nof rispek fi yu an yu niem,Mek di taim kom wen yu ruul iina evri wie.
Give us each day our daily bread.
column2: Evridie gi wi di fuud we wi niid

column1: And forgive us our sins,for we also forgive everyone who is indebted to us.And lead us not into temptation,but deliver us from evil.”|Paadn wi fi aal a di rang we wi du,kaa wi paadn piipl we du wi rang tu.An no mek wi fies notn we wi kaaz wi fi sin.’ ”

Then He said to them, “Which of you has a friend and shall go to him at midnight and say to him, ‘Friend, lend me three loaves,|Den Jiizas se tu dem se, “Supuoz wan a unu av wan fren, an unu go tu im iina migl nait an se, ‘Brejrin len mi chrii bred de
for a friend of mine on his journey has come to me, and I have nothing to set before him’;|kaaz wan a mi fren dem we a paas chuu di ieriya tap a mi yaad, an mi no av notn at aal fi'im nyam.’

and he will answer from within, ‘Do not trouble me; the door is now shut, and my children are with me in bed; I cannot rise and give you anything’? |“An wa ef im fren tan iina im ous an se, ‘No bada mi man. Mi duor lak aredi, an mi an mi pikni dem gaan a bed. Mi kyaahn get op an gi yu notn nou.’

I say to you, though he will not rise and give him ­anything ­because he is his friend, yet because of his ­persistence he will rise and give him as much as he needs.|Mi a tel unu, im naa get op jos kaaz di tuu a dem a fren, im wi get op an gi im evriting im aks fa kaaz im fren naa go tap nak.

“And I tell you, ask, and it will be given to you; seek, and you will find; knock, and it will be opened to you.|“So, mi a tel unu. Aks fi wa unu waahn an unu wi get it, luk fi wa unu waahn an unu wi fain it; nak pan di duor an it wi uopm op.

For everyone who asks receives, and he who seeks finds, and to him who knocks it will be opened.|Kaaz enibadi we aks wi get wa dem aks fa, di wan dem we luk wi fain wa dem a luk fa, an di duor wi uopm fi di wan dem we nak.

“If a son asks for bread from any of you who is a father, will you give him a stone? Or if he asks for a fish, will you give him a serpent instead of a fish?|“Wich wan a unu we a faada, wuda gi unu pikni wan siniek wen dem aks unu fi wan fish?
Or if he asks for an egg, will you offer him a scorpion?|Ar wich wan a unu wi gi unu pikni skaapiyan, wen dem aks fi eg?

If you then, being evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your heavenly Father give the Holy Spirit to those who ask Him?”|Ef unu so wikid an stil nuo ou fi gi unu pikni nais sitn, unu no tingk se unu Faada op iina evn wi iivn muo dan redi fi gi di Uoli Spirit tu enibadi we aks im!”

He was casting out a demon, and it was mute. When the demon had gone out, the mute man spoke, and the crowd marveled. |Wan taim Jiizas did a ron wan diiman outa wan man. Nou, di man kudn taak kaaz di diiman did mek im dom. Afta Jiizas ron out di diiman, di man staat chat, an evribadi we si wa apm jaa jrap uopm.
But some of them said, “He casts out demons through Beelzebub, the ruler of the demons.” |Bot som a dem se, “A Belzibob, di diiman ruula, gi im powa fi ron out diiman.”
Others, testing Him, asked Him for a sign from heaven.|Som ada piipl iina di kroud did waahn fi tes Jiizas fi si ef a riili Gad sen im. So dem aks im fi wan sain fi pruuv se a Gad sen im.

But He, knowing their thoughts, said to them, “Every kingdom divided against itself is made desolate. And a house divided against itself falls.|Jiizas did nuo wa did de iina dem main, so im se tu dem se: “Wan kindom naa go laas ef di piipl dem we liv iina it a fait gens dem wan aneda, it a-go mash op. Eni fambili we a fait gens dem wan aneda mos mash op.

If Satan also is divided against himself, how will his kingdom stand? For you say that I cast out demons through Beelzebub. |So, ef Sietan a fait gens imself, ou im kindom fi laas? Mi a aks unu dis sins unu se a Belzibob gi mi powa fi ron out diiman.

Now if I cast out demons by Beelzebub, by whom do your sons cast them out? Therefore they will be your judges. |Nou, ef a Belzibob gi mi powa fi ron out diiman, den a uu gi fu'unu piipl powa fi ron dem out? Unu uona piipl a-go se unu rang bout mi.
But if I cast out demons with the finger of God, no doubt the kingdom of God has come upon you.|Bot ef a Gad gi mi powa fi ron out diiman, dat miin se Gad a ruul mongks unu aredi.
“When a strong man, fully armed, guards his own palace, his goods are peacefully kept|“Wen wan chrang man we av wepan, a gyaad im ous, evriting we im uon sief.

But when a stronger man than he attacks and overpowers him, he seizes all the armor in which the man trusted and divides his spoils.|Bot ef sumadi we chrangga dan im atak im an win im, di chrangga wan a-go tek we di wepan dem wa di man did tingk se wuda kip im sief, an shier op shier op aal a wa im tek.
“He who is not with Me is against Me, and he who does not gather with Me scatters.|“Enibadi we no de pan fi mi said, gens mi, an aal a uu naa elp mi gyada, a skyata.

“When an unclean spirit goes out of a man, it goes through dry places seeking rest. Finding none, it says, ‘I will return to my house, from which I came.’|“Wen wan wikid spirit kom outa sumadi, it go chuu dezot, a luk plies fi res. Wen it no fain no we, it se, ‘Mi a ton bak go a di ous we mi lef.’
When it comes, it finds it swept and furnished. |Wen it kech bak, it fain se di ous swiip kliin an evriting niit an taidi.

Then it goes and brings seven other spirits more wicked than itself, and they enter and dwell there. And the last state of that man is worse than the first.”|Di diiman si dat, an go fain sevn muor spirit we wosa dan im an di uol a dem go liv de. Iina di lang ron, di man a-go wosa aaf dan bifuo.”

As He spoke these things, a woman from the crowd raised her voice and said to Him, “Blessed is the woman who gave You birth and nursed You.”|Siem taim Jiizas a taak, wan uman iina di kroud baal out, “Di uman we bring yu iina di worl an we tek kier a yu, riili bles.”
But He said, “Indeed, blessed are those who hear the word of God and keep it.”|Jiizas ansa ar an se, “Di piipl dem we ier Gad wod an du we it se, a dem riili bles.”

When the crowds pressed upon Him, He began to say, “This is an evil generation. It looks for a sign, but no sign will be given it except the sign of Jonah the prophet. |Wen muor an muor piipl staat fi kroud roun Jiizas, im se, “Di piipl dem iina da taim ya, a wan wikid set a piipl. Dem aks fi wan sain we wuda pruuv se a Gad sen mi. Dem naa get non! Di onggl sain dem a-go get a sopm laik wa did apm wid Juona.

For as Jonah was a sign to the Ninevites, so will the Son of Man be to this generation. |Jos laik ou Juona did a wan sain fi di Ninive piipl dem, a siem so di Man we Gad Pik a-go bi wan sain fi di piipl dem iina da taim ya.

The Queen of the South will rise up in the judgment with the men of this generation and condemn them, for she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon. And now one greater than Solomon is here.|Di kwiin we kom fram Shiiba iina di sout, shi a-go kom bak alaiv wid di piipl dem fram da taim ya. Shi a-go shuo se dem rang, kaaz shi did kom fram faar faar jos fi ier di waiz sitn dem we Salaman did av fi se. Bot luk ya, sumadi we biga dan Salaman de rait ya-so.

The men of Nineveh will rise up in the judgment with this generation and will condemn it, for they repented at the preaching of Jonah. And now one greater than Jonah is here.|Di piipl fram Ninive, a-go tan op pan jojment die wid di piipl dem fram da taim ya an shuo dem se dem rang. Kaaz wen Juona did waan di Ninive piipl, dem did sari fi we dem du an chienj dem wiez. Bot luk ya, sumadi we biga dan Juona de rait ya-so.

“No one, when he has lit a candle, puts it in a secret place or under a basket, but on a candlestick, that those who come in may see the light. |“Nobadi no lait lamp an put it wich paat nobadi kyaahn si it ar kova it wid bokit. Lamp pudong we piipl kyan si di lait wen dem kom iin.

The eye is the lamp of the body. Therefore when your eye is good, your whole body also is full of light. But when your eye is bad, your body also is full of darkness. |Yu yai dem a laik lamp, a dem gi yu badi lait. Wen yu yai dem gud, yu uol badi ful-a lait. Ef dem bad, yu badi ful-a daaknis.
Take heed therefore lest the light which is in you is darkness.
column2: Mek shuor di lait we iina yu a riili lait.

column1: If your whole body, then, is full of light, no part being dark, the whole body will be full of light, as when the shining candle gives you light.”|Ef yu uol badi ful-a lait, an no paat a it no daak, it a-go lait op laik wen lamp lait a shain pan yu.”

As He spoke, a Pharisee asked Him to dine with him. So He went in and sat down to eat.|Afta Jiizas don taak, wan Farisii invait im a im yaad fi kom nyam wid im. So Jiizas go wid im an wen im riich im sidong a di tiebl.

When the Pharisee saw it, he marveled that He had not first washed before dinner.|Di Farisii shak fi si se Jiizas no wash im an dem bifuo im staat iit (kaaz dis a sitn we di Farisii dem du kaaz dem tingk dat wi mek dem rait wid Gad).

Then the Lord said to him, “Now you Pharisees clean the outside of the cup and the dish. But inside you are full of extortion and wickedness. |Di Laad se tu di Farisii, “Nou unu Farisii, unu wash di outsaida kop an pliet, bot iina unu aat, unu griidi an wikid.
You fools! Did not he who made the outside make the inside also?
column2: Di uol a unu a fuul! No di siem wan we mek di badi mek di aat tu?

column1: But give alms from what is within. And then all things are clean to you.|Gi tu di puor an du it fram unu aat, an den dat wi shuo se evriwe kliin.

“Woe to you, Pharisees! For you tithe mint and rue and every herb and pass over justice and the love of God. These you ought to have done, without leaving the others undone.|“Aal unu Farisii — Chobl fi unu, kaaz outa evri ten bongl a mint, tii bush an di sitn dem we unu gruo iina unu gyaadn, unu gi Gad wan. Bot stil unu no diil wid piipl fier an unu no lov Gad niida. Wa unu fi du a diil wid piipl fier, lov Gad an gi Gad di wan outa evri ten we unu av siem wie.

“Woe to you, Pharisees! For you love the prominent seats in the synagogues and greetings in the marketplaces.|“Unu Farisii — chobl fi unu! Kaaz unu lov fi sidong iina di bes siit iina di Juu dem choch. An unu lov wen piipl gi unu speshal oudi wen unu go a maakit.

“Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you are like unseen graves, and the men who walk over them are not aware of them.”|“Chobl fi unu, kaaz unu komiin laik griev wa piipl waak pan an no nuo se it de de, chuu dem no av no maak pan dem.”
One of the lawyers answered, “Teacher, by saying these things You insult us also.”|Wan Laa tiicha ansa Jiizas se, “Tiicha, wen yu se dem sitn ya, yu a disrispek wi tu.”

He said, “Woe to you also, you lawyers! For you load men with burdens difficult to carry, and you yourselves do not touch the burdens with one of your fingers.|Jiizas se, “Unu si aal unu we tiich di Laa — chobl fi unu! Kaaz unu pak op piipl wid luod we dem kyan bieli manij, an unu, unu no iivn lif wan fingga fi elp dem.
“Woe to you! For you build the tombs of the prophets, and your fathers killed them. |“Chobl fi unu, kaaz unu bil tuum fi di prafit dem, an a di siem piipl we unu kom fram kil dem.

So you are witnesses and entirely approve the deeds of your fathers, because they killed them, and you build their tombs. |Wen unu bil tuum fi di prafit dem we unu piipl dem kil, wa unu a se a dat unu piipl did rait.

Therefore also the wisdom of God said, ‘I will send them prophets and apostles, and some of them they will kill and persecute,’ |Siek-a dis, Gad we waiz iina evri wie se, ‘Mi wi sen prafit an apasl gi dem, bot dem wi kil som, an dem a-go mek som a dem sofa.’

that the blood of all the prophets, shed since the beginning of the world, may be required from this generation,|Di piipl dem fram da taim ya afi go ansa fi aal a di blod a di prafit dem we dem kil fram di worl staat;

from the blood of Abel to the blood of Zechariah, who was killed between the altar and the sanctuary. Yes, I tell you, it shall be required from this generation.|fram Iebl go rait dong tu Zakaraiya we dem kil bitwiin di alta wich paat dem bon sakrifais iina Gad ous. Yes mi a tel unu, di piipl dem fram da taim ya afi go ansa fi aal a dem.

“Woe to you, lawyers! For you have taken away the key of knowledge. You did not enter yourselves, and you hindered those who were entering.”|“Chobl fi unu we tiich di Laa, kaaz unu tek we di kii we uopm di wie fi piipl andastan an nuo Gad wod. Unu neva go iin an unu a tap ada piipl fram go iin tu.”

As He said these things to them, the scribes and the Pharisees began to incite Him vehemently and angrily draw Him out concerning many things|Wen Jiizas lef de-so di Farisii an di Laa tiicha dem staat fi chriit im wikid. Dem aks im wan bag a chriki kwestiyan
lying in wait for Him and seeking to catch something out of His mouth, that they might accuse Him.|so dem kuda kech im an yuuz wa im se gens im.

Meanwhile, when thousands of the crowd were assembled, so as to trample on one another, He began to say to His disciples first, “Beware of the yeast of the Pharisees, which is hypocrisy.|Wen touzn an touzn a piipl staat gyada gyada we Jiizas de, dem did so nof dem aal a tep op tep op pan dem wan aneda. Jiizas taak tu im speshal falara dem fos, im se, “Wach out fi di tuu mout Farisii dem.
For there is nothing covered that will not be revealed, or hidden that will not be known. |Notn no aid we wi naa go fain out bout, an no siikrit no de we naa go bos out.

Therefore what you have said in the darkness will be heard in the light. And what you have whispered in the ear in private rooms will be proclaimed on the housetops.|Wa unu se iina di daak, piipl a-go ier iina die lait, an wa unu wispa tu unu wan aneda wen unu lak we, piipl a-go baal it out fram di ous tap.
“I say to you, My friends, do not be afraid of those who kill the body, and after that can do no more.|“Mi fren, ier wa mi a se, no fried a uu kyan onggl kil di badi — dat a aal dem kyan du!

But I will warn you whom you shall fear: Fear Him who, after He has killed, has power to cast into hell. Yes, I say to you, fear Him. |Mek mi tel unu uu unu fi fried a: fried a di wan we kyan kil di badi an av di powa fi fling unu suol dong a el tu. Yes mi a tel unu, a im unu fi fried a.
Are not five sparrows sold for two pennies? Yet not one of them is forgotten by God.
column2: No onggl tuu peni faiv bod sel fa? Bot Gad no figet no iivn wan a dem.

column1: Indeed, even the hairs of your head are all numbered. Therefore do not fear. You are more valuable than many sparrows.|Iivn di ier we de pan evri wan a unu ed im kount op an nuo umoch de de. So no bada fried kaaz tu Gad unu wot muo dan nof nof bod.

“I say to you, whoever confesses Me before men, him will the Son of Man also confess before the angels of God.|“Mi a tel unu se enibadi we mek piipl nuo se dem a fi mi falara, di Man we Gad Pik wi tel Gad ienjel dem se dem a fi'im.
But he who denies Me before men will be denied before the angels of God. |Bot enibadi we tel ada piipl se dem no nuo mi an ou dem no mi falara, mi a-go du di sed ting tu dem infronta Gad Ienjel dem.

And everyone who speaks a word against the Son of Man will be forgiven, but he who blasphemes against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven.|Yu si ef unu go se notn bad bout di Man we Gad Pik, unu kyan get paadn, bot enibadi we se wikid tingz gens di Uoli Spirit an kliem se a sumadi els du di wok we a di Uoli Spirit du — dem kyaahn get paadn.

“When they bring you to the synagogues, rulers, and authorities, do not be anxious how you will answer or what you will say. |“Wen dem kyari unu bifuo di Juu dem choch, di ruula dem an di piipl dem we av uol iip a powa fi aal sen piipl go ded, no fret bout ou unu a-go difen unuself, ar wa unu fi se ar ou unu fi se it,
For the Holy Spirit will teach you at that time what you should say.”
column2: kaaz di Uoli Spirit wi tel unu wa fi se wen da taim de kom.

column1: Someone in the crowd said to Him, “Teacher, tell my brother to divide the inheritance with me.”|Sumadi iina di kroud se tu Jiizas, “Tiicha, tel mi breda fi shier di ded-lef wid mi no.”
Jesus said to him, “Man, who appointed Me a judge or an arbitrator between you?”|Jiizas ansa se, “Man, uu gi mi di rait fi sekl aagiment an shier ded-lef bitwiin di tuu a unu?”

Then He said to them, “Take heed and beware of covetousness. For a man’s life does not consist in the abundance of his possessions.”|Den im tel dem se, “Wach out! Unu fi gyaad gens aal kain-a red yai, kaaz laif no jos bout umoch sitn wi uon.”
And He told a parable to them, saying, “The land of a rich man produced plentifully. |An Jiizas tel dem da tuori ya: “Wan rich man did av wan faam we bier uol iip a fuud.
He thought to himself, ‘What shall I do, for I have no room to store my crops?’|So di rich man se tu imself se, ‘Wa mi fi du? Mi no av no plies fi kip aal a dem sitn ya.’

“Then he said, ‘This I will do: I will pull down my barns and build greater ones, and there I will store all my grain and my goods.|“Den im se, ‘Mi nuo wa mi a-go du. Mi a-go tier dong mi stuor ous dem an bil som biga wan, an mi a-go kip mi grien an aal we mi uon iina dem.

And I will say to my soul, Soul, you have many goods laid up for many years. Take rest. Eat, drink, and be merry.’|An mi a-go se tu miself, maasa yu a wan loki man. Yu av nof sitn an dem a-go laas yu fi wan lang lang taim. Tek laif iizi, nyam, jringk an mek meri.’

“But God said to him, ‘You fool! This night your soul will be required of you. Then whose will those things be which you have provided?’|“Bot Gad tel im se, ‘Yu fuul! Tinait tinait, yu a-go ded. Uu a-go get wa yu put op fi yuself?’
“So is he who stores up treasure for himself, and is not rich toward God.”|“Dis a wa apm tu enibadi we siev op fi demself di sitn dem we de pan ort bot no rich iina di sitn dem we Gad kier bout.”

Then He said to His disciples, “Therefore I say to you, do not be anxious for your life, what you will eat, nor for your body, what you will wear.|So Jiizas tel im speshal falara dem se: “No bada fret bout unu laif, a wori op unuself bout wa unu a-go iit, ar wa unu a-go wier.
Life is more than food, and the body is more than clothes.|Kaaz laif muo impuotant dan fuud an di badi niid muo dan kluoz.

Consider the ravens: They neither sow nor reap, they have neither storehouses nor barns. Yet God feeds them. How much more valuable are you than birds?|Tingk bout di blak bod dem! Dem no plaant, dem no riip, an dem no av no stuor ous niida, bot Gad fiid dem! Unu wot uol iip muo tu Gad dan blak bod!
Who of you by worrying can add one cubit  to his height?
column2: Unu tingk se wen unu wori wori op unuself dat gweehn mek unu liv iivn wan owa langga dan unu fi liv?

column1: If you then cannot do what is least, why are you anxious about the other things?|So ef unu kyaahn du da wan likl sitn ya, wa unu a wori unuself bout di res dem fa?

“Consider how the lilies grow. They neither spin nor weave. Yet I say to you that Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these.|“Tingk bout ou di lili dem gruo. Dem no du no wok an dem no mek dem kluoz, bot Salaman wid aal a im fansi sitn dem no nais laik wan a dem lili ya.

If God so clothes the grass, which today is in the field and tomorrow is thrown into the oven, how much more will He clothe you, O you of little faith?|Ef dat a ou Gad jres op wail graas, wa de ya tide, an dash iina faiya tumaro, den im naa go mek shuor se unu av kluoz fi wier tu? Luk pan unu, wat a likl bit a chos unu put iina Gad!
And do not seek what you will eat or what you will drink, nor be of an anxious mind.|No kip aan a fret bout wa unu fi nyam ar jringk; no wori op unuself bout dat.
For the nations of the world seek all these things, and your Father knows that you need them. |Di piipl dem we a no Juu ron aafa dem de sitn de. Unu Faada nuo se unu kyaahn du widout dem.
But seek the kingdom of God, and all these things shall be given to you.|Wa unu fi du a put unu main pan Gad kindom an wa im waahn unu fi du, an unu wi get aal a dem sitn de.
“Do not be afraid, little flock, for it is your Father’s good pleasure to give you the kingdom.|“So, unu we a fala mi, no bada fried. Unu Faada api fi gi unu im kindom.

Sell your possessions and give alms. Provide yourselves purses that do not grow old, an unfailing treasure in the heavens, where no thief comes near and no moth destroys.|Sel wa unu av an elp di puor so unu kyan get moni we kyaahn ron out an stuor op aal kain-a gud sitn fi unuself iina evn. Wa de op de-so no tiif kyaahn kom tek an no mat kyaahn kom nyam nyam op.
For where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.|Kaaz eniwe unu put di sitn dem we wot nof tu unu a de-so unu aat a-go de.”
“Let your waist be girded and your lights be burning
column2: “Fiks op unu kluoz so unu redi fi wok an kip unu lamp a bon tu

column1: and you be like men waiting for their master to return from the wedding banquet, so that they may open the door immediately for him when he comes and knocks. |jos laik sorvant we a wiet fi dem maasta fi kom bak fram wan wedn, so az im kom nak so, dem kyan uopm op di duor siem taim fi'im.

Blessed are those servants whom the master will find watching when he comes. Truly I say to you, he will dress himself and have them sit down to dine, and he will come and serve them. |It a-go gud fi di sorvant dem uufa maasta fain dem bizi a wiet fi'im kom bak. Mi a tel unu dis, di maasta imself a-go put aan im wok kluoz, mek dem sidong a di tiebl, an im wi sorv dem.

If he comes in the second watch, or comes in the third watch, and finds them so, blessed are those servants. |It wuda wok out gud fi di sorvant dem uufa maasta kom weda liet a nait ar orli orli maanin an kom kech dem bizi a wiet fi'im.

But know this: If the owner of the house had known at what hour the thief was coming, he would have watched and not have allowed his house to be broken into.|Bot andastan dis! Ef di uona fi di ous did nuo di taim wen di tiif a kom, im wudn mek di tiif brok iina im ous.
Therefore be ready, for the Son of Man is coming at an hour you do not expect.”|A siem so unu mos redi, kaaz di Man we Gad Pik naa go kom wen unu tingk im a-go kom.”
Peter said to Him, “Lord, are You telling this parable to us, or to everyone?”|Piita aks, “Laad a wi wan yu a tel dis, ar a evribadi?”

The Lord said, “Who then is the faithful and wise steward, whom his master will make ruler over his house servants, to give them their portion of food at the proper time?|Di Laad ansa im se, “Uu a di manija we di maasta kyan chos an dipen pan? A dat de wan im a-go put inchaaj a im sorvant dem, fi gi dem fi dem shier a di fuud wen di rait taim kom.
Blessed is that servant whom his master will find so doing when he comes.
column2: It a-go gud fi da sorvant de ef im maasta kom fain im a du wa im fi du.

column1: Truly, I say to you, he will appoint him over all his possessions.|Mi tel unu dis, an a chuu mi a taak, di maasta a-go put im inchaaj a evriting im uon.

But if that servant says in his heart, ‘My master delays his coming,’ and begins to beat the house servants, both men and women, and to eat and drink and get drunk|Supuoz di sorvant se tu imself se, ‘Mi maasta a tek wan lang taim fi kom bak,’ an so im staat biit di ada sorvant dem an iit, jringk an get jongk.

the master of that servant will come on a day when he does not look for him, and at an hour when he is not aware, and will cut him to pieces and will appoint him his portion with the unbelievers.|Bot di maasta a-go kom bak wan die wen di sorvant naa luk fi im, an wan taim wen di sorvant naa chek se im wuda riich bak. Di maasta a-go chap im iina tuu an fling im out mongks di wan dem we no lisn ar fala wa im, di maasta, se.

“That servant who knew his master’s will, but did not prepare himself or do according to his will, shall be beaten with many stripes. |“Di sorvant we nuo wa im maasta waahn im fi du, an no get tingz redi ar no du wa im maasta waahn a-go get som big lik.

But he who unknowingly committed acts worthy of punishment shall be beaten with few stripes. For to whom much is given, of him much shall be required. And from him to whom much was entrusted, much will be asked.|Di wan we no nuo se im a du sitn rang jos a-go get wan wan lik. Evribadi we get uol iip, afi go gi uol iip. Enibadi we di maasta chos an lef inchaaj a uol iip a sitn, afi go ansa fi uol iip.”
“I have come to send fire upon the earth and wish that it were already kindled! |“Mi kom fi set faiya pan di ort, an bwai mi wish it did lait aredi.
But I have a baptism to be baptized with, and how pressed I am until it is accomplished! |Bot mi afi go chuu som siiros sofarieshan, an mi aat evi til it don!

Do you suppose that I have come to give peace on earth? No, I tell you, but rather division.  52For there will be from now on five divided in one house, three against two and two against three. |Yu tingk mi kom fi bring piis pan ort? Nuo sa, a separieshan.

For there will be from now on five divided in one house, three against two and two against three.|Fram nou aan ef faiv piipl de iina wan fambili, dem a-go fait gens dem wan aneda, chrii gens tuu an tuu gens chrii.

They will be divided, father against son and son against father, mother against daughter and daughter against mother, and mother-in-law against her daughter-in-law and daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law.”|Dem a-go fait gens dem wan aneda, faada gens im bwai pikni an bwai pikni gens im faada, mada gens daata an daata gens mada, mada-in-laa gens daata-in-laa an daata-in-laa gens mada-in-laa.”

Then He said to the crowd: “When you see a cloud rise out of the west, immediately you say, ‘A shower is coming,’ and so it is.|Jiizas tel di kroud se, “Az unu si kloud a kom kraas fram di wes, unu se, ‘Rien a-go faal,’ an di rien faal fi chuu.
And when a south wind blows, you say, ‘There will be heat,’ and it happens.|Enitaim di sout briiz a bluo, unu se, ‘It a-go at,’ an it at.
You hypocrites! You can discern the face of the sky and of the earth. But why do you not know how to discern this time?
column2: “Ipokrit! Unu kyan tel di weda wen unu luk pan wa gwaan roun unu an wen unu luk op iina di skai bot ou kom unu kyaahn andastan wa a gwaan iina dis ya taim ya?

column1: “Why even among yourselves do you not judge what is right?
column2: “Wa mek unu no joj fi unuself wa rait?

column1: When you go with your adversary to the magistrate, as you are on the way, diligently try to settle matters with him, lest he drag you to the judge, and the judge will hand you over to the officer, and the officer will throw you into prison.|Enitaim yu a go a kuot wid sumadi, chrai sekl unu aagiment pan di wie, ar di sumadi mait-a jrag yu infronta di joj, an di joj an yu uova tu di poliis an di poliis go lak yu op iina prizn.
I tell you, you shall not come out from there until you have paid the very last penny.”|Mi tel yu dis, yu naa go kyan kom out til yu pie op evri laas sent.”

There were present at that time some who told Him of the Galileans whose blood Pilate had mingled with their sacrifices.|Bout di siem taim, som piipl did de de we tel Jiizas bout ou Pailat tek di Gyalaliiyan dem blod an mek it miks op wid di blod a di animal dem we dem did kil fi bon sakrifais.

Jesus answered, “Do you suppose that these Galileans were worse sinners than all the other Galileans, because they suffered such things?|Jiizas se tu dem se, “Unu tingk se dem de Gyalaliiyan de did wosa dan aal a di ada Gyalaliiyan dem, mek dem sofa so?
I tell you, no! But unless you repent, you will all likewise perish.|Nuo! Mi tel unu, bot ef unu no sari fi di rang we unu du an chienj unu wiez, unu a-go ded siem wie laka dem.

Or those eighteen, upon whom the tower in Siloam fell and killed them, do you think that they were worse offenders than all men living in Jerusalem?|Di ietiin we ded wen di towa iina Sailuom jrap pan dem, unu tingk se dem did wosa dan di res a piipl we liv iina Jeruusilem?
I tell you, no! But unless you repent, you will all likewise perish.”|Nuo, mi tel unu! Bot ef unu no sari fi di rang we unu du an chienj unu wiez, unu a-go ded siem wie laka dem.”

Then He told this parable: “A man had a fig tree planted in his vineyard. He came and looked for fruit on it and found none. |Den Jiizas tel dem da tuori ya, “Wan man av wan prangganat chrii plaant iina im gyaadn, an im go fi si ef fruut de pan it, bot im no fain non.

So he said to the vinedresser of his vineyard, ‘Now these three years I have come looking for fruit on this fig tree, and I find none. Cut it down. Why should it deplete the soil?’|So im se tu im gyaadna se, ‘Fi chrii ier nou mi a kom luk fi prangganat pan da chrii ya, an no fain non. Chap it dong! Wa mek it fi a wies gud dot?’
“He answered him, ‘Sir, leave it alone this year also, until I dig around it and fertilize it.|“ ‘Sa,’ di man se, ‘lef it fi wan muo ier, an mi wi dig roun it an put manyuor de.
And if it bears fruit, well. But if not, after that you shall cut it down.’ ”|It mait-a bier neks ier! Ef it no bier, den yu kyan chap it dong.’ ”
He was teaching in one of the synagogues on the Sabbath.|Wan Sabat die, Jiizas did a tiich iina wan a di Juu dem choch
And there was a woman who had a spirit of infirmity for eighteen years and was bent over and could not straighten herself up.
column2: an wan uman did de de we wan diiman kaaz fi kripl fi ietiin ier. Ar bak did ben an shi kudn chrietn op.

column1: When Jesus saw her, He called her and said to her, “Woman, you are loosed from your infirmity.” |Wen Jiizas si ar, im kaal ar an se, “Uman, yu beta nou.”
Then He laid His hands on her, and immediately she was made straight and glorified God.|Im put im an pan ar, an siem taim shi tan op chriet chriet an priez Gad.

But the ruler of the synagogue answered with indignation, because Jesus had healed on the Sabbath, and said to the people, “There are six days in which men ought to work. Therefore come and be healed on those days, but not on the Sabbath day.”|Di ed man fi di Juu dem choch did beks kyaahn don, kaaz Jiizas get ar beta pan di Sabat. So im se tu di piipl dem, “Siks die de iina di wiik fi wok. Kom get beta pan wan a dem de die de, no dwi'it pan di Sabat!”

The Lord answered him, “You hypocrite! Does not each one of you on the Sabbath untie his ox or his donkey from the stall and lead it away to water it? |Di Laad tel im se, “Unu tuu-fies! Unu no luus unu kou ar dangki fram di staal an liid dem out fi waata pan di Sabat?

Then should not this woman, being a daughter of Abraham whom Satan has bound these eighteen years, be loosed from this bondage on the Sabbath?”|Den dis uman, wan a Iebriyam gyal pikni, we Sietan bain op fi ietiin lang lang ier, so wa, shi no fi get frii pan di Sabat tu?”

When He said this, all His adversaries were ashamed. And all the people rejoiced for all the glorious things that were done by Him.|Wen Jiizas se dis, aal a dem we gens im shiem, bot di res a piipl dem did api bout di gud gud sitn dem we im did a du.
Then He said, “What is the kingdom of God like? To what shall I compare it?|Jiizas aks dem se, “Ou Gad kindom tan? Wa it komiin laik?

It is like a grain of mustard seed which a man took and planted in his garden. It grew and became a large tree, and the birds of the air nested in its branches.”|It komiin laik wan likl likl siid, we wan man plaant iina im gyaadn. It gruo an aal ton chrii, an bod bil nes iin de.”
Again He said, “To what shall I compare the kingdom of God?|An Jiizas se agen, “Ou Gad kindom tan? Wa it komiin laik?

It is like yeast, which a woman took and hid in sixty pounds  of meal until all of it was leavened.”|It komiin laik di yiis we wan uman tek miks iina uol iip a flowa — se fifti poun — an miks it til it swel op.”
Then He went through the cities and villages, teaching, and journeying toward Jerusalem. |Jiizas did a go a Jeruusilem an a tiich az im paas chuu di toun an dischrik dem.
Someone said to Him, “Lord, will those who are saved be few?”He said to them, |Sumadi aks im se, “Laad, a onggl likl bit a piipl a-go get siev? Jiizas ansa dem se
“Strive to enter through the narrow gate. For many, I tell you, will try to enter and will not be able.|“Chrai unu bes fi go chuu di naro duor. Nof sumadi a-go chrai fi go iin bot naa go get iin.

Once the Master of the house has risen up and shut the door, and you begin to stand outside and knock at the door, saying, ‘Lord, Lord, open for us,’ He will answer you, ‘I do not know where you come from.’|Di taim a-go kom wen di uona a di ous get op an lak di duor an unu wi tan op outa duor a nak an beg, ‘Sa, uopm di duor fi wi.’ “Bot im wi ansa se, ‘Mi no nuo unu ar wich paat unu kom fram.’
“Then you will begin to say, ‘We ate and drank in your presence, and you taught in our streets.’|“Den unu wi se, ‘Wi yuus tu nyam an jringk wid yu, an yu did tiich pan wi ruod.’

“But He will say, ‘I tell you, I do not know you, or where you come from. Depart from Me, all you workers of iniquity.’|Im wi se, ‘Mi no nuo unu an mi no nuo we unu kom fram. Gu we fram mi, unu uol wikid unu.’

“There will be weeping and gnashing of teeth when you see Abraham, and Isaac, and Jacob, and all the prophets in the kingdom of God, and you yourselves thrust out.|“Unu a-go a baal an a grain unu tiit, wen unu si Iebriyam, Aizak, Jiekob an aal di prafit dem iina Gad kindom, an unu get lef out.

They will come from the east and from the west and from the north and from the south and will sit down to dine in the kingdom of God.|Piipl wi kom fram iis an wes, an naat an sout, an go sidong iit big dina iina Gad kindom.
Listen, there are the last who will be first, and the first who will be last.”|Bot andastan dis, di wan dem we de a front a-go de a bak an di wan dem we de a bak a-go de a front.”

On the same day certain Pharisees came, saying to Him, “Get out and depart from here, for Herod wants to kill You.”|Siem taim som Farisii kom tu Jiizas an se, “Lef da plies ya an go a wan neda wan. Erad waahn fi kil yu.”

He said to them, “Go and tell that fox, ‘Look, I cast out demons. And I perform healings today and tomorrow, and on the third day I shall be perfected.’ |Jiizas se, “Go tel da faks de se, ‘Luk, mi wi ron out diiman an mek piipl beta tide an tumaro, an pan di tord die, mi wok wi don.’
Nevertheless I must travel today and tomorrow and the day following. For it cannot be that a prophet should perish outside Jerusalem.
column2: Mi afi gwaan we mi a go tide an tumaro an di neks die. Kaaz no prafit kyaahn ded outsaida Jeruusilem!

column1: “O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, which kills the prophets and stones those who are sent to you! How often would I have gathered your children together, as a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, and you were not willing!|“Ai Jeruusilem, Jeruusilem, yu we kil di prafit dem an stuon di wan dem we Gad sen tu unu, mi lang fi gyada yu piipl roun mi, laik ou foul gyada fi ar pikni dem anda ar wing, bot unu neva waahn mi fi dwi'it!

Look, your house is forsaken. Truly I say to you, you shall not see Me until the time comes when you say, ‘Blessed is He who comes in the name of the Lord.’”|Gad naa go bizniz wid unu ous. Mi a tel unu dis, unu naa go si mi agen til unu se, ‘Gad bles di wan we im sen.’”

On the Sabbath they watched Him as He went into the house of one of the leaders of the Pharisees to eat bread. |Wan Sabat, wen Jiizas did go fi nyam a wan impuotant Farisii yaad, di ges dem did a wach im laik aak.
There before Him was a man who had edema.
column2: Wan man we a sofa wid swel op an an fut did infronta Jiizas.

column1: Jesus said to the lawyers and Pharisees, “Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath?”|Jiizas aks di Laa tiicha dem an di Farisii dem se, “Ef yu get piipl beta pan di Sabat, yu a brok di laa?”
But they remained silent. So He took him and healed him, and let him go.|Dem no ansa im. Jiizas uol di man an an mek im beta, den sen im we.

Then He said, “Which of you having a donkey or an ox that has fallen into a pit will not immediately pull him out on the Sabbath day?” |Jiizas aks dem se, “Wich wan a unu ef unu av wan bwai pikni ar wan kou we jrap iina wan wel pan di Sabat, naa go jraa dem out siem taim?”
And they could not answer Him regarding these things.
column2: Dem kudn ansa dat niida.

column1: When He marked how they chose the seats of honor, He told a parable to those who were invited, saying to them,|Jiizas si ou di ges dem a chrai fi sidong nier di ed a di tiebl, so im tel dem da likl tuori ya:

“When you are invited by any man to a wedding banquet, do not sit down in a seat of honor, lest a more honorable man than you be invited by him; |“Wen sumadi invait yu fi go a wan wedn, no sidong iina di bes siit, kaaz dem mait-a did invait sumadi muo speshal dan yu.

and he who invited you both will come and say to you, ‘Give this man the seat,’ and then you will begin with shame to take the lowest seat. |Di wan we invait di tuu a unu wi kom tel yu se, ‘Gi da man ya yu siit.’ Shiem wi tek yu an yu wi afi tek di luowis siit.

But when you are invited, go and sit down in the lowest seat, so that when he who invited you comes, he may say to you, ‘Friend, go up higher.’ Then you will have respect in the presence of those who sit at dinner with you.|So wen dem invait yu, tek di luowis plies, da wie de di sumadi we invait yu wi kom se tu yu, ‘Fren, muuv op go tek wan beta plies.’ Den yu wi get big op infronta di ada ges dem.
For whoever exalts himself will be humbled, and he who humbles himself will be exalted.”|Evribadi we put demself uova ada piipl, wi get pudong, bot ef yu ombl yuself, yu wi get big op.”

Then He said also to the one who invited Him, “When you prepare a dinner or a supper, do not call your friends or your brothers or your kinsmen or your rich neighbors, lest they also invite you in return, and you be repaid.|Den Jiizas se tu di sumadi we invait im se, “Wen yu gi wan lonch ar wan dina, no invait yu fren, breda, yu fambili, ar yu rich nieba dem niida kaaz dem mait-a invait yu an pie yu bak.
But when you prepare a banquet, call the poor, the maimed, the lame, the blind, |Wen yu av wan dina, invait puor, kripl, liem an blain piipl

and you will be blessed, for they cannot repay you. You shall be repaid at the resurrection of the just.”|an den Gad wi bles yu. Dem kyaahn pie yu bak, bot yu wi get pie bak wen aal a di ded dem we du rait kom bak alaiv.”

When one of those who sat at dinner with Him heard this, he said to Him, “Blessed is he who shall eat bread in the kingdom of God!”|Wan a dem we de a di tiebl an ier we Jiizas se, se tu im, “Di wan we a-go nyam a Gad tiebl, a im bles.”
Then He said to him, “A man prepared a banquet and invited many, |Jiizas se, “Wan man did a luk bout wan big dina, an im tel nof sumadi fi kom.

and sent his servant at supper time to say to those who had been invited, ‘Come, for everything is now prepared.’|Wen di taim kom fi di dina im sen im sorvant fi tel aal a uu im invait se, ‘Kom, evriting redi nou.’

“But they all with one mind began to make excuses. The first said to him, ‘I have bought a piece of land, and I must go and see it. I ask you to excuse me.’|“Aal a dem staat mek ekskyuuz. Di fos wan se, ‘Mi jos bai piis a lan, an mi afi go luk pan it. So mi beg yu paadn.’
“Another said, ‘I have bought five yoke of oxen, and I am going to prove them. I ask you to excuse me.’|“Aneda wan se, ‘Mi jos bai ten kou, an mi a go chek dem out an si ou dem wok. Mi beg yu paadn.’
“Still another said, ‘I have married a wife, and therefore I cannot come.’|“Aneda wan se, ‘Mi jos marid, so mi kyaahn kom.’

“The servant came and reported this to his master. Then the master of the house in anger said to his servant, ‘Go out quickly into the streets and lanes of the city, and bring in here the poor and the maimed and the lame and the blind.’|“Di sorvant kom bak an tel im maasta wa dem se. Den di maasta fi di ous get beks an se, ‘Mikies go outa ruod an kyari di puo, di kripl, di blain an di liem piipl dem kom.’
“The servant said, ‘Master, what you commanded has been done, and yet there is room.’|“Di sorvant se, ‘Mi du wa yu aada mi fi du Sa, bot ruum de ya fi muo piipl.’

“Then the master said to the servant, ‘Go out to the highways and hedges, and compel them to come in, so that my house may be filled. |“Di maasta tel im sorvant se, ‘Go out pan di aiwie an iina di konchrisaid an mek piipl kom, so mi ous wi ful.
For I tell you, none of those men who were invited shall taste my supper.’ ”|Kaaz yu si aal a dem piipl de we mi did invait, no iivn wan a dem a-go ties mi fuud.’
Large crowds went with Him. And He turned and said to them, |Wan big big kroud did a waak wid Jiizas. Im ton tu dem an se,

“If anyone comes to Me and does not hate his father and mother and wife and children and brothers and sisters, yes, and even his own life, he cannot be My disciple.|“Ef sumadi kom tu mi an no lov mi muo dan ou dem lov dem faada an mada, waif an pikni, breda an sista, iivn dem uona laif, dem kyaahn fala mi.
And whoever does not bear his cross and follow Me cannot be My disciple.|Enibadi we no kyari fi'im kraas an kom wid mi, kyaahn ton wan a mi falara dem.

“For who among you, intending to build a tower, does not sit down first and count the cost to see whether he has resources to complete it?|“Supuoz wan a unu waahn fi bil wan towa. Yu no wi sidong fos an chek out umoch it a-go kaas yu, so yu wi nuo ef yu av inof moni fi bil it.

Otherwise, perhaps, after he has laid the foundation and is not able to complete it, all who see it will begin to mock him,|Ef yu bil di foundieshan an kyaahn don bil di towa, evribadi we si'it a-go laaf aafa yu.
saying, ‘This man began to build and was not able to complete it.’|Dem wi se, ‘Yu staat bil bot yu kyaahn don it.’

“Or what king, going to wage war against another king, does not sit down first and take counsel whether he is able with ten thousand to meet him who comes against him with twenty thousand? |“Supuoz wan King waahn fi go waar gens aneda King. Im naa go sidong fos an tingk ef fi'im ten touzn man, kyan go gens twenti touzn?

Otherwise, while the other is yet at a distance, he sends a delegation and requests conditions of peace. |Ef im kyaahn win, wen di ada King stil de faar fram im, im wi sen mesinja fi fain out ou dem kyan mek piis.
So likewise, any of you who does not forsake all that he has cannot be My disciple.|So, ef yu no gi op evriting, yu kyaahn ton wan a mi falara dem.
“Salt is good. But if the salt has lost its saltiness, how shall it be made salty?|“Saalt gud, bot ef di ties gaan, ou it fi ties bak laik saalt?

It is fit neither for the land nor for the manure pile. So men throw it out.“He who has ears to hear, let him hear.”|It no gud fi di sail ar di manyuor pail niida, it fi dash we. Ef yu av iez fi ier, ier we mi a se.”
Now all the tax collectors and sinners drew near to Him to hear Him.
column2: Di taks kalekta an di sina dem gyada roun fi ier wa Jiizas av fi se.

column1: But the Pharisees and scribes murmured, saying, “This Man receives sinners and eats with them.”|Bot di Farisii an di Laa tiicha dem staat grombl se, “Da man ya a fren op sina an aal a nyam wid dem.”
So He told them this parable, saying,|So Jiizas ansa dem wid da tuori ya:
“What man among you having a hundred sheep and losing one of them does not leave the ninety-nine in the wilderness and go after the one which is lost until he finds it?
column2: “Supuoz wan a yu av onjrid shiip an wan a dem laas. Yu naa go lef di nainti-nain iina di fiil an go luk fi di wan we laas til yu fain it?
