column1: And when he has found it, he places it on his shoulders, rejoicing.|Wen yu fain it, yu so glad yu put it pan yu shuolda

Then when he comes home, he calls together his friends and neighbors, saying to them, ‘Rejoice with me, for I have found my sheep which was lost.’|an go a yu yaad. An wen yu riich yu kaal out yu fren an nieba dem an se, ‘Kom selibriet wid mi, mi fain mi shiip we did laas.’ ”

Likewise, I tell you, there will be more joy in heaven over one sinner who repents than over ninety-nine righteous men who need no repentance.|Jiizas se tu dem se, “Mi a tel unu, a siem wie evn a-go selibriet uova wan sina we ton tu Gad dan uova nainti-nain piipl we du rait an we na'av notn fi sari fa.

“Or what woman, having ten silver coins  and losing one, does not light a candle and sweep the house and search diligently until she finds it? |“Ar sopuoz wan uman av ten silva kain an laas wan. Shi naa go lait lamp, swiip out di uol a di ous, an luk evriwe til shi fain it?

And when she has found it, she calls together her friends and neighbors, saying, ‘Rejoice with me, for I have found the coin which I had lost.’|Wen shi fain it, shi kaal out ar fren an nieba dem an se, ‘Mek wi daans an praans, mi fain mi kain.’
Likewise, I tell you, there is joy in the presence of the angels of God over one sinner who repents.”|Mi a tel yu a siem wie Gad ienjel dem api wen wan sina ton tu Gad.”
Then He said, “A man had two sons.|Den Jiizas se, “Wan man did av tuu bwai pikni.

The younger of them said to his father, ‘Father, give me the share of the property that falls to me.’ So he divided his estate between them.|Di likla wan se tu im faada se, ‘Dadi, gi mi fi mi paat a we yu av fi mi.’ So di faada shier op aal a we im av bitwiin di tuu a dem.

“Not many days later, the younger son gathered everything together, and journeyed to a distant country, and there squandered his possessions in prodigal living.|“Likl afta dat, di likla wan tek aal we im get, go a farin, an wies im moni a liv wail.
When he had spent everything, there came a severe famine in that country, and he began to be in want. |Afta im spen aaf evriting im av, staavieshan kom pan di uol konchri, an tingz did bad wid im.
So he went and hired himself to a citizen of that county, who sent him into his fields to feed swine.|Im go wok fi wan man iina da konchri de an di man sen im fi go fiid im ag dem.
He would gladly have filled his stomach with the husks that the swine were eating, but no one gave him any.|Im did so onggri im did aal waahn nyam di ag fuud, bot nobadi no gi im notn.

“When he came to himself, he said, ‘How many of my father’s hired servants have an abundance of bread, and here I am perishing with hunger! |“Den im kech imself an se, ‘Bot di man dem we wok fi mi faada av muor fuud dan we dem kyan nyam an mi de ya a ded fi onggri!
I will arise and go to my father, and I will say to him, “Father, I have sinned against heaven and before you. |Mi a go a mi faada go tel im se: Dadi, mi du rang gens Gad an mi du yu rang tu
I am no longer worthy to be called your son. Make me like one of your hired servants.” ’|mi no gud fi bi yu pikni agen, bot mek mi wok fi yu.’

So he arose and came to his father.“But while he was yet far away, his father saw him and was moved with compassion, and ran and embraced his neck and kissed him.|So im get op an go a im faada. Im did stil faar fram im yaad wen im faada si im an fiil sari fi im. Im faada ron go og im op an kis im.

“The son said to him, ‘Father, I have sinned against heaven and before you. I am no longer worthy to be called your son.’|“Di pikni se tu im faada se, ‘Dadi, mi du rang gens Gad an mi du yu rang tu. Mi no gud fi bi yu pikni agen.’

“But the father said to his servants, ‘Bring out the best robe and put it on him. And put a ring on his hand and shoes on his feet. |“Bot di faada tel im sorvant se, ‘Mikies! Kyari di bes kluoz kom put aan pan im. Put wan ring pan im fingga an shuuz pan im fut.
Bring here the fattened calf and kill it, and let us eat and be merry. |Bring di kyaaf we mi a fatn kom kil it. Mek wi nyam, daans an praans.

For this son of mine was dead, and is alive again; he was lost, and is found.’ So they began to be merry.|Mi pikni did ded bot im kom bak alaiv. Im did laas bot mi get im bak.’ So dem staat fi daans an praans.
“Now his older son was in the field. As he came and drew near the house, he heard music and dancing.|“Di biga bwai pikni did de a grong. Wen im riich nier di ous, im ier myuuzik a plie.
So he called one of the servants and asked what this meant.
column2: So im kaal wan a di sorvant dem an aks im a wa gwaan.

column1: He said to him, ‘Your brother has come, and your father has killed the fattened calf, because he has received him safe and sound.’|Im tel im se ‘No yu breda kom uom an yu faada kil di kyaaf we im did a fatn, kaaz im kom uom sief an soun.’
“He was angry and would not go in. Therefore his father came out and entreated him. |“Di biga breda did so beks, im wudn go iina di ous. So im faada go out go beg im fi kom iin.

But he answered his father, ‘Look! These many years have I served you. Nor have I ever transgressed your commands, yet never have you given me a goat, so that I might be merry with my friends.|Bot im se tu im faada se, ‘Aal dem ier ya mi wok laka sliev fi yu an mi du evriting we yu tel mi fi du. Bot aal dem taim de no iivn wan dege-dege yong guot yu no gi mi fi selibriet wid mi fren dem.

But when this son of yours came, who has devoured your living with harlots, you killed the fattened calf for him.’|Bot az da pikni de, we wies aal we yu gi im a bai uman, kom uom, yu kil yu bes kyaaf fi'im!’
“He said to him, ‘Son, you are always with me, and all that I have is yours.|“Di faada se, ‘Pikni, yu aalwiez de ya wid mi, an evriting we mi av a fi yu uon.

But it was fitting to be merry and be glad, for this brother of yours was dead and is alive again; he was lost and is found.’ ”|Bot wi did so glad wi did afi daans an praans, kaaz yu breda we did ded an kom bak alaiv, kom bak uom. Im did laas bot wi get im bak.’ ”
He told His disciples: “There was a rich man who had a steward who was accused to the man of wasting his resources.
column2: Jiizas tel im speshal falara dem se: “Yu did av wan rich man we ier se im manija did a wies im sitn dem.

column1: So he called him and said, ‘How is it that I hear this about you? Give an account of your stewardship, for you may no longer be steward.’|Di rich man kaal im an aks im se, ‘Wa dis mi ier bout yu? Rait dong wa yu get an wa yu spen, kaaz yu kyaahn bi mi manija agen.’

“Then the steward said to himself, ‘What shall I do, for my master is taking away the stewardship from me? I cannot dig. I am ashamed to beg.|“Di manija se tu imself, ‘A wa mi fi du nou? Mi maasta a go tek we mi jab. Mi no av di chrent fi dig grong, an mi shiem fi beg.
I know what to do so that, when I am removed from the stewardship, others may receive me into their houses.’|Mi nuo wa mi a-go du, so dat wen mi baas faiya mi, piipl wi stil waahn mi kom a dem yaad.’

“So he called each of his master’s debtors, and said to the first, ‘How much do you owe my master?’|“Im kaal iin evri wan a di piipl dem we uo im maasta. Im aks di fos wan se, ‘Umoch yu uo mi maasta?’

“He said, ‘Eight hundred gallons of oil.’“He said to him, ‘Take your bill, and sit down quickly and write four hundred.’|“Im se, ‘Wan onjrid baril a aliv ail.’“Di manija tel im se, ‘Tek yu bil, sidong kwik, an rait op fifti.’

“Then he said to another, ‘And how much do you owe?’“He said, ‘One thousand bushels of wheat.’“He said to him, ‘Take your bill, and write eight hundred.’|“Im aks di sekan wan se, ‘Umoch yu uo?’“ ‘Wan onjrid bag a wiit,’ im se.“Im tel im se, ‘Tek yu bil an rait ieti.’

“The master commended the dishonest steward, because he had acted prudently. For the sons of this world are wiser in their own generation than the sons of light.|“Iivn duo di manija did tiif, di maasta big im op kaaz im did sumaat. Di piipl we bilang tu da worl ya, sumaata wen dem a diil wid dem wan aneda, dan Gad piipl.

I say to you, make friends for yourself by means of unrighteous wealth, so that when you fall short, they may receive you into eternal dwellings.|Mi a tel yu dis, yuuz di moni we yu av fi du gud fi piipl an mek fren, so wen it don, yu wi av wan uom iina evn.

“He who is faithful in what is least is faithful also in much. And he who is dishonest in the least is dishonest also in much.|“Enibadi we yu kyan chos wid likl bit, yu kyan chos dem wid uol iip tu, an enibadi we yu kyaahn chos wid likl bit yu kyaahn chos dem wid uol iip niida.

So if you have not been faithful in the unrighteous wealth, who will commit to your trust the true riches? |Ef piipl kyaahn chos yu wid moni ar di sitn dem iina di worl, uu a-go chos yu wid eniting we riili wot sopm?
And if you have not been faithful in that which is another man’s, who will give you that which is your own?|Ef dem kyaahn chos yu wid ada piipl tingz, uu a-go gi yu notn fi yuself?

“No servant can serve two masters. Either he will hate the one and love the other, or he will be loyal to the one and despise the other. You cannot serve God and wealth.”|“No sorvant kyaahn sorv tuu maasta. Yu wi iet wan an lov di ada wan, ar yu wi ron go du eniting we wan waahn bot no tuu bizniz wid di ada wan. Unu kyaahn sorv Gad an moni.”
The Pharisees, who were lovers of money, heard all these things and derided Him.|Di Farisii dem laaf aafa Jiizas wen dem ier dis, kaaz dem lov moni.

He said to them, “You are those who justify yourselves before men, but God knows your hearts. For that which is highly esteemed before men is an abomination before God.|Jiizas se tu dem se, “Unu aalwiez mek unuself luk gud tu ada piipl, bot Gad nuo unu aat. Yu si aal dem sitn we piipl lov, Gad naa no yuus fi dem.

“The Law and the Prophets were preached until John. Since then the kingdom of God has been preached, and everyone is pressing into it.|“Bifuo Jan kom piipl did afi fala Muoziz Laa an wa di prafit dem rait dong. Bot sins im kom an di gud nyuuz bout Gad kindom a priich siem wie, evribadi a fait fi get iin de.
It is easier for heaven and earth to pass away than for one stroke of the law to fail.
column2: It wuda kwika fi evn an ort mash op dan fi di liklis leta iina di Laa chienj.

column1: “Whoever divorces his wife and marries another commits adultery, and whoever marries her who is divorced by her husband commits adultery.|“Wan man we brok op wid im waif an go marid sumadi els, a brok di Laa, an di man we marid wan uman we brok op wid ar ozban a brok di Laa tu.
“There was a rich man who was clothed in purple and fine linen and fared sumptuously every day.
column2: “Wan taim yu did av wan rich man we yuus tu jres op iina porpl kluoz mek outa fansi an dier klaat an did a liv big laif evridie.

column1: There was also a beggar named Lazarus, covered with sores, who had been placed at his gate,|Wan bega, niem Lazaros, did de a di rich man giet, an im badi ful op a suor.
desiring to be fed the crumbs falling from the rich man’s table. Moreover the dogs came and licked his sores.
column2: Im did wel waahn fi nyam wa jrap aafa di rich man tiebl. Aal di daag dem did kom a lik aaf di bega-man suor dem.

column1: “It came to pass that the beggar died and was carried by the angels to Abraham’s presence. The rich man also died and was buried.
column2: “Di bega ded an di ienjel dem kyari im tu Iebriyam said. Di rich man ded tu an get beri.

column1: In Hades, being in torment, he lifted up his eyes and saw Abraham from a distance and Lazarus in his presence.|An iina el, im did riili a sofa, di rich man luk op an si Iebriyam faar faar, wid Lazaros saida im.

So he cried out, ‘Father Abraham, have mercy on me, and send Lazarus to dip the tip of his finger in water and cool my tongue. For I am tormented in this flame.’|So im kaal out, ‘Faada Iebriyam, elp mi, sen Lazaros kom dip di tip a im fingga iina waata fi kuul mi tong. Mi a sofa bad bad iina dis ya faiya ya.’

“But Abraham said, ‘Son, remember that you in your lifetime received your good things, and Lazarus in like manner evil things. But now he is comforted and you are tormented. |“Iebriyam ansa im an se, ‘Pikni, wen yu did alaiv, a bier gud sitn yu get, an a bier bad sitn riich Lazaros, nou im api an a liv aarait an yu a sofa.

And besides all this, between us and you there is a great gulf, so that those who would pass from here to you cannot, nor can those from there pass to us.’|An muor dan dat, wan diip diip chrench de bitwiin wi uova ya-so an unu uova de-so, an nobadi fram non a di said dem kyaahn kraas uova.’
“He said, ‘Then I pray you, father, to send him to my father’s house|“Di rich man se, ‘Den mi beg yu faada, du, sen Lazaros go a mi faada ous,
for I have five brothers, to testify to them, lest they also come to this place of torment.’|beg im waan mi faiv breda dem, so dem no kom dong a da plies ya, we evribadi a sofa.’
“Abraham said to him, ‘They have Moses and the Prophets. Let them hear them.’|“Iebriyam ansa se, ‘Dem av Muoziz an di prafit dem. Mek dem lisn dem.’

“He said, ‘No, father Abraham. But if someone from the dead goes to them, they will repent.’|“ ‘Nuo, faada Iebriyam,’ im se, ‘bot ef sumadi we ded go taak tu dem, dem wi sari fi di rang we dem du an ton tu Gad.’

“He said to him, ‘If they do not hear Moses and the Prophets, neither will they be persuaded if someone should rise from the dead.’ ”|“Iebriyam se, ‘Ef dem no lisn Muoziz an di prafit dem, no iivn sumadi fram di ded a-go mek dem chienj dem main.’ ”

Then He said to the disciples, “It is impossible except that offenses will come. But woe to him through whom they come! |Jiizas se tu im speshal falara dem se, “Unu aalwiez a-go av sitn we mek piipl du rang, bot chobl fi di wan we mek sumadi els du di rang.

It would be better for him if a millstone were hung around his neck and he was thrown into the sea, than to offend one of these little ones.|Dem wuda betaraaf ef wan big big rakstuon did tai roun dem nek an dem get fling iina sii, dan fi dem kaaz wan a dem likl wan ya fi sin.

Take heed to yourselves.“If your brother sins against you, rebuke him. And if he repents, forgive him. |So wach unuself! Ef yu breda ar yu sista du yu sopm rang, taak tu dem bout di rang we dem du an ef dem sari, paadn dem.

If he sins against you seven times in a day, and seven times in a day turns to you, saying, ‘I repent,’ you must forgive him.”|Ef sevn taim iina wan die, dem du yu rang, an evritaim kom bak an se, ‘Mi sari,’ yu fi paadn dem.”
The apostles said to the Lord, “Increase our faith.”|Di apasl dem se tu di Laad se, “Laad, elp wi fi chos iina yu muor!”

The Lord said, “If you had faith as a grain of mustard seed, you could say to this mulberry tree, ‘Be uprooted and be planted in the sea,’ and it would obey you.|Jiizas se, “Ef unu did chos iina mi likl bit, iivn laka wan likl likl siid, unu kuda se tu da big bredfruut chrii ya, ‘Ruut op yuself fram ya-so an go plaant yuself iina di sii,’ an it wuda du wa unu tel it fi du.

“Which of you, having a servant plowing or herding sheep, will say to him when he has come in from the field, ‘Come now and sit down for dinner’? |“Wich wan a unu wuda se tu unu sorvant we kom bak fram di fiil ar jos don luk aafa di shiip, ‘Kom, kom sidong an nyam’?

Will he not rather say to him, ‘Prepare my supper, and dress yourself and serve me until I eat and drink. And afterward you will eat and drink’? |Unu naa go kwika fi se, ‘Gwaan go luk bout mi sopa, an fiks op yuself an kom sorv mi mi fuud. Wen mi don nyam an jringk, yu kyan go nyam an jringk tu.’
Does he thank the servant because he did what was commanded? I think not.
column2: An unu tingk di maasta wuda tel di sorvant tangks kaaz im du wa im tel im fi du?

column1: So you also, when you have done everything commanded you, say, ‘We are unprofitable servants. We have done our duty.’ ”|A siem so, wen unu du evriting we unu sopuoz fi du, unu fi se, “Wi a onggl sorvant, wi no fi ekspek no big op ar notn speshal niida, kaaz wi onggl a du wa wi sopuoz fi du.”
As Jesus went to Jerusalem, He passed between Samaria and Galilee. |Jiizas did de pan im wie a go a Jeruusilem wen im paas chuu di paat we Samieriya an Gyalalii miit op.

As He entered a village, there met Him ten men who were lepers, who stood at a distance. |Siem taim Jiizas a go iina wan dischrik, ten man we did av wan siknis we mek dem skin fasi-fasi, kom op tu im. Dem neehn kom tuu kluos, bot tan likl wie fram im
They lifted up their voices, saying, “Jesus, Master, have pity on us!”|an ala out se, “Jiizas, Tiicha, elp wi, du!”

When He saw them, He said to them, “Go, show yourselves to the priests.” And as they went, they were cleansed.|Wen Jiizas si dem, im se, “Gwaan go mek di priis dem luk pan unu.” Wen dem de pan dem wie, dem get beta.
One of them, when he saw that he was healed, returned with a loud voice glorifying God|Wan a dem si se im get beta an ton baka priez Gad loud loud.
and fell down on his face at His feet, giving Him thanks. And he was a Samaritan.|Im chuo imself a Jiizas fut an tangk im. An im a did wan Samaritan.
Jesus said, “Were not the ten cleansed? Where are the nine?|Jiizas aks im se, “A no ten a unu did get beta? So we di ada nain de?
Were there not any found to return and give glory to God except this foreigner?”
column2: Nobadi els no kom bak kom priez Gad? A onggl da farina ya wan?”

column1: Then He said to him, “Rise, go your way. Your faith has made you well.”|Den Jiizas se tu di man se, “Git op an go a yu yaad, yu biliiv an a dat mek yu get beta.”

When He was asked by the Pharisees when the kingdom of God would come, He answered them, “The kingdom of God does not come with observation. |Di Farisii dem aks Jiizas fi tel dem a wen di taim a-go kom wen Gad wi ruul iina evri wie. Jiizas se tu dem se, “Notn no de we kyan tel unu a wen Gad a-go ruul iina evri wie,

Nor will they say, ‘Here it is!’ or ‘There it is!’ For remember, the kingdom of God is within you.”|an piipl naa go kyan se, ‘Luk, si Gad a ruul ya!’ ar ‘Luk, si Gad a ruul de,’ kaaz Gad a ruul mongks unu aredi.”

Then He said to the disciples, “The days will come when you will desire to see one of the days of the Son of Man, but you will not see it. |Den Jiizas se tu im speshal falara dem se, “Di taim a-go kom wen unu wi lang fi di Man we Gad Pik kom bak, iivn fi wan die.
They will say to you, ‘Look here,’ or ‘Look there!’ Do not follow after them. |Piipl wi tel unu se, ‘Luk, si im de!’ ar ‘Luk, si im ya!’ Bot no go, no fala dem.

For as the lightning flashes and lights up the heavens from one side to the other, so will the Son of Man be in His day. |Di die di Man we Gad Pik kom bak, a-go komiin laik wen laitnin flash kraas di skai an lait op di uol worl.
But first He must suffer many things and be rejected by this generation.
column2: Bot mi afi sofa uol iip a sitn fos an di piipl dem fram da taim ya a-go ton dem bak pan mi.

column1: “Just as it was in the days of Noah, so will it be in the days of the Son of Man.|“Jos laik ou piipl yuus tu gwaan iina Nowa taim, a siem so piipl a-go gwaan wen di Man we Gad Pik kom bak.

They were eating, drinking, marrying, and were given in marriage until the day when Noah entered the ark. Then the flood came and destroyed them all.|Piipl did a nyam, jringk, an a get marid op tu di die wen Nowa go iina di aak. Den di flod kom an kil aaf di uol a dem.

“Likewise as it was in the days of Lot: They ate, they drank, they bought, they sold, they planted, they built.|“A di siem wie di piipl dem iina Lat taim did a gwaan. Dem did a nyam an jringk, bai an sel, plaant an bil.

But on the day that Lot departed from Sodom, fire and brimstone rained from heaven and destroyed them all.|Bot di die Lat lef Sadam, faiya an brimstuon kom dong laik rien fram evn an kil di uol a dem.
“So will it be on the day when the Son of Man is revealed.
column2: “A siem so it a-go apm pan di die di Man we Gad Pik kom bak.

column1: On that day let him who is on the housetop, with his goods in the house, not come down to take them away. And likewise let him who is in the field not return to the things behind.|Pan da die de, uu de pan ruuf tap an av gudz iina di ous, no fi go dong fi get dem. An uu de iina di fiil no fi go bak fi notn.
Remember Lot’s wife.
column2: Memba Lat waif!

column1: Whoever seeks to save his life will lose it, and whoever loses his life will preserve it. |Di wan we a chrai fi kip im laif, wi luuz it, bot di wan we wi gi op im laif, wi siev it.

I tell you, on that night two men will be in one bed; the one will be taken and the other will be left.|Mi tel unu, pan da nait de, tuu piipl wi iina di siem bed, wan a-go get tek we an di ada wan a-go get lef bak.
Two women will be grinding grain together; the one will be taken and the other will be left. |Tuu uman wi a grain grien, wan a-go get tek we an di ada wan a-go get lef bak.”
Two men will be in the field; the one will be taken and the other will be left.”
column2: Too man ago ina di feel; wan ago get tek we an di ada wan ago get lef.

column1: They asked, “Where, Lord?”He replied, “Where the body is, there the eagles will be gathered together.”|Dem aks im, “Wich paat Laad?”Im se, “Eniwe yu av ded badi, a de-so jangkro a-go gyada.”
He told them a parable to illustrate that it is necessary always to pray and not lose heart.
column2: Den Jiizas tel im speshal falara dem da tuori ya fi shuo dem se dem fi aalwiez prie an no gi op.

column1: He said: “In a city there was a judge who did not fear God or regard man.|“Iina wan toun, yu did av wan joj we no fried a Gad an we no rispek nobadi.

And a widow was in that city. She came to him, saying, ‘Avenge me against my adversary.’|An iina di siem toun de yu did av wan uman we ozban did ded. Shi eva a kom tu im an a beg im se, ‘Mi waahn jostis, protek mi fram mi enimi dem, du!’

“He would not for a while. Yet afterward he said to himself, ‘Though I do not fear God or respect man,|“Fi wan lang taim im a tel ar nuo. Bot afta a wail di joj se tu imself se, ‘Mi no fried a Gad an mi no rispek nobadi

yet because this widow troubles me, I will avenge her, lest by her continual coming she will weary me.’ ”|bot siek-a ou da uman ya kip aan a bada mi, mi a-go mek shuor se shi get jostis, so shi wi tap kom kom taiyad mi out.’ ”
And the Lord said, “Hear what the unjust judge says.|Di Laad tel dem se, “Unu ier wa di wikid joj se?

And shall not God avenge His own elect and be patient with them, who cry day and night to Him?|So unu no tingk se Gad a-go gi di piipl dem we im pik jostis, iihn, di wan dem we baal tu im die an nait? Unu tingk se im wi kip aan a put dem aaf?

I tell you, He will avenge them speedily. Nevertheless, when the Son of Man comes, will He find faith on the earth?”|Gad wi mek shuor se dem get jostis kwik kwik. Bot wen di Man we Gad Pik kom baka ort, im a-go fain piipl we biliiv iina im?”

He told this parable to some who trusted in themselves, as though they were righteous, and despised others:|Jiizas tel dem da tuori ya tu di wan dem we fiil se dem a du rait an a luk dong pan evribadi els:
“Two men went up to the temple to pray, the one a Pharisee and the other a tax collector.|“Tuu man go op a Gad ous fi go prie. Wan a dem a did wan Farisii an di ada wan a did wan taks kalekta.

The Pharisee stood and prayed these things about himself, ‘God, I thank You that I am not like other men: extortioners, unjust, adulterers, or even like this tax collector.|Di Farisii tan op an prie bout imself se ‘Gad, mi tangk yu dat mi no tan laka ada piipl we tiif, brok di Laa, sliip wid piipl dem no marid tu, ar iivn laik da taks kalekta ya.
I fast twice a week, and I tithe of all that I earn.’|Mi faas tuu taim fi di wiik an evriting we mi get mi shier it op iina a ten an gi yu wan.’

“But the tax collector, standing at a distance, would not even lift his eyes to heaven, but struck his chest, saying, ‘God, be merciful to me a sinner.’|“Bot di taks kalekta tan faar. Im wudn iivn luk op a evn. Im biit im ches an im se, ‘Gad, tek piti pan mi, wan sina.’

“I tell you, this man went down to his house justified rather than the other. For everyone who exalts himself will be humbled, and he who humbles himself will be exalted.”|“Mi a tel unu da man ya, no di Farisii, bot di taks kalekta, im go a im yaad an evriting rait bitwiin im an Gad. Enibadi we put demself uova ada piipl a-go get pudong, an dem we ombl demself, wi get lif op ai.”

They also brought infants to Him that He might touch them. When the disciples saw it, they rebuked them. |Piipl did a kyari dem biebi go a Jiizas fi im toch dem. Jiizas speshal falara dem si wa a gwaan an staat tel aaf di piipl dem an ron dem.

But Jesus called them to Him and said, “Permit the little children to come to Me, and do not hinder them. Forto such belongs the kingdom of God. |Bot Jiizas tel dem fi kom wen im se, “Mek di likl pikni dem kom tu mi. No tap dem, kaaz Gad kindom a fi piipl we komiin laik dem likl pikni ya.

Truly, I say to you, whoever will not receive the kingdom of God as a little child will in no wise enter it.”|Mi tel unu dis ya, an a chuu mi a taak, enibadi we no chos iina Gad an fala im laik wan likl pikni naa go kyan go iina Gad kindom.”
A certain ruler asked Him, “Good Teacher, what must I do to inherit eternal life?”|Wan ruula aks Jiizas se, “Mi gud tiicha, wa mi mos du fi liv fi eva?”
Jesus said to him, “Why do you call Me good? No one is good, except God alone|Jiizas ansa im se, “Wa mek yu kaal mi gud? Nobadi no gud, onggl Gad wan.

You know the commandments: Do not commit adultery, Do not murder, Do not steal, Do not bear false witness, Honor your father and your mother.”|Yu nuo di Laa dem: ‘No sliip wid nobadi we yu no marid tu, no kil, no tiif, no tel lai pan piipl an yu fi rispek yu faada an mada.’”
He said, “All these I have kept since my youth.”|“Fram mi a likl bwai, mi a fala aal a dem de wid aal a mi aat,” im se.

When Jesus heard this, He said to him, “Yet you lack one thing. Sell all that you have and distribute to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven. And come, follow Me.”|Afta Jiizas ier dis, Jiizas se tu im se, “Yu stil av wan ting lef fi du. Sel evriting we yu av an gi di moni tu di puo piipl dem, an yu wi rich iina evn. Wen yu du dat, kom fala mi.”
When he heard this he became very sorrowful, for he was very rich.|Wen di man ier dis, im aat jrap, kaaz im did wel rich.

When Jesus saw that he became very sorrowful, He said, “How hard it is for those who have riches to enter the kingdom of God!|Jiizas luk pan im an se, “A di aadis ting fi rich piipl go iina Gad kindom!
For it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of God.”
column2: It iiziya fi wan kyamil go chuu wan niigl yai dan fi sumadi we rich go iina Gad kindom.”

column1: Those who heard this said, “Who then can be saved?”|Dem we ier dis aks Jiizas se, “Den a uu kyan get siev?”
He said, “What is impossible with men is possible with God.”|Jiizas se, “We piipl kyaahn du, Gad kyan du.”
Peter said, “Look, we have left everything and followed You.”|Den Piita se, “Wi lef evriting we wi did av fi fala yu!”

He said to them, “Truly, I tell you, there is no man who has left his home or parents or brothers or wife or children, for the sake of the kingdom of God|“Mi a tel unu di chuut,” Jiizas se tu dem, “enibadi we lef fi dem yaad, fi dem waif, breda, mada an faada ar dem pikni siek-a Gad kindom
who shall not receive many times more in this age and, in the age to come, eternal life.”|dem wi get bak uol iip muo iina da taim ya, an dem wi get fi liv fi eva iina evn.”

Taking the twelve, He said, “Listen! We are going up to Jerusalem, and everything that is written by the prophets concerning the Son of Man will be accomplished|Jiizas tek im twelv falara dem wan said an tel dem se, “Wi a go op a Jeruusilem, an evriting di prafit dem rait dong bout di Man we Gad Pik a-go apm.

for He will be handed over to the Gentiles and will be mocked and insulted and spit upon. |Dem a-go tek im gi di piipl we a no Juu. Dem a-go laaf aafa im an tek mi mek preke, shiem im an pit pan im. Dem a-go biit im wikid wikid an kil im.
They will scourge Him and put Him to death, and on the third day He will rise again.”|Bot chrii die afta dem kil im, im a-go kom bak alaiv.”

They understood none of these things. This saying was hidden from them, and they did not comprehend what was spoken.|Jiizas falara dem neva get non a we im se. Di miinin did aid fram dem, so dem kudn andastan wa im a taak bout.
As He was drawing near Jericho, a certain blind man sat along the way begging.|Nou, wen Jiizas kech nier Jeriko, wan blain man did sidong a di ruod-said a beg
Hearing a crowd passing by, he asked what it meant. |Di man ier di kroud a paas an aks dem a wa a gwaan.
They told him that Jesus of Nazareth was passing by.|Dem tel im se, “A Jiizas we kom fram Nazaret a kom.”
He cried out, “Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!”|Im baal out loud loud, “Jiizas, Dievid pikni, tek piti pan mi no!”

Those who went in front rebuked him, so that he would keep quiet. But he cried out much more, “Son of David, have mercy on me!”|Di wan dem we did a liid di wie tel im fi shet im mout an tap im naiz, bot im shout out louda, “Dievid pikni, du, tek piti pan mi no!”
Jesus stood and commanded him to be brought to Him. When he came near, He asked him|Jiizas tap, an tel dem fi bring di man kom. Afta di blain man kom nier, Jiizas aks im se
“What do you want Me to do for you?”He said, “Lord, grant that I may receive my sight.”|“Wa yu waahn mi fi du fi yu?”Im se, “Laad, mek mi si agen.”
Jesus said to him, “Receive your sight. Your faith has saved you.”|Jiizas tel im se, “Si de, yu kyan si agen. Yu kyan si kaaz yu biliiv.”

Immediately he received his sight and followed Him, glorifying God. When all the people saw it, they gave praise to God.|Siem taim im kuda si an im fala baka Jiizas a priez Gad. Afta di piipl si wa apm, dem priez Gad tu.
Jesus entered and passed through Jericho.
column2: Jiizas did a go chuu Jeriko

column1: A man was there named Zacchaeus who was a chief tax collector, and he was rich.|wich paat wan man niem Zakiyos did liv. Zakiyos a did wan a di ed taks kalekta dem an im did wel rich.

He tried to see who Jesus was, but was not able from the crowd, because he was little in stature.|Im did waahn fi si a uu Jiizas bi, bot chuu im did so shaat an kaaz di kroud did so big, im kudn si im.
So he ran ahead and climbed up into a sycamore tree to see Him, for He was to pass that way.|So im ron infronta dem an klaim wan taal chrii so im kuda si, kaaz Jiizas did a waak da wie de.

When Jesus came to the vicinity, He looked up and saw him, and said to him, “Zacchaeus, hurry and come down, for today I must remain at your house.”|Wen Jiizas riich di chrii, im luk op an se tu im, “Zakiyos, kom dong nou. Mi afi tan a yu yaad tide.”
So he hurried and came down, and received Him joyfully.|So Zakiyos kom dong siem taim an did glad fi welkom Jiizas iina im ous.
When they saw it, they all murmured, saying, “He has gone to be the guest of a man who is a sinner.”|Di piipl si dis an dem staat grombl, “Im gaan go tan a wan sina man yaad.”

But Zacchaeus stood and said to the Lord, “Look, Lord, I give half of my possessions to the poor. And if I have taken anything from anyone by false accusation, I will repay him four times as much.”|Zakiyos tan op bifuo evribadi an se tu di Laad, “Luk Laad, aaf a we mi av, mi a-go gi tu di puo, an ef mi rab nobadi, mi wi pie dem bak fuo taim wa mi did tiif.”
Jesus said to him, “Today salvation has come to this house, because he also is a son of Abraham.|Jiizas se tu im se, “Tide da fambili ya get siev, kaaz da man ya, a wan a Iebriyam pikni tu.
For the Son of Man has come to seek and to save that which was lost.”
column2: Di Man we Gad Pik kom fi luk fi piipl we laas an siev dem.”

column1: As they heard these things, He continued and told them a parable, because He was near Jerusalem and because they thought the kingdom of God would immediately appear.|Wen dem a lisn tu dis, Jiizas tel dem wan neda tuori, kaaz im did nier Jeruusilem an di piipl dem did tingk se Gad kindom did a-go kom siem taim.

Therefore He said, “A nobleman went to a distant country to receive a kingdom and to return.|Jiizas se tu dem se, “Wan big impuotant man did go a wan faar plies fi dem mek im King an den fi go baka im yaad.

So he called his ten servants and entrusted to them ten pounds  and said to them, ‘Trade until I come.’|Bifuo im lef, im kaal ten a im sorvant dem an gi aal a dem som moni. Im tel dem se, ‘Tek da moni ya an si umoch unu kyan mek til mi kom bak.’

“But his citizens hated him and sent a delegation after him, saying, ‘We do not want this man to reign over us.’|“Bot di piipl dem we liv wich paat im kom fram did iet im. So dem sen piipl baka im fi se, ‘Wi no waahn da man ya fi ton wi King.’

“When he returned, having received the kingdom, he summoned these servants, to whom he had entrusted the money, that he might know what everyone gained by trading.|“Bot im ton King siem wie, an wen im riich uom, im kaal fi di sorvant dem we im did gi moni, fi fain out umoch dem mek.
“The first came, saying, ‘Master, your pound has made ten pounds more.’|“Di fos wan kom an se, ‘Sa, mi mek ten muo pan tap a we yu gi mi.’

“He said to him, ‘Well done, good servant! Because you have been faithful in very little, take authority over ten cities.’|“Im maasta se, ‘Yu du gud mi sorvant! Siek-a ou yu anggl wan sumaal sitn, tek chaaj a ten siti.’
“The second came, saying, ‘Master, your pound has made five pounds more.’|“Di sekan wan kom an se, ‘Sa, mi mek faiv muo pan tap a we yu gi mi.’
“He said in like manner to him, ‘You, take authority over five cities.’|“Im maasta ansa, ‘Yu tek chaaj a faiv siti.’
“Then another came, saying, ‘Master, look, here is your pound, which I have kept put away in a napkin. |“Aneda sorvant kom an se, ‘Sa, si yu moni ya. Mi kip it rap op iina piis a klaat

For I feared you, because you are an exacting man. You collect what you did not deposit, and reap what you did not sow.’|chuu mi fried a yu, kaaz yu a wan aad man. Yu tek wa yu no put iin an riip wa yu no plaant.’

“He said to him, ‘Out of your own mouth will I judge you, you wicked servant. You knew that I was an exacting man, collecting what I did not deposit and reaping what I did not sow.|“Im maasta se, ‘Mi wi tek yu uona wod dem joj yu, yu woklis sorvant! Duo yu se mi a wan aad man we tek out wa mi no put iin, an riip wa mi no plaant?

Why then did you not deposit my money in the bank, so that at my coming I might have collected it with interest?’|So wa mek yu neva put mi moni iina di bangk? Da wie de wen mi kom bak, mi wuda did av di moni wid inchres.’

“Then he said to those who stood by, ‘Take the pound from him and give it to him who has ten pounds.’|“Den im se tu im sorvant dem we weehn a tan op de, ‘Tek di moni fram im an gi it tu di wan we av ten.’
“They said to him, ‘Master, he has ten pounds.’|“ ‘Bot Sa,’ dem se, ‘im av ten aredi!’

“ ‘I tell you that to everyone who has will be given. But from him who has not, even what he has will be taken away from him.|“Di King se, ‘Mi a tel unu, di wan we av, wi get muo, bot di wan we no av notn, iivn wa im av dem a-go tek we fram im.

But as for those enemies of mine, who would not let me reign over them, bring them here and slay them before me.’ ”|Yu si dem we iet mi an neva did waahn mi ton dem king, kyari dem kom kil dem rait ya-so.’ ”
When He had said this, He went before them, ascending up to Jerusalem. |Afta Jiizas se dis, im gwaan mek im wie go a Jeruusilem.

When He came near to Bethphage and Bethany, at the mountain called the Mount of Olives, He sent two of His disciples|Siem taim im a kom nier Betpiej an Betani a Mount Aliv, im sen tuu a im falara dem, an se tu dem se

saying, “Go over into the village opposite you, where, as you enter, you will find a colt tied, on which no one has ever yet sat. Untie it and bring it here.|“Go a di dischrik infronta unu, an wen unu go iin, unu wi fain wan yong dangki we nobadi neva raid yet tai op de. Luus it an kyari it kom.
If anyone asks you, ‘Why are you untying it?’ you shall say to him, ‘Because the Lord has need of it.’ ”|Ef nobadi aks unu se, ‘Wa mek unu a luus it?’ tel dem se, ‘Di Laad waahn it.’ ”
Those who were sent went and found it just as He had told them.
column2: Dem go an fain evriting jos laik ou Jiizas tel dem.

column1: As they were untying the colt, its owners said to them, “Why are you untying the colt?”|Wen dem a luus di dangki, di uona aks dem se, “Wa unu a luus di dangki fa?”
They said, “The Lord has need of it.”|Dem ansa, “Di Laad waahn it.”
They brought it to Jesus. And they threw their garments on the colt, and they set Jesus on it. |Dem kyari it go gi Jiizas, put som a dem jakit pan di dangki bak an put Jiizas fi sidong pan di dangki.
As He went, they spread their clothes in the street.|Siem taim Jiizas a raid go, piipl a pred dem jakit pan di ruod wich paat im a paas.

When He was coming near the descent of the Mount of Olives, the whole crowd of the disciples began to rejoice and praise God with loud voices for all the mighty works that they had seen|Wen im riich wich paat di ruod staat go dong Mount Aliv, di uol a im falara dem we did a waak baka im did staat fi get api an priez Gad loud loud fi aal a di mirikl dem we dem si.

saying:‘Blessed is the King who comes in the name of the Lord!’Peace in heaven and glory in the highest!”|Dem se,“Gad bles di King we im sen kom!Im sen im wid fi'im powa!”“Mek piis ruul iina evn,an priez tu Gad we liv iina evn.”
Some of the Pharisees from the crowd said to Him, “Teacher, rebuke Your disciples.”|Som Farisii iina di kroud se tu Jiizas, “Tiicha, tel yu falara dem fi kiba dem mout an no du dat.”
He answered them, “I tell you, if these should be silent, the stones would immediately cry out.”|Jiizas se, “Ef dem no mek no naiz, dem stuon ya — dem wi baal out.”
When He came near, He beheld the city and wept over it,|Afta Jiizas kech nier Jeruusilem an si di siti, im staat baal fi dem

saying, “If you, even you, had known even today what things would bring you peace! But now they are hidden from your eyes.|an a se, “Jeruusilem, Ef yu di onggl nuo tide wa wuda gi yu piis — bot di chuut aid fram yu.

For the days will come upon you when your enemies will build an embankment around you and surround you, and press you in on every side.|Di die a-go kom wen yu enimi dem a-go bil op wan waal roun yu so dem kyan atak yu fram evri said an yu kyaahn get we.

They will dash you, and your children within you, to the ground. They will not leave one stone upon another within you, because you did not know the time of your visitation.”|Dem a-go mash yu dong tu di grong an kil aaf aal a yu piipl dem. Dem no iivn a-go lef no rakstuon pan tap a wan aneda, kaaz di taim wen Gad kom fi tan wid yu, yu neva nuo.”
Then He entered the temple and began to drive out those who sold and bought in it
column2: Jiizas go iina di yaad we Gad ous de an staat jraiv out di piipl we did iin de a sel.

column1: saying to them, “It is written, ‘My house will be a house of prayer,’  but you have made it ‘a den of thieves.’”|Im se tu dem se, “It rait dong iina Gad wod se, ‘Fi mi ous a-go bi wan ous we piipl kom fi prie,’ bot unu ton it iina ‘wan aid out fi tiif.’ ””

He taught daily in the temple. But the chief priests, the scribes, and the leaders of the people tried to kill Him.|Evridie Jiizas tiich iina di yaad we Gad ous de. Di ed priis, di Laa tiicha dem an di liida dem tu, did a set fi kil im.
Yet they could not find a way to do it, for all the people were very attentive to hear Him.|Bot dem kudn fain no wie fi du it, kaaz evribadi did a lisn evri wod we Jiizas se.

One day, as He taught the people in the temple and preached the gospel, the chief priests and the scribes with the elders came up to Him|Wan die, Jiizas did a tiich di piipl dem an a priich di Gud Nyuuz iina di yaad we Gad ous de. Di ed priis dem, di Laa tiicha dem an di elda dem kom tu im.

and said to Him, “Tell us, by what authority are You doing these things? Who is he who gave You this authority?”|Dem aks Jiizas se, “Tel wi sopm, wa rait yu av fi a du dem sitn ya? An a uu gi yu da rait de?”
He answered them, “I will also ask you one thing. Answer Me:|Jiizas se tu dem se, “Mi a-go aks unu wan kwestiyan an mi waahn unu fi ansa mi.
Was the baptism of John from heaven or from men?”|Wen Jan did a baptaiz piipl, a uu did sen im fi dwi'it, Gad ar man?”

They debated with themselves, saying, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ He will say, ‘Why then did you not believe him?’|Dem taak mongks demself se, “Ef wi se, ‘Gad,’ im a-go aks wi, ‘a wa mek unu neva biliiv Jan?’

But if we say, ‘From men,’ all the people will stone us, for they are persuaded that John was a prophet.”|Bot ef wi se, ‘a man,’ di uol a di piipl dem a-go stuon wi, kaaz dem tingk se Jan a did wan prafit.”
So they answered that they did not know where it was from.|So dem ansa se, “Wi no nuo a uu sen im.”
Jesus said to them, “Neither will I tell you by what authority I do these things.”|So Jiizas se tu dem se, “Den mi naa go tel unu uu gi mi di rait fi du dem sitn ya niida.”

He began to tell the people this parable: “A man planted a vineyard, and leased it to vinedressers, and went to a distant country for a long time.|Den Jiizas tel di piipl dem da tuori ya: “Yu did av wan man we did plaant op wan griep faam, rent it tu som faama an go we fi wan lang taim.

At harvest time he sent a servant to the vinedressers so they might give him some fruit of the vineyard. But the vinedressers beat him and sent him away empty-handed.|Wen a did taim fi riip di fuud, im sen wan sorvant go a di tenant dem fi get fi'im shier. Dem biit im op an sen im we wid notn.

Again, he sent another servant. But they beat him also, and treated him shamefully, and sent him away empty-handed.|Im sen wan neda sorvant, dem biit im op tu, shiem im, an sen im we wid im tuu lang an dem.
Once again, he sent a third. And they wounded him also and drove himout.|Im stil sen wan neda sorvant — dat mek chrii. Dem biit im op an chuo im out.

“Then the owner of the vineyard said, ‘What shall I do? I will send my beloved son. Perhaps they will respect him when they see him.’|“Di uona fi di gyaadn se, ‘Wa mi fi du? Mi a-go sen mi bwai pikni, we mi lov. Dem mait-a av rispek fi'im.’

“But when the vinedressers saw him, they debated among themselves, saying, ‘This is the heir. Come, let us kill him, that the inheritance may be ours.’ |“Wen di tenant dem si di pikni, dem se tu dem wan aneda, ‘A da wan ya a-go get evriting wen im faada ded. Mek wi kil im, so a wi get it.’
So they drove him out of the vineyard and killed him.“What then will the owner of the vineyard do to them?
column2: Dem chuo im outa di gyaadn an kil im.”Jiizas aks di piipl dem se “So wa unu tingk di uona a di gyaadn a-go du tu dem?

column1: He will come and kill these vinedressers and will give the vineyard to others.”When they heard this, they said, “May it not be so!”|Im a-go kom an kil aaf di tenant dem an tek di faam gi ada piipl.”Wen di piipl dem ier dis, dem se, “Wi uop se dis wi neva apm!”

He looked at them and said, “What then is this that is written:‘The stone which the builders rejectedhas become the cornerstone’?|Jiizas luk chriet iina dem yai an aks dem, “Wa unu tingk it miin wen it rait dong se:“ ‘Di rakstuon di bilda fling we,a it a uol op di bildin nou’?
Whoever falls on that stone will be broken. But he on whom it falls will be crushed to powder.”|Evribadi we jrap pan da stuon ya a-go brok op iina piisiz, an uu it jrap pan a-go mash op bad.”

The chief priests and the scribes tried to lay their hands on Him that same hour, but they feared the people. For they perceived that He had told this parable against them.|Di Laa tiicha dem an di ed priis dem luk fi wan wie fi lak op Jiizas siem taim, kaaz dem nuo se a dem im did a chat bout. Bot dem did fried a di piipl.

They watched Him and sent out spies who pretended to be righteous men, that they might seize Him in His words to hand Him over to the power and authority of the governor.|Den dem wach Jiizas laik wan aak. Dem aiya som man iina siikrit fi gwaan laik se dem anis, so ef im se notn rang dem kuda kech im an ton im uova tu di Ruoman govana we inchaaj a di ieriya.

So they asked Him, “Teacher, we know that You speak and teach rightly. And You do not show partiality, but You truly teach the way of God.|Di infaama dem kwestiyan Jiizas, “Tiicha, wi nuo se yu taak an tiich wa rait. Yu no paashal, bot yu tiich di rait sitn bout wa Gad waahn.
Is it lawful for us to pay taxes to Caesar, or not?”|It rait fi wi pie taks tu Siiza, di Ruoman ruula, ar wi no fi pie notn?”
He perceived their craftiness and said to them, “Why do you test Me?|Jiizas si chuu dem chrik an se tu dem se
Show Me a denarius. Whose image and inscription does it have?”They said, “Caesar’s.”| “Shuo mi wan moni. Uufa picha an niem de pan it?” “Siiza,” dem ansa bak.
He said to them, “Then render to Caesar what is Caesar’s, and to God what is God’s.”|So Jiizas se tu dem se, “Den gi Siiza wa a fi'im, an gi Gad wa a fi'im.”

They could not catch Him in His words before the people. And they marveled at His answer and were silent.|Dem kudn chrap im wid wa im se infronta di piipl dem. An dem so fraitn fi ier ou im ansa, dem kudn se a wod.
Some of the Sadducees, who deny that there is any resurrection, came to Him and asked Him|Som a di Sadyusii dem kom a Jiizas (dem neva biliiv se wen yu ded yu kyan kom bak alaiv).

“Teacher, Moses wrote for us that if a man’s brother dies, having a wife but no children, then this man should take the wife and raise up children for his brother.|Dem aks se, “Tiicha, Muoziz rait se ef wan man breda ded an lef wan waif bot no pikni, di man fi marid im breda waif an av pikni wid ar fi'im breda.
Now there were seven brothers. The first took a wife and died childless.
column2: Wan fambili did av sevn breda. Di fos wan marid wan uman an ded bot neva av no pikni.

column1: The second took her as wife, and he died childless.|Di neks breda marid ar an ded tu.
And then the third took her, and in like manner, all seven died and left no children.|Wan neda wan marid ar an ded, aal sevn a dem marid ar, ded, an no lef ar wid no pikni.
Last of all, the woman died also.|Den di uman ded tu.
Therefore in the resurrection whose wife will she be? For the seven had her as a wife.”|Sins di sevn a dem marid tu ar, wen a taim fi dem kom bak alaiv a uufa waif shi a-go bi?”
Jesus answered them, “The sons of this age marry and are given in marriage.|Jiizas se, “Di piipl iina da taim ya a marid

But those who are counted worthy to attain that age, and the resurrection from the dead, neither marry nor are given in marriage.|bot di piipl dem we fit fi liv iina di taim wen ded piipl kom bak alaiv, dem naa go get marid.

For they cannot die any more, for they are equal to the angels and are the sons of God, being sons of the resurrection. |An dem naa go kyan ded agen, kaaz dem komiin laik ienjel an dem a Gad pikni. Dem a Gad pikni kaaz Gad mek dem kom bak alaiv.

Now, at the bush, even Moses pointed out that the dead are raised when he called the Lord ‘the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.’|Iivn Muoziz shuo se di ded a-go kom bak alaiv. Wen di bush did a bon, im kaal di Laad ‘Iebriyam Gad, Aizak Gad an Jiekob Gad.’
For He is not the God of the dead, but of the living. For to Him all live.”|Im a no Gad fi di ded, bot fi uu a liv; kaaz fi Gad, di uol a dem alaiv.”
Some of the scribes said, “Teacher, You have spoken well.”|Som a di Laa tiicha dem se, “Chuu wod Tiicha, gud ansa!”
After that they dared not ask Him any question at all.
column2: Fram dat dem fried fi aks Jiizas no muo kwestiyan.

column1: Then Jesus said to them, “How do they say that Christ is David’s Son? |Jiizas aks, “Wa mek dem se di Krais a Dievid pikni?
David himself says in the Book of Psalms,‘The Lord said to my Lord,“Sit at My right hand,|A Dievid siem wan se iina di Buk a Saamz:“ ‘Di Laad tel fi mi Laad se:“Sidong a mi rait an
until I make Your enemiesYour footstool.”’
column2: til mi tek dem we iet yu ton dem iina stuul fi yu put yu fut pan.” ’

column1: David therefore calls Him ‘Lord.’ How is He then his Son?”
column2: Dievid kaal im ‘Laad.’ So ou im fi bi Dievid pikni?”

column1: Then as all the people heard, He said to His disciples, |Evribadi did a lisn wen Jiizas se tu im speshal falara dem

“Beware of the scribes who desire to walk in long robes and who love greetings in the marketplaces and the prominent seats in the synagogues and the seats of honor at banquets|“Main yuself wid dem Laa tiicha ya. Dem laik waak roun iina lang jakit, an lov wen piipl gi dem speshal oudi iina di maakit an fi get di bes siit dem iina di Juu dem choch wen big dina a kip.
who devour widows’ houses and for a pretense make long prayers. They will receive greater condemnation.”
column2: Dem rab out di uman we ozban ded an prie lang prieya fi shuo aaf. A dem a-go get ponish di muos.”

column1: He looked up and saw the rich putting their gifts in the treasury.
column2: Jiizas luk op an si di rich piipl dem a put iin fi dem sitn we dem a gi fi aafrin iina di aafrin baks.

column1: He also saw a poor widow putting in two mites|Im si wan puo uman, we ozban ded, a put iin tuu sent tu.
and He said, “Truly I tell you, this poor widow has put in more than all of them.|Jiizas se, “Mi a tel unu di chuut, da puo uman, we ozban ded, put iin muo dan di res a dem.

For all these out of their abundance have put in their gifts for God. But she out of her poverty has put in all the living she had.”|Aal a dem ya piipl gi fi dem aafrin outa wa dem av fi spier, bot da uman ya, iivn duo shi puo, shi gi evriting we shi av.”

As some spoke of how the temple was adorned with beautiful stones and gifts, He said|Som piipl did a chat bout di priti stuon dem we priti op Gad ous an di iip a sitn dem we piipl gi Gad fi aafrin, wen Jiizas se

“As for these things which you see, the days will come when not one stone shall be left on another that will not be thrown down.”|“Di taim a-go kom wen no iivn wan stuon a-go lef pan tap a wan aneda. Aal a dem a-go get lik dong.”

They asked Him, “Teacher, when will these things be, and what will be the sign when this is about to happen?”|Dem aks Jiizas se, “Tiicha, a wen aal dem sitn ya a-go apm? Wa kain-a sain wi fi luk fa fi shuo se dem suun apm?”

He said, “Beware lest you be deceived. For many will come in My name, saying, ‘I am He,’ and ‘The time has drawn near.’ Therefore do not go after them.|Jiizas se tu dem se, “Wach out, no mek nobadi fuul unu op. Kaaz uol iip a piipl a-go kom yuuz op yuuz op mi niem, an a se, ‘Mi a Krais, a mi Gad sen fi siev piipl’ an, ‘di taim fi Jiizas kom bak de nier.’ No fala dem.

When you hear of wars and commotions, do not be afraid. For these things must first take place, but the end will not be at hand.”|Enitaim unu ier bout waar an se govament get ton uova, no fraitn. Dem sitn ya afi gwaan fos, bot di en naa go kom siem taim.”

Then He said to them, “Nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom.|Den Jiizas tel dem se: “Wan set a piipl a-go waar gens wan neks set a piipl, an wan kindom a-go fait gens wan neda kindom.

Great earthquakes will occur in various places, and there will be famines and pestilence. And there will be terrors and great signs from heaven.|Big ortkwiek a-go kom, an aal bout, fuud a-go shaat an aal kain-a siknis a-go kil aaf piipl; som torbl sitn a-go kom fram evn an piipl a-go fried.

“But before all these things, they will seize you and persecute you, delivering you up to the synagogues and prisons, and you will be brought before kings and governors for My name’s sake.|“Bifuo aal dem sitn ya apm, dem a-go grab unu an diil wid unu bad. Dem wi tek unu an an unu uova tu di liida dem fi di Juu dem choch an sen unu go a prizn. Dem a-go kyari unu go infronta king an liida, kaaz unu fala mi.
It will turn out as a testimony for you.
column2: Dis a-go gi unu chaans fi tel dem di gud nyuuz.

column1: Therefore resolve in your hearts beforehand not to practice your defense.
column2: No fret bout ou unu a-go ansa.

column1: For I will give you a mouth and wisdom, which all your opponents will be able to neither refute nor resist.|Mi wi gi unu di wod dem so unu wi nuo ou fi ansa, so non a unu enimi dem kyaahn tan op gens unu ar se unu rang.
You will be betrayed by parents and brothers and relatives and friends. And they will put some of you to death. |Aal mada, faada, breda, fambili an fren, a-go sel unu out, an dem a-go kil som a unu.
You will be hated by all men for My name’s sake,|Evribada a-go iet unu siek-a unu fala mi.
but not a hair of your head shall perish.
column2: Bot dem kyaahn toch no iivn wan schraan a ier pan unu ed.

column1: In your endurance you will gain your souls.|Uu tan op chrang fi mi no mata wa, wi siev dem laif.
“When you see Jerusalem surrounded by armies, then you know that its desolation has drawn near. |“Wen taim unu si se suoja soroun Jeruusilem, unu fi nuo se dischrokshan de nier.

Then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains, and let those who are in the city depart, and let not those who are in the country enter it.|Evribadi iina Judiya fi ron go op iina di mountn dem. Uu iina di siti fi kom out an uu de iina di konchri no fi kom a di toun.
For these are the days of vengeance, that all things which are written may be fulfilled.|Di taim wa rait dong wen Gad a-go ponish im piipl wuda don de ya.

But woe to those who are pregnant and to those who nurse in those days! For there will be great distress in the land and wrath upon this people.|Wat a sitn iina dem taim de fi uman we av biebi iina beli an fi mada we av yong biebi! Piipl a-go sofa bad bad iina di lan, an Gad a-go ponish dem piipl ya.

They will fall by the edge of the sword and will be led away captive to all nations. And Jerusalem will be trampled on by the Gentiles until the times of the Gentiles are fulfilled.|Dem enimi a-go yuuz suod kil aaf som a dem, an tek som a dem ton prizna a farin. Di piipl dem we a no Juu a-go ruul uova Jeruusilem an mek dem sofa til fi dem taim don.

“There will be signs in the sun and the moon and the stars; and on the earth distress of nations, with perplexity, the sea and the waves roaring;|“Sain a-go de iina di son, di muun an di staar dem. Pan di ort, di piipl dem we a no Juu a-go twis an ton an no nuo wa fi du wen dem ier di sii a ruor.

men fainting from fear and expectation of what is coming on the inhabited earth. For the powers of heaven will be shaken. |Piipl a-go kech dem fried an kin uova kaaz dem a-go wanda wa a-go apm tu di worl, kaaz evriting we de iina di skai a-go get shiek outa dem plies.
Then they will see the Son of Man coming in a cloud with power and great glory.
column2: Den dem a-go si di Man we Gad Pik a kom iina wan kloud an im a-go av powa an wan brait brait lait a shain roun im.

column1: When these things begin to happen, look up and lift up your heads, for your redemption is drawing near.”|Wen dem sitn de staat fi apm, tan op chriet an uol op unu ed kaaz di taim fi frii unu suun kom.”
He told them this parable: “Look at the fig tree, and all the trees.|Jiizas tel dem dis tu, “Luk pan di fig chrii an aal di ada chrii dem.
When they are sprouting leaves already, you see and know for yourselves that summer is now near. |Enitaim dem staat gruo liif, unu nuo se soma suun kom.
So in like manner, when you see these things happening, you know that the kingdom of God is near.|So enitaim unu si se aal dem sitn de a apm, unu nuo se Gad kindom suun kom.
“Truly, I tell you, this generation will not pass away until all these things are fulfilled.|“Mi a tel unu dis an a chuu mi a taak, di piipl dem fram da taim ya naa ded til aal a dem sitn ya apm.
Heaven and earth will pass away, but My words will not pass away.|Evn an ort naa go de bout fi eva, bot fi mi wod a-go laas fi eva.

“Take heed to yourselves, lest your hearts become burdened by excessiveness and drunkenness and anxieties of life, and that Day comes on you unexpectedly.|“Wach out an no spen di uol a unu taim a nyam an jringk, an a fret bout laif, ar da die de a-go kriip op an kech unu laik wan chrap.
For as a snare it will come on all those who dwell on the face of the whole earth.
column2: It a-go kom pan aal we a liv pan di ort.

column1: Therefore watch always and pray that you may be counted worthy to escape all these things that will happen and to stand before the Son of Man.”|Aalwiez a wach, prie se unu wi kyan get we fram aal a wa a-go apm, an prie se unu kyan tan op infronta di Man we Gad Pik.”

Each day He was teaching in the temple, and each night He went out and stayed on the mountain called the Mount of Olives. |Evridie Jiizas tiich iina di yaad we Gad ous de, an a nait taim im go op a Mount Aliv.
And all the people came early in the morning to hear Him in the temple.
column2: Aal a di piipl dem get op orli a maanin taim fi kom lisn Jiizas a Gad ous.

column1: Now the Feast of Unleavened Bread, which is called the Passover, drew near.|Di alidie we piipl nyam bred widout yiis an we did niem Paasuova, did suun kom

And the chief priests and scribes were seeking how to kill Jesus, for they feared the people.|an di ed priis an di Laa tiicha dem, did a chrai fain wan wie fi get rid a Jiizas anda di kwaiyat, kaaz dem did fried a di piipl dem.
Then Satan entered into Judas, called Iscariot, who was one of the twelve.|Den Sietan go iina Juudas, we dem kaal Iskyariyat, im a did wan a Jiizas Twelv apasl dem.

He went and discussed with the chief priests and captains how he might betray Him to them. |So, Juudas go a di ed priis an di tap man dem we gyaad Gad ous fi taak bout ou im kuda sel out Jiizas an gi im uova tu dem.
They were glad and agreed to give him money.
column2: Dem glad so til an pramis fi pie im.

column1: He fully consented and searched for an opportunity to betray Him to them apart from the crowds.|Juudas mek baagin wid dem, an im wiet fi di chaans, wen di kroud no de de fi gi Jiizas uova tu dem.

Then the Day of Unleavened Bread came, when the Passover lamb must be killed.|Nou di alidie wen piipl nyam bred widout yiis did kom. Da taim de piipl did afi bon sakrifais wid di biebi shiip dem we get pik fi di Paasuova alidie.
He sent Peter and John, saying, “Go and prepare the Passover for us to eat it.”|Jiizas se tu Piita an Jan se, “Go luk bout di Paasuova fuud fi wi nyam.”
They said to Him, “Where will You have us prepare it?”|Dem aks Jiizas se, “Wich paat yu waahn wi fi go luk bout it?”

He said to them, “Now, as you enter the city, a man carrying a pitcher of water will meet you there. Follow him into the house which he enters|Jiizas ansa dem se, “Az unu go iina di toun, wan man we a kyari wan jog a waata wi miit unu. Fala im go a di ous we im a go

and say to the owner of the house, ‘The Teacher says to you, “Where is the guest room where I may eat the Passover with My disciples?” ’|an tel di uona se, ‘Di tiicha se fi aks yu se: We di ges ruum de, we mi kyan nyam di Paasuova fuud wid mi speshal falara dem?’
He will show you a large furnished upper room. Prepare there.”
column2: Im a-go kyari unu opstiez go iina wan big ruum we set op aredi. A de-so unu fi fiks op di fuud.”

column1: They went and found it as He had told them. So they prepared the Passover.
column2: Dem lef an fain evriting jos laik ou Jiizas did tel dem. An dem luk bout di Paasuova fuud.

column1: When the hour had come, He and the twelve apostles with Him sat down. |Wen di taim kom fi dem nyam it, Jiizas an im apasl dem sidong a di tiebl.

And He said to them, “I have earnestly desired to eat this Passover with you before I suffer. |Jiizas se tu dem se, “Unu no nuo ou mi did wel waahn da taim ya kom so mi kuda nyam da Paasuova fuud ya wid unu bifuo mi sofa.
For I tell you, I will never eat it again until it is fulfilled in the kingdom of God.”|Mi naa go nyam it agen til mi riich iina Gad kindom.”
And He took the cup and gave thanks and said, “Take this and divide it among yourselves.|Jiizas tek op di kop an gi Gad tangks. Den im se tu dem se, “Tek dis an shier it op mongks unu wan aneda.
For I tell you, I will not drink of the fruit of the vine until the kingdom of God comes.”|Mi a tel unu dis mi naa go jringk wain agen, til Gad kindom kom.”

Then He took the bread, and when He had given thanks, He broke it and gave it to them, saying, “This is My body which is given for you. Do this in remembrance of Me.”|Jiizas tek op di bred, gi Gad tangks an brok it op gi dem, an se, “Dis a mi badi, we mi a gi op fi unu. Unu fi du dis fi memba mi.”

In like manner, He took the cup after supper, saying, “This cup is the new covenant in My blood which is shed for you.|A siem so wen dem don nyam, im tek di kop an se, “Da wain ya a di nyuu pramis wa Gad mek wid mi blod we a-go puor out fi unu.
But see the hand of him who betrays Me is with Me at the table. |Bot luk, di man we a-go sel mi out de rait ya-so a di tiebl wid wi.
Indeed, the Son of Man goes as it has been determined. But woe to that man by whom He is betrayed!” |It don disaid aredi ou di Man we Gad Pik a-go ded bot chobl fi di wan we sel im out.”
They began to inquire among themselves which of them it was who would do this.|Dem staat fi aks dem wan aneda, a wich wan a dem wuda du dat.
There was also rivalry among them concerning which of them was to be counted the greatest.
column2: Den di apasl dem staat kos bout wich wan a dem av di tap pozishan iina di gruup.

column1: He said to them, “The kings of the Gentiles exercise lordship over them, and those who exercise authority over them are called benefactors. |Jiizas tel dem se, “Di piipl dem we a no Juu, fi dem king dem baas dem op fi mek dem du we dem waahn dem fi du; an dem de we iina powa se dem a ‘di wan we elp di piipl.’

But you are not so. Instead, let him who is greatest among you be as the younger, and he who rules as he who serves. |Bot unu no fi galang laka dem. Di wan we av di tap tap pozishan fi gwaan laik di wan we de a di batam, an di liida fi gwaan laik di sorvant.

For who is greater: he who sits at the table, or he who serves? Is it not he who sits at the table? But I am among you as He who serves.|Tel mi sopm, uu aiya dan uu? Di wan we sidong a di tiebl ar di wan we a sorv? No di wan a di tiebl? Bot mi de ya mongks unu a sorv.
You are those who have continued with Me in My trials.
column2: Unu tan wid mi wen mi did a go chuu mi chobl dem.

column1: And I appoint to you a kingdom as My Father has appointed one to Me,|An nou mi a mek unu king, jos laik ou fi mi Faada mek mi king,

so that you may eat and drink at My table in My kingdom, and sit on thrones judging the twelve tribes of Israel.”|so unu kyan nyam an jringk a mi tiebl iina mi kindom, sidong pan chuon, an joj Izrel twelv chraib dem.
Then the Lord said, “Simon, Simon, listen! Satan has demanded to have you to sift you as wheat.|“Saiman, Saiman, Sietan aks fi sib unu chuu chriena laik flowa.

But I have prayed for you that your faith may not fail. And when you have repented, strengthen your brothers.”|Bot mi prie fi yu, Saiman, so yu no tap biliiv. An wen yu chos iina mi muo agen, elp yu breda dem fi chos iina mi tu.”
He said to Him, “Lord, I am ready to go with You to prison and to death.”|Bot Saiman se “Laad, mi redi fi go wid yu a prizn an fi iivn ded wid yu tu.”
He said, “I tell you, Peter, before the rooster crows today, you will deny three times that you know Me.”|Jiizas se tu Saiman se, “Piita, bifuo di ruusta kruo, yu wi se chrii taim se yu no nuo mi.”

Then He said to them, “When I sent you without purse or bag or sandals, did you lack anything?”They said, “Nothing.”|Den Jiizas aks dem se, “Di taim mi did sen unu widout moni, an tel unu no fi pak no bag ar kyari no ada slipaz, unu did shaat a notn?”Dem ansa Jiizas se, “Nuo wi neehn shaat a notn.”

He said to them, “But now, let him who has a purse take it and also a bag. And let him who has no sword sell his garment and buy one. |Jiizas tel dem se, “Nou, ef unu av moni kyari it wid unu, ef unu av wan bag kyari it tu, an ef unu naa no suod, sel unu jakit an bai wan.

For I tell you, what is written must yet be accomplished in Me, ‘And He was numbered with the transgressors.’  Indeed, what is written concerning Me has a fulfillment.”|Mi a tel unu, it rait dong se, ‘An dem kaal out im niem wid aal di kriminal dem.’ Wa rait dong, afi apm. A mi it a taak bout an it a gwaan rait ya nou an it a-go don suun suun.”
They said, “Lord, look, here are two swords.”He said to them, “It is enough.”|Im falara dem tel im se, “Laad, si tuu suod ya.”“Dat wi du,” Jiizas se.
According to His custom, He came out and went to the Mount of Olives. And His disciples followed Him. |Jiizas go a Mount Aliv jos laik im aalwiez du, an im speshal falara dem did go wid im.
When He came there, He said to them, “Pray that you may not fall into temptation.” |Wen im riich de, Jiizas se tu dem se, “Prie se unu no fies notn we wi kaaz unu fi sin.”
He withdrew from them about a stone’s throw, and He knelt down and prayed|Jiizas go wan said, no tuu faar fram dem an niil dong an prie
“Father, if You are willing, remove this cup from Me. Nevertheless not My will, but Yours, be done.”|“Faada, ef yu waahn fi dwi'it, tek da kop ya fram mi, bot ef a no dat yu waahn, aarait den.”
An angel from heaven appeared to Him, strengthening Him. |Wan ienjel fram evn kom tu Jiizas an mek im chrang.

And being in anguish, He prayed more earnestly. And His sweat became like great drops of blood falling down to the ground.|Jiizas did a sofa an dat mek im prie aada. Im swet komiin laik blod a jrap a grong.

When He rose from prayer and had come to His disciples, He found them sleeping from sorrow. |Jiizas get op fram wich paat im did a prie. Im go bak tu im speshal falara dem, onggl fi si se dem a sliip. Dem did taiyad out kaaz aal a di sitn dem we Jiizas did tel dem, dem did a tek it wel aad.
He said to them, “Why do you sleep? Rise and pray, lest you fall into temptation.”|Jiizas aks dem, “Wa mek unu a sliip? Git op an prie man so unu no fies notn we wi kaaz unu fi sin.”

While He was yet speaking, a crowd came. And he who was called Judas, one of the twelve, was leading them. He drew near to Jesus to kiss Him.|Wen Jiizas did stil a taak, aal av a sodn wan kroud kom dong. Wan a Jiizas twelv apasl dem, di wan we niem Juudas, did a liid dem. Im go fi kis Jiizas,
But Jesus said to him, “Judas, do you betray the Son of Man with a kiss?”|bot Jiizas aks im se, “Juudas, yu a go yuuz wan kis an sel out di Man we Gad Pik?”
When those who were around Him saw what would follow, they said, “Lord, shall we strike with the sword?” |Jiizas speshal falara dem si wa a go apm an se, “Laad, wi fi tek wi suod an fait dem?”
And one of them struck the servant of the high priest and cut off his right ear.|Nou, di liida fi di priis dem sorvant did de de an wan a Jiizas falara dem tek im suod chap aaf im rait iez.
But Jesus said, “This is enough!” And He touched his ear and healed him.|Jiizas se, “Unu tap it!” Den Jiizas toch di man iez an fiks it bak.

Then Jesus said to the chief priests, and captains of the temple guard, and the elders who had come for Him, “Have you come out with swords and clubs as against a rebel?|Jiizas se tu di ed priis dem, di man dem we inchaaj a di gyaad dem fi Gad ous an di elda dem we kom tu im, “A kom unu kom wid suod an big tik fi ares mi laik mi a oul tiif an mordara?

Daily, while I was with you in the temple, you did not lay hands on Me. But this is your hour, and the power of darkness!”|Evridie mi de a Gad ous wid unu, an unu neva ares mi. Bot dis a fu'unu taim an di taim wen di wan we ruul uova daaknis a wok.”

Then they arrested Him, and led Him away, and brought Him into the high priest’s house. Peter followed at a distance.|Dem grab Jiizas, an tek im we go a di liida fi di priis dem ous. Piita fala dem bot no tuu kluos.

But when they had kindled a fire in the middle of the courtyard and sat down together, Peter sat among them.|Den dem bil wan faiya iina di migl a di kuotyaad an sidong tugeda, an Piita sidong wid dem.

Then a servant girl saw him as he sat near the fire, and gazed at him, and said, “This man was with Him.”|Wan sorvant gyal si Piita a sidong iina di faiya-lait. Shi luk pan im gud an se, “Da man ya did de mongks im tu!”
But he denied Him, saying, “Woman, I do not know Him.”|Bot Piita se a lai shi a tel. “Uman, mi no nuo im,” Piita se.

A little later someone else saw him and said, “You also are one of them.”Peter said, “Man, I am not!”|Likl lieta sumadi els si Piita an se, “Yu a wan a dem.” Piita se, “Luk ya man! Mi a no wan a dem!”

About an hour later another man firmly declared, “Certainly, this man also was with Him, for he is a Galilean.”|Bout wan owa afta dat wan neda wan taak out chrang se, “Mi shuor se da man ya a wan a im speshal falara dem, kaaz im kom fram Gyalalii tu.”

Peter said, “Man, I do not know what you are saying.” Immediately, while he was yet speaking, the rooster crowed. |Piita se, “Man, mi no nuo we yu a chat bout!” Siem taim, Piita a chat, di ruusta kruo.

The Lord turned and looked at Peter. Then Peter remembered the word of the Lord, how He had told him, “Before the rooster crows, you will deny Me three times.”|Di Laad ton an luk chriet pan Piita an im memba wa di Laad did se tu im, “Bifuo di ruusta kruo, yu wi se yu no nuo mi chrii taim.”
And Peter went outside and wept bitterly.|Piita go outa duor an baal, an baal, an baal so til.
The men who guarded Jesus mocked Him and whipped Him.
column2: Di man dem we did a gyaad Jiizas staat laaf aafa im an biit im op.

column1: When they had blindfolded Him, they struck Him on the face and asked Him, “Prophesy! Who struck You?”|Dem put klaat uova im yai an se, “So yu se yu a prafit, so tel wi, uu lik yu?”
And many other things they blasphemously spoke against Him.
column2: An dem se aal saat a ada torbl sitn gens im.

column1: When day came, the assembly of the elders of the people, both the chief priests and scribes, came together and led Him away to their council, saying|Wen maanin kom, di gruup we mek op a di ed priis an di Laa tiicha dem, miit op, an gi aada fi Jiizas kom bifuo dem.
“Are You the Christ? Tell us!”He said to them, “If I tell you, you will not believe.|Dem se, “Ef yu a di Krais, tel wi.”Jiizas ansa, “Ef mi tel unu, unu naa go biliiv mi
And if I also question you, you will not answer Me or release Me. |an ef mi aks unu, unu naa go ansa.
From now on the Son of Man will be seated at the right hand of the power of God.”|Fram nou aan, di Man we Gad Pik a-go sidong a di rait an a Gad, we powaful.”
They all said, “Are You then the Son of God?”He said to them, “You truly say that I am.”|Aal a dem aks im se, “So yu a Gad pikni?”Jiizas ansa an se, “A yu se so.”
Then they said, “What further testimony do we need? We have heard it from His own mouth.”|Den dem se, “Wa wi waahn muo witnis fa? Wi ier it kom outa fi'im uona mout.”
Then the whole assembly rose and led Him to Pilate.
column2: Den di uol a dem get op an tek Jiizas kyari im go a Pailat.

column1: And they began to accuse Him, saying, “We found this Man perverting our nation, and forbidding us to pay taxes to Caesar, and saying that He Himself is Christ a King.”|Dem staat tel bier lai pan Jiizas se, “Wi kech da man ya a chrai fi mek di piipl dem go gens di govament. Im waahn wi fi tap pie taks tu Siiza di Ruoman ruula an kliem se im a Krais — bout im a King.”
So Pilate asked Him, “Are You the King of the Jews?”He answered, “You truly say so.”|Pailat aks Jiizas se, “Yu a di Juu dem king?”Jiizas ansa im se, “A yu se so.”
Then Pilate said to the chief priests and to the people, “I find no fault in this Man.”|Den Pailat tel di ed priis dem an di kroud se, “Mi no fain no riizn fi chaaj da man ya.”

But they insisted, saying, “He stirs up the people, teaching throughout all Judea, beginning from Galilee to here.”|Bot dem stil a push, “Im rail op di piipl aal uova Judiya wid we im tiich. Im staat iina Gyalalii an kom aal di wie op ya-so wid it.”
When Pilate heard of Galilee, he asked whether the Man was a Galilean. |Afta Pailat ier dis, im aks ef di man kom fram Gyalalii.

When he learned that He belonged to Herod’s jurisdiction, he sent Him to Herod, who was also in Jerusalem at that time.|Az im fain out se Jiizas de anda Erad ruul, im sen Jiizas go a Erad, we did iina Jeruusilem dem taim de.

When Herod saw Jesus, he greatly rejoiced, for he had desired to see Him for a long time, because he had heard many things of Him, and he was hoping to see some miracle performed by Him.|Wen Erad si Jiizas, im api so til, kaaz fi wan lang taim im did waahn si im. Fram wa Erad ier bout Jiizas, Erad uop fi si Jiizas wok som kain-a mirikl.
He questioned Him with many words, but He gave no answer. |Im aks im uol iip a kwestiyan, bot Jiizas no ansa non a dem.
The chief priests and the scribes stood by, vehemently accusing Him.|Di ed priis dem an di Laa tiicha dem did tan op de an a kos se Jiizas du uol iip a bad sitn.

Then Herod with his soldiers despised Him, and mocked Him, and dressed Him in a fine robe, and sent Him back to Pilate. |Afta Erad an im suoja dem laaf aafa Jiizas an tek im mek preke, dem jres im op iina wan priti ruob, an sen im go baka Pailat.

On the same day Pilate and Herod became friends with each other, having previously been at enmity with each other.|Da die de Erad an Pailat ton big fren, kaaz bifuo da taim ya dem did iet dem wan aneda.
Pilate called together the chief priests and the rulers and the people,|Pailat kaal op di ed priis dem, liida dem an piipl dem

and said to them, “You have brought this Man to me as one who incites the people. And truly, I, having examined Him before you, have found no fault in this Man concerning those things of which you accuse Him. |an se, “Unu kyari da man ya kom tu mi an kliem se im a kaaz di piipl dem fi go gens di govament. Mi kwestiyan im infronta unu an si se im no du non a di sitn dem we unu a bliem im fa.

No, neither has Herod, for he sent him back to us. Look, nothing worthy of death has been done by Him. |Erad neva si we im du notn rang niida, kaaz im sen im bak tu mi. Unu kyaahn si se da man ya no du notn fi wi kil im.
I will therefore chastise Him and release Him.”|So, mi wi jos ponish im an let im go.”
For he was obligated to release one man to them at the feast.
column2: Kaa im did afi lego wan a di man dem gi dem ina di fares.

column1: But they all cried out at once saying, “Take this Man away and release Barabbas to us!” |Di uol kroud shout out, “Kil Jiizas! Gi wi Barabas!”
This man had been thrown in prison for an insurrection in the city and for murder.|(Barabas did iina prizn kaaz im liid piipl fi fait gens dem ruula, an im did kil piipl.)
Therefore Pilate spoke to them again, desiring to release Jesus. |Pailat did waahn let go Jiizas, so im taak tu di kroud agen.
But they cried out, “Crucify Him! Crucify Him!”|Bot dem kip aan a shout, “Yes! Kil im pan di kraas! Kil im pan di kraas!”

He said to them a third time, “Why, what evil has He done? I have found in Him no cause worthy of death. I will therefore chastise Him and release Him.”|Pailat aks dem agen — dat mek chrii taim. “Wa mek? Wa im du rang? Mi no fain se im du notn rang fi wi kil im. Mi wi ponish im an den let im go.”

But they insisted with loud voices, asking that He be crucified. And the voices of these men and of the chief priests prevailed. |Bot dem no tap shout out se dem fi kil Jiizas pan di kraas; dem shout so til dem win.
So Pilate gave the sentence as they demanded.|So, Pailat gi dem wa dem waahn.

He released to them the man who was thrown in prison for insurrection and murder, whom they asked for. But he sentenced Jesus according to their will.|Im let go di man we dem did aks fa. Di wan we did mek piipl fait gens dem ruula an we did morda piipl. An Pailat gi dem Jiizas fi du wa dem waahn du wid im.

As they led Him away, they seized Simon of Cyrene, who was coming from the country, and they laid the cross on him to carry it behind Jesus.|Siem taim dem a liid we Jiizas, dem grab Saiman we kom fram Sairiin, im did a kom fram konchri. Dem fuos im fi waak baka Jiizas an kyari di kraas.
A large number of people followed Him, including women who mourned and lamented Him.|Uol iip a piipl fala baka Jiizas, an di uman dem ban dem beli an a baal fi im.

Jesus turned to them, saying, “Daughters of Jerusalem, weep not for Me, but weep for yourselves and for your children.|Jiizas ton roun an se tu dem se, “Uman fram Jeruusilem, no baal fi mi. Baal fi unuself an fi unu pikni dem.

Listen, the days are coming when they will say, ‘Blessed are the barren, who never bore and never nursed!’|Kaaz di die a-go kom wen piipl gweehn se, ‘Uman we kyaahn av pikni, uman we neva av pikni an uman we neva nors no biebi — a dem bles!’
Thenthey will begin to say to the mountains, ‘Fall on us,’and to the hills, ‘Cover us.’|Den“ ‘dem wi tel di mountn dem, “Jrap pan wi!”an dem wi tel di il dem, “Kova wi op!” ’
For if men do these things when the tree is green, what will happen when it is dry?”|Ef piipl du dem sitn ya wen chrii griin, wa a-go apm wen it jrai op?”
Two different men, who were criminals, also were led with Him to be killed.|Dem kyari tuu kriminal fi go kil dem siem taim wid Jiizas.

When they came to the place which is called The Skull, there they crucified Him and the criminals, one on the right and one on the left.|Wen dem kech a di plies we niem Di Skol, dem niel op Jiizas an di kriminal dem pan di kraas dem, wan pan di rait-an-said a Jiizas an di ada wan pan im lef.

Jesus said, “Father, forgive them, for they know not what they do.” And they divided His clothes by casting lots.|Jiizas se, “Faada Gad paadn dem, dem no nuo wa dem a du.” Den dem chuo dais fi shier op Jiizas kluoz.

The people stood by watching. But the rulers with them scoffed, saying, “He saved others. Let Him save Himself if He is the Christ, the Chosen One of God.”|Di piipl dem we tan op wan said a wach an di ruula dem did a skaan Jiizas. Dem se, “Im siev ada piipl, mek im siev imself, ef im a riili Krais.”
And the soldiers also mocked Him, coming to Him and offering Him sour wine|Di suoja dem kom a tek Jiizas ton preke a gi'im sowa wain
saying, “If You are the King of the Jews, save Yourself.”|an a se, “Ef yu a di King fi di Juu dem, siev yuself.”
An inscription was written over Him in letters of Greek and Latin and Hebrew:|Wan sain did iivn uova Jiizas ed we se, “DIS A DI JUU DEM KING.”

One of the criminals who were hanged blasphemed Him, saying, “If You are the Christ, save Yourself and us!”|Wan a di kriminal dem we did eng op saida Jiizas, staat kos im se, “Yu a no di Krais? Siev yuself an siev wi tu!”
But the other rebuked him, saying, “Do you not fear God, seeing you are under the same sentence? |Bot di ada kriminal set im chriet an se, “Yu no fried a Gad, laik ou yu a ded laik im?

And we indeed, justly. For we are receiving the due reward of our deeds. But this Man has done nothing amiss.”|Dem a ponish di tuu a wi fi wa wi du, so wi a get wa wi dizorv. Bot da man ya no du notn rang.”
Then he said to Jesus, “Lord, remember me when You come into Your kingdom.”|Den im se, “Jiizas, memba mi wen yu kom iina yu kindom.”
Jesus said to him, “Truly, I tell you, today you will be with Me in Paradise.”|Jiizas se tu im se, “Mi a tel yu di chuut, tide yu a-go de wich paat mi de iina Paradais.”
It was now about the sixth hour, and darkness came over all the land until the ninth hour|Nou a did bout migl die an di uol plies ton daak daak rait bak til bout chrii aklak.
while the sun was darkened. And the veil of the temple was torn in the middle.|Afta it get daak, an di big tik kortn iina Gad ous plit iina tuu
