And Jesus cried out with a loud voice, “Father, into Your hands I commit My spirit.” Having said this, He gave up the spirit.|Jiizas baal out loud, “Faada, mi put mi spirit iina yu an.” Az Jiizas se dis so, im bluo im bret wan laas taim an ded.

When the centurion saw what had happened, he glorified God and said, “Certainly, this was a righteous Man.”|Wen di ed suoja fi di aami, si wa apm, im priez Gad an se, “Fi riil da man ya mos a wan gud man we neva du notn rang!”
All the crowds who came together to that sight, witnessing what occurred, struck their chests and ­returned.|Wen aal a di piipl we gyada si wa apm, dem go we wid pien iina dem aat.

But all those who knew Him and the women accompanying Him from Galilee stood at a distance, seeing these things.|Bot di piipl dem we nuo Jiizas, an di uman dem we fala im fram Gyalalii, tan wan said a wach.

Now there was a man named Joseph, a member of the Council, who was a good and just man.|Yu did av wan man we niem Juozif, we bilang tu di gruup we mek op a di ed priis an di Laa tiicha dem. Im did a wan gud an anis man

He had not consented to their counsel and deed. He was from Arimathea, a city of the Jews, and he himself was also waiting for the kingdom of God. |an neva did go fi wa di res a kounsl memba dem did mek op dem main fi du. Juozif did kom fram Arimatiya, wan toun iina Judiya an im did a wiet fi Gad kindom.
This man went to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus.
column2: Im go a Pailat go aks im fi Jiizas badi.

column1: Then he took Him down, and wrapped Him in linen, and placed Him in a hewn tomb, where no one had ever been buried. |Im tek dong Jiizas badi an rap it op iina linin klaat an put im iina wan tuum we dig iina wan rak we nobadi neva beri iina yet.
It was the Day of Preparation, and the Sabbath was drawing near.|A did di die wen di Juu dem wuda get tingz redi fi di Sabat we did bout fi staat.

The women who came with Him from Galilee followed, and saw the tomb and how His body was placed.|Di uman dem we kom wid Jiizas fram Gyalalii fala Juozif an si di tuum an ou Jiizas badi did pudong iina it.

Then they returned and prepared spices and ointments. On the Sabbath they rested according to the commandment.|Den dem go a dem yaad go luk bout spais an porfyuum. Bot pan di Sabat, dem res kaaz a dat Muoziz Laa se dem fi du.

Now on the first day of the week, very early in the morning, they, and certain other women with them, came to the tomb bringing the spices they had prepared. |Orli, orli Sonde maanin, di uman dem go a di tuum wid di spais we dem did luk bout.
They found the stone rolled away from the tomb.
column2: Dem fain di stuon ruol we fram fronta di tuum.

column1: But when they entered, they did not find the body of the Lord Jesus.|Dem go iin de, bot dem no fain Jiizas badi.
While they were greatly perplexed concerning this, suddenly two men stood by them in shining garments.|Siem taim wen dem a wanda wa apm, tuu man iina kluoz we brait laik lait kom tan op saida dem.

As they were afraid and bowed their faces to the ground, they said to them, “Why do you seek the living among the dead?|Di uman dem aat riich a dem mout an dem eng dong dem ed kaaz dem so fraitn. Bot di man dem se tu dem se, “Wa mek unu a luk fi di wan we a liv mongks di wan dem we ded?
He is not here, but has risen! Remember how He spoke to you while He was still in Galilee|Im no de ya, im kom bak alaiv! Memba wa im tel unu wen im did mongks unu iina Gyalalii.

saying, ‘The Son of Man must be delivered into the hands of sinful men, and be crucified, and on the third day rise again.’ ”|‘Dem a-go tek di Man we Gad Pik gi wikid piipl we a-go kil im pan di kraas bot im a-go kom bak alaiv chrii die lieta.’ ”
Then they remembered His words.
column2: Den dem memba we Jiizas did tel dem.

column1: And they returned from the tomb and reported all these things to the eleven and to all the rest. |Afta dem kom bak fram di tuum, di uman dem tel Jiizas ilevn apasl an aal di res a falara dem wa did apm.

It was Mary Magdalene and Joanna, Mary the mother of James, and other women with them, who told these things to the apostles. |Nou a did Mieri Magdaliin, Juowana, Mieri we a Jiemz mada, an di ada uman dem, uu did tel di apasl dem wa dem si.
But their words seemed like fables to them, and they did not believe them. |Bot di apasl dem neva biliiv di uman dem, kaaz we dem did a se soun laik fuulinish.

But Peter rose and ran to the tomb. Stooping down, he saw the linen clothes lying by themselves. He departed, wondering in himself what had happened.|Piita get op an ron go a di tuum. Im ben dong, bot di onggl ting im si a di piis a linin klaat wan, so im go we, a wanda wa apm.

Now that same day two of them were going to a village called Emmaus, about seven miles from Jerusalem.|Di siem die tuu a Jiizas falara dem did a go a wan dischrik niem Emiyos, bout sevn mail fram Jeruusilem.
They were talking with each other about all these things that had happened.
column2: Dem did a chat bout evriting wa apm.

column1: While they communed and reasoned together, Jesus Himself drew near and went with them.|Siem taim dem a chat an aal a aagyu wid dem wan aneda, Jiizas kom op an staat waak wid dem
But their eyes were kept from recognizing Him.
column2: bot dem kudn pik op se a im.

column1: He said to them, “What kind of communication are you sharing with one another while you are walking and are sad?”|Jiizas aks dem se, “Wa unu a taak bout?” Dem tap waak, dem fies sad.

One of them, named Cleopas, answered Him, “Are You the only foreigner in Jerusalem who does not know what has happened there in these days?”|Di wan niem Kliiyopas, se tu Jiizas se, “Yu mosi di onggl sumadi we kom iina Jeruusilem we no nuo bout di sitn dem wa apm dem laas kopl a die ya.”

He said to them, “What things?”They said to Him, “Concerning Jesus of Nazareth, who was a prophet, powerful in deed and word before God and all the people|Jiizas aks dem, “Wa kain-a sitn?”Dem se tu im se, “Bout Jiizas fram Nazaret. Im did se an du som powaful sitn yu si we shuo aal di piipl dem se im a wan a Gad prafit dem.
and how our chief priests and rulers handed Him over to be sentenced to death and crucified Him.|Di ed priis dem an wi ruula dem an im uova so dem kuda kil im, an dem niel im op pan wan kraas.

But we were hoping that it was He who was to redeem Israel. Moreover, today is the third day since these things happened. |Bot wi did a uop se im a did di wan fi frii Izrel. Nou a chrii die sins aal a dis apm.
Even some women from among us, who arrived early at the tomb, surprised us. |Bot no onggl dat, som a di uman dem we fala Jiizas laik wi, shak wi. Dem go a di tuum orli dis maanin

When they did not find His body, they returned saying that they had even seen a vision of angels, who said that He was alive. |bot dem no fain di badi. Dem kom tel wi se, dem si ienjel we tel dem se Jiizas alaiv.
Then some of those who were with us went to the tomb and found it just as the women had said. But they did not see Him.”
column2: Som a di man dem go an fain di tuum uopm an emti jos laik ou di uman dem did se.”

column1: He said to them, “O fools! And slow of heart to believe what the prophets have spoken!|Jiizas se tu dem se, “Ou unu fuul-fuul so, unu aat so tof unu no waahn fi biliiv aal a wa di prafit dem se!
Was it not necessary for the Christ to suffer these things and to enter His glory?”
column2: Unu no nuo se di Krais afi sofa dem sitn de bifuo Gad tek im op iina evn an ana im?”

column1: And beginning with Moses and all the Prophets, He explained to them the things concerning Himself in all the Scriptures.|Jiizas eksplien tu dem aal a di sitn dem we did rait dong bout im, fram wa Muoziz did se tu aal a wa di ada prafit dem did se.
They drew near the village where they were traveling, and He seemed to be going farther. |Wen dem riich nier di dischrik we dem a go, Jiizas gwaan laik se im did a go forda.

But they urged Him, saying, “Stay with us. For it is nearly evening and the day is far spent.” So He went in to stay with them.|Bot dem beg im, “Luk di die aalmuos don, an nait a kom, so tan wid wi.” So Jiizas tan wid dem.
As He sat at supper with them, He took the bread, blessed it and broke it, and gave it to them.|Im sidong a di tiebl wid dem. Jiizas tek bred, gi tangks, brok it an gi dem.
Then their eyes were opened, and they recognized Him. And He vanished out of their sight. |Den dem pik op se Jiizas a di man dem did a taak tu bot siem taim — braps, im disapier!

They said to each other, “Did not our hearts burn within us while He talked to us on the way and while He opened the Scriptures to us?”|Dem aks dem wan aneda, “Wi neehn fiil sitn a bobl iina wi aat wen im did a chat wid wi pan di ruod an a eksplien tu wi wa Gad wod se?”
They rose up and returned to Jerusalem at once. And they found the eleven and those who were with them assembled together
column2: Dem get op an go baka Jeruusilem siem taim. An dem fain di Ilevn an dem we did gyada wid dem

column1: saying, “The Lord has risen indeed, and has appeared to Simon!”|an se, “A chuu! Di Laad kom bak alaiv an mek Saiman si'im.”

Then they reported what had happened on the way, and how He was recognized by them in the breaking of the bread.|Den dem tel dem wa apm pan di ruod tu Emiyos, an ou a wen Jiizas a brok di bred gi dem, dem pik op se a im.
As they were saying this, Jesus Himself stood among them and said to them, “Peace be unto you.”|Siem taim dem a chat bout aal a dis, Jiizas imself tan op wid dem an se, “Piis!”
They were terrified and frightened, and supposed that they saw a spirit. |Im falara dem fraitn, kaaz dem tingk dem a si wan dopi.
He said to them, “Why are you troubled, and why do doubts arise in your hearts?|Jiizas se tu dem se, “Wa mek unu fraitn? Wa mek unu no biliiv?

See My hands and My feet, that it is I Myself. Feel Me and see. For a spirit does not have flesh and bones as you see that I have.”|Luk pan mi an an fut dem. A mi! Toch mi an si. Dopi no av skin an buon, laik mi.”
When He said this, He showed them His hands and His feet.|Afta Jiizas se dis, im shuo dem im an an im fut dem.
And while they yet disbelieved for joy and wondered, He said to them, “Do you have any food here?” |Dem glad so til dem kudn biliiv we dem a si. So im aks dem se, “Unu na'av notn fi iit?”
They gave Him a piece of broiled fish and some honeycomb.
column2: Dem gi im piis a ruos fish

column1: And He took it and ate it before them.
column2: an Jiizas tek it an nyam it infronta dem.

column1: He said to them, “These are the words which I spoke to you while I was still with you, that all things must be fulfilled which were written in the Law of Moses and in the Prophets and in the Psalms concerning Me.”|Jiizas tel dem se, “Wen mi did de mongks unu, mi tel unu bout aal a dem sitn ya. Mi tel unu se evriting we rait bout mi iina Muoziz Laa, wa di prafit dem se an we iina di Saamz tu did afi kom chuu.”
Then He opened their minds to understand the Scriptures.
column2: Den Jiizas uopm op dem main an mek dem andastan we Gad wod se.

column1: He said to them, “Thus it is written, and accordingly it was necessary for the Christ to suffer and to rise from the dead the third day|Jiizas tel dem se, “Dis a wa rait dong: Krais a-go sofa, im a-go ded an kom bak afta chrii die

and that repentance and remission of sins should be preached in His name to all nations, beginning at Jerusalem. |an iina fi mi niem unu fi priich an tel di piipl dem we a no Juu fi ton tu Gad an get paadn fi we dem du rang. Staat rait ya-so iina Jeruusilem.
You are witnesses of these things.
column2: Unu mos tel piipl bout evriting we apm.

column1: And look, I am sending the promise of My Father upon you. But wait in the city of Jerusalem until you are clothed with power from on high.”|An luk, mi a sen unu we mi Faada pramis fi gi unu, bot tan iina di siti til unu get powa fram evn.”
Then He led them out as far as Bethany, and He lifted up His hands and blessed them. |Jiizas liid dem go outa Betani. Im lif op im an an bles dem.
While He blessed them, He parted from them and was carried up into heaven.|Siem taim Jiizas a bles dem, im get tek op iina evn an im lef dem.
Then they worshipped Him, and returned to Jerusalem with great joy|Afta di falara dem worship Jiizas dem go baka Jeruusilem api so til.
and were continually in the temple, praising and blessing God. Amen.|An dem eva de a Gad ous a priez im.
The book of the genealogy of Jesus Christ, the Son of David, the son of Abraham:|Dis a di lis a Krais Jiizas faada faada dem go bak. Jiizas did kom fram Dievid an Iebriyam fambili.

Abraham was the father of Isaac,Isaac the father of Jacob,and Jacob the father of Judah and his brothers.|Iebriyam did a Aizak faada,an Aizak did a Jiekob faada,Jiekob pikni dem a did Juuda an Juuda breda dem.

Judah was the father of Perez and Zerah by Tamar,Perez the father of Hezron,and Hezron the father of Ram.|Juuda a did Perez an Ziira faada (Tamaar did a dem mada),Perez pikni a did Ezranan Ezran pikni a did Ram.
Ram was the father of Amminadab,Amminadab the father of Nahshon,and Nahshon the father of Salmon.|Aminadab a did Ram pikni,an fi Aminadab pikni a did Nieshan,an Saman a did fi Nieshan pikni.

Salmon was the father of Boaz by Rahab,Boaz the father of Obed by Ruth,and Obed the father of Jesse.|Saman a did Buowaz faada (im mada a did Rieyab),Buowaz a did Uobed faada (Ruut a did im mada).Jesi a did Uobed pikni

Jesse was the father of David the king.David the king was the father of Solomon, by her who had been the wife of Uriah.|an Jesi did a king Dievid faada.Dievid did a Salaman faada (a Yuuraiya waif did a fi im mada)
Solomon was the father of Rehoboam,Rehoboam the father of Abijah,and Abijah the father of Asa.|Salaman pikni a did Reyobuom,Reyobuom a did Abija faada,an Abija a did Asa faada.
Asa was the father of Jehoshaphat,Jehoshaphat the father of Joram,and Joram the father of Uzziah.|Asa pikni a did Jeyoshafat,Jeyoshafat a did fi Juoram faada,Juoram pikni did a Uziya.
Uzziah was the father of Jotham,Jotham the father of Ahaz,and Ahaz the father of Hezekiah.|Uziya pikni a did Juotam,Juotam a did fi Ayaz faada,an Ayaz did a Ezikaiya faada.
Hezekiah was the father of Manasseh,Manasseh the father of Amon,and Amon the father of Josiah.|Ezikaiya a did fi Manase faadaan Manase a did Ieman faada.Ieman pikni did a Josaiya
Josiah was the father of Jeconiah and his brothers about the time they were exiled to Babylon.
column2: an Josaiya a did fi Jekonaiya faada plos im did av som ada bwai pikni. Dis a roun di taim wen di Babiluoniyan dem did tek we di Izrel piipl dem an fuos dem fi go wok a Babilan.

column1: And after they were brought to Babylon,Jeconiah was the father of Shealtiel,and Shealtiel the father of Zerubbabel.|Afta da taim de:Jekonaiya did av Shiyaltiyel,an Shiyaltiyel did get Zeruubabel.
Zerubbabel was the father of Abiud,Abiud the father of Eliakim,and Eliakim the father of Azor.|Zeruubabel pikni did a Abiyud,Abiyud a did Elaiyakim faada,an Elaiyakim did a fi Azuor faada.
Azor was the father of Zadok,Zadok the father of Akim,and Akim the father of Eliud.|Azuor pikni did a Zadak,Zadak pikni did a Akim,an Akim did a Eliyud faada.
Eliud was the father of Eleazar,Eleazar the father of Matthan,and Matthan the father of Jacob.|Eliyud did a Elieza faada,Elieza pikni did a Matan,Matan a did fi Jiekob faada
And Jacob was the father of Joseph, the husband of Mary, of whom was born Jesus, who is called Christ.|an Jiekob did a Juozif faada, dat a Mieri ozban — Mieri we did av Jiizas — dat a Krais Jiizas.

So all the generations from Abraham to David are fourteen generations, from David until the exile to Babylon are fourteen generations, and from the exile in Babylon to Christ are fourteen generations.|So fram Iebriyam go chriet baka Dievid, a fuotiin jinarieshan Jiizas did av. An fram Dievid taim op tu wen dem did tek we di Izrel piipl dem an fuos dem fi go wok a Babilan a fuotiin jinarieshan Jiizas did av de-so tu, an fram da taim de tu wen Krais Jiizas baan, a fuotiin jinarieshan dat tu.

Now the birth of Jesus Christ happened this way: After His mother Mary was engaged to Joseph, before they came together, she was found with child by the Holy Spirit. |Dis a ou Jiizas Krais did baan. Im mada Mieri did jos ingiej fi marid Juozif, dem neehn kom liv tugeda yet laik ozban an waif, bot dem fain se shi did av biebi iina beli, an a di Uoli Spirit did put di biebi de.

Then Joseph her husband, being a just man and not willing to make her a public example, had in mind to divorce her privately.|Nou Juozif, di man we shi did ingiej fi marid, im a did wan gud man we aalwiez du wa rait. Im neehn waahn shiem ar infronta evribadi, so im mek op im main fi lef ar anda di kwaiyat.

But while he thought on these things, the angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream saying, “Joseph, son of David, do not be afraid to take Mary as your wife, for He who is conceived in her is of the Holy Spirit. |Jos wen Juozif did a tingk fi du dat, wach ya nou — wan a di Laad ienjel dem no jriim im. Di ienjel se, “Juozif, Dievid pikni, no fried fi tek Mieri an marid ar, kaa di pikni we iina ar beli, a di Uoli Spirit put im de.
She will bear a Son, and you shall call His name JESUS, for He will save His people from their sins.|Shi a-go av wan bwai pikni an yu fi kaal im Jiizas, kaa im a-go siev im piipl dem fram dem sin.
Now all this occurred to fulfill what the Lord had spoken through the prophet, saying|Nou aal a dem sitn ya apm fi mek wa di Laad did tel di prafit fi se kom chuu.

“A virgin shall be with child, and will bear a Son, and they shall call His name Immanuel,” which is interpreted, “God with us.”|Di prafit did se, “Lisn op! Di uman we neehn sliip wid no man a-go get biebi — a wan bwai shi a-go av, an dem a-go kaal im Imanyuwel.” Da niem de miin, “Gad de ya wid wi.”

Then Joseph, being awakened from sleep, did as the angel of the Lord had commanded him, and remained with his wife|Den wen Juozif wiek op, im du jos wa di ienjel tel im fi du. Im tek Mieri an go marid ar.
and did not know her until she had given birth to her firstborn Son. And he called His name JESUS.
column2: Bot im neehn go a bed wid ar til shi av ar pikni — wan bwai biebi; an im niem im Jiizas.

column1: Now after Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judea in the days of Herod the king, wise men came from the east to Jerusalem|Jiizas did baan iina Betliyem, wan toun iina Judiya. Dem taim de, a Erad did a king iina Judiya. Nou, iina dem siem taim de, som waiz man fram di Iis said did kom a Jeruusilem an a aks

saying, “Where is He who was born King of the Jews? For we have seen His star in the east and have come to worship Him.|“We di pikni de we baan di ada die, we fi kom ton king fi di Juu piipl dem? Wi si im staar iina di Iis, we shuo se im baan, an wi kom fi shuo im nof rispek.”
When Herod the king heard these things, he was troubled, and all Jerusalem with him.|Nou wen King Erad ier dis ya, dis bada bada im ed, an it bada uol iip a piipl iina Jeruusilem tu.

And when he had gathered all the chief priests and scribes of the people together, he inquired of them where Christ should be born. |Erad kaal evribadi tugeda iina wan miitn — aal a di ed priis an di man dem we tiich Muoziz Laa — an im aks dem a wich paat di Krais — di king we Gad pramis, fi baan.
They told him, “In Bethlehem of Judea, for this is what the prophet wrote:|Dem ansa se, “Iina Betliyem, kaaz a dat di prafit did rait dong:

‘And you, Bethlehem, in the land of Judah,are no longer least among the princes of Judah;for out of you shall come a Governor,who will shepherd My people Israel.’”|‘An yu Betliyem we iina Judiya,wen yu luk pan aal di ada toun dem we a liid, yu no wot no les dan dem — yu op de mongks di tap-a-tap toun dem;kaaz a fram outa yu wan liida a-go komwe a-go protek an liid mi piipl dem we iina Izrel.’”

Then Herod, when he had privately called the wise men, carefully inquired of them what time the star appeared.|Den Erad sen kaal di waiz man dem fi kom kom chek im anda di kwaiyat, an fain out fram dem a wa taim dem did si di staar.

And he sent them to Bethlehem and said, “Go and search diligently for the young Child, and when you have found Him, bring me word again, so that I may come and worship Him also.”|Im sen dem go a Betliyem an se, “Gwaan go luk fi di pikni. Luk gud gud, an wen unu fain im, kom tel mi, so mi kyan go shuo im nof rispek tu.”

When they heard the king, they departed. And the star which they saw in the east went before them until it came and stood over where the young Child was. |Afta dem don lisn di king, dem lef go we. Az dem a go bout dem bizniz so, no di sed staar we dem did si iina di Iis said kom bak agen! It galang infronta dem til it riich wich paat di pikni did de, an a uova de-so it tap.
When they saw the star, they rejoiced with great excitement. |Wen dem did si di staar agen dem glad-bag bos!

And when they came into the house, they saw the young Child with Mary, His mother, and fell down and worshipped Him. And when they had opened their treasures, they presented gifts to Him: gold, frankincense, and myrrh.|Dem kom iina di ous an si di pikni wid im mada, Mieri, an dem go dong pan dem nii an priez im. Dem tek out di prezent we dem did bring, an gi di pikni — guol, frangkinsens an mor.

But being warned in a dream that they should not return to Herod, they returned to their own country by another route.|Nou, chuu Gad did don waan dem aaf, an tel dem iina wan jriim se dem no fi go baka Erad, dem tek wan neda wie go baka dem konchri.

Now when they departed, the angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph in a dream, saying, “Arise, take the young Child and His mother, and escape to Egypt, and stay there until I bring you word. For Herod will seek the young Child to kill Him.”|Afta dem go we, wan a di Laad ienjel dem jriim Juozif an se, “Git op! Tek di pikni an im mada an ron we go a Iijip. Tan de til mi tel yu, kaa Erad a-go luk fi di pikni fi kil im.”
When he rose, he took the young Child and His mother by night, and departed into Egypt|So im get op, tek op di pikni an im mada an lef go a Iijip iina di nait.

and remained there until the death of Herod, to fulfill what the Lord had spoken through the prophet, “Out of Egypt I have called My Son.|An im tan de til Erad ded. Da wie de, wa di Laad did yuuz di prafit fi se did kom chuu. Im did se, “A outa Iijip mi kaal mi bwai pikni.”

Then Herod, when he saw that he had been tricked by the wise men, was utterly furious and sent forth and killed all the male children who were in Bethlehem and the surrounding region, from two years old and under, based on the time which he had diligently inquired of the wise men. |Wen Erad si se di waiz man dem did chrik im op, im beks til im nieli bos! Im sen out aada, an kil aaf aal a di bwai pikni dem we did iina Betliyem an di plies dem we did de nier Betliyem, aal a di pikni dem we did a tuu ier uol an anda tuu. Im du dat azkaadn tu di taim wen di waiz man did se dem si di staar.
Then was fulfilled what was spoken by Jeremiah the prophet:|Den wa di Laad did yuuz di prafit Jerimaiya fi se, kom chuu:

“In Ramah a voice was heard,grieving and weeping and great mourning,Rachel weeping for her children,and she would not be comforted,because they are no more.”|Piipl did ier sumadi a baal iina Raama,dem did a ala an baal loud loud,A Riechel did a baal fi ar pikni dem,an shi no waahn nobadi fi osh ar,kaa ar pikni dem gaan.”
But when Herod was dead, an angel of the Lord appeared in a dream to Joseph in Egypt|Afta Erad ded, luk ya no: wan a di Laad ienjel dem no jriim Juozif wen im de a Iijip.

saying, “Arise, take the young Child and His mother, and go into the land of Israel, for those who sought the young Child’s life are dead.|Di ienjel se, “Git op, tek di pikni an im mada an gwaan a Izrel, kaa uu did a chrai fi kil di pikni, dem ded.”
And he rose, took the young Child and His mother, and came into the land of Israel.|So Juozif get op, tek di pikni an im mada an go baka Izrel.

But when he heard that Archelaus reigned in Judea instead of his father Herod, he was afraid to go there. Nevertheless, being warned by God in a dream, he withdrew to the region of Galilee. |Bot wen im ier se a Erad pikni, Arkelos, tek uova an did a ruul Judiya, im kech im fried an neehn waahn go de-so. An kaa Gad did waan im aaf iina wan jriim, im lef go Gyalalii insted.

And he went and lived in a city called Nazareth, that what was spoken by the prophets might be fulfilled, “He shall be called a Nazarene.”|Im kom a wan toun niem Nazaret an tan de-so. A so kom wa di prafit dem did se kom chuu. Azkaadn tu di prafit dem, dem a-go kaal Jiizas wan Nazariin man.
In those days John the Baptist came, preaching in the wilderness of Judea|Nou iina dem die de, wan man niem Jan di Baptis kom iina di dezot paat a Judiya an staat priich Gad wod.
and saying, “Repent, for the kingdom of heaven is at hand.”|Im se, “Ton we fram unu sin, kaa di die suun kom wen evn a-go ruul uova di worl iina evri wie!”

For this is he who was spoken of by the prophet Isaiah, saying:“The voice of one crying in the wilderness:‘Prepare the way of the Lord;make His paths straight.’ ”|A im Aizaiya, di prafit, did a taak bout wen im se:“Sumadi a shout iina di dezot,‘Klier di wie fi di Laad kom chuu,mek di chrak we im fi waak pan chriet.’”

This same John had clothing made of camel’s hair, a leather belt around his waist, and his food was locusts and wild honey. |De siem bwai ya we niem Jan, im kluoz mek outa kyamil ier, im wier wahn leda belt rown im wies, an im iit luokos an wyl oni wen im onggri.
Then Jerusalem, and all Judea, and all the region around the Jordan went out to him|Piipl fram Jeruusilem, piipl fram di uol a Judiya an aal a di plies dem nier Jaadn riva did a go tu im

and were baptized by him in the Jordan, confessing their sins.|an wen dem taak infronta evribadi bout aal a di rang sitn we dem du, an ou dem sari se dem du dem sitn de, im baptaiz dem iina di Jaadn Riva.

But when he saw many of the Pharisees and Sadducees come to his baptism, he said to them, “O generation of vipers, who has warned you to escape from the wrath to come?|Bot wen im si uol iip a piipl fram di Farisii an Sadyusii gruup a kom fi im baptaiz dem, im se tu dem se, “Unu siniek pikni unu! A uu waan unu fi ron we fram di jojment we a kom?
Therefore, bear fruit worthy of repentance|Du di sitn dem we shuo se unu riili tap sin.

and do not think to say within yourselves, ‘We have Abraham as our father,’ for I say to you that God is able from these stones to raise up children for Abraham. |An no bada se dis an tingk se unu sief: ‘A Iebriyam a wi faada.’ Mek mi tel unu sopm, Gad kyan mek pikni fi Iebriyam outa dem rakstuon ya ef im waahn!

Even now the axe is put to the tree roots. Therefore, every tree which does not bear good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire.|Rait ya nou di aks de a di chrii ruut. An evri wan a di chrii dem we naa bier gud fruut a-go chap dong an bon op iina faiya.

“I indeed baptize you with water to repentance, but He who is coming after me is mightier than I, whose shoes I am not worthy to carry. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and with fire.|“Mi tek waata baptaiz unu fi shuo se unu ton we fram sin. Bot sumadi a kom we muo powaful dan mi. Mi no iivn gud inof fi aal kyari im slipaz. Im wi tek di Uoli Spirit an faiya, an baptaiz unu.

His fan is in His hand, and He will thoroughly clean His floor and gather His wheat into the granary, but He will burn up the chaff with unquenchable fire.|Im av im faak iina im an redi, an im a-go riek op di fluor wich paat di grien chrash out. Im a-go gyada op di grien an put it iina di bochri, bot im a-go bon op di chrash iina wan faiya we kyaahn out.”
Then Jesus came from Galilee to John at the Jordan to be baptized by him.
column2: Den Jiizas kom fram Gyalalii fi Jan baptaiz im iina Jaadn Riva.

column1: But John prohibited Him, saying, “I need to be baptized by You, and do You come to me?”|Bot Jan chrai fi tap im. Jan se, “A yu fi a baptaiz mi, an yu kom fi mi baptaiz yu?”

But Jesus answered him, “Let it be so now, for it is fitting for us to fulfill all righteousness.” Then he permitted Him.|So Jiizas ansa im se, “Rait ya nou, du wa mi aks yu fi du, da wie ya wi wi du aal we Gad waahn wi fi du!” So Jan se aarait den an du it.

And when Jesus was baptized, He came up immediately out of the water. And suddenly the heavens were opened to Him, and He saw the Spirit of God descending on Him like a dove. |Az Jiizas don baptaiz so, wen im a kom op outa di waata, aal av a sodn evn uopm op an im si Gad Spirit a kom dong pan im laka wan dov.
And a voice came from heaven, saying, “This is My beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.|An wan vais fram evn se, “Dis a mi wan dege-dege Bwai Pikni, mi lov im, an im mek mi aat glad.”
Then Jesus was led up into the wilderness by the Spirit to be tempted by the devil.
column2: Den di Uoli Spirit tek Jiizas iina di dezot so di devl kuda chrai fi mek im du rang.

column1: And He had fasted for forty days and forty nights, and then He was hungry.|Afta Jiizas neehn nyam notn fi uol-a faati die an faati nait, im beli did a baal tu ou im onggri.

And the tempter came to Him and said, “If You are the Son of God, command that these stones be turned into bread.”|A da taim de di devl, we eva a chrai mek piipl du rang, kom se tu im se, “Ef yu a Gad Bwai Pikni, tel dem rakstuon ya fi ton bred.”

But He answered, “It is written, ‘Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word that proceeds out of the mouth of God.’”|Jiizas ansa bak, “It rait dong iina Gad wod se, ‘Man no liv pan bred wan. Bot wi niid evri wod we kom outa Gad mout fi riili liv.”

Then the devil took Him up into the holy city, and set Him on the highest point of the temple|Afta dat, di devl tek Jiizas kyari im go Jeruusilem, di uoli siti. Im mek im go tan op pan di taalis paat a Gad ous

and said to Him, “If You are the Son of God, throw Yourself down. For it is written,‘He shall give His angels charge concerning you,’and‘In their hands they shall lift you up,lest at any time you dash your foot against a stone.’”|an im se tu im se, “Ef yu a Gad Bwai Pikni, jomp aafa ya-so. Kaaz it rait dong se,‘Gad wi tel im ienjel dem fi tek gud kier a yu,’an dat ‘Dem a-go kech yu,so yu no lik op yu fut pan rakstuon.’ ”
Jesus said to him, “It is also written, ‘You shall not tempt the Lord your God.’”|Jiizas ansa im se, “Bot it rait dong tu, se ‘No tes di Laad we a yu Gad.’”

Again, the devil took Him up on a very high mountain and showed Him all the kingdoms of the world and their grandeur|Den di devl kyari im go wan taal taal mountn an shuo im aal a di konchri dem iina di worl an shuo im ou dem luk gud an ting.

and said to Him, “All these things I will give You if You will fall down and worship me. ”|Den im se tu Jiizas se, “Mi wi gi yu aal a dem sitn ya ef yu go dong pan yu nii an se mi a Gad, an worship mi.”

Then Jesus said to him, “Get away from here, Satan! For it is written, ‘You shall worship the Lord your God, and Him only shall you serve.’  ”|Jiizas ansa bak, “Muuv an gu we fram mi Sietan! It rait dong se, ‘Yu fi worship di Laad we a yu Gad, an a im wan yu fi sorv.’”
Then the devil left Him, and immediately angels came and ministered to Him.|Afta dat di devl lef im, an ienjel kom kom luk aafa im.
Now when Jesus heard that John was put in prison, He left for Galilee.|Nou wen Jiizas ier se dem lak op Jan, im lef go a Gyalalii.

And leaving Nazareth, He came and lived in Capernaum, which is by the sea, in the regions of Zebulun and Naphtali,|Wen im de a Gyalalii, im lef fram Nazaret an kom liv a Kyaporniyom, a di sii-said, iina di Zebyulan an Naftali ieriya
that what was spoken by Isaiah the prophet might be fulfilled, saying:|da wie de, wa di prafit Aizaiya did se wuda kom chuu:

“The land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali,the way to the sea, beyond the Jordan,Galilee of the Gentiles:|“Zebyulan an Naftali,di plies dem we yu afi paas wen ya'a go a Gyalalii sii, di plies dem we de kraas fram Riva Jaadn,di siem Gyalalii we di piipl dem we a no Juu liv —

The people who sat in darknesssaw great light.And on those who sat in the land of the shadow of death,light has dawned.”|di piipl dem we sidong iina di daakGad shuo dem wan nyuu laif — a laka wan brait lait dem si.An aal uu weehn a liv, bot neehn riili a liv fi chuu,a laik nait don an di son a kom op, kaa Gad kom kom siev unu ya nou.”

From that time Jesus began to preach, saying, “Repent! For the kingdom of heaven is at hand.”|Fram da taim de, Jiizas staat priich da mesij ya: “Ton we fram unu sin an chienj unu wiez, kaa di die suun kom wen evn a-go ruul uova di worl iina evri wie!”

As Jesus walked beside the Sea of Galilee, He saw two brothers, Simon called Peter, and Andrew his brother, throwing a net into the sea, for they were fishermen.|Wen Jiizas did a waak saida Gyalalii sii, im si tuu breda: Saiman, we dem kaal Piita, an Saiman breda, Anju. Di tuu a dem did a fling out dem net iina di sii fi kech fish, kaa dem did a fishaman.
And He said to them, “Follow Me, and I will make you fishers of men.” |Jiizas se tu dem se, “Fala mi, an mi a-go mek unu ton fishaman we kech piipl.”
They immediately left their nets and followed Him.
column2: Dem lef dem net sed taim an fala Jiizas.

column1: And going on from there, He saw two other brothers, James the son of Zebedee and John his brother, in a boat with Zebedee their father, mending their nets, and He called them.|Wen im lef de-so an go forda out im si tuu ada breda: Jiemz an Jan — Zebidii bwai pikni dem. Di tuu a dem did de iina di buot wid dem faada a fiks op dem net. Jiizas kaal dem.
They immediately left the boat and their father and followed Him.|Dem no bada lie-lie, dem lef dem buot an dem faada sed taim, an fala Jiizas.

Jesus went throughout all Galilee teaching in their synagogues, preaching the gospel of the kingdom, and healing all kinds of sickness and all sorts of diseases among the people.|Da taim de, Jiizas did go aal uova Gyalalii a tiich iina di Juu dem choch. Im did a priich di gud nyuuz bout Gad kindom an a get piipl beta — piipl we av aal kain-a siknis an we sik iina aal saat a wie.

His fame went throughout all Syria. And they brought to Him all sick people who were taken with various diseases and tormented with pain, those who were possessed with demons, those who had seizures, and those who had paralysis, and He healed them. |So piipl staat ier bout im muo an muo aal roun Siriya, an dem kyari aal saat a piipl kom we sik iina dis ya wie ar dat de wie. Dem kyari piipl we pien op an a sofa fram aal saat a kraasiz, an aal uu did a sofa fram sitn we mek dem kech fits dem kyari dem kom tu. Dem kyari piipl we kyaahn waak, piipl we av diiman iina dem, an Jiizas get di uol a dem beta.

Great crowds followed Him from Galilee, the Decapolis, Jerusalem, Judea, and from beyond the Jordan.|Siek-a dat, wan bag a piipl staat fala baka im: piipl fram Gyalalii, di ten toun dem we dem kaal Dikyapolis, piipl fram Jeruusilem, Judiya an di plies dem we de paas Riva Jaadn.
Now seeing the crowds, He went up on a mountain. And when He sat down, His disciples came to Him.|Wen Jiizas si di kroud a piipl dem, im go op pan di mountn go sidong, an im falara dem kom tu im.
And He began speaking and taught them, saying:|Im uopm op im mout an staat fi tiich dem. A dis im se:

“Blessed are the poor in spirit,for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.|“Aal a unu we nuo se unu niid Gad iina evri wie, Gad bles unu,kaa di gud sitn dem we Gad gi wen im ruul piipl laif iina evri wie, a unu a-go get dem.
Blessed are those who mourn,for they shall be comforted.|Aal a uu a baal nou, Gad bles dem,kaaz di taim a-go kom wen Gad a-go osh dem an mek dem api agen.
Blessed are the meek,for they shall inherit the earth.|Aal a uu ombl demself, Gad bles dem,kaa yu si di ort, a dem piipl de a-go kom get it.

Blessed are those who hunger and thirst for righteousness,for they shall be filled.|Uu waahn du wa rait iina Gad yai so bad, dat it komiin laik se a ded dem a ded fi onggri an dem chuot jrai laik se dem no jringk waata ou lang, Gad bles unu,kaa unu a-go get unu beli ful
Blessed are the merciful,for they shall obtain mercy.|Unu we paadn piipl, Gad bles unu,kaaz im a-go paadn unu tu.
Blessed are the pure in heart,for they shall see God.|Aal a uu onggl waahn fi du di sitn dem we mek Gad api, Gad bles unu,kaaz wan die, wan die, unu a-go get fi si Gad.
Blessed are the peacemakers,for they shall be called the sons of God.|Gad bles aal a uu elp piipl fi liv iina piis,kaaz a piipl laik dem de Gad a-go kaal fi im pikni dem.

Blessed are those who are persecuted for righteousness’ sake,for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.|Di piipl dem we ada piipl mek sofa jos kaaz dem liv ou Gad waahn piipl fi liv, Gad bles unu,kaa di gud sitn dem we Gad gi wen im ron piipl laif ou im waahn ron it, a dem sitn de unu a-go get.

“Blessed are you when men revile you, and persecute you, and say all kinds of evil against you falsely for My sake. |Gad bles unu wen piipl shiem unu, wen dem mek unu sofa an wen dem se aal kain-a wikid sitn bout unu we no chuu — bot se it jos kaaz unu fala mi.

Rejoice and be very glad, because great is your reward in heaven, for in this manner they persecuted the prophets who were before you.|Mek unuself api wen dem sitn de apm tu unu; jomp op an dong wid jai iina unu aat, kaa nof gud sitn pudong iina evn fi unu. A siem so dem yuus tu chriit Gad prafit dem we did de ya bifuo unu kom.

“You are the salt of the earth. But if the salt loses its saltiness, how shall it be made salty? It is from then on good for nothing but to be thrown out and to be trampled underfoot by men.|“Unu a laik saalt fi di uol worl yu no. Bot ef di ties gaan outa di saalt, ou it fi ties bak laik saalt? It no wot notn nou. It fi jos dash we an tep tep op pan.
“You are the light of the world. A city that is set on a hill cannot be hidden.|“Unu a laik lait we di uol worl niid. Wan siti we de pan di il tap, it kyaahn aid.

Neither do men light a candle and put it under a basket, but on a candlestick. And it gives light to all who are in the house. |Nobadi no lait lamp an kova it op anda wan boul — nuo sa! Lamp pudong we it kyan lait op di uol ous.

Let your light so shine before men that they may see your good works and glorify your Father who is in heaven.|A siem so unu fi shain unu lait mek evribadi si, da wie de dem kyan si di gud sitn we unu du an big op unu Faada we de a evn.

“Do not think that I have come to abolish the Law or the Prophets. I have not come to abolish, but to fulfill.|“No bada tingk se mi kom ya fi mash op we di Laa tiich an we di prafit dem did tiich, an se dem sitn de naa no yuus agen. A no dat mi kom ya fa, az a matarafak, a kom mi kom ya fi mek di uol a dem kom chuu.

For truly I say to you, until heaven and earth pass away, not one dot or one mark will pass from the law until all be fulfilled.|Mek mi tel unu dis, an a chuu sitn mi a taak: evn an ort wuda afi mash op fos bifuo di liklis leta we mek op di Laa, ar iivn wan piis a wan a di leta dem, no miin notn agen. An bifuo dat kyan gwaan, evriting we fi apm, afi apm fos.

Whoever, therefore, breaks one of the least of these commandments and teaches others to do likewise shall be called the least in the kingdom of heaven. But whoever does and teaches them shall be called great in the kingdom of heaven. |So ier mi nou, enibadi we brok dong tu di liklis Laa, an go tiich piipl se di Laa no mata an mek dem brok it tu, outa aal di piipl dem we Gad ruul uova, da sumadi de naa go mata so moch iina Gad yai. Bot enibadi we lisn di Laa an du wa it se, an tiich piipl fi du dat tu, dem a-go get tap-a-tap pozishan iina Gad kindom.

For I say to you that unless your righteousness exceeds the righteousness of the scribes and Pharisees, you will in no way enter the kingdom of heaven.|Mek mi tel unu sopm, ef unu no du di sitn dem we Gad waahn muo dan di Laa tiicha an di Farisii dem, unu kyaahn ton wan a di piipl dem we Gad ruul uova.

“You have heard that it was said by the ancients, ‘You shall not murder,’  and ‘Whoever murders shall be in danger of the judgment.’ |“Unu nuo se dem weehn tel unu faada faada dem se, ‘No kil nobadi’ an ‘nobadi we kil nobadi, dem a-go go a kuot ous an di joj a-go se dem gilti an rait dem aaf.’

But I say to you that whoever is angry with his brother without a cause shall be in danger of the judgment. And whoever says to his brother, ‘Raca,’ shall be in danger of the Sanhedrin. But whoever says, ‘You fool,’ shall be in danger of hell fire.|Bot ier wa mi a se, jos beks wid unu breda ar unu sista, an unu afi go a kuot, an di joj a-go se unu gilti an rait unu aaf! An enibadi we shiem dem breda ar sista an tel dem ou dem woklis an dem sitn de, unu a-go afi go a di tap-a-tap joj dem, an enibadi we kaal dem breda ar sista wan woklis gud fi notn fuul — el faiya a-go riich dem.

“Therefore, if you bring your gift to the altar and there remember that your brother has something against you|“So ier mi den, ef unu a go a di alta go gi unu aafrin an unu memba se unu breda ar sista beks wid unu bout sitn

leave your gift there before the altar and go on your way. First be reconciled to your brother, and then come and offer your gift.|unu fi lef unu aafrin a di alta — no gi it op yet. Go mek it op wid unu breda ar sista fos an den kom bak kom gi unu aafrin.

“Reconcile with your adversary quickly, while you are on the way with him, lest your adversary deliver you to the judge, and the judge deliver you to the officer, and you be thrown into prison.|“Ef sumadi de kyari yu go kuot, sekl unu aagiment pan di wie, sekl it faas faas, ar di sumadi mait-a an yu uova gi di joj, an di joj an yu uova gi di poliis an di poliis wi go lak yu op iina prizn.
Truly I say to you, you will by no means come out of there until you have paid the last penny.|Mi a tel yu dis, yu naa go kyan kom out til yu pie op evri laas sent.
“You have heard that it was said by the ancients, ‘You shall not commit adultery.’|“Unu did ier se Gad se, ‘No sliip wid nobadi yu no marid tu.’

But I say to you that whoever looks on a woman to lust after her has committed adultery with her already in his heart. |Bot ier wa mi a tel unu se, unu jos waahn luk pan wan uman we unu no marid tu an waahn ar badi, an a sliip unu don sliip wid ar aredi iina unu aat.

And if your right eye causes you to sin, pluck it out and throw it away. For it is profitable that one of your members should perish, and not that your whole body be thrown into hell.|Ef unu rait yai a mek unu sin, tier it out an dash it we! Aftaraal it beta fi luuz onggl wan badi paat, dan di wol a di badi get fling dong a el.

And if your right hand causes you to sin, cut it off and throw it away. For it is profitable for you that one of your members should perish, and not that your whole body be thrown into hell.|Ef unu rait an mek unu sin, chap it aaf man an dash it we! Aftaraal it beta fi luuz onggl wan badi paat, dan di wol badi get fling dong a el.
“It was said, ‘Whoever divorces his wife, let him give her a certificate of divorce.’|“It rait dong se, ‘Eni man we lef dem waif fi gi ar di piepa we shuo se dem no marid agen.’

But I say to you that whoever divorces his wife, except for marital unfaithfulness, causes her to commit adultery. And whoever marries her who is divorced commits adultery.|Bot ier wa mi a se: eni man we brok op wid im waif, an a no laik se shi did a kip man wid im ar a gwaan wid no ada seks sin, ef da uman de go marid wan neks man, a di fos ozban wuda mek shi a liv iina sin kaa nou shi wudaana sliip wid wan neks man. An di man we marid da uman de afta ar ozban lef ar, im a liv iina sin tu, kaa im a sliip wid wan neks man waif.

“Again, you have heard that it was said by the ancients, ‘You shall not swear falsely, but shall fulfill your oaths to the Lord.’|“Unu nuo se dem did tel unu faada faada dis tu, ‘Wen unu gi unu wod an swier se unu a-go du sitn, unu no fi brok unu pramis, bot go du di sitn dem we unu tel di Laad se unu a-go du.’

But I say to you, do not swear at all: neither by heaven, for it is God’s throne;|Bot a dis mi a tel unu se, unu no fi swier at aal at aal. No bada swier an kaal pan evn fi shuo se wa unu a se a chuu, kaaz a evn Gad tan an ruul fram.

nor by the earth, for it is His footstool; nor by Jerusalem, for it is the city of the great King.|An no bada swier an kaal pan ort niida, kaa ort a laik wan stuul we Gad put op im fut pan; no kaal pan Jeruusilem tu kaa dat a fi Gad siti, an im a di bigis king.
Nor shall you swear by your head, because you cannot make one hair white or black. |No bada swier an kaal pan unuself, kaa non a unu kyaahn mek no iivn wan schraan a ier blak ar wait.

But let your ‘Yes’ mean ‘Yes,’ and ‘No’ mean ‘No.’ For whatever is more than these comes from the evil one.|Ef a ‘yes’ unu a se, se ‘yes’ an don, ef a ‘nuo’ — den se ‘nuo’ an don. Ef unu put notn muo pan dat, a siek-a di wikid wan.

“You have heard that it was said, ‘An eye for an eye, and a tooth for a tooth.’|“Unu did ier se Gad se, ‘Ef sumadi juk out yu yai, yu kyan juk out fi dem uon, an ef dem lik out yu tiit, yu kyan tomp out bak fi dem uon.’

But I say to you, do not resist an evil person. But whoever strikes you on your right cheek, turn to him the other as well.|Bot ier wa mi a tel unu se, di piipl dem we du aal saat a wikidnis tu unu, lou dem mek dem gwaan. Ef sumadi baks unu kraas unu fies, pan di rait an said, ton di neks said gi dem.
And if anyone sues you in a court of law and takes away your tunic, let him have your cloak also.|An ef nobadi waahn kyari unu go kuot fi tek unu shot, gi dem yu jakit tu.
And whoever compels you to go a mile,  go with him two. |An ef nobadi fuos unu fi kyari dem bag fi wan mail, unu fi kyari it fi aal tuu mail.
Give to him who asks you, and from him who would borrow from you do not turn away.|Sumadi beg unu sitn, gi dem, an no ton unu bak pan di piipl dem we waahn baro sitn fram unu.
“You have heard that it was said, ‘You shall love your neighbor  and hate your enemy.’ |“Unu did ier se Muoziz did rait se, ‘Lov unu nieba’ an ‘Iet unu enimi.’

But I say to you, love your enemies, bless those who curse you, do good to those who hate you, and pray for those who spitefully use you and persecute you,|Bot dis a wa mi a se, lov unu enimi dem an prie fi di piipl dem we chriit unu bad an mek unu sofa.

that you may be sons of your Father who is in heaven. For He makes His sun rise on the evil and on the good and sends rain on the just and on the unjust. |Wen unu du dat, unu wi komiin jos laik unu Faada we de a evn. Yu si ou im mek di son raiz op an shain pan wikid piipl an gud piipl? An a siem so im mek rien faal pan piipl we du wa rait iina im yai an di wan dem we no lisn wa im se.
For if you love those who love you, what reward do you have? Do not even the tax collectors do the same? |Aftaraal, ef unu onggl lov di piipl dem we lov unu, wa unu a-go get outa dat?

And if you greet your brothers only, what are you doing more than others? Do not even the tax collectors do so?|An ef unu onggl tel fu'unu piipl dem oudi, a wa unu wuda du so we nobadi els no du? Iihn? Dong tu di rang-duwa du dat tu, no chuu?

Therefore be perfect, even as your Father who is in heaven is perfect.|So ier mi nou, unu no fi gud onggl somtaim an onggl tu som piipl; nobadi no fi av notn bad fi se bout unu, tan jos laik unu faada we iina evn — im gud aal di wail, tu evribadi, an nobadi kyaahn se notn bad bout im an a taak chuut.”

“Be sure that you not do your charitable deeds before men to be seen by them. Otherwise you have no reward from your Father who is in heaven.|“Wach it! No bada du wa rait onggl fi mek piipl si unu! Ef a so, unu kyan no bada luk fi get notn fram Faada Gad we de a evn.

“Therefore, when you do your charitable deeds, do not sound a trumpet before you as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets, that they may be honored by men. Truly I say to you, they have their reward. |“So, wen unu a gi we tingz an a du gud fi piipl, no bada mek wan bag a naiz bout it, so evribadi si we ya'a du, jos laik wa di ipokrit dem du wen dem iina di Juu dem choch an outa ruod. Dem du dem sitn de fi mek piipl big dem op. Mek mi tel unu dis, an a chuu mi a taak: dem naa notn muo a get.
But when you do your charitable deeds, do not let your left hand know what your right hand is doing|Wen unu a gi we notn, no bada mek unu lef an nuo wa unu rait an a du.

that your charitable deeds may be in secret. And your Father who sees in secret will Himself reward you openly.|Da wie de, nobadi naa fi nuo se unu gi we notn, an unu Faada we si tingz we nobadi els no nuo bout, im wi gi unu wa unu fi get”.

“When you pray, you shall not be like the hypocrites. For they love to pray standing in the synagogues and on the street corners that they may be seen by men. Truly I say to you, they have their reward.|“Wen unu a prie, no gwaan laik di ipokrit dem, kaa dem lov tan op an prie iina di Juu dem choch yu no, an pan di kaana outa ruod, so piipl kyan si dem. Mek mi tel unu dis, an a chuu mi a taak: dem don get wa dem fi get aredi, an dem naa notn muo fi get fram faada Gad.

But you, when you pray, enter your closet, and when you have shut your door, pray to your Father who is in secret. And your Father who sees in secret will reward you openly.|Bot wen unu a prie, galang iina wan ruum man, lak di duor an prie tu unu faada an no mek nobadi nuo. An unu Faada we si tingz we nobadi els no nuo bout, im wi gi unu wa unu fi get.

But when you pray, do not use vain repetitions, as the heathen do. For they think that they will be heard for their much speaking.|Wen unu a prie, no bada chat di siem sitn uova an uova we no miin wan ting. A dat di piipl dem we no nuo Gad du, kaa dem tingk se wen dem yuuz wan bag a wod, a da taim de Gad a-go ansa dem prieya.
Do not be like them, for your Father knows what things you have need of before you ask Him.|Unu no bada gwaan laka dem, kaa fi unu Faada nuo wa unu niid iivn bifuo unu aks im fi it.
“Therefore pray in this manner:Our Father who is in heaven,hallowed be Your name.|“So, a so unu fi prie:“‘Wi Faada we iina evn,mek piipl av nof rispek fi yu an yu niem.
Your kingdom come;Your will be doneon earth, as it is in heaven.|Mek di taim kom wen yu ruul iina evri wie.Mek we yu waahn apm pan ort apm,jos laik ou a wa yu waahn fi apm iina evn apm
Give us this day our daily bread.
column2: Tide gi wi di fuud we wi niid.

column1: And forgive us our debts,as we forgive our debtors.|Paadn wi fi aal a di rang we wi du,siem laik ou wi paadn dem we du wi rang.

And lead us not into temptation,but deliver us from evil.For Yours is the kingdom and the power and the glory forever. Amen.|An no mek wi fies notn we wi kaaz wi fi sin,bot protek wi fram di wikid wan.’
For if you forgive men for their sins, your heavenly Father will also forgive you.|Kaaz ef unu paadn piipl we du unu rang, unu Faada we iina evn wi paadn unu tu.
But if you do not forgive men for their sins, neither will your Father forgive your sins.|Bot ef unu no paadn piipl, unu faada naa go paadn unu wen unu du rang.

“Moreover, when you fast, do not be like the hypocrites with a sad countenance. For they disfigure their faces so they may appear to men to be fasting. Truly I say to you, they have their reward. |“Wen unu kip we fram fuud fi worship Gad, no bada lang dong unu fies laik di ipokrit dem. Dem ogli op demself so piipl wi si se a faas dem a faas. Mi tel unu dis, an a chuu mi a taak: dem naa notn muo a get.
But you, when you fast, anoint your head and wash your face|Wen unu kip we fram fuud fi worship Gad, ail unu ed an wash unu fies man

so that you will not appear to men to be fasting, but to your Father who is in secret. And your Father who sees in secret will reward you openly.|so evribadi no si se a faas unu a faas, bot onggl Gad wan — we nobadi kyaahn si. An unu faada we nobadi kyaahn si, wi si wa unu du, an gi unu wa unu fi get.

“Do not store up for yourselves treasures on earth where moth and rust destroy and where thieves break in and steal.|“No bada gyada op chrezha fi unuself, we de ya-so pan ort. Yu si ya-so, worm an dem sitn de wi kom nyam nyam op unu sitn dem, an dem wi get rosti an mash op. Plos tiif de ya, an dem wi kom brok iin an tek we unu sitn dem.

But store up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust destroy and where thieves do not break in nor steal|Wa unu fi du, a pail op unu chrezha op a evn. No worm no de de-so. Dem naa go get rosti an mash op, an no tiif no de de fi brok iin an tiif unu sitn dem.
for where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.|Kaaz eniwe unu chrezha de, a de-so unu aat set, so a dat unu a-go tingk bout aal di wail.

“The light of the body is the eye. Therefore, if your eye is clear, your whole body will be full of light.|“Di yai dem a laik lamp, a dem gi di uol badi lait. So ef yu yai dem gud, yu uol badi wi ful-a lait. So unu wi si gud gud wa unu a du iina evri paat a unu laif.

But if your eye is unclear, your whole body will be full of darkness. Therefore, if the light that is in you is darkness, how great is that darkness!|Bot ef unu yai no gud, den di uol badi naa go daak op? Kaaz ef di sitn we fi gi unu lait, daak, den laad a masi man — unu wel daak den!

“No one can serve two masters. For either he will hate the one and love the other, or else he will hold to the one and despise the other. You cannot serve God and money.|“Nobadi kyaahn sorv tuu maasta. Yu wi iet wan an lov di ada wan, ar yu wi ron go du eniting we wan waahn, bot no tuu bizniz wid di ada wan. Unu kyaahn sorv Gad an moni.

“Therefore, I say to you, take no thought about your life, what you will eat, or what you will drink, nor about your body, what you will put on. Is not life more than food and the body than clothing?|“So mi a tel unu, no bada fret bout unu laif, a wori op unuself bout wa unu a-go iit ar jringk, ar wa unu a-go wier. Kaaz laif no muo impuotant dan fuud, iihn? An di badi no niid muo dan kluoz?

Look at the birds of the air, for they do not sow, nor do they reap, nor gather into barns. Yet your heavenly Father feeds them. Are you not much better than they?|Tingk bout di bod dem. Dem no plaant, dem no riip, an dem no stuor op stuor op fuud, an Gad fiid dem, duohn? Den unu no wot uol iip muo tu Gad dan dem?
Who among you by taking thought can add a cubit  to his stature?
column2: Wich wan a unu kyan liv iivn wan owa langga dan unu fi liv kaa unu wori wori op unuself? Iihn?

column1: “Why take thought about clothing? Consider the lilies of the field, how they grow: They neither work, nor do they spin. |“Aal kluoz? Wa mek unu a wori op unuself bout dat? Tingk bout ou di lili dem gruo out iina di fiil. Dem no wok, an dem no mek no kluoz fi wier.
Yet I say to you that even Solomon in all his glory was not dressed like one of these.|Bot ier mi no, no iivn Salaman wid aal a im fansi-fansi kluoz did jres op nais laik wan a dem lili ya.

Therefore, if God so clothes the grass of the field, which today is here and tomorrow is thrown into the oven, will He not much more clothe you, O you of little faith?|An ef dat a ou Gad jres op wail graas, we de ya tide, an dash iina faiya tumaro, den im naa go mek shuor se unu av kluoz fi wier tu? Luk pan unu, wa likl bit a chos unu put iina Gad!

Therefore, take no thought, saying, ‘What shall we eat?’ or ‘What shall we drink?’ or ‘What shall we wear?’|Ier mi man, no wori an fret bout, ‘Wa mi a-go nyam?’ ar ‘A wa mi a-go jringk?’ ar a se, ‘A wa mi a-go wier?’
(For the Gentiles seek after all these things.) For your heavenly Father knows that you have need of all these things.
column2: Kaaz a di piipl dem we no nuo Gad kip aan a tingk bout dem sitn de. Fu'unu Faada nuo se unu kyaahn du widout dem.

column1: But seek first the kingdom of God and His righteousness, and all these things shall be given to you. |Muo dan notn els, wa unu fi du, a put unu main pan Gad kindom an du wa im waahn unu fi du; wen unu du dat, aal a dem sitn de, unu wi get dem.

Therefore, take no thought about tomorrow, for tomorrow will take thought about the things of itself. Sufficient to the day is the trouble thereof.|So no bada wori an fret bout tumaro; tumaro wi tek kier a itself. Aftaraal, tide av fi it uona set a badarieshan.”
“Judge not, that you be not judged.|“No joj piipl laik se Gad kyaahn paadn dem, so di siem sitn wi no riich unu.

For with what judgment you judge, you will be judged. And with the measure you use, it will be measured again for you.|Kaaz di siem wie ou unu joj piipl, a so Gad a-go joj unu tu. Ef unu tek taim wid ada piipl, a so Gad a-go tek taim wid unu tu, bot ef unu redi fi rof dem op an rait dem aaf, a dat a-go riich unu tu.

“And why do you see the speck that is in your brother’s eye, but do not consider the plank that is in your own eye?|“Wa mek unu si di lili piis a saados iina unu breda ar sista yai, an unu kyaahn si di big piis a plangk iina fu'unu uon?

Or how will you say to your brother, ‘Let me pull the speck out of your eye,’ when a log is in your own eye?|Ou unu kyan riili se tu unu breda ar sista se, ‘Kom mek mi tek out di saados outa yu yai’ an wan piis a plangk de iina fu'unu uon, iihn?

You hypocrite! First take the plank out of your own eye, and then you will see clearly to take the speck out of your brother’s eye.|Unu ipokrit unu! Fos unu fi tek out di plangk outa fu'unu yai. Da wie de nou, unu kyan si gud fi tek di lili piis a saados outa unu breda ar sista yai.

“Do not give what is holy to the dogs, nor throw your pearls before swine, lest they trample them under their feet and turn around and attack you.|“An, no tek unu gud kliin sitn dem, we a fi Gad, gi daag, an unu gud gud porl dash gi pig. Dem naa go tep tep op pan dem, den ton roun tier unu op.
“Ask and it will be given to you; seek and you will find; knock and it will be opened to you.
column2: “Aks fi wa unu waahn an unu wi get it; luk fi wa unu waahn an unu wi fain it; nak pan di duor an it wi uopm op fu'unu.

column1: For everyone who asks receives, and he who seeks finds, and to him who knocks, it will be opened.|Kaaz enibadi we aks, wi get wa dem aks fa; di wan dem we luk, wi fain wa dem a luk fa, an di duor wi uopm fi di wan dem we nak.
“What man is there among you who, if his son asks for bread, will give him a stone?|“Wich wan a unu we a faada, unu bwai pikni aks unu fi piis a bred an unu tek stuon gi im?
Or if he asks for a fish, will he give him a snake?|Ar se im aks unu fi wan fish, unu wuda gi im wan siniek?

If you then, being evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your Father who is in heaven give good things to those who ask Him!|Ef unu so wikid an stil nuo ou fi gi unu pikni nais sitn, unu no tingk se unu Faada we iina evn wi gi beta sitn tu di piipl dem we aks im fi sopm!

Therefore, everything you would like men to do to you, do also to them, for this is the Law and the Prophets.|“So, no mata wa unu a du, unu fi chriit piipl ou unu waahn dem fi chriit unu. Dis a we di Laa an di prafit dem did miin.o chuu di naro giet, kaa di wan we waid an iizi fi go chuu dat tek unu chriet dong a el, an a dong de-so unu wi don fi eva. An a wol iip a piipl go chuu dat de giet.

“Enter at the narrow gate, for wide is the gate and broad is the way that leads to destruction, and there are many who are going through it|“Go chuu di naro giet, kaa di wan we waid an iizi fi go chuu dat tek unu chriet dong a el, an a dong de-so unu wi don fi eva. An a wol iip a piipl go chuu dat de giet.

because small is the gate and narrow is the way which leads to life, and there are few who find it.|Bot di giet we piipl go chuu an get fi liv fi eva, dat de giet naro an aad fi go chuu. An a likl bit a piipl fain it.

“Beware of false prophets who come to you in sheep’s clothing, but inwardly they are ravenous wolves. |“Wach out fi faalz prafit tu. Dem kom tu unu a gwaan laik dem a shiip, bot iina dem aat dem a laik wikid wail wulf.

You will know them by their fruit. Do men gather grapes from thorns, or figs from thistles? |Unu wi nuo a uu dem riili bi, siek-a di fruut we dem bier. Piipl no pik griep aafa makabush an prangganat aafa maka chrii?
Even so, every good tree bears good fruit. But a corrupt tree bears evil fruit.|A siem so aal a di gud chrii dem bier gud fruut an di bad chrii dem — fi dem fruut no gud.
A good tree cannot bear evil fruit, nor can a corrupt tree bear good fruit.|Wan gud chrii kyaahn bier bad fruut, an wan bad chrii kyaahn bier gud fruut. Notn no go so.
Every tree that does not bear good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire. |Evri chrii we no bier gud fruut, it get chap dong an dash iina di faiya.
Therefore, by their fruit you will know them.|So, di fruut we dem bier a-go mek unu nuo uu a uu.

“Not everyone who says to Me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ shall enter the kingdom of heaven, but he who does the will of My Father who is in heaven. |“A no evribadi we kom tu mi an kaal ‘Laad, Laad,’ a-go get fi kom ton wan a dem we Gad ruul uova yu no; onggl di piipl dem we du wa mi Faada iina evn waahn.

Many will say to Me on that day, ‘Lord, Lord, have we not prophesied in Your name, cast out demons in Your name, and done many wonderful works in Your name?’|Pan da die de, a wol iip a piipl a-go kom a se, ‘Laad, Laad, wi neehn yuuz fi yu niem an tel piipl wa Gad se, an wi yuuz yu niem ron out diiman tu an du uol iip a powaful sitn, no chuu?’
But then I will declare to them, ‘I never knew you. Depart from Me, you who practice evil.’|Bot a gweehn se tu dem se, ‘Mi no nuo yu non at aal. Gwe fram ya-so! Aal unu du a brok Gad Laa!’

“Whoever hears these sayings of Mine and does them, I will liken him to a wise man who built his house on a rock. |“Evribadi we ier wa mi a se, an du wa mi se, komiin laik wan man we av sens an bil op im ous pan rakstuon.

And the rain descended, the floods came, and the winds blew and beat on that house. And it did not fall, for it was founded a rock. |Di rien faal, di plies flod out an di briiz bluo aad aad an biit gens di ous. Bot di ous neehn mash dong, kaa a rakstuon it weehn bil op pan.

And every one who hears these sayings of Mine and does not do them will be likened to a foolish man who built his house on the sand.|Bot aal uu ier wa mi a se, bot no iivn pie it no main, komiin laik wan fu-fuul man we bil fi'im ous pan san.

And the rain descended, the floods came, and the winds blew and beat on that house. And it fell. And its fall was great.”|Di rien faal, di plies flod out an di briiz bluo aad an it jrap dong — braps, an mash op.”
When Jesus finished these sayings, the people were astonished at His teaching|Wen Jiizas did don se dem sitn ya, di piipl dem did shak tu ou im tiich.
for He taught them as one having authority, and not as the scribes.|Kaaz Jiizas did tiich dem laik sumadi we av di rait an di powa fi du it. Im neehn tiich laik fi dem Laa tiicha.
When He came down from the mountains, large crowds followed Him. |The whole city came out to meet Jesus. And when they saw Him, they begged Him to depart out of their region.

And then a leper came and worshipped Him, saying, “Lord, if You are willing, You can make me clean.”|Den wan man no kom tu Jiizas, im did av wan siknis we mek im skin fasi-fasi. Di man go dong pan im nii infronta Jiizas an se, “Laad ef yu waahn fi kyuor mi an mek mi kliin, yu av di powa fi dwi'it.”

Jesus reached out His hand and touched him, saying, “I will. Be clean.” And immediately his leprosy was cleansed. |Jiizas chrech out im an, toch di man an se, “Mi waahn yu fi get kliin. Gwaan yu beta nou!” An siem taim di man skin get kliin kliin.

Then Jesus said to him, “See that you tell no one. But go your way, show yourself to the priest, and offer the gift that Moses commanded as a testimony to them.”|Den Jiizas se tu im se, “Mek shuor se yu no tel nobadi, bot galang a wan priis an mek im si yu. Kyari di sakrifais we Muoziz Laa se yu fi gi wen yu skin get beta. Dat wi shuo evribadi se yu aarait nou.”
And when Jesus entered Capernaum, a centurion came to Him, entreating Him|Wen Jiizas go Kyaporniyom, wan ed fi onjrid suoja kom tu im a luk elp.
and saying, “Lord, my servant is lying at home, sick with paralysis, terribly tormented.”|“Laad, mi sorvant de a yaad a lidong an kyaahn muuv. Som wikid pien a lik im.”
Jesus said to him, “I will come and heal him.”|Jiizas se tu im se, “Mi wi kom an mek im get beta.”

The centurion answered and said, “Lord, I am not worthy that You should come under my roof. But speak the word only, and my servant will be healed.|Bot di ed suoja se, “Laad, mi no gud inof fi yu kom anda fi mi ruuf, bot jos se di wod an mi sorvant wi get beta.

For I am a man under authority, having soldiers under me. And I say to this man, ‘Go,’ and he goes, and to another, ‘Come,’ and he comes, and to my servant, ‘Do this,’ and he does it.”|Kaaz mi tek aada fram dem we uova mi tu, an mi av suoja we mi kanchuol. Mi tel da wan ya, ‘Go de-so’ an im go, an wan neks wan, ‘Kum ya’ an im kom. An mi tel mi sorvant, ‘Du dis’ an im dwi'it.”

When Jesus heard it, He was amazed and said to those who followed, “Truly I say to you, I have not found such great faith, no, not in Israel. |Jiizas jaa jrap wen im ier dis ya, an im se tu di piipl dem we did a fala im se, “Mek mi tel unu dis, an a chuu mi a taak, mi no fain nobadi iina Izrel we chos iina mi so!

And I say to you that many will come from the east and west and will dine with Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob in the kingdom of heaven.|Ier mi no, uol iip a piipl fram iis an wes a-go kom sidong iit big dina wid Iebriyam, Aizak an Jiekob op a evn iina Gad kindom.

But the sons of the kingdom will be thrown out into outer darkness. There will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.”|Bot di wan dem we did fi bi paat a Gad kindom, Gad a-go chuo dem out go wan plies we blak laka midnait. De-so, piipl a-go a baal an a grain dem tiit di wie pien a waks dem.”

Then Jesus said to the centurion, “Go your way. And as you have believed, so let it be done for you.” And his servant was healed that very moment.|Den Jiizas se tu di ed suoja se, “Gwaan baka yu yaad, di siem ting yu biliiv se a-go apm, a dat a-go apm.” An di sorvant get beta da sed taim de.
When Jesus entered Peter’s house, He saw his wife’s mother, lying sick with a fever.|Wen Jiizas riich a Piita yaad, im si se Piita mada-in-laa did lai dong iina bed. Shi did av fiiva.
He touched her hand, and the fever left her. And she rose and served them.|Im toch ar an, an di fiiva brok, an shi get op siem taim an staat luk aafa dem.

When the evening came, they brought to Him many who were possessed with demons. And He cast out the spirits with His word, and healed all who were sick|Wen iivnin kom, dem kyari uol iip a piipl we av iin diiman kom wich paat Jiizas did de. Im jos se wan wod an diiman kom outa piipl, an aal a uu did sik, im mek dem get beta.

to fulfill what was spoken by Isaiah the prophet,“He Himself took our infirmitiesand bore our sicknesses.”|Da wie ya, wa di prafit Aizaiya did se, wuda kom chuu. Aizaiya did se:“Aal a di sitn dem we wi sofa wid,im kom tek dem we, an aal a wi siknis dem, im tek put pan imself.”

Now when Jesus saw large crowds around Him, He gave a command to depart to the other side. |Nou wen Jiizas si wan big big kroud a piipl roun im, im tel im falara dem se fi go uova di ada said a di liek.
Then a certain scribe came and said to Him, “Teacher, I will follow You wherever You go.”|Den wan Laa tiicha kom tu im an se, “Tiicha, mi wi ton wan a yu falara dem an go wid yu eniwe yu go.”

Jesus replied, “The foxes have holes and the birds of the air have nests, but the Son of Man has no place to lay His head.”|Jiizas se tu im se, “Faks av uol, an di bod dem av nes, bot di Man we Gad Pik no av no we fi pudong im ed.”
Another of His other disciples said to Him, “Lord, let me first go and bury my father.”|Wan neks wan we a fala im se, “Laad mek mi go beri mi faada fos.”
But Jesus said to him, “Follow Me, and let the dead bury their dead.”|Bot Jiizas tel im se, “Fala mi, an mek di ded galang go beri uu ded fi dem.”
Then He entered the boat, and His disciples followed Him.|Den Jiizas go iina di buot an im falara dem fala baka im.

Suddenly a great storm arose on the sea, so that the boat was covered with the waves. But He was asleep. |Widoutn waanin wan wikid wikid staam kom dong pan di liek so di wiev dem staat flod di buot. Bot Jiizas did a sliip.
His disciples went to Him and awoke Him, saying, “Lord, save us! We are perishing!”|So im falara dem kom wiek im op. Dem se, “Laad siev wi! A ded wi a go ded nou!”

He replied, “Why are you fearful, O you of little faith?”Then He rose and rebuked the winds and the sea. And there was a great calm.|Bot im se tu dem se, “Ou unu friedi-friedi so? Unu chos iina Gad likl bit iihn?” Den im get op an tel di briiz an di sii fi sekl demself. An evriting jos sekl bak dong.

The men were amazed, saying, “What kind of Man is this that even the winds and the sea obey Him!”|An di man dem jaa jrap a grong, dem se, “Bot a wa kain-a man dis ya? Aal briiz an sii lisn im an du wa im se!”

When He came to the other side into the country of the Gergesenes, there met Him two men possessed with demons, coming out of the tombs, extremely fierce, so that no one might pass by that way.|Wen Jiizas riich a di neks said, iina di konchri we di Gyadariinz piipl dem liv, tuu man we did av iin diiman kom op tu im. Dem did a kom fram beriyin grong. Nobadi kudn kanchuol dem man de. Dem did rof an tof an a bier waar dem did push. Siek-a dat, nobadi kudn paas de-so.

Suddenly they cried out, saying, “What have we to do with You, Jesus, Son of God? Have You come here to torment us before the time?”|Di man dem baal out, “Gad Bwai Pikni, lef wi no! A kom yu kom ya fi mek wi sofa bifuo taim, ehn?”
Now a good way off from them was a herd of many swine feeding.
column2: Wan uol iip a ag did a nyam likl wie fram wich paat dem did de.

column1: So the demons begged Him, saying, “If You cast us out, permit us to go away into the herd of swine.”|Den di diiman dem beg Jiizas, ier dem no, “Ef yu a go ron wi out, du, sen wi go iina dem pig de.”

He said to them, “Go!” And when they came out, they went into the herd of swine. And suddenly the whole herd of swine ran violently down a steep place into the sea, and perished in the waters. |An im se, “Gwaan!” So dem kom outa di man dem an go iina di ag dem, an di uol a di ag dem tek aaf dong di stiip stiip il-said go chriet iina di liek an joun iina di waata.

Those who kept them fled, and went their ways into the city, and told everything, including what had happened to those possessed by the demons.|Di man dem we luk aafa di ag dem ron go iina di toun go pred evriting we apm tu di man dem we did av iin diiman.
The whole city came out to meet Jesus. And when they saw Him, they begged Him to depart out of their region.|Den di uol toun kom kom miit Jiizas, an wen dem si im dem beg im fi lef dem ieriya.
He entered a boat, crossed over, and came into His own city. |Afta Jiizas go iina di buot, im siel go kraas di neks said, an riich a fi im uona toun.

They brought to Him a man sick with paralysis, lying on a bed. And Jesus, seeing their faith, said to the paralytic, “Son, be of good cheer. Your sins are forgiven you.”|Siem taim som piipl bring wan kripl man kom tu im pan wan chrecha. Wen Jiizas si umoch dem biliiv iina im, im se tu di kripl man se, “No wori mi bwai! Mi paadn yu fram aal a yu sin dem.”
Then certain scribes said within themselves, “This Man blasphemes.”|Den som a di Laa tiicha dem se tu demself se, “Bot wiet, a uu da man ya riili tingk im bi — a dis im a disrispek Gad!”
Jesus, knowing their thoughts, said, “Why do you think evil in your hearts?|Jiizas did si wa dem a tingk se, so im se tu dem se, “Wa mek unu tingk dem wikid sitn de iina unu aat?
For which is easier, to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven you’ or to say, ‘Arise and walk’?|Tel mi sopm, wich wan iiziya, fi se, ‘Mi paadn yu sin dem’ ar ‘Git op an waak’?

But that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins”—then He said to the paralytic, “Arise, pick up your bed, and go into your house.”|Bot fi mek unu nuo, mi a-go shuo unu se di Man we Gad Pik av di rait an di powa fi paadn sin pan ort,” den im ton tu di kripl man an se, “Git op, tek op yu chrecha an gwaan a yu yaad.”
And he rose and departed to his house.|An di kripl man tan op, an gwaan a im yaad.

But when the crowds saw it, they were amazed and glorified God who had given such authority to men.| Wen di kroud a piipl si dis ya, dem kech dem fried an staat big op Gad, kaa a im gi piipl di rait an powa fi du dem sitn ya.

As Jesus passed on from there, He saw a man named Matthew sitting at the tax collector’s station. And He said to him, “Follow Me.” And he rose and followed Him.|Wen Jiizas a lef de-so, im si wan man we niem Matyu a sidong a di staal wich paat piipl kalek taks. “Fala mi,” im se tu Matyu. An Matyu get op an fala Jiizas.

While Jesus sat at supper in the house, many tax collectors and sinners came and sat down with Him and His disciples.|Afta dat, Jiizas go nyam a Matyu yaad, an wan uol iip a taks kalekta an piipl we du rang did kom kom sidong an a nyam wid im an im speshal falara dem.

When the Pharisees saw it, they said to His disciples, “Why does your Teacher eat with tax collectors and sinners?”|Wen di Farisii piipl dem si dis ya, dem ton tu im speshal falara dem an se, “Wa mek unu tiicha nyam wid taks kalekta an rang-duwa?”

But when Jesus heard that, He said to them, “Those who are well do not need a physician, but those who are sick.|Wen Jiizas ier wa dem se, im se, “Piipl we no sik no niid no dakta, a onggl sik piipl niid dakta.

But go and learn what this means, ‘I desire mercy, and not sacrifice.’  For I have not come to call the righteous, but sinners, to repentance.”|Gwaan go fain out a wa dis miin: ‘Mi waahn piipl fi gud an kain tu piipl, no fi dem kom kom bon sakrifais gi mi.’ Kaaz mi neehn kom ya fi tel piipl we du rait fi ton fram dem rang, a piipl we du rang mi kom ya fa.”

Then the disciples of John came to Him, asking, “Why do we and the Pharisees fast often, but Your disciples do not fast?”|Den Jan falara dem kom aks Jiizas se, “Ou kom wi an di Farisii dem kip we fram fuud fi worship Gad, bot fi yu falara dem no du dat?”

Jesus answered, “Can the guests of the bridegroom mourn as long as the bridegroom is with them? But the days will come when the bridegroom will be taken from them, and then they will fast.|Jiizas se tu dem se, “Yu tingk se di piipl dem we di braidgruum invait kyan a lang dong dem fies an sad sad op demself wen di braidgruum de mongks dem? Di taim a kom wen di braidgruum a-go gaan fram dem. A da taim de, dem wi kip we fram fuud.

“No one sews a piece of new cloth into an old garment, for that which is sewn in to fill it up pulls on the garment, and the tear is made worse.|“Nobadi no tek nyuu klaat an suo pan uol kluoz yu no, kaa di pach a-go tier aafa di kluoz an den di fos tier a-go wosaraaf.

Neither do men put new wine into old wineskins. Or else the wineskins burst, the wine runs out, and the wineskins perish. But they put new wine into new wineskins, and both are preserved.”|An nobadi no put nyuu wain iina uol wain bakl niida. Ef a so, di wain bakl dem a-go bos op, di wain a-go dash we, an di wain bakl dem a-go mash op. Wa piipl du a put nyuu wain iina nyuu wain bakl, an di tuu a dem — di bakl an di wain, wi aarait.”

While He was speaking these things to them, a certain ruler came and worshipped Him, saying, “My daughter is even now dead. But come and lay Your hand on her, and she will live.”|Wen Jiizas de de-so a se dem sitn de, aal av a sodn, wan liida fi di Juu dem choch go dong pan im nii infronta im. Im se tu Jiizas se, “Mi daata ded jos a wail ago, bot kom put yu an pan ar an shi wi kom bak alaiv.”
Jesus rose and followed him, and so did His disciples.|An Jiizas an im falara dem get op an fala im.

Then a woman, who was ill with a flow of blood for twelve years, came behind Him and touched the hem of His garment.|Nou wan uman we did a sofa an a bliid fi twelv ier kom op baka im an toch di tiel a im kluoz.
For she said within herself, “If I may just touch His garment, I shall be healed.”|Shi did a se tu arself se, “Ef a kuda onggl toch im kluoz, mi wi get beta.”

But Jesus turned around, and when He saw her, He said, “Daughter, be of good comfort. Your faith has made you well.” And the woman was made well instantly.|Bot wen Jiizas ton roun an si ar, im se, “No fret daata! Kaaz yu biliiv iina mi, yu aarait nou.” An fram da taim de di uman did beta.

When Jesus came to the ruler’s house and saw the musicians and the mourners making a noise|Wen Jiizas go iina di liida ous an si di piipl dem we plie di fluut, an di kroud a piipl dem a ala an a gwaan

He said to them, “Depart. The girl is not dead, but is sleeping.” And they laughed Him to scorn. |im se tu dem se, “Di uol a unu kum out! Kum out! Di pikni no ded; a sliip shi a sliip.” An di piipl dem staat laaf aafa im.

But when the people were put outside, He went in and took her by the hand, and the girl arose.|Bot wen dem mek di kroud a piipl go outa duor, Jiizas go insaid an im tek di pikni an, an di gyal pikni get op.
The news of this went out into all that land.
column2: An da nyuuz de pred aal uova da ieriya de.

column1: As Jesus departed from there, two blind men followed Him, crying out and saying, “Son of David, have mercy on us!”|Wen Jiizas did a lef de-so, tuu blain man did staat fala im an did a baal out, “Dievid pikni! Tek piti pan wi!”

When He entered the house, the blind men came to Him. And Jesus said to them, “Do you believe that I am able to do this?”They said to Him, “Yes, Lord.”|Wen Jiizas go iina di ous, di tuu blain man kom tu im, Jiizas se tu dem se, “Unu biliiv se mi kyan du dis?”Dem ansa bak, “Yes, Laad.”
Then He touched their eyes, saying, “According to your faith, let it be done for you.” |Den Jiizas toch dem yai an se, “Kaaz unu biliiv se mi kyan mek unu si agen, unu a-go si agen.”

And their eyes were opened, and Jesus strictly commanded them, saying, “See that no one knows of it.”|An dem yai uopm op. Den Jiizas waan dem aaf gud an prapa. Im se, “Luk ya nou, mek shuor se, nobadi no nuo bout dis.”
But when they had departed, they spread His fame in all that region.|Bot dem lef an tel evribadi iina da konchri de, bout wa Jiizas du fi dem.
As they went out, they brought to Him a mute man possessed with a demon.|Wen Jiizas an im falara dem did a go we, piipl kyari wan man kom we did av wan diiman iina im an we kudn chat.

And when the demon was cast out, the mute man spoke, and the crowds were amazed, saying, “This has never been seen in Israel.”|Wen Jiizas ron di diiman fram outa di man, di man staat chat! An di piipl dem fraitn! Dem se, “Nobadi neva yet si notn laka dis apm iina Izrel!”
But the Pharisees said, “He casts out demons through the ruler of the demons.”|Bot di Farisii dem se, “A di liida fi diiman gi im powa fi ron out diiman.”

Jesus went throughout all the cities and villages, teaching in their synagogues, preaching the gospel of the kingdom, and healing every sickness and every disease among the people. |Den Jiizas go bout iina aal a di toun an dischrik dem a tiich iina di Juu dem choch, a priich di gud nyuuz bout Gad kindom an a get piipl beta we av aal kain-a siknis an a sofa fram aal saat a kraasiz.

But when He saw the crowds, He was moved with compassion for them, because they fainted and were scattered, like sheep without a shepherd.|Wen im si di kroud a piipl dem, im did sari fi dem, kaa aal saat a sitn did a bada dem, dem did kanfyuuz an dem kudn elp demself. Dem did komiin laik shiip we naa nobadi fi tek kier a dem.
