“So the servant fell on his knees, pleading with him, saying, ‘Master, have patience with me, and I will pay you everything.’|“Di sorvant jrap pan im nii infronta di king an beg im, ‘Du tek taim wid mi sa, gi mi som taim an mi wi pie bak evriting.’

Then the master of that servant was moved with compassion, released him, and forgave him the debt.|Di king fiil sari fi im an mek im gwaan. An aal we im did uo, di king se im na'afi pie bak notn agen.

“But that same servant went out and found one of his fellow servants who owed him a hundred denarii.  He laid hands on him and took him by the throat, saying, ‘Pay me what you owe.’|“Afta im go we nou, da sed sorvant de si wan neks sorvant we uo im wan lili bit a moni wen yu tingk bout umoch im did uo di king. Di sorvant grab di neda wan chuot an staat chuok out im die lait. Im se, ‘Gi mi di moni we yu uo mi!’

“So his fellow servant fell down at his feet and entreated him, saying, ‘Have patience with me, and I will pay you everything.’|“Di neda wan we a wan sorvant jos laik im jrap pan im nii an beg im, ‘Du, tek taim wid mi. Gi mi som taim an mi wi pie bak aal a we mi uo yu.’
“But he would not and went and threw him in prison until he should pay the debt.|“Bot im neehn tek dat. Im se nuo, an go we go fling di neda sorvant iina prizn til im pie im bak evriting.

So when his fellow servants saw what took place, they were very sorry and went and told their master all that had taken place.|Wen ada sorvant laik im si wa apm, dem beks bad bad an go we go tel di king evriting.

“Then his master, after he had summoned him, said to him, ‘O you wicked servant! I forgave you all that debt because you pleaded with me.|“So di king kaal di fos sorvant an se tu im se, ‘Yu wikid sorvant yu! Mi paadn yu umoch umoch miliyan kaa yu beg mi!
Should you not also have had compassion on your fellow servant, even as I had pity on you?’|Yu miin se yu kudn tek piti pan sumadi we a sorvant jos laka yu di siem wie ou mi tek piti pan yu?’
His master was angry and delivered him to the jailers until he should pay all his debt.
column2: An di king get beks an gi im tu di prizn gyaad dem fi dem taament im til im pie bak evri red sent we im did uo di king.

column1: “So also My heavenly Father will do to each of you, if from your heart you do not forgive your brother for his trespasses.”|“A siem so mi Faada iina evn wi du unu ef unu uol op unu breda ar sista dem iina unu aat, an no paadn dem.”

Now when Jesus finished these sayings, He departed from Galilee and came into the region of Judea beyond the Jordan. |Nou wen Jiizas did don se we im a se, im lef Gyalalii go paas Riva Jaadn an go iina di Judiya ieriya.
Large crowds followed Him, and He healed them there.|Wan bag a piipl fala im, an im get dem beta rait de-so.

The Pharisees also came to Him, tempting Him and saying, “Is it lawful for a man to divorce his wife for any reason?”|Den, som Farisii piipl kom fi kom tes Jiizas. So dem kom kom aks im se, “Wan man kyan go brok op wid im waif fi eni an eniting? Muoziz Laa lou dat?”
He answered, “Have you not read that He who made them at the beginning ‘made them male and female,’|Jiizas ansa se, “Unu no riid se fram Gad mek di worl im mek man an uman

and said, ‘For this reason a man shall leave his father and mother and be joined to his wife, and the two shall become one flesh’? |an im se, ‘Siek-a dis, wan man a-go lef im faada an mada an jain op wid im waif an di tuu a dem wi ton wan sumadi’?
So they are no longer two, but one flesh. Therefore what God has joined together, let no man put asunder.”|So dem a no tuu agen, dem ton wan. So wa Gad jain op, nobadi no fi plit op.”

They said to Him, “Then why did Moses command to give a certificate of divorce, and to send her away?”|Den dem se tu Jiizas se, “So wa mek Muoziz Laa se, wi kyan gi wi waif wan piepa we shuo se wi no marid no muo, an ron ar outa wi ous?”

He said to them, “Moses, for the hardness of your hearts, permitted you to divorce your wives, but from the beginning it was not so. |Jiizas se tu dem se, “Muoziz lou unu fi lef unu waif kaa unu aat did tof! Bot wen Gad did fos mek man an uman a no so tingz did set op.

But I say to you, whoever divorces his wife, except for sexual immorality, and marries another, commits adultery. And whoever marries her who is divorced commits adultery.”|Nou ier we mi a se, enibadi we brok op wid dem waif an go marid sumadi els, an a no se dem waif did sliip wid nobadi els, a gi dem a gi ar bon an a brok dem brok di Laa!”

His disciples said to Him, “If such is the case of the man with his wife, it is not good to marry.”|Jiizas speshal falara dem se tu im se, “Bwai ef a so it go bitwiin wan man an im waif, den it beta fi piipl no marid den.”

But He said to them, “Not all men can receive this precept, but only those to whom it is given. |So Jiizas ansa bak, “A no evribadi kyan tek wa mi jos se yu no — dat a no fi evribadi; a fi onggl uu it go fa.

For there are some eunuchs who have been so from birth, there are some eunuchs who have been made eunuchs by men, and there are some eunuchs who have made themselves eunuchs for the sake of the kingdom of heaven. He who is able to receive this, let him receive it.”|Kaaz yu av man we kyaahn marid fi difrant difrant riizn. Som man no get marid kaaz fram dem baan dem kyaahn av seks — a jos so Gad mek dem. Dem kyaahn du notn so dem no marid. Som man kyaahn av seks kaaz piipl kot aaf dem tingz, dem kyaahn du notn so dem no get marid niida. An som man, dem no bada get marid so dat dem kyan spen muo taim a du Gad wok. Uu kyan tek dis fi tek it.”

Then little children were brought to Him that He might put His hands on them and pray. But the disciples rebuked them.|Den piipl kyari di likl pikni dem kom a Jiizas fi im put im an pan dem an prie fi dem. Bot Jiizas speshal falara dem staat tel aaf di piipl dem we bring di pikni dem kom, an staat ron dem.

But Jesus said, “Let the little children come to Me, and do not forbid them. For to such belongs the kingdom of heaven.”|Bot Jiizas se, “Lou di likl pikni dem, mek dem kom tu mi. No chrai tap dem, kaaz Gad kindom a fi piipl we komiin laik dem likl pikni ya.”
He laid His hands on them and departed from there.|An im put im an pan dem, an den go bout im bizniz.
Now one came and said to Him, “Good Teacher, what good deed shall I do to have eternal life?”|Wan man kom tu Jiizas kom aks im se, “A wa kain-a gud sitn mi fi du so mi kyan liv fi eva?”

He replied to him, “Why do you call Me good? There is One who is good. But if you would enter life, keep the commandments.”|So Jiizas se tu im se, “A wa mek yu kom a aks mi bout wa gud? A onggl wan sumadi de bout we gud yu no. Bot ef yu waahn fi liv fi eva kip di Laa dem we Gad did gi Muoziz.

He said to Him, “Which ones?”Jesus said, “You shall not murder, You shall not commit adultery, You shall not steal, You shall not bear false witness,|“Wich wan a dem?” im aks Jiizas.So Jiizas ansa bak, “‘No kil, no sliip wid nobadi we yu no marid tu, no tiif, no tel lai pan piipl,
Honor your father and your mother, and, You shall love your neighbor as yourself.”|rispek yu faada an mada’ an ‘Lov yu nieba siem laik ou yu lov yuself.’”
The young man said to Him, “All these I have kept from my youth. What do I still lack?”|So di yong man se tu im se, “Mi a fala dem de wid aal a mi aat. So a wa muo mi niid?”

Jesus said to him, “If you would be perfect, go and sell what you have, and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven. And come, follow Me.”|So Jiizas se, “Ef yu waahn bi evriting we Gad waahn yu fi bi, gwaan go sel evriting we yu av an gi di moni tu di puo piipl dem, an yu wi rich iina evn. Wen yu du dat, kom fala mi.”
But when the young man heard this, he went away sorrowful. For he had great possessions.|Bot wen di yong man ier dis ya, im aat jrap an im go we sad, kaa im did wel rich.

Then Jesus said to His disciples, “Truly, I say to you that it will be hard for a rich man to enter the kingdom of heaven.|Den Jiizas se tu im speshal falara dem se, “Mi tel unu dis an a chuu mi a taak, it a-go wel aad fi rich piipl go iina Gad kindom!

And again I say to you, it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of God.”|Ier dis tu no: It iiziya fi wan kyamil go chuu wan niigl yai dan fi sumadi we rich go iina Gad kindom.”
When His disciples heard this, they were greatly amazed, saying, “Who then can be saved?”|Jiizas falara dem did wel shak wen dem ier dis. Dem se, “Den a uu kyan get siev?”

But Jesus looked at them and said, “With men this is impossible, but with God all things are possible.”|So Jiizas luk pan dem an se, “Wa piipl kyaahn du, Gad kyan du, kaaz notn no de we Gad kyaahn du.”
Then Peter answered Him, “See, we have left everything and followed You. What then shall we have?”|Den Piita se tu im se, “Si ya! Wi lef evriting we wi av fi fala yu! So wa wi a-go get?”

Jesus said to them, “Truly I say to you, in the regeneration, when the Son of Man sits on His glorious throne, you who have followed Me will also sit on twelve thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel. |So Jiizas se tu dem se, “Ier mi no, an a chuu mi a taak: Wen Gad mek evriting nyuu agen, an di Man we Gad Pik sidong pan im tap-a-tap chuon, aal a unu, we fala mi, a-go sidong pan unu uona chuon tu. Unu a-go sidong pan twelv chuon a joj Izrel twelv chraib dem.

And everyone who has left houses or brothers or sisters or father or mother or wife or children or fields for My name’s sake shall receive a hundred times as much and inherit eternal life. |An enibadi we lef dem yaad, dem breda, sista, faada, mada, pikni ar dem lan siek-a mi, dem wi get bak onjrid taim muo dan wa dem did av; plos dem a-go get fi liv fi eva tu.
But many who are first will be last, and the last first.”|Bot nof a uu de a front nou a-go de a bak, an uu de a bak a-go de a front.”
“For the kingdom of heaven is like a landowner who went out early in the morning to hire laborers for his vineyard.
column2: “Gad kindom komiin laik wan man we uon wan faam. Im go we orli iina di maanin go tek aan som wokman fi im griep faam.

column1: When he had agreed with the laborers for a denarius a day, he sent them into his vineyard.|Im an dem wok out se im wi pie dem wan naamal die wok pie, an den im sen dem go pan im griep faam fi staat di wok.
“Then he went out about the third hour and saw others standing idle in the marketplace|“Bout nain aklak iina di maanin, im go we agen an si som muo man a tan op iina di maakit naa du notn.

and said to them, ‘You also go into the vineyard, and whatever is right I will give you.’ So they went.|So im go tu dem an se, ‘Unu gwaan dong a di griep faam tu, an mi wi pie unu wat-eva unu fi get.’
Again he went out about the sixth hour and the ninth hour and did likewise.|So dem go.“Im go bak out bout migl die, an chrii aklak tu, an im du di sed ting.

“About the eleventh hour he went out and found others standing idle, and said to them, ‘Why do you stand here idle all day?’|An bout faiv aklak im go out agen an fain som muo man jos a tan op bout di plies naa du a ting. So im aks dem se, ‘Wa mek unu tan op ya-so uol die naa du notn?’

“They said to him, ‘Because no one has hired us.’“He said to them, ‘You also go into the vineyard, and whatever is right you will receive.’|“Dem ansa bak, ‘Kaaz nobadi naa gi wi no wok sa.’“So im se tu dem se, ‘Unu gwaan go wok pan mi griep faam tu.’

“So when evening came, the owner of the vineyard said to his steward, ‘Call the laborers and give them their wages, beginning with the last to the first.’|“Wen iivnin kom dong nou di faam uona se tu im manija se, ‘Kaal di wokman dem an pie dem. Staat wid di laas set a man dem we mi tek aan, an pie aal a dem dong tu di fos set.’
“When they who were hired about the eleventh hour came, they each received a denarius.|“Wen di wan dem we staat wok bout faiv aklak kom fi fi dem pie, aal a dem get wan uol a die pie.

But when the first came, they supposed that they would receive more, but each of them likewise received a denarius.|Wen di wan dem we di faam uona did tek aan fos kom nou fi get fi dem pie, dem tingk se dem wuda get muo moni. Bot evri wan a dem get di naamal die pie tu.
When they received it, they grumbled against the landowner|So wen dem get dem pie, dem staat grombl grombl bout wa di faam uona did du;

saying, ‘These last worked only one hour, and you made them equal to us, who have borne the burden and the heat of the day.’|ier dem no, ‘Dem wokman, we kom iin laas, a onggl wan owa dem wok fa an yu pie dem siem laik wi, afta wi du muos a di wok an bon op iina son uol die.’

“But he answered one of them, ‘Friend, I am doing you no wrong. Did you not agree with me for a denarius?|“Di faam uona ansa wan a dem, ‘Fren, afta mi no tiif unu notn. Wi neehn kom tugeda an se a di naamal die pie mi fi gi unu? Iihn?
Take what is yours and go your way. I will give to this last one even as I give to you.
column2: So tek wa unu fi get an gwaan bout unu bizniz. A mi waahn gi di man we mi tek aan laas di siem moni we mi gi unu.

column1: Is it not lawful for me to do what I wish with my own things? Or is your eye evil because I am good?’
column2: Mi kyaahn du we mi waahn du wid fi mi uona moni? Iihn? Ar a red yai unu red yai kaa mi kain?’

column1: “So the last will be first, and the first last. For many are called, but few are chosen.”|“So di wan we no luk so impuotant we de a bak, Gad a-go push dem op a front, an di wan dem we luk laik se a dem impuotant, we de op a front, a dem a-go get push a bak.”

As Jesus was going up to Jerusalem, He took the twelve disciples aside on the road and said to them|Wen Jiizas did a go op a Jeruusilem, pan di wie, im tek im twelv speshal falara dem wan said an se tu dem se

“Now we are going up to Jerusalem, and the Son of Man will be betrayed to the chief priests and scribes. And they will condemn Him to death |“Luk ya no, wi a go op a Jeruusilem, an dem a-go tek di Man we Gad Pik an ton im uova tu di ed priis an di Laa tiicha dem. Dem a-go joj im an se im gilti an fi ded.

and deliver Him to the Gentiles to mock, and to scourge, and to crucify Him, but on the third day He will rise.”|Dem a-go gi'im tu di piipl dem we a no Juu fi dem laaf aafa im an tek im mek preke, biit im wikid wikid an afta dat dem a-go kil im pan di kraas. Bot chrii die afta dem kil im, im a-go kom bak alaiv.”

Then the mother of Zebedee’s sons came to Him with her sons. And kneeling before Him, she asked for a certain thing.|Den Zebidii bwai pikni dem mada kom tu Jiizas wid ar bwai dem. Shi niil dong a grong an aks im fi du sitn fi ar.

He said to her, “What do you want?”She said to Him, “Grant that these two sons of mine may sit, one at Your right hand and one at Your left, in Your kingdom.”|So im se tu ar se, “Wa yu waahn?”Shi ansa bak, “Mi waahn yu fi lou mi tuu bwai dem fi sidong iina yu kindom, wan a yu rait-an-said an di neks wan a yu lef-an-said.”

But Jesus answered, “You do not know what you are asking. Are you able to drink from the cup that I am to drink, and to be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with?”They said to Him, “We are able.”|So Jiizas se tu ar se, “Yu no nuo wa yu a aks mi se! Unu kyan jringk wa mi bout fi jringk? A sofa mi a-go sofa yu no.”Di bwai dem se, “Ye, wi kyan du dat!”

He said to them, “You will indeed drink from My cup and be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with. But to sit at My right hand and at My left is not Mine to grant, but it is for those for whom it is prepared by My Father.”|So Jiizas se tu dem se, “Unu wi sofa ye; mmhm — unu wi jringk mi kop, bot fi sidong a mi rait-an-said an mi lef-an-said, a no mi wok out da wan de. Kaaz dem pozishan de don put op aredi fi di wan dem we mi Faada se fi get dem.”
When the ten heard it, they were moved with indignation against the two brothers. |Nou wen di ada ten falara dem ier dis, dem did beks wid di tuu breda dem.

But Jesus called them to Him and said, “You know that the rulers of the Gentiles lord it over them, and those who are great exercise authority over them.|Bot Jiizas kaal dem an se, “Unu nuo se di piipl dem we a no Juu, fi dem ruula dem lov kanchuol dem an lov shuo se a dem av powa, an aal dem ed ruula — dem lov baas baas op di piipl dem tu.
It shall not be so among you. Whoever would be great among you, let him serve you|A no so it fi go mongks unu! Insted-a dat, ef nobadi waahn av tap pozishan mongks unu, dem afi sorv unu,
and whoever would be first among you, let him be your slave|an nobadi we de mongks unu an waahn big op a front, dem afi ton unu sorvant.

even as the Son of Man did not come to be served, but to serve and to give His life as a ransom for many.”|A so it fi go, jos laik ou di Man we Gad Pik neehn kom ya fi nobadi sorv im; a kom im kom ya fi sorv piipl an fi gi op im laif so piipl kyan get frii fram dem sin.”
As they departed from Jericho, a large crowd followed Him.|Wen Jiizas did a lef Jeriko, wan bag a piipl fala baka im.

There, two blind men sitting by the road, when they heard that ­Jesus was passing by, cried out, “Have mercy on us, O Lord, Son of David!”|Tuu blain man did sidong a di ruod-said a beg. Wen dem ier se a Jiizas a paas chuu, dem shout out, “Laad, Dievid pikni, tek piti pan wi du!”

The crowd rebuked them, that they should be silent. But they cried out even more, “Have mercy on us, O Lord, Son of David!”|Di piipl dem tel dem fi shet dem mout an tap dem naiz, bot a da taim de dem staat shout out, “Laad, Dievid pikni, tek piti pan wi du!”
Jesus stood still and called them, saying, “What do you want Me to do for you?”|Jiizas tap. Im kaal dem an se, “Wa unu waahn mi fi du fu'unu?”
They said to Him, “Lord, let our eyes be opened.”|Dem se tu im se, “Laad uopm op wi yai dem, du.”

So Jesus had compassion on them and touched their eyes. Immediately their eyes received sight, and they followed Him.|Jiizas fiil sari fi dem an toch dem yai — Braps! Dem yai get beta an dem kuda si, an di man dem fala Jiizas.

When they drew near to Jerusalem and came to Bethphage, on the Mount of Olives, then Jesus sent two disciples,|Nou wen dem riich nier Jeruusilem an kom a Betpiej, rait a Mount Aliv de-so, Jiizas sen tuu a im falara dem

saying to them, “Go over into the village opposite you, and immediately you will find a donkey tied, and a colt with her. Untie them and bring them to Me.|im se tu dem se, “Gwaan a di dischrik infronta unu, az unu kech de-so unu a-go fain wan dangki tai op, an wan yong dangki a-go de de wid ar. Luus di tuu a dem an kyari dem kom.
If anyone says anything to you, you shall say, ‘The Lord has need of them.’ And he will send them immediately.”|Ef nobadi se notn tu unu, unu fi se, ‘Di Laad niid dem,’ an dem wi sen dem sed taim.”
All this was done to fulfill what was spoken by the prophet, saying:|Dis apm fi mek wa di prafit did se kom chuu. Di prafit did se

“Tell the daughter of Zion,‘Look, your King is coming to you,humble, and sitting on a donkey,and on a colt, the foal of a donkey.’”|“Tel di piipl dem we kom fram Zaiyan se,‘Luk ya, unu king a kom tu unu,im a kom jengkl an ombl, a sidong pan wan big dangki,an pan wan yong dangki tu — dat a di mada dangki biebi.’”
The disciples went and did as Jesus commanded them.
column2: Jiizas falara dem go we an du wa im tel dem fi du.

column1: They brought the donkey and the colt, laid their garments on them, and He sat on them.|Dem bring di mada dangki an di likl dangki go gi Jiizas. Dem put dem jakit pan di dangki dem bak, an Jiizas sidong pan dem.
A very large crowd spread their garments on the road. Others cut down branches from the trees and spread them on the road.
column2: Wan bag a piipl pred out dem jakit pan di ruod. Som ada piipl kot aaf chrii branch an pred dem out pan di ruod tu.

column1: The crowds that went before Him and that followed Him cried out:“Hosanna to the Son of David!‘Blessed is He who comes in the name of the Lord!’Hosanna in the highest!”|Di kroud a piipl dem we waak infronta Jiizas, an di wan dem baka im did kip aan a shout out,“Priez Gad! Priez Dievid pikni!”“Gad bles di wan we im sen kom — im sen im wid fi'im powa!”“Priez Gad we iina evn!”
When He entered Jerusalem, the entire city was moved, saying, “Who is He?” |Wen im riich Jeruusilem evribadi ina di siti tek nuotis an se, "A oo im?"
The crowds said, “This is Jesus, the prophet from Nazareth of Galilee.”|Wen im riich iina Jeruusilem di uol toun kech a faiya, evribadi a se, “A uu dis ya?”

Jesus went into the temple of God and drove out all those who sold and bought in the temple and overturned the tables of the moneychangers and the seats of those who sold doves. |Den Jiizas go iina Gad ous an staat fling out aal a di piipl dem we did iin de a sel an a bai. Di piipl dem we did a chienj out moni, Jiizas pich uova fi dem tiebl, an ton uova di chier fi aal uu did de de a sel dov.

He said to them, “It is written, ‘My house shall be called a house of prayer,’  but you have made it ‘a den of thieves.’  ”|Im se tu dem se, “It rait dong iina Gad wod se, ‘Fi mi ous a-go bi wan ous we piipl kom fi prie,’ bot unu ton it iina wan aid out fi tiif’!”
The blind and the lame came to Him in the temple, and He healed them.|Blain an kripl piipl kom tu Jiizas iina di yaad we Gad ous de, an im get dem beta.

But when the chief priests and scribes saw the wonderful things that He did, and the children crying out in the temple, “Hosanna to the Son of David,” they were extremely displeased |Bot wen di ed priis an Laa tiicha dem si di mirikl dem we im du, an ier di pikni dem iina di yaad we Gad ous de a baal out se, “Priez im! Mek wi priez Dievid pikni” dem beks kyaahn don

and said to Him, “Do You hear what these are saying?”Jesus said to them, “Yes. Have you never read,‘Out of the mouth of children and infantsYou have perfected praise’?”|an dem se tu Jiizas se, “Yu ier wa dem a se?”So Jiizas se, “Ye man. Yu neehn riid iina Gad wod se,‘Im mek pikni an likl biebipriez im ou im fi get priez’?”
And He left them and went out of the city into Bethany, and He lodged there.|An wen im lef dem, im kom outa di toun go Betani an tan de fi di nait.
Now in the morning as He returned to the city, He became hungry. |Nou orli iina di maanin, wen Jiizas a go baka di toun, im did onggri.

When He saw a fig tree by the road, He went to it but found nothing on it except leaves. He said to it, “Let no fruit ever grow on you again.” Immediately the fig tree withered away.|So im si wan fig chrii a di ruod-said an go kraas wich paat it de, bot im neehn si notn at aal pan it, jos suo-so liif. Jiizas se tu di chrii se, “Yu naa go eva bier fruut agen!” an siem taim di fig chrii jrai op.
When the disciples saw it, they were amazed, saying, “How did the fig tree wither away instantly?”|Wen im falara dem si wa im du, dem yai uopm op waid waid. Dem se, “Ou di fig chrii jrai op so faas?”

Jesus answered them, “Truly I say to you, if you have faith and do not doubt, you will not only do what was done to the fig tree, but also, if you say to this mountain, ‘Be removed, and be thrown into the sea,’ it will be done.|Jiizas ansa bak, “Mi tel unu dis, an a chuu mi a taak, ef unu jos chos iina Gad likl, an no if-an-bot an wanda-wanda, unu naa go jos du wa mi du tu da fig chrii de, bot aal ef unu se tu da moutn ya, ‘Git op go fling yuself iina di sii, it wi apm.
And whatever you ask in prayer, if you believe, you will receive.”|An eniting we unu prie an aks Gad fa, ef unu biliiv se im gu'unu, unu wi get it.”

When He entered the temple, the chief priests and the elders of the people came up to Him as He was teaching, and said, “By what authority are You doing these things? And who gave You this authority?”|Nou afta Jiizas did go bak iina di yaad we Gad ous de, wen im did a tiich, di ed priis an di elda fi di piipl dem kom tu im. Dem aks im se, “Wa rait yu av fi du dem sitn ya, an a uu gi yu di rait fi du dem?”

Jesus answered them, “I also will ask you one question. If you tell Me, I likewise will tell you by what authority I do these things.|So Jiizas ansa bak, “Mek mi aks unu wan kwestiyan. Ef unu ansa mi, mi wi tel unu a uu gi mi di rait fi du dem sitn ya.

Where did the baptism of John come from? From heaven or from men?”They reasoned among themselves, saying, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ He will say to us, ‘Then why did you not believe him?’ |Wen Jan did a baptaiz piipl, a uu did sen im fi dwi'it, Gad ar man?”So dem staat wok it out mongks dem wan aneda. Ier dem no, “Ef wi se, ‘A Gad’, im a-go aks wi se, ‘Den wa mek unu neva biliiv im?’

But if we say, ‘From men,’ we are afraid of the people, for all hold John as a prophet.”|Bot ef wi se, ‘A man’, di kroud a piipl no wi ton dong pan wi, kaa di uol a dem tek Jan fi wan prafit — wi fried dat go apm.”

So they answered Jesus, “We do not know.”Then He said to them, “Neither will I tell you by what authority I do these things.|So dem se tu Jiizas se, “Wi no nuo.”So Jiizas se tu dem se, “Den mi naa tel unu a uu gi mi di rait fi du dem sitn ya niida.

“What do you think? A man had two sons. He came to the first and said, ‘Son, go work today in my vineyard.’|“Tel mi wa unu tingk? Wan man did av tuu bwai pikni. Im go tu di fos wan an se, ‘Mi bwai, gwaan go wok pan mi griep faam tide.’
“He answered, ‘I will not,’ but afterward he repented and went.|“Di bwai se, ‘Mi naa go no we.’ Bot lietaraan im chienj im main an go.

“Then he came to the second, and said likewise. He answered, ‘I will go, sir,’ but did not go.|“Di Faada go tu im neks pikni an tel im di sed ting. Dis ya wan se, ‘Mi a-go go dadi,’ bot im no go no we.

“Which of the two did the will of his father?”They said, “The first.”Jesus said to them, “Truly I say to you, the tax collectors and prostitutes enter the kingdom of God before you.|“So tel mi, wich wan a dem du wa im faada waahn?”Dem se, “Di fos wan.”So Jiizas se tu dem se, “Mi tel unu dis, an a chuu mi a taak, taks kalekta an seks woka a-go go iina Gad kindom bifuo unu!

For John came to you in the way of righteousness, and you did not believe him. But the tax collectors and prostitutes believed him. And even when you saw it, you did not afterward repent and believe him.|Kaaz Jan kom shuo unu di rait wie, an unu neehn biliiv im. Bot di taks kalekta dem an seks woka did biliiv. Unu si dis apm, bot unu stil neehn chienj unu main an biliiv im.

“Listen to another parable: There was a certain landowner who planted a vineyard and built a wall around it. He dug a winepress in it and built a tower. Then he rented it to vinedressers and went into a distant country.|“Ier da tuori ya tu: Yu weehn av wan man we uon wan griep faam an di man plaant op im faam. Im put op wan waal aal roun it, dig out wan uol iina di grong fi krosh out di griep fi mek wain, an bil op wan plies pan tap a di waal fi di gyaad wach uova di faam. Den im rent it out tu som faama an go farin.

When the season of the fruit drew near, he sent his servants to the vinedressers to receive his fruit.|Wen di griep dem raip op nou, an a taim fi pik dem, im sen im sorvant dem go a im tenant dem fi kalek wa im fi get fram im faam.
“The vinedressers took his servants and beat one, killed another, and stoned another.|“Bot di tenant dem uol aan pan di sorvant dem, biit wan, kil wan, an stuon di neda wan.
Again, he sent other servants, more than the first. And they did likewise to them. |So im sen som ada sorvant, muo dan wa im did sen di fos taim. An di tenant dem chriit dem di siem wie.
Last of all, he sent his son to them, saying, ‘They will respect my son.’|So di man riich di laas schraa nou an sen im uona bwai pikni go tu dem. Ier im no, ‘Dem wi rispek mi bwai.’

“But when the vinedressers saw the son, they said to themselves, ‘This is the heir. Come, let us kill him and seize his inheritance.’ |“Bot eh eh, wen di tenant dem si di bwai, dem se tu dem wan aneda se, ‘A da wan ya a-go get evriting wen im faada ded. Kom mek wi kil im an tek wa im wuda get.’
So they caught him, threw him out of the vineyard, and killed him.|So dem grab im, chuo im aafa di faam an kil im.
“Therefore, when the owner of the vineyard comes, what will he do to those vinedressers?”|“Nou wen di uona fi di faam kom bak, wa unu tingk im a-go du wid dem tenant de?”

They said, “He will severely destroy those wicked men and rent his vineyard to other vinedressers who will give him the fruits in their seasons.”|Dem ansa se, “Im a-go kil aaf dem uol wikid de! An tek im faam an rent it tu ada tenant we a-go gi'im wa im fi get wen im griep dem redi.”

Jesus said to them, “Have you never read in the Scriptures:‘The stone which the builders rejectedhas become the cornerstone.This is the Lord’s doing,and it is marvelous in our eyes’?|Jiizas se tu dem se, “Unu neehn riid iina Gad wod se:“‘Di rakstuon di bilda fling we,a it a uol op di bildin nou.A di Laad du dis,an wi yai uopm op waid waid wen wi si di sitn we im du’?

“Therefore I tell you, the kingdom of God will be taken from you and given to a nation bearing its fruits. |“A dat mek mi tel unu se Gad kindom a-go tek we fram unu an gi di piipl dem we a-go bier fruut.
Whoever falls on this stone will be broken to pieces. But on whomever it falls, it will crush him.”|Uu jrap pan da stuon ya a-go brok op iina piisiz, an uu it jrap pan a-go mash op bad bad.”

When the chief priests and Pharisees heard His parables, they perceived that He was speaking of them.|Wen di ed priis an Farisii piipl dem ier Jiizas tuori dem we soun laik rigl, dem kech se a dem im did a chuo wod pan.

But as they tried to arrest Him, they feared the crowds, because they held Him as a prophet.|Dem did waahn lak im op, bot di kroud a piipl dem mek dem kech dem fried. Kaaz di piipl dem did tek Jiizas fi wan prafit.
Jesus spoke to them again by parables, saying|Den Jiizas chat tu dem agen a yuuz tuori we soun laik rigl. Dis a wa im se:
“The kingdom of heaven is like a certain king who arranged a marriage for his son
column2: “Yu did av wan king uufa bwai pikni did a go get marid. So im did a saat out wan big dina fi'im bwai — an a dis Gad kindom komiin laik.

column1: and sent out his servants to call those who were invited to the wedding, but they would not come.|Wen a taim nou fi di dina, di king sen im sorvant dem fi go kaal aal uu im did invait, bot dem wudn kom.

“Again, he sent out other servants, saying, ‘Tell those who are invited: See, I have prepared my supper. My oxen and fattened calves are killed, and everything is ready. Come to the wedding banquet.’|“So im sen som ada sorvant, ier im no, ‘Tel aal a uu mi did invait se, “Luk ya no, di big dina we mi did a fiks op fu'unu, it redi nou. Mi tek out mi naisis bulkou an mi speshal kou we mi mek get big an fat so dem wuda iit gud. A dem mi kil an evriting redi nou. Kom a di wedn dina.’

“But they made light of it and went their ways, one to his farm, another to his business;|“Bot dem neva weehn a tek im aan at aal, an dem lef go we sed wie. Som go a dem faam, som did av bizniz fi tek kier a.
the rest took his servants, treated them spitefully, and killed them.|Di res a dem uol aan pan im sorvant dem. Dem biit dem op an kil dem aaf.

When the king heard about it, he was angry. He sent in his army and destroyed those murderers and burned up their city.|Di king beks kyaahn don! So im sen out im suoja dem, an di suoja dem kil aaf di uol mordara dem an bon dong dem toun.
“Then he said to his servants, ‘The wedding is ready, but those who were invited were not worthy.|“Den im se tu im sorvant dem, ‘Di wedn redi bot uu mi invait no fit fi kom.
Go therefore to the streets, and invite to the wedding banquet as many as you find.’ |So gwaan outa di mien ruod an tel aal a uu yu si out de fi kom a di wedn dina.’

So those servants went out into the streets and gathered together as many as they found, both bad and good. So the wedding hall was filled with guests.|An di sorvant dem go out wich paat di mien ruod dem de an gyada op evribadi we dem fain: gud piipl, bad piipl — evribadi! Wich paat di wedn dina weehn a kip weehn ful op wid wan bag a piipl wen dem don.
“But when the king came in to see the guests, he saw a man who was not wearing wedding garments. |“Wen di king a kom iin nou fi si uu did de de, im si wan man we neehn av aan no wedn kluoz.
He said to him, ‘Friend, how did you get in here without wedding garments?’ And he was speechless.|So im se tu im se, ‘Fren, a ou yu kom iin ya na'av aan no wedn kluoz?’ Di man kudn se a ting.

“Then the king told the attendants, ‘Bind him hand and foot, take him away, and cast him into outer darkness, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.’|“Den di king tel di sorvant dem we wok iina di ous se, ‘Tai op im an an fut dem, an chuo im wich paat it blak laka migl nait. De-so, dem a-go baal an grain dem tiit, siek-a di pien we a waks dem.’
“For many are called, but few are chosen.”|“Kaaz a uol iip a piipl Gad kaal, bot a onggl wan an tuu im pik.”
Then the Pharisees went and took counsel to entangle Him in His words.
column2: Den di Farisii go we an staat mek plan fi tek Jiizas uona wod chrap im.

column1: They sent their disciples to Him with the Herodians, saying, “Teacher, we know that You are truthful and teach the way of God truthfully, and are swayed by no one. For You do not regard the person of men.|So dem sen som a fi dem falara plos Erad falara dem go a Jiizas. Dem se tu im se, “Tiicha, wi nuo se yu a taak chuut an yu riili a tiich di rait sitn bout wa Gad waahn. Yu no kier bout wa piipl tingk, kaa yu no paashal.
Tell us then, what do You think? Is it lawful to pay taxes to Caesar, or not?”|So tel wi sa, wa yu tingk, it rait fi wi pie taks tu Siiza, di Ruoman ruula, ar wi no fi pie notn?”
But Jesus perceived their wickedness and said, “Why test Me, you hypocrites?|Bot Jiizas did si se a bie wikidnis did iina dem aat, so im se, “Unu set a ipokrit unu! We unu a tes mi fa?
Show Me the tax money.” They brought Him a denarius.
column2: Shuo mi di moni unu tek pie taks.” So dem bring wan silva kain kom.

column1: He said to them, “Whose is this image and inscription?”|Jiizas se tu dem se, “A uufa picha an niem dis?”

They said to Him, “Caesar’s.”Then He said to them, “Render therefore to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and to God the things that are God’s.”|Dem ansa bak, “Siiza.” So Jiizas se tu dem se, “Den gi Siiza wa a fi'im, an gi Gad wa a fi'im.”
When they heard these words, they were amazed, and left Him and went on their way.|Wen dem ier ou im ansa, dem did fraitn. So dem go we lef im.

The same day the Sadducees, who say that there is no resurrection, came to Him and asked Him|Da siem die de som Sadyusii piipl kom a Jiizas (dem set a piipl de se, wen yu ded yu kyaahn kom bak alaiv). Dem kom kom aks Jiizas se

“Teacher, Moses said, ‘If a man dies having no children, his brother must marry his wife and raise up children for his brother.’|“Tiicha, Muoziz se, ‘Ef wan man ded an neehn get no pikni, im breda fi marid im waif, an av pikni wid ar fi im ded breda.’

Now there were seven brothers with us. The first died after he married and, having no children, left his wife to his brother. 26Likewise the second and third, on to the seventh.|Nou sevn breda did de mongks wi. Di fos wan marid wan uman an ded, an kaa im an im waif neehn av no pikni, im breda marid ar.
Likewise the second and third, on to the seventh. |Di sed ting apm tu di sekan breda, di tord wan, an aal a dem dong tu breda nomba sevn.
Last of all, the woman died also. 28Therefore, in the resurrection, whose wife shall she be of the seven? For they all had her.”|Den di uman ded tu.

Therefore, in the resurrection, whose wife shall she be of the seven? For they all had her.”|So wen a taim fi dem kom bak alaiv, wid aal a di ada ded piipl dem, a uufa waif shi a-go bi? Kaaz di uol sevn a dem did marid ar.”

Jesus answered, “You err, not knowing the Scriptures nor the power of God.|So Jiizas se tu dem se, “Unu a se ded piipl naa kom bak alaiv — bwai unu rang, kaa unu no nuo we Gad wod se, an unu no nuo Gad powa.

For in the resurrection they neither marry nor are given in marriage, but are like the angels of God in heaven.|Kaaz wen ded piipl kom bak, dem naa go a get marid, kaa dem taim de dem komiin laik ienjel we de a evn.
But concerning the resurrection of the dead, have you not read what was spoken to you by God|Nou bout da taim de wen ded piipl kom bak alaiv, unu neva riid we Gad se tu unu

‘I am the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob’? God is not the God of the dead, but of the living.”|‘Mi a Iebriyam Gad, Aizak Gad an Jiekob Gad’? Im a no Gad fi ded piipl, bot im a Gad fi uu a liv!”
When the crowds heard this, they were astonished at His teaching.|Wen di piipl dem ier da wan ya, dem fraitn tu ou im tiich.
When the Pharisees heard that He silenced the Sadducees, they came together.|Nou wen di Farisii ier ou im shot op di Sadyusii dem, dem miit op tugeda.
One of them, who was a lawyer, tested Him by asking Him|An wan a dem, wan Laa tiicha kom kom aks Jiizas wan kwestiyan fi tes im. Ier im no
“Teacher, which is the greatest commandment in the law?”|Tiicha, outa aal a di Laa dem, wich wan a di muos impuotant wan?”

Jesus said to him, “ ‘You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart, and with all your soul, and with all your mind.’|Jiizas ansa bak, “Lov di Laad we a fi yu Gad. Yu fi lov im wid aal a yu aat, aal a yu suol, an wid aal a yu main.’
This is the first and great commandment. |Dis a di fos ruul we Gad gi Muoziz, an it a di muos impuotant wan.
And the second is like it: ‘You shall love your neighbor as yourself.’|Di sekan wan tan laik it. It se, ‘Yu fi lov yu nieba siem laik ou yu lov yuself.’
On these two commandments hang all the Law and the Prophets.”|Aal a Muoziz Laa dem, plos wa di prafit dem se go bak tu dem ya tuu Laa.”
While the Pharisees were assembled, ­Jesus asked them,|Wen di Farisii dem did stil gyada op, Jiizas se tu dem se,

“What do you think of the Christ? Whose Son is He?”They said to Him, “The Son of David.”|“Di wan we a kom fi siev piipl, di Krais, wa unu tingk bout im? A uufa bwai pikni im bi?”So dem se, “A Dievid pikni.”

He said to them, “How then does David in the Spirit call Him ‘Lord,’ saying:|Ier im no, “So, ou kom wen di Spirit did a liid Dievid, Dievid siem wan kaal di wan we Gad a sen fi siev piipl, ‘Laad’? Im du dis wen im se,
‘The Lord said to my Lord,“Sit at My right hand,until I make Your enemiesYour footstool” ’?|‘Di Laad se tu fi mi Laad se:“Sidong a mi rait-an-saidtil mi put yu enimi dem anda yu fut”’
If David then calls Him ‘Lord,’ how is He his Son?”|So ef Dievid kaal im ‘Laad,’ ou im fi bi Dievid pikni? iihn?”
No one was able to answer Him a word, nor from that day on did anyone dare to ask Him any more questions.|Nobadi kudn se notn, an fram da die de, nobadi no iivn tingk fi aks im notn muo.
Then Jesus said to the crowds and to His disciples
column2: Den Jiizas ton tu di kroud an tu im speshal falara dem tu. Ier im no:

column1: “The scribes and the Pharisees sit in Moses’ seat.
column2: “Di Laa tiicha an di Farisii dem sidong iina Muoziz siit.

column1: Therefore, whatever they tell you to observe, that observe and do, but do not do their works. For they speak, but do nothing.|So unu fi lisn dem an du aal we dem tel unu fi du. Bot no du wa dem du, kaa dem no du wa dem priich se.

They fasten heavy loads that are hard to carry and lay them on men’s shoulders, but they themselves will not move them with their finger.|Dem tai aan evi luod pan piipl shuolda we aad fi kyari, bot dem no iivn waahn lif op wan fingga fi elp dem.

“They do all their works to be seen by men. They make their Scripture boxes broad and lengthen the tassels on their prayer shawls.|“Dem jos shuo aaf! Dem du aal we dem du fi mek piipl si dem. Unu si ou dem mek fi dem leda baks wid difrant difrant vors outa Gad wod wel big, ye, di siem wan we dem tai aan pan dem ed an dem an. An luk pan dem tasl, luk ou lang it bi!
They love the places of honor at feasts, and the prominent seats in the synagogues|A bier impuotant siit dem lov sidong iina wen dem go a big dina an iina dem choch.
and greetings in the marketplaces, and being called ‘Rabbi’ by men.|Dem lov wen piipl gi dem speshal oudi wen dem go a maakit, an wen dem kaal dem, ‘Tiicha’.

“But do not be called ‘Rabbi,’ for you have one Teacher, the Christ, and you are all brothers.|“Bot nobadi no fi kaal unu, ‘tiicha,’ kaa a onggl wan Tiicha de bout, plos di uol a unu a breda an sista; nobadi no aiya dan nobadi.
And call no man on earth your father, for you have one Father, who is in heaven.|An unu no fi kaal nobadi ya-so pan ort unu ‘faada,’ kaa a onggl wan Faada de bout an im de a evn.
Nor be called teachers, for you have one Teacher, the Christ. |An mi se, nobadi no fi kaal unu ‘tiicha,’ kaa a onggl wan Tiicha unu av an dat a di wan we Gad sen fi siev piipl, di Krais.
He who is greatest among you shall be your servant. |Di wan mongks unu we a di muos impuotant sumadi, a dem a-go sorv unu.

For he who exalts himself will be humbled, and he who humbles himself will be exalted.|An enibadi we kom kom a big op demself, dem a-go get sitn fi kwaiyat dem. An di wan dem we ombl demself, a dem Gad a-go big op.

“Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! You shut the kingdom of heaven against men. For you neither enter yourselves, nor allow those who are entering to go in. |“Bot yu si aal dem Laa tiicha ya an di Farisii piipl dem, chobl fu'unu! Uol ipokrit! Unu shot Gad kindom iina piipl fies! Unu no go iin de, an unu naa lou piipl we a chrai fi go iin de, fi go iin.

Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! You devour widows’ houses and for pretense make long prayers. Therefore you will receive the greater condemnation.|Chobl fi unu we a skraib an farisee, unu ipokrit unu! Yu mash dong di wido dem ows an priten fi a prie fi lang. So unu ago get kandem muo dan di resa dem.

“Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! You travel sea and land to make one proselyte, and when he becomes one, you make him twice as much a son of hell as yourselves.|“Mi se di Laa tiicha an Farisii piipl dem chobl fu'unu! Unu ipokrit unu! Unu kraas uova lan an sii fi chrai chienj wan sumadi fi go fu'unu wie, an wen da wan sumadi de staat worship Gad fu'unu wie, unu mek dem fit fi go el tuu taim muo dan unu!

“Woe to you, blind guides, who say, ‘If anyone swears by the temple, it is nothing. But if anyone swears by the gold of the temple, he is obligated.’ |“Chobl fu'unu we a liid piipl an kyaahn si wan ting. Bout unu a se, ‘Ef nobadi swier pan Gad ous dat no mata, bot ef dem swier pan di guol fi Gad ous — a dat mata.’

You blind fools! Which is greater, the gold or the temple that sanctifies the gold?|Unu blain fuul unu! A wich wan muo impuotant, iihn? Di guol? Ar Gad ous? No kaa a Gad ous di guol yuuz fa iina di fos plies mek it komiin so impuotant?

And you say, ‘If anyone swears by the altar, it is nothing. But if anyone swears by the gift on it, he is obligated.’ |Ier dis tu no, unu se, ‘Enibadi we swier pan di alta, ef dem no du wa dem swier fi du, it no mata, bot ef dem swier pan di aafrin we sumadi bring go a di alta dem afi du wa dem pramis fi du.’
You blind fools! Which is greater, the gift or the altar that sanctifies the gift? |Unu blain sa! Wich wan muo impuotant? Di aafrin, ar di alta we mek di aafrin wot sitn?
Therefore he who swears by the altar, swears by it and by all things on it.|So enibadi we swier pan di alta swier pan it an pan evriting we de pan it.
But he who swears by the temple, swears by it and by Him who dwells in it.|An enibadi we swier pan Gad ous, swier pan it an swier pan Gad we liv iin de tu.
And he who swears by heaven, swears by the throne of God and by Him who sits on it.|An ef nobadi a swier an kaal evn niem, dem a swier pan Gad chuon an pan di wan we sidong pan di chuon tu.

“Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! You tithe mint and dill and cumin, but have neglected the weightier matters of the law: justice and mercy and faith. These you ought to have done without leaving the others undone.|“A se chobl fu'unu Laa tiicha, an aal unu Farisii — chobl! Ipokrit! Unu gi Gad wan outa evri ten mint, spais laik dil, an ada siiznin laik kyuumin, bot di sitn dem we muo impuotant iina Gad Laa unu no bizniz wid dem de. Im se unu fi chriit piipl fier, unu fi gud an kain tu dem an fi mek shuor se im kyan chos unu kaa unu du wa im se unu fi du, bot unu no pie dem paat a di Laa de no main. A dem paat a di Laa de unu fi fala, bot unu fi stil memba fi du di ada wan dem tu.

You blind guides who strain out a gnat and swallow a camel!|Unu blain no bat, bout unu a liid piipl! Unu chrien out evriting we unu jringk fi mek shuor se no iivn wan lili flai no iin de, bot unu siem wan swala wan uol-a kyamil an no iivn nuo!

“Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! You cleanse the outside of the cup and dish, but inside they are full of extortion and greed.|“Yu si aal dem Laa tiicha ya, an di Farisii piipl dem, chobl fu'unu! Uol Ipokrit! Unu wash outsaida kop an pliet kliin kliin, bot wa unu put iina dem doti, kaaz a griidi unu griidi. Unu yuuz wikidnis an tek dem fram piipl. Unu jos bizniz bout unuself wan.
You blind Pharisee, first cleanse the inside of the cup and dish, that the outside of them may also be clean.|Blain Farisii! Kliin insaida di kop fos, so di outsaid paat kyan kliin op tu!

“Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! You are like whitewashed tombs, which indeed appear beautiful outwardly, but inside are full of dead men’s bones and of all uncleanness.|“A se, yu si unu Laa tiicha an Farisii — chobl fu'unu! Set a ipokrit unu! Unu tan laik tuum we dem pient wait a ier taim — priti pan di outsaid bot insaida dem ful op a ded man buon an aal kain-a doti, ratn sitn.

So you also outwardly appear righteous to men, but inside you are full of hypocrisy and iniquity.|A siem so pan di outsaida unu luk laik gud gud piipl we du evriting we mek Gad api, bot iina unu aat unu a big big ipokrit — wikid an ful op a sin!

“Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! You build the tombs of the prophets, and adorn the memorials of the righteous|“A se chobl fu'unu Laa tiicha an Farisii piipl, unu set a ipokrit unu! Unu bil op tuum fi di prafit dem. An di piipl dem we did liv gud iina Gad yai, unu priti op dem griev.

and say, ‘If we lived in the days of our fathers, we would not have partaken with them in shedding the blood of the prophets.’|An ier unu no, ‘Ef wi did liv iina wi faada faada dem taim wi wuda neva ron wid dem go kil aaf di prafit dem.’

Therefore you are witnesses against yourselves that you are sons of those who murdered the prophets.|Bot wen unu se dem sitn de, a taak unu taak gens unuself, an a pruuv unu a pruuv se unu riili kom fram piipl we did kil di prafit dem.
Fill up, then, the measure of your fathers’  guilt.|So gwaan go don wa unu piipl dem weehn staat.
“You serpents! You generation of vipers! How can you escape the judgment of hell?|“Unu set a siniek an siniek pikni unu! Ou unu fi eva get we, an no get ponish dong a el, iihn?

Therefore I send you prophets, and wise men, and scribes. Some of them you will kill and crucify, and some you will scourge in your synagogues and persecute them from city to city|A dat mek mi a-go sen prafit tu unu, mi a-go sen som man we waiz kom, an som piipl we tiich Gad wie, som a dem unu a-go kil an niel pan di kraas, an som, unu a-go biit dem iina di Juu dem choch an ron dem dong fram toun tu toun laik wail animal.

that on you may come all the righteous blood shed on the earth, from the blood of righteous Abel to the blood of Zechariah son of Berekiah, whom you murdered between the temple and the altar. |So aal a di piipl dem we did a liv rait iina Gad yai an unu kil dem, fi dem blod a-go de pan fu'unu shuolda. Fram Iebl we did a liv rait iina Gad yai, tu Zakaraiya — Barakiya bwai pikni. A im unu kil aaf bitwiin Gad ous an di alta wich paat dem bon sakrifais.
Truly I say to you, all these things will come on this generation.|A tel unu dis ya, an a chuu mi a taak, da set a piipl ya, we a liv iina da taim ya, a unu a-go pie fi aal a dem sitn ya!

“O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, you who kill the prophets and stone those who are sent to you, how often I would have gathered your children together as a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, but you would not! |“Ai Jeruusilem, Jeruusilem, yu we kil di prafit dem an stuon di wan dem we Gad sen tu unu, mi lang fi gyada yu piipl roun mi, laik ou foul gyada fi ar pikni dem anda ar wing, bot unu neva waahn mi fi dwi'it!
Look, your house is left to you desolate.|Bot luk ya, Gad tek we im ous fram mongks unu. So wa unu bil op an kaal Gad ous, im no de de no muo.
For I tell you, you shall not see Me again until you say, ‘Blessed is He who comes in the name of the Lord.’”|Mi a tel unu dis, unu naa si mi agen til unu se, ‘Gad bles di wan we im sen.’”

Jesus departed from the temple and was leaving when His disciples came to show Him the temple buildings.|Jiizas did lef di yaad we Gad ous de an a go we, wen im falara dem kom kom a shuo im di bildin dem we mek op Gad ous.

Jesus answered them, “Do you not see all these things? Truly I say to you, not one stone shall be left here upon another that shall not be thrown down.”|Jiizas se tu dem se, “Unu si aal a dem sitn ya? Ier mi no, an a chuu mi a taak, no iivn wan a dem stuon ya a-go lef pan tap a dem wan aneda. Di uol a dem a-go lik dong!”

As He sat on the Mount of Olives, the disciples came to Him privately, saying, “Tell us, when will these things be, and what will be the sign of Your coming and of the end of the age?”|Wen Jiizas did a sidong pan Mount Aliv im falara dem kom tu im wan said an se, “Tel wi, a wen aal dem sitn ya a-go apm? An a wa kain-a sain a-go shuo se yu a kom bak an di worl suun don?”
Jesus answered them, “Take heed that no one deceives you. |So Jiizas se tu dem se, “Wach out, no mek nobadi fuul unu op.

For many will come in My name, saying, ‘I am the Christ,’ and will deceive many.|Kaaz a uol iip a piipl a-go kom yuuz op yuuz op mi niem, an a se, ‘Mi a Krais, a mi Gad sen fi siev piipl,’ an dem a-go fuul op nof piipl.

You will hear of wars and rumors of wars. See that you are not troubled. For all these things must happen, but the end is not yet.|Unu a-go ier se waar a gwaan a woi woi an waar a gwaan anda unu nuoz. Bot mek shuor se unu no fraitn yu no, kaa aal a dem sitn ya afi gwaan, bot non a dem de no miin di worl don yet.

For nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom. There will be famines, epidemics, and earthquakes in various places. |Kaaz wan set a piipl a-go waar gens wan neks set a piipl, an kindom a-go fait gens kindom. Fuud a-go shaat iina nof nof plies an uol iip a piipl a-go staav, pan tap a dat ortkwiek a-go kom shiek op difrant difrant plies.
All these are the beginning of sorrows.
column2: Aal a dem sitn ya a jos di fos set a lieba pien we unu a-go fiil wen di nyuu worl a baan.

column1: “Then they will hand you over to be persecuted and will kill you. And you will be hated by all nations for My name’s sake. |“Wen dat apm, dem a-go tek unu, an gi unu uova tu di piipl dem we a-go ponish unu an kil unu. An kaa unu a fala mi, piipl fram aal bout a-go iet unu.
Then many will fall away, and betray one another, and hate one another.|Uol iip a piipl a-go gi op an tap fala mi. Dem a-go sel out dem wan aneda an iet dem wan aneda.
And many false prophets will rise and will deceive many. |Nof nof faalz prafit a-go kom bout an chrik chrik op uol iip a piipl,
Because iniquity will abound, the love of many will grow cold. |an kaa wikidnis a-go pred laik wail faiya, muos piipl aat a-go ton kuol an dem naa bada lov piipl laik wan taim.
But he who endures to the end shall be saved.|Bot aal uu eng aan an tan op chrang no mata wa, a dem a-go get siev.

And this gospel of the kingdom will be preached throughout the world as a testimony to all nations, and then the end will come.|An da Gud Nyuuz ya bout Gad Kindom afi go priich aal uova di worl. So evribadi wi get di chaans fi ier di chuut. A onggl afta dat, di worl a-go don.

“So when you see the ‘abomination of desolation,’spoken of by Daniel the prophet, standing in the holy place (let the reader understand), |“Bot bifuo dat apm, unu gweehn si wa di prafit Daniyel weehn taak bout, wen im did a chat bout di ‘wikid wikid sitn we go gens Gad an doti op Gad ous,’ ou it tan op iina Gad plies (mek shuor se evribadi we riid dis ya andastan we it miin).
then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains. |Dem taim de, uu de a Judiya fi ron we go op a di mountn dem.
Let him who is on the housetop not go down to take anything out of his house.|Uu de pan ruuf tap, no fi kom dong kom tek out notn outa dem ous.
Let him who is in the field not return to take his clothes.|An di wan dem we did gaan a bush, no fi ton bak fi no jakit.
Woe to those who are with child and to those who nurse in those days!
column2: Wat a sitn iina dem taim de fi uman we av biebi iina beli an fi mada we av yong biebi!

column1: Pray that your escape will not be in the winter or on the Sabbath.|Prie se unu na'afi go ron we wen staam a kom ar iina rieni taim, an pan di Sabat die niida.

For then will be great tribulation, such as has not happened since the beginning of the world until now, no, nor ever shall be.|Dem taim de piipl a-go sofa bad bad. Sofarieshan neva so wikid fram di worl a mek til nou, an nobadi naa go eva sofa so agen.

“Unless those days were shortened, no one would be saved. But for the sake of the elect those days will be shortened.|An ef Gad neehn mek op im main se im a kot dong ou lang da taim de fi laas, nobadi wudn liv. Bot siek-a di piipl dem we im pik, im mek op im main se im a-go kot it dong.
Then if anyone says to you, ‘Look, here is the Christ,’ or ‘There He is,’ do not believe it.|Da taim de, ef nobadi kom an a se, “Luk ya, si Krais ya!” ar “Luk! Si im de!” No fala dem.

For false christs and false prophets will arise and show great signs and wonders to deceive, if possible, even the elect.|Kaaz piipl a-go kom kom se dem a di wan we Gad sen fi siev piipl, wen notn no go so. An som faalz prafit a-go shuo op tu. Dem piipl de a-go wok aal kain-a mirikl an shuo aal kain-a sain fi chrik op piipl, dong tu aal di piipl dem we Gad pik, di faalz prafit dem wi chrik op tu ef dem get di chaans.
Listen, I have told you beforehand.|Unu beta memba se mi weehn tel unu dem sitn ya bifuo dem apm.

“So, if they say to you, ‘Look, He is in the desert,’ do not go there; or, ‘Look, He is in the private chambers,’ do not believe it.|“So ef sumadi go se, ‘Luk ya, im iina di dezot.’ No go out de. Ar ef dem se, ‘Luk ya! luk ya! Im a aid ya-so!’ No lisn dem.

For as the lightning comes from the east and flashes to the west, so will be the coming of the Son of Man.|Kaaz jos laik ou laitnin flash fram iis go wes an evribadi si it, a siem so di Man we Gad Pik a-go kom bak — evribadi a-go si im.
Wherever the carcass is, there the eagles will be gathered together.|Eniwe di ded badi de, a de-so jangkro a-go gyada.

“Immediately after the tribulation of those days,‘the sun will be darkened,the moon will not give its light;the stars will fall from heaven,and the powers of the heavens will be shaken.’|“Bot iina dem taim de, likl afta di sofarieshan don,“Di son a-go daak op,di muun naa go shainan di staar dem a-go jrap outa di skai.Evriting we iina di skai a-go get shiek outa dem plies.

“Then the sign of the Son of Man will appear in heaven, and then all the tribes of the earth will mourn, and they will see the Son of Man coming on the clouds of heaven with power and great glory. |“Den, yu av sitn we mek evribadi nuo se di Man we Gad Pik a kom, piipl a-go si da sitn de op iina di ier, an piipl fram aal uova a-go staat baal. Dem a-go si di Man we Gad Pik a kom pan kloud we kom outa evn, an im a-go av powa, an wan brait brait lait we kom fram Gad a shain roun im.

And He will send His angels with a great sound of a trumpet, and they shall gather His elect from the four winds, from one end of the heavens to the other.|Im wi sen im ienjel dem fi kom bluo di chompit loud loud, an dem gweehn gyada op di piipl dem we im pik fram naat, sout, iis an wes, fram aal uova di worl.

“Now learn this lesson from the fig tree: When its branch becomes tender and grows leaves, you know that summer is near.|“Nou lorn sopm fram di fig chrii: Wen taim unu si dem branch get wel saaf an griin, an dem staat sen out nyuu liif, unu nuo se soma suun kom.

So also, when you shall see all these things, you know that it is near, even at the doors. |A siem so, enitaim unu si aal a dem sitn ya, nuo se di wan we Gad sen fi siev piipl suun kom; a laik im de rait outsaida unu duor.

Truly I say to you, this generation will not pass away until all these things take place. |Mi a tel unu dis an a chuu mi a taak, di piipl we a liv iina dem taim ya naa go ded til aal a dem sitn ya apm.
Heaven and earth will pass away, but My words will never pass away.|Evn an ort naa go de bout fi eva, bot fi mi wod a-go laas fi eva.

“Concerning that day and hour no one knows, not even the angels of heaven, but My Father only.|“Nobadi no nuo di die an di taim wen aal a dem sitn de a-go apm, nobadi no nuo a wen, no iivn di ienjel dem iina evn — onggl Faada Gad wan nuo dat.

As were the days of Noah, so will be the coming of the Son of Man.|Siem ou tingz did tan iina Nowa taim, a siem so it a-go bi wen di Man we Gad Pik kom bak. 38Kaaz iina da taim de bifuo di flod kom, piipl did a nyam an jringk, uman a marid an man a marid rait op tu di die wen Nowa go iina di aak.

For as in the days before the flood, they were eating and drinking, marrying and giving in marriage, until the day Noah entered the ark|Kaaz iina da taim de bifuo di flod kom, piipl did a nyam an jringk, uman a marid an man a marid rait op tu di die wen Nowa go iina di aak.

and did not know until the flood came and took them all away, so will be the coming of the Son of Man. |An dem neehn nuo notn til di flod kom kom tek we di uol a dem. A siem ting a-go apm wen di Man we Gad Pik kom bak.
Two will be in the field; one will be taken, and the other left.|Dem taim de, tuu man wi outa bush an wan get tek we, lef di neks wan.
Two women will be grinding at the mill; one will be taken, and the other left.|Tuu uman wi a grain grien an wan get tek we lef di neda wan.
“Watch therefore, for you do not know what hour your Lord will come. |“So mek shuor se unu eva a wach an a luk out, kaa unu no nuo a wich die unu Laad a-go kom bak.

But know this, that if the owner of the house had known what hour the thief would come, he would have watched and not have let his house be broken into.|Bot andastan dis: Ef di uona fi di ous did nuo a wa taim a nait di tiif a kom, im wudn mek di tiif brok iina im ous.
Therefore you also must be ready, for in an hour when you least expect, the Son of Man is coming.|A siem so unu fi redi, kaa di Man we Gad Pik naa go kom wen unu tingk im a kom.”

“Who then is a faithful and wise servant, whom his master has made ruler over his household to give them food at the appointed time?|“So den, a uu a di waiz sorvant we di maasta kyan chos fi dwi'im wok? Uu a di wan we di maasta put inchaaj a im uol ous, an mek shier out di sorvant dem fuud wen a taim fi dem nyam?
Blessed is that servant whom his master will find so doing when he comes.
column2: It a-go gud fi di sorvant we di maasta kom fain a du im wok.

column1: Truly, I say to you that he will make him ruler over all his goods. |Mi tel unu dis, an a chuu mi a taak, di maasta a-go put im inchaaj a evriting im uon.
But if that evil servant says in his heart, ‘My master delays his coming,’|Bot ef da sorvant de wikid an go aal se tu imself se, ‘Mi maasta naa kom bak fi nou.’
and begins to strike his fellow servants and eat and drink with the drunkards|An im staat biit di ada sorvant dem, an nyam an jringk wid jongkad
the master of that servant will come on a day when he does not look for him and in an hour he is not aware of
column2: an im maasta go kom bak wan die wen im naa luk fi im an wan taim wen im naa chek se im wuda riich bak.

column1: and will cut him in pieces and appoint him his portion with the hypocrites, where there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.|Di maasta a-go chap im iina tuu an fling im we di ipokrit dem de. De-so piipl a-go baal an a grain dem tiit di wie pien a waks dem.”

Then the kingdom of heaven shall be like ten virgins, who took their lamps and went out to meet the bridegroom. |“Da taim de, Gad kindom a-go komiin laik ten yong gyal we tek dem lamp go miit di man we a get marid.
Five of them were wise and five were foolish.|Faiv a dem did fu-fuul, an di neks faiv did av sens.
Those who were foolish took their lamps, but took no oil with them.|Wen di fu-fuul wan dem tek fi dem lamp, dem neehn bring ekschra ail.
But the wise took jars of oil with their lamps.
column2: Bot di wan dem we av sens did waak wid ekschra ail fi fi dem lamp.

column1: While the bridegroom delayed, they all rested and slept.|Di braidgruum did a tek lang fi kom, an sliip did staat fi uol dem dong an di uol a dem jrap a sliip.
“But at midnight there was a cry, ‘Look, the bridegroom is coming! Come out to meet him!’|“Bot iina di migl a di nait sumadi shout out: ‘Ei, di braidgruum de ya! Kom kom miit im.’
“Then all those virgins rose and trimmed their lamps.
column2: “Di yong gyal dem get op an staat fiks op dem lamp so it kuda bon gud.

column1: But the foolish said to the wise, ‘Give us some of your oil, for our lamps have gone out.’|Ier di fu-fuul wan dem tu di waiz wan dem no, ‘Gi wi som a unu ail no, kaa fi wi lamp suun out.’

“The wise answered, ‘No, lest there not be enough for us and you. Go rather to those who sell it, and buy some for yourselves.’|“‘Nuo, nuo,’ dem ansa bak. ‘Wi na'av inof fi shier fi wi an fi unu. Go tu uu sel it an go bai som.’

“But while they went to buy some, the bridegroom came, and those who were ready went in with him to the wedding banquet. And the door was shut.|“Bot wen dem go we go bai di ail, di braidgruum go kom, an di wan dem we did redi go wid im wich paat di wedn dina did a kip. Den di sorvant dem lak di duor.
“Afterward, the other virgins came also, saying, ‘Lord, Lord, open the door for us.’|“Likl muo, di ada yong gyal dem kom bak. Ier dem no, ‘Laad, laad, uopm di duor fi wi no!’
“But he answered, ‘Truly I say to you, I do not know you.’|“Bot im ansa bak, ‘Ier mi no, an a chuu mi a taak, mi no iivn nuo unu!’

“Watch therefore, for you know neither the day nor the hour in which the Son of Man is coming.|“So ier wa, mek shuor se unu eva redi an a luk out, kaa unu no nuo a wich die ar a wa taim di Man we Gad Pik a-go kom bak.

“Again, the kingdom of heaven is like a man traveling into a far country, who called his own servants and entrusted his goods to them.|“Mek mi se dis tu, da taim de, Gad kindom a-go komiin laik wan man we a go wan faar plies, so im kaal op im sorvant dem an gi dem aal we im uon fi tek kier a til im kom bak.

To one he gave five talents,  to another two, and to another one, to every man according to his ability. And immediately he took his journey. |Im gi wan a dem faiv bag a guol, im gi wan neks wan tuu bag, an im gi wan neks wan wan bag a guol. Im gi dem bies pan wa dem kyan manij. Den im lef go wich paat im a go.

He who had received the five talents went and traded with them and made another five talents. |Di wan we get di faiv bag a guol, im lef go we sed taim an yuuz da faiv bag de mek wan neks faiv bag a guol.
So also, he who had received two gained another two. |Di wan we did av tuu bag mek tuu muo tu.
But he who had received one went and dug in the ground and hid his master’s money.
column2: Bot di wan we did get di wan bag a guol neehn du a ting dan go we go dig wan uol iina di grong an aid im maasta guol iin de.

column1: “After a long time the master of those servants came and settled accounts with them.|“Lang afta dat, di maasta fi di sorvant dem kom bak an kom kom fain out a wa dem weehn du wid im guol dem.

He who had received five talents came and brought the other five talents, saying, ‘Master, you entrusted to me five talents. Look, I have gained five talents more.’|Di wan we did get di faiv bag kom bring faiv muo, ier im no, ‘Sa, yu gi mi faiv bag a guol fi tek kier a. Si mi mek faiv muo pan tap a it de.’

“His master said to him, ‘Well done, you good and faithful servant. You have been faithful over a few things. I will make you ruler over many things. Enter the joy of your master.’|“Im maasta se, ‘Yu du gud mi sorvant! Yu a wan gud sorvant an mi kyan chos yu. Yu tek gud kier a wan likl sitn, so mi a-go mek yu tek chaaj a biga tingz! Kom kom nyam fuud an daans an praans wid mi.’

“He who had received two talents also came and said, ‘Master, you entrusted me with two talents. See, I have gained two more talents besides them.’|“Di wan we did get di tuu bag a guol dem kom tu im tu kom se, ‘Sa, yu did gi mi tuu bag a guol fi tek kier a. Si de, mi mek tuu muo pan tap a we yu did gi mi.’

“His master said to him, ‘Well done, you good and faithful servant. You have been faithful over a few things. I will make you ruler over many things. Enter the joy of your master.’|“Di maasta se tu im se, ‘Yu du gud mi sorvant! Yu a wan gud sorvant an mi kyan chos yu. Yu tek gud kier a wan likl sitn, so mi a-go mek yu tek chaaj a biga tingz! Kom kom nyam fuud an daans an praans wid mi.’

“Then he who had received the one talent came and said, ‘Master, I knew that you are a hard man, reaping where you did not sow, and gathering where you did not winnow. |“Den di sorvant we did get di wan bag a guol kom kom se, ‘Sa, mi nuo se yu a wan aad man. Yu pik we yu no plaant op an gyada we yu neehn skyata no siid
So I was afraid, and went and hid your talent in the ground. Here you have what is yours.’|siek-a dat mi did fried, so mi aid yu guol iina di grong. Si de, yu get wa a fi yu uon.’

“His master answered, ‘You wicked and slothful servant! You knew that I reap where I have not sown, and gather where I have not winnowed.|“Bot im maasta ansa bak, ‘Yu woklis, gud fi notn, wikid sorvant yu! So yu nuo se mi pik we mi no plaant an gyada we mi neehn skyata no siid?

Then you ought to have given my money to the bankers, and at my coming I should have received what was my own with interest.|So wa mek yu neehn put mi moni iina di bangk? Da wie de, wen mi kom bak, mi wuda get muo moni pan mi moni!
“ ‘So take the talent from him, and give it to him who has ten talents.|“Ier mi no, tek di guol fram im an tek it gi di wan we av ten.

For to everyone who has will more be given, and he will have an abundance. But from him who has nothing, even what he has will be taken away.|Kaaz di wan we av, a-go get muo. Bot di wan we na'av notn, aal we im av a-go get tek we fram im.

And throw the unprofitable servant into outer darkness, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.’|An tek da woklis sorvant ya dash im out wich paat it blak laka migl nait. A de-so piipl a-go a baal an grain dem tiit di wie pien a waks dem.’

“When the Son of Man comes in His glory, and all the holy angels with Him, then He will sit on the throne of His glory.|“Wen di Man we Gad Pik kom wid di powa we im av kaa im a king, an aal a di ienjel dem kom wid im, im a-go sidong pan im tap-a-tap chuon.

Before Him will be gathered all nations, and He will separate them one from another as a shepherd separates his sheep from the goats. |Evribadi pan ort a-go kom tugeda infronta im, an im a-go plit op di piipl dem laik ou sumadi we tek kier a shiip, muuv di shiip dem fram wich paat di guot dem de.
He will set the sheep at His right hand, but the goats at the left.|Im a-go put di shiip dem pan im rait-an-said an di guot dem pan im lef.

“Then the King will say to those at His right hand, ‘Come, you blessed of My Father, inherit the kingdom prepared for you since the foundation of the world.|“Den di king a-go se tu di wan dem pan im rait-an-said se, ‘aal a unu we mi Faada bles, kom kom tek Gad Kindom, a fu'unu uon. Gad did fiks it op fu'unu fram im a mek di worl.

For I was hungry and you gave Me food, I was thirsty and you gave Me drink, I was a stranger and you took Me in.|Kaaz mi did onggri an unu gi mi fuud. Mi chuot did jrai an unu gi mi sitn fi jringk. Unu neehn nuo mi an unu tek mi iin siem wie.

I was naked and you clothed Me, I was sick and you visited Me, I was in prison and you came to Me.’|Mi neehn av aan no kluoz an unu gi mi kluoz fi put aan. Mi did sik an unu tek kier a mi. Mi did de iina prizn an unu kom luk fi mi.’

“Then the righteous will answer Him, ‘Lord, when did we see You hungry and feed You, or thirsty and give You drink?|“Den di piipl dem we du rait iina Gad yai a-go ansa bak se, ‘Laad, a wen wi did si yu onggri an fiid yu, ar a wen fi yu chuot weehn jrai an wi gi yu sitn fi jringk?
When did we see You a stranger and take You in, or naked and clothe You?|A wen wi si yu, no nuo yu, an weehn tek yu iina wi ous?
And when did we see You sick or in prison and come to You?’|A wen wi weehn si yu sik sa, ar a wen yu did iina prizn an wi did kom kom luk fi yu?’

“The King will answer, ‘Truly I say to you, as you have done it for one of the least of these brothers of Mine, you have done it for Me.’|“An di king a-go ansa bak, ‘Mi tel unu dis, an a chuu mi a taak, di taim dem wen unu weehn du dem sitn de fi wan a mi breda an sista dem we piipl se no wot notn, a laik se a mi unu did dwi'it fa.’

“Then He will say to those at the left hand, ‘Depart from Me, you cursed, into the eternal fire, prepared for the devil and his angels.|“Den di king a-go se tu aal uu de pan im lef-an-said se, ‘Gwe fram saida mi! Gwaan go bon op iina di faiya we a bliez fi eva an eva. A it Gad did fiks op fi di devl an im ienjel dem, bot im a sen unu go de tu!
For I was hungry and you gave Me no food, I was thirsty and you gave Me no drink|Kaaz mi did onggri an unu neehn gi mi notn fi nyam. Wen mi chuot weehn jrai unu neehn gi mi notn fi jringk.

I was a stranger and you did not take Me in, I was naked and you did not clothe Me, I was sick and in prison and you did not visit Me.’|Unu neehn nuo mi an unu neehn tek mi iin wen mi did kom mongks unu. Mi neva av aan no kluoz an unu neehn gi mi non fi put aan. Mi weehn sik, mi did de iina prizn an unu neehn kom luk fi mi.’

“Then they also will answer Him, ‘Lord, when did we see You hungry or thirsty or a stranger or naked or sick or in prison, and did not serve You?’|“Den dem tu a-go se, ‘Laad a wen wi did si yu an yu weehn onggri ar yu chuot weehn jrai? A wen yu neehn av aan no kluoz Laad, an a wen yu weehn sik ar iina prizn an wi neehn elp yu, iihn? A wen dat?’

“He will answer, ‘Truly I say to you, as you did it not for one of the least of these, you did it not for Me.’|“Den im a-go ansa bak, ‘Mi tel unu dis an a chuu mi a taak, di siem wie unu neehn du dem sitn de fi wan a mi breda an sista dem we piipl se no wot notn, a siem so unu neehn du dem fi mi, kaa a laik a mi unu neehn elp wen unu neva elp dem.’

“And they will go away into eternal punishment, but the righteous into eternal life.”|“An dem piipl ya, dem a-go go wich paat dem get ponish fi eva, bot di wan dem we du we rait iina Gad yai, Gad a-go mek dem liv fi eva.”
When Jesus had finished all these sayings, He said to His disciples|Wen Jiizas don se aal a dem sitn ya, im se tu im speshal falara dem se

“You know that after two days is the Passover, and the Son of Man will be betrayed to be crucified.”|“Unu nuo se tuu die fram nou di Paasuova alidie we piipl nyam bred widout yiis a kom, an dem a-go an uova di Man we Gad Pik so dem kyan kil im pan di kraas.”

Then the chief priests, the scribes, and the elders of the people gathered in the palace of the high priest, who was called Caiaphas|Den di ed priis an di Juu elda dem miit op wich paat di liida fi di priis dem liv — di liida fi di priis dem did niem Kaiyafas.
and took counsel that they might take Jesus covertly and kill Him.
column2: Di gruup a dem plan ou dem wuda fain som chrikifai wie an uol aan pan Jiizas so dem kuda kil im.

column1: But they said, “Not on the feast day, lest there be an uproar among the people.”|Bot dem se, “Mek wi no dwi'it pan di Paasuova alidie, kaa di piipl dem mait-a kaaz el-an-pouda-ous!”
When Jesus was in Bethany in the house of Simon the leper|Jiizas did de a Betani, a Saiman yaad. Saiman a wan a dem we did av di siknis we mek yu skin fasi-fasi.

a woman came to Him having an alabaster jar of very expensive ointment and poured it on His head as He sat at supper.|Nou wen Jiizas did de de-so, wan uman kom tu im wid wan dier porfyuum iina wan likl stuon jaar. Jiizas did de roun di tiebl wen shi tek di stuon jaar an chuo out di porfyuum pan im ed.
When His disciples saw it, they were indignant, saying, “For what purpose is this waste?|Wen im falara dem si dis ya, dem beks so til dem bout fi bos, ier dem no, “We shi wies di porfyuum so fa?
This ointment might have been sold for a large sum and given to the poor.”|It kuda did sel fi uol iip, an tek di moni gi puo piipl!”

When Jesus perceived it, He said to them, “Why do you trouble the woman? She has done a good work for Me. |Jiizas did don nuo wa dem did a se, so im se tu dem se, “We unu a bada di uman fa? A sitn gud shi du tu mi.
For you have the poor always with you, but you do not always have Me. |Kaaz unu a-go eva av puo piipl roun unu, bot unu naa go av mi roun ya wid unu fi eva.
In pouring this ointment on My body, she did it for My burial.|Wen shi chuo di porfyuum pan mi badi, shi a get mi redi fi wen dem a-go beri mi.

Truly I say to you, wherever this gospel shall be preached in the whole world, what this woman has done will be told in memory of her.”|Ier mi no, an a chuu mi a taak, enitaim piipl priich da Gud Nyuuz ya roun di worl, dem a-go memba ar an taak bout wa shi du.
Then one of the twelve, who was called Judas Iscariot, went to the chief priests|Den wan a Jiizas twelv falara dem, di wan we niem Juudas Iskyariyat, lef go wich paat di ed priis dem de.

and said to them, “What will you give me if I hand Him over to you?” And they paid him thirty pieces of silver. |Ier im tu dem no, “Wa unu wi gi mi, ef mi elp unu ares Jiizas?” So dem kount out toti silva kain an se a dat im wi get.
From that moment he searched for an opportunity to betray Him.
column2: Fram da taim de Juudas staat luk fi wan chaans fi sel out Jiizas.

column1: On the first day of the Feast of Unleavened Bread the disciples came to Jesus, saying, “Where will You have us to prepare for You to eat the Passover?”|Nou di alidie wen piipl nyam bred widout yiis did kom. Pan di fos die a da alidie de, Jiizas speshal falara dem kom tu im an se, “We yu waahn wi fi luk aafa di Paasuova fuud fi yu nyam?”

He said, “Go into the city to a certain man, and say to him, ‘The Teacher says, My time is at hand. I will keep the Passover at your house with My disciples.’ ”|So Jiizas se, “Go tu suo-an-so iina di toun an tel im dis, ‘Di Tiicha se, “Mi taim suun kom. Mi a-go nyam di Paasuova fuud wid mi speshal falara dem a fi yu ous.”
The disciples did as Jesus had directed them, and they prepared the Passover.|Im falara dem du wa im tel dem fi du, an dem luk bout di Paasuova fuud.
When evening came, He sat down with the twelve. |Wen iivnin kom, im go sidong a di tiebl wid im twelv falara dem.
And as they were eating, He said, “Truly I say to you, one of you will betray Me.”|An wen dem de de a nyam a gwaan, im se tu dem se, “Mi tel unu dis, an a chuu mi a taak, wan a unu a-go sel mi out.”
They were very sorrowful, and each of them began saying to Him, “Lord, is it I?”|Dem aat get evi, an evri wan a dem staat se tu im se, “A kyaahn mi, Laad?”
He answered and said, “He who has dipped his hand with Me in the dish will betray Me.|Jiizas ansa bak, “Di wan we dip im an iina di boul wid mi, a im a-go sel mi out.

The Son of Man goes as it is written of Him, but woe to that man by whom the Son of Man is betrayed! It would have been good for that man if he had not been born.”|Di Man we Gad Pik mos go siem ou Gad wod se im a-go go, bot yu si di man we sel im out — chobl fi'im mi tel yu! Im wuda betaraaf ef im neehn baan.”

Then Judas, who betrayed Him, answered, “Master, is it I?”He said to him, “You have said it.”|Den Juudas, di sed wan we did a go sel out Jiizas, ier im no, “A kyaahn mi, Tiicha?” Jiizas se, “Yu se so yuself.”

As they were eating, Jesus took bread, blessed it and broke it, and gave it to the disciples and said, “Take and eat. This is My body.”|Wen taim dem de de a nyam, Jiizas tek di bred, gi tangks an brok it gi im falara dem. Im se, “Tek dis an nyam it. Dis a mi badi.”
Then He took the cup, and after He gave thanks, He gave it to them, saying, “Drink of it, all of you. |Den afta im tek di kop an gi tangks, im gi dem an se, “Aal a unu, jringk fram it.

For this is My blood of the new covenant, which is shed for many for the remission of sins.|Kaaz dis a mi blod. A da blod ya yuuz fi set op di nyuu plan we Gad mek wid unu. A da blod ya ron fi evribadi, so dem kyan get paadn fi dem sin.

I say to you, I will not drink of this fruit of the vine from now on until that day when I drink it new with you in My Father’s kingdom.”|Ier wa mi a se, mi naa jringk no muo wain til da die de kom wen mi jringk it wid unu wan nyuu wie iina mi Faada Kindom.”
And when they had sung a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.|Afta dem sing wan im don, dem lef go a Mount Aliv.

Then Jesus said to them, “All of you will fall away on account of Me this night, for it is written:‘I will strike the shepherd,and the sheep of the flock shall be scattered.’|Den Jiizas se tu dem se, “Tinait, tinait, di uol a unu a-go ron we lef mi siek-a wa a-go apm tu mi, kaa it rait dong iina Gad wod se:“‘Mi a-go lik dong di shepad,an aal a di shiip dem a-go ron aal bout di plies.’
But after I have risen, I will go before you to Galilee.”|Bot afta mi kom bak alaiv, mi a-go go iina Gyalalii bifuo unu.”
Peter answered, “Though all men will fall away on account of You, yet I will never fall away.”|Piita se, “Aal ef di uol a dem ron we gaan siek-a wa a-go apm tu yu, mi naa go no we!”

Jesus said to him, “Truly I say to you, this night, before the rooster crows, you will deny Me three times.”|Jiizas se tu im se, “Mi a tel yu dis an a chuu mi a taak, tinait tinait, bifuo di ruusta kruo, yu a-go se yu no nuo mi, chrii taim.”

Peter said to Him, “Though I should die with You, yet I will not deny You.” And all the disciples spoke in this manner.|So Piita se, “Aal ef dem afi kil mi wid yu, mi wi neva se mi no nuo yu.” An aal a im speshal falara dem se di siem ting.

Then Jesus came with them to a place called Gethsemane and said to the disciples, “Sit here while I go and pray close by.”|Den Jiizas an im falara dem lef go wan plies we niem Getsemini, an im se tu dem se, “Sidong ya-so wail mi go uova de-so go prie.”
He took with Him Peter and the two sons of Zebedee and began to be sorrowful and troubled.
column2: Im tek Piita an Zebidii tu bwai dem wid im. Im did wel sad. Im aat did evi.

column1: Then He said to them, “My soul is very sorrowful, even to death. Wait here, and keep watch with Me.”|Den im se tu dem se, “Mi aat evi so til mi fiil laik da presha ya a go kil mi. Tan ya-so an no bada go sliip pan mi.”

He went a little farther, and falling on His face, He prayed, “O My Father, if it is possible, let this cup pass from Me. Nevertheless, not as I will, but as You will.”|Jiizas go out likl forda an dash imself a grong, ton dong im fies an im prie. Im se, “Mi Faada, ef yu kyan dwi'it, du, tek da kop ya fram mi! Bot a no wa mi waahn stil, a wa yu waahn.”

Then He came to the disciples and found them sleeping, and said to Peter, “So, could you not keep watch with Me one hour?|Den im kom bak tu im falara dem an kom fain dem a sliip. Im se tu Piita se, “So unu kudn tan wid mi an kip wach fi wan owa — unu gaan gaan sliip?
