Watch and pray that you enter not into temptation. The spirit indeed is willing, but the flesh is weak.”|No sliip. Kip wach an prie so unu no fies notn we wi kaaz unu fi sin. Kaaz iina unu aat unu waahn du wa rait, bot unu a jos piipl an dat mek unu wiik.”

He went away a second time and prayed, “O My Father, if this cup cannot pass away from Me unless I drink it, Your will be done.”|Im go we wan sekan taim go prie. Im se, “Mi Faada, ef dis a di onggl wie, an mi afi jringk fram da kop ya, den mi afi du wa yu waahn.”
Again, He came and found them sleeping, for their eyes were heavy. |Im kom bak agen an kom kech dem a sliip. Dem kudn kip op. Sliip did a kil dem; dem yai did evi.
So leaving them again, He went away and prayed the third time, saying the same words.|So im lef dem agen an go we go prie wan tord taim. Im se di sed ting agen.

Then He came to His disciples and said to them, “Sleep on now, and take your rest. Look, the hour is near, and the Son of Man is betrayed into the hands of sinners.|Den im kom bak tu im speshal falara dem an se, “Unu stil a sliip an a res? Si ya, di taim a kom nou wen dem sel out di Man we Gad Pik an an im uova tu di wikid piipl dem.
Rise, let us be going. Look, he who betrays Me is at hand.”|Git op! Mek wi go nou! Si ya no! Di wan we sel mi out kom nou!”

While He was still speaking, Judas, one of the twelve, came. And with him was a great crowd with swords and clubs, from the chief priests and elders of the people. |Wen Jiizas did stil de de a taak, Juudas, wan a im twelv speshal falara dem, kom. Wan bag a piipl kom wid im. Dem did kom wid suod an big tik, an a di ed priis an Juu liida dem did sen dem.

Now he who betrayed Him had given them a sign, saying, “Whomever I shall kiss is the Man. Seize Him.” |(Nou di wan we sel out Jiizas did gi dem wan sain. Im se, “Di wan we mi kis, a im a di man. Ares im!”)
He immediately came to Jesus and said, “Hail, Rabbi!” and kissed Him.|So siem taim im go op tu Jiizas an se, “Oudi Tiicha,” an kis im.

And Jesus said to him, “Friend, why have you come?”Then they came and laid hands on Jesus and took Him.|Jiizas se tu im se, “Fren, du wa yu kom ya fi du.”Den dem kom kom uol aan pan Jiizas an ares im.

Immediately, one of those who were with Jesus stretched out his hand, and drew his sword, and struck the servant of the high priest, and cut off his ear.|Bot wan a Jiizas falara dem grab im suod an tek it chap aaf di iez a di sorvant fi di liida fi di priis dem.

Then Jesus said to him, “Put your sword back in its place. For all those who take up the sword will perish by the sword.|Den Jiizas se tu im se, “Put op bak yu suod! Kaaz enibadi we tek op suod fait, a suod a-go kil dem.

Do you think that I cannot now pray to My Father, and He will at once give Me more than twelve legions of angels?|Ar a tingk unu tingk se mi kyaahn kaal pan mi Faada? An im wudn sen wan bag a ienjel kom elp mi rait ya nou — muo dan twelv big gruup a dem.
But how then would the Scriptures be fulfilled, that it must be so?”|Bot ef mi du dat, ou wa rait dong iina Gad wod, we se a so it fi go, wuda kom chuu, iihn?”

At that same moment Jesus said to the crowds, “Have you come out as against a thief to take Me with swords and clubs? Daily I sat with you in the temple teaching, and you did not seize Me.|Da taim de, Jiizas se tu di kroud a piipl se, “A kom unu kom wid suod an big tik fi ares mi laik se mi a oul tiif an mordara?” Die iin die out unu si mi iina di yaad we Gad ous de a tiich, an unu no ares mi.
But all this was done that the Scriptures of the prophets might be fulfilled.” Then all the disciples forsook Him and fled.
column2: Bot dis ya apm so wa di prafit dem se iina Gad wod kyan kom chuu.” Den aal a im speshal falara dem ron we lef im.

column1: Those who had seized Jesus led Him away to Caiaphas the high priest, where the scribes and the elders had assembled.|Nou di piipl dem we ares Jiizas, tek im kyari im go a Kaiyafas. Im did a di liida fi di priis dem, an a fi im ous di Laa tiicha an elda dem did gyada op.

But Peter followed Him from afar to the high priest’s courtyard and went in, and sat with the servants to see the end.|Bot Piita did de likl forda aaf a fala Jiizas. Im fala im go aal di wie tu wich paat di liida fi di priis dem liv. Im go iin de an go sidong out iina di yaad wid di gyaad dem fi si wa a-go apm tu Jiizas.
The chief priests and the elders and the entire Sanhedrin searched for false witness against Jesus to put Him to death
column2: Di ed priis an aal a di Juu liida dem did a chrai kom op wid aal kain-a lai fi tel pan Jiizas so dem kuda kil im.

column1: but they found none. Yes, though many false witnesses came forward, they found none.At last two false witnesses came forward|Bot dem kudn fain notn fi yuuz kil im, iivn duo wan bag a piipl kom op kom tel lai pan im.Den tuu piipl kom op.
and said, “This fellow said, ‘I am able to destroy the temple of God and to build it in three days.’ ”|Ier dem no, “Da man ya se, ‘Mi kyan mash op Gad ous an bil it bak iina chrii die.’ ”

Then the high priest stood up and said to Him, “Do You answer nothing? What is it these men testify against You?”|So di liida fi di priis dem tan op an se tu Jiizas se, “Yu naa notn fi se? A wa kain-a sitn dem ya, dem a se bout yu?”

But Jesus remained silent.The high priest said to Him, “I adjure You by the living God, tell us whether You are the Christ, the Son of God.”|Bot Jiizas no se notn.Di liida fi di priis dem se tu im se, “Infronta di Gad we liv, mi de kaal pan yu fi taak chuut, yu a di Krais, Gad Pikni?”

Jesus said to him, “You have said so. But I say to you, hereafter you will see the Son of Man seated at the right hand of Power and coming on the clouds of heaven.”|So Jiizas se tu im se, “Yu se it yuself. Bot ier mi no, fram nou aan yu a-go si di Man we Gad Pik a sidong a di rait an a di wan we powaful, an a kom dong pan kloud we kom outa evn.”

Then the high priest tore his clothes, saying, “He has uttered blasphemy. What further need do we have for witnesses? See, now you have heard His blasphemy. |Wen di liida fi di priis dem ier dat de, im tier im kluoz an se, “Im tingk se im an Gad a wan! Im disrispek Gad! Wa wi waahn muo piipl fi pruuv notn fa? Unu ier im a dis op Gad!
What do you think?”They answered, “He is guilty unto death.”|Wa di kuot se?”Dem se, “Im gilti. A ded im fi ded.”
Then they spat in His face and struck Him. And others slapped Him with the palms of their hands
column2: Den dem pit iina im fies an tomp im op. An som a dem slap im op

column1: saying, “Prophesy to us, You Christ! Who is it that struck You?”|an se, “Yu no prafit? Iihn Krais Jiizas? So tel wi a uu lik yu!”

Now Peter sat outside in the courtyard. And a girl came to him, saying, “You also were with Jesus of Galilee.”|Nou Piita did a sidong out iina di yaad we di liida fi di priis dem liv. Wan sliev gyal kom op tu im an se, “Di man fram Gyalalii, Jiizas, yu did de mongks im tu.”
But he denied it before them all, saying, “I do not know what you are saying.”|Bot Piita se a lai shi a tel infronta aal a dem: “Mi no nuo we ya'a chat se!”

Then when he went out onto the porch, another girl saw him and said to those who were there, “This man was also with Jesus of Nazareth.”|Wen im go outa di giet wan neda sliev gyal si im an se tu di piipl dem we did out de se, “Da man ya did de mongks Jiizas we kom fram Nazaret.”
Again he denied with an oath, “I do not know the Man.”|Im se a lai shi did a tel tu. Da taim ya im swier. Ier im no, “Mi? Nuo sa! Mi swier se mi no nuo di man!”

After a while those who stood by came to Peter and said, “Surely you also are one of them, for your accent betrays you.”|Likl lieta, di piipl dem we tan op de kom tu Piita an se, “Yu a riili wan a dem tu — aal ou yu chat gi yu we man, yu soun laik dem!”

Then he began to invoke a curse on himself and he swore, “I do not know the Man.”Then immediately a rooster crowed. |Piita staat kos an kaal dong aal kain-a kraasiz pan imself. An im swier an se, “Mi no nuo di man!”Sed taim wan kak kruo.

Then Peter remembered the word Jesus had spoken, “Before a rooster crows, you will deny Me three times.” Then he went out and wept bitterly.|Den Piita memba we Jiizas did se: “Bifuo di ruusta kruo, yu a-go se yu no nuo mi, chrii taim.” Piita go outsaid an im baal, an im baal, an im baal so til.

When the morning came, all the chief priests and elders of the people took counsel against Jesus to put Him to death.|Orli orli iina di maanin, aal a di ed priis an Juu elda dem miit op an mek op dem main fi kil Jiizas.
When they had bound Him, they led Him away and handed Him over to Pontius Pilate the governor.|Dem tai im op, kyari im go we an an im uova gi Pailat, di govana.

When Judas, who had betrayed Him, saw that He was condemned, he repented and brought back the thirty pieces of silver to the chief priests and elders|Wen Juudas, di wan we did sel im out, si se dem gi uova Jiizas fi dem kil im, im sari bout wa im did du, an kyari bak di toti silva kain dem go gi di ed priis an elda dem.

saying, “I have sinned in that I have betrayed innocent blood.”They said, “What is that to us? You must see to that.”|Ier im no, “Mi sin, mi sin, kaa mi sel out sumadi we neehn du notn rang!”Bot dem se tu im se, “Wa dat av fi du wid wi? A fi yu prablem dat, gwaan go diil wid dat yuself!”
So he threw down the pieces of silver in the temple and departed. And he went and hanged himself.
column2: So Juudas chuo dong di silva kain dem iina Gad ous an lef de-so. Den im go we go eng imself.

column1: The chief priests took the silver pieces and said, “It is not lawful to put them into the treasury, because this is the price of blood.”|Di ed priis dem tek op di moni an se, “It no rait fi wi put da moni ya wid Gad moni, kaa a blod moni dis.”

So they took counsel, and bought with them the potter’s field to bury strangers in.|So dem taak wid dem wan aneda an mek op dem main fi tek di moni bai piis a lan we bilang tu sumadi we mek klie pat, an dem yuuz da lan de beri farina.
Therefore that field has been called the Field of Blood to this day. |A so kom, aal a nou, piipl kaal da piis a lan de ‘Blod Fiil.’

Then what was spoken by Jeremiah the prophet was fulfilled: “They took the thirty pieces of silver, the value of that the sons of Israel set on Him|Siek-a dat, we di prafit Jerimaiya did se kom chuu. Im did se: “Dem tek di toti silva kain dem, a dat di Izrel piipl dem se im wot,
and gave them for the potter’s field, as the Lord appointed me|an dem tek dat bai di piis a lan we bilang tu sumadi we mek klie pat, a siem so di Laad tel mi it fi go.”

Jesus stood before the governor. And the governor asked Him, “Are You the King of the Jews?”Jesus said to him, “You have said so.”|Nou Jiizas tan op infronta di govana, an di govana aks im se, “Yu a di Juu dem king?”Jiizas se, “A yu se so.”
When He was accused by the chief priests and elders, He gave no answer.|An wen di liida fi di priis dem an di Juu liida dem se im du aal kain-a rang sitn, im neehn ansa bak.
Then Pilate said to Him, “Do You not hear how many things they testify against You?” |Den Pailat se tu im se, “Yu no ier umoch bad sitn dem se yu du?”
But He never answered him a word, so that the governor was greatly amazed.|Bot Jiizas no ansa no iivn wan a dem; dat did sopraiz di govana.
Now at the feast, the governor was accustomed to releasing to the people a prisoner whom they chose.|Nou iina di Paasuova Alidie, di govana aalwiez frii wan prizna; enibadi we di kroud waahn.
They had then a notorious prisoner called Barabbas.
column2: Dis ya taim dem did lak op wan wikid prizna. Evribadi did nuo im. Im did niem Jiizas Barabas.

column1: So when they had gathered together, Pilate said to them, “Whom do you want me to release to you—Barabbas, or Jesus who is called Christ?” |So afta di kroud a piipl gyada op, Pailat se tu dem se, “Uu unu waahn mi le'go fu'unu nou, Jiizas Barabas ar Jiizas di wan we dem kaal Krais?”
For he knew that they had handed Him over out of envy.
column2: (Kaaz Pailat nuo se dem onggl bring iin Jiizas kaa dem bad main.)

column1: When he was sitting on the judgment seat, his wife sent word to him, “Have nothing to do with that righteous Man, for I have suffered much today in a dream on account of Him.”|Wen Pailat de de a sidong iina im speshal siit az joj fi di kies, im waif sen im da mesij ya: “No av notn fi du wid da man de kaa im no du notn rang. Mi av wan bad bad jriim bout im tide. Laaks! It mek mi sofa.”
But the chief priests and elders persuaded the crowd to ask for Barabbas and kill Jesus.
column2: Bot di ed priis an Juu elda dem push di piipl dem fi aks fi Barabas an fi mek dem kil Jiizas.

column1: The governor answered, “Which of the two do you want me to release to you?”They said, “Barabbas.”|Di govana aks dem, “Outa di tuu a dem, wich wan unu waahn mi le'go?”An di piipl dem se, “Barabas!”

Pilate said to them, “Then what shall I do with Jesus who is called Christ?”They all said to him, “Let Him be crucified!”|Pailat se tu dem se, “Den wa mi fi du wid Jiizas we dem kaal Krais?”Di uol a dem se, “Niel im pan di kraas!”

The governor said, “Why, what evil has He done?”But they cried out all the more, “Let Him be crucified!”|So im se, “Fi wa? Wa rang im du?”Bot dem shout louda dan dem did a shout fos, “Niel im pan di kraas!”

When Pilate saw that he could not prevail, but rather that unrest was beginning, he took water and washed his hands before the crowd, saying, “I am innocent of the blood of this righteous Man. See to it yourselves.”|Wen Pailat si se im neva did a go no we wid dis ya, bot did onggl a rail op di kroud muo, im tek waata wash im an infronta dem an se, “A no mi mek da man ya ded. Fi'im blod de pan fu'unu ed!”
Then all the people answered, “His blood be on us and on our children!”|Aal a di piipl dem se, “Ye, bliem wi! Mek im blod kom dong pan wi an wi pikni dem!”

Then he released Barabbas to them. But when he had scourged Jesus, he handed Him over to be crucified.|Den im let go Barabas gi dem. Im mek dem tek wip biit Jiizas, an den gi im uova fi dem niel im pan di kraas.

Then the soldiers of the governor took Jesus into the Praetorium, and gathered the whole detachment of soldiers before Him.|Den di govana suoja dem tek Jiizas wich paat di govana liv an kaal op di ada suoja dem fi gyada op roun im.
They stripped Him and put a scarlet robe on Him
column2: Dem tier aaf im kluoz an put aan wan brait red ruob pan im.

column1: and when they wove a crown of thorns, they put it on His head and put a staff in His right hand. They knelt before Him and mocked Him, saying, “Hail, King of the Jews!” |Afta dem mek wan kroun outa makabush, dem put it pan im ed. Dem put piis a tik iina im rait an, an dem niil dong infronta im, an a muuv laik se dem did waahn tek im fi iidiyat. Ier dem no, “Manaz an rispek tu di Juu dem King!”
They spit on Him, and took the staff and hit Him on the head.|Dem pit pan im an tek big tik biit im iina im ed, uova an uova.

After they had mocked Him, they took the robe off Him, put His own garments on Him, and led Him away to crucify Him.|Afta dem mak im don, dem tek aaf di ruob an put aan bak fi im uona kluoz. Den dem kyari im go we fi niel im pan di kraas.

As they came out, they found a man of Cyrene, Simon by name. This man they compelled to bear His cross.|Wen dem a go we wid Jiizas, dem fain wan man fram Sairiin, we niem Saiman. Dem fuos im fi kyari Jiizas kraas.
When they came to a place called Golgotha, which means The Place of the Skull|Dem kech a wan plies we niem Golgota (we miin di Skol Plies)

they gave Him sour wine mingled with gall to drink. But when He tasted it, He would not drink it. |an di suoja dem gi im wain miks op wid sitn bita fi jringk, bot wen Jiizas ties likl im neehn waahn jringk it.

When they crucified Him, they divided His garments by casting lots to fulfill what was spoken by the prophet, “They divided My garments among themselves and for My clothing they cast lots.”|Wen dem don niel im pan di kraas, dem chuo dais fi shier op im kluoz.
And sitting down, they kept watch over Him there. |Den dem sidong rait de-so an gyaad im.
They put His accusation over His head, which read:|Uova im ed dem put op wan sain we shuo a wa im du mek dem kil im. It se, “DIS A JIIZAS, DI JUU DEM KING.”

Then two thieves were crucified with Him, one on the right and another on the left.|Wen dem did a niel im pan di kraas, dem did niel op tuu tiif tu. Wan did de pan im rait-an-said an wan pan im lef-an-said.
Those who passed by insulted Him, wagging their heads|Di piipl dem we did a paas se aal kain-a torbl sitn bout im. Dem shiek dem ed.

saying, “You who would destroy the temple and build it in three days, save Yourself! If You are the Son of God, come down from the cross.”|Ier dem no, “Yu, we kyan mash op Gad ous an bil it bak iina chrii die, siev yuself no! Ef ya'a Gad Bwai Pikni, kum dong aafa di kraas!”
Likewise the chief priests, with the scribes and elders, mocked Him, saying|A no dem wan, aal di ed priis, plos di Laa tiicha an elda dem did a laaf aafa Jiizas. Ier dem no

“He saved others. He cannot save Himself. If He is the King of Israel, let Him now come down from the cross, and we will believe Him.|“Im siev ada piipl, bot im kyaahn siev imself! Im a di King fi Izrel? A wa kain-a king im bi? Im a Izrel king! Mek im kom dong aafa di kraas nou an wi wi biliiv wa im se.

He trusted in God. Let Him deliver Him now, if He will have Him. For He said, ‘I am the Son of God.’ ”|Im se im chos iina Gad, den mek Gad siev im ef a dat Gad waahn du, kaa im no se, ‘Mi a Gad pikni!’ ”
Even the thieves who were crucified with Him insulted Him in the same way.
column2: Aal di tiif dem we did niel pan di kraas wid im did kos im out tu.

column1: Now from the sixth hour until the ninth hour there was darkness over all the land.
column2: Nou fram migl die di uol plies get daak til chrii aklak.

column1: About the ninth hour Jesus cried out with a loud voice, “Eli, Eli, lama sabachthani?” which means, “My God, My God, why have You forsaken Me?”|Wen it kech bout chrii aklak, Jiizas shout out loud loud, “Eli, Eli, lema sabaktanai?” Dat miin, “Mi Gad, mi Gad, wa mek yu lef mi an gaan?”
Some of those who stood there heard it and said, “This Man is calling for Elijah.”|Wen som a di piipl dem we did tan op de ier im, dem se, “Da man ya a kaal fi Ilaija.”

Immediately one of them ran, took a sponge, filled it with wine, and put it on a stick, and gave it to Him to drink. |Sed taim, wan a dem ron go get wan sponj an ful it op wid sowa wain an put it pan wan piis a tik an gi im fi jringk
The rest said, “Leave Him alone. Let us see if Elijah will come to save Him.”|Bot di res a dem se, “Lef im an mek wi si ef Ilaija a-go kom kom siev im.”
And Jesus, when He had cried out again with a loud voice, released His spirit.|Den Jiizas baal out agen loud loud an put im spirit iina Gad an.

At that moment the curtain of the temple was torn in two, from the top to the bottom. And the ground shook, and the rocks split apart. |Siem taim, di kortn we did eng op iina Gad ous plit iina tuu, fram tap tu batam. Di ort shiek op an di rakstuon dem plit uopm.
The graves also were opened, and many bodies of the saints who had died were raised|Tuum flai uopm, an uol iip a Gad piipl dem we did ded kom bak alaiv.

and coming out of the graves after His resurrection, they went into the Holy City and appeared to many.|Dem kom outa dem tuum. An afta Jiizas ded an kom bak, dem go iina Jeruusilem, an uol iip a piipl si dem.

When the centurion and those with him, keeping watch over Jesus, saw the earthquake and what took place, they feared greatly and said, “Truly He was the Son of God!”|Wen di ed fi onjrid suoja, an di suoja dem we did de wid im a gyaad Jiizas, si di ortkwiek an aal we did a apm, dem kech dem fried wikid wikid. Ier dem no, “Fi riil, da wan ya did a Gad Bwai Pikni fi chuu!”
Many women who were there watching from afar followed Jesus from Galilee, serving Him|Uol iip a uman did tan op forda out a wach we a gwaan. Dem did kom wid Jiizas fram Gyalalii an did a luk aafa im.

among whom was Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James and Joseph, and the mother of Zebedee’s sons.|Iina di gruup, yu did av Mieri Magdaliin, Mieri — dat a Jiemz an Juozif mada, an Zebidii bwai pikni dem mada did de de tu.

When the evening came, there came a rich man of Arimathea, named Joseph, who also was a disciple of Jesus.|Nou wen iivnin kech, wan rich man fram Arimatiya we niem Juozif, kom. Im did a wan a Jiizas falara dem tu.
He went to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus. Then Pilate commanded the body to be given to him.|Im go a Pailat go aks im fi Jiizas badi, an Pailat se dem fi gi im it.
When Joseph had taken the body, he wrapped it in a clean linen cloth|Juozif tek di badi, rap it op iina wan kliin linin klaat

and laid it in his own new tomb, which he had cut out of the rock. And he rolled a large stone to the door of the tomb and departed. |an put it iina wan nyuu tuum — dat a did fi im uona tuum we did iina di rak. Den im ruol wan big big stuon kraas infronta di tuum.
Mary Magdalene and the other Mary were there, sitting opposite the tomb.|Mieri Magdaliin an di ada Mieri did a sidong de, kraas fram di tuum.

The next day, following the Day of Preparation, the chief priests and Pharisees gathered before Pilate,|Di neks die, dat a did di Sabat die, di ed priis dem an di Farisii dem miit op tugeda infronta Pailat.

saying, “Sir, we remember that deceiver saying while He was still alive, ‘After three days I will rise.|Dem se, “Sa, wi memba wen da oul laiyad de did stil a liv, ou im weehn se, ‘Afta chrii die mi a-go kom bak alaiv.’

Therefore command that the tomb be made secure until the third day, lest His disciples come by night and steal Him away, and tell the people, ‘He has risen from the dead.’ The last deception will be worse than the first.”|So tel dem sa fi mek shuor se di tuum gyaad gud gud til di tord die, so im falara dem no kom kom tek we im badi an tel di piipl dem se, ‘Im kom bak alaiv.’ Ef dem se so an chrik op piipl, dat de lai wuda wos dan di fos wan, wen im did kliem se a im a di Krais.”

Pilate said to them, “You have a guard. Go your way. Make it as secure as you can.”|So Pailat se tu dem se, “Tek wan gruup a suoja fi go gyaad di tuum, an mek shuor se dem gyaad it di bes wie dem kyan gyaad it.”
So they went and made the tomb secure by sealing the stone and posting the guard.|So dem lef go we wid di suoja dem, an dem maak di stuon so dem wuda nuo ef nobadi muuv it.

At the end of the Sabbath, as it began to dawn on the first day of the week, Mary Magdalene and the other Mary went to see the tomb.|Nou afta Sabat don, orli Sonde maanin, di fos die a di wiik kom, Mieri Magdaliin an di neks Mieri go fi go luk pan di tuum.
And then there was a great earthquake. For the angel of the Lord descended from heaven and came and rolled back the stone from the door and sat on it.
column2: An aal av a sodn wan wikid wikid ortkwiek shiek op di plies kaa wan a Gad ienjel dem kom dong fram evn an kom ruol we di stuon an sidong pan it.

column1: His countenance was like lightning, and his garments white as snow.|Im did luk brait laka laitnin an im kluoz did wait laik sunuo.
The soldiers shook for fear of him and became like dead men.
column2: Di gyaadi dem did so fraitn dem a shiek iina dem buon. Dem jrap a grong an tif out laka ded dem ded.

column1: The angel said to the women, “Do not be afraid. For I know that you are looking for Jesus who was crucified.|Bot di ienjel se tu di uman dem se, “No fried; mi nuo se a Jiizas unu a luk fa, di wan we dem kil pan di kraas.
He is not here. For He has risen, as He said. Come, see the place where the Lord lay. |Im no de ya, kaa Gad mek im kom bak alaiv, jos laik wa im did se. Kom luk wich paat im did a lidong.

Then go quickly and tell His disciples that He has risen from the dead, and indeed, He is going before you to Galilee. There you will see Him. Listen, I have told you.”|Den ori op an go tel im falara dem se, ‘Im ded an kom bak alaiv. Im a go a Gyalalii til unu kom. Unu wi si im de wen unu riich.’ Mi tel unu we mi did fi tel unu!’ Lisn wa mi se an du wa mi se unu fi du.”
So they departed quickly from the tomb with fear and great joy, and ran to bring His disciples word. |Di uman dem tek aaf kwik kwik! Dem fraitn an glad siem taim, an dem ron go tel Jiizas falara dem.

As they went to tell His disciples, suddenly Jesus met them, saying, “Greetings!” They came and took hold of His feet and worshipped Him.|Bot Jiizas miit dem op an se tu dem se, “Iel!” Dem kom tu im, ben dong a grong, uol aan pan im fut an worship im.

Then Jesus said to them, “Do not be afraid. Go tell My brothers to go to Galilee, and there they will see Me.”|Den Jiizas se tu dem se, “No fried. Gwaan go tel mi breda dem se dem kyan go a Gyalalii. Dem wi si mi de.”

While they were going, indeed, some of the soldiers went into the city and described to the chief priests everything that had happened.|Siem taim dem a go de-so, som a di gyaadi dem go iina di toun go tel di ed priis dem evriting we apm.

When the chief priests were assembled with the elders and had taken counsel, they gave much money to the soldiers|Afta dat, di ed priis dem miit op wid di elda dem an kuk op wan plan. Dem gi di suoja dem wan uol iip a moni

saying, “You are to say, ‘His disciples came by night and stole Him away while we were sleeping.’|an se tu dem se, “A dis unu fi tel evribadi se, ‘Im falara dem kom iina di nait an kom tiif im badi wen wi weehn a sliip.’
If this comes to the governor’s ears, we will satisfy him and keep you secure.” |Ef di govana ier da tuori ya, wi wi wok it out an mek shuor se unu no get iina no chobl.”
So they took the money and did as they were instructed. And this saying has been commonly reported among the Jews to this day.
column2: So dem tek di moni an du wa dem tel dem fi du. An piipl stil a taak da tuori ya mongks di Juu dem op tu tide die ya.

column1: Then the eleven disciples went away to Galilee, to the mountain to which Jesus had directed them. |So Jiizas ilevn falara dem go a Gyalalii a di mountn we im did tel dem fi go.
When they saw Him, they worshipped Him. But some doubted. |Wen dem si im, dem worship im, bot som a dem neehn tuu shuor ef a im.
Then Jesus came and spoke to them, saying, “All authority has been given to Me in heaven and on earth. |Den Jiizas kom kom se tu dem se, “Gad gi mi powa uova evriting we a liv iina evn an pan ort.

Go therefore and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit|So gwaan, yuuz fi mi powa, tiich mi mesij tu piipl evriwe, so dem kyan ton mi falara tu. An yuuz di powa we di Faada, di Bwai Pikni an di Uoli Spirit gi an baptaiz dem.

teaching them to observe all things I have commanded you. And remember, I am with you always, even to the end of the age.” Amen.|Gwaan go tiich dem fi lisn an fala aal a di ruul dem we mi gu'unu. An memba, mi no lef unu non at aal, mi de wich paat unu de til taim don.”
